name: HallPass
content: Okay spot, only two dining options while we were there on a Saturday afternoon. Bar service was very slow (15 min to get a couple of draft beers) during not a very busy time. Our food was pretty tasty.

name: HallPass
content: Wonderful location. Beautiful space. Great menus.  The problem is with execution and during these times (when everyone is having such staffing issues) this place suffers. Empty tables sat dirty so people had no where to sit. Two cocktail waitresses for the whole place and you can't walk up to the bar to order. So drinks came after we had our food. It's a great concept and I think once we can find people who want to work again this place will  kill it.

name: HallPass
content: If you've never been here, this place is like a dining hall/upscale food court, meaning you have multiple options. I only tried the Nashville hot chicken sandwich, Mac n cheese, and clam chowder (from another food place here), but all three were good! I'd say the Mac n cheese was my favorite. Overall, I don't think the food will blow anyone away, but the chill staff, wide food selection, and nice atmosphere make this a place I'd definitely return to!

name: HallPass
content: It's basically an expensive food court where you can drink. Only 2 options were open for lunch, and we chose the chicken place.The service was good.We had the tenders combo. 1 spicy. 1 mild. The portions were generous and filling, however this was probably the greasiest chicken I've ever had. So.much.grease.The mild tenders had no flavor, not even salty or peppery, just boring chicken batter.  The spicy was hot, but again, no real flavor. The tenders were tender, but so greasy, and at $14 per combo, I'd been better off at an actual sit down restaurant.

name: HallPass
content: HallPass is the best food court in SLC. Great music, good location, sport games on and very high diversity in term of food available. There are almost no better food court in SLC that is better than HallPass. Also the staff here are very nice

name: HallPass
content: WHOA! Pricey! We got a chicken sandwich combo which was $20, pretty good. Tried the BBQ pork noodles and that was $15 on its own, not a lot of flavor. You're definitely paying for atmosphere, variety and bar availability on top of the food. We like trying new spots and We wanted to try some other menu items so we will be back for a round 2  but 3 stars this far for taste vs. price.

name: HallPass
content: Super fun vibes and cool atmosphere in there. Drinks were yummy but a little pricy. We got bao buns which were super yummy and the chicken tenders which were good. We got the level 2 spice on the chicken, which was surprisingly way too hot. I can handle spicy and hot food, but it just was burning my mouth hot. Not quite sure how that is a level 2 spice? Fries with it were delicious!

name: HallPass
content: The way the food court is set up was confusing for a second but makes so much sense to break it up how they have the straws are cool too

name: HallPass
content: I have been back to HallPass several times since my last review and have been able to try the other restaurants! I think i've found my favorites. Skinny fats offers lots of classic burgers and sandwiches with a healthy twist. They also have some interesting side choices mike a vegan caesar salad and grapefruit brûlée. I tried the "Chix on Broadway" chicken sandwich and it blew my mind. It has a lemon herb aioli that compliments the veggies and chicken really well. You also can't go wrong with a brioche bun. On the side I tried the vegan caesar salad and grapefruit brûlée. I quite liked the dressing but it had far too many apple slices to be able to enjoy the whole salad. The grapefruit brûlée was a total win! Crunchy sugar on the top and sweet citrusy grapefruit made for an awesome "healthy" dessert. Colossal Lobster is another favorite mini restaurant in Hallpass. My boyfriend is a huge seafood connoisseur and he rates colossal lobster a 4/5. We have tried the Lobster ruben and the lobster roll. We really liked both, however the portions are small and don't come with a side. If you're looking for an elevated twist on classic lunch items, HallPass is for you! It's also a nice change of pace from your typical dining experience.

name: HallPass
content: The lobster rolls are unbeatable. They're a little pricey and should just come with fries on the side, but so so so good!

name: HallPass
content: The environment is absolutely awesome! Was there on a Sunday night and it was packed. Went there the following night with some buddies because it was such a fun time and it was a lot less busy since it was a Monday but still had amazing food and awesome service from Logan!

name: HallPass
content: Really cool concept. Good food and great service from bar servers. Minus one star for not having validation.

name: HallPass
content: I'm so glad we have this place downtown. It's like a party on any night of the week and you can try anything. The only advice I offer is that the bars do need you to order food. So it's not a drink only spot. But the fries that we ordered were insanely good and I'll never turn down good fries.

name: HallPass
content: Sorry Yelpers, I forgot to take pics as I was more worried about eating LOL HallPass is a great addition to The Gateway. Definitely a vibe to chill and eat and/or drink with your people. The variety of foods to choose from is a treat as it provides something for everyone. There are tables for small to large groups and tables outside as well. There is a bar here for those that drink with tables on their side of the divider. There are employees that work there to clear and clean the tables. Masks and hand sanitizer were available at the host stand as we walked in. Since I went on the weekend, it was busy but we were still able to snag a table. It wasn't cleaned yet, but when one of the employees passing by saw I was wiping the table with a wipe, he came back over with a clean towel to wipe our area down. There is a soda station that all restaurants sell cups for. There wasn't more than one person in front of me when I went to refill my drink. After trying a couple restaurants, I'm sure I'll return to try another spot in here ready to do another review.Good job Gateway!

name: HallPass
content: Get the blaze of thunder chicken sandwich. AMAZING!!!Tenders were pretty good too at the recommended spice level but the sandwich was just amazing with a side of pickles....  definitely would come here again.

name: HallPass
content: We tried the Blaze of Thunder Chicken Sandwich here and it didn't disappoint. It comes in different spice levels and while I usually never opt for the spiciest level, with this sandwich I wish I had. The atmosphere of this restaurant is unique, it's located in the Gateway Mall and it's a cool place to just hang out. My favorite chicken sandwich of all time is Mico's Hot Chicken in Houston, TX. While this doesn't quite live up to that, I'd say it's a pretty close second.

name: HallPass
content: Fast and kind  service. Had Blaze of Thunder. Absolute gas 10/10There is so much to try so have to come again to try everything

name: HallPass
content: This place is dope, if you're flight gets delayed roll up and eat some brunch - then grab an espresso martini with Logan and have a nice day

name: HallPass
content: Hip food hall with five eatery options, a large bar fit with oversized tv's, and innovative tables fit with server call buttons. Take-out available. Blaze of Thunder's sandwich combo with cajun fries alone was well worth the visit.

name: HallPass
content: Came here on a Sunday and was bummed to find that the cod, lobster roll, and SkinnyFats(?) counters were closed, but we were still intrigued by the baos and hot chicken counters.For the hot chicken: Wow, it was hot and almost not enjoyable. We ordered a tender meal with the second from the lowest spice level and were thrown off by the thick layer of spices that caked our fingers and throats. The chicken itself was tender but coughing at one of the lowest spice levels when our spice tolerance is high was concerning. The fries were okay and the soda options were interesting.For baos: We ordered the Szechuan chicken dumplings (order of 5) and the pork belly baos (order of 2). Overall a good price for the portions but it left me wanting more. Everything was made to order but the dumplings were cool when we picked them up. Would love to try their noodle dish sometime, too.I'm hoping to visit during at a time when I can snag a lobster roll. Lots of seating, various food and drink options, and location were great. Overall, I would score Hallpass as a 3.5/5.

name: HallPass
content: Great flavors and spice to their chickens. Quick and easy pickup with decent prices. Also in a pretty cool food court area.

name: HallPass
content: Brunch is what you make of it, for me...it's mostly about connecting with my besties, over some delicious food (and, a mimosa or 2), before starting another work work week! Amiriiight!!! It's one of my favorite meals, because it combines two of them! Lol  At Hallpass SLC ( @hallpassslc ) at Gateway Mall, they now have BRUNCH y'all!!! We enjoyed some traditional entrées, like Nashville Hot Chicken And Waffles + hot honey, Brulee French Toast and Fresh Fruit. What's rad about Hallpass is that you can get other options too! I also hit up Graffiti Bao ( @graffitibao ) and got some Chicken Dumplings/Potstickers and their famous Bao Buns (with Short Rib and Pork Bellayyy)! It's a unique way, to mix up the traditional brunch fare and I'm all about it! Pro Tip: For a few more dollars, you can get unlimited Bloody Marys & Mimosas! You're welcome!

name: HallPass
content: HallPass in downtown SLC is like having a little piece of Vegas right here with us in downtown Salt Lake City!  We love the open atmosphere and amazing wooden furniture.Beer Zombies is a great place to sit and enjoy comfort or craft beer and cocktails while you chat or watch the Utah Jazz kick some ass.We have now tried 3 of the restaurants including Graffiti Bao for tasty pork buns, Blaze of Thunder for my fav Nashville Hot chicken sando and SkinnyFats for some amazing truffle fries!We are looking forward to trying the lobster rolls and clam chowder at Colossal Lobster ASAP!  We haven't been while the DJ was spinning yet, but looking forward to that as soon as we can.The prices are a bit spendy at each of the restaurants, but overall a great, fun place and cool atmosphere.  It's like you aren't even in Utah!  Stop in and check it out!

name: HallPass
content: This is an upscale of a food court. The food all looks amazing.  My lobster Rueben was delicious. I loved the clam chowder. Probably didn't need the tater tots!  Could not eat them all. 2  up!!

name: HallPass
content: Hands down the best food in SLC! We literally ate here everyday of our trip. Their brunch was probably one of the best brunches we've ever had . The eggs amazing! Potatoes Amazing! French toast amazing! We also tried their Blaze of Thunder Chicken Sandwich which was probably the best chicken sandwich we've ever had next to Throbin Thicke at Cops n Throbbers! Run don't walk here!

name: HallPass
content: Oh man, best nashville hot chicken sandwiches here. The lobster roll place is pretty good too, but I would make a trip specifically for the chicken. I'm not even a huge chicken sandwich fan but my husband got one and I tried a bite, so good I went and got my own to take home. Seriously, try it out. Oh and the pork buns from the bao place aren't worth it, just get chicken.

name: HallPass
content: I love the food here. But tonight I had an experience seems to happen every time I come here - they're out of everything. 5 out of 6 drinks featured on their menu that we tried to order were out. Their recommendations for replacements didn't end up so great. At the end of the night we asked for validation as we closed our bill, but you guessed it - out of those too.

name: HallPass
content: Customer service was excellent, the employees were very polite, patient, and friendly. Indoor seating was available and there were multiple fountain drink options. The prices were not too bad for the portions of food we bought. My best friend and I shared a Spicy Nashville chicken sandwich, which was BOMB! However, I do recommend not going any higher than the second spicy level, haha. One sandwich fed me and my best friend, and their Mac & Cheese was pretty decent. I'm eager to try the lobster rolls when I return back to Salt Lake.Overall great experience.

name: HallPass
content: Mmmm Good! Love the cafeteria style dining. I had the Fish&Chips, other than fresh tasting fish, crispy batter and chips are large cut (bit salty for my taste) but hits the spot after a great day of skiing. Now I know where to go for good comfort food. Super friendly staff ... Fun atmosphere.

name: HallPass
content: This place is great! It has a really cool atmosphere with unique furniture and interesting artwork throughout. HallPass is perfect for people looking to get a good meal that is also very Instagramable. There are TVs everywhere and a bar which makes it a very fun social activity with friends or co-workers. They do have some funky hours around mid day so make sure you look at the hours of operation before you come so you don't find yourself hangry and cold.

name: HallPass
content: Tried the Asian place. The bao buns were not already prepared. The two small bites of beef on the plate are all you get to stuff in your buns. That was barely enough for one bun, so the other was pretty much a veggie bun. It was ok. Was disappointed because bao buns are a bit more challenging to find near me and these did not live up to my excitement. Spring rolls were nothing amazing. Just "ok"

name: HallPass
content: It was my wife's birthday and we heard about HallPass from my Son , who has a friend that works at the bar, so we thought we would go up and check it out, we had a party of 7 who all have a variety of food tastes and this place was perfect for us all dealing with differences in what we wanted to eat that night. HallPass has I believe 8 different restaurants and 2 bars, it's like a big food court way of ordering your food, you just walk around and figure out what your wanting , so our food choices were great, I went with the 3 pieces of Cod and tater tots, the cost was ok around $9 for some big pieces of cod which I thought to be good, others in my party I heard enjoyed there food also with no complaints, we also got some big shrimp and ceviche all good to the taste buds, this place has a fun atmosphere and I will definitely go back

name: HallPass
content: This is such a cool concept situated within The Gateway. There are so many different restaurants to try that surely everyone in your party will be satisfied. Seafood- try CodSpeed! Chicken- go for Blaze of ThunderBurgers- SkinnyFatsDrinks- BeerZombiesAnd there is still SO much more! The atmosphere is fun and relaxed. Definitely a must visit for a bite if you are visiting The Gateway or chilling nearby!

name: HallPass
content: Really neat dining experience. The name Hall Pass is fitting as you walk in and realize it's literally setup like a badass cafeteria built for the younger crowds in the area. The atmosphere is chill and the drinks are good. If you're sippin on alcohol here, make sure to order two drinks since they are tiny servings; at least the one I had was. Our waitress was extremely new, and didn't quite explain how the place worked, but it wasn't too hard to figure out. I think the Gateway needed a place like this to help revive the area.

name: HallPass
content: Abstract: fun place to eat with adults and kidsWe went here on a Saturday evening during covid with two adults, one tween, and one toddler and we all had a great time. I haven't been to SLC in over a year so I was happy to find a new place to try while we're in town. It's cafeteria style so seat yourself. Go to restaurant stations, order, and pay then wait for your buzzer to go off. You do need to order your beer at the table by pushing the button though. I'm a fried chicken girl and so I was really looking forward to Blaze of Thunder. I was bummed to find out that they stopped serving bone in chicken :( so they only have sandwiches and tenders. I'll just have to stick to Pretty Bird for my Nashville bone in chicken. I got the tenders in "too fast" and they sure were spicy. I only ate one piece before I started crying. The meal came with a side which I opted for the banana pudding with banana cotton candy. Yum yum yum my toddler and I loved this. It was really creamy with a light banana taste that's not over powering. As a fried chicken girl I also tried "general Tso's chicken wings" at Graffiti Bao. It came with 6 party wing pieces, pickled carrots strips, and a dipping sauce. I thought these wings were a bit overcooked (chewy and dry) and there was too much sauce. If there's gonna be that much sauce there needs to be some rice to sop with all up. My husband had the "fish and seashore fries" from Codspeed. He thought the fish was okay. The fish was lightly battered and tasted like fish. My tween had the "classic burger" from SkinnyFats and she enjoyed her meal. She said the burger was nicely cooked (they asked and we requested medium well). She got truffle fries and I thought they were one of the best I've truffle fries I've tasted. Very light truffle flavor so it doesn't over power your pallet. They used parmesan crumbles instead of shaved or grated parmesan so it may not be as fancy.  My husband tried to order beer at the bar counter but you actually order from a waiter at your table. You push the button to get service or in my husband's case had a waiter follow him to the table. He had the "coconut stout" and he liked it. He thought it tasted like a good stout but there was nothing really outstanding. His favorite coconut beer is from Kona Brewing. Overall our experience was nice. Everyone wore masks as they were walking around. The tables were well spaced out. The staff were friendly and attentive. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by a manager or supervisor of some sort. Showed us the ropes and politely left. Throughout our stay (about an hour) the staff came up to us 4-5 times asking how everything was. Overall I recommend this place for large groups or indecisive people. It's also a great place for families with different preferences in food. Ambiance is nice and the food isn't too bad.

name: HallPass
content: My first time visiting this place I was surprise right off the bat it has at least five different places to get food  from meaning some thing for everyone I highly recommend this place the food was delicious and I will definitely be coming back again and again

name: HallPass
content: Went into this place at 10pm, they close at 11 so we figured we had some time. Stood at the door for a minute and wasn't greeted by anyone. Went up to the bar and the bartender said we could pick a seat and he'd send someone over. We sat down and pressed the service button. Table was dirty and all others around us either had glasses or dishes on them. Waited about 10 min and the only person that came over was a girl who was sweeping the floor around us and didn't say anything. We had enough time to find a new place and just walked out past the employees and they didn't say a word to us. Do you not want money or? It's a shame, the food looked good.

name: HallPass
content: Stumbled on the place on a rainy night when I was visiting SLC. I love a good food hall. This place had a little of everything. I tried a little of it all and a few cocktails for the bar. I was not disappointed and would recommend this place if you're with a group who all can't decide on the same place to grab a bite.

name: HallPass
content: I sometimes come here for food and drinks. But this time it's a review you don't want to miss out on! I had the pleasure of trying the new menu before it hits the streets.... bar.. restaurant. The point is, I felt like a real food critic to get the inside scoop for my fellow foodies. If you know me, you know I love my chicken wings. So I had to try the General Tso's wings. Wings mixed with one of my favorite spice? I couldn't pass up on that. The first bite was aaammmazing, it was crispy and juicy and full of flavor. The only downside is I wish it was spicier (personally for me). But overall, the wings did not disappoint! Next, your girl had to try the fries. Can't say no to carbs. The crispy chili garlic fries with pork belly, hits you hard in the heart (like full of goodness and probably health wise). But the pork belly was very tender, and the fries with the chili garlic had an Asian kick to it. You can't go wrong with fries, and the pork belly was the cherry on top. You have the option of adding the pork belly or not, so don't feel pressure. Last but not least, the Graffiti Burger... omg like one of the best burger I have ever had. I believe it had coleslaw in it. So if you're a fan, you're going to love this burger. It was so good, I don't even have the words to describe it. I have nothing bad to say about the new menu, everything was on point!

name: HallPass
content: This might have been my favorite discovery of 2020! I love the idea of one place having a variety of food options for everyone. This is the grown-up version of a food court. That being said, it's still family friendly, but it has a trendy vibe. When you walk in you're greeted by a host who, for new comers, will explain a little bit about the place, where to go, and how to find what you're looking for. Basically, wind through the loop of restaurants, figure out what sounds good, and order from as many places as you want. Once you order you're handed a buzzing number that will notify you when to pickup your food. There's seating throughout the place including single tables, communal tables, and patio seating. They also have a few soda stations throughout, but be warned, this is not a traditional Coke or Pepsi soda machine. Their soda fountains remind me of the ones at Blue Lemon. Handcrafted, natural, unique sodas... The "healthier" versions. My initial reaction at the sofa machine was slight disappointment (I'm a Diet Coke girl), but ended up really enjoying mixing a couple sodas. And yes, several refills were involved. Another cool feature is that each table has a button to push for bar service. Once pushed a server will approach to get your bar order. They have a pretty good selection and offering of cocktails, spirits, and beer. My friend and I had so much fun hanging out there and overeating! A really fun environment that got even more fun with a DJ spinning around 9 or 10pm. I think Colossal has the best Lobster Roll in SLC. The toasted buttery bun, finely chopped celery, big chunks of lobster, and a light dressing of mayo spread made it perfectly delicious. The Szechuan Dumplings were far more addicting than I anticipated. And the spring rolls that you wrap with lettuce, jalapeno, thai basil, mint, and some pickled veg make the fried roll seem lighter and more balanced. Plus you get to add as much or as little of the accoutrements as you want, making it customizable to your specific taste. So the food is amazing, vibe is fun, drink game (soda or alcohol) is strong, and the staff is so friendly and high energy. No judgey Abercrombie/Hollister vibe here! Everyone was great at answering questions and making suggestions. Our cocktail waitress was the best too. We ended up hanging out there for like 4 or 5 hours. Such a fun place! It's a MUST EAT place without a doubt!

name: HallPass
content: Update since the last review: workers appear to have updated protocol and are all wearing masks now (as of December 2020) whereas that wasn't the case a couple months ago. Good food, nice ambiance, and a good selection of drinks. Colossal Lobster

name: HallPass
content: HallPass is nothing fancy, but it's good food for what it is. There are many places to choose from, kind of like an upscale version of a mall food court. The reason I say upscale is because the quality of food is a little bit better, but the ambience is much better. Really, the ambience is the only reason to come here. As we looked around, it seemed that it was a gathering place for the pretty people downtown. We hung out, ate our food, watch the fight on the big TVs, and had a great time. As far as the food goes, I got the chicken sandwich with mac & cheese. It was pretty good. You can make the chicken as spicy or mild as you want. The mac & cheese is good quality with a little bit of kick.

name: HallPass
content: I like to come here on Sundays, with fewer people and perfect for chilling. Not my first time in here but this time, I had to try the real quick sandwich from Blaze of Thunder that offers Nashville hot fried chicken, you can choose their heat level from 0mph to 500mph. I like the creamy slaw in it with pickles and it's all loaded up on a brioche. Would highly recommend stopping by and try their sandwich!

name: HallPass
content: This makes dining fun, simple as that. There is something for everyone here. Want Fried chicken? Cool, got that. Want Beef noodles? Done.  How about a cocktail with some fish's be chips? Easy. Walk in, take a lap around to look at all the options and then go order. Sit where you want, if you want a drink someone will be around to take your order or go to the bar. Easy. Salt Lake has needed a food market like this for a long while, and they nailed it.

name: HallPass
content: Tried their new restaurant tonight Graffiti Bao and found a lonnnggggg nice hair in the middle of my rice!!!!  So funnnnn!!!!  I love spending $14 on nothing.

name: HallPass
content: The food was amazing. I got a claim chowder bowl from Colossal Lobster. Definitely a recommend.

name: HallPass
content: The options are decent. Kids loved the colossal seafoodPlace. Clam chowder and lobster sandwich were excellent. My salad from skinnyfat was pretty good, not too exciting. Husband got the fish, chips and tots. Really good. The ambience was super cool. Great service from the ladies in the bar. They kept checking on us. Very nice!

name: HallPass
content: My friend and I went to Hallpass on a Monday night and it was empty! We both decided to go to Blaze of Thunder to try their take On Nashville Hot Chicken. I got the sandwich and he got the Chicken fingers. Overall, huge portions! We both got medium and it was plenty spicy! We both left feeling so full and a bit grossed out by how much we ate (portions are that big!), but it was completely worth it! Definitely go during the week if you are looking for avoid crowds

name: HallPass
content: HallPass is a VIBE. Basically a trendy, more upscale food court, guests can choose between about six restaurants and sit wherever inside or on the patio.Ramen, Nashville hot chicken, lobster rolls, sushi, burgers, and more are all options here. If you're not hungry, that's fine too: HallPass has a bar with TVs and alcoholic beverages of all kinds for you to chill and/or be social.What I love most about HallPass though is the atmosphere. Wooden tables and wooden wall and ceiling accents give this a truly unique, modern feel. The outdoor seating is a nice way to enjoy a fall evening.I'd definitely recommend HallPass!

name: HallPass
content: We tried the Asian food place, the fried chicken and Skinnny Fats. We figured as a food hall we should order from multiple establishments to see what it was like. We weren't impressed with any of the food, we felt like it was below average food with lipstick on. For spending $40 for two we were expecting to have at least one item be wow! Also, we were trying to order two drinks and hit the drink button multiple times and received no service - hence we can't speak to if the bar is good. We won't be going back and we're very disappointed.

name: HallPass
content: Great concept in the heart of Downtown Salt Lake City. 6 or so eateries all under one roof-Graffiti Bao, Nashville Chicken, lobster,  fish sticks SkinnyFATS and a bar. Very clean. We got the lobster sandwiches, lobster bisque and tater tot's. Really good! Great servings of lobster. Serve your own fountain drinks. Not all of the restaurants were open inside. I believe they're going to have a crêperie eatery. Hopefully they open soon. It's  in a great location where you can walk around and go do some shopping, catch comedy club, check out a museum. Great place to people watch and listen to some music by the outdoor fireplace.

name: HallPass
content: LOVE this place! Super cool, relaxing environment. We ate at 3 different spots and ended our date with some fresh, warm cookies! It is definitely worth the trip. I got fish & chips and it was the ABSOLUTE BEST.... The Lobster tail was a HIT, and the spciy chicken sandwich was BOMB! I would defiantly reccomend this place. The owner Dave was an awesome help and was really nice. 10/10!

name: HallPass
content: Great concept, brought my kids here to try it out thinking how cool it would be to get a drink with our food. The girl at the front door explained everything so well and all seemed great. I pushed the button on my table for drink service and waited and waited and waited, I went and asked the bar tender how to get a drink, he told me I had to be served by a server. He also said he would send some one right over. So I waited and waited and waited, ate our food and left with not one visit from a server to take a drink order. Lobster bisque was good Chicken tenders were very over seasoned Rice bowl tasted like dirty water riceGreat concept, but total miss! maybe after the excuse of COVID things might get better for this place.

name: HallPass
content: Utah's first food hall is a great new addition to the Salt Lake dining scene. We visited several months ago when they were in the soft opening phase. Not everything was open yet but the space was beautiful. I loved the wood tables, fireplace, and the windows which offered lots of natural light.There is a nice variety of food there, from lobster roll and cod vendors, to a ramen joint, a fried chicken stand, a dessert place, and a stall called "skinnyfat" that has a menu mixed with healthy and not so healthy offerings. Of the places that were open, we tried Blaze of Thunder, a take on Nashville hot chicken.This is an excellent location and despite the many great restaurants in the area, it should do well.

name: HallPass
content: This place is awesome! It fits all in the name of the venue. A "hall" full of different amazing eats to choose from! Wonderful addition to Downtown SLC!

name: HallPass
content: Utah finally has its first food hall!! Coming from California, I was actually blown away by this place. The ambiance was very eclectic & moody, but still was an invitation for good overall vibes. I would 10/10 recommend anyone in the area to stop by. The owner (I believe) actually personally came up to my boyfriend and I and introduced himself and gave more background into his vision for the food hall, which was really nice to be able to connect to someone who's clearly passionate about his project!! Cannot wait to come back and see this place grow! The food was offerings are still being tweaked, but for the better. They still had so much to offer despite 2 places not being open. I opted for the Nashville hot sandwich restaurant, which was amazing!! The seasoning was very satisfactory and fulfilled a craving I didn't know I had! 10/10 will be getting again, but maybe the spicy level :) my boyfriend got the lobster roll & loved it! On alcohol, I really appreciate that they literally come to you and ask if you want to order any alcohol! I've never experienced that at foodhalls in CA! They had a good variety of offerings. COVID: hand sanitation is provided upon entry (yes, you have to sanitize first). They had people walking around constantly, ready to clean.

name: HallPass
content: After two years of a business in Red Lodge, Montana holding the spot for best ranch I've ever had...I have a new #1 ranch. I have been wanting to check out HallPass forever to see what the hype was about. At first it is very confusing...you walk in and it's like one big restaurant. If you get a drink or a water cup, you will need to refill it on either side of the building. You are able to pick any restaurant to eat your food and then you can sit anywhere that you may find a spot. There was a seafood place when I first walked in, but I don't like seafood so I respectfully declined. I made my way over to a place called skinny fats and ended up getting just a classic burger. I got fries with my burger and obviously made sure they ran me my ranch. I have never teared up over a meal quite like I did while eating skinny fat's ranch. I went here on Saturday, it is now Wednesday and I am dying to go back just for the ranch. Chefs kiss.

name: HallPass
content: Such a bomb ass establishment. Tried coming for lunch but they opened up at 5p.m so I made sure to back track and try them for dinner instead. So since I'm traveling solo it was an awesome choice for me. I sat at the bar and had some adult beverages and tried different items. Got the buffalo cauliflower from skinny fats and the ahi tuna poke nachos from colossal lobster.  Then before leaving I finished off the night with the grapefruit brûlée form skinny fats. I'd definitely come back once I'm here again.

name: HallPass
content: The concept is amazing! Place is amazing and great vibe! Drinks are great .... bartender MJ makes the best dranks ! She is super friendly and enjoys making your drinks!!

name: HallPass
content: The reason why I'm giving this place 3 stars is because of the food and atmosphere.  The service for drinks sucks.  Seven people in our group and they all get their drinks.  Other tables get their drinks and then also a second round and yet still missing my drink.  Finally waitress comes around and I let her know that I still never got my drink.  She said she would get that right out and I said that's okay you can take it off the tab, I don't wanna wait any longer for the drink. This will be updated to see if she does take the drink off the tab.

name: HallPass
content: Great new place to go eat with different foods (great variety). Great seating inside and out. the staff members were so friendly and we had a great feeling.cute wall arts and furnitures. Highly recommend any time of the day.

name: HallPass
content: The atmosphere and the scenery around this place is awesome. It's like a buffet 5 locations in one restaurant literally something to eat for everyone me and the wifey got lobster be ceviche and kiddos got chicken tenders with truffles fries

name: HallPass
content: Love, love, love!!  Went here with family and loved all the option with food.  Plenty of room inside, just wish more outside seating or windows were open so we could see outside.  My new favorite mixed drink is here and it's delicious!!  Highly recommend you give them a try for something new and out of just ordinary.

name: HallPass
content: Great spot for Family and for hanging out. Amazing food and a great selection of local beer. One of my favorite places to visit in Salt Lake City

name: HallPass
content: Talk about a really cool place so the way that this place works is that they have eight different restaurants inside it with two bars and they use it as a test bed for new restaurant ideas or a restaurant ideas upcoming well besides the Ramen not being served which they explain to me is that they get their product on Monday and then they sell out by Saturday so they're close Sunday and Monday for Ramen in which I love Robin so that kind of sucks. But I end up having a steak bowl from this one place then I had some shrimp from the seafood place and some Nashville hot chicken from the hot chicken place and man was it good everybody there was incredibly nice the scene was art deco cool and absolutely awesome.

name: HallPass
content: Awesome place! Came here late on a Tuesday. Wasn't too hungry got some sides at Skinny Fats. Side salad, cauliflower and a juice. All really good. Wish there were a place like this in LA where I'm from. I like all the concepts. Wish I got the lobster roll too but wasn't starving. Few places open past 10pm.

name: HallPass
content: Had a great time at hall pass, it has a good vibe and friendly staff. the too fast chicken sandwich was great along with the parmesan tots from codspeed. Dave is a really cool guy and showed me and my brother great hospitality. The bartender gave fast and accurate service. All around great experience and I'll definitely be back. The decor is great especially the wood tables.

name: HallPass
content: HallPass is easily becoming one of my favorite dining experiences downtown. The atmosphere and staff are very friendly and welcoming.  (especially the staff at SkinnyFats)Their drinks are also amazing! This is where my spouse and I begin our nights when we go downtown to bars. It's a great place for a large group of friends and couples. We can stay there talking for hours. The seating areas are comfortable and allow for privacy and I find the lighting romantic.

name: HallPass
content: Was surprisingly happy with the experience at HallPass. Food halls are often hit or miss, but HallPass has a moderate (not huge) offering of good food. Had the hot chicken tenders from the chicken place and tuna poke nachos from the seafood stall, and both were great! Staff were all super friendly, we could sit outside, and the place was the only restaurant in the shopping center that had multiple groups and a lively environment

name: HallPass
content: Thank you braddah Dave for the recommendation. The staff was very friendly and welcoming! Even the food options were so yummy. Shout out to Ian for the excellent recommendations for the lobster roll and lobster reuben. You da bomb!  Thank you again Dave and the rest of the Hallpass staff for an amazing experience.

name: HallPass
content: Yuuuum! It is expensive but super awesome and pretty. This is one of my favorite spots in SLC for its hipster vibes. I live in UT county and am from AZ, so I'm sure there are other awesome spots. I like the art at the Gateway though, especially the swings by the artist mural that has many lovely artists like Jimmy Hendrix, Freddy Mercury, and Janis Joplin. It does only have one female artist which does make one think a bit about the misogynistic history of the world, especially in UT. Nevertheless, there's plenty to see around HallPass and I would go again if I didn't have to move back to AZ.

name: HallPass
content: Great variety and atmosphere!  The selection of beers was nice. I can only imagine how cool it would've been if not for Covid-19.

name: HallPass
content: HallPass offers a wide variety of food choices. With many options to choose from HallPass is a great place to dine at with a large group. It was hard to decide which places we wanted to try. We ended up at Blaze of Thunder and SkinnyFATS. Blaze of Thunder offers GREAT chicken with different levels of heat. "Too fast" provides a great amount of flavor and heat. SkinnyFATS offered a wide range of healthier options and packed their food in environmentally friendly packaging. Their steakation (steak sandwich) was on point with flavor and over all quality of meat. I'm not the biggest fan of brioche bun and wish they weren't out of their whole-wheat option. We also ordered Smoke in a Bowl (chicken stirfry). This bowl offered AMAZING mouth watering flavors. The only con is, I wish there was more rice. Three of us decided to order the Bartender Roulette and one on a beer. Bartender Roulette is exactly what it sounds like. It's when the bartender makes a drink for you of their choice. All three of us received three very different drinks, which we were informed they normally don't do. One tequila, one vodka, and one rum. All three drinks offered very different, unique flavors and I highly recommend giving it a try. The beer was room temperature and I don't know about you but room temp beer isn't good. Over all I will definitely go back whenever I'm in the area.

name: HallPass
content: This was a great spot for me and my family to eat, loved all the seafood and the chicken sandwich was divine.

name: HallPass
content: My wife and i came for the first time a few weeks ago, and were totally blown away at how awesome this place is. Live music, incredible aesthetic, and even better food choices.  We have been coming every week since, and don't plan on stopping.  HallPass is an absolute must to go to!

name: HallPass
content: Great concept!  For a hipster eatery, the foods are amazing! I can't imagine what it would be like if things were back to normal, but I was appreciative with the staffs following the 6ft+ guidelines to keep customers safe and distanced. I ordered a lobster roll and clam chowder from Colossal Lobster.  Hands down tasty, and not even bothered by how much it was because the food makes up for it! I was so pleased with the clam chowder, most importantly.  Screw Boudin's because Colossal's chowder doesn't have that usual clammy flavor.  My SO ordered a spicy chicken sammy from Blaze of Thunder.  He enjoyed the sammy and the mac and cheese! I think their mac & cheese kinda stole the show lol.  It's creamy and even if you're busy enjoying your chicken sammy, the cheese sauce doesn't solidify or get clumpy. It's literal perfection!  If you wanted to order the spiciest chicken sammy, they make you sign a waiver form. Haha.We'll definitely be back for more and try out other eateries inside!

name: HallPass
content: This place is all the best food variety in one place. The fried chicken is so good I went back twice.  ramen was delicious, lobster sandwich was decent.  Strongly recommend it for casual dining grab and go.  Ser

name: HallPass
content: Yay for Utah finally having a food hall. Step inside to another experience here. Great for groups so you all can get what you want to eat then sit together. For those that drink alcohol they will come around and ask if you would like something from the bar. Tons of food options, lobster, cod, skinny fats, waffle place and more. We ate at SkinnyFats. Loved my buffalo chicken salad. I'm not a ranch fan so I had that put on the side. The burger was amazing and don't skip on the truffle fries. And get the SkinnyFats sauce too. Check out the Gateway for this location!

name: HallPass
content: If you're in the awkward situation where you have a large group of people and you all have to decide where to eat and make everyone happy... Hall Pass is your solution.*This isn't average cafeteria. This is the cafeteria for those who understand self-love, who appreciate the finer things in life, who want to have it all and won't compromise. That's Hall Pass.*We got to try Blaze if Thunder, Raining Ramen, and Colossal Lobster while we were there but they have so many options I don't know how you could go wrong.*Go there. Then get the poke nachos.

name: HallPass
content: I've come back a few times since, and been more than satisfied each time. Skinny fats burger melt was a perfect road trip snacker, and I can't get over how delicious and fresh Codspeed and Colossal Lobster are. Scallops Tacos might be my new favorite fish tacos anywhere.

name: HallPass
content: Horrible rude bar waitress. No shade at out door tables. Ate at Skinny Fats. Hubby's burger ordered medium well it was med rare. I ordered the Zucc It. I am not sure how zucchini noodles get to the point they are so hard and tough you can hardly eat cut them with a knife. The rest of the veggies were mushy and over cooked. Over all a bad experience.

name: HallPass
content: I can't believe I hadn't been here until today What a super cool place to eat, hang out, get a drink. Indoor and outdoor seating. There are so many different options of food from Seafood, Ramen, Waffles, Chicken, Health-food, and more.

name: HallPass
content: So I was having the worst day ever and came in to just check it out. Kelli helped me out. She's such a vibrant person and has such a heart of service! Because of her level of customer service I will be back 100%. And I'll be bringing more people with me!

name: HallPass
content: You know, there's just no reason you should pass up this dining option. Even if you don't want to park, take the train - it's about 2 blocks from the UTA blue line.Went on a Friday afternoon and managed to snag a 1 hr parking spot right across the street. They checked our temperatures (by our wrist) upon arrival and asked that we wear a mask when not eating, though it was a suggestion and not required. Plenty of social distancing options.My husband and I have very different food palates, but with 7 options plus a bar, we totally made an adventure out of it. We visited SkinnyFATS, Blaze of Thunder, CodSpeed and Colossal Lobster. (See their Yelp sites for my reviews.) Passed on Raining Ramen simply because it looked like too much food on top of what we ordered, but it's on the list for next time. Waffadopolis wasn't open nor was Hibachican, but they are also on the list. (I've had samples of the Hibachican sushi before - don't miss it!)Everyone was very friendly and even took our plates as we finished with each item, and brought us an extra bag for our leftovers.Take a group - it's the only place I know where there's something for everyone.

name: HallPass
content: Hallpass is a conglomerate of a bunch of different food places put together at the Gateway mall.  I really love this addition to the Gateway area.  Think high end food court; though, I think calling it a 'food court' would be almost irreverent given the quality of the food.  But it is in that you have your choice of places to order food and you find your own place to sit.  I've sampled food from a lot of the different places during an event, but for this review I'm going to focus on Colossal Lobster and Beer Zombies.My dining companion and I came when they first opened on the morning of 6/12/20.  Given that it is during the first days of reopening restaurants for dine in and the like after everything being shut down due to COVID-19, we were greeted and our temperatures taken before we were allowed in.  The person who greeted us was pleasant and friendly with good customer service skills.  He and the rest of the staff were wearing masks.  It's possible that gloves were also worn, but I just don't remember if they were.I ordered the Maine Lobster Roll and some Clam Chowder from Colossal Lobster.  It's important for people to know up front that this food is fresh and you're paying for fresh and flavorful food, so expect to pay the correct price for lobster.  In my opinion, the price is worth it.  I haven't found a lobster roll in Salt Lake City that is as good as this one.  The clam chowder is also one of the best clam chowders I've had in the state.  I could say that it probably is one of the best clam chowders in the state.  One could argue that isn't hard to do in a land locked state, but the freshness brings me back to eating in a coastal state.  I will absolutely come back to Hallpass specifically to order these items again.I ordered the Berry Me from the Beer Zombie and it was also very good.  I can't say much about the menu as I didn't spend a lot of time looking it over.  I do like that you can look at the drink menu on your phone by scanning a QR code, but I'm a little old school and would love to have the option of getting a physical drink menu to look at.  There is something viscerally enjoyable about a physical menu that is lacking in looking at a drink menu on my phone.  Kind of like reading a book printed on paper vs reading it on a kindle.  It's still the same book, but it just adds to the experience for me to have it in hand to look over.  I also find reading things on a cellphone less enjoyable overall.  But really that's just a personal thing and being able to scan a QR code to look at the drink menu is convenient and quick, and it works well with the overall concept of Hallpass.A few other mentions are that the space is open and comfortable to sit in.  With all the windows it fits perfectly with the Gateway's outdoor mall feel.  The bathrooms are nice and clean, and the wooden tables also work well with the outdoor theme of the mall.  In general, I really like Hallpass's concept and the quality level of the food.  I would definitely recommend it to others and I know that I will definitely be back.

name: HallPass
content: We decided to get lunch here as part of a special celebration. Parking underground in the mall parking was fine, and it didn't take us long to find our way to the store. The exact opening and closing times are in flux right now, but they were attentive and had a great focus on service and safety. After a short wait we got in. They have a large space with a variety of places to sit and dine, and some beautiful murals and outdoor seating to enjoy. It is kind of like a food court, but where all the restaurants are food truck owners. The availability varies from day to day. We had the options of seafood, spicy chicken sandwiches, and rice bowls, all of which looked good. We got the lobster roll and the More Cow Bowl which were both excellent. Good ingredients, good quality, a bit pricey, like most food truck fare. The rice bowls for takeout are different than the dine-in so be sure to get your order to go if you think you won't finish it and want to save the rest for leftovers. They have bathrooms and I heard there's a secret room you can book for private dining. They will offer drinks if you sit up front by the Zombies bar. My companion enjoyed the Berry Me mixed drink. The drink menu is only viewable via QR code though. Overall everything was good and clean, 5 star service, and 5 star food.

name: HallPass
content: This review is for Carmen! I was delivered the wrong order by door dash twice. I called SLC food hall, and Carmen went ABOVE and beyond to help me.  She attempted to contact door dash themselves, and the agent ended her chat while she was on the phone with me. She then spent another 15 minutes working to solve the problem, help me to not get charged twice and stayed on the line until another dasher had been assigned to my order. This level of customer service hardly exists anymore, and I'm so appreciative of Carmen's time and effort. She was so kind, patient and worked to solve the problem. Thank you Carmen!!!

name: HallPass
content: We are from our of town and saw the review so we decided to give it a go. The skinnyfats amazing healthy choices. Customers service excellent! Also got food from the Codspeed amazing and the customer service superb.Definitely visit this place for a one of a kind experience!!!Reed, the owner, your AMAZING and your place is amazing!!!!

name: HallPass
content: Great food, amazing setup. It's like a Disneyland for people that like food. I have the crab roll and it was awesome went back for some Ramen and in the broth is great.

name: HallPass
content: Went there for a yelp elite event and it was great! Love the layout and vibe. Didn't get to try many places since I'm vegetarian but the overhears conversations about the food was positive! Also love the secret bar (if you can find it ). That was probably my favorite part of the night! There are plenty of seats and the fire places are a nice touch!

name: HallPass
content: This is a great place to hang out with friends and family. I like to go with a group, we are able to all order our foods separately based on our craving and still meet to sit with each other. There's so many options, its a more modern and classy foot court. The decor and ambiance is nice with plenty of seating option inside and outside. This place definitely owns up to its hype. Bringing a little more life and excitement to the gateway mall. They have a full bar, many food options, pick your seats and buzz for a bar tender. Can't get any better!

name: HallPass
content: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. I have been a Skinny Fats fan FOREVER and was so excited they came to Utah. Everything about this place is awesome, atmosphere, drinks, food options, EVERYTHING. Blaze of glory chicken strips and a Montucky Cold Snacks  the fresh seafood place is also exceptional, one of the best clam chowders I have ever had.

name: HallPass
content: We ordered online due to Covid having restaurant shut down was told it was going to be ready at 4:48 arrived at 4:40 to wait at the curbside pick up had three other cars show up and pick up their orders before we were even talked to waited for about 40 minutes didn't get our order until 5:20. We got home and got the food the sandwich was supposed to come with two buns as pictured on the menu but instead came in two slices of bread, also the lobster was extremely dry and rubbery. To end on a positive note the chicken and the fries were very flavorful just wish it came as expected.

name: HallPass
content: What a cool place to eat! I live within walking distance of HallPass and I love the verity here. You want sushi? What about chicken wings? Lobster? Burgers? Ramen? Crapes? Pizza?The point is, if you're hungry, this is the place to go. Especially with a large group who all want something different :) very very good!

name: HallPass
content: Great environment and such a fun place to go for lunch if you work within the Gateway area! So many options for meals from ramen, to cod to chicken sandwiches! My favorite is Skinny Fats!

name: HallPass
content: There is a great variety of restaurant and drinking options at this venue! Everyone can find something that they want. The food is delicious and unique. The customer service is great too!

name: HallPass
content: As hard as it is for me to post this review I feel I needed to.  My wife and I have loved visiting SkinnyFats in LV for a few years now.  I personally was bummed when we visited LV a few months ago to see they changed their menu and removed some of our favorites, but we enjoyed some new selections.  We've been excited for months seeing the building of HallPass for months and then finally being able to visit.  Wow, what a disappointment!  My impression is, they want to add a feel of a trendy hipster bar feel to the whole idea.  Not good.  I get it that maybe to make a splash with some of the food critics that don't see life outside of a small corridor from the Avenues to 13th&13th and maybe Park City.If this is the case, HallPass will come and go as fast as trendy hipster foodies change their minds on the latest and greatest food scene for the moment.I had seen some reviews of how they were helped to be seated in the awkward seating that is very hipster bar scenesqe. When we walked in we seen four people walking around with radios in their ears and acting like they ran the place.  We received sad efforts at smiles and then watched them walk off talking with each other.  No effort to help.  The seating when there are lots of people is not convenient.  If HP doesn't figure out how to make the seating that will accommodate the non-hipster solicitor, I think a year from now the Gateway lease agreement will seem difficult to justify.When we tried to figure out what was served at some of the other vendors we felt like we were in the way of traffic.  The distance between seating and the fronts of the small restaurants is not accommodating. I actually sent a message to HP on yelp to see if there were online menus so this exact situation wouldn't happen.  In short I was told all of the restaurants had rotating menus so it wasn't an option.  Funny thing is there is now menus for most of the restaurants online, funny how that occurs.As much as I want to see this HP work, it will not work if they don't think more in line with serving the type of visitor that returns and not just a small fickle hipster group that will be gone as soon as next new thing pops up.Two stars for the fact that I do like SkinnyFats food.

name: HallPass
content: I love the concept here just wasn't too impressed with the actual food we did have. We had the frozen crunch balls, truffle fries, chicken tenders and pork belly bao with some cocktails. I was a bit underwhelmed but I feel like this place has a lot of potential and the ambience/decor is great. Would definitely give this place a try again

name: HallPass
content: Awesome food choices. SkinnyFats have delicious menu and love GF foodie. The staff was really friendly.

name: HallPass
content: The food was outstanding !! The chicken sandwich from blaze of thunder was to die for. We also enjoyed a "More Cow Bowl" and some fries from the unique menu at the SkinnyFats restaurant. Great downtown location as well, easy to park in the parking structure below the restaurant. While we enjoyed the vibe some may find it to be too noisy and crowded, it could also be hard to find seating at peak times.We will certainly be back to try more of the tantalizing options !!

name: The Copper Onion
content: This restaurant definitely ranks near the top of the locations I've tried in Salt Lake City. The service and food quality are top-notch. The wine selection is immaculate. I am constantly recommending this place to friends in town and to my coworkers. Definitely, you must try out the stroganoff and the bone marrow!

name: The Copper Onion
content: Solid place and really good food! Pork belly is really good and has good flavor! Marty's chicken is good too but I wish it had better sides that come with it. We came back to this place twice for dinner and both times were great! I wish they had better desert options :)

name: The Copper Onion
content: My girlfriend and I both decided to eat here for dinner as I had heard about it and seen it on lists of top restaurants in SLC. Safe to say we weren't disappointed and will return again. Food-We both had the carbonara and, as other helpers have mentioned, the pasta here is probably the best I've had. It was a pretty decent portion as I felt satisfied though it's not gonna overwhelm you. As for the dish itself, there wasn't too much sauce, and the bacon wasn't lacking. Location/Parking-It is central SLC so that usually means street parking which is the case here. Wasn't too bad finding a spot. Environment-It's a nice little restaurant, it can feel a bit cramped especially during COVID but it was manageable and the staff wore masks. Can be a little loud due to how many people are there and the mentioned crampedness but it wasn't unbearable. Service-Our waiter was very nice and checking on us throughout our stay. She gave us multiple refills, and picked up our plates as soon as we were done. We also didn't have to wait to be seated which was convenient (7pm on a Monday).

name: The Copper Onion
content: I eat here weekly, great food, friendly staff, ambiance is eclectic and warm.You don't wanna miss this place.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I dined in at the copper onion for dinner and I enjoyed there unique food. The place gets very crowded even during COVID. I recommend making a reservation. The ambiance is nice and they have a outdoor patio. Our waiter was nice and regularly checked for help on our meal. I ordered there beef wagyu stroganoff. The beef was very tender and flavorful. The pasta was firm and was cohesive to the sauce; honestly one of the best pastas I've had. The sauce was very beefy and creamy. Overall the dish was unique and I definitely recommend.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The food was amazing and the drinks were great too! I have nothing negative to say! The waiter was also so nice and had great recommendations for what's good on the menu. The bridle sprouts were also so good! Must try!

name: The Copper Onion
content: The Copper Onion...wow...it takes you back in time with the Frank Sinatra playlist. The ambiance is great, chill, moody, amazing. The food, DELICIOUS, and plated beautifully. Although a little pricey, WORTH...EVERY...PENNY. Sipping on a glass of white wine, listening to "You Make Me Feel So Young" by Frank and eating my perfectly cooked salmon at The Copper Onion....yeah I'll be back.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I had dinner at Copper Onion last night and really enjoyed my meal.  We both ordered the beef stroganoff which was recommended to us by our server and it was a great choice.  The Brussels sprouts side dish was ok. But I enjoyed the potato based appetizer and the local beers they had on tap. Service was excellent and the interior was modern and hip. We had an early dinner but by the time we got up to leave the restaurant was packed.  Copper Onion looks like it's a popular restaurant, I can see why.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I've lived in UT for years and this is the best food I have ever had here! Seriously so good. A little bit more expensive, but completely worth it! The burger was the best I've ever had... So much flavor and the caramelized onions were perfect. The beef stroganoff was to DIE for! Seriously amazing. The meat was so tender and the dish overall had the perfect amount of flavor. Highly recommend this place!

name: The Copper Onion
content: Great food and atmosphere. The meat and cheese plate was wonderful and the beef stroganoff was really good.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Farm to table freshness at an affordable price. The lamb riblets were ridiculously tender; bone marrow was super buttery; and the commodore cocktail was citrusy sweet. Great service too!

name: The Copper Onion
content: I want to come back to this restaurant at dinner and then give it another review. We came here during lunch time around 2PM and did not know that they didn't really have a lunch menu, but rather it was a brunch menu. Even still we decided to stay due to all the good things we had heard. Food & PresentationWe started with the ricotta dumplings which were fantastic. A little pricy for only 3 small balls, but delicious nonetheless. We followed it up with the 2 of the 4 lunchesque items that were being offered at 2 PM which were the carbonara pasta and the cacio e pepe. Both were decently good but nothing incredible. Presentation was also typical and did not really have a wow factor.Vibe & ServiceI love love love the vibe of the restaurant and how casual yet classy it feels. It seems like a great place to go for not only a great meal but to also just hang out with your friends and eat some great food. The service was pretty great as well.

name: The Copper Onion
content: i was in town this past weekend for a ski/snowboard trip with relatives. and what is the first thing that a yelp elite from SoCal would do when they are not in their hometown? yep thats how i found this restaurant. they are 2nd most reviewed restaurant in SLC after Red Iguana.decided to go with this place. i was mis-led by their yelp page saying that they DO NOT take reservations. but if go into their website, they actually DO through Resy. so admin, please update your yelp page. people probably see your yelp page more than your website.walked in around dinner time 7.30PM on a Friday night and was quoted 1 hour wait time, cool no problem we took a walk around the block and came back around 8.15PM. table wasnt ready until 9.00PM. umm we would appreciate if you guys quoted us more accurately? we could have gone elsewhere and come back around 9PM.we were starving after a full day on the mountain.started off with 5 appetizers- black pepper mussel - pepper sauce was great, but the mussels had no meat. so small- sauteed mushroom - delicious- pork belly - typical juicy pork belly, i like the glazing though, its sweet and savory- bone marrow - very generous, didnt expect it would come with 5 half marrows. never seen that in LA before. flavor-wise, well its roasted bone marrows, what do you expect.- ricotta dumpling - just mediocre. nothing special.continued with the entrees- lamb riblets - this was good, very tender, flavor was there. very generous portion.- wagyu beef stroganoff - it was okay, ive had better stroganoff elsewhere.- carbonara - ordered by a relative, didnt try- steak frites - - ordered by a relative, didnt try- some daily special pasta with tomato sauce - - ordered by a relative, didnt tryalso, had the cauliflower sides, i liked it. very delicious.our stomach did not have more rooms for dessert so we asked for check right away.service was quick. our server was attentive.to me, portions here are a little more generous compared to most restaurants in LA. this was our first meal in SLC, we didnt know. so you might wanna consider that.would have been a 5-star review if yelp page was showing the correct reservation information and if we were quoted correct waiting time.would i be back? idk, ill think about it.

name: The Copper Onion
content: We dined on the patio for Valentine's Day and the both food and service were great! We went before the sun went down so with the heaters it wasn't too cold, but if we would have gone any later it would have been too chilly to enjoy. The filet mignon special was delish and the beef stroganoff is always a hit. Drinks were great too!

name: The Copper Onion
content: Simply amazing food and a creative menu. One of me and my wife's favorite spots to eat.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Great meal at the copper onion! We had the stroganoff, salmon, mushrooms and pork belly. All were so delicious, we were blown away. Felt very covid safe, too. Would highly recommend!

name: The Copper Onion
content: I'm a fan. I thought for sure it would be overhyped. It's definitely pricey but the food is made with love or something! The stroganoff was more delicious than mom makes!! Delicious bread and a really fun ambiance. I'm looking forward to going back.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The copper onion is always a hit, especially in the summer when you can sit on the patio.  Their charcuterie board is amazing, the shashito peppers so good and their balsamic vinegar for dipping bread is so so good.  It's always booked and busy though so make reservations in advance.

name: The Copper Onion
content: One of my favorite experiences dining out. We tried the charcuterie board, stroganoff, and pudding. Food is worth the price.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Love this place!!  Great house made bread to start, ahi special appetizer, goat cheese salad and stroganoff.  It was all amazing!  The stroganoff was one of the best I've had outside of my own.  Love the fresh pasta. Great flavor overall. One complaint I have was the lack of clearing our dishes throughout the meal. Could be a covid protocol to limit interaction, so that's understandable. If not, I'd suggest clearing dirty plates more frequently. Otherwise, great service!

name: The Copper Onion
content: The food was delicious! The short beef waygu and mussels were perfectly cooked and tender. It was not dry and a really good portion size. The only thing we didn't like was that we ordered a side of papas fritas for $6 and it came with only six wedges.... that's basically $1/wedge and not worth it. Super pricey. The ambience was very nice and the tables are spaced apart for social distancing. Service was good and the have a full liquor bar!

name: The Copper Onion
content: I wanna start off by saying Brady is a fantastic waiter, and the cheesecake he recommended us to get is equally great. I don't usually opt for American food restaurants but this is the best food in that category that I've had. We were lucky to catch them on a day where the wait wasn't too long and ordered the Wagyu Stroganoff and the burger. Good portions, quality food, if you want a 10/10 experience order the cheesecake.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I know it's tough out there when a number of core "go to"  SLC restaurants close up shop.  My gosh, I never thought I would see Porcupine outside of the "U"  close. I still crave that delicious burger and fries and Copper definitely delivers.  I love their cocktails and their beef bourguignon has always been a must..probably why I never ventured too far within their menu in the past.  However for that burger craving in this new challenging environment, Copper is my new "go to."  To the Copper team who continues to deliver a great product while keeping the doors open during this tough time.. my hats off to you.  I am definitely picking up an order tonight in prep for college hoops.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Came here on Christmas Eve and had a very pleasant experience. The cocktails were delicious and boozy. One of my friends got the bone marrow and was a little disappointed with the portion, he didn't even say anything to our waiter and they brought out an additional bone and said that the chef felt he didn't get a fair amount. They also brought a side of fingerling potatoes for us. You can tell they care about you having a positive experience here. I got the white miso polenta... so yummy! I also got the mussels which have a perfect amount of spice. Our waiter also brought out more bread for us to dip in the mussels sauce.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Delicious food and great service! Everything on the menu I tried was delicious, including the cauliflower.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Absolutely incredible experience! Bone marrow was absolutely amazing, chicken was scrumptious and the broth was to die for I drank it with a spoon. My husband had the carbonara and it was delightful! Our server was lovely as well ( Janice? Jamie? Janine? I forgot, it was the delicious cocktails that caused the fuzz's memory! Literally best food I have had in a very long time. HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!!

name: The Copper Onion
content: I've eaten here many times. The inside is small but comfortable and cozy. The food is a little on the pricey side, but delicious. Like I said I've been here many times so it's not like it's too expensive. They usually have at least one surprising off menu item you can order, which I usually do. Good place.

name: The Copper Onion
content: FOOD: Food here is really good. Was recommended to try the Wagyu Stroganoff a few years ago and it was amazing. At a recent visit with friends, the dish is still top notch (friends still cant stop taking about it). Lots of good stuff to choose from, can't really go wrong with anything. AMBIANCE: Cute place! Sat outside this time because of the pandemic. Not fun in this kinda winter cold. PARKING: Street parking.TIP: There's usually a wait and they don't take reservations. So park, leave your name, and enjoy your car's fully blasted heater. OR have dessert first at Gourmandise (not too far away) after leaving your name on the wait list. (:

name: The Copper Onion
content: I think the copper onion is the best food in SLC. it's a little higher end, but the food isn't overpriced at all. Everything is delicious and the professionalism is admirable

name: The Copper Onion
content: One of the finest restaurants in Salt Lake for sure! You don't wanna miss this place.  I have tried their brunch and dinner, and it was excellent both times.  The portion is not big so you can enjoy an appetizer or/and dessert too.  I highly recommend  the carbonara pasta....one of the best I have ever had!  P.S. The covid procedure was well above the standard of restaurant businesses.  Temperature check upon arrival, QR menu, and shield on the bar counter.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Where do I start? So many amazing options, so little time. We loved the full meal. We had to wait a short wait so went next door to their sister restaurant for a cocktail. The wait went by very fast this way. We were sat and the were presented with so many delicious options it was hard to choose. We got the Patatas bravas, so crisp and delicious. The ricotta dumplings, sweet but savory and so so good. We shared the burger and beef stroganoff. I'm serious in saying that everything was incredible. This is a must visit in salt lake. We can't wait to go back!

name: The Copper Onion
content: I have always had a pleasant experience at the copper onion. Very good food and fair pricing. Clean and neat.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I love their drinks and appetizers. Their cheese plate is also divine. Strongly recommend you check them out.PS Copper Commons is great too!

name: The Copper Onion
content: We came here because (even with masks on) we could smell onions and there was a very happening vibe. There is outdoor seating and the indoor is also hip and trendy. The bathrooms are gorgeous and you'll likely see lots of couples or small groups of friends dressed nicely (girls wearing heels and cocktail dresses, as well as more casually dressed people) for a nice dinner. Being from outside of SLC, the prices seemed so affordable for a place that looks like this. This place serves American food, here are some notes from the group: - burger was delicious but the portion of steak fries was too small. You only get four pieces- the cacio e pepe tasted flavorful but was not authentic, they put their own spin to the dish with brown butter and onions, which is different from the actual recipe. The fetuccine was sligly over cooked- the carbonara pasta (according to my friend) wasn't good, but likely because she doesn't like onions in her food and didn't realize that all dishes at this restaurant will have onions- the salad and ricotta stuffed dumplings tasted great! they came to us broken which the waiter apologized for, and he comped it. we weren't sure why they didn't re-make it?I'd certainly come back here for a nice ambiance, not necessarily to scarf down food!

name: The Copper Onion
content: Taking COVID serious and serving great food.  Wonderful spot and good seating options.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Blt was amazing! And my bartender kept mimosas flowing. Great scene and not too expensive. My sandwich came with an arugula salad with a bomb dressing.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I'll preface this by saying my distaste for Salt Lake City runs deep, so it's not entirely The Copper Onion's fault for being located there. SLC isn't exactly a culinary capital so you should automatically lower your expectations wherever you go there. If you enjoy pretentious restaurants with trendy ambiance, you'll probably like this place. If you're a weary traveler looking for a respite and a well-rounded meal, then perhaps not. I ended up there against my will as it was one of the few places open past 9pm in SLC.  The menu was full of overpriced items which I assume some people enjoy, but as I didn't have a hankering for bone marrow or gazpacho, I settled for a burger and "steak fries." The steak fries tasted fine and were cooked well, but they were more like potato wedges than anything resembling a fry. The burger was lackluster at best and downright weird at worst. Again, partially my fault for ordering medium-well and expecting it to be cooked medium-well, but it was cooked until it was extra dead, and THEN some. This resulted in a springy and somewhat flavorless burger. The caramelized onions clearly had been caramelized using brown sugar which is both uncharacteristic and terrible. They tasted almost candied in the worst way. I did not finish the burger. Please stop doing this to onions. They deserve better. After a 40 minute wait for a table, another 15 minutes before our order was taken, and another 25ish minutes before our food arrived at our table, this was a long and slightly annoying experience. This was due in part to the table of loud, college-aged hipsters next to us who asked me to take a photo on a disposable camera, which they clearly believed was an interest piece. In response to a simple question about the film count, I received a scornful glance dripping with teenaged superiority over my perceived inability to work a "vintage" camera. It was simultaneously amusing and nauseating. They were not entirely to blame, however. Our server was adequate but brusque at best, with the kind of demeanor that made you question yourself for asking for ketchup. Also, the white cloth napkin had lipstick stains. Gross. This restaurant is exactly everything I dislike in an establishment, but it may be just what you're looking for.

name: The Copper Onion
content: My boyfriend and I had our anniversary here TWICE! It had amazing food! A great atmosphere, lovely staff, and feels so comfortable.  Our favorite place in SLC is the Copper Onion.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The Copper Onion is that rare restaurant that can be all things to all people.  Looking for a nice lunch while working downtown? No problem - they got you covered.  Good lunchable items with a lot of variety on the menu that won't break the bank.  A night out with your special someone.  Good atmosphere in the heart of downtown.  Done and done.  Big night out with the family to celebrate and you want to go nuts?  Perfect.  Just did that last night and with their mix of small plates and big you can craft a huge meal that is indulgent and celebratory.   They have items you don't often find like bone marrow.  They do the more well known dishes like a Pork Belly just right with some nice veg that takes it to the next level.  Their carbonara was a joy with plenty of bacon in place of lardon that brought a crunch and flavor that was great.   My steak was flavorful and my wife really enjoyed her trout.  The outdoor dining was well spaced and we felt safe from Covid.  Service was timely and unobtrusive.  Please come and support this institution.  Not all restaurants are gonna make it through these troubled times.   Vote with your wallet to help this one succeed.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Amazing Benny!! Amazing bloody Mary's! Insanely cheap prices. Awesome server. We are hooked

name: The Copper Onion
content: Yummm brunch here is the best! Get the eggs Benedict; so good. Good prices, $5 mimosa.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Everyone loves this spot. I love their strogonoff! Super delicious. Very good. The wait can get very long tho:(

name: The Copper Onion
content: Last time I was here I loved the atmosphere, drinks, bartender but the food was cold and just not what I had expected. I went here this morning and oh my did it change my opinion! Mimosas were delicious, my biscuits and gravy was warm, the biscuits were flakey and I could not have imagined something better! Our server was awesome and fun and we enjoyed the sun and everything else. Thanks Copper Onion, see you next time!

name: The Copper Onion
content: Went during COVID-19 time. They did not take reservations and first come first serve basis on table. We got their early (5:30pm) enough on Saturday to get patio seat.  It was very cool that they have a picture of bar code on each table to scan on our own cellphones, which brings up the menu on our cellphones. No touching menus from the restaurant. I left pretty much all the food and drinks selections to our wonderful server Alex, and everything gave us was great.  We had Pork belly for appetizer, Beef stroganoff and Mary's chicken for dinner and chocolate pudding for dessert. All great! But have to say, the Beef Stroganoff was something very special. We had 3 drinks and they were all very good, but my surprise favorite was Citrus Splash, which was non alcoholic drinks. If I could get this one + shot of vodka or gin, I could drink a whole pitcher of this!Very nice place with great food, awesome music selections and delicious drinks. Highly recommended.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The atmosphere and ambiance is an A+. A casual but classy feel. The host and majority of the staff seemed to be attentive and kind. My specific server was not rude, but not helpful.
