My main meal was the Copper Onion Burger with an Arugula salad. The duck flavors come out strong in the burger and add a unique and delicious touch. The bun was carefully toasted. The burger itself was good but nothing to write home about. The side salad was plain. Tip: Try the cheesecake. Very good if you like honey Con: The cheese board was good but overpriced and underwhelming Pro: The atmosphere sucks you in and makes you want to stick around

name: The Copper Onion
content: Great food and service. We had the goat cheese salad, white polenta and mushroom bowl and the carbonara and all were fantastic. The salad was perfectly seasoned and the dressing was light and the polenta was perfectly cooked and the mushrooms and fresh green beans really complemented the flavors. You can't go wrong with carbonara and the egg was fresh and mixed at the table. They also get 5 stars for extra covid safety with contactless menus and payment option.

name: The Copper Onion
content: My fiancé and I came here after our flight. They were pretty busy but it was worth the wait! We had a couple of cocktails and had the wagyu bone marrow, wagyu stroganoff and the rainbow trout. The cocktails are pretty tasty and the bone marrow is one of the best bone marrows that I ever had! The staff was great and were very attentive.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Thank you for the refund, Jeff. I wish you were as empathetic and humble as you are efficient when it comes to handling reimbursements. Be sure that this was the last time you had me as a customer. I can forgive mistakes, even mediocre food (it happens), but rudeness and cockiness, NEVER.

name: The Copper Onion
content: One of my favorite restaurants in SLC. Somewhat unique food and atmosphere is nice. Hard to get in because space is small. Looking forward to going again.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I really do love this place. The food is delicious and the place has a really nice ambiance. I'm giving it only 4 stars because I've never been impressed with the staff there...I've sometimes felt like I've created this huge burden for them when asking for something small. I've also seen a waitress turn from a table and roll her eyes. Yikes. The food is a bit pricey for what it is BUT I keep coming back because those papa Fritas keep pulling me back in

name: The Copper Onion
content: This place is about as close to perfectiopn as it gets. From excellent staffing to their attention to detail on the plate. The only thing missing is, well, nothing.

name: The Copper Onion
content: We were in SLC visiting for a long weekend over the winter and had the delight of dining here on a Friday. Service was impeccably friendly and professional, and everything we tasted was divine - with my favorite probably being the beef stroganoff that was made with Wagyu - although the brussel sprouts were also excellent. Would definitely visit again next time we are in town!

name: The Copper Onion
content: A work group popped in hoping to snag a table. Luckily, the big table in the center of the restaurant was open for ninety minutes. There were eight of us and the crew did a fantastic job. We ordered a variety of items, all delicious. My pasta was perfection. Can't wait to go back when they reopen.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I really love The Copper Onion! I've been here many times, and have even celebrated my birthday here before. In my opinion it's one of the better restaurants in the area, and they have a great menu that changes a lot. It's on the expensive side, but if you know that going in, you won't be disappointed because the food is worth it! Also very well decorated and great staff.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Wonderful environment, friendly staff, classic food with a twist.  Thank you for the experience.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Did I come here on an off day, or did I order wrong (Mary's Cast Iron Chicken)? Definitely consider calling ahead for reservations, as seating is small and limited in this nicely designed, almost farmhouse chic atmosphere. Parking is super easy if you can get the spots across the street, and parking during the week is free after 8pm. Its seemingly very popular, as i came here on a Tuesday and it was packed. I once tried coming here before, but the wait was so long, that it really only made sense to come with reservations. I ordered the Mary's Cast Iron Chicken - which according to the waiter was an 'right-on! excellent choice' - from his reaction; I was excited and ready to be wowed! Except I was underwhelmed and left hungry and disappointed afterwards. The meal fell below my own expectations - If i hear 'cast iron' my mind goes to crisp chicken skin, with a taste and seasoning that you can only get from a well seasoned cast iron pan. Instead, I got wet chicken skin with mild brown seasoning, that sat in a bowl with a mix of veggies, some sort of raisin or dried berry, swimming in a thing unflavored broth. It basically felt like I was eating a chicken breast in a shallow bowl of veggie soup. Oh, and it wasn't even served in a cast iron pan - it was served in a bowl. Totally boring meal - (see pic). I give this place a 2-Star because the service was pretty good, I did enjoy the appetizer/small plates that they had - the bone marrow dish was interesting and flavorful, fried cauliflower was pretty good as well. The shisito peppers were borderline, I felt like they should have bought smaller ones, as the larger shishito peppers tend to have larger seeds which isn't always the best thing to chew on and get stuck in your teeth. Would I come back, ehh I 'might' only if someone else drags me here - i know I just wont order Mary's Wet Chicken Soup.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Even though we didn't have a reservation and it was busy, we were seated right away. This place was a dream come true. We sat at the chef's table and watched all of the food being made and plated. Everything was exquisite and delicious. The service was polite and unobtrusive. Husband had the waygu stroganoff. It was absolutely delicious, rich and balanced.My 9 year old had the pasta carbonara which he loved. It was smokey and creamy. I had the scallops. The smoked mushroom risotto was to die for. I highly recommend the green lip muscles. They were the plumpest, cleanest muscles I have ever eaten and the sauce was so delicious, bright and citrusy, but it did not overwhelm the muscles. We did not try dessert, but I would like to return in the future. Well worth it.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Wow! Fun atmosphere! Definitely higher end restaurant and higher prices. But. The. Flavors. Perfect potion sizes and filling beautiful local eats. The stroganoff was awesome but heavy, I wish I would have tried one of their yummy looking salads with it.Get the fried cauliflower as an appetizer. Melt in your mouth and bursting with flavor! LOVED IT. Tip- get a reservation online. So simple and easy!

name: The Copper Onion
content: I love that their kitchen is so exposed and out in the open. I very much enjoy seeing the chefs making the food right there, displaying their artistry. My favorite things on the menu is the stroganoff. I tried the burger for a second time since people rant and rave about it so much but I just think maybe it isn't entirely consistent. The first time it was dry, the second time, it had far too much onion. Granted, the place has onion in its name but I could hardly taste anything but onion. I did like the bread, though, but don't plan to order the burger here anymore. Stick with their other entrees that they do so well. I also love their bone marrow appetizer as well as the mushrooms. The service has been great, in my experience.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Crispy goat salad was good. The breading around the goat cheese had the right amount of crunch. Pork belly was DE-LISH. I loved the fig jam with it.Lamp riblets were so tender, the meat just fell off the bone. It was my boyfriends' favorite dish. Pasta carbonara was perfection. Loved loved loved it.Our waitress was the sweetest and very attentive. I love the atmosphere as well. I suggest sitting at the chef's table to see how it's all made. I would definitely recommend to my friends who want to come visit Salt Lake City.

name: The Copper Onion
content: This was the best dining experience I've had in months. The braised octopus was juicy and crispy and was fantastic with that spicy aioli and pickled onions. The patatas bravas were delicious and crispy. We were very happy with the wagyu stroganoff, cacio e pepe, and pork chops. Most of all, AJ and James took great care of us. Service couldn't be better.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Excellent Food, great location, beautiful costumer service. Visited during lunch on a weekday, it was busy yet the costumer service didn't reflect it. I was surprised by the diverse menu, which made it hard to choose my meal. I ordered the rainbow trout. It took a while to be served but did not disappoint. The rainbow trout was served on lentils and a yoghurt sauce, it was a perfect taste blend. I am looking forward to come back to taste the rest if the menu items.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Food was awesome! Service was great! Thanks Tyler and Alex for the attentive care. Get the poached pear for dessert! So good!

name: The Copper Onion
content: Went for lunch. Great food and awesome beer. They could use more vegan options but so could most places.

name: The Copper Onion
content: AJ is my favorite waitress. All the staff are always kind. She is so knowledgeable, and makes suggestions. She checks up enough but doesn't come back every minute. The food is great too, but I really dig great service! Speaking of food though, one word- CAULIFLOWER. Is it the best cauliflower I've ever eaten? Yes, yes it is. Do I eat a lot of cauliflower? Yes, actually, I do. Will I order it every time I come? Abso-freaking-lutley. Is it worth a trip and possible wait just for the cauliflower?  The Location is fantastic. They will validate for the parking garage next door. One of my favorite places to dine downtown.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Service was a little slow but we were chatting so it was fine for us... the food and atmosphere was amazing so I have no complaints. Excited to return!

name: The Copper Onion
content: Amazing restaurant In the heart of the city I must visit and delicious food. Highly recommend

name: The Copper Onion
content: Not much more to say that hasn't been said?Get a reservation if possible , they get busy and it's not a huge place. AJ was an amazing server. Knowledgeable and was so nice not to rush. We all loved our food. Didn't get many pics!

name: The Copper Onion
content: Great meal all around. Nice buzz in the room too. And service was top notch. I was in town for a conference and had some concern about the quality of the local food scene but this place would get 5 stars from me anywhere.

name: The Copper Onion
content: NOT VERY ACCOMMODATING . .  . We thought we would try this restaurant. There were four of us so I called ahead for reservations. They said they didn't take reservations so we figured we'd gamble and went there anyway. We showed up and when I was asked "do you have a reservation" I said I thought you didn't take reservations. A woman with large black glasses snapped at me and said "we are full up". So I said in answer to your question "no we don't have a reservation". The three women I was with were shocked at how rude she was. It gets better. It just so happened that a reservation of party of four did not show up so they seated us almost immediately. Which was great. One of the women in our group apparently had her boyfriend stop by to see if maybe he could just talk to us. He did not want to eat. He came to the table and was promptly told he would have to leave. We asked to speak to the manager. It was the same woman that snapped at me with the black glasses. She came over and said that they could have us go back to the waiting area and we could put our name back on the list.  We had already ordered. Her boyfriend just left. It was very awkward and she was clearly very agitated with our group. She said "if you had asked for a table of five we would've seated you to a Table of five but you asked for a table for 4 and then try to add one more person". "We can't do that"  She cited some bullshit story "if the fire marshal came in here he would shut us down"?  That's odd because as a fire fighter I know the fire code and that's complete bullshit.  Furthermore we were sitting right next to a fire exit egress.  Anyway the server was kind, the food was good, however small portions, no bread, and all salads were additional charge. We had a very bad taste in our mouth after dealing with this manager so it will be sometime before I ever go back to this restaurant.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Visiting from out of town and decided to find a place with a wide selection so Yelping led here. The range of dishes on the menu is really nice. We came at a buAs for the food, the dish was delicious and came out at a good time. Portions for the dishes I saw coming out of the kitchen looked well sized for a hungry fella like myself.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Oh my god, this meal! I found The Copper Onion on our ride from Moab to SLC, I was craving Pasta Carbonara and immediately made a reservation. My partner ordered the burger. We didn't speak much during the meal because we couldn't stop eating! We contemplated coming back a second night but our visit was so short we wanted to try another restaurant. I regret missing out on another meal here.

name: The Copper Onion
content: This place was amazing.  Make sure you get a reservation.  I highly recommend the beef stroganoff.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I went here once before as a work outing, and we got almost everything on the menu. It was all delicious.Came here with my wife for her graduation celebration. We started off with the inimitable patatas bravas. The flavors were incredible. Smoky, crisp, and mouth-watering potatoes in a to-die-for sauce. What an amazing way to start. Followed it up with the house bread. Simple, scrumptious, and satisfying. My wife had the beef stroganoff, and I got the lamb riblets. My wife loved hers, and I loved mine. For my dish, the lamb literally fell off the bone. Neither of us wanted our dish to end. They were both absolutely delightful.Oh, and the service was attentive and considerate. The environment was warm and welcoming. What more could you ask for? We will be back.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Good food and service. A little noisy and hard to hear.Had a bunch of homeless surrounding the location which made my other guests feel unsafe.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The staff here was rude and disrespectful during a recent visit. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby that treat their customers with more respect so don't bother with this place.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Best burger I've ever had in my entire existence. I turned to my fiancé and asked, "have we just walked into heaven?"

name: The Copper Onion
content: this place was awesome!! i was pretty full when we got here, so we got a few appetizers and dishes to share/try.the sides i ordered were awesome - my favorite was the roasted cauliflower. unbelievable. the bone marrow we got as an app to share was great. and the wagyu pasta was well seasoned and hearty. we all had mixed reviews about this pasta - we felt as though the meat didn't taste like wagyu, but like a cheaper meat.finally. my favorite part of this dinner were the ricotta dumplings. they reminded me of gnudis. crispy on the sides, soft on the inside, and a complex flavor profile of both sweet and salty. we kept ordering more of these!!!i would love to come back. service was impeccable. bathrooms were clean. food was excellent. would like to try their brunch next time.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The staff was very friendly and offered polite but not overbearing service. The house bread was good and the honey butter smeared along the side helped the dish to feel unique. There was also salt sprinkled below the bread which was a nice addition to the bread and honey. The fries were surprisingly crisp for being thick wedges. The copper onion burger was pretty good. Nice bun, the aioli was strong (which is good, what's the point of a flavorless sauce?)The meat cooked exactly to specifications. But it was just a standard burger. No unique flair to it or anything to make it stand out in a lineup.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I was told this place was great and wasn't disappointed..! My goodness. The atmosphere is relaxed, intimate and friendly. The food was heaven to my pallet. I recommend the beef stroganoff!!!

name: The Copper Onion
content: went out with a friend for dinner, food was amazing well thought out. all the flavors goes together

name: The Copper Onion
content: Absolutely amazing dishes !! The scallops are my Personal favorite ! It comes over a creamy dish of rice. The chicken is also absolutely exquisite!! I would recommend to anyone for a cute date or a fun occasion. Can't go wrong. They also had vegan and gluten free friendly options which was so great being that I am allergic to gluten.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Came in on our anniversary trip looking for good food and were not disappointed. We started our dinner with the ricotta dumplings. They were good but a little to sweet (they add honey and it was a little much).Next we had the Wagyu Bone Marrow and it was as delicious as could be imagined. It was like butter and it had a fresh little salad to break up the heartiness of the bone marrow.Finally we each had pasta. My wife had thee Wagyu Beef Stroganoff and I had the Carbanara. They were delicious and highly recommend the Carbanara. Overall would recommend it to everyone!

name: The Copper Onion
content: I was visiting my kids and we decided to have brunch here today.  While waiting, my son and I had a drink at the bar and met a cool guy from the East coast. After talking awhIle we were seated and preceded with brunch. Our meals were great and the service from Halley was absolutely perfect!  I could not have asked for any better food quality or service.  As we waited for our check, Halley came back to let me know that the man at the bar paid our bill. I was awestruck over the kindness. We stopped at the bar to say thank you and talked a bit....Thank you Andy. The environment today was perfect from the Copper Onion and our new friend Andy who bought us brunch because my son is deploying and for my past service.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Awesome!! I really love this restaurant. The food And the service were both so good.  I highly recommend this place to  anybody.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The hostess and waiter were rude from the start, it stated it was kid friendly, it was far from it. Pasta carbonara was bland and unappealing. It was an awful experience all around.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Love this spot in downtown SLC. The burger is delicious but so is the bone marrow and the Brussels sprouts. I've never had anything I didn't love actually

name: The Copper Onion
content: Amazing food and service, attentive staff and good value for quality.  Got the Wagyu Beef Stroganoff and it was tasty and tender.  Small selection of beers but good mix of locals.  Crowded and busy but you couldn't tell by the level of service.

name: The Copper Onion
content: This place was amazing! Loved every second and the food was delicious. Hostess/host were great and the waitstaff was wonderful. 10/10 would always recommend!

name: The Copper Onion
content: My boyfriend and I came from out of town for our anniversary because it was highly recommended from all our local friends. We were so excited about the menu and the venue as it looked awesome and had great reviews! Our server was beyond condescending and rude, when we mentioned he might be having an off night to the host he reassured us he knew him and he really was a good guy :/ Asking to pair a wine with our meal felt like a huge inconvenience. When trying to strike up a conversation with our server about visiting Oregon, the state he was from, he rudely interrupted us to ask if that was all while turning his back. Our overall experience was unforgettable for all the wrong reasons. We rushed to close out our tab and leave without trying any of the items we had been craving from research online. Unfortunately copper onion turned out to be quite disappointing.

name: The Copper Onion
content: We went on a Friday night around 8 and had about a 45 minute wait, which we expected. They do allow you to leave and will text when your table is ready so we did that and headed next door for a drink. Great ambiance, love the decor, and the experience was great. Our server AJ was potentially the kindest person I've ever met. She was enthusiastic, warm, patient and knowledgeable. If for nothing else, I'll be back because she was SO great. We ordered the ricotta dumplings and crispy cauliflower to share. This cauliflower is what dreams are made of. Wow! The dumplings were nice. Me and a friend split the goat cheese salad and beef stroganoff. I would say maybe skip the goat cheese salad. It was dry and the only part I really enjoyed was the crispy goat cheese. As for the stroganoff, it was delicious.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I can't believe I forgot to write a review on this place but here it goes. While I had visited my friend who lives in Utah he had suggested this restaurant . Before coming in I came with a party of 15 we had called in to make reservations since it was such a big group . Since it was my first time ever being in Salt Lake City and not familiar with the area nor the restaurants I can say that this place is very accommodating. Knowing that we had a huge party they made it work. Upon of arrival there is no parking  lot,  but they do offer street parking and there's a parking structure next door I believe. We  had a late dinner so parking wasn't hard to find. Walking in I love how the restaurant was modern with a hint of rustic  theme which I lovee! Over all the service was great and the food was great ! Highly suggest to share the food since it comes in big portions. I can't wait to come back and dine here again !

name: The Copper Onion
content: Wow, best burger in town for sure. My friend who is a local recommended this place and let's see I was no disappointed. The copper onion burger is bursting with flavor, the meat is perfectly cooked, and the bread was soft and warm. The banh mi was also really good. All the flavors stood out individually yet came together really nicely. The arugula salad was one the best salads I've had in a long time. So fresh and delicious!!!The staff was friendly and the service was quick. The venue is classy and clean. Will definitely return again next time I'm in Utah.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The burger was amazing! We went here to kick off our yearly ski vacation and it was delicious. We made a reservation around noon and arrived at 11:40am and we were sat immediately. Our waiter was attentive and nice. My dad and I both had the Copper Onion Burger and it was delicious! We will definitely be returning in the future!

name: The Copper Onion
content: What is a copper onion? I have no clue. But I had one of the best meals in a while, so I could care less. I had the duck confit cassoulet, which was amazing! The duck was good, but the andouille sausage really gave this dish some amazing flavor (the sausage was the circular pieces in the dish). I had a whiskey drink which was good as well. The seats at the bar had backs, which made it comfortable for eating a real meal. Seems like a real foodie spot.

name: The Copper Onion
content: I had the chance to try the Copper Onion during the Salt Lake Dine o Round. I think I will just get myself an entree on my next visit, as it would have been cheaper to do it that way, and just share an appetizer and dessert. But all three of my courses at this meal were stellar. I had the roasted potatoes, which I loved. My partner got the alternative entree, which I believe was spaghetti squash. His was OK; I was happy I got mine instead. My mushroom fettucine was awesome, though I could have used some meat in the mix. My partner got the fish, which came in the form of a little ramekin-shaped cake. He was happy with the taste, but said it wasn't what he was expecting. Both desserts (pudding with olive oil, and cheesecake with honey) were so, so good. I think I liked the cheesecake more, which surprised me. Our service was good. We got there right at opening so as not to have a wait. I liked the design and environment inside the restaurant as well. Overall, I'd definitely come back.

name: The Copper Onion
content: The food and drinks are wonderful here, especially the rainbow trout and wagyu stroganoff. It is best to make a reservation as it gets pretty crowded especially on Friday and Saturday. It is great for a casual dinner, however it is quite loud in the restaurant. So if you have a big group (6-10)  it will be harder to hear each other. Service was great and the food came out quickly. Parking can be tricky especially on busy nights like Friday and Saturday but there is a parking garage next door. Overall excellent place to eat.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Copper Onion is a Salt Lake staple. I work downtown at a hotel and cannot recommend it enough to guests. Whether they are looking for something unique to Salt Lake, or simply a delicious, sit down dinner, my first recommendation is always Copper Onion. As for my own visits to CO, I've never had anything on the menu that has been short of excellent. Both their brunch and dinner menus have a variety of options that make it difficult to choose, but ensure everyone will find something suited for their own tastes. These dishes have really stood out to me BALLARD FARMS PORK CHOP BEEF STROGANOFF SNAKE RIVER FARMS FLANK STAKE(however, I will say it was a smaller portion) CRISPY CAULIFLOWER BRUSSELS SPROUTS As for the drinks, the Valentino and bourbon sidecar are my favorites. They both have fantastic flavors, and are on the sweeter side.

name: The Copper Onion
content: Great food and environment. Perfect for a date. It was pretty busy so we ate at the bar which I recommend :) Pricey but delicious.

name: The Copper Onion
content: We had a great meal here. We sat at the chef's table which is cool to watch. Our waiter, Brennan, was very nice and knowledgeable of the menu. We started with the ricotta dumplings which were the perfect size app for 2 of us. I had the burger and my boyfriend had the trout. Everything was delicious and cooked perfectly! The peanut butter crisp marshmallow dessert was sooo good. Highly recommend coming to the Copper Onion!

name: Red Iguana
content: We didn't care for this place, hard to find,  we tried all 5 salsas and didn't care for any of them. Nor mole. Just didn't care for anything we ate. Slasa leedos is 100x better

name: Red Iguana
content: This place was incredible! Ask for a mole sample and the waiter will walk you through each of them and recommend what you should order based on which one you like. The shredded beef in the tacos was amazing. Everything they brought out was delicious. The guacamole was incredibly fresh and bright. Go at an off time to get a table right away.

name: Red Iguana
content: I am not sure that I can contribute to the more than 3.8k reviews --- but.....this place rocks.   If you are not local, you will never know.   Recommended from some local people and it did not disappoint.   We thought it was funny, we wear told that the restaurant was located in a sketchy part of the Salt Lake City.   I did not find it dangerous or really all that bad.   We waited outside for an hour and it was totally safe.  The place is all about Poblamo sauces, which is not my first choice.  But we shared their sample plate and it was awesome.   There is some really unique flavors.  This is a must try if you visit.   The chips were brought out hot and the salsa is decent.    I did order some queso for dipping, it is not traditional white queso, more like velvetta or something like that, kind of weird, shrug.......I went with a carnitas chimichanga, it was very good.   It DID come out with white queso, lol.   I must have not understood my server, for some reason it did not come out with red sauce, no problem, the server quickly brought some.     Fresh guacamole A+++++++.........My business guest all ordered the poblamo chicken dishes.    All dishes are served hug and between the four of us, we could share and get a good variety of their offerings.   Overall, just a great experience and the margaritas are decent too.

name: Red Iguana
content: If I could eat here everyday I would !  But I'd get fat. Dessert is my weakness ! Fried ice cream is to die for.

name: Red Iguana
content: I'm from the Central Valley in California, so if I'm comparing Mexican food from  Cali to RI in Utah, I can't give 5 stars. No way. No comparison, California Mexican food is just better. Food was 3/5 rating and 1 extra star just for our server. She was a hustler and did a very good job. My wife and I did sample all the moles before ordering. My favorite was the Poblano mole, which was a dark red mole that was the perfect balance of smoky heat and sweet and my wife liked the Verde mole, which was a bit nuttier and almost creamy. While the chicken mole enchiladas are good, the rice and beans were not as good as they should of been. If you're from a state or city that doesn't do real Mexican food, this place will be a treat for sure. If you're from a place that has easy access to great Mexican food, you will leave a little disappointed. I'd Come back though if I had reservations and didn't have to wait, otherwise the wait wouldn't be worth the meal

name: Red Iguana
content: This restaurant is a beautiful image of Mexican food. Service was incredible as the waiters were super respectful. Our food came 5 mins after we ordered it and was SPECTACULAR! 3 of us shared a chicken fajita. We asked for extra tortillas which came immediately. Deserts were good as well. We ordered flan and tre leche. Overall, a really enjoyable restaurant for family's.

name: Red Iguana
content: I think the food is overall good but insanely busy and personally not really worth the wait imo. I think if it's your first time in salt lake, this is a place worth trying out since it was on a food network show but if you wanna try something else that feels more authentic I suggest definitely trying blue iguana.

name: Red Iguana
content: I've been to Red Iguana a handful of times over the years, and every time I go, I want to like it the way everyone else does. I really do! I come determined to really like my food here. But man, I just don't get it. Everything here to me is just OK. It's always super busy, so get there early or plan on a wait. I've had enchiladas, chimichangas, and burritos. All fine. And if I remember right, I don't love their chips and salsa, though it's been a minute since my last visit. Service has always been good from what I can remember. Red Iguana will never be my first choice for Mexican food. I'd rather go to West Valley for Don Pollo, Cottonwood for Lone Star Taqueria, or Chile Tepin if I'm downtown. If someone wants to go to Red Iguana, I won't pitch a fit, but I also won't understand why they picked it.

name: Red Iguana
content: Rarely do things live up to the hype. Not only was the food and drinks amazing, but the service as well :) we made a reservation in advance but when we checked in a lot of folks had waits fo an hour or more! Still would be worth it, but glad we didn't have to wait this long to eat this food!

name: Red Iguana
content: Do not like this food. I will never eat here again. The green chilli wasn't hot or very good, the burrito reminded me of taco bell. I don't get what the hype is about, I did not like the food or the prices

name: Red Iguana
content: Always a must stop when in SLC on business!  No wait to get in, which was nice!  Usually it takes a few minutes. Had the beef enchilada plate and added 2 fried eggs!

name: Red Iguana
content: A good spot with good atmosphere just a little small and the menu was a little confusing but a local hotspot if you know anyone who likes Mexican or Aztec food or mine food take them here your sure to impress

name: Red Iguana
content: I just wanna say, before this dining experience I was NOT a fan of Mexican food. But this restaurant changed my culinary taste buds ever. The BESR MEXICAN FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD! This place will blow your mind, no wonder Guy Fieri came here! The mole here is fantastic! And we had two rounds of virgin Pina colada! The fried ice cream is enormous and delicious, overall this is a great dining experience!

name: Red Iguana
content: This place was so amazing we visited twice during our stay and we all ate the exact same thing both times. I can't say enough about the savory mango mole enchiladas. What's not to love about carnitas wrapped in a corn tortilla and topped with savory mango mole. I wish this place would open in my home town. Place can be very busy but service is pretty fast. They will put you on a wait list while you wait in your car. It's worth the wait. The place is not big but they spread out the tables. Staff wore masks and cleaned the tables with disinfectant. We had a wonderful dinner and a experience at Red Iguana.

name: Red Iguana
content: The food is so good, when there is family coming into town from out of state we make sure to hit this place up while they are here. Even though we live a few hours from SLC the drive is worth it. Having lived in New Mexico we got to really know the flavors of the southwest, and this place does such a good job bringing those tastes to Northern UT. Prices are not bad, they are a little higher than some other places, but really a good deal, each time we have come in our server has been so friendly and very on top of our needs.

name: Red Iguana
content: Every website we checked out and person we talked to said Red Iguana was worth the wait and lived up to the hype. The wait was an hour and a half at 7:45 pm but we decided on take away which came out in about 15 minutes, so no complaints there. The staff was super lovely and recommended the yellow mole and we did the mushroom quesadilla as well. The mole sauce was great but just placed over the chicken, which was dry. Beans and rice were bland. The mushroom quesadilla was greasy and salty. Honestly, I don't get the hype. Kind of confused on the Mexican scene in Utah.UPDATE: Chips and salsa are fire. This salsa might be the best I've had.

name: Red Iguana
content: Fabulous authentic Mexican food. Yummy margaritas (and I am a margarita snob). Soooo accommodating!  We had an 8:30 reservation (the restaurant closed at 9). Flight was delayed so we didn't get there until just before 9 and they still let us in. SUPER fast and friendly service!  Highly recommend if you are in the area.

name: Red Iguana
content: AMAZING - food and service were excellent.  Make a reservation, otherwise expect a wait {we waited 45 minutes on a week night} but whatever wait there may be it's worth it.  I had the quesadilla which looked more like a burrito and it was SO GOOD!  My friend had the chimichanga it wasn't a crispy chimichanga like she expected but she said it was excellent.  The guacamole was so good - everything was fantastic!  I can't wait to come back!

name: Red Iguana
content: Truly amazing place! I've heard people raving about it so much, so I decided to check it out! Obviously, there was a huge line when we've arrived, but was totally worth the wait! Super nice and friendly stuff, our waiter Tony was superb! Very accommodating, helpful and fast! True ninja :)The food was wonderful! Best shrimp quesadilla I've ever had, hands down!

name: Red Iguana
content: One of the best Mexican food restaurants in North America. Always premium service from their staff and consistently tasty Mexican food.Try something outside of their Mole specialty's like the Don Ramon tacos.

name: Red Iguana
content: Lots of food. Amazing serviceHorchata is best in UT hands down. Only go here if you're hungry cause they do give lots of food

name: Red Iguana
content: Came in today swing by and was very glad I did highly recommend you stop by this place if you have the chance

name: Red Iguana
content: Classic Slc Mexican. They have the best black mole ( probably the only black mole)! Get the mole tester to try them all! There is another location around the corner of the line is too long! Same chef!

name: Red Iguana
content: We heard a lot about this place so we just tried a few items: the mole verde, nachos regulares, and the guacamole. The mole verde was very unique in flavor and unlike any mole I've ever had. It was good but the chicken was pretty dry. The nachos were pretty flavorless but the kids liked it okay. The guacamole also lacked flavor too, which is pretty disappointing. We had to add salt to it to make it edible. Good guacamole is a must if you want to be a good Mexican spot. I will say their tortilla chips which seem house made were very good with some seasoning on it. Overall, nothing to write home about. It gets 3 stars because they were very nice and the mole was good. Otherwise, bland Mexican food.

name: Red Iguana
content: Delicious declicious delicious. Now I know why there's always a wait or a line for this place! Their food is a little on the pricier side, but so fresh abs so so good! We got the shrimp fajita with the fish tacos. The only thing that disappointed me is that my husband asked for a fish burrito they wouldn't make that for him even though we offered to pay extra he really wanted the burrito I hope you make an exception for people who only can eat halal or kosher. Other than that their service food and drinks were all incredibly amazing. We will be back for sure.

name: Red Iguana
content: Amazing food, lives up to the hype. The wait is well worth it. We had to come back two days in a row on our vacation from Texas. I really doubted this place as I am not a fan of Mexican food. I would have never imagined myself ordering "mole". They have quite a variety of different types of mole. If you ask, they will give you a sampler plate of all the flavors. Our food was so enjoyable I wish we had one down in Houston, TX! Drinks are also made strong but have a good flavor. The only downfall to this place is long wait times.

name: Red Iguana
content: The spot is truly exceptional and unique. The most authentic and homestyle Mexican food I've ever had on the side of the border. All of their Moles were phenomenal and homemade. Guacamole and salsa con queso were tremendous. Even the kids chicken quesadilla and chicken taco we're also phenomenal.Bold authentic flavors, clean and upbeat atmosphere.An absolute must see if you are in the Salt Lake area and looking for tremendous Mexican cuisine. Will be back again and again.

name: Red Iguana
content: Heard about this place many times, decided to check for myself. Only my 3rd Covid inside dining in 11 months. Felt safe, food and service were both 5 stars. Will be back often.

name: Red Iguana
content: Great authentic Mexican food. The restaurant is roomy a d they have a heated patio,  to ease any indoor dining concerns with covid.

name: Red Iguana
content: This is a must when you are in Salt Lake. I'm back in Utah for a class and I have to eat here before I leave. Hands down it is the best Mexican food. And excellent margaritas.

name: Red Iguana
content: Love this place. If you like Mole, you must go to this place. A dozen mole varieties, every one has been awesome. Go early. It gets crowded.

name: Red Iguana
content: 3 stars for above average Mexican food. From NJ where there are also a ton of Mexican food and this place does compete with them but did not blow them out of the water. The wait was approximately 40 minutes on a weekend day early afternoon. Service was very friendly and helpful. It is small inside and they space out tables evenly for social distancing. 1. Sopa de Maria - Good, a little kick from the Jack cheese.2. Carne Asada tacos - On the drier side. Comes with ingredients that you assemble yourself. Plenty of meat. Good taste overall. Overall, good place to try at least once or if you're craving Mexican food and don't mind a wait.

name: Red Iguana
content: Amazing food! Great service! This really is one of the very best restaurants in SLC! The jalapeño cucumber margaritas are to die for!

name: Red Iguana
content: Had in restaurant eating with reservation. Food was great, mole sampler was a cool touch.

name: Red Iguana
content: Nothing beats this spot when looking for Mexican. Their Mole's are to die for--their enchilada suizas and the puntes de filette are mind blowing. My fav restaurant in Utah!

name: Red Iguana
content: I am reading the glowing reviews, including California escapees like myself, and I feel bad having to disagree.  For Salt Lake City, this may very well be the best Mexican food around but in reality it was average, at best.I had the chicken tacos and they were delicious but that was where the exceptional part came to a halt.  The beans and rice were truly substandard.  Simple filler at best.  Yes, California has some exceptional Mexican food but so does Utah.  However, this didn't make the list.They certainly don't deserve a 3 but to get a 5 everything on the plate needs that authentic Mexican flavor and I thought it fell short.My wife had similar reviews of both the beans and rice but she is notoriously hard to please since everything is compared to the food she grew up with.  However, this time.  I agree, it just wasn't top notch.

name: Red Iguana
content: This is our go to Mexican.  Their moles are to die for and best in the valley. Ask for the sampler to decide what flavors you love. Our favorites is enchilada suiza and steak a la ranchero. Tres leches pretty tasty. It is a dive that is worth your time and will leave you dreaming of their cuisine.

name: Red Iguana
content: So I have to admit that I rarely crave Mexican cuisine, but I've had Red Iguana on my bookmarks since my first visit to SLC years ago. I've visited the city a few times since then and just never got around to trying them out, but on my most recent road trip, I thought why not...and I have to say that it was totally worth it.You definitely want to have a reservation if you plan on coming here or risk waiting for a while. I was lucky to have snagged one last minute and we were seated promptly upon arrival while there were parties still waiting for a table. The menu has tons of tempting options, but considering it may be a while before we come back to the city, I decided to order the Red Iguana combo plate which has a little bit of everything...1x cheese enchilada, taco a la iguana, beef flauta with guac+sour cream, chile relleno, and a beef tostada. Each one was so tasty, but the cheese enchilada and beef flauta were my favorite! My husband ordered the puntas de filete a la nortena and he pretty much licked his plate clean despite how LARGE the portion was. The only dish I wasn't a fan of was the soup. It was a bit bland for me, so I'd pass on it.

name: Red Iguana
content: I will tell you this definitely not the cheapest Mexican food around but by far the best!!  Service was quick and everyone so friendly. Tons to choose from and the sauces amazing. Plenty of social distancing available. Drink menu has so many choices.

name: Red Iguana
content: Hands down my families absolute favorite Mexican restaurant. My go to order is the enchilada suizas, my husbands go to order is the red iguana. My mother loves to order the enchilada poblanos. We have ordered the specials over the years as well, we've never been disappointed. I was so positive while living in Chicago that we would find a comparable restaurant to enjoy. I was dead wrong, nothing is comparable! Red iguana is simply the best when it comes to authentic, delicious Mexican food.

name: Red Iguana
content: Ordered takeout - tacos and quesadillas! Had the pulled chicken and steak! Definitely enjoyed the steak more - so flavorful, but both very good! Salsa was a little spicy for my taste but great experience overall!

name: Red Iguana
content: Great customer service and amazing food!! Local and authentic!! Loved the Enchiladas Suizas and the Horchata was TO DIE FOR!! I had two!! (Favorite Guilty Pleasure) Would definitely visit again next time we are in town!!

name: Red Iguana
content: I ate here once before many years ago and the food was delicious. My friends and I were passing through to head to the mountains so we decided to stop here for lunch. We made a reservation and were seated immediately. All the staff wore masks And the tables were properly socially distanced . We asked to try the different moles which were all really delicious and unique. My favorite though was the verde. I got the Tapatio platter which had a Chile rellano, Flauta and enchilada. I asked if they could top the enchilada with a mole. They said it was no problem so I got the Verde mole on top of it. One of my friends got the red iguana special, another friend got the Verde mole enchiladas and a third friend got beef flautas. We all enjoyed our food and devoured it. We would definitely return.

name: Red Iguana
content: Anyone that left anything more than a one star does not cook their food with seasoning and thinks black pepper is spicy. I lived in Michoacan Mexico from March 2020-September 2020. Prior to that I lived in Los Ángeles CA for 29 years. I'd say I have a pretty good palette for Mexican food. So believe me when I tell you, this AIN'T it. My abuela would smack me with her chancla if she saw what I was eating. I got the carne asada burritos and the tacos don Ramón. Tacos were DRENCHED, and I mean DRENCHED, with grease. Practically swimming in it, doing the breast stroke. The burritos? If you think bland meat and mushy gunk, I mean, guacamole, is good, then you won't be disappointed. Please stop hyping this place up. Support your local taco trucks and corner mexican spots instead. 51 dollars I will never get back but at least it will end up where it belongs- the toilet!

name: Red Iguana
content: Great server, great food, great drinks and prices. Not typical Mexican food, real authentic. What else can I say?

name: Red Iguana
content: My only regret is that I didn't have two stomachs to consume more food when I was there. Yes! It's that good. The Red Iguana plate was something special. We were offered a sampling of all of the moles that were available that day (a substantial amount) and I thoroughly enjoyed each. Please visit when you get a chance - you will not be disappointed.

name: Red Iguana
content: I'll be honest, it's been at least 8 years since I've been to Red Iguana. And it's strictly because I was so underwhelmed on my last visits. But it was time to go back to see if my opinion had changed!Here's what I can award 5 stars:1. The house made salsa is phenomenal. In my opinion it's exactly how salsa should be; slightly spicy and blended to perfection. 2. The refried beans are creamy, well-seasoned, and the perfect addition to every dish on the menu. It's basically bean dip, which is what makes it killer. 3. Speaking of killer, anything with "Killer" in its name on the menu is just that. Absolutely killer. Follow the killer on the menu and you'll be sitting pretty. 4. The cocktails are delightful! We had the mojito and that rum-horchata concoction (sorry, I forgot the name) and we were in alcoheaven. 5. And lastly, the service. Our server Tony was incredibly kind, attentive, and cool as he juggled all of his demanding tables while still being a great host to our table of two. Here's what I cannot award 5 stars:1. The store bought tortilla chips/tortillas. They're good but come on! I expect house-made chips and tortillas when I'm dining at one of Utah's best Mexican restaurants.2. The wait time. It's good Mexican food, but I'm not sure it's wait 30-90 minutes to be seated good. 3. The extra fees for things like smothered style and cheese. $4.19 for Chile verde? $2.29 to add cheese? Absolutely ridiculous. 4. Maybe it's just me, but the "salsa espanola" tastes a lot like the sauce in Spaghettio's or Chef Boyardi canned pasta. Not my favorite. Ultimately, Red Iguana offers a unique dining experience and a one-of-a-kind Mexican menu in Utah. It's worth trying at least once to see if you're one of  the die-hard fans or a one-time visitor. In the meantime, I'll continue my search for the best Mexican restaurant in town!

name: Red Iguana
content: It's so good I could stop eating. Friendly staff with great food. Usually you have to go to the best places in SoCal for this quality and flavor. If u want Mexican food in SLC area this is it !!!

name: Red Iguana
content: MOLE MOLE MOLE! Mmmmmmmole!  I really hope you reading this said it in your best Austin Powers voice because that's exactly what I did! Can you believe I've never had mole before? I know right! And I call myself a foodie, pssh! However! There is a first for everything. Well, today was my first time trying mole and it's a sweet and spicy sauce. You get hints of chocolate, peppers, and raisins. Pretty interesting combination since I wasn't sure what to expect. I'm also not a fan of raisins, but it works in mole for me!  I had their mole Amarillo covered in shredded chicken and served with a couple of tortillas and of course rice and beans. It was delicious! The orange fruit pictured in the entree looked like it's been sitting out for a minute so I didn't use it. The mole was pretty sweet enough. I'm not exactly sure if mole is supposed to be this sweet, but I live in SLC where people like extra sugar in everything.  Service was great and food came out really fast. On a Tuesday night, there was about a 40 minute wait. With social distancing going on, it's expected for really good food.

name: Red Iguana
content: Really delicious Mexican food! They've got a couple of vegetarian options - not a ton. But still good. We got the guacamole tacos and the chimichanga and both were delicious. Their in house salsa is spicy and and so good!! They served the chimichanga with a roasted char grilled jalapeño and omg it was amazing. Be warned there's always a line - I recommend making a reservation or calling ahead to be on the waitlist.

name: Red Iguana
content: My friends and I decided to take a road trip. We were yelping and found Red Iguana. We ordered the famous dishes and shared. We found that this restaurant to be typical to the Mexican restaurants in SF. Customer service was pretty on point during covid.

name: Red Iguana
content: SO good! Mezcal margaritas and queso are the way to my heart! My daughter LOVED her pb&j burrito as well. The Ramon Jrs was delicious and satisfying! I don't know if I could dis like any of their menu options!! And a fun atmosphere makes this place a go-to!

name: Red Iguana
content: Love the menu! Salsa so fresh and food was amazing! It is had to find authentic Mexican food in Utah and this is it! They have so many different types of margaritas. I tried 3 kind. They were all great! Also, the queso is a must!

name: Red Iguana
content: Yummy as always.. very clean and great fresh Mexican cuisine and order the tacos or the verde

name: Red Iguana
content: This place is sooo good. Tons of options and we loved  everything. Get some of the mole. We got 3 kinds.

name: Red Iguana
content: This is among my top 10 restaurants and might just be my favorite Mexican restaurant to date. The mole sauces alone put the Red Iguana in this category. Add the amazing salsa and margaritas... well there's a reason Guy Fieri featured it on triple D. I'll definitely be back next time I roll through SLC

name: Red Iguana
content: The consistently best Mexican food in SL Valley in 33 years of my personal experience.  But it's not just that the food is consistently good and fresh and quick without rushing the dining experience, it's that the expert knowledge of running a restaurant as a business is always evident.  It has been perfected as a multi-generational commitment to providing good food at a very fair price.  With flawless service. Every time. Perhaps the Cardenas family should consider a culinary school to encourage young cooks/chefs/entrepreneurial restauranteurs? No one should selfishly hope the the great American temptation which comes to all excellent restauranteurs to franchise can be resisted for at least another generation, yet we do.  Because this notion of handing down the recipes of this eclectic and diverse menu to the philistines who will inevitably take the company public and run it into the cost-saving-terrain of cheapening both the product and the service will inevitably prevail.  Witness Chili's on Greenville Avenue in Dallas in 1975.  I was there.  Completely unrecognizable in content or service today.  Yet, the Cardenas family who has been involved in the grueling business of running a (now 3) restaurant empire for more than 50 years, might choose to reap the rewards of their business acumen and their recipes with a franchise agreement.  No one could dare blame them.  I just selfishly hope it's not on my watch.

name: Red Iguana
content: This place is the real deal - best Mexican food in SLC hands down. It's not the fanciest place in the world, but it's definitely where you go if you want good, authentic food. I got a burrito (I don't remember what kind), but it was out of this world - so good.

name: Red Iguana
content: I love this spot. Great chips and really awesome customer service. The greater Steve is the coolest dude!!

name: Red Iguana
content: Outstanding Maui Fish Tacos and shredded chicken chimichanga! Perfect Mexican food and we are from California

name: Red Iguana
content: So delicious! The mole is just amazing. I tried a few different moles and they were all absolutely delicious. It's not your average Mexican food. It's authentic and like nothing else you've ever tasted!

name: Red Iguana
content: Food is great yes. But there is a great waiter Margarine. She made our day on our last visit. The lady had great recommendations. Her passion for food and her personal touch made our meal extra special.

name: Red Iguana
content: I'm sorry, it's overrated and $$$. I didn't get the mole which is a hit there, so maybe that was my mistake! The micheladas were decent. The waitress was very attentive to us & quick at least. Overall, it was ok. I don't think I'd go back.

name: Red Iguana
content: Always good, can be very busy so plan to sit outside in the elements.  A little expensive but very large portions.  I prefer getting takeout and avoiding the crowd.

name: Red Iguana
content: Red Iguana is the best authentic Spanish food restaurant I have ever had. They serve a full and I mean full plate no matter what you order. I would recommend everything on the menu. Plus they make a great margarita. The only down side is at lunch, there is a line clear down the street. It's well worth the wait to get in.

name: Red Iguana
content: This spot is great for large groups. They're always able to handle us. The food is very affordable and delicious. There is a great atmosphere here and the staff is very helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that there isn't one closer to me!

name: Red Iguana
content: Utah is full of great Mexican food, but no other Mexican restaurant in Utah does quite what Red Iguana does. Obviously you go for the mole -- if you didn't know that already, now you do. But here are a couple of other things I order: cochinita pibil (an orange-colored sweet shredded pork), chilaques, Huevos moluteños... and frankly the whole list of the Red Iguana Classic on the menu. Also, you have to have two margaritas -- yes they're delicious.

name: Red Iguana
content: Delicious food, was not disappointed with my chimichanga! A bit busy inside the restaurant so we had takeout.

name: Red Iguana
content: What can I say?! This place has great food! There are several different types of mole to choose from. Food came out quickly and hot! Make sure you try the margaritas

name: Red Iguana
content: So delicious! I have a hard time ordering because we always start with the selection of molé and they ARE ALL SO GOOD! Every time I am there I feel like it's the first time, because depending on the molé you choose, it alters your dish dramatically, even if you order the same dish. I do love the enchilada suissa. I love everything they have with shrimp. I DO love their margaritas and because of that, I must have a designated driver.

name: Red Iguana
content: Let me tell you about Red Iguana... WORTH THE HYPE! Thaaaaank you Guy Fieri for highlighting Red Iguana on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives! This place is SO amazing! My boyfriend and I are devastated that we do not live near Red Iguana. We live in a different state! My boyfriend and I were on a road trip, camping, and just visiting National Parks. Utah was the last state we visited before driving back home and HAD to make a stop and so glad that we did!I made a reservation online. The day of our reservation, I called to let the staff know that I will be about 5 minutes late. When arriving, our table was not ready and I think we waited another hour before actually being seated. I would knock off a star for that, but the customer service, cleanliness, and food were on point. We were seated and the tables were all socially distanced and the staff were all wearing masks. Our server was Tony, who was absolutely wonderful! He was super kind, easy to talk to, and gave recommendations! We ordered:- Horchata- Tacos Don Ramon- Puntas De Filete A La NortenaOMG! WOW! Everything was SO comforting and delicious! When we placed our order, Tony gave us complimentary chips and a small plate of mole samples (we asked to try them). I kid you not, ALL of the moles were perfect. I'm not too familiar with mole, that's why I asked if I am able to sample them. I am now pretty sad that we did't buy some mole to-go to take back home. I have not tried mole this good. My mouth is watering writing this review. My boyfriend and I miss this restaurant so much. We loved everything so much!

name: Red Iguana
content: As always the Service is impeccable and the killer nachos are out of this world! They never disappoint! I appreciate the cleanliness and social distancing.

name: Red Iguana
content: Best food in town. Great location for people visiting downtown. Long lines, but well worth the wait. Two locations with exact same menus so either is great and also both are within walking distance of each other.

name: Red Iguana
content: Really, really good food - just expect a bit of a crowd.This place is hyped to hell, and for good reason.  Expect a line out the door, a waiting list, and a busy server.  It's all part of the experience, I think - a place this good demands attention.The food here is superb.  I tried one of Red Iguana's "experimental"/"adventurous" dishes, which was as delicious as it was voluminous.  I left very, very full - and was served very, very quickly.  Needless to say, if you're hankering for Mexican food and willing to wait, you've got to go here!

name: Red Iguana
content: Absolutely hands-down one of the best restaurants in the valley. If you haven't gone yourself the service of this place is to die for

name: Red Iguana
content: Great food and great service! I got the tamarindo margarita and it was so good! I also got the Chile Verde chimichanga and the green Chile wasn't too spicy and was very flavorful. Definitely recommend!

name: Red Iguana
content: My family came all the way from GA to eat at this restaurant and see what others have raved about! I was soooooo disappointed in the customer service. When I asked for a kids menu, the server instantly ASSUMED that I was getting the menu for myself, when it was for 10 year old daughter! I guess she thought I was going to order for myself. Not to mentioned she just assumed that we were only ordering waters! Bad mistake on her part! So we left and went to  a much better restaurant that instantly welcomed my family and treated us with RESPECT! So I will make sure I NEVER go to Red Iguana and maybe you shouldn't  either!

name: Red Iguana
content: This place is simple but no joke. I had the mole sampler and left with a pint of the Poblano style for leftover thanksgiving turkey. I also had the transcendent quesadilla with mushrooms. This place came highly recommended for good reason. This is the best Mexican food north of Sacramento.

name: Red Iguana
content: The Chili Verde my daughter ordered was delicious. I ordered the Chili Colorado and was a bit disappointed as it had such a heavy smoke flavor. The service was fine.

name: Red Iguana
content: AMAZING! Would come back if I was ever back in town! Would recommend to everyone that is in this area. Best Mexican food I think we have ever had! Super fresh and hot and the service was great!

name: Red Iguana
content: Got one of the famous Mole dishes and was not disappointed. They give you a lot of food and it's definitely different than the Mexican food I'm accustomed with. Also it's very spicy which I love, didn't need to add any hot sauce! You gotta try it, it isn't fine dining but the end result is similar. It's an exploration of some kick ass food. Seriously worth a try.

name: Red Iguana
content: Average place, average food and nothing special about service i don't know why people rate the place so high.

name: Red Iguana
content: I know this place is super highly reviewed, but in the multiple times I've been there, I've never been blown away. Obviously great Mole - really like their Almond Mole - but I feel like most of the dishes are just too soupy/liquidy. Not to contradict my previous point, but we ordered the fish tacos last time which were super dry.

name: Red Iguana
content: My go to is the 2 carne asada burritos.  Get it with cheese on top.  The steak is chopped up nicely inside.  Not your typically long strips of streak.  This is very well prepared and the flavor and textures are the best I've had.  Stop by and enjoy!!

name: Red Iguana
content: This is a local favorite! Sometimes I feel like it's over rated but their service is always awesome! The hostesses can be sassy at times but the service past the gate keepers are always great ThAts why I gave them 5 stars but food is a solid 4-4.5

name: Red Iguana
content: Simply put, I had the best plate of Mexican food I've ever had in my life there. I lived in Houston for 13 years and have eaten in plenty of Mexican restaurants. This one is the best. Their sauces are awesome. I'm not even a big Mexican food fan (went here to please my wife) but this place is awesome. I had the dish called the Res Iguana and it was outstanding. I literally cannot find even one small detail that needs to be improved about this place. From food to service, it's all outstanding.

name: Red Iguana
content: Visiting from Cali, Red Iguana was highly recommended and did not disappoint.  Second visit in last couple weeks great food and service

name: Red Iguana
content: I've never done a Yelp review before. I don't get food poisoning. But the Red Iguana nachos were not only a terrible Mexican mush but also gave me and my wife terrible food poisoning. I called to get a refund and they said no. Red Iguana is absolutely disgusting and don't go there. Ever. So gross.

name: Red Iguana
content: Amazing. Unique and creative food that has a one of a kind flavor and style. Really shows what a Mexican restaurant can be. When food becomes art!

name: Red Iguana
content: I love this place!! We have lived in salt lake for a year and finally got a chance to try out this delicious Mexican food this week. I had mushroom enchiladas which were absolutely amazing. I also liked that their menu highlighted vegetarian options very clearly. We were too full for dessert but will definitely try some churros next time! So good!

name: Red Iguana
content: I have heard things about this place from several people before trying it. Yep! They were right, this place is spectacular. Wait time was a little rough, but well worth it. If you're in a rush and want to get their food, #2 is right down the road and has a great atmosphere.

name: Red Iguana
content: Delicious Pescado Veracruzado. I will certainly return to this place place when I'm back in SLC.

name: Red Iguana
content: I love this restaurant i forgot the name of the plate but had very large shrimps lime and some spices as you can see in my picture also they're cheese dip was very good the tamales taste it  so good and to be honest i haven't had best experience with Mexican food but in this case i gotta say love there food. Remember to make your reservation they are always busy.

name: Red Iguana
content: Best Mexican food in Salt Lake City. Period. Everything on the menu from Mole to nachos are the best I've ever had.

name: Red Iguana
content: INCREDIBLE. There were four of us and each had a different meal. Everything was delicious! Our drinks were also fantastic and the service was phenomenal. We absolutely would come back (if/when we visit SLC again). If you don't get the fried ice cream, you're doing it wrong.

name: Red Iguana
content: Excellent service, delicious food, great ambiance. We'd been wanting to come here forever and finally made the trek to town. Our server Tony was great!  The queso dip is fabulous. Margaritas delicious!!  Make the effort to get to The Red Iguana, it won't disappoint.

name: Red Iguana
content: Food was amazing ! Our server Jose was awesome! Super helpful on deciding on our choice for food and drinks! Try the Mole guys!! Ask for samples they're all good! First time in Salt Lake City? Eat here!

name: Red Iguana
content: So the service was great, and I appreciated how caring they were to their customers. Now the food, I'm from Chicago so when I asked where to eat this was the place everyone told me to go. Walking into the restaurant you see all these famous people like Johnny cash have been there, so it must a good place. I don't know if it's because I'm in Utah but the food was average. It's like every other small Mexican restaurant in the Chicago area nothing really memorable about it.

name: Red Iguana
content: Everything from Red Iguana is so authentic. I've tried several dishes and non have disappointed. I don't know of any other restaurant that has ten different kinds of mole, and I'm Mexican from southern california. Their drinks are amazing too, try the oaxaqueña is you're looking for something a bit different.

name: Red Iguana
content: This place is incredible!  Great prices, incredible portions.  Just get there early for dinner, and the complimentary valet is a nice touch.

name: White Horse
content: In from out of town, happened upon this very cool place. Amazing bourbon collection, service was exceptional, special menu- fresh, exciting and delicious. Highly recommended!

name: White Horse
content: Super chill vibe, tons of drink options, great food; everyone in my party all raved how good it was (forgot pics).  Wait staff all very friendly.  Excellent place to get your friends together and enjoy downtown indoor/outdoor bar experience.  Only suggestion I would offer is play your music just a bit louder and consistently with more upbeat jams to keep up the energy and good times flowing.  Cheers

name: White Horse
content: First off, it is hard to get reservations, but they DO accept walk-in business. So if they are full, just go get your name on the list and have a fun walk or drink about the town. My wife and I love this place. We just get a bunch of things and share. My favorite thing on the menu is also the cheapest. The EGG CHIPS! You are just gonna have to trust me on that. We then just get things to share:  the arugula salad, French onion soup, and mac and cheese are must for us. Then we will try out an entree to share as well. Go eat there!

name: White Horse
content: Great vibes and great service. The food is amazing!! Try any burger and the onion soup! DELICIOUS!

name: White Horse
content: We loved our experience at White Horse! The environment and vibe is incredible, it's very well appointed inside. The service was top notch with continuous attention to our table. Here are my reviews on the food!Mac N Cheese: 5/5, the texture of the noodles with the great cheeses...really amazing starter!Burger: 3/5, it was overcooked, and no flavor really stood out as special.Fries: 5/5, they were SO good! Fresh cut with a Cajun seasoning. Reuben: 4/5, it was good but really heavy and greasy! Overall really enjoyed but wish I had tried the steak sandwich over the burger.

name: White Horse
content: My wife and I enjoyed lunch here. Actually our sandwiches were too big along with the Brussels appetizer.  Saved half of it and ate it for dinner

name: White Horse
content: Good for late night eats- we came into town Easter night STARVING... no Uber Eats deliveries and hotel room service stopped at 9. But hotel deck clerk sent us to White Horse for yummy food.

name: White Horse
content: Stopped in for a weekday lunch... nice little place.  Service was good, albeit a tad slow... but not so much that I minded.  Food was surprisingly good as were the portions.  Fairly nice whisky selection too with relatively fair prices... at least from a Houstonian's perspective.  Try the signature Egg N'Chips... really good for something so simple.

name: White Horse
content: Had a really great dinner at White Horse! They do not take reservations Friday night or Saturday night. We arrived at 6:30pm Friday to put our names down and were told it's a 2.5 hour wait. We decided to go to Alibi (cocktail bar - would also recommend) a few doors down to pass the time and get some apps while we waited. Thankfully it was only a 1.5 hour wait and we were in by 8pm.SETTING: They're taking COVID precautions: tables spaced apart, every waiter with a mask, when you go to the bathroom or stand up from your table you're asked to mask up. It is a very trendy and 'buzzy' restaurant - good for date night, friends dinner,  etc. FOOD: The menu here is extensive and there are many great options. For appetizers we ordered the arugula salad, beet salad, egg n chips, duck wings and brussel sprouts. The standout for me was the brussel sprouts. The duck wings were OK but the kimchi did not really jive with the blue cheese spread. The egg n chips r amazing in theory (if you love eggs and chips like I do!) but u ultimately end up with soggy chips. The arugula salad was really simple (just arugula, lemon juice, Parmesan), but quite tasty. The beet salad was delicious!For entrees we had the croque madam, the patty melt, the wagyu cheeseburger and the gnocchi. The patty melt was delicious on really good bread, perfectly cooked and with just the right amount of cheese and grilled onions. The cheeseburger was also fantastic! Can't speak for the other two entrees but our friends definitely enjoyed.VERDICT: I would recommend this restaurant for a fun night in SLC.

name: White Horse
content: The drinks are on the expensive side so I thought that they would at least be good. My hot toddie tasted like weak flavorless lemon water. The server was also very rude.

name: White Horse
content: Great food - their steak tartare has the perfectly balanced flavor palate, the capers and lemon zest added a unique kick. Amazing service Well crafted drink menu - LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE the pearls on a string

name: White Horse
content: Usually eat here and they have fantastic food but to be honest this steak I ordered last night was solid fat. Ive never seen a steak with this much fat I couldnt even eat it. See pictures

name: White Horse
content: One of my absolute fave places in the city to eat and hang. Food is amazing, presentation on point and the vibe is so right.

name: White Horse
content: Ate lunch at White Horse recently and it was one of the best lunches I've had in a long time.  We ordered the Brussel sprouts, Buffalo cauliflower, wagyu burger, and the bread pudding - all of which were excellent.

name: White Horse
content: Everything is made in house. Great menu from a small nosh, to sharing plates, salads, hearty sandwiches, and entrees. Love this place when in town for business.

name: White Horse
content: Really cool rustic bar atmosphere right downtown. Lots of leather and exposed brick. The steak sandwich is amazing. Perfectly cooked and flavorful. Last time we were there the staff confused who was responsible for our table and made us wait awhile. Luckily we weren't in a rush and they even gave us their amazing soft boiled egg over chips for free to make up for it. I wish they still gave you your check in an old book but maybe after covid they will go back to that again. Amazing but maybe a little loud for some

name: White Horse
content: The service was pretty good, once you got in. The food was decent and I did enjoy the cocktails, but you can tell they are just weaker than a traditional cocktail. I'm giving them 3 stars because they were rude about finding space for 7 people, when we got there, there were people with larger groups. Next, all of my veggies were undercooked. The food was overpriced for what it was. Finally, Gramps likes to put his finger in peoples faces when they are coming in. That's 100% unacceptable. All you have to do is open the door and kindly ask for people to wait to come in. One day he's going to put that finger in the wrong persons face.

name: White Horse
content: Amazing experience at this gem in downtown SLC. Very abundant selection of whiskeys and Bourbon with draft beer and wine to boot. Eileen was our server and she steered us in the right direction through the meal. Extremely happy that we selected White Horse for our dinner meeting. Very satisfied. Suggest the Brussel sprouts to share, and the French Onion Soup (probably the best I've had). Steak salad was done to perfection.

name: White Horse
content: Best finger food in slc. The setting is stunning here. Service was fine, the wait is expected for a place like this.

name: White Horse
content: Great service, kind staff, mindful of guests. Great food, pork belly is the best. Drinks are very good, get the Leave Britney Alone.

name: White Horse
content: This is our favorite place to eat in Utah. We always order new things and everything is always impeccable. Great staff. Amazing food. Must try spot!

name: White Horse
content: Flew into Salt Lake today and was headed to Park City.  We were looking for a lunch spot on the way and this hit the spot for sure.  I saw someone recommend the short rib sandwich, but I got the Pastrami Benedict Because it was something different that I'd never had before.  I wouldn't have thought sauerkraut and hollandaise would work, but it was wonderful.  If you are looking for a good brunch spot, I would recommend this place.  The drinks were great, too.

name: White Horse
content: We're in from out of town and ended up here when the neighboring restaurant couldn't accommodate us. What a nice deviation! The drinks were delicious, the duck was outstanding, and the server rounded out an overall fantastic experience.

name: White Horse
content: There is a reason this is one of the highest rated restaurants in Salt Lake City! Top notch every time. The special of the night was steak tartare on smoked bone marrow. It was one of the best things I've eaten.

name: White Horse
content: This is a cocktail enthusiasts dream. The mixologists are incredibly talented and gifted artisans of their crafts. The food is absolutely spectacular with amazing variety and innovated combinations. The house made chips were divine bordering  on addictive. Perfect balance for delightful libations. The ambiance is warm and exotically cosy - you feel you are in a wine bar in Europe which adds to the entire experience. This place is a must for culinary and cocktail enthusiasts.

name: White Horse
content: Great atmosphere, service, drinks and food! Oysters were so fresh and delicious. The egg and chips is a must try! There are so many options on the menu that are incredible, so I feel like you can't go wrong. The veggie hash and spaghetti and clams are two that I love that have so much wonderful flavor.

name: White Horse
content: Good contemporary vibe restaurant. Came on a weeknight with an early reservation and there was plenty of seating with a steady stream of customers. Service was friendly and helpful on recommendations. The setting is nice with booths and a tall bar fully equipped with one of those bookshelf ladders! 1. French onion soup - 4/5. Full dish which can make you full if you eat all the bread and cheese. Delicious! 2. Octopus - 4.5/5. Smoked taste which was nice. Comes with ink rice which had pieces of meat and a small spiced kick to it.Overall, good to try at least once if you are in the area! Good food!

name: White Horse
content: This is a must stop! Order egg n chips (ordered twice!). Cocktails, service and food are splendid. You will imagine u r in the very food towns in USA... think Portland, San Francisco, and Chicago. MUST HAVE in SLC. Dinners are amazing.

name: White Horse
content: Came to SLC for the weekend and heard this was one of the best restaurants, so I obviously had to go. The food was incredible. The drinks were pretty sub-par. We ordered the eggs and chips, the brussel sprouts, the short rib, and the bourbon pudding for dessert. The eggs and chips were good, not amazing. Honestly, idk why they even put the egg on it. The house made truffle chips alone are really good. The brussel sprouts were honestly my favorite part of the meal. One of the best brussel dishes I've ever had. And the short rib was also delicious. It was a good portion and was very flavorful. I would skip the bourbon pudding, to be honest. It was okay and the popcorn on top was kind of weird. We also ordered a flight of their draft ciders and the honey rush cocktail. The drinks were okay, not spectacular. But I'd definitely go back for the food.

name: White Horse
content: Excellent cocktails, decent food (tell them not to put the gravy on the wagyu beef - I don't know who would do that - insane)Really worth your time in salt lake

name: White Horse
content: Love every single visit. Always has good food, and always love suggestions from the servers. And the bartenders signature drinks.

name: White Horse
content: Came here on a business trip with my fiancé and we were thoroughly impressed. The rustic modern decor was very cute and comfortable. We each got a delicious aperitif to start and loved them, he had the Nonino Amaro Bitters and I had the New World Wasatch Cherry Blossom. For appetizer, we shared the Fried Stuffed Mushrooms which were very unique and delicious! Then we shared the Grilled Octopus and Duck Wings which were both extremely flavorful and tasty. Another drink to recommend was the Hotel Nacional 44, bright and sour flavors and a fluffy top surface.

name: White Horse
content: Best place I have tried in Salt Lake so far! Awesome drinks, awesome ambiance and above all, awesome food! Had the fried stuffed olives to start out. A unique flavor and was really good. Also the fried Brussels sprouts are the best I've ever had. The steak sandwich is exploding with flavor and the steak was perfectly cooked. The truffle grilled cheese and bisque pairs very well. Then to top it off the crepe brûlée was melt in your mouth amazing . Very inviting atmosphere and great food. You MUST try!

name: White Horse
