content: I enjoy their amazing food and love their imaginative cocktails.  I will be a staple here for years to come.  Thank you for the atmosphere and great times!  The waiters here also are on point

name: White Horse
content: Some of the best food I've literally ever had. We had the egg and chips 10/10, the Mac and cheese was sooo cheesy and creamy with amazing flavor. The gnocchi was so airy and the steak sandwich was cooked perfectly. I HIGHLY recommend this place!! Also Tehran you're ordering a drink and you're indecisive they do a bar roulette and the bartender makes your drink for you.

name: White Horse
content: Not sure why it took me so long to come back here from the first time when it opened a few years ago.  We will be back for often in the future.  The space is perfect and beautiful.  The patty melt here will keep me coming back for sure.  It was perfectly cooked and will match or beat any burger in town.  Great beer list for me and bartenders that can make just about any drink you can think of with high quality.

name: White Horse
content: Food amazing, bartender so sweet, cocktails amazing. The roof is made out of wine barrels and the building itself is gorgeous! If I lived in this city  this would be my spot!

name: White Horse
content: I had such a great meal here! The atmosphere was cozy and warm - a bit small though, so perhaps make a reservation. The service was excellent. I had a drink called "dripping glitter" (I think that's what it was called...) and it was very good. For my meal, I had the short ribs served over mashed potatoes. It was delicious! I think I could've licked the plate clean. It was also a nice serving size. Sometimes I feel with short ribs you get a smaller portion and served more accompaniments but that wasn't the case here. If I was a local, I'd definitely be back.

name: White Horse
content: Got the braised short ribs which were good. The meat just fell apart in your mouth, but just wish the portion was bigger. I finished mine in less than 10 bites. My girlfriend ordered the gnocchi was very good too. Our table shared the eggs and chips (unique and awesome), the Kennebec fries (above average but nothing earth shattering), and the fried Brussel sprouts (delicious).I would come here again but I just wish the portions were larger. Had two appetizers, my entree, 1/3 of girlfriends entree, and I still was barely satisfied. Ended up spending ~$40 before tax and tip. My caveat is that I do eat a lot and my girlfriend was stuffed for hours.

name: White Horse
content: Absolute best meal I've had in Salt Lake City! The Niçoise salad, Brussels sprouts and fries were amazing! The service from JP was exceptional and the atmosphere of the entire place was fantastic. Can't wait to come back ! 5 stars!

name: White Horse
content: Street parking only, kinda small on the inside, and so delicious!! Loved everything here. Drinks were fresh and not overly sweet. I had the octopus with black squid ink rice and omg was it delicious!! Cooked perfect also. My friends had braised short ribs and the ricotta gnocchi and both loved their dishes. The gnocchi is very rich, it's literally made of cheese and not pasta so kinda heavy but everything was really good!!

name: White Horse
content: Absolutely incredible experience, we came here for Christmas Eve and boy we were not disappointed.kacie  was our server and she was absolutely delightful, she killed it!!!!!, so knowledgeable and oysters food and drinks. We had the tartare which was incredible served with Ryebread, my husband had a sampler platter of all the West Coast oysters and he was delighted by the freshness, it was orgasmic for him. We finish it up with the Buffalo cauliflower and Ray short ribs stuffed peppers and they did not disappoint as well. Everything was cooked to perfection, staff was incredible, beyond our expectations. Will be back if I'm ever in town again highly highly highly recommend. Wonderful experience!!!!!

name: White Horse
content: Delicious! I loved the grilled cheese. The Brussel sprouts were good too but a little saucy. Cool vibe.

name: White Horse
content: first time visiting SLC and we were starving, but this place did not disappoint. not only was the service amazing and friendly, the food and drink came out rather quickly. we came on a wednesday around 2pm where it honestly was quite slow, which we didn't mind. the whole look of the place was so aesthetically pleasing and perfect for pictures with the girls. we ended up ordering the steak sandwich, the truffle grilled cheese with tomato bisque, and pblt sandwich with the arugula salad on side. the steak sandwich was tasty, it's literally a steak in between some bread (which we aren't complaining), the truffle grilled cheese was sooo flavorful, but my favorite had to have been the pblt. the pork belly was so tasty and crunchy and the salad was perfect, it had a light refreshing dresdingfor drinks we did 3 taster flights of the ciders which were such a good price-- we recommended the huckleberry! all of the different ciders were delicious and so cute. definitely would come back to this place for the food and drinks!

name: White Horse
content: This review is from back in January when i was visiting SLC - I hosted a small event at this bar, and i very much enjoyed it.We did have 1 small issue that came up - One of our guests was not brought their orders for a very very long time, and we needed to remind the staff about the order - But that was quickly resolved and everything was delicious. I will be back - I think though i will limit my party to 6 when dining here, since they didn't seem setup to accomodate a group larger than 6 at the time.

name: White Horse
content: White horse never disappoints! Their food is phenomenal and the service is always great. My favorite dishes are the brussel sprouts, jalapeño Mac and cheese, arugula salad, and the charcuterie board. Honestly, you can't go wrong with whatever you order!

name: White Horse
content: Well definitely be back next ti.e I'm in town. Service, ambience and food all 5 stars. Even though I'm from CA I thought the only good place to get a pastrami sandwich was on the east coast until now. Best pastrami sandwich ever. Ordered the steak salad as well also exceptional. Good beer and wine list and beer was served at perfect temp not too cold so you could actually taste the beer. I think I might come back to slc just to get my white horse fix

name: White Horse
content: I think it was good.   Started off with French 75, less sweet and the drink felt flat.... but not sweet as I requested.  Then the beet salad with strong vinegar flavor overtaking the plate, but love the caramelized walnut that is sensible and not like candy sweet.  Also the creamy goat cheese on the side of the plate  instead of typical crumbled goat cheese directly on top of the salad.   Then the Manhattan was tiny and it was actually my least favorite.  It was not blended well like the place I love when they have the Manhattan barrel aged well blended in harmony.  Then my main meal duck, as far as the meat it is cooked to perfection but way too salty  The sauce overtakes the beautiful taste of the meat itself.   And unfortunately, the Brussel sprouts that comes with the dishes were charcoal burnt.  Very mixed feeling as they could have gotten five or four stars if the minor details were perfected.  And no cafe au lait or latte to finish the course is bit disappointing.  The only choice is coffee...........

name: White Horse
content: This is easily one of our most favorite spots in SLC. Every time my wife and I frequent White Horse we are never disappointed and always happy with everything we order. The Egg n Chips and Wagyu Steak are the bomb. If you're looking for a great night out with your partner or group of friends, this is the place. Superb food, drink and atmosphere all the way around.

name: White Horse
content: White Horse never disappoints.  The food is outstanding, the service was top notch, the appetizers and main course wee incredible me. They have an assortment of ciders on top and the Island Creek oysters are an all time favorite.  I can see why this restaurant is consistently one of the top restaurants in Salt Lake City.

name: White Horse
content: This place has been on my radar to dine at for more than a year. I came year right after opening with an out of town work partner.  The drinks were good. The atmosphere perfect. We went to another couple places, and Whitehorse looked to be the best of the options.Since then, my wife has been here a couple times for a girls brunch and loved it. In some respects, that made it a longer time for me to come. She wanted to go elsewhere because she'd already been here recently. Finally, the stars aligned and we came with my son.We started with drinks. Classically made and tasting good. I went with the Bar Roulette and gave a base alcohol I wanted. The drink was epic and he even made a little recipe card to take with me. That's fantastic.The oysters were fresh and clean. It was a nice start. The French onion soup was really well done. Lots of onions and not salty with a deep flavored broth. We had several of the entrees and each one was well priced and perfectly executed. I'd heard how well they were executing on the food, and how good it was. There is no question this is one of the top restaurants in the city. Period. On top of that, nobody under 21 allowed. It doesn't get much better than that.

name: White Horse
content: One of my favorite restaurants of all time and certainly a number one favorite in Utah. Exceptional service, exquisite food and cocktails, and a beautiful space. We had oysters and egg n chips to start and then the braised short rib, roasted organic salmon--all perfectly prepared and absolutely delicious. The whiskey sour was the best I've ever had by a long-shot. Also really appreciated that the restaurant and staff were wearing masks, sanitizing, and following social distancing guidelines but in a way that wasn't disruptive to the experience whatsoever. I'll be back to try everything on the menu.

name: White Horse
content: Omg. Get the gnocchi. Or the octopus. Everything is homemade including their pasta and tastes like it was all made from scratch for you. We stumbled into this spot just by walking around downtown and was so impressed. This is not simple bar food. Very upscale and classy for a fraction of the price. Love it.

name: White Horse
content: We had a really lovely experience here.Super cute spot, great ambiance, perfect for a date night or a small group. We were a party of four, stopping in later in the evening (7:30pm) on a Thursday, looking for some food and drinks.Minus one star because the service was kinda on and off. At first our server was very attentive, but once we had our first round of drinks, he didn't really come back for food orders, to the point where our fourth member of the party had to leave without eating because he had to be somewhere at 9pm and we hadn't ordered yet.That said, when the service was on, it was great, and the food we did order was pretty spectacular. The brussel sprouts were perfect, fried well and bursting with umami flavor from the pork belly and sauce. I ate every single bite of the truffled grilled cheese, which was crispy and gooey. The old fashioned was awesome and I found myself drinking a couple more than I ought to have, plus I sampled a bit off that tempting whiskey menu.Overall, this is a must-visit stop in SLC.

name: White Horse
content: Not really vegetarian friendly unless you want a bunch of sides. It's pretty inside. I would say go out for dinner somewhere else and come here for drinks and tapas. The Mac and cheese and burrata were my favorites.

name: White Horse
content: Talk about a whiskey gals dream! We're visiting from Norcal and this is probably our favorite bar/restaurant to go to! The service is amazing and the bartender( we didn't get his name) was so knowledgeable and really recommended some great whiskeys for us to taste. They had the razor clams in so we definitely had to have some and I'm so glad we did! They were made so well and that white sauce was yummy! All the employees were vibrant and cheery. We will definitely be back.

name: White Horse
content: Bottom line up front in case you're in a hurry -- this place is amazing. Period. Cocktails - for the Honey Rush (Bourbon) and Hotel Nacional (Gin). Both were delicious and reasonably priced based on the product. Food - Waygu Cheeseburger and Ruben. Both were equally awesome.Service - these guys know their stuf,  and more importantly, they're into it! Bottom line - one of the best places to visit. Definitely worth a stop.

name: White Horse
content: Highly recommend White Horse! We had an old fashioned, the French Mare and Brussels to start. AMAZING!  But the show stopper was the roasted chicken! It was phenomenal! The staff was also very attentive!

name: White Horse
content: Went for dinner with a large group. Everything we ordered was amazing. I had the burger and have to say one of the best burgers ive ever had.We all had mutliple cocktails and really loved the let the bartender make a drink option everyone they suprised us with was delicious. Cheers to gish the bartender!!

name: White Horse
content: Covid-19 is killing our dinning experience. We went for Dinner and had our food delivered before our appetizer. When the app came out our food was call. Managment was very responsive and immediately brought us out refined food.

name: White Horse
content: Waited an hour and 15 minutes for a table, but the food was excellent! We had the Mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts, so good!

name: White Horse
content: This is a great place with good food and drinks. We've been there a few times. Most recently Caitlin was our waitress and she was amazing! Attentive, sweet and one of the best we've had anywhere. Check this place out and do yourself a favor and ask to be seated in her section.

name: White Horse
content: Visiting from Seattle...The food was amazing. Drinks, while pricey, were great. Our server clearly HATED her job, but we got past that. Recommend the "Crispy fried Brussel sprouts". Fantastic taste.

name: White Horse
content: Boy! Talk about strong drinks. I asked the bartender to make me a drink without any sugar additives and with tequila which I believe was a "drink roulette". My tequila drink was personally too strong for me, I asked them if I could get it mixed with something so they kindly brought out a glass of ice with tonic for me to add my drink to and that was much better (still strong af ) they bring out the drinks with a card with the ingredients in it which was cool. My Partner got a roulette with whiskey and he really enjoyed that, he had two (also strong af). We also got the crispy Brussel sprouts without the bacon, which tasted like it was floating in soy sauce. Overall, if I were to come back to this place I'd try a different cocktail (a set one from their menu), and a different appetizer. Great presentation for drinks and great service.

name: White Horse
content: Great little restaurant in downtown SLC. Get the egg chips, they're awesome and the wagyu burger is the best!

name: White Horse
content: Say out their front patio a few weeks ago and felt comfortable with how well spaced the few tables out there were. Service was as friendly and quick. Got the burger which was delicious and the truffle chips with egg (what??!?) and was in heaven.

name: White Horse
content: Hands down my favorite restaurant in SLC. Atmosphere was great and lax which was perfect after a long day of work. The bar also reminded us of the Jameson distillery in Dublin.We loved the cider carafes, the egg chips (wow, a must try!), the Reuben sandwich, and the wagyu burger (both the sandwich and burger melted in our mouths!). Can't wait to stop by again!

name: White Horse
content: My regular spot, love everything about this place, the drinks are a bit pricey but worth it and the food is amazing. Brunch is 11/10 as well

name: White Horse
content: Great atmosphere & Yummy food especially tomato basil soup & Salmon. Cauliflower not so much but okay just a bit HOT. I didn't know about Buffalo!  Wish we had sat on the patio however the interior is quite interesting and historical I think

name: White Horse
content: What a fantastic place. Miles was an amazing server. Cocktails and beer were great. The BRUSSEL SPROUTS were to die for. All food was great.

name: White Horse
content: If the only thing I did in Salt Lake City was eat the steak sandwich at White Horse and then fly back to Texas I would consider it a 100% successful trip, that sandwich is amazing! White Horse also had a great drink selection and plenty of other menu items to choose from if Steak isn't for you...but man oh man that sandwich was good. I will be back.

name: White Horse
content: Everything was good but nothing that is really calling us back for round two. Glad we tried this place but not sure we'd come back. My favorite thing was the tomato soup. It was so creamy and delicious; I'd get that again in a heartbeat. Our main courses were fine. The bacon popcorn pudding I enjoyed, minus the popcorn. It had too much of a smoky flavor for my taste.

name: White Horse
content: We came here randomly while we were exploring downtown and I'm so glad we found this place!! Our server Smiles was awesome! I had the oysters & hamachi crudo which were both super fresh and delicious, & French onion soup was flavorful! My. boyfriend had the Benedict that he says might have been the beat he's ever had... and an omelette that we ended up taking to go but it was just as amazing as everything else we had. The basil cucumber lemonades were refreshing. I'd highly recommend this place!

name: White Horse
content: This place has the best cider in town! It's seasonal so RUN there!! It's called Hive Autumn Cider

name: White Horse
content: Incredible! I just moved to Salt Lake City and have not dined out yet. I also am high risk, so am weary with Covid. Today's my birthday so I decided to treat myself to some takeout and look up restaurants in the area. After looking at the menu here, I knew this was the place. While I was waiting for takeout, I was watching their team enforce social distancing and masks and that was SO reassuring! Typically I don't expect 100% with takeout (of course it's always better dine in). But WOW! Everything was amazing, even the fries were still nice and crisp. The burrata appetizer is delicious and the flavors work incredibly well together. The short rib sandwich was tender and flavorful and some of the best short rib I've had. I work in the industry, so I know people don't compliment as often and just wanted to make sure this place gets the recognition it deserves. Thank you!

name: White Horse
content: Huge crowds, little to no covid distancing, masks, or seriousness, insane waits. Not worth your time.

name: White Horse
content: We have frequented White Horse in past. Now that this wonderful pandemic (add sarcasm) is disrupting everything... dining out has taken a turn for the worst.My wife and I really enjoy eating at places that have great food, a great vibe and make you feel welcomed. If you are the same... you have found a place to add to your list. On this most recent visit, we opted to order take out and go to a local park for dinner.  I realize this isn't ideal and dining in is where it truly is at... still it allowed us to support a local establishment that is well deserving. One of the downfalls to ordering takeout, is you miss out on the opportunity to select a drink from their incredible bar. They have just about everything a person could ask for. Well, let me just say this. Our takeout order didn't miss a beat. Everything was fantastic. Same great flavors. Excellent portions and packaged thoughtfully. Admittedly, I would prefer to have dined in, however, this was a great way to enjoy White Horse, while dealing with the social distancing requirements. Be sure to give them a try. I am pretty sure you will find it to be a great choice.

name: White Horse
content: I've been here several times and my favorite part is that I forget I'm in Utah. The servers, whiskey selection, cocktails -- everything.This place could easily exist in D.C. and I wouldn't bat an eye. The knowledge of every server I've had here blows my mind. They HAVE to be transplants. There is no way they know that much about whiskey. But it doesn't stop at their cocktails. Their presentation of appetizers and entrees are also amazing. I need to say their octopus is the best I've ever had and I've tried octopus all over the country. Aside from paying the price of their overall excellence, I find no fault and if you're in SLC, White Horse is a must.

name: White Horse
content: Favorite place for drinks and snacks in Salt Lake. This place is seriously underrated. If I could give them more than 5 stars I would. I am never disappointed when I come here unless the wait is too long for me to get in. ;) The staff is always friendly, the drinks are always fun and the food is fantastic. I love the cider on tap and the appetizers are on point. Word of advise, GET THE BRUSSELS SPROUTS! You won't regret it. My husband will sometimes just order this for his meal, they are that good. The egg and chip is also really delicious and fun. Would HIGHLY recommend. Now if I could only get them to share that brussels sprout recipe with me... @white horse DM me if you can hook me up.

name: White Horse
content: Amazing Food and Amazing Service! White Horse is definitely one of the best bars in town. All the staff that I interacting with were super friendly and attentive. The bartender Dylan, made me a delicious bar roulette. The dinner special of the night was incredible. 10 out of 10 will go again and recommend!

name: White Horse
content: This place is as advertised. Excellent food, friendly staff, huge drink selection. Only in town for the night and glad I found this place.

name: White Horse
content: Great atmosphere, fun drinks and excellent food. Definitely not disappointed..Outdoor seating available.

name: White Horse
content: UNBELIEVABLE!! I'm from Houston and I've had nothing comparable to this place! The presentation and freshness is NEXT LEVEL!! NO WORDS....

name: White Horse
content: I had a wonderful experience here yesterday, I'm visiting for one night from Maryland and stopped in for lunch. My server Kendall was kind, attentive, and a pure delight to talk to. I had Oysters Rockefeller and the Ahi Niciose Salad- both were fantastic. After my 7 day trip to Yellowstone, I'll be back in SLC for one night and plan on visiting White Horse again. Also, one of the most impressive bartenders I have ever seen!

name: White Horse
content: Came back for a second round in SLC and once again the drinks were delicious and the food was good. Now it wasn't great because I felt like the greens with the burrata dish were not fitting. The macerated strawberries in the balsamic were really good. I wish they had put in whole piquin peppers instead of the chopped up piquillo peppers because they tasted like a soggy mess. The oysters were on point. So fresh and delicious. We even got the fried oysters which were really delicious.

name: White Horse
content: The food here was off the charts amazing! The wait wasn't bad either enjoyed a drink next door. It was perfect. Great for a fancy date night out.

name: White Horse
content: My new favorite restaurant in SLC!Be prepared, this is also a bar so they will ask for ID.  I've lived in SLC for 25 years and have learned not to order oysters.  Even at so-called fish places like Market Street, Current, etc. I've always been disappointed.  I explained this to the server when she told me about the oysters and she promised me I'd be happy or she'd pay for them.  And lo & behold, I was absolutely shocked at the freshness & quality.  I ordered 6 before dinner and six more after, both west coast varieties.  Awesome!We also ordered the burrata appetizer with strawberries & piquillo peppers...incredible!  Had the deep fried olive snack, beet salad, roasted chicken and the wagyu steak.  Everything was a legit 10/10 except the wagyu, which was more like a 7.5, but since it was around $30 (would be double that or more in a prime steak house) I still think it was a good value.For drinks we had House sparkling Rose and cider flights, followed by full-size carafe of the pear cider.  All were delicious and reasonably priced.The service was excellent, properly paced with food coming out hot & timely but still properly sequenced.  Over a week later and I'm still thinking about the strawberry & piquillo burrata and the chicken dish, and this is the ONLY place in SLC I will go when I'm craving oysters.

name: White Horse
content: I took clients there to celebrate a successful transaction. The food was yummy but the service was terrible. We felt in the way, rushed and ignored. Rarely did anyone check in on us. We would have ordered more after dinner drinks but left to celebrate elsewhere.

name: White Horse
content: Edit: and they tipped themselves from my credit card an extra $20. UNBELIEVABLE. Thieves! I left her $10 cash, $7 for the bartender and you steal $20 from my card???!! You really think you deserve $37 on a $105 check after such service?Upon walking in we were asked for IDs. We had to walk back to the car to get them because this was completely unexpected at 4:30pm to enter a restaurant for food. We come back and show our ids. My mom's ID is expired; she had a paper extension, but not on her because come on, she's an elderly citizen, she obviously looks older than 21. We are allowed in.We haven't made it to our table when the manager started whispering about us with the hostess, assuming regarding the expired ID, then proceeded to stop my husband midway to our table by the bar to tell him expired IDs are not accepted. My husband clarifies and we keep going. Still we find it rude because we felt profiled; but ok. There's 2 tables in the whole restaurant, you'd think they'd try harder at customer service...Our server Erica comes, we order a bottle of Cava right away and a beer. We are in the industry- we won't be ordering a $300 bottle of wine; but $45 worth of drinks by the time we are sitting down sounds pretty good to most servers. She comes back to struggle to open the sparkling and while she's at it, we ask her what the oysters are. She doesn't know. We ask her for the fish of the day; which is on the menu like that. She doesn't know either. We ask her for any specials, she says she has to check. With the Cava we get 10% ice in the ice bucket, and a warm bottle. When she comes back to tells us what the oysters are, we go ahead and order 6 oysters. Oysters take forever, we have to flag her down and ask her because of our fear that everything will come at once. We finally get them. Of course we get 12 instead of 6.  One of us isn't having any so I have to tell the manager when he drops them off that we only wanted 6. His response: "oh, well enjoy them." Really? Language can be powerful.We ordered 3 burgers because being in the industry I choose not to give money to places that don't care to have me there, and at this point I have already ordered plenty for the kind of service we have gotten. As expected, as she's taking the order and as she realizes is going to be 3 burgers, she smirks and laughs and walks away. Burgers were all 3 different temperatures, but all 3 were overcooked and wrong. She comes back right after our burgers were dropped, our oysters were still there because we had literally just gotten them and she says: "I heard you were asking for the specials", Um no, you didn't "hear", I asked you directly. And then asked someone else when you never came. So I tell her tht and she proceeded to avoid us the rest of the meal. We never got water refills even though our glasses were empty, we poured our own wine the whole time, our table was never bussed- we piled up the plates and moved them to a corner, and they remained there until the end.But this whole time the bouncer/manager was worried about my mom's ID being expired. Talk about priorities.We get the check and the oysters had been corrected, but of course not comped. I never worked in a restaurant where the managers wouldn't have automatically just taken care of those $18 for being wrong; late and rushed: but not here.The area is horrible; I don't know the city but the amount of homeless, meth addicts and weirdos around the restaurant is a little concerning. Again, you'd think these people would try harder to keep customers. The only person that seemed to know their job duties and any customer service was the bartender. We saw him telling the server to give us more water. We saw him taking care of tables that were neglected. We saw him sending the servers to our table to pick up the credit card, etc. So as we are walking out we gave part of the server's tip to the bartender and thanked him for trying to take care of us. Labor day weekend and these are your strongest servers?Burgers were good, oysters were fresh. But still $120 badly spent.This review is a free F&B consultation, you should value it.

name: White Horse
content: Awesome food as always but our waitress tonight was super rude. Put a frustrating edge to an otherwise great meal.

name: White Horse
content: Friendly team and the food was delicious. For me, the guava cider was my favorite . None of the dishes disappointed . It was also reasonably priced .

name: White Horse
content: White horse is easily in my top 3 restaurants in Utah. The cocktails are great and the selection of drinks is literally floor to ceiling. Cool looking bar. While the drinks are worth coming for alone, what really keeps bringing us back is the food. I like to order something different each time but the steak sandwich has been my favorite so far. The steak is definitely the star of the show but every component is top quality and the portion is just the right size. The Mrs can't see beyond the brussel sprouts. She orders the appetizer every single time and has loved it every single time. She tells me its the best restaurant dish she's ever had.Service has always been efficient and friendly without being overbearing which is exactly how I like it. When I'm out with the Mrs I wanna chat with the Mrs, ya know? Ambiance is great.

name: White Horse
content: Fish, my waiter is a great start. He was able to speak with me and recommend some great suggestions. Fresh Oysters. Would never have thought SLC is a place to get them. They fly them in direct from a place in WA state.  Whomever prepared them did an excellent job and did not skimp on the horse radish, vinegar etc.  Scallops cooked perfect. Duck was good and certainly fresh.  Highly recommend this place and ask for the waiter Fish.

name: White Horse
content: Great selection of whiskeys, comfortable atmosphere and fantastic food. I've eaten there twice when I'm in town and both experiences were fantastic. Friendly staff, checked in with you but weren't intrusive and gave suggestions when asked. Definitely a must when you're in the area.

name: White Horse
content: Outdoor seating was perfect .  Drinks were great .  Food was excellent .  Service was excellent .  I seldom give five stars but this place earned it .  Hot day and they kept bringing out the water.  We had draft cider flights .  Nice and cold.  The salmon with corn and crab was so good .  The duck breast with Utah sour cherries and toasted Brussel sprouts was excellent.  The american wagyu cheese burger was delicious .  The arugula salad was the best and very generous portion .   Definitely worth the wait for table .

name: White Horse
content: I never give reviews of restaurants but this time I had to make an exception.  Everything I ate was absolutely phenomenal.  The Egg n'chips, crispy Brussels sprouts, Oysters Rockefeller, Duck Breast, Vegetable Hash, and the Bourbon Butterscotch Pudding....awesomeness!!

name: White Horse
content: This bar and restaurant is fantastic and honestly the food is SO good. For the eggs Benedict they use thinly sliced ham rather than big Canadian bacon it's so clever and good. Also they have amazing oysters. Definitely worth a stop. In a kinda sketchy area we saw two homeless guys tweaking on the sidewalk but apart from that outstanding service and food

name: White Horse
content: Came here for dinner and enjoyed their great selection of ciders, excellent food, and fantastic service. We ordered the arugula salad to share and it was large enough to serve as a side for three people. The vinaigrette had a great light flavor that paired well with the earthy arugula and mild cheese. Our mains were the organic salmon, duck breast, and wagyu bacon cheeseburger. The salmon was perfectly cooked with a crispy skin, and the dish included a generous amount of crab. I tried bites of the duck as well and it was flavorful and juicy. I'm glad we choose White Horse for our night in SLC!

name: White Horse
content: Dined in during COVID-19 restrictions. Only smaller parties allowed and social distancing was enforced. The service and food were excellent. Good variety in the menu. Ordered the fried olives, pickles, steak tartare, and wagyu burger. Server recommendations were spot on. Definitely recommend this spot!

name: White Horse
content: Bar food on steroids. I always think of bar food as an afterthought-- something the business provides to earn a little extra revenue, but not their main focus. While I can't speak for the drinks at White Horse, the food is top notch. I had takeout and was able to try the steak entree and the prime rib. Unfortunately by the time I tasted the steak it wasn't warm anymore. That's just the nature of takeout though. I could tell it was cooked with care. Perfectly medium rare. The prime rib was likewise delicious, and the mash potatoes were perfect as a side. It's a bit pricey, but I think it's worth the dough. Will definitely be back.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: The Cauliflower wasn't our favorite, but would recommend the killer shrimp and the bacon jam toast. Not our favorite spot in SLC though for dinner.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This place is a mix of Wisconsin comfort food meets your uncle from Paris. The deviled eggs were obviously created by a deal with the devil and are truly exceptional. Creative stuff like the Reuben salad and the Brat Ban Sanny make me return to try everything here. And dang those spicy tots. Oy vey.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Awesome food- a little expensive but fun with friends and sharing plates. Veal meatballs were THE BEST! Barramundi good but too expensive.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: For only being in Salt Lake for that afternoon, I'm super glad we stopped at Carson Kitchen! My brother and I had the entire place to ourselves and we had the pleasure of having the manager, Margo, also be our waiter. She easily provided some of the nicest and attentive service I've ever gotten at any restaurant! The food was also overall pretty good. My favorite was definitely the killer shrimp, as they were light and flavorful. The butter burger, spicy tater tots, and pork belly were also good, but the most memorable part of this visit was definitely the service that Margo provided!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: There were 3 of us. My son had the chicken sandwich, my husband had the burger, and I had the Killer shrimp and one of the salads. Everything was absolutely delicious. The server was really knowledgeable and just friendly enough.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Wow what a finde he food was so good, young beets, vegan tacos, killer shrimp, Italian sausage flat bread was amazingly awesome. Highly recommend!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Everything was delicious and farm to table fresh! Cocktails were delicious, especially the one called Just the Tip.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Phenomenal service!  Had dinner here while staying in SLC.  We had a variety of plates some super yummy and a couple that were average. Our top dishes were the mac and cheese, the killer shrimp and the over the top glazed donut bread pudding.  We also enjoyed the chicken thighs and bacon jam.  We were a bit disappointed with the ny steak dish which didn't have the great beef flavor I expect when ordering a steak at a nice restaurant.  Also the potatoes and leeks were underwhelming.  We tried a few of there mixed drinks and wine. The mixed drinks were flavorful and the wine selection was small but perfect for this establishment. We will visit again since some of there most popular dishes (pork belly, oxtail risotto and deviled eggs) were unavailable at the time.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Well, I have to give a huge shout out to crunchy fried chicken skins, which sounds weird but is one of the most delicious things I've eaten with a sprinkle of spice and honey to dip.  It's insanely delicious and we went back a Few weeks later just for this on repeat. The burger was amazing too and tater tots, and the beet salad is soooooooo goooooooood.  I mean, order these things and you will be sooooo happy.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Met some clients for drinks and snacks. Snacks were pretty good. We had the Ny strip, the cauliflower, shrimp, pumpkin flatbread and deviled eggs. The eggs were unreal with caviar on top of them! Service was great. Atmosphere was also great.  Not sure what the problem was but our table felt like it was 58 degrees all night. Little chilly for all of our liking.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: The is my favorite to stop for a cocktail and bites after a day on the slopes! Will be back again, very accommodating and friendly staff. Highly recommend the butternut squash flatbread.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This place is absolutely beautiful on the inside. A tidbit chilly. Could've turned up the heat.Came with a friend and wasn't totally hungry but got a few tapas to share. The vegan jackfruit tacos were the best I have ever had!The killer shrimp was killer LOLThe grilled oysters were amazing. Especially the juice on the inside of it with whatever is in it.My only complaint was the cost vs what you get. The reason for my 4 star. I mean I am all down with sharing tapas. But it only comes with three.  If everything is meant to share, and you Just come with more than three people. You would have to get multiple of the same dish for everyone to have a bite. Why not serve four?

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Bacon Jam and pork Belly all day long!!! So damn good! Cool ambiance as well!! Wish they gave free refills on sodas, but besides that, the experience was awesome!!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Had a damn great time here.  The bartender Val makes great drinks and is super fun to sit with!!The food was amazing, the service was top notch the whole time thanks Val and Margo for a great time!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We came here on a Monday night, wasn't very crowded but got busier. We were seated immediately. We had the bacon jam to start, the havarti cheese on top made it but overall, wasn't our favorite dish. It was definitely more of a jam as it states than a dip like I honestly was hoping for. Big onion flavor. The baguettes served with it also were not toasted fully. The chicken skins were good with the crispy outside and the sauce. The Mac and cheese was actually super great. I had the sangria which I would not consider sangria. It definitely was more of a cranberry mimosa or something with sparkling wine and fruit juice. Very little actual red wine in it. I was bothered by the service as they didn't remove dirty dishes from our table until I had to ask at the very end. Overall, I wasn't super impressed by any of the dishes but think this restaurant could have potential with some dish modifications

name: Carson Kitchen
content: I wanted to love this place. I was very disappointed in the service. Came on a Sunday. The wait to get our food was longer than we have ever waited at a restaurant. Usually, when waits are long, we are patient due to the manager or waiter coming over and letting us know. There was no communication. Didn't offer us anything for the wait. Not even a drink. Once we got our food, our server never came and checked on us. I would have liked the food more had our server asked if we needed anything. We ran out of ketchup and sauce, so everything was dry. Unfortunately we will not be back.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Those I trust love Carson Kitchen in Las Vegas, and it's stood the test of time there. Now that the hype is over, it was time to go visit our version.We arrived right at opening on Saturday to beat any rush. Unfortunately, even well into lunch hour there were too few people. They do an excellent job with COVID friendly policies. From meeting the host, being seated, and our excellent server, everyone was friendly and competent beyond expectations. I also visited with the bartender after his excellent rendition of a Bees Knees. It beat the one I had in the American Bar at the Savoy, arguably the best bar in the World. He really knew his stuff as i talked to him. He's better than almost any restaurant bar deserves.After cocktails, we ate the crispy chicken skin they are known for. It's too big for two people, but we found a way to eat them all. The veal meatballs were excellent. Along with the beets, and grilled mac and cheese, it was more than we could eat. We had a well priced bottle of Barbara di Asti to go with the food.It may have started as a Kerry Simon celebrity chef restaurant, concept, but today it's a truly excellent restaurant with very reasonably priced food.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: When we lived in Vegas this was one of our go-to favorites. Imagine my surprise and happiness when I realized they followed us up to SLC!I was slightly nervous to give it a try. Would it be as good as my beloved downtown Vegas spot? YES. Just as good. Fried green beans and pork belly were phenomenal. My belly was so happy to once again eat the bread pudding. Good job Carson Kitchen SLC!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Excellent food and drinks and friendly staff with great recommendations.  We enjoyed a few dishes from the small plates menu and all were delicious. So glad still open in the current environment, and felt very safe with the staff in masks and spaced out tables. Highly recommend, and we will be back.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This truly bad and overpriced food. Had the Black Rice and Oxtail Risotto the texture was sickening and it was mostly tasteless. Chili Cauliflower (try Whole Foods cauliflower if this is your idea of gourmet, your mind will be blown for a fraction of the price!). Lastly the Veal Meatballs with Sherrie foie gras cream. Which is kinda laughable considering it tasted like a funky lemon cream sauce... maybe they we're out of the correct sauce. Too bad, we were excited to give this place a try but it was too icky to return.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Sopapilla French Toast from @carsonkitchen *Tried out Carson Kitchen for our Valentine's Day brunch this last Sunday! This sopapilla french toast was definitely the favorite.*It's deep fried, filled with yumminess, topped with figs... you can't go wrong.  ORDER IT.*Brunch was more of little shared plates which was nice but they were out of the shrimp of grits which made me a bit sad. And their spam Benedict didn't have spam! I was very confused. *If you've eaten here before let me know what I should have gotten! I feel like I might need to give this place another try.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Valentines dinner! It was so so good. We got the steak, green beans, pork belly, and bread pudding. We loved the atmosphere, great service, and awesome food! We would eat the pork belly every day! Steak could have used a little more seasoning, but we're just salty people  we'll be back!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Was a little skeptical but I'd have to say this place nailed it. Food was super unique and very palatable. We had the oc tail risotto, meatballs and chicken thighs. The cocktails we had was their take on the manhattan. Will be coming back here again !

name: Carson Kitchen
content: One word AHHHMAAAAZING! As in the best meal we have had in a long time, maybe ever. The entire meal. The ENTIRE meal, each bite of each dish that came out one of us was saying "oh my god, this is soooo good"  Seriously. The tempura green beans with the red pepper jelly cream cheese. Perfect combo of flavors. Shrimp dish. Yum. Cod dish. Yum. Mac and cheese was the best we have all had in our entire lives. Soooo good. Mouth-gasmic. Donut bread pudding and brownie w  bacon ice cream. Sounded weird but what a mashup of flavors. We were licking our plates, folks.  Sadly we dug in and didn't get pictures of our savory dishes but we did snap a couple of desserts. This place was so good we were talking up people on the sidewalk outside saying the HAD to go in and try. TRY THIS PLACE. You will not be sorry. And our server whose name escapes me, fantastic service!! Out of this world good all around. And they were seating inside socially distanced, all servers wearing masks and masks required by customers when not eating.drinking. We were there closer to 4 for late lunch and it was the perfect time - only three tables occupied.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Solid 4.25 star restaurant. Made reservations on a Saturday night and glad I did because it was busy! Tables are socially distanced apart. Service was friendly, helpful. I liked that everyone helped out with the duties including the check in staff taking away plates that were empty. Clean, trendy decor/setting.1. Beets - Very good. Unique combination with goat cheese but one that worked out. 2. Oxtail risotto - Agree with another reviewer that the dish provides more risotto than what it looks like. Smoky, rich taste with bits of meat mixed throughout. 3. Pork belly - Average to me. Drier side of pork. The buffalo sauce seemed a little out of left field for this dish but did not take away from it.4. Bread pudding - Rich. Bigger than it seems. Sauce is a mix of vanilla and caramel. 5. Drinks were on the lighter side but flavorful nonethelessOverall enjoyed the good food here. Recommend to try at least once!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This place was great. Went here with my son for dinner, and sat at the "kitchen bar"The chefs were great! The food was really tasty for me and my younger son. Pork belly, chicken skin, flat bread and the Ruben salad were spot on... just be sure to save room for dessert! Really inventive menu and a great atmosphere

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Sunday brunch???  There has never been a sadness that can't be cured by breakfast food. Oh my God! Carson kitchen hits every corner of my soul.  Ooooh baby take me to church! YUMM!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Amazing soul food. My favorite was the killer shrimp and Mac n cheese. There's quite a few things on the menu so I want to go back soon and try more!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Omg, chicken skin, not healthy, but incredibly tasty!! The pork belly is eye candy! It comes in 3 one bite cube (ok, it took me 2 bites, because I don't want to finish it too fast!). It's the combination of savory, sweet and sour. Btw, I also like their diner ware. Just take a look, it's cute!  The space is big with industrial look. Dining in during this crazy time is kind of scary, but social distancing is practiced here. They sanitized the tables and chairs after each customer.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We love this restaurant for date night. Delicious food and drinks and great service. The bacon jam is our favorite!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Wow!!  What a great little hidden gem!!  I am GF and almost everything on their menu is GF or can be made GF.  Everything we ate was over the top delicious!  The shrimp I will be craving by next week.  The taste is indescribable delicious!  The Secret Sunday Chicken was mouthwatering and even better than the original!  The beet and goat cheese salad was also excellent!  The Chef actually came out to our table to discuss my allergy and advise preparation techniques and the recipes.  The wait staff was also exceptional!!  I can't wait to go back!!  Comfortable, friendly with high end food at a very reasonable price!!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Social distancing, masks, sanitizer used.We ordered the tempura green beans, potatoes and leeks. Firey Shrimp, and cheeseburger with spicy tater tots. We also ordered the Jack Mormon cocktails.We enjoyed everything except the potatoes and leeks. Sort of meh. The service is excellent and I enjoyed the cocktail. The menu is seasonal and subject to change. Will definitely return.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This place was wonderful! I really enjoyed the crispy chicken skins as an appetizer. I highly recommend it! The atmosphere was great, they played great music and had some interesting cocktails. I had the Mac n cheese as an entree, it was sent from cheese heaven. It had the best flavors. I had a bite of the burger which had an amazing aioli sauce in it. I will definitely come back and get the burger! Great flavors all around!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: You have the get the chicken skins! Alex was our server and she was great. The attention to detail was great. We had the burger, Mac and cheese, and flatbreads. Everything was amazing. Also suggest the green beans as an appetizer. They are fried but still very light.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Thoroughly enjoyed the food, drinks, and thoroughly enjoyed the ambience.  Our server was top-notch (even under the cumbersome Covid restrictions she had to work around), as well as the hostess and manager.They made it seem like it was just a normal wonderful dining experience.. thank you!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We heard about the buzz from some friends in Vegas and this place did not disappoint!! The food is excellent! My wife and I were together with two other couples. Our order included several items that we all shared. Everything was really delicious! Chicken thighs, strip steak, pep on pep pizza, mac & cheese, green beans, cauliflower... all very good! The ambiance was chic and trendy. The staff was welcoming and provided great direction on the menu. All around - a great time!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: A great new addition to the slc dining scene - energetic, lively environment with amazing service and great food. Try the shrimp and pork belly, can't go wrong! Highly recommend this new spot.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Good times. Finally somewhere that doesn't circle jerk each other over a plate of short ribs and bavette steak. Carson is new American but with a ever apparent southern flare. They do their style and don't care what you think. Go with an open mind and enjoy. If I see you get a burger and say it isn't good enough to go back then you have zero respect from me or any other person. The bottom line is that they have fun, unique and delicious menu that will satisfy you. If you're a cheap son of a bitch that doesn't want to spend more than $20 per person than go elsewhere.  If you love good food take a $100, a date, and enjoy. Bacon jam: off the charts. Loved the pepper on the bread too, nice subtle addition that not many would notice but it takes the flavor to never never never land. Shrimp: great. I loved the red jalapeños. Is there a difference? I wish there were more to get into every bite, it brought it together.  I think they were 8Fresno. Cut the jalapeños, use more Fresno. Chicken skins: delicious honey. The chicken skins were hard to eat, very crunchy. Delicious, but just too crunchy for me. Hurt my mouth and the honey is served too shallow to actually dip the skins. There is a better way to serve this thatd be more conducive to eating and not looking. Pork belly: great. Loved the carrots and Buffalo spin. Delicious. Perfect. Beets: fresh, light. Loved the pistachios rolled INTO the goat cheese. Made it easy to eat and come together. Wished there was a few more oranges. Mac and cheese: smooth, thin and sharp. Great stuff. I'd love an herb. Something to make it kick but otherwise wonderful. Just a little blan but not badBread salad: deliciousChicken: wonderfully tender, perfectly cooked. The sauce needed more power in my opinion. It was missing a kick: citrus, spice or otherwise. I could be totally wrong but it seemed muddled. It was very fun to eat and it was good BUT compared to the other dishes, this one lacked the coherent and boastful flavors. Turns out it was supposed to have a mustard taste and that would've been great. Maybe just got a weak batch of sauceSteak: a little too much espresso. The balance between bitter and sweet was a little off but not insultingly so. Just a little too much but that red wine sauce was incredible. Make sure you get some in every bite or it may throw you offDonut bread pudding: perfect. Get it. Not many bread pudding captures the "pudding " part. Instead the serve soggy bread and when you to the middle it's just dry. This was tender and sweet to the core. GreatBacon desert: slightly unexpected, however not terrible. The icecream was off the charts good. Wow. The brownie was lame. Served cold and dry. Why not a hot brownie? It was a good brownie but it served room temperature, like it had been sitting for over a day. Like I said it was tastey, but the experience was overall just too dry. No sauce, no warmth, no gooeyness. Id rather take a bowl of icecream with the brownie bits mixed in. Maybe I'm biased towards the flawless bacon ice-cream, but the ratio was off. MORE ICE-CREAM! Haha i don't know, everyone is different but there was too much cold, hard brownie. This is the only dish that needs to actually be re-imagined in my opinion. There was potential in this dessert but the execution of it was no amazing. Tastey! But lacking in cohesion Go here. Enjoy. Stop crying and eat like an adult

name: Carson Kitchen
content: VEGAN - focused review FOOD REVIEW. Pros : COVID protocol followed. Everyone was seated a safe distance and all staff and cooks wore their mask the entire time. Very well mannered and hard working waitresses and cooks. CONS As a vegan, there is only one menu item that is vegan and that can be considered substantial , there are other vegan items that are there but they are focused on one vegetable . Like Cauliflower, or edamame or broccoli centered dish .. I would love to see more options that included a plant based protein , like chickpeas , tofu , seitan, or mushrooms added since this option will only apply to a niche type of vegan , someone who is not that hungry and going in for a very quick bite to eat. PRO The option are jackfruit tacos which were very well prepared and seasoned. They come in a set of 3 the size of street tacos . Ultimately, it was surprising to see a miniature  selection  of vegan food for a  downtown restaurant. PRO However, they have a great selection of alcoholic drinks that have been crafted to highlight the flavors of the ingredients. I know this restaurant is not targeted at a vegan restaurant but just in case your Omni friends and you are looking for  a night out this is a restaurant   that's can provide good drinks and tasty bites but maybe not a full meal .

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Obsessed. This place is amazing. We loved everything about it. Our bartender was so nice and inviting and personable! The inside is tasteful and pretty. Can't wait to come back.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: It was our first time trying out Carson Kitchen and it was DIVINE (thanks Utah Grubs for the rec)! It's a fun ambience located in the heart of slc with plenty of parking around. The service was 10/10 and the food was 10/10. I highly recommend trying the Mac and cheese with the NY strip steak. They pair beautifully! & you can't leave without getting the glazed donut bread pudding... we may just have to come back tomorrow for another.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Yes!  I know I've reviewed Carson kitchen, and it was JUST last weekend...however...I couldn't stop thinking about this food ALL week long and had to return today.  I ordered the oatmeal brûlée AGAIN and the avocado toast AGAIN...amazing AGAIN...just can't get enough.  Sooo full.  I need a nap!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Contemporary, vibrant, and sleek, this place sits in the heart of the downtown city. My brother took me and my mom here when we were in town, and we all felt safe especially with Covid-19 going around. It was clean, spotless, and everyone was wearing masks. The staff was friendly and the service was remarkable.We got: ~ Killer Shrimp: spicy, addicting, great app to start!~ Crispy Chicken Skins: served with honey, perfect for sharing, sweet and salty crunch, bad for your arteries, good for your taste buds!~ Chicken Thighs: tender, charred and smoky, could use a side dish, big enough for 2!~ Secret Sunday Chicken: huge and juicy, crispy sandwich, satisfying and filling, came with plenty of spicy tater tots on the side, not a secret anymore!~ Black Rice & Oxtail Risotto: rich, delectable, yummy gremolata on top, generous portion, mom loved it!~ Magarian Cocktail: cool and tangy, refreshing and sweet, perfect cucumber, honey lemon and gin combo!~ Communication Breakdown Drink: break it down with bitter and sour balance, bottoms up, Mezcal and ginger liqueur!Great place for nibbles or drinks in the area, but take note that their alcohol is perfectly measured just like everywhere else, not too strong, and parking is metered on the street.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: The food and ambiance is fantastic. They just look like they're closed from the outside because it's so dark. And the paper-printed "now open" sign looks far more ghetto than the welcoming and modern interior. If they want to attract more business, they may consider an attractive and modern "open, please come in" light or something of the sort. Although it looks dark from the outside, the ambient lighting inside is wonderful and the food is fantastic.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: The presentation of the food was amazing. The  ambience was beautiful. The food was spectacular. We tried the flaming shrimp, beet and goat cheese salad and the mac & cheese. I would love to give a favorite suggestion, however each one was spectacular and different. The service  however, was less than spectacular, Chelsea, was more interested in chatting with the other servers.   Definitely a place to visit  downtown.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: ASK FOR INDY! The best customer service and can make any drink you can think of... from a whisky sour to the best red blend on the menu.... the pork tenderloin is to die for and the Mac and cheese is a MUST!!!!!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Everything was so amazing. The staff was so so friendly and helpful (we asked what we should order - Alex and Shance were great!). Food came out perfectly timed. Honestly everything we chose was delicious. We ordered the Caesar salad, pork belly, and watermelon salad, the Mac n cheese, and steak. And THEN, we got the bread pudding for dessert - holy moly, literally the best bread pudding we've ever had (pic). Loved it! Highly recommend.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: The crispy chicken skins with smoked honey were an unexpected surprise. Just like chicken bacon and the smoked honey is the perfect dipping choice. Chef Joe cooked my butter buger perfectly and don't worry when it comes and the cheese isn't melted all of the way, it's supposed to be like that. And you'll know why once you take a bite and the Boursin cheese comes into play....... Absolutely delicious. The in house made tater tots are as addicting as hell and I found myself sad when they were gone  I finished with the glazed donut bread pudding. I just have to laugh at how ridiculously good it is.The Manager Margo and the bartender Val were both very warm and welcoming, and I felt very comfortable eating in there as a compromised person. Everything was sanitized and everyone was observing the recommendations of the CDC. Bottom line is, GO AND EAT HERE.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This place is definitely in my top 5 favorite restaurants in Salt Lake!  Everything we ordered was amazing!  The staff was very friendly and had great recommendations!  The drinks were pretty good, too!  We will be back again and again!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Chic restaurant with an inventive menu! The prices are very fair considering the quality of the food provided. We stopped in for a quick lunch. The staff all wear masks and there are signs on every other table to block people from sitting at them in order to reinforce social distancing.Here's what we ordered:CRISPY CHICKEN SKINSThis was so savory and smoky! Reminded me of pork chicharon but way better and less greasy. They pair it with honey that adds to the great smoky flavor. The portion size is more than enough for two people. I was tempted to order a second one to go because it was so delicious.BLACK RICE & OXTAIL RISOTTOThick and creamy and definitely filling. Don't let that plate fool you - the bowl is quite deep so you get a generous portion of risotto. It came with a gremolata on top to give it a nice kick - so good that I asked for extra gremolata on the side.GLAZED DONUT BREAD PUDDINGThis dessert wasn't overwhelmingly sweet, which I appreciated. Pretty straightforward and the bread was very soft.Overall, I loved the atmosphere, quick service and fresh ingredients. Great place for lunch or dinner!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Amazing Service provided by all staff! A special shout out to both Val and Margo were outstanding care by them!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Want amazing food? Look no further!  Seriously, the food here was the best I had during my road trip around the state.  My husband and I shared a bunch of things and loved every single one.  The green beans were perfectly cooked and the dipping sauce went perfectly with them.  I loved the mac and cheese and tried to eat it all myself without sharing.  The meatballs were unique and delicious and my husband said his favorite item was the turkey burger. Everything was "normal" food but the unique flavors and updates/upgrades to the items made everything feel new.  I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant and the employees were very friendly and helpful.  Highly recommended!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We have been low key stalking this place...wanting to try it...and finally today we went in for lunch....I have no idea what took us so long!!!!!!! When you walk in your met with a warm welcome from the amazing GM. The space is very trendy with industrial clean lines. Our server was very accommodating and offered suggestions. The food was AMAZING!!!!! We started with the Fried Chicken Skins with Smoked Honey....WHOA!!! That was a game changer!!!!! It was beyond!!!!! Crispy and crunchy with the sweetness from the smoked honey!!!!!! Could have had a whole bag of those!!! My hubby and I shared the NY steak which was grilled to perfection, and our son had the Butter Cheeseburger which is seriously the best burger I've had this year. If you are downtown looking for an amazing spot...you need to pop in here!! You will not be disappointed.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: I've been to the Carson Kitchen in downtown Vegas and loved it, so was excited to see it arrive in SLC. Every bit as good as the LV location and we don't have to drive six hours. Highly recommended!!!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This place was AMAZING. I can't say enough good things about the food, the service, the atmosphere. All of it was incredible. You have to get the deviled eggs and the baked Mac and cheeese. Also shout out, to our server Indy who was so kind!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: So excited for this epic new restaurant.  The food is divine....and truly unique!!!! The staff  were so fabulous.  I'm psyched to head back.  We had the deviled eggs, oxtail risotto and veal meatballs.  We had the bread pudding for dessert and no lie .... best I've ever had. Cannot give enough praise for this place.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: New restaurant in downtown SLC serving up great food. The pork tenderloin was exquisite!!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: The food is truly awesome I was in SLC on a business trip and fortunately found this place. I loved my meal here everything was so delicious and the service was really great too. Next time I'm in SLC, I will go back!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Visiting from Texas and we're so happy we found this place!! Indy was a great Bartender and really helped us pick our drinks and food, he highly recommended the Pork Tenderloin and WOW the best thing I've eaten in a long time!! We also had the Edamame, Baked Mac'n Cheese and the Bourbon Fudge Brownie. It was all a delicious experience and I can't recommend it enough!!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: A must-eat restaurant bar in downtown salt lake. Very nice ambiance, enhaced only by natural lighting thanks to huge street windows.  I loved the bar setting. I ordered the wild mushrooms flatbread and devil's eggs. Both delicious, not to mention a glass or two of cabernet wine. Very fair prices. Excellent!!! Thank you (I just ordered the killer shrimp too. I'm such a glutton-love this place)

name: Carson Kitchen
content: After being turned away from our prior reservation for not having ID on us (guess the place was more of a bar than a restaurant), my wife and I used Rest to scope out Carson Kitchen join the waitlist as we walked over. While there was some initial confusion over the Resy waitlist and tables, the host were able to squeeze us in at the kitchen counter. I have never been more thankful for not taking my ID with me. The food here was amazing. We went with the broccoli crunch, deviled eggs, New York strip, Mac and cheese and the chili cauliflower. My only regret was that, given it was our last night in town, we couldn't come back to try some of the other items as they sounded so good. As we were sat at the kitchen counter, we could watch the chefs prepare all of the dishes. Everything was made fresh with ingredients of the highest quality. The waitstaff was friendly. Would definitely return the next time I'm in SLC.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Had a great dinner - this was our first dinner out since COVID and we felt safe, and had a wonderful meal! Very creative menu, loved the shared plates, each new dish was a delectable surprise - and the cocktails were fabulous!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: I'm glad to find another Carson Kitchen! The bacon jam is delish. The bartender kindly made me a drink from his secret menu. It was sublime. If I lived in SLC, I'd visit often. Minus one star for the lack of speaker sound at the bar.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This restaurant didn't seem to take COVID seriously at all and had very normal cleaning standards.  There were no sanitizers used between seatings.  There was also a drunk 20 person group that was ambling around the restaurant without masks, yelling at each other and would bump into our table. It was a very uncomfortable and frustrating experience at a time where we've so rarely get to experience restaurants, such a waste of time and money.The food was mediocrely best.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Amazing food and service. Felt very safe as we went during COVID. Highly recommend and would go back.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We are regulars at the Las Vegas restaurant which we fell in love with after our first visit and have returned many times. When Ethan told us of the opening of one in our home town we were over the moon and the new place doesn't disappoint . Doesn't have the energy of Las Vegas but we are in Covid so I'm certain that has had an effect. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a fantastic foodie experience. High marks!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This place is awesome. From classic food presented in a new way to mind blowing cocktails (English is a mad scientist) you can't go wrong with any choice you make. I'm not sure why people have posted anything negative because my experience here was nothing short of magic. These guys are a shining star in a sea of mediocre slc food. Not only worth a stop if you live in the city but worth a drive if you are in the surrounding 200 miles.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Sorry no pics, it's all so delicious. Shrimp, devil eggs, steak, salmon and drinks were amazing but the service and whole staff is even better. A must downtown spot.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We tried this place because our daughter said it was good and guess what?? It was AMAZING!! We had the shrimp dish, pork tenderloin, the meatballs, beets and the oxtail risotto.  They were all delicious!  For dessert we had the bread pudding and OMG, it was sooooooo good!  The guys who all served us were so friendly.  I can't wait to visit SLC and eat here again!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Tried a number of hand crafted cocktails while sharing 8 menu items with 3 other people. The food was incredible from the appetizers to the dessert. If you are looking to try things and get of your standard comfort zone, this is the place to do it. All of the food was remarkable and melt in your mouth!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: An excellent addition to the downtown SLC dining scene. The menu is both creative and delicious. Try the shrimp, veal meatballs and black rice with oxtail risotto. And everything else.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: I just love this new SLC restaurant! I have yet to narrow down my Must Try list since so many choices are amazing. Now they've added brunch & the choices are equally delicious. The bar is gorgeous too!Give it a try. So fun!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Another great addition to downtown food scene!  Wish I had a bigger stomach so I could have tried more dishes.  They have so many unique dishes and flavors that you will not find anywhere else!  For a newer venue they really seemed to have already worked out all of the growing pains and bugs!  Service was fantastic and the music playlist was like something out of my High School days.  Great place!!!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: For those seeing the hype, it's real. In Vegas, the original store is an absolute MUST for locals who love the food scene in Sin City.  Having recently moved to SLC from Vegas, stumbling across Carson Kitchen here was nothing short the most pleasant surprise. The food was fantastic, well prepared and a quality in taste that we've longed for since moving to Utah.Alex, our server, was friendly and knowledgeable of the menu steering us to a few recommendations on their seasonably changing menu. We had the Shrimp, Meatballs, and Broccoli and that was easily enough for a later dinner for two. The manager, David, was likewise very friendly and both he and his staff showed the level of service that will quickly establish their store in Salt Lake as a benchmark that foodies will adore.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Love it!! Every dish was so good and the sangria was amazing.  Wait on a Friday night was only 20 min and the service was delightful.  Definitely going back!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Very impressed with this place! Everything here is soo delicious and for the price isn't crazy! The shrimp is and the bacon jam is a must for appetizers. Drinks were on point. Soo dang good. We kind of all shared everything that we got and loved everything we ordered. Highly recommended.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Carson Kitchen does food very well, minimal menu but everything is spot on. We have been here twice once for dinner and once for lunch and now we can't wait to try the NEW brunch menu, Carson Kitchen is now open for Sunday brunch.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: My husband and I went for our anniversary. The staff was so welcoming and the food was so good. They made us a specialty drink not on the menu to celebrate us and bought us a free dessert!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Butter burger is amazing, veal meatballs are so tender.  Margo and Tina were so hospitable.  Great atmosphere.  Learn it love it love it!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: I LOVE this place. Where has Carson Kitchen been my whole life?? Salt Lake needs more great restaurants like this. I've been here 3 times and I'm always blown away. Try the veal meatballs with foie gras cream, you'll be glad you did! Margot and Tina took great care of us. We'll be back!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This place opened last month and has a cool vibe to it.Never been to their Las Vegas restaurant and they had many different and interesting items on the menu we just had to try. Service was attentive, the chef came out and talked to us about what we liked/disliked which was way cool!The only thing I didn't like was the Mac & Cheese, just was missing something or had too much of something (couldn't put a finger on it).From start to finish the meal was delicious and so fun. Can't wait to go back and try other items.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: This is another Vegas restaurant like nacho daddy.  Carson's has great lighting and a a good setting. Service was good. Loved the lazy Susan's on the bigger tables. Bathrooms r shared with nacho daddy.  Sparse parking.  Across from the downtown post office.  Now the food.  This needs fine tuning because everything was way too salty or overdressed or underwhelming.   We started with delicious chicken skins accompanied with honey.  After 5 pieces it became too rich and needed like a coleslaw or a ranch to cut the fat.  Too b honest I missed the meat.  Chicken tenders would b a good idea.  The Brussel sprout ceaser was way too overdressed.  It was good and I appreciated the pieces of bacon but just overdone with dressing.  Dishes are more tapa style even tho they have sandwiches.  Hamburger looked plain but come with tator tots, yum.  The spicy chicken sandwich has no spice.  The mac and cheese was cheesy and rich had way too much salt in it. We could have returned it but we all kept our mouths shut and boxed it to go.  For dessert we got the berry.  Yup full of berries if thats your thing.  Not for $10.  Overall solid menu but somebody needs to taste the food before it goes out.  $6 for Coors cans is pretty steep too.  Overall a nice place and I will come again when they get in to the groove of things.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Went here twice in the past month and I'm a BIG fan! First of all, the drinks are awesome. Started out with a few drinks and all were very good. Had the chicken skins which sounded weird, but we all loved them. Then Mac n Cheese, veal meat balls, Brussels sprout salad, all awesome. Mac n cheese was amazing. If I could get a a bucket of that, I'd eat it all til I was sick. Then the dessert. We had the cobbler and the donut bread pudding. Cobbler was fine, but I'm not a cobbler fan. Then the donut bread pudding. This is the reason I'm even writing a review. This is the BESTTTT dessert I've ever had in Utah!!! I just wish it were bigger. Like, a lot bigger. Anyway, highly recommend this place

name: Carson Kitchen
content: My husband and I tried this restaurant and really enjoyed our experience. For a chain, it was excellent. I would recommend it for appetizer and drinks. It would be a great after work spot with coworkers.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: great food. never had a problem with serice. just slightly high price wise. the bbg chicken ranch is the best thing on the menu but the chipotle bone broth is good too

name: Carson Kitchen
content: New restaurant in town that everyone should try. Great atmosphere with modern and clean dining area. Food is prepared well with nice presentation. I am definitely going back. Managers David and Margo were super friendly and did great job taking care of my table.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: I understand why they have a swear jar. The pork tenderloin is f*cking divine! We also really enjoyed the deviled eggs and cocktails. The staff was super friendly and the chef at the station near our table was an all around awesome guy! Also, bourbon bacon butter ice cream?! What's not to love!!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Nice place, great service!!Food portions are ok, you can't expect more for a tapa place.Presentations awesome l! Flavor very very salty! That why I'm giving them tow stars, you can enjoy the food more if wasn't so salty.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We stayed at the AC Hotel next door. Carson Kitchen had opened 2 days or so before our stay so we were very lucky. Great service, great food, wonderful ambiance. We stayed in SLC 3 days and ate dinner there twice!  Definitely recommend. Next time we're in SLC we'll look forward to eating there.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We went here for our anniversary and I am so glad we did. The food is fantastic. We had the bacon jam, Mac and cheese, chicken thighs, and the bread pudding was amazing. Service was great, drinks were tasty, and Margo (the GM) was so friendly and inviting. I definitely recommend this place and bring some friends so you can have smaller portions of more things.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: The staff was extremely friendly! The food was great. I had the burger and was extremely surprised by the flavors. The chef was trained in Vegas. The berry cobbler was also really good. I'll be going back for sure!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: The food was delicious and Val was exceptional. She made an Old Fashioned just the way I like it. The pork tenderloin was amazing as well as the deviled eggs. Definitely will be back.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: We ordered the chicken skins, oxtail risotto and veal meatballs and everything was very tasty. Our favorite was the chicken skins. Portions are more tapas style than family but we really enjoyed our meal. I had the sangria which I'll skip next time because it hardly had any alcohol but definitely can't wait to go back! Perfect for a date or group. Staff was very friendly. Highly recommend.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Also one of my favorite Vegas restaurants, if you read my previous review, you know how much I love the Turkey Burger, but on this visit I enjoyed the beets and goat cheese, watermelon salad, oh my goodness the Meatballs are just as perfect as the Turkey Burger. I just can't find anything I don't like here! Good job and congratulations on growing to other cities. Love the Vibe! Hope I get to travel to Georgia soon and eat there too. I'll just follow Carson Kitchen around the globe, bucket lists.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: I stumbled upon Carson Kitchen while looking for places to eat in Vegas. Was pleasantly surprised to see they have a location in downtown SLC. I promptly booked a table for a Tuesday evening. Located near the Salt Palace, I'm sure they'll get plenty of traffic when conventions are in full swing. The dining room is spacious with tables, banquettes, and kitchen counter dining. We chose the counter and received a great show. Our chef was informative and entertaining. Very professional. We chose the deviled eggs and the bacon jam, then moved on to mac&cheese and a pork tenderloin with a peach chutney and apple butter mustard. Dessert was a bourbon brownie with brown butter bacon ice cream. No regrets. Highly recommended!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Fantastic!! the food is amazing! Can't wait to go back!! The Turkey Burger was delicious ..can't wait to try the bison burger next time!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: New place that opened up in my neighborhood. Super friendly and attentive staff. The cocktails have been delicious every time.
