My girlfriend and I went in for dinner and then came back for lunch the next day. The food is really great, highly recommend the watermelon & feta salad, Mac & cheese and the beets. Can't wait to go back to try their pizza. We are so glad to have this new spot to enjoy!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Fantastic meal, great service and ambience. I also found out that they've only been open for a little over a week. Fantastic job on training the staff. Everyone was friendly but professional. I ordered the tempura green beans, young beet salad and the back rice and oxtail risotto. The dishes come out when ready so everything was the correct temperature. The tempura green beans were delicious; light batter, crunchy and not overly salted. The beets were the perfect blend of earthiness and sweetness and the black rice and oxtail risotto was beyond anything I've had before.

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Incredibly friendly staff from the manager, English, to our super spunky amazingly attentive waitress, Alex! We wanted to go to Nacho Daddy and ended up at Carson Kitchen as the best accident we could have made! Would recommend the killer shrimp, chili cauliflower, flatbreads, and the doughnut bread pudding!

name: Carson Kitchen
content: Great place, great staff and food and vibe. Recommended from a trusted friend and did not disappoint.

name: Purgatory
content: "It'll just be a few minutes" means they haven't actually put your order in at all and you'll be waiting 15-20 minutes, minimum. Just keep that in mind if you make the mistake of trying to get food from here.Only reason they get 2 stars instead of 1 is because they have tasty vegan burgers.Their service is terrible. They mess up our orders EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. Calling to fix the issue for some reason requires a complete explanation of the entire situation to a minimum of 2 people. When we come to pick up the replacement of the messed up orders the food isn't ready when they say it will be (an hour after calling). Still have to wait another 120 minutes standing in the doorway. The staff doesn't seem to care that they're completely incompetent, and seem pretty "meh" about everything in general.This is my last time ordering here. The burgers aren't nearly good enough to put up with the annoyances.

name: Purgatory
content: That BLT disappeared faster than David Copperfield on a good day. The Old Timer was ordered by my partner which they expressed their satisfaction. Sunday brunch was enjoyed by all with a $16 bottle of champagne and a splash of orange juice (made our own mimosas) outside on the patio. And don't get me started (I'll most likely finish mine and yours!) on the home fries. Whoa!!

name: Purgatory
content: Ive been to Purgatory a couple of times for dinner and brunch and it's great place to grab drinks and food with friends. The Bloody Mary is the perfect drink for brunch and the Paloma is an amazing drink at dinner! My favorite food I've tried is the Buffalo Cauli Bowl - you can't go wrong with this item.

name: Purgatory
content: We came for an early dinner on a Thursday and there were plenty of options to sit indoor and outdoor. We sat indoor but still got some of the nice breeze as they their walls open to outside.For appetizers we ordered the croquettes and thought they were good, but the only flavor came from the katsu sauce which is pretty strong by itself. We also ordered the pork belly baos. The pork belly had great flavor and was super tender, but was cold. We'd order these again though.For our main entrees we ordered the purgs burger with fries. The bun wasn't soggy and the fries were hot and crunchy. The katsu chicken sando was delicious! The breading isn't too heavy and the slaw on the side added a lot of freshness.The service from all the staff from the host, to our server, and to the bussers, everyone was so friendly and professional.

name: Purgatory
content: I've had a couple of takeaways from here in the past few weeks, I really enjoy what I had and I keep going back to it.This place is now in my top choice of takeouts, I've always thought their offerings are quite funky, original, with very unusual flavor profiles, compared to what else we have locally.I still love the pork belly buns, with a beautifully fresh and accordion-like dough and hoisin sauce. The Spam sushi [for the time being I just can't remember the name] is very interesting too, and has a nice spicy cake.Competition is hotting up in Salt Lake City for the best chicken sandwich. Pretty bird is doing a pretty good job, and I saw just recently that it has a new location on 21st south. However, the offering here gives everything I've tried a run for it's money. The chicken is moist, Crunchy, and fresh. The brioche bun I think is Hawaiian in style and is very good too, as are the sauces and relish is that make up this delicious bite. I think it is with their sauces in which this kitchen really excels, they really find away to elevate their food by matching it with the right flavor of liquid that goes over it, be it for flavor or decoration. I have to give kudos to the steak and cheese sandwich as well. I have trades a dish with fries and the same meat, which is clearly used in a few of the dishes, thin strands of very tender beef. The sandwich was a knockout, must try it again, only good memories of it too.I think I'll be going back Here on my phone for my next meal brought to my house...

name: Purgatory
content: Interesting music, attentive waitresses but kind of dark any lonely in our bubble. Kind of far from everything but worth the trip.

name: Purgatory
content: Superrrrr delicious, great prices on drinks, sometimes the waiters take a while to get back to you. Other times they're really attentive, but can be a little hit or miss.

name: Purgatory
content: Good food, good beer and good patio. They have a couple greenhouse bubbles outside that are first come first serve but now that it's warming up they are probably opening up more seating. I really like the Eastern burger and the K pop fries

name: Purgatory
content: This review is for take out. During COVID we never indoor dined anywhere but this place did look super fun. I'll start by saying the food was really rich, saucy and delicious. I had the vegetarian burger, and my partner had the short rib grilled cheese. So I hate to say it, but getting the food was an awful experience. I called in the order and arrived at the estimated time. My food was ready and bagged. The host had some trouble swiping my credit card so instead took a few guests to seat them. Then he went to try it on a different machine. They a manager came by to say their system was down and it would be a bit of a wait. My food was in a bag, about a foot in front of me. And it had been about 15 minutes after arriving. The host and manager disappeared for a while longer, with my credit card, but did offer me a seat (no, I'm getting take out during a pandemic for a reason). When the host finally came back I asked if I could pay cash and leave, he said, "I guess?". I paid him, and left a tip despite it all. Overall I spent 20 minutes indoors, in a crowded space (hence why it looked fun), while our food got cold in a box.

name: Purgatory
content: This restaurant had a fun environment with great music and a cool crowd. The food was just below average, but it didn't feel overpriced which made it ok. Overall a solid 4 out of 5.

name: Purgatory
content: K Pop fries were to die for! I definitely plan on coming back. Did to-go, but the atmosphere inside looked chill.

name: Purgatory
content: Even with Covid Precautions in place the service, atmosphere, and food is awesome. The curry is out of this world! Cheese fries are awesome! And the selection of drinks is great. Something for everyone!

name: Purgatory
content: My travels have taken me to Salt Lake City!  Purgatory is a bar with food that was recommended and highly touted.  They promptly seated us and pointed out the virtual menu.Their menu is very well sized.  Tons of brews, wines, and liquor options!  Tons of unique food items on the menu.  I went with the chicken katsu rice.  It was delicious.  The sauce was very very good with a little kick.  Tastes of cilantro burst in the katsu sauce.  The rice was light and fluffy.  Pickled onions are also included. I highly recommended the dish.  The portion size was was just right for the size.  One other person got the cheesy corn. They loved it!  It's loaded with cheese and cooked lightly brown.  For a main dish, they got the buffalo cauliflower.  She claims the Buffalo sauce was very tasty and would fall under the mild side for spice levels.  The 3rd person got the chicken katsu-don.  The flavor was very tasty but it was soggy.  From our experiences, this should have been much crispier and they did not finish the dish.  Overall, I would highly recommend Purgatory.  The food was very tasty.  The menu has many Japanese and Asian influences like katsu burgers, etc.  I will be back!  I recommend giving Purgatory a try.

name: Purgatory
content: fabulous food, fun and upscale ambience, friendly service, fair prices! will return without a doubt

name: Purgatory
content: hey! please make sure the orders are right, even for door dash. i ordered a vegan burger and was given a beef burger instead... thanks for offering vegan options though.

name: Purgatory
content: We just happened to pick Purgatory as it was highly recommended on Yelp. We agree! Both our meals were very flavorful, the drinks were made well. Our server was helpful, and the food was timely. Most importantly (saying it again), the food was flavorful, and the taste was excellent. I would recommend this place and would come back.

name: Purgatory
content: The food in this place was really good. I don't live in this city but next time I'm in town I'm definitely coming back.

name: Purgatory
content: Atmosphere a but dark and unwelcoming won't lie but the customer service was good and the food was fantastic not to mention the beers.  It's definitely not the typical scene one expects when being in Utah and definitely worth the visit for the night scene.

name: Purgatory
content: I have officially found my favorite brunch place! Our server, Nik, was incredibly attentive, charming and made our experience at purgatory so fun! I definitely recommend the full bottle of champagne, like he did, so you can enjoy several of their mimosas paired with their delicious brunch specialties! The chicken toast and cinnamon toast were delicious. I also recommend requesting to sit in their outside "igloos" for the perfect Sunday brunch atmosphere. I will be coming again and recommending to all my friends, but only with Nik as my server!

name: Purgatory
content: Such a wonderful wonderful place we have been there two times now and the food is just delicious. And the craft cocktails are very good to

name: Purgatory
content: Top 3 favorite places in Salt Lake! The food, the service and the atmosphere are always top tier

name: Purgatory
content: The drinks were very good and super well priced the only reason I'm reviewing it with three stars is the food was just okay. The udon was good just a little salty and the beef bowl was lacking a little spice. This is a great place for drinks though would give it 5 stars for that just not the food. The Rosemary Parmesan fries were good though

name: Purgatory
content: This is one of my favorite bars in SLC. The atmosphere is lively and fun, especially in the summertime. There are twinkly lights and a little fire outside that I just LOVE. They also have you use their QR code for the menu and pay which is pretty neat. Highly recommend!

name: Purgatory
content: I last went to Purgatory pre COVID so I can't say much on the existing condition of the place but I'm sure they are following guidelines and doing their best.Glad they're still open and hope they will continue to be and continue to thrive during this difficult time for so many business owners.The last tome I did go I got a delicious hot alcoholic beverage and some gluten free vegan bites my husband and I shared as a late night date spot for a snack in the city.

name: Purgatory
content: Was looking for a nice place to grab brunch and a mimosa. When we walked in the hostess spoke to us like we were idiots for not making a reservation. She told us in the most snot nosed manner that a table wouldn't be available until 3:00pm. Granted, this was just 2 people walking in at 11am looking at a 4 hour wait!!!! I understand there is a pandemic going on, but seriously. You could at least hire a polite staff. Even if the food was mouth watering spectacular (which, it's not really all that great) I'm never returning to such and establishment with such rude service. From what I got at the front door, I'm sure the rest of the staff can't be that much better.

name: Purgatory
content: to be honest, we had other options on the list ahead of Purgatory, but since it was president's day and Valentine's day weekend, every place was like 2 hours wait and we didnt want to wait because we were starving after a full day on the mountain.a friend of mine who stayed in SLC dropped in at this place and put down our names first because we lived about 20 mins away from SLCDT. was quoted 45 mins. but they texted in 30 mins saying table was ready, we were not expecting the table to be ready that fast. called them saying that wont make it until another 30 mins. asked whether its ok to skip a table and we will just take the next available one. they said its okay. when we got there, there was an empty table outdoor under the igloo. so yeah we took that one.we went to Copper Onion the day before and over ordered because we were not used to SLC portion. this time we thought we would learn from our mistake but we did not. they had 7 smalls on the menu, we ordered 6 of them LOL. we were surprised that the "smalls" were HUGE.  FML. those 5 were- croquettes - it was okay.- cheese corn - no bueno, i have had so many cheese corn, and this was probably the worst.- musubi - regular musubi topped with mentai sauce. who doesnt like mentai?- pork belly bao - pork belly was juicy but nothing special, very typical.- winter bowl - this was a risotto dish but it was that traditional risotto. it was very uniqie but VERY DELICIOUS. i would order this any day for myself.- cauliflower - not too bad.and then each one of us ordered our own entrees. i got the pan fried udon which i personally think i have made a better udon myself before. LOLwe also ordered two fries, K-POP and Curry fries. but it seems that they may have forgotten this because halfway throughout out entrees, they havent come out yet. so we were hoping that they had forgotten about it, but the server told us that the fries are coming but we could cancel if we wanted to. so yes we did cancel.our server was great 90% of the time, the other 10% was him being a pushy salesperson trying to sell us the special dessert that they had that evening. LOL. but it was cool. i find him funny. no complaint whatsoever. oh and i asked him to surprise me with a bourbon/scotch drink, i wanted it strong and bold, and he delivered. he said its a house specialty drink, kind of in between of old fashioned and manhattan. the igloo was super cute, i dont think i have ever dined in that kind of environment. heater was provided so it was warm. but the downside is that the porch that we step on/sit on were puddled with water because it was raining all day. i mean 1/4 inch of our soles were submerged pretty much our entire dinner time. it was pretty annoying.eventhough the food were not all 5 star, and i personally would have given them a 4-star review but i really enjoyed the dinner experience here. under an igloo, surprised me with a good bourbon drink, allowing us to cancel the 2 fries knowing that we over ordered, didnt need to wait for hours to eat. these stuff add up another star.will i be back? i think so if i will ever be in town again.

name: Purgatory
content: Although we had a bit of a wait time, it was well worth it. The drinks are a nice price with awesome flavor. Spiked tea was my personal fav. Couldn't even taste the alcohol but it still got the job done. I had a try of their Moscow mule but it was a bit overpowering with the ginger. We stayed for about 2 hours and it was nice. They only started playing good music around midnight. They also have these igloos outside for people to sit in for 90 minutes at a time. They are sanitized after each use. Loved it here, I would go here again.

name: Purgatory
content: This place is awesome! Great staff and food! Cool spot! Definitely coming back next time I visit slc.

name: Purgatory
content: While visiting Utah for a ski trip, my friends and I decided to check out this place because of the yummy drink selection and eclectic menu options! We definitely weren't disappointed! We decided to sit outside in one of the offered heated igloos, which I found to be a cool concept during these crazy times. However, halfway through the experience, our entry zipper got broken and rather than fixing it or moving us to another igloo, it was just left open - making the igloo quite chilly after a while. For the dishes, we ordered the brisket fried rice, short rib grilled cheese, both the chicken sandwich options, and the Panko fried burger. The fried rice was the perfectly complimented combination of exquisite flavors in your mouth! Definitely cleaned the plate on this dish. The short rib grilled cheese was also phenomenal - just the right amount of extra gooey cheese to short rib ratio. Also the fries and special fry sauce were an amazing side piece. Not sure what the secret was, but everyone raved about them! The panko fried burger was a little underwhelming, maybe I wasn't expecting a burger to be that thin and crispy, but it didn't live up to the perfection of the other dishes. My friends also enjoyed their chicken sandwiches, so we decided to try the pork belly bao since the waitress raved about them. These were not my favorite either, as the pork belly was very chewy and mildly warm when served. To be fair, we were being gluttonous when ordering these, so my expectations could've been exceedingly high. But overall, I enjoyed my experience at Purgatory and the food/drink options were such a variety and well-executed that I'd recommend to anyone heading to Salt Lake!

name: Purgatory
content: Food good to excellent.  Prices are low so good value.  Service so so - slow and not too informed.  Suggest avoiding bar to eat as it appeared the bar back was our waiter.

name: Purgatory
content: Oh man! The patty melt is pure fire! I'm not sure if it's the talent of the guy in the kitchen or wizard magic, but it was one of the best burgers I've had in SLC.

name: Purgatory
content: The Toast Malone was a serious treat for breakfast. Would certainly eat that again. A bar and restaurant so hip that it might actually be cool.

name: Purgatory
content: Maybe it's because I haven't dined out much the last 10 or so months, but our meal at Purgatory was memorably creative and delicious, with every unique dish delivering big on flavor. The group couldn't decide on what we wanted to eat, so the New American/Pan Asian menu at Purgatory seemed like a good catch-all option. We put down our names and waited about 20 minutes (I imagine this place was packed during pre-COVID times), then were quickly seated. One of the first things we noticed was that the drinks were super well-priced at ~$8, and really well-thought out. I had a smoky, strong pineapple drink that I loved, and other members of my party got a grapefruit drink that they enjoyed. After looking over the menu, which had a lot of options I'd never seen elsewhere, I had the chicken toast, which was moist and flavorful and served with a hint of maple syrup and savory homemade gravy. I also got to try a bite of the brekkie bowl - a really satisfying brunch riff on fried rice.Service was friendly and prompt, and the contactless menu QR code was easy to use. I'd definitely love to return in warmer months and enjoy more drinks and bites on their outdoor patio!

name: Purgatory
content: My wife and I have been here three times in six months, and we'll keep doing so if they continue to have such great food! The burgers are fantastic, the appetizers unique and flavorful, the setting is fun and the service is top notch.

name: Purgatory
content: A coworker that lives here recommended this while I here for work trip. OUTSTANDING! Super cool urban contemporary vibe. Dimly lit. Great service. I was loving my meal and wine.

name: Purgatory
content: Decadent appetizers and top three burger in town.  And the staff is easy on the eyes.  Not a bar guy but don't let that get in the way.

name: Purgatory
content: Highly recommend making this a stop in downtown SLC! Great staff, food, and atmosphere! We were there for Saturday brunch and ordered the Chicken Toast and Breaky Bowl. Both entrees were filled with flavor!! This a must try. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.

name: Purgatory
content: This place is amazing! Seriously one of the best bloody marys I've ever had. I love the Asian fusion style of most of their dishes. Every person in our party loved their dish and the portions are generous.

name: Purgatory
content: Visited during brunch. It wasn't super busy, so we didn't have to wait for a table. We ended up going with the toast malone, the chicken katsu sando, and a bottle of champagne for mimosa's. I've always liked the food at this establishment, this visit was no different. The food is a bit rich, but not unexpected for bar food. What sets Purgatory apart is the Japanese fusion with some of their dishes. I'm really not a fusion restaurant person, but this place is great! Definitely visit for brunch, you will not be disappointed!

name: Purgatory
content: We found this place by accident while searching for a safe dine in place. This is a cool hang out place near the downtown area. The food and the ambience are really good. The service was quick and the tables were socially distanced. The spiked hot chocolate was amazing! We ordered the Katsu don and the chicken Katsu sando both were delicious. This is a must try place if you're visiting the city!

name: Purgatory
content: I thought I was well versed in Utah brunch spots but somehow I havent had Purgatory until now. They were fantastic! The Toast Malone is crazy good! Each bite was perfectly savory, salty and the home made gravy is SO flavorful. I love a good bloody mary and they definitely do those right as well.I love the shooter options. We had a few of the margarita ones! 10/10 go to Purgatory for brunch

name: Purgatory
content: The people working here were so nice! Our server was so knowledgeable, and I appreciated that he knew so much about the ingredients in everything, including how certain alcohols are made and where they are from. I learned so much about mezcal and my drink before ordering it. I always appreciate the art they display on the walls, which is from local SLC artists. I also love the cornhole pit in the back and have had a lot of fun tossing bean bags with friends while sharing some drinks.I was disappointed by how small their drink menu seems currently compared to when I went back in February, and they are not offering my favorite drink anymore (the "Good Morning Vietnam"). I hope they expand their menu and begin to make more of their flavored simple syrups, otherwise I may wait to go back. I love their food. The K-Pop fries are to die for, and the Buffalo Cauliflower bowl is a breath of fresh air. It's always so nice when bars offer healthier food, and for that food to be delicious!Parking was easy, but I went at 5pm on a Wednesday. I was a little worried about my car getting broken into, just because the level of homelessness in the area seems high the further from State St. you walk or park.

name: Purgatory
content: Great drinks, even better food.I dropped in here for a quick early dinner, and really enjoyed the experience.  The drinks were pretty solid - all had a great and not overwhelming flavor profile - but the food was really what was memorable.  Many dishes have this unique Asian inspiration that I quite enjoyed, particularly since it elevated them beyond the usual American pub fare that's common in other bar/restaurants like this.Needless to say, if you want a drink and a delicious bite, I'd highly recommend Purgatory.

name: Purgatory
content: We came from out of town and relied on Yelp reviews. Glad we were able to make it in. Even with covid there was limited seating on a Thursday night. Drinks are priced on the low side and actually a great deal. We opted for the Bloody Mary shot and a bottle of wine. We split the brisket grilled cheese and it was bomb. Talked about it all weekend and now I need to find a place in Texas that has something similar.Wish we could have stayed longer but they closed at 10pm. Stayed long enough to get the vibe and I would recommend this place for sure.

name: Purgatory
content: Purgatory is hello good yo! Went for my sisters 21st birthday and they were oh so delicious. I'm a sucker for fusion type food and their fries were insane. I also got the hot chicken sando and it blasted my taste buds straight to nirvana

name: Purgatory
content: I feel mixed about Purgatory at times. Their drinks? Delicious and the menu is pretty dang big. Their food is also quite tasty. I've had brunch there a couple of times and it is definitely a good cure for when you've imbibed a bit too much the night before, but also for just a good lunch or dinner as well. The biggest issue I have with this spot is actually the service. I feel like every time I've gone, we've been forgotten at our table, drinks take a long time to arrive, and one time they were just not that nice. People have bad days, I get it, but it's been consistently lackluster. That said, I will ignore any service issues because I genuinely enjoy coming here. The space is great, and it is a favorite spot to visit in the summer time since they have the outdoor patio with the doors that open up.Overall, Purgatory is a fun place to visit with good drinks and eats - if my experiences with services would have been better, it would have gotten 5 stars.

name: Purgatory
content: Got overcharged by restaurant and after 4 calls I still have not gotten my refund. Service was so slow and took over 2 hours. The waitress kept cussing at us.

name: Purgatory
content: This place is amazing.  Decided to check this place out as I flew into SLC to visit a family member.  Great menu, good vibes and awesome service.  You won't be disappointed.

name: Purgatory
content: Really good food and a nice atmosphere. It was busy but was able to get a seat at the bar inside. Staff was nice but busy end felt a little rushed. The bartenders were great and helpful.

name: Purgatory
content: I never thought I'd say this but, too much cheese! I got the cauliflower Buffalo wrap, corn, and cheese fries. The wrap just tasted like burnt tortillas. It also had way too much cheddar cheese and then blue cheese as well. There was hardly any corn under the thickest layer of cheese. Our waitress also disappeared or her shift was over and never said anything.

name: Purgatory
content: This bar is decent. We went on a Friday and had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated. Not including the 20 minutes to find parking. And after the wait, they sat us in the back on this wobbling small round table. The appetizers were delicious but the entrees were not all that great. The drinks were pretty good and the service was nothing special.

name: Purgatory
content: Super chill bar with great outdoor seating. Even with limited capacity, the bar had plenty of tables open. This food was out of this world!! Loved the Japanese curry entree. Would totally come back! Staff followed safety protocols and were very attentive.

name: Purgatory
content: Wait was an hour for bigger groups but luckily my husband and I got right in and were able to sit at a table outside by the fire. We ended up deciding to switch tables once our food came, no problem. Drinks and food were unique and flavorful! Great experience and atmosphere!

name: Purgatory
content: Ambiance was really nice. The host seemed enthusiastic. We had to find somebody to clean a table for us. The dishes were removed but I was a little surprised it wasn't wiped down especially during COVID. I'm not sure if she forgot. I ordered the Summer bowl and it was supper yummy. Very green. I also ordered a margarita on the rocks with salt and it was great as well. I love that it didn't have too much of a bitter taste. We also ordered the buffalo fries. The sauce tasted more on the sweet side. I would come back for the ambiance and to give other things a try. The only reason this place got 3 stars was because I questioned the cleanliness and service.

name: Purgatory
content: You come here for the drinks and the patio, with the food being so-so. They have $4 shots and pretty cheap cocktails, too! Pretty good vegetarian menu, love seeing places that have options besides soup/salad.

name: Purgatory
content: Perhaps don't understaff your bar on a Saturday afternoon and leave your poor wait staff to deal with the fallout. We waited ten minutes for a table to be cleared so we could sit down. We waited ten more minutes for a server to talk to us. We ordered a beer and a shot. We waited twenty five minutes for those things and they never arrived. We eventually gave up and went somewhere else. The menu looked interesting - my boyfriend particularly likes the burrito - and they have a lot of decent beers on draft. However, waiting 30+ minutes to receive drinks is unacceptable. Again, this wasn't the fault of the staff. Everyone we encountered was nice, albeit stressed. This was the fault of the management. I have no intentions of coming back here for a long, long time.

name: Purgatory
content: This place has a super cool ambiance. I had the burger and fries which was pretty basic but I know that's not what they were really known for. Would go back to try something else

name: Purgatory
content: Loved this place. A full bar, packed with finest spirits, a respectable cocktail menu, backed by friendly and talented bartenders.  I stumbled upon this local gem and loved it immediately. Great ambiance, a outside patio with fire outside, and bestest/hardest working bartenders and waitress anywhere. This place is no accident and here to stay. Thank you.

name: Purgatory
content: Been here for dinner and brunch. The drink menu is good and they're good about sanitizing and social distancing/masks. Really loved the brunch menu and will be back again. The drinks and food menus are creative and tasty. Definitely stop in if you're looking for a good atmosphere!

name: Purgatory
content: I can't even rate the food because with an hour left before closing they wouldn't serve us.  Got turned away at the door .  Told they are not letting anyone else in meanwhile there are about 10 people inside.  So fine we leave and 2 girls come walking in and they let them in.  The host saw us standing outside so she came to let us know her supervisor said we could come in too!!! What ?? You don't need money right now ? We didn't go in.  Don't need to try this place that bad ...

name: Purgatory
content: I love how every time I go, there isn't a wait to get a table. The food is delish and they have plenty of drink options. Highly recommend any of the loaded fries as I haven't ever been disappointed in them.

name: Purgatory
content: SO SALTY. My friend and I got the gyu dons, and I got the cheese corn. Both were so salty that I only ate barely half of it before I choke myself in sodium. When I mentioned it to the waitress, she simply said she will let the kitchen know. First impressiom of SLC, the salt doesn't cost money. However, the drink is very nice. I got tall dark n handsome. Highly recommend the drinks.

name: Purgatory
content: We're hesitant eating at indoor restaurants due to COVID, so their outdoor patio was perfect (spacing, murals, lighting, fire). Our server Russell was friendly and attentive. Ordered a few beers and started with the musubi which was a little heavy on the spicy mayo but delicious. Then I ordered the Gyu-don, which my gf ate about half of, . Overall great atmosphere and will hit up when we are back in town!

name: Purgatory
content: I think Purgatory is a sleeper food spot. I have been for dinner (+ drinks) a few times, but was really excited to try it for brunch, especially given the great vegan options. I went with the Veeg's burrito, which was really excellent, but found myself drooling over my friend's summer bowl. I recommend finding a good friend whose willing to split both.As you can tell from the egg in the coma bowl, they have plenty of non-plant based options as well, so it's a great choice for everyone. We got the vegan fries to try out. They were surprisingly addictive and I found myself unable to stop eating them!

name: Purgatory
content: Amazing food, drinks, and vibes. Got the Smoky Loma & chicken katsu, so good! Lots of seating on the patio and not too crowded on a week night.

name: Purgatory
content: The food here was delicious. I love Asian Fusion food and Purgatory's menu was great. I was just visiting from out of town, but wish I was able to eat there again. They were organized and prepared for Covid measures as well.

name: Purgatory
content: The food is great the drinks are okay, their absinthe is terrible and not well mixed, the server Amantha stood and watched me making me uncomfortable to the point where i chugged and absinthe and felt nauseous and dizzy for the rest of dinner and most of the night, because i wanted another drink and instead of putting it back on the bar and bringing it back 5 minutes later she stood and watched me finish my first one (last call is at 11:30 by the way for drinks even though the kitchen is open until midnight?!?). Tables are unsanitized and the server took a while to even get the used napkins off ours. I had a great experience here pre-covid but it's not worth it anymore.

name: Purgatory
content: The atmosphere was top notch. I love the industrial style mixed with a relaxed but classy environment. The service was also very good. The food was good but didn't "wow" me. I tried the buffalo fries, spicy chicken sandwich, and the brisket grilled cheese. All were decent meals but none would give me a craving for more. The spicy chicken sandwich was a katsu styled chicken which I did appreciate.

name: Purgatory
content: We came on a Wednesday around noon! The bartender was super nice and same with the guy that checked us in. They were very attentive and made sure we had great experience. The food was absolutely delicious, and the guy bartender with the long curly hair made the best bloody Mary we have tasted. If you eat here I would recommend the purg burg. It was so good. They also have some of the best fries I have tasted. Great music and fun atmosphere. We will definitely be coming back

name: Purgatory
content: So food was rocking, drinks delicious!!!  Barstaff on top of it, Kendra not so much.We would have been happy to stay longer, but she rushed us out, kept asking if we were finished... and two of our drinks were even taken away prior to us being done with them.

name: Purgatory
content: Honestly one of my favorite places to eat in Salt Lake. Everything I've ordered tastes great for a good price and their patio is so cute!

name: Purgatory
content: Can't go wrong with a name like Purgatory... In light of covid, we took advantage of their large patio. And what a wonderful patio it is. Murals on several walls, statues, variety of seating option, lots of plants, fireplace, strung up lights, shade banners... I really don't know what more a person could ask for. I had a little glimpse of the inside and it looks equally funky yet inviting. We visited for brunch, which was simply outstanding. If you want something out of the ordinary to get your day started, then this is the spot for you. Very innovative menu items as well as more traditional options should be able to satisfy any appetite. The portions are large and the prices reasonable. Service is about average. I enjoyed a cherry mimosa, which was my first. I've had a lot of other flavors, but never a cherry ... until now. I also devoured about half of a Baby Arm Burrito... that's all I could eat. I don't know what kind of babies they have around here, but it's got to be giants. That burrito was thicker thn my arm and I am fully grown. The taste was spot on. My guests enjoyed French toast and the Coma bowl. Both were deemed delicious. One thing is for sure, if I'm ever in SLC again, I will make it a point to stop by here for another round or two of brunch.

name: Purgatory
content: Incredible food, drinks, and service! Great outdoor ambience + lighting -- felt very comfortable here even during covid times!

name: Purgatory
content: I really liked the purgatory. Yes service might be a little slow but it's understandable because of short staff. Prides are very good. I sat at the bar and bartenders were really nice.

name: Purgatory
content: Can't speak to their cocktails, but their hours are off. They say that they are open till 12, but they won't allow you to get a drink after 11:20. Probably a fine place but don't say you are open till 12.

name: Purgatory
content: Great food and service. Highly recommend. Attentive staff.  No surprises.  Would eat there again and again.  You won't be disappointed.

name: Purgatory
content: So disappointed in our meal here. My husband and I shared the bao, corn, and the Katsu-don. The Katsu-don really tasted as if it had been microwaved, and the only dish we enjoyed was the corn appetizer. I'm not one to frequently write negative reviews, but both of us feel sick and were unable to finish our food.

name: Purgatory
content: This place was not it. I received a VERY uncomfortable vibe from both the working staff and the other patrons around me. Food was good, not great. Honestly would not go here again just because of how uncomfortable it made me.

name: Purgatory
content: Cool place, good food with nice patio. We've been here twice and the service is poor. We entered and they said they were slammed and it would be a little while. Understandable except that they waited on everyone around us. We watched tables around us get two rounds and food and we were never approached by a server. We left and nobody even noticed us leaving. ‍

name: Purgatory
content: First time here and went for something safe.  Hamburger.  It was excellent.  Server was perfect.  He came from behind the bar and was very attentive.  Decor is clean and cool. Excellent vibe. Definitely going back.

name: Purgatory
content: Came for brunch. I've been here at night and it was pretty poppin, but the late morning vibes are immaculate as well. I joined my party a bit late and ordered maybe 5 or 6 minutes after them, but my food came out 15 or 20 minutes after theirs, hence the removal of 1 star. The breakfast sando was a good. Love the pillow-soft buns. Will probably be back for brunch again.

name: Purgatory
content: Food was great, the staff was really nice, informative when it came to the operational guidelines, and were always on the watch for how things were going. A+++++

name: Purgatory
content: Good food and service. Funky vibe!The avocado toast was as good as I've ever had. So flavorful and everything went well together. Not you basic smashed up avocado on toast. This dish is thought out and extremely tasty.I had the Loco Moco for my entree and it was good. I'm thinking they should consider on a bed of grits rather than white rice. Just a thought. The cheese fries were very good. My wife's tofu burrito was good but...it was tofu!The service was very good. Russell was nice, attentive and on the ball. It's an eclectic menu and I liked that. Wish they served the katsu-Don on the brunch menu. Smiley face!

name: Purgatory
content: They've got a great beer selection and the Buffalo cauliflower bowl is amazing. Pairs well with an IPA.

name: Purgatory
content: This place is unbelievably good. Five star food coming out of an amazing bar and restaurant. The outdoor seating was great during COVID-19 and the staff was extremely safe. We were in Salt Lake for three says

name: Purgatory
content: This menu is amazing. Clearly a lot of intentionality/creativity/effort put into it. And they deliver. Haven't been disappointed by a single food item or drink my friends or I have ever ordered. I'll need to take some pictures next time, but it's as good as it looks.

name: Purgatory
content: Great funky bar and grill. Excellent food and great atmosphere for lunch! Try the grilled cheese with brisket! Fantastic!

name: Purgatory
content: We were charged for 2 plates that no one in our party ordered. I called right when we discovered their mistake about 30 minutes after we had left last Saturday 7/18 and I was told that the items had been refunded. As of today 7/24 I have not been refunded for the items that we did not order. Although the food and service were decent I wouldn't recommend this please unless you want to potentially end up paying for things you never ordered.

name: Purgatory
content: It was our last night in SLC and we had been recommended to go to Lucky 13 for a burger, but we were warned that we should get a reservation because they always have a long line to get in; so made a res for 4:30 which they confirmed with an email. Arrived at 4:20 only to be told that they closed the restaurant until 5pm for cleaning! I get it & applaud their diligence but it would have been nice to have been told that our res could only be made for 5pm. The gentlemen who told us this did not bother to tell us that we were standing at the back door & we noticed the line forming at the front door (in the blazing sun). I am relaying this story because sometimes happenstance works out so well! We got disgusted with the whole ordeal & decided to jump in the car & go somewhere else close by. We happened upon Purgatory & the reviews looked wonderful, so in we went! We were greeted by friendly people & being somewhat early, the place was not too busy. We got to pick a table & were pleasantly surprised to have a server almost immediately! She brought us a couple of wonderful tap beers & we were directed to look at their menu online, which was no problem. To my great surprise & joy, there were lots of choices of very interesting sounding foods & I selected the Gyu-don, which was a fabulous bowl of braised brisket/pickled ginger/a fried egg over rice! It was so tasty! And hubby had a brisket grilled cheese that he loved. The whole experience was wonderful, even with the very drunk man who had to be escorted out (provided entertainment!).

name: Purgatory
content: Really hip vibes, fantastic service, cool art, awesome music, and the best Paloma of my life (for real). Who knew purgatory would be so enjoyable?

name: Purgatory
content: Had the Katsu sandwich and it was amazing. Vibe of this place is super dope, it's a great place to sit and chill. People are also really friendly

name: Purgatory
content: Visiting from California. Disappointed that most of the places we've eaten in Utah have been subpar and extremely mediocre. Purgatory was a bright spot for us. The staff was extremely friendly and were very cautious when it came to the health regulations. The food was fantastic. My girlfriend and I eat musubi and bao all the time and we were extremely impressed with both items! We also ordered the udon noodles and those were great as well! The hibiscus mule was delicious and I ordered many of them! Fun place, great atmosphere. I can see why it was packed. Will come back the next time I'm in town!

name: Purgatory
content: This place was just a little better than ok . The food was good but not great. The staff was ok but a little on the slow side . There were only 6 people in side and all was waiting on the food. But if you called it in you went to the front of the line. Try it it just my opinion you may like it .  It's worth the try .

name: Purgatory
content: I absolutely love purgatory! Their drinks are always amazing and reasonably priced. The food is delicious and great to share with big groups. Try their curry on anything!

name: Purgatory
content: Nope! Had dinner here last night - just not our vibe. Found this place to be extremely loud and frankly uncomfortable. We had the "Cheesy Corn", which was tasty but odd. Also shared the grilled brisket and cheese. This could have been good, but I think it sat for awhile before it was served as the bottom side of the sandwich was wet. The fries were good. Wouldn't bother with this joint unless you're young and looking for loud music. I found this listed on the Diners, Drive-In's & Dives site...but there was no indication at the restaurant that Guy F. had ever visited.

name: Purgatory
content: Stopped in recently on a road trip, very glad we did! Found from Triple D listing. Staff was very friendly and welcoming, great indoor/outdoor space. Staff were all wearing masks and they checked our temperature on arrival. The restaurant was very clean as well. We ordered the baby arm burrito, cheese corn, and breakfast tacos - all were very delicious!! They also have a great local beer selection and the bartender gave great suggestions. Will visit again next time in SLC.

name: Purgatory
content: Very friendly and attentive service...such a cool vibe!! Food and drinks were super delish.

name: Purgatory
content: This is my favorite bar in SLC. I can never get over how good the food is. Their drinks & food are unique  & delicious. The atmosphere is awesome on top of the staff being so friendly. 10/10

name: Purgatory
content: This place was really cool and tasted amazing!  Their burgers are just so good!  As I hope you can see in the picture!  I even fit it in my mouth without using a fork.  I would go back for sure.  I got the Eastern burger and it was everything I hoped for in a burger!

name: Purgatory
content: Good food and drinks, wife wasn't crazy about it but i liked it great for bar food

name: Varley
content: Food was delicious. We got here for early dinner on Sunday and felt like we had the place to ourselves. Drinks were kind of hit or miss. I liked the black sesame drink but the pink drink (I forgot the exact name) and their martini are very underwhelming. Would recommend friends to check out this place.

name: Varley
content: Went here for drinks last night, and ended up staying for food + more drinks cause we were so impressed. Everything from the quality service to the food/ drinks they serve *chefs kiss* so good

name: Varley
content: Horrible service and experience with staff. Had a reservation and waited over 40 minutes, was never seated or accommodated in any way.  Unfortunately, never waited long enough to get food or drinks but based on this experience will likely never go back.

name: Varley
content: The vibe is cool and the decor inside is minimal yet funky. DJ was spinning vinyls. Nothing special about the drinks that makes the bar stand out. They have their own special old fashioned but don't serve it with a whiskey ice cube which is a waste of a drink. We didn't have any of the food but it looked alright.

name: Varley
content: Great new spot!! Felt like a grown up/big city cocktail bar in little Salt Lake!! Was surprised that their selection of signature cocktails were so small and they had more wines than anything. Loved that they served food until midnight and our server, Cody was amazing! Very attentive and helpful! And the Dj was on fire with the music!

name: Varley
content: Walked over half a mile with a disabled guest. Only to find out they couldn't accommodate our reservation. What a joke.

name: Varley
content: We went there on a Sunday night, so the bar was pretty empty but the atmosphere was very good. We ordered the Gnocchi & mushrooms and several cocktails.I can understand why this place has such high ratings; the mushroom & gnocchi is absolutely divine! I have never tasted something so delicious and flavorful. This place deserves every star of my 5-star review. The staff here is very friendly and I'd definitely recommend this place if you're in the SLC area.

name: Varley
content: Amazing food+ drinks! Great atmosphere + ambiance. We went with a big group of us and we had to split up, which we didn't mind. Great new restaurant!

name: Varley
content: Love the atmosphere and the food menu was fantastic. The mussels and gnocchi were so delicious, wonderful flavor! The drink selection is a little disappointing and for the price I expected the drinks to be a little bigger. Would recommend for a drink or two and an app to start the evening.

name: Varley
content: I love going here! It's carries such a sophisticated look  and atmosphere without breaking the bank. The cocktails are unique and the selection is broad yet not overwhelming. Our bartender, GianCarlo was very tentative and knowledgeable of the menus. Almost enjoyed him more than my company!  Will definitely be going back because of him! Thanks GianCarlo.

name: Varley
content: 38 minutes to take our order as we were seated. Bartender and waitress are absolutely terrible. They both disappeared for around 10 minutes. When our order came out, I requested the check because we had a reservation somewhere else. The waitress then talked trash about us 10 feet away from us to the bartender saying "another couple having reservations somewhere else rushing out of here"Ignore this place at all costs. Can't imagine actually getting food here

name: Varley
content: Was visiting Salt Lake City for Valentine's weekend and had one of the best nights/experiences at this bar. Not only are the cocktails unique, but the food was delicious and the vibe is fun yet classy. I decided to try the verjus martini and I loved it! The drink was very well flavored and almost savory. If you need a food recommendation you have to get the mussels in the coconut curry. The curry sauce was so flavorful and the mussels were of good quality which I wasn't too sure about at first because we were in Utah. The service was excellent too!

name: Varley
content: We really enjoyed the food. We ordered the charcuterie board. Simple meats, but we really liked the blue cheese (very stinky). We purchased a few drinks along the way. Varley Old Fashion, very smooth with great bitters. The mojito and margareta were very sweet and my GF didn't love them. We finished with a portobello mushroom burger and the pork appetizer. They were amazing. The guacamole mousse added the extra flavor for the burger. The appetizer was a delicious and the cabbage added texture. I would slightly toast the bread so it doesn't have like a wet feel. I was really feeling the the live DJ creating a great ambiance of mashups. The seating along the wall is very creative and super comfy. Beautiful place for a date night or special occasion.Overall we would have enjoyed a little bit more of a cocktail bar, but will be back for the food.

name: Varley
content: My boyfriend and I came here for the first time for our anniversary. It is a beautifully done bar and I loved the ambience/lounge feel. We got the broccolini and chickpeas to start. The broccolini was amazing and highly recommend. My bf got the burger and enjoyed it. I am vegetarian and  got the gnocchi and with out the pork. The dish was delicious and so creamy, and still pretty much worth it for the full price without the meat.We ended the night with the cheesecake and oh my god, it was AMAZING. I was trying to hold off before eating it all, but I was too worried my boyfriend would eat it before I could.  We will be back, for sure. My only "complaint" was the lighting kept changing every 15 minutes or so. It would be perfect, then suddenly much darker, and the bright again. Like someone was hitting the switch. This only was annoying because your eyes had to adjust to such dramatic lighting.

name: Varley
content: Became a regular here. I love the music and atmosphere here. Great place to enjoy drinks, good music and good friends! Can't wait to try their sister restaurant!

name: Varley
content: Back again and I'm still very impressed. The service is great and the the drinks are stellar. We are looking forward to having dessert. This is a go to for drinks on the weekend. Such a nice hang out place.

name: Varley
content: I absolutely LOVED this place. The atmosphere and food were absolutely incredible. Can't wait to go back!!

name: Varley
content: I was excited to check out this new spot (formally BTG wine bar) and it did not disappoint! The ambience was perfect for our girls night out. I ordered the chorizo fried rice which was a little small but the flavor was on point and so delicious! The service was quick and friendly and although I didn't order a drink, my friends loved theirs (ask for the medicinal shot!).

name: Varley
content: My hell.....THE best Thai curry mussels I have ever had! The charturie board was amazing. The broccolini was to die for. The best beet hummus ever. Wish they had a better selection of specialty cocktails.

name: Varley
content: This place deserves every star of my 5-star review. The atmosphere, drinks, and food are all on point. I came here for the first time for a friends birthday, and we probably had 25+ in our group. The food was amazing, the service was great, and they did a great job catering to our party. I will for sure be taking a date here since the food was great and the ambiance is great for a solid date night. Please give this place a shot! It's brand new, and make a reservation. They're thriving through a covid opening!

name: Varley
content: Great place!!!!!  We were some of the first people to come in for the night.  It has a great atmosphere and is beautiful on the inside.  The seating is very comfortable.  The service was great, the server that was helping us really enjoyed his job.  He was super excited to tell us about the different dishes and cocktails.  He def sold me on the special that night (shaved beef and grits) WOW! it was great as well as the midnight margarita that was unique but delicious.  Will for sure be coming back, it would make a nice place to come for a romantic night of drinks or with a group of close friends.

name: Varley
content: I'm still thinking about the mussels in coconut broth, delicious!  Yes this swank place has food options like fried rice and garbanzo beans.  Small tapa style so don't expect full dinner.  Portions are small but what you get is quality and very tasty.  Location is the old btg bar but painted black and so it's sleek with comfy booths.  All the employees were very nice.  Drinks were nice and strong and good beer list.  Parking is street parking across from the convention center and marriott.  Not a lot of action over there due to covid so easy to park.  They are practicing covid precautions so we felt safe.  Can't wait to go back.  Cool place

name: Varley
content: To all my east coast transplants: this is the closest thing to a NYC bar I've gone to in SLC. It has the same vibe but without the prices. I would definitely recommend making a reservation as it seems like a lot of large groups of men decide to go there and take up 10 years to pay their check and leave. Drinks were GREAT but would not recommend the charcuterie. Blue cheese on a fancy cheese board doesn't sit right with me haha

name: Varley
content: This place is amazing!!! Great atmosphere, so classy and cozy. Cocktails were great. Apps were delicious. Great place to stop by for a drink or meal!

name: Varley
content: This place was great! The cocktails were what we wanted after a long day , but the food was fabulous! The mussel appetizer was so good and the bread to sop up the fabulous sauce was yummy. Husband had the burger and I had the chorizo fried rice . Topped it off with the pumpkin creme brûlée. Very very good. Highly recommend. Varley has a great vibe too.

name: Varley
content: Honestly, I wish was a hiker. Because I would climb on top of the nearest mountain and sing from the mountain top my praises of this place. I couldn't have been served, treated, or accommodated any better. From the food, cocktails, and beautiful atmosphere I couldn't be happier. I recommend 10+ with a cherry on top.

name: Varley
content: This is that NEW NEW. Thank you VARLEY for a fun night out! The service was AWESOME. The VIBE was chill and the cocktails are TOP SHELF! Did I mention the food was AMAZING? Definitely coming back to this place!

name: Varley
content: Really appreciated the intimacy and attention to detail with which the owners of Varley have created the perfect chic lounge. This is exactly what DTSLC needed and it couldn't have come at a more perfect time. A safe, upscale, posh getaway in the heart of the city provides diners/drinkers with a place to relax, refresh and reinvigorate. 5 stars for the drinks, 5 stars for the food and 5 stars for the ambience.

name: Varley
content: Salt Lake has been missing a place like this. It's got a hip, quaint vibe that affords for actual conversation instead of the loud music of a night club. The drinks are unique and tasty and the service is top notch. Highly recommend for a drink before or after a downtown show or dinner.

name: Varley
content: This bar has a great atmosphere and vibe. The servers were attentive and brilliant. The drinks were mixed with creativity.  I highly recommend visiting this new establishment.

name: Varley
content: The food!!! I cannot tell you how impressed I was with the gnocchi, mussels, and their charcuterie board. The ambience is superb-- dimly lit and sensual vibes. Absolutely gorgeous design and decor. You'll find yourself planning your next visit in no time. I'm dreaming of the gnocchi!!!! Well done B and Vaughn.

name: Varley
content: What a spectacular new bar! This block has been needing something to liven it up for a while & I'm so glad that Varley has opened. They were doing all proper Covid procedures. The hostess properly took our temperatures and masks were required to be worn on all patrons and employees; hand sanitizer was also provided throughout the venue. The food and drinks were incredible! The Midnight Margarita was too good to only have one and the Thai Coconut Curry Mussels, Sautéed Broccolini, Chorizo Fried Rice and NC BBQ Pork Rillettes were some of the best shareable plates I have tasted in some time. We heard the burger was delicious as well, but were too full to try- sothat's on our list for next time. The music was great throughout the night and the service was spot on. I can't wait to come back!

name: Varley
content: Amazing new intimate with a great vibe in downtown Salt Lake City. From the craft cocktails to the sharable plates, our whole group was impressed! We will definitely be back.

name: Varley
content: Beautiful new bar in downtown SLC. This block has been lacking a nice bar for a long time and so excited something gorgeous came in! They follow Covid protocols (temp check, mask required, sanitized) and are doing their best as a new place. We sat at the bar and were greeted by the bartender who gave us some recommendations on food (he described the burger and we weren't hungry but mouths started watering- we'll try next time!) and then we ordered some cocktails. Ordered the Midnight Margarita, was interesting. For sure something in the glass than what is listed on the menu (which is a pet peeve since maybe I hate or am allergic to an ingredient) but it was tasty. Ordered the Schlack's Daiq but he must have misheard and brought out a Tangerine Sour. It was good! Super tart and refreshing. Next we ordered the Schlack's Daiq again and once again had an ingredient that wasn't listed (it's pink! So maybe a berry component?) and it was really good- a great take of a classic daiquiri. In the end he made up for the wrong cocktail first and we had a great time. Can't wait to come back for the food and maybe someday with a group of friends to sit in the amazing window booths! Make a reservation and go!

name: Varley
content: Short Review: 5 Star from start to finish. Order anything and you will be happy and in love. Great Bang for the Buck, flavors, vibes, and Covid practices.Walking into Varley felt good, almost as if I had returned home from being away for years. An impossible thought because this was the opening night, but it gives that vibe. The look of this place is incredible! Cozy yet classy, warm but with an edge, simple yet beautiful. I can honestly say that I have not been into a cocktail bar that looked and felt like this. I just want to go back.The staff was perfectly on par. The waitress knew her stuff, she was attentive, helpful, and just happy to be there. I really respected that. If we had a question that she did not know, she would return in seconds with an answer that you would think she took a course at the university on the subject. We had two shareable and two solo dishes. Starting us off was the NC BBQ Pork Rillette. Three fresh, doled up pork sliders that leave you wanting more. The Caroline Vinegar sauce on this alone I want to bottle up and pour into a tub to swim in later. Where did this come from? Wow. The vinegar pared with the Brussel sprouts slaw in a glorious fashion. I would expect every dynamic duo to look at this and give a thumbs up. This is a must-order. The flavor was subtle yet slapping my lips as the little pickled peppers came into play. I could FEEL the taste, something I thought impossible. To complement this sharable, a beautiful bright red Grilled Beet Hummus made its way to the table. For a second I was taken back to the meals they served in Neverland... those bright colored dishes that made you want to reach through the TV and devour. This dish took me there. The bright red color of the beets felt really good on my eyes. I LOVED the beet flavor with the diced cucumbers on top, the whole thing sleeping soundly on a grilled Scallion Roti Bread. Yum. Although this was a starter, I returned to it several times throughout the main course.I ordered the Classic Americana Burger. Two Smashed Beef Patties with traditional fixings. The taste of this bad boy blew my mind. It was not a new taste, just one that I rarely experience in a restaurant, let alone a cocktail bar. I am convinced this burger is now the best-kept secret in Salt Lake City. If you are not familiar with the Maillard reaction, read up on it. A smashed patty is a party where all are invited and all have a part. The flavor is not burned out, the char does not overtake the rest of the experience, each ingredient makes its way to the front stage at just the right moments. I love the bun, not sure what kind it was but it didn't really matter. It contained and had a satisfying crunch, two things that have to be involved with a good burger. In short, this is a rad burger. It comes with a delicious pile of fries that somehow have a first crunch but feel soft. They have nailed the crispy/fresh ratio on these fries. I would imagine that they will have to fight off some pesk that is after their secret formula for the fry sauce. I know there is something else in there besides Mayo and Ketchup... maybe scallions? Garlic? Whatever it is, it is working really well. My lovely girlfriend ordered the Grilled Pear and Goat Cheese Salad with added Grilled Chicken. She usually cannot handle the punch of the goat cheese so she swapped that out with one of the other 2 options they provided. Manchego Cheese. I watched her face as she began the journey. Pure joy. Honestly, PURE JOY. "I literally have not had a better salad." They do not mess around when it comes to their salads. Calling it a salad almost demeans it. The grilled chicken was resting on top, almost challenging us to try to eat it all. This is not one of those salads that place a few pieces of the bonus protein on top and calls it good, this is a treasure of ingredients liberally poured on. I had to have what she was having. The Grilled Chicken was juicy, full of flavor, and fresh. SO FRESH. The greens, grilled pears, arugula... So fresh. I kept asking her what kind of dressing was there because it didn't taste like a vinaigrette to me. It has such a sweet, almost sugary flavor on there. I am guessing the Pear-balsamic has something to do with it. Candied Walnuts adding a satisfying crunch, Grilled Pears keep things interesting, you would think they created a new species of salad here that is begging to be had by all. I want to take loved ones here and watch them eat. We had lovely crafted mojito with fresh mint resting on top, I am not a drinker but from the happy and smiling faces around us, they know what they are doing. If the food is this good, surely the cocktails will blow your mind.I wish badly that we had room for dessert, next time.Such a great bang for you buck, 5 out 5, 10 out 10, 20 stars, whatever you want to call it. From the decor to the beautifully built drinks, It's just really really good. I see this becoming a downtown staple, we will be back.

name: Pretty Bird
content: One of the best fried chicken sandwiches I've ever had! Definitely a place I won't ever forget. My chicken pieces are always huge and are dark meat, which I love!!! Another plus for their fries and PB sauce.

name: Pretty Bird
content: There sandwiches are so big I had to share it with my friend, the chicken is soooo soft as well!!!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Pretty bird is so great & worth trying different things on menu. Huge pieces of chicken, great quality, even though it's considered fast food there's much better quality here than your average fast food chicken sandwich place. Got the mild sandwich & was amazing. Get extra sauce!

name: Pretty Bird
content: I was so stoked to finally try Pretty Bird!! Been hearing about this place for a while now. It's probably one of the most popular spots in SLC! Because of that, I think I came in with super high expectations. And I ended up liking it a lot, but wasn't swept off my feet. Some good things:-The flavor, crunch, texture, quality of the chicken is top notch. Whatever they coat that chicken in is gold. -That is a hefty sandwich! Felt like work to eat it which is exactly how a chicken sandwich should be. -Worth the price. It's a lot of good, high quality food so I think it's definitely worth your money for a fun downtown spot. Other than that, this place was good but not great to me. For example, I didn't love the sauce! I love when restaurants have a unique sauce for the it dishes, but this was not my fave. I left feeling glad that I tried it and had a fun experience, but not dying to come back soon. I'd rather try other fun, new places downtown.

name: Pretty Bird
content: You can't go wrong with Perry bird. I was blown away by the street corn salad and the chicken sandwiches. They are on the spicy Side so make sure you are prepared for spice... I cannot believe the flavor that was in the breading on the chicken. Sweet but spicy. The slaw was super good too. I'll be back!

name: Pretty Bird
content: I did not enjoy this meal at all. It was overpriced, the breading did not adhere to the chicken. The fries were nothing special.  I had high expectations based on the television connection and they were not met.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Yummm! I got the Hot chicken tenders because I was worried the Hot behind might be that type of spicy where it just hurts and doesn't taste good. I thought the name said it all! You know what I mean? I love spicy food and I can handle a lot of heat. The hot wasn't spicy to me, it had a little kick to it but my friends don't trust me when I tell them it's not spicy lol!  I'll try the hot behind next time! Also, I had the PB sauce and the white sauce!!! I loved both! Creamy and full flavor! I need to come back ASAP!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Order before going! But other than that this has to be the absolute best Nashville chicken sandwich I've ever had in my life

name: Pretty Bird
content: The chicken is fried really well and has a delicious unique flavor, but the spice level is all over the place. I love spicy things, but the only way to ensure a spicy experience is to get hot behind.When they first opened, hot was definitely pretty spicy at times, but recently the consistency hasn't been great. I know they say it depends on who's making the chicken that day, but at $10.50 a sandwich it can be pretty disappointing. It might just be a Utah thing where it's rare to find to something actually as spicy as advertised, so definitely go with the hot behind to guarantee some spice. I've had hot sandwiches that could pass as medium or below. The hot flavor to me is better, but it's not worth the gamble if you want that spicy experience. Everything else is really good though, and I would recommend getting your slaw on the side if you grab a sandwich. ;D

name: Pretty Bird
content: We drove hours from LA for this! Well we kind of did. Lol! When we learned that we will be in Salt Lake City for our family springbreak trip there was only one name on my foodie list! This! And truly it did not disappoint. I am always a big fan of whoever beats Bobby Flay (I'm the underdog fan as always) and I was amazed by the simplicity and complexity of flavors in this chicken sandwich. I hope they open a branch in LA soon!

name: Pretty Bird
content: We ordered the chicken sandwich, fries, the Mexican corn, extra pickles, and extra picked cabbage. If you're a pickle lover like I am you'll definitely want their extra crunchy, thick sliced pickles! The Mexican corn is a little different than the traditional elotes you'd get from a taco stand. It has jalepeño & green onion slices along with he usual mayo and Mexican cheese. Nothing there're tasted anything but fantastic. It's worth a try if you're in the mood for a chicken sandwich. Only thing I wish the owner would consider is possibly breading and frying a vegetarian version of his fried sandwiches. I feel like he's missing out on a big market here in the Salt Lake City area.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This probably should not be your everyday meal as the chicken sandwich is boarding on 2000 calories, but definitely a unique experience.  With covid we had to take the order to go.  Online ordering was easy but expect to wait for pickup.  Chicken was large crispy and juicy and somewhat messy so be prepared.  Would stop again when we return to salt lake.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I can't get enough of their sandwiches. I am stoked they opened a second location with more convenient parking. Be aware that their hot butt is actually hot, not just Utah hot.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Sandwiches were made fresh to order, steaming hot right out of the fryer and seasoned extremely well. The perfect balance of sweet and spicy with an amazing crunchy breading. Combine this with an excellent special sauce, pickled cabbage which adds the perfect bite and complimented with deli pickles. This sandwich is the the real deal. The fried chicken did have a hint of "fishy" taste to it which the wife agreed did distract from the overall taste of the sandwich. Not sure if the oil was old or if this was just the flavor of the specific chicken that they use as they are very large chicken thighs. Would love to try the fried chicken alone next time, but if you're looking for a very flavor and excellent chicken sandwich then give this place a shot.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This chicken sandwich is very good!!  I don't think its the best I've ever had (sorry), but definitely a solid chicken sandwich.  The fries were also great.  I will agree, this sandwich is huge!  I planned on eating it all for dinner, but ended up saving half for lunch the next day.  The PB sauce was good, but I love ketchup and ended up preferring ketchup for my fries.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Just  beyond good. So good!!! It will be perfect if the down town area was a lot bigger.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Pretty Bird serves up these jumbo Nashville-style fried chicken sandwiches which critics call "mind blowing." A pretty bird on a buttered bun topped with purple coleslaw, pickles and PB (their special sauce). Even their crinkle-cut fries are amazing - perfectly crispy and salty. Tip: Right now during the pandemic you can only order online. So order about 15-20 minutes before you arrive!

name: Pretty Bird
content: There's not much else to say besides it's the best chicken sandwich, best fries, and best special sauce around. Eat here!

name: Pretty Bird
content: The size portion is huge which is great. The chicken was just overly seasoned which made it hard to enjoy it. Felt like I was just biting into clumps on chili powder & garlic. You have to order on your phone before walking in to pickup. I just don't think it's worth all the hype.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Restaurant has no phone number. The 999-9999 number listed is not working. I just placed an order and it doesn't give you a pick up time until you submit payment. The time pick up time that they gave me is in 2 hours!!! I can't cancel the order because, again, no phone number. So now I've got 4 cranky, hungry kids, and a $70 order that I can't cancel. What business doesn't have a way for their customers to contact them? Ridiculous.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Highly recommend!The day I tried Pretty Bird my partner and I were craving a good chicken sandwich. We weren't craving the car accident that happened on our way there that made us almost three hours late to pick up our order, but the staff at Pretty Bird were extremely kind and patient when I arrived for their evening open hours.Even if that day hadn't been rough the food would've still tasted fantastic. The Fried Chicken Sandwich has such a great crunchy texture and delicious spices, plus their take on fry sauce may be the best in the city.The car is still in the repair shop but once it's back I'm excited to get another sandwich!

name: Pretty Bird
content: The best damn hot chicken sandwich you can get. It's seriously two meals in one it's so big and heavy but absolutely delicious.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I'm going to have to go with 2 stars due to the chicken sandwich being a bit dry which makes it chewy as well. Frys were also sub par. Some of them super crispy and others not. No real consistency. The people working here seemed very polite and was super clean, just the food fell short of my expectations

name: Pretty Bird
content: I remember thinking this place seems a little pricy for a chicken sandwich but wowza.... I would pay that price 10000 times over again because it is THAT good. I have a big appetite and the sandwich with a side of fries was more than satisfying. My life is better having eaten their chicken. If you're still questioning it, just go.

name: Pretty Bird
content: The wait was ridiculous and definitely not worth it.The meat was dry and crusty and I do NOT mean that in a good way for fried chicken. It was not a good flavor and the toppings were pitiful. Cabbage and pickles with their own sauce. The fries were also a ridiculous price for how cheap they were. They tasted like the same fries you could buy at Walmart for triple the price. The drink were also the smallest thing for how much they costed. Dry, gross, and way overpriced.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I ordered a to go from pretty bird downtown off of regent street. The fried chicken Sando is a large portion lunch. The chicken is half white meat and half brown meat. I wish they had a sandwich with all white meat. I ordered online at: prettybird-orders.crispn…The restaurant is closed and they do come outside to greet you and give you your to go order. The crinkle cut fries with PB sauce is wonderful and also generously served. I highly recommend buying the extra pickles for one dollar. My to go order was packaged beautifully and well labeled. It is a must try. In my personal opinion for two people I would order one fried chicken Sando one crinkle cut fry with PB sauce and one extra pickles.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This place is worth any wait. Best chicken sandwiches around, perfect level of spice and delicious house sauce.

name: Pretty Bird
content: i thought it was going to be a regular ol chicken sandwich but gah damn this shit SLAPS

name: Pretty Bird
content: We had some friends RAVE about this place so we checked it out when we were downtown. Picking up the food is tough due to limited parking. Eventually I just dropped my wife off and waited in the car. We took the sandwiches to a nearby park. The portions are huge. The sandwich will definitely fill you up. The mild sandwich is moderately spicy. The picked cabbage on the sandwich is nice.   Good quality meat as well. I would not make a special trip back up but if I happened to be in the area it is worth a stop.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Amazing! Favorite chicken sandwich ever - plus new Covid pickup process is super easy. This is a go to for us

name: Pretty Bird
content: The chicken itself is stringy. I have never had chicken be stringy like this before and I can't get past the texture. Love the flavors, but not enough to get past the texture.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Best Hot Chicken in Utah!!! This is our go-to lunch spot when people are in town visiting. The spice rub on this will blow your mind. I get the medium cause it has just enough spice to make your lips tingle but it's not over the top. It also has an underlying cinnamon flavor which is great and the purple cabbage slaw has just enough creaminess to cool your mouth down. Just as an FYI, these sandwiches are really big, I can never finish a whole, so come hungry.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I was watching the tv show 'Beat Bobby Flay' and saw the episode where the owner of Pretty Bird was going up against Bobby with his hot chicken as his signature dish. *SPOILER ALERT* he beat Bobby Flay. Right then and there I knew I had to try that sandwich. I went to Salt Lake the next day and ordered the Sando with a side of fries. OMG Pretty Bird knows how to make a chicken sandwich! It was spiced well and very filling. When I went, I did have to stand in line (which I hear is pretty standard) for around 15 minutes. Once I got in and ordered, it went pretty quick. There is not a lot of seating, so I went to City Creek and ate my food there. If you want to try the hot chicken that beat Bobby Flays, definitely check Pretty Bird out.

name: Pretty Bird
content: The only place to get good Nashville-style chicken in SLC.  Not the same as Hattie B's in Nashville, but darn close. Definitely worth the drive into the city. I wish they had collard greens!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Absolutely amazing. This is a perfect example of pick one thing and do it well. Hats off to the most perfect chicken sandwich and crinkle cut fries and the sauce, OMG the sauce, amazing!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Now that we are back in WI we are still taking about the flavor on this friend chicken sandwich. Even the leftovers in the fridge the following day were incredible!!!

name: Pretty Bird
content: It's awesome. Very spicy, but if you like a fried chicken sandwich, it's awesome. All about the basic sandwich. It's a lot of food, so you don't need much else.

name: Pretty Bird
content: The hot behind here literally hits the spot every-time. The perfect crispness with the dark chicken meat satisfies my craving each time I crave it! I haven't been back since covid and they are doing online orders only and you just pick up. A perfect to go lunch/dinner.

name: Pretty Bird
