content: I have been longing to try one of these chicken sandwiches for years, and finally I did! We did takeout, as that is all that is allowed. Unfortunately, they made the order much faster than it said it would be ready when I ordered online, so by the time I got it home, it did not taste as hot and fresh as I would have really preferred. At room temperature, it didn't taste particularly special. Funny enough, I had the second half of it cold from the fridge the following morning, and that tasted better (?). Weird. FYI, the sandwich is HUGE. I mean massive. My partner couldn't even eat his entire sando, which is unheard for him. These sandwiches are heavily breaded and well fried. I liked the pickles and slaw. The peanut butter sauce added the to flavor but wasn't as exciting or unique flavor wise as I thought it would be.

name: Pretty Bird
content: One of my favorite chicken sandwich places! Everyone here is always so friendly and the food is amazing. I don't know what they put in that secret sauce of theirs but I might have to organize a heist to find out! (Don't worry I'm not going to heist you Pretty Bird). Hopefully when you come here you get Kacie, one of my favorite chefs in the place, making your food but you're going to love it either way. My only recommendation for you PB is to start offering sweet tea, can't get enough of the stuff.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Best fried chicken ever!! All those haters have no palate whatsoever. I've tried lots of  hot chicken sandwiches in the Bay Area, nothing compares.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This place is worth it. Review is based on a medium spice chicken sandwich with fries. Bread - great ratio of bun to chickenChicken - spices are spot on, love the slight taste of sweetness; moist with an awesome crunch.Slaw/pickles - perfect comboFries - love crinkle fries and its crispinessCan't wait to have my next hot chicken sando!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Way over rated....just another deep fried chicken  sandwich..seriously  average  nothing to write home about

name: Pretty Bird
content: This is the only hot chicken sandwich place you need to go to in Utah. Trust me. I've tried quite a few of them and the others just don't compare. The chicken is sooo yummy and flavorful and juicy and the slaw compliments it perfectly. The fries and sauce are also amazing. We tried the side of corn last time which was really small for the price but once we tasted it, we could see why. So good! Probably will just stick to the sandwich and fries in the future but it was fun to try. One thing to note is the portions are huge. The sandwich is deceptively filling.  I usually can't finish one sandwich by myself so I will either split it or save the chicken and sauce for later. The leftover chicken is super yummy to reheat as-is or on a salad. It may seem a little pricier but you definitely get what you pay for! Compliments to the chef, Viet Pham. He's a mastermind and has really nailed down the perfect hot chicken recipe. Thanks for bringing your culinary talents to Salt Lake!

name: Pretty Bird
content: This is one of the best places to eat in Utah.  Best chicken sandwich I have ever had, the crisp batter almost has a curry flavour.  The sandwiches are HUGE but even if you have a small appetite you may be tempted to eat the whole thing anyways.  Very friendly staff, would give 10 stars if I could

name: Pretty Bird
content: This place ROCKS!  Excellent food, made right on time and listed. Definitely will be back.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This was the first time trying pretty bird. It was a pretty big delicious bird. My niece loved it but she did mention it's a little greasy and it was so big we couldn't finish it. the sandwhich the cole slaw that comes with abs the sauce the sauce especially it was so so good. I have to take a star off for the grease other than that it's a must try.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Best chicken sandy in town. Amazing quality but there is always a line out the door. I guess that's how you know it's good!

name: Pretty Bird
content: It's mostly a hyped up chick fil a. Sandwiches might be a little bigger, but are double the cost. Also my fries were cold when I ordered, gag. Their sides are also pretty costly

name: Pretty Bird
content: Wow! My wife and I have been here three times, and I'm incredibly happy to say that the first time we went must have been a fluke night, because the two more recent times have been amazing. We get it now! The chicken pieces on the sandwiches were HUGE and delicious, and the fries were perfectly crispy on the outside, and pillowy on the inside. Happy to update the review, and say our minds and bellies have been completely changed for the better.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Picked up my food and it was still hot! Such a huge amount of food too! Those sandwiches were so dank and well seasoned. 10/10 recommend to any out of towners like myself who are in the neighborhood for a little bit.

name: Pretty Bird
content: The line to get it is insane! At least to my taste. Telling you how good is this place. I like to cook chicken at home so I am not crazy to get chicken when I order food, and I am definitely not crazy about chicken sandwiches. But I made a bet with a colleague so I had to try it. And I have to say, it is really really good! Now I am working on convincing my husband to try it so I can go back!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Great spot to grab lunch right now. You aren't even allowed inside, you just simply order online and pick it up outside, so very COVID friendly. Besides COVID things, this is quite literally the most delicious chicken sandwich I have ever had. The condiments and toppings are so good and the chicken is spot on. Great spices and incredible fry on the outside, yet amazingly moist and tender on the inside. Fries are also fantastic. It's a little on the spendier side for a sandwich, but worth it every time. 10/10 will be returning.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This isn't about the food. I've been to this place twice and never even gotten to the food. It's like they don't want to actually sell their product. Each time I've been there, I've walked away empty handed. The phone number is wrong. There's not an easy way to access a website to order. Good luck. I'm GUESSING the food is pretty good, but I honestly have no idea. I can say the effort isn't worth the effort or time wasted at this point.

name: Pretty Bird
content: If you're in Salt Lake you absolutely have to stop by Pretty Bird. My favorite is their Hot Chicken Sando. The cider slaw is crisp, but not over powering. The chicken is so juicy and crispy and the seasoning is *chefs kiss*. After I picked up my order in SLC, I decided to wait and eat it at home about 30mins away and the sandwich and the fries were still warm and crispy.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This place is super yummy! The chicken is crispy on the outside and moist on the inside! I don't know how they do it but definitely worth checking out!

name: Pretty Bird
content: I wish I could give this more than 5 stars. We were passing through and stopped here on a whim. We come from the south and LOVE our fried chicken. Man, this blew it out of the park. The portion is huge and it is delicious! I wish we had one out here in Seattle.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I want to give Pretty Bird a better review and we may consider trying it again but our first impression was not good. First, due to Covid they would not let anyone inside so we had to order online, which, considering the circumstances was fine. The third party pretty bird uses for ordering was quite cumbersome and the wait time was about an hour. Although the sandwich looked very much like the other photos online and on Instagram it was extremely messy and fell apart immediately. The sandwich was not overly hot but it wasn't cold either. The crunch was fantastic but otherwise there was slaw, sauce and chicken falling out everywhere. If we do order again, we will make sure we are not overly hungry because the wait will be very long as well as perhaps ordering strips or something less messy.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Food was good (although cold when they finally gave it to me).  Service was terrible.  I ordered online which is currently the only way they take orders due to COVID.  But I stood in line waiting to pick my order up for over 10 minutes in the freezing cold.  Meanwhile I kept receiving texts from them saying my order was ready but I couldn't get it.  Once I walked back to my car I opened my order and found they had forgotten one of my items.  Too cold to stand in line again so I tried to call and message them but they have a fake phone number, (801) 999-9999, and don't answer Facebook messages.  Too bad they can't get it together because the food seems like it would have been pretty decent.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I'm sorry but this place ain't it. The staff is friendly and the online ordering process is easy enough, but I genuinely feel bad for people who rate this as the best chicken sandwich they've ever had. The first time I ate here was about a year ago and I got a mild sandwich which was weirdly sweet and the chicken itself felt off. So this go around I went with a medium and it was still really sweet which is just so odd for a "hot chicken" sandwich. It felt like it was more breading than meat and once again the chicken was weird and stringy. I had to stop eating it, which sucks because it's not exactly cheap. The fries are whatever, frozen and bland. If they ditched the raggedy Kroger-reject chicken thighs and maybe added tenders or something I'd give them another chance. But the unseasoned masses have spoken with their glowing reviews and inexplicable willingness to wait in line for this stuff (imagine!!!), so changes are unlikely. Save a few bucks and go to Chick-fil-A.

name: Pretty Bird
content: There's a lot of Nashville hot chicken places these days. You have to have a great product to stand out from the rest of the competition. Good news is that a lot of the competition isn't very good. Pretty Bird definitely puts out a quality hot chicken sando.I honestly didn't really have any expectations, but after my first bite I was impressed and completely sold.The slaw, batter, spice, and sauce all worked harmoniously to deliver a satisfying bite every time. The chicken wasn't dry at all. The onlyyyy minor complaint I have is that the bun was a little dry.Oh, about the spice: Their hottest spice level definitely has a mean kick, but I personally eat extremely spicy. Like, my friend is convinced my taste buds are toast. Anyway, their spiciest is definitely VERY hot for the average person.I placed an online order and was notified by text when my order was ready for pick-up. The biggest suggestion I have is to give customers an option to make their order a combo. I literally wanted to spend more money, but ordering online doesn't give you the option to add fries and a beverage. It's advertised on their menu to make it a combo, so why not do the same online? It just didn't make sense to get an order of fries because it would be the same cost as a combo essentially.All in all, the sando was satisfying, delicious, and definitely shareable if you wanted to. Later at night I thought to myself, "I could definitely go for one right about now." In fact, I think I might grab one before I leave Utah.

name: Pretty Bird
content: The sandwich was very good the batter is sweet, so I wish I had gotten a Spicer sauce. With takeout definitely get the ingredients separate so your sandwich doesn't get soggy, so happy they have that option while you are ordering!

name: Pretty Bird
content: It was an overpriced good sandwich that didn't live up to the hype. The chicken was tender. The breading was a little much (too thick and waaay too buttery). It was a really big sandwich, but I feel like I need to take a shower to get all the butter off my hands/face. I'd choose Chick-fil-A over this 9x out of 10.

name: Pretty Bird
content: For over a year I have seen the lines in front of Pretty Bird and have wondered what I've been missing.  Stopped by last week and ordered a chicken Sandwich. The flavor was good, the bun was fresh and the staff seemed like they enjoy working there. Only downside is that I ordered spicy. A bit to spicy for me. Will definitely be back! Manegment seems to have created the percent situation.

name: Pretty Bird
content: It's a decent sandwich, but definitely not worth the 1 hour wait. The app said it was a 30 minute wait. We ended up waiting 30 minutes past that outside in 35 degree weather. They seemed unfazed with 20 other unhappy customers waiting past their pick up time. The employee just kept answering with "sorry we're a little behind". 5-10 minutes is a little behind, not 30. They did nothing to compensate or communicate how long the wait actually was. If their app had been accurate and had said 1 hour wait I never would have ordered. Like I said, decent sandwich, but not worth the hype or the wait. I probably won't be going back.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Chicken should not be this good.  It's amazing.  Same owner that used to own Forage which was the best restaurant I've ever eaten at in Utah, so it's no surprise this one is great with the simple menu and knock out recipes.***HEAT ADVISORY*** Do not underestimate how hot their chicken can be.  I'd order down at least 1 level from what you'd normally get to be safe.  For us, the medium was barely edible it was so hot.  I suffered through it but after that I've always stuck to mild and been happy.I just wish they had a bigger place with more seating as it's just packed and usually unable to sit down.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This definitely lived up the the Yelp reviews.  Due to COVID placed order online. Was ready when I got there in and out, friendly service. A must when in town

name: Pretty Bird
content: Definitely worth the hype and price. We went there during Covid and ordered online. My first thought was who sells $10 chicken sandwich that too in SLC. However, the portions in enormous and the sandwich itself is a piece of art. We got the medium spicy and felt it was spicy even by Indian standards. The chicken has amazing crispiness and is super flavorful, the bun is out of the world and condiments just make the sandwich heavenly. I would come again when I visit SLC.

name: Pretty Bird
content: SO GOOD. Aesthetically its the best looking sandwich you can find in the area from like ogden all the way to St. George. Good size and the quality control is good, topped off with the bright purple coleslaw which tbh if your sandwich doesn't have slaw or pickles then its not a sandwich worth eating. So its a great looking sandwich. In terms of flavor, its got plenty of flavor. The breading on the chicken itself is mad good. They got some freaky spices in there that are straight witchcraft. Like you can smell it the second you pick it up. The spice levels are accurate, don't be a hero and try and max out the spicy bc you'll just end up not enjoying your sandwich. The slaw has great acidity and sets off the sandwich well. Best chicken sandwich in utah, good price, i'll come back every weekend for one of these.

name: Pretty Bird
content: The chicken sandwich was HUGE and tasted so good. Will definitely be bringing friends to this spot whenever we have a craving for deep fried chicken.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Great food! I thought I was OK with heat, but this stuff is fire. If you aren't sure how much heat you can handle, start with the lowest option. Not much seating, and the line was long but moved quickly enough at lunch time. It was worth it! ( Just found this review stuck in my drafts from October 2019, so can't speak to any changes related to Covid.)

name: Pretty Bird
content: Damn tasty chicken sandwich. I always get the medium, good spice but not crazy hot. There big crinkle cut fries are awesome too. I really like the simple menu. Order on line and pick up with minimal contact super easy.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Fantastic fried chicken!! I lived in atlanta for 5 years and am a native southerner. The fried chicken at pretty bird reminds me of home which is a difficult accomplishment for the west coast. I'm so glad I tried it and will definitely be back, especially for some spicy hangover food!

name: Pretty Bird
content: SO good! The chicken is nice and spicy with a hint of sweet. Also recommend the Mexican corn.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Visiting SLC. According to Yelp, this is one of the most popular places. When I arrived at Pretty Bird, it was much smaller than I though. The alley was almost a ghost town because of covid. Many of the surrounding shops were closed. To order, we had to go to a webpage online. Very basic and easy to use. I got the fried chicken sando. Wow. Next level. Aesthetic with the purple coleslaw. So many flavors. The sauce. The pickles. The fried chicken was the juicy I've ever had. One of the bites I took, was magical. A moment I will never forget. Incredible. Hype is real for this one.

name: Pretty Bird
content: The chicken sandwich was so flavorful. I got medium and it had a nice kicked. The sauce was so good, however, i wish we didnt have to pay extra for sauce. The fries are crispy but nothing special. The service is great though. I came at right time and missed the crowd but the line can get pretty long. Went here in Feb prior to pandemic so we were able to dine indoors, not sure how it is now. I would come back for the sandwich. Come early bc they have limited amount and stop once it's sold out.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Yes! The food was delicious and beautifully prepared.  But the PEOPLE at Pretty Bird were absolutely fabulous.  So patient with my glitchy online order.  So kind and accommodating.  I support businesses with this kind of top drawer customer service! We will be back!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Great food, kinda expensive for what you get. Outside tables were pretty dirty. Understand Covid is going on, but would prefer the outside be tender better.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Pick-up order only, make sure to order online and give yourself 15 minutes before the food is ready.  If you order the chicken, it might take a bit longer.I went with the Fried Chicken Sandwich, from price point - expensive compared to Popeyes or Chick-fil-a.Overall, the sandwich was good.  I could eat the chicken by itself all day long, it was perfectly seasoned, fried to perfection, moist and the medium spice level hit the spot.  However, I was not a fan of the slaw, it didn't really help the sandwich, probably been better without it. The buns could have spent some time in a steamer as it wasn't soft, maybe it's just the type of the bread they used.  If I were to revisit, I would probably stick to fried chicken.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Best fried chicken in all of Salt Lake hands down. That's it. They do one thing here and one thing only and they do it right. Some peope say it's too expensive, and that's true if you're comparing this to Wendy's. But THIS IS NOT a Wendy's chicken sandwich. This sandwich is a mouth-watering artisan creation that rings on your taste buds from Bun to Shining Bun. Well worth the $10 for just the sandwich and if you've already gone that far, why not just pay $14 and get some crinkle cut fries. Seriously I think this is one of the best takeout spots in the city, don't miss out.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Best hot chicken sandwich this side of the Mississippi that I've had. I've had varying spice levels, and it does get up there, but if you are looking for something super tasty but not spicy, you can definitely go the safe route and you won't be sorry either.What really wowed me though is the quarter chicken. I'll be the first to admit that I absolutely love chicken skin, and this is just simply the best. The batter on the chicken allows for it to be light, crunchy, and freaking tasty. Fries are a delicious crinkle cut that are the perfect mixture of crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. Get the PB sauce to go along with them. You really can't go wrong with anything here. It's all fantastic.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Was headed to the airport and decided to try this place because of the great reviews. I ordered before I left home (Utah county) and there was a huge crowd of people standing around waiting for their orders to be ready when I got there. On arrival you go to the door and give the person your order name and they'll add you to the list then they go and grab multiple orders at once depending on what was ready. The guy taking names was in a bad mood, probably due to the fact that people were confused about having to order online and the ridiculous amount of customers waiting, but not a great impression of the general attitude of the employees.It took about ten minutes to get my food out. My first issue was the way things were packaged. The corn container was under the sandwiches so at first I was frustrated because after waiting I thought I didn't have everything. After looking through everything I decided to check under the sandwiches and finally found it and headed to the airport. The sandwiches were so different than anything I've tried. They were sweet which I wasn't expecting so it was a weird sensation when I was expecting salty chicken.The corn also wasn't what I was expecting. Usually Mexican street corn is cotija, corn, and chile with some lime and cilantro this was not that. It had more toppings than corn and it was an overwhelming combination of flavors that I couldn't even finish it. My husband got two different spicier versions of the sandwich and really enjoyed the flavors and the texture of the sandwiches. In conclusion, I'd probably go back and just get a sandwich hopefully on a day they are less crazy and I can have more than one bad impression of what their employees are like.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I've been here twice and I gotta say, I don't get the hype. The spices and seasoning of the chicken are all wrong. I wanted to like it, but the chicken, chili powder and maybe lime (??) just don't meld. Maybe I need to try the "No Spice" version? The breading is beautiful and crispy. The bun and pickles are good. I like the crinkle cut fries.

name: Pretty Bird
content: If you are looking for something really heavy, this is your thing. It was very greasy, and SO SO heavy. Terribly hard to eat and not great. The best part was tearing the breast a part and eating the meat by itself. The meat inside was not terrible. Very moist.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Absolutely loved this place! Everything was so fresh and you can't go wrong with the street corn! You have to visit this place if you're in town! Only recommendation is that even if you think you handle spicy foods well maybe get the chicken in medium than spicy. I grew up with spicy food and I didn't even get the extra spicy but the regular hot flavor was so hot it burned my lips afterwards. Overall, great experience!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Helluva Chicken sandwich!! I went for the spiciest one because I can handle a lot of spice... and this definitely tested me, so caution to those that like a challenge. Regardless... 12/10 delicious and will definitely be going back for more.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Omg delicious. Ok review done - just kidding. We are passing through SLC on the way to the east coast and checked this place out based on the reviews. I got a non spicy chicken sandwich and fries and my husband had a medium spicy sandwich with Mexican corn. I like that they are very strict on Covid guidelines as well. We found a bench down the street and happily chowed down. The breading is somehow crispy and also soft, and my husband said his medium spice level had a sweet and spicy flavor to it, which he appreciated. Fries are fries, but were cooked well. Mexican corn was really good with the PB sauce, it's like a lime sort of crema. I'm normally not a fan of slaw but this one was good. Staff was super friendly and food was nice and hot when we picked it up.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This place is so delicious. It's online order only and take away but it was hands down one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I've had. The breading was crispy and almost sweet and the PB sauce was super yummy.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This place is a must try when in Salt Lake City. Ordered the fried chicken sando online and the food was ready in 5 minutes. The sandwich was about 11 dollars and  the size of it was about 2 to 3 normal chicken sandwiches stacked together. The seasoning and cooking of the fried chicken was perfect. Very crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. One of the best chicken sandwich ive had. Would definitely come back when in the city, highly recommend!

name: Pretty Bird
content: This madness.... I love chicken sandwiches and was so excited to try this but I'm just bewildered. The chicken tasted like fish. It had such a fishy flavor, I was perhaps disgusted and could not finish my meal. I don't know how this has so many positive reviews. Better luck next time.

name: Pretty Bird
content: This may be my favorite chicken on the planet.  As long as you get the slaw to go with it.  It's constant, and delicious.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Exceptionally tasty chicken.  I had the medium sandwich and the spice level was just right (about the level of a Wendy's spicy chicken).  The slaw was yummy and don't forget the PB sauce for your fries!My son got the hot and spent several minutes jumping around the chicken exclaiming how good it was.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I'm a vegetarian but when I spoil myself it's here!Best fried chicken in SLC hands down! HUGE hunk of chicken in the sandos, so juicy yet crisp! The medium spice is just perfect for me. Takeout only right now but they finish your order in just 5-15 minutes.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I have been waiting to try this place, from a recommendation from a surgeon I work with. We went after picking up our nephew from the FrontRunner, for a quick dinner before Halloween traditions. Currently, orders can only be made online for pickup, but service was relatively quick. The sandwich was sooooooo delicious and crispy! It totally exceeded my expectations, and that of my husband, who is sometimes hard to convince! He loved it so much, we went back again a second day in a row!The sandwich is is perfectly seasoned, and has slaw and pickles to accentuate the flavor. Their PB sauce is delectable with the fries and sandwich! We're definitely making this a regular on our food rotation!!!!

name: Pretty Bird
content: Very disappointing experience. My husband and I were on the road all day and stopped in SLC for dinner. I happened upon Pretty Bird and decided to make that our meal after reading all the positive reviews.Because of COVID-19 their process has changed which of course is needed. What could have really helped is more signage. They only are taking orders online and not in person. They have a pickup line that isn't organized and is hard to navigate. The guy who was handling pickups had to keep telling people that they have to wait for the ready for pickup message. A sign greatly would help in this situation. I'm willing to give them a pass on this, COVID has cause a lot of upheaval.What I am not willing to give a pass on is the taste of the food. I could hands down say this is one of the WORST chicken sandwiches I've ever had. It had a really off taste. The chicken itself had a weird sweetness which was off putting when combined with the other seasoning on the chicken and it's toppings. The sandwich was big and I could barely make my way through it because every bite was as disappointing as the last. I got sides as well the fries were normal but I wasn't able to eat the Mexican street corn salad because they didn't give me a spoon. Since we immediately hopped onto the highway I had to throw it away since we had no way to eat it.I really really wanted to like this place but after the experience I had tonight I can honestly say it's not worth it especially at the prices they charge. I wish I could get my money back on this one.

name: Pretty Bird
content: My favorite meal in SLC. The best fried chicken sandwich I have ever had. Went during Covid time and you have to order online for takeaway

name: Pretty Bird
content: pretty bird was so good!! my friend and I got 2 fried chicken sandwich meals: 1 hot and 1 mild. The chicken was huge and perfectly crispy, and we LOVED the fries. It was super good with the pretty bird sauce. The hot sandwich was HOT, so be prepared. We took off 1 star for the price. It was $16.50 for a meal, which is a bit excessive. The door says the combo is $15, but when I try to order online everything is priced separately. I asked the worker, and she said "they're not doing combos right now, it's all priced separately". I thought that was lame. Also our drinks were over 3/4 of ice. All in all, super fun and super yummy, just a bit overpriced.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I got the fried chicken sandwich hot. Very large portion of chicken breast for the sandwich. Excellent taste sweet and spicy. You have to order online because of the pandemic. Definitely a must visit.

name: Pretty Bird
content: Some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Had to try this place while visiting from California and it didn't disappoint. Ordered the medium spice level sandwich with fries and PB sauce. Medium was perfect heat. Have to order online and no seating. Messy but so good! Highly recommend.

name: Pretty Bird
content: I ordered the medium spice chicken sandwich. This came with a slaw and pickles on top. The breading was on the thicker side, but not overly thick. The medium was not spicy to me, so I would opt for something hotter next time. The chicken was very juicy and plump. The bun was soft and soaked up the juices to prevent it from being messy.The pickup service was fast and friendly. Great place for a quick bite!

name: HSL
content: Had all the vegetarian items on the menu and none of it was disappointing. Cocktails were a bit on the pricey side but were still rich with flavors. Here's how I'd rank the vegetarian items:Insanely Good:CAULIFLOWERBUTTERMILK BISCUITAPPLE TOASTReally Good:FLATBREADCHICORIES + BROCCOLINICHOCOLATE TORTEGood, but not world beaters:BUCATINIIt didn't even seem like COVID was happening, the entire restaurant was popping and the service was top notch! Highly highly recommend!

name: HSL
content: We loved this restaurant! We did shared plates and loved everything. Definitely one of our more memorable meals -- our favorites were the pork shank, and the fried chicken main dish, SO good. The Japanese whiskey cocktail is a must try if you want to get an interesting cocktail worth the $.Service was awesome and the vibes were great.

name: HSL
content: I've been here a few times. Each time the service is good and the menu is unique compared to standard SLC fare.

name: HSL
content: We came here for dinner on a  Friday night and it was very busy. All the tables were filled but distanced. All of our food came out rather quick, I think we were done within an hour of our reservation. We ordered the hamachi crudo which we would give 1 out of 5. The hamachi was very fishy and paired with too sweet of a ponzu sauce. Everything after this was delicious though. We ordered one of each of the hot selections. Then buttermilk biscuit was amazing. Buttery, flaky, a hint of sweet and salty...make sure to get your own! The general Tso cauliflower flower was also pretty good. I had high expectations so I was a bit disappointed. I was hoping for a batter fried cauliflower similar to general tso chicken. However the sauce was very good.The apple toast was a table favorite for sure. Don't you love a flatbread/pizza with a crust that holds and has a nice crunch? Not only that but the pesto, mozzarella was quite tasty! And lastly we got the bucatini which had a great mushroom bolognese sauce. I wish we weren't so full to have ordered some of the hearty dishes! Perhaps next time?!

name: HSL
content: Wow, what an amazing experience we had. Our waiter, Ericson was our waiter, and made great recommendations . We had the crudo, clams, fried chicken & the market fish. Every dish was incredible, from flavor, to presentation. We were impressed and very much enjoyed ourselves. Oh, and the deserts were devine! The dark chocolate & the caramel both were so good, almost better if ordered together!

name: HSL
content: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SLC. The ambience is very inviting and it is a great place to go with friends. It is hard to pick from all of their tapas but thats why I would recommend going with at least 4 people so you can get a good sampling of everything. Honestly whatever you get will be unbelievable.

name: HSL
content: Ate at HSL for the first time last night. It was excellent. The General Tso Cauliflower is amazing. I had the pork shank, which was also fantastic. The service was great, and the setting was intimate and quiet--possibly due to the setup due to COVID. I will definitely be back!

name: HSL
content: Finally got to visit HSL. Excited to try it since it was featured on RHWOSLC. A side the nice welcome and alright service the food was so-so and over priced. Small menu not many creative options. The menu was pretty basic. I started with a cocktail but ended up with a cup topped off with ice an a splash of liquor, with lime  absolutely awful!! Pissed i paid $12 bucks!! So I said,  screw the cocktails let me get an Arnold Palmer, how hard is it to make AP?For my meal, I ordered this apple appetizer an a salad, recommended by our server, it was ok. Also, ordered the pork shank n the fried chicken. Disappointed  sorry HSL you get 2

name: HSL
content: I have to keep going back because I love so many different things on the menu!  BUT the Cauliflower is ordered every time.

name: HSL
content: This place earns a 5 star for both of my visits so far. Even the desserts are delicious. A little pricey for my income and still enjoyed every bite.

name: HSL
content: I had the apple toast, flatbread, cauliflower, whisky pudding, and the chocolate torte. We had ginger beer and lemonade as well.Everything was amazing. I'm looking for unique flavors that are well balanced and that's what you get at hsl. I was worried about portions but I thought the portions were perfect for two people and allowed us to try 3 dishes and have room for dessert.Atmosphere was pretty and romantic, my only nit picky thing would be raucous music at times.The waitress was very attentive and everything came out quickly!

name: HSL
content: Had such a good experience here! The whiskey caramel pudding was the best for me hands down. My second favorite was the cauliflower dish which I thought was chicken so I didn't initially eat it and then ended up ordering it fo my main course.Adorable ambiance and for sure romantic vibes as well the nice restaurant for sharing bites and plates as well as good drinks and the works!

name: HSL
content: I'm don't post reviews often, but when a restaurant is this good...I think it's important. HSL just does everything right. It's actually hard for me to think of a better restaurant. I am not local to the area, but My family invited us out here last week, and our experience was so great, we came back again just a week later. ITS THAT GOOD. To start, the ambiance is great. It's open, not too loud, and just great all around. In my two visits here, I've now tried a decent portion of the menu and I can't stay one negative thing about any single bite I had. The one thing I will say is that meat and cheese board ..... I'll never forget a charcuterie board like that. Also, it was different last week - and just as memorable. If you reading this review, you clearly found interest. Here's ur sign to go have an enjoyable date night here. Unfortunately for me, I don't live in town but if I did, I would be here often. Go see Eitsan or Erickson. They are both great waiters!!

name: HSL
content: Food is always on point and the service is outstanding. Ian makes the best cocktails in town

name: HSL
content: Came here to celebrate a birthday with Family and had a nice time here.  It's an upscale Farm to Table kind of place with a couple vegetarian items you can modify.  The inside is really cozy and was nicely decorated for Christmas during December.  There is a cool looking bar and tables scattered around a very modern looking restaurant nicely lit to make for a great ambiance.  Staff here are very good and pretty efficient at recommending wines and beers as well as modifying the menu to accommodate different dietary preferences.   The menu is pretty limited in terms of choices and all of the dishes are smaller than what you would normally find even considering this is fine dining.  The menu is divided into Cold, Hot, Hearty and Limited.  The first two are self-explanatory. The Hearty is what I guess you would consider the main courses of the menu.  The limited one was a bit strange in that it was only two items on it were white a milk stout beer and a Hamachi Tataki plate. Not quite getting that. I guess this is the kind of place where you will need to get multiple dishes to be full.  What that means in disguise is bring your wallet loaded lol.  The drinks menu I thought was a little lacking in terms of selection.  For example, they only had 7 bottled beers on the menu and two of those selections were Negro Modelo 5.4% and Dortmunder Bohemian 6% WTF.  Seems like for an upscale restaurant these are kind of lame choices.  Good news is I found one Rye beer from Salt Flats locally made that worked for me. Wine menu was a little more expansive. What was a bit strange to me was seeing such a large Aperitif drink menu.  Like 30 choices. Granted I don't think I have ever tried one before...  Oh, wait I forgot about my living in Germany days of chasing Jagersnitzel and Rumple Mints with my beers. So, I'm not sure if this is a local thing or not but spending up to $16 dollars for a shot of Digestif seemed a bit crazy but to each their own...I had the Chicories plus Broccolini salad as a starter.  This was presented in a very large bowl so the salad looked tiny... and basically it kind of was.  I'm a salad junky so to say it mildly I would have liked to have a slightly larger portion.  No sharing going to happen here for sure sorry:(  Taste wise the salad had a lot of bitter greens like radicchio chicory etc and the bitter dish was offset with the sweet dates in the mix.  The Sherry vinaigrette gave it a tang.  The Spanish almonds were nice to give it a little crunch.  Think a little avocado would have also been nice but that's just me.  Overall, it was ok but was nothing mind blowing.  For the main dish I had the Bucatini dish which was a pasta dish with a mushroom Bolognese red sauce to go with this.  I came with just a few small pieces of fennel in the dish.  Basically, I was a little underwhelmed with this dish.  I loved the concentrated red sauce and the mushrooms in the dish but it was lacking more pasta.  It was kind of a bummer to have eaten the pasta and have a good portion of mushroom sauce still on the plate.  I mean how much can spaghetti pasta cost to maybe include more so that the whole dish can be enjoyed in totality?  I also didn't really like the spaghetti type pasta for this dish.  The mushrooms and sauce were so concentrated a wider or spiraled type pasta would have made the dish much better. Finally, I got to try a bit of another dish called General Tso's Cauliflower.  This is a vegan dish they offer on the hot menu.  I liked the spicy sauce on this dish a lot but it was a bit over sauced and deep fried.  I think I would have liked it better to have a less oily version that captured the spicy taste of the Tso's maybe adding in some veggies  but that's just me.Overall though I'm glad I got to try this place out and would consider to come back if they offered new veggie related items to try out.  It's a bit spendy as the courses add up but for special occasions I'd say it's worth the dime.

name: HSL
content: I've always loved HSL!  They're so accommodating and never once have I ordered something I did not like.  We got the charcuterie board which was a meal on its own and the salmon.  I love the atmosphere of HSL!  A great place for dinner with friends or date night.

name: HSL
content: One of the best restaurants I've been to. You willnot regret ordering the biscuit and cauliflower as appetizers

name: HSL
content: My girlfriends and I go every year the week of Christmas. We had the biscuits (to die for), cauliflower and mushrooms for appetizers. They were all delicious. For dinner we ate the pork shank, fried chicken and fish. Everything was cooked to perfection and the ambiance was fantastic as always. Finally our server was wonderful, he answered every question with patience and consideration.

name: HSL
content: We enjoyed a festive and fun Christmas Eve at HSL - the perfect choice! With COVID safeties well adhered to, we feasted on a multi course dinner which truly inspired our family of four, including my fussy gourmet chef husband. The wine pairings matched well and introduced us to a delightful new varietal Jacquere. Although we very much enjoyed the NY Steak and the rack of lamb entrées, the pork tenderloin took the prize! Between the quality ingredients and execution, the clever wine pairings, the top notch service, and general ambiance, I hope to return to SLC someday soon to enjoy this restaurant again!

name: HSL
content: Came here on Christmas Eve and had the opportunity to try HSL's apple toast, and lamb rack and I was blown away. The servers here are exceptional and straight to the point in an atmosphere that demands comfort and class. Food presentation was immaculate and really bundled together my experience here. I highly recommend further complementing your meal with a glass of sparkling wine. I will be coming here again, thank you for the amazing meal HSL.

name: HSL
content: Lovely place, enjoyed it very much in preCOVID times (BC). excellent service. food is amazing. Miss it. Visited 2018.

name: HSL
content: Phenomenal! The food was delicious, the temperature of the food was perfect and the service was excellent. It's been a while since we had an amazing dining experience. We are already planning to go again next week.

name: HSL
content: HSL is the ultimate date spot in my mind. You can go here, get a few drinks each and some plates to share for less that $150 after tip. The food really is amazing. When I say most things are small plates, I mean small plates. You'll want to get a few different appetizers. The entrees are decently sized, and they're great to share as well! Everything is plated beautifully, and the quality of the food is top tier. The mood of the place is pretty dark and it's not loud. It's the perfect date mood, but I probably wouldn't go here for a work dinner meeting. Definitely give this place a shot for a upper middle price date! I will for sure be back as I've been time and time again!

name: HSL
content: So good that we came back for another birthday! This time I had the fried chicken and was impressed with how they were able to make fried chicken taste like a luxury comfort food. The breading was thin and crispy without being overly oily like many other fried chicken dishes. The meat was tender and juicy and the flavors paired very well with the choice of vegetables the chicken sat on top of. Very beautiful presentation and excited for the next holiday we get to spend here!

name: HSL
content: Beautiful place.  We really enjoyed the ambiance and the food.  Definitely will go back

name: HSL
content: I try not to leave reviews that are basically "yes, everything you've heard is correct," but ... everything you've heard is correct. Maybe the only "unique" thing I have to add to the many other reviews is that their outdoor dining setup is great. Now that the weather is colder I'm assuming they'll be pulling that for the winter, but I hope that they bring it back in the spring and keep it up even after we're out of the whole global pandemic thing. I'm more of a "sit at the bar" person in a non-COVID world, but the outdoor dining is super charming!To hit the marks:- Service is perfect. Attentive, but very relaxed. I feel bad that I don't remember our server's name, but she really helped make the evening by giving us some great suggestions, being super friendly, taking the right precautions because of COVID, and making sure we didn't run out of water or wine : )- The food is excellent; I'd put it top-10 in the area minimum. That said, the General Tsos cauliflower (which we didn't order this time) is awesome if you're in the mood for a twist on General Tsos, but it's fried cauliflower with a heavy sauce, so you do need to be in the mood for that : )Strongly, strongly recommend both HSL and its sister Handlebar in PC.

name: HSL
content: Great service and ambiance. The cauliflower is amazing with amazing flavors and cooked perfectly. Big fan of this place. Will definitely be going back!

name: HSL
content: The cauliflower keeps me coming back, I want to eat it every day. I highly recommend General Tsos cauliflower, the texture and flavor are perfect. The interior is so well designed, it's great for a girls night out, a romantic date, and really any celebration. I got the fried chicken and loved it. It's crispy and juicy and huge, so I'll enjoy leftovers too! For dessert I tried the chocolate torte. It was both tasty and fun to eat! The honey comb crumbs were a unique tasting experience.

name: HSL
content: This place is amazing! We had one of the best meals on our girls trip to SLC. Our server was super nice and the food was to die for. Everything we had was so good down to every detail. My favorite part was the burger and we almost decided against it. The prices are reasonable and they have lots of seating indoors and outdoors. I would love to come visit again and try more things on the menu! Bravo!

name: HSL
content: Fantastic food with helpful, friendly staff. A very hip joint with a creative menu. We'll definitely be back next time we're in SLC!

name: HSL
content: We had an great experience at HSL for my girlfriend's birthday. We were running late but they were very accommodating and held our seat for us. The drinks were average (and a bit overpriced) but the food was AMAZING. I had the pork ravioli and she had the flatbread. Some of the best food I've had. Will definitely be ordering the New York next time. I was hoping for a more intimate and romantic ambiance and HSL was more on the casual side, but that ended up being perfect. We were able to laugh and enjoy ourselves without fear of judgement and the wait staff was very attentive and polite. (As a server myself I applaud you!)Will always recommend HSL from now on. I'll be back soon!

name: HSL
content: One of our favorite spot in SLC. Food is always elevated and good. The Cauliflower is a must have. The ambience is amazing and service is always great.

name: HSL
content: worst customer service. Hostess obviously doesn't want to be there, and very confused about her job, couldn't handle a few parties arriving at the same time, mixed up names, party size and has no clue what to do and unable to set expectations, condescending attitude ignoring customers waiting to be seat and eating there. Very disappointed and poor service. Left for an Italian joint next block, which is great!

name: HSL
content: 5 stars for a fantastic accommodative dinner at HSL on Saturday night.  In the last 3 weeks we've eaten Saturday night dinner at Tiburon, Table X, and HSL.  Tiburon is still our favorite for a special night out but it's a close call with HSL now.  My wife started things off with a Prosecco.At HSL we had the Hamachi appetizer which was delicious and is almost always on the menu.  The flavors were so perfect.  The chickory salad was the best salad my wife and I have ever had.  She couldn't stop eating the salad but had to when the General Tso's cauliflower arrived.General Tso's cauliflower is a must and a must and good old stand by.Finally, the Duck Liver mousse with blackberry jam with some toasted bread.  That was so deliciousWe decided on the Choc Torte and also the Whisky Caramel pudding for dessert.  We had a couple scoops of ice cream to fill in the cracks.The final bill $107.  Compared to Tiburon and Table X, HSL is. Home run.  If you go, ask for Table 301 or 302 which have super high backs and offer somewhat of a secluded experience.

name: HSL
content: This place has some of the best food you will eat in SLC. Everything is delicious, the space is beautiful and well designed, and very much worth the steep prices. HSL is a must if you are looking for luxury in Salt Lake City!

name: HSL
content: So good! Went early on a Saturday night and received fresh food with friendly service. Great wine list, very accommodating staff. Wonderful date night.

name: HSL
content: Hands down best food we had in Utah. The cauliflower is unreal, the fried chicken is fantastic as well. The hostess is accommodating, polite, warm, and friendly. The rest of the staff is fantastic as well. We live in nyc and we were truly impressed by this place. It's just on a different level than the rest.

name: HSL
content: Ordered takeout and we were pleased with the masked service. The food was mixed. My fries and kale salad were delicious and the burger was good. The duck appetizer was also a winner as was the ice cream bar. The fried chicken didn't meet my husband's expectations and the shrimp dish my son had had too much going on. We will likely return and see if we can find other things we like on the menu.

name: HSL
content: On a busy Saturday night, there was only seating available at the comunal or the couches which face toward the windows. We took the couch and I'm so glad! It was cozy, we had a good conversation and there's full service. The warm toast with apple and goat cheese I think.. oh it was to die for! My husband loved the salmon and I loved my burger; although sometimes I think good old-fashioned greasy burgers are better than gourmet hamburgers that use all the fancy things.. but I could not deny the deliciousness of the meat.

name: HSL
content: Very good restaurant. No question about it. Highs: spicy fried cauliflower was amazing. The cilantro and peppers complemented this dish perfectly. Buttermilk biscuit. Unreal. The salt was the game changer. SO GOOD. the honey, butter, salt and biscuit is just wow town. They have topo chico. Enough said. Lows:Burger. I feel like it fell a little short of expectations. Very good, no question, but the tomato jam and white cheese (which I don't think was American) were nice, but not great. The pickled cabbage as well. As a whole it was a nice burger, but again, not great. Best part was the bun.Fries. Over salted. My mouth is still reeling from the salt. Service. Everyone was totally nice and great, but didn't totally know what they were talking about. I asked about the burger and the waitress said "rated the best burger in Utah", and naturally I asked, "by whom", which she then didn't know who had rated it so highly, so naturally I was skeptical. Then I asked about their blend of beef (cause I love burgs) and what they told me just didn't seem right.Anyways. Good. Not great. Would return to try the chicken and get the biscuit again!

name: HSL
content: Over the last couple years, I've spent about a week in Salt Lake City on business. The first time, in late 2018, I had dinner at HSL. That first visit, I was struck by the restaurant's gorgeous ambiance, and the excellent service. I ordered a toast app and the heralded General Tso's Cauliflower along with a cocktail (bourbon-based, I believe, and disappointing), and while the presentation was gorgeous and the food was tasty, it didn't quite live up to my expectations. But, in all fairness, even the chef thought my meal was too carb-heavy. So there is that.And let's just be honest, okay? This is Salt Lake City. It's not LA or New York or SF or any of your other major food cities. So expectations should be tapered a bit. Also, I have found, in my SLC eating expeditions, that Utahns really like salt. In Salt Lake. Haha--get it? But I'm not joking--lots of salt.Anyway, I was in SLC again at the end of January, right before we were widely aware of COVID, for the Silicon Slopes Tech Summit. And I wanted to give HSL another shot. This time, the restaurant was hoppin' (being popular with locals + massive tech summit + Sundance = busy), and even though it took a while to be seated, service was still great. This time I got a gin-based cocktail, which I didn't like much (probably just get wine here), the baby kale salad, and the apple toast. This time, the food was DELICIOUS, in addition to being beautiful. If you're in SLC, go here. If you live in SLC, go here. It's a gem.

name: HSL
content: Great food!  Great wait staff! We had friends in town and it was the perfect place for large gatherings.  Steak salad was awesome!

name: HSL
content: 5 star food & waiter reduced to 3 star review - poor management decision to not credit a glass of wine returned that tasted terrible - either corked or just terrible - replaced by ordering another glass of a recognized Pinot - management decided to charge for glass not touched - likely won't go back-

name: HSL
content: Good god we had a great meal here. Started the the Hamachi Crudo, which might as well have been candy. Then on to the apple toast which was pleasingly crunch and doughy all at once. It only got better when the big show arrived, general tso cauliflower and the pork chop. This place is world class, every dish punches you in the face with flavor and delightful textures.

name: HSL
content: Who knew there was a restaurant of this caliber in SLC?  I was in town for business and needed a place to take some clients to dinner.  Someone had suggested HSL so I called and got a reservation (call if their on line booking shows them full- there might be availability)It was a snowy night and we got to the restaurant a little early for our reservation.  It was nice to pull open the door and see the warmth in the decor and lighting, immediately making you feel like you were in a good spot.  I was seated immediately and ordered a drink wile I waited for the rest of our party.Our server, Alex, was great with plenty of suggestions on what we should order from the menu.  We started with some warm olives, the meat and cheese plate, and the cauliflower.   All were delicious but that cauliflower was out of this world!  If tis on the menu- order it!For our entrees most went with the pork chop which was huge and I had the fish of the day which was delicious.But here's my tip- save room for the caramel pudding!  This is their signature dessert and is amazing!  I don't know how they make it but I seriously wanted to lick the jar it came in.If you drive- please note that they have a small lot in the back that fills up quickly so you may find yourself looking for street parking.  And don't make the mistake that I did- the back door by the parking lot is locked so you will need to walk around the front of the restaurant to gain entry.All in all a great choice for a special dinner in Salt Lake!  You can bet I will be back!

name: HSL
content: Our favorite restaurant in SLC and one of our all time favorites. The restaurant the food the service is all top-notch and you have an epic dining experience it is a fantastic fabulous spectacular restaurant I cannot rave more highly about the restaurant the wine list the cocktails the food all just delicious and amazing

name: HSL
content: Five star visit to HSL! Briar Handly delivers not only creative and delicious cuisine, he delivers an experience...one that my husband and I will not soon forget. Briar Handly was recently placed on the semi-finalist list for the "Best Chef", James Beard award and there is not a single question why after eating his food. He is a truly an expert in his field and deserves every single accolade that comes to him.On a Saturday night, this thoughtfully designed space is alive and full of energy. The service is on point. Our server, Erickson, was as professional as they come and anticipated our every need. As plant-based diners, he was knowledgeable about the menu and what could be modified to meet our needs. Accommodations were easily made and we were made to feel welcome and appreciated. Like its sister restaurant in Park City (Handle), HSL is a secret spot for high level plant-based cuisine while also expertly catering to omnivores. Thank you to Briar, Erickson, and the whole HSL team. We LOVED our Saturday night with you and look forward to our next visit.

name: HSL
content: Amazing service, amazing ambiance, and amazing food. Can't say enough good things about this place, myself and my party were blown away by all that HSL had to offer. We tried multiple dishes but were particular impressed with the New York steak which was cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection, the apple toast appetizer, and the apple galette dessert (which was crusted in potato chips, um, yum!!). We also enjoyed the Pok Pok sodas, which were unique and flavorful. This place is worth every penny, it's a must try in SLC!

name: HSL
content: My older brother left a two-star review here, saying the price is not worth the taste or quality. Let me begin with our server, Ehsan. He was friendly, prompt, and informative. My ignorant older brother has an extremely immature palate, and is a coward. The presentation of every dish was of highly exquisite. The cauliflower: to die for. The contemporary digs, paired with the modern design, made for a wonderful night out. My brother's life is a fool's errand.

name: HSL
content: Wow!!Food was great!! And the macadamia Ice-cream was to die for Highly Recommended!!

name: HSL
content: The Food was exceptional!  We had a group of 8 and were celebrating a birthday.  Since we had a larger group we tried several items and shared them.  Definitely the way to go as it would be difficult to pick just one item as they ALL stood out and were amazing and delicious.  The service was spot on, attentive but not intrusive.  Our waiter kept our drinks, food and suggestions of what to try, coming.  He never missed a beat.  I highly recommend this place.  I will tell everyone I know who goes to Salt Lake City.  Thank you!!!

name: HSL
content: Love this place! The decor and atmosphere is beautiful, and the food is delicious. I have to get the general tso's cauliflower every time.

name: HSL
content: Some of the best cocktails I've ever had in Utah! Great atmosphere. Wonderful service.

name: HSL
content: The ambiance and decor here is amazing. Cocktails are incredibly tasty and well made. Only knocking a star because I wasn't blown away by the food. I would definitely come back here again for cocktails though. They were absolutely divine.

name: HSL
content: Best restaurant I've found in SLC thus far. Everything we have tried has been good and their charcuterie board is delicious and fun to pair with wine!

name: HSL
content: This is a fantastic restaurant with very unique twists on the standard American menu. Get the cauliflower and apple bread!! The Pork Shank was also incredible.

name: HSL
content: Definitely a delicious burger. I would give HSL 4.5 stars if I could. It has a great ambient and good service. The only weird aspect of this experience was the change in water temperature as the meal went on. At the beginning of the night we were offered 3 choices of water, and we chose tap water. The water that was given to us was basically room temperature. Seems odd for they price you pay. Then after we ordered food, the waiter asked again what our drink choice was. We stuck with water. Then as we needed refills, the water was noticeably colder than the water that was originally poured. Maybe this is a tactic to get you to order something other than water? I would've liked cold water the first time around, and while it didn't detract from the overall experience it was very odd. Also if you want to go on a Friday night make reservations. They have areas that are open to walk ins, but if you're looking to have your own table or not worry about spots being taken then make a reservation.

name: HSL
content: First time visitor. Found HSL from blogs and reviews. Had the Burger which had universal great reviews.Pros: Friendly staff, great service, no problems with restaurant operations. High quality food. I'd definitely come back.Cons: Zero flavor to the burger. I had to dip it in the ketchup to get any flavor.  I asked for medium, got well done. Once upon a time, the burger might have been a perfect burger but it's an overrated, overpriced slider for $16. Too bad. Good food quality but for the money, not worth your time. With zero flavor and a tiny portion, it's a dud. Give us a high quality, well flavored burger and not some poor excuse for a "gourmet" burger.

name: HSL
content: Everything here is delicious! We ordered a ton of food and I wish the table was bigger for a better spread. My favorite of the night was the scallops tostada. These scallops were humongous and cooked oh so perfectly! The avocado purée was so good I made sure I got every bit off the plate! It's also not on your typical tostada, instead on a few chips. But who cares! The scallops were amazing!The chicories + broccolini salad was delicious and dressed nicely. I loved that they grilled the broccolini then cut it up for easier eating. The chopped marcona almonds were a great addition for texture. I forgot there were dates hidden in here and it was a very pleasant surprise! The charcuterie plate (meat + cheese) had all sorts of cheese (head cheese, bleu cheese, mint and lavender cheese, and a few others I can't name) house pickled cucumbers and cauliflower, blood sausage and prosciutto. I didn't care for the sour dough bread, but it was on the plate.The wood fired flat bread is one of the best I've had in SLC. I love pizza and this goes in my top 3 rankings of pizza! It must be the pesto and burrata. This is a must try!The beet salad is a colorful dish! The strawberry herb gelee with the beets is unbelievably delicious and this is also needs to be added on your eating list. This was basically my dessert. Just enough sweetness! I wanted a huge bone for the pork shank, but it was a bitty bone. Still cute and plated very well. The shank was prepared by sous vide and marinated in Frank's hot sauce. Pork was tender, but there were some tough parts that my friend loved. He said it was the tendons? I'm not sure. I wish it was a different sauce other than franks, because I associate it with chicken, but it was still good.

name: HSL
content: Stopped here the last night I was in SLC after skiing all day. Based on Yelp rating and images, I figured this would be similar to some of my favorite bistro-type restaurants in Pittsburgh.  I originally came here with an entree in mind having seen it on their website's menu, only to realize the menu they had posted had been updated and did not have that item on it.  With that said, still plenty of options.  Started with scallop tostadas.  Scallops perfectly cooked and love anything with avocado.  Good portion.  I also ordered a second entree, which I asked the waiter what he recommended given I pretty much eat anything.  He recommended the burger, which typically I dont order for dinner at a place like this but decided if its recommended it has to be good.  Burger looked good, but the meat or the pairing was off.  It was super sweet, which was not what I would want ever in a burger.  Fries were ok, but nothing special.  Wanted to like HSL more, but it was very meh.  Glad I tried it, but not a place I would go back to over many other options.

name: HSL
content: Eclectic menu, perfect for sharing, and good for groups. Amazing cocktails and impeccable service. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and it didn't feel crowded even though the restaurant was packed. The menu changes but get the apple toast if you can!

name: HSL
content: We came with a group  of friends and everyone was impressed. Loved the cocktails and wine selection as much as the appetizers. Salmon was delectable. Ice cream and sorbet was made for royalty.

name: HSL
content: Delicious. All things delicious and creative. Even if you only go for the cauliflower, it is worth the trip.

name: HSL
content: Friends told me I had to come here and check it out. I shared the Cauliflower App (This is money!! So amazing!!) and had the Pork Shank (another incredible dish!! Wow!!) for dinner. Check out my photos. Our server was great and there was a casual atmosphere. Got to come back to try some other tasty option!!

name: HSL
content: I love this place! My husband found this place through a co-worker where he works- The lodge at blue sky. They are all foodies and they highly recommended this place for a casual dinner. The vibe reminded me of napa and very cali- young, fun, wild.

name: HSL
content: As always the food was amazing. We sat at the bar and had the Cauliflower and warm olives for an appetizer. If you had to pick one, do the cauliflower. For our main course we had the tostada and pork shank. The pork shank is cooked in Franks Rwd  . Sauce so there is a little  bit of spice, but nothing that is to much. The service was great too, the bartender was  very attentive and made great drinks.

name: HSL
content: My server was very attentive and polite and so was the lady who check in my coat. The food was excellent and I highly recommend their market fish option. The fish I had was cook to perfection and paired nicely with a light sauce and tender veggies. That said, the service was unacceptably slow. I receive my food 40 minutes after my starter.

name: HSL
content: This place is amazing.  The ambience s lovely and the food is bth beautiful and delicious.  We sat at the bar service was good.  Great value. High quality and reasonably priced

name: HSL
content: Loved HSL! We stopped here for our final dinner before leaving SLC and we are so glad we did. It is pricy, but being from LA, it lines up with what the common cost for high class food is, no complaints.We started with the scallop tostada as an appetizer and it was perfect for the two of us. A bit on the salty side but the scallops were made well and the combination of the chip, scallop, and fixings paired beautifully. I enjoyed every bite of this dish. We shared the pappardelle for our entree and again, it was perfect for the two of us. The truffle ricotta gave the dish a subtle hint of delicious truffle that did not overpower, which truffle often can. The pasta tasted homemade and the sauce was slightly spicy and delicious. We were very pleased with our experience at HSL and very pleased with what we ordered. If we lived in SLC, we would be back!

name: HSL
content: One of the best places I've been to since being in SLC. I've been there twice! The pork shank was amazing! The service was great. The waiters tell you the good and bad about each dish. Love their honesty! They also check in at the right moments and make sure you have everything that you need but it's not overwhelming.

name: HSL
content: Loved this place. Scrumptious! I'd try the Cauliflower  General Tso's. Cocktails are great too.

name: HSL
content: Jess is the best server! She totally made our night. Aside from the exceptional service the food was phenomenal. I had the set menu for NYE however, I assume the steaks are on the menu year around and you can't go wrong! The drinks were great and exceptionally crafted. Highly recommend

name: HSL
content: Do you ever really want to like a place but it's off somehow?  That sums up HSL to me. The decor is lovely. Reservation seated immediately. Our server was pleasant and enthusiastic about the menu offerings. His suggestions were spot on. So why a four?The meal was rushed. Although the server gave us plenty of time to decide cocktails, apps and entrees it all came too fast. Drink order and apps placed and in a nano second both appetizers appeared. Before the cocktails. Okay. And it's not as if they were incredibly busy and the bar was backed up. Drinks arrive (and they were marvelous) and about half way finished with apps and here come the entrees. It's not like we were eating slowly. Husband had the pork shank. It was tasty but not crazy about tepid meat. Again just a feeling that everything was sitting around and BAM! just waiting to be plated. It was fine, but just not the lovely, relaxed meal I was looking forward to. No need to rush a meal to turn a table on a Sunday night with no wait.

name: HSL
content: It's easy to miss this place...in fact I drove right by it...FYI there is a parking lot behind the building.The staff is amazing...the bartender knows her stuff and the waiter had great recommendations.If your looking for a normal meat and potatoes place...this isn't the place for you...their items are trendy and beautiful.If you like expanding your palate...this is the place for you!

name: HSL
content: We came to this restaurant because of high rating review but only learned the experience was very different from their review description. Several servers were very rude and didn't have a sh*-*about you. The food was average and one of our dishes was so salty as well. Not worth the price

name: HSL
content: Super stylish and very busy. Our waiter, Erickson was top notch. Food was excellent. Creative, cooked perfectly and surprisingly quick to the table.   Will definitely come again.

name: HSL
content: Wow, amazing! The atmosphere, food and service were all 5 stars. We got the sourdough/apple and the cauliflower appetizers, and then the fish dish (Atlantic Char today) and the broccolini salad. All of them were amazing, but I think the sourdough appetizer was our favorite. Highly recommend!

name: HSL
content: HSL is definitely more of a $$$ restaurant but it is amazing! We started with the oh so famous cauliflower dish and it met all expectations. My boyfriend was very reluctant as he isn't really a cauliflower kinda person but he loved it and we licked the bowl clean. Truly a great vegetarian dish that everyone can get behind. Onto the entres: I got the market fish which happened to be a trout. The fish was the melt in your mouth type yet seared on the outside. It was served with sautéd mushrooms and a side of something weird I didn't love. My boyfriend got the fried chicken. My favorite part was the side of potatoes with a balsamic vinagrete glaze. Truth be told, I liked the fish but I loved the chicken. For dessert we had the chocolate torte with pear sorbet and freeze dried honeycomb. (!!) AMAZING!!! The combination of flavors was spectacular. All in all, I loved the experience. The ambiance is great, the flavors are unique and the menu is always changing for lots of variety.

name: HSL
content: Excellent food, excellent drinks, excellent service. Get the homemade pasta! Favorite dish at our table (we ordered 4 of their top dishes). That pasta was incredible!!!

name: HSL
content: We stopped by at 4:45-4:50pm Sunday. There was an Open sign by the window so we went in. However the waitress told us they were not open(opens at 5 pm). And we asked whether we can wait inside since it was cold outside. She answered with one simple word NO. This is actually one of the rudest conversations we ever had in a restaurant. We left immediately and switched to another restaurant, the waitress of which politely invited us to sit and wait inside since there was just several minutes before it opened.

name: HSL
content: Best little SLC treat! Hipster, but not pretentious. Great food, atmosphere and service. Definitely coming back next time in Utah.

name: HSL
content: HSL has incredible food!  We had the cauliflower, which was to die for!  And the honey crisp apple bread was so flavorful!  We also had a fish dish and a pasta.  Both of them were delicious!  This was possibly the most interesting food I've ever eaten in Utah!  The flavors were complex and delightful.  Definitely worth going out for!  A real treat!

name: HSL
content: Came here for dinner with two friends. We ordered the cauliflower to start which was delicious. I had the the pork and it was very tender and flavorful. My partner had the fried chicken which was also good, but we both preferred my dish. We tried the chocolate ganache for dessert which was very rich. The honeycomb that came with the ganache was really good. The inside of the restaurant was cute with comfortable seating and nice atmosphere. Our waiter was also very helpful in describing each dish and the different components to us. Would definitely come back to try different dishes (:

name: HSL
content: Wow! The service here was absolutely great. We came to HSL to celebrate a birthday, and all ordered different dishes to try. I ordered the Pork Shank, and loved how well the flavours complemented each other! It was a very unique experience as their flavour profiles were extremely well thought out. However, my favourite was definitely the pork chops! It was cooked to perfection and the top of the pork chops had a nice crisp to it! I'd definitely come back here again for any special occasions.

name: HSL
content: Recommed, would go again!! Holy smokes this place is amazing. Enjoyed their seasonal pork dish, with house pickled fried green tomatoes, with the acid countering the fatty richness of the pork chop. It was cooked perfectly, medium rare, bone in and f'n luscious! The dish was wonderfully balanced, as well as my rye cocktail. The smallish dining room was warm and enjoying themselves. This is a well loved place.

name: HSL
content: Great food well presented by smart and engaged staff members. Great romantic setting and fantastic cocktails!!Go with the Rye drink or any of the roulettes

name: HSL
content: Not worth the price.  Nothing fancy enough to deserve the price. Not a single menu item good enough to warrant tube fancy rate.

name: HSL
content: So we were only in Salt Lake City for one night and had tons of options but we decided to give this place a try. It was amazing! The service was wonderful and the food was impeccable. The atmosphere was nicely lit with a very soft and quaint ambience. The decorations and plants made the place look very modern without being over the top fancy. If you are looking for a great place for date night this is it! While more upscale, it offers the perfect setting for great conversation and getting to know one another. The food portions filled us up without making us fill super stuffed and we ate everything on our plates! The drinks were also very creative and original. We will be visiting again!

name: HSL
content: HSL is a neat spot with lots of potential. Service was great and the ambience was trendy yet comfortable. Unfortunately I was not swept off my feet by the food. Cauliflower is one of their signature dish. It was tasty on the first bite but I was quickly overwhelmed by sauce. The salmon (market fish offering) and diver scallops also came in a bit too salty. Perhaps HSL is a better match for those who prefer stronger favors. The homemade ice cream were wonderful though.

name: HSL
content: The food is very good and the service is awesomeThere are a lot of vegan and vegetarian optionsThe honey crisp apple with sourdough was very good. It was sweet and savory at the same time. The chicory broccolini salad was delicious. I thought the Kung pal cauliflower was ok. It was very flavorful but a little heavy because it was deep friedThe apple pie is vegan and it was delicious!

name: HSL
content: Probably my favorite restaurant in SLC. Excellent food, near downtown, and the service is good. The menu rotates regularly, so you're always able to try something new. Makes for a great date spot.

name: HSL
content: Omg, Handle park city and HSL are by far the best restaurants in Utah. Amazing local food prepared daily, great service and cocktails. It's a bucket list for sure!!!!

name: HSL
content: Super yummy!!! Will be back FOR SURE! The service is great and they have an amazing burger.

name: HSL
content: I had the privilege of coming here for my 27th birthday, we had a nice range of dishes. My favorite, which we got 3 of because we couldn't get enough was called the cauliflower. I order the fried chicken, extremely tender. The word fire flatbread was more sweet than I expected. The pork shank was delicious, but on the sweeter side.The market fish, this was my favorite dish. The roasted mushroom and corn purée was everything I needed and more. The fish was great, just wish it didn't have the skin on it.

name: HSL
content: The ambiance and decor was the highlight of my visit. I was disappointed in the fact that they don't serve fountain soda and the meal left me desiring more. The tomato jam with my burger was great, but the rest really didn't live up to the hype. It was just a meh burger.

name: HSL
content: This may be my new favorite restaurant in SLC. If it isn't my absolutely favorite, it's at least up there.First off, the people are so nice. Friends and I have all commented on how great our servers have been. The vibe is cool, and reservations are recommended. And now for the best part. The food.As someone who likes to try new food, eating tapas style is the ultimate dream. I love getting to try multiple dishes instead of the one I order. The menu changes seasonally, so who knows what they may have when you are there. My favorites I've tried are the General Tsao's Cauliflower, Chicories & Broccoli, and the Fish Tostada. I hear the burger is absolutely amazing, but I don't eat beef.They really do a great job with flavors here and each dish is clearly treated with such care. I can't wait to go back.

name: HSL
content: I came here with a few friends and I had a pretty pleasant time. The food was pretty decent for the price. Service here was also polite and really helpful in making suggestions on the more loved dishes. A suggestion for improvement though is maybe not scheduling reserved parties too closely together because at the end of our dinner, we felt slightly rushed to leave when you guys made it known there's another party next to take our table.

name: HSL
content: Always solid, pork shank never lets me down, fried chick also amazing.Also the cauliflower starter, and the crudo starter were great.

name: HSL
content: Loved this place. Beautifully decorated. Great food. Great service. Have the fried chicken - it is light and delicious. Cool vibe. Nice outdoor seating too.

name: HSL
content: Excellent food, creative combinations without being intimidatingly weird. A new downtown favorite.

name: Whiskey Street
content: This was the only near by place that was open on Sunday night and it had decent reviews. I decided to try it. I was going to order burger at first but asked to substitute cedar for Swiss cheese and they said they don't have any. So I ordered the Special which was pasta with grilled chicken and veggies... First piece of chicken tasted good but unfortunately that was the only piece that was fully cooked. The rest of the chicken was raw, crunchy and tasted awful. It was close to midnight and I didn't want to even bother sending it back. I went back to my hotel hungry.

name: Whiskey Street
content: The selection of whiskey is extraordinary in the west not just in Utah.  Drinks are good.  Food is OK.  Service is a hit or miss and could use improvements.

name: Whiskey Street
