content: We had a Long week and wanted good food and relaxing atmosphere, we were pleasantly surprised. Service was spot on, amazing Bourbon selection  and not overly priced. Had the chili burger with fries, burger was great and fries were hot and cooked perfectly. Awesome we will be back on next trip.

name: Whiskey Street
content: My first impression of this place was not so good. I found the wait staff to be inattentive and not very knowledgeable about the whiskey I wanted to try. A spot opened at the bar, so I moved there. The man (sorry, I'm terrible with names) behind the bar completely changed my mind. They were out of some of the things I wanted to try but he was quick with a recommendation for something else and all were excellent. I'll be back next time I'm in town

name: Whiskey Street
content: Love the peanut butter s'more and coffee and donut (THE BEST crème brûlée IVE HAD) The selection of whiskey is phenomenal. Can't wait to visit again!!!!!

name: Whiskey Street
content: I took my Son and Daughter in law here for His birthday. What an awesome experience. Great setting in the tall booths. And the food! What a great menu. My Daughter raved about the tuna! I got the Cajun plate that was the best. Ferry accommodating and friendly. Definitely a be back!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Good food, interesting food and drink selection. Rude guy at the bar yelled at me for not wearing a mask for the 4 feet from my table to the exit when leaving.

name: Whiskey Street
content: This restaurant has a huge selection of mixed drinks and an even bigger list of whiskey and Scotch. The food served here was a selection of good pub burgers and streak sandwiches with an assortment of yummy appetizers and everything came with amazing garlic fries. The old fashioned drink I ordered was on point. A little pricy, but a good solid restaurant.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Massive drink menu, and the cocktails are fantastic! We've only done apps here, and all of them were great. Cheese curds were my favorite. Good atmosphere and service.

name: Whiskey Street
content: This place was pretty good. I've been in Utah for about one month for work. Our server was nice, which hasn't been common for Utah. The cocktails were definitely the better ones I have had. I am only giving them 4 stars because their bouncers at the front are incredibly rude. I get that you need to check IDs but I definitely know I do not look remotely close to 21 or younger. They need to be a little more professional with customers, it kills the whole mood.

name: Whiskey Street
content: This place was recommended by several friends. I can't say enough how disappointed we were. We arrived 10min early to be told that we should go have a drink elsewhere since our table wasn't ready. 10min later we were called to come back. We were sat at a "booth" the waitress took our order for drinks and appetizers. The fried pickles are huge and mainly batter. As well as the cheese curds. Absolutely no flavor and just fried batter. Our main course was decent. As my friend who was celebrating her bday went to the restroom we called our waitress over to let her know it was her birthday if she could bring a desert with a candle at the end of dinner. She was extremely loud and kept talking and offering other options as our friend was coming back from the restroom. She brought the cake with the candle while we were still having dinner! Ridiculous. We decided to have a last drink before leaving the table was never cleared to the point that the waitress struggled to find room on the table to set the drinks. Definitely not a great or fun experience.

name: Whiskey Street
content: A few friends recommend this place for brunch/lunch and it did not disappoint. The long list of cocktails and whiskey is impressive to say the least. There is even a solid amount of food choices. We had a little issue with the wings, since they are smoked they were pink inside so we sent them back. Our waitress was awesome (I wish I got her name)  and had the manger come over and explain the wings were smoked for hours and that's why they were pink. They even sent over a fresh order to just be sure. Awesome experience overall!

name: Whiskey Street
content: We decided to try them out and are so glad we did! The food was phenomenal! We didn't get a drink this time but they have a huge selection. Our waiter was great as well!

name: Whiskey Street
content: This bar was like a little sliver of NYC. The ambience is fantastic! We were lucky to snag a patio seat so I highly advise making reservations because this place is in high demand!The cocktail list is impressive. I had the cucumber Collin which had all of the earthy, sweet and savory notes that I crave in a drink. For my dinner, I had the lump crab cake salad and the portobello mushroom sandwich. The salad was okay (I wish it had more crab) but for what little crab was there, it was extremely tasty! And the mushroom sandwich... it was excellent!!! It was packed full of flavor, the bean sprouts added a nice crunch and the champagne vinaigrette added some nice flavor.

name: Whiskey Street
content: On there site they say that they are registered as restaurant but they are not so fuck them all to hell

name: Whiskey Street
content: I have just 4 words for you. Bourbon Bacon Caramel Popcorn. Thats it. End of review! Ok, ok... I'm going to add more because they deserve it! It was the weekend of Valentines day and a Friday night! The wait was an hour so we went a few doors down and got some drinks while we waited. THEY ARE WELL WORTH THE WAIT!!! The prices are what I expect from a steakhouse. We tried a few appetizers since we had already eaten a full dinner. I had the Polenta Poutine, sampled the cheese curds, the table also ordered the Poke and Calamari and WE FINISHED EVERY BITE. And of course we all DEVOURED the Bourbon Bacon Caramel Popcorn. I also ordered 2 for the road.  IT'S. THAT. GOOD. (Have I said that enough times now?) anyways... we enjoyed some whiskeys and of course Mountain West Hard Cider (because I love the ruby) and enjoyed the company, ambiance and experience. I will be back FOR SURE.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Um...what can I say. One of our favorite places in Salt Lake City! I highly recommend the ahi tuna!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Cool vibe, friendly bartender.  Great cocktails.  Nice menu of many comfort type dishes.  Try the polenta fries - amazing.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Great experience here on a weeknight. It was filled with customers to their legal limit in the pandemic. Everyone was spaced apart more than 6 feet even at the bar. The staff was very friendly, courteous, and respectful with regard to covid. The bartender (forgot her name) was extremely knowledgable about whiskey, etc and taught us a great deal about them. She was very patient as well. 1. Lamb chops - Big portions, cooked medium how I like it. Grilled tasting which was amazing. Came with spinach with garlic, and potatoes. 2. Truffle fries - Came out fresh. Big portion as well. Overall, had a great time here and will definitely be back in the near future! Highly recommended!

name: Whiskey Street
content: We really enjoyed Whiskey Street.  Bourbon selection was quite extensive & so was the beer offerings.  Had their Asian wings from Appetizer menu.  They were fantastic.  Then each had the Steak sandwich which was like just having a steak.  Very tasty and a pretty good size.  Lots of the delicious Truffle Parmesan Fries to go with it.  Wait staff was friendly & appropriately attentive.  We loved the atmosphere.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Everything about Whiskey Street deserves five stars! I've been frequenting this establishment since moving to Utah ten years ago. It's iconic. The atmosphere, the drinks, the food, and the service are all outstanding. Even their safety measures during these apocovidalyptic times deserves high marks. Whiskey Street serves up some of the best bar food in the state. (Hell, maybe some of the best in the country.) Our group of three shared the fried calamari, fried cheese curds, and pork belly lettuce wraps. And we were in appetizer heaven. It's incredible how Whiskey Street always manages to make pub fare classics taste like Michelin worthy meals. Absolutely amazing, as always!

name: Whiskey Street
content: We hit up this spot based on a recommendation from a friend. He suggested we get the spicy Asian wings and the short rib poutine. We decided to also get the crab Louis salad since we weren't sure if it would be enough food. Well, the two appetizers are incredibly generous in portion size, so we probably would have been fine! We also both got cocktails - a high street Boston sour for me and a house old fashion for my fiancé. First, drinks - I'm personally not big into dark liquor so I knew I wanted a sour. The waitress recommended the high street Bourbon sour, which has rye, egg white, bitters, and lemon in it. It was delightfully citrusy and foamy with the most delicious maraschino cherry on top. On the other hand, my fiancé does enjoy dark liquor so he went with a classic old fashion. His thoughts - "it was good, just the right amount of orange."Now, for the food. For the ribs, we went with medium spice. We're living in Texas, so it turns out that medium spice here = no spice. Noted - we'll be sure to order it hotter next time! Otherwise the glaze on the top was sticky and sweet. The poutine was by far my favorite! So savory! Those cheese curds! The perfectly soft boiled egg. Wow. The textures and flavors in this dish were perfect. I would definitely order this one again. Now, the salad was obviously much less savory than the other two dishes. We went with a salad to get some veggies in. I loved the tempura asparagus, and the grape tomatoes added some nice, bright acidity. They are generous with the amount of crab they give you and overall, I felt that the flavors meshed well together.We left feeling fat and happy! We would definitely come back and recommend this place to others. 5 stars!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Can be a little crowded at times, but it has such a fun vibe and the food and drinks are amazing. The grilled cheese is insanely good. Great downtown vibe.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Very delicious buffalo cauliflower, it was honestly AMAZING and their steak was amazing! I also tried the Asian wings which were good and the honey bourbon chicken. They had a lot of cool drinks and the vibe of this place was awesome. I also loved how late this place stayed open because I'm a night owl. The only downfall that sucked was the way they do their seating /waitlist/waiting area. So basically, they don't take your name down on a waiting list and they won't take your number or any information down. You literally just have to wait outside in the freezing cold weather by this little rinky-dink heater and wait for a table. Whether it's 10 minutes or an hour, nobody wants to wait in the freezing cold weather outside. The food is good, but it isn't worth the frostbite. It does not make any sense whatsoever why you can't put your name down and come back during a certain time frame, especially since there's nowhere to really wait and how cold it is at night. Please fix this massive issue and your customers will be much happier.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Not bad but not great!! The fireball definitely made the cheeseburger taste better! I couldn't figure out what was the Smokey taste on the fries but turns out it was in the ketchup.

name: Whiskey Street
content: We came to Whiskey Street for Sunday Brunch and we were not disappointed! Everything that we ordered was great. I had the classic Eggs Benedict, my GF had the Eggs Florentine, and our friend had one Crab Benedict ala carte and one Irish Stout pancake with Bailey's whipped cream. They both also ordered an Irish Coffee that came with the Bailey's whipped cream, and I had a Cuban cocktail. All of the food was delicious and the drinks were great. There were a few small hiccups (like the Bailey's cream not coming out and having to be asked for), but overall it was very, very good. We would have brunch there again for sure.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Great bar cool drinks. Awesome atmosphere! Highly recommend the place. Also get the $125 drink it's amazing lol! (Really only $18)

name: Whiskey Street
content: The food is amazing! The presentation and the taste. The only bad thing that I could say is that the bartender seemed to have little to no education or knowledge on any of the whiskeys/scotch we asked about. If we're paying more than 20$ and more for a pour we ask for a little bit of description.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Good food and drinks! I had the calamari, pork belly lettuce wraps, and steak salad. All were really good! The drinks were good as well and there is a large selection. The service was a little slow but other than that it was a good time

name: Whiskey Street
content: Service is great! Very good food. Definitely recommend the fried pickles. Definitely a whiskey lover's dream. So many options!

name: Whiskey Street
content: I love this restaurant. We went there last night to celebrate our anniversary, and had a lovely time. The servers are honestly so impressive. They know so much about drink ingredients--where they come from, why they have the names they do, flavor profiles, et cetera. I appreciate when servers have both the patience and knowledge to answer my questions.We struggled to decide what to order, as the menu is so big! My partner ordered the Elder Bourbon. It was delicious and had a simple but elegant presentation. I ordered an equally delicious drink with bourbon and thyme. It was a drink you wanted to sip and savor (and believe me, I did!). Having just had drinks at Fletcher's in Park City and been disappointed by both the enormous price tag for a subpar drink, I was pleasantly surprised that Whiskey Street offers supremely high quality cocktails for $8-18 (I think mine was only $10-12).I had the pasta bolognese special and a side caesar. GET THE CAESAR SALAD. Oh my god, it is fantastic! I cannot stress this enough. The side comes as a small head of perfectly grilled romaine with a thick and flavorful dressing drizzled over it. The presentation was stunning and the woody/charred flavor unmatched. The pasta was just okay. It lacked the meaty crumbles I expected to find in a bolognese, and the noodles were very stiff (reminded me of very thick ramen and undercooked ramen).My partner had the Bourbon Salmon. I had a bite and it was packed with flavor and cooked excellently. He said that while the flavor was great for a few bites, it quickly became overpowering and too rich to keep eating. Next time we intend to try a few of their appetizers, as they all sound so good!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Came here for a tinder date one autumn eve; at a time when my pockets were often empty. A well off group of businessmen thought we were a cute couple and gave use whiskey that I couldn't afford and she couldn't metabolize. All's well that ends well, so they say. Maybe one day when the plague has subsided I'll be able to return to this handsome establishment with my wife and refrain from sharing the story.

name: Whiskey Street
content: So happy to see this place open! Very strict social distancing so I stopped by to have a drink. Their signature Old Fashioned was excellent. I had already eaten but will now return to eat here on my next visit. I did have the boubon bacon popcorn because it sounded so awesome.....it was!!!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Great food, best beer selection around, and about any bourbon you could want.  Always my go-to when I'm in the Lake.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Gotta be honest, coming for brunch is a disappointment and I'm sure dinner is way better. Being that we ate dinner at the next door restaurant, white horse, and they basically share the same menu/ kitchen. The food for dinner was great! But the review is based off brunch and brunch is pretty much re heated dinner leftovers. The bourbon bacon popcorn was not at all fresh, it was stale and left over. Also the short rib (friend ordered the short rib Benedict's and I ordered the short rib hash) was also left over and reheated from dinner. It was not as tender as it had been because my friend also had short ribs for dinner a few days prior here. So just beware that brunch is reheated dinner leftovers. Otherwise if it had been made fresh it would of been great. The sticky buns tasted old too, waaaay too hard of a chew and leaves the pure hard sugar coat stuck in your teeth. However my fav pet of this breakfast was the amaretto coffee cocktail. That was delicious! And they do give you a lot of food so it's a good bang for your buck.

name: Whiskey Street
content: They take covid precautions seriously here! My husband and I enjoyed a relaxing dinner and cocktails here! The food is fresh and tasty! The have a great choices on the menu! Great presentation of deviled eggs!!!! Very smooth bourbon cocktails!! Our server was attentive and professional.  Highly recommend this restaurant!

name: Whiskey Street
content: I was visiting SLC and I stopped in to whiskey street and I'm really glad I did! The drinks and food is amazing and the service was great!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Awesome place with two floors . I like the vibe  and theme . If you're in Salt Lake City i definitely recommend this spot.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Absolutely incredible atmosphere, Kimo was our server and was wonderful- so charming and so friendly. Whiskey list is absolutely incredible and extensive.  You can find anything and everything here. Good beer selection, impressive cocktails, full bar, and good prices. Will definitely be back!

name: Whiskey Street
content: First time at this place staff was on the ball friendly and was helpful in choosing good dishes for brunch. The atmosphere was fun, loads of of uniqueness in this location. Got the country fried steak. It was great egg was done well

name: Whiskey Street
content: Excellent ambiance.... Old building with a throwback to a speakeasy feel.  Beyond extensive selection of whiskey and also beers.  Menu looks tasty we tried the poutine which had so many great flavors between the Scotch egg, perfectly flavored and cooked brisket.... All the flavors combined really was a nice appetizer.  Prefer the seating in the high back booths.

name: Whiskey Street
content: I could have dined on the sauce smothering my brisket gnocchi alone. I wanted crusty bread to soak it up after the pasta was gone... I managed without cause it was not going to waste. It's the kind of dish that makes you want to lick your plate. My friend had the Cajun shrimp pasta and loved his just as much.They have a great cocktail menu and the bartenders really know about each liquor if you ask. I definitely recommend this place not only for a date night but if you're going solo and feel like treating yourself.

name: Whiskey Street
content: This is one of my staple bars downtown SLC. As you may guess, they have a fine selection of whiskey and drinks. Their food is pretty outstanding, I don't think I've ever had a bad bite here yet. From my experiences here, the service can be really slow so I would suggest planning to spend a bit more time here than you might expect (which is easy because the ambiance and vibe is so relaxing).

name: Whiskey Street
content: In town for a week to do some traveling and thought we'd try something fun and random. Scanning my DL upon entry threw me off since I've never had to do that just to gain entry to a restaurant. Had Deviled Eggs for appetizer and they were great. Wife had Avocado Hefeweizen beer and it was delicious. I had the short rib grilled cheese with a side of bison chili and Oh. My. God it was amazing. Wife had Salmon and she loved it. Luis our server was awesome and very interactive and such great fun. This place rocks.

name: Whiskey Street
content: My mom and I decided to stop here for breakfast before heading up the canyon to do some shopping.  The staff was really great and super helpful. The building is historic and they have cool natural light coming in from the skylights.  It's a really lovely environment. They have a good champagne menu so we had some yummy mimosas. Before I get into the reason I'm only giving four stars I will say that the dinner menu here looks intriguing and I do want to come back and give this place another shot.  That being said we were not impressed with our eggs benedict.  The hollandaise sauce was very disappointing.  It had no acidity or salt.  It tasted and even looked after a while like it was just egg yolks and melted butter whisked together and that was it.  It was flavorless.  I also felt the tasso ham was overpowering.  The smokiness was quite intense.  On the other hand I will say the poached egg was on point.  It was perfectly round with a perfectly runny yolk.  The English muffin was also delightful, nicely toasted and perfect size for the eggs.  I also really, really loved the potatoes that came on the side.  They were so crispy and had a lively seasoning.  Because there were some aspects of the dish that were executed flawlessly I will definitely be giving this place another shot.  I will be happy to give more stars once I'm able to try it out again.  I think this place has a lot to offer and I can't wait to find out what that is.

name: Whiskey Street
content: the bar is super cute. the service was a bit slow, as well as the food/drinks. it first took us 20ish minutes to flag down a server to order food since we were in the back. and soon after we waited another 20 minutes for 1 drink (and keep in mind the place wasn't very busy). but i do recommend the peach mule! as for food we ordered the cauliflower, calamari,  short rib polenta poutine, steak sandwich, cajun shrimp pasta, and short rib grilled cheese. the appetizers were so good, the cauliflower tasted almost like orange chicken. as for the short rib polenta, i thought it was a little over hyped and a very heavy dish, but overall good. the steak sandwich did not disappoint, it's literally a whole steak on a piece of bread! but the cajun shrimp pasta was very disappointing and super salty. overall 3/5 because the service and good but not amazing food.

name: Whiskey Street
content: First time to Whiskey Street. Impressive spread of alcohol.  Bartenders were all very helpful. Great recommendations. Food was OUTSTANDING! Had the BBQ Burger. They cook to temp, medium, didn't come out medium, although I appreciate the attempt, the Angus beef was juicy and flavorful regardless and I could care less how it was cooked anyway.We probably won't spend up to $500 on a pour of rare whiskey, but they had what we wanted at a good price. And the fattest fried pickles I've ever seen! When a place is busy like they were on a Friday night, it really is because it's good! both the drinks and dinner were delicious. Super impressed with the sandwich and garden salad!!This is one place I will visit every time I'm in town. You might want to call ahead during covid times since indoor space is limited on busy nights.

name: Whiskey Street
content: While visiting for the weekend this was the Perfect place on a Sunday night for great meal and whiskey with my guy.  Super cool atmosphere and service was excellent.  Will definitely recommend and visit again !

name: Whiskey Street
content: Whoa, this place was phenomenal! The salmon was awesome and their whisk(e)y selection was out of this world.

name: Whiskey Street
content: This place is heaven in Salt Lake City. Best bar in the state. The bartender Matt is knowledgeable and friendly. The food is Phenomenal!!! Try the shirt rib grilled cheese. You will love it. The whisky selection and cocktails cannot be beat.

name: Whiskey Street
content: One of my favorite places in SLC. Drinks and food is pretty great. Wait staff is very nice. Not a big fan of the night club bouncers outfront feel but that's a Salt Lake City thing unfortunately. Things are weird with covid but Whiskey Street is keeping it real!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Five stars all day!!! Came here after looking on Yelp, being in SLC for a couple days. This place is amazing!!!! Being from Vegas as a bartender, this place was perfect! The most whiskey i ever seen in one bar/restaurant, Staff was amazing and very knowledgeable. Food was just as good! I highly suggest the deconstructed Poutine! Thank you!! We will be back.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Whiskey Street is such a fun bar to visit and they have amazing eats.  I ordered the fried cauliflower, fried pickles, and the pork grilled cheese.  The appetizers were AMAZING.  But the meat on my grilled cheese was dry.

name: Whiskey Street
content: The service is great.  They have incredible food and amazing drinks.  It's a great location on main street and with their connection to white horse you could have pretty much anything you want.I removed a star because the security kind of ruins the mood.  I totally understand they have a lot going with Covid restrictions, but they literally just sit in a chair and bark orders at people.  You can take my advice however you want, but at a club with such a great reputation, asking security to be kind, efficient and professional is a small ask and since they're the front line of the establishment, it's severely important that they put on an inviting face.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Came here for my birthday dinner and we had a great time! We enjoyed our ciders, whiskey, and beer, and the food was tasty! Would recommend the chili fries and their burger.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Great selection of whiskey although I found it curious that the bartender didn't know how to make a Manhattan without looking it up.  You had to sanitize your hands before you went in - I wish more places did that.  Server was very attentive and accommodating.  My bourbon glazed salmon was delicious although the wasabi bacon potato salad wasn't wasabi at all.  Son had the halibut and was crazy about it.  Husband loved his meal as well.  We got the chocolate dessert that was demolished by all of us.  All in all a wonderful meal and we'd go back again.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Great Drinks, great vibes! Came for day drinking. We enjoyed all the drinks that we got and the service was great. The minus 1 star was because they have WAY too many choices on their menu and when we were ordering some of the drinks were not even available. Overall would go back and try something different!

name: Whiskey Street
content: My boyfriend and I chose this as our only stop in driving through Salt Lake City, and we were so glad we came!  Atmosphere, cocktails, food, and service were all awesome. The team follows all COVID protocol very well too: we felt comfortable and supported the entire time. The cocktail list is hard to beat: new and old takes on classic drinks. They also have multiple types of old fashions and mules, plus unique cocktails, which makes this an epic place if you want a nice drink (plus TONS of local beers, wines, ciders, and of course, whiskey). The food is also delicious and the menu really has something for everyone: meat, fish, veggie dishes. Our biggest regret is not being able to stay for more drinks and food for more hours - we could have sat there all day eating and drinking every item on the menu and enjoying every second of it.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Huge list of available brown water.  We had to wait a bit to be seated but out front is awesome for people watching and this street is a non-stop party.  We were greeted by an awesome person and she took great care of us our entire time.  We ordered some whistle pig and Hazy IPAs and it was great.  Our party person put on a beer tasting for us with many different glasses.  She lined up the beers and the glasses so we knew what we were tasting.  The ambiance is loud but not over bearing.  Seats and tables are comfortable, bathrooms are super clean and it is a positive fun place.  I will be back.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Amazing atmosphere! The service is top notch! With the biggest selection of whiskey in the state

name: Whiskey Street
content: This and White Horse are my absolute favorites. Amazing food, atmosphere, and drinks.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Great place for some drinks after work and to get an early dinner. All of the food has been good so far. I will warn you not to stay too long, as the bar is extremely narrow. After 8 or 9 you aren't going to be able to sit much less move! So, come after work and after a drink or two, it's time to move to a wider bar.

name: Whiskey Street
content: As noted these days when you log into Yelp to leave a review, COVID has deeply impacted every restaurant. Which is why the ones that get it right deserve high praise, because "getting it right" truly is a matter of life and death. From the social distancing leaving plenty of healthy space for everyone, the staff wearing masks over the nose (what is it with SLC folks not understanding the concept!), the plethora of hand sanitizer available and especially the staff diligently scrubbing the stations and wiping the menus fastidiously, this is one restaurant where you can truly feel safe to eat at. And eat you will want to! Highly suggested menu items include the pork belly lettuce wraps, the snackably addictive curried cashews, the roasted corn crab chowder (loaded with enough crab to make the @SantaBarbaraShellfishCo blush) and the Pork Belly Cuban.Wash it all down with a craft cocktail or three, poured knowingly and provided by a staff that seems to truly care, and you're all set for an enjoyable afternoon, evening or both. Bravo, Whiskey Street! Your efforts are not unnoticed!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Fantastic whiskey bar. Best in Salt Lake City. Service was friendly and informative . Drinks were awesome and the food was amazing. Do not skip this place. You will miss out. You must order the lamb chops.

name: Whiskey Street
content: I love whiskey. I definitely love whiskey more than it loves me.That being said, this place could get me into a whole lot of trouble if I let my guard and bank account down. You're not going to find a selection like this anywhere else -- although they have Blanton's next door (my favorite). They have some fantastic food as well, but everything seems to pale in comparison to their cocktails/whiskey. This place is another must-go on my list when people come to visit.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Food was great and the staff really knows their beer and whiskey! If you want the stronger beers get them out of can fyi. =)

name: Whiskey Street
content: Decided to try this place out after shopping options on yelp. Of course being downtown SLC there are plenty of options but I'm soo glad that we went with Whiskey Street! We didn't have to wait more than about 15-20 minutes before we were seated with an option of which area we preferred and all staff is super friendly. I had The Rotisserie Inn Punch which was light, crisp and just the right amount of sweetness. The fried pickles with spicy remoulade dipping sauce were amazing! Sadly I had already eaten too much of my main course so I didn't eat too many of them! (I had ordered the meal before finally caving and ordering the pickles so that's why they came out after the main course). Both my sandwich and my husbands were delicious.... the pork had a wonderful smokey flavor and the braised short ribs in my grilled cheese were cooked to perfection! The fries were also delicious! Ambiance - awesome music and a very impressive bar area with a larger alcohol variety than I've seen at most restaurants. Their menu of whiskey options is top notch as well for all the whiskey drinkers out there. If you're in the area..... stop by even if it's just for a drink! So worth it!

name: Whiskey Street
content: So much for treating black people equally. Being a huge fan of Bourbon, other whiskeys, and cocktails, I was more than excited to go to an establishment that touts itself as the finest whiskey restaurants in Salt Lake City. We were completely ignored for over 20 min. The staff and management were confused and lacked caring completely. We ordered appetizers and they took about 20 mins to come out which was fine as we were enjoying our drinks. But then once we ordered our entree everything  changed. It came out 3 mins later as we were just digging into our appetizers. No server to check on us, we had to grab the manager, Sin, (10 mins later) to get the entree sent back so that we could finish our appetizers. No drink replenishment for me this entire time.  20 mins later, our server came over and asked if we wanted more drinks... c'mon!!! We told her we were done and that she had ignored us! I'm sorrys but no fixing the issue.  We had to grab the manager again and he was sorry to be told, but not sorry for the terrible service  and acknowledged that they were confused at the placement of servers. This is a time for above and beyond treatment and instead we were ignored!! Btw-we watched at least 4 bartenders stand around and fist bump. Mind you that the place was half capacity, due to COVID. I guess the same could be said about service and management, half ability due to COVID. The drink glasses were empty and we were 10 ft from the bar!! So disappointed!!!The only reason I gave it a single star, is because you can't give zero or a minus!!

name: Whiskey Street
content: A fantastic restaurant! I felt so safe eating here, every table was more than 6 feet apart. Their food was to die for. I got the Pork Belly Cuban and I'm still thinking about it days later. The drinks were even better, I got the Panama Mamma and it was perfect. Some of the best cocktails I've ever had. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area!

name: Whiskey Street
content: I'm glad that this place is follow Covid policies, nextdoor.. not so much. They only take reservations and will check your id at the door. The service is really good. They have an extensive drinks list (duh!) and the cocktails we had were pretty good. The food was alright, my fiancé and I enjoyed the appetizers more than the entrees. If we come back, we would probably stick to their apps.

name: Whiskey Street
content: From out of town, made a dinner reservation for a birthday celebration, showed up on time, got one drink right away, the second persons drink never showed up and took about 15 min for server to come by to check on us. Told him to forget about it and close us out, instead he begged us to stay and not write a bad review after poor service. Very disappointed because we had plans to have a nice dinner with many many drinks and instead had to find a different place last minute because we were so hungry. No apologies were offered and still paid $10 for a small drink while we were there for 30 minutes. Not to mention we were watching servers/bartenders taking shots while we still didn't have a drink.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Whiskey Street was the absolute highlight of our trip to Salt Lake City. My husband is a big bourbon drinker thus when I saw their extensive whiskey list I knew we had to have dinner here. We ended up eating here two weekends in a row! Their beet salad is delicious! The salad comes with a very interesting whipped chèvre, large slices of roasted beets, arugula dressed in a vinaigrette, grapes and some spiced nuts. It's a very filling salad with great textural variety and the right balance of sweet/salty/earthy flavors. Our first night in, my husband has their pulled pork sandwich from the specials board. The second time around, he had their NY strip which was "an excellent cut of meat" according to him. He devoured it in no time! I also had the corn chowder on our first visit - I loved the corn flavor mixed with the different peppers. Both times we had the mud pie for dessert. SO GOOD! A little tough to eat given that it arrives almost frozen solid, but once you give it a few minutes to warm up it is fantastic. My husband tried many different bourbons, the old fashioned and I had a grapefruit/whiskey drink. Good service, fast kitchen, fun atmosphere.

name: Whiskey Street
content: This place is Great!!! The bar is amazing alot of drinks to choose from.  I had the lamp chops medium well, they were delicious . I will definitely be back.

name: Whiskey Street
content: The staff is young and friendly.  Loved Noah as the greeter.  Funny and friendly.  Relates well. We sat outside and Lindsay was our upbeat and attentive waitress.  Started with a cocktail.  My husband had the cherry coke old fashion.  He really liked it. I'm not a soda fan.  I had the elder bourbon.  Light and refreshing.  Not too sweet.  We got the crab eggs Benedict.  It was a good choice.  Large serving.  More than enough for two.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  Including the 4 asparagus.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Very yummy food and great drinks, would 10/10 recommend!! And for the French fry lovers out there, they were so good!(:

name: Whiskey Street
content: My husband and I  went a few times, mostly because we liked the server. There was never really anything on the menu that was worth going  back for though. Their burger was good, but not  great. The cheese and ribs sandwich was dry, like the ribs were cooked too long, not moist at all.  The atmosphere was okay, but sometimes the crowd could get  too crude and the management didn't seem to care. A bit annoying. Their french fries were good though, reminded me of McDs, salty and cooked just right. Sorry, I wish I could give more stars, we really tried to like this place, but it just wasn't worth it with all the other places in SLC.

name: Whiskey Street
content: I've spent a lot of time here and it used to be one of my go-to's for brunch....but over the past year I feel like the quality of the food has declined and become way too hit or miss. Sometimes it's good and sometimes it's cold and greasy.Plus, the ambiance has always been weirdly aggressive and in light of all the sexual harassment and racist behavior from the owners I guess it makes sense. I've heard so many first-hand accounts of gross behavior from the management that it makes it impossible to feel good about supporting this place.I won't be back.

name: Whiskey Street
content: This place is GREAT. Beet salad  and tuna poke were some of the best I've had, and craft seasonal cocktails are a home run. The ambiance is the cherry on top.

name: Whiskey Street
content: I love Whiskey Street for brunch! Their spicy bloody mary is truly unrivaled. You have to try the guiness pancakes. I was worried it would be too sweet with the jameson syrup and baileys whip but it's actually light and the flavors really come through. We ordered just one side cake and shared it amongst the table. Id also suggest the short rib benedict!

name: Whiskey Street
content: Great bar and restaurant with a wide variety of drinks and beer selection plus it's open late . The prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly only issue I had was my ID been photographed by the host when I entered . I ask why and he said it's for " in case people do a dine and dash " Interestingly enough alot of customers came in after me that was white and didn't have there ID photograph . If this is a policy it's very invasive especially in the current climate I don't mind holding my card but to photograph my ID is a bit excessive .

name: Whiskey Street
content: Good food and drinks, servers were super friendly.  But they kept changing the music so many times it was annoying, multiple servers and managers kept plugging in their iPods and blasting shitty music that it ruined the atmosphere.  Stick to chill, or jazz or something that fits your atmosphere

name: Whiskey Street
content: The service and quality was great! Awesome spot to grab a drink and hang out. Huge variety selection to choose from.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Food and drink were very good.  It was interesting how they grilled the Caesar salad and the grilled chicken sandwich was great

name: Whiskey Street
content: Got into SLC a bit later than expected and was recommended here by our hotel manager. Amazing relaxing atmosphere for our post flight dinner. Everything tasted amazing.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Nice elegant place, food is not worth the price it has though. Truffle fries were amazing but chicken was 50% fat annnnd i recommend the Boston sour.Staff is nice

name: Whiskey Street
content: I never did particularly like this bar. It was way too narrow and crowded. Almost impossible to get to the actual bar to order a drink. Everything was awkward. Sitting at a table was awkward. Walking around was impossible. Now that the reality of management has come to light i really dont want to go back

name: Whiskey Street
content: OMFFFFG!!! This Whiskey Street place is abso-effing-lutely amazing!! The food was the best I have ever had...even from in California. The brisket chili...to die for. The Brisket gnocchi...to die for. The beef jerky app OMG!! The Poké app looked delicious...the pork ribs...WHOLLY SHIT....OVER THE TOP!!! And the Epic Wheat beer...so effing good!! A must when you visit Utah!!

name: Whiskey Street
content: I felt compelled to write this review due to the recent events. However, I'll talk about my experience here as a customer since non-food related reviews tend to be taken down frequently. Whiskey Street is conveniently located on Main Street alongside many other bars. As long as you're there, you won't miss the outdoor patio and the somewhat rustic look. I will say, this isn't my go to since my friends and I would rather have a casual vibe than overpay for food and drinks. The price is quite the turnoff, not just for the drinks. Why overpay for basic sandwiches when you can go next door to Ramen Bar for a very reasonably priced, delicious bowl of ramen. Even drinks here are mediocre for the price. For a few bucks extra, I'd rather go to Lake Effect for its ambiance and better selection of alcohol. Even the Rest next door has a much more fun environment, which I'd recommend any day. And as a tip, learn to treat your employees (and people) like human beings. It's not a good look for you when you don't. Needless to say, I will no longer bring any business over here.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Service was good but not the rest. Scary how opposed the owners are to appropriate COVID 19 precautions. Profit over people does not make for a good dining or drinking experience. Would not recommend.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Whiskey Street is one of the many bars on Main Street, but what makes it stand out is the rustic saloon feel to it. Now that sounds ratchet, but it is a fancy saloon feel, like a sophisticated saloon. I had been here before Covid-19 and I have just visited recently during this Covid-19 pandemic. Overall look at their precautionary measures: masks to enter, hand sanitizer at the door, distanced seating, and the servers are always wearing a mask as well. The service has always been decent. My most recent experience was just a couple days ago. I went with my boyfriend, Stanley, and we had originally planned on going to White Horse, but the wait was 1.5 hours, so we decided to go next door, and we were not disappointed. We were seated immediately at a table across from the bar, all of the booths were sadly taken. The waitress was a delight! She was so kind and took time to reassure us on our choice of food.We ordered the NY Steak Salad with Balsamic Vinaigrette and the Cajun Shrimp Pasta. They were both so delicious! It was a good mix of food. The Cajun Shrimp Pasta is on the heavier, thicker side and the salad was light and refreshing. In short, the Cajun Shrimp Pasta was like thick, short ramen noodles marinated in a creamy orange sauce with shrimp and sausage. The NY Steak Salad was like any other salad, but what made it the better dish for me was the steak. The greens were served with a fully cooked steak on top of the salad, which gave it a more refined look. The steak, oh my gosh, was juicy and thick. We had it cooked to medium and it was still quite red, which actually usually bothers me, but I took a bite of this steak before having it sent back and it did not taste bloody at all! It was one of the best steaks I had eaten in a while. The only thing my boyfriend mentioned was that maybe if it was a bit warmer, it would have been even better, but overall it was DELICIOUS!The one thing I would take away from my review is the food. The NY Steak Salad is one of the cheaper options on the mention, clocking in at $16 for the entree, but I think it is one of the best options on the menu!

name: Whiskey Street
content: I use to think this place had a pretty good burger. However, I did not know it was served with a side of racism. I will not be setting foot in any Bourbon Group establishment ever again.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Just perfect! Food, drinks, and awesome service! Love Shayna's spirit, humor and information!

name: Whiskey Street
content: This place is amazing!!! Food drinks loved it all! Went twice while on vacation. That's how good it was.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Pretty covid 19 friendly with cleanliness and masks.  Patio seating is ideal.   The drink menu doesn't do anything for me but I'm not in to whiskey but decent draft menu.  Food is all delicious from popcorn to steak.  Service can b dicey but for how busy it it, pretty good.  Definitely a regular spot.

name: Whiskey Street
content: One of my regular haunts.  This place gets crowded fast so get here early or call ahead and see if they will take a reservation.  Try the fried green tomatoes topped with pork belly.  I crave this dish!!!  Steak salad, also great.  Meatloaf (and who orders meatloaf at a restaurant) excellent!  Brunch . . . delicious.  Really cool vibe.  Make sure to read the menu, interesting Utah history.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Had a great dinner last night. Their bacon is magical. Love the drink selection. It's a beautiful restaurant with a fresh menu and a great atmosphere.

name: Whiskey Street
content: First off the place is dirty the menu looks good but after arriving by Uber they asked if we had reservations there was absolutely nobody in the place when we said we didn't they asked us to wait outside a few minutes later said oh I have a table ready for you and they gave us a high top next to the street and asked us to leave our service dog out on the opposite side of the rail on the street well needless to say we are mediately left in here for a one star review the place sucks

name: Whiskey Street
content: I've been coming here for 3 years and it's been great but when someone orders a drink, make sure they're there because they will claim your significant other "has been drinking" and won't serve you guys. Don't go to this place. They're inconsiderate and don't accept people of color.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Friendly staff. Wide drink selection. A menu that isn't the same thing you see everywhere else. I really like it Disclaimer: this is the first bar or restaurant I've been to since covid started so I'm easy to please right now lol.

name: Whiskey Street
content: Don't need to say much, a few hundred whisky offerings and good food on top of that. A great place for lunch, dinner, or trying whisky until an uber is a necessity.

name: Takashi
content: This place is INCREDIBLE!!!!   I am in town for business and got to visit a friend who couldn't shut up about this place......HE WAS RIGHT!!!!  I never write reviews but i couldn't skip this one.  Best sushi I ever had and I had assumed my friend (who picked up the tab) had spent $500.  Then I found out the check was only $200......Amazing.   We waited over 2 hours for the table and I am still reviewing it 5 Stars.....That should say something.

name: Takashi
content: There's usually a long wait but it's worth it! Great ambiance and excellent sushi. Their sashimi is also delicious. I have yet to order something on the menu that isn't fresh and delicious.

name: Takashi
content: Best sushi I have had in years - definitely the best in SLC. Accommodated my spouse's gluten allergy with many options.

name: Takashi
content: Best lunches ever! Love their homemade hot sauce and combo specials

name: Takashi
content: We ordered *a lot* of take out last night, we hadn't tried it yet, but my sister who lives in town was so excited to, so I knew I wanted to order some for her. From pick up I could tell the ambiance inside is terrific, and customer service left a great impression. Everything in my order was perfectly plated inside paper take out containers, everyone was super helpful and friendly (and COVID safe) and they didn't miss a single thing- I know they must have checked everything twice! Every roll was delicious, their use of yuzu and wasabi tobiko was .. a revelation. We had 5 speciality rolls, 2 orders of nigiri, 2 orders of sashimi, a negihama (always a favorite anywhere-simple and classic), green papaya salad (drool), and couldn't resist the panna cotta (oops I didn't share this one very well). All was excellent. Can't speak on cooked dishes, but everything we had was terrific and great quality, I bet the whole menu is delicious. Unfortunately, we have become sushi snobs over the years, and even at some expensive respected places where we are from in Houston we can be very disappointed in the quality offered, so now we are loyalists to Uchi Houston and have a hard time straying. I am so happy that this was not one of those experiences!! I would recommend to anyone in PC or SLC craving sushi to give them a try! Looking forward to returning and having the full experience after pandemic restrictions can safely be lifted.

name: Takashi
content: They are amazing!  Always early to deliver curbside pickup and so friendly about it.  I am a picky sushi person and their rolls are delicious.  Definitely recommend!  I hope they open for in-restaurant eating soon!

name: Takashi
content: Hands down the best place in SLC for sushi. I am pescatarian and am SUPER picky about my fish and high quality sushi, and this is the only place I'll go any more!

name: Takashi
content: Probably the freshest su hi I'm all of Slc. You definitely pay the premium but the amazing downtown location makes up for it!

name: Takashi
content: Best sushi in Utah hands down. Never been disappointed with the service or food. Won't regret trying the place out

name: Takashi
content: Amazing as always and it was great as takeout, I'm excited for them to reopen there dining room.

name: Takashi
content: Honestly, after all the hype, I wasn't impressed. Staff was a bit cold and the sushi did not live up to my high expectations. Beautiful place, though!

name: Takashi
content: Best I've ever had! (I've had fresh very expensive high end in Singapore) Takashi is above all others. Their menu is superb. The Aburi Gindara is my all time favorite thing in the world. It's a Torched Sabelfish, get the Nigiri. I'm not exaggerating when I say it changed my life. I can't help but close my eyes and savor every bite that goes into my mouth.  If you are unsure or scared of taking risks if you are new to sushi then try the Strawberry Fields roll. It's one of their most popular and for good reason. I don't think I've tried anything on the menu I haven't liked. You will spend more on sushi here than other places but it's because it is TOP QUALITY and done better than anyone else. It's 100% worth it. Pay extra for an amazing meal. I'm a total foodie and this place is by far at the very top of my list.

name: Takashi
content: Wow! This fish was so fresh.... I truly have no words to describe it. You would think you're sitting somewhere on the beach versus being in the mountains.The quality of sushi at Takashi is outstanding! Each roll is carefully crafted and every bite will blow your mind. Literally, I audibly said wow throughout the meal after every bite. They're honestly geniuses. You can't go wrong with any roll, but if I could make any suggestions, the black woman magic roll and the forest gump roll are out of this world! And the imagine roll is so fresh, it literally melts in your mouth. I wish I ordered more. Their curbside carry-out is amazing and the food arrive well packaged and warm. Go ahead and place your order right now!

name: Takashi
content: I love Takashi. I'm so weary to eat sushi anywhere else in Salt Lake. Fish is always high quality, which isn't always a guarantee in a land locked state. Their panna cotta for dessert is delectable. Yum!

name: Takashi
content: After reading reviews I was hoping this place was going to live up to them during covid.Food was just ok, service was good but they were forgetful. The best roll "the sunshine roll" was the best thing and was almost forgotten by wait staff.The whole fish was also pretty good. A little to expensive for what you got.  I won't go back.

name: Takashi
content: We just got takeout, so we went with all rolls and a few nigiri. It was very good, they are super nice, price is reasonable and it's right in town.

name: Takashi
content: I live good sushi and with all the half priced rolls out there it is hard to find.  My daughter loves sushi and so we go to Takashi.  Good stuff.  I'd give a 5 start but the server acted like an elitist snob.  However, as long as the food is good and the service is respectable, I'm a happy camper.

name: Takashi
content: This is a delayed review; I haven't been here since COVID. I live in Oregon but would travel to SLC once a year; I did so for 4 years and each time I'd make a point to have dinner here!The ambiance is gorgeous and everything I put in my mouth there was completely delightful and delicious. I'm from Louisiana, and have lived in California and Oregon, but this the BEST SUSHI EVER!!

name: Takashi
content: The upside of the pandemic for me is that I've been getting take out from some of the places in SLC that I've always meant to try in person, but have missed thus far. While Takashi has been around forever with great reviews, it wasn't until the pandemic hit that I finally have ordered curbside takeout. The sushi is delicious and I can see why they always win awards as a place for Utah's best sushi. I really love the rice bowls too.  I've been back a few times and my only regret is that I didn't try this place sooner!

name: Takashi
content: Sushi quality is amazing. Hands down the best in town. It is on the pricy side, but the fish is so fresh, they just melt in your mouth.I would eat this everyday if I had the money. Well down Takashi. Highly recommend!!

name: Takashi
content: Crazy good sushi chefs! They had so many options! It definitely depends on your taste for what to like but there was little that I didn't like!

name: Takashi
content: Although due to Covid-19 my family and I didn't get to go in person, the food was still excellent. Our takeout order was available for pickup rapidly. Our food stayed in really good quality on the drive home which is about a 15 minute drive. This fact really differentiates Takashi from other sushi places, I've tried takeout from some of other sushi spots (that I enjoy) and sometimes the quality of the sushi just doesn't age amazingly on the commute home. The rice tends to get a bit stiff due to the wait but we didn't experience this at all from Takashi. Everything was delicious. I can't wait to be able to go in person.

name: Takashi
content: Amazing take out! We ordered directly from the website -- our order was ready right on time and they brought it out to our car -- great service! We stopped in SLC for one night and Takashi did an amazing job. The rolls were some of the best we have had in a long time. Fresh fish and very reasonable sized rolls. Definitely recommend!

name: Takashi
content: Absolutely incredible. My husband and I just moved to SLC and have received countless recommendations to try their sushi. We got the Philly, Caribbean, and Miguel rolls and were blown away by all of them. I've never had such delicately rolled bites of sushi. The fish was the freshest I've ever eaten. I finally know how good fish can be! We regretted only getting three rolls and will definitely be back for more. The only mishap occurred in our pickup process. Since there is no dine-in, currently, we did curbside pickup. We waited at the curb half an hour after our pickup time, until finally we got our order. The staff apologized profusely and the manager called to apologize and comp part of our meal. For a slight inconvenience, I am so impressed with the way they handled this interaction. So many restaurants have shown little to no courtesy in similar situations, but Takashi has lifelong customers in us for the great food and generosity!

name: Takashi
content: Hip place and tasty sushi. Excellent service. Difficult to get in quickly so plan ahead, put your name in a get a drink or two next door. Make an evening of it!

name: Takashi
content: Best sushi I've had in Salt Lake, hands down. Can be a little on the pricey side, but definitely worth it for a good meal. So far I've only done takeout, so I'm excited to see the quality when I finally dine in.

name: Takashi
content: Takashi's sushi has been delicious every time we've had it. They also prepare to-go orders with care and attention to detail. We ordered our anniversary dinner from them earlier this week, and the food was incredible! Looking forward to visiting in person again, but until then we'll continue to order delicious takeout.

name: Takashi
content: Excellent food... Although it almost got 4 stars for the long lines, but I guess their only fault is not having more locations!

name: Takashi
content: Best sushi in Utah.  We don't get downtown too often anymore so I miss eating here but they always surpass expectations.  Definitely the best sushi around.  Lots of small effort that puts them over the top and the fish is fresh and perfect every time.  Highly recommend.

name: Takashi
content: Always a favorite!  Can be very busy so plan accordingly.  Also, be sure to ask about specials and items off the menu.  The bar makes a yummy Hachi Hive you will certainly want to try:)

name: Takashi
content: Whatever the wait is--it's worth it!!! Go grab a drink near by and come back. I love, love LOVE this place! It's definitely in my top favorites in Salt Lake. I love the vibe. Every time I've gone we've asked our sever for recommendations and have been so happy with what they brought us!!

name: Takashi
content: This was soooo good! I'm legit considering going back to reorder the Tiger and Sebastian roll. It was hard to find the place but they're located along the alley way right before the melting pot. Highly recommend

name: Takashi
content: Confession: we've been ordering take out from Takashi almost every single weekend during the pandemic. That's how much we love it. And the one weekend we skipped it? It's because the wait was going to be long. That's how much everyone else loves it. We ended up ordering from another sushi restaurant and honestly, the other restaurant didn't hold up in comparison to Takashi. See you next weekend! (...and the next, and probably the next...)

name: Takashi
content: Takashi is hands down the best sushi in Utah. From the Toro to the Maguro; the nirigi is exceptional, note the attention to detail on the quality of fish and the perfectly executed sushi rice. The off-menu rolls are worth asking about. And make sure to treat yourself to a cocktail and a Japanese whisky flight. Truly an exceptional meal.

name: Takashi
content: Takashi is both the best and the most expensive sushi you can get in Salt Lake City. Takashi is really the only "high end" sushi restaurant in Salt Lake, in my opinion. I'd recommend it if that's what you're looking for.

name: Takashi
content: Not a big fish fan, but the chef here knows what's up. Im not a very adventurous eater, so I usually get the lunch steak which is delicious!!

name: Takashi
content: Really great place and very authentic. Family-owned and pretty amazing story actually the food was amazing and I highly recommend supporting this small sushi joint as they work very hard to deliver high-quality food and service.

name: Takashi
content: See my review for Post Office Place, Takashi's "Sister Bar serving 85% of Takashi's menu while it's closed for the pandemic." That's a direct quote of the girl on the phone. I went to POP and ordered from both menus. I did a full, compelling review of both places in my POP review but apparently Yelp doesn't let you copy. So I'm not writing it again. Summary: Takashi is a little better than POP. Both were disappointing. Best thing was Takashi's $5 sunomono salad with tako. Just get that, drop $7 on the table while the waitress thinks you're still perusing and run away.

name: Takashi
content: This is me being a half-Japanese sushi snob who has spent more than a decade in Japan:Meh.I guess if this is all there is out here in SLC, it is what it is. But I feel like there are probably some better places in this county... Places with larger cuts of rolls and generally better flavor.

name: Takashi
content: What can I saw that hasn't already been said. Takashi is our favorite sushi restaurant. Our first time there was almost a religious experience. The torched sable nigiri was life changing. The rolls are delicious and other Japanese items are just as good too. The wait is worth it!

name: Takashi
content: The only place to go for sushi in slc! Very chic place with good quality food and clean service.

name: Takashi
content: This place used to be soooooooo good. Now, I find it average. Their sushi tasted a little unfresh to me. I will say this: there potstickers bowl was dreamy. Everyone likes a good potsticker now and then:)

name: Takashi
content: I have to write an updated review, as I have ordered from Takashi's curbside service numerous times (probably weekly?) since the beginning of the pandemic 7 months ago. I truly believe that Takashi has made my life better during a difficult time, and I am so grateful for their care, concern, safety measures, and professionalism during this pandemic.Firstly, curbside ordering is incredibly easy. I usually call around lunchtime and my order is ready in 15 minutes or so. I pull up outside, call the number again, and my order is brought to my car within 2 minutes. The staff who have served me always follow safety procedures, including wearing gloves and masks (over their mouths AND noses). I feel very safe eating Takashi's food, and they are one of the few places I will order from right now.The Little Mermaid, Imagine, and Yellow Submarine rolls are by far my favorites. I do miss some other items that were on their dine-in menu, but I definitely have all of those to look forward to when I am able to eat out again! Prices are standard, $11-15 for most rolls. But the quality of the seafood is absolutely incredible!! The best I have found in the SLC area, for sure; there is really no comparison, especially for the price.I so desperately look forward to visiting Takashi again some day, but I am more than happy with their curbside service in the meantime. I have a deep appreciation for their approach to food service during the pandemic and am for sure a lifelong customer now.

name: Takashi
content: It was OK and I am searching for the reason that it wasn't worse and it wasn't better? Everything about the place (to me) was simply "fine" - so I feel the 3-Stars is a fair reflection.  I hope to be able to go back and determine if I should do a new review!

name: Takashi
content: Some of the best sushi rolls I've ever had! We ordered the (puff, the) magic dragon, crunchy ebi, and salmon skin rolls as well as the steak bowl. All of them were amazing but my favorite was the (puff, the) magic dragon roll. During covid, we ordered over the phone and did curbside pickup. It was super quick and easy. Highly recommend!

name: Takashi
content: First time takeout from Takashi. Very nice experience to taste such fresh and delicious food! They are as good as dinner at the restaurant!

name: Takashi
content: Best sushi in the state and so easy to do takeout. Although I miss hanging out in restaurants, being able to get fresh Takashi fast fills the void pretty well. Once I get there I've never waited more than a few minutes for my food. They have rolls you won't anywhere else (like the Easy Rider with mint and basil or the Black Magic Woman with lemon pesto...both favorites) and even do to-go drink mixers.

name: Takashi
content: Amazing food! Good service! Highly recommended! If you planning on coming here try to get here a bit early because lines get really long.  If you get there late, just remember that the wait is worth it!

name: Takashi
content: Best sushi in the state!  Happy to see them taking dine-in customers again after COVID.

name: Takashi
content: Definitely the best sushi spot i've been to in Salt Lake and one of my favorite restaurants in general.  I've never had bad experience here.

name: Takashi
content: With my last two deliveries I had at LDS hospital I made my husband bring me the Sunshine Roll immediately to the hospital since I could finally have sushi again. It's THAT good.

name: Takashi
content: In terms of Sushi quality, it's not going to get any better than Takashi. You can easily taste it. The ambiance here is also nice, and the design is clean white lines. Cons: My biggest complaint is that they don't accept reservations. I'm sure there is some kind of reason for this, but it still is a point of contention for me. The price is higher than other places, but taking the quality into account it makes total sense.

name: Takashi
content: Absolutely amazing sushi. I'm from Seattle and lived in Hawaii. I've had my share of excellent sushi and poke, this is among the best. Their salmon rolls with thin slices of lemon (strawberry fields?) were some of the best sushi I've ever had. Their poke was on par with Tamura's and Maguro Bros on Oahu (famous on the island....doesn't get much better). BROKE DA MOUF BRAH! SUPA ONO FIVE STAR KINE!!! Aloha!

name: Takashi
content: I try a new Sushi place every chance I get. Takashi has some rolls that I have had other places that were excellent, like the sunshine roll. However I was blown away by the strawberry fields roll. It seemed so weird that I had to try it and I'm glad I did. I'm not from Salt Lake so figuring out the curbside pickup was strange, but these are strange times. Would totally come back...

name: Takashi
content: Went for a date night and was not disappointed! I ordered tempura veggies and a Buddha roll wrapped in soy paper and my husband ordered a yellow submarine. We also ordered a steak bowl to share. The green sauce that came with the steak was to-flipping-die-for!! Both of our sushi rolls were delicious and well made. I loved the crunchy bits in my Buddha roll! I'm pretty picky when it comes to vegetarian sushi and I strike out at most places, this was not the case here. I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu. With Covid, their full menu is not available but our server said they are working towards bringing more items back.

name: Takashi
content: I have been to this place twice before and had great experience. Even though it's a little pricey but I LOVE the vibes here. It's a great place for a date. The design is pretty cute, they have white ballon like lights on their ceiling which makes it extremely romantic I think. Plus their seating is pretty cute as well. Small tables mostly for two people. They also have a bar seating area.The food and service is great. But like I said, the design and decorations at this place is my favorite. I can't remember what food item I got at this place last time I went, but whatever you get, is a win.

name: Takashi
content: Takashi is a no brainer for sushi. It isn't over priced, and it's the freshest fish in town. I love to dine in but it's usually a super long wait. Get the lunch special to-go if you want to save some money!

name: Takashi
content: Had this as takeout for my Husband's B-Day. It was the best as usual. Love this place! I don't think I've ever had bad Sushi from here in all the years I've been coming here.

name: Takashi
content: Went here with my wife best Sushi place in town. Comfortable environment friendly staff would definitely recommend

name: Takashi
content: My favorite restaurant in Salt Lake, and the best sushi I have ever had. I have lived in 10 different states, and have had sushi all over the world. Even my discerning California friends say it beats anyplace they have eaten there. Definitely a must try if you are a pescatarian, or a visitor in the Salt Lake area.

name: Takashi
content: My favorite sushi in Salt Lake City. Although the wait times are always really long (that's how you know it is good), it is worth it. Seriously, best sushi!

name: Takashi
content: I don't have much to say except it's some of the best sushi you can get. I would recommend it to anyone, and I will continue to come here for special occasions, or if I am just feeling like some great sushi.

name: Takashi
content: This is my favorite sushi place in the city and it isn't even close.  TNT with the hotter than hell sauce is unbelievably good!

name: Takashi
content: This place has the best sushi I have ever tasted. My fiancé and  are from California and eat sushi a lot and this place is the best. The service was amazing and the atmosphere was amazing too. Our server, Michelle, made us feel completely at home like we were regular customers even though it was our first time. I would HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone who loves sushi or Japanese cuisine!!

name: Takashi
content: Best sushi in Utah and very nice service every time. They have a nice wine selection and they have a nice, convenient, and technologically advanced system that makes it easy to get a table. I love this place for its food, ambiance and customer service

name: Takashi
content: In SLC and craving sushi? Look no further (literally, don't you dare) than Takashi. They have the freshest ingredients, the beat service, and the tastiest, most interesting rolls. We held our most recent support-local-businesses-during-COVID takeout night on the perfectly maintained lawn across the street after grabbing takeout in our car. Quick and contactless service--just the way we like it these days. Their COVID-19 takeout menu can be found here: slcmenu.com/2011/04/03/t…We're gluten free, and they took it seriously. The guy who took our order really knew his stuff. We started with sunomono salads (add fresh tako, of course) followed by the ceviche roll (comes with its own sauce which is TO DIE FOR), the spider roll, the spicy hamachi, and the evergreen. To be honest, I cannot choose a favorite dish because they were all amazing. My partner loved the ceviche roll, and I fawned over the evergreen roll, but they were all exactly what we're looking for when we sushi. Can't wait to dine in again, Takashi! Thanks for representing Asian food in SLC as well as you do.

name: Takashi
content: Best/freshest sushi in SLC. Great for a business lunch or a relaxing dinner date. If you're going for lunch, be early. This place fills up quick and no reservations.

name: Takashi
content: I'm honestly upset that I've lived in the Salt Lake area for a year now and hadn't tried Takashi until this week. I've had multiple people recommend this place and I understand why. The sushi is phenomenal!!!!!! I will say that if you're looking for some cheap sushi, this is not your place. However, I personally feel that the price is very reasonable for the quality of sushi. I wish I could remember everything I ordered because it was all so good (but refer to the pictures below because they honestly tasted even better then they look). I did go purely off of the servers suggestion and got a variety of rolls- tempura, vegetarian, etc. I'll definitely be back!

name: Takashi
content: Easily my favorite sushi place. Usually pretty busy and no reservations but so worth the wait! I love all the rolls I have had there and the sake cocktail.

name: Takashi
content: THE best sushi spot in SLC! I highly recommend the sablefish nigiri, I've suggested it to every friend who's been to Takashi and they were not disappointed. The fish is so buttery and melts in your mouth. I also love the muscle shooters (caution, it may be too limey for some people) and the strawberry fields roll. I tend to get a variety of different things every time I go, but the dishes I mentioned earlier are must each visit. A quick tip, if you want your food delivered quickly, take a seat at the bar!

name: Takashi
content: The hype is real. Best quality fish in town. Would spend all my money here if I didn't have self control. Their nigiri is everything you need. Also the box roll.

name: Takashi
content: Best SLC sushi. Creative combinations, great variety of selections, all of the absolute highest quality. Takashi ranks up there with the best that I found in Tokyo and Osaka. Be aware that there can be long waits for a table and that they don't take reservations. I always try to get there 10-15 minutes before they open so that I can get in on the first seating.

name: Takashi
content: My girlfriend and I came here a couple months ago and we thought we were in heaven. Really yummy drinks and sushi rolls, both vegetarian and not. She really loved her Strawberry Fields roll and says she dreams of it constantly.

name: Takashi
content: I don't get what the big hype over this place is. Sure, I think their food is averagely good. But it's not the best in the valley for it to consistently win awards for Best Japanese Food year after year.I've tried their sushi and a few other dishes they have to offer and nothing about it stands out for me that I would endure another long, underquoted wait time and lackluster service for.We were originally quoted 30-45 mins for our wait time and the actual wait time was double that. Our server also had an attitude, though admittedly she said she was swamped. Couldn't joke with her without a blank stare and she didn't notice that we were missing some of the things we ordered until it was time to pay.

name: Takashi
content: The waiting queue is definitely long..came at 5ish pm and waited an hour for a table of two. Decorations and the vibe are on point--very classy, romantic. Professional staffs & chefs.The seafood is so fresh, probably freshest in the States! I only eat nigiri & sashimi here since other places can't get their hands on fresh products like this. Calamari is sooo good & so is the ice cream.$100 for the food in the picture. Expensive so visit should be occasional.

name: Takashi
content: Great sushi, probably the best that I've had in Utah. Ordered the Magic Dragon, Crunchy Ebi, Tiger's Roll, and T & T. Favorites were the Crunchy Ebi and Tigers. Liked the T & T and thought the Magic Dragon was just okay.

name: Takashi
content: We ordered strawberry fields, ceviche, easy rider, and sunshine. We asked to put the spicy parts on the side. The strawberry fields is delicious and even better with the peppers on the side The ceviche is unique, pure, and tart. I didn't love the Easy Rider. I think the mint doesn't go as well with fresh fish as I thought it would.

name: Takashi
content: I want to start this off by saying you can always count on waiting. Whether it's 30 minutes for 3 hours, it's worth the wait as long as you plan for it. Their sushi is creative, delicious and not super over priced for the quality you receive. I usually only go here for a special occasion because the wait can be hefty. I highly recommend trying Takashi if you haven't. It is hands down the best sushi in Utah and I have tried a lot of sushi. I recommend getting their muscle shooters. They are unique and tasty!

name: Takashi
content: We waited 45 minutes outside and was then told we were on a wait list and they would text us within 45 minutes. Needless to say they didn't. This place is the pits. Don't waste your time on this establishment.

name: Takashi
content: Stumbled across this place and will be back every time we come to SLC.  SO GOOD!  The SUMMIT roll - riceless and truly amazing!  Everything was perfect - no wait but we had a late lunch.  Lauren - five stars too - super helpful and perfect service.  Yay!

name: Takashi
content: I'm in town for work and was craving sushi so I asked some local colleagues for suggestions and at least 3 of them told me I had to try Takashi. I read the reviews about how busy they get but I figured being 20 minutes past opening on a Wednesday night would still be ok to get a table - nope! This place is that good and the wait is real, but trust me it's worth it. I got The Downtown roll which is riceless and wrapped in cucumber and wow talk about flavourful. Hands down it was my favorite! I tried the Yellow Submarine and Puff the Magic Dragon rolls which were excellent as well. It's definitely worth a visit but come as soon as they open or make a reservation.

name: Takashi
content: Just arrived in SLC and needed a little "snack" before my birthday dinner. The BF wanted a roll (or 2) and I was just going to get an appetizer. He got two rolls and I got the yin yang salmon. It was PERFECT. Good wine selection and the staff is very friendly.

name: Takashi
content: Loved this place I came back within the next day and there was 90 minute wait. Coming in during lunch the first time, it was quite busy and I was still seated immediately. I ordered the MISO soup- standard and delicious Ying Yang Salmon- delicious, but a bit too much sesame for my liking. The sauce is still delicious. The Yellow Submarine was incredible. I ordered this every time. The balance of sweet and spicy was amazing.

name: Takashi
content: Hands down the best sushi in Salt Lake. Easily. The bar is the best place to sit unless you're in a group. The chef's know what's in season, what pairs, and what you should and maybe shouldn't try. Absolutely love telling them what I like and seeing what they come up. A great selection of fresh, in-season catches along with roles and a solid drink menu (or you can pop next door to Post Office for a drink while you wait).

name: Takashi
content: We order A5 wagyu nigiri everytime. Trust me, you will love it if u try it. It' our favorite. Everything is great and delicious. Best sushi place in SLC.

name: Takashi
content: This is my go-to place for business and groups dinners. The ambience is chic and unique. The food is delicious with some unique choices. I always get a group of six together for a reservation. The wait for a table can be 2+ hours without a reservation. If it's your first time then order calamari and steamed gyoza. The sunshine roll is one of my favorites. The crunchy ebi is a sweet treat for people trying sushi for the first time.This is one of the top 3 sushi restaurants and top 10 overall restaurants in Salt Lake City! I highly recommend it for business dinners or group dinners of 6+.

name: Takashi
content: What's all the hype about? I was on business trip in Salt Lake City last week and after seeing the reviews I thought I'd try this place. I'm picky when it comes to sushi and maybe because I'm from California but I didn't think the sushi was great here. They sat me at the sushi bar, which was fine. But I didn't have anything that wowed me! I had the summit roll and some nigiri. Nothing special.

name: Takashi
