content: Very easily the best sushi in Utah by a mile. It's all about the fish. It's so fresh and so high quality, it just melts in your mouth. This is even better than most coastal sushi places I've been to. It's busy, but well worth the wait, and the line moves faster than you'd expect.

name: Takashi
content: WOW!!!Everything was on point from starters to rolls to desert. Don't miss the curry muscles!  This is a short and sweet review because I am almost speechless from the freshness and quality of ingredients. Their house cocktails are great too. A must try for sure!!!

name: Takashi
content: This is by far the best sushi place in SLC in my opinion. I have been going there for over twelve years now. I never liked the fact that we always had to wait at least an hour fifteen minutes if we didn't get in line by 5 pm. We can't make reservations because our party is always less than six people. Nonetheless, the wait is worth the time. Today I went with my wife and daughter. We were lucky and got seated once it opened because we were in line around  ten minutes past five. The place was full capacity as usual. We got seated at the sushi bar area. This is the first time we have sat there. We were enjoying our time, along with our food. Half way through, they seated an individual next to my daughter. This lady was in need of some help, I think. However her behavior became a spoiler soon. She mixed the ginger and wasabi with her bare hands  in a disgusting manner and started to apply it all over her hands, wiped it and kept on mumbling in the process.  The gentleman who was couple of seats from my daughter, noticed it as well and alerted one of the hosts who handled the situation professionally and escorted the lady out of the establishment. I realize there are no guarantees in life and any one could fall on hard times. It looked like this lady's situation was dire. This scenario turned our evening sour . We left very soon after this for we weren't enjoying anymore. I hope management will do a better job next time so this kind of situation doesn't happen again. Sometimes the meaning or exact experience gets lost when writing a post. This was our worst evening at Takashi's.

name: Takashi
content: Best sushi in Salt Lake City. Being landlocked I can usually tell fish has been flash frozen but not here and the presentation is beautiful too!  Perfect for celebrating or a date night or if you want to impress business colleagues

name: Takashi
content: Lines form before opening time. All parties must be present to be seated (even if they're outside trying to find a parking). The service was good. Food was good and everything as expected for a busy restaurant. Great place to eat with family and friends. Would eat there again

name: Takashi
content: Oh my god, just do it. This place is incredible. I've had sushi at hundreds of places all over the world. This is the best! Go!!!!

name: Takashi
content: My favorite restaurant in Utah. I usually order the ceviche roll, mussel shooters, tnt roll, and the whole fried trout. Seriously amazing!

name: Takashi
content: Came on a Wednesday night, 1.5 hour wait, and then 45 min to get our food. Asayako and blye sky are also good. My friends really liked the box roll.

name: Takashi
content: One of the best sushi experiences I've ever had. The atmosphere, experience sitting at the bar, and food is overall beautiful.  The menu is diverse and  even my dad, who wasn't fond of sushi, had an amazing experience. I highly recommend Takashi to anyone on the fence!

name: Takashi
content: Delicous. We ordered the Nigiri and Jose hooked it up. Jose prepared the Nigiri just how we love it, fully dressed and ready to eat with no need to dip the sushi into soy sauce. Jose is creative, knowledgable and very passionate about his craft so i'll order his Omakase next time.

name: Takashi
content: I love sushi, but always get a bit more cautious when in landlocked states/countries.  Had high hopes for Takashi though based on some coworkers who used to be based in SLC and also the fact that everything I read said "arrive before they open, there will be a line outside!"....and they were 100% accurate.  Got there about 25 mins before it opened and there were probably at least 30 people ahead of me.  Once they opened though and since it was just me, got in quickly and was set at the sushi bar making for fun experience watching the chefs prepare everything.  Picked three different roles.  Believe I had the Yellow Submarine, the Imagine, and the Little Mermaid.  All three were super fresh and served fresh wasabi.  The sushi chefs were pretty personable, even though they were slammed with orders.  It was even interesting watching them just grab tickets from the counter top in what seemed to be no real order....they were just stacked.Would highly recommend if in SLC if you dont might waiting in line and needing to arrive early.  Will be back.

name: Takashi
content: This is a great sushi place with some amazing combinations as well as classic favorites. The Azucora Beef is amazing and a must every time and strawberry fields has a nice combination of sweet and salty. Fish is fresh and service is amazing as well.

name: Takashi
content: Favorite place to get sushi. My favorite roll  is the rice less rolls. Love the atmosphere and decor. This place is always busy so be prepared to wait or plan accordingly and snag a drink while you wait.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for good food and hospitality. I came in to get a takeout bowl what was told I couldn't, but with 30 minutes before closing I was invited to dine in. I quickly ordered and was quickly served. And as I ate closing Time came around and the waitress asked if I needed more and she reassured me that even though they were closed that they would still serve me and there was no rush, to just enjoy my meal. I appreciate their patience and hospitality and I hope they know that they are doing an amazing job and to keep the same energy going forward.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Disclaimer: this was my first hot pot experience so I don't really have anything else to compare it to. When you first walk in they have a fancy thermometer checker that checks your temperature virtually without touching your skin, which was kinda cool. They also have you pick out what you want & write it on a sheet for your hotpot and then they get it for you from the buffet area. I thought the broth was a little on the bland side but they have lots of sauces to chose from to spice it up. Next time I will try the spicy hot pot broth. They had a lot of variety for noodles, meats, sauces, and veggies to put in it & everything looked and tasted fresh. We also got the appetizer sampler and everything was great in that as well. The potstickers were full of meat, the crab rangoon had lots of cream cheese, and the sushi was on the smaller side, but also very tasty. I didn't like the chicken katsu, it was too much breading for me. Our server seemed to not enjoy working there and did not come around to our table often to check on us.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: If you want to spend over $25 to cook your own food and not have it taste good, this is the place to go! Very underwhelming flavor. The only flavor comes from the sauces which are also not very good. And no free refills for the drinks. What is this? Europe??

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: My number 1 favorite spot for shabu shabu right now! Due to covid, they had you a piece of paper to check off what you want and will grab the items for you. Such a great deal with fresh ingredients! I always order the vegetarian option. Don't be fooled, you still get seafood and the meatballs, etc. the only thing you don't get are the sliced meats! The appetizers are also delicious, we always order the combo to share while waiting for the broth to heat up! *disclaimer, the heating element for the shabu pots aren't the best. So it does take 10-15 minutes for the broth to start boiling. The service is always friendly and it's one of our favorite places to dine!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: All southerners that may try this place. Its very nice and beautiful in the inside. Service and staff were excellent. The atmosphere was great very clean. However for some reason up north theres no flavor in the food. I guess they don't believe in salt. The broth was not flavorful and the meats were plain. So 3 stars for the flavor

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Mr. Shabu has been on my radar for such a long time. Glad to finally try it.Service was so top notch, and ordering process was a bit complicated. We had to all try and figure out what was best to order.What threw us all off was the buffet table was only for servers and not the guests.Once food came out things were rolling smoother as we were able to gauge the portion sizes.Loved the different noodle selection and sauces.Can't wait to return.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I love interactive dining experiences. These guys are going the best they can all things considered. I will say I was a little disappointed. I made a res. For my bfs birthday. It was not the romantic, fun experience I imagined. We just sat across from each other with a big tub of broth and threw vegetables and weird sea creatures in it. I have experienced Shaba Shabu in Tokyo and I think I was expecting something similar so this may be on me. Fun to try once, but I don't think I will be back.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Such a fun place to go. I chose the veggie broth and it had ZERO taste. Not good at all.  Very disappointing. However, everything else I ate, I loved. The all you can eat sushi and wontons are worth the visit. I'm pretty sure I ate about 12 wontons. So dang good. Service was awesome.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: 5 stars for Mr. Shabu. The staff, from taking our reservation to table service, were welcoming and accommodating. The restaurant it self was incredibly clean with lots of room to distance.Our kids loved the hands on experience. Food was delicious and fresh. Really appreciated the help with a to-go order. Big thank you to the night manager!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Pros:+ All You Can Eat for $25 ($18 for lunch!!)+ Wide variety of vegetables and meats+ Appetizers included in AYCECons:- Not limiting capacityWe came here twice during our ski trip. Our Wednesday evening @ 5PM dining experience was nice. I'd guess the restaurant was operating at 25% capacity. They were able to distance all of us to make us feel safe. Saturday night @ 6PM was completely different. All tables occupied. The place is spacious, but it's way too many people in an enclosed environment. We made the decision to dine-in despite the max capacity.Honestly, their meats are superb. I love their #3 and #7. That's all we ate. Their broths are weak, but that's fine if you're a sauce person. The service is always great.Of the 4 of us, 3 returned to SF sick. I was the only one fully vaccinated and feeling fine. Looking back, the only potential exposure was indoor dining (once in Vail and twice at Mr. Shabu). It's 50/50 between Vail and Shabu.Be smart and dine-in at your own risk. Really want hotpot? Get it on a weekday.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Place was good but the some of the sliced meat stuck onto the plate and some pieces were dried out suggesting it was precut and was sitting around for a while. Broth was good.  I had the spicy one.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: We eat here twice in a week that's how much we enjoyed it. Fun meal, great environment with excellent service. Love the lobster balls and crab balls. So many things to try, you'll have to go there at least twice.Really great value for the money.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: What a fun fully immersive experience   You get to control what you eat and what you like in it. Bonus unlimited sushi and other yummy appetizers! Yes please. I went with the veggies and the veggie broth. Not a lot of flavor in the broth. Will try another flavor next time. Because the experience can be so different each time I will go back. Great variety of veggies and not to mention all the meats and seafood that my hubby did.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Dine in is open! That's great news but when you're inside, it doesn't look like there's a pandemic going on. There's so many people in the dining room and the lobby area. It's super cold outside so of course we're all inside trying to stay warm. Masks are required but there doesn't seem to be much social distancing going on. We sat in the tall booths and there are people in front, behind and to the side of us. I assumed they'd block every other booth and table. I get that there are busy days and busier nights. Friday night was one of those crazy nights and I felt that management should have added more staff to keep up with the demand. Instead of walking up to the "salad bar" you jot down whatever you want and the server will pick it up and bring it to your table. As great as that sounds, service was soooo slow. It was very extremely disappointing to wait for 30 minutes before our server came back to check in. We actually had to flag her down. We ran out of food, water, soda, napkins, broth, you name it. It was getting so ridiculous that my friend complained about the wait since it was about another hour into service before we received our second plates of meat and refills of everything we needed. Food is good, but too pricey for a small selection and now extremely slow service. I hope management learn from my experience and add hire more staff during their busy nights.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Excellent food and excellent service! I was so impressed with the high quality food. The veggies were fresh and the meat was to perfection. Highly recommend!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Very tasty all you can eat shabu. I went for lunch so the selection was somewhat limited but I was very impressed by the quality of ingredients and the broth.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I'll start off by saying I'm more accustomed to Taiwanese style hotpot my basis for good hotpot may be a bit different. That being said, this place is still good, just very salty. To me, the sign of good hotpot is the broth, and the flavor in the three different broths I tried just didn't do it for me. The variety and ability to pick out your own ingredients is very nice though.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Food is delicious but service quality depends on day. I have been there five times and two times I had great service and three times I had bad service. There steak is perfect and their appetizers are great but very small portions. So order 2 orders of apps of you want a normal portion. There rosemary fries and won tons are delish.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I came here while visiting a friend in Salt Lake City. I wish Mr. Shabu was in more locations in the United States because this was an amazing meal!! This location is in the Gateway. Parking is easy due to the parking garages. My friend made a reservation in advance and even though we arrived early, they were able to seat us right away. You will get your temperature taken before being seated. Once we got to our seat, there were menus with steps on how to order as well as a piece of paper and pen to choose what vegetables, noodles, and seafood you want. The self-serve buffet with these items is currently only accessible to employees due to COVID. Shortly after being seated, our waiter came to our table to explain the process and to take drink and appetizer orders. He suggested to try the sampler, consisting of a few of each appetizer as well as three rolls. This came out quickly and was delicious!  Our waiter came back to take our orders for broth, meat, and to take our order sheets. Service was prompt and he was back within the five or so minutes to get our broth started. This felt very COVID friendly considering my friend and I each had our own broth to use and did not have to share. Our waiter then came back with trays of meat and plates with the vegetables, noodles, and seafood we ordered.I chose the miso broth and was flavorful without being too overpowering. I did add some garlic and green onions. I ordered three different types of beef and most were good with a few pieces being a little bit too fatty. Despite this, the meat was quality and vegetables were fresh with great taste when cooked in the broth. I will definitely be coming back here when I am in Salt Lake City! For the price, this is a quality, delicious meal and a fun experience.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: My family and I went to Mr. Shabu on the first day of our trip to Utah in February 2021. We did not have reservations but we're still seated. They check everyone's temperature upon arrival. They restaurant was extremely clean, it is the kind of hot pot place where each person has to individual pot. The buffet is no longer accessible except for two workers. Your waiter will bring everything you request. This is AYCE. My husband and I frequent shabu joints, and are kind of shabu snobs. This is definitely one of the better shabu restaurants we have been to. It is also very reasonably priced, bordering on too cheap for the amount of food you get! It was so good we went on the last day of our trip even though it was not part of the itinerary. The spicy broth and Saki Yuki broths were our favorites. All the seafood was so fresh! The meats are delicious. Also the views next to the window are excellent when it snows! Would definitely recommend!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Absolutely delicious!! I ordered the Spicy Hotpot (for vegetarians).The other two people on the table ordered - the veggie broth (tasty with the sauces)- mix of Spicy hotpot and Tonkatsu (yes, you can customize. Was delish!)The cream cheese wontons were sooo good! Love a crunchy snack in between sipping the ramen. I also wasn't aware that it was a part of the buffet :) sweet surprise!None of us were disappointed at all! We loved it. Would recommend going on an empty stomach.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Salt Lake City.I went when it first opened because we had spent hours at the made in Utah event selling our handmade candles for a cause (@belightcandleco). We give back to suicide prevention and mental health so we are passionate about that to say the least!The food was our of this world I couldn't get enough. I probably had like 3 different servings because I kept coming back for more.  #truestory

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: They are very covid friendly! They take your temperature before you go in and serve you all your food. The quality is great especially for the price point. It's easy to eat since each person has their own hot pot.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Mr. Shabu is one of my favorite restaurants in Utah. I love how clean the restaurant is, it's so welcoming and not to mention a fun experience. Love the variety of vegetables noodles, meats, broth to choose from, they also have a phenomenal selection of sauces to choose from as well. This place is all you can eat and it's definitely worth the price. Lunch is about $17.95 a person and dinner, I believe about $24 something. They also have an amazing appetizer sampler that is highly recommended to order it's included in the meal. I wish I could eat here every single day it is so good

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This is one of my favorite hot pot restaurants in Salt Lake! I end up waddling out of here every time I go, it's so good that I don't want to stop eating! The restaurant is always clean, they take your temperature when you walk in and all the servers wear gloves. It's set up like buffet style but because of Covid, you fill out a form and your server grabs everything for you. Give it a try, you won't regret it!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I have not yet had a bad experience here. The staff is friendly and the service has been exceptionally great for every visit. They offer an appetizer platter that allows you to taste all their delicious starters. The truffle fries are my favorite. Prior to covid, we were allowed to pick the type of veggies, seafood, noodles, and sauce and load them onto our own plates. Now, they provide a piece of paper with your options they have and the server will bring back portions that you have selected. They also have plenty of sauce options to pick from. The wagyu beef is offered for dinner so that's what I usually end up ordering. I order a mixture of the tonkotsu and spicy hotpot broth to add a bit of extra kick of flavor. The only complaint I have is the seating. For some reason, the tables feel extra tall when I seated on the booth. It feels like I have to reach my arm far up in order to reach my food. There are only a few booths that I've sat in that are seated this way. Usually the two person table is adjusted correctly but with a table that seats four, I usually encounter this issue.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Love this restaurant it's been one of our favorites. We come here often and always expect exceptional food and service.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Four stars might be too harsh.  I just hold five stars for the perfect dinner.  The waitress totally covered my daughter in sauce.  It was an accident- I get that.  I was just surprised she didn't do more to apologize.  We joked with my daughter that now she had Mr. Shabu panties....  So the service could have been a little better and a little less eventful.  (Mr. Shabu panties in January don't make for an enjoyable outside shopping stroll through the Gateway - or so I'm told).  The food was amazing though and the portions were generous.  The flavors were great!  My favorite meat cuts were #1 and #7.  The mushrooms were amazing in the spicy tonkatsu mixed broth too.  We'll be back - perhaps we'll have my daughter wear a rain suit next time.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Great spot for hot broth in winter. They have individual pots and you don't have to leave your seat to get food right now due to COVID - they bring everything you ask to the table. Food is fresh and clean. Broth is on the mild side but this is how Japanese food is supposed to be. You can ask for other spices if you would like and put in the broth for personalized taste.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Fun place to go get a shabu shabu fix. Not super authentic but you are in SLC so sometimes you just be thankful you have an option. Decent variety though and each person gets their own pot so no sharing  if that bothers you. But if sharing a hot pot bothers you then you probably don't like Asian food anyway

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Love this place! The food. beautiful. so fresh. their service is quick and efficient as well as friendly. great for pescatarians and vegetarians. I can't wait to come back with the whole family.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This is our favorite place to go!! Best spot in SLC. High quality meat and broth! Delicious! We will be back next week!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: A very good hotpot place at SLC Utah!! The servers were very helpful and friendly and always checked in on us. The whole restaurant is very clean and maintained well through covid! 10/10

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: A great hotpot place in Salt Lake City Utah! It is all you can eat and each individual has their own hotpot. They have safety regulations in place such as it is not longer a buffet style, you have to fill out a form with what you want. The servers were great and friendly!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Best hot pot you can get in Utah ! Amazing good quality food ! Make sure you get the pork no.8 one of the best I have had ! And get the appetizers combo ! The fries are way better than any other frys place you can get !

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Absolutely amazing! Our server Carmela was amazing! We had a lot of requests and she so efficient with all of them! We are from out of town and this is where we eat everytime we are in Utah! We love shabu shabu and this is the best one we have ever been to.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Visiting from LA, we weren't expecting too much from Mr.Shabu, but man.. was it a pleasant surprise. The meat choices were great and abundant, the extra sides they let you select were high quality (crab, clams, mussels, etc), and the service was super attentive. If I ever come back to visit Salt Lake City, I'll def be visiting Mr. Shabu especially since the weather is so damn cold here. The food was def on par with what we have in LA, but way less inexpensive.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This is my one and only goto spot for shabu in Salt Lake. We came from CA having tried every single shabu place over there. And the service for this place is definitely amazing and the food is also top notch quality as well.P/S: number 5,6 and tonkotsu broth are definitely worth it.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Best hot pot place in Utah! Everything is so fresh and the beef quality is supreme. I am a hotpot fanatic and so so happy with this place. The dinner menu has sushi option and they are delicious too! We keep coming back here! They check your temperature at the door so we feel pretty safe

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Easy to make reservations ambience is nice with privacy at each table.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Would be better if there was more table service as it gets very overwhelming and cramped.  Eating tables are very high and a bit awkward for trying to shuffle around raw meats cooked foods and a hot pot.  Appetizers were the best food we really enjoyed the bulgogi wrap, tonkatsu, and gyoza.  Decent choices for lunch menu lots of options.  Hot tea wasn't very good.  Would enjoy more sauce choices.  Didn't love that most of the seafood was all in full shell including heads and eyeballs... Wasn't prepared to squish brains and eyeballs before I ate my food.  Goals easily tip over and there needs to be somewhere to put dishes as you don't need them.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I'm originally from Southern California but was in town because my cousin recently relocated here. Socal has many, many shabu shabu places that I'm a big fan of and I must say that Mr. Shabu exceeded my expectations. The meat and broth was so good! For those of you who enjoy spicy foods, I would recommend getting the miso broth with a side of their spice! The restaurant is also very big and spacious so you'll surely be socially distanced from all other diners. They also take your temperature upon arrival. Overall, I would definitely recommend this spot!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Super sweet workers and great experience! SO clean and organized. The food was so good and I definitely have to come back. The servers were very attentive and on point!! I eat Shabu a ton in California, but this is definitely is one of my favorites. Sad it's not in Provo but it's good for whenever I visit the Asian markets nearby in SLC! Portion sizes were good too. Love Mr. Shabu!!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Good shabu with lots of options. Tried the tokotsu with beef and it was great. Wonderful food and great selection

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I enjoyed this Shabu Shabu place a lot. They did an excellent job following covid protocols.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Best hot pot I've ever eaten and I've eaten Michelin star hotpot in Hong Kong. I was just blown away by how good their soup base was. Service is top notch and the meat is super fresh. Definitely check them out if you get a chance. They are busy on weekends so come during the week.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Great shabu spot. The best meat we've had by far out of all the shabu spots we've tried. Great social distance and also measures to ensure there's no contamination. My favorite was the pork belly! We also had Mr Shabus soup base. AYCE appetizers too!!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Awesome food and service! All you can eat! Loved the location Inside was very modern and clean.Lots of great options for appetizers, sushi, and all the choices for meat and veggies

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Everything was super good and super fresh! From out of town and really recommend! Lots of food and options. Staff is accommodating and friendly!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Lots of option for meats and veggies. Everything was super tasty! Mr. Shabu soup was my fav!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This place is literally the best place to bring friends or family! I'm not really a hotpot typa girl (since this is my very first time having hotpot lol) but let me tell you, this place is YumMmMM. You will definitely get your $$$$ worth, especially if you are a seafood/meat lover. I love the Tonkatsu & spicy hotpot broth the best!! The Tonkatsu broth especially is so creamy. Their sauces really allow you to amp up the taste based on your preferences which is nice. Another plus, this place is SUPER clean. Will be back!!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This restaurant is very clean and has great service. There's a wide variety of meats, broths, and vegetables to choose from. This is one of the best Shabu places I've been in the Salt Lake area.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Amazing service! We had an excellent server that even offered to let me try the broths when I couldn't decide. She got us everything we needed promptly and checked in often. Not to mention, I loved the quality of the meat. So fresh and there were 6 different types of beef to choose from. The appetizer sampler was a great add on.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: They have added sushi as an appetizer here. The truffle fries and edamame are a great addition.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This place is so much fun.  Such a great spot to sit, take some time and make some delicious soup !  Great time to sit, visit and reconnect with someone.   All the food selections are beyond amazing.  The sauces, appetizer and ambiance are top notch.  Let's not forget the awesome service .  They are very attentive to your needs!  So fun to come here and have a great experience!  And don't forget to get the appetizer sampler!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: One of my favorite restaurants in SLC! I have tried a lot of other shabu places but Mr. Shabu tops them all with the quality food and service they provide. You can't go to the bar to pick up your veggies and sauces anymore due to covid but ordering it from your table is so easy and quick. Some of my favorite items from the salad bar is the kimchi, fish balls, udon noodles, and all the fresh veggies. Go give them a try! So worth it.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Decided to go here for dinner after visiting the planetarium. They have very good covid measures; they have a cool machine that remotely scans your face for temperature, all servers wear masks, some tables are kept unoccupied to promote social distancing, and the servers get your items from the salad bar. All the meats were thinly sliced and very tender. They had a good selection of sides, appetizers, and sauces. Our server, Bea, was awesome. She was very attentive and brought out orders quickly. Will definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Price was right with a Great staff and delicious food this is our go to place for hotpot.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Really good food and fun experience! A little confusing to understand the process at first but overall a great time and good food.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This place is so fun!  I brought my kids and boyfriend and we ordered so much food.  It's fresh and delicious!  Will definitely come back!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: We were there for my birthday. It was delicious, so flavorful broth and good quality. Definitely going back!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I always come over here for the best shabu. Their Tonkatsu broth is the best. The service is nice and I really like the vibe!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This place is my go to for hot pot. It's so good! I love how they have individual hot pots and the meat choices are really good.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: So so so delicious! My husband and I came here for date night and wow it was amazing. The customer service was amazing and the little yogurt drink at the end was the cherry on top. 10/10 AMAZING

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Temperature check at the door, mask enforced when you're away from your table, and tables are socially-distance -- they are doing all the right things to ensure restaurants stay open in Utah. The food is delicious and there are a lot of options, best part is it's all you can eat for an affordable price ($18/lunch and $26/dinner). Broths and sauces are very tasty. I really like the diversity that Mr. Shabu brings to the Gateway. Easy and convenient parking. Would highly recommend this place, especially on a cold day!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: So yummy and so fun. The waiter was so fast and awesome. Good place for dinner and all you can eat

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: The facilities were clean and safe. The wait staff were great! The tonkotsu broth had great flavor! All of the ingredients were fresh and the meal was so filling and tasty!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Came here with my family. Very easy and accessible. I like having my own individual pot and always wanted to try and it was a great first experience.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: We stopped here on our way to Yellowstone, and it definitely hit the spot! My boyfriend loved his tonkotsu soup with his meats, and loved my veggie miso broth! The included appetizers were also super delicious! Hint: cream cheese wontons were amazing! Definitely recommend it.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This is my second time eating here for lunch. It is indoor eating but the tables are well spaced. Masks and gloves are worn by the staff. They check everyone's temperature before coming in. The food is sooo good. Highly recommend. Everything is really fresh and tastes really clean. A large selection of choices for broths, meats, vegetables, and sauces. Staff is really friendly and efficient. Lunch prices are very reasonable for how much food you get and they have various discounts going on.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Yummy. All you can eat. Very fresh. Great broths to chose from. Endless veggies and seafood choices. Great appetizers. Fun way to have a meal with others.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Variety choices of meat, veggies and carbs!  I love their sauce and and broth is awesome.  I highly recommend this place for cold weather.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Came here during lunch and the service was amazing. Thought it wouldn't be the same experience since it's wasn't regular buffet style, but I was definitely wrong. The staff was very attentive and polite. They would also often check-in with us to see if anything else was needed.The food was great!! Lots of meat, seafood and veggie options. Definitely a place worth checking out.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Amazing service! We came here on a Monday afternoon for their lunch, and they follow all appropriate COVID measures. Staff were super polite and attentive and all of our food came out attentively. Their appetizer tray was so fresh and delicious! Loved their meat and variety of selections! Would definitely recommend this place again!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This is a great place with lots of options to choose from and some amazing appetizers included. Love this spot.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Friendly staff and nice quality meat!Nice interior and healthy food! Highly recommend #7 meat. All the meat lovers should try!!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Very good quality meat with fresh veggies and seafood are served. Friendly staffs with good customer service. Highly recommend!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: First time to Mr shabu.  The food is very fresh and thr waitress helped walk us through the shabu process and was patient and kind. The portions are gigantic, we weren't expecting the amount of add in that we chose. Will definitely be back with a group.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Hands down the best shabu shabu spot in the valley. The mr shabu broth is super flavorful and the meats are very high quality. The veggie/seafood bar is not self served because of covid, but the servers bring them out for you so its very convenient. 10/10 would come back

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: While walking through the food center next to our hotel on Friday night, we decided to come here on Saturday night for dinner.  When we arrived, our group was greeted by the staff right away and they checked our tempertaure with high tech device.  The staffs was very nice and they checked on us every 5 minutes to see if we needed anything.  The seafood, vegetables was fresh and very yummy especially the soup.  They even have wagyu for the meat options.  Our group really enjoyed everything about this place. We would definitely come back here again if we are in the Salt Lake City area.  Remember to make a reservation one day in advance to get 20% off.  Thanks again for the awesome food and experience Mr. Shabu.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This was one of the best Shabu places I've been to.  The sauces for the hot pot was delicious.  Also, the broth was very flavorful.  Moreover, the food was fresh and the staff was courteous.  I'm from California, but I'll definitely make a trip back to Utah to have Mr. Shabu again.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Excellent service that makes it feel safe to eat out during COVID. The Mr. Shabu broth is light, flavorful and cravable. All the meat selections were also fresh and delicious.Very reasonable prices especially when visiting from CA.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Best Shabu place ever! Great sides that are very fresh. Service was fast and the servers were super nice.  Broth is also really important when eating Shabu. I had had the Tonkatsu and it was delicious. I highly recommend this place to anyone craving Shabu!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: We are visiting from California for our annual Basketball tournament. Since COVID nothing is open in California. We missed the hotpot experience. We really enjoyed this fast service and the super friendly servers. The meat, seafood and veggies are really fresh. The price is really good , too. I recommend eating here if your In UTah 5star all the way

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This place is so good! We called to make reservations and was seated right away when we came at our designated time. We were seated at a good distance from other parties there. The selection was good, you have to write everything except the meat down on a piece of paper and they bring it to you, but the meat you can order 2 things at a time. They now offer sushi with the AYCE but they only have 3 types, California roll, Vegas, and playboy roll. Overall the experience was good and staff was clean and attentive! Will be coming back.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Great place for shabu, they have prime beef and wagyu. Plenty of selections for anyone, vegetarian friendly.  I got the tonkutsu broth, perfect blend for the meat and assorted seafood.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Extremely fun and welcoming environment. There are so many options for everyone. Food was very good, especially the meat. Our server, Jolie, was patient with us and very helpful as it was our first time. We will definitely be back.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: I love the variety of food Mr Shabu has while still tasting quality. The appetizers are endless and they have sushi for dinner. The meat for the entree tastes very quality especially for being all you can eat. It's a really fun and welcoming atmosphere. The service is always attentive and friendly. I will definitely be back!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: When they say "all you can eat" they aren't kidding. My eyes were definitely much bigger than my stomach. The food is fresh, the staff is friendly and explains shabu to you if you dont know what it is and most importantly, they take covid seriously.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This is my favorite restaurant in SLC and my go to place to bring guests. Bonus that it's AYCE. Every time I come here (about once every two weeks), I always think about how well set up and great quality the restaurant is - cleanliness, beautiful aesthetics, comfy chairs, thick napkins, fantastic service, fresh meat and veggie quality. I get the miso broth so that I can add extra garlic and hot chili oil to customize it to my preferences!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Pretty good! Lots of variety stuff you can choose from & their service was quick. Great place to come if you are craving hot pot.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This is all-you-can-eat Korean/Japanese Shabu Shabu  place with an individual pot and grill. The selection of appetizers, broth, as well as meat, veggies, noddles, and seafood is beyond my expectation!!! Clean and nice interior/decor; atmosphere is chick yet comfortable; service is great, not overdone or underdone. What a nice surprise to have this high-quality Shabu restaurant in Utah! Definitely will come back. I now have found my favorite Asian restaurant where I can pamper my out-of-town guest. Highly recommend.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This was our first time at Me Shabu but we've been to other hot pot type places in the past. Totally worth it if you're a fan of hot pot. The meat was super tender, portions were good, and we received our orders quickly. Jolie was our server and everything was perfect. She has an upbeat attitude and was attentive without being overbearing.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: We went during late lunch. This place takes reservations over the phone too. Once u arrive, there are covid-19 signs and a nice temperature scanner at the front desk. We always wear our mask as a common courtesy and for safety measures. Here while entering, talking to the waiter, when we left our table, and exiting. All staffs wearing masks too. It's so cute and nice, clean inside. We ordered all items we wanted from the waitress, it's all you can eat. The restaurant closes at 2pm for cleaning to reopen at dinner at 5. They didn't rush us to leave after closing. Service was good and a variety of food choice on the menu, especially the veggies, it's my fave. We enjoyed it very much here and can't wait to go back soon. I highly recommend this hot pot, best we've had in salt lake county!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Crap service Crap food Food was rancid tasting Don't eat here Sorry folks but it's bad Like a husband and wife operation but they are not at all good For owning a restaurant in a good place they are crapDon't go period !!!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: They take COVID seriously, the quality of the food is awesome. And the vibe is fun. Let's just say I went there 2 times in 24 hours after I found it . I highly recommend. It is super good.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: This place was really good! The server was very helpful as it was the first time we had been here. It was a very fun experience!

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: My husband and I didn't have the best experience here. Food was pretty mediocre. They didn't have a couple basic hotpot things like daikon (our server seemed to not have heard of it). My Tonkotsu broth was kind of bland and greasy. We feel like they got a bit passive aggressive towards the end... our server stopped coming to the table and we started having to ring the bell more than once to get their attention for more food. Someone came by and asked if we wanted more appetizers (we were ordering meat at this point). When our server did come back and we placed an order of meat, she just coldly said "okay anything else?". Maybe we were eating too much :p Music was also pretty bad for a relaxing dining experience. Place was big and open tho, and they have a temperature scanner that scans everyone who comes in during covid. Meat was good.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Went with my family and colleagues, body temperature checked at the entrance, all employees had masks on. Fast service and good food for what they charged for. Will eat here again if we're in the area and are in the mood for Shabu.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: Took a little stop in Salt Lake City and was craving something delicious after a long drive. Area was pretty nice, it was not packed at all mainly because of the pandemic. Parking was super easy to find.The customer service was beyond amazing. It was our first time there and the waitress, I believe her name is Joy, was very helpful. We were not sure what to order as an appetizer so she said she would just give us a sampler platter of everything. She would keep checking up on us to see if we needed to order more for our all you can eat hot pot.The broth choices were pretty good and the meats and veggies were amazing. Definitely will come again next time I'm in Utah.

name: Mr. Shabu at Gateway
content: We were visiting from out of town and love Shabu Shabu so we decided to stop by due to the mostly positive reviews. We were the first customers when they opened for dinner and our waitress was very thorough initially and very attentive, unfortunately after she brought our first course we slowly felt ignored as more customers came in. It seemed like they were understaffed and it showed. When ordering meats, you are limited to choosing only 2 at a time which caused SIGNIFICANT delays. Despite there being a service button at your table, no matter how many times we pressed it we did not get any response. We waited so long we eventually just gave up and asked for the bill. The food wasn't bad, but service was slow. Again, this may be due to being understaffed, but if you can't even refill our beverages when they are clearly layed out in the front of the table, then you do not deserve any higher ratings until you get your service in check

name: The Ivy
content: I had just arrived to my hotel late in the evening and was hoping to order room service because I was starving but they did not have that as an option so I quickly hopped on Yelp and saw that I could order from 'the ivy' through grub hub. Thank goodness! I didn't want to eat junky food so I was happy I had 10 minutes to spare and place an order. I wish I would've taken a photo because the seared salmon was cooked perfectly in a bed of white kidney beans and cherry tomatoes. I ordered the broccolini as well and everything was amazing! Everything was cooked to perfection, I'm sure it would only be just that and more if you dine in.

name: The Ivy
content: Not sure how long this place has been around but glad we found it! The decor and ambiance were really nice, a little understated so you would feel comfortable being in casual wear or something a little nicer. The menu is pretty original, some unusual pairings, but everything we tried worked well I thought. I went out on a bit of a limb and ordered the "Flafel Waffle" but it was really delicious, great Flafel flavor served with very fresh and flavorful beet hummus and some light veggies tossed in a mild sauce. The waiter was knowledgeable and gave some good recommendations. We'll definitely be back!

name: The Ivy
content: Came in on a Sunday with a reservation and had a great time. It looked like they had room for walk-ins as well so if you're on the fence give em a call.  This place is centrally located with a super pretty outdoor spot-I hope they open the outdoor seating for the warmer months. Parking is downtown so just pick a place and walk a lil bit, uber, or find one of those super fun guys with the bike carts to take you on an exhilarating ride. The ambiance is just beautiful. The décor is super clean with lots of candles and glowing lights as well as some beautiful non faux foliage. The bar is super spacious and they have a whole other area for large parties or maybe if you want a more quiet spot. All of the staff were very kind, the hostess, the bus boy, the bartender...everyone was nice and made me feel welcome.  Our bartender was Jordan and he was super friendly and knowledgeable. I had the hibiscus margarita and WOW...it was a winner for sure. It was nice and sweet and just perfect for me. My girl friend that I went with asked him to make her something on the sweeter side and he delivered 100% with this amazing pineapple, cucumber, mint, magic drank.  The everything Brussel sprouts are really what everyone says they are...absolutely amazing. They start on the bottom with some amazing cheese and then put some crispy brussels on top and then a sprinkle of some "everything bagel seasoning", they finish the dish with a majestic mustard-maple sauce...I cannot tell you how amazing it was. Get one for yourself. Don't share it hun. You know when you take a bite of something and have to think about it...yea...it was like that. It takes a second to process all the yummy flavors happening but try it and you won't regret it.The main dish I had was the seared salmon with cannellini beans, arugula, cherry tomatoes, crispy shallots and chimichurri sauce. The fish was great with the veggies and the chimichurri sauce. My friend had the sweet potato gnocchi and it smelled amazing and I may try it next time. I remember this building when it was the Vortex and it was an AMAZING party venue. I would absolutely love to see them do something super fun especially with their patio! So exciting to see SLC growing and changing!

name: The Ivy
content: I took my best friend here for her birthday and I could have not been happier with the quality of food and service. Our server was awesome and pointed us to some really good dishes. If you get a chance try the curry muscles. They were amazing.

name: The Ivy
content: Awesome food servers and environment. Flew into slc and it was the first place we hit. It did not disappoint

name: The Ivy
content: Found this place on Yelp and then saw pictures posted by Van "Xíu" N. Made reservations on OpenTable. It was dead upon arrival and then quickly filled up with every table taken.Food came out in an orderly fashion as they used mPOS devices to take your order and wirelessly sent to the kitchen. This keeps the servers on the ball while they attend to other tables.My favorites:-Everything Brussels-Chorizo Fried Rice-Chicken Caprese sandwich-Sweet Potato GnocchiThe manager came to visit each and every table and asked what we liked/disliked.It was a pleasant meal and for sure will be back.

name: The Ivy
content: Honestly, what you're paying for is the gorgeous ambiance. It is a beautiful venue.I went to The Ivy for a birthday party and I ordered the cashew kimchi bowl ($17) and the Everest first flush ($11). I think the general consensus of my group was that while the food was beautiful and tasty, it was overpriced for the portion size. I think everyone left the restaurant still a little hungry.As for drinks, I thought the Everest was delicious if you love sourness and don't like the taste of alcohol. Truly, it reminded me of a hard lemonade. If I wasn't concerned about driving home, I could probably drink three of them--they're so refreshing and yummy. I tried my friend's Hibiscus Oleo Marg and I wasn't a fan... but I'm also not a tequila person, so take that with a grain of salt.I could see myself going to The Ivy again for a Girls Night, but other than that, I probably wouldn't come back. The customer service was awesome, though!

name: The Ivy
content: They took over the old Cafe Molise and I have to say they did an amazing job updating it and making now a super cool, hip, and new trendy spot! I am in love with the vibe and love that it is only 21+! I feel there needs to be more of these and they are open until 1! The food was fantastic, however we tried the ribblet appetizer and I would say it was not my favorite. Highly recommend though the Thai Curry Muscles..cooked to perfection and the sauce was so good, I wanted to take it home and pour it over some rice! Their goat cheese and pear salad was freaking the bomb and I added a fillet of salmon for some extra protein. It was amazing!! Defiantly highly recommend and will be going back ASAP!

name: The Ivy
content: We were walking around the downtown area shortly after 5pm on a Sunday (read: majority of shops and restaurants are closed) and decided to stop inside for some drinks- very thankful to have found somewhere that was actually open! First impressions were great and tables are spaced out well enough so we felt comfortable. The interior design is appealing with lots of plants, neon signage, and unique lights. The cocktail prices are definitely on the higher end of the spectrum for Salt Lake- average price for a cocktail here is $12.33. Our favorite was the Everest First Flush (botanical vodka, tea, palm sugar) which was like a more mature version of what you'd expect if you asked the bartender for a sweet cocktail. Our least favorite was the Life After Death cocktail which contains toasted buckwheat that gave the drink a strange texture and left somewhat of an aftertaste. Maybe we just aren't toasted buckwheat people, but we can appreciate the experimentation.We did not try any of their food items besides a small trail mix (you have to order food if you order alcohol), but the selection on the menu looked interesting.

name: The Ivy
content: The service and food were incredible. This is going down as a favorite and we will definitely go back. I always order Brussels sprouts if they are on the menu at a restaurant, Ivy's are the best I have ever had! Our waitress took care of our every need. The manager came by to see how our meal was. Great evening!!!

name: The Ivy
content: Not good for food. How you ruin a ceasar salad is beyond me but they managed to do it. Sweet but bland croutons with a mustard based dressing (i think?). My husband's side salad was mixed greens only with WAY too much dressing that it was inedible.  The sauce on his caprese sandwich was a spicy aoli that had no place on that sandwich and again was layered on too thick. Drinks were ok. Bartender was nice and only reason it got 2 stars vs 1.

name: The Ivy
content: The interior is a dream! All of the plants are real and beautifully taken care of. Food was great and service was quick, such a cute spot!

name: The Ivy
content: LOVE this space! It is absolutely beautiful, filled with warm lights and plants everywhere. I had a wonderful dining experience here and our hostess/waitress and the busboy were so kind. I am now craving everything that I tried at The Ivy the other day. The broccolini was perfectly roasted. The mussels with the Thai curry sauce was very savory and fragrant. I also really enjoyed the roasted nan bread that accompanied the roasted beet hummus and mussels. Extra kuddos * my Palestinian girl friend really appreciated the use of the word and the spice "za'atar" utilized in the roasted beet hummus. Which is not something that she sees often in SLC. Haha my hands smelled so good and like coconut milk after eating this meal!I don't drink alcohol, and so I was happy that The Ivy  has a signature mock tail that the waitress suggested. I am sucker for drinks with a strong ginger and mint flavor. The mocktail I had included ginger-ale, cucumber, mint, and a splash of grapefruit juice. Reservations on the Open Table options pops up seamlessly when you look up The Ivy on the Google Maps app.Can't wait to visit again soon and to try more of the menu!

name: The Ivy
content: This is the sister company to Varley next-door. They share the same menu, and their food is amazing! If I had to pick which restaurant to go to, I would definitely pick The Ivy. The ambience and atmosphere is way better. Got the everything Brussels: fried brussels sprouts, fromage blanc, maple-mustard, everything bagel seasoning, dill- so delicious! And my favorite dish....Thai coconut curry mussels:  lemongrass, thai chillies, thai basil, cilantro, mint, coconut milk, roti bread. AMAZING! Can't wait to return again!

name: The Ivy
content: Really glad I decided to book this spot for drinks and dinner last night with a friend. We're in SLC just for the night and wanted a fun vibe-y restaurant with cocktails and food to match. This place had an awesome ambience (edison style lightbulbs, succulents, etc.) The margarita is SO REFRESHING... one of the best drinks I have ever had at a restaurant (no joke). The food was terrific... get the everything brussels and the falafel burger. Salmon was fine but they have other dishes that we found more unique and flavorful!

name: The Ivy
content: We ordered the burgundy braised beef which is beef slow cooked in a wine sauce on top of creamy polenta. It was delicious! We ordered the chicken Caprese it says it comes with balsamic but it actually came with a very spicy aioli. For my taste it was way too spicy and very unexpected. If I had known this dish was spicy, I would have ordered a different dish.

name: The Ivy
content: Love a place that has unique vegetarian options- tried the Everything Brussels appetizer and it was amazing. Had the Falafel Waffle for my entree and it was super unique and delicious. Server was very friendly and cocktails came out quick (although they are a little pricey IMO).  Atmosphere is really cute also. Would definitely recommend!

name: The Ivy
content: Girls weekend...we had Katie as our server and she was so fun and food was great!! Yeeeehaawwww!!

name: The Ivy
content: The Ivy was a super fun experience. It was a loud, cool, open bar environment. The staff was friendly and quick to serve us at every turn. Their menu was full of great options. The tables were far apart and all safety measures are being taken to protect staff and customers. I truly enjoyed the drinks I had. I did walk in there wanting to order Five Wives, hopefully they have it in their bar soon. Would recommend making reservations.

name: The Ivy
content: The Ivy was such a fun spot to have a girl's night out! It's right in the heart of downtown Salt Lake City and they serve tasty cocktails and foods. It is a little bit on the pricier end, but I would definitely go here again! Everything we ordered was delicious. My favorite was the "Everything Brussels."

name: The Ivy
content: Service was great! We had a huge table far from others. Very cute interior. And delicious drinks. We had the everything Brussels sprouts as an appetizer that was probably my favorite! I had the sweet potato gnocchi with pulled pork that was very good and filling. Quite A few vegetarian options also.

name: The Ivy
content: Booked a reservation on Open Table to try out The Ivy. My wife and I were skeptical because we don't drink that this was going to be a mediocre bar food experience. Not the case at all. We started with Brussel sprouts which were amazing, the mussels with bread on the side to avoid gluten and a charcuterie board with bread on the side.  The board had 2 different kinds of cheeses and 3 meats. Apps were good. Brussels were the best dish. Main course we ordered the salmon and beef cheeks. Mains were ok but not great. Both dishes were recommended by our waitress. Great atmosphere, good service and great buildout. I think they did a nice job with their restaurant design.

name: The Ivy
content: Food is decent, drinks are great, vibes are immaculate, and service is friendly. Nice to see a new spot in SLC.

name: The Ivy
content: I was not expecting things to run so smoothly on an opening weekend! The Ivy will no doubt be a future favorite and staple to the down town area. We had a fairly large party and each of us ordered different appetizers. I highly recommend the Brussel Sprouts, Mussels, Beet Hummus, honestly everything. I can for once say that any item you order here will be enjoyed. I ordered the Burger. It's tasty, fresh, and has a solid bun. The fries and fry sauce are a home run. Others in our party ordered the Salmon, Shrimp and Grits, Burgundy Braised Beef, Grilled Chicken Salad, and some others. Once again, incredible. I actually heard one say "This is the best thing I have ever ordered off a menu." I believe that was about the Shrimp and Grits. This is a wonderful place. You will be happy, you will feel warm, welcome, and satisfied. I will be back.

name: The Ivy
content: Unfortunately I can't recommend The Ivy. I went with a couple girlfriends, one of whom had recommended this new spot. We were super eager to go for cocktails. I was initially put off when the man checking ID's at the front (I believe the owner) didn't believe my ID was real. I'm older than 21 and recently moved from Florida, but he side-eyed me pretty hard, even after he scanned it and it went thru. I found the cocktails to be a bit pricey, but hey, we're downtown and it was a special occasion for us, so no worries. The waitress brought us a round of cocktails and forgot my friend's drink. Hey, people forget, no worries. But it took about fifteen, almost twenty minutes for her drink to come. We obviously waited to cheers, but by the time her drink arrived, mine was getting warm. Lame. The waitress really should have made that forgotten drink the priority, rather than taking orders at other tables.We finished the first round and went to order a second round and the waitress let us know that The Ivy is a restaurant, not bar, so we'd need to order food as well. To my understanding, that's actually not legal in Utah - being that they are a restaurant, we would have had to order our food first, along with the first round of drinks. The waitress gave us the option of a "Chex mix" type of snack, which we decided to go for since we weren't too hungry. Y'all. I tried to stifle my laughter when she brought the "Chex Mix". It was less than a 1/4 cup size - for the table! I counted seven tiny pretzels! C'mon. The waitress probably should have brought one for each of us, it was hilariously tiny. Like, we're really supposed to divy up those pretzels? We obviously weren't aware of the size, but she should have had better judgment there.I ordered my drink of choice, a g+t with a local gin, Beehive I believe. My drink came out and it was...pink? I've never in my life ordered a plain gin and tonic and it was pink. I checked with the waitress to make sure she had brought me the correct drink, she assured me it was. It was tasty, but I couldn't taste a hint of gin or alcohol in it. Super lame. Now, I'm 5'8", 155 lb. lady here who hadn't eaten since lunch, only Chex Mix in my belly, it's now 8pm and I'm on my 3rd g+t and not even a buzz? What's up with that? It honestly felt like a joke. Like I was being tricked. I had gone to another restaurant earlier that week and had a solid buzz from two g+t's made with the same gin. Bartender here was definitely diluting the drink! And for the price, that's just not cool. We were at the restaurant for about 1.5 hours in total, drinking and laughing as we ladies do on a ladies night out. The waitress brought out the check a little earlier than we would have liked, which was okay until she came back yet again to say, pretty firmly, "goodnight". Minutes later, a different waitress came by to say "goodnight". Obviously, we were being hustled out. The hours are until midnight, and it was only 9:30! The place was emptying out, but seriously? And it isn't like we weren't an expensive table - we spent around $200 in drinks total (which is sort of crazy, since we each had 2 drinks except 3 for me). The waitress definitely made good tips from us (I never leave less than 20% and usually round up to 22-25% especially because with COVID these are hard times for our service staff), so I couldn't understand why we were being hustled out!This review is long, and I certainly don't mean to be rude, I just wanted to give the details. The entire vibe since we arrived was that we just weren't wanted there. That's not a cool feeling, you guys! We were really excited to try the place out and it felt like there was virtually no alcohol in my drinks and the waitress was pretty rude. TL;DR Everyone in my party agreed that the experience was lame, the drinks overpriced and under-boozed, and that we were DEFINITELY hustled out despite being a well-paying, well-tipping, polite table...

name: The Ivy
content: Me and my friends came here over the weekend and we were so exited to try this place because we saw that it was new and had great reviews. When we first got there the hostess were really nice and friendly. The food was alright and the only thing that stood out to me was the brussel sprouts. The service that we got from our waitress Bell was disappointing. She gave us attitude multiple times. She made us feel like it was a hassle to help us. When we were trying to pay, one of my friends noticed that there was an item missing from her check so she told our waitress and the waitress sigh so loud that we all heard her. It was so unprofessional!

name: The Ivy
content: Went there for Valentine's dinner. We got seating right away since we made the reservation. They were quite busy as we expected but the service was good and we didn't have to wait too long for the foods. We ordered 2 drinks, The Ivy and Milk And Honey, they both were yummy. 2 appetizers, fried oysters and charcuterie which are our favorite of the dinner.  1 soup, loaded sweet potato soup, it was good but seemed like it needed a little bit more salt. 2 entrees, sweet potato gnocchi and chicken milanese, the gnocchi was good but again needed some salt and pepper. The chicken Milanese (which basically is Caesar salad with deep fried chicken breast) was a disappointment, it was bland and boring for a $19 dish. The bill was $109 which was a reasonable price.

name: The Ivy
content: I was so excited to check out the new place that to the spot of Cafe Molise and they did not disappoint. The food was incredible, I would highly recommend the everything brussel sprouts and the steak and frites. And the service is IMPECCABLE. We got our food in a matter of minutes and they ensured our drinks were always full and our table always clear of dishes. Highly recommend!

name: The Ivy
content: I am here in SLC for work and my hotel is fortunately across the street. I ate at other places around here and feel like I wasted my money lol. I've been here twice for dinner in the last few days and plan to go again tomorrow. The ambiance, staff and food-perfection. I wish I could bring this place back to Texas with me!

name: The Ivy
content: Such a cute vibe and brand new to salt lake!! The gnocchi and Brussels sprouts are to die for. My one complaint is that they didn't have a lot of options to choose from on their cocktail list. Other than that, great place with wonderful staff and amazing food.

name: The Ivy
content: For my first time in SLC, this was the perfect spot to visit. They are fairly new/recently opened but you couldn't tell. Staff and service were phenomenal! Josh, Bell and Katie were super friendly and attentive. I had the brussel sprouts which are a must to order and the chorizo fried rice. The fried riceis up for debate. It's served with a sous vide egg; before you mix the egg in, I like the flavor but afterwards the flavor disappears and I didn't like the wet texture. But they were very accommodating and took it off my bill as I tried something else, the steak frites which was on par with the brussel sprouts. I also had the Oreo and Baileys cheesecake which was good. For cocktails, I had their signature drink, the Ivy 75 which was delicious and Katie made me a custom gin cocktail with a local gin, citrus and their house made honey syrup OMG it was to die for. This was an amazing establishment to visit and I would highly recommend!!!

name: The Ivy
content: Had the pear goat cheese salad and sweet potato gnocchi. Friends I went with had the shrimp and grits as well as the beef and grits. Everything was SO delicious. Drinks were very well made too. Great service and loved how the space was decorated. I will definitely be going back!

name: The Ivy
content: Such great food and service! Would definitely recommend. (Oh and the sweet potato gnocchi is to die for)

name: The Ivy
content: Great food and great staff, but a logistical nightmare for large parties. They can only split the tab 6 ways total, which is fine until they actually only split it 2 ways and make you do all the work. Literally. We had to pull up a copy of the menu, a calculator and write everything down by hand to match it up to the receipt.We had planned to do up to 6 groups of 4 since they had let us know they could split it 6 ways, but then the checks came out for 2 groups of 10 and they weren't separated by seat which made the whole thing even more overly complicated. Will I go back? Yes. The food was great, but i will never go back with a large group cuz it took us just as long to figure out payment than it did to eat.

name: The Ivy
content: New spot, my favorite kind!!  Got in early enough before they got busy.  The location has been beautifully done.  I got the Steak Frites that were cooked perfectly and had an extremely wonderful taste along with the rosemary fries that I loved.  For dessert we had the blondie was great.  If you want a nice place to eat with a nice atmosphere check them out.  Looks like it can get busier and livelier as the night progress if that is also you jam!  Great addition to our downtown scene.

name: The Ivy
content: We went soon after it opened. Really good food. Loved the atmosphere.  We will definitely be back!

name: The Ivy
content: I love seeing new restaurants open in Salt Lake City and I really enjoyed my first time at The Ivy.  The staff was very on top of everything!  The Brussel Sprouts were AMAZING (we had 3 orders for a table of 4 ladies).  I also had the Steak & Frites.  I will definitely go back to try some more things.

name: The Ivy
content: Great ambiance, and exactly what SLC needed. The food is top notch, decor is very fitting, and the drinks are made to perfection. It is a great spot for different occasions, and the patio will be one of the best in SLC!

name: The Ivy
content: Saw the decent reviews figured I would give it a shot being in SLC last weekend. I had the IVY Caesar and the Steak Frites. I can't figure out what exactly they do to the Caesar, but it was a to die for... Steak Frites was cooked correctly and melted in my mouth.. I hope they open one of these places in New York soon...

name: The Ivy
content: Great new place!  The vibe is very cool!  The service was good, and the food was excellent!  We LOVED the Thai mussels.  Definitely check this place out!

name: The Ivy
content: Food was excellent! Can't wait to go back and something else. Curry Mussels were my absolute favorite! The curry wasn't super spicy but just enough. My entree was the Steak Frites with a side of the curry sauce. My partner had the braised beef and it was spectacular as well. It's good to see a new location place in this space again!

name: The Ivy
content: Great new spot open later than others. The vegetarian portobello mushroom/guacamole sandwich and the chicken caprese sandwich were on point and stacked beautifully. I'd recommend grabbing take out during COVID but worth checking out the interior at a later date

name: The Ivy
content: Gorgeous space with amazing eats, what's not to love? I ate dinner opening night which is usually a gamble but they have it nailed down - service was great and food was timely....and delicious. If you are a fried brussel sprout groupie like me, try theirs and you won't be disappointed- only that you didn't have bread to sop up the remaining sauce! The fried oysters were perfectly cooked, tender and most importantly fresh. I had the shrimp and grits as my main which came with nice big boy shrimp on white cheddar grits with a creamy chorizo sauce - solid choice. BUT my friend ordered the burgundy beef cheek which was so tender and came smothered in a rich, savory, wine-reduced gravy that gave me serious food envy. Everything was delicious and I rarely say EVERYTHING.

name: The Ivy
content: We decided to try this place the weekend they opened and were beyond impressed with everything. For any restaurant, they were quick, professional, and on top of it. For a restaurant that has only been open for 2 days was shockingly amazing. They just had it together so fast! We ordered a couple drinks each (the Ivy, the marg, and Everfest) and all were great. Then the food was all amazing too. (Definitely order the brussel sprouts) Will be coming back here very often and can't wait to see it even more lively when quarantine is over

name: The Ivy
content: We came on a Saturday night. Food is fabulous.  The appetizers all are wonderful. I got the braised beef and it was amazing. My wife had the salmon It was awesome. Vibe and drink menu are top notch. Get the ivy!

name: The Ivy
content: What an experience. I was lucky enough to attend the opening night- and wow! Such a fun vibe brought to SLC. This is the sister restaurant to Varley. I am so glad that this entertainment group decided to bring life to this block. It was much needed! My girlfriends and I had such a great time. Great music. Delicious food. Fun cocktails. What more could you ask for? The burger was GREAT. The mussels were some of the best I've ever had. The pork sliders- so good! I hear they have the biggest patio in SLC, so thats something I'm looking forward to this spring. Can't wait to come back!

name: ROCTACO
content: Some of the best tacos I've eaten. Unlike other tacos these were stuffed full with great toppings. At $3.50 a taco, they were worth the price and made for an affordable nice dinner. The food was ready fast even when it was busy. Highly recommend!

name: ROCTACO
content: I'm jumping on the Roctaco train!At first the $3.50 per taco seems slightly high, but they make each taco worth it. Fun location, cool faucet in the bathroom, friendly staff and normal size cups for water (much appreciated)!The Tikka, Angry Bird, Uncle Al and Jimmy Churri were all fantastic. The Royal wasn't my fav.Will be back

name: ROCTACO
content: We love this place! The vibe is great the service is nice, the food is incredible with different sauces with all different hint of sweetness,  tartness and flavor will just burst in your mouth like fireworks, every bite is amazing!  Hard to explain but I love the unique combinations of flavor and the color of every taco is superb, it's Art! Love the container to go as well, it will not destroy your on the way home. It's our favorite taco place in Salt Lake City! This is going big! I can tell, what a great idea!

name: ROCTACO
content: Cool taco place in the same downtown alley as Campos. Busy flow on a Sat evening. Service is fast, cool bldg a partial container as their kitchen area. Nice variety of tacos with interesting names. I had K-Pop, Chanco, the Jimmy Churri, My favorite is the Jimmy Churri- had carne asada on a crusted flour tortilla. My Wife's fav was the Amy hates Fish. Check them out, fast becoming a downtown hotspot

name: ROCTACO
content: I love the idea behind this restaurant and it reminds of Velvet Taco. They add some fusion into traditional taco flavors but the execution completely missed the mark. I got the Tikka, Banh Mijo and K-Pop.Tikka - Mild tikka masala flavor and the chicken was really dry. Every other topping was pretty much tasteless. 2/5 Banh Mijo - The best of the bunch but still the meat had very little flavor and was dry but at least you could taste the pickles. 3/5K-Pop- Tasted like an egg on a falling apart tortita. If I didn't see the meat I would of thought they forgot it. This is really sad attempt at making food. 1/5Update: Following morning felt sick with food poisoning. The only thing I ate in the last 24 hours is ROCTACO and Oatmeal.

name: ROCTACO
content: I loved the tacos and the location! I ordered three because I wanted to try them all, but should've opted for two because they're hearty. The guac and chips is next level with the pomegranate. And they've got plenty for the creative eaters and a few things to appeal to the taco purists as well. Also interior decor is super cool!Why the four stars not five? It's an ethics thing. Plastic cups, straws, non reusable guac bowls and chips in a bag. All of these things would be super easy to replace with something that won't end up in the landfill. I hate having a moral dilemma about eating somewhere just because eating there means that I'll be using a bunch of single use landfill items. Make the switch to reusable items and I'll stop in a lot more!

name: ROCTACO
content: We stopped in after finding this place on Yelp.  It did not disappoint!  The unique taco flavors were enjoyed by all 5 in our party.  We ordered the Angry Bird, Jimmy Churri, Uncle Al, Chanco, Rude Bull, Amy Hates Fish and The Royal.  The guacamole with sunflower seeds and pomegranate was a delicious twist on the classic recipe.  One warning: be prepared for loud music if you eat inside.  I wish we had a Roctaco in Memphis.  Bottom line - Don't even think about it....just go here!!

name: ROCTACO
content: So I love tacos... who doesn't right?  And I bet your are wondering why the three stars for this hot new taco spot....  well, it's the tacos. The tacos are tasty, freshly prepared and served in a cool hip spot on the upcoming Edison street in downtown SLC.  The tacos don't lack originality, or flavor, but for me they just missed a little. The K-pop was good and so was the Tikka & the Amy hates fish taco was good, it just didn't deliver on the hype for me. Maybe I just expect tacos to be a little more traditional instead of all over the place, and they they were good... just not my thing. I'll stick to Santos Tacos or Lonestar for my taco fix.  Or I'll head over to the god old Red Iguana and get me some Tacos Don Ramon which has hit the spot for about thirty years.

name: ROCTACO
content: Okay this ranks right up there with  the best tacos I've ever had.  Seeing some on here complain that the tacos aren't traditional ?   Are you kidding me?   Yes they may not prepare Al Pastor in a traditional oven spit (I didn't see one ) but damn, there's a taco place across the freeway that cooks al Pastor in a spit and it tastes like Nebraska Tacos.   Anyway, I didn't come to Roctaco to get a traditional Asada taco with onions and cilantro.  Tacos are at their essence, a simple creation that satisfies an appetite in a small package  meant  to be consumed quickly by hand.   The variety of taco varieties is a testament that Taco fillings are meant to be explored.    And ROCTACO has explored and presents magnificent medleys of ingredients.  This was probably the finest corn tortilla I've ever had!   And some tortillas get grilled with cheese before filling.  So good.   And the creative fillings?  I only tried 2 different tacos and the each had unique ingredients that married flavors to absolute perfection.   I'll be back as often as I can.

name: ROCTACO
content: Roctoco has nailed it! After living in southern Mexico for a couple of years, I've been craving hand made tortillas. Thought not the same, these tortillas are amazing!
