I can't go off on all the flavors because they're all masterpieces. We got 8 tacos and shared them. You'll have to go in for yourself for the full experience. Will be coming here again, again and again...

name: ROCTACO
content: This place EXCEEDED all of our expectations. Wasn't expecting much of this place but let me tell you, it's so worth it. First off, their menu is so creative and they have so many different combos that I would never think of. I got the tikka, the fricado and the Amy hates fish taco and they were all amazing. All the flavors go so well together!!! Not only were the flavors good, the prices were so good. definitely will be coming back!

name: ROCTACO
content: Hip new taco shop owned by the same people as Cafe Rio. Ordered Uncle Al, Jimmy Churri, Rude Bull, Amy Hates Fish Taco, chips and green salsa, and elote. Good: handmade tortillas, unique flavors, broad taco selection. Owner/manager nice/attentive. Bad: just a slight step up from cafe rio and isn't really authentic (al pastor seemed like crockpot, carne asada ehh). Limited seating. Ugly: green salsa tasted like cafe rio enchilada sauce Overall a good taco but nothing that would keep me coming back.

name: ROCTACO
content: Amazing!!!! If you're coming here you HAVE TO order the Amy hates fish, Jimmy Churi and the Holy Kalbi!!! So flavorful, amazing, tasty, delicious, scrumptious.... these are just a few words that describe these tacos... would definitely come here again!!

name: ROCTACO
content: New favorite spot to eat!!!   We had a big group & ordered all of the appetizers- loved every one!  But the tacos!  WOW!  I had 3 very different ones-personal favorite was the Chruracho- slightly sweet from a raspberry chipotle sauce....fantastic and unexpected combinations on all of the tacos....Can't wait to go back! We got there a little early and the line built up as we were eating but I noticed they were cranking it out and no one waited very long!  Take out was busy too!  Word is getting around already!

name: ROCTACO
content: Went here for lunch and was very impressed! Really cool space, it's the kind of place I would bring my out-of-town friends to show them the cooler side of SLC. We got the tikka taco, beef kilabi, and chicken tinga tacos. Loved them all. They had a lot of tacos to choose from with different protein choices, excited to come back and try more!

name: ROCTACO
content: Delicious tacos. Reminded me of tacos that I used to have when living in Austin, TX. So happy to have found something similar!

name: ROCTACO
content: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!The BEST corn tortillas I ever had.Flavors complement each other very well without having it feel over saturated.Great options and love the creativeness of each taco option.Really neat place to just chill out, listen to great music and have a great meal!

name: ROCTACO
content: Tacos ! This place did it for us ! Tacos were amazing , staff was polite and welcoming clean and inviting atmosphere! Definitely will be back !

name: ROCTACO
content: What a find! Innovative, delicious fun variety of unique offerings. I got 3 tacos, my U student son got 2 different ones, and they were each incredibly good! We'll be back...

name: ROCTACO
content: Weak experience all around. The menu is so creative and exciting so I really wanted to like this joint but it fell fall short.1) they unfortunately messed up my order. I ordered three different tacos and requested no onions but found onions on them anyway2) food is absurdly bland - I ordered an angry bird,  a Kpop, and a fricado. The kpop "short rib" was not the buttery smooth short rib one would expect but a chewy and poorly marinated steak. The angry bird had a few sauces each more bland than the next. And the fricado was only saved by the cheese crusted tortilla. Just flavorless all around.3) not a huge deal but the meal took 35 min to be ready instead of the 15-20 I was quoted over the phone :/

name: ROCTACO
content: I think this place was okay.  The menu offers variety and the establishment was clean (which is why I gave 3 stars) however the tacos were lacking a bit for me.  The cilantro was brown and the tortillas were cold.  Flavors didn't pop for me.  For taco cravings I will stick to street tacos from the taco cart off state street.

name: ROCTACO
content: In the first part of the "my friend and I grab dinner, park somewhere pretty, and watch the sunset while eating in my trunk" food review series, we decided to hit up Roc Taco and try something new. It truly didn't disappoint!We ordered three tacos each with some chips and guac, which turned out to be the perfect amount of food. I got the Royal, Angry Bird, and Holy Kalbi. I absolutely loved the Royal and Angry Bird and would definitely get again. The tortillas were fresh and the chicken was really tender. Both tacos had totally different flavor profiles, and I really liked the variety. I wasn't super wowed with the Holy Kalbi in comparison with the other two.My friend got the Royal, Fricado, and Lebanese Blonde. She couldn't stop raving about the Fricado. Next time we go, she said she's getting three of them! She was also super impressed by the Lebanese Blonde and said it wasn't like anything she's had before in a taco. We got drinks to round out our meal. I got the Chile Mango and she got the Strawberries and Cream. They weren't overly sweet and were really refreshing. We both liked the guacamole, but we agreed that it needed a little more pomegranate or some lime to brighten it up. We got our food for take-out, and the packaging was amazing! Each taco had its own little space in the box, and everything was labeled with stickers.TL;DR: If you're looking to try some fun fusion tacos in Salt Lake, this is for sure your spot!

name: ROCTACO
content: The variety of tacos is awesome. I've gotten take out twice so far and got to sample a bunch of different tacos and I'd say just about all of them are great. A couple stand outs: Jimmy Churri and K-pop. One I'll be avoiding in the future is Amy Hates Fish because it's pretty boring. The service has been great and the space is cool. I'll definitely be back!

name: ROCTACO
content: The new king of Taco's in Salt Lake.  This street is becoming a destination place with all the new unique places on it.  RocTaco is no different.  They have the best taco's in Salt Lake and we eat a lot of tacos.  The owner was so friendly and was walking around making sure everyone was happy.  The decor is unique from a bottle cap mural to a giant octopus mural.  The only thing missing for me would be able to sit and have a nice local beer to go with the food.  We will come back here a bunch.

name: ROCTACO
content: Incredible food, and a great atmosphere. Everything was fresh and made to order. The tacos are far from traditional flavors, but use great technique.It's great that they have a variety of options including vegetarian, chicken, beef, pork, and fish. Definitely try a batida! It's a terrifically refreshing drink and I'm sure it's gonna be great over the summer.There's some seating inside. It was surprisingly busy for a Wednesday night. There's some street parking and a small pay lot on Edison, but it's in a very walkable part of town.

name: ROCTACO
content: Was excited for a new taco spot and came here because Taco Taco was closed (all time favorite). Great little spot, cool vibe and nice people. Tacos sounded good, but overall I was disappointed with them. Also, I ordered all the Earth and Sea tacos (three) and was annoyed they were mixed up with other tacos as this caused me to eat some beef thinking my three tacos were together. Maybe it's not important to everyone but this seems basic, keep a persons order/meal together.I would come to Roctaco again, but only if Taco Taco is closed - cuz it's the bestest!I will say the frozen horchata was absolutely delicious!

name: ROCTACO
content: A wonderful find. The tacos are as good as they are inventive. Funny coming from Kansas City and seeing one named The Royal. Nailed the KC BBQ sauce with very tender chicken. Fish taco was fresh and the fried cheese was delicious. Very unusual guac- added sunflower seeds (a nod to Kansas again?) and pomegranate seeds. It worked. And the interior design was quirky and fun. Highly recommended!

name: ROCTACO
content: So good! I love everything about this place! I work downtown and it's a perfect fun business lunch OR quick grab. I know it's covid but I only wish they had a hot sauce selection available so I didn't have to bring my own Yucateca. Beer would be great too. Otherwise, probably my fave taco joint in Utah. Well done!!!!

name: ROCTACO
content: This place is great. I ordered 2 "Amy Hates Fish" tacos and they were super good. The chips and guacamole was also tasty. If they bottled their spicy mayo I would buy it.

name: ROCTACO
content: Absolutely the best elevated tacos I've ever had - and being from L.A. I've tasted a lot of tacos.  I had the Lebanese Blonde (no meat or fish ) but a big slice of halloumi cheese with tabouli salad - absolutely delicious, the Banh Mi (shredded pork with Asian bbq sauce- flavors were spot on, and the Jimmy Churri (carne asada with chimichurri sauce- amazing.  Every single tacos flavors were spot on.  The food came out quickly and two staff members came to the table to ask how we liked it. Very friendly atmosphere.   This is a real gem and exciting addition to the SLC food scene.

name: ROCTACO
content: This place is absolutely incredible! The customer service was 1000/10! The building is so cool and the tacos are ridiculously amazing. Best tacos I've had in my whole life. Chips and guacamole were so delicious and the frozen horchata was life changing. I had the best time and I would come here every day if I could!

name: ROCTACO
content: Rick is the best! He was so nice and suggested the delicious strawberry and creme smoothie. Also the carnitas taco was super tasty and unique. Cool atmosphere, will definitely be coming here again!!!! #ROCTACOROCKS

name: ROCTACO
content: This spot is the best taco place in Salt Lake City, hands freaking down. People here are so sweet and the service is impeccable. The tacos are so unique and different. My personal favorite is the Banh Mijo and 10/10 recommend. Great place to go out with friends or a family dinner. If I could, I would go here every other day. Very affordable and so tasty. I would order three tacos to feel really good, and then four if you are feeling really hungry!

name: ROCTACO
content: RocTacoset up shop in Taqueria 27's back yard and they offer a better product for less. On my first trip I had the Angry Bird, BanMi Ho and Jimmy Churri with elotes.Everything was great, and the price was right, about $12 for a solid meal. Definitely add Roctaco to your "To Do" list.

name: ROCTACO
content: Visited RocTaco for the first time tonight! We ordered 6 tacos - Angry Bird, Uncle Al, Jimmy Churri, Rude Bull, K-Pop, and Holy Kalbi. Between my boyfriend and I we were able to finish all of them easily. Flavors were very unique and it was fun twist on tacos that I've never had before. Our favorites ended up being Angry Bird and Uncle Al but honestly, all of them were really good. We even ordered Elote after we were done eating them. We were checked on by I think must have been the owner? He made sure we had napkins and gave us spoons to make it easier to eat, also gave us a sparkling water on the house! Overall, every person we interacted with, even the person who took our order was very friendly! Definitely would recommend to others.

name: ROCTACO
content: I ordered 4 different tacos and honestly only liked one of them. The Jimmy churri. I also got the fish taco, uncle al and bahn mijo but don't recommend those. Don't bother with the elotes. Save your money there. Frozen horchata was good but not drawing me back on its own. Corn tortillas - cool that they make and press their own but they can't hold the weight of the taco and it falls apart at the first bite.

name: ROCTACO
content: A little difficult to find and there is metered parking but definitely worth it. Had the guacamole with pomegranate seeds and surprisingly good. The Amy hates fish is delicious and I recommend the red sauce if you like a little heat with good flavor. The Rude Bull is just as delicious but the crepe fresh and pickled onions have a sweet flavor. The staff were really friendly

name: ROCTACO
content: ROCTACO is a fun take on putting diverse flavors from all over the globe into a taco. I've been to many places where fusion foods are the theme of the menu, but few pull of the idea as well executed as ROCTACO. I swung by on Friday with my wife and after reviewing the menu, I felt obligated to try all of their tacos. So,.. I just ordered two of each thing.My personal favorites went like this:1.) Rude Bull2.) Jimmy Churi3.) Holy Kalbi4.) Bahn Mijo5.) K-Pop6.) The Angry BirdTheir chips and guacamole are on point!The fact they have elote on the menu made me so happy although I would recommend adding jalapeño to it or something to give it more of a kick but it was good either way,.. plus I know most Utahns just can't handle much spice.The ambiance & location of this place make it perfect for a date night. They had very cool artwork painted all over sad and better music playing than most other places.I highly recommend ROCTACO!

name: ROCTACO
content: This place is a must if your stopping in Salt Lake, went here after shopping and it definitely satisfied our hunger. The flavors are amazing and I thoroughly enjoyed both tacos! We got guacamole without the toppings as we weren't feeling to adventurous with the toppings. Everyone was very COVID safe and the space was very clean! I can't wait to go back and try the other tacos!

name: ROCTACO
content: This place was absolutely delicious! Every taco we tried got better and better. My favorite was the fried avocado one and the royal taco. We will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu!

name: ROCTACO
content: Awesome taco spot. I'm surprised no one seemed to mention how the tacos (tortillas split) immediately fall apart...I got one tikka and one Amy hates fishy. (Both as is).The concept of this place is very smart, trendy and appealing. Great, upbeat music. Lovely decor. Amazing flavor options for tacos and of course you gotta have elote or esquites on the menu ;)The owner definitely knows what he's doing and Salt Lake is the right place for this new adventure!Taco review: Em fim, the fish taco left a lot to be desired..maybe a bit of lime juice woulda helped but already the tortilla was compromised.

name: ROCTACO
content: Incredible taco combos like chicken tikka or fried avocado Super quick service with a decent amount of seating inside Awesome addition to Edison street. Will definitely be back!!

name: ROCTACO
content: Love the style here with all the reclaimed decor and the music is freaking awesome. We ordered 3 tacos each which was plenty of food. Depending on how hungry you are, 2 may be good. Our fav was the Rude Bull but we also really enjoyed the Chancho, Royal, and Uncle Al in that order. We ordered the chips & guac as well which were tasty. The tacos that weren't our fav were the Fricado and Jimmy Churri. They weren't bad but just not as good as the above mentioned ones. We will be back to try more on the menu.

name: ROCTACO
content: On a run down in Salt Lake City and I find this brand new hole in the wall spectacular motif. . Went in and tried several of their tacos and I've got to tell you there is good as I've ever had anywhere from a barbecue brisket taco to a spicy chicken taco it was so good I brought my girlfriend back later that day to try it highly recommend it even though they're chief  fans that on it.

name: ROCTACO
content: The tacos on this place were unbelievable. Got the fried avocado taco and the fish taco. To die for!!

name: ROCTACO
content: Just damn good tacos! Great flavor in every bite! Everytime we leave we are already talking about when we're going to go back! You just can't go wrong. Very neat modern industrial aesthetic, good tunes, just a really enjoyable place to be. Bahn Mijo is my personal favorite but you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Go check it out! Great location

name: ROCTACO
content: OMG I came here for lunch and this place was amaze-balls. So good. They had 4 GF tacos to choose from. I figured why choose so I ordered all 4 of them. The person taking my order was friendly and super helpful on what was GF. I ordered the Angry Bird, the Rude Bull, Amy Hates Fish and Uncle Al. I used a spork to eat the toppings and no tortilla. Tacos were all super tasty. I think my favorite meat was the pastor in the Uncle Al.  Funky little spot. Their buildout is awesome. Plenty of seating for parties of 2,3,4 throughout the tiny little space. Definitely coming back here!

name: ROCTACO
content: Cute little spot with a creative menu and great tacos! Highly recommend the banh mijo and the tikka tacos! Friendly staff too. Thanks all!

name: ROCTACO
content: Finally!! A Salt Lake taco shop that slaps you in the face with flavor! The menu is creative and the quality and service are fantastic. We've eaten there twice now and trying to work my way through the menu. Everything I've tried has been delicious.

name: ROCTACO
content: Pretty cool taco spot. Small but seems like a decent amount of seating for a smaller restaurant. I had the fish taco and Al pastor. Both were good but the Al Pastor was great. A bit on the sweet side but a real nice flavor combo. This is not a traditional taco place, kinda hip and new. I am a traditional Mexican food lover but like the modern take every once and a while. Will bring the fam next time.

name: ROCTACO
content: This hot new taco place just popped up. Great location, unique and inviting atmosphere with all the vibes. I was first impressed by the menu-clever and intriguing with a flow. Don't believe me, just take a look at the kids menu-hilarious. And the ordering system was genus, tacos were labeled with slickers. Perfect for those of us who order many different kinds. We dined in, it was nice but lots of people were picking up to go orders, so I might try that when I come back to get my fix. Everything we had was delicious, angry bird, the royal, the tiki, fried avocado taco, rude bull AND the frozen horchata was hands down the best I've had in Utah. Okay now let me breakdown why I gave this place 5 stars and only gave Taco Taco 4. It's how the tortillas hold up, they don't fall apart even though they are packed with favor and lots of filling. I could believe it and I know you know what I'm taco-ing about. Either the tortillas break because they have too much filling and they get soggy or you have two tortillas trying to hold it altogether-which then off sets the ratio of tortillas to filling. Gourmet tacos at its finest with lots of flavor with a modern twist leaving you saying...I'll be back next week.

name: ROCTACO
content: I travel all over and have yet to come across tacos this good anywhere else!  I had the Angry Bird, the Jimmy Churri and the Bahn Mijo. The last of which is the ultimate if you like Asian fusion.  I also tried a Strawberries & Cream Batida which was also really good.   Next time I'm in SLC, I'm coming back!

name: ROCTACO
content: ROCTACO specializes in gourmet tacos. We tried 4 tacos and the flavor combinations were generally excellent. I had the Holy Kalbi and the Royal which were recommendations from the cashier, and I was blown away by both. He also recommended the Chanco, which I am excited to try on my next visit. My wife got the Uncle Al and K-Pop. They were all quite good. We were slightly disappointed by the Uncle Al but we used to live in Mexico City so our Al Pastor standards are high. I see another poster here loved the Uncle Al, so YMMV. I am excited to add ROCTACO to the restaurants we regularly visit.

name: ROCTACO
content: Tried this for the first time tonight and we will be back. We tried several different tacos and each one was amazing in its own way. We will definitely be back!

name: ROCTACO
content: This is not your traditional taco spot. It is unique, fresh, & delicious. Out of the six tacos we ordered my favorite was the Tikka.  They have a variety of options. I would recommend ordering two or three tacos per person. We ordered to go, and they packaged it perfectly and they labeled each taco so you know exactly what you are eating. Each taco is completely different. First you want to pick what type of taco shell you want, they make all of these fresh in house. Then pick what type of meat you want and select your unique taco! Yes, they do have a kids menu. They also have coke products but no alcohol is served at this time. The inside of this restaurant is a hipster, artistic flair, warehouse feel. Don't let the appearance scare you off, I would stay and enjoy a unique unforgettable taco.

name: ROCTACO
content: I really cannot say enough about this place. We were so impressed that we came back twice in one day. We got the Fricado, Rude Bull, Uncle Al, and Angry Bird tacos. All of which were only like $3 - $4 each. For how good these were and where the location is the price is amazing. Some of the best street tacos we've ever had. I will be coming back to this place time and time again. We also got the Chips & Pom Quac. Holy cow. Never seen pomegranate in Quac but now that I have it's all I want. There was a ton is Quac and a ton of chips. All of which were fantastic. The interior of this place is so damn fun too. It's super fun inside and out. I posted a ton of pics because we were so impressed with this place. The service is also top notch. It was super quick and the food was super fresh. Love this place. If you are downtown and you're lookin for some tacos and a rad place to eat and chill then come to this place. You won't be disappointed. We'll be locals soon.

name: ROCTACO
content: An outstanding new taco shop hidden on Edison Street, around the corner from the Copper Onion, is now open.  At first blush, it looks like a prototypical hipster fusion restaurant---stylized "graffiti," shipping container-looking exterior, GenX staffers---but within lies some pretty spectacular tacos.  To be fair, you're not going to find authentic tacos here.  Roc Taco borrows global inspiration for its tacos; I'd try to think of them as more a vehicle for delivering delicious bites versus an authentic version of cuisine.  Taken in that light, Roc is a clear standout.  First of all, they make their tortillas fresh and from scratch.  The corn is king here, but you can also select from wheat, cheese-crusted and an intriguing blue hibiscus base.  Then, the tacos are like mezze from around the world---Mexico, Korea, Lebanon, India---each distinctive and boasting a complex harmony of flavors.  The "batida," sort of an aqua fresca/smoothie hybrid, are delicious and a great accompaniment to the food.  The tacos are wonderfully packaged in recyclable to-go containers with separate compartments so they don't smash together.  Figure $5 a taco with three of them more than sufficient to satiate a typical appetite.

name: ROCTACO
content: So good! We just happened to be doing a mini taco tour of SLC and popped in last min and turns out it was their first day open. Talk about excited. We loved their "freestyle" taco creations! Kpop and Uncle Al's were my fav that I've tried so far. They were kind enough to offer chips and salsa while we waited and then handles to top of dinner. What a treat! Will definitely be going back!

name: ROCTACO
content: Being from SoCal I know a good taco.  Love street tacos my fav rav being tacos al-pastor.  Roctaco spruced it up to give me the best taco al-pastor I've ever had, Uncle Al (that's what's called i think).  Really real good taco, super friendly, and nice atmosphere.  One critique, they need to give you a slice of lime.  Tacos need that fo' sho.'  Haha

name: ROCTACO
content: Tasty tacos. Also enjoyed the elotes. Look forward to going back and trying more flavors and the seafood side of the menu. Service was quick and I was happy to see the place was busy on a Tuesday night.

name: ROCTACO
content: Just ate here today with a friend and I already can't wait to go back.Tikka Bahn miAmy Hates Fish (mahi mahi) Kids quesadilla Frozen horchata Each to die for. Thank you for the delicious food and the friendly service!

name: ROCTACO
content: This place is awesome. Great environment, food, and service. Must get the corn. Yummy. The tacos were perfect. Owner came up to us to see how we liked it. This is a must visit establishment!!

name: ROCTACO
content: I want more. Holy shit was this place awesome!! It's one of those joints you just need to start at the top andwork your way down the menu when ordering. Appetizer was guacamole with pomegranate, yum! Chips and salsa, again, yum! Lebanese blondeTikkaHoly KalbiRick, the super nice owner, came by to check on us and  made sure we were taken care of. Brought us the frozen horchata which is another reason I'll be back for more. The interior and exterior build-out is so unique and rad.

name: ROCTACO
content: One of the best taco places I've ever tried!This is by no means the most authentic Mexican tacos, but thats the appeal - that's why they're called Freestyle tacos! Roctaco has effectively and really amazingly  blended flavors from all over the world using high quality ingredients - in the form of a taco. I personally got the Tikka, Uncle Al (al pastor), and K-POP tacos. The Uncle Al was probably one of the best tacos I've ever had, truly. The mango sauce they put in there with it elevates it 100%. The Tikka tasted AMAZING. Curry flavor with a creamy sauce, really delicious. The kpop taco is like a roll you would make at a KBBQ place, with a tortilla, lettuce, fried egg and marinated meat with gochujang sauce. The batidas are so yummy and I definitely recommend getting thr horchata one. They are not too icy either which is nice. The overall atmosphere is very trendy and artsy and the staff gives amazing service and makes sure you are taken care of. I will definitely be returning asap!

name: ROCTACO
content: So my daughter and I took a variety of tacos home last week and I am hooked! The Uncle Al tacos were our favorite, with the sweet and spicy mix of flavors. Yum!!! This place is hidden away and easy to miss, but the decor is so great and so is the food! We'll be back!

name: ROCTACO
content: Arrived at ROCTACO moments after the official opening.  Running pretty smoothly considering it's moments after official start of business. Food was a bit slow but I expect that to accelerate as they get systems dialed in. Waiting for my takeout order, I had the apps at least 20 minutes before anything else, but they (unnecessarily) apologized - and, as I said, I'm confident they'll have it dialed in soon. The upside: time to write most of this review. Interior is narrow and deep - maybe a dozen tables, so we got ours to go (hey, still better to be safe in the pandemic times). Decor is industrial and multicultural, reflecting the menu. And if you don't like your music thumpin' you don't want to dine in. (Might be worth dialing in the EQ; at least from the front it's all bass and hi-hat.)The menu itself is wide ranging and definitely not afraid to branch out from the sacred taco form. And please go read the names of the kids menu items. They're classic. Neighbor Diabolical Records (also five stars even if I haven't reviewed it yet) recommends everything so I felt comfortable on the first order. Appetizers/sides were high on our list to try, including chips + guacamole (chips included in guacamole even if it's not obvious on printed menu) and elotes. Both were fantastic, and the chips are light and taste housemade (I prefer the lighter kind, so if the thick are your preference (1) order these anyway and (2) you're misguided.)Back to the taco menu: we ordered only half-ish of it to start. Every single one is recommended. Chancho: sweet and tender; the onion is a great balance. Uncle Al: after one bite, my wife exclaimed "that's the best taco in America." It might be. Note: the made from scratch tortillas are exceptional. Jimmy Churri: tender meat, cheese-encrusted tortilla and fresh chimichurri sauce. Possibly my most favorite of six favorites. Rude Bull: quality steak and probably the best asada I have had in years. Spice as a a delightfully delayed fuse. Amy Hates Fish: zesty and citrus-y and definitely not fishy. Lebanese Blonde: since "juusto" is Finnish for "cheese," I felt we needed to try the grilled "cheese cheese."  A Mediterranean-tasting vegetarian winner. On our return I think I'll try a few tortillas ala carte so I can try the ones made with less obvious ingredients - and of course the Tikka and K-Pop. Highly recommended- reasonable prices and portions.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: We were visiting Salt Lake from Nebraska and my boyfriend was most eager to come here for dinner. We had reservations and were seated right away. The wait staff was extremely friendly, and the bruschetta at the beginning was delightful! I highly recommend the pasta sampler. But, after reading more reviews I'm afraid we may have been shorted on this appetizer. We were served three pastas, not four, two different ravioli and a gnocchi like pasta.   After this we ordered our main dishes. I ordered the lasagna from their suggested dishes. This lasagna is bland. It taste like cooked beef and oil. For the price, and the hype, I was expecting strong bursting flavor, but unfortunately I was wrong. The atmosphere and service was great. My only qualm is my personal taste in lasagna. This was a great experience and I would like to give it another try with another entree.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Decided to try Valter's based on Yelp reviews. It's was Friday night and the restaurant was completely booked luckily  they were able to sit us at the bar. Jim was tending bar and our server. He gave outstanding recommendations and was super entertaining. The bread and garlic dipping sauce is excellent. Can't wait to try making it at home. Both the salmon and salsicce Mare entrees were very good. Great old school atmosphere. Great choice for Italian downtown!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Great place to eat and really good menu selection.  The atmosphere was also very appreciated and elegant.  We will definitely be coming back and enjoying a peaceful dinner here again.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Wonderful classic Italian restaurant.  All staff are exceptional at their jobs. Service is a 10 out of 10. Food is even better. Expensive but well worth it. A special occasion place.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Glad we got to try this place out after hearing so many great reviews about it. Service was much quicker than we expected (and warned by friends). Pasta tasted fresh and delicious. Would def order everything we got again except for the duck dish, which we felt was too sweet for an entree. Our personal favorite, sadly is not pictured, was actually the complimentary bruschetta from the kitchen--tangy taste from fresh tomatoes with basil and olive oil sitting on a small piece of perfectly toasted/crunchy bread. Oh, and the butter/olive oil bread dipping sauce was heavenly as well. It's also nice to briefly say hello to Valter as he made a round to everyone in the restaurant from an iPad.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I have wanted to go to this restaurant ever since I moved to Salt Lake and last night I finally made it! I got a bottle of the BO, the Caesar salad which was made at the table, and the pasta sampler that had two kinds of ravioli, gnocchi, and a spaghetti, let's just say it was 10 out of 10. Gustavo was our server and he made the night! Can't wait to go back

name: Valter's Osteria
content: If you are looking for the best authentic food in Salt Lake City, Valter's is the place to go. Before you keep reading, you must know going into it that it's going to be expensive... if you are okay with that, keep reading!Everything on the menu is so flavorful and perfectly cooked. You must start off with the housemade bruschetta, phenomenal!! If you are looking for a good green side, the asparagus wrapped in prosciutto are fantastic, fairly small portions though. You really can't go wrong on your main dish. I would have to say the best dish has got to be the pasta sampler. You get to try 4 different pastas - 2 types of ravioli, a lemon angel hair, and a gnocchi which was my personal favorite. Another favorite dish was the bolognese. Such thick delicious pasta with a meat sauce. The only thing I wouldn't recommend getting is the chicken piccata dish. I should have know that going to an authentic Italian restaurant. But I would just recommend eating the carbs instead!The best part of dinner is that your server will serve the plate in front of you before each dish. Very exciting to see how each dish is personally made, especially the vanilla ice cream dessert. I typically wouldn't order something so boring-sounding, but this vanilla ice cream topped with lemon juice, honey, and salt is pretty increíble. Great service, amazing food, fun ambiance, but just remember that you are going to be paying for all of those things!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This was our third time here. Valter's NEVER disappoints! I usually get the ravioli and gnocchi sampler, but decided to try the Fettuccine Gorgonzola E PEPE. It is a truffle lovers dream come true! My boyfriend got the Pasta Carbonara which was excellent. It is the be at Italian Restraunt in SLC hands down. We are never disappointed with Valter's, and the service is always excellent.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Amazing restaurant and amazing food. We are always happy to be there when we are in Salt Lake. It's hard some time to get a reservation but it's worth it. Thank you so much  we will be soon!!!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Valters is quite the experience. It's very pricey but you get what you pay for. My personal favorite was the chicken carbonara. They always have warm bread for you! I also freaking loved the gelato.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: My BF and I went here for my birthday dinner, arguably for a second time, even though I knew it was our first together. It is tucked in next to a brewery, we would never have found it without multiple trips around the block! The outside seemed small, yet once we came into the restaurant it opened up, beautiful and romantic. The experience was great and the food was delicious, full of subtle and rich flavor. Our server was kind and generous throughout our meal. Definitely recommend for any type of group. And the original owner visited, via FaceTime, while a hostess walked around to each table with the tablet to speak to each group and thank them for their solicitation of his establishment.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This place is the best Italian food ever in the entire Country.The freshly made daily pasta, with such rich creative flavors, is the best I've ever had. The restaurant is a high-class luxury setting along with perfect, friendly service. Amazing value for what you get. They could change to $$$$$ four dollar sings vs. $$$ three dollar signs and still be as busy.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This isn't just a restaurant, it's an experience. This well known and classy place has a warm ambience when you walk through the doors. All of the staff are accommodating and attentive. Servers know the menu inside and out without a menu. We tried the tasting menu which had multiple courses including caprese, butternut squash ravioli, fresh salad, melon wrapped in prosciutto, gnocchi, salmon, halibut, and pork osso bucco. The pork was the best I've ever tasted! So many unique and bold flavors. The halibut was the only dish we didn't care for as it was a little dry; when the server noticed it wasn't being eaten he immediately had the manager come to the table. He offered to make any other dish and brought complimentary orange gelato! For dessert we ordered an almond cake and sorbet. Both were beyond amazing! They also brought complimentary hot chocolate and biscuits to finish off the meal. We loved this place and although pricey, it's worth it!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Incredible service, always topping up the drinks and bread. Lots of items are prepared tableside, which adds to the atmosphere. Incredible food. Tastes very authentic.Price wasnt near as high as I anticipated. I mean, it's not cheap, but my wife had a soup, the Lasagna (highly recommend) and gelato, while I had a four course meal. Now, we're non drinkers, so that cuts down considerably on the tab, regardless, out the door $175 after a generous tip. Israel is a FANTASTIC server. World-class.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I had their Nana in Porchetta Savinese  it was amazingly delicious. Best meal I've had dinning out, hands down! The staff was very nice and our waiter was amazing. Definitely worth the $$$ for a nice evening out!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: The best Italian food I've ever had - better than anywhere I've been in Italy where I lived for a year. Service is impeccable, restaurant is beautiful, Valter is an icon. An absolute must

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I have eaten here a few times and loved it as a "special occasion" treat. For our anniversary today we ordered takeout (not ready to risk in-person dining). The takeout menu is.....not great. The baked ziti is effectively a $75 tray of macaroni and cheese. I assume their in-person menu is as stellar as always. But the takeout menu has left me with some GI distress....not the special occasion treat I was looking for. :(

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This place is the premier restaurant for Italian, in Salt Lake. The food, the wine, the service, all remarkable. My wife and I had Kamel as our server. After understanding what we enjoy, he guided us to the best options on the menu. Cannot recommend the pasta sampler enough: The raviolis were life changing. For the second course, their lasagna was extremely robust. The short rib w/ risotto was the highlight of the meal. And don't forget the wine. The Borgo Morlino was an amazing white to start the meal and the Colosi Rossi was a great pairing for the short rib. Thank you to Kamel and the whole Valter's staff. It was an incredible evening!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Awesome dining experience. Got the ravioli appetizer, salsicce e mare, chicken piccata & everything was excellent.  Spendy but worth it

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Been here many times since my last review. Some servers good others not that good at listening and one even told me which political person he liked.Food is so amazing, and so expensive! Some of the appetizers are more expensive than a main course.Can't say enough about the awesome quality and taste of the food. The prices need some help as they are 2x more expensive than all over Italian places in the Wasatch Front.Also if the servers weren't so pushy and listen to what we really want would be great. It is almost as if they get commission for pushing the higher priced menu items.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: My wife and I took a couple of friends here after going for the first time about a year ago. After the first time we went, we both thought it was amazing and couldn't wait to go back. This time though, we were pretty disappointed. I got the lasagna and it had a burnt flavor to it which wasn't great. My wife said her pasta was good, but not like what she remembered. Our friends were both somewhat underwhelmed as well, especially for the price. Maybe it was just an off night because it really was so amazing the last time we went, but I feel like it'd be hard to justify spending that much money on a meal next time we're in town after an experience like this. The bread was still delicious though and was probably the highlight of the meal for all of us.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I can't remember every disagreeing so strongly with the consensus, but it's fair to say that this was the worst meal any of us have had in a long time. I wonder if it's simply a reflection of the struggles during COVID given how much other people seem to like it. But for us, it was awful across the board.  Service- Our main server seemed to be there against his will. I half expected him to say "I am being treated well and am unharmed."- One of the guys helping him bring the food stood directly over me as he walked through the dishes. Having a dude in your space and breathing over your food like that is just gross even before you factor in COVID.- For some reason they make the server read off like 613 specials. You couldn't tell where one ended and the next one began.- We had to wait 20 minutes past our reservation. That's a lot.Food- Bruschetta. It was ... fine? You've had better, but it's inoffensive.- Pasta sampler for one. Like the bruschetta, it wasn't terrible. But very one note (oil & fractionally overcooked pasta).- App trio (beef carpaccio, shrimp, crab). This was the first affirmatively bad dish. The beef was all salt and oil and tasted like it had been sitting around a day too long. The seafood dishes similarly were not fresh.- Veal in some kind of oily caper sauce. Oil on oil on oil.- Two of us ordered the fish trio. Fish was slightly overcooked, and smothered in sauces that were fairly muddy tasting, and had a bit of a "this has been sitting out waaaay too long" to them.Price: somehow all of that and a $70 bottle of wine topped $350 prior to tip. That's insane. And, honestly, I'm kicking myself for not looking carefully at the bill because it's not clear to me how the math even gets close to that in the cold light of the next day.One random note. The menu is weirdly inscrutable. It's hard to explain why except to say that you want all the apps, all the secondi, and all the primi on the same pages as each other, and this was ... not that.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: If I could live here I would. The best Italian food you will ever indulge in. Don't skip desert & get the lemon gelato topped with honey & salt! You're welcome.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This was an amazing find! Dish after dish I was so pleasantly surprised. The food was SO delicious. The service was top notch, you will definitely be catered to if you dine here

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Talk about a dining experience to top all others. Everything to be considered was absolutely amazing from the service to the ambience and of course the amazing food and the chance to meet Walter himself. We left absolutely blown away and left with having been ruined for all other Italian food. Easily the number one best spot in all of Salt Lake City, Utah

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I'm disappointed at having to leave a negative review. I agree with the previous reviewer, what's going on with Valter's? We've eaten at Valter's four times over the last year and each time we had a good experience. I recently tried to make reservations for dinner. I left three voicemails over a three day period. No one returned my call. I called again and finally reached someone on the phone and made a reservation for a Friday night two weeks out. Great. Five minutes later I received a call back from Valter's indicating that they could not accommodate me (without explanation) for the time that they previously committed to. I was told they were not taking reservations between the hours of 6:15-7:30 pm. I'm not sure if they were saving this timeframe for walk-ins? Needless to say I was not pleased with them canceling the reservation immediately after accepting it. They offered seating either very early or much later but neither were convenient for our plans that evening. I told them about the issue of having three voicemails earlier in the week that were not returned. They blamed it on the "high winds" earlier this week. I'm not sure how that would affect their phones, but okay, I'll give them a pass. One would have thought, given their mistake, that they would have honored their commitment. Not only were we looking forward to a good dinner at Valter's, we also wanted to support local restaurants who have suffered loss of revenue during C19. I'm not sure the reason why Valter's has become so disorganized that  they can't return phone calls, make (and keep) a simple reservation, or provide basic customer service after they've failed to provide it (multiple times). Reluctantly, we will not be returning to Valter's.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This is the best Italian food I've had in Utah.  Every bite was incredible.  Very reminiscent of food we enjoyed in Italy.  It's not cheap, but it was amazing.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Nothing special as a meal besides pictures at the entrance. I give 3 star for this place because it's a really clean place  bathrooms, kitchen , employees  everywhere was well organized and clean Another positive star service is good and servers are very polite . We ordered 3 different pasta dish non of us couldn't finish it even we were starving !!!I'm sure owner established his place and let it run this place to other chefs now but who ever running the kitchen is not doing a good job Lasagna was very dry and tasteless , my friends pasta didn't taste like freshly made sauce flavor was very bland When I visit town again I'm sorry I won't come that place It didn't  give me a memory to talk about this place

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Amazing. Worth every penny! Best pasta I've had! The whole experience is lovely and the waiter was very helpful in every way.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Everything here is great, but it's the desert (Hot Chocolate) that I'm always excited for. Excellent service, and no waiting for your reserved time. My favorites.. the chicken with Marsala sauce, Salmone Al Coccio (so many flavors, it's amazing), and the Spaghetti Carbonara sounds ordinary, but is anything but! Dining at Valter's is an experience. Savor it, and same room for the Hot Chocolate! You'll thank me!!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: TL;DR: service was great but I threw up because of their Scoglio Di Mare Con Gameroni (angel hair pasta with seafood). We told them we think it's food poisoning. They INSISTED it was not their food quality issue and the bill still reflected the dish that made me sick.Overall, the service was great. They made sure our glasses were always full and our bread basket was never empty. Two of us ordered the "taste of Tuscany" tasting menu, and I ordered the above dish.I was fine up until I finished about 1/3 of my entree. I started feeling very dizzy, lightheaded and was sweating. My stomach felt funny and gassy. It all hit me very quickly. I had to close my eyes and rest my head on my hands. Apparently my friends asked if I was feeling ok, but I couldn't respond for a couple of minutes. Finally, I threw up (at the dinner table, very sorry about that), but it just involuntarily happened and next thing I knew I just could not stop. They were kind and helped. They initially gave me a bucket (you know, the dirty red sanitizer buckets you see restaurants use to hold bleach water that wipes tables at the end of a meal), to throw up into (rather than a clean bag??). I cut dinner short because I felt horrible. One of us stayed behind to pay the bill. Two of us only ate up to the mains of the tasting menu. The receipt still showed full bill WITH the seafood pasta. They didn't offer to remove the item that made me sick or even an appetizer. We paid it.Their response to our claim (that it was food poisoning) even after we paid for it, was what ultimately made me give them 1 instead of 2 stars. When they called us later that night to check up, we said that we think it's food poisoning from their seafood as I've eaten most of the seafood, and all three of us ate the same foods all day except for food in the restaurant. They denied it, claiming their seafood is "fresh" and the muscles are "frozen" so it can not have gone bad or have bacteria. Worse yet, we're insistent it's NOT their food quality issue, but something else I ate before dinner.The three of us are the same food all day except for different mains for dinner so I don't see how I could've caught the bug from different food. Everyone else was fine that night. Don't think I need to explain further what happened at home. Also, I shared a couple of muscles with one of the people in the party. The next day, he also felt a bit unwell and had to use the bathroom. Nice things about them: their complementary bruschetta and artichoke gravy for their bread were delicious. Their set of four handmade pasta was also tasty. If my experience hasn't deterred you from visiting, I'd recommend you order that.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I've heard glowing reviews about how this would change my mind on Italian food and I mean they were kind of right because it changed my mind in the worst way. Appetizers are where it's at. They have amazing apps. Entrees, not so much. I can't remember what I ordered but it was one of the specials with a ravioli covered in truffles. That was the only edible part, the roll and spaghetti were bland and disgusting. It tasted like oil. No flavor. Risotto of the day was good but it was undercooked. The salmon meal was sad; it was two salmons the tiniest portions I've ever seen. The only dish I thought was worth it was as the seafood one. Everything else lacked flavor and salt. Wins: their bread is worth coming back just to eat that w/ their Caesar dressing. The staff was amazing! This place is extremely over priced for what they are serving if I'm going to spend $500 for a dinner out it should be up to that high standard. I hated that they plated our food in front of us. It felt tacky and the presentation for the food lacked. Maybe it's what we ordered but overall just not worth the price. I just think this place has a hype for no reason.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: It's the best Italian you can get around here. It takes some time to eat here, but that is because everything is made fresh and from scratch. From the bread, to the entree, to the desert, it's all top tier.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Arturo, the manager, turned a fun and delicious experience into a bad experience and I won't be back because of him. Also, there were several flies at my table and I was in the back room in the restaurant; as you can see in the pictures there were flies in my wine and dessert. My server, Eduardo, was the best and I would love to have a server like him every time! The appetizer was delicious, main dish was average, and the dessert was tasty without the flies in it. I return for customer service and that is why they only get 2 stars because of poor management from Arturo who cared more about himself than good customer service. If it was just based off him I'd give 1/2 star.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I have never had such a positive experience at a restaurant in my life. Our server, Eduardo, was wonderful. The food was incredible. Can't say enough good things! I will be back!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Hands down the best Italian restaurant I've been to in the United States. You can't get better than this, Valter is a gem and one of the most fabulous people you'll ever meet. Arturo who is always right there as well to help take care of will make sure your experience is nothing short of excellent. The pasta trio is an excellent plate to get if you want to try a variety of pastas and don't forget to get the lemon gelato for dessert, you won't regret it. The service is impeccable, the food is heavenly and the atmosphere is unmatched

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Great for a date night or special occasion. One of my favorite restaurants in salt lake. Great wine list and fun atmosphere. Less uptight than most "fancy" restaurants which is nice.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Holy shiz...This place will burn a hole in your pocket, but it was well worth it Will definitely be going back. First, the BREAD. Holy crap. I think I ate a basket by myself. It crumbled in your mouth and the garlic sauce was . Then we got a seasonal appetizer (can't remember the name), but I'm sure they are all divine. As our main dish, we each got the pasta sampler. It was butternut squash ravioli, gnocchi (I got mine with truffles and silky cream sauce), and then the most delicious angel hair pasta that had almost a lemony tasting sauce. Seriously the best pasta I've ever had. It was delicious. To finish off our meal, my husband got the lemon honey gelato (again, divine.) and I got the creme brûlée. Perfect way to end the dinner. The service was epic and we were treated so well. Thank you Valter's!Photo quality isn't great since they are screenshots from a video. Sorry!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Plan on no less than 2 hours. Don't look at the menu if valter is there. Have him choose for you and you won't be disappointed. Order a good bottle of wine and settle in for an amazing dining experience.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: My favorite place in SLC! I'm not a big Italian lover but Valter's is light and delicious. We had Valter's special which isn't on the menu. He surprises you with samples from several different plates and it's well worth it! He is so friendly and tries to stop by every table to thank you for coming!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: The only thing better than the food at Valter's is the incredibly warm and friendly service. This is perhaps my favorite restaurant in the world. Valter treats everybody as if they're a long-lost and beloved relative and exudes joy at providing service and delicious food. The limoncello is beyond description so save room for dessert!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: One trip here and you will understand why this is the best restaurant in SLC. Before you even order anything you are gifted bread with an anchovy oil and bruschetta that are both simple and out of this world. My personal favorite, the pizza carne, is a massive tenderized pork cutlet lightly breaded with sauce and cheese that while have you leaving there full and satisfied. As an east coaster I thought it was impossible to find Italian food here in Utah, but this warm and delightful restaurant really hits the spot.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This is the 2nd  time I've been to Valter's. The 1st time was outstanding; outstanding food, I will never forget my duck, lemon dessert, our attentive personable  waiter and of course seeing Valter. It was a great dining experience especially being new to SLC. Unfortunately our second visit left us frustrated. The service started out fine.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive. He prepared us for the long winded "flight" option which we were happy to hear as it is Valter's vision. We discussed possibly getting the flight and another dish. He seemed annoyed that we had thought of sharing the flight. I can assure you we are not cheap but 3 salads, 4 pastas, salmon 2 ways and whatever else came with it seemed like plenty of food plus we were ordering an additional entree we had the time before that  was to die for. We placed our order and I asked if we had made a good choice on the dishes we  selected. He said "hmmm yeah that's the  perfect amount of food if you're not hungry". This was very upsetting to me. I love people, I've been in customer service for almost 15 years. I was made to feel stupid, cheap, and a burden. 2 hours later, $150 less in my pocket, decent appetizer, cold, watered down pasta, poorly cooked duck and we were out of there. Everyone has off days. Unfortunately 90% of it was off. My favorite part was the cute couple next to us sharing their birthday dinner and of course time with my husband! Won't be returning... ever.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I left Valter's underwhelmed and frustrated. I was very excited to take my wife out for a celebratory dinner. I knew Valter's was expensive and was prepared to pay for good food. The waiter appeaRed to be cheerful as he explained the 'flight' which was $110. When questioning further what to get he just started rushing to put our order together even though we hadn't decided what we wanted. Ultimately,  we ordered two entrees and an appetizer. The waiter was obviously annoyed that we didn't spend more money and rudely just walked away after our order. When questioned by my wife if that was a good order he said it should be fine if we weren't hungry. The one tasty item of the even was the trio aPpetizer of crab on carrots, burrata with prosciutto, and lobster on carrots. 45 minutes later our cold entrees arrived. I ordered duck with cognac and grape sauce reduction. The duck fat was not rendered correctly and was completely unedible and chewy. My wife's pasta sampler was okay, but cold. The pasta did not taste freshly made and was overcooked. We passed on dessert as we were full despite our small order. $155 semi-mediocre meal with rude service. Will not be going back or recommending. $155 for 3 plates of food isn't cheap and at the very least I would expect to be treated a bit better.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: High quality food! They make all their noodles in house and you can tell they use nice cheeses

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Absolutely epic, as good or better than every lovely restaurant after a month in Italy. I'd fly back in town just to eat here again. I'll be back.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Possibly the greatest restaurant in Utah. Valter's has a fantastically diverse and inventive menu, mixed with modern Italian classics. The restaurant is beautifully decorated, and it's lively and fun. Valter himself is a fantastic fantastic and warm host, and is fully part of a wonderful meal.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: WOW!!!!! If I could give it 10 stars, I would! What a special place for a date night or a very impressive business meeting. Heck, I even saw a guy there eating alone! You don't need a special occasion to come here...Valter & his team will make you feel special on any day of the week! Valter is such a character and will be at his restaurant almost every night without fail to greet and welcome all of the guests. He makes you feel like part of his big Italian family. He's always ensuring that his kitchen is running smoothly, that his staff is taking great care of the guests, and he pays special attention to VIP's. I have seen numerous Utah celebrities dine here including Jazz players, Mitt Romney, and many others--Valter even has the entry of the restaurant full of photos to prove it! The food is outstanding. We did multiple courses and I can't even pick a favorite. All of them were divine. Everything is extremely fresh & made with such great care. The staff is very attentive, filling bread & water at every opportunity and clearing our plates quickly. Such an exceptional team working here. Overall, this place gives a first class experience! Bravo!!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: We were a party of 6 and all enjoyed the 4 course meal. The appetizers were the most varied options and most appealing.  Everyone independently selected different entree's which were delightful. The service is attentive but almost too much so.  The water guy was aggressive with the glass refills even when asked to slow it up.  The wine list is not for the faint of heart; more options under $200 would be welcome.  This establishment seems to be a special event place and it lived up to our expectations.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: The food here is always excellent. It is a little pricey and the service was not great. Usually we are treated like royalty but our server was less than dazzling. Still my favorite Italian .

name: Valter's Osteria
content: We were a party of four. We weren't shown a menu when we first sat down and felt like we were bamboozled and a little rushed into ordering the three course meal. Our reservation was on the later side of the evening, so perhaps, it was the quickest way for the kitchen to process the 4 of us.  The meal was very good, however, when we got the check, it was over $650.00. Roughly about $162 a person which includied corkage but not the tip, We did order 2 desserts, but the check price was extremely exorbitant and on par with a NYC 5 star restaurant.  It would have been far better to have been offered the menu first and then decide if we wanted the 3 course meal. The service was excellent, everyone was very friendly and welcoming. After it was all said and done, we all thought it was a nice & enjoyable dinner, but the bill really took us aback, especially since we didn't see the pricing of the menu.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Valter's - not just a meal, it was an experience. We had the best time and felt like we were at home with Valter. What an example of a genuine owner that made me love being there as much as I loved the food! We started the night with some the best bread I've had with a delightful dipping sauce (thinking it's a blend of capers, garlic, olive oil, anchovies, etc.). Next we got the pasta sampler with true truffles shaved over top. I've had "truffle" flavor or faux truffles but loved getting the real stuff (even though it is $$). For the entries I ordered the best of the group with the ravioli macchiati (highly recommended) which has an addictive light tomato sauce on a bed of butter and cheese. Next best was the pizza carne. It was breaded pork, covered in a chunky tomato sauce and mozzarella. The ravioli 4 formaggi, fettuccine with chicken and shrimp were also super tasty. For dessert we got (in order of deliciousness) 1) pistachio gelato, creme brûlée, lemoncello gelato (honey and sea salt on top), peach gelato, tiramisu, cheesecake with strawberry preserves. We will definitely be back!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: First time eating here with my wife.  I couldn't believe the caesar salad I had.  I've never been a fan of caesar salad until now!  This was the first time I tried Scaloppine Di Vitello Al Marsala which is made with natural milk-fed veal.  The flavor was subtle enough to enjoy and didn't have an overpowering wine aftertaste.  Also, make sure you stay for dessert.  They prepare the gelato in front of your table and it is delicious.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Valters is the best Italian in SLC hands down!!  Ask to meet Valter for a personal recommendation.   He'll ask you what you like and pair an amazing dining experience.   He pairs wine with appetizers salad main entree and dessert.  The food is incredibly fresh served hot and to a high standard.  We had cantaloupe ricotta cheese and prosciutto for appetizer.   Main course was saltimbocca with an amazing arugula salad in between.  Dessert was peaches with blueberries and a soft wine poured in the bowl to bring it all together.   Our table had just a fabulous night all around.  Thank you Valter!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Everybody is somebody at Valter's. If you love exquisite service, food and wine, then you deserve fine dining at its best in Salt Lake. They make their own bread and gelato and you'll taste the scrumptiousness in every bite. Do yourself a favor and tell the waiter what you like (mine was David) and have him or her order for you. You won't be disappointed.Have Lee make you an Italian lemon drop to top it off. Best restaurant in salt lake. Say hi to Valter cause he makes certain every patron is satisfied.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Server Gish was terrific! The atmosphere & location are great. But, it is overrated. Appetizers: We started with lobster over sliced tomatoes. Very simple. Then had duck with foie gras. Not good or healthy. We also had an anti pasta plate which not typical of most true Italian restaurants. Gish sold us on  NY Strip then came back to say they were out. Not his fault. For my entree I had bronzino over spinach. This round shaped chopped fish over spinach. But, they completely drowned the dish with two jars of Kroger brand Dijon mustard. My friend had Osso Buco which not completely tender & also heavily sauced. Way too expensive for the quality of the food. Over $400 for two people with drinks.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This place was amazing!!! My brother had found it online & come a month or so ago & they'd raves about how great. I came to SLC for 24 hours & decided to try it. It was by far the best Italian food I've had. I tried the sampler with 2 kinds of ravioli (spinach & butternut squash), gnocchi & then added the limoncello angel hair. It all tastes great! The ravioli & angel hair were my favorite. We also got the lasagna, which was great. The bruschetta they brought over to start was so good & I hate tomatoes, but somehow they hardly had the normal tomato flavor as the olive oil & other flavoring was so good!!! The bread they brought was also delicious! We tried the creme brûlée & the lemon gelato with honey & loved both! This is definitely a must stop & worth every penny! The owner was also so friendly & walking all through the restaurant chatting with people. Wish I lived in SLC so I could have often.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This restaurant experience will stay with me forever , everything about dining here was highly genuine. Our waiter was so attentive to our needs and was so nice . He was honest and helpful when trying to meet my dietary needs , when I told him I was vegan before ordering our meals for the night. He brought us a special little white custard to celebrate our anniversary without being asked. We also met Valter, as we were heading to the exit door. He waved us over to his table and hugged us both ! So cute ! I am a big fan of Italian food as of today! You are also able to bring your own wine bottle , we just had to pay the cork fee. THANK YOU !

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Overall really solid place. Loved the atmosphere and food was above average. As a solo diner it was fairly easy to get a seat at the bar on a Wednesday night. Between the complimentary bruschetta app and bread basket it's already a pretty filling start. Got the romaine heart salad to start - was ok but a little on the bland side. The bartender recommended the rigatoni but to add some kick with some peperocini. Was a great call and delicious though was super full. All in all a memorable experience that I highly recommend.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Best restaurant in SLC and probably all of Utah outside Kanab.Took the whole family for a Birthday dinner. Well worth it and he handles large groups so well.The food it soooo authentic and delicious. No wonder it's so hard to get a table here.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Valter's is the kind of restaurant you might see in a movie. It's stylish and absolutely dripping with ambiance. Valter himself greets guests and makes everyone feel like welcome family. It's filled with beautiful people eating beautiful food. We went to celebrate a birthday, and noticed that others had come for similar celebratory reasons. From the bruschetta, to the bread and balsamic, to the Caesar salad prepared tableside, to the butternut squash ravioli and spaghetti carbonara, to the hot chocolate and biscotti, to the creme brûlée, every bit of our dinner was special, high-quality and truly delicious. We will visit Valter's again soon. It was a satisfying and memorable experience all-around.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I heard about this place on an NBA podcast (the TK Show if you're curious) and both Steve Kerr and Ron Adams (Warriors asst. coach) said it was their favorite spot. So being a dubs fan, I had to go check it out. Once you're inside, you can see photos of Valter with a bunch of NBA people (Steph, Pop, plenty more) so I knew I'd found the right place. The food is, as you can imagine quite good, and though it seems silly to say, the thing that is sticking in my head the most is the anchovy based sauce they give you in the beginning along with their excellent bread. I need to figure out what it is. I also had a hearty (but not heavy) bowl of mushroom soup and this crusted duck in a cognac/grape sauce. The duck's sauce was a bit sweet to my liking but I really loved the fennel crust on the duck. I'll def be back next time I'm in SLC.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I've heard about this place for a long time and yes, it lived up to the hype plus more!! The entire experience--the food, the service, the vibe, etc... and Valter is walking around making sure everyone is happy!! I've been to Italy and I felt the food here was better!!! We were never rushed and spent a comfortable 2 1/2 hours enjoying it all. The pasta sampler is a must--so you get a little taste of a bunch of yummy pastas. The salmon was AMAZING--let's just say I licked my plate clean on that one!! I can't wait to go again!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: We happened on this wonderful spot while in Salt Lake City for the evening. It has everything you want- great food, great atmosphere, good service and of course, Valter! His attentive presence throughout the evening guarantees your experience will be memorable. We will definitely be back!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Very nice ambiance and quieter than we thought it would be inside. Valet parking was helpful. The two different people I spoke to regarding reservations were quite uninviting and borderline rude though. Unfortunately the food was extremely bland. I had the lasagna. Usually a lasagna dish is bursting with flavor however, it left me wishing I had ordered something else. The service was not too bad. Not too personable though. They did some things great and others were left to be desired. My tastes are different than others. If you want bold complex flavors I'm afraid you won't find it here. Overall, I was disappointed because this place was highly recommended.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: My friend took me to Valter's for my birthday and WOW, was it amazing! Hands down the best restaurant in Utah for food, service, ambience and experience. The staff came around often to check on us, and Valter himself was intent on me having a good birthday experience in his restaurant. The slower dining experience led itself to an opportunity for good conversation. The food came out hot, fresh and is real authentic Italian.I ordered the chicken with capers. The meal was delicious. We also got the trio salad, and the trio pasta sampler. My favorite was the prosciutto salad and the butternut squash ravioli.I look forward to the next special occasion where I can make a case for myself to go back for such fine dining. While we were there, 7 tables were sung happy birthday too, so you know it's a special occasion type place. Absolutely loved it!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: The ambiance at Valter's Osteria was amazing. It felt like you were being transported to an Italian bistro on the other side of the world. The restaurant staff were very helpful in making our dinner wonderful buy suggesting great menu options as well as being on top of everything. The lasagna was out of this world as well as the cheese cake. I would recommend it, to any one. The bruschetta and the caprese salad were wonderful. The heirloom tomatoes and the fresh mozzarella were to die for.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I just KNOW I'm going to irritate a lot of folks with this three star review, but hey, every experience is a unique one, right?  So my wife and I had dinner here with a good friend who was in town for the recent doTerra conference, and she couldn't wait to treat us.  We had reservations and sat right down...probably at one of the most traffic-intensive tables (just off the sound end of the bar and near the entrance to the kitchen.  So besides constantly scooting in to make room for the waiters passing by with trays and carts, I guess it was OK.I started off with the Pasta e Fagioli soup which was good but unremarkable.  Then my main course was their Cioppino Toscano which was, well, unique.  I love cioppinos and found this one to be tasty and full of assorted seafood (love the Escolar!), and was enjoying it until I got down to the crab...and quite literally a small soft shell crab lying in the bottom of the sizeable bowl.  I figured I would be getting literal chunks of crab, but no.  Valter and his cooks make you work for it...and that's when I lost the rest of my appetite.  Just not a crab/lobster aficionado especially when I have to tear them apart to enjoy them.The small chocolate dessert was tasty if not very rich...which brings me to my final point.  Needless to say the cost of the food is steep, and may be one of the larger barriers to me over coming back, but the 'richness' of the food caught up with me - and my wife and our family friend/host - after the fact.  All three of us dealt with lower GI issues for the next day or so, and the only commonality between the three of us was dinner at Valter's.  Unfortunately.  And no, it wasn't the Escolar...as I've had 'butter fish' before with zero side effects.Valter does take pride in his establishment and was seen everywhere ensuring that everyone had a great time and good food, even stopping by to say hello to our host, and that is to be commended.  However, his restaurant is probably not somewhere I'm going to patronize again any time soon, even if it is Hugh Jackman's Fave here in SLC.Three stars..."A-OK" for rich food (beware) and rich prices.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This is an absolute gem.  Walter (Valter) took such great care of us and spoiled us over the course of the evening.  If you're looking for a high end, authentic Tuscan experience, Valter's is your place.  Expensive but the personable staff, quality of food and atmosphere are everything you'd hope for.Everything we had was flawless.  I highly recommend the raviolis.  Careful with that bread, it's far too good and will fill you up too early.  The fresh lemon local honey sea salt gellato was a dream.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Best Italian restaurant I have eaten in. Every dish was unique and amazing and the service was too notch.I strongly recommend!!!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: My favorite restaurant in Utah and some of the best Italian food that I have had anywhere. Great service, atmosphere and food.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Absolutely my favorite place to dine in Salt Lake. The food is amazing & the environment is beautiful & elegant. Valter's himself is so friendly and personable. Your not just eating food, it's an experience.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: The best I have ever had!  He arrive, the food and the style was excellent. Make sure you save room for the lemon gelato!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: We came to SLC for doterra convention and my friend wanted to try this place because it's one of Hugh Jackman's favorite in town. Quiet busy on a Tuesday night but we were able to book a table. First they served us bread with this house sauce which I believe it's made out of olive oil, garlic, and some anchovies. I can easily eat the whole basket of bread with the sauce and a glass of wine which will complete the dinner. But we have to try everything and everything that followed were beyond amazing!! They mix their Caesar salad and plate the pasta in front of you. You can definitely tell they use top and fresh ingredients. We had the gnocchi and ravioli sampler, pappardelle with Valter's mother secret recipe, and duck breast.  We left with four doggie bags. Last but not least, they served us a chocolate syrup with lemon biscotti before our desserts. The chocolate syrup was so good it reminded me of Angelina's in Paris.  Valter was so so nice, he greeted every guest at the table and made sure everyone is happy. Definitely an amazing host!! We have decided that we will definitely be back every year we come back to SLC. Highly recommend this place for some real authentic Italian food!!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Absolutely stunning food!!! Service was outstanding.  Food was magnificent.  Wine list was small but strong with reasonable price points.  Chef Valter worked the room relentlessly.  Perfect for ANY occasion!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: For the money, this is the worst Italian restaurant I have ever been to. I have never had a more bland pasta bean soup. It was terrible. The salad was average. I have to say the lasagna was very good. But not for $30. Above all, the price for this meal was more expensive than any Italian restaurant I have ever seen. Not worth it, will never go back.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: AMAZING. I come to Salt Lake City every few weeks and ALWAYS make a point to go to Valter's for at least one meal. Eduardo and Lee provide the best service. They both remember me every time I come in, even though I don't even live here! I usually ask Eduardo to choose his favorites, he always remembers what I've had before and chooses an amazing meal for me. A few favorites, butternut squash ravioli, rigatoni, ciopinno, tuna tartare, and the beef carpaccio.  Valter makes it a point to stop by every table which makes his restaurant feel like home.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Swanson's TV dinner anyone? I had high expectations considering the prices, pretentious attitude of our server, and the hype. While the bread was good, the rest was a snooze at best. And trust me, we almost fell asleep waiting 40 minutes for our entrees. Ordered the veal scallopini. As they say, a picture is worth a thousand words. (See photo...yes, that is how it really came out). The plate had a bunch of dirty smears on it and there was a nasty film on top of the "meat". I can see why they don't list the prices on the website. It cost $43. I've had better looking and tasting TV dinners. Tip: save yourself the pretentious attitude and go to the frozen food section of SMiths and load up on stouffer's Salisbury steaks. You're welcome.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Been here 10 times...never had a bad meal..it's not a cheap date but I have taken 3 of my vendors from Italy there and they've said it's the best meal they've ever had...I tell everyone it's the best Italian food I've ever eaten and I've eaten Italian in little Italy in NYC, the best Italian restaurants in Chicago and I've eaten in Bergamo, Milan and Venice Italy...best meal, not just Italian , I've ever eaten...I highly recommend the tasting menu, not a cheap date but well worth it...and the imported wine that's bottled for Valter's and made in Italy is so excellent...Mr Valter greets everyone and is the nicest man ever....I try to go every other trip there (I go to salt lake every month).. my favorite restaurant in the world

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I took my niece and nephew there for dinner on a cold March night after a day of skiing and they loved it. Fresh and tasty Italian food which won't disappoint. Make sure you call ahead for a reservation.Remember to leave room for their lemon, salt and olive oil infused ice cream. You won't be disappointed.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Had heard about Valter's form many sources and finally decided to check it out. And now I'm kicking myself for not trying it sooner. The food was fantastic, very fresh and satisfying to the last bite. We tried the sampler, which was a bit expensive but gave us a better view of what was offered from Valter's. Can't wait to come back and focus on a couple of the menu items as a main course. Needless to say the pasta was amazing.Have reservations for tonight and can't wait. Dinner and the BOM at Eccles tonight.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Valter's food is absolutely amazing, every single dish we tried was cooked to perfection... but the service is lacking.
