I made a reservation for 6 people at 8pm, we waited til 9:15pm to be seated... despite having made the reservation 11 days in advance. Their hostess Courtney just stood there while we waited, and kept telling us it would be 10-15 more minutes... not an hour.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Went with our wife for the anniversary. Reservation at 6 and we were seated at 5:50. Everyone was great including Valter himself walking around. We had the sampler salad sorry no pic. Tomato with mozzarella was  great and the green salad with creamy 4 cheese dressing was delicious. My wife has the lasagna and it was great. It had a great flavor to it and left you wanting more, thankfully portion is large enough to have some leftovers. She also had a special gelato drink that she absolutely loved. I had the fettuccine gorgonzola and it was great, creamy and flavorful. We saved room for dessert and my wife got the lemon honey gelato and wow it was so good great gelato and the fresh lemon and fresh honey was so good. I got the cheesecake with strawberry and dang one of the best cheesecakes I have had. Super moist and great flavor.  Recommend very highly. It's not cheap but dang it is good.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Beautifully orchestrated meal. The pasta sampler was great, and the service was outstanding. Several of us were a bit disappointed in the entrees, including myself (I ordered the beef medallions and scallop), but overall, a very nice experience.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I had the best experience here, which is why I came back to back nights while I was in SLC for business. Bruschetta is super fresh, soup was good, bread and dessert were amazing. I tried the rigatoni the first night & the seafood pasta the second night. They were both totally different, but the seafood pasta was probably my favorite! I love that Valter comes out to visit with his guests many of times, very welcoming. I also enjoyed Lee, she was great! I will be back.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: The food was pretty good and the service is even better.  Being from the NYC area, I can be a tough critic on Italian food. A staff that takes great care of its guests. They are patient, willing to recommend their best dishes and wine. The restauranteur and Chef greets everyone when they leave and during the meal.  Be ready to get kissed, whether you want to be or not!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Amazing!!! Hands down the absolute best Italian food in the state! I highly recommend this place. We wanted to try so many things, we asked the server to make us somewhat of a mix plate. The bread and dipping sauce to start is on point. The chocolate and cookie after is amazing. I don't think there's one item on this menu that isn't amazing. I will say my only complaint is the black haired hostess. She was nothing short of just a total brat. Other than that, this place has my heart! I will be back regardless of the young and rude hostess!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Delicious dinner at Valter's Osteria. The salads were my favorite, with the pastas as a close second.My favorite dish of the night: AVOCADO IN BIANCO CON GRANCHIOHalf Avocado, Arugula, Fresh Crab, baby shrimpand four cheese RIGATONI AL SUGO DELLA MAMMARigatoni in Valter's Mothers' Special Porcini & Meat RAVIOLI MACCHIATIHomemade Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli in a Butter,Sage, and Light Tomato SauceINSALATA TOSCANA DELLA CASARomaine Lettuce Served in a Pasteurized Egg, Mustard, and Gorgonzola Dressing

name: Valter's Osteria
content: If you have ever been to a perfect symphony - you will understand Valter's.   You will also understand Valter himself.  His name is on the door and he will fuss until it is just right.  While the entrance is a bit small, you feel like you are entering the home of a friend.    His warmth is sincere and it shows in his staff, his food and his quality.I could write paragraphs on how good this place is - but to just confirm your feeling that you might want to come here, I will give some highlights1) Staff wants to help you.   They want you there, they want you to have a good time.  They know the menu.   They are not up selling, they are trying to maximize your experience2) Food is rock star quality.   My method?  Table side Caesar - it says for 2, it's for 6....you will eat it all.    Split a plate of pasta - gnocchi which is pillow soft in a loving mellow sauce.,  Carbonara is rich.   But so good.   I stick with the veal here.   It's fair to say that veal is hard to get right and 90% of places cook it too long and it's tough.  Not here - fork tender and not over fussed - just right.    Gelato for dessert.    If I had one nit - just one - I wish they used more of a straightforward sausage...I think theirs is too delicate and spiced a little sweetly.   But that's it.    The rest is perfect.Best restaurant in this city - bar none

name: Valter's Osteria
content: This place was amazing!!!!  The bar service is slower than the table service and only has 4 seats, but either way, you can't lose!  The spaghetti carbonara is amazing...and that is not something I would traditionally choose!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Wow. From the service to the food this place is top notch. They even made their owe orange bitters for the old fashion. Appetizers to desert everything was amazing.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Although this place is on the pricey side, it's well worth it. The lemon gelato with honey blew my mind. Everything we've ever ordered here is absolutely delicious.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: What an experience!  From the call to set the reservation until the selfie with Valter on the way out, first class. The food, the staff, the environment were all better than anticipated which is not an easy thing because exceptions were high. Everyone on the staff seemed to truly care about making sure every customer felt comfortable, at home and happy. We felt very well attended to, but had time to enjoy our time as well. You will spend a fair amount here. But go ahead, treat yourself. You deserve it!!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Food was good. Service was horrendous. I had a truly regrettable experience here, and the decent food does not make up for it. There is a lot of bluster, and not enough substance to match. For someone who has never been outside of Utah, this might be considered above average cuisine, however, for those of us who have been a few places, can attest that this is merely good, not great food. I have been to Michelin starred restaurants where the staff had less airs about them. The staff, from the host, to the bartender, to the server were pretentious, passive aggressive, and outright rude. It may be because I am a person of color that I was treated this way. I am absolutely disgusted by the treatment I received at this restaurant.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: I was visiting SLC for work and my coworkers and I decided to go out for a nice meal after working for eleven hours. We made a reservation a couple hours ahead and were excited that they'd be able to seat us that night. It was close to both our hotel and the convention center. We arrived a couple mins before our reservation and they seated us ten mins after our reservation. Even though it was a Monday, the place was PACKED. We were served complimentary brucetta and break with a sauce. The bread was PERFECT, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The majority of the group ordered on entree while others ordered two. Because two people ordered an extra dish, it meant our food took even longer to come out. It was pretty awkward sitting around watching them eat then waiting even longer to get our orders. I got the fettuccini with a four cheese gorgonzola sauce. It tasted like a fancy Alfredo with a hint of Gorgonzola. (Was it worth $30 + tax and tip...I'm still debating). The portions were average size, everyone finished all the food on their plates and didn't need take away bags. The best part (aside from spending time with friends) was the dessert. They give you a complimentary hot chocolate and lemon biscotti. It was AMAZING. The bad part of this was the meal took forever. From the moment we sat down to the moment we left was two and a half hours. I'm all for freshly preparing food, enjoying company, a long meal, etc. but it was to long. Aside from the price and the wait, it was an excellent meal!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Food Heaven!Came here with my husband for an early birthday dinner (and it was when they had an opening.) From the moment we walked in we knew we were in for a treat. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming and we were greeted by Valter himself. After being seated we were brought complementary bruschetta which had an incredible lightness and finesse to it that we were not expecting. We were also brought bread for the table. The bread was definitely made in house. It was soft and warm and was served with an olive oil with garlic and capers in it. The saltiness of the capers was perfect with the oil and the garlic. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful and recommended a few things for our entree and recommended an Italian fruit drink (which I cannot remember the name of but it was amazing.) My husband ordered the lasagna and I ordered the gnocchi. My husband is of Italian heritage and we are VERY picky about Italian food. My husbands lasagna was perfectly balanced. He ate up every bite and raved about it the entire time. My gnocchi was absolutely perfect. Many places put too much flour in them making them dense and weighted down. Not Valter's. The gnocchi were perfect light, and fluffy pillows covered with just the right amount of zesty tomato sauce. After tasting one I looked at my husband and literally said "I have just died and gone to food heaven." They were that good. After we finished our entrees we ordered some dessert but were also given a small cup of melted Italian chocolate and a biscotti  to dip in the chocolate. The chocolate was rich and warm and I wanted to drink the whole cup (which I slightly regret not doing) and the biscotti was the perfect texture. For dessert my husband ordered the panna cotta and I ordered the tiramisu. I didn't get a chance to taste my husbands dessert but he said it was perfectly balanced and the texture was spot on. My tiramisu was also perfect. The balance of coffee to cream was exactly how it is supposed to be. We loved everything we ate here and I believe what makes this place so incredible and different is Valter. He greets everyone and roams around the restaurant making sure everyone is comfortable and having a good time while also visiting the kitchen. Yes, the prices are high but it is definitely worth it. If you are looking for an upscale experience and authentic Italian food, Valter's is the place to be. I will be coming back for every birthday to come.

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Just hanging in SLC and decided to drop in Valter's Osteria, thanks to Yelp I felt confident dinner would be delicious and it was!  Great atmosphere, outstanding service and the food is wonderfully authentic.  Try their cappuccino's too!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: If you're looking for an upscale night out with tremendous food, consider a reservation at Valter's. It's an experience that you won't soon forget.  Each course is ordered and priced individually and then plated at your table. Before your food is played and set in front of you, they present it you in the dish it was prepared in. If it's acceptable they plate it and give it to you to enjoy. The ambience here is very upscale and classy but not stuffy. Valter himself wanders around greeting diners-I noticed there were several likely regulars, they way he interacted with a few folks. The food is amazing. Very flavorful and authentic. I doubt there's a freezer anywhere on the property.(There might be, but everything tastes so fresh that there would be no need for one.)Plan on spending a good amount of money-this is not a budget friendly place. But it's worth saving up for!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Outstanding service, food and atmosphere! Best restaurant we've been to in Utah. Italian food at its finest. Couldn't have had a better experience and our server was impeccable in his attention and recommendations. Well done!!

name: Valter's Osteria
content: Absolutely one of the best Italian restaurants - the food was fantastic; Gustavo looked after everyone-highly recommended!!!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Been there dozens of times and have only ever ordered the Hoss.  It's awesome.  Fried chicken, bacon, topped with an egg.  Great coffee, too.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: The food was good, but the service honestly ruined my experience and I would most likely not come back unless I'm getting Togo and having minimum interaction with any of the staff. Our server came to our table and was decently pleasant. However, when she started taking our order - mmm not so pleasant. Granted - we were a table of 6, decently sized group, so I'll give her that. But when trying to take our order, she seemed to get flustered ?? I ordered something about 5 times but she seemed to have missed it, so when I told her I wanted to include that as part of my meal when she repeated our order, she was not havin it. Need I remind you, I repeated myself multiple times so like... you chose not to listen. No one else was talking either, so it's not like it was loud. However, I apologized anyway for the confusion on behalf of our table and she was like "yeah y'all should've written it out, that would've been helpful" with some sass. Mmm excuse me ma'am okay, it is 8 am on a Sunday not sure if you were getting over a hangover but I'm from out of town and did not choose violence that day.. so I kept my mouth shut. Our food comes out - they are starting to place it on our table and we are trying to make additional space and while a different lady was holding the plates, she made a snarky comment about us needing to hurry up because the plates were hot. Okay yes, totally get it - the plates are hot and you want to set it down, however, your tone was not appreciated and I did not need to get sassed for the second time that morning. Like there was a different way to deliver that message and that was not it. Not only was her tone rude but so was her comment.. I wish I could've remembered what it was.Then, our bill comes out. We already know the staff is not a fan of our table so we didn't even bother asking for a split check - so one person paid and pressed a print button on the portable device they gave us - cause you know.. we assumed it would print the receipt after we paid. However, we did not know it printed to the kitchen.. I mean it really was an accident, like you insert your card and a screen pops up asking to print, one would assume it's the receipt of the bill! Well the waitress came up to us and we were like hey we tried printing the bill but didn't see it come out, so was wondering if you could print it for us. And again with the sass and condescending tone - "it printed to the kitchen so unless you want them to make your food again you shouldn't have pressed that" I'M SORRY MAAM WHO PUT B-WORD IN YOUR CEREAL THIS MORNING? Anyway, three different instances where we were treated poorly and given unwarranted attitude. I didn't wake up to have my last meal in Utah be such a negative experience, so if you don't want the same - I suggest you not waste your time coming here.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: What a great find!  Visiting for work from Denver.  The service was amazing.  Arri was great!  She recommend us to get the loaded hash amd add salsa.  Everything is fresh!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Our breakfast was delicious and the service was amazing! The hash potatoes are a "must try". I don't typically like drip coffee and their regular coffee was really good.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Came to SLc on vacation and this was by far the best meal we had. The mint limeade is out of this World. The Hoss sandwich and the bread pudding French toast were both fantastic. Special shout out to Joel our server for great recommendations and an even better personality. If I were a bar/restaurant owner I'd hire him in a second.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I went to this on a Sunday and was treated quite rudely by the hostess.  She never acknowledged us and continued to be on her phone and seat everyone who came after us.  Then an Asian man came in and asked about the wait time and was told it was 20 minutes but when he left she seated the next white family that came in no wait time.  I'm confident that this restaurant discriminated against anyone who is over the age of 30, Asian. The food was nothing to brag about. So if you are in Utah do not go to this restaurant.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: The people are nice but the food was not that amazing. It wasn't full of flavor. It took our waitress over ten minutes to bring us our drinks. The food you can tell had sat for a minute before we got it because it was no longer hot. Overall, it was a mediocre experience.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: If you haven't been here yet you need to try the food is very unique and quite delicious. The presentation is always good in the service is always good it is a little pricey but the portions are huge

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I've been dying to try Sweet Lake for a while, but usually there is a line out the door and a wait list for hours. Now that I've tasted their food, I completely understand why these biscuits are in such high demand. This place is worth the wait! I would avoid the weekend brunch crowd, and go on a week day. The service was prompt and the food delicious. The server was very helpful in assisting me as a first timer and recommended the Hoss and the French Toast. Both were fantastic!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Simply said this place was amazing. The Hoss was delicious and the bananas bayou was probably one of the best desserts we ever had, do not pass on this. Their hot sauce was excellent. Staff was very friendly and attentive. We will be back next time we are in SLC.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: What a fun and unique place! We loved our food and the staff were super kind and accommodating to get us in and out fast! We will definitely come back!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Spotless clean. Constantly disinfecting. All staff wore masks. Tables socially distanced. That was the set up so we felt safe and comfortable. One of us had The Hoss with hash browns, and the other the Conspiracy Cakes. I had never had wheat blueberries pancakes before and they were very good! Both our meals were different from what we are used to and super nice. Our server was Ashley. It just doesn't get any better. Congratulations to whoever hired her! This was an excellent place for brunch.  We live a long ways away and we were just passing through but already dream of returning.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Blown away again. Sweet lake never misses. Because of the good weather, we decided to sit outside. The patio area is beautiful. Ordered the St francis, which is like a deluxe avocado toast, and it was heavenly. I don't know who St Francis is but damn he did a good job on this meal. My partner got the Titanic chicken sandwich and titanic is a good name for it because this thing was HUGE. Too big for his plate. He is someone who takes pride in being particular about fried chicken, and he approves of Sweet Lake's chicken sandwich. This says a lot people. His meal came with chips and limeade salsa as an appetizer and we really enjoyed it! Super refreshing and sweet, which is perfect to not fill you up before your meal. For beverages we tried the "Limey Palmer" and i have to say it wasn't super impressive. Not a terrible drink, it was just very bland and lacking flavor. Wouldn't order for 3$. However, we are still hooked on the Honeydew cucumber limeade!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: If you want a great place for breakfast or lunch definitely recommend coming here. Overall experience is great and servers are always smiling and super friendly. If I could with out gaining 100 lbs extra I would come and dine here wayyyyy more frequently lol

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Been to this place a couple times now, and the food is good, but the service was a little off, which is why I try to avoid busy brunch spots usually.The drinks are probably what they do best, I've tried the honeydew cucumber limeade which was delicious, but they all look tasty. I was wanting to try the Backporch (or was it frontporch?) cocktail but unfortunately they only serve the liquor cocktails at their Draper location. I went for a Lime Shandy as a backup but they were out of that which was disappointing.I tried the T. Rose to see how the portobello compared to the chicken, which I am sad to say it didn't. It was pretty good, and I really liked the asparagus but the entire time I kept wishing I was eating some of their delicious crunchy fried chicken. Their hash browns with quinoa and some other goodies I couldn't identify was delicious by the way. A little bummed it doesn't come with and you have to order it as a side, but m worth the extra $3 in my opinion. Overall verdict is tasty but overrated, but maybe that's just cause brunch isn't my favorite meal, but if you are an avid brunches you may disagree with me.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I wish I had the capability to give this place 10 stars. Here's why:The food was phenomenal. Like, UNREALISTICALLY good. My friend and I were visiting from out of town, and we decided to split an entree. We ordered the Cuban (the sandwich one), but they brought us the Cuban Benedict (I hate benedicts) and guys IT WAS SO GOOD. Let me reiterate that they brought us the wrong thing, I hate benedicts, and this thing was still so good we finished it. That right there is next level food.We also had their blackberry lemonade mimosa and the honeydew cucumber limeade - that limeade tho. I hate cucumber. I loved this limeade. Their food is MAGIC.After we left, we looked at our bill and realized we had been brought the wrong entree and that an extra drink had been added to our bill. All in all, we got mischarged about $7. I emailed them about it, and they REFUNDED OUR WHOLE MEAL. Who even does that?!  They had a hard time getting the refund to go through, but they kept at it until it worked, all the while being extremely kind, apologetic, and just the best in every way. I am so mad that we don't live near this place so I can give them money every week because not only does their food deserve it, they deserve to be supported as a top example of everything a business should be.GO HERE EVEN IF YOU DON'T GO ANYWHERE ELSE IN SALT LAKE. This place has my loyalty until death

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Can't say enough food things!! Definitely get the biscuit bites. All the food and limeades we had we're absolutely delicious. Our server was super friendly and even though it was busy you could tell he was working hard to make everyone in his section feel good. Definitely would come back!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: If I could give this place more than 5 stars believe me- I WOULD! Are you looking to satisfy a delicious brunch craving with an eggs Benedict? Perhaps you're looking for something a little different, like some chilaquiles? Or are you just feelin' like chompin' down a juicy burger? Look no further, THIS here is your spot. The feel of the place is comfy and cute- super aesthetic if brunch selfies are your thing. The people who work here are super sweet and make you feel welcome. But the FOOD?! Lawd Jesus. Delicious! I got the Benedict biscuit and every bite of that was delicious. Biscuit was soft, egg perfectly cooked, savory yet slightly sweet ham...yummmm. I could eat this at least once a week and look forward to it every time as if it was my first, every time. I washed that down with an OJ mimosa. The juice was freshly squeezed! It was so delicious and refreshing. And if you appreciate hot sauce that is spicier than Cholula, you have GOT to sprinkle the red and green sauces available at the table. The red has a pretty strong punch so sprinkle with caution-or not, all up to you. The green tasted fresh, like my mom makes back in LA. Overall, I'm pretty pumped to have found such an incredible brunch spot. I'll definitely be back!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: By far my favorite breakfast/brunch place in Salt Lake. All the drinks are so good and unique and reasonably good price.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: We waited an hour for our table after being told it would be 30 minutes. We finally went and asked what was going on and they said someone had taken us off the list and we never received any kind of phone notification and nobody ever came to check on us. When we finally got sat, it was another 10 minutes for anyone to come by with even water. Multiple takes came and left before we even got sat. Really disappointed with the service.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I got a to go order and was extremely disappointed. The biscuits were hard as rock and there was more slaw than pulled pork. The food was cold. No one in my party got their chips with the order. The drinks are good but nothing worth going for if the food isn't up to par. The staff was not friendly either. Disappointed with my experience here

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Delicious food, and great service! The biscuits are amazing, and the hot chocolate was the best I have ever had!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I'm shocked at the ratings, I saw some pictures and thought this place looked amazing! I went today and got the hoss and even though it looks amazing it had NO flavor, I was so confused why it didn't taste good but it didn't. Then I tried my friends food and it was dull as well. HUGE disappointment as we spent about $50!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I love this restaurant but they keep mangling their delivery menu on Doordash/Caviar/Chowhound. A few weeks ago they removed the Basic from their menu (which isn't my favourite but I definitely do like it and order it occasionally). The real qualm I have is that last week they removed the Biscuit Benedict which is easily my favourite item on the menu (I'd even go so far as to say it's my favourite breakfast in SLC). The Hoss and the biscuit+gravy are pretty solid but they really don't compete with the items they pulled off.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Best breakfast/brunch place in SLC! Biscuits are delicious and the chicken is amazing!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: My wife and I ate here late in the afternoon on a Saturday.  Not to busy.  Food was good, but serve needs a lot of work.  Took forever to order and to get the check after we finished eating.  I don't know if I would return if it is this slow regarding service.  I feel myself age as I sit here waiting.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Always delicious! The eggs are cooked to perfection and I love their homemade hot sauces and the quinoa hash.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Yummy options, nice and helpful ervice! Taking COVID precautions, we had a great experience.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: This is one our favorite breakfast spots ever. The food is so fresh and delicious and we just love it. I have tried multiple things on the menu and each one is delicious. The inside of the restaurant is clean and spaced well. Ordering take out is super easy and kept under a warmer which I appreciate so much.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Amazing! First time here, came at around 11 am, heard  about this place from a friend, and it's really   delicious! We waited 5 min to be seated....Their lime juice are aweeeesome, they have a little corner where they prepare the fresh juices for you!I really like it, I  was impressed and exceed my expectations.... will be back for sure!!!!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: This place was outstanding! Right when I walked in, I was greeted by the server and the barista. The first bite of my food took me away. I ordered the hoss biscuit meal and the hash browns. The chicken was the perfect amount of crispy and the bacon was a great compliment. Also had the honeydew limeade. The limeade was the best drink I've ever had in my life. Perfect balance of all of the key ingredients.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: It was okay. The girls were real sweet and the food was okay, but the service (at this price) was horrible. Waited outside in the cold only to have people seated before. Had plenty of time to look at the menu so I was ready and placed my order before all the other tables, and yet, I was the one served last. Pretty sure the sweet girl forgot my order. Probably won't return, seems like one of the many, many overrated places in Utah.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Hostess was very rude. She told me the wait was 1 hour. So I quickly ran to fill up my gas tank at Costco. 20 minutes later after putting my reservation in, they sent me a text saying the table was ready. I get there 10 minutes after the text was received, then waited in the long hostess line for 4 minutes. I said my name and she said, "since we sent you the text 19 minutes ago, we already sat your table." I told her they sent it to me 10 minutes before I got in line to be seated, and they were drastically (70%) off the stated wait time when I put in my reservation. She said, "no, we sent it to you 19 minutes ago." Well after she found a table I looked. And it's been 14 minutes... she was so rude I never want to come back here. My meal, the hoss, was also just okay for the price. Chicken tasted like it was frozen and had been baked. Upgrading to two stars because my waiter, Cliff, was very pleasant to interact with. He was the best part of the whole experience. Super chill dude.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: If you  like big food and are impressed with an over-the-top presentation at the expense  of tasty food, then this might be the place for you.  The biscuits are very good (which you'd expect given the name) but the limeade is not.  I love limeade but I didn't drink more than a few sips. Gravy should be great at a place like this, but it's bland and tastes suspiciously like it's from a mix.  The hash browns with quinoa are just weird.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Love this place! First visit we had the Hoss and it was excellent, but on visit 2, we tried the Titanic (biscuit) and it is a fave. Of course, it includes the house biscuit.  Chicken is juicy and crispy, the spicy pickle is a great topping with the perfect sour note and the sandwich has bacon! Perfect.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Awesome is the only word I can say. Food was AMAZING!!!!  I wish they opened one up where I live or make a recipe book.   Everything was Amazon no went with three friends and we had

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I came here for a team lunch. We did make reservations which I felt helped with being seated quickly. We decided to order breakfast for lunch and got "The HOSS" and "BASIC" both serving sizes were generous. Also suggest ordering the Banana foster to share because that was a treat! The service was slow but overall a decent experience. I did order a limey Palmer...I should have paid attention to the word limey because it was just that. Id love to come back and try other limeades. The overall vibe is great, workers were friendly and didn't rush you to leave or order right that second.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: i never write reviews but i thought this would be the time. my boyfriend and i came here for breakfast a couple days ago and we loved this place. when we got seated we had to wait 30 minutes before anyone even realized we didn't have any drinks or food in front of us. when we finally got our biscuit benedicts, it tasted good but the real trouble came a couple hours later. we both realized we had food poisoning and had to go to work with diarrhea. it's been 2 days later and we still have diarrhea because of this place. also after we ate i still tipped 20% even though the service wasn't great and now i feel ripped off. so go at your own risk

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: First of All I can't give a review on the food because we were not seated even though there was a lovely table unused, social distanced from other tables. The gal seating said she was too busy so we would have to wait 30 minutes before even seating us. We wouldn't have minded just setting and having a cup of coffee while waiting... We were quite disappointed with the short experience we had. I wouldn't usually Yelp about this, but we didn't feel very welcome to this establishment so that's what I'm Yelping about... Needless to say we won't give this restaurant a second try. If only the girl working had been more accommodating this review may have been much better!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Spent one day in SLC, did a quick google search Of places that serve breakfast and came across this restaurant. There was no wait time so we were seated pretty quickly and the staff were very friendly. The food was off the chart delicious we were so glad to have stumbled across this gem.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: WOW. Talk about some tasty food. I should have written this review a few month ago, but forgot (but it goes to show how stand out the food was since I still remember it).My partner and I looked up the best places in Salt Lake City for breakfast and Sweet Take Biscuits & Limeade was right at the top.There was a little bit of a wait, but overall it wasn't bad. The service was friendly and quick. I ordered the ORANGE RASPBERRY LEMONADE and BISCUIT BENEDICT with HASH BROWNS. The hash browns are super unique with the red quinoa, but super tasty. The meal overall was amazing... but honestly, nothing could compare to the homemade biscuit that my partner ordered on the side. It was hands down the best biscuit I have ever tasted. If you are in the area, I would highly suggest stopping in for breakfast. I can guarantee you will have a great meal.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Incredibly delicious biscuit plates - want to go back, might have to schedule a trip just to eat! If you're on the fence, give it a try. I believe you can also put together a healthy plate if that's your aim, but you have to try the biscuit!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: The food here is good! We got the limeades and the hoss and my wife got French toast! The hoss was good but needed more gravy and better biscuits in my opinion the French toast was dang good! A little bit too expensive for a breakfast place but it's a cool atmosphere and the service was really good

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I googled, breakfast near me, and this place popped up.  4.5 startsI think people are just being too nice to this place.  I like supporting small businesses and I do not expect a lot, but,1st. Waiting for too long just to place the order. 2nd. Asked for a tee spoon to mix sugar in coffee, got a table spoon.  A teaspoon to mix sugar should have been there from the start.3rd. Eggs Benedict was so so.  Very messy and too watery.  Perhaps it was because I ordered a Cubano.  Basically some pork meat. Shredded. Inside of the eggs Benedict.4th. Ambiance is very basic. 5th. The young girls serving us were probably overwhelmed with work.  But, they did try. I really wanted to give them more stars.  At least one more.  But, I just can't.  They are a 3 star place.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Not a long wait time at all! Staff was nice wore mask social distancing as well. The food is very delicious and the Mint and Raspberry limeade were my favorites! Highly recommend for brunch! Kids are welcomed as well!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: We dined here on a Saturday morning. Arrived around 10 am. They told us the wait time was 1 hour, but the table was ready in about 25 minutes. Because of Covid, there were only 4-5 tables inside. The service was quick and we were able to eat and be done within 30 minutes. The food and drinks were great.  The limeades were very flavorful.... especially the raspberry. We both had the basic breakfast sandwich with the mushroom gravy on the side. Definitely filling and yummy! I would come back in the future!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: My boyfriend and I decided to visit on President's Day so we knew it would be a little busy. I attempted to check into the Yelp line with the app but for some reason, it wasn't functioning that day. When we arrived, we checked in and was told that there would be about a 40 minute wait. We waited in the car and browsed the online menu. An hour later, we were finally seated. I ordered the eggs Benedict with my hash browns extra crispy. My boyfriend got the cubano sandwich. My eggs Benedict was perfect - runny egg yolk. The hash browns were extra crispy like I had asked, but it wasn't anything that made it stand out from any other breakfast/brunch restaurant. The raspberry orange lemonade was delicious. I'm usually not a fan of lemonade but this was sweet and tasty. Other than the long wait, I had a pleasant experience. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. The seating seemed to be rather limited. Four tables in the main seating area, which is a nice precautionary arrangement for COVID-19, but I saw other guests being walked into another seating in the back so there must've been more tables.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Had the Hoss and the raspberry limeade  both delicious. Would definitely recommend this as a breakfast spot.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: One of my favorite restaurants here in salt lake, perfect for brunch or lunch. I get the chilaquiles or the love burger every time, it's seriously next level. I will say the wait is usually fairly long on weekends but I have yet to find a half decent breakfast spot in salt lake that doesn't have an hour wait. Definitely worth the try if you're looking for a bomb breakfast place. Also!! Don't forget to try the house made ketchup, it's better than you'd expect.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Such an amazing big breakfast here!! The hubby and I loved it!! Great service, great tasting food and awesome outside tables!!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Fantastic food!  Fresh, local ingredients. Our server was amazing and so friendly. Limeade was  I can't wait to go back because there's so many other menu items I want to try!!!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Delicious, unique food. Wonderful staff. From scratch meals are worth the wait. Feels safe and clean.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: They currently offer dine in here and we were able to score a table while still feeling safe since there were only 3 tables in the main room and spread out more than 6 ft apart.I was having a hard time of choosing what to order since they serve breakfast options all day along with their main entrees. We couldn't not order any of their limeades, so I went with the honeydew cucumber limeade and my fiance got the limey palmer. All limeades are sweetened with organic cane sugar. We definitely enjoyed both!As for the biscuits, I went with the San Antone - fried local chicken breast, local honey, house hot sauce, local cheddar, house slaw. I love the sweet/savoy mix with the honey but the hot sauce was surprisingly strong. I'm glad I had my limeade to help wash it down. My fiance got the Hoss - Red Bird Farms fried chicken breast, cage-free egg, Daily's bacon, local cheddar, house-made Tooele Valley sausage gravy, green onion. He esp enjoyed the gravy and their house hot sauce, he even thought about getting a bottle to take home, maybe next time.Love the options here from the limeades to the biscuits, great place if you're in the mood for a treat meal.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: One of the best places we've been to yet! The customer service was amazing, the food was amazing, and it's in a really cute location. We got the pancakes with fried chicken and it was SO GOOD

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: This has to be the cutest little spot. We got there just in time for the rush, so it was great timing. I couldn't have asked for more. The food was spectacular. Even the coffee. I'm 100% coming back.. over and over again.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: came here sunday lunch time around 11.30AM. was quoted 1 hour and 30 mins, we got seated exactly as quoted, it was 1PM.we ordered these- mint limeade - loved it.- habanero limeade - pretty damn good.- the hoss - excellent- biscuit bennedict - delicioso- french toast - just okay- loaded hash - whatever- chips and cheese dips - mediocre.overall i enjoyed my lunch here. i am not a fan of biscuits but theirs were amazing, i just had to keep on eating it. lol.server was attentive and very kind. she came over to check on us very frequently.there was one thing that i wished the server would have done though. the hoss and bennedict came with hash and loaded hash, we would appreciate if she could remind us that those two dish already come with hash so we didnt have to order extra has on the side because we end up not finishing the hash. would i come back? yessir!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Amazing food and service each time I've gone. The hoss is delicious, smothered burrito, and I'm sure everything else. Glad i tried them out

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: excellent food, fantastic customer service. we were extremely pleased with the quality of food as well as the kindness of the staff.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I've been a couple times now. The most recent visit was delicious. My girlfriend and I had the biscuits, orange raspberry limeade, ginger limeade and Chilaquiles. Everything was cooked to perfection. The orange limeade was particularly good, I'm so happy I ordered it. Can't wait to order it again!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Fantastic brunch spot! Their house made hot sauce is perfect on everything. Hot with great flavor! Highly recommend the Hoss, but honestly anything would delicious.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: We ordered The Hoss, Conspiracy Cake, Jalapeño biscuit bites and Honeydew Cucumber Limeade.The jalapeño bites are just okay as it just taste like a. Heesy bites with sprinkle of bacon and jalapeño to me, nothing special.Surprisingly, the Limeade was good and refreshing! One of the staff recommended me the honeydew so I ordered that one instead of raspberry limeade!Best decision ever!Of course The Hoss is really up to hype. My husband loves the biscuit, although I'd say the texture is crunchy and soft, the biscuit is too 'stuffy' for me.Hash brown was sooo good and I really loved their bacon too as I'm not a big fan of bacon in general.Conspiracy cake, okay I told my husband to not order this because I knew we wouldn't be able to finish that... Seeing the pictures from Yelp, I could tell it's a type of dish for people who dislike biscuits, and the rest ingredients are pretty much the same.Will I come back? Yes, for the hashbrown, limeade and trying other stuff, and my husband would definitely come back for the biscuits.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Came from out of town and was looking for a fun unique local restaurant to try. Did not disappoint. Great biscuits, fried chicken and hash brown hash. Amazing breakfast!!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Locally sourced breakfast spot we found while vacationing here. Portion size for the Biscuit Benedict was outrageous, to the contrary the Conspiracy Cakes portion size was less than filling. Overall a good find, and I would recommend!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Food is good, but it seems the place is run by idiots. I asked to speak to the manager (looks kind of homeless) and was extremely rude. Probably wouldn't go back

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: We were really excited to try this place as it has so many wonderful reviews, but it was pretty disappointing. The staff was wonderful. They all very kind and attentive. And the service is super fast. But we had to wait 45 min for a table and it really wasn't worth it. We ordered the titanic and the steak breakfast burrito, as well as the ginger and habanero lemonades. So, the lemonade is basically the same base and then they just add chunks of ginger or habanero into it. So, the flavor doesn't really diffuse into the drink. And it was honestly way too sweet for our liking. As for the food, the breakfast burrito was sub par. It was pretty bland. Even after I added some of the hot sauce. I will say, the steak was cooked well. The beans that come with it were undercooked. They were so hard. The titanic biscuit also didn't hit. The biscuit itself was pretty dry, the chicken was over cooked and didn't have much flavor.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Ooweeee the biscuit and gravy was so good! The flavoring of the gravy was really good! I also got the quinoa hashbrowns was delicious! I also got the cucumber mint Limeade, that was really good but a little too sweet for my liking. I really e joyed the raspberry fresh squeezed orange mimosa, it was really yummy. Oh and the house made hot sauce is good as well I even bought one hehe.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Great breakfast joint! Love the biscuits.Service is quick and the portions are decent.It's a bit expensive but most the food is locally sourced, so understandable for sure! Support locals!!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Man, this food is dang good. Unfortunately, COVID has made dining in hard to do (and I got the feeling that dining in would be better than eating take out). That said, the food was still amazing to-go. I tried the Hoss and the San Antone and liked both, but much preferred the Hoss. The SA is surprisingly spicy! I've heard great things about the drinks, and I'm kicking myself for not trying a limeade...

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Amazing!!! Absolutely delicious. We got the HOSS and the Conspicuous cakes with fried chicken. The HOSS was incredible with a perfectly baked biscuit. The biscuit was moist and flaky. The egg, bacon, fried chicken, and sausage gravy were perfect as well. We are already dying to go back and try more. It was hard to even decide what to eat because the whole menu looked amazing. Don't forget to get the Raspberry Limeade or Orange Raspberry Lemonade. YUM.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: My fiancé and I decided to check out this spot on our last day in SLC! We heard that it is one of the best brunch spots in town, and we were intrigued by their specialty in limeades. Because it's a popular spot, we did end up having to wait a bit. Luckily, they have a couple heaters and benches outside and we didn't end up having to wait as long as they predicted. We also got seated inside, which was appreciated with the colder weather. My fiancé got the Hoss since it's clearly the most popular dish. With his love of sausage gravy, that aspect was spot on! He said that the dish could do without the piece of fried chicken, which was a little dry and flavorless. He also got a drip coffee and gave it a thumbs up for being "fine". I tasted it and liked the flavor a lot as it wasn't too bitter.I got the Benedict (with added avocado), and I loved it! They accidentally gave me one with Cubano meat, which I didn't originally order but ended up liking a lot. The biscuits were so crumbly and buttery! Also, the hash that came on the side was very crispy, which I enjoyed. To drink, I got a raspberry limeade. This drink is definitely pricier ($6), but it was tasty. As another reviewer said, the sugar crystals collect on the bottom and don't dissolve. I didn't mind because I enjoyed how tart it was, but I could see how this would be annoying if you wanted a sweeter drink.Also, our waitress was super nice and helpful. Our food came ridiculously fast - like only a few minutes after we ordered.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: In the mood for some biscuits and gravy? This is a good place to go! Their lemonade was very sour! They really enforce social distancing, which was really nice and we felt very safe. The biscuits is buttery and soft! Really loved that it was dry and cakey!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: The menu here is creative and delicious.  Can't go wrong with any of their homemade lemonades or the Benedict.  The staff did a great job making recommendations and answering questions.  So so good, definitely give this place a try

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: AMAAAAAAAZING. So tasty. Just go. You won't be upset. Everything is so good. The gravy, biscuits, eggs, chicken. Top rated for good reason.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Biscuits and gravy for lunch? You bet. Perfect way to spend a chilly afternoon. Having lived in the south before, I love their spin on the biscuit and gravy. Very delicious and undoubtedly a great place for some comfort food! A bit on the pricy side, enjoyed the food.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Came from Florida as a vacation to Utah. Saw this place and new it was a must have. Boy was I right! This place is DELISH. the biscuits are to die for and their limeade is good.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Best breakfast place in salt lake, hands down. Come here for all special occasions because it is just so delicious.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: You might experience a small wait time, but invest in this restaurant because the fresh and delicious food and drinks are 1000% worth the wait. Tip your servers well they work their asses off to serve y'all!!!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Very tasty!My husband got "The Hoss" and it was HUGE! It had a spicy kick to it, that I wasn't expecting so I didn't eat much, but their breaded chicken was good, maybe it was breaded in panco crumbs? It felt "lighter" than other breaded chicken out there. I got the Biscuit Pudding French Toast and it was rich and dense which I really like in bread pudding. There were a few blueberries in the actual "toast" and then they have some fresh berries in their homemade yogurt. The contrast of the rich syrup, and French toast paired really well with the tanginess of the yogurt and helped lighten up the dish. We also for the Raspberry Orange Lemonade and it was very sweet and tasty. I'm personally too cheap to pay $5 for one drink without refills, but others would. We went during COVID-19 restrictions and they only had 18 seats in their restaurant, so I'm sure you will have a wait if you are expecting to eat at this location.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Sooo good. This is one of the best breakfast spots. The staff is very friendly to non locals and the food is amazing. The hot chocolate is definitely something to recommend.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: We only managed to get pictures of two of the 4 things we ordered. The Hoss is just house suggestion that's not bad. The eggs Benedict is definitely one of the best you can find in the valley. Lemonades are a great concept, especially fully local made aspect but it's kind of a bit of an annoyance to have to stir to break up the sugar. Service is always great, even if there is a wait.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: The Hoss was delicious! The biscuits are buttery and flakey. The biscuit bread pudding is wonderful. I would definitely recommend Sweet Lake! Love this place!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: The reviews are true. This place is the bomb. Not crowded, great ambiance, server was chill and nice. Food..... EVERYTHING was great. A must visit. Make sure to try their cinnamon honey!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: We love their brunch items (especially the biscuits) and always include the healthy flavored limeade options.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Damn this place is awesome! We're from western Colorado and found this restaurant by coincidence, what a great find. After having an incredible meal on Saturday morning, I returned with my daughter the following day and had yet another unforgettable breakfast. You will not be disappointed, no matter how much of a food snob you are. Great service and food!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: As always, the staff and food were exceptional. My husband had the Hoss and Raspberry Limeaid and I went with my favorite, the St. Francis with a honeydew cucumber limeaid. They forgot the avocado on my toast but it was still superb.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Nothing to complain about. Buttery biscuits, the mushroom gravy was magical to me, and the limeades were great and very refreshing to wash down breakfast! As a LA foodie in Utah, we did a lot of searching before picking where to go eat and absolutely no regrets for this place. Food was wonderful. Thanks!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Visited SLC in December 2020 and stopped by Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade. Went on a Saturday morning, and there was about a 30 minute wait to be seated. They have limited indoor and outdoor seating (tables are spread out, so it's COVID safe). I like how they will text you when it is your turn to be seated, so you don't have to stay in the area. We actually ventured to the bar, Big Willy's, down the street while we waited.Thanks to the recommendation of my fellow yelpers, I ordered a mint limeade and the Hoss. It was delicious! The Hoss was a meal in itself- large portion, full of flavor and delicious! I ordered potatoes on the side, but wish I didn't because then I couldn't finish the Hoss. The Mint Limeade was delicious too, not too sweet, and they even let me take one to go!We sat outside, and there were fires to keep us warm. Staff is attentive and wearing masks. Clean bathrooms too!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: In town for a short period of time and had to visit after reading reviews. They were able to get us a table much quicker than anticipated, and the food was some of the best of the trip. Definitely get the mint limeade!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Visited the place at 7 in the morning on a Thursday on a trip in December. The place had a high rating and it didn't disappoint. The staff was friendly and the service was quick. Enjoyed the Hoss and a vegetarian option. Easy to recommend for nice and heavy breakfast for a perfect road trip day

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Ode to Sweet Lake Biscuits: Your round, voluptuous buttery soft biscuits I want to marry, looking all fine dressed in homemade raspberry jam and drizzled with honey. Your jalapeño cheesy biscuit bites everyone wants to party with, and your drink concoctions get the normal plane Jane to kick off her flats. Thank you, from the bottom of my stomach, you are a true gem in Utah amongst a bunch of cheap corporate chains.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Delicious biscuits and unique limeade. This is a great breakfast spot - cute shop, feel, and decor with friendly staff and really fresh, delicious food. We got the hass sandwich and the eggs benedict. Both were really tasty.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Absolutely delicious. We got the Hoss and San Antone and both were amazing. Hoss was one of the most delicious things I've ever had and is what I would order going back. The San Antone was also amazing--had quite a kick to it so my nose was running. The limeade salsa was so delish. Staff was very accommodating and efficient. Overall we had an amazing experience!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Great food and service. Unique items you don't find regularly. Definitely coming back

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: This place was awesome!! The biscuits were amazing. Super filling. This is not a place for a snack. The limeade was good too.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: We went for breakfast. It wasn't too busy but it was a Wednesday at 9am. They were very friendly! Our waitress was super helpful and awesome!I got the Hoss, which was amazing! The chicken was good and I loved the gravy!  I would get it again. My wife got the bread pudding French toast. It was super sweet but good. We would both just rather go with the Hoss next time. We got the strawberry orange lemonade. I thought it was alright but my wife loved it. In my opinion, it wasn't worth it. Overall, we really loved it and will be coming back soon!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: Such good food it is a bit limited but very tasty. I got something simple. Two scrambled eggs bacon very tasty. The biscuit was delicious and so was the orange juice. Definitely recommend

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I called ahead of time to see if they would accept reservations on Sunday and they did not. Once I arrived there was no line. Everything was socially distanced, indoor and outdoor. They had fire pits and heaters outside. I came with a party of 7 and we asked to sit inside. We thought there would have been a wait because no tables were available in the front room but she was kind enough to check the back room and found a table to accommodate us. She was very cheerful and friendly.Tessie Mae was our waitress. She was awesome! She made recommendations from the get-go. I had the orange raspberry limeade per her recommendation and I loved how refreshing it was. It was not too sugary either. It was the perfect balance! I ordered the T Rose plate (vegetarian). It tasted so fresh as well! I loved that it was filling but didn't sit heavy. I think the only thing I wish it had was a bit more flavor to the sauce. The sauce really makes the biscuit and I felt it fell a little flat. But everything all together was still good! I will definitely come back to try more of their dishes!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: 2 stars for the flavor of the limeade. $6 for limeade seems extra to me. Biscuits were dry, gravy tasted a little off. It's a cute trendy place but definitely overhyped.

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: I absolutely love this restaurant. Although there is typically a wait to get in if you come right as they open during the week you can usually get in pretty easily. At any other time of day though you're almost guaranteed a wait that is well worth it. Beginning with the biscuits, they are mouthwateringly tasty, fluffy, and crispy all in one. Paired with the house jam + butter they are bound to brighten your day. I ordered the biscuit bread pudding french toast with a side of eggs and bacon and a hot chocolate to drink. The bread pudding was very dense and flavor-packed. I appreciated the almonds on top and the side of yogurt to dip it in. The yogurt really added another keynote of flavor to the plate. The eggs and bacon were typical of a diner and the hot chocolate was decent. Would have appreciated the hot chocolate having been made with milk/cream rather than with water, but I did enjoy the quantity of whipped cream on it. Definitely, a place you have to stop by at!

name: Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade
content: The nachos were so good, such a new take on the traditional nachos I'm use to in San Diego

name: Chile-Tepin
content: You want the best Mexican street food in Utah? Go to Chungas and get some pastor. You want the best restaurant-style Mexican? Go to Chile tepin. I've introduced so many people to this place that I should never have to be put on wait on a Friday night, yet I will still wait cause I love it that much. A lot of people and tourists hear of other local place pushed on them by their concierge or Uber driver that is in a sketchy part of town that does have an amazing mole at an overpriced menu and daunting wait time (I think you know what I'm hinting at). But this is the definitive best Mexican food in Salt Lake City. If you are with two large men, or 3 regular sized humans, you can split a parrillada, a shared fajita-type meal for us gringos, and it is only $25. Yeah, feed 3 for $25. You are gonna get asada, chicken, shrimp, rice, beans, quesadillas, it's amazing. I will go and get the parrillada for myself and just eat it throughout the week. That's meThe wife is obsessed with the cheese enchiladas with green sauce. The first time I took her here she straight up said, "THESE ARE THE BEST ENCHILADAS IVE EVER HAD" and her mom is from Mexico. Then we brought her, my mother-in-law, and she was 100% in. And she's the type of woman who is always judging places like, "yeah it's good, but I can do better". So her approval is huge. Eat here, not the other "best Mexican food", just not when I go here, cause I don't want it to become too popular so I then I have to wait

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Big portions and it was all tasty. We got the Paradilla. Says 2 people can share but probably could feed 3-4. Fast and friendly service.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This is out spot for good Mexican food. We love to go an share the molcajete! Comes with shrimp, steak, and chicken. The environment is nice and the service has always been fine when we go.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: We got food poisoning from this restaurant.  They claimed it could not have been them.  We love the food but... not sure we can ever go again.Here's why:1.  I don't trust they will look further into the issue and fix it, and I never ever ever want to spend another night throwing up, unable to sleep, and with incredible stomach pain and then have to miss 2 days of work due to fatigue, an inability to eat without pain, and dehydration.2.   Our bill was $35. They would not refund it or grant a gift card. The best that Carlos could do was refund half of my husbands meal. It's my boyfriend... but anyway...3.  The service there seems exhausted like they are worked beyond their own mental or physical health allows.  This is still a pandemic, and... your workers shouldn't be exhausted, and your restaurant shouldn't be that constantly crowded, definitely zero covid restrictions besides wear your mask for two seconds.4.  They are closed on Sundays... and that's lame.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: If you're looking for a nice Mexican restaurant in Salt Lake, you can't go wrong with Chile-Tepin! I go here for lunch all the time and it NEVER misses. It always good food and the staff is always friendly! Can be difficult to find a table on weekend nights but that's just because of how good it is. The Molcajete is one of my favorite dishes in the City, but I'd recommend sharing it!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This restaurant is spot on for a decent Mexican experience. Reasonably priced for downtown with great fajitas. The Carne Asada was good (not great) but was what I expected. Many options for kids: quesadillas, burritos, tacos, etc. Fast and responsive service.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Really delicious molcajete. My husband and I were really impressed. Even the beans that come on the side had fantastic flavor! Will be coming back despite it being quite chilly inside.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Chile Tepin has been consistently good the handful of times I've been. Tonight I started w/a classic margarita on the rocks. The strength was excellent. My go-to dinner is the molcajete, because I love that delicious green sauce it comes served in along with nopales, but I switched it up and ordered the parillada, which has basically the same things (shrimp, steak, chicken) minus the nopales and that green sauce. However, it does come with some quesadillas, yummy, spicy salsa, guac, cream, pico, rice and beans, a jalapeño, grilled onion, queso fresco... basically, I'm full and still looking forward to leftovers for lunch mañana. My photo did not do justice, but I was eager to dive in.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place is fantastic. Dine in is so popular, had to opt to get takeout or else wait 1 hour. Take out was prepared quickly. The packaging is great and the food is clean, tasty and prepared perfectly.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Worth the wait. We went here for a birthday dinner with a group of 7 and the wait was 1.5 hours in the later evening on a Saturday night. We fully expected to wait and the the food did NOT disappoint.  You have to get the Parillada. It honestly could feed 3 people. It had everything you needed for an amazing dinner, plus the margaritas were also delicious!! I can't wait to come back here.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Front desk service sucked! But our waiter Tina made up for it she was super nice!! We have been to top notch restaurants and no service matched up to hers!! The food was good the Camarones a la diabla we're pretty delicious!! But over all I'm writing this review totally based on Tinas service I would come back just based on how nice she's treated us:)

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place came highly recommended and they did not disappoint. I normally don't venture out on dishes I've never had before, but I ended up trying one of their entrees off of a whim and am SO glad that I did. Delicious place and I will definitely be back in the future. They were also very friendly and despite not being seated until later in the evening, they didn't rush us or make us feel pressured. They also kept it clean and I felt completely safe dining in here.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Went here for Valentine's Day- it was super busy but they were awesome about putting as many tables as they could fit & despite being busy service was great! As a former server I would've  understood but they were on top of it! I clumsily spilt my water on the table/myself & winning 2 SECONDS (literally) a sweet lady (busser) was cleaning me & the table up! She must have been watching me knowing I look like a spiller   parking can be hard there so we took an Uber. Meal was excellent! I wouldn't say there chops & salsa are th best ever but they're decent. Def my fave Mexican place in slc.I wouldn't reccomend the queso "dip". We got it with chorizo. It's not really a dip... imagine dipping a chip into a bunch of shredded cheese you microwaved.. it's just really stringy & kinda hard? I prefer a more liquid queso. & you feel like you just ate a weeks worth of cheese in a few bites lol

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Chile-Tepin definitely isn't fully authentic, but it's not fully Americanized either. It's on the spectrum- some places can't pull it off, but I think that CT does it a lot better than most.You could get something familiar, but I'd encourage you to branch out...just don't get the mole here haha. Or if you already did, don't assume that all moles are like this. Mine was very underwhelming and bitter (more than your avg mole) and the horchata and flan that I chased it down with didn't have many redeeming qualities either. Mole shouldn't be just another dish it should be the bright and shining star of the show!INSTEAD...get the freaking PARRILLADA with frijoles charros. This dish single-handedly gets all the stars. I lived in northern Mexico for a couple of years and I cannot tell you how badly I miss a good northern style carne asada and everything that entails...chiles toreados (preferrably cerranos), tortillas, cebollita, etc. This brings back memories. There are few things in this world as pure and perfect as a real carne asada and they managed to pull it off pretty well! It would be even better if it was al carbon :') I would literally weep.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Amazing! Not your usual Mexican place! Unique flavors and friendly staff. We had the Parrillada and friends had the Molcajete. Been back several times for the Parrillada and everything else we've had is exquisite. Everyone we have told to go try it has thanked us. All we can do is pass the thanks on to the chefs. Don't pass it up!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: The Parrillada for 2 is a MUST!! So much food & soooo good!! The chips & salsa are Amazing! We got the queso on the side & it definitely was just stringy cheese but it was delicious! You can find me here every weekend. We did feel rushed to get out. Immediately after receiving our food our waitress brought our checks & was constantly trying to clean up our plates.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Amazing! Don't go on a jazz game night or it is packed.  Get the shared meals! It's an amazing deal for 2-3 people. Also the shrimp filled peppers is by far the best app!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Chile Tepin is my all time favorite Mexican restaurant. My husband and I always share their Parillada and it never disappoints. I keep wanting to try the Molcajete or something else but I love the Parillada too much to stray. The chicken, shrimp, and steak are cooked and seasoned to perfection, and we are always stuffed after. It is so well priced sometimes I even feel guilty... haha I've never had a bad experience with customer service. Bonus: free chips and salsa to start the meal that are

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place is ridiculous. So overly crowded shoulder to shoulder during covid for average food. Told us the wait would be an hour and once we waited an hour he told me it was gonna be another hour. Not worth whatever hype someone gave them

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Chile-Tepin is one of our favorite go-to restaurants in SLC. It's such a great atmosphere, with windows facing out to the street below. The staff of quick, friendly and always top notch. Their menu items are thoughtfully created and the plate presentation is always so appealing. One of our favorite appetizers is the Rajas Queso Fundido. It's a large helping of melted jack cheese and poblano peepers, served piping hot in a cast iron pan with a side of tortillas. Really great start. My wife and I both went with combo plates, because we love having left overs for the lunch the next day. Their Res Molida has exceptional flavor and goes well in their enchiladas and tacos. The Chile Relleno is fantastic. Truly, everything of great. I would recommend you give this wonderful establishment a try. You will be happy you did.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Where do 4 foodies, who haven't been outside much, go out to eat together, in downtown SLC? Chile-Tepin ( @chiletepin ), of course! It was worth standing out in the snow, to be able to go inside and enjoy some of their amazing warm dishes! We got their famous #chorizofundido #chilerelleno #tacosalad #burrito and #quesidilla ! It's a great place for fun and festivities! I'm grateful for a new year, with these dear foodie (and real life) friends, of mine! They make me look forward to leaving my house and acting like a human again! ***If you are wanting and covid distancing, this is NOT the place for you!!! We we pretty much touching elbows, with the people on either side of our table! (It kinda felt like being in NYC! lol) This was the later DINNER RUSH though (but, it's pretty much always that busy) and it just goes to show how DELICIOUS their food was! Wish I didn't forget my damn taco salad leftovers, because it was sooooo good y'all!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: My favorite Mexican restaurant downtown Salt Lake City. Friendly service and delicious food. The parrillada and the Molcahete are a must try. Excellent quality and good price. Definitely recommend this place for families and groups. A+++++

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Really not anything good to say about our experience here.  Started with the host telling us that the wait would 25-35 minutes and then it took 60 minutes.   After that the service was poor,  obviously not enough servers working,  our server would only sprint by the table with a cursory check to see if we needed anything.  To top it all off when my food came, I ordered fajitas it was Luke warm, at best,  and it took an extra 5 minutes to get the tortillas.   The meal was quite expensive as well.   I will not go here again

name: Chile-Tepin
content: I have a gluten allergy, and their menu does not list which items are gluten free. So, I called to ask, and the guy responded with, "Honestly, I don't know". This was their final answer. Very disappointing service.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Really great Mexican food! Far better than the incredibly overrated Red Iguana. If you're wanting a large variety of incredibly flavorful, good food, then get the parrillada! I still have dreams of it.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Since the pandemic started Chile Tepin has been our go-to for delivery. They have a really user friendly ordering feature directly on their website with no minimum order. Also they don't outsource their delivery so you know that 100% of your money goes straight to the business which is so important in these tough times. In addition to their seamless online ordering experience, they do a great job of packaging their food really well. We almost always order the parillada, which was our favorite pre-pandemic as well. They package it up in a sturdy aluminum pan instead of flimsy styrofoam that melts when in contact with hot food. All of these little features make the delivery experience top notch! I can't recommend them enough!There have been a couple of occasions where they get overwhelmed with orders and have either delivered late or the food didn't meet the usual quality standards. This happened to us on Cinco De Mayo for example but they are so gracious when they can't meet the usual standard that I still highly recommend them.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place is amazing! Really good service, really good food, and super clean restaurant!! 10/10 recommend, the guacamole is delicious.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This was our first meal in Salt Lake City after we moved here, and WOW!!  This was amazing!  We got food to go (covid) and verrry hungry when we picked it up.  We got the Parrillada and every bite was better than the next.  Everything was cooked perfectly, seasoned perfectly, and SO delicious.  It was definitely enough food for two plus leftovers we enjoyed later.  I can't wait to make a repeat visit here.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: don't bother showing up on a saturday night. you'll get salsa spilled all over you by a waiter that won't help you clean up the mess or offer any napkins and you'll be waiting an hour and a half to order a meal only for it to arrive 15 minutes after close, cold and incorrect. overall you will waste 3 hours or so here while your waiter hides in the back and half of your party will leave before ordering due to how disappointing the service is. DO BETTER. what an absolute embarrassing establishment.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: We've been here about a dozen times in the past three years and Chile Tepin is remarkable both for their delicious and authentic food and their consistency.  Everything from service to flavors has been spot in every time.My wife and I have settled in on the parrillada and molcajetes as our go tos just because they are so hard to replicate with high quality.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Came in from out of town. Recommended by residents. From the hostess stand, in between people, to the setver no one was friendly or helpful at all. Chips and salsa was tasteless and the bowl of chips for a party of 4 could easily been for a party of one. The carnitas were COLD and Extremely Dry. The margaritas I'm confused. Any alcohol at all?  We will never go back nor will we recommend it.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Shut up and get the flan. Best flan I've had! Food was great, flan was next level. Friendly service. Clean restaurant.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Chile-tepin, in Sonora chiltepin is a small pepper that grows wild in the Sonoran desert that is very picante

name: Chile-Tepin
content: My newest obsession! I tried Chile-Tepin on a whim and it's the best Mexican food I've had in awhile. So worth the visit! The complimentary chips and salsa are a plus. I ordered the fajitas de pollo meal and it was perfection. Our waitress was super sweet and made sure our waters were always full. I would give Chile-Tepin 6 stars if I could!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Chile Tepin is our go to for Parrillada and Mocajete. Both include plenty of food for two at quite a reasonable price and are great to go. Their toritos and queso fundido with chorizo are also favorites of ours.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: We love this place! We got palomas and steak fajitas. Sooo good! The staff was so sweet. Please support if you can.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: it's good I like the guacamole. But my parents have one complaint. It's that's the foods to big. But it's more of a joke, I like this restaurant but sometimes my parents enjoy it to much, but that's ok I like this restaurant.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Pretty decent Mexican food. Based of the quality of the Mexican food, I would give it three stars. The carne asada was a little tough. But four stars for the price to food ratio. Specifically when talking about the nachos. They are so good for the price. Two servings of nachos fed me and my two roommates for four days. And they are pretty good leftover as well.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: A favorite of mine:). Prices are very reasonable and everything has a fresh spin on it.  Great Mexican but I feel less guilty, well a little:). I strongly suggest giving them a try.  I like to go on off hours around lunch time when it's a little less busy:)

name: Chile-Tepin
content: We ordered takeout because of concerns about covid.  The order was supposed to be ready at 4:45 but it was not and I was told to wait in a crowded waiting area.  The guy at the desk simply told me the order was not ready.  It was only after I had been waiting 30 minutes and started escalating my expressions of concern that they started paying attention to me and actually checked on my order.  I had ordered takeout because of concern about covid, but the 45 minute wait in the crowded waiting area exposed me more than eating in the restaurant would have.   The food, when it finally came, was great but my advice is not to order takeout---they don't have a good system for keeping track of orders and don't have a safe place for you to wait.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: I love Mexican and being 33 min from Salt Lake I will drive anytime I want good Mexican Food. The best I have found and as a Mexican/Margarita connoisseur this is the best place

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place is amazing and I'm kicking myself for not trying this place sooner!! We've already gone back twice and it's been just as good both times. We've gotten the parradilla with half corn/half flour tortillas both times because it's SO good and is a great deal (~$25 and feeds two with leftovers). It comes with steak, chicken, and shrimp and it all tastes AMAZING. It's so moist and flavorful. It also comes with guacamole, pick, quesadillas, rice, and beans which I love. All of the flavors here are seriously so so good and you definitely get your money's worth! I will say when we've gone for dinner on the weekend, it's been really crowded even with covid.
