The tables are somewhat distanced and they do keep things very clean and wiped down but it is pretty busy. The wait for us was around 20 mins. Overall, SO yummy and we'll definitely be back!!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Best Mexican food I've had in a while.. my boyfriend and I shared the parrillada it was so good! They even have hand made tortillas. The service was good.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: So delicious, the waitress, Claudia, was so sweet and kind and helpful. I loved everything I ordered. The chips and salsa kept coming and the refills were great too. The setting was perfect. I have absolutely no complaints

name: Chile-Tepin
content: DO NOT come here during COVID-19. They don't take the correct safety precautions during this pandemic. I went here two weeks ago. And there's customers walking around or leaving without a mask on. They walk right next to other tables without having any care for others at all. And the staff there, doesn't do anything about it, they carry on with whatever they're doing. Its their job to make sure everyone is following the rule of wearing a mask to protect the safety of others, but it seems like they could care less. Also my server was cleaning up the plates on my table, and before she came to my table, she was cleaning someone else's table. And when it was our turn, SHE PUT THE OTHER CUSTOMERS CUPS ON OUR TABLE, and then took our plates and stuff. Like if you can't take everything at once, take what you already have first and then come back to take ours. This is just totally wrong especially during COVID. I'm so mad about these two  things, even after covid ends, I'm never coming here again. I'm sticking with Red Iguana.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: The most amazing food and service!  Staff is so friendly and quick. Food is delicious.  The molcajete might be my favorite meal of all time.  Always get the nachos con todo to share. We've never left disappointed.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This is one of my favorite Megan places! Service was quick even thought they were busy and we didn't have a reservation. I loved the in dining experience and their virtual menus were very cool!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Chile-Tepin is on point! I love it because sometimes your craving Mexican food but you also want a good sit down experience. If this is the mood, Chili-Tepin is the move. Their food is top notch quality, their staff is kind and they make Mexican a foodie friendly experience. I have had the nachos which are incredible. The fajitas are good as are the burritos. I really have no complaints! Make sure to go early or plan to wait because there is always a line and they don't take reservations. The location is fun! Right next to Gateway.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This is my favorite restaurant in SLC. The food is always consistent and the owner Carlos always takes the time to say hi and check in on the quality of food and experience. When people ask for recommendations this is my go-to.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: So amazing! The food is delicious, the service is fantastic, and the owner is so nice. Will definitely be coming back.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: WOW. They should be charging more. Authentic, AMAZING food and drinks with very kind staff.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Delicious food! One of my favorite places in SLC. I think it is even better than the famous red iguana. Great prices good. You can't go wrong with the nachos!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Food was great but now they are charging extra for things that they never charged for and gave complimentary. I was just charged $5.00 for a SMALL ramekin of the hot salsa which I have asked for and never been charged for almost every time I have eaten here over the past 3 years. The one star is for being cheap, greedy and not informing customers that you are charging them for what used to be a complimentary request. Shame on you.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Despite COVID, this restaurant is still full of customers! However, even at the busiest time of day, with tons of people outside, my partner and I only had to wait 15 minutes. I did not like the mango margarita, but their other margaritas were delicious. Our server was from Venezuela, so she had a hard time understanding us when we ordered, but she was extremely nice. It helped to for me to try to speak spanish, which is always fun for me anyways! The molcajete was INCREDIBLE. I had never had it before, as I always opt for more American style dishes, which clearly has been a mistake because the molcajete was so good. As was the queso fondido with chorizo. I would go back here any day. They do a great job.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place was super good!! They had the best mixed place of parillada and it was perfect to share. I will be back for sure!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Delicious carne Asada fajitas, $5 glasses of wine were nice as well! Definitely worth the trip and staff was very friendly.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Before covid we use to come here all the time. Decided to eat here last night for our anniversary since it's literally one of our favorite restaurants. This time though my carne asada tacos were disgusting. It's as if they'd been sitting out for a while. The tortilla were completely soggy and the meat tasted old and like canola oil. The service was still great and my husbands meal was very good but mine was not good at all. Maybe avoid ordering the tacos.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: The best Mexican food you'll find in Utah! The carnitas are so authentic and tender! The poblano is also great! They usually have long wait times during peak hours, but if you go after 8:00 you can usually get right in.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Literally the best Mexican food in Utah. I moved here from the border a few years ago and hadn't found anything I loved (do not get me started on red iguana). But this place is so yummy and authentic. It is my new favorite restaurant in Utah!! Do yourself a favor and get down there fast!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. The food is great and the portion sizes are plentiful. The prices are really low considering the quality of food. The only negative would be how loud it is. Maybe we caught them on a busy night but I could barely hear what my wife was saying even though she was sitting right next to me. Overall a great experience and will definitely be coming back.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: GO HERE!! We need this place to stay open, so I encourage you to visit ASAP! Dine in is open at 50% capacity, and they are doing all the sanitizing things to keep everyone safe. Their food is amazing, and Carlos the owner is like an old friend to everything. Love this place!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Likely CoVid- related but my party of 3 was seated, served, billed and dismissed in less than an hour. Meal was served as we were dishing out our appetizer that had just arrived, boxes and bill came while we were eating dinner and still on our first margarita! Food was good, staff was great but being rushed out the door...  coulda sat and enjoyed drive-through more than this.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place has some of the best Mexican food downtown has to offer! 10/10 They're super fast and super friendly! Try the enchiladas and a daiquiri!!!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Ordered take out and it was ready in just 10 minutes. Take out cake with chips and salsa which was a welcome bonus. Food itself was like any other mexican restaurant, but solid nonetheless. They were very friendly in the restaurant and seemed to keep the place pretty sanitary. No outdoor sitting or else we would have eaten there.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: We shared the Parrillada plate that's made for two people. The price was $24 for two which is a steal. I cannot say enough good things about it! The food was incredible and I was obsessed with the beans. Will be going back regularly!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Had the carnitas, the flavors were delicious but the pork was a bit dry. Also had a peach margarita, nothing special but their salsas were also delicious. Will give it a second chance to try the diablo shrimp!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Best Mexican food in Utah. Staff is friendly and food is great! I always order the combo or carne asada. Only downside is that service can sometimes be slow

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Who would've thought that would be great Mexican food in Salt Lake City Utah? But alas here is a well deserved five star review. We parked on the street and the place wasn't very crowded on a Friday late afternoon We split the Parrillada plate which includes grilled Asada, Shrimp and Chicken, along with tortillas, beans, rice, guacamole and sour cream. It was more than enough food for 2-3 peepsAlso tried the quest fundido- very niceI highly recommend this place if you're craving Mexican food in Salt Lake City

name: Chile-Tepin
content: There's not many spots in Utah that offer good Mexican food but Chile-tepin definitely does !!!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: A good and quiet place to meet casually or for business, the food is consistently good.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place was amazing! The food was delicious, the service was exceptional. Our server Veronica was very nice and polite. It was our first time here and wasn't sure what to order, she steered us in the paradilla? Plate.... it was bomb! Everything we had was all delicious. The prices are very reasonable and fairly priced as well. We will definitely come back here again and try there other items on the menu. From the pictures we cleaned our plates! Delicious!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: love this place. authentic, yummy food. it's basically always packed, so we haven't always had the best service ever. sometimes a bit slow. otherwise i wouldn't hesitate to give 5 stars.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: One of my favorite restaurants in Salt Lake. The service is great and the owner Carlos is so friendly. I love the shredded chicken and it is great in any of the dishes. The salads are great for lunch and everything is well priced. You will also be obsessed with the chips and salsa.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: What more can I say -  Simply a great meal - my enchiladas were outstanding .  I love the hip vibe the old building brings to a great restaurant. -  They get busy...cuz they are good.    Fun atmosphere, great food,  good Margarita's -  we will go back for sure.   Great place to take out of town visitors - to show them how cool SLC can be

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Some of the best Mexican food I've ever eaten. My fav Mexican restaurant in SLC by far. Try their enchiladas!! If you order a margarita, be prepared to order another because they are so good! Their desserts are amazing as well if you can save room. For whatever reason, their refried beans are the best refried beans I've ever had. I come here all the time because it's just that good.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Sometimes when you go to a fancy ethnic place the food actually loses some of its authenticity. This place however, was authentic and delicious!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: The queso fundito with chorizo here is probably one of my favorite things to order ever, from anywhere.  I absolutely cannot go there without getting it.  It's that good.  That being said, I have not had any other dishes there that I have disliked.  I love how many options you have for their combination dish.  Tacos, enchiladas, tostadas, chimichangas, you name it.  My only negative and reason for the lost star is that the interior is not much for atmosphere, and I have been there on a few occasions when there is an event at Vivint Arena and they are just not staffed appropriately.  On one occasion our group waited over 45 minutes just to have our order taken.  Hopefully management can watch event schedules in the future to predict when they are going to be really busy and increase wait and kitchen staff.  That would make them 5 star worthy.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: I loved the food,  so amazing and delicious. The. Camarones a la Diabla is something straight from Mexico. The nachos were bomb, and the burrito my bf got was delicious. I am giving 3 stars because we went to pick up takeout and the waiting room was PACKED with people. No social distancing. Restaurants should only let so many people in to wait at a time, I get that it's difficult,, but we had to walk through this small waiting room full of people not wearing masks to get our food and we were very concerned about that. Have people wait outside or in their car and text them when their table is close to being ready, or something?I also received a sad churro cheesecake, not really worth the price. It was good but I didn't feel it tasted very churro-y? I will be back for your food, but want to show my concern.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: It was delicious!! I was very surprised because I didn't think SLC would have great Mexican food, but I was surprised by their food! My friend and I split the Molcajete and were satisfied!! Javier was a great server as well!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: I don't know what happened and yes I get that this crazy pandemic has changed so much for a lot of us. However, while I previously touted this as one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in downtown SLC, (and that being a native of Denver/LA) I can't go back for dine in until things get back to normal. We came cinco de Mayo, I stood in line for almost an hr to get in while there were plenty of open tables. (Not including those left for social distancing) First, house salsa was not the same. Not sure but I think it was store bought. Chips were slightly burnt. Margaritas were poorly mixed. Either too sugary or too watery. It took forever to see our server again to order food. By the time it did come, it was a huge disappointment. No house dressing. It was plated sloppy. It actually tasted sad. And this is the same salad I've always ordered before and LOVED. No nuts, or avocado. My boyfriend got a smothered burrito with mole that tasted cheap and over salted. Meanwhile another poor couple that sat and ordered before us didn't even receive their plates by the time we were leaving. On top of this, my boyfriend threw up his dinner outside the apartment before we even made it home. Totally disappointing and lackluster.I'm leaving 3 stars for the fact that this place has previously provided amazing food and service. I sure hope they get back to that. Otherwise, let your servers collect unemployment and just do curbside takeout so the quality of your reputation isn't hurt. It's not normal for two dishes and a couple drinks to take over 3 hours. If that's the new normal, I don't want it.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: I've come here numerous times and have never had a bad experience, until now. I'm writing this with a grain of salt given the difficulties of running a restaurant during this time, with the hopes things improve to how they were. We came for dine in service on Cinco De Mayo a few days after the lockdown was downgraded, and while the weird vibe was understandable, the regression in food and service quality can't be ignored. The taco salad definitely had Sysco brand ranch as opposed to the house made dressing we remember and came often for. The food in general just tasted like something made by people who didn't want to be there. I will try and come back once things return to some degree of normalcy, and hopefully come back to the same Chili Tepin that we're used to.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Guys. Get here ASAP. We went for the first time on Saturday and had a wonderful experience.We were seated right away (thanks 'rona), with plenty of space between tables. Everything was clean, and servers were masked. I love how well-lit the space is inside. Silvia was our server, and she was awesome. She was available when we needed her but didn't hover. She made the perfect recommendation of the Parrillada for us to share, and everything on it was SO GOOD. Chicken, shrimp, and steak, plus quesadillas, soup (not my favorite), and extra tortillas. The guacamole was amazing. The chips were just OK--nothing special, but no complaints. The chicken and shrimp had such good texture and flavor; I'm not big on steak, but my boyfriend liked it, so I guess that's good! We will DEFINITELY be back. I want to try their burritos and chimichangas. And I hope we get Silvia again.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Tried Chile-Tepin last night, so delicious. Love the downtown atmosphere,  love the food, service was great.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: LOVE CHILE-TEPIN!! A couple days ago my wife and I ordered not realizing how busy they would be on that particular evening (cinco de mayo). They didn't realize how busy they would be either. They had also just reopened dine in service so understandably they were getting back into the groove. Our order got delayed and then we decided to cancel the order. We weren't mad-understanding completely how it can be during this pandemic. Restaurants are doing their best, under staffed and just trying to feed the public. The manager was in contact with us the whole time and offered to give us our order for free the following day. The owner of Chile-Tepin delivered our food to our door himself, apologizing for the problems with our order the night before. Everything tasted great as usual! That is true customer service, and even with our order being on the house the quality was still top notch! The parillada is boooomb!!!!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: The only word for this place is "perfection". In the restaurant? Delicious food, fantastic service, and amazing (and cheap!) margaritas. Pick up? Same delicious food, same smiling and friendly service, but sadly, we can't take margaritas to go. That's okay, because the food more than makes up for it. Their Molcajetes and carne asada enchiladas are my favorites, although i'm pretty sure everything on their menu is equally as tasty. Also, the fact that they are still sending you home with their chips and salsa when ordering to go was the most welcome surprise.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: By far the worst service I've ever experienced. Not only did we not get our food, they waiting hours to tell us our order wasn't in. The website says no refunds so we waiting hoping our food would come. We tried speaking to an employee but all they said was they'd be right with us. We ordered around 6pm and left at 9pm without food and a pending refund. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND! The food is not worth the horrible service!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Reviews are good. My friends said this place is excellent. I was so excited to eat here. What a disappointment on many levels. First. It was Cinco De Mayo, so I expected the wait to be long. Which was completely fine. Waited 20 min outside. The lady came out and called my name, even when I had a buzzer. Was confused. She said she could seat us, but it's another long wait, because they had accepted 50 online orders. Well okay then. That's fine. Sat down. Was seated in the back. There are carboard boxes left out. Reminded me of a storage area. Drinks were okay. Ordered a few shots of Patron and the mango tango. The mango tango was good. The tequila shots were served in shot glasses that look really old and dirty. They were hardly dressed, and with a few salt rocks, and a dry lime.  Chips & salsa were terrible. Broken pieces of chips served in a basket with a small dish of salsa. Appetizer was good! Toritos yellow peppers stuffed with jack cheese and shrimp. I won't be coming back, so this was the best thing. Waited and waited and waited for our dinner. It appeared they completely forgot about us. We had to ask for drink refills. Well actually get up and find someone. Or tap on the waitresses shoulder at a table next to us. Everyone who arrived after us had already eaten at this point. Asked where our food was. Then finally brought it to us. Got the chicken and cheese enchilada smothered with mole sauce. I got both the poblano and verde mole. Both were runny. Not really flavorful. My friend got the chimichanga. It could have been a frozen one microwaved. That's exactly what it tasted like. The kicker.....The lady from  Chanel 5 news happen to be sitting across from us. She was treated like royalty. Drinks brought out before she could even ask. Her appetizer was served in 20 seconds. Constant waiters and waitresses at her table ready to provide the best customer service, while we sat across from her and was completely forgotten about. And our bill was probably four times the amount hers was. Terrible customer service. Terrible food. Terrible experience.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This was my second visit to this restaurant for pickup. I ended up waiting at the restaurant 3 hours for my food. When I finally received my food It was cold and items were missing. Also, because management failed to have a plan on handling the volume during a pandemic I believe they put their customers and staff at risk. People were shoulder to shoulder in their waiting area, unacceptable.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This place is a scam. It's mediocre Mexican food dressed up in a trendy brick building and fancy tables to trick you into thinking the food is actually better than anything you could buy in Rose Park. I'm also a little bitter that on Cinco de Mayo I came in to pick up a carry-out order and waited 1.5 hours after they said it would be ready.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: I hate to write a negative review of a restaurant during a trying time but this establishment absolutely does not have their business organized. I wasn't aware they were doing dine-in (otherwise i would not have supported this restaurant) i ordered take out online and received only one update of food being delayed 20 minutes (totally fine) but 90 minutes later and front desk staff still not aware of our order is a real big problem. Please do not try to be open for take out or dine-in if you haven't figured out how to do it. Now people are unnecessarily waiting in your lobby.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Food review: the food is overrated. I mean, it's fine, but definitely middle of the pack in terms of Mexican food goes.Service review: I ordered take out on Cinco de Mayo so I knew the wait would be long. The person taking my order told me 45 minutes. Fine. I proceeded to show up 45 minutes later only to wait ANOTHER 1.5 HOURS for my food. If you are someone who hates hangrily waiting for their food, don't go here.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: We've ordered delivery a couple of times directly from their website (more options) during the pandemic and to our surprise, the food arrives hot and the chimichangas were still crispy!  Nice job Chile-Tepin!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: First of all I would like to apologize to the person who got my order. I hope you enjoyed it. Either that or these guys got every item messed up that I ordered.   I don't know which one it was, but after today I won't be going back.  Fajitas were bland and 50% of the meets were not what I ordered.   Side salad was messed up and not the one I asked for.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: All I have to say is...WOW!!This place is one of the most incredible places I have ever been to! This place is undeserving of 5 stars and needs at least TEN! The delivery by Emy was spot on. It was extremely easy, she was kind and she even was protected from spreading sickness by wearing a mask and handing me the food through the window. But it doesn't even stop there people...The food is some of the best food I have had in a while & the best Mexican food I have ever had in my entire life! It is flavorful yet so yummy! You get an amazing amount of food for what you pay for; I got 4 tacos, an enchilada meal and chips & salsa all for under $20. Once the dining area opens back up this would be a fantastic place to check out! I am still in shock with how amazing this place is!!! I am going to have to become a regular here. If you have not checked this place out yet, you have to stop by!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: Great little spot downtown but not quite in the thick of it (makes parking easy!)  Coming from California, it's still hard for me to compare and evaluate "Mexican" food (snob alert!) so I'll judge this on food alone and not in comparison.  So that's to say, service is great and love the dining experience with high ceilings and lots of seating. Enchiladas had a nice texture (not too dry) and taste.  Chips and salsa were addicting.  Portions are more than generous.  Great spot for lunch!

name: Chile-Tepin
content: This was such a great experience! It was during the craziness of covid so we just did takeout but placing an order online was easy and we went and picked it up. The food was soooo good. We had a carne Asada chimichanga smothered in Chile verde and a fajita salad. They were both EXCELLENT. There was so much flavor in both and it was all pretty much perfect. The chips and salsa were also excellent. The salsa had the perfect amount of kick.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: I've been here a few times, and never disappointed with my choice. Pretty good value, and sizes. Overall, great food, lots of good choices and lots of natural light in the dining area for lunch.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: One star purely based off customer service. Food there is good.  I called to see if they accept reservations for dinner as I had a large party of over 10. The girl who answered the phone said they can only take reservations before 4PM but if I talk to a manager they can help me.  I asked to speak with a manager, none were available, I was told to call back around 6PM that night.  I called around 6:15ish I was told the manager still was not in. I left my name and number and asked if they could please have the manager call me back. 24 hours later, no response. I decided to email the restaurant as their website had a contact us portion.  Still - no response. I called that Wednesday again, I was told there's no manager on site.  I was asked if I'd like to leave a message, I told the girl that I did earlier in the week and hadn't heard back. She said no one ever left a callback message, so I provided my information again. I was told to call back the next day if I didn't hear back.  Come Thursday, still no response from a manager, I called early afternoon to follow up. Again I was told there's no manager available or on site but that the owner would be in later that day and I could speak with them, to call back after 6.  I called around 6:30, as you can guess - no manager or owner on site. A simple call back would have been great, and at the very least the most basic form of customer service.  I find it hard to believe that an establishment like this went a whole week without some form of manager or supervisor being present.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: The building is very tall and the ceilings are high. It does give off an "extra" kind of vibe. When you walk into the establishment, there is a front desk to greet you and guide you to your table. The one restaurant looks like it is split into two different vibes. I did not have a great look on the farther half of the restaurant, but it did look a little different. We were seated in the front half. It was fairly empty when my friend, Tommy, and I arrived. We ordered quite a bit of food. We ordered a queso dip appetizer called the Queso Fundido and it came out not fully done. The cheese was not melted and it was cold. We mentioned it to our waitress and she took it back in to completely heat it for us. We ordered the Molcajetes; it comes out in a heated big black pot filled with food to the brim in a green sauce. It tasted unique. I had never ordered something like this before, so it was a good experience. We, also, ordered a combo plate that came with rice, beans, and a few other pieces. I honestly enjoyed the plate more than the Molcajetes. Other than the unique food, the service was not too up to par. The waitress was a little rude, was quick to leave our table, and forgot a couple things we had requested until we requested it again. I'm not too sure if it was because we were the youngest people in the room or if we weren't dressed "right", but the service we received seemed less than what other tables were receiving. A man- not too sure if he was the manager or another waiter -at the end came to our table with the to-go box I requested twice and chatted with us for a bit, made the overall experience a bit better.

name: Chile-Tepin
content: One of the best Mexican restaurants in Utah. No doubt. Walked right in and got seated immediately. Granted, I didn't go on a weekend or on a night where the Jazz play. Service: unbelievable. Was super super impressed with our waitress. She was helpful, gave good recommendations, was very friendly, and even a little funny. Chips and salsa were freaking awesome. Salsa was fairly spicy -- which was just the right amount of spiciness for me. Chips were solid. So - the main dish. Parrillada.  woww. I'll be coming back for that many times. My wife and I shared it. It was a big plate of chicken, steak, shrimp, quesadillas, beans, rice, guac, and sour cream. Also came with a few warm tortillas. We shared it and it was plenty of food for the two of us. My favorite was the steak. Wife's favorite was the shrimp, but it was all incredible. Can't say enough good about this meal. Will definitely be back!!

name: WildWood
content: Burrata salad was delightful. The burger was great just a little too salty. The Fried Chicken had such a nice light sauce with it. Mac n cheese was good but not super special, just would get something else next time. Loved it, the "speak-easy" are was so fun!

name: WildWood
content: Pretty solid choice. I think they recently changed the owners or something. But food was yummy. Appetizers are a must. They have good selection and variety.

name: WildWood
content: Perfect little avenues gem! Looking for delicious food, excellent wine pairings and nice dessert along with excellent service? It's here! In a place that feels cozy, like the chefs hole for a private tasting. I highly recommend the Steak Bavette!! It will melt in your mouth along with the potatoes - yum!! Looking forward to sitting outside in the courtyard.

name: WildWood
content: Good service, great food - especially the Brussel Sprouts and the portion sizes were larger than anticipated. I'll be back.

name: WildWood
content: This is my favorite restaurant in SLC, hands down. Sophisticated yet soulful, at a price you can't beat compared to some of the other high-end restaurants in the state. Glad they're still open for business!

name: WildWood
content: Probably one of the best restaurants I have been to in Utah. My fiancé and I shared the risotto appetizer and it was so good. For our main entrees I got the Waygu steak and he got the chicken hash and both were amazing!! The steak was cooked perfectly, and the mashed potato's were to die for. The chicken hash was also incredible, great flavors. However, I felt the service could have been better and it definitely took a hot minute to get our food, but definitely worth the wait. Can't wait to go back!!

name: WildWood
content: We started with the Onion Risotto and it was fantastic! It was a generous portion. We then ordered the Chicken Hash which was shredded chicken made into two patties with a rich creamy sauce. We then tried their Chicken Wings that had a kick but not an overwhelming heat. The sauce for the Chicken Wings was out of this world and had fresh bleu cheese chunks in it. We finished up with Beignets which were sprinkled with cinnamon and sugar and topped off with whipped cream and fudge.  All the entrees were generous and we did over order but are happy we have left overs for tomorrow.  The restaurant is very small and you can see them cooking your meal. We ordered a take out and everything was packaged neatly and clearly labeled.  When we tried to order from the menu they said their menu had changed and we get the impression the menu will continue to change. We are excited to see what new additions to the menu they come up with next.

name: WildWood
content: This was an interesting little find on third Avenue and we found it to be simply charming and it's food and service cozy. This is a perfect place to get out get comfortable and enjoy a small intimate setting. We gave this place a 4.5 largely because the dishes cane to the table cooler than we'd like...hot  food would have made this place a 5. We noticed that the warmer didn't appear to be on at the pick up station.

name: WildWood
content: Just went back to Wildwood. I called at 5pm on a Saturday and was able to get a reservation for 7:30, which was incredible! The Caviar pillows were a surprising appetizer. I thought I would not like them, but the caviar complimented the creamy sauce and fluffy fried pillow they came on. Presentation was beautiful. This is a very small appetizer, which is perfect to me!The Ginger Heat drink is superb, as it was last time I had it. The French fries tasted significantly better this time. Dare I say they were fantastically seasons and fluffy on the inside. They tasted freshly fried. My burger was delicious but the bottom bun quickly became way too soggy.The tuna entre was reported to be delicious and a huge portion, as was the Waygu steak. The buttermilk fried chicken was an absolutely massive portion. The person who ordered this said it was delicious, but was disappointed by the small amount of greens it came with. The service was excellent and Covid precautions are followed. Highly recommend.

name: WildWood
content: Sooooooo good. Best I've had in salt lake! Our server Matt was super friendly and fun to be around. Food came out perfect and fast! Gonna be going back whenever I can!

name: WildWood
content: Tried this place on a quiet Sunday night with my family. Each of us had a different entree (Cast Iron Bavette, Mussels and Frites, Mac 'n Cheese, Chicken Pot Pie and Chicken Paillard) and all were exceptional. The brussel sprout starter was a huge hit, as were the beignets and warm chocolate to finish the night.The service was incredible and when they say that the whole menu is great, they're not lying.Will definitely be back with family or friends.

name: WildWood
content: This quaint little restaurant nestled in a neighborhood in the avenues is a rare find. Everything just melted in your mouth. Service was on point. They spoiled me on my birthday giving me 3 desserts that were to die for.

name: WildWood
content: Easily one of the best restaurants in Salt Lake currently. Staff and restaurant is friendly and COVID conscious. It's has all three, great ambiance, fabulous food for every course, and great service. Will definitely be going back!

name: WildWood
content: We are trying to support local during these hard times. We are overlooking a lot. But this establishment broke our trust tonight. We watched our server go eat his dinner after serving us the appetizer. He licked his fingers several times while eating. He went into the kitchen to get himself some sauce with his sticky fingers. Then he came to ask us what we needed. Sir, with those spit fingers we will take the check. If you're concerned about Covid, I wouldn't go here. Really upset that they failed so bad tonight. Come one, stop the spread!

name: WildWood
content: This place was an absolute delight. Starting with the service all the way to dessert. Everything was perfect and I mean that sincerely. I had never visited the location as WildWood or Aves Bistro. But I saw the menu while searching for new restaurants and had to see what it was about. It's getting difficult to find a creative eatery in Utah and this place hits all of the marks of incredible food while also aiming to serve things outside of the box. I don't know how to describe the satisfaction. The quality was on par with any establishment that you'd experience in a culinary destination like a Los Angeles, or NY. The dishes were all so well balanced and easy to eat. The chef has taken a lot of classic comfort foods and really managed to make them incredibly unique to his kitchen. Everything was rich and full without being gut busting or overpowering. We had the Philly, pot pie, Brussels sprouts, and beignets. I just can't say enough about how amazing it was. Please visit. This place deserves attention.

name: WildWood
content: I am so obsessed with WildWood. I can't believe I hadn't discovered it sooner. The food is incredible, and the space is so cozy and welcoming. It has a low-key neighborhood vibe, yet the food just elevates it to another level. You can tell they use the best, most fresh ingredients - it's evident they love what they do.

name: WildWood
content: Popped in last minute for date night. Saw that Avenues Bistro had recently been rebranded to the new WildWood concept. STARTERS: burrata salad had fresh tomatoes, huge helping of buratta, avocado and citrus vinaigrette and was amazing. Squash and pancetta was on point, super rich but perfect.  The butter braised radishes were a pleasant surprise. Had never really eaten radishes before. Loved them. MAIN: both my wife and I ordered the Snake River Farms Bavette.  I ordered mine with fresh veggies instead of the mashed potatoes. The steak was cooked perfectly and was fork tender. We had a really cheerful great waitress. She was really helpful in pointing out what to order. I love that you can see the open kitchen and the chef / owner Mike is all about interacting with his guests. Great little spot for dinner. PS we were floored when we got the check and after 3 appetizers, both of us ordering steak and my wife ordering a desert the bill was under $100. Great value for the high quality food we were served!!

name: Oquirrh
content: This spot is amazing! Intimate, unique, fabulous. The miatake mushroom appetizer was so unified and flavorful. And the chicken confit pot pie was flavorful and homey. I appreciate the playful touches to an approachable yet fun enticing menu. Loved it! The staff was also so friendly and made the atmosphere so inviting.

name: Oquirrh
content: The bread was amazing! I had the pot pie and I loved it also, will definitely go back.

name: Oquirrh
content: Great folks, very personal, good food knowledge Made some great food, had a profound knowledge of gin which amazed me much

name: Oquirrh
content: Food was great.  The only reason I dropped a star is that service was a bit slow.  I guess being busy during covid times is a good problem though.

name: Oquirrh
content: I've heard so many great things about this restaurant... I REALLY wanted to like it but perhaps expectations were too high. They were serving a special porkbelly starter on a gingersnap cookie garnished with grapfruit... INTERESTING we thought. But that's all it was, it really needed a sauce to bring it together... as served, it was kind of bizarre... and actually boring.  Two in our party ordered the bolognese spaghetti which the server said was a favorite... this came out luke warm and was incredibly average... VERY light on sauce and just not flavorful. Our order took about an hour to come out so I'm sure the spaghetti was ready early and they were waiting on the other entrées.  The ribeye, ordered by another member of our party "was delicious" he reported, and I ordered the short ribs, served in a sauce or "soup"  that was hot and flavorful and I really enjoyed them.Don't expect a cool vibe or anything like that... featured in the entry is a large coke cooler with the associated bright red- back lit logo on it and make sure to dress warm... it's very cold if they sit you anywhere by the entry. The place was busy, not overly crowded and everyone seemed to be having a good time. Server was nice but definitely seemed stretched thin.  They had hand sanitizer on the table... some might be put off by that but I appreciated the attention to detail and convenience... saved a trip to the bathroom just to wash up.

name: Oquirrh
content: We called last minute to seat a large party of 16 and Angie immediately switched things around and accommodated us! The service was great despite our last minute seating request and the food was even better. The hits of the night were the spaghetti & the chicken pot pie. Angie was such a gracious host and even say to talk to us all herself! 100% would recommend Oquirrh for any dinner or brunch needs - support local, you won't regret it!

name: Oquirrh
content: Do yourself a favor and do NOT skip the pot pie!! Rich and filling and warm and delicious...oh my! We also ordered the short rib dish which was just as delightful. Filling and savory with the potato soup base, green onion really rounds it out. For dessert the Normal ice cream choco taco did not disappoint! Not too sweet with the right amount of ice cream, chocolate & waffle cone! YUM!!!!

name: Oquirrh
content: We loved this place! Really delicious, great service, and we would absolutely recommend it to others!  Best meal we had in SLC.

name: Oquirrh
content: Oquirrh is outstanding. I would describe their menu as really creative and technically brilliant riffs on classic dishes like chicken pot pie and braised short rib. Each dish has been really expertly put together and you can definitely appreciate the quality ingredients and the love that has gone into elevating these humble sounding entrees into really exquisite dishes. I really can't recommend them highly enough.

name: Oquirrh
content: Best takeout EVER!! I so wish we could dine in their clean, beautiful space, but as we hesitate to do a babysitter in 2020, we opted for takeout. The owners Angie and Drew heard it was a special celebratory meal for us and they treated us to the Milk Braised Potatoes (WOW! Seriously delicious.) and made sure we had everything we needed for a fun date night in. I have to say, we spent the whole meal discussing the genius of Chef Drew! That and planning our next meal with them. I also can't believe food of this caliber was so affordable. We have high expectations and have been consistently blown away by Oquirrh. I'm happy to see they have other great reviews on here--this is such an outstanding establishment we're lucky to have in SLC!

name: Oquirrh
content: Went out to eat here for my girlfriends birthday. I had a prime rib dish and she had a homemade spaghetti. Both were phenomenal. We had dessert as well, it was hard to choose from all of their dessert options. The owner came to our table to wish my girlfriend a happy birthday and gave her a cactus plant. The food was great and the service was better! Great spot

name: Oquirrh
content: Tried the ricotta soaked potatoes. FRESHHHH RICOTTA. Delicious. Thank you Ang and Drew :) So proud of you guys!

name: Oquirrh
content: everything, from the homemade sourdough bread to the braised ribs and the generously strong drinks, was spot on. angie made the dining experience here exceptional w her friendly attitude and ability to make all her visitors feel like family.

name: Oquirrh
content: How have I not known about this place? Wow! Staff is sweet, funny and attentive.  Music and art on point. Then the food and drinks! Amazing! Ordered the special braised short ribs, my husband got the pot pie. Definitely one of Top 10 meals of our lives. Absolutely recommend this place!

name: Oquirrh
content: Wow. I am a pretty picky eater and I rarely do reviews. But I have to do one now. I just found this place driving along 100 S. in downtown Salt Lake City and I will be coming frequently. I had the salmon with a risotto that is absolutely divine. Did I mention I am picky? The quality of the fillet was incredible and the creative composition and the risotto was absolutely inspired. Better yet this is a mom-and-pop operation that makes it feel intimate and friendly to dine. I shall return.

name: Oquirrh
content: Awesome folks running a small, cute restaurant. They knew I was celebrating my birthday and took an interest in me event though I was only there to pick up takeout. The stake was savory an delicious with a generous portion that I split into two meals.

name: Oquirrh
content: Such a lovely restaurant with a fresh, revolving menu. All of the staff were warm and very accommodating, answering all of our silly questions. Ang was so sweet and we would definitely come back. If you love fresh, unique american fare in a laid back, classy environment then you'd love Oquirrh! I had the chicken pot pie, the oquirrh salad and their fresh homemade sourdough bread with their homemade butter. 10/10  :)

name: Oquirrh
content: To begin with, this restaurant is safe. Angelina and Andrew, the very charming owners, provide every possible protection against Coronavirus for both indoor and outdoor diners. We think this may be Salt Lake's best restaurant! Everything we ordered was delicious, including the city's most unique dinner salad, and a beautifully prepared Salmon in a delicate risotto. A housemade pasta- spaghetti that was silky smooth and as aromatic as an Italian herb garden. A knock your socks off Asian rib appetizer in an unforgettable turnip puree and marvelous ice cream desserts from Normal, which is anything but! Even though my husband and I are writing this review in the car driving home from the restaurant, I can't tell for the life of me what we paid. A meal like this, it just doesn't matter!

name: Oquirrh
content: The customer service was fantastic, and the food was even better. Even better, they were mindful of Covid safety measures. Thanks for having us!

name: Oquirrh
content: Outstanding! Ribeye was second to none with the mushroom and bean Ragout,Squash blossoms were amazing, and the burger with heirloom tomatoes was ridiculous. Wow. If you eat at one restaurant in Salt Lake City eat here.I would have posted pictures but I ate it too fast.

name: Oquirrh
content: Cool little SLC spot. I came here for dinner and really enjoyed the food. They have a pretty limited menu right now, but enough variety that I'm sure everyone can find something they like. I ordered the salmon. It was very well made! The corn risotto was a brilliant touch. I also tried the spaghetti and the pork ribs. I didn't care much for the spaghetti, but the ribs were good. Portions are good sized as well. The reason this gets four stars is because it's about what I expected for the price. Entrees are in the $20-40 range, but it didn't blow me away. The service was not great. My water was not refilled until the very end of the meal. I would say they were short staffed, but we were the only party present. I would definitely try this place if you are looking for a hearty, moderately priced meal in downtown Salt Lake City.

name: Oquirrh
content: I went to dinner here with a small group. The restaurant was pretty empty, with only one other table filling up before we left. The service was good, but a little slow. I think they have a very lean staff right now so can't blame them. The menu is also trimmed down, but all the dishes looked great. We had the bread and salad to start which were both tasty, then tried the salmon, ribs, and spaghetti. All the dishes were so flavorful and delicious and we were glad we stopped in to try. Would love to come back when they have their full menu!

name: Oquirrh
content: Absolutely the best dining experience you are going to have in Utah. 100% great chef made meals. Wife and Husband owned and they are awesome! Super friendly and down to earth. I cant wait to see what this chef puts out next.Thank you!Chef Skyler

name: Oquirrh
content: Amazing takeout experience! Considering that it came in a box and partly unassembled, this was among the best burgers I have ever had. The meat itself was so flavorful that no additional sauce was needed (although I had the option). The fries were also delicious, as was my husband's creamy risotto. I've eaten here a couple of times pre-Covid and it has always been stellar. The owner told me they are setting up additional outdoor tables so dine-in should also be a safe option.

name: Oquirrh
content: 10/10 would recommend. You have to get the potatoes!!!! Everything on the menu was great

name: Oquirrh
content: My wife am I just had a take away dinner for two from Oquirrh and it was excellent. Perfectly grilled salmon with roast potatoes (spicy like patatas bravas which I love) plus vegetables and delicious sauces, and a salad for two with dressing. Incredible value for money for food of this quality. We will definitely be back.

name: Oquirrh
content: A gem in the City Salt Lake. This little family place is cozy, comfortable and possesses a menu that hits on every entree, and hospitality that is spot on --attentive servers that go the extra mile to create comfort and attentiveness.

name: Oquirrh
content: Quarantine takeout!  We ordered dinner here for my birthday last night and it was EXCELLENT.  The food was absolutely delicious and chatting (from afar) with the wonderful owners as my food was getting boxed up was so lovely.  I can't wait to enjoy the full experience once the restaurant is open again and we get through this wild pandemic.  A true gem in the SLC dining scene!

name: Oquirrh
content: A good place to splurge! The food was great, the drinks were unique and good, with a small cute atmosphere. My husband and I ha e large appetites so we had 1 appetizer a d shared 2 entrees and could have had more, but these portions are likely great for most people!

name: Oquirrh
content: We came here on a whim when Sunday brunch was packed everywhere else. What a pleasant surprise, it was incredible. The food was unique and delicious. The server was funny and personable. Everything was fantastic. highly recommend.

name: Oquirrh
content: It's a charming little place that'd be easily overlooked. Older crowds than most places around here. We got sourdough bread and smoked lettuce (not pictured) for appetizer--as good as these would typically taste. They def stepped up with the main dishes: the lamb and chicken pot pie were amazing (pictured). My personal impression: heavy (tomato) marmalade influence on most dishes. Would want to come back and try their brunch menu.

name: Oquirrh
content: I was very disappointed with this food. We went for a girls night because we heard such good things. All of us upon leaving agreed we were underwhelmed and would not be back.

name: Oquirrh
content: Invited friends for brunch and it was fabulous . We had several of their specials. I hope it catches on so they kept selling fantastic food creations.

name: Oquirrh
content: Went here for brunch with my lady. A bit hidden from off the street. Great space and ambiance. Our server, also the owner, was extremely kind to us. Service was fast, but the only reason I'm giving 4/5 stars was because I had asked for a sweet funnel cake and was served a savory, gravy heavy funnel cake. The soft shelled crab Benedict should be votes the best in SLC. I'll be coming back.

name: Oquirrh
content: My friend and I wanted to try a new restaurant and Oquirrh had great ratings so we stopped in for lunch yesterday.  They only had a brunch menu on Saturday.   I ordered the lobster roll since I didn't want eggs and my friend had the flatbread.  My friend said the flatbread was tasty, but the egg wasn't fully cooked (unless you like uncooked egg whites).  My lobster roll was scarce on the lobster and the taste was unimpressive. Oquirrh seems to be trying too hard to be trendy.  I felt it was overpriced and overrated.  Not one I'll visit again when there are so many other great restaurants in SLC.

name: Oquirrh
content: This place is so over-hyped, especially for the price.  All their dishes seem like they put all the latest trendy ingredients together to make dishes, but it didn't result in any interesting flavors.  For example, the smoked cabbage is described as having a "tomato & chili fermented marmalade" but it just tasted like salsa with vinegar.  The $32 seafood dish was three scallops on top of some wilted greens.  The other entre we ate was likely ravioli from Trader Joe's.  One drink, two appetizers, and two entres cost $120 and I was so hungry afterwards I went to Este's for a slice of pizza.  This is petty but it really bothered me that their payment defaulted to a 22% tip when the waiter made a huge deal about how they accommodate allergies, but when I said I was allergic to sunflower seeds he said he made sure that there were no sesame seeds in the dishes.

name: Oquirrh
content: Really stylish and welcoming place! My husband and I dropped by here for Saturday brunch and were impressed. The service us good and everyone is friendly. The dishes and decor are all from local artists. And the food was great too! They have cocktails, coffee, tea. Their food is well thought out, interesting, and flavorful.

name: Oquirrh
content: We had a really good meal here. I got the pot pie and my husband got the market fish. His portion was small but mine was filling. The have a full cocktail wine and beer menus. We'll be back!Edit: we also had the brunch last time we visited and it was so good. I had the Benedict and my husband had the lobster roll that was to die for. We love the staff almost as much as we love the food!

name: Oquirrh
content: Dinner for four on a Sunday night - first visit.  Very impressive complexity of richness and flavor in all dishes - decidedly among the best in Salt Lake City that we have visited.  Recognizing that fine dining and small portions go hand in hand, the portions here were all very small and the pricing very high, even for the admittedly very high quality.  So, five stars for delectability, 2-3 for value.  Everyone left a little hungry. This was the most expensive dinner we've experienced in SLC and we have visited virtually all of its fine dining establishments.  Friendly but fairly inattentive service.

name: Oquirrh
content: What a fabulous addition to the SLC dining experience.  Saw this place pop up in an article on FB and gave it a shot and I am so glad I did.  The beef bavette Steak was to die for.  It was one of those dishes that as you eat you make weird noises of joy because it is so good.  IT was cooked medium rare just as requested, super tender, juicy and flavorful.  The polenta and kale complimented the dish beautifully.  I normally don't do dessert, I just don't have a sweet tooth, but I am so happy I did try one here. I had a scrumptious croissant with a chocolate ganache with a scoop of ice cream.  The croissant was crispy on the outside ans so flakey.  The inside was moist and buttery and the chocolate ganache was not overly sweet and it was well complimented by the yummy ice cream that had melted chocolate with it.  For someone who is not a sweet tooth this was the absolute perfect dessert.  I would go back just for that dessert.  The staff was amazing and great at recommending items.  The restaurant is small and modern and really nice.  The menu is small so I hope that it changes occasionally or things are added based on the seasons.  I have a feeling they would do some amazing things with new items

name: Oquirrh
content: Oquirrh, a long-time resident on my list of desired restaurants without my ever managing a visit, demanded I attempt the unthinkable: dine out alone! For many, this is commonplace, and I enjoy doing most things by myself, so cannot say why this hadn't occurred prior, but regardless, I was a lone diner virgin here. And I felt kind of weird about it. I made a reservation for noon on a Saturday, though on arrival, found this to be unnecessary, with only two other parties present. There was plenty of parking out front along the street, but I could see it being inadequate at dinnertime. Oquirrh is in a small, charming brick building, and I was greeted as soon as I walked in. Given the choice of a dining room or bar seat, I chose the former, and made myself snug in a corner. It is a cozy space, with large front windows, beautiful artwork adorning the walls, and a modern, attractive bar. I need not have worried as, with a book to keep me company, I did not feel lonely or awkward at all!Brunch is available on Saturdays and Sundays (dinner daily except when they are closed Monday and Tuesday (and Sundays are 20% off for industry night!). The menu was limited to ten items, with a couple sides, but I do not mind this, as I would much prefer fewer, but better options. The beverage menu is extensive, though, featuring several cocktails and beers, a variety of wines, and even some fun, less common non-alcoholic options. Three desserts were also available.It seems there is sometimes a daily special as I was informed there was not one on my visit, but the scramble/omelet consists of a seasonal and varying selection of ingredients, on this day, roasted sunchokes, rapini, and parmesan. At first, I leant toward the salad or carrots (though sweet or savory funnel cake is very intriguing!), but that seemed too boring, plus I'd heard rave reviews of the hash browns. With this in mind, I opted for the omelet with soft shell crab added 'cause I'm living my best life and you've got to take advantage when that beloved crustacean is on offer! My order took only ten or so minutes to arrive, presented beautifully on a heavy stoneware platter. Now, to me, a well and skillfully made omelet is luscious, creamy, and...ahem, moist. While I would not go so far as to call this one dry, it was browned in spots, and decidedly not the epitome of omelet perfection. I adored the well-prepared sunchokes and rapini, the crab legs were fantastic and crunchy, but I found the breading to have softened too much by the time I got to its body. The hash browns were everything promised: crispity crunchy exterior, an inch thick, rich and velvety tender inside. Offered ketchup or hot sauce, I took the latter, and would suggest you do the same! It imparted the perfect amount of heat, acid, and peppery flavor without overwhelming any component of my dish. My server was one of the owners, and wife of the chef. She was lovely and friendly, chatting amiably with others dining in, and even taking a seat next to me as I made payment, to share their restaurant philosophy. The problem, I think, is my oft-made complaint that New American feels slightly uninspired, in part due to my ability to create similar dishes at home. And while quick to point out they feel no desire to label themselves as that (or any) particular style of cuisine, it is what they are serving here. They also eschew the title of fine dining, and I agree they are not quite there (in the best way! The vibe is much more relaxed and pleasant). With that said, prices averaging $20-$30+ an entrée convey the expectation of a certain level of excellence, and especially for such simple fare as an omelet, I was a little disappointed. I would absolutely return, though, for dinner, and even for brunch, to try something else, as I think this may have just been a case of ordering the wrong thing. Nearly every menu item sounds delicious, and some seem quite creative. I adore their whole aesthetic, and the owners are so affable, fun, and clearly passionate about what they are doing. I love that they have created a restaurant like this in Salt Lake.

name: Oquirrh
content: i'm from California and I was looking for a place in SLC for an Executive Level dinner.  After looking at countless food pictures on Yelp, Oquirrh had the most amazing food porn!  In booking an event where I'm not there, it always causes a level of anxiety.  However, working with Angelena and Andrew they really left me feeling confident that they cared about my event as much as I did.  The communication was awesome and the level of attention they had to detail could really be felt.  Our executive team had a great time and even ordered more food since they enjoyed what I pre-ordered for them so much.  Awesome job Oquirrh!  Thanks for hosting our Executive Team.  We'll be back!

name: Oquirrh
content: If I had more money, I would eat here all the time. The milk braised potatoes are unlike anything I've had before and delicious. The carrots many ways are also delicious. My duck breast was perfectly cooked and flavorful, and the little cylinder of confit that came with it was nicely crisped and moist. Just ducky. They made up a delicious cheese plate for us with what they had on hand. It should be on the menu. The one thing that lets the place down is the wine list. Just 4 or 5 whites, a rosé, and a dozen or so reds, and the list does not include regions or vintages. Wine prices jump from $60-70 to $100+ with not much in between. The whole wine situation needs more thought. They deserve to succeed.

name: Oquirrh
content: Full send on this menu!! Holy sh** the bread? Cooked to a fine delicate crispy moist baby. The potatoes are so god damn good i cant think about the correct adjective to explain the spiritual experience i had enjoying these things. The fried cabbage SLAPPED. Perfect mixture of rich and light. I have yet to bathe myself in my entree but i cannot wait

name: Oquirrh
content: My husband and I had a wonderful evening at Oquirrh on our recent trip to Salt Lake City. The owners are warm and very hospitable. They made sure we ordered great bourbon cocktail and the right wine for our meal. We tried the carrot starter which was beautifully presented and interesting in flavor. The potpie is a perfect french version of a classic comfort food. We also shared the clams in broth which was delicate, not overly buttered. For dessert we enjoyed a delicate European style Pear tart which was lite and delicious with a flaky crust. Highly recommend this quaint spot with a lovely owner chef.

name: Oquirrh
content: I'm so thrilled we tried Oquirrh. From beginning to end, it was a memorable dinner. The ambiance was warm, and the service was even warmer. Ange and Andrew, the owners, welcomed us and treated us like old friends. Every plate was beautiful and complex, but not pretentious--most of all, everything was balanced and delicious. The cocktails were well-made and interesting--not your same ole classics (and not too sweet, which is often a problem with Utah restaurants). I've found a new favorite! Thanks, guys!

name: Oquirrh
content: I have to say this is my favorite restaurant in SLC. Can't wait to return. The Oquirrh Salad was super fresh. Steak, Duck, and Little Neck Clams were all perfectly seasoned and amazing favor profiles. Get the Corn Pudding for desert! 3 empty plates and cocktails. Need more please.

name: Oquirrh
content: The food was delicious and service by Bre was fantastic. She and the chef accommodated our many dietary requests. Bre alowed me to sample the wine and change my order. I loved the carrot purée and the clams were amazing. I appreciated the owner (Angie) visiting with us.  We will be back with others!

name: Oquirrh
content: Don't sleep on this place!  Easy to miss when you drive by, but definitely worth a visit.  I stopped by on a whim at an odd time, which turned out to be 15 minutes before they closed after brunch service.  Thankfully AJ was cool about it and still provided friendly service, while her chef husband Andrew prepared our food.  We had a couple cocktails, both were refreshing.  Started meal by sharing the carrot plate, and it was the fanciest carrot dish I've ever had!  Gorgeous presentation and most importantly delicious!  Quite an elevation of the humble root veggie, I really appreciated that the chef came out to explain all ways he used carrot to create the nuanced flavors.  Their salad was a generous portion of super fresh greens with just the right amount of dressing.  We split the flatbread that had roasted fennel, tomatoes, goat cheese and fried egg on top.  We enjoyed every bite!  I was really impressed with brunch menu, can't wait to go back for dinner!

name: Oquirrh
content: Meh, like the chicken pot pie was cool but how do mess that up. The rest was over priced and quite boring and I am not that exciting.

name: Oquirrh
content: Server was excellent and the food was great. The lamb dish is a little big and heavy but if you are hungry you'll be happy you ordered it. We got the beef tartare and it was spectacular!

name: Oquirrh
content: It pains me to write this review, but I'm left wondering if my first experience at Oquirrh was a mirage. The second two visits would suggest as much.On our first trip to Oquirrh, in early June, we were preoccupied by the delighted anticipation of an upcoming trip to the inimitable Chez Panisse just a few weeks later. With this in mind, we were expecting a pleasant, but unremarkable dining experience at Oquirrh, one that we felt we should have before it would inevitably shutter its doors, like so many unremarkable SLC fine dining establishments. However, as our server attended to us, impeccably timing one stellar cocktail and appetizer after the next, we began to wonder: If this is real, and it's always like this, then why do we need to spend $600 for dinner at Chez Panisse. Cocktails were creative, but balanced. A consummate professional, our server served the meal with impeccable timing, was attentive, warm, engaged, contained, and not the slightest smidge invasive. The black radishes were cold and fresh, butter rich and tangy, and sourdough bread had the perfect crumb and tooth. As we noshed on the salad, bavette steak and tartare, we kept looking each other with delighted alarm. What is going on here? Again, why bother with Chez Panisse when Oquirrh is practically in our back yard?Alas. On two other occasions we again dined at Oquirrh, first expecting another sublime dining event, and on the second, just hoping things might turn around. Service was slow, sloppy, and casual. A different server, but the same for visits two and three. Well into our second cocktail, she casually noted that she had forgotten to bring us water, despite us having requested it upon being seated. She got around to it, eventually. We waited, and waited, and waited further for each stage of the meal. And then, she brought out the appetizer, the previously glorious sourdough, WITH the entrees, which by then, was cold and mostly too crunchy to eat. Tragic. Also, she kept calling me "hon." Look, if you work at Sapp Brothers, which is a fabulous local truckstop diner, please, feel free to call me "hon." Though the servers at Sapp Brothers are expert at intuiting when to lay down such casual language, and when to be more formal. This server could take some lessons from those splendid hash-slingers. The food on round two was mostly unremarkable, except for the root vegetable terrine, which was a delicate stack of improbably shaved and perfectly sous vided goodness. Round three food, excluding the bread, was solid. We tried the kale stem risotto and the pasta with lobster. Delish. Both were a joy to consume, and they made me want to cook. To be fair, Oquirrh was packed on visits two and three, so perhaps this is a problem with management rather than service. Still, a good restaurant can handle busy, and no fine dining patron should ever be addressed as "hon." Gross.I hope to favorably modify my review when we return for one more hopeful attempt in a few weeks.

name: Oquirrh
content: Went to Oquirrh tonight and must say I was not impressed. The waitress was friendly, but the service was very slow. The appetizers were overpriced and not flavorful. We ordered the sourdough which came out burnt and had a terribly lack luster butter on the side. The carrots were small, and unevenly salted. The potatoes were the best appetizer we tried, but not enough for a table of four. As a vegetarian my menu choices were limited, so I went with the barley berry risotto. It tasted like a berry dessert cobbler. It was incredibly sweet for a main dish. When the waitress asked why I had not completed my meal, I told her so. She said she would check with the kitchen because that was an unusual critique of the meal. When she returned her response to me was, "The kitchen is going to make a new batch and make sure it is up to par." A new batch for who? So if the kitchen remakes and tastes the risotto and says they like it, then my opinion and the opinion of the diners I was with did not matter? She asked ME about the meal, I did not complain or send it back. Very odd response. Wine selection was not great and the cocktails were medi-Oquirrrrrrrrrrh. Overall, this place is overpriced and a bit pretentious for what you get.

name: Oquirrh
content: It's just not that good. It's a knockoff of Cucina in the Avenues. Maybe I went on a bad night, but it certainly did not live up to the hype I had heard. My favorite part was the sourdough pancake underneath the duck, if that says anything. Plenty of better options

name: Oquirrh
content: Friendly service, delicious fresh food, simple urban ambiance.    We had a trio of starters -- the standout was the beef tartare.    Chef made modifications so that all of our dishes were gluten free.     Solid wine and cocktail menu.    Only negative is that it was nearly full and so quite loud.

name: Oquirrh
content: Accidental tourists....missed our connection at SLC and looked for a good restaurant. Got far more than we expected.Absolutely phenomenal from cocktail to appetizer to main to dessert. My daughter didn't want lobster in her pasta. The chef custom made the tastiest veggie pasta.  Pot pie, beef, duck, lobster pasta, carrots (!)....yum!And the owners are so friendly. No question a do-over next time in Salt Lake City.

name: Oquirrh
content: Such a great time here. Every detail is well thought out. We tried the carrots and potatoes as starters. The carrots are a must. Around the table we had the duck, pasta, steak and chicken pot pie. All super amazing. The menu is seasonal though so it may change. The owners are so nice and the wait staff was really friendly  don't let the simple modern dining space fool you - this place is fine dining. Thanks so much, Angie!

name: Oquirrh
content: I loved this place. The food was amazing but what makes it for me was the owner /manager. She was so sweet and welcoming. This place deserves more than 5 start for the food and the service

name: Oquirrh
content: This food is delightful! Clearly the chef has put his whole heart into these magical creations and the space is incredible too! Want delicious soul food and an amazing atmosphere, check it out! The chicken put pie was the best I've ever had!

name: Oquirrh
content: I love this place! Food is always fresh and delicious. The talent at this restaurant is amazing!

name: Oquirrh
content: Angie and Drew  have hit a home run with Oquirrh! From Brandon at the bar, Bre serving in the dining room, to the effervescent, ever present  Angie  making sure everything is running smoothly, Oquirrh is a delight. The asparagus with morels was so complex that we spent at least ten minutes ferreting out the tarragon. The sourdough is reminiscent of Poilane in Paris. Seriously. I had the kale and rye risotto. Can't wait for a redux tomorrow with a poached egg on top. Just fabulous. Do yourselves a favor and go and enjoy the joie de vivre this place exudes.

name: Oquirrh
content: First time dining at Oquirrh but definitely will not be our last! Excellent food & service asparagus & morels were delicious, sea bass outstanding with an unbelievable broth. Wine recommendations were perfect! We can't wait to dine here again and will be returning very soon with good friends to enjoy this treasure!

name: Oquirrh
content: We recently celebrated our wedding anniversary and are here. The food is so good! We loved that they can customize dishes for my wife's celiac issues. I'm a real foodie and this place clearly has great attention to detail in every dish. The flavors were surprising and delicious.The service was great too. Loved how our waitress paid attention to our needs and kept track of us even when the place filled up. I'd suggest coming early however, because when the place is full it gets loud. I love how this is also clearly a small family establishment. The manager is married to the chef and when something is off she fixes it immediately. My wife had a dish with a cool looking pickled onion garnish. But eating it whole was intense! The waitress noticed and every dish afterward had the onions diced. It made the dish even more excellent. We loved that we had made a difference in the experience of other diners. We will be back.

name: Oquirrh
content: We had a great first experience at Oquirrh. I had the carrot dish and buckwheat salad. Both were delicious. The salad was light and fresh. My dining partner ordered the duck. He said it was excellent. We will definitely return!

name: Oquirrh
content: I was very excited to try a new niche restaurant in Salt Lake.  Be prepared to have your ears ringing because this space is really loud. The menu simple yet difficult to understand clearly what you're getting. Kale stem & Rye risotto with kale ??? Warm sourdough bread w/butter $7. Sounded good and thought it would be something special. Steak tartare comes w/crostini, pretty much pieces of bread sliced and toasted over fire. Same bread as the crostini-3 half slices w/dab of butter??. Sorry chef while the bread is good so is bread that is brought to your table upon arrival as part of being a guest at many great places.  While some of our good was okay nothing we ordered was great! Homemade pasta delivered lukewarm and sticky. Nothing made me want to go back. Dessert was just weird. Maybe trying too hard to be different but for the high price the noise and the so-so food I won't be back.

name: Oquirrh
content: I'm a veggie and we hesitated coming here for quite some time due to the menu. Finally took the leap to find they were very accommodating and were able to make just about everything meatless. Not only was it all vegetarian but it was truly incredible.

name: Oquirrh
content: The menu is well balanced.  The food preparations were strong and the service was excellent.  They are working through some opening hiccups but they handle them well; noise level is very high but dampening panels are on the way.  Fresh pasta was delicious but could use another two ounces of lobster to make it perfect.  I'm sure they are balancing costs but locals need to recognize quality of ingredients and be prepared to pay for it.  The pasta was $29 and delicious but I would have paid $34 for another two ounces of lobster.  (The people at the table next to me that complained about the pricing should just go to Red Lobster and get their frozen dinner microwaved!)  Anyway, I digress.  Overall this is a neighborhood GEM that deserves to be frequented often and supported by locals.  Also, Page, our server, was so engaging and knowledgeable.  Again. A five star experience, even with the hiccups.

name: Oquirrh
content: This restaurant has the best food in Salt Lake!  The Chicken pot pie is sublime as is the lobster pasta.  I have also had the fish special and loved every bite.  This restaurant has wonderful staff and great ambience but it is the food that is spectacular!

name: Oquirrh
content: I was so excited to dine here based on the reviews and food pics but Oquirrh was an unfortunate let down. Service and the pace of the meal were sooo slow. We got seated and it felt like no one came to take our order for another 10 minutes, not even to see if we wanted to start with drinks, which then took forever to come out after we ordered. I had the house made pasta with lobster and celery. The lobster was cooked nicely but the pasta was disappointingly cooked past al dente. I thought the sauce was too sour. I enjoy sour/acidic foods but this was just an unbalanced sauce, maybe from the pecorino? I also tried the lamb shank which looked like an impressive dish but also failed to deliver. The curry crust had no flavor and the curry and lamb were completely missing seasoning. It came with naan which had the texture of a biscuit vs. traditional naan. We didn't bother with dessert.

name: Oquirrh
content: This is a must in SLC! The cocktails were divine and the service delightful. We shared the carrots, potatoes, and sourdough bread as appetizers. Everything was delicious! I especially loved the potatoes. For the main dish I had the chicken pot pie, the crust was light and fluffy but slightly browned on the top. Most definitely the best chicken pot pie I have ever had. If you need a new spot to visit this should be next on your list!

name: Oquirrh
content: I was excited all week to eat at Oquirrh, but the experience did not live up to the Yelp hype. The service was slow, the ambience was loud/over crowded, and the food, while decent, was extremely over priced. I paid over $50 for a tiny drink/appetizer/entree and still went home afterwards and had a frozen pizza due to my continued hunger. I won't be coming back anytime soon.

name: Oquirrh
content: Ahhh! First time here wont be the last! The owners and the team of servers and bartender were the best. Which translates to a great experience from the moment you walk in. Cocktails were perfect. We had the raddichio salad perfection with the lardons and blue cheese. The house made pasta with lobster and celery and just the right amount of acidity. On to a wonderful confit! And a lamb shank to finish it all off. Everything was perfect and innovative. Thank you Angela, Drew and staff for making our evening a night to remember.

name: Oquirrh
content: Besides the carrot appetizer being "meh" everything else we ordered was excellent. Our service was great and everything came out at the perfect pace. Happy to have this restaurant in downtown SLC.

name: Oquirrh
content: Ordered the carrots, wine, chicken pot pie, and lamb shank. I didn't expect the carrots to be "fridge" cold and be the equivalent of 1.5 carrots for $13..pot pie tasted great, ok portion size. While the lamb shank was a great meal size, it had a "curry" flavor but was very bland. Would have loved to taste the $41 dollars I paid for in that one dish. Although they did explain when we arrived that the kitchen was backed up, it took about 2 hours to receive and eat our meal. Overall unimpressed by the sizes and taste of the dishes for the money paid.

name: Oquirrh
content: Honestly this place is freaking AMAZING.  Best food I've ever had, I know that sounds like an exaggeration but I swear to god it's not.  GO HERE

name: Oquirrh
content: Had dinner here last night and it was top notch! Tried the lamb and beef bavette.....both were amazing. Great atmosphere and service. I will definitely be back for another dinner here.

name: Oquirrh
content: Stumbled onto this gem and can't wait to go back to sample more from the menu. Drew Fuller does an amazing job with the food. It's beautiful and delicious. The atmosphere is friendly, even neighborly. A truly great addition to Salt Lake dining.

name: Oquirrh
content: My lady and I wanted to try something new. We used yelp to find a place. We are stoked that it lead us to Oquirrh. We got the chicken pot pie and the bavette steak. Both were full of flavor and hit all the spots that you want your meal to hit. My girlfriends exact words were, "this was one of the best things ive ever eaten." Page was our server and she was great, super friendly and honest. We met the owners and they are the cutest, down to earth couple. Our experience was great, the food was good and we felt like we made friends with the staff. We would recommend Oquirrh to everybody.

name: Oquirrh
