content: Oquirrh has quickly vaulted itself into contention for best restaurant in Salt Lake.  It's hard to believe this restaurant has only been open for a month or so.Oh, the food!  Chef-owner Drew Fuller has made the culinary rounds around town (Copper Onion, Pago, HSL) and he brings these influences with him to Oquirrh.  You can see a bit of the culinary DNA from these earlier stints, but the menu is original and distinctly Fuller's.  The plating is lovely, but without all the of the pretentiousness of some fine-dining restaurants.  Among the highlights of the menu are the Indian-influenced fried lamb shank, the bavette steak and the carrots done in seven preparations.  A special was an unbelievable ethereal ricotta-stuffed Italian dumpling in a bolognese sauce---if you see it on the menu, don't hesitate to order it!  The wine list is thoughtfully conceived and reasonably priced.  The cocktail menu is very solid.  The dessert list is short, but has contributions from superstar pastry chef, Alexa Norlin, so you know it's gonna be sensational.Service is a particular high point at this establishment.  The staff is all experienced and particularly friendly.  This greatly contributes toward giving Oquirrh a very unfussy, comfortable atmosphere.Plan on spending about $50 a head.  There is only on-street parking available, although there is adequate parking in this neighborhood.

name: Oquirrh
content: the bar has officially been raised in SLC restaurant-land. y'all better get your acts together to keep up with creative new spots like Oquirrh. Lovely small plates: roasted carrots miso-cured beautifully presented, asparagus with lemon zest and lardo, and griddled radicchio. The confit chicken pot pie making the rounds on social media is stupendous-rich, creamy, and flavorful. Duck breast with cherry sauce was perfectly cooked. Service was impeccable: knowledgeable and helpful. Super impressive debut. Will be back soon.

name: Oquirrh
content: This is such a cute little local restaurant! The food was amazing! We had the special of the day, the dumplings... the dumplings themselves were so tender and the cheese worked so well with the sauce. Our second starter was the carrots, which was a platter of carrots in various forms, so good! My two favorite dishes, hands down, were the confit chicken pot pie. Talk about a grown up pot pie! The chicken was so tender and juicy, and the crust was crispy and flaky, totally would come back for that. For dessert, the pain au chocolate is such a unique dish that I don't think you can find anywhere else. It is a chocolate croissant on melted chocolate paired with a sour cream ice cream. The sour cream ice cream threw me for a loop at first, but it was amazing, and it worked so well, and everyone should try it at least once in their life.  The service was also great!

name: Oquirrh
content: This is one of the few menus where nothing looked attractive in print. The fish was quite tasty. I would have liked a salad but, again, none looked appealing. The "risotto "--not really a risotto--was particularly disappointing. We really like farm to table and creativity but this seemed strained. Lots of root vegetables. Again, good but good but not so pervasive, even in dessert. Definitely had sticker shock at $200 dinner with wine for three. Kudos for the building renovation.

name: Oquirrh
content: I'm from out of town and I'm going to definitely come back for the chicken pot pie!! It is the best pot pie I have ever had. It's full of flavor and the pastry is delicious!!!

name: Oquirrh
content: Yes you should go - absolutely go! I loved the creative menu - very unique with flavor combos that are not only interesting but also delicious. We had the grilled radicchio with creamy bleu and lardons to start. I love the bitterness of the radicchio balanced with the cheese and saltiness of the bacon. For mains we split the lobster spaghetti and Bavette steak. The spaghetti was homemade, fresh, tender, creamy deliciousness topped with perfectly cooked lobster. The steak arrived with polenta topped with fermented kale and a beef jus. The quality of the beef is what really stood out - you can just taste quality and it melts in your mouth. There was a lot of apps I can't wait to go back and try - the carrot salad looked amazing. The staff was super friendly and seemed genuinely happy to be there. Super sweet owner stopped by to see how our meal was and you can see the pride in their craft - rightfully so. So like I said, GO!

name: Oquirrh
content: WOW, how refreshing to go to a restaurant that had amazing food AND amazing service!!!  (see my last 2 reviews of the crap restaurants in Park City).  This place is worth the drive down.  From ordering drinks to finish our desserts the entire experience was fantastic.  Will definitely stop back by when we are in town!

name: Oquirrh
content: We had a great dinner. They service was fantastic. They are clearly making an effort to make everyone happy. Our meals were delicious. We will definitely go back. The only negative is that the space is loud.

name: Oquirrh
content: The food and drinks are carefully made and presented. Everything was delicious; flavors are precisely layered--sweet, spices, earthy and full-bodied. Just loved the food.The restaurant is small and loud. The staff is very friendly.. maybe a little overly friendly. My partner had his back to the main walkway for the staff and they kept rubbing his back when they approached the table.

name: Oquirrh
content: I took a chance because of a few other Yelpers who raved about this new place. Everyone is right. Sat at the bar and Steven shared a spring cocktail that is still unnamed. Grapefruit shrub and gin was a great way to start.The starter special was ricotta dumplings with beef/pork boulignais. Amazing, worth getting on an airplane to come here for the specials.Can't wait for the main...Beef bavette steak with organic polenta, fermented kale and beef Ajus. They sourced super high quality  meat and cooked to a perfect medium rare.Plus I love carrots so I had to get what I call carrots 9 ways. Super interesting carrot flavors.Next up, can they impress with dessert?Oh yes!  They call it Sunchoke Cereal. I call it sweet creativity. You have to taste to understand how panna cotta, sunchoke granola and almond milk ice cream go together.I'll be back.

name: Oquirrh
content: I live in the downtown area and love finding new restaurant options. Oquirrh is a great addition to the Salt Lake downtown dining choices!  The atmosphere is intimate and inviting and the service was friendly and attentive. They have a creative, fresh menu and fun craft cocktails (my favorite was the MDP). We had the pasta with lobster and celery and the sea bass. Both were delicious, but the sea bass was amazing and had so much flavor!  The coffee cake for dessert was delicious!  Definitely a new favorite go-to dining spot.

name: Oquirrh
content: What a fabulous, quaint, fine dining experience! The atmosphere is inviting, service is knowledgeable and friendly, and the food is amazing!! Specialty drinks are tasty and the coffee cake dessert is delicious!! Definitely a must-try new restaurant in SLC!!

name: Oquirrh
content: Oquirrh is another great upscale restaurant downtown with a short but deep menu and full flavors.After walking by this place while it was being built for months, we looked forward to finally checking it out. We went yesterday and weren't let down.Our party of 2 split the radicchio salad, lobster pasta and curry lamb - which turned out to be more than enough food for us.The radicchio salad was delicious but much more hearty than we expected. Complete with meat and cheese, this isn't a light appetizer, but more of a heavy beginning.The lobster pasta looks like a small portion, but due to the richness of it that's all we could handle. The pre-cut, perfectly sized pieces of lobster were delicious and left us wanting another tail.The star of the dinner was the curry lamb shank - a 12oz portion of friend lamb with a curry crust served with a few sides and nan bread. The lamb fell right off the bone, was perfectly cooked. The sides for the lamb included mint, a tzatziki like sauce, and a few others. Our only complaint was we could have used more of the sides, since they ran out before we were half done.We were too full for dessert and will surely be back for more cocktails and trying out everything else on the menu.

name: Oquirrh
content: The 'project' is a work in progress. Next up is the pricing conundrum, half a bavette on some greens for $31 in SLC is a project setting up to fail. The wine list is priced to extract as much $$$ out of your pocket as possible. 300% to 400% markup on commodity wines is a crime, I feel for restaurants who have to pay retail but if you want to gouge me at least have a well curated list. Now the good, the wait staff were fantastic, the cocktails were great, the carrot dish and pot pie were spot on. I want them to succeed but we are back home ordering a pizza because the prices are way out of line and we could not bleed anymore.

name: Oquirrh
content: This restaurant is endorsed wholehearted by celebrity singer Cardi B, Oquirrrrrrrrrrrrh?!

name: Oquirrh
content: I love trying new places. So the hubbs and I were excited to try this new restaurant. For a starter we got the ricotta potatoes. They were so good, filled will tons of flavor. Loved them. I got the bass and the hubbs got the lobster pasta for our main course. Both were amazing dishes; we'd get them again for sure. First two courses were definitely 5 stars. But then came dessert. We got the coffee cake and ice cream. The coffee ice cream was great, but I don't think I've ever had a coffee cake (or any cake for that matter) that was as dry as this one. It was so dry it just crumbled apart as my fork touched it. It was not good at all. Darn it!!However, the service was perfection. She was great. And we chatted with the owner also; she was just the sweetest. We will for sure go back to try more items off the menu. I'll just steer clear of the coffee cake.

name: Oquirrh
content: Great restaurant! The staff were very attentive. Had the special, grapefruit salad was amazing, ordered the chicken pot pie( so unique) was delicious. Love trying people's interpretations. Will be back! Thank you

name: Oquirrh
content: All right y'all this place is top notch! So dang good! I consider myself a pretty high end food snob having traveled all around the world and developing a snobby pallet ‍ This place blew me away! I was so excited to see a spot open near my place. The radicchio app was holy.smokes. Out of this world. Probably the best app I've had. Ever. The pasta and lobster also SO good. Then the coffee cake. Y'all, this place was out of this world good. Just go! Prices are very reasonable for the quality of food. It's a small little spot so make a reservation, and get ready to ENJOY! Met both Angie and Andrew during our visit - loved them and their vibe. You can tell they're so passionate about their work and food Oquirrh is legit - try it, love it, try it again. Oh and BRE! She's awesome. Loved her. She knew the menu through and through and was a super great server. Loved her.

name: Oquirrh
content: This place is truly a gem to the neighborhood. I was surprised how good everything was! From the apps and drinks to the mains and desserts. Delicious! Came here to celebrate my birthday and it was the perfect dinner. Staff was friendly and attentive and the menu had something for everyone. My favorites were the braised potatoes, steak with polenta, handmade pasta and the lamb. Braised potatoes- I could eat this all day long! The sauce to perfectly cooked baby potatoes was on point!Steak and polenta-had a secret weapon and it was chard kale that was so balanced to give it enough pop without over powering the dish. Handmade pasta with lobster-this was absolutely the perfect portion for something light and super flavorful. The lamb-this wasn't any ordinary lamb dish. So rich with flavor and it fell off the bone, my mouth is watering thinking about it. Order this and get ready to have a meal. We shared then all three desserts and the coffee cake was my favorite of them all, which is saying a lot since I usually don't think dessert is worth it unless there is chocolate inside. In fact, the only thing that this place lacked was a rich chocolate option for dessert, something smooth and rich with an intricate twist on a classic. Regardless of that I will be back to try it all!!

name: Oquirrh
content: We loved everything about Oquirrh! Amazing food, beautiful atmosphere and excellent customer service! This is a must see in SLC! We can't wait to go back to try some of our favorites again and to try the things on the menu we didn't have room for!

name: Oquirrh
content: Fantastic menu and great service, easily the best new restaurant in SLC. Food: 1. The appetizers we had were excellent, specifically the braised potatoes and carrots.2. Confit chicken pot pie is a safe bet, but expertly done. The chicken falls right off the bone, and the pastry wrap is flaky and buttery. The lamb shank is the best lamb I've ever had, and the portion is huge. There's a great sauce and side included.3. Desserts are all great. We tried all three, and each one had complex and refreshing flavors. The entire restaurant is very welcoming and friendly. Make sure to get a reservation. The bartender is awesome too, so be sure to grab a drink and hear some of his fun stories.

name: Oquirrh
content: Very impressed with this place!! I am so glad we stumbled upon it yesterday. The interior is very trendy and the atmosphere is lively. The seating is a bit crowded, but that's to be expected for any new downtown restaurant. Firstly, WOWZA, the warm salad was a treat. It was served with blue cheese, peppers, and pancetta. The flavorings were savory, tart, spicy, and a tad bit bitter. It was absolutely delicious! The pairing on that dish were unique and worked well together. The main entrees were also superb. I ordered the chicken pot pie, and my date ordered the steak. The pot pie was stunning! Visually impressive, but it also tasted impeccable. The puff pastry was perfectly cooked and the pot pie filling had a delicious savory and sour taste to it. My boyfriend's steak was also amazing. The chimichurri accompanying the steak was really good, and the steak was cooked exactly medium. The steak was also incredibly tender and juicy. My only regret is not ordering dessert! I was set to order the pain au chocolat, but we were both too full after our main entrees.Overall, this place is delicious and I will definitely be returning. Unique dishes that satisfy the pallet and aesthetics!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Five stars for not enforcing the mask mandate!  Thank you for being human.  Enjoyed the burger bowl for brunch.  Great local beer selection.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I forgot to take pictures, I had a "burger bowl" which is essentially a hamburger in the shape of a bowl filled with cheese, then put on a bun with condiments. It was truly delicious! We also had the carnitas nachos, also perfect and delicious. They have board games to play and all around it was a fun time! I was only a little confused because you can make a reservation on Open Table but it is counter order...

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Stopped there on our way to the airport. Definitely worth it.  Had carnitas salad, steak salad, tacos, and burgers.  Everything was DELICIOUS (especially carnitas salad!).  Staff very friendly and prices extremely reasonable.  Recommend it if your looking for a great fast fresh meal.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: The service was excellent and very fast! The staff were so attentive and also explained the menu to us since we had never been before. Definitely would recommend if you want some quick, tasty bite.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Flat out awesome food. Friendly chill atmosphere and great staff. I had to talk my son out of a third steak sandwich in one setting. LOL. Solid pizza with some excellent options for specialty pizzas. Daily specials just add to the variety and value. Food for all ages and a great selection of local specialty beers and they make a mean Moscow Mule. Why would you eat at one of those chain restaurants with no flare and personality when you can support a local restaurant like Diversion that obviously care greatly about their quality and service? I'm a local resident that lives around the corner and am happy to have a local eatery like Diversion

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: AMAZING food and service!!! My entire family loves the menu here! It's a "MUST" if you are in the area!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I had a great visit to this casual eatery after a long trip from the East Coast. I heard about this place from a blog and we decided to Uber from the airport while we waited for the rest of our party to arrive. It was pretty close (less than 15 minutes) and easy to get to. I ended up making a reservation since I wasn't sure how busy it got during lunchtime and they had our table ready when we arrived.First off, the staff is great - they welcomed us in with smiles and told us a bit about the menu along with recommendations. Our friends ended up being delayed, so we stayed much longer than we had planned, but they didn't mind at all. They kept checking on us and making sure we were good. Really great!For food, we ended up getting a burger and fries, and a burger salad, which was great to see on the menu because it's something I make at home all the time. Both were really good and I especially liked the fries with all the different sauces. I wish the salad would have had kale or spinach, but it was still good and a huge portion for lunch. We also ordered a bunch of the chocolate chip cookies they sell to take with us. Since we ended up hanging around for awhile, we ordered wine off their drink menu and the red was really good.Overall great place!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This place is delicious! Highly recommend the Cubano club and the Gorg burger! Lots of variety for then whole family and everything was really good! Love the kombucha on tap!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Really enjoyed our experience here! The staff were friendly and the service was great. We were brought drink refills which I didn't expect from this type of restaurant. I had the steak salad, it was great and enjoyed a side of sweet potato fries with fry sauce. Would definitely recommend!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Wings were awesome! Loved the sauces (gorgonzola was delicious). Pizza was also fantastic. It was a perfect Super Bowl meal.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Ordered online. Order will be ready in 10 mins. 35 mins later we are still sitting here waiting. Food is great if you have all night to waste!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: A collective "meh".   Not worth the hype.   Burger was dry and cold.  Poutine gravy tasted burnt and drinks tasted watered down.    Next time, JCW's. Will be half the price and much better food

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Delicious food and super friendly staff! The atmosphere looks amazing, so I'll definitely have to check it out after the pandemic! Do yourself a favor and support this local business!!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Very close to the Marmalade Library which we went to often before COVID. Now we still go for the great food, kind and conscientious service!Staff's super-accommodating with any requests, for picky eaters (my kiddo) and dietary needs (me). We love the GF pizza, burgers & veg burgers, salads, and French fries! We've had some fun family meals here. Will order take-out again soon.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Was a bit disappointed with my hubby's lunch. He ordered an avocado toast and wings. The toast was so sad and the wings were soggy and not tasty :(

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This place is amazing, food is even better! It's very affordable and locally owned. Can't suggest this place enough and can't wait to try all of the items on their menu!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I thought I would try this place I had never heard of because it had 4 stars.  My coworker decided to order as well.  Ordering was easy and food was described well.  I ordered a make your own pizza and my friend had a carbless burger.When our food arrived back to our work, it was still hot.  I gave her her burger and took out my pizza.I opened the box and dang, a bunch of the toppings were in the box, not on my pizza.  The bottom was really soggy and it wasn't cut through.  I would go there again, just won't get pizza.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Found this place while passing through SLC. Was surprised that a counter service establishment was this good. I ordered the Buffalo chicken salad and a side of sweet potato fries. The salad was fresh and didn't have an overwhelming amount of Buffalo sauce, the chicken was served warm and wasn't dry which is a common complaint for me with salads. The sweet potato fries were crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Everything was very simple, but good.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: The burger was amazing. Ordered the Triple Cheese, very delicious.  The poutine was great, curds melted perfectly, gravy was flavorful, didn't need any additional salt or pepper.  Great conversation with guys working. Kept the glass of soda full, didn't need to ask for anything they were in top of it. Place is really clean and a home run.  Great burger joint!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: BEST PLACE IN SALT LAKE CITY. Between the prices and quality of food I'm not sure how anything can top this place! The menu had options for everybody which included pizzas, burgers, poutine, and tacos! The beer here was amazing as well, the Mexican nut beer was easily the best beer I have ever had! If you like options this place is for you, I can not believe that I've never heard of this place until recently, I really have been missing out!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: While on a visit to Utah, I found this hot spot on Yelp. They were very accommodating to my son's food allergies and the food was fresh and made to order. Indoor and outdoor seating were available. I'll be back next time I'm there.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: 10/17/2020 Using Yelp we decided to try Diversion because the reviews were so excellent.  The hostess stood & told me all the various options. I went with the cauliflower crust, combo pizza replacing green pepper with tomatoe.  I also orders the steak salad. Jack ordered the beer brat on a pretzel bun. We choose to sit outside. They start out bringing silverware & an Abdi mint! She said steak salad is Hugh so she brought us extra plates for sharing. Everything was very good! They definitely have the cauliflower crust down! Let diet easily practiced here. Not that I was going for that! Ha

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Diversion is one of my top choices right.  Love the Gorg  and the steak salad YUM.   Great atmosphere, amazing staff and best of delicious food that is affordable.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Keto galore - never thought I'd be loving a cauliflower crust pizza but yes I am.   Steak salad and Gorgonzola burger are big favorites.  Because the prices are very reasonable I'm eating here more than even I expected.  Great for take out or Uber eats.  Big portions. Top Taste. Def in my weekly rotation

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: The poutine is the best I've had outside of Canada. I also recommend the steak salad. I've eaten here more than once. The service has always been prompt and friendly

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This was my first time ordering from Diversion, but it certainly won't be my last!  I ordered The Western burger bowl.  I am diabetic and I am trying to make better choices when it comes to carbs so I opted for a lettuce wrap.  SO DELICIOUS!  I wasn't missing the bun at all!  The veggies were fresh and crisp and the burger was satisfying!  I also ordered a keto cookie because I always seem to crave a sweet treat.  It definitely satisfied my sweet tooth and it was nice that it isn't a sugar bomb!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Super friendly and helpful service. I went on a Tuesday and was told it was taco Tuesday haha. I tried one of each taco they offered. All delicious and big portioned. Delicious pizza too! I would recommend this place who wants some good, no gimic, food and service!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Absolutely awesome spot... Nice atmosphere, trendy, with local artwork decor.Can't beat the drink specials. I am thrilled about $3 mimosas all day. A nice variety of beers available.I heard the pizzas and burgers are great here. I went with a salad though... my first carnitas salad. That is a rather large affair, with a ton of meat and fixings. Absolutely delicious. Also ordered chili cheese fries. Yummy... messy... cheese... mountain of chili... need I say more? We were all surprised by the amount of fries and salad you get here for your money. The prices are very reasonable, especially considering the amount and quality of food you get here. Wish I lived closer. Definitely will visit any time I'm in SLC.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I am always happy to support a local restaurant that also provides vegan options. We had lovely service and, due to the global pandemic, got our vegan pizza with cauliflower crust to go. We had to sneak a peak once we got in the car and then the peak turned into eating just one bite and, well, that turned into eating just a slice.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: BOMB.COM! And the cashier was amazing! I messed up on my order and she was able to fix It right away! The food is beyond amazing!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Ordered takeout on Sunday a little after 11am and said my food would be ready in 10 min! Gentleman who took my order was very friendly. I got a 10" pineapple pizza and a side of sweet potato fries. Both were delicious. Their fry sauce is honestly the best I have had since moving out to Utah and discovering that fry sauce exists. It was amazing. I didn't eat inside but did go in to pick up my food and it was very modern style and extremely clean. They also have outdoor seating available as well. I would definitely recommend giving this place a try!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: my boyfriend & i were wanting to try something new & this place was awesome! there was a lot of different foods to choose from! we got the chili pizza & pepperoni pizza and they were so good we ordered more to take home with us! highly recommend!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: We have been here twice now and I ADORE And dream about their Poutine. The gravy is incredibly flaorful and the cheese curd melted to perfection. I have also tried the smoked salmon tacos which were so salty I wanted to cry. Perhaps the nature of the smoked salmon itself, but it could use some thought into how to pair the salt down in that taco. I also tried the breakfast burger bowl. I love the concept of a burger bowl and the burger was perfectly cooked and well presented. Oddly enough the problem here was it needed more flavor and more salt. For how amazing it looked the burger was boring. I will also say that the staff is fabulous, and genuinely kind. We love stopping in. My companion for the evening ordered the burger pizza was in her opinion was a lot of acidity on one plate, the other friend with us had what I believe was a chicken parm sandwich, which he said was simple but delicious. I am happy to continue to try other things as we will be returning for the poutine. I am sure there are other menu items we will find that we love just as much.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Great flavored burgers! Love the size and quality of ingredients. My favorite has to be the half and half poutin fries. Everything I need and more.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: We stopped in here for dinner last night and had an awesome experience. I got a burger and poutine, the gravy on the poutine was yummy. My husband got a burger and chili cheese fries. The chili was super good. The service was excellent as well.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I did curbside pickup and tried Diversion for the first time. Highly recommend! It was ready within 10 minutes and I didn't even have to call, they just walked right out with my order when I pulled up. I had the Old Timer but subbed the Veggie patty instead. Delicious! Could tell it wasn't one of those gross frozen Veggie patties. I'll definitely be back!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: We have been here twice in the past week after relocating to the area. Tacos and poutine fries were amazing the first time, wings and poutine were 5 star as well. The staff is cheerful and attentive. Will absolutely go again.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Tried Diversions today for the first time, had curbside pick-up soon as I pulled up the food was put in my car.Once I returned home and put the food out Steak Salad,Burger Saladand the mixed poutine fries, both me and my wife were veryimpressed with what we got, And when we ate it ,delicious.We will definitely go back.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Spending a Sunday downtown Salt Lake is a bit challenging with kids if you want to eat something local. Most places were bars open and we found this place via Yelp. The food was delish. The staff was very welcoming and ensured our experience was pleasant. They have a great selection of local and canned beers along with mixed drinks. Give the chips and guacamole a try and you won't be disappointed. We tried the chicken tacos, pizza and burgers. Everyone enjoyed food and environment. Check for local entertainment also as we enjoyed some while we were there.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: They have a plethora of ketogenic, low-carb, gluten-free, vegan or vegetarian options. Fresh, local, nutritious and yummy food

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: We found this gem of a restaurant on our way down from Jackson Hole to Las Vegas, and are so glad we did.  Though it's a small restaurant they have both an indoor and outside dining area, and though reservations are not required, they did save a table for our party of five when we called ahead.  The staff here were all very friendly and the service was outstanding.  The food was equally great with a wide selection of burgers, salads, pizzas, and other selections.  I opted for the poutine from the appetizer menu with added steak and grilled onions with a mixture of regular and sweet potato fries (a combo recommended by the staff), and it was the best poutine I've ever had!  Also, despite it being an appetizer, it was large enough for a dinner entree.  My wife had the steak salad and loved it as well!  My son also enjoyed his large Old Timer burger.Of note, this is a casual restaurant where you order your food from the counter and they bring it to you, but the servers kept coming back to refill drinks and check on us to make sure we had everything we needed.Overall, this place was great, and I would highly recommend stopping here for lunch or dinner when in Salt Lake City!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Incredible food! Great when my wife and I want to have some pizza cause she went vegan a few months ago and this place has vegan pizza!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: The Patty was fantastic, especially how they kind of curved the edges up a little bit to hold all the good stuff in there! Perfectly cooked and juicy burger on a great soft bun. ours was to go so the bottom bun was a little soggy. We chose the spicy one with jalapenos and Chipotle aioli, and it was a bit bland for our liking not very spicy, yet good. I got the chili cheese fries and my daughter got the poutine. they were both very good a little sparse on the cheese curds but otherwise great.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: When I hear the advertisements for this place they just talk about the burgers but, their pizza is so damn good I can't talk my self into trying something different. The pizza is perfectly thin and crispy with quality cheeses and toppings. Their curbside pick up is the bees knees. It is always quick and courteous.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I picked up my order and noticed I was missing cheese on  the fries and some sauces. I called to order more and they threw in four cookies/brownies and two "free entree" coupons along with the stuff I called for.. They have been so good with all orders and I love eating here no matter what. Amazing food and great, quality service!!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: They make you pay extra for Buffalo sauce then don't put it in the bag :(Food was pretty good though

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I am IN LOVE with this place. The picture on a delivery app drew me in, but the menu was just so impressive. I was particularly drawn in by the burger bowls as Im doing keto and my fiance pointed out they were selling a keto cookie, and let me tell you it almost made me cry because of how good it was (Shout out to day 4 employee who helped me out) I wish you guys were in SoCal because Im gonna miss you when Im gone and I definitley plan to stock up on cookies before I leave.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Did a curbside pick-up for the first time last night. As soon as we got there, they got out to bring our food. We got the burger salad and the carnita salad. It was so good! Will definitely be back to try out more of their food!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This place is great! We were greeted at the door by a really nice guy named Ryan who helped us decide what to order. He patiently took our order and showed us where we could sit. The food is delish. The western burger and the gravy burger for the bigs thumbs up. Also this place is clearly into diversity for all people. Lgbtq flags up and very inviting. Fun environment and decor. Personally I do not drink but the prices just about made me start back up. This is a new SLC must tucked up in the always fabulous Marmalade side of town.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Every neighborhood in America needs a place like this. A neighborhood spot. A spot where the food is simple but good. Where the owners are down to earth people. Where the vibe is come-as-you-are, come enjoy some time with us, come and get some food and a drink, no fuss.And this neighborhood especially needed Diversion. It's an up and coming part of town, but it's been hard to get food here. I tried to get deliver to Mountain West Cider once, and it turns out that this Marmalade area is a dead zone. Dead no more.Diversion opened late last year with little fanfare, but with a long pedigree of hospitality. It's owned by a couple (and by extension, their young family) who have put their heart and souls into making a spot where you can come to hang out. He has a long history of restaurant operations on a larger scale, and together the two of them have built a place where neighbors grab a bite.Wings, burgers, pizza--it's all pretty straightforward, but I haven't had a thing I didn't like. They have "Burger Bowls" which are like a regular burger, but the patty is a bowl shape and that's where the goodies and toppings live. I got the Western Burger and we also ordered a Burger Salad, which is a salad that has, you guessed it, a burger patty. Both were just what we needed.They have conversation starters on the wall, and pre-COVID they had a bunch of board games you can just use and play. They want folks to come hang out. They want it to be a social place. That's hard during social distancing, so do take advantage of pickup and delivery options right now. On top of all of this, they have a full restaurant license so you can get beer, wine, or spirits if that's your thing. There's a TV if you're headed to watch a game, but the bar section only seats a handful.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Ordered take out from Diversion first the first time and loved everything we ordered. One of the best options for take out that we've found right now!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I had their veggie burger and fries, and it was DELICIOUS! I definitely plan on coming back to try the rest of their menu (which offers a lot of options, I must say.) The food was great, the prices were fair, and the staff was very attentive. They also had these fun conversation starters on the walls that really added to the experience. Diversion is definitely a new favorite!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: locally owned and operated! this place has good beer AND delicious food... AND the staff are always incredibly nice, and genuine.they also do takeout, and deliver.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: First time here, but not last! (06/05/20) The staff was very friendly, helpful, and welcoming. The dining room is open seating up to 6 guests at a table. You can also eat outside. They were quick to clean up tables and I felt safe with all the precautions they were taking. My pizza came out piping hot, crust was perfect! My husband ordered the tacos with corn tortillas. They came out with flour tortillas. Once we made mention of it to the staff, they were so quick to correct it. They apologized profusely and remade the tacos. They even sent him home with a an additional order to go to make up for the inconvenience! They have only been open for 8-9 months. I really hope they make it. I love supporting small businesses where the staff go out of their way to make sure the customer has a positive experience!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Creative twist on an American staple. Their burger bowls are like burgers, but better. I ordered the troublemaker burger bowl and boy did it make trouble in my mouth in all the right ways. Will definitely be trying all of these magnificent burger bowls. It could be the death of me, but life is short, right?

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Fairly new, and cute placeFood: 3/5. Tastes are good. I wish they have a better plating done. Drink: 5/5. Absolutely amazing. Love the fact that they got a lot of option for the drink. Ambience: ?/5 they just reopen from the quarantine. It was empty but I can see there would be more people. Service: 3.5/5. Above average. I'm not complaining. But I wasn't sure they were providing decent service because it wasn't busy when I visited.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Awesome food! Very accommodating to a restrictive dairy allergy diet!  Burgers were huge, pizza was excellent! Staff was friendly and engaging. Will return!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: the food is alway horrendous and if it wasn't for the fact that i'm an alcoholic i wouldn't have gone there 3 separate times. the last time i went i got the bfast pizza and it left me with a nasty metallic taste in my mouth idk if it was the pizza with bad ingredients or the tin the serve it on but it was awful. also the main guy always tries to get me to order the burger bowl. no dude! it sounds awful! stop pushing it!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: The family was in the area after having a great visit to Toasted Barrel Brewery. I was planning on another location for lunch, but the son suggested Diversion. I trust him so we went.Fast Casual, Burgers, Tacos, Pizza, Ho Hum, Boring, yada, yada. People who know me know my dislike of fast casual places. It's full Gen X. Low card and Gluten free all over. I had incredibly low expectations.We were there Saturday afternoon. Things were slow. I got the Diversion Burger and fries. Do we get to pick how the burger is cooked? No. It's a thin burger can't do medium rare. Hmmm. We got a poutine. I noticed beer. Things were looking up a little. They have interesting local beers. It's not all Bud and worse. They have a full liquor license. I had them do a Manhattan. Excellent. Things are certainly looking up.The burger was moist even though cooked pretty much well done. The poutine was the best I've had locally. It even beats the last poutine I had in Ontario. The fries were excellent.For this old goat, who values proper dining and food, the food is excellent. They have a fine bar and beer selection. The owner/workers nice to talk to. I can be happy here. The son was correct in his assessment.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: They have a gluten free pizza crust which earned a 5 star review from my youngest son. My other son ordered tacos and said they were a solid 4 stars. My husbands old timer burger was pretty flavorless and the bun was mediocre. The fries were burnt so he gave it 2.5. My steak salad was the worst item we ordered. The tomatoes and veggies were soggy and the pre-made dressing was too sweet to eat. I don't know when they cooked the steak but it was unfortunately atrocious. It earned a generous 2 by our family's standards. We liked the atmosphere and the staff was very friendly and attentive. They even had a youth open mic night so we got to enjoy young local artists. We'd like to try it again but won't be back unless they adjust some of the recipes.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: The guys from Diversion came to our offices today and let us know they are in town. Their pizza is great! I will be a frequent visitor on my lunch break!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I dropped in on a whim wanting something different than Crown Burger and was not disappointed. Easy atmosphere, great Burger, prompt service, I hope it stays around for a while.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: The place had an enjoyable atmosphere with friendly employees who enjoyed their job. Great food with excellent presentation at a medium price range. Plenty of fries for the potato lover. Clean and well kept. We will enjoy eating there again. Beer and wine coolers for the ones that like that with their meal.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This place was unbelievable.  I was in Salt Lake City during a snowstorm and we ordered 3 specialty pizzas for delivery on Grubhub. They took 3 hour to get to us, but they were still amazing. We couldn't stop talking about them. They next day we went to one of the hottest new restaurants in the area. We had a couple drinks, a few appetizers and then right before we ordered our main course, we all agreed that nothing on the menu sounded near as good as another shot at Diversions pizzas. We asked for the check, saved our hunger for Diversion and man, did we make the right move. We ordered 2 pizzas and had some awesome beers. Having the pizza hot, out of the oven made it just spectacular. Our favorite was the Hawaiian.  The owner, who was awesome by the way, even gave us a few cookies on the house. They were fresh out of the oven as well. Just an unbelievable place.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I'm glad I gave this place a second chance. The first time I picked up food here I got a burger and poutine, and it was...OK.  I needed dinner tonight and I only live a couple of blocks away, so I decided to try it again and ordered a steak salad to pick up. And it was GOOD! I'm not sure why this place always looks empty. It's definitely worth a shot.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This place is new to the area but will likely become legend over the years. I traveled to Salt Lake on a business trip to shoot some marketing films. After receiving some pizzas from them for lunch on our film shoot we were blown away by how good the pizza actually was even though Grub Hub delivered it an hour and forty five minutes late. Later that night we had gone out to HSL, a restaurant that Yelp suggested was going to be awesome. As it turned out the three of us decided HSL was not awesome... so much so that we decided to leave after only having drinks and appetizers. After leaving we started to talk about the pizza that we had for lunch. We all decided we should actually go to Diversion to try the pizza again and see what it was like fresh out of the oven. Not only was it incredible but all three of us were able to have food and drink for the price of one entree at HSL which I believe is overrated. I am glad we changed our plans and went down the street for dinner. It is more enjoyable when you go into a place like Diversion where the owner greets you at the table, and the staff doesn't act like they are so posh. Diversion also had live music playing inside which made for a cooler experience. After growing up in Western New York where pizza is king living in Los Angeles for over 5 years and now in Florida for over 10 I'm confident I can say that the northwestern corner of the US up there in Salt Lake City has some of the best pizza in the country, as long as you are eating at Diversion a Social Eatery.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Great food! Great Customer service! And wounderful live music We are staying right down the street and are from out of town so this place was very convenient. So glad we gave it a try. Definitely will be back

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This was my first time at Diversion A Social Eatery and there were  a lot of positive but also some negatives about this place. At first I thought it was more of a sit down order type restaurant which it was not. You w Ent up to the front and  ordered you ur food and drinks. I ordered the steak fries putine which was absolutely amazing!!! The steak was super tender cooked to perfection. The gravy they used was spot on and the egg was icing on the cake! The food came out super fast. Customer services was really great. Now the down falls... we went when they had a band playing which was cool and all but there was no room for conversation with the peers I was with. We literally were yelling at each other when we were trying to talk. Another thing that actually bugged all of us is they had the option to order Champagne for Mimosas. Usually at other brunch spots a bottle of Champaign is usually $13-$15 for a bottle that also comes with juice of your choice. Well here a bottle of champagne was $20 and on top of that it didn't come with juice... like you had to order and pay for the juice which a surprise to the whole table. My advise for this place is if someone is going to buy a $20 of champagne for mimosas... include the juice. Don't charge them extra for it. Also it was a small glass of juice. Unless you want to ratio of your mimosa 90% champagne and 10% juice, you're going to run out of juice after making 3-4 mimosas and then will have to order more juice. All in all 3 out of 5 stars. Food and customer service was great. Other things.... no so much.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Delicious and fun! The double cheese pizza is so so good. Also got the tacos which were great with the salsa. They had board games which I loved! Also a fun live music line up for the week. What a fun addition to this area. We will definitely be back!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Really great food and beer selection at this place! I wasn't sure about the premise. I mean, aren't all restaurants social places to hang out? But now that I've been here finally I think I get it. I think what they were going for is a place where people of all ages are free to hang out with their friends and family. There are a lot of places in Utah that people hang out at but most of these places are bars and because of Utah's strict laws, you can't bring your kids or your friends who are underage. Even though this place is all ages, they have a huge selection of alcohol and even sell shots! I like the chill atmosphere and the wait staff are very attentive (almost too attentive!). They also have a huge selection of non boozy drinks and even have kombucha on tap!The menu is a little overwhelming, I think they're trying too hard to please everyone with it but the good news is that if you have any dietary restriction, they are likely able to accommodate you. I also feel like the name is a little too literal and is a little bit of a turn off. I mean, in it's attempt to be extremely descriptive, it's actually not descriptive of the kind of food you can expect. The kind of food they serve is similar to a regular burger place but with a million options of how to serve it to accommodate various dietary restrictions. If you don't have any dietary restrictions, you'll probably be happy just ordering the daily special or a plain burger. I ended up ordering the plain burger but substituting for dairy free cheese (because dairy doesn't agree with me), and I was actually pleasantly surprised by the quality of everything!This is a great place to go to if you are with a large group of people and everyone wants something different and are different ages and what not. There's something for everyone (literally) and while you're not likely to have the best experience of your lives, no one in your group will have anything to complain about.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Great establishment up in Marmalade District. Plenty of seating. We came on a Monday and it was open mic night. So fun to have live music while we ate. Everything we had was delicious. Poutine Fries, chips and quac, and the steak salad was so tender and juicy. Prices were very reasonable  and there's is plenty of parking.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Great food at an even better price. Staff clearly care and are very accommodating to dietary restrictions such as gluten free and dairy free.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Such a wonderful addition to the Marmalade neighborhood! Everyone was incredibly friendly and there is something for everyone on the menu. Lots of vegetarian options, as well as high-protein options, too. There aren't very many places in Salt Lake City where you can get a cocktail in a casual atmosphere with your kid. They had games for us to play and everything was tasty. Down to earth and delicious! We will definitely be back.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Diversion is an awesome concept. We need more places like this. It has been on my list to try after I discovered what it was. I would drive by regularly squinting to try to read their sign from the street. After some Yelp detective work I discovered that it was indeed a new eatery of sorts which is a novel idea for this particular area. Last Saturday night we decided it was time to give it a try after being dejected by multiple over-crowded restaurants downtown. We showed up just a little bit after 8PM. Besides us there were a group of three gentlemen at the bar glued to some college hoops on TV. There was Jazz game and UFC fights that were also happening at that moment. This is definitely not a fight venue, but the staff was happy to oblige changing one of the channels to the Jazz while we waited. The staff was boisterously outgoing and helpful. They were kind enough to run us through the menu offering multiple suggestions after discovering it was our first visit. The burger bowls didn't seem very appealing to me so I went with the Old Timer minus red onions. My date tried the Aloha pizza. We also ordered chips and salsa with guac. My date wanted to try the sweet potato fries. However, they decided to include those with my burger instead of the fries I ordered which was a bit of a disappointment for me. Also our chips came with just the guac and no salsa, but this was easily overlooked as the guac was super delish.  Their beer selection was slightly better than average focusing mainly on Salt Flats brews. We decided to get our order to go as we had enough fun for that particular evening. We waited about 20 mins as our selections were crafted exclusively to order. While we waited a couple DoorDashers came in, but that is about it, sadly. The ambiance is obviously centered around socializing. There are cool talking points hanging on all the walls and there are social games that you can play with groups. Excellent concept. If this place were around a few years ago when I was in my 20s we would have hung out here all the time waiting for the clubs to open. They close at 10PM otherwise it would have been the perfect after hours spot. My burger ended up being pretty good. My date was a little underwhelmed by the pizza and the sweet potato fries were too cold and soggy by the time we got them home.Our chips n guac, pizza, and burger came to just under $25 so the price is definitely reasonable. We obviously ordered poorly for our first visit. We will be back to sample the tacos, wings, nachos, and poutine for sure. Looking forward to updating this review.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: We randommly  stopped by wHile waiting to pick up my daughter and hEr friends from gateway. The cHeeseburger pizza was really good and the open mic and games make for a really fun atmosphere. I think  I'll be stoppping by for taco Tuesday.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Been living in Marmalade For 5 years and have been waiting for something fresh and new, sadly this  isn't it. It comes off as if it's bagged and frozen. For the same price I could drive a mile and get what I really want. The direction is off. Let's step it up before you turn into the subway that disappeared. Went a couple of times to see if it was an off day. Every day's off.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Marmalade has been waiting years to have a neighbor gem like Diversion to swoop in and rescue us from nearby fast food eateries. Unfortunately, I feel they missed the mark. For the price I would expect better quality beef and seasoning, especially because that's the competition in this hood. Nothing I tried tasted unique or made in house. The only enjoyable menu item is the number of brews and the garlic wings. Diversion team, invest in good tasting food, invest in the R and D! Marmalade needs this!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: No complaints here! The frysauce was bbq based and sooo good. Regular fries were good too! (Im pretty sure they had cheese baked on! Will definitely be back.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Service was great, but that was about it. Burger was okay. Wings were the fattyest I've ever seen. I had a hard time finding any meat in them. Menu is well written and looks appetizing but leaves you disappointed after the food arrives

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This is a great addition to the Marmalade area of SLC.  They're menu is delightful.  We need more restaurants with great salads, Poutine and incredible burgers.  It's also counter service, that doesn't skip out on service over all, which is nice to have.My only suggestion, is that the name doesn't stick out in my head.  I literally cannot remember it whenever I want to suggest it to my friends.  I have to open yelp and look it up.  I kind of get the reference, but it's not speaking restaurant to me.  I'll be back.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I am absolutely saddened to have to leave such a low score. We have been here once before and enjoyed everything about it. To break it down into categories. Service: 5 Stars - the girl that helped us was very sweet and kind. Ambiance: 4 Stars Casual and relaxed. Fun art on the wall and clean.Price: 3 Stars Reasonable and fair.Food: 1 Star!!! The pictures turned out great. The taste is where everything went south. The Steak Tacos were covered in "old" (bagged) cabbage that was brown and dry and had grated carrot that was so dried up, they were almost chalk white. The tortillas were brittle and dry and the steak was filled with fat and undercooked . My wife took two bites and that ended her meal. The poutine gravy was so salty, we ate less than half of the portion... Finally, the Old Timer (veggie burger version), was average. Typical frozen patty and not much to it. Oh Diversion.... I am sorry to be so blatant and honest,  but you deserve legitimate feedback, so you can improve. I really hope you can turn it around. Tonight was a rough one and I truly wish you well.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I loved eating here, they had live music playing, a section filled with games to play, and the food was so good I definitely recommend it to others

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Nice to see a new place come to the neighborhood, perhaps my expectations were too high. My comments will be broken down into 3 areas: food, service, logistics. FoodBurgerNot bad, but not great and you had to pay for fries..not a fan of the concept PizzaOkay. Crust wasn't great. I happen to like crust, call me crazy-this was limp leaning towards soggy. Buffalo sauce had a good kick which helped me get over the weakness of the crust. Salad Nothing special. Looked like a bag of premixed salad from smith's was dumped in a bowl but the carnitas on top was actually super delicious. NachosGreat as a app-wish they had a haft side optionService Very attentive. This is fast casual so there wasn't a need to check on us at all. But they did and they were both very awesome and kind to do so. Logistics Lots of parking which is super helpful especially when your meeting a group-which they are great for. They had a 'specials' menu but you couldn't even see it until you sat down. Which was a total bummer because I came on a Tuesday, which is taco-Tuesday and I didn't even see that was a special until after I ordered. The biggest downside to me of it all was the menu it's self. You walk up and it's so overwhelming that I didn't even know where to look first. Way too much going on and there was no story...I wasn't even sure  how to describe what kind of food they have without just listing it all off? Good luck to this place, I know it's only the beginning.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Ambience is great. Design is modern. Staff overly friendly. Main issue was value prop of the food.For the price, the food leaves a bit to be desired. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. I thought I ordered safe by picking two things from the daily specials (usually daily specials are popular items designed to make repeat customers, even if it is only once a week).I tried the pizza(Monday special) and the wings (Wednesday special). Again, for the prices I've had better food experiences. I did like the water.From the gist of things I'm thinking that the burger bowls are their main thing, but I didn't even see one on the daily specials.I really hope they improve with time. I will probably go back sometime to give it another shot for two reasons:  1) it's right next to a Quench It (my fave soda place) 2) I really want to see their success.More detail on the food.Pizza: I'm pretty easy going. I need to be wowed by at least one of the key pizza elements, dough, sauce, toppings. I thought all 3 were just ok.Wings: I'm picky. There's not a lot to wings, the wing itself and the flavor enhancer i.e sauce or rub. The wing must be perfect. I thought the wing was too soft, maybe even soggy. It looked very satisfying, but biting into it wasn't as satisfying. I don't think the wing would be any good eaten by itself, which this is the most telling attribute. The flavor enhancer was good, I got the jalepeño rub.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: The pizza was so good we got it 2 times in one day!!! So glad to have a great neighborhood restaurant with great food and beer.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Super friendly and warm service- Had a Buffalo Chicken Pizza and added 3 fried eggs-It was redic yummy..We will go back for Mimosas' (3$) on Sunday. Place was clean A+ restroom score! Currently waiting on Grub Hub to deliver some wings & steak salad! To be continued....I'd dock a cpl stars after our take out food experience but I like the people!...So...if you HATE onions like me, you should probably declare an ONION ALLERGY...(Sadly the steak salad was drenched in white onions when we asked for No Onions)...Wings were the kind with soggy fatty skin...Not at all crispy).

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: My husband and I came here on a whim when we were looking for burgers after Christmas light searching. It was Monday night, which is apparently their open mic night... I love open mics. The sound was really good. I don't know if they knew the artists but the musicians were incredible, so lovely. The burgers were amazing... we are burger connoisseurs and they were real solid, meat was very tasty. You don't get fries with the burger, just so you're aware, but I didn't mind because I don't ever eat the fries anyway. Also ordered the hefeweizen on tap, it was very very good, slightly citrus-y and had an aftertaste like a pretzel. We are going back for the Thursday music night after our gym time, apparently some of the open mic artists we heard are playing then. The owner was talking about a 'burger bowl' which I really want to try on Thursday. He also gave us a complimentary cookie, which was so so good, slightly cinnamon-y and so warm and slightly gooey. Already have plans to go back, we just moved here and we have been trying to find good restaurants!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I work near this restaurant and have passed by it for several weeks. Today, my department and I ate lunch here, and WOW! We feel so lucky to have a phenomenal eatery near us. I had The Motz with chicken breast, and the chicken was excellently seasoned and perfectly moist. My colleagues loved the Cave Man pizza on cauliflower crust. I'm looking forward to visiting again with my vegetarian and keto friends and family because I saw so many options to fit their dietary needs. Fairly priced, delicious, definitely a must-try.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I just one of the most basic and delicious burgers of my life. Everything from the ingredients to the excellent bun was amazing.I'm sure that you could fancy it up, but why when the basics are done so right.I also had an excellent local stout that suited my burger to a "T".  Go here and enjoy classic excellent food.It occurs to me that I used the word "excellent" too many times, but I just came away...blown away.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Had the cheeseburger pizza twice in a 1 week period. #noshame #writingthismademewantitagain

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Almost missed the location as the signage is very hard to see but glad we took another look and did the u turn. The burgers very terrific as was the service.  The burgers were juicy and cooked to perfection. The sweet potato fries were just right as well. The staff was as helpful and pleasant  as possible.  Would love to make this a regular spot but unfortunately we live over 2000 miles away in Atlanta.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: I went last night for the first time. First thing was you can tell the owners really try and the interior looks nice. The menu has a lot of different options and I had the veggie burger with sweet potato fries. The food was delicious and I definitely left satisfied. The acoustics were a bit loud but you can tell it's a fun and satisfying atmosphere and I'll go back and support for sure.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Yea food was very good and its a cool place to get drinks and chill out with some buddies. I was a fan of the food they had on offer and its a great place for the friendly staff and chill atmosphere. Its somewhere in between a sports bar and a place to grab a bite. I would recommend it for a casual dining experience.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: This is my fourth visit to Diversion and exceeds my expectations every time, my favorite menu item so far has been the Troublemaker Burger Bowl, another nice addition has been the local beers and spirits they have brought in!  Welcome to the neighborhood.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Stopped in tonight and enjoyed the buffalo chicken salad and the aloha pizza. The staff was super friendly and offered us a free cookie. We will definitely be back!

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Loved our first trip down; great atmosphere, and I personally love how they bake their menu options. Another unique aspect is Kombuchu on tap,- strawberry basil was amazing, but the vanilla option was a close second. I'd recommend Diversion as a great local place to check out.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Let me just say to start, the food at Diversion is delicious!  Reinvented American casual cuisine is very trendy right now and I'm all on board. Gourmet burgers, unique pizzas, gorgeous salads, tacos, wings, and a beer and cocktail bar!  All of that is great but I'm still thinking about the gravy-smothered fries with cheese curds.  And I'm salivating.   OK...I'm obsessing about those fries.Diversion is an "order at the counter, seat yourself in the brightly-lit dining room" kind of place, like a fast-food restaurant.  But what sets it apart from all the others is the creatively constructed menu, along with a beer and cocktail bar.  (I had a lovely cocktail) And Kombucha! (Extra points for serving Kombucha on tap!) There were some low carb and gluten-free options, that I did not try this time.  (I'll update my post when I get around to trying those. I have some food allergies would cause me to be interested in these modifications.)The only drawbacks to me were:  how bright the dining area is, which makes it feel more like a lunch place, even though the food was clearly great for dinner too.  And also, there is a couple of big screen TV's.  Surely sports fans will love this, but TV draws my attention away from the people I'm with, and therefore I don't care for them.  I really love many of the unique one-off restaurants in downtown Salt Lake City, and Diversion does not disappoint.  I'm looking forward to going again with friends.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Best burgers I've had in Salt Lake. The owners & staff are awesome. Nice alcohol selection as well.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: It's a solid 4 opener that I expect to trend upward. For full disclosure, I attended a yelp elite event a Diversion and will let the 40 other people wax on about the all the normal things. Diversion is attempting produce a modern public house; a meeting place intended for casual food, drink and socialization..... and yes, that is different than a bar. The public house is more of a European tradition and akin to the brauhaus of German. While competition from places like Beer Bar, Fischer, and The Garage place a strong emphasis on the over priced alcohol gut busting meals, Diversion has aimed for a moderately priced evening that is fit for a number of social situations. This is a great place of your tinder date... or any first date... because it is moderate priced, has food and drink options, has games, and is purposely geared towards breaking the ice. I wouldn't be ashamed to bring people here from work for networking or the first stop on an all night bender. It is a great option for college students(if they are old enough) that want a group meeting away from campus and aren't interested in that greasy spoon on the west side of campus with walls covered with pictures of people nobody remembers or cares about. Quick note on food - it's good! Buns make the burger. Poutine... yup. Pizza is heavy on toppings and the crust is a bit thin for that. For this location, I would use a thick crust to make sure nobody leaves wanting.Quick note on booze - it's good! They have their own pilsner. It's unremarkable and very much a pilsner. The kind of beer that pairs well with most any food and won't make you smell like a brewery.The location is close enough to the city for biking and near a freeway entrance for people that own a home. There is off street parking.And finally, the complaints: The exterior sign is impossible to see at night. The interior has signs with cute ice breakers, but they are on clear plastic and difficult to read with my sniper eyes. So why 4 stars, because i'm going to hold out the last star for a return visit.... And that should say something about the level of interest. Cheers.

name: Diversion A Social Eatery
content: Great place! Had tried one of their pizzas and wasn't disappointed! My wife had their carnita salad, which she loved. The staff is super friendly as well.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: This restaurant is a little gem, delicious food! All fresh, flavors on point of authentic Asian cuisine.  Owner was serving the tables and she is super friendly.  Loved the experience, loved the food.  Will go back soon.  Recommend the drunken noodles and the ribs bowl.  The Japanese ramen was also great.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: This place was super cute and had modern feel. Even tho it was in the higher end of price, the food was amazing. Not only that they had great food the drinks were amazing as well. This place is definitely you can do for a cute date night, girls night, or even a family dinner. Please note it's kind of small and probably can't accommodate more than 7 people to a party!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Authentic and spicy. I love noodles and this place doesn't disappoint. I like a little spice and this took me just beyond my spice level. Which is good to do every now and again. My friends love loved it but they can handle more spice than me. We had the Tom Kom, boat noodles with short rib, crispy spring rolls, curry puffs and kao soi. All of it was tasty especially the appetizers. The portions were big and service was fast and delightful. Since they have so many options to try I would definitely come back and try a few other things.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Kicking myself for not trying this place sooner! Cute space first off. For all of us OG's this use to be the Tin Angel spot, right across from Pioneer Park. So, menu has your typical Asian/Thai cuisine, but all of it is delicious. There were 5 in our party this night so we got an array of food. Appetizers were curry puffs and crispy rolls. Everything was fried to perfection. Curry puffs are sometimes hard to get right cause the portions are off but that was not the case here; ratios were on point. Main dish I went with the Tom Yum Seafood Soup, so delicious! Packed with flavor and cooked really well. I got the mixed seafood version and the squid was nice and soft. Others at the table got the Boat Noodles and a curry dish which I hear were really good. We left with no food on the table, which is always a good sign. Overall, great experience - including the atmosphere and service! Highly recommend if you can't tell.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Food was delicious, fresh vegetables and noodles.  GF and Vegan noted on the menu.  Service was top notched.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: There are so many good local Thai Food in North Hollywood, so since we moved from LA to SLC, we were glad to find this place in Utah. We used to love coming here every weekend but we stopped dining in here since that one unpleasant experience that we had. We decide to only do take out service since then and today, I found a plastic piece on the bottom of my soup ( wasn't a plastic wrap tho) that I almost swallowed it . It hopes this will bring to their attention when prepping foods especially this noodle price is not cheap. Just please be careful !!!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Pho-king AMAZING!!!  Hidden gem in SLC. Everything on the menu is the best thing I've ever eaten.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: My favorite new noodle spot in SLC! I went twice in the span of two days. It's that good! The first time I went I ordered the Bamee Shrimp Wonton Soup. The egg noodles were really good and the shrimp wontons were very flavorful. The broth was very clear but lacked a little more flavor for me. Not the best but pretty good if you're looking for something light. I also ordered the curry puffs which are delicious! The next visit I ordered the Boat Noodles with Beef short ribs. It was outstanding! Best noodle soup I've ever had. It is their signature dish for sure. The sweet and spicy with the combination of the short ribs just hit the spot! Can't wait to go again!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Wow! We started with the Curry Puff which was flavorful, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Then we had the chicken noodle soup. This soup is spicy and they give you plenty of chicken. Very delicious!    We also ordered the Ramen which had a delicious broth and pork belly. We ordered through Grubhub and when it arrived it was packaged perfectly. The broth's where in a separate container and everything was cleanly and neatly organized. Very good presentation. We will order again soon.  We also did call the restaurant and the girl we spoke to was very helpful and thorough! Great job All around!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Good food and service in a neat setting looks like when weather is warm they open garage type doors.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: This food is hands down delicious! This is my first time coming to this restaurant and was greeted with a warm smile. For appetizers I got the curry puff and pork potstickers! The curry puff was such an interesting concept, but very delicious. I ordered a Thai tea which was pretty good! Then from my main course I got the ramen and drunken noodles. The drunken noodles were very fulfilling and they had multiple proteins options! As for the ramen, I wish I could of changed the protein but other than that it was very rich in flavor.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: We have eaten here several times and the food is always so good.   Tonight we got take out.  Soup is often not great to order take out but tonight was great.  My daughter got Pho and I ordered boat noodles.  Long drive home and soup was super hot and tasted great.  We love this place.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Takeout and eating here are so good, food is always tasty and the staff is always nice. I love their pad Thai and drunken noodles!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: This is such a yummy find in SLC. Their Yakisoba is amazing and I would highly recommend! Great drinks too.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Good food - good service - lots of parking - dining in available!  We began with crispy Larb ($8) - very good and tasty- then came the curry puff ($9) - tasty and yummy!The Boat noodles with Short Ribs ($16) was a bit sweet for me but the short ribs were fall apart tasty - everyone on the table enjoyed it! Pad See Ele ($13) was very good!  Lots of veggies with flat noodles Ramen ($13) on par with many ramen served here-  lots of good pork 2 1/2 eggs with some veggies Massamun curry ($13). Excellent-  will be ordered again served with a red bean rice!  We had it with chicken which was perfect-  good flavorService was attentive and good served timely and hot!  We will be back to try other menu items!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: We were craving noodles last night, so we ordered a couple bowls of the Bamee Shrimp Wonton Soup and some appetizers, and everything was delicious! The delivery was fast, the food was great, and we will definitely be ordering again soon!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Pho that hit the spot on a cold day. The apps were delicious too, cooked perfectly. The flavors of the pho and quantity were as expected and consistent.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: I was in a big nood mood for some reason while I was visiting Utah. I'm pretty sure the cold weather and snow had something to do with it. Anyway, what better way to warm your soul with some delicious and spicy Thai boat noodles?Kin Sen doesn't put blood in their boat noodles, if that makes or breaks anyone's decision. Blood certainly adds a layer of flavor to the broth, but I really don't have a preference either way. Regardless, the broth smelled fragrant and inviting. It was sweet and very comforting to sip and drink. We ordered it as spicy as possible, which definitely has a kick. Careful when drinking it otherwise you'll end up coughing up a lung like my fiancee.They did not skimp on the fixings like beef, gai lan, and meatballs. Initially I wished the portion was bigger, but throughout our meal, I realized that it was actually a pretty big portion because we were getting pretty full from just sharing it.Sad to say, the noodles were broken into bits and pieces... which also is kind of a pet peeve of mine. If the noodles were actual strands and al dente, it would've been more enjoyable.I've had much better boat noodles elsewhere, but Kin Sen makes theirs pretty good. I'm sure this is probably the best you'll find in SLC or Utah for that matter.Kin Sen Noodle Bar is definitely a one-stop shop for noodles. There's noodle soups, pan fried noodles, and even several rice dishes too. They have crowd favorites like ramen, pho, pad thai, and different renditions of pasta with Asian flavors/ingredients. There's sure to be something for everyone, no matter what kind of nood mood you're in.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: All around amazing experience and such fresh and amazing Pho' and great Pad Thai.... yum yum delish. Well recommend dining experience..

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Couldn't have been happier with the food. Curry puffs, Larb, Yellow Curry, and Raad Na were all delicious. The order arrived faster than estimated and was still piping hot. Can't wait to come here post-COVID.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Online ordering was easy to use and convenient. However, the restaurant did not handle our online order very well. We arrived a few minutes after the set order time. We drove up to the drive thru and they said they could not find our order although we had received an order confirmation about 20-25 minutes before arriving. They were able to find it and said it would take another 15 minutes or so.  It took 20 minutes before they completed our order without an apology for losing our order followed by cold service. There was a sticker on our bag that showed the initial order time so I'm not sure what happened. The food was decently good, we ordered the boat noodles with beef short rib boat noodles, pad spaghetti seafood, and rotee. The spaghetti seafood had way too many basil leaves that filled up a good chunk of the dish, I wish the dish also had a bit more seafood. The beef short rib boat noodles had good flavor but the noodles were too soft. We really enjoyed the rotee and the fresh fruit that came with it.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: A-mazing. Brought my 3 girls in tonight and we loved everything: the interior, the music, the staff, and especially the food. The curry puffs and pad Thai were delicious. The mango sticky rice was incredible. And our waitress was great, knowledgeable and funny. We'll definitely being going there again.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Discovered this place while visiting SLC and so glad we did! Would highly recommend the drunken noodles and wonton soup. Great place!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Food was AMAZING!  What was not amazing was the server rushing us out of the restaurant at the end of our me and getting snippy when we followed up with a sake order 15 minutes after ordering when there were less than 10 people in there.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
