content: Chicken teriyaki was not great and it would be helpful to have spice guides on relative heat index.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. First off, the waitress who was also the hostess was SO KIND! Very friendly, welcoming and bubbly. The atmosphere was really cool, small but felt warm and inviting. Service was fantastic! My son and I shared crispy rolls and chicken pad Thai, they were great! Very well priced. I cannot wait to come back!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Excellent service and excellent quality of food. The food also came out in a timely manner. It is a cool atmosphere and they did a good job at social distancing.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: What a gem! We came here because I'm a ramen guy and my wife prefers pho... Both were excellent! Their boat noodles stole the show though, mouth watering good. On top of fantastic food, the atmosphere is also great!  A cute place for a date or a small get together with friends. I cannot recommend this place enough, please go now!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: According to word hippo dot com, the meaning of kinsen translates to money, cash, and gold. Whether this was the intended meaning or not, in my eyes Salt Lake City you have hit jackpot with this new-ish nood bar! Noods, nudes, same same but different.Here we are, just suffering from an endless pandemic, an earthquake, hurricane winds, a divisive election, all the crazy karens, and literally just drowning in a pool of turmoil.BUT LOOK OVER THERE!!! Just sitting quietly across Pioneer Park is Kin Sen Noodle Bar! Shimmering in their magical pixie dust and cooking up an Asian persuasion storm with selections ranging from killer kao soi to mother pho-ing noods. And if you are a big ole weirdo who ain't into wet noods, then no worries they offer them dry stir fry variations too.Though I may still be drowning in misery like the rest of America, at least I can say I have it better than most with some Kin Sen in my life. Thank you for being that shining sparkle during these dark days.-Sailor out

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: So legit. I ordered the drunken noodles, and never knew that dish could taste so good. Perfectly flavored with fresh noodles, thai basil, veggies, etc. I'm so happy with my visit to this place. Everyone should try it.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: I don't even know where to begin on how good this meal was, and that's hard to do with to-go ramen. The portions were perfect, I definitely felt like I got my money's worth. The curry broth was seasoned to perfection, and I loved that the pepper sauce came on the side to add some extra heat. I got the chicken in mine and it wasn't like most places where you get a few slivers of meat. It was BONE IN chicken, 2 drums and a wing and the meat was perfectly cooked that it just fell off the bone. The pickled cabbage was delicious, I could have eaten it plain as a side. My boyfriend got the Boat and he loved his as well, it was delicious and unique from the Kao Soi. Will definitely be back, especially after a day of skiing! We also really loved the drive up window, especially during Covid. Convenient and quick!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Just had a wonderful dinner! I got the larb appetizer and split the khoa soi and the sukiyaki with a friend, the food was amazing. Fantastic atmosphere and our server Liz was amazing. She was so friendly and had delightful suggestions. Definitely coming back my next time in Salt lake!!!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: We were visiting SLC from San Diego. The food did not meet expectations; didn't taste authentic and was a bit bland. I could make top ramen taste better. The service was great though and the place itself was very cute!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: My friends and I got the pho to go and it was  good!! They gave us perfectly portioned sauces/bean sprouts/Thai basil to go which was super nice. Inside is super cute as well.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: I am super surprised with this place. This was on my radar and was super excited when I was able to convince my friend that we needed to go here for lunch. I can see parking being hectic during busy lunch or dinner time. We came slightly later and on the middle of the week, so parking was no problem. The interior design captured what a restaurant would actually be like in south east Asia. The windows was open, it was nice and warm. The food was amazing. I was glad we are able to get a more Thai "street food" style restaurant. The curry puff we ordered was so flavorful. The pastry was perfectly flakey and crispy. The stuffing was amazing and flavorful. It has a slight heat, and for additional flavor - the sweet Thai chili sauce. I got the boat noodle soup for my main dish. Super flavorful. It is also spicy, but I'm sure you can tell them no spice if you don't like it. I added more spice to mine cause I love the heat. The beef in my soup was medium to medium done. Perfect texture, but I'm sure you can request well done if you wanted. You could also soak it in the soup and have it cook a bit more in there. 5 yummy stars! And I definitely want to come back to try more stuff.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Excellent kao soi, good wines, great atmosphere in the old Tin Angel spot. Sit by the open garage door for the best feel. Good price point.Excellent place, just go!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Yesssssss! Boat noodles and the Curry Puff app were delicious.  The Kin Sen Mule? 5 stars!  I will be back anytime i come through SLC.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: My favorite new Asian noodle place in SLC by far. Finally  a legit place to experience the great flavors of Asia in a funky cool atmosphere. The flavors are off the charts and the menu has a little something for everyone. Best put my name on a permanent table as I'll be a frequent visitor. Delicious!!!!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: All I have to say is anyone that enjoys great flavor and incredible food come here ASAP! By far the best noodle/Thai/Asian food I have had anywhere in Utah. I cane with 3 friends and ordered family style. We ordered the boat beef noodle, drunken noodles, and a crispy noodle dish. All of the dishes were 5 star. I can see why my business partner has been here 3 times in the last week. Absolutely ridiculously good!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Food and service were amazing. I loved the pho, my wife ordered the boat noodle with short ribs and it's the best short rib I've ever had. This place is highly recommended

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: WOW!!! This place... I got the braised short rib boat noodle and it's insane! Makes my top 5 noodle dishes I've had in the nation. This dish is like the best Pho meets the best braised short rib Massaman you've had X10! I've found a new go to after this experience!Please go visit. They seemed slow wether Covid related or not who knows but they MUST survive! Staff here are also super sweet and accommodating and SO SO fast!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: I have come out of my retirement (yelp elite status) to review this restaurant because it's AHHMAAaaZInnnnggg!!! Let me start off with their patio. SO CUTE!  It is shaded and the tables are socially distanced which gives you that extra safe feeling and some privacy. They also have a beautiful interior that we can't wait to sit in when the pandemic is over. We had tom yum seafood noodle with shrimp and crispy pork with jasmine purple rice. The noodles in the soup is bean thread kind. Both are delicious including the hot crispy chicken curry puff we got as appetizers. They definitely do have some unique dishes that some other Thai restaurants do not have. We will definitely be coming back!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Forgot to write a review on this place from before. This is were the Tin Angel restaurant which has since moved to main street. Parking is still horrible here and that is where the negativity ends.We were greeted with a smile upon entering and quickly seated, they practice social distancing, they were PPE, they also provide hand sanitizer.The temperature outside was around 78 degrees and they had the outdoor windows open which let in a perfect breeze. The presentation on the food is appetizing and beautiful. My most favorite item is still their Kao Soi also spelled Khao soi or Khao soy. The curry broth is thick, and flavorful and the ample portion of the tender short rib is amazing! Can't forget the boat noodles, mango and pumpkin custard sticky rice were also amazing!Haven't had a single item where I wasn't totally impressed with, this is a fancy upscale Thai place and the prices are on point for the portions and quality.For sure will be back!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Wow, this was a delicious meal! Both dishes were phenomenal! We ordered Boat Noodles with short ribs and Khao Soi. Great ambiance and a nice breeze with the open windows. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff! I highly recommend Kin Sen!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Hands down the best Khao Soi I've had in the United States and especially in Utah, very close to the Khao Soi in Chiang  Mai, Thailand. I highly recommend this place, friendly staff as well

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: I've ordered takeout and dined in this place and really enjoyed both! Favorite dish I've had is the Kao Soi (sp?) noodle soup. It's a rich curry broth with a bit of spice and pickled veggies and it's oh so tasty. I got that one as takeout and surprisingly was not annoyingly set up like some other take out noodle soup or pho. Also the curry puffs are hearty and had a flaky puff kind of similar to a phyllo dough which was different. I will definitely be back!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Good food!!! Order several item on doordash! All taste good!!! Best Thai noodle in salt lake!!!!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: All I can say is yum yum yummmmm! Was in Salt Lake City for a night and was able to walk to this place from our hotel downtown. I'm so glad we did! This place hit the spot for my noodle cravings. I ordered the ramen and my husband got the drunken noodles - both were great! Drinks were tasty and refreshing. I love the little indoor/outdoor patio.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: We've dined at numerous Asian joints in Salt Lake and like each of them for various reasons. We tend to play it safe on our first visit, try the "one that got away" on the second, and take a leap on the third. Tonight was our first experience at Kin Sen. Our kind and attentive waitress was extremely accommodating and executed a perfect balance of privacy and service. We ordered Thai Tea, Gyoza, Drunken Noodles (chicken) and Pad Thai (chicken). I can say, confidently, that Kin Sen produced the most excellent serving of Drunken Noodles I have tasted to date. Everything else was superb, too. Presentation, taste, texture, all of it. We really enjoyed the meal, atmosphere, and service. The menu is reasonably priced, portioned, and varied.It will be difficult to knock this out of our Top 5 for Asian cuisine.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Everything was so good. We ordered steak and meatball pho, the chicken soup, shrimp wontons and yellow curry. Couldn't say one thing bad about any of these dishes. The service was very friendly and accommodating. They were wearing face protection and offer outdoor seating. Definitely a must try.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: 3 of us for lunch, all different items.  All very good and flavorful.  Small but intimate location.  Good variety of noodle or rice dishes.  Worth the visit.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Hubs and I got to-go yakisoba with chicken and pad thai with tofu. Cute spot, and COVID-19 protocols were diligently observed. Both noodle dishes were phenomenal. First, the food came HOT - had obviously been made to order. My pad thai was just the right amount of sweet, sour and spicy, and the toppings were fresh and actually added something rather than being obligatory. Noodles were perfect texture, which I noticed about those in my husband's dish as well. We will be back next time we're in SLC!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Okay, hands down: this is the best Thai food I've ever had. We ordered the popcorn chicken, crispy rolls, drunken noodles and Kao Soi. So flavorful and the perfect amount of spicy. The kao soi noodles were DELICIOUS. I'm still dreaming about that curry and crispy noodle they topped it with.I'm taking off a star because the service was not it. We had to go out of our way to ask for help with changing our order. The waitress was nice but we were the only people in the restaurant and she never once checked on us. Anyways, the food is A1 but the service not so much.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: We ordered the pad seafood spaghetti, short rib boat noodles, Tom yum, raad na, larb balls, curry puffs, and mango mimosa - everything was SO GOOD. The place is so cute and service was great. And they are open on Sundays  Will definitely come back.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: WOW...  the best variety of Asian noodles in Utah... KIN SEN Noddle Bar @ 365 w 400 s SLC, UT 84101  The authentic Thai boat noodles ( ) and Vietnamese Pho () were the best I've had in Utah... Oz Prat is one of the best Thai restauranteurs I know, she has trained at 5 Star resturants and has brought that great style, service with great classic Asian noodle recipes to this "hip" spot... It is like being in a cool noddle shop in Thong Lor in Bangkok, complete with "chill chill" acid-jazz cool tunes playing... (PLEASE open a Park City location!)

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Found this gem while visiting Salt Lake. Had the crispy pork and sukiyaki. Sounds like a lot for one person and it was but it was so good I couldn't decide which one to get. Glad I ordered both. The pork was crispy even after a delivery and the shrimp and noodles were piping hot on arrival. Can't wait to visit again. This will definitely be a go to while visiting Salt Lake.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: First time trying this place! Saw amazing photos all over IG and was intrigued with the idea of a variety of noodles! Majority of my favorite dishes were on this menu so I was excited to come and try it out! It is definitely located in an area that you can easily miss so just know it's on the south side of Pioneer park! I was happy to see that they had good parking in the back of the restaurant. They offer indoor seating along with patio seating! Cute little spot with cute decorations! I ended up getting the Kao Soi. It was yummy! I got mine with chicken and I loved how the meat just slipped off the bone! Made it easier to eat! Definitely will be back to try other things in the menu!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: This place is ~kinazing~ fosho. And serendipitous, too. I had just discovered the deliciously brothy, love-in-a-bowl dish that is khao soi the week before and had made a home version. When I saw Kin Sen had it on their menu, I had to try it! No regrets there. The soup was a perfect blend of red curry and coconut milk (arguably the best dairy out there), and the toppings were a lovely mix of savory and crunchy. The only critique I have is that it was a tad salty for my taste, especially with the pickled cabbage on the side, but it ain't no big. Would definitely come back and have another go at the menu.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: You'll be hard pressed to find an Asian who doesn't love their noodz. I think I first drove by this place before it was opened and I already couldn't wait to try it. I was so excited to see Khao Soi on their menu. When I went to Thailand, that was my absolute favorite dish. Kin Sen did not disappoint. The flavors were authentic, maybe the curry was a tad heavy, but still so delicious. I also loved the chili oil they give you on the side. Nice and spicy if that's what you're about. I had enough for two meals so with that in mind, the price was very reasonable. I can't comment on the atmosphere because we had it delivered in these COVID times, but I can say that the food was still hot when it came. My friends tried the drunken noodles and we shared some curry puffs. The curry puffs are so tasty. The drunken noodles were not bad, my friend thought it was too salty though. I look forward to trying their other dishes but don't know if I can resist getting the khao soi every time

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Great place for pad Thai.  I'm not by any means a con issuer of exquisite Thai cuisine but I know what I like when I get Pad Thai.  A little spicy, a little savory, a little sweet and tiny bit green bitter.  This place was spot on.  We got our food to-go, ya know Covid and all, ate at our hotel room around the corner and thoroughly enjoyed every bit.  The staff was super friendly and helpful.  The mango rice and Thai tea for dessert was most excellent!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Went in to get some take out. Saw the dining area was accepting dine in patrons. Next time I will dine in. Ordered Ramen, Pad Thai, and Pad Kee Mao. All of it was very good. Will be back again.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Wow! Our family was bemoaning the fact that Covid-19 made us scrap our annual trip to SE Asia when we stumbled upon Kin Sen and every dish just transported right there! From our first delicious spoonful of the boat noodles, khao soy, and the bamee shrimp wonton we were in heaven. Then, to top it off, we sampled two desserts - the mango sticky rice and pumpkin custard and couldn't get enough. Definitely come here. The food is delicious. The decor is adorable and the service is exceptional! We will be back often!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Nice interior, reasonably fast. I got the boat noodles which was very similar to pho but with different spices. It was delicious!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: It's my new favorite place for noddles, the flavors just let know how well made and fresh everything is. The place has a unique design just as what you will eat. I love it

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: The food is absolutely amazing! The owner O came to our table and chatted and she's an incredible person. Her personality speaks to the wonderful environment she created in the restaurant. The food is so good it's cravible. It's such a fun environment with great food and incredible staff.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: So tasty! I will definitely be back. Got the boat noodle with beef. Broth was amazing!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: This is my second time visiting and it was even better than the first. My waitress recommended an excellent dish, was able to substitute for dietary preferences, clean, beautiful dining areas (inside and out), I love their variety of different Asian cuisines and they have fun takes on a few classics (like their pumpkin rice dessert). Will definitely be dining here again and again. Thank you Kin Sen (and O my waitress)

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: We ordered delivery. When then pho came, it is all broken. Soup taste wired. Next time I'll go Vietnamese place.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Delicious, fun, creative fplace.. Had larb and beef drunken noodles, fresh flavors and portions great! Look forward to coming again next time in town. Indoor and outdoor seating great way to break out after stay at home orders .Bamee Shrimp Wonton Soup

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: One of the best Thai restaurant in town! We tried Pad Thai and Pho and both were sooo yummy! Very friendly staff , easy access parking. Highly recommended!!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Great food, fun atmosphere. Tried the yaki soba, drunken noodles, pad Thai, and massaman. All excellent.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: This place is amazing. The owner is a very familiar friend from an old restaurant.  The flavors were awesome, very homemade feel to their food and desserts. I would definitely recommend coming to check out. Thai Boat noodles were amazing as well as the drunken noodles. The fried larb was amazing appetizer.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Loved the Boat Noodles and Pumpkin Custard Dessert. Staff was very friendly and great location! I can't wait to come back and try some more.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: I've been excited to try Kin Sen since before they opened, and it was worth the wait! I ordered the Bamee Shrimp Wanton noodle soup and it was wonderful. The noodles, wontons, pork, and broth were all super stars and came together to make one of the best meals I've had in a while. I'm excited to order here again and try the rest of their menu!

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: Great noodle bar downtown with easy parking! Very friendly and the food was delicious. Try the boat noodles with beef and the crispy pork with garlic sauce. Highly recommend for something different! We'll be back.

name: Kin Sen Asian Noodle Bar
content: This place is delish! It's new so I decided to check it out. We got the crispy rolls, boat noodles and the pad see ew. My fav was the boat noodles! It's sweet, spicy and savory  the waitress was super nice and even asked us if the soup was too spicy. Which is nice because sometimes I go places and it's too spicy, but the food here was a perfect amount of spicy. They even gave us a free dessert, pumpkin custard and sweet rice. It might have been my fav part of the whole meal, so delicious.Go check this place out! It's new and definitely worth it. It's a cute, quiet place because they opened during COVID. Go show your support!!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This place is amazing! incredible Italian everytime we are in Salt Lake we go here!Jake Ellison the manager is amazing, incredible hospitality and love! I highly recommend this restaurant.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Some of the best food I've had in a long time.  Excellent menu, food, service, everything. We save it for special occasions but think about the duck and veal all the time. Place is a must

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We had a party of 6 and everything we ordered was the best food we have all ever had. It's a long list but the shrimp, lobster, duck, veal, raviolis, and truffle pasta was the best we have ever had. Highly highly recommend this place! Will eat here whenever I get the chance. Great service also

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Cucina Toscana really makes you appreciate the exceptional service and quality of food we have here in Salt Lake, especially when you travel away.  I recently visited Sedona Arizona and experienced the worst service and marginal food at higher than resort prices.  Instead of reaming those restaurant, I decided to take the high road and praise one of my favorite local restaurants, Cucina Toscana.  Truly one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever had the pleasure of dining at. I highly recommend this restaurant for it's quality service, exceptional Italian food and elegant setting.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: The food at Cucina Toscana is beyond perfect. The service is great and the waiters and waitresses are extremely helpful. Very elegant, clean and a wonderful atmosphere. I cannot wait to go back!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This restaurant is a must go. Located in a historic Firestone building this restaurant provides a perfect modern twist to fine dining. The staff was knowledgeable and hospitable all in all extremely warm and helpful. I appreciated the attentiveness of the staff to detail. My personal favorite was the Caesar salad which was prepared table side by the server out of fresh ingredients. The next course I had was the Chicken Parmesan  and when I say it was incredible I am under selling it! The chicken itself was perfectly crisped with a delicate spicy marinara sauce with mozzarella melted across the top. I couldn't put my fork down. To top the meal off I had to try the cheesecake. I was informed that the cheesecake is made fresh from scratch and man could you taste it. It felt like the smoothest, richest cake I have ever tried with the crispest cheese taste. All in all the meal was wonderful, the staff excellent and setting immaculate would highly recommend.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: You're better off at Olive Garden.At the time of writing, I'm 45 minutes into my dining experience, with no food. Our reservation was for 7pm on a Friday evening. We waited 10 minutes to be seated, and now I understand why. It took the sever 10 minutes to even acknowledge our table and bring water. He came back about 10 minutes later to take our drink order, which he failed to get correct anyway. The wine glasses were dirty as well. We were brought a meager amount of bread (maybe a slice divided into 4 tiny pieces) that was cold and relatively stale. 50 minutes later out server finally took our appetizer and dinner orders. The food ended up being pretty mediocre, with their "charcuterie and cheese board" being literally 4 grapes, some prosciutto, and a couple pieces of cheese, all of which was pretty standard fare. When the main entrees actually arrived (an hour and a half after we were seated) it was really mediocre, with my "spicy" gnocchi being absolutely foul and the sauce straight out of a can, and the ravioli overcooked and sad looking, served off a rickety table with a used dish towel near my food, not to mention the server removing his mask several times to talk to us and other tables. It's obvious that their failing health grade was earned. There appeared to be a general manager of some sort walking around, which he felt appropriate to both 1. Not help a clearly overworked and understaffed team 2. Wear his AirPods the whole time.The sever eventually acknowledged (yet didn't apologize) for the wait, claiming it was because there were too many patrons without reservations, despite us having a reservation.This restaurant used to be one of my favorite Italian places in Salt Lake, but unfortunately this service was so bad and the food not even good enough to justify it, I won't be coming back and wouldn't recommend it. It must be new management or something because it's really such a different experience than the one I'm familiar with in the past.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I have a very high bar for restaurant dining, and this restaurant exceeded my expectations.  The food was to die for...   I had started with the caprese prosciutto and it was fantastic.  For my main course I had a Chicken Parm which was one of the specials the waiter proposed, and it was incredible.  Not your average Chicken Parm -- the chicken was extremely tender and flavorful.  I would also highly recommend the Chocolate lava cake.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to my family and friends!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We are from out of town and Cucina Toscana came HIGHLY recommended from friends. We were not disappointed! The food was INCREDIBLE and the service was wonderful! I ordered the Tutta Pasta Grande and it was amazing! The gnocchi in particular was delicious, as was the burrata appetizer. But the best thing on the menu was the lemon gelato! The fresh lemon juice, the salt, and the honey drizzle.... it was HEAVENLY! Definitely plan on coming back next time we are in town.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I have never written a review, this my 1st!  If You don't want to read all I wrote, Bottom-line: This Restaurant offers Fantastic service with outstanding meals!!!My Ladies BD is Dec.31st, we usually go out for her special, but Covid we were uncomfortable dinning in.  We called several restaurants to arrange take out, ALL expect Cucina Toscana said they were not offering New Years Eve! I must acknowledge & say "JOE" the person I made contact with on the phone was exceptional!  Our order was placed for an early pick-up (6PM), Caprese e Prosciutto, Barbabietole Insalata, Piccata di Pollo Limone, Ossobuco di alla "Piedmontese! Joe went above & beyond texting me when our meals were ready for pick-up.We totally enjoy our meals with some left over for another meal, Our complements to the Chief!!!I look forward to being able to dine in for what I believe will be a Wonderful experience, Plus I look forward to seeing JOE and the excellent staff he was working with on Dec.31st, Happy New Year!!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: One word AMAZING ! Incredible service thanks Luis. You feel so welcomed since you open the door. They get your coats, they are on it. Delicious food! Amazing wine. Being there was so special. We celebrated my friends bday and they brought her the dessert of her preference with a candle on. They took pictures of us at the very end and we just said goodbye like a family. It was an amazing cozy welcoming experience. I'll go back whenever I visit Salt Lake City again. I'm from San Diego but I've never had such an amazing experience on any restaurant here in my own city. P.s they also prepare your Caesar salad in front if you.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: My second time visiting this restaurant in a week and found it to be quite delicious and amazing.Made reservations on OpenTable both times and things couldn't have ran smoother. We had 3 servers to our table as did the rest of the guests sharing the same group of workers.The main server was so knowledgeable on all of the ingredients and preparation. Food came out in a timely manner all made from scratch and delicious.Not a single complaint from my picky hard to please little brother and his wife.Exceptional food, service, ambience, and warm welcoming staff with a smile.For sure will be back!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We had an amazing date night! We were seated right away for our reservations and Margherita, our waitress, was amazing. She made the best caesar salad table-side we've ever had! The food was amazing all around, I can't say enough great things about this restaurant. We will be back soon!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This place was amazing!! And the food was absolutely delicious!!My girlfriend and I were visiting Salt Lake City for my birthday trip and decided to give this place a try after reading all the raving reviews. The atmosphere and service was awesome. our server, Maggarita(?) (I'm sorry if I butchered the spelling here!) was super attentive, helpful and patient with us as we navigated the menu. I had the Lamb Shanks and my girlfriend had the Ossobuco (ribs), both the dishes were soooo good.The lamb absolutely blew me away, it was so flavorful and cooked to perfection! Definitely a must-try!The ribs literally fell of the bones and was also really good.They're open for dine-in during covid with the tables being really spaced out so we felt pretty safe dining-in.If you're just traveling through, or live in the city you definitely can't miss out on the food here. (This is definitely a go-to spot for us now anytime we're in SLC!)

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Yesterday was a great experience and excellent service, thank you Margarita for making our visit a great moment

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I wanted to like this restaurant - but a number of factors came together to make a horrendous experience. The wait after we sat down was very long, when we were offered bread the young man did not appear again for another half hour. Our waitress was polite and doing the best she could but the food took extremely long. We would not have minded as we were having a good time with our drinks, if it wasn't for the screaming child. The table next to us had a toddler that screamed the entire time we were here, meanwhile his parents were our on the patio photographing themselves in the couch with their drinks. I would have expected the restaurant to proactively tell these parents to either control their child or simply leave, an upscale restaurant that charges comparatively upscale prices is not the place to bring a toddler, much less leave one alone at the table to take some pictures for Instagram. We appreciate out waitress apologizing for the noise and giving us a small plate of ice cream - but we expect the restaurant to proactively protect the experience of all guests. Not that of entitled parents who think their gram and personal freedom is more important than common decency.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I returned to this restaurant after many years' absence, only to find its atmosphere unrecognizable. It used to have classic decor and be an established fine dining restaurant where you'd be embarrassed to wear shorts and a tee. Now it is a modern establishment and has many guests dressed casually. A homeless woman who was probably psychotic entered and was yelling and swearing about the heat. A manager carefully attended to her needs until she left and kept her away from guests. Despite these distractions, the food was amazing. We enjoyed mouth-watering handmade pasta, Caesar salad made at our table and delicious cannoli as pictured. Our waiter was funny and attentive. I think next time I'll order to go.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: My family and I tried this Italian restaurant as we are passing through Salt Lake downtown. We had a late dinner.  My kids loved the  three cheese white pasta sauce, So ridiculous delicious. The restaurant was clean, staff was friendly and every one working there was wearing gloves+mask.Not from here but so worth to try this place.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Waaaaay overpriced for the quality. The bread was mediocre and bland, the vegetables didn't taste fresh, the meat was meh, the sauces were ok, the service, all of it was mediocre. I wouldn't be so rough if it wasn't so expensive and branding itself as super upscale. I went there with my girlfriend to celebrate something and it was a total waste. Would hope for prices to lower or stars to reduce below 4

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Steven R was our waiter and he did awesome!! The food was amazing and he gave us great service.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: It took me a while as a Salt Lake resident to finally make it out to Cucina Toscana but man am I glad I did. The manager was beyond kind to my girlfriend and I. Our server Kayla was great at explaining the dishes and making sure we were making sound selections for dinner. If you are looking for yummy Italian food and an intimate environment to enjoy it in, CT might be just what you're looking for.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We dined here for Valentine's Day and although we were caught off guard on the prix fix menu; everything was delicious; but the real standout was the service.  From the manager to our waitress, every one was so engaging and professional.  We checked in and our reservation from Open Table did not go through; the manager told us not to worry and made up a table for us.We made a toast to Cupid over a bottle of Veuve Clicquot as we pondered our selections.  We both started with the Caesar Salad and asked for anchovies, which she provided generously on a side plate. The salad was simple yet delicious.  For the second course, I had the gnocchi arrabbiata and my partner had the ravioli with ricotta and spinach. From the first bite you knew that the pasta was made in-house; it was perfect.  Both dishes were properly sauced, had just the right amount of heat and perfectly al dente.  We both wanted seconds.Our waitress recommended a lovely bottle of Chianti to go with our dinner; and it was perfect selection.For our entrees, I had the veal saltimbocca and J had the lamb; although good they were just too salty and after a few bites we couldn't finish.  The manager came over and saw our plates and asked if everything was okay; we mentioned that it was slightly salty.  He immediately whisked them away and had them remade for us.  This is service.  The dessert was a nice ending to a well rounded meal.  Once again, the evening was all about the service.  Our waitress was fun, she was lively and engaging.  She had such a playful personality and she made our evening.  The manager, walked the restaurant and was so attentive to his guests.  You could tell he took absolute pride in his job and restaurant and it showed.We weren't able to finish our bottle of wine; so we gave what was left to our lovely waitress so she could enjoy it with her Valentine after her shift was over.We will definitely be back on our next trip to SLC.For a fun read, please read my review on Bambara.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Simple, modernistic style with a touch of elegance lets you know that the place is no Denny's. We were seated in one of the seats that run parallel to the street and the large windows that provide a view of the entire street make you feel as if you're dining outside on the patio without breathing car fumes. A nice selection to dine while chatting and mindlessly people-watching. Food is good. Nothing extraordinary or spectacular but delicious enough to enjoy. Service is excellent. The server came by regularly to check and to refill water. A decent list of wines. We particularly enjoyed the South African red wine. I would highly recommend it if you happen to visit this establishment and enjoy wine. Parking can be a bit of an issue, as there is no designated parking. We had to find a pay street parking. It can get tough but it is downtown.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Cucina Toscana never disappoints!!! We went for an early Valentines dinner and had a perfect evening! Ask your server for the off menu cheese plate. The cheeses are all imported from different regions of Italy and are an experience you won't forget. You can't go wrong with any of the entree choices. We had the beef medallions and they were so tender and flavorful they practically melt in your mouth. For dessert you have to try the lemon sea salt gelato... unlike any flavor I've had before.... your taste buds will thank you!!!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I held a business dinner there. The room rental was $150 which was not bad. They were very accommodating and had a private room for my party of 11. There were two issues I had #1 the floor and rugs were all dirty and needed vacuuming which was kind of gross. #2 The waitress said she would bring in a variety of appetizers which were good, however she also brought a $28 mid corse pasta sampler out for everyone that I never asked for. The food was good but I feel like the waitress should have asked to do a mid coarse. There was a little bit of a language barrier with the waitress also so I am sure that contributed to the situation. All in all it was $1,500 for the night. Felt a little hood winked with the addition of the mid coarse. I will look for a different place to do business dinners in the future.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Great food!!! Great atmosphere and Great service. I will be back when I am in Salt Lake!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Food was very good. Margarita was an amazing, attentive server. The duck was so good.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: The service here is absolutely incredible. However, I don't think the price matches the food. I got the carbonara and it was just so so. My fiancé got some sort of asparagus ravioli that tasted really funky. Also they charge for water. A large large amount for water. And their chocolate cake  tasted like it was made from a box. Waaaay overpriced. Go to Bona Vita instead

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Every dish I have had has been amazing. The staff are always top notch. The chef has some mad skills. The atmosphere is inviting and romantic.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: With so many restaurants to choose from, how do you select one? One member of our group said,  "There's a place I'd like to try..." and without reading Yelp reviews, there we were.Beautiful vintage building, white linen covered tables, and a virtually empty dining area greeted us. This is the old Firestone building, hence garage door windows. Food was delectable. Portion sizes were that of the "fancy food" just-a-taste. Three asparagus raviolis with a superbly crafted sauce,  and a handful of gnocchi was $29.  Value for cost was not there in that even in "overpriced Park City",  this would have been less or portion size more.Two guests ordered a seafood special, exclaiming the halibut perfectly done.Caesar salad was the exception - I found it overpowering with an awfully strong anchovy and  Worcestershire flavor. I pushed the plate away after a grimacing taste. Desserts were heavenly.Servers wore numbers, instead of names. Ours was good, but quite stiff and hauty in her conversations. Recite with a fake smile. Stop by on occasion when our mouths were full to check in. And ignore us when we needed a refill of water. It took 5 min to flag down another waiter. Suggestion: remove the attitude. Would I go back? No.There's a superior Italian restaurant just a short walk away.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We stopped for a late night dessert after the Jazz win and the staff was attentive. We ordered a torta (chocolate cake), cheesecake, pistachio gelato, and glass of red blend wine. EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS! Our waitresses was Margarita and provided amazing service and was very attentive to us. Her wine recommendation was perfect. We shared that this was our first time in town and she graciously provided local attractions. Can't wait to visit again and try the main courses.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We had a wonderful evening at Cucina Toscana! Our waitress,Flo, was attentive and helpful. The dinner and dessert were delicious! We will return!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: A great experience.  Great food and equally good service.  The cheese plate was varied and elegant.  A little slow on delivery so it's best if you have nowhere to go.  The restaurant was busy but well managed.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This place was amazing as a date night, Flo was amazing and told us al the chef specials and went over the wine list with us. The place to me was beautiful nice music average amount of talking and great atmosphere. Bread was amazing I'm a big bread person! Anyways we got a free gelato for checking in.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: What a lovely boring place.  Cucina Toscana was located only a few cold blocks away from our hotel while in Salt Lake City for business.  As always I judge a restaurant on decor, service and of course food (and drinks) which is where Cucina Toscana fall down as a very ordinary, if not rather boring Place to eat. Here goes.Decor.  Done nicely with a semi converted garage or industrial space, the tables are appropriately spaced apart, the overall look is simple, elegant but with modern industrial overtones making it a 'very nice' looking space.Service.  Quite good.  Our staff was nice, not super knowledgeable but competent and food prep and food running was efficient and satisfying.Food.  Average at best.  While there was absolutely nothing wrong with the food, there was zero memorable or technically delicious about any of the meals for our table of four.  Lasagna portions are small but ok, Halibut was the fish of the day (I have a rule of never ordering seafood in a land-locked state but on our us did order it and said plainly it was 'fine', not as in fine food, but just ok).  Caesar salads were ordinary and nothing to speak of, and the cheeses used were rather bland.  But the really odd thing were the drinks.  Now I know this is Salt Lake City and there's a lot of odd rules about alcohol in the state, but I had 4 (four) martinis and didn't get a buzz.  Yes FOUR OF THEM.  If I had had four martinis in a restaurant in New York, or LA, or Miami, I would have been smashed.  Of course, they cost the same as in New York, or LA, or Miami, but all of us walked out of the place not feeling a thing.  Watered down liquor perhaps?  Can't really say but for spending that kind of money I should be well hung over This morning and that didn't happen.So overall I was not really impressed, but like I said in the beginning, to me this was just very ordinary, rather boring food and I would not spend a penny of drinks there if ever going there again.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Dinner was incredible, the Chianti was absolutely delicious! I can't wait for the next time I visit SLC to have dinner here again! 100% recommend having dinner here if you are trying to impress someone

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Terrible food .. service is even worse. Took 20 mins for the server to get us our drink.Food took another 25-30 mins and the credit card machine crashed.  Skip Toscana. Try Sicilia Mia instead.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This dining experience was one of the finest Italian meals I've had in years. Highly recommend enjoying a night at Cucina Toscana.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Cucina Toscana has a very nice interior, but overpriced Italian food. It is fine dining, but food has to be fine too! As for dinner we both started with La Mista Italiana salads which were fresh and nicely prepared. I must admit that I found the salad dressing a bit difficult to down. My wife had the Risotto Alle Verdura which she found okay, but pricey for a pasta/vegetable dish. I had the Osso Buco, which was tender, but I did not care for the sauce and had to scrape it off. We both had expensive glasses of wine which were okay, but not worth the time describing. All in all Cucina Toscana provides an overpriced meal within a beautiful restaurant. My search continues for a great Italian restaurant in SLC that knocks my socks off and does not lead me towards the poor house.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Really good food. Steven is great ; helped us understand the menu and suggest some good food. The sauces are the highlight!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Best Italian I have ever had. Superb service. Had the Ravioli Toscano, superb. Eat here when downtown SLC.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Excellent food & service. I highly recommend checking in with them for your next client dinner!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I usually dont like Italian food But I have to accept this restuarant change my mind had a taste of the house pastas and they were delicious great atmosphere, service was just great I had the chicken parmesan not the usual taste way better tiramisu dessert delicious. Recommended stop by and try it you won't regret it.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Was there Saturday for the 2nd time margarita help us excellent service, food was delicious again, had pollo al limones recommend, had a dessert can't remember the name but was also delicious definitely will go back with all my family and friends.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Went here for the first time on a night out and loved the place. The service was great and the food was incredible. We had the grande pasta meal and the risotto and both were amazing. The tiramisu was the perfect end to the meal. Our server, Flo, is the main reason I will return - such a doll! Great all-around experience.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Amazing place to it. The food is so delicious and our server Margarita was the best. So attentive, so quick, and sweet. I highly recommend this place.If you're looking for a good Italian place to eat at, this is the one.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We are very pleased with the service given by our server Margarita. She had great recommendations and was very knowledgeable about the menu. I ordered the Spaghetti All'Ubriaco and it was out of this world.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Been in Salt Lake City for the past 5 days for the YL Convention.  Out of all the restaurants that we ate at, this is by far the best one.  The service was excellent Margarita is the best server, she went out of her way to serve us.  My daughter and I had the house special of the night Chicken Parmigiana. Over all everything was exquisite.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Another fine dining experience at Cucina Toscana.  Service was impeccable and the restaurant manager Marc was pleasant and nice.  I was in the mood for just pasta with red sauce and shrimp and the chef was able to accommodate what I was looking for.  I will definitely be back again the next time I'm in Salt Lake City.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We had a cheese platter that was to die for. Our server was wonderful and explained where each of the cheeses came from! Would highly recommend.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This should be, without a doubt, a four star review. Be patient with me, I'll get to that in a bit. So we're in Salt Lake City for a few days for a Business Valuation Conference, which ended at noon Saturday. So we have a day and a half to see the sights. Oh boy I'm going off the rails.Okay, so it's Saturday night and I figure we should go out for a romantic dinner. Yelp screams out this restaurant and bonus, it's a block away from the Condo we're renting.We're seated at a really table and our waitress gives us the specials. We order drinks and start going over the menu which is not one of those five page menus, but about a dozen choices, specializing in Homemade Pasta.I choose their Duck Breast,  and Mrs. E. Goes with their Duo of ravioli & gnocchi. First their cheese platter which was beyond excellent. Apparently they partner with a local cheese artisan that imports cheese from Italy.All the food was excellent, service from our waitress, perfect. Oh before I explain my issue, a Yelp check in gets you a free Gelato desert. LOVE YELP.Ok so a maitre d, I guess keeps coming over to our table talking to us, or particularly my wife. He's talking about Salt Lake City, then goes on about a local photographer, constantly cleaning out table. On and on to a point that it was uncomfortable. He finally leaves for minute then returns with pictures on his phone to show my wife. After she gives me the look, of get this guy out of here, I say , we have to order our desert now. He leaves and is back in two minutes with more talk to my wife.At this point I'm ready for a knife fight, and I know I can take this guy, fair fight or not. Well I think he gets the hint and leaves. He returns with the check, and hands it my wife, like I'm not there. Someone needs to put a leash on this dude, and walk him out the back door. Yes the food was worth 4-5 stars, same for most of the staff, but for me, this guy cost the restaurant. I don't know if I'll be back in Salt Lake City any time soon, but this restaurant is on my " Do Not Go To"  list and I have to encourage you not to go there until a change is made. Sorry

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Really enjoyed this place. Service was excellent Atmosphere was very good and they acted like they cared about the customer. Had the handmade ravioli which was excellent my guest had chicken marsala and enjoyed It. Shared a bottle of wine that was excellent and reasonably priced.Would go back again and would recommend to others

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Love this place.  You really cannot go wrong here - it's a little pricey but it's also higher quality.  I had the seafood pasta and it was fantastic.   The lemon and sea salt gelato was pretty much the perfect dessert.   The ravioli is some of the best I have had among my travels

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Fantastic! Margarita treated me like a treasured guest. Her service was impeccable. I had a beet and avocado appetizer, that had pear in it. Very refreshing! For my main course, I had a veal dish to die for. Pairing it all with a tropical white wine put me over the top! Definite recommendation.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Margarita was a wonderful wait staff person. She was attentive and made our experience very pleasant. We started off with complimentary bruschetta.  One of the people at our table had the Caesar Salad that is prepared table side. Her presentation was excellent. Our food was fabulous. My husband had the lasagne. I had the Pollo in Saltimbocca, our guests had Veal Scallopine, and Pesce in Umido. All excellent. I wish I had chosen the fish dish because it looked so delicious and was full of shrimp, clams, scallops, etc. She brought us hot chocolate with biscotti. A nice touch! The only draw back was we sat near the open kitchen. It was very loud. The kitchen staff was loud and were noisy banging pots and pans and dishes. But, it was our choice as we often sit in restaurants that have open kitchens. That's why I still have it 5 stars. We could have sat somewhere else.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This place is wonderful!  Kayla, our waiter for the night, was very sweet and helpful to us. Additionally, the food was very delicious and they gave us a complimentary hot chocolate at the end which was so, so sweet. The service was amazing and the people are so sweet and caring. Thank you, exquisite!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Absolutely delicious Italian food! Menu was complete with plenty of options over multiple courses so nice wide selection with plenty of dishes that can be shared easily - servers will dish up separate plates for sharing. Food was very tasty and cannot day enough about the flavors. Wine list was very good for the Italian selections. Highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We were in Salt Lake City for a conference and after 2 days in the hotel were ready for a good meal.  Everything we had was first class - the appetizer, the wine, the risotto and the ravioli.  The service was good.  Yes the price was high, but my wife and I thought it fair for what you were served.  Should we travel again to Salt Lake City Cucina Toscana is on the top of the list!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This place was awesome. The food was great. The reduction sauces were awesome and flavorful. The service was attentive but not overbearing. The dessert was good, had the chocolate cake. The atmosphere was just the right amount of excitement. We had a lovely dinner that was memorable.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Excellent food. A little pricey but good. The desserts were amazing!Drinks were good but overpriced.Overall good

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Definitely didn't live up to the hype. I had heard many great things about this place. But the actual execution was not what I expected. I had the carbonara and it seemed they were very proud of their sauce and not so much the bacon. The bread and dipping sauce seemed a bit off. The end of meal hot chocolate was about the best part of the meal.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: If you like average, high priced, Italian dinners and a place where you have to scream across a two top table just to carry on a conversation, then this is the place for you. Incredibly noisy and average, at best, service. Really nothing special about Cucina Toscana other than they do a nice job of clearing your table...oh and the white table clothes give it a classy appearance.  However, get past that and it's an average place with above average prices.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This place is amazing, and probably the closest you can get to authentic Italian! I had the ravioli. I was debating between the two different kinds of ravioli, and they let me do half and half. They were both delicious. The service was amazing, the atmosphere felt high end. Will definitely be back.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Nice upscale italian restaurant in Salt Lake City. The food was solid but not fantastic, probably more because of my choices. I had the garden salad and the spaghetti crudo, I was trying to be healthy for some stupid reason. I even skipped dessert, and the table next to me had the gelato and it looked very tasty. I will come back again when I am in town, but I will be more adventurous with my choices.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Called same day for a reservation for 5. They were extremely accommodating. Service here is excellent, and the food: INCREDIBLE. I had them modify my dish to suit my needs- changed the pasta type, the sauce etc. and they got it right perfectly.I had such a wonderful time here with my friends and would highly recommend!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This is an awesome restaurant.  Our server Valerie guided us through the evening and made for an excellent experience.  The pasta sampler,  cheese plate from the place next door and all of the main courses were excellent (chicken saltimbocca, veal saltimbocca and lamb chops).  Can't wait to come back to SLC again and eat here

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Always consistent in quality and taste. I wish there were more vegetarian entree options but the best Sangria in town with wonderful outdoor patio seating makes up for all summer.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: What a bad bad experience. We went there for new year's, once seated we found out the regular menu was not offered (new information to us).  We decided to go along with it and that is when the bad dining experience started. The salad was like out of Wendys; the Caprese's tomatoes way passed its prime, the ravioli were so over done no italian would eat it and the wines (2oz glasses ) were average at best.To the day i am not sure how they got along with charging us hundreds ofdollars for such horrible meal.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We came to Salt Lake City just a couple of hours ago, and we went to Cucina Toscana to have our first dinner here in Utah. The place is nicely decorated, the food is full of Italian flavor (we had Zuppa Di Asparagi, Rovioli Toscana, and Piccata Di Pollo Al Limone) and it's served beautifully; Valerie took care of us tonight, she made the experience especially pleasant.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Mediocrity. Have been here twice now, and the same both times: awkward service, mediocre food, slow kitchen, small portions, big prices.They are obviously going for a fine dining experience, but they miss the mark. The front of house staff all seem like they've never worked in fine dining before, but are told to "be fancy". So they awkwardly get in your way to open doors, make weird comments as if part of a script, etc., But fail to be actually good at the service aspect. Food isn't bad. If you don't get apps, the 30+ entree will leave you wanting. Don't get the table-side Caesar. Had it twice now and it's not good. Menu is sufficiently pretentious, but without the chops to back it up.Not to be snobby, but this seems like the kind of place that bankrolls on selling 'novice' diners on the idea that this is a high class restaurant so they can charge high prices, but it's just a facade - easily seen through if you've been to good places or worked in the industry. I would say the tables you sit at are a good metaphor for the dining experience: cheap folding tables with nice tablecloths.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Went here for a large group dinner. It was pretty good. Service was excellent. The staff was attentive to our needs and kept the drinks flowing. Food was good. I went with the lasagna which was fine. For sure not the best I've ever had and not one I'd order again, but fine. We had a few appetizers, all which were good. The salami and cheeses were delicious. Cocktails were spot on. All in all, a nice place to have dinner.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Absolutely amazing! The bruschetta was so tasty, along with the cheese plate which had 3 kinds of cheeses, nuts, grapes and these amazingly thin slices pairs with honey like you've never tasted before. I would highly recommend the cheese to start with. I ordered the lamb based off of other reviews and recommendations, although I was weary because I've never had lamb that I enjoyed before-it blew my mind! Hands down, would recommend to anyone, try the lamb and you will not be disappointed. The entire staff was very friendly and the waitress, Margarita, was exceptionally personable, friendly and very attentive. Will be returning soon!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Great food. Great range of options. Can't go wrong with any of the options. A little on the expensive side but great dining experience

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Fantastic restaurant on all levels-food, service and decor. Margarita was superb and we felt truly special during our anniversary dinner! Thank you!!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Terrible, terrible service. We had a group of 10 and made a reservation for 5:45. We made such an early reservation because we had tickets around the corner for an event at 7:15. An hour and a half for a light dinner should have been plenty.Despite the restaurant being less than half full, it took our server 30 minutes just to take our order. We let her know we had an event in another hour we didn't want to be late for. An hour should have still been plenty to serve a meal and eat. It took another 30 minutes just to bring out our glasses of wine. Again, we reiterated that we had an event in 30 minutes now and requested to bring out the checks with the food, so they could run our bill while we ate to save time.7:15, 30 minutes later, they bring the bills (we had to beg to split checks) and NO FOOD yet. We're paying and not even knowing if we're going to see any food for our money. And on top of that, we are late for our event now. Then they bring our food in boxes, as we had no choice but to request, and they get them mixed up.Basically, we're eating takeout for full price, and to top it off, they add an automatic 20% tip to everyone's bill. 20% for what service I have no idea. Who charges a 20% tip for takeout? I paid $50 bucks for mediocre, runny risotto to go and a glass of wine I couldn't pair with my food.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Authentic Italian food. The service was exceptional.  The food was amazing.  Would highly recommend it.  The duck is a winner.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I found the dishes I ordered were bland and lukewarm. The asparagus soup needed something extra to not taste like bland asparagus soup. The eggplant parmiagiana tomato sauce was not hot enough. The mozarella looked like it was over cooked, it was very tough. I suspect this appetizer was premade and they just heated it up again. The gnocchi tasted really gummy, like they did not cooked it long enough.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Delicious Italian food that will have your taste buds asking for more. A 5 star restaurant with the food, service, and extras you expect. The hot chocolate and Biscotti was a perfect after dinner surprise! Treat that special someone to a fantastic meal out. They will thank you later!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: We had a family dinner here. The service is great. They prepared Caesar salad as spinach ravioli in front of us. The beef tenderloin was cooked perfectly. The Chianti sauce is a little bit too greasy to my taste. Rack of lamb is good too. The sauce is amazing.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Rack of lamb is raised locally in Morgan Valley. It was very delicious. It came with some potatoes and spinach on the plate. I feel the dish could have used another item on the plate, maybe a puree, but that's just personal preference and not worth knocking off a star. Really great food and really great service.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Happen upon this restaurant last night while walking through town. They Were very accommodating and got us a table for four right away! The wait staff was very attentive. The food was incredible. Hand make gnocchi was amazing. The seafood dish was incredibley fresh!The chef even sent out espresso sized hot chocolate and biscotti at the end of our meal. We will definitely be back on our next visit to SLC.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: It's been almost a year since I've been here and it was just as good if not even better then I remember. Their chef really knows what he's doing and the staff is so attentive, I had a few people always available to help when I was looking around. Their team is well trained and super professional.I had their risotto special of the night, with mushrooms and truffle oil.The portion is rather large so I lucked out with lunch for tomorrow. I also tried their beet salad with goat cheese, it was small but the perfect size for a dinner salad. My husband had the duck and said it was one of the best he's ever had (not my cup of tea) and that the sauce was a perfect balance. We've been in on crazy busy nights and nights that weren't as hectic but when I make reservations I always ask for something a bit quieter and the host has always accommodated our request. This place never disappoints and is always one of my top choices for date night.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Great Italian food. Great staff. Couple that with a great atmosphere and you have a good restaurant. I have been to this place a few times with friends or it's great for visiting parents which my mom really loves this place. I have never been disappointed. I very much highly recommend this place especially if you enjoy awesome food and great staff serving and are trying to entertain company.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Let me start by saying DO NOT GO HERE!  I am visiting Salt Lake City from California and I had one of the worst dining experiences ever.  First...I tried to make reservations online as their website directed me and it said hey were booked until 6:45.  When we arrived the restaurant was EMPTY. Only one table of four was in the entire restaurant.  It is fairly big in size and I knew that was a bad sign.  I broke my rule of dining in an empty restaurant.  But it had good reviews online so I took a change...BIG MISTAKE .  It was creepy because they had a full staff and they were bored so they kept coming around and staring and wanted to rush us to order.  We finally ordered salads and they were ok.  But when I received my Chicken Piccata entree....the manager brought over our food and there was a long BLACK HAIR right across my plate.  It was disgusting.  I refused to eat.  Our whole meal was ruined.  I just wanted to run out as fast as I could.  They lost what little faith I had!  Besides that horrible experience...we had just dined at Valters the night before and it appears that this restaurant has copied all the little extras that they do, from the complimentary bruschetta, to the biscotti with dipping chocolate.  I was shocked.  I have never seen a restaurant copy every detail that another has.  Be warned that this restaurant is empty for a reason and Valters is almost impossible to get into.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: My husband and I dined here for our 6 year anniversary. It was very classy and romantic. The food was delicious and the wait staff were amazing! The lamb was great and I really enjoyed trying something unique or at least out of the norm for Salt Lake City. They had a fun and creative beet salad that was so so flavorful with the melding of different flavors I wouldn't think to combine. Loved our experience. (Definitely pricy)

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Amazing homemade pasta, and the service was exceptional. Ceasar salad was made table side. Nice view.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I don't understand the glowing reviews here, but I'd guess that this restaurant was once really good and has since fallen off. Like way off. Over-the-cliff-itself off. Our server was great, and the manager removed items from our bill and gave us a generous discount on the rest, but those are the only positives.The beet carpaccio was a plate of dressed beets and past-its-peak avocado placed on top (brownish instead of bright green). Some beets had been pressed into a mold first, hence "carpaccio," but it was still just a plate of overdone room-temperature beets. The tomatoes in the caprese salad were pale and mealy (in July!). The prosciutto that came with the salad was piled on the right of the plate and not incorporated into the salad at all. We agreed after the apps that if the entrees had problems, we were leaving. My husband ordered the rack of lamb special medium rare. It came out well done and gray, and it was chops, not a rack, that had clearly been cooked as chops. My entree was more edible, at least the meat, but the vegetable garnish was pathetic: a handful of undressed, nearly-raw green beans and a few cubes of grease-saturated potato. From other reviews here, I gather this is the standard garnish, so even though most entrees are upwards of $30, the kitchen can't be bothered to customize a fairly small entree menu.I like classic Italian, and that's what this place is, so we weren't expecting innovative menu items or techniques, but we were expecting classic dishes done perfectly, and that's not even close to what we got. The place was slow for 7:30 on a Saturday, and I imagine they'll limp on with business from non-locals like us for a while longer before closing, but it's heyday is well past.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Phenomenal meals. Everything was incredibly delicious, from to bread to the desert cocktails. The special lamb was incredible, while the duck was a bit sweet. Our server was a bit cold at first but became much more lively. To be fair when we showed up we were not dressed as patrons who would probably respect the type of food served here due to a last second cancellation at another restaurant. Amazing through and through including the delicious espresso at the end of the night.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Very good experience. The staff was well organized. Food was amazing. The sea salt lemon gelato is the best gelato I've had.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I've eaten at Cucina three times so far in the last year and a half-every time has been delicious. I feel the food here is far superior to Valter's Osteria, without the pretentious feel. Nice ambiance, feels like a california-style italian restaurant- good light, white tablecloths, a slightly open kitchen. The nice part was that even though it's an upscale restaurant, we felt comfortable bringing our children here. My favorite thing to get is the pasta trio tasting platter (the butternut ravioli with browned-butter sage sauce was melt-in-your-mouth yum!), my husband loves it when they have a lamb special. Also--panna cotta! So fresh and creamy and delicious, perfect paired with their espresso at the end of the night....the salad was meh so skip that and go straight for the pasta. Service here has always been very good, very attentive.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: The restaurant is beautiful with gorgeous light coming in from the large windows. The tables are set as you walk in and add to the overall ambiance. We wanted a quick bite before heading to the airport to fly out if SLC, and asked if it was possible to eat and be out in 45 minutes. We were told that if we just order the entree, it was possible. We were able to get out in 1 your, so this was great (close enough). As we waited for food we were given free fresh bread and a concoction of capers, mustard and oil, probably to dip the bread. This was ok, nothing extraordinary. Also, our table got some bruschetta. Typically the bread is pretty nicely grilled or toasted, so that when you add the tomatoes on top, the bread isn't soggy. Not the case with these. They were not very toasted, so became soggy and hard to hold when lifted off the plate, as they would fall apart slightly. Flavor-vise, also very underwhelming. No garlic, and no salt. The entrees on the menu only describe the meat or fish, but no mention on what they come with. We asked the server and were told that all dishes come with green beans and potatoes. I ordered Osso Bucco au jus, and was expecting potatoes and green beans with some beef. Instead the Osso Bucco came with a tomato based sauce, that was poured over a bed of spinach. Given that I do not like tomato based sauces at all, and I was expecting the beef to be "au jus" as described on the menu, and really wanted some potatoes on my plate, this was a huge disappointment. The beef was fall apart tender, but the sauce killed it for me. If I lived in SLC, I would definitely give this place another try, since I like the atmosphere at the restaurant, but I wouldn't be surprised if my experience was a flop again. So, 4 star review it is.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Lovely atmosphere, excellent service and the food was amazing. I traveled to SLC with our exchange student from Rome, Italy and she said everything was legit. I had the ravioli toscana with a green salad and glass of malbec, and it was fantastic. She had the risotto di giorno (porcini mushroom) and just melted with every bite. Highly recommend!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Hands down the absolute best Italian restaurant in Utah. The service is outstanding and  a Great atmosphere

name: Cucina Toscana
content: First time visiting SLC looking for a great Italian place Found it !!Great service and ambience delicious food !!

name: Cucina Toscana
content: One of the worst restaurants I have eaten at. The food was worse than Olive Garden. Ordered the asparagus soup and the waitress took it off the bill without us saying a thing because in her words 'it's awful but I wanted to let you try it'. On the positive side the service was amazing

name: Cucina Toscana
content: This is not the place to go if you're looking for a quiet evening out to be able to talk with your date or hold a conversation with friends. One can barely hear others at the table - the restaurant could use some sound deadening on the ceiling. Also the tables are very close to each other (which seems unnecessary since a whole area of the restaurant was closed off and empty). The food was very good however the service was a bit slow. The use of numbers to identify servers (instead of names/name tags) seemed rather impersonal. Good food, rather pricey, rather impersonal.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I finally found A restaurant that can compare to ones in NJ and NY! From beginning to end EVERYTHING was delicious.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Occasion: 30th birthday... they asked the occasion but sadly never brought it up the rest of the night. Atmosphere: wish it had a more warm and intimate environmentService: waitress had a great personality and friendly service but made a few mistakes. Mixed up our appetizers with another table and told us the wrong special which made me change my mind on a meal last second. Food: di blue appetizer was delicious and my favorite part of the meal. We shared the pasta duo-- the gnocchi was the best I've had!! Bread and melted butter mix was delish. Main fish- the carbonara wasn't my favorite. Had a very bacon grease texture for the sauce. Husband had the drunken spaghetti which was okay but not great. Little hot chocolate at the end was a nice treat. Very rich. Total bill with a bottle of wine was $200. Overall I didn't feel it was worth the price tag. Had some highs and lows.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: I have no clue why Cucina Toscana has 4 stars... My boyfriend and I had reservations for Valentine's Day and were severely disappointed in the atmosphere, the service, and mostly the food. Upon arrival, we were told that there was a set menu for Valentine's Day. I realize some restaurants do this for holidays, but it would have been helpful to have this information posted on the website or on Open Table, where we made the reservation. I was really excited about a number of pastas on the normal menu, but the fixed menu only offered TWO pastas (neither being what I wanted).This place looks OLD. We were seated in the back section, which felt like a decaying 80s country club. The tables were positioned awkwardly and were way too large for a party of 2. The chairs felt like they were about to fall apart. I even had to ask them to dim the lights because it was shining brightly into my face like an interrogation. And then my boyfriend had to get me a new chair because the arms wouldn't fit under the table and I couldn't scoot in.The server and the buser both didn't speak English very well, so it was very difficult to communicate what we needed and ask specific questions.  Because it was a set menu, we paid $70 (+ and additional $15 for wine tasting) per person and got to choose form a couple appetizers, a couple entrees and a couple pastas. You would assume, that if you're offering a set menu, that you provide your all-star plates, but OY! I could have cried they were so terrible!  The caprese appetizer was tasteless. A nursing home would have done a better job. The gnocchi pasta was okay, but I wasn't impressed (especially for being an Italian restaurant). The chicken entree was hilariously disgusting. It was very thin, with little flavor, bizarre potatoes on the side. It reminded me of a meal at cheap wedding at a Holiday Inn ballroom. I was starving but couldn't even stomach this thing. Woof! The waitress offered to give me more pasta instead, but I just wanted to get out of there.At the end of the day, I think the restaurant wanted to be able to churn people in and out, while still making $$$. They claimed it was a very busy night and the chef needed to keep up, thus the fixed menu, but it didn't seem any busier in there than a normal night at a restaurant (there were empty tables and their "large group" was about 8 persons). So either the chef is completely incompetent or they're just greedy and lazy. Regardless, we will NOT be back. I'm horrified that we paid so much money for such lackluster experience. Practically ruined our Valentine's Day (we decided to laugh through it, since it was pretty laughable). Cucina Tuscana should be MORTIFIED.

name: Cucina Toscana
content: Had dinner here as a part of my visit.  The atmosphere was nice, elegant but casual.  Service was excellent.  I ordered PESCE IN UMIDO which was awesome.  I love seafood pasta.  It was actually on top of a bed of spinach so  I ordered a side of pasta.  Fish was fresh, jumbo shrimp, scallops and squid in a red sauce.  ExcellentHighly recommend.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Overall pizza wasn't to bad, just a tad bit pricy from what  I would prefer. It's worth a try to support your local business but still think my favorite local pizza joint is Scilla pizzas in downtown

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Excellent service, ordered burger and chicken wings and it tasted very delicious. Overall good food and great selection of beers, will come back again.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Well.. honestly it was good food. Just good food. But the execution was off on each dish. For each dish / side we received, there was something wrong. None of them felt very complete. We were very excited to try Nomad and had heard great things. And I was especially excited to try their pizza because Im a SUCKER for honey on za. But they just fell short. Why?Bees knees -- honestly wonderful toppings. The taste was fantastic. But my experience was ruined because the crust felt extremely cheap. It was like I was eating pizza out of the freezer aisle. It honestly ruined the pizza for me. But again, toppings were on fleek.Pulled pork sandy -- again, good subtle flavors, throughout the sandwich with the pickled celery, but the bun felt and tasted stale while the whole sandwich was dry. I'm not sure if they put any sauce on the sandwich but it DEFINITELY needed more. It felt like we were eating a French dip with no au jus sauce, which is obviously pointless. Loaded fries -- solid attempt. Why? Because. The cheese is the best part, and as you can see it wasn't melted very well on the fries, which I think was a shame because without the cheese the fries are mediocre. Over salted and over cooked. My mouth is still reeling from the salt. Anyways. Very good effort but probably won't be returning.

name: Nomad Eatery
