content: We were staying at one of the many hotels by the airport - very few options nearby, so this was a great find!  We loved the chicken tacos and smoked turkey club, but the Betty White pizza was standout!  Super nice staff!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Have you ever had your perfect bite? You know that feeling when you eat the perfect combination of flavor, texture, and everything else? I have, twice tonight. My first bite of the BBQ wings. Their white bbq sauce is if it was possible, would be apart of ever meal. Then when I think heaven has been found....I get my first piece of their margarita pizza. Crispy but thin crust. Amazing crust. And at a deal. This has become my favorite place to eat by far. Please, please, please come eat here.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This restarting is in a super weird, kind of out of the way location if you're used to downtown. I really wanted a unique pizza, and I wasn't disappointed with my meal from Nomad. We got take out, due to the quarantine, but they were quick and helpful and offered creative dishes. Will definitely return!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Very friendly staff.  Their smoked turkey club was bomb!  And, you could taste the flavor of the vinegar in their salt & vinegar chips, also super good!  The lettuce in their salad was extra fresh, good even though I only eat them to be healthy-ish.  I will be making the drive from Ogden again to see what else they have that's good.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: I was at this place last night and had a great time with great food. Went back tonight and the little waitress was a pain, miserable, acted as if I were interrupting her evening by asking to sit at the bar. Then she couldn't figure out how to order what I wanted so I tried to help her and she said I was standing too close to her so I got disgusted and left. It's a shame because it's a nice place with not much else around it and the food is good. This girl ruined my dinner (thankfully before I ordered and suffered through an unpleasant time (she seemed determined to make sure that I wasn't going to have a pleasant experience) so it's too bad for me and too bad for the owner. Sadie was amazing the previous night but this girl was a wet blanket. If you understaff you're place and have disgruntled employees that happens. You deserve what you get.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This is very likely my favorite restaurant in Salt Lake!  I work nearby so constantly order lunch from there.  I love their salads and their pizzas. They change their menu fairly often, which adds variety, but can be a bit of a bummer if you love something that they have removed (e.g. burger).  My favorite pizza is the Betty White- delicious and still seems somewhat healthy.  I love the ingredients that they put together to create new flavor sensations.  I also love the Kale Ceaser - their dressing is delicious.  I also loved the salad that it replaced (squash frisee or something like that, which also had DELICIOUS salad dressing).

name: Nomad Eatery
content: One of my favorite restaurants in SLC. I love their pizza. Anytime you are by the airport, stop by for some delicious food. The spicy chicken sandwich is a favorite, yum!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Visiting from Cali and decided to try this restaurant out. Found them on Yelp. We ordered a couple pizzas, salad, an app and drinks. We loved the breakfast pizza by far. Knuckle sandwich was overpowered by the horseradish. Kettle chips were good along side the rest of the items ordered. The only turn off was the energy from our server. She seemed to be unhappy based off of her actions We requested plates/ utensils when our food arrived. She decided to bust tables and 5 minutes later from our initial request only brought napkins and forks. We waited patiently and another 5 or so minutes passed and we had to get up to request them. She basically refused to bring them over. Overall our experience was nice minus the poor customer service from our server. The rest of the team we interacted with were great!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Good food, but have been there twice and BOTH TIMES they have run out of pizza dough. It's cheap and pizza and is a huge portion of their menu. Make more dough on the weekends. Disappointing when you are going there to eat pizza, twice.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Loved Nomad!!!Kind of a weird location out near the airport. But absolutely worth the trip out there! I loved the vibe here. Felt like I could just hang out here all night. The service was also super kind and personable. Now on to the FOOD. Yum!! We tried the Margherita and Betty White pizzas and I absolutely loved both. Probably preferred the Betty White a little more. I feel like the prices are super fair for the quality and amount of food we got. I was planning to just eat half of my pizza and save the rest for lunch tomorrow, but I literally Could. Not. Stop. Myself. I recommend this place to all my friends and fellow yelpers!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Huge fan of this place! I came here tonight for the first time and it was everything I hoped it would be. Right when we walked in I loved the atmosphere and it smelled amazing. I couldn't wait to eat! The pizzas were delicious, fresh, and packed with flavor (I tried both the Margherita and Betty White)! You'll pay a little over $10 for a pizza, but they're a decent size! You can definitely leave with leftovers and get two meals out of it, which is a big plus for me. Also, they're so good that it's easily worth the money to me. The location is a little weird (out kind of by the airport), but it's worth heading out that way and isn't too far if you're in downtown slc already! I just wish I lived closer so I could come more often. Definitely recommend Nomad!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Great place. We got there right when it opened so we were the first ones there but the line never stopped after we sat down. I wasn't completely impressed with the kale Caesar salad but everything else was excellent. The cheese pizza for my boys was scarfed down. And the tres leches cake was excellent. I could eat that again for sure.  I'd definitely come back here for dinner.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: OK look I need to apologize about something. I have known about this place for couple years but never went there because I was an idiot and judged the book by its cover. It's in kind of a weird place over by the airport almost an industrial-ish type of location and so I never really had a desire to go over there. But I went there tonight.... I'll tell you what I was blown away!!!Everything was really really good. The fries with my sandwich were just amazing I don't know why. The flavor was great the consistency was great it was just great. I had the knuckle sandwich which is roast beef with a cheese sauce on it and it was amazing. Perfectly flavored beef perfect tenderness and incredible cheese sauce on it. My kids had a cheese pizza and it was such a good cheese pizza. It was with authentic  mozzarella slices like they do back in Italy and some places in New York ... ya know the  margarita style pizzas. And you know what this cheese pizza was just as good as one of my favorite places in Florence Italy called Gusta pizza! It was really good!! And then we ended with the Tres Leche which was AWESOME. Nice setting inside . GREAT food. I will definitely be back . If they will forgive me for being so Judgy beforehand.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Very cool place .. I had falafel salad and the hot wings and both were excellent. Pizza looked yummy but I'll try next time. Knuckle sandwich was always very good as well per my friend.  Can't wait to come back

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Worth the trek - Pizza is delicious, wood fired heaven. - Salads are crisp, fresh, and perfectly crafted. Try the kale caesar, even if you hate kale, you'll be hooked.  - Drink selection is good, but I wish there was beer on draft. - Fast casual concept is awesome and service was fantastic.- Great ambiance- So excited for this to open on the east side!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This place is awesome. Conveniently located minutes from the airport, I love making a quick stop before or after a flight. Staff is awesome and friendly, food is fantastic. I love the rotating menu, it always keeps things interesting

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Wow! Very impressed with this place! Not only is is decorated so cute the food was great! There was a line out the door but we didn't wait to long. You order and pay at the counter and then pick your own seat. Everything we got was great!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: I've been here before and had forgotten how good it was. I had the burger before but I think their menu rotates & I couldn't get it this time. So I opted for the smoked turkey club with sourdough bread. Loved it! Everyone in our group had a great experience. Fries were great, a couple of the people in our group got pizzas and liked them, and others thought the spicy chicken sandwich was amazing!! If you are going for lunch, try to get there before 11:45am because the line will go out the door!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Decided to visit after reading Yelp reviews and looking for a place to  eat lunch before a flight. Super close to airport but I would eat here even if it was out of the way. Great menu choices. Casual hip vibe. Friendly staff.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: My boyfriend and I were blown away by the food and service here! Best wings I've had in a long time, pizza was fantastic and we loved the atmosphere. We got there at 5 on a Friday and 30 minutes later it was completely packed! I guess we found one of Salt Lake's hidden gems :)

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Not sure what the hype is about- or where all the good reviews are coming from. We ordered pizza and wings, there was a scarce amount of cheese on our pizza, some of which was burnt- yes burnt- not toasted. I appreciate different types of crust from chewy to crispy- this was just hard, inedible in places. The wings were too spicy for our taste, but I wont fault for that. Overall, there was nothing outstanding or memorable to be said about their flavor profiles/mashups, food textures or customer service--except for maybe the idea?

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Great casual atmosphere   Wonderful pizza and sandwiches. Wine selection small but good offering. Beer seems to be the crowd favorite. A must if you need some food on the way to or from thhe airport.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Today I met my friend and her family at Nomad for lunch. We chose Nomad because the restaurant met her nutritional needs as a clean eater and her young children (2 and 4) could eat as well. Though there wasn't a kids menu they both loved the pizza and fries. Even she, the clean eater, had to taste these delicious, crispy fries. I myself, LOVE beets and Nomad made the introduction of beets to her and her children SO easy as they were so good! The chicken sandwich was pretty spicy even for her husband who loves spicy foods, but he ate the whole thing. The signature cocktails we drank were well made and delicious though we were surprised the bartender did  not know how to make an, Old Fashion. (It's Utah?) Belly full, heart glad.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Ok this place has GOT it. First the buildout is adorable- exposed ceiling & brick, separate bar area. You order at the register and get a number & they'll bring it out. We got the Betty White Pizza & the Wedge Salad and they were both excellent. The pizza was perfect. Garlic cream, fontina, mozz, arugula, evoo & pickled squash. If you would have told me you were gonna put SQUASH on my pizza I would have told you to gtf... ya know. Sometimes life is about saying shit you never thought you'd say.. like, I love squash on my pizza. Wedge Salad was above the bar of typical wedge salads, they went the extra mile & then some. Everything was delicious and I can't wait to squash more pizza ayyyeee.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Very cool place! Chill vibes. Kind staff. Amazing salmon salad, like amazing!!!! Decent margarita pizza. Great wine. Kind of in a random area haha don't be deterred by the location. I would recommend!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This is a solid place but it's just not consistent. I've been there a few times and the food is really good on some days and other days not so much. My pizza was cold after waiting for it for about 30 mins AND the bartender took 40 mins to bring drinks that were in cans. This is a good place but be prepared to wait.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Fantastic pizza and a great beer selection, I haven't had anything else on the menu besides their pizzas but that in itself makes the place a great stop. Lots of parking!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: I can't stop coming here every time I'm in SLC!And I know there are many options that won't destroy my mouth, but I can't stop getting the spicy chicken! Get plenty of ranch and cold beer because this one always lives up to its name! Crunchy chicken with great seasoning slathered in the spicy sauce is a love hate situ... great pickles, great bun, all around winner!Ambiance is urban industrial, service is counter order, and prices are in line with expectation... I already said I can't stop coming here, so this joint is definitely on the list! Get here, to the detriment of your toasted tastebuds!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: I have to say that I loved the menu and the food. I'll be back next time I'm off the beaten path. The location is sketchy if you aren't a local.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Ok... really... we have to drive to the airport to find a place this good?  What is wrong with SLC??????  We need more places like this in the city: great pizza... great salads... great beer!!!  Kudos Nomad!!!  Please open more locations and keep the quality at this level.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Admittedly we walked in kinda late, but hey, we tried. Still 20+ minutes to kill. Guy with the cast was awesome. I wish I knew how to tip here so I just threw a bill in the tip jar. So with tip it was $67 for a very mediocre meal, 2 hop risings, wings, chicken sandwich with fries, and a pizza. Pizza was on the burnt side, we took it home and threw it away unfortunately. Looking at the photos they all kinda look like that though. Wigs were there, and for some reason we were missing one wing and they would bring it out later, super weird to be served one wing way later. No one is going to eat that. Speculative wing. Chicken sandwich was yums, but still I'll head to pretty bird for that. Overall I don't get how this place is that cool at all. Also if you guys expect us to bus our tables can you at least wipe them down so we have somewhere to initially sit?

name: Nomad Eatery
content: What can I say? Good eats and modern, relaxed vibes right by the airport. Absolutely perfect for snagging a meal you actually want to eat before flying back out without the rush. Simply order at the counter and food is brought out to you. While the menu wasn't extensive, I'd say there was an option for everyone.I looooved the Broccoli Bob pizza! All the goodies in pasta carbonara with the satisfaction of broccolini. The veggie makes it healthy. ;) The pizza came out larger than I was expecting, and I promptly announced to my coworker that there was no way I was finishing it and he should help himself. That... turned out to be a lie. I ate every bit. No Crumb Left Behind. My coworker had the chicken sandwich. He's not a guy to wax poetic about his food, but he said it was good and it surely looked tasty enough. Mentioned he would have preferred it was a chicken breast.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Great date night with delicious food in an out of the way location. We visited sugar house, downtown SLC and finished here. My husband loved the decor and feel and music. It was relaxing and fun. We have the citrus wings instant 5 stars and the next day cold they were still fabulous. Our second favorite was the betty white pizza with squash. Super tasty sauce and lots of arugula. We also enjoyed the beet salad. My husband loved it all but I wasnt sure about the added granola and might have preferred it warm. The blend of sweet creamy cheese and tart balsamic flavors though was excellent. The only disappointment was the loaded fries which were not that loaded and lukewarm at best. We are huge poutine fans and this was kinda cool and soggy instead. We do appreciate their neat menu selections and flavor combinations and would come back!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Tried the wings, loaded fries, pickled beet salad and the kale caesar salad. Loved them all! Drinks were good and at or under $10. Most of the menu was under $15. It had a cozy feel and communal seating. Definitely a must for any Nomad.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: The establishment is nice. You order and pay at the counter before choosing your seats. The food was underwhelming nothing great. We ordered the smoked salmon salad which was too sweet. The dressing tasted like a homemade thousand island. Not my style. We also ordered the buffalo wings and were also disappointed the sauce was very thick and tasted like it had ketchup in it.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Delicious food for the hipster in all of us that's tired of all the same old food.  I've had their pizza which is great but their turkey sandwich is amazing...off the charts.  The location is outside of the hustle and bustle of downtown but not too far away either.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Hidden gem right by the airport ! Very nice and modern and great food!! The wings were delicious ... probably the best wings I've had so far ! Those served with good beer , followed by a pizza  = amazing !

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This is a really great place ! Saw the great reviews and decided to try it ! Great ambience, modern and clean. Food was awesome. Pizza, probably the best one I have had in the US ! Great crust, perfectly cooked ! Excellent. The clam chowder was also very tasty.... If you are staying close to the airport you MUST MUST try this place. Great job !!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Solid joint in an area where you can't find much good food. The pizza is great but my favorite is the in house salt and vinagre chiPs and the burger that they put them on!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This place is by far the best place to hang out at near the airport. I had the chicken sandwich and it was the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. I also had a fun whisky sour  made with dates. The setting is really cute too. The servers are wearing suspenders and there's a cozy fire place you can sit next to. You order up at the counter which is nice because then you can have uninterrupted conversation while you hang out. I will definitely be coming back!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Super yummy grub food.  Awesome sandwiches.  Pizza is amaze balls.  Overall atmosphere was just a as good as food.  I went in at 11:30(when they open). Best falafel ever!   They were packed by 11:45!  Can't wait to come back.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Such a fun little joint. The food is so tasty and the pizzas are all very unique. If you're a fan of beets, their roasted/ pickled beets are to die for. The location is somewhat odd but I love the atmosphere and it's definitely worth takin the drive out west.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Guy working the desk was super nice. I got the chicken sandwich, and honestly I wasn't too pleased with it despite it being the number 1 seller. I thought that the meat was really juicy, but it was just way too breaded. It wasn't even crispy at the point--it was just a hard slab of breading. Also, the chips had a weird aftertaste/smell. The whole experience was 3.5 stars.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This place has incredible service and amazing food. The workers are incredibly helpful and willing to serve in anyway possible.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Underwhelming.  I had high expectations and the actual experience fell short.  Arrived just as they were opening.  The male server greeted us, and then the woman server immediately approached and said they don't open for 6 more minutes.  It was actually 4, the front door was open and we were more than happy to just check out the menu.  There wasn't anything really calling to me on the menu.  Eclectic sandwich choices, salads seemed to be best bet (I prefer to make my own salads at home) and pizza.  The new special was falafel sandwich.  Pizzas had combos with options like pickled squash or montauk with clam and bacon.  When you order the check out process pushes 15% or 20% tip.  This is a pet peeve of mine in a restaurant that is serving essentially gourmet food in a fast food/self serve format.  You order before you sit, and get your own water, silverware and condiments.  Food itself was decent and had unique flavors.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Absolutely delightful! I had the falafel burger with a side salad and it was divine! Perfectly filling and I personally appreciated the beats in the salad. My friends had the spicy chicken and turkey sandwiches and enjoyed them very much as well!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Very hipster feel, which is fun to experience every so often. Not a lot of choices on the menu, but that's probably part of the hipster vibe... food was good, not priced too high, and good quality. Restaurant is clean and I heard they are adding a second location!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: I can not recommend this place enough. If I ever go back to Salt Lake City I will absolutely go to this place again. It was a fast casual place with quick service and a super modern but fun and casual vibe. Obviously I need to rave about the food. The salads my friend and I had were both amazing. I had the squash salad and it was a perfect portion with great flavor and a super yummy dressing. I wish I could eat this for lunch every day! My friend tried the smoked salmon salad and she also said it was amazing! We also got a side of fries and they were cooked perfectly. I wanted a healthy lunch this day but I would love to go back sometime to try the sandwiches as well! A must try lunch place in Salt Lake City!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Great spot near SLC airport.  Excellent food, tried the Children of the Corn pizza and it was amazing!  Like no pizza I've ever had.  Service was good and restaurant is clean and well kept.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Thanks yelp! I really appreciate the reviews because this is a hidden gem near the airport. My flight was an hour delayed. Luckily I received the notification prior to returning the rental car, so I decided to boycott the terrible airport food and go somewhere else. This was nearby enough so that I did not need to re-fuel after visiting. I just went straight to the airport!Being my first time at this place, the cashier was very patient with me. I confirmed the broccolini and burrata was not a salad per se (listed under that category), but instead a plate of both. The cashier explained the loaded fries were like poutine, and intrigued, I decided to go ahead and order. They come with bacon, so that's a win already right?The broccolini and burrata was delicious. It was exactly as I expected and reminiscent of my trip of Italy. The broccolini was crispy and not soggy (hate soggy broccolini), and the burrata...OMG I think they could just serve a plate of 3 of them alone, and it would be delicious. Burrata is one of my favorite cheeses. I would not be surprised if you could order the burrata alone off-menu or add to another salad/fries. Yum!The loaded fries were perfect. I have been to Montreal, and if you are going to do poutine wrong, this is the place to do it. This is a bit different because the cheese used is not the same as Montreal, and the gravy is a turkey gravy, but it's delicious. The fries stayed crispy the entire time while I was working, which is a miracle in my opinion. This probably has to be the best mock poutine I have eaten in the USA! The first dish took about 10 minutes to arrive, and the second dish arrived 5 minutes later. There is a free water jug along with utensils, etc. at a station next to the water. Whenever you are done, you can just leave the dirty dishes. I took the to-go menu since I will be traveling to this city more often and truly despise the airport options. I will be back!Broccolini and Burrata $10Loaded Fries $7.00State Sales Tax $1.49Total $18.49

name: Nomad Eatery
content: I'm stuck in town by an airline so found this place because it's within walking distance.  Very limited menu and with uninspiring overpriced food.  Maybe I'm spoiled by living in Austin, but 2 stars for being clean at least.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This place was a little hidden treasure! We split the brocollini salad which is amazing and the white pizza also very tasty and light with the added slivers of squash on top! They have a good selection of beers to choose from as well! It's one of those places where you choose your meal and pay at the front and then find your own seat! Overall very tasty and nice atmosphere!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This was my second time eating here after a strong positive recommendation from a friend. It was busy and only one bartender and one cashier.  We ordered our food and sat at the bar- good ginger pear bourbon drink. After over an hour I asked about our food only to have it be found, cold, waiting for take out. Our waiter/ bartender was apologetic and said he'd make it up to us... but handing us one rice crispy treat near the end of the visit was truly not the best way to handle that.  Try your luck there, I probably won't return.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: The best place to go for salad and light meal. Fresh ingredients, fast service, delicious food!I had the Wedge salad with no bacon. the lettuce was super crisp and I also loved the dressing. The Smoked Salmon salad and Betty White pizza were superb as well.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Phenomenal food. Great cocktails and atmosphere. Must try. Had the pickled beets and smoked salmon salad.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Was working in an office nearby and found this spot on yelp.... and was so pleasantly surprised!! 5 of us had different things and everyone enjoyed their lunch: pork tacos, falafel salad, turkey sandwich and wedge salad. And fries for the table. Don't pass on the fries. Please don't. They are delightful :-)Everything was fresh, tasty, and fast. Go here. You won't be disappointed!!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Great service and great food. Sat at the bar and was introduced to a local brew that was very good. If you like roasted beets, the roasted beet salad doesn't disappoint.  Glad I listened to the other reviews.  If you're on the hunt for a place in SLC, you should give it a try. I'll be back!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Buffalo style wings Winning! Smothered fries not so much, tasted one without gravy and cheese and it was super tasty. Go with the regular fries. The lunch rush will take you a while so be prepared

name: Nomad Eatery
content: With unique appetizers, classic entrees and very fresh ingredients, Nomad strikes perfect notes of familiar and novel. The fast casual set up makes it great for either a quick bite alone (being near the airport) or dinner with friends.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Awesome salmon salad!  Great flavor and just right for a lunch portion.  Bottled soft drinks a little pricey without refills.  Parking can be tight.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Great food, great atmosphere, we had the chicken sandwich and the Betty White both were excellent. Will definitely go back.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: We shared several things recommended by the waiter. All were fantastic! Spicy chicken sandwich, children of the corn pizza and the smoked salmon salad. The wait staff was very helpful and personable: great ambiance! Great find!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Tried this place because it was close to my hotel and ordered pickup. I must say it was FANTASTIC - I absolutely loved the beets (the granola added a nice sweetness) and the falafel salad was so wonderful! Great food!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Located just minutes from the SLC airport, this somewhat hidden gem serves up some unexpectedly tasty dishes.I've been here twice now. From what I've tasted, the chicken sandwich is my favorite (that's why it's the most popular item, right?) The chicken is so tender and the batter is fried perfectly with the right amount of graininess. The only thing lacking would be more hot sauce and condiments. But overall, I like it more than Pretty Bird. Nomad's sandwich is more savory whereas Pretty Bird's is sweeter and tangier.A close second is the pizza. I had the Margherita and it was absolutely wonderful. I loved the flavors of the fresh ingredients accompanied by the crispy crust. There are also some oils and balsamic vinaigrette by the utensils that would go well with them too.I've also had a few other bites that I enjoyed. The white citrus BBQ wings are glorious. It doesn't feel heavy but it's packed with flavors that leaves you wanting more. I might just go during lunch and order a big plate of those. The fries are also great - some of the best fries around. I've sampled the salmon salad as well, and the combination of the ingredients with the thousand island dressing makes for a filling yet light meal. Takeaway? All of their dishes are great, it doesn't seem like there's a miss. This is definitely a restaurant worth trying.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: I had been coming across this place all the time researching new places to eat.  Because of it's obscure location, I passed it up several times.  I'm so glad I finally went.  It was delicious!  We tried the pizza, the chicken sandwich and the pork tacos.  I'm not much into fried chicken sandwiches so that wasn't really my thing but the pizza and the tacos were really good.  The tacos are definitely something I'll be craving.  And their BYOW policy is the best EVER!   Please please keep this place consistent.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This place is a gem and should be in more locations. The staff is super friendly, the ambiance is perfect, the food is amazing and their beer menu is solid.I was here for work for a few weeks and I ordered the children of the corn pizza and pork tacos multiple times. Both solid choices.I would stay in the sub-par Radisson again just to be able to walk across the street and pick up food from them.My only suggestion would be to add sweet potato fries to the menu. I would order the sh*t out of them.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: What a cute place! The food was delicious and relatively fast. My cocktail was delicious too. Fresh and friendly!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Great sandwich and atmosphere. Everyone is friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The smoked turkey sandwich was legit. The smoke in the turkey was awesome and the salt and vinegar chips are great as well. Great food bit pricy will deff go back.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: What a cool location. VERY nice employees and very helpful. I ordered the 4 pc chicken wings with buffalo sauce and they were very very tasty. As a main dish I ordered the fish sandwich with the AMAZINGLY awesome salt and vinegar chips. WoW those were awesome. I would definitely go back and explore the menu.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: As soon as we walked in we were blown away with how good it smelled. Made us excited to try items on the menu. You order at a counter and they give you a number for your food. They have a small bar and lounging area where you can watch tv as well as the self seating area to dine. Peaked into the kitchen and it looked clean... always a plus. Would definitely recommend this place!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: The food was so delicious and the vibe to match. The service was amazing, would definitely stop by again. Blackberry bramble cocktail was fireeee

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This is not a gluten free friendly restaurant as promoted on yelp. Go next door to the bar for better gluten free options.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: What is surprise to find such a great place across the street from our hotel. This place is a real gem and worth traveling for even if you're not staying across the street.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Amazing food!!! Our first time here while visiting Salt Lake City. Friendly staff, very helpful. Cool casual atmosphere. Come with a group of people so you can all try different dishes. The spicy chicken sandwich and Children of the Corn pizza were some of the best.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: After reading Yelp reviews, my friend and I stopped here directly after picking up our rental before driving out of Salt Lake City. This was our first introduction on how friendly and hospitable people in Utah are. The menu had some unique items that all looked tasty and they also have a full bar attached to the eatery (must be 21 and over to sit on that side). I ordered a Salt Lake City beer, blackberry sour. If you like sour beers, you'd enjoy it! My friend ordered an Amber Ale from Moab Brewery. We had no trouble finishing our drinks. We shared "children of the corn" pizza and spicy chicken sandwich to share. Both had unique delicious flavors. If you are in Salt Lake City or fly into Salt Lake and want a bite to eat before leaving Salt Lake, I highly recommend stopping here for a beer and their food. Also, the nicest people work here! We are from FL so we weren't used to people being SO nice, SO thoughtful, and SO friendly!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Might very well be the best restaurant in salt lake. The best part is that much of menu is often changing so it's always fun. Also, the hot chicken is amazing, better and cheaper than pretty bird. Burger is good, I mean price to taste ratio it's one of the best. Pizza can be hit or miss it's 90% a huge hit. Just go. Just go, don't hesitate.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Ate here for the first time today...WOW! The "Betty White" and "Children of the Corn" pizzas were incredible! So full of flavor! And, the crust! Awesome!I will be back...

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Came from the airport. Visiting the area from Denver. Love the atmosphere when you walk in. Great staff, but the food was less than satisfactory especially for the price. The falafel salad is way too small even though it was tasty. The spicy chicken sandwich was all dark meat and grisly so it was not enjoyable.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: First time hearing about this place, random walk-in and I was truly impressed. The Filet O'Fish burger was very very good, came with a side of chips (salt and vinegar) also pretty good.Burger had the right amount of everything, moist well seasoned, a little kick on the after-taste, good price. Very clean, modern and casual place. Would highly recommend for lunch or a quick tasty bite to eat!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: The food was great! I had the Fish Sandwich and it was well seasoned and tasty:) The restaurant is super clean and welcoming.  I will return with more friends next time! This is a major contribution to the Fairpark/Rosepark neighborhood and a yummy quick stop when you are headed to the airport.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Not a lot of good options in this area, so this was a pleasant surprise. My friends loved their chicken sandwiches, the fries were pretty good, and my Greenhouse Salad was tasty--but tiny. It's more of a side salad. I don't have a massive appetite, and it definitely wasn't enough for a meal for me, though was priced like a full salad. I gather some of the other salads come in more generous portions.Other positives are the lively atmosphere, and that it's a great looking place--hip urban rustic, if that's a thing. Friendly staff, too. But I can't give a higher rating for a meal that left me that hungry.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: I can't even.  The BEST. SALAD. OF.  MY.  LIFE. In house smoked salmon,  pickled celery,  radish,  golden raisins, parmesan,  almonds,  topped on lettuce with kind of a thousand island dressing but 10x better.  I have had dreams about this salad since I've had it. Perfect flavor combination.  There's nothing else to say.  Get that salad and get it often.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Okay let's begin. The name Nomad Eatery? Might as well be hobo eatery or homeless man eatery. Dumb name, but let's get to the vibe - loud music a bit hard to hear other people's conversations because I am alone. I enjoyed the architecture very modern and rustic. Food wise, great to take a picture of, post it on insta #food #nomadeatery do all that. Then throw it away and leave, get some fucking McDonald's or something LESS salty.. One bite of the pizza gave me osteoporosis. Not even lying the LANDRAUCHSCHINKEN, dumb name right, was some good crust with a pound of salt poured over it. Serious warning you eat that pizza you cross the bridge to a heart attack. The sandwiches use deli meat from Walmart and I'm sure the week old lettuce and spinach is varnished in E. coli. That's my two cents

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Fish o'filet was really sour! Good for the most part though. I really liked their salt and vinegar chips- really thin and crispy and tasted like sweet potato chips (?)

name: Nomad Eatery
content: This is a great find! This was our first visit, and we got the Betty White and margarita pizzas. Excellent! The Betty White is awesome! The place is clean, great atmosphere, wonderful staff--don't miss this terrific eatery!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Ate here yesterday with a friend and it was SUCH a good experience! I ordered the Betty White pizza, and it was SO good! The service was great as well! Looking forward to coming back again :)

name: Nomad Eatery
content: The falafel salad, smoked salmon salad, and roasted/pickled beets were so complex and really let the vegetables shine.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Fun and unique dining experience in a strange location out by the airport but worth the trip. Hip interior (although didn't love how loud the music was) and super friendly and attentive staff who were happy to give us a full rundown of the menu along with recommendations. I had the hot chicken. Honestly, it doesn't touch Hattie B's in Nashville but this sandwich is quite good for Salt Lake. The side of house made salt & vinegar chips were excellent, a buttery smooth crisp that melted in your mouth. They have a lot of unique menu options and I plan to come back and try more. The hot chicken is their most popular but there are a lot of other interesting dishes I'm excited to try on future visits.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: It was great!! I enjoy the creativity with their menu. I just took my family there, my kids are 3 & 7 and they loved it! Watching the pizza being rolled out and going into the oven! The staff has always been incredibly friendly and helpful. I would recommend Nomads to all the foodies out there!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Literally my favorite place to go while in the area for work. This past week alone I have been 4 times. The staff are friendly and super helpful. Out of the items I have had everything has been 5 stars. The loaded fries are literally out of this world crazy good  .  The chicken sandwich is fantastic if you like spicy . All the meats are smoked out back and taste amazing so you can't go wrong with anything. The bar is great as well. Last thing is the vibe, It feels like the living room of your house (if your house is trendy that is). Try it you won't be disappointed.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: The location is totally random, but the inside is trendy, clean, modern, and fun. Menu is not too large, but lots of good options from sandwiches to salads. Not much for dessert- when I visited I think the only option was a chocotaco. Decent beer list and cocktail list. I tried the chicken sandwich, as that is what I went specifically to try due to rumors of its superiority to Pretty Bird's. There is no modulating the heat in this one though! Man, I know I'm a wimp, but their hot sauce had so much heat I got a rash! It was good though. (For the record? I prefer Pretty Bird but my husband prefers Nomad.)

name: Nomad Eatery
content: The service was good, but the food was honestly not that great. The Spicy Chicken sandwich had a really weird blend of sauces that didn't work, and the loaded fries were nothing to write home about. I may change my review if I come back to try something else, but not a great first experience.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Super cute place with pizza, sandwiched, salads and has a bar with beer and wine. I had the children of the corn pizza and it was excellent! I would recommend asking for a little extra chorizo on it as mine was a little light and that made it.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Gotta revise my earlier review after my latest visit. We were craving the chicken sandwich from our earlier visit but what we got was vastly different. The breading tasted like cornmeal, which was the sandwich's strongest flavor coming through. That, and the hot sauce they douse the sandwich in. It was painfully hot. We also got the falafel "salad", which was basically three falafel balls served with some pickles. Tasty, but not the salad we were expecting and not all that satisfying. I miss that chicken sandwich from before!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Nomad Eatery is one of my favorite Salt Lake City restaurants. The menu has a variety of options from flatbread pizzas to wholesome sandwiches and a variety of salads. Each menu item is created with a combination of unique ingredients that are perfectly crafted and well sized portions! There's a wide range of adult beverages and dessert options that perfectly compliment any meal. In a comfy, laid back atmosphere with friendly and quick service - I highly recommend Nomad Eatery for a lunch or dinner destination.

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Amazing food and top notch service! You can tell the ingredients are fresh and they care about their customers. I visited twice in a week and the Margherita Pizza, Children of the Corn Pizza, Pear & Arugula Salad and Falafel were delicious!! Thanks, Nomad!!

name: Nomad Eatery
content: Funky little place with counter service. Food fresh, eclectic and very tasty! I had smoked pork tacos and they were excellent! Everything looked very good!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Fresh food, bold flavors. Modern interior. I sat on the patio which was lovely. It may be fun to sit inside since it's an open kitchen. The menu is small with a salad, seafood, pasta, beef and other main dish options. 3-5 starter options. Drinks were nice too. My companion said it was the best hamburger she has ever had-the chef purchased the cow from a local farm and butchered it himself. I already want to go back with a group of friends for a beautiful meal.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Beautiful restaurant with a very unassuming exterior but then welcomes you with a cute and modern indoor and outdoor seating area.Great and friendly service that you would expect from a modern up coming establishment and still feels local to SLC.The food was delicious! We ordered the sea bass and the duck, both of which were cooked and seasoned to perfection. Absolutely loved the presentation and freshness of the dish. We even ordered the unassuming bread and butter to be pleasantly surprised with a flaky delicious roll.Overall I would 10/10 come back here again. Great place for romantic dates and special occasion, and still casual enough to just catch up with friends.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Very nice little restaurant with a cute back patio. Design is clean and elegant with an open kitchen. The staff was so friendly & kind, they really took the time to explain menu items. The chef is obsessed with his craft in thee most sensual way I have ever seen. The visual aspects of each dish are perfectly & carefully detailed. It's like you can taste the love & care that was put into these dishes.While visiting we tried the artichokes, bread & french butter, mushroom toast, citrus salad, Jalapeno cheddar burger & braised beef. All of it was delicious & it felt like a experience more than just a dinner. Overall if you are looking for a light fresh dinner definitely visit this unique gem!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: After enjoying an evening on the patio, Arlo quickly jumped to my #1 restaurant in SL. From cocktails through to dessert, everything was absolutely amazing. The staff was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable; and the atmosphere was casual, yet refined. I highly suggest the mushroom toast, beet salad, & sea bass. The food was truly outstanding. All were presented beautifully and exceeded our expectations. We can't wait to return.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: I rarely write reviews for anything but Arlo deserves an excellent one! We live in the neighborhood and would frequently walk by before they were open on our evening "COVID-times" walks and lust after dining there! Well, we finally got to try Arlo last night in celebration of being vaccinated and a work success, and we were not disappointed. The interior is gorgeous, although we sat on the dreamy patio in the spring sun. The service was impeccable, friendly, and warm - everything you'd want from a neighborhood spot. The food was amazing, we loved hearing about the new menu items and where the ingredients were from (local!). It felt like we were dining on a patio in Europe - simply dreamy! We will definitely be back ASAP!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Food was phenomenal, which I'll detail next. One star deducted for the fact that the printed menu didn't match what we were given (carrot soup was asparagus leek soup--awesome, but unexpected; duck dish was the lamb dish with chicken--and to be fair, they comped us a dessert for the mixup), and one star deducted for the most uncomfortable chairs ever. An hour in those streamlined modern seats which tilt at an odd angle, and I couldn't wait to get out of there, my rear and thighs were so sore. The only moderately manageable position is partway leaning back, but if you try to lean forward to talk to your dining companion, you're in trouble. I'm still sore the next morning. As for the food: the savory mushroom French toast was light and delicious, the sea bass perfectly enhanced by the unique cashew sauce (although the accompanying pumpkin was mealy), the lemon tart's piquancy tamed by the rosemary and crunchy meringue topping, the apricot cheesecake good (but wish it were smaller at the end of a big meal). Overall, we were delightfully surprised by each bite, but would have to think hard about a return visit given the chairs I wouldn't ever want to sit in again.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Ever chance if and creative menus is refreshing.  One of the few real "good ones" around Salt Lake.  Nothing I've gotten here has disappointed.  Beautiful restaurant and food.  Very well deserving of a visit!!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Truly an exceptional restaurant! Delicious, creative food. Ate outside in the heated tent and felt very safe during COVID. Show this wonderful little gem of a restaurant some love, they're bringing a beautiful experience to SLC.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: This place is amazing. My wife and I have been there a couple of times and have loved that the menu constantly changes. I have had the best chicken confit and pork chop of my life at this place. This place also has great service. Every time that we have been there, they have given us a complementary appetizer. Last time we went they gave us the citrus salad and it was delicious. 10/10 would recommend. Love the vibe, love the service, love the food.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: I have to say Arlo is the best restaurant in city. Great staff. Very Covid safe. Food unlike anything I have ever had before. If you are visiting Salt Lake City you have to eat here.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: What a great job they did in remodeling this beautiful old venue in the capitol hill area.  I love the atmosphere and I would have to say that they are taking the virus more serious than any other place we have been to this year.The food was fantastic, I had never had a lamb burger before and was very surprised with how much I loved it.  It was cooked perfectly and was extremely juicy.  The price of the food is probably more reasonable than you would get in a place with the same quality.  I loved our visit here

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Tasty and interesting dishes. I felt safe and comfortable. Good service. Overall a really good experience. Will definitely be back

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: What a beautiful place! Beautiful locally-sourced and seasonal menu, and they don't waste! They populate their menu based on what's available! For brunch I love the Mexican eggs and the empanadas. For dinner I love their little gem salad. But gosh, one of my absolute favorites is their breads and French butter!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: A very nice location, and helpful & pleasant staff. We totally enjoyed everything we ordered except I probably got a bad piece of fish. (Otherwise, my wife and I shared everything and she had no troubles) I didn't find this out until about an hour later, and it was obvious (painfully) that I'd eaten something bad...It happens, so I'm not freaking out about it. But five stars implies a perfect, superlative experience, and this fell slightly short. I would, nonetheless, ABSOLUTELY return when I'm in the area.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: We went for brunch on Sunday and lived it! The patio was beautiful and the food was wonderful. We had the French toast, the Mexican eggs and the simple eggs. My favorite was the French toast. They could use a better tea selection but that's my only complaint. Service was friendly and fast. We'll be back soon!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Such a nice atmosphere and the food was amazing. The French toast wasn't overly sweet and everything I had had such a great balance of flavors. I will definitely go back, as I had brunch, I am excited to try the dinner menu.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Service was attentive, so they were able to tell us dinner was going to be delayed. When we finally got our main courses I was underwhelmed with the pork and potatoes. Meat portion was small and overcooked. Lots of potatoes, but just not that tasty. Beet salad was good. Friends all had squash which was ok. Very limited menu and vegetable centric. Gluten free options very limited. A lovely seating area outside.Would not rush back.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: This was our first time dining out in a while, and the Arlo team made it a great one!  We are in the SLC area on an extended visit from California, and didn't have reservations on a Friday night.  We called and they were able to seat us at one of the front patio tables right away.  Having not been there before, we weren't sure what the front patio would be like but we gave it a try.  Turned out to be a nice, quaint outdoor space perfect for the two of us.  We started with some bread and butter then ordered the beet salad.  At this point I appreciated that our server was really attentive and came back to check on us, but not so much that it distracted from the evening.  That's a skill he showed especially after it was clear we weren't in a hurry - thank you Jason!  Back to the beet salad, in my opinion the combination of flavors was creative and worked really well together.  We both agreed the cheese (wish I could describe it better) at the base of this salad was excellent; my partner thought the tomatoes were excellent and the beets were average.  I had the lamb ravioli which was creative and the right portion size.  Overall the experience reminded me of what spoils me back home - fresh, seasonal food created by chefs who know how to adapt to what is in season.  Oh, and the wine menu was nice as well.  We had the Chimeres Grenache with the vegetable tart and Vietti Barbera with the lamb ravioli, both of which paired well.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Arlo was fantastic. The food was wonderful and very true to what was in season. I loved every dish I ordered and there was nothing left on anyone's plate in our group. The patio was beautiful and tables were appropriately spaced. Everyone took mask wearing seriously as well. It is a perfect spot!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Went here the week it opened and it was a refreshing experience and menu despite covid taking over our lives. The food and drink menu is excellent and you can really taste the craft and care that Chef Milo puts into all his dishes. I can say that you will not be disappointed by anything you order even if an ingredient or flavor combination seems off. Their patio seating is beautiful and private and it's quickly moved to the top of our list.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Perfect meal. No exaggeration, it was the best thing I've eaten in a while. Get the cioppino while you can.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: What a delight-true commitment to fresh ingredients combined with creativity. A "southern fried chicken" with grits and tomatillo chili relish or a traditional empanada with almond "slaw."Bravo!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Incredible amibaince tucked away on Capitol Hill, perfect for these early fall nights. Highly suggested, feels like you're in Marin County in the Bay Area. Lovely sunset view during my entire meal, and the meal itself SO good. Flavors on point with the butternut squash tart, the ravioli was light and just right, left enough room for the lemon tart and another glass of wine.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Great atmosphere and top quality food. The empanadas are a must have. The basic green salad was a little plain, but fresh. Ravioli is always changing, but was perfect.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Loved this spot and the outdoor patio is amazing.Ceviche - A+Ravioli - A+Also loved the Beet salad and the chicken dish.  The desserts are really the star menu items. Well, post- menu items.The lemon blackberry tart is special but the rice pudding- I could eat ten of them.  I know, I know..., rice pudding usually seems bleh and boring, but this was something very magical. I highly recommend. I will be coming here again. Good, friendly service. Good vibes.Oh, and make sure you get the bread and butter to start with!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Arlo was amazing in every way - the food, the service, and the atmosphere. We ordered the ceviche, the squash main, and the pork. Every dish was delicious and filling. Loads of flavor. We had a great waitress who came at all the right times. The patio was beautifully lit and had lots of pretty plants. I cannot wait to go back!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: I discovered this adorable spot on accident, while wandering around the neighborhood on an evening walk with a girlfriend. The twinkling patio lights and grapevines draped over the pergola first caught our attention. So, we peaked inside the restaurant, and a friendly hostess let us peruse the menu. I promised myself I would dine here soon.On a date last night, I had my first opportunity. This restaurant is my new favorite restaurant in Salt Lake City, and possibly... anywhere. I had the opportunity to meet the owner, and I could tell he really cares about the quality of dishes he creates in his kitchen. I could sense the intentionality and care he puts into everything from the way the kitchen was designed, to the setting of the tables, to the typeface of the font on the menus. We ordered the ceviche, a ravioli dish, a beet salad, and a blackberry lemon tart. Every dish was perfection. Every bite tasted like falling in love in the summertime. You may think this is an exaggeration for a simple plate of food, but I encourage you to try it out for yourself, and see if you disagree. I can't wait to share this new gem of a dining establishment with my friends and family, so I can share the delightful experience I had here with them!I think I'll end my review with my thoughts on the blackberry lemon tart, which would most accurately be described with as few words as possible, because this dessert left me speechless.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: So damn good. I had to stop myself from licking the bowl of the ceviche. The patio is great as well.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Great ambiance and amazing service. We ordered the ceviche, tomato tarte, tomato and stone fruit salad, and chicken with smoked eggplant puree. Food was extremely fresh and delicious. Unfortunately, our dessert was disappointing. We ordered the chocolate cake which was dry and didn't have much flavor. But I still think it was a great experience!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: They were fully staffed to be sure and had a patio filled with patrons--so money was being made.  The waitstaff was horrible.  They could not speak about the menu.  Hot food was served lukewarm. The "worlds greatest" butter was served rock hard and unable to spread--it did taste great--but knowing how something is supposed to be served is basic.  I left hungry still.  Unsatisfied.  How's that as final word after paying the check---had to eat something else later to feel like I'd eaten dinner.Nice location.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Big Time WOW!The entree I had here was a special one.  Chicken comes a dime a dozen so for such a simple dish to stand out so much is worthy of note. I tried hard to eat slowly so I could enjoy every bite to the fullest but with each bite all I could think was that it Couldn't have actually been that good,  I'd better take another bite to make sure...  So on and so on, now I'm left salvating for my next visit.Going out during Covid times is or rather it should be a treat,  so treat yourself to a great meal, and great service.  Bravo Chef Arlo

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: The patio is lovely and feels so safe. The food is exceptional. The stone fruit and tomato salad was so fresh and delicious. The halibut was cooked perfectly and melted in your mouth. The cocktails are adventurous and delicious.  The service was very attentive and friendly. I would highly recommend this experience a great escape!!!!

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: They set a table on the sidewalk patio to accommodate us last minute. It was greatly appreciated. We felt like we had our own private patio. We got lamb ravioli that had walnuts and olives. It was definitely different. Sadly the meat was a little on the dry side. We also ordered the halibut which came with a nice green bean mustard salad. The halibut itself was also overcooked. The dessert was amazing though. We got stone fruit tart which had the most amazing ripe plums, and rice pudding which we though was delicious.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Most enchanting patio in SLC.  Visited last night for my bday dinner with a small intimate group.  Food was terrific and the ambiance just made for a perfect summer evening.  We ordered half the menu and were very impressed.  Can't wait to visit again soon.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: This restaurant was delicious and exactly what I wanted in a dining experience. The wait staff was attentive and took their time explaining things. They also paid attention to detail which was appreciated. The food was delicious as well and everything felt healthy! Our favorite dish was the ceviche.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: We celebrated a bday outside in their plaza. Menu was a bit restricted but amazingly offered quite a variety. Do not leave there without trying the ceviche. Wow!The selections were fantastic and the waitstaff were very friendly and professional. This is a definite must!T

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Bottom line is that the food is good, well prepared and tastey. Service was good. They use a ton of super fresh ingredients and high quality food. The prices are fair and the portion sizes are just right. I am very happy we ate here and we will definitely be back. The balance between price, quality and flavor are spot on. Go with confidence and enjoy! Make sure you have a drink with your food. I'll explain later. Overall I will be back for sure. This place is good, but as time goes on I hope it can get better. With a few extra minutes to put themselves in the customers shoes, they'd offer an experience hard to beat in SLC. And I sincerely mean that. One of the hardest things to do while running a restaurant is to have "customer eyes." I feel like those that can master this aspect are unstoppable. There is a fine balance between your passion and what's realistic. We went after dark and the corners of their patio are not lit, which is where we were sat. We couldn't see our food which was a huge bummer. I wish they would find a creative way to light their patio better. This would enhance the experience as we did not get to enjoy the artful presentation of the food or understand the way it was plated. More light would be a great idea. The food itself was great with a few complaints. Shining plates were the pizza, tomato tart, and stone fruit salad. The other plates were good too, but lacking the same cohesion.  Honestly id go back just for the tart and pizza. OFF THE CHARTS. The spaghetti was severely undercooked, almost crunchy. Obviously this was not on purpose, but my main issue is that there was an ungodly amount of chunked parmaesan cheese that overpowered the food, which was very light on flavor to begin with. It was very soft tomato sauce, almost white.  They topped it off with full basil leaves which was strange cause I had to break it all up to incooperate it into the dish. Quite frankly the preparation and serving of the pasta was lazy. While it was tastey, it was just lazy. Then again if I'd had some light I could've picked around the cheese....The ravioli was odd but still good and fun. I enjoyed eating it but wasnt a huge fan of the olive/plum/walnut idea. It clashed a little too much for me. The bitterness of the olives were amplified by the tartness of the plumes rather than balancing it.  They were not sweet plums at all which is what I think was the problem. It was a pungent, albeit fun, bite. I'd nix the olives next time. They were an unnecessary bitterness added to a dish that I think was meant to be on the sweeter side of the spectrum.  Alot of the menu was overpowered by bitter, tart and strong flavors. From chunks of sharp parmaesan, to olives, to plums, there was too much bitter without much to mix up my pallet. After eating there my mouth had that feeling that I have after eating too much sour candy. Moral of the story is that  you need a drink other than water to really enjoy this place. The food would've paired very well with a mellow beverage.  Great prices, great ingredients and great ideas. A few small yet essential changes will put Arlo in my top 5 in SLC.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: This was our first time out since Covid and we chose the right place. The food was incredible, the patio was perfect, the service was awesome, and we will go back with the menu changing weekly.I got the Pizza and it was so good. It had a pesto sauce and a lamb sausage. The crust was so good I would have just eaten that by itself. The ingredients on top were so quality and delicious.   I also had the whisky cocktail and it was exactly what I wanted that night.Highly recommend, we have needed more restaurants like this.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: My boyfriend and I dined at Arlo yesterday and it was fabulous! The food was unbelievably good. They have patio dining only which we appreciated. We will absolutely be dining here again! Wear a mask please

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Patio life!!! I am super impressed with Arlo. They've only been open for a few weeks, but they seem to have everything dialed in. The casual patio vibe you loved from Em's is still there but the service seems a bit more precise and detailed. Drinking a glass of wine on their patio is a must for a SLC summer.The food is spot on, exactly what you'd hope for from a upscale casual restaurant. The menu wouldn't be out of place at a spot in Napa Valley. Highly recommended.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Salt Lake needs more restaurants like Arlo! Unique food with seasonal ingredients that taste AMAZING! We sat on the patio and the ambiance was awesome. Everyone at the table kept talking about how delicious each dish was. We tried almost everything-my very top favorites were the grain salad, both pasta dishes and the chicken which was cooked to perfection. Two thumbs up-everyone should show some support to this local Utah business.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: Ate here last night and it was delicious! First off, the staff and service are incredible. Attentive, knowledgeable but let my friend and I linger over our meal and drinks. The outside seating is an upgrade from Em's with shade canopies and new tables and chairs. They only offer outside seating right now (good call) but the inside decor is so beautiful. My friend and I both had the bread and butter (sounds basic but so worth it), the halibut (very tender with incredible potatoes and this citrus purée that was so perfect with it all), and the frozen yogurt (perfection - and it came with three soft, delicious cookies!). We also tried the vodka cocktail which was so light and refreshing it has become my new favorite drink. A wonderful meal at a lovely location. Plus, they let me know that while they don't have a standard kid's menu they can make cheese pizza, buttered noodles and other kid friendly options! And we heard the server offer an extensive list of vegan options which was great to hear.

name: Arlo Restaurant
content: I can't justly put to words how excited I am to have Arlo added to SLC's restaurant scene. Such a great Saturday night experience on their beautiful patio.Location: The interior is designed incredibly well, but the patio is perfect. Large shade sails make it cool during the heat, while tall greenery gives the area a cozy feel. The marmalade neighborhood is very walkable, so plan on a stroll after eating here through the streets or up around the Capitol.Service: Fantastic. Such friendly and inviting people, which is especially refreshing at a new restaurant.Dinner: Everything we ordered was excellent. The team here has designed a great flavor profile. The only criticism is that the pierogi style dish was tasty, but very small, more of an appetizer than a meal. Thankfully the pizza was very hardy, so we shared that.Desserts: PHENOMENAL. The chocolate cake is the perfect blend of sweet and rich, while not being terribly dense. Visually it's a show stopper. My favorite was the strawberry tart though. Perfectly ripe strawberries, a little tartness in the custard, and then the shell was crunchy without being overly thick.Great work Arlo!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: This is always a fun place to visit. The Decour is cool and the food is usually very good. I think they've had a bit of a challenge in the last year with Covid but I hope to see them return to their old self soon

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: My friend and I had such high expectations for this place. A good friend of ours that lives in Park City recommend it. We called around 6 PM and asked if there were any open tables available. A man said they had two available tables and shouldn't be an issue. We then  arrived about 40 minutes later. Upon arrival the host (wearing a Baltimore ravens sweatshirt) said the wait would now be about two hours. Then the manager was lacking hospitality skills.... We had one drink and then left. I come from a hospitality background in San Diego and have never been treated like this from any of the best restaurants or bars in San Diego. Obviously the two guys think that they are really cool working at this place but honestly Salt Lake City is really just a little dot on the map. Good luck guys will take our money somewhere else and you're not going get anyone's business from San Diego!!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I was only in the little bar area at the front... no idea what else is there. But..... my friend and I were just there for a beer and water before deciding where else to eat.  We only had one beverage. We were there maybe 30-40 minutes and were told that we had to clear out because of other customers who need the table. I glanced outside and there was NO ONE waiting to come in.  And there was still room for others even if we stayed. How rude!!!  That right there decided that I would never return.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: First time in SlC, first bar here, grabbed a couple drinks upstairs. Amazing hospitality, Spencer is an awesome bartender and great host. Will come back 100%.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Made reservations on OpenTable and they required a credit card be put on the reservation just in case we pulled a no call no show before 24 hours of the reservation. Also noted that there would be a $40 charge per person if one of the 3 people weren't able to make it.They take reservations pretty seriously! Anyway service was attentive and amazing the whole time. We had a difficult time deciding what to order as everything looked so amazing.The beer can chicken was succulent and tender, they brought it out before they cut it up and literally took a full hour to make that. We also had the deep fried NY steak, the charcuterie board with locally made ingredients. Also had the bread service which they made their own butter and even smoked one of them. The French onion sliders with brisket were super tender and flavorful.The only thing we found that kinda sucked were the beignets as there just wasn't enough sweetness to counter the dough.For sure will return as the place was exceptional!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: How can you not love this place? Intimate, romantic and the food is amazing!! We ordered the beer can chicken to split and the "blind pig" cocktail which, gave the bartender the freedom to make whatever he felt. Amazing! Loved it!!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Loved this spot. A low key, late night vibe. We stumbled in here after dinner and drinks at White Horse, and despite some bad luck, we had an awesome time.When I say bad luck, I mean this - we came in, hungry after a few drinks, but had just missed our opportunity to order food. The taco menu looked bomb, but the kitchen had just closed. Also, we realized that this place houses a really cool looking speakeasy, the Rest. Of course, they were filled and we had no reservations. All in all, we were stuck to normalcy, forced to drink tequila and mezcal in public with no food (lolz).The staff was awesome. It was later in the evening so it seemed like things were winding down, and everyone was really friendly. We bought them a round of shots and hung out probably way longer than we should have, but we were having such a great time.Lesson learned: make a resy next time and show up earlier. Either way, don't miss this spot.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I was really looking forward to this place. It looked interesting and different. I know that with COViD things have changed but it was still kind of boring. I went by myself hoping to sit at the bar and people watch. Instead they placed me all the way down the hallway in the back. It was dark and not a lot to look at besides a few pictures on the wall. The food was good, I ordered the pork belly and the bartender made a fantastic drink that he was experimenting with. Service was good, it was just kind of dull. On my way out I saw plenty of people at the bar and the tables around the open room.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I'll be the first to admit-I'm a sucker for unique places and even more so for surprises. The Rest fits that bill perfectly.From the main/upstairs entrance off the street, you might be a little turned off. The place is tiny, doesn't have much to it and very rarely are there other people in there. But when you arrive and ask the host to go to The Rest (which you should have a reservation for), then the magic begins. There is a locked door that leads down a dimly lit staircase to the speakeasy below. The mood and ambience changes immediately and you are transported to another place. And you know that it's special.There are booths/tables as well as a bar. I enjoyed eating at a booth with a group of colleagues, although the bar would be fun for a more casual experience. This is not the place where you order a glass of wine or a beer. Sure, they have those things. But the bartender is amazing and you really ought to let him craft you up something delicious. Speaking of delicious, give yourself time to explore the food menu and order a meal. Since this is classified as a bar and not a restaurant (21+ required), you can just order a drink if you prefer. But you'd be missing out if you didn't order food as well. Everything that we ordered in our group was perfection. Remember, superb food takes time, so plan accordingly. The service here is top notch-your drink won't ever go dry and if you'd like a recommendation or two, your server will point you toward something great.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: We went to the Rest right on the weekend that they reopened due to Covid. What a time! We had the legendary beer can chicken and pork tenderloin and both were great! For me personally the pork tasted better and scored higher in flavor. The beer can chicken is more visual for sure. It tasted a little salty on the skin but when eating everything together it balanced out. We had to wait for an hour for the chicken to be done, so we ended up with plenty of meat for 2 people. It was such a good meal and we will go back.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Myself and coworker had a great time in the cool downstairs speakeasy.   Excellent drinks and wonderful food.   Sit at the bar and learn about cocktails from knowledgeable bartender!  Great place

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: The Beer Can Chicken is WORTH it EVERY time! Service is always friendly. Cocktails tend to be on the overly herbaceous side but are still tasty!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Spencer is awesome! Made some drinks off the cuff for my picky (sick) self and friend. It's always a nice touch when a  bartender will use the craft to make an experience that much better.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I had a great time at this intimate underground oasis. I came for a finely crafted cocktail and stayed for the great food, excellent service and friendly atmosphere. I'll definitely visit again the next time I'm in town.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: The corny locked door to the "speakeasy" downstairs really does unlock a masterpiece of drinks and dining. If you're looking for cocktail craftsmanship do the smart thing and order a cocktail off-menu with bartender's choice and the base liquor you're craving. I'm a sucker for a cocktail that takes time and thought and these tenders are up for the challenge. The space is romantic and lit perfectly like a Fritz Lang noir.I've only had two meals but both were fall off the bone perfection. Don't let the modest upstairs fool you. This place is a gem.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: An absolute hidden gem. Steeped in the long-forgotten era of gentlemen and gentlewomen. We adore this place and their stellar cocktails, excellent food and unexpected and perfect décor. Oh yes, the stuffed beignets are c'est magnifique!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: This is one of my favorite places! The beer can chicken is worth the wait (about 60 mins to prep) and it's worth the price. It's huge! It comes with potatoes and asparagus on the side. It's seriously so amazing that you'll eat yourself sick trying to finish it all (I did and I still couldn't finish it all). You could share it with a date, however all other items on the menu are great too! Especially the pork chops! I'm not a huge fan of their craft and one off drinks but they make all sorts of drinks.  I had a great blueberry Moscow Mule. Best time I've had, was we had a group of 10 and sat in the back library(ish) room. It felt like a private party since you're so secluded in the back. down sides...it's dark. Like super dark. You'll use your phone or the table candle to read the menu. It took a while for my eyes to adjust. It's hip. Like hipster hip so cool. Plus you'll need to plan ahead to make a reservation and if you're late you'll lose your reservation. If you make a reservation for say.. 8 people and only 6 people show up, they charge you for the people missing in your party. It's all good tho, if you plan accordingly you'll love it!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: A must-stop on any trip to SLC.  I've been here four times and it has not disappointed.  The dark, underground space with a turn-table and homemade butters - what could be better on a cold blustery night.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I don't understand why this place has such a high rating on yelp. Disappointed in the service, the food, and the overall value of the experience. My husband and I decided to try The Rest for the first time prior to attending a musical at Eccles theater. When we arrived, we were made to wait in the Bodega for 5 to 10 minutes while our seating was "prepared." However, when they took us down to be seated, we were simply sat at the bar - which was empty. We were the only ones! Why they made us stand and wait in the vestibule upstairs is beyond me. Not a good way to start off. Next, we decided to order the charcuterie board and some drinks to start. Because of the slow service, this is all we would end up having time for. I ordered red wine and my husband got a beer. This is not the place to go if you want wine; the varietals are not even listed on the menu. When I asked the bartender for a glass of their best Cabernet, I was disgusted. $14 and it tasted like a box wine. By the time the charcuterie board finally appeared, we had no more time to order any additional appetizers or food. The charcuterie board only contained two cheeses and two meats despite its high price tag; and the board was 1/3 sourdough bread, which was hard. Clearly not fresh. I'd rather go to Caputo's and create my own charcuterie board at home. Finally, despite communicating to the bartender that we needed to get to the theater, we sat with my credit card out on the counter of the bar for 20 minutes and the bartender never came back to pick up. I finally just held my credit card in the air like I used to do in college until the bartender noticed. The only reason I am not give this place only one star is because of the cool ambiance. If you're looking for atmosphere and a neat, speakeasy vibe, then is your place. But I would not go here for the food, the drinks, or the service.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I had an issue with Bodega/Rest and the management.  Thus, my last review came from a boiling cauldron of anger.  However, this is a great bar and under appreciated in Salt Lake City.  In many ways, Bodega/Rest was way ahead of its time.  That is an anomaly in Utah.  Cool, hip, and sophisticated, B/R should not only be packed every night of the week, it should have national recognition.  Drinks, food and service are all great, and the concept is just now being copied world wide.  Management is still arrogant and dismissive, but maybe they have a right to be.  Michael Jordan is arrogant, and he should be.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Cool little speakeasy right in downtown. Has a small bar on the street level where you can wait and get $3 tequila shots, beers, etc but once you go downstairs it's like a dark and vibey hideaway filled with taxidermy, books, and weird little objects throughout.
