The record selection is pretty stellar so take a moment to peruse the options and pick a side by placing it in the queue. Got seated at a table, orders placed and the drinks came after a little wait. The Elder's return was by far my favorite and it's a cool take on a tiki classic. Drink prices can be a bit much but they are pretty worth it when you factor in the experience and all. Definitely a must see when in SLC.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Easily the most unique spot in all of Utah. With a speak easy kind of atmosphere in a turn of the century basement. The ambiance and decor definitely help with the lore of the place. But with that said the food is absolutely perfect. My steak was beyond the best thing I've eaten in years. Our server was great with many suggestions.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I absolutely love this place. If you go, you need to ask one of the Bodega employees. They will then put you on a list, and take you down when it's your turn. The ambience is dark and sexy. Feels like you are in another world. Perfect place for private conversation and a relaxing environment. Not to mention beautiful.  The restrooms are pretty neat. Giant troft in the middle between the unisex bathrooms. Staff is nice. Drinks are amazing.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Found this spot on yelp when we visited Salt Lake City and loved it! The upstairs bar has an INCREDIBLE ambiance and look/feel - it can get busy so be sure to get there somewhat early so you don't get x'd out. Walk to the back and ask to be seated for dinner at the rest and they'll lead you downstairs to the speak easy which is beautifully decorated and has great food! If you don't ask they won't show ;) great for any night out

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Love the deep fried steak and bear can chicken which take a long time. Our bar tender Lucas is awesome. He created this new drink which I named Lucas's green bear is so good. Refreshing. Not too sweet. Perfect cocktail.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Pretentious atmosphere.I guess we didn't have the right look. We waited to go into the speak easy but were continuously passed up for parties that came in after us.  Made me feel kinda shitty.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Cute environment and cheap tequila shots, but got treated very rudely last time we came in. We ( a group of 4) had come in and gotten tequila shots .we went and sat down in the corner, took them and had been talking for no more than 5 minutes. Got told by one of the staff that we had to leave because "they were at capacity and we weren't drinking." Mind you, we were planning on getting more drinks shortly and HAD LITERALLY JUST BOUGHT ALCOHOL. Also, there had to be no more than 10 people there. I've seen way more people squished into bodega on busy nights. Many other customers had been there longer than us with no drinks in their hand. I understand they are a business and have to make money/sell drinks, but we weren't loitering by any means. Simply taking a breather before we ordered more shots.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Such a great find! Tucked away in the basement, I honestly had no idea what to expect when the door to the restaurant had to be unlocked for us to enter. But hidden away is a gorgeously decorated, eclectic, speakeasy space. The ambiance is amazing and the staff matches it. The bartenders make amazing custom cocktails that don't disappoint. The restaurant is slightly on the expensive side with entrees ranging for $25-30. We had the ceviche and pappardelle for appetizers and the braised beef for the entree. The pappardelle was fresh and delicious, the ceviche was on the sweet side which wasn't bad just not what I anticipated. Beef fell of the bone and was perfectly tender. Would definitely return, the staff put it over the edge and really enhanced our experience.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: They were really rude to us even though we had reservations and everything.Wore an exclusive romper (decent enough to get into high end clubs/restaurants such as sky/Bambara without any issues) for dinner to celebrate my bday and they turned us our entry stating that they will not allow us "wearing costumes" (which the person stated was very rude and sarcastic with his statements).They clearly mentioned that they will not charge our card and they will cancel our reservation as this would be their mistake and call it even.We left there, with the guarantee from the person at front desk there and the next day I notice a charge of freaking $280 from bodega. Highly disappointed with the service and customer treatment.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: This place makes me feel like I'm knocking back tequila shots in moms kitchen!! Ample counter space and houseplants galore!  Definitely will return! Check out the underground too while you're at it.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Cute speakeasy.  We had the ceviche as an appetizer which was decent.  My entree was the risotto which was above average (a little too salty for my liking) and the gf got the scallops which were amazing but sadly only 4ish pieces. Pretty nice drink menu. Service was very very very good, our waitress was very kind and attentive and spent a lot of time with us. Pricier than I would like.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: One of my favorite cocktail bar/food experiences in Utah. I started with the Old Fashioned flight. Loved the variety. You really can't go wrong with that bar. For food, I ordered the deep fried NY strip steak, and I must say, it was insanely good. Normally I'd be suspect of any such thing happening to such a gorgeous cut of meat, but honestly it was fantastic. We also tried fried ravioli, which was good, not great. They certainly did enough 'special' to earn my 5 stars.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: What a cool place!  We really enjoyed the Rest down in the secluded underground and the drinks were good.  We enjoyed the Old fashioned and the Viceroy.  This is a unique experience you won't want to miss.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: The atmosphere and staff are great, unfortunately if you enjoy drinking beer, stay away from this place.The worst beer selection, if it can even be called a selection, in SLC.In fact, the worst, most minimal beer selection I've seen anywhere in the US for any establishment of comparable size, having visited bars/breweries/speak easy's from coast to coast and points in between.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Inventive cocktails and delicious food. A unique bar that I always love spending time at with interesting company. Vegan and gluten free options as well!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I've been to The Rest twice, the first several years ago. I had a 5/5 experience and loved the atmosphere. We went back while in town over Christmas and I was disappointed to see that the vegan option had been removed from their menu and the vegetarian options lacking.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Whodathunk such a cool place would be found in SLC? Must say one of the most unique places I've had the pleasure of dining in. First the Bodega- very unassuming small hole in the wall kinda place, clearly something unique with a small bar, pinball machine and just weird in a good way. Then you get escorted through the door to The Rest and the fun begins. What a downright cool vibe. Everything is something. Things to look at and explore throughout the evening. Weird dolls, books and books, trinkets, vintage lighting, vault door, pictures, and so much more. Cocktails are off the charts unique and very very tasty. It's ok to eat the flowers, we did. Yes and expensive too. Food was very good. You want to go here and yes you'll tell other people about it. And when you go back to SLC in the future you'll go here again. Promise.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: One of my favorite places in SLC.  The drinks are perfection.  I recommend the Blind pig (aka bartenders choice)! They change their menu here a lot, but the beer can chicken has been there since conception. Reservations are highly recommended because it gets busy quick, but I love that it is never over packed downstairs.  A nice finishing touch are the beignets! They change up the dipping sauce that it usually comes with.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Love the speak easy feel of this place. Their atmosphere and drinks get a 5 star rating, but the scallops me and my client got were extremely salty. Another client got the salmon and said it was very salty too.  We got 2 chickens (order an hour before) for the table, and they were delicious and full of flavor!!! I would come back, but not order seafood

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Place employs security guards that sexually assault girls. The picture is of their "business cards" something they have doormen hand out to girls after grabbing them and touching them. If you try to contact the owner, Sara Lund, she will tell you that it happens because she's a female and she gets harassed and assaulted in bars, including her own bar. This does not make it acceptable or okay for other people to get assaulted and harassed. This is especially bad when it's by people on her payroll. It's not other patrons that she has no control over, it's her own employees. There are a lot of great bars in Salt Lake City. Bodega is not one of them. Avoid at all costs. If you're looking for cheap drinks, Jackalope is a great one. If you're looking for nice drinks and great food, go down the street to White Horse or Whiskey Street.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Very cool speakeasy! This place was recommended to us during a business trip. My coworker and I are usually skeptical about recommendations from people that we don't know well, but this one was a good one. Really chill atmosphere, not to loud and friendly service. Food is very good, drinks are tasty and the menus changes often (so I am told). This would be a great place to bring a date as long as she doesn't get freaked out by stuffed animals on the wall. Would definitely come back again. You have to make reservations or you can eat at the bar if there's an open seat.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Speakeasies are a dime a dozen! If you want a unique experience with great drinks and awesome bartenders and waitstaff, then there're a dime a million! Bodega falls into the latter with its secrecy and intimate setting of weird artifacts and sweet music! Drinks are Da Bomb and you should advise the waitress to surprise you when she is taking your cocktail order! Explore with your eyes as you sit down. You'll see so many treasures in this joint!!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: My coworkers and I were here on a business trip and were told this restaurant was a must. The environment was great. Loved the dimmed lighting and low key feel. I had the fried steak and it was delicious. We also nibbled on the bread platter and beignets and it was very good. What truly made the experience over the top was the customer service. We had a server named Louisa and she was so sweet and accommodating. It was the best experience we've had so far during our stay!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Definitely a place to try. Highly recommended by a colleague from home...visiting for a work trip...and we were not disappointed. The steak entree and beignets are delicious!!! The service was awesome. Our server, Luisa, went above and beyond to ensure our experience was unforgettable. Kudos as well to the chef. :)

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: We got in and asked for food and drinks. We were put on a waiting list and told we would be called in 40 minutes. We were never called, we were also pushed back by other guests and they never mentioned their food wasn't available. We got down to the booths where it was empty (what were we waiting for?) when we finally asked if food was available in this specific area where we got the unfortunate news. Bad planning

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Loved 'The Rest'! It is a hidden gem. I wouldn't have been able to find it if it wasn't for the pictures of the place posted by previous Yelp reviewers (thank you!). We waited 15 minutes to be led downstairs to The Rest. Upstairs is the Bodega, small and noisy, not for us. Once we were brought downstairs to a more spacious, relaxing and quiet room we were delighted and pleasantly surprised. It's just what we were looking for. The 'rain in hidden valley' drink was a bit too juicy/sweet/not strong enough of a drink for me but the Manhattan was decent. Would definitely go back again!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: If you can get into "the rest" it's definitely worth it. Awesome cocktails in a cool environment unlike anywhere else. Haven't tried the food, but am definitely planning to. Making a reservation is suggested. The cocktails are worth trying and the servers have great recommendations.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: This bar is so neat, you can't miss it! It has a special environment and an element of surprise. The upstairs portion is kind of crowded, which seemed slightly inconvenient with the rush of people and only 1 bartender. I ordered a port wine cocktail which was made very well, and you could tell the bartenders were extremely skilled in their expertise. If you're looking for a busy environment or a classy bar for a few drinks with friends, Bodega fits both needs!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Not worth it. I was recently in Salt Lake City for work. Meet a few friends at Bodega (upstairs) and then was hoodwinked into staying at eating dinner at The Rest. After being "secretly," led to our table we were given menus and abandoned. In this "cool" and "swanky" library-esque dinning room it was too dark to actually read the menu. So we all had to break out our phones and use the flashlight function. After three tries I was able to order (they were out of my first two options - which isn't a problem I get it restaurants run out of things). 45 minutes later our food arrived. My Shepard's pie was fine, but could also be described as bland. Overall, the place was just too pretentious for my taste. Focus on your food and diner experience and less on your aesthetic. I wouldn't go back if I lived in SLC and have felt so strongly about it that I'm now writing a review.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I was so disappointed with my experience here. My friends and I went in to celebrate my 21st birthday and asked a bartender if we could go down to The Rest. She told us she would go check and get back to us. We waited and waited and waited but were ignored so we picked up a game on the table. After a long while, we asked again. Before we could even get an answer, the doorman said that we had ten minutes to leave because we were taking up space and not buying anything. We were planning on buying tons of drinks but weren't even given the chance to go downstairs. An angry bartender walked up to our table and said the downstairs was all full and would be an hour wait. It was a Tuesday. There's no way. So confused/disappointed by this experience and won't be back. We took our business to Whiskey Street and had a lovely evening.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Awesome place, awesome environment. We got the absinthe and the Old Fashioned flight and loved it. Speakeasy type, prohibition feel to it. Service was awesome and the drinks were great. Would go again and would recommend.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: The wife and I love finding new places. Sometimes they are a swing and miss, and sometimes you can't imagine going anywhere else to eat when given the opportunity. The later is how I feel. The beer can chicken is worth every minute it takes for it to cook, and while you wait, the drinks are, if not the best in town, tied for the top. Worth the money. The charcuterie board was amazing as we sipped away on the crafted cocktails. Only regret isn't trying a beer. I guess that's what second visits are for. The ambiance is awesome. The lighting is a tad dark, but as long as you aren't reading Tolstoy down there, it's perfect. The decor is eclectic. The service top notch. Great evening.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Very cool speakeasy, definitely make a reservation if you're visiting SLC. The s'mores beignets were not very good but the drinks were fantastic. Service was fab!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: When I tell you that The Rest has the best drinks in town, I mean it. MUST make a reservation for The Rest. The highlight of my vacation in SLC.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: This bar is 5 stars and the reason why is because this bar cares about people. I went to this bar being from our of town and not knowing the Utah etiquette I accidentally walked to the back of the bar to check out the cool decor. I did not notice that a private event was being held at the time and I was quickly inform that this area was closed. The owner quickly escorted back to my table but apologized about the inconvenience. I did not get upset but what was really cool was how the owner came back to me and after the private event was over and escorted me and my group to look at the decor. She offered us a free beer and had a really good conversation on how she open the bar. I am impressed how she recognized that even though I did not know at the time a private event was going on she took time to explain and apologized for the inconvenience. I highly recommend this bar because the owner is cool and recognizes people and this goes far in Utah. Please visit this bar and and give this bar 5 stars because it is hard to find good people now of days and the owner is top notch and this bar is A++. Bring your friends family members and support this place because the atmosphere is good and the people are friendly.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: This bar is such a awesome place to have a really unique fun night on the town. I always like to start with the $2 shots of spicy tequila and hanging out upstairs while waiting for the speakeasy. Great vibe and staff has always been super professional and gracious; even when the place is packed. The Rest is absolutely gorgeous, macabre decor, dim lighting, soft music, and unique high taste cocktails. The bar staff never seems stressed or overwhelmed with drinks and always are interesting to talk too.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I love it. I'm not telling you what's downstairs because it's a secret. But I can tell you that you're going to like it. Do you have to wait an hour or two? Do it and stop whining. Sit upstairs and throw down 2 dollar tequila shots and Tecates until they have room for you. If you're lucky, you'll get downstairs and meet Ky. She's going to take care of you because she's amazing. You're going to spend all of your money and you're not going to care because you're being so damned taken care of. You're going to like what's going on. I know I'm being vague and it's starting to sound like something illegal is going to happen but it isn't. You're just going to have a good time. Let go, throw on a record, drink some fancy cocktails, and enjoy.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Very nice ambience.  Pork belly sliders were amazing.   Ordered the salmon which was good but the sauce was over salted.  Holy hell.  Service was a little slow and inattentive but I would try this again.  The Moscow mule was made improperly.  Very bad.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Loved our dinner experience at this place, end of July 2018. Bartenders were THE BEST in personality, style, and technique! I am in the business myself and they had lots of neat spirits to enjoy - I indulged in a couple of their cocktails and then had a local amargo as a digestif. The food was hearty and well prepared. Can't say enough good things about Bodega!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Cool/hipster super tiny bar when you walk in. Then the host walks you through this hidden back door, I thought she was taking us to some dungeon. Which makes sense for the name of the restaurant. It's was fun, almost felt like I was part of a solve the murder mystery game. When you get to the bottom level, the ambiance was very intimate. Great for a romantic date. But once you look up at the tall walls, the decor was more medieval style. Kinda confusing. But It might have been a little too dark in there for me, I couldn't read the menu that clearly. But it's perfect if you you wanna take someone with a great "personality", luckily my date wasn't bad looking. The food was Amazing. We ordered the can up the butt chicken and it was definitely worth the hour wait. Good beer selection. Terrible mixed drinks and limited alcohol selection. Definitely need a reservation!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Love the contrast of the two places, but both a great time. The top has two dollar tequila shots and fun tall cans. The rest below is a fancier choice with delicious food and unique cocktails. The beer can chicken at the rest takes an hour but is SO worth it!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Really disappointed tonight with Bodega + The Rest . We booked ahead online and with no hesitation that a minor could go. No warning or anything on the website that would hinder our night out. We then arrive at 9:15 and we cannot go in because the restaurant is in the back and the minor could not walk through due to the bar. No refund either on the $40 "no show" for the reservation even after we showed them that there was nothing on the website warning us. Very disappointed and would not go again.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: By far one of my favorite places in SLC. One of the most unique gastro-cocktail experiences in the city. When friends come in from out of town I take them here and they always want to go back. The owner needs to be commended for creating a truly one of a kind find. Service is always impeccable. The setting is as swanky cool as they come. And don't even get me started on the food which is only rivaled by the cocktails. Thank you to the proprietor and staff for such a special multi sensory magical adventure.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Ambiance is bomb. Loved every minute of it. Even the bathrooms had a cool feel to them. The food was meh. Like it wasn't bad, but we weren't in love. Husband got the fried chicken and I got the steak and grits. Mine needed a sauce and then it would have been much better - just felt lacking. Got the bread plate - butter was warm - husband likes it warmer, I like it cold and firm. One type of bread was delish with the compound butter and the other didn't quite fit. We don't drink, but they will make a cool mock tail for you for $5. Worth the ambiance and overall experience. Not in a rush to go back though.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: The hostess mistook me for someone else. I was in town visiting and it was my first time here. She told me they couldn't serve me because of my behavior last time and asked me to leave. I hadn't even drank yet. I had argued this and security aggressively grabbed me and told me to get the fuck out and slammed the door in my face. Terrible bar with awful service.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: If you are not Caucasian be ready to wait outside for at least 20 mins until the bouncer Josh lets you in. Every time we come here he always lets Caucasians in right away and makes colored people wait and hope they walk away. PS- Cami is the best bartender that's why we put up with this crappy bouncer.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Great staff and the Rest was fantastic! Specialty cocktails are great. We only had cocktails but the food menu looked intriguing.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Decent place. The decor is pretty awesome, especially in the downstairs bar. Place is a little too hipster for me with odd drinks and menu items. Everything was delicious but pricey. Apparently the menus are different in the front and back. I saw the tacos on here but couldn't order them :(

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Went there on a Friday night because this place was suggested by a friend. Never have I ever had to stand for 15 Mins just to get a drink. If you looking to get downstairs  I wouldn't count on it. If it was because the downstairs was full it would've been nice if that was communicated. Otherwise it comes off as if you're being ignored. On the flip side of things I heard their bartenders are mixologist. Too bad I didn't get to experience it.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Fantastic prohibition-era speakeasy with a wonderfully eclectic menu. Over priced but worth the occasional visit. A long corridor adds to the vibe of being a secret, illegal hideaway. Music is played on vinyl, and I've always enjoyed their selections. Try the violet drink, it's delicious!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Incredible setup.  The "rest" downstairs has incredible food and alcohol selection.  The beer can chicken is delicious but it typically takes one hour to prep.  The folks I went with ordered all over the menu and nothing was a bad option.  It's a really cool place with a laid back atmosphere.  Check it out if you're downtown.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Small bar upstairs is cool, good music drinks and  scene. The downstairs is another world.  Amazing space, menu and drinks.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: We decided to go here because we heard excellent things about this place. We were not disappointed! We got a seat at the bar downstairs and the ambiance was amazing. Dark, beautifully designed, old fashioned deep lighting. They even had a record player that we could choose records for. The drinks were absolutely amazing and strong! Bar tender was genuine and kind. We ordered the cauliflower curry for starters and the naan that came with it was the best I have ever tasted. Salty, buttery perfection. The cauliflower curry had a hint of spice and was cooked perfectly too! Then we moved on and ordered the beer can chicken. It was cooked perfectly. And I mean PERFECTLY. The potato salad and asparagus came with it were so yummy. Honestly, I haven't had food this great outside of my own home probably ever. Thank you guys for having us, we will certainly be back again.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: What a cool place! From the secret entrance to the wonderful ambience, we loved the experience. There isn't much light so your eyes have to adjust to be able to read the menu. But you feel like you e stepped into a hip speak easy. We started with some tasty cocktails: In the Air and Yankee Dime. In the Air was fruity and refreshing. Yankee Dime was a more old fashioned drink. For Appetizers we tried the Garden Tempura and Burrata Panzanella. The tempura veggies were delicious with the avocado spread. The burrata dish didn't blow us away. It felt like it was missing something to make it good. We shared the New York Steak entree which came with creamed mushrooms, ancho chili chimichurri, au gratin potatoes. The steak was juicy and cooked perfectly but again missed that wow flavor. Our server told us  the steak didn't require any dipping sauce because it's so flavorful but we disagree. The potatoes and mushrooms were to die for and were the highlight of the meal. Overall, we rated a 4 because although the food wasn't perfect, the ambience and service made up for it. We'd love to come back just to sit at the bar for drinks.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: At this point, i've been here more times than i can count. The Bodega is a fun TINY little street level bar on main with good drinks and tacos. Sometimes crowded but usually a good place to grab a stool and hang out. It has a fun atmosphere. But The Rest is one of my favorite places in town. I love to swing in here on the off chance theres a couple free seats at the bar or i make reservations when there are guests in town to go and have something to eat off their seasonally changing menu. The food is always delicious. The drinks are on point. The atmosphere is perfection. A quaint little basement speak easy with records playing and group chatter abound. The interior design work is great and you feel like Ernest Hemingway could be sit at the table right behind you. We've gotten together here to sit and drink "in the library" section and read tarot cards. It's really just a fun place and a must to check out.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Excellent and varied craft cocktails in the heart of SLC. They had the spirit forward drinks I was looking for! Haven't tried the food but enjoyed the ambience and drinks. The bitters they have for sale are a great gift for yourself and others.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Similar to a speakeasy, on the surface the restaurant appears as a small bar but once you are lead to the main dining area, you are surprised to find a very intimate atmosphere. The lighting and decor is on point to set the tone for your drinks and meal. The fried chicken is flavorful, well seasoned and perfectly breaded. The short ribs are very tender, cooked to perfection and in a delicious sauce. These meals were the best that my boyfriend and I have had in a LONG time. Drink menu has a good selection. I highly recommend the C.T.C. The bartenders were also very friendly. A great experience for our first night in Salt Lake.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: We trekked all the way across town in our best clothes, only to be denied entry because we have overseas driver licences. Apparently we needed our passports for entry as our licences aren't good enough - but these are fine for every other venue in Utah and to hire a car. Our licences have photos, date of birth and date of issue.Was told that this is the owners rules - but no signs, and nothing on their website.Really annoyed. Went to Whiskey next door and got amazing service and will definitely be back there.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Good food, ok cocktails and the worst service you will ever experience in this expensive of a restaurant. If you like being treated horribly while paying $300 for your meal, this is the go to spot in SLC. If you expect any level of service whatsoever, choose literally anywhere else.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: COOLEST BAR IN SLC, PERIOD. I'm from Portland and honestly this bar is cooler than any of those too. This is the perfect spot to take friends/family/a date to impress them. Bartenders are on point too, I asked if they would make me a pina colada and they whipped one up from scratch. Best I ever had. We didn't eat here but the food looked amazing!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: This place has the most amazing atmosphere.  I love this place.  The service is great and the mixologists are amazing.  They truly know how to cater to your likes and dislikes.  Adam is the best and will make you a drink crafted just for you.  Their knowledge base is truly remarkable.  Also the "Honest Johns Bitters tasting"is an experience and one that I would highly recommend.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Great atmosphere and excellent service from the bartenders. Not very big so I wouldn't recommend to a large group but they make up for it in their drinks and pricing. Pricing was very fair $6-10 a mixed drink, and like I mentioned our service was fabulous. I wish I would've gotten his name to mention him but he was awesome and made my group of friends a variety of great drinks. We also played UNO here for the first time since we were children haha. Cool little place

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Amazing. Just come here, and drink their craft cocktails and eat their delicious food. You won't be disappointed. Highly recommend sitting downstairs, such a cool ambiance.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: My all time favorite bar | hidden gem in Salt Lake City! This is such a delightful place and have been meaning to come here ever since I moved to Salt Lake City. I luckily had the opportunity when some friends came into town for business and I got to recommend some cool low key, local only, awesome finds, if I knew of any. Of course I wasn't about to let my peeps down! I immediately recommended we walk up the street from wherever we were, which happened to be The Blue Iguana which they weren't as much fans of, but hey they didn't ask me my opinion on where to go, ha. Kidding, kind of. Anyways, in case you are wondering they did end up eating at the Red Iguana before they hit the road home to Idaho on Sunday. I had said that the Red Iguana was the best Mexican food in town and if they had a chance to go there before they left, they should. Happy to hear that they loved and enjoyed it which most everyone I know who has been there, has!Back to the amazement that is The Rest. So, you will see Bodega on the street. Bodega is the top of this building and business. The Rest is the bottom and it is so cool, low key, undercover, library, vintage, romantic, dark lit, urban vibe, you won't want to miss out. I will advise you, I don't know what the price range says on Yelp or Google right now, but it is pricey. For the one drink I got there, which I believe was the cheapest on the menu, or I at least was aiming to stay somewhat classy and cheap, that drink alone cost $18. *Insert the shock face emoji* It is on Main St in Salt Lake City by Whiskey Street. You'll see the sign Bodega outside and then the downtown is The Rest. It's a hidden gem and you have to ask about and you can request a table, they will go check if there is anything available. You will hang out upstairs in a crammed area which doesn't compare to the downstairs, so just hang tight. Once you go downstairs you will go down these mysterious eloquent stairs and may think something sketchy is going on. Pretty soon you will appear in what is called "The Rest". Enjoy, and of course you are welcome. Reviewing isn't what I do, its who I am. Kidding, Kidding, well, only sort of.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: This place is a hidden (or not so hidden) gem. The Lighted green Bodega sign is very visible from the street. Walk in and grab yourself a deliciously cheap shot and/or beer. Think $2. You may want to call ahead to get a reservation for the speakeasy downstairs. If you didn't call ahead, ask the friendly bartender to see "the rest". He'll add you to the list. There is always a wait. Don't be surprised if you get downstairs and it's 20% full. They think it's part of their charm. The craft cocktails and food are delicious. Pricey (read well over $10 and closer to $20). The decor is lovely (except for the dead stuffed animals on the wall). It's very dark and the light bulbs are Edisonesqe. I give it four stars instead of five because of the unnecessary wait time and prices downstairs.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Surprised hubs with a dinner date here on Valentine's. We're decorating out home bar like a speakeasy so after finding The Rest it was a must try. Going into Bodega totally threw him off, but when we got downstairs he lit up. It was perfect. The decor, the scratchy old music, the oddities...  And the food...OMG! I had a mussel appetizer that was amazing. Just the right amount of salt & spice and very fresh. We both had bison short ribs with a bone marrow sauce and fingerling potatoes. Outstanding. Dessert was beignets with an apple espresso compote. I could eat those all day. Perfectly cooked and such a great flavor combo. They are definitely not shy about their pours. Classic cocktails with a twist. Bartender was super knowledgeable and made us surprise drinks based on flavors we liked. He hit the nail on the head. Waiter was awesome, attentive, informative, and let us explore. Best dinner date ever and our new favorite!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I hesitate to write a review because The Rest is one of my favorite spots and I don't want to tell anyone about it because I don't want to share! Also, it's hard enough as it is to get a reservation, if more people find out how fun this place is I am afraid it will get harder. Fun ambiance (it is dark, if you have issues with that.)  Love the ginger mocktail! Love the hot chicken! Love the beer can chicken! Love the Beigets! Loved that my service wasn't rushed and I could settle into my meal with my company and enjoy our evening. Such a great spot! Summary: It's terrible, never eat there. :)

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Loved the atmosphere, loved the service, loved everything about our night here!! The fried chicken was wonderful!! Sadly the duck and pork tenderloin were over cooked, but everything else was so great it was fine!! One thing that I was so impressed with was before I even came I asked on Yelp if we could bring in our own wine, and the owner got back to me within minutes saying we could!!! Our server Matt was wonderful!! He gave us the history of the place and the owner, which made it more special for us being there! He also knew the menu and drinks so well it made it easy to know what we would want to order! The atmosphere is so great!!! I loved it, and I can hardly wait to go again!!!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Great date spot. Come early or reserve, and do a drink in the Bodega or any of the 4 bars on this block while you wait. Tasty drinks and fun vibe.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: The experience is one of a kind in salt lake. After you walk down the stairs to the most beautifully decorated hallway you're greeted with a kind and knowledgeable staff.  We were there for an early Valentine's Day and they really made it special. The drinks are incredible. The local private bitters are one of a kind. Then the food is an intense review of flavor and uniqueness. I'm going to take anyone who is in town visiting here from now on.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Wow - such a cool location. You might walk past & never know if you weren't in the know. The address is the Bodega on the outside, but then there's a secret entrance over the rest.room, hence The Rest. Bring your ID to get taken down the secret path to an amazing room/bar. The decor and theme is awesome. It was love at first sight. The apps were ginormous & the drinks were delish. The chicken pot pie was full of flavor and plenty to feed many. The braised short rib however was overdone, completely dry. It didn't fall apart like it should, the sauce was around the grits but not so much on the meat. The grits were also blah. Didn't make it to dessert, although it sounded fantastic, so I might have to go back & pace myself better. Worth finding & checking out, stop by if you are near.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: I am happy to report that their food menu has expanded and is drastically improved.  They do have their bar license so you can have drinks without ordering food, but why would you with the new menu?  So happy to see this place improving. Such a great and unique vibe!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Went here for my birthday dinner,  my new favorite place in SLC! Had the new fashioned with the hot chicken... amazing!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: You know the feeling of coming home from a long day at work and just wanting to take your pants off, sit in your cozy living room, and listen to some records? When you walk down the stairs into the magic that is The Rest, you will have an overwhelming feeling to just let lose and enjoy an evening in (but keep those pants on because I am pretty sure that isn't allowed--perhaps, just frowned upon...ok, maybe cheered on but resist the urge). The Rest gives us an opportunity to experience fine dining in a cozy, intimate, yet lively place with mood lighting and vinyls on play like Amy Winehouse and America. There are so many micro-details to check out. From the herringbone wood above the bar, the Alice in Wonderland sized apothecary jars lining the bar walls to the tiny doll heads in the looking box at your table or the hidden library in the back--make sure to take in more than the scrumptious fumes coming from the kitchen. Speaking of food, most would probably think to come here for drinks with friends but their menu is one of the best in Salt Lake, and not to be overlooked. Start with hearty, savory hush puppies which will melt in your mouth. For the main course, their hot fried chicken with al dente southern macaroni and cheese is mouthwatering and has a spicy kick or perhaps you are in the mood for steak accompanied by potatoes which are a unique spin on tater tots. Save room for dessert, this is one of the few places in Utah that serves fresh, warm beignets drizzled in a pecan caramel sauce--you are booking a reservation right now, aren't you? The staff are very nice, superb service. All I have to say, bon appetite! P.S. Ask for a "Blind Pig" (mock or alcoholic) you will be pleasantly surprised. You're welcome.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Curt, rude host put us off immediately when, upon opening the front door halfway, she declared "we're at capacity"... and returned her attention to her waitlist immediately.  We may have been willing to wait outside, or come back later, had the hospitality been better and that option presented to us.  Instead, we walked half a block to a lovely sushi spot with quality food and an excellent staff.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Best bar in SLC! What makes it amazing beside the delicious cocktails they serve at The Rest, is the great staff! In particular, Erica! She rocks! She is always professional, quick and customer service is #1 with her. Ky is cool too. If you can multiply Erica and Ky, you can rule the world! Marco is a master at mixology, perfection in a drink. Bodega and The Rest is a must if you enjoy craft cocktails and a cool bar. Two thumbs up with sparkles.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Met some girlfriends here for drinks and dinner. The reservation process was easy and straightforward. I would recommend making reservations about a week prior for the rest.  Loved the drink list. Great selections with inventive and tasty options. Dinner was a little disappointing. Although there were some great selections, it didn't justify the price. The fried chicken is by far the best thing on the menu. Pricey but good. Would go back for drinks.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Downstairs the drinks are SO good! A little pricey but very good. The servers are very friendly and knowledgeable about the seasonal changes to the menu. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 is because the Hostesses have never been friendly. I've been here several times and they can be quite rude. Not a fan.

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Great atmosphere, cocktails, food, and service. Intimate setting makes this a real hidden gem in downtown SLC!

name: Bodega + The Rest
content: Their food is fantastic. I love the way they take reservations. It creates a nice environment to chat and catch up with friends. I always bring my friends from out of state here because it's always chill and the rest is a cool off the grid place.

name: Lake Effect
content: Awesome food in a fun environment!! Had the seared tuna- OMG and the Lamb ribs!!! Great beer selections as well. Chocolate pot dessert was tres short of chocolate.

name: Lake Effect
content: Really cute and nice, trendy bar in SLC!Came by for drinks and bites on a Wednesday at 6:15pm. We had to make a reservation and though the restaurant definitely adheres to COVID protocols (mask wearing when not seated, partitioned booths, servers wearing masks, etc) the place was pretty busy for a Wednesday night and almost every table/booth/hightop was taken. The decor is very open (huge cavernous room) with high ceilings - looks fancy and perfect for dates, birthday drinks, friends drinks, etc. They have live music (kinda loud but nice enough to listen to) and an amazing list of cocktails/drinks (there was an entire book of them!). I can't leave too extensive of a review as we only got a few drinks here but every drink was delicious, the food was good and I would recommend stopping by!

name: Lake Effect
content: Super Cool place in Salt Lake City! Awesome location, Great food and music! Was in vacation for a few days and loved that place!

name: Lake Effect
content: Food is mediocre - we ordered chicken nacho, Fired pepper and tuna. Chicken was extremely dry. And the excessive spice overpowers the tuna. Drink price is close to nyc, yet quality is no where comparable. I reserved my table with special seating arrangement 2 weeks ahead. Yet that was not remotely attempted.

name: Lake Effect
content: Decent upscale restaurant in the heart of Salt Lake city with a NYC vibe. Came here while on a bachelor party and had a decent time. The restaurant is very club like and has a full club in the basement, so the later you go the harder it is to get in. By 10pm this place is packed out, even during covid times. The food overall is pretty good and they have a wide variety of options. They also have a huge drink menu and some of their specialty cocktails are very good. For an upscale place the prices are very reasonable. The service was pretty slow, but like I said, the place does get packed.

name: Lake Effect
content: Awesome place! Great food and drink. The music vibe is great!  Atmosphere is cool and relaxing. Perfect place for a business dinner.

name: Lake Effect
content: Great music, drinks and food. Also, great environment.Three starts because of the deficiency on their customer service, especially towards their regulars.Thanks,

name: Lake Effect
content: avoid at all costs, I repeat, avoid at all costs. not sanitary at all, I was served a drink in a used glass, I kid you not. disgusting.

name: Lake Effect
content: Lake Effect is a hidden gem in SLC. Across the street from the convention center. I had the lamb ribs and the Thor cocktail that was made to perfection. The lamb ribs are excellent!

name: Lake Effect
content: Really enjoyed this place on a recent trip to SLC. Good food menu...ahi was excellent as was the lamb appetizer. Plenty of local beers to choose from.  Behind the bar is Danny and he will take great care of you.

name: Lake Effect
content: Normally we love this place, but tonight, it took over an hour to get just 2 drinks. Our server, Megan B, made 6 trips to the table full of men (even made eye contact with me on trip 4) before coming to check on me and my husband once. As a former server, I normally tip pretty high, but as a former server, I also recognize when a server is deliberately ignoring one table to flirt with another.

name: Lake Effect
content: This place was a nice getaway on a Sunday afternoon. Their cocktails were amazing and the ambiance is so very trendy. We arrived around 2:30 and they were serving brunch. When we made a reservation we didn't realize that they don't start serving dinner until 4-5pm. So if you are planning to go for dinner make sure you check when dinner service starts. That being said, the brunch they served was good, just not what we had been hoping for when visiting. Our only complaint was that service took a long time. I ordered my drink and didn't get it until almost at the end of our meal. Also service was relatively slow to clean up when guests left too. Not sure if that was because it was a Sunday and it is usually slow? Either way, though, it was still a nice place to visit. We plan to go back on a Friday evening to enjoy the live music they offer.

name: Lake Effect
content: Had the best time last night at the gorgeous Lake Effect downtown. Beautiful and spacious with luxurious decor, we sat quite comfortably at the bar where Danny delivered spectacular drinks with impressive speed. Thanks Danny, you're a 5 star kinda guy!

name: Lake Effect
content: This place is legit. Watched Danny hustle all night and make drinks that have dozens of ingredients. Danny made our experience coming from Colorado a memorable one. Will for sure come back.

name: Lake Effect
content: The ambience and drink quality is great The bartenders know what they are doing but during COVID times what they are doing is pretty f"d up .. Things on a Friday night I saw felt like COVID didn't exist..

name: Lake Effect
content: Very fun place to come to. Solid 4 stars. They have a restaurant / lounge set up and I can see this place being the spot to go to on weekend nights. They had live music when we came on a Thursday night. The crowd is 20-30s mostly but also older. The food and drink menu is extensive and alot to go through. The waiter was friendly and helpful. 1. Fish tacos - Flavorful with a grilled taste. The pickled onions did not detract too much from the taste. 2. Guacamole - Spicy and comes with jalapenos. Slowed down my usual devouring of chips and guac.3. Seasoned fries - Average. Way too salty.Overall, would try at least once. If I lived in the area, I would definitely come back!

name: Lake Effect
content: I came to lake effect a couple of times, and everytime i come here i'm never disappointed. I do like their basement a bit more than being up stairs. I think upstairs is great if you just want to sit down, and have a nice night of drinking and food. Downstairs is all of upstairs with a fun flare. The drinks here are really great. They don't have your standard bar drinks, but they also have their own specialty drinks. Some of them are pretty fun, yummy and great to take pictures of. Others are just pretty, but that could just be because it didn't please my taste buds. The food here is surprisingly great. You'd think it would be a bar standard food, but it's actually slightly elevated. I've tried their nachos, and Beignets. Both of them really good. The nachos has a lot of cheese and the presentation is amazing. The beignets are amazing and fluffy. They are also bite size, so you wouldn't need to worry about the powder sugar flying everywhere. Love this place.

name: Lake Effect
content: Nacho night! My friend invited me out for drinks and dinner. She thought this would be the perfect place and talked about how every time she is here things feel normal. Our night was awesome. We did need to wait outside for a few minutes until a table was ready. I'll add that it was a Friday night. We ordered drinks, Tacos and nachos. The food was large portions and the nachos are meant to be shared with more then 2 people. The night did feel like a pre covid era night and was everything I needed. The staff was wearing masks, people at tables were not. It was weird to see people socializing from table to table. This is what worried me but I was able to keep my distance as needed. The live music was my favorite!! The whole vibe was right. I would recommend Lake Effect to everyone and anyone. If you are wanting to keep distanced and safe I would suggest going around 5 or 6pm. However....It was a great night and I can't wait to bring my husband next time.

name: Lake Effect
content: This is hands down the coolest bar in Salt Lake City. The drink menu has anything you could possibly want and the food is incredible. You must try the tin can nachos! There's a reason Lake Effect is the place to be any night of the week. Every time I leave I can't wait to go back!

name: Lake Effect
content: Lake Effect has become one of my absolute favorites in Downtown SLC. The food, the drinks, and the vibe is always so good. Love the live music nights, and the staff is so attentive and fun to talk to. Great place to go even if you don't drink and just want an upscale dining experience.

name: Lake Effect
content: If you are looking for a fantastic dinner with delicious cocktails and live music.. this is the place!First off the staff and host were great at accommodating our group of 10. Make a reservation prior with Heather via email. She was great!This restaurant is combined with another bar "Rabbit Hole" so if you get lost look for this sign. The venue has a classic roaring 20s feel with gold accents, open brick walls and classy tufted cushion booths. The bar has a huge beautiful wall of every type of liquor with the fun library sliding type ladder to reach the top. Onto the food... the coolest and yummiest appetizer was the Tin Can Nachos, literally is delivered to your table in a tin can, pretty neat. I ordered the Salmon Salad covered in beets, carrots and a balsamic vinaigrette. The beets were my favorite part! The salmon was cooked to perfection. This salad was big enough to share with another person. All the other meals across the table looked amazing! My friends and I were very impressed.When you get a chance, walk downstairs to the bar. It resembles a speakeasy; very dark and mysterious with classy seating. Overall great experience!

name: Lake Effect
content: We were looking for a late night open kitchen after a long day of travel. After a suggestion to try Lake Effect, we decided to try it. First we were hit with a cover charge. I haven't paid a cover charge for a restaurant since I was in college. The menu was a limited late night menu- they didn't have 2 of the items so we were left with an option of steak tacos or nachos. Thank goodness for the large beer selection that won us over. The side of Parmesan French fries weren't cooked all the way and were somewhat raw in the middle. We then realized that in the basement of this establishment is a club. This is fine- however covid is still a thing and none of the millennials in the basement were wearing masks. There is a bathroom located down there and I felt extremely uncomfortable having to use it because I was surrounded by the largest amount of unmasked people that I've seen in a while.I'm sure this restaurant has potential especially during the day but there was too much going on at night and I wouldn't return here at night.

name: Lake Effect
content: Great ambiance and atmosphere! We loved the live music. The food was excellent. We got the tin can nachos and they did not disappoint!

name: Lake Effect
content: The bar portion, great. The food portion, they don't give a shit about. Typically their food is pretty good. I can't eat dairy, and I let them know that. Ordered the burger that had no cheese listed, it came with cheese and I gave it away. I was super bummed when it didn't come with the pork belly that was listed on the menu, but came with the cheese I couldn't eat. Gave half my meal to the table and it was all whatever. The seasoned fries come with garlic and parm. I wish I knew that. There was also a bone in the burger after I scraped the cheese off it. Check out the pics!!! I'm down to give them another change. The other food looked good, but an extra $8 for vegan cheese on the Mac and cheese... you're joking guys

name: Lake Effect
content: If you're looking for a chic place to go out and get drinks, and you want something with a bit more class than the average downtown bar, check out Lake Effect. Due to it's popularity and seating restrictions (Covid), you'll want to make a reservation ahead of time.Parking can be a little dicey, just like with most downtown establishments. But hey, that's part of it's charm, right? There are scooters all over the place, so if you have to park a few blocks away, hop on one of those and arrive in style. Be prepared to show your ID-this is a bar, and you have to be 21 to enter. Once you show your ID, the hostess will seat you. There are lots of interesting seating options-some very high back chairs that look like mini thrones and some pretty pink chairs that would be adorable for a bachelorette party. The bar takes up one side of the restaurant and there's seating there, too. When I was there, we got to enjoy some live music. I'm not sure if that's just a weekend thing, or if that's every night. It didn't get so loud that my group had to yell to talk to each other-which I appreciate. I love live music, but I like it at a level that still allows people to chat while listening in the background. Service was ok. Our server started out attentive and friendly, but then sort of disappeared when we wanted our check. Another server noticed that we had been sitting awhile and came to check on us-she brought us our tab. I don't fault our server too much-it was a busy night and he was taking care of several tables. The drink menu is impressive-lots of options from wine to beer to cocktails. Prices are a bit on the steep side, but you're paying for ambience and experience, not just the liquor. We ordered several small plates to share, one being the tin can nachos. They come in a giant tin can and when the server removes the can, they spill out magnificently onto the plate. I don't eat cheese, so I didn't have any, but the folks in my party enjoyed them.This may not be my "every weekend" hangout, but it will definitely be one that I consider for a slightly more special occasion or night out on the town.

name: Lake Effect
content: Went here for dinner and had a burger, nachos, and shishito peppers.  Everything was great but the nachos were incredible.  Great atmosphere, live music, and a fun place for drinks with a group of friends.

name: Lake Effect
content: I really enjoyed this place...the atmosphere is very cool and it was crowded with live music!!The drinks were amazing and are certainly the highlight...try the tin can nachos too.Very fun place to hang out!

name: Lake Effect
content: This place is so cute and boujee! It's the perfect Saturday brunch spot! I would come again next time I'm in town!

name: Lake Effect
content: I called Lake Effect to ask the simple question of if IDs needed to be taken just to eat (no drinks) - when the woman who answered the phone plainly (and quite rudely) said they needed to scan IDs, no apology offered, I kindly asked if she had any recommendations for another restaurant similar to theirs - small plates - as we are coming from out of town. She responded curtly and quite rudely, "Nope - I don't." This looked like one of the coolest spots in the city but I will not be eating here ever due to the demeanor of their hostess. She needs better hospitality training. It was a simple question and she couldn't be bothered to assist. If she had answered kindly I would have definitely returned to Lake Effect with a 21+ crowd. Now I will make sure not to, and tell my friends never to.

name: Lake Effect
content: Lake effect downstairs environment is the place to be. It's a quieter atmosphere with private little booths. Upstairs is fun but the live music has a tendency to make conversations hard, or maybe I am just old and lame. The men's bathroom has very tasteful pictures of women on the wall while you're depositing.  The nacho thing was good. It's in a tin cover and falls out when they remove the tin.  All the drinks are spectacular.

name: Lake Effect
content: This place is pretty cool. Went on a Friday night. Nice ambiance, the live music was awesome, food and drinks were good. I had a spicy margarita and the tin can nachos. Presentation was cool. The service was just ok. Overall, a good experience!

name: Lake Effect
content: The best bar in slc , so spacious when you want it to be and so clubby when you need it to be . The drinks there are out of this world and the decor reminds me of Alice and wonderland. I always have a great time there and all the staff , security and bouncers add to the good time ! P.s very good plant based vegan tacos . Friendly to vegans :)

name: Lake Effect
content: I've always enjoyed this restaurant. Fun atmosphere and music (sometimes a bit on the loud side) however I was even more pleased with the outstanding service I received this last weekend. They follow all covid guidelines and are sensitive to those who are unable to wear a mask. Will continue to visit and recommend

name: Lake Effect
content: Love it!First time going, it was so fun!Band was great, place is so big!Really enjoyed the food and drinks too!Will be back for sure

name: Lake Effect
content: The biggest shoutout to Sharlynne. We ended my wife's birthday festivities here and our server was so helpful in making it a memorable experience. She let the woman performing last night know and she played happy birthday on her guitar as well as wished Nina a happy birthday. I attempted to nonchalantly order their beignets (I'm not smooth at all) and when they came out, they had put a couple candles on top. They were so delightful -- especially that lemon dipping sauce. Naturally, several cocktails were had as well and I swear they make one of the best Manhattans I've ever tasted. To say their list of cocktail offerings was expansive would be an understatement. It took my wife about ten minutes just to determine which one sounded the best. Thank you so much for making my wife's birthday so special.

name: Lake Effect
content: This is my favorite spot on a Friday night! Great food, outstanding cocktails, live music, and chill vibes. Everything on the menu is worth trying. (Sadly, most of my photos didn't turn out because of the dark lighting, so you're just going to have to take my word for it.)I heard they have brunch on the weekends?! I'll do my best to make a trip to Lake Effect in the AM for once.

name: Lake Effect
content: We came from LA to visit a friend. He recommended a nice out to Lake Effect for dinner and drinks. We had an amazing server Hannah. She was none stop moving and working! Super sweet Lady. Our food was great and drinks delicious. If you go, Hannah has you covered in great customer service! 10/10 recommend.

name: Lake Effect
content: Our new favorite place! Nachos are amazing! Also if you like a good tiki drink but with whiskey instead of rum ask for the "Sneaky Tiki"  Its kinda a secret item that Louie makes and it needs to be a thing!

name: Lake Effect
content: Ambiance, music, food, service, selection and pricing will leave you glad you made the choice.

name: Lake Effect
content: I know restaurants/bars are doing their best during COVID, and I don't like leaving bad reviews, but I would  not go back here. I had a reservation as we were planning on eating. Instead of sitting at a regular booth  or table (which were available) we were sat at a teeny tiny table with bean bag chairs?? Where you'd sit for a drink while you wait for a normal sized table. Regardless it has a fun atmosphere so we dealt with it (later in the evening they sat couples directly next to us  on each side... which was super uncomfortable) The food came out. The ahi tacos were ok. The chips were stale. The lamb was incredibly tough but had good flavor. It's small portions so we asked for the baked mac and it was brought to us still swimming in pasta water with half melted cheese. Wouldn't go back.

name: Lake Effect
content: On our last evening in Salt Lake City we decided to have dinner here. And we were pleasantly surprised. The lamb chops and macaroni and cheese were delicious. And they have a variety of signature cocktails/ drinks to choose from. Just when we thought what could make this any better, there was a band playing live music. Highly recommend this place if you're visiting or are a local and want to have a great evening with someone special or with a group of friends.

name: Lake Effect
content: This bar/restaurant is everything I needed after a few rough work days in a city I didn't know.  The staff is very friendly and the bartenders make a mean Manhattan.  The star was definitely the Crispy Lamb Ribs.  I nearly ordered another helping!  Well worth a stop in!

name: Lake Effect
content: I was here while visiting Salt Lake for a business trip and I am so glad I stopped in for dinner. I met up with some local friends and it did not disappoint. The Ahi Poke Bowl was absolutely delicious and had amazing flavor and spice. The atmosphere was great, service was amazing and they had a great live music preformer! I will be back next time I'm in Salt Lake!

name: Lake Effect
content: Enjoyed going downtown on a Saturday night for drinks and dinner.We sat down stairs and had great service with excellent food.Their drink menu is extensive and well prepared.We will be back soon!Thank you for a fun night

name: Lake Effect
content: The drinks we had were really good, nice live music, and service was good. The brisket and pork were very good. I ordered the shrimp capernelli dish and it was very bland and only had 5 shrimp, not worth 22$. We also ordered the charcuterie board which was decent but needed more to be worth 18$.

name: Lake Effect
content: The food is great! Really, really great! Fresh, crafted, smoked and grilled, it is all good, baby. Try the "Enthusiast" if you have a craving for BBQ and a bigger hunger. Tips, brisket and pork with a most excellent cheddar biscuit and a side of Cajon fries. And the burgers, don't pass on the burgers. I tried the "Basic Bitch" and found it anything but basic!  Picture a juicy beef patty topped with pork belly, lettuce, and onion with a side order of baked beans. Grilled to a perfect medium rare, it was delicious. And the bar has the best selection of fine wine, top shelf liquor and beer in the state. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, enthusiastic and professional. Covid-19 masks were used by all staff and distancing protocols were enforced.  I would recommend Lake Effect to anyone visiting SLC.

name: Lake Effect
content: I had been here before and had a pleasant experience but this last time scares me from ever going back. I ordered the chicken taco salad.. when it came, no chicken or dressing. The kitchen remade it and still didn't get it right. There was no avocado or dressing again. I also expect that when I pay $15.00 for a salad, it's not going to be equivalent to what I can get at Subway. Last but not least, just know the tacos actually don't come with chips and guac as a side like the menu says. They will charge you extra for that, even though it says "All tacos come with one of the following sides: fries, chips and salsa, or chips and guac." Lake effect? More lake defect

name: Lake Effect
content: What a cool place! Amazing aesthetic, hip vibes, and a groovy live band. The booths are a real treat. Will be back.

name: Lake Effect
content: Hispanic and brown and racially profiled with my friend's black son, we were with a group of blonde, white females and were the only two in the group not allowed in because apparently they could only allow so many people in. There were a few people who defended us and fought for us to go inside, but we didn't.

name: Lake Effect
content: My wife and I wanted to grab a bite, but there aren't a lot of restaurants open after 10pm in SLC. We found Lake Effect on Yelp and decided to give it a try. It's a great experience the second you walk in, the hostess was great, the live music incredible and the food is awesome. We got the Mac and Cheese and Crispy Lamb. Highly recommend!

name: Lake Effect
content: Nice place for cocktails.  They sat us in the patio to accommodate our service animals.  Lovely drinks were served.  But the appetizer was this cheesy cauliflower dip and it rocks!!!   We said no chips so they thinly sliced crisp veggies.  We loved it.  The menu was modified but we still staked for appies and cocktails.

name: Lake Effect
content: This place looked Uber trendy and fun inside, in better days, but it was early evening during COVID, so we just sat in a little outdoor area at wooden tables to the right of the entrance. We could still hear the acoustical musician/singer, inside, and he came outside (and talked to us) for breaks. I no longer see my entree listed on their website, which is for the best as it was pretty dull. I had grilled chicken breast, broccoli and mashed potatoes, although some other mixed veggie was first brought out and sent back. My husband ordered the Brazilian burger and I was jealous as he raved so much about it. It included a fried egg, potato sticks and mozzarella and came with fries. With a yelp check-in you got an order of fries so we opted to try the garlic Parmesan fries. They were delivered late in the meal and appeared to be left out too long and overdone. Five minutes later the waitress came out and volunteered to bring a new order, saying she'd noticed their questionable condition. But we declined as we were stuffed, though saving room for the awesome sounding Irish Car Bomb Brownies. Listen to this! Guinness brownie, whiskey ice cream, and Bailey's whipped cream. Drooling. Well...I just didn't feel like complaining nor waiting for a replacement. The live music and wine had me in a good mood. But I was VERY VERY disappointed not to receive a brownie topped with the awesome sounding Bailey's whipped cream. The brownie and ice cream were fantastic, but I'm still missing the experience of trying that whipped cream. During what is definitely a slow COVID time, they need to up their game a little. But A+ for entertainment,

name: Lake Effect
content: Awesome place, was on the more chill side with a live singer on the night we went. My friend said it's fun to go out here but didn't get a chance to because of covid :/. The food was good and drinks were tasty. We sat in a comfy booth and it was exactly the kind of place I was looking hoping to go to for dinner.

name: Lake Effect
content: I must say this is a wonderful place to celebrate your events. My fourth time going there and every time I have been blown away by the quality of the food. Pork tacos are my favorite.Tonight we had the best time. Incredible food and the best server I have ever had. I wish I could remember her name.She was exactly on time with refills. Awesome recommendations for drinks and prompt service on appetizers and the food.Made our celebration that much better. Great job !Added after I got my email receipt.The server's name is Megan B. I was very happy with the quality of service from her. Made my daughters birthday so much better!

name: Lake Effect
content: Excellent service, live music, and top notch Tapas!  If I lived here I would definitely make this my favorite spot! When I come back to SAlt Lake I will definitely be heading straight back here.

name: Lake Effect
content: Great bar and so happy it's still open during covid19 new normals. Amazing choice of beers, food was good and the atmosphere is awesome. A must.

name: Lake Effect
content: I've been coming here for the last 2-3 years for anything ranging from a late night bite, group outings, or just a place to dance to either live band or in the club setting downstairs. A bit rowdy at times, but the food and drinks have always been good, as is the service. One of the best late night spots in Downtown SLC.

name: Lake Effect
content: My husband and I decided to order take-out tonight instead of dining in. Not only were they on time with their prep time, they were extremely friendly! The environment in the restaurant is that of an old school speakeasy. We ordered the lamb ribs and tin can nachos. They weren't skimpy with the food either. We had a TON of food. It was incredibly delicious! If I had to rate it I would give 10/10 for portions, and taste. DEFINITELY WILL be going back for date night to dine in.

name: Lake Effect
content: My favorite part about this place it the beautiful decor.  There is no place more beautiful in all of Salt Lake City and would put it up against any of the night clubs and bars in even some of the larger upscale towns.  The bar area is so beautiful and they have a huge selection of specialty cocktails.  The beer menu is rather extensive with local and imported beer.  The food here is its one thing that could use a little work, it is not bad but it does not blow your mind like you think it would.  We have eaten here several times and its been just okay every time.  But if you are trying to show off what Salt Lake has to offer in nightlife this is the place to start.  Also try the bar below called the Rabbit Hole it is great as well.

name: Lake Effect
content: All I can say is WOW! First off, it's a historical landmark, which makes it extra special. They have done some remodeling inside as well to make the place look upscale. Our server was wonderful and I wish I had pictures of all the food I had here.We started with the garlic aioli fries and buffalo califlower dip, which were both excellent. Then, I ordered the ahi tuna tacos for my main entree, which were bursting with flavor. We ended with beignets, which ofcourse weren't as good as Cafe Du Monde and could have had some more dipping sauces. However, they were still pretty good for Utah.

name: Lake Effect
content: That's the second time that  I have been here. Each time I was impressed by the food quality and the service despite having a big crowd . We had the lamb ribs , and they were great . The bloody hell  burger was quiet delicious , perfectly cooked and juicy , the combination of the red slaw with the blue cheese gave it a unique kick. Mixed drinks from the bar were exceptional as well. The Irish brownies were definitely a big hit ! Great ambiance with a wide age range . The band was very good , added a special lively ambiance . Update : First time I have been here since they reopened. They have been strictly following guidelines and seating every other table . Servers, bartenders and hostess were wearing face masks . Hand sanitizer was available when you come the door . Food quality haven't changed and remains excellent . As the restaurant seen is trying to get back to normal , praise should be given to every place that goes above and beyond to follow guidelines while providing excellent care for their customers.

name: Lake Effect
content: This place has a piece of our hearts. First live music experience since being back out in the world and first awesome drink/meal experience. We stopped in SLC on a whim overnight quick en route to Jackson, WY and found Lake Effect online.We called and they said they didn't have a wait at the moment so we quickly went over and were highly impressed with the cleanliness all around. Staff was wearing masks/gloves, seats spaced apart, the whole crew doing what they can to follow the new guidelines - bless them! The food though...great!! We had friend pickles, ahi tacos, and poke bowl. All 5 stars for flavor, freshness, and fullness. Pro tip: If you check in on yelp you should get an offer for free seasoned fries as well! The drinks - 5 stars! TONS of beer to choose from..tons. Pretty much anything you want, they have. I also had the riders in the storm cocktail and it was so smooth. The atmosphere is what makes this place. The live music was so refreshing and fun. Good vibes all around and such a trendy place. Highly recommend when in SLC!

name: Lake Effect
content: The atmosphere is super rad here. Went here last night for dinner, drinks, and to watch Scott Foster. WOW. He was AMAZING. The drinks? AMAZING!!!!! The food? Ok. I liked the arugula salad my husband ordered. He got the Mahi Tacos. He thought they were ok, but he wouldn't get them again. He liked my crab Mac and cheese, but I wouldn't personally get it again. I ordered the Honeysuckle cocktail! OH MY! HEAVEN IN MY MOUTH!!! Our waitress was super friendly. The ambiance here is unmatched by any bar we have visited. It makes Prohibition look like Wasted Space! My husband and I agreed that, for now while they have their limited menu, it'd be a place for appetizers and drinks or after dinner drinks. Definitely looking forward to returning, ESPECIALLY for Scott Foster nights!

name: Lake Effect
content: The drinks here are very yummy. I also love the vibe. The downstairs is full of music, laughter, and entertainment. Also, the bathrooms are very clean and beautiful. Thanks for the experience!

name: Lake Effect
content: Yessy was great. She sat down at the table with us and was patient and went over the menu and helped us decide what we wanted.  Great customer service. Beautiful bar with great design and beautiful colors Definitely check it outIt could possibly become your favorite bar

name: Lake Effect
content: Flavor explosion food! Dialed up cocktails and great live music. Hip vibe. Memorable dining my friends will remember! Crab cakes blew us away so we took another order home. Sophisticated place. Wine and spirits list is excellent!

name: Lake Effect
content: I'm lake effect is a fun bar with many young people. They have great live music on weekend nights. The waitstaff is helpful even when busy.

name: Lake Effect
content: This was a full surprise. Such a cute place and good vibes here. Booth areas are cute. And other seating areas are really comfy as well ( I'm not sure about the regular table and chair area haha)I was there on Wednesday night, and they had live music going on. They have more area downstairs. We walked in without any expectations and walked out with satisfaction. This can be a cute spot for girls to hang out and drink or for any first time date night spot.

name: Lake Effect
content: One of our favorite downtown spots! Nice vibe, delicious drinks (Every Rose ) and seriously amazing food. We love the tin can nachos, vegetarian tacos with DEEP FRIED AVOCADO and Mac and cheese.

name: Lake Effect
content: I must ssay that Vida's review was spot on!.. even though it's a few years old, it's all relevant. The decor, the clientele of mostly  30-40 year olds, the menu of decent burgers, tasty small bites, and the extensive cocktail menu is what this place has going for it. The crispy ribs were a treat, the fried pickles were spicy that I was not expecting, garlic parmesan fries were tasty, Smoking bird was decent but there was a bone in one of the orders, Basic Bitch burger was good, Mac and  Cheese is a must. For desert, try the Beignets and the Irish Bomb Brownies! Live music up stairs, downstairs, Rabbit Hole, is darker, more quiet and private. We came early on a Saturday before a concert at the Viviant. I would highly recommend it as a spot to get food and drinks before a concert in the downtown area and just a few mins  walk to Viviant.

name: Lake Effect
content: Fantastic. Only here a split second and loved it. You like cocktails, stop here! Mix masters can mix well, atmosphere is spot on.   You want to have a good night, stop!

name: Lake Effect
content: Lake Effect Bar is Outstanding and a Genuine Treat.  Professional fully stocked bar with Exceptional drinks that are perfectly balanced.  This wonderfully renovated 1880's building would be a must visit for any Architecture Enthusiast.  Menu is on point as well.  Pro Tip:  Ask for Yelp Fries for gratis appetizer.   An Oasis for any out of town traveler.

name: Lake Effect
content: Everything is haute, chic, jazzy, groovy, sexy art in the jon, amazing staff, feels like SLC mixed with SF.  Good hooch, too.For the love of Christ on a bike followed by all the Mormon apostles, get better at food.  Then you'll truly be on top.

name: Lake Effect
content: I'm realllllly sad to do this but I've been trying to get ahold of their event coordinator for at the very least 3 weeks now. I've been planning my 30th birthday since I was like 13! It's my golden birthday, if you know what that means then you get it!! I have called, my husband has called and so has my best friend trying to book a reso or a buy out and they will NOT return any of our calls or messages. That was the #1 spot I wanted to spend my birthday and they didn't even have the decency to call back. I have 29 people that were coming to celebrate with me and we will have to go elsewhere. Good luck if you are trying the same cause it was a joke.

name: Lake Effect
content: Good food! Service wasn't ideal. We waited a while for our food and had to flag our waiter down a few times. I would go back for the ambiance and music, with hopes the service would be better.

name: Lake Effect
content: This place is fantastic. The live music is a plus and the service was very good. Just a great vibe. We went to try the Jackfruit options on the menu, and they did not disappoint. The drinks were good. The only gripe is that the Spirits portion of the menu lacked some clarity on how much you are getting for what you're paying. Still, I've got only myself to blame for presuming and not asking a question Going back soon!

name: Lake Effect
