content: We really liked Lake Effect! Dress up, it is a very upscale environment, you feel like you stepped outside of Utah for a night out! It has lots of tables and closed booths and space to meet friends. There is live music on the ground level. The cocktails are pricey but are really well made. I had the PB&G (Peanut Butter and Gin), it was delicious. Especially if you are a PB fan. And some appetizers. The servers were very attentive. The place can be a bit pricey if you aren't prepared for that going in, and there was a $5 Cover. But if you like to dress up and go out, this is a must visit!

name: Lake Effect
content: Just come here for the food and live music. It's worth it. Love the atmosphere here, and the food is better than most restaurants. Best nachos I've ever had.

name: Lake Effect
content: Awesome service, great chicken wings and amazing cocktail! Very knowledgeable bartenders and really fun environment.

name: Lake Effect
content: I am giving a one star review not based on my dining experience because I did not get to have one.  My New Year's Eve reservation was cancelled by the restaurant with no warning or explanation. I received a cancellation email and proceeded to call the restaurant four times with no answer to find out why. I received a text message the following morning explaining that they had been overbooked due to an OpenTable glitch. Instead of just cancelling my reservation with no warning, they should have called and given me the option to book a different time. I then had to scramble to make new plans for New Years Eve. This was incredibly inconsiderate of the management team and should have been handled in a more professional manner.

name: Lake Effect
content: This is the best cocktail bar in SLC - hands down. The ambiance is PERFECT.Exposed wood ceilings, chesterfield chairs, vintage ceiling tiles repurposed into a bar front with an incredible arched library style bar to pair. Even the communal style tables have amazing metal work and every drink is served in crystal style drink ware. Everything feels intentional, designed, and there are even a few TVs so you never miss the game! We've also found they have good taste in live music so it's always an enhancement and never irritating. Favorite cocktails include: PB&G, Brown Derby, Klovers Club ... and many more but those really stand out. The food - so underrated. Yes, the tin can nachos are a solid snack but can we talk about brunch?! This is one of the best brunch spots in SLC?! We had the crab benni and the fried chicken and biscuit. Both were amazing! I can't wait to be back and try the shrimp and grits as well - it looked awesome. Value: this place isn't cheap. We're talking $12-$14 drinks BUT they are anything except ordinary. It's not a spot we come to spend all night but for a fabulous, complex, unique drink or two we will later try to rip off at home? Perfect. The food is a great value! This is a must try for locals and visitors alike!

name: Lake Effect
content: I've debated about this review.  I have been several times and have always had a really fun experience.  Their food and drinks are great and the ambiance is a huge bonus.  I do however have a MAJOR issue; A group of my friends and I decided to try out Jazz night.  We arrived, found a seat at the rear of the downstairs area, ordered and were enjoying the music.  Within 10 minutes an elderly man approached us and stated that we could not be there if we were going to speak and he would only "ALLOW us to stay" if we were quiet.  First, we were not being loud at all.  Second we were so far removed from all of the other guests where we were seated that talking quietly didn't seem like it would be an issue.  When we asked the man if he worked at the establishment, he informed us no, but that he "organized all the jazz nights" and what he says goes.  When we voiced our concerns to actual staff we were met with "oh, yeah he can be like that.....". I am sorry but my party are paying guests and being told that we are only ALLOWED to be present by this man's good grace is absurd.  He approached us AGAIN towards the very end of the night to let us know we still were too loud which is crazy as we were literally whispering.  He asked a bouncer to remove us.  As we had already paid our bill, this wasn't such a huge deal, but had we not already been in the process of leaving I am certain we would have been asked to move or leave by your staff.  This is outrageous considering you are allowing a non-employee to bully, threaten and determine who is ALLOWED to be present in your establishment.  As a fellow paying customer, I find this unacceptable.  For the sake of your business you may want to rethink this mans participation in organizing anything for your establishment.

name: Lake Effect
content: To be honest I came here to eat their appetizers not for drinks. And to be more specific to eat their nachos! When we arrived they stated it was open seating and since we arrived around 8, the place was pretty open. While everyone was ordering drinks we just ordered steak nachos, cauliflower buffalo dip, garlic fries and of course Mac and cheese. Our waitress was pretty surprised but by any means I didn't feel judged she was very friendly and attentive. When out did arrived the buffalo dip did not live up to its expectations, you couldn't take the buffalo and the cauliflower taste was pretty overwhelming. It was okay but not the favorite. The Mac and cheese was pretty good, at first I thought the portion was small but it was actually pretty filling. As far as the teste it was good nothing special though. The garlic fries were delicious! It came with an aioli and it was amazing! They were the first ones to be finished! Would definitely order again!Last but not least, Tin can steak nachos! I would come back here just for the nachos to be honest. The portion was big, were were sharing it between the three of us and we still didn't finish. They had everything you wanted and thought you needed. Would totally recommend it. Overall our experience was great! I would suggest you check in with yelp when you arrive because they will give you free fries!

name: Lake Effect
content: Cool joint downtown with a great food and drink selection - but it was the kitchen that was open till 1am that drew us here after a late day flight to SLC. Service was great - we enjoyed our late night tacos.I always seek out bars & restaurants with a decent cocktail menu so appreciated their selections. Drinks were great but would not say amazing - but again, it was after 11pm on a Sunday in Salt Lake City so I was appreciative they were even open!I'd certainly go back again to try more.

name: Lake Effect
content: What an amazing atmosphere. I'd love to come back later one night when it's more of a club than a restaurant   Super cool place. I had the pulled pork sandwich which had a totally unique and delicious. Very original flavor. Tried the purple slaw which was great as well. Oh, and they had live music on a Monday night which sounded great and really added to the ambiance.

name: Lake Effect
content: I've heard all great stuff about Lake Effect. After a few visits here, I have to say this place is fantastic. I went on a weekend, the live music is a big plus. Intimate settings for small groups, large bar, beautiful decor and great ambiance. The vibe here was everything! It gets busy during the weekend night life. Perfect busy crowd, has a more upscale culture and vibe. I've recently went for brunch on Sundays. I love their mimosa options and brunch menu. Our group tried almost everything on the brunch menu. Everything was delicious. If your're looking for a spot to watch football and enjoy a few. This is a great place. Cocktail, beer and and wine menu is amazing here. So many awesome choices!

name: Lake Effect
content: Nice energy and feel to this location.  Busy night and service was great as well.  Parking was a bit tricky but worth it once inside.

name: Lake Effect
content: I can't say enough good things about Lake Effect! Their food is great, especially the garlic fries with aioli sauce! I would literally come here just for those. The drink menu is extensive; they are sure to have the perfect cocktail for any palate. I absolutely loved the Zion cocktail, which they had about a year ago. Since then I have tried a few others and none have disappointed. Lake Effect has live local music in the evenings for entertainment. Definitely need to visit here if you're in Salt Lake and looking for some creative cocktails!

name: Lake Effect
content: This was my first time here. We were a party of 9 on a wed eve pretty early! It's a great vibe albeit very loud! We got the tin can nachos which were great! But $14 for nachos with no meat? This was the beginning of massively overpriced food. Sadly this was the best of.I got the kolob burger with Mac n cheese. $20. Maybe it's because we had. A large party but my burger arrived stone cold. Like not even room temp. But cold. Like they made it first and let it sit until the whole order was ready. So disappointed. The Mac n cheese was cold on top, but warm enough to eat at the bottom. It was completely dry. No cheese. No sauce. Dry noodles with crumbs on top. I dont get it. But I'm starving and I couldn't eat the burger. And I couldn't send it back because our server, who was very nice, was never to be seen again. I didn't take A single bite of my cold burger. It had fried pickles on it that fell off and were totally cold and soggy. Nothing was edible. My friends got the 3 meat bbq and said it was awful. And their potato side was totally cold as well. My veggie friend got the bbq tempeh and said it was the worst she's ever had. Sooooo I think this is a drinking only place. It's extremely overpriced! Even if I could eat my $20 burger...the meat looked like a Costco patty. The bun was hard and cold to the touch. Oh and the best part?! I had asked for ketchup for my burger and was charged 75 cents!!!!  for ketchup. For MY BURGER! Which I didn't even eat!! Food wise, nachos aside, this place was a disaster. Oh also?Parking doesn't exist under $10.

name: Lake Effect
content: Good beer nice place just to hang out with people or alone good music and kinda fancy. I recommend lake Effect the beer and add a shot of tequila to it

name: Lake Effect
content: On the rare occassion we didn't have my child,  my husband and I decided to try lunch at Lake Effect.  I ordered the Crab Cake Cobb Salad while my husband ordered the Brazillian Burger and Cajun fries.  Both were very delicious, although my  crab cakes were a bit on the salty side.  I will definitely patronize this establishment again to try another dish, that I am sure will be great as well.

name: Lake Effect
content: Lake effect is a fun place for nightlife and dinner! I really enjoy the food that they offer, and their cocktails are super yummy. Pro tip: you get free fries when you check in on Yelp. I enjoyed dinner and drinks when I came on a Saturday night. It wasn't too crowded and the service is great. However, at night it turns into a more club vibe. I had to pay a $5 cover to get in. There is a downstairs that is super crowded. I would stay upstairs if you want to avoid the crowds and hang out with friends. The upstairs also had live music which was a nice touch. Overall, I prefer Lake Effect for dinner over nightlife, but would consider giving the bar another try for late night drinks.

name: Lake Effect
content: Fun joint, great music, cool seating.maybe some more vegan options please. Enjoyed your paloma.

name: Lake Effect
content: I would give 0 stars if I could, I went here last night and got a few drinks, with cash, downstairs from Mimi I think her name was , the short haired girl bartender. everything fine, served quick and they were friendly... then I sat down with a huge group and a black waitress came to ask if we'd like a drink, and we said yes, then she told us we have to open a tab. I said I only have cash, and that I've been paying cash, And that I'll just go to the bar and get it myself with cash because I didn't bring a card. She said that the bar would make me open a tab also, and She said "well if you're going to be rude then bye!" Because I told her I'll just get it myself. HERE WE GO, I go to the bar, and immediately here Mimi, tell the other bartenders out loud "he's an asshole, make him wait" so I told her I hope she wasn't talking about me and she said that when people are rude to her servers they are not priority, so I told her that I wasn't rude, it was a miscommunication, then paid with a 20, she gave me 3$ change on a 6$ beer and when I said something, she said OH, my bad! Unbelievably unprofessional. Then she did it again! Another "my bad" no only was she saying that the beer was 8&, about 10 with tax, where's she learn math? Or how to treat paying customers? I'll never recommend this bar to anyone and my friends drink heavy. Learn how to keep your emotions at home, and work when you're behind the bar!

name: Lake Effect
content: Great ambiance. Excellent drink menu. Fantastic BBQ. Close to Vivint arena and the Salt Palace. I recommend Lake Effect.

name: Lake Effect
content: This place is new to me, so I was excited to try it. The inside pics on their website show a large bar reminiscent of an old library meets industrial new. When we arrived, I have to say the place was pretty true to their site. Friendly folks greeted us at the front, and our server was pleasant. Ordered the 1 meat bbq plate - brisket. Ill stop here - I've had some pretty decent brisket over the years so my expectations were admittedly very high. The food came and that's where it fell flat. The brisket was dry. I mean like hard to chew. I had a few pieces that were over a half inch thick, which added to the eating difficulty. It had little to no moisture and most pieces were really tough. I tried three different sauces to help work that cow, but none were useful bringing out flavor. So now for a few good experiences. The Cajun fries were decent, as was the cheddar biscuit. The brisket should have been the center piece though, and for that I have no choice but to give 2 stars. It's likely a much better place for drinks and small plates, but dinner was disappointing.

name: Lake Effect
content: This upscale restaurant & bar is a perfect spot downtown. Nothing on the menu disappoints. The beer, wine and coktails list is extensive and they have something for everyone. I was here recently and split the brussel sprouts, tin can nachos, and the Cajun ahi tacos. It was almost too much food for 3 people. But it was enjoyed by all!Lets start with the sprouts- served shredded with pecans and goat cheese these are a perfect way to sneak some veggies in. I really loved the shredded form as it made them much more tender than your typical brussel sprout. The Tin Can Nachos were served in a tin can about the size of my head. The waitress then removed the tin can and out poured delicious tortilla chips covered in generous amounts of melted cheese, jalapenos, our cream, and gaucamole. We opted to add Pulled Pork to the nachos and that was definitely the right choice. Two people could easily share this as an entree. For 3 people we all got plenty  this would probably even offer enough nschos for 4. The Cajun Ahi tacos were amazing light bites. Served with your choice of side dish (pro-tip sides are on the backside of the menu at the top right). We opted for the chipolte fries with cajun spice and it was a definite winner. I am making this my normal stop when I am in SLC and you should too!

name: Lake Effect
content: Fresh squeezed juices. Homemade syrups and mixers. Fresh fruits and veggies to make those craft drinks. Matt is a mixologist of the Fifth degree. Not a huge place. But every drink is made with care. Highly recommend.

name: Lake Effect
content: Waitress was friendly but didn't check in to make sure the food was ok. The hostess was not welcoming at all. Food is ok. The place is cute. I got the Mac n cheese with brisket. The Mac n cheese was decent the brisket not so much. It was chunky and not good. Double check what they charge and what is priced on the menu. They charged me more then what the menu said.

name: Lake Effect
content: Good atmosphere, great nachos but service was not so great but it was also really busy.  She was very friendly but it took a long time to get drinks and people at our table were left out when ordering food.  The brisket tacos were tough and the ribs came out cold and were also mostly fat.  Maybe this was just a bad nite?

name: R&R BBQ
content: This place is so good! The rib meat *almost* falls off the bone and I loved the sweet BBQ sauce. The okra is awesome and they have a really big selection of sides! I might try the sweet potato fries next time. I've never actually seen a BBQ place offer hush puppies in lieu of a roll, but I must say they were better than hush puppies I've had at seafood restaurants. The creamed corn is extremely sweet- unexpected, but still very tasty. Very large portions and a great price point. We will definitely come back!

name: R&R BBQ
content: I like the place, and coming back. 4 stars just because for some reason my meal was a cold but the flavor are there. I realized that I should bring it up to the manager so thats why I'm writing this review so they can fix this little issue. I'm going to try again and if my meal is hot, I'm coming back and change my review to 5 stars. God Job guys keep it UP!

name: R&R BBQ
content: The Caveman Burger is a serious piece of meat... I could feel a coronary starting to come on, but in like the best way.

name: R&R BBQ
content: After waiting for over an hour for our delivery, the driver shows up there to be told R&R had a problem with our order and they had to cancel it!!! No phone call or anything! We love their food so to have this experience is super disappointing!!! Tried to call and talk to someone. Was on hold for 16 min only to get an answering machine!

name: R&R BBQ
content: I'm visiting SLC from Tennessee for a month and was craving BBQ. I was skeptical when ordering BBQ in Utah. The smoked boneless chicken was divine! The brisket on the other hand was dry and over cooked. The Mac n Cheese was pretty good and the baked beans could have had more flavor. I loved the sweet smoky bbq sauce. I ordered from DoorDash and it came quickly and was still warm. Overall I enjoyed it. Thumbs up!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Great fries and Mac and cheese and potato salad but I will say the burger was a little undone. I don't know if that's how they do it in these parts but I like mine medium rare, not raw  picked out all the raw pieces and it tasted quite delicious though

name: R&R BBQ
content: This place is the best bbq in salt lake. I've tried the ribs, chicken, brisket, pulled pork, sausage, the desserts, and almost all the sides. Everything is great but my favorite so far is the brisket and the ribs! Still looking forward to trying the wings, salads, and tacos!

name: R&R BBQ
content: The staff is efficient, the restaurant is clean, and the food is delicious. It is very family friendly. You can bring in very young children and the staff will accommodate.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I'm pretty disappointed with my recent visit to R&R. We've ordered many times from here and been extremely happy with the food and the service. However, our experience last weekend during the Super Bowl left us anything but satisfied. I placed an online order for pick up on the Friday before Super Bowl with the order to be picked up on Sunday at 5:40 PM. While I recognize that Super Bowl Sunday is an incredibly popular time to pick up barbecue I figured that by placing the order two whole days in advance we would be fine to get the food that we were looking for. They charged our card, our order was confirmed and everything seemed good to go until I actually went to pick up the order on Sunday for the Super Bowl. When I got there I couldn't even pull into the curbside pick up spots as they were blocked by multiple cars parked illegally. I figured no big deal, I would just walk in to get our food instead. When I walked in there was about 30 other people trying to get food and I walked up to the register to explain to the person working there that I had a curbside pick up that I had placed as an order two days ago and I was here to pick it up. He literally laughed at me and said "get in line behind all these other people waiting." I was a little confused and said "No I don't think you understand I placed this order two days ago and it's my pickup time, I'm not trying to place an order right now."  and he literally told me "it doesn't matter when you place the order it's based on the pick up time." Needless to say my 5:40  pick up time came and went and there were still a bunch of people ahead of me. I kept waiting and around 5:55 I was informed that they were completely out of food except for some chicken thighs and pulled pork and that they would not be able to fulfill any part of my order except the one order of pulled pork I had actually ordered. I was extremely disappointed and I was really confused as I intentionally ordered  two days in advance but for some reason everybody who ordered the same day of the Super Bowl was taking priority over me just because their pick up times were earlier than mine? That just doesn't make any sense to me. The priority of the order should be based on when the orders were placed, not what time the pick up was. Essentially every single person who waited until Super Bowl Sunday to order, even just an hour before my pickup time, was given priority over my order. All in all, they did try to make it right and gave us three orders of pulled pork with whatever sides they had left and I appreciate that they at least attempted to try to make it right. But it was almost none of the food we had actually ordered. I just think this is an extremely faulty system and I don't know if I'll ever be trusting them again with large orders for any sort of party. It just doesn't make sense to me that somebody who ordered two hours before their pick up time on the same day takes priority over someone like me who ordered two full days in advance, just because their pick up time is five minutes ahead of mine. That doesn't make any sense and I've never heard of a restaurant doing that. Needless to say I don't know if we'll be back.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I was excited to find a  bbq place with good ratings, but boy was I disappointed. We ordered the brisket and pulled pork sandwiches expecting some nice hot sandwiches, instead we got some frozen sandwiches. And when asked to heat the sandwiches employee didn't even apologize. When sandwiches came back they were only lukewarm and the buns were falling apart. Also we got watered down bbq sauce and by the way our sides where also cold I'm baffled that this place has a high rating.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I ordered via Uber Eats and laughed when I opened my takeaway box. I ordered the three meat plate because I figured there would be plenty for another dinner tomorrow since I worked late. There was hardly enough for me that night. I've ordered from R&R before but I was actually in the restaurant so I guess I'll have to go in for the right quantity of food. I ordered Brisket, Sausage, and Pulled Pork. There were two tiny slices of brisket, one sausage chopped, and not even a small handful of pork. The majority of the box held the dinner roll and a tub of Mac and cheese. I went through photos of everyone else's three meat figuring I was just acting really silly and everyone else's is huge. Definitely not worth $35. I'll go in the restaurant to order again.

name: R&R BBQ
content: This place is straight fire. The half rack of ribs was fantastic, very juicy and meaty. The bbq chicken wings were on another level and were crispy but not over cooked. When I'm back in SLC this place is going to be on my list to visit. Place was clean and the staff were good about enforcing masks.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Tonight was 3rd time to restaurant. In 3 weeks.First trip brisket was awesome. Great taste and tender. Banana pudding great. Two nights later went to order. No brisket. So I ordered chicken. Was really dry out. Tonight back in town . Stopped before getting to hotel. Hotel is block away. Brisket sandwich  was dry and tuff. The bun was dried out falling apart.. the baked beans and garlic mashed potato was really good. 2 out of 3 visits bad.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Good food, fast service.  I had the BBQ ribs which were a tiny bit dry, but the extra sauces made up for it.  Cole slaw and bbq wings also very good.  They also do a good job keeping the place clean.  Cannot think of anything to criticize so, what the heck, full 5 stars.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Everything on the menu is delicious. Highly recommend. Not pictured but also delicious: peach cobbler, wings

name: R&R BBQ
content: The ribs are great (whenever they have them) but I've been there many times at 5:00 (a respectable dinner hour) to find that they were out of ribs or that I was just in time for the last half rack. I know that its all about timing and knowing how much to smoke, but can't the target dinner hour be some sort of basis to figure it out? The food is good. I just hate driving all they way there to turn around and go home empty handed.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Pretty good, and I hate everything.  Just fix those hush puppies to have a little more flavor (something like Long John's).

name: R&R BBQ
content: Just moved here from California, and was amazed at the reviews at this place and was looking forward to some good southern food. The restaurant was very nice and welcoming and had a separate building for the pick up orders which was pretty convenient, but was very disappointed when we got our food. We paid $90 worth and had a few mistakes that we noticed off the bat, our burgers didn't come with any lettuce and tomatoes when all we instructed was no pickles. We also asked for well done and got rare patties instead. The bbq sauce was very diluted and the Mac and cheese felt over cooked. The only thing that was actually good that we ordered was the potato salad.

name: R&R BBQ
content: The employees were nice and friendly! It was my first time coming here so I ask the cash register guy what food he recommends. They offer daily specials only on the weekdays. It looks intersting, but since it was my first time I tried the 3 meat plate. I ordered the ribs, briskets, and pull porks. I thought the briskets were a little dried, and all the meats were little salty. I usually like to eat less salt, so others might think the taste is good. I think it just depends on people taste buds.  I ordered potato salad and garlic mashers for the sides. The sides were both delicious.  It was in a small plaza so there were limited amount of spaces, but I went on off-hours so there were couple of spaces available. I will definitely try the bbq pork tacos next time!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Visited from California and man.....this makes the trip well worth the snowstorm we hit on our way up there. Fall off the bone ribs. Juicy pulled pork. Tasteful brisket. Oh and if you like Hot, try their "Danger" sauce. Boy....Perfection

name: R&R BBQ
content: The BBQ is decent enough but they lost our Christmas order leaving us to scramble to put together a last-minute meal. We called in the order 5 days earlier and the employee read it back to us. Presumably it never got entered in their system. I know these things happen but sadly we won't be relying on them for our holiday meals any more.UPDATE: The staff at R&R reached out and we've talked about the gaps that resulted in the lost order. They've generously offered to make up for this mistake and we're looking forward to it.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Smoked wings were amazing, could have been smoked a little longer but they were awesome! Mac & cheese is not yo mama's, but I guess it will do. Next time I'm in Salt Lake & craving some bbq I'll be sure to stop through & try the ribs and other sides next time. Keep up the good work!

name: R&R BBQ
content: R&R went from amazing to mediocre back to amazing again, and that is with a new owner (I hear) so they must "get it" and are sticking true to the roots of when this place first opened.  We order every couple of months and it's great for large groups.

name: R&R BBQ
content: This place is just ok. My wife gives R&R 4 stars, but I do not! Every time she brings me their food, I lose half of it picking out the fat chunks. Trim that shit!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Excellent meats - ribs and pulled pork were A-1. This place goes to 5 stars if they'd heat up their sauce rather than serve it cold (I think it was refrigerated) and serve their hush puppies hot instead of having them sit out

name: R&R BBQ
content: This evening I was craving meat so I went out to satisfy that desire. Where else to go, but a BBQ joint? And what better BBQ joint than R&R?We actually went to their new location in South Jordan first, but the line was too long as it should be. It's a popular place and a great addition to the south end. We instead decided to drive to the Salt Lake location hoping we'd avoid the dinner rush. Turns out, I wasn't the only one with a meat craving.While a bit shorter, the line at the Salt Lake location was also long and impressive. We decided to wait it out and ended up waiting 15 minutes before we were even able to order. Luckily, we got one of the few last ribs orders left and once we ordered, the food came out shortly there after.With all the driving and waiting, the ribs, the BBQ sauce and the hush puppies were definitely worth the extra time and effort. The ribs were big and meaty and I couldn't get enough of the BBQ sauces choices. Sooo good.Update for Thanksgiving: As if R&R wasn't awesome already, just add the holidays to their dopeness! This Thanksgiving season, we didn't want to spend so much time in the kitchen cooking for such a small bunch so we decided to order out and let R&R prepare our meal. Can I just say that I have never enjoyed turkey so much! I love turkey, but R&R smoked turkey blew all my memories of home-cooked turkey out of the water. Their turkey was so juicy and flavorful, we pretty much ate every last bit of it. We were all blown away. The smoke was perfect and added so much deliciousness, but the fact that it wasn't dry and boring made the meal perfect. The sides were great and we just added our own yams and cranberry sauce to complete the table. It was a total steal for the price and totally worth it not to have to slave away in the kitchen. And while they indicate their meal will feed 8, it will definitely feed a few more than that! We will always get our Tday turkey from R&R from here on out!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Half rack ribs were delicious!  The flavor was just right, I did not need to dip in any BBQ sauce.  The place was cleaned, people follows social distancing.  Staff were friendly.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Awesome pulled pork! Lean and very tasty. And indoor seating made me feel like a human being once again. This place is great and I'll be back!

name: R&R BBQ
content: We order a plate and an extra side for take out. Not only everyone was super friendly and nice but it was damn fast. First time here, as a "chain" it's not bad at all, but compare it to any serious smokehouse and it lacks enormously. They really need to step up with their rub, you can't taste any salt nor pepper, the meat is not the greatest quality and you can taste it, The brisket had a nice smoke ring but you can tell they preferred to overheat it rather than slow and low, the bark is soft, the cuts where a real nice size but the meat was a tad dry. The pulled pork had the perfect amount of moist but no taste at all, no smoke, no condiments. The sausage was great but it seemed kinda generic. The sides were good ( smashed potatoes and the beans) but they could be better, not very memorable. They have a thing going on but they really need to step it up. The portions and the sizes were amazing but would prefer to pay more or have smaller portions for something that tastes better.I wouldn't come back

name: R&R BBQ
content: Found R&R through Yelp. Was in walking distance from hotel. Had the 3 meat combo and was pleasantly surprised. Would definitely comeback and try other menu items

name: R&R BBQ
content: I was excited to try them and then deeply underwhelmed. I travel extensively and have to rely more and more on Uber eats and DoorDash and the like. Usually they are the culprits in poor quality upon delivery. Not so in this case. I will say that the brisket on the sandwich and the BBQ sauce (less sweet more heat) was delicious. The rest was kind of a disaster. I ordered a brisket sandwich; it came on a cold, un-toasted bun. I don't know if that is how they normally serve it. I was expecting a toasted bun. With the thick cut of brisket, this did not transport well. Perhaps they do not know this and it is a different experience in restaurant! Please reserve judgment. It is hard to give negative feedback when I know restaurants are struggling and I hope this is taken as constructive, not critical for the sake of being unkind!!The sides were the problem: I ordered the smashed potatoes and brown gravy- and there was no gravy. Ouch. Cold mashed potatoes are not ok. I can work with reheated with gravy in the microwave- that is why I ordered this. The okra, totally my favorite, was under cooked and in clumps. I think this was just carelessness. Please, just because it is a DoorDash or other third party service, don't skimp on care!! We pay just as much and this is the only way I can get food when I am working in another city. I don't have a car when I'm traveling. I rely on you and I look for the local restaurants that everyone raves about. Please don't let me down.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Delicious!  The pulled pork salad was bomb.  I got my hubs a pulled pork sandwich and he loved it.  They give you a very large quantity of food for the price.  I definitely recommend!!!!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Had the pulled pork sandwich (onions, no pickles, coleslaw topper on side) with fries and Carolina sauce. Bbq flavored wings. Was told the non spicy sauce was bbq for the wings - yet even the bbq wings were spicy! Pulled pork sandwich buns were flavorless and I would just order the pulled pork meat plate instead next time to skip the horrible buns. Carolina sauce was described to me as tangy and vinegary by the waiter- but the sauce was actually thin and spicy with no vinegar tangy taste.  Fry sauce (pink sauce) was amazing, fries were perfectly seasoned and delicious. Pulled pork meat had great taste- not fatty. Would re order the pork meat and fries, not the wings!

name: R&R BBQ
content: My boyfriend was craving bbq & usually we satisfy our cravings at Phils BBQ being that we're from San Diego. Decided to try this place out and we're glad we did! We ordered their special which we chose brisket and ribs. Soo juicy and tender! Make sure you ask for the side of bbq sauce to add to it. Really friendly and helpful staff. We also got free wings for checking in! 10/10 recommend

name: R&R BBQ
content: First time at this place, I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and the brisket sandwich with mac and cheese and mashed potatoes as sides. The mac and cheese was really disappointing, it tasted like nothing, really plain, couldn't even tell if there was salt in it. I ordered for curbside and paid 2.50 for each can of soda. The online order didn't specify that it was going to be a can and not fountain, price seems a bit steep for can drinks. The meat and bbq sauce was okay. From the amount of locations and other reviews I expected way more.

name: R&R BBQ
content: It was my first time coming here and I wasn't impressed. Got the chicken salad and the portion size was great and it was fresh. But I didn't like the seasoning they used on the chicken. Also the chicken wasn't cooked all the way. Probably won't be giving these guys another try.

name: R&R BBQ
content: After many trips to SLC, I finally found my favorite place. Day one I had the salad with roasted turkey , and was back for more on day two. Day three I tried the ribs (perfect) with Mac n cheese. Back to the salad of day four, with brisket. The guys were on to me now, and I looked forward to my daily visits. Best bbq week ever!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Food was great! This is our first trip to Salt Lake City! We just came across this little place. I would eat here again.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I love R&R and the food is amazing, but it's pretty expensive. I door dashed it and paid about $30 for a two meat plate and some fried pickles and there were like 3 pieces of chopped brisket... I paid $30 for quite a bit of food and there was probably about 1/4 the amount of brisket that there should be. Nothing against the food, but they kind of cheated me on this one.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Great food but literally out of everyyyyy single thing, even ice cream. They were advertising free wings for yelp check in or download their ordering app. BUT they're out of wings . Ok no problemo, we wanted brisket, sausage and ribs . Out of sausage and ribs . Ummm ok .... understandable since we were there pretty late at like 730pm ish.  Most good bbq places sell out early . But wait .... that's not all they're out of . We ordered a peach cobbler ala mode. The server didn't tell us till after we paid and sat down and ate our food that they're also out of ice cream also and Instead of asking us what we wanted as substitute . She gave us extra cobbler ? I would have preferred to cancel the whole order .

name: R&R BBQ
content: Great place to eat. Stopped in and had a Three meat plate which was great! The Mac and cheese not the best but the creamed corn was great. Also get the Peach cobbler that was on point. Service was a little spotty but overall was a good place and good food.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Good BBQ. Good Cole slaw. But I ordered coleslaw as a topper AND a side--and paid 75 cents for the topper-- but didn't get it. I ordered a side order of fries for 3 and a half bucks and they were cold and limp. Since they were delivered within 5 minutes of leaving the restaurant, it wasn't a delivery problem. Hot fries went  to the dine-in clients. Suckers who ordered delivery were sent the stuff that had become too cold to serve.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Shared 3 meat plate with pulled pork, chopped brisket and spicy andouille sausage added Cole slaw, mac n cheese with hush puppies and have to say it's one of the best bque plates we've eaten in the valley. Practicing social distancing and the staff is very polite and helpful. Glad we stopped. Highly recommend.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Food was good cold and bad service this business doesn't take cash this is liberty and against the coinage act put in place by our founders no cash means no freedom please don't patron business that don't take cash

name: R&R BBQ
content: How can you be out of your special at 11 am. Disappointing, looks like you gotta call, brought my whole crew in only to be disappointed.  Glad business is good but don't forget your regulars

name: R&R BBQ
content: Brisket was juicy excellent. Smoked boneless chicken was tasty, not dried out. Seating was spread out so you don't worry about the covid19.  Manager suggested this extra and you have to try the banana pudding, well worth it. Friendly staff always a plus.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Some of the best bbq ribs and burnt ends in town!! I love this place. They even have a location inside Vivint smart home arena. So delicious.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Burgers were very overcooked and dry. When we called to notify the Supervisor his response was "yeah, I never order the burgers here". All other food items were good. Just don't order the burger! Apparently the employees don't even eat them!!

name: R&R BBQ
content: got 2 Lbs of the Brisket  it was extremely over cooked and dry. Best BBQ in utah that is a joke their BBQ is horrible . Im from the south I know good BBQ this is not it

name: R&R BBQ
content: Very good BBQ,a bit pricey but the taste was great. The mashed potatoes and their original sauce is really good,Mac and cheese was a little bland though.

name: R&R BBQ
content: The perfect spot at the perfect time. Perfect in time of COVID and mask. Staff was friendly and welcoming as we were first timers. Advised on what to order - we love smoke bbq food but you can always be surprised. Young lady taking orders, manager on duty and other staff who helped were all great. And then... the food. Ribs, wings, brisket and salad hit our lips perfectly with a hint of spice. Would definitely recommend for travelers like us. Stay all safe and healthy

name: R&R BBQ
content: We are visiting from another state and were told that R&R was a good place for BBQ. Unfortunately this was not the case. The food was subpar. Our falsely promised "fall off the bone" ribs were dryer than the personalities of our cashier. We had inquired about the sauces that they provided and his simple response was "we have 3". When we order the food he asked us "what sauce would you like" and made no attempt to even state what kind of sauces they had. One would assume when someone asks about what sauces they had, that we have never been to their establishment. If he was ignorant or just lazy I could not tell the difference. He also chose to sing along to the radio instead of prong attention to the guests. And when we were ready to pay we had to ask twice if we could "pay now".  Stating that I am severely disappointed is a grave understatement. The only reason our review constituted two stars was the female server that was very sweet. Utah is not known for BBQ and if R&R is their best to offer then I have nothing else to say.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Place is good but not my favorite there alot of places in Salt Lake that will give this place some serious competition. Not bad not GREAT but definitely work checking out if you have not been here. You won't be disappointed but you will see what I mean I will go back for sure but just cant the 5 stars just yet

name: R&R BBQ
content: I had the three meat plate from ordered doordash and as soon as I took a bite of the french fries I knew I had made a mistake. The fries and chicken tasted like they were drenched in salt making then very hard to eat. I love French fries but these were not good.The pork and brisket were alright but too dry as there wasn't an option to add sauces and none were included. I've had R and R before and it did not taste this salty.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Because of Covid this review is strictly based on the food. Their BBQ is real good but the roast beef sandwiches on two separate occasions had four small rectangular slices of meat. Maybe 3oz and I'm not exaggerating. For the price that is a ridiculously small portion size. We'll try again when we can go to the restaurant. It wasn't the sandwich but the chopped brisket, sorry my mistake.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Usually I am a fan. Today's experience is enough for me to stop visiting R&R. For a family picnic, we ordered from the North Salt Lake location the Family Pack as advertised with pulled pork, rolls, mashed potatoes, cole slaw and plates and napkins for 8. The food was delivered curbside. When we arrived at the picnic and opened the package there was no cole slaw, soggy buns including one missing a bottom, and no plates and napkins. The fact these items were missing is a shared issue - they should have been included and we should have looked earlier. This review is due to the customer service, or lack thereof, that comwhen we called to inform the location. After being told that 'sometimes we get busy and don't include stuff', 'I'm not the curbside manager so oh well', 'well you left so you there's nothing I can do.' In a time when restaurants may be in need of customers, apparently R&R is not. Lesson learned and I will take my business, and inform others to take their business, elsewhere. Thank you for the response and appreciate your addressing the issue. I will reach out to the company President.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Food = 3.5/5. Probably the best smoked wings I've ever had, so those I'll highly recommend. The brisket, ribs, whatever they claim as "burnt ends" and pulled pork just fail to standout, however. Lived in Kansas City for 6 years, where bbq is just on a different level. Perhaps it's not fair to compare a mountain west establishment to a cornerstone bbq city, but in my opinion, if you're going to put out a product knowing what else is out there, then it's fair game for comparison. Service = 1/5. Very friendly, which is always a good thing. But my order was an entire 3-meat plate short, and when I went back in to retrieve the plate, it was given to me with only two meats. Again, they were friendly and apologetic about it, which beats the alternative of being incendiary and rude, but still come on. Gotta get it together. At the end of the day, I'd go back for the wings.

name: R&R BBQ
content: We went for lunch today and we were so impressed! The food was Amazing! We got the pulled pork, chicken and side of creamed corn. They have the employees sanitize each table after the customer leaves. It was very organized and they were quick to get our food to us. Very happy with our visit today!!

name: R&R BBQ
content: We had heard wonderful things about this place so we thought we'd order from them.  We got the pulled pork, chicken wings, brisket and potato salad. While the potato salad was excellent and the brisket was good, the chicken wings were flavorless. The worst, however, was the pulled pork. It was dryer than beef jerky and twice as chewy. The only one in our family that didn't spit it out was our dog. (He did seem to be a big fan, however.)

name: R&R BBQ
content: You know what they say when you grow too fast your product goes down hill Sorry guys your food has gone down I have eaten there long enough To know what their food once was

name: R&R BBQ
content: Wonderful FOOD!!!!!!!Trevor and his staff are great ...very friendly and the peach cobbleris amazing!!!! we came up from California and best decision we made on the trip was eating hereyou won't be disappointed.

name: R&R BBQ
content: After many recommendations I stopped by R&R today and my only regret is not having gone sooner. The staff was over the top nice, welcoming, and sure knew their meats!! Each staff member shared their personal recommendations, and took the time to explain to a newb like myself what a hush puppy is, the different slabs of meats and sauces, and more. They were so friendly and the food itself so delicious- I recommend to everyone and can't wait to go back. Thank you for the experience.

name: R&R BBQ
content: For the price thru Door Dash I would expect a LOT more ..  Pulled pork sandwich ..  Bun is a Mass produced roll,  No browning to it .. Just your typical Bun  add BBQ sauce and Coleslaw and you have a Soggy slimy mess ... BBQ sauce  was  SWEET  and HOT,  but no other flavor in between.   Fried Pickles were Awesome,   French Fries  Limp and no crisp to them.   Hush puppies lacked flavor.  Maybe put onion in the batter instead of just on the outside of them.   OVERALL  I will not be back,  to many other better places to go for that price.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I had R&R BBQ a couple years ago and remembered it being good so thought it would be a great choice for Father's Day. We called ahead of time to place an order. First flaw was when we called we asked if all the sauces were gluten free. The guy simply said he did not know. Not let me check with someone or review the allergy guide. "Simply I don't know. I think it has soy sauce." *Please train your employees or give them resources to properly do their jobs.*We did our own research and found a number of celiac sites stating their BBQ sauce was safe so decide to make an order and had a set time for pickup. We arrived at the time stated and it was pure chaos. Bunch of people standing in the lobby during covid all anxious to get their food. They were handing out wrong and partial orders to everyone. We waited 50 minutes from our pickup time and our order never came up. We finally decided to walk away. Only redeeming factor was when our order was placed over the phone they weren't able to process our credit card so didn't need to go through the hassle of trying to get a refund.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I've read on here before that they frequently mess up your order. The first time we went here the food was good but they gave us the wrong sides. We didn't really care because we were hungry. The second time we ordered delivery to our home. We waited 50 minutes (we live 10mins away) but figured it was the dinner time rush so nbd. When we get our food our sides are wrong again, and this time with food we don't even like so it was way more irritating. But the worst was there was no BBQ sauce!! The meat is not bad here but if there is no BBQ sauce it kinda defeats the purpose of eating BBQ! We drove all the way there (because no one answered our phone calls) just to get told they couldn't redo our order because they ran out of the meat and sides we had ordered. Word of advice don't order delivery, they'll probably mess it up.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Amazing location. I grew up in the south and love BBQ.  Their BBQ is not fit to eat. They hide the flavor with so much pepper that it burns my mouth. Why the cracked on pepper. Strange. We gave them three visits different food each time hoping they would have great food. Sad sad face. We now have to drive to Bountiful to smoke and bones.  2 min drive now has to be 15 each way.   Sad face, and tummy!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Always my go-to when I'm in Salt Lake City!  During the current Covid-19 restrictions I thought I would have to walk there from my hotel, order to go, and then trudge back to the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised when they ask 'here or to go?'  Once again the food was excellent!  I had the brisket and pulled pork with the slaw, amazing. If you can avoid getting there an hour before they close, they might still have ribs.....If you're hankering for the 'Que in SLC, this is your place!

name: R&R BBQ
content: I did curbside pick up for lunch and the experience was fast and easy! The parking lot was a bit packed, but probably just because it is so tasty!

name: R&R BBQ
content: The narrative currently reminded me of the awful experience I endured at this restaurant nearly four years ago. I actually experienced racism from the employees and the store manager. I was treated disparately b/c of the color of my skin.  I was first told the store was for customers only.  This is not the way to approach customers. I informed the staff I was waiting for my order.  The staff told me I could not sit if I didn't have my order in hand.  Fine.  I agreed to comply if they would ask these two white guys to also follow the same policy, since they came in after me and sat down at a table without food (presumably, that would become my table).  The staff told me they had been in the restaurant for half an hour before me.  When I told staff they came in after me I saw them, the staff actually said I was LYING.  After arguing with the staff for a few minutes, the guys (who were watching all this ensue) got up to get their food.  I was visibly upset, and when I pointed out what transpired to the staff, they said they were sorry they didn't believe me.  I pressed them why they didn't believe me and eventually I brought up the color of my skin.  The staff were visibly disturbed but their reaction told it all.  That's exactly what it was.  Instead of trying to make things better, they actually called the cops on me.  This experience has stayed with me for four years.  Shame on this restaurant, the managers, and the ownership group.  More should have been done then.Do not patron this restaurant until significant changes are made.  That means tone at the top. I posted my review the day after this transpired, I was saying "inconsistent application of house rules" over and over so the manager knew who posted this comment.  He knew he was saying I was wrong because he was against me during the altercation.  I felt the racism.08/10/2016No beef ribs, small location, staff inconsistently apply house rules.  The customer USED to always be right.FYI TO ALL YELPERS, THIS IS THE MANAGER'S RESPONSE:"Sorry we don't do beef ribs. We do our best but sometimes the customers is wrong."Vote with your wallet, don't frequent an establishment where they don't listen to the customer.  Also, it would behoove the manager to train employees to listen to customers when they raise an issue while dining in rather than allowing them to selectively choose to believe if there is an issue.

name: R&R BBQ
content: The first time I went to R&R, I honestly wasn't very pleased. The mean smelled gross and not cooked right. However, I have given them a few more chances and been pleasantly surprised. I have had 5 star visits and I have had 3 star visits, which is unfortunate. They would get a 5 star if there was consistency, but there isn't. I am giving 4 stars because their ranch is the best ranch in the city and that means a lot to me and puts a lot of weight on a restaurant. I love them when they're good, but have tossed their food when it's not. It's sad that a great company can't have consistency but it is what it is. I love my 5 star visits...they were delicious then!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Terrible service and a terrible owner. I ordered 2 of the 2 meat plates. Most of the meal was incorrect with one of the meats being correct and the sides being all incorrect. When I called the next day to inquire and get some sort of refund I was told by the owner that they ran out of the items I requested so they just gave me what they had. They never informed me of this before I picked up my food or as I was picking up my food. The owner then stated that he just bought this store and the employees were terrible and needing to be retrained on the proper way to handle these situations. He then said he would issuing a full refund back to my card. He sent me an email a few days later with a pic of the refund, even after I gave him all my info to refund he ended up refunding to some other random customers card. When I called to complain about this he said it was someone else's fault and then when I tried to speak he talked over me, I asked him not to talk over me and then he disconnected the call. When I called back he refused to speak with me. I hope I get the refund promised but I'm getting tired of the owners attitude and don't want to deal with this anymore.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I love brisket, good brisket with that crunchy exterior, a nice deep smoke ring and juicy flavorful meat dead center. R&R fills that bill, using Angus beef, but you have to try their spice rubbed baby back ribs, smoked to perfection. And honestly, if I don't get the combination plate with pulled pork and brisket I'd feel like I got ripped off. They make the best pulled pork I've ever had, making me think that maybe brisket isn't always my thing.  Their garlic mashers with gravy are not to be missed. During crazy times, they added creamed corn to their take out menu, and I hope it never goes away. This is some great BBQ!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Stopped by R&R on Memorial Day, ordered the family brisket meal with a Rack of Ribs, the meat was tender and succulent, so was the coleslaw and the beans, we must have forgotten the mashed potatoes, which I hear is mouth craving delicious, we'll be back soon, and that's a quote from entertainer Chris browns wife, Anita Johnson-Brown, Author, and Journalist at Canyon News in Beverly Hills California.

name: R&R BBQ
content: PLEASE READ FULL REVIEW. IT MAY SAVE YOU FROM GETTING COVID-19 AND PUTTING YOUR LIFE IN DANGER.I have to start by saying that the food was good. It did not resist a 15-minute drive back home, and thus, it became cold. However, it still tasted better than other BBQ places in SLC. Apart from the brisket being dry, the flavor of the wings and the pulled pork were excellent. The sides were also good (coleslaw specially)... but they "forgot" to give them to me so I had to drive back once again to pick them up. What is truly concerning is how packed the place was during quarantine and COVID-19 times. People eating inside, no one respecting the 6-feet distance, more than 50% not wearing masks. The reason why I decided to purchase my food at R&R was because they were offering "curbside pick-up". I was told to park on either slot #1 or #2, both apparently not existent (or that was what I was told by the very cordial guy at the pick-up window). This same guy said that the food was delayed (30-min of extra waiting time) and that I could go inside the restaurant where they were calling people's orders out... I think the point I am trying to make is more than clear: if you decide to go to R&R, you will be putting your health (and perhaps, life) and the one of your loved ones in high risk. Note: when I called the restaurant to ask about where the slots were, they never picked-up. I find this to be so irresponsible, especially when a place says to be offering curbside pick-up... Now it's understandable why and how we have 200 cases of COVID-19 daily in Salt Lake City (and over 8,000 total). I wish the government would make restaurant owners legally responsible for not setting a maximum amount of people inside their place, for fake advertisement (no curbside pick-up), and for making people go inside the restaurant full of irresponsible people to wait for their food.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Was told to try this place and did take out. Ordered one pulled pork and 2 chicken sandwiches. Picked up and drove away. Found no bbq sauce in the bag or ketchup for the fries. Went back. Drove off. Realized only had 2 sandwiches. Didn't have the time to go back. Then dug into the food. Decent bbq but not great. The french fries were without a doubt the worst I've ever had. Ever. I think they had been under a heat lamp for days and that is not an exaggeration. We ended up tossing them despite being hungry and without the third sandwich. Super disappointing.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I ordered the brisket sandwich with a lean cut and the fat cap removed..... all I got was fat.... such a waste if money... basically paid $13 for fat with a side of potatoes

name: R&R BBQ
content: Truly a bad pick up experience. Difficulty ordering online but I realize system may have been overloaded as it was Mother's Day. Completed order by phone, including payment (my son was to pick up). He called when he got there and was told he needed to pay. I was told the payment didn't go through (a call could have solved that problem). However, in checking my bank account. There was a charge pending which I then called back to make sure they cancelled. Most of my order was fine with the exception of the fried pickles which were flooded with the ranch dressing that wasn't sealed properly and only partially fried--much of the breading was not cooked. In addition, my chopped beef sandwich (labeled on my box) was definitely not beef but pork (I don't eat pork). The final disaster was the creamed corn which was definitely not edible--there was a very off putting flavor. The banana pudding was the saving grace.  This is a great restaurant where I have been satisfied many times in the past. It may have just been the holiday, but I'd think twice before ordering in the future.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Little pricey for fast BBQ but always a great experience. Their sauce is so good and the overall vibe of the place is fun.

name: R&R BBQ
content: My elderly father has ordered take out twice in the last few weeks for himself and both times he never received his side dishes. I was with him when he ordered and can confirm that he did not receive them. He called the manager and he was promised a refund for the items not received, but that never happened either. I think that we might need to find a new bbq place unless this stops happening. It is frustrating to face this when we are all trying to support small businesses.

name: R&R BBQ
content: CHECK YOU ORDER TO MAKE SURE YOU GET EVERYTHING YOU ORDERED BEFORE YOU LEAVE!Last week I ordered to go from the downtown store. We like their food, but are becoming frustrated because this is the second time we've been shorted our side dishes. We called the managers phone line and the lady took down our information for a refund--NEVER HAPPENED!  VERY DISAPPOINTED with the service!!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Ordered takeout from DoorDash last night and spent close to $50 on 2 meals. Fries were cold and did not have ketchup or ranch to go with them. A 3 meat plate with brisket and some really expensive meat served with no sauce at all. No rolls and the tacos I ordered were basically tortillas smothered In coleslaw. I have eaten at R&R before but never had my meal prepared for takeout. R&R should have perfected this by now. The items missing were essential to the meal. Locals are being encouraged to support small businesses and I'm disappointed that whoever was in charge of packaging the togo food yesterday evening did a terrible job and was an absolute fail.

name: R&R BBQ
content: First place I felt like could be close to or as good as Texas in a LONG time. Great food. Only wish I knew the calories though. ‍

name: R&R BBQ
content: We shared a three meat platter with pulled pork, chopped brisket, and the sausage with a side of coke slaw. The pulled pork and the sausage were really good but the brisket was kind of dry. We would definitely come back but would order more of the pulled pork.

name: R&R BBQ
content: We ordered three delicious takeout meals through the Yelp app.  The Yelp ordering system is provided by Grubhub ... it doesn't work.  The restaurant never received the order but Grubhub received my money!  We had to repeat the order at the restaurant and thankfully the restaurant made it right for us and didn't charge us.  I wish there was a way for us to review the Grubhub ordering system. I feel bad that the restaurant has to rely on such an unreliable system. On the bright side our food was outstanding, perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned.  R&R will be one of my regular takeaway spots during the stay home but not Yelp ordering.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I mean if you want some mean bbq this is the place. Their brisket is so bomb. I am in love with their brisket tacos which require at least 3 napkins so you know they're good. Peach cobbler is to die for.

name: R&R BBQ
content: The only negative to this place is that when you order the 3 meat plate you have to make a decision of which 3 meats to get!! Every time I have been here that has been a line which proves how good it is(don't worry it moves fast!) The brisket, the ribs, the sausage, the HUSH PUPPIES!!!!, the MAC AND CHEESE!!!! Everything is to die for. I changed it up for once and got the wings and now it's going to make my decision even harder every time I come here! I travel a lot for work and people are always shocked to hear me say my favorite BBQ place is in SLC!!Staff is always very friendly, place is clean, and plenty of sauces and paper towels available :)

name: R&R BBQ
content: The food here is actually pretty affordable. The portions are pretty solid. However, you guys need to change the recipe for the mac and cheese. Jesus, it was rank. Everything else was so good. Brisket, the Ribs. OH MY DAYS.

name: R&R BBQ
content: The food is amazing but is a little pricey. It is worth every penny though! The brisket tacos are to die for (and are their daily special every Tuesday) and their house made Mac and cheese is AMAZING! Everyone should try it at lease once.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I seriously have never eaten bbq as good as this ever -- and I lived in NC for 8 years. Food delivered hot. I got ribs, brisket and chicken w/garlic mashed, creamed corn & cole slaw. This was excellent!!!!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Got a 2 go order from a home delivery service.  Ordered 2 meals with rolls. We got hamburger buns instead. I wanted your beans, got coleslaw instead.Both dinners were 3 meat. I had sausage, boneless chicken and brisket. He got 2 ribs and something else. I took a photo of the food I received. He always gives me his side. So he ordered a 2nd beans.

name: R&R BBQ
content: The food is always great. That's why we've put up with the bad service at this location for so long. But tonight- that was the last straw. We ordered pickup, and came home with only 4 of our 5 meals ordered. When I called to see how to get it, they were extremely short with me. I ended up having to drive back to the restaurant to pick up our forgotten meal. I have to say- this happens every time we do pickup. I got to the restaurant and was waiting for a good minute or two and no one even looked at me. I finally asked if anyone could help me. There were 3 guys behind the line, no other customers, and they were barely working. The meat guy said- very sarcastically- "Oh. We'll drop everything just for you."  Really?!?!? Someone came over and I said -totally over it at this point- "you guys forgot one of my meals, and this is how I'm treated?!? That was totally rude and unacceptable!"  They barely mumbled an apology and handed me my meal. We are done with this location. We have been customers for years, and now you've lost us.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I admit it. I've tried everything but now I rest on the 3 meat combo with chicken as most of the meat. This is my favorite macaroni in the world and I adore the slightly spicy hush puppies. This place is fantastic!

name: R&R BBQ
content: Once again I have been to this location and treated  poorly. I don't understand why people in the service industry have such a hard time being nice. I really enjoy the food but dislike the way I am treated at this location. It's not hard to treat people nice and with respect.

name: R&R BBQ
content: It's pretty obvious that this might be the best BBQ joint in town. The pulled pork sandwich was amazing, it was so tender and juicy. There was no fighting with the meat to tear it apart, it literally fell apart in your mouth. Also not to mention the fries were pretty amazing. I was impressed with the price for the amount of food you get! I was just slightly disappointed at the fact that it was 630 pm on a Thursday and they were completely out of ribs, if you want to go here I suggest going early. It gets very crowded and there's not a ton of places to sit, also come early if you don't want to miss out on there ribs! I would 100% come back here again.

name: R&R BBQ
content: I normally love R & R, but today the quality of the meat was horrible. I ordered a brisket salad via Door Dash and the meat was mostly inedible fat chunks. Gross.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Ate here for the first time yesterday and the BBQ was so good, I'm back today! I've had the 3 meat twice, and a winner both times. I will be back... Love the food!

name: R&R BBQ
content: I'm from Oklahoma, so my bbq standards are high.  This place does the best bbq I've found in Utah.  It is a bit pricey, but delicious.

name: R&R BBQ
content: Solid BBQ joint. Honestly my favorite thing is their home made sauces. Their "less sweet more heat" sauce is perfectly sweet and has good lingering heat, I think I could probably drink it straight. Their Carolina style is vinegar based and is fantastic on their pulled pork. And their traditional sweet sauce is everything a classic Kansas City sauce should be. Expect large crowds and a decent wait time, especially during the work week but you can't do good BBQ fast. Would recommend R&R to anyone, especially out-of-towners who "know good BBQ" they will be pleasantly surprised.

name: R&R BBQ
content: What I ordered | 2 entree plate of brisket | sweet potato fries | bbq baked beans Taste | I thought the brisket was a little salty in some parts of the meat. they had four different kinds of sauces (sweet, spicy hot sauce, bbq, and a carolina sauce). the sauces were okay to me, nothing too different. the baked beans were yummy. Parking | lotNote | you wait in line to order first then pay once you get your food.

name: R&R BBQ
content: What a great environment; great food, excellent service.  I had a half rack of ribs, my friend had the brisket.  Well seasoned, tender and portioned enough for lunch the next day, for under $20.00.  Had the peach cobbler and ice cream for dessert!  We will definitely be going back.  Parking is in a small lot, so don't wait until you're hungry to go; you may have to wait for a parking place.  But the food and service are well worth it; served quickly and with a smile!

name: Caffé Molise
content: I came here with a group of 10. We shared appetizers.  We were in the upstairs area with a couple other groups well spread out in a large, high ceiling, room. It is a beautiful room.We had most of the appetizers. Who would know I'd prefer the polenta with mushrooms over the one with sausage. The wife had a braised lamb shank special and I had the Pappardelle al Sugo. This is basically their version of Bolognese. The chop of the soffritto was pretty rustic. The dish, though was just fantastic.The Tiramisu for dessert was good. There was a nice wine selection, as would be expected being a sister to BTG wine bar. We found a well priced good bottle of Italian wine to have with it.

name: Caffé Molise
content: This restaurant was on our bucket list for a long time. The building is stunning and so fun to see the different rooms.We clearly stated which of our party needed gluten free. The server was on it, and verified all questions for us to make an informed choice for our daughter. The breakdown happened when a different person brought the food and put the wrong salad in front of our daughter. Another diner at our table received her order. We didn't realize it as the offending item was the dressing itself and the gluten wasn't discernible. We found out when the server came out and realized the mistake.  It was definitely a reminder to double check, asking "is this the gluten free item?" before eating each course. The server was very careful to make sure the gluten free pasta made it to our daughter.The wining dish was definitely the Arista. The pork was so tender. The mission fig compote definitely made the dish and I wished there was just a bit more of that.  We enjoyed the tomato and mozzarella antipasti. The other items we ordered were okay, but not memorable.  We'd like to work our way through the rest of the menu. Definitely we will order the Arista again.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Delicious! I called ahead and made a reservation, just to make sure we had seats. We are on a 1 day layover so we don't have a car to go to multiple places. So, i bought my two children, and they felt completely welcome, while I got to enjoy the ambiance of a beautiful dinner. We had sea scallops with a blueberry reduction on top for an appetizer, my children ordered strawberry  Italian sodas. The waiter also mentioned at first, that they don't have a children's menu but the chef would whip up a little fettuccini Alfredo if we would like. Which my son enjoyed. Get the gelato. It's amazing. Have a wine. End with an espresso. The food was great.

name: Caffé Molise
content: This ihas got to be my new favourite restaurant. We went there by accident after calling around to other places that didn't have a table. They had good reviews on Yelp so we thought we would give it a try. Everything we had was absolutely amazing!! The butternut squash ravioli appetiser was divine. Even though fettuccine Alfredo was not on the menu they made it for me with grilled chicken and it was the best I have ever had.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Great atmosphere if coming to enjoy a glass of wine or dinner with friends. Menu has multiple excellent options. Recently enjoy the wonderful pork chop special. Don't skip dessert! The hazelnut chocolate cake was the best and goes great with the port:)

name: Caffé Molise
content: I went here with my parents for my birthday and all of our food was great. I wish the bruschetta platter came with more tomatoes & a little less hummus. The penne di caprino is one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. If you're looking for something a little lighter, the spaghetti pomodori is simple and very flavorful. I really enjoyed the location & atmosphere. I'm looking forward to going back!

name: Caffé Molise
content: This place has a very good ambiance in a historic downtown building - rare in SLC. The music is a good mix and the creme brulee and the Roth wine I had we're really good. The service was timely and professional.

name: Caffé Molise
content: What a joke.  We had a reservation for a party of 6 at 7:15 on a Friday night to celebrate a birthday.  The service was absolutely terrible from start to "finish".  We ordered immediately as we had plans afterwards.  We still had no dinner 65 minutes later!  It's pasta for heavens sake!  Over one hour and still no food!  Someone from our party had to leave without dinner.  After the server took our order, she never came back.  No second drinks, no apology for the delay until we had to go downstairs for a manager.  The manager was equally terrible!  She used a ridiculous excuse that they like to give people time to visit and not rush them through dinner.  We ordered by 7:30 and finally got our ravioli at 8:45.  This place is run by very poor management!  The food was mediocre when we finally got it.  Maybe it was the automatic 20% tip that made the server never come back.....she was getting paid either way.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I want to start by saying the service here was GREAT! It was my first time and I accidentally got there a few minutes before they opened, but they let me wait inside in the warmth - which was very nice of them! Our server was also very kind and attentive. I really enjoyed the "Under the Mistletoe" cocktail - it was light, flavorful, and refreshing. I got a wonderful window seat and the natural light in the restaurant is amazing! The only thing that can be difficult is parking, but I will definitely be back!

name: Caffé Molise
content: AMAZING FOOD! The beef tenderloin and shrimp scampi were soooo yummy. The service is 10/10 and the atmosphere is to die for. Feels like you are in Italy. Loved it!

name: Caffé Molise
content: I had lunch here couple weeks ago....extremely  disappointed.  Tiny tiny menu, super small portion....covid restrictions over the top. Will NOT return or recommend.  Only giving a 3 star to be nice.

name: Caffé Molise
content: My wife and I visited for a date night and were very pleased. We had reservations, and were seated right away by a very friendly hostess. Our waiter was great, he came quickly and gave us some great suggestions. We had the Ravioli con Zucca and the scallops for appetizers. The raviolis were amazing. Stuffed with a butternut squash filling, brown butter sauce, asiago cheese and a balsamic reduction. Our favorite thing though was the little bits of fried garlic which added a really tasty crunch. The scallops though, those were just amazing. Being landlocked, there are a lot of subpar scallops in salt lake, but these were very tasty and tender. Cooked just right, and sitting in a sauce that I could just eat with a spoon all day. Yum. I got the soup, which was one of the few mistakes of the evening. It was a squash bisque... This was so thick and almost cloying that I simply couldn't eat it. For dinner my wife ordered the gnocchi. They were super light and pillowy, with pine nuts and tomato cream. Overall it was very very tasty. I got the daily special which was a sea bass dish. The sea bass was cooked perfectly, and had a really tasty sauce. The only negative for me here was the side of little pasta balls (I can't remember the right name). These have no flavor whatever. They didn't taste as though salt or pepper had come anywhere near them. We got the Italian cream sodas, and they were delicious. We also enjoyed a creme brulee for dessert, which was extremely tasty. All in all, we very highly recommend this place and we'll be going back soon... Just stay away from squash bisque soup if they happen to have it!!

name: Caffé Molise
content: Loved this building with old world charm.  The rolls and goat cheese penne were .  Our server Chris was wonderful and very helpful with ideas for our stay in Utah.

name: Caffé Molise
content: If you like Italian food that is NOT fresh and made offsite by other people and then reheated by Cafe Molise, then Get the ravioli. Pretty sure all the food is made in bulk and reheated (I saw them vacuum packing some sort of meat when I peaked into the kitchen). But I know for a fact they don't make their own raviolis. If you can't make your own fresh italian food, then you shouldn't operate an Italian restaurant. PSA: You are better off making your own fresh Italian food at home for 1/4 the cost.

name: Caffé Molise
content: This place was great for a great Italian meal. You can add whatever protein to your meal as well. The wine and meal was so filling. The atmosphere was awesome and our waitress Maysie was great. We went with a group of about 8 people and the people who reserved our table were sitting inside. When we walked up to the door, the hostess didn't ask us if we have a reservation or anything just said stay outside while she not able to turn on the heaters on. It was in the 30s. Was a little off-putting honestly. They do have a face/head scanner which is pretty high tech to check temperatures.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Cute restaurant in SLC, open on Sundays and during COVID. Felt pretty safe eating here - distanced tables, waiters with gloves / face masks (no shields though). Service ok, food ok. It's a solid "C" grade restaurant, Olive Garden disguised as a cafe. Dinner for 2 was $75. The best thing was the seafood chowder for $3. Pappardelle & bread pudding were disappointing (and the reason we came). Just want to save other tourists from doing the same thing we did.

name: Caffé Molise
content: The ambiance of this restaurant reminds me of the stylish upscale restaurant from the 1900s. Although I did not really understand the bird-themed pictures that were up, I loved the rest of the decor and the vibe of this restaurant. We started our lunch with the bruschetta which featured a white bean paste that was incredibly delicious, unique, and perfectly meshed with the tomatoes and spinach on the bruschetta. Following that, I ordered the special of the day which included a mushroom stuffed ravioli with a white cream sauce and with sausage on top. It was a very unique meal and incredibly tasty. The flavors danced together and blended delicately for an exquisite taste. The second plate I ordered was the Pappardelle al Sugo which had a slow-cooked sauce of pork and beef with tomatoes. It was pretty good but wasn't anything extraordinary. It sounded nice but tasted like a typical red sauce. Overall it was a great experience and the plates were beautifully created. The taste of the appetizer and the first dish was phenomenal. The service was decent.  Definitely worth stopping by.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Love the old architecture.  Sitting on the top open floor is a bit awkward...
