Lacks the normal ambiance of Cafe Molise.  Our favorite dishes were the fungi ravioli and the special appetizer of scallops.  The gnocchi was just okay, shrimp was a bit overcooked and the chicken was alright.  Preference to eat on the patio outside in warmer weather.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I got the Pollo alla Gratella and I frankly wasn't very impressed with it. The chicken was more on the dry side and the veggies it came with were bland. The whole dish came with a sauce but it didn't really seem to matter. The veggies they chose simply didn't go with the rest of my dish. The artichokes and sun dried tomatoes complemented each other and the chicken, but the squash and zucchini choice confused me. Wouldn't order this dish again. However, the rest of my table seemed to love their dishes. I tried my friend's Gnocchi and it was delicious! I would order that. My other friend had the Bistecca but I didn't get to try it, but he said it was great! Seems like it's a good restaurant but I ordered the wrong thing. Don't let my review steer you away from this place, just probably don't order the Pollo a La Gratella.

name: Caffé Molise
content: We still love this restaurant as much as ever!  Their new location is stunning. I love everything about that beautiful building!  We were so impressed with the precautions they are taking for covid. They ask you to wait outside and an employee wearing gloves opens the door for you. Before you enter the restaurant they take your temperature and have you fill out a form so you can be notified in case of someone in the restaurant while you were there coming down with covid. You enter the restaurant and are asked to scan the menu with your phone and then are taken to your table. The tables are very far apart. Every employee is wearing a mask and gloves. The service from opening the door to our wait staff was outstanding. Our food was excellent as usual, we can always count on an amazing meal here.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Excellent food and creativity with menu items. Everything was fresh and delicious from the bread with Olive oil and balsamic vinegar to the appetizers. I ordered the special- the bison short ribs and was very impressed with the quality of the meat and that they were cooked to tender perfection. Atmosphere was clean and beautiful with calm music. It's a great place to have dinner with friends you can talk to for a long time as it's a class Italian style dinner that takes time.

name: Caffé Molise
content: My friend and I had an amazing time here and the food was out of this world...every bit of it.  The building is historic and well done inside.  I think it would be a great place for a romantic dinner and would definitely impress on a first, second or third date!  We walked here from our hotel, so that we could have some cocktails also.  Nothing on the cocktail menu interested me so I asked if the bartender could make a Dark and Stormy.  Sure enough, they made me an excellent one and then I had another.As an appetizer, we had Ravioli con Zucca.  This was probably my favorite thing.  WOW!  Amazing flavor.  If I ever am in town again, I will be going straight here for this.  We both had salads which were very good - The Spinaci and the Mediterranea.  I had the Pollo Marsala which was just an average Chicken Marsala...I wish I would have been more adventurous.  My friend had the Pappardelle as Sugo and she cleaned her plate!  The house bread and butter were very good.  We didn't have room for dessert.I would not hesitate to come back here!

name: Caffé Molise
content: My siblings and I went on a group date here. We made a reservation so we could get a decent time and move on to our activity. We all really enjoyed our meal. I particularly loved the butternut squash soup (I think it was a special for the evening). The night we went had very mild weather so we were able to eat outside. We all commented on how the outdoor atmosphere was perfect.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Caffe Molise has been a favorite of mine for years. I have celebrated so many occasions here, from myEngagement party to bachelorette party to birthdays and anniversaries. I never get tired of the pappardelle al Sugo or the pesto gnocchi. The appetizers are always amazing and the salads fresh and generous.Service is always stellar and the wine selection CANNOT BE BEAT. If you don't know, you can ask for the menu from BTG wine bar and order the same champagne flights (but shhhh it's a secret!)Caffe Molise will always have a special place in my heart and stomach.

name: Caffé Molise
content: You want Shelby as your server! She is hands down the absolute best waitress! Shelby took my birthday experience over the top by toasting my favorite dessert, crème brûlée, table side style. Wow! What a treat! I've never had any server go out of their way like that to make me feel extra special. Thank you Shelby! You're a class act. Give her a raise! Oh and course the food was phenomenal.

name: Caffé Molise
content: We were disappointed after reading so many reviews.  The food was very much average to underwhelming and the service was very disinterested.  It took forever to get a server's attention for drinks and refills.  We got eggplant meatballs, ravioli in a creamy pesto sauce, chicken involtini and lasagne.  All of it just so-so, none of us finished any of the dishes.  And ambience, not much to speak of.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I was visiting town for the weekend and this restaurant was walking distance from our hotel.  It looked like a fun and nice place.  The food was good but this review is for the service.  We reserved a table for 4 at 8pm and we all got there on time.  We were brought to our table in a timely manner, but it stopped there.  Our server got to our table about 10 minutes later, took our orders.  We had ordered drinks and appetizers, but did not get to our table until 15 to 20 minutes later. There was a mix up of some of our orders.  No one came to our table to check on us.  another 20 minutes later they brought our soups and salad.  Then our entrees came not too long after.  Other tables that arrived after us received their food in a timely manner.  Not sure what happened to ours.  Our server did apologize, but unfortunately it wasn't a great experience.  I understand it's a difficult time now, I just wish the service was better.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Visiting Caffe Molise was a spur of the moment decision and a good decision at that. The atmosphere was classy yet relaxed. The location of being in downtown Salt Lake City was a plus. Service was great from start to finish. I wouldn't consider myself vastly knowledgable in the world of Italian cuisine, but the food was delicious. I had the Gnocchi which was very tender and full of flavor. The sauce was delicious! I enjoyed the experience and would certainly recommend it.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Face masks, and temperature scanners and distancing, oh my! In all seriousness, as someone who has hardly eaten out since the beginning of Covid 19, I do appreciate the safety measures that have gone into effect at Caffe Molise. Even if they feel ever so slightly totalitarian. I'm all for it. The American people demanded that they should be able to eat out and voila, safety measures ensue. Incidentally, the hygiene and safety practices are not the only major changes that have occurred since I last visited Caffee Molise in 2013. Let's start with the biggest change, THE LOCATION. And we're not talking about a location change from one quaint restaurant space to another. We are talking about a major overhaul of what used to be a teenage dance club that Molise has claimed as their new home turf. It's a particularly dramatic move seeing as they relocated from a whimsical, quaint little space to a large and dramatic repurposed club venue. At first, I was a bit confused as to what we would find beyond the entrance. I have no idea what the building looks like now compared to how it looked when it was The Bay, but they've managed to create a pretty incredible atmosphere. Caffe Molise went from a small, intimate space to a full-blown, multi-storied, dramatic, high ceilinged affair. It's grandiose and maybe a little bit over the top considering how Molise used to operate. But I can't lie, it's definitely a beautiful space that has edged out a dated and strange former resident. What I'm really excited to try out is the patio. It's tragically become too cold for patio dining now, but it's decidedly on my bucket list when we make it to the other side. I remember the food at Molise being pretty damn good. But not good enough for me to put the restaurant into my regular rotation. For me, this remodel has also extended to the food. I'm not typically a full course appetizer-entrée- and dessert kind of gal, but hey, when it's my bday dinner, I do things a little differently. As a vegetarian, I don't eat meat. However, I do make an exception on my birthday and so I hoped and prayed that Molise would deliver, and not be another meat meal wasted.The dinner unfolded as such: a prosciutto appetizer with bread, arista main dish(spice-rubbed pork tenderloin with a black fig compote) mashed potatoes and seasonal vegetables served with a house salad (asiago vinaigrette). The meal ended with a creme Brule and a warm latte. What can I say? The food was far better than I remember. Everything is as good as it sounds, but particularly the Arista and salad. Everyone at my table felt the salad was exceptionally balanced, a really difficult mission to accomplish. The dressing was perfectly distributed, coating everything with a light but a generous dash of vinaigrette. The Arista was bursting with flavor. Whatever spice rub they concocted, I wish they sold it in a bottle. The potatoes and vegetables were the perfect accompaniment. They even managed to somehow roast the figs to perfection. If you're a pork or fig person, this is a MUST try.  Whereas back in 2013 I wasn't too eager to come back, Caffe Molise has now definitely caught my interest. Perhaps it will be a long time before I get back out to a restaurant, but I'll make it to your patio one day, SOMEWAY, SOMEHOW.

name: Caffé Molise
content: My boyfriend and I ate here on our road trip through Salt Lake City and it was great! I got the gnocchi and my boyfriend got the ravioli, both were delicious!

name: Caffé Molise
content: Fantastic restaurant with great ambiance and great food! Caffe Molise is inside an old building downtown with beautiful indoor and outdoor seating. When we went on a weeknight they had a great jazz band playing outside. The food was fantastic! We had the bruschetta, parpadelle al sugo, and mushroom ravioli. The ravioli had the most unique flavor of the three but all were really fantastic! I would definitely go back!

name: Caffé Molise
content: Every time I visit Salt Lake City or am in the area, stopping by Caffé Molise is an absolute must. The Ravioli Con Zucca is the best pasta on the planet! Very robust and flavorful. If you are going to dine here it's a must have. Try it and thank me later!(I loved the old location better, but the new location is still great! The outdoor patio space is really nice.)

name: Caffé Molise
content: I had the Shrimp Scampi alla Diavola and I wasn't impressed. $20 meal when I could go to Olive Garden, get something similar, for a better price and it'd taste much better! The bread with olive oil was good, but that's the only good thing I have to say.The waitress was slow to get us something if we needed it, and it took very long to get our food.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I was a little disappointed in this place.....I got the chefs special scallops and pasta plate and there really wasn't anything special about it. The scallops alone didn't have a good sear and lacked seasoning (salt and pepper). The pasta was a did come with a bit more flavor and brought the dish back to life.The Bistecca was really nice and tender served on a bed of mashed potatoes and comes with a side of vegetables. (I recommend this) Both dishes come with a house salad, but if you would like a different salad such as the Caesar, be ready to pay a $5 upgrade charge. Customer service: Super friendly staff and are always available. But there was a constant asking of if I was finished with my plate....even though there was half my dish still remaining.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Happy to find this nice and tasty restaurant today passing bu salt lake city.They take the health issue very seriously and above any other restaurant we visited during our trip.Our server, Erin, was very kind and attentive.I would recommend this restaurant

name: Caffé Molise
content: Must be popular...   called for reservations and they squeezed us in with our promise we'd be done by such n such a time.  Beautiful patio.    Bar tender and kitchen staff did my specialized order perfectly.   Love when establishments allow for substitutes.    I paired the halibut with the risotto. Soooo.    I'll sum it up.  Food Orgasm...   my dining mates had ribs which were amazing and spaghetti pomodoro that needed a bit more spice and maybe add a lil fresh mozzarella...  the staff was extremely pleasant.   Thanks cafe  M....

name: Caffé Molise
content: The staff, food and location was great, didn't take any other pictures because we started eating as soon as it got to the table. I would definitely come back when ever I'm back in Salt Lake CIty.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Really appreciated the safety they show around COVID. Took our temps upon entering. They have a beautiful patio area with tables spaced well apart. The food & service was exceptional. I had the  Pappardelle al Sugo & my son had the Orecchiette al Salsiccia - both were delicious and were very large portions. They also served rolls. Christine was a great server!

name: Caffé Molise
content: This is one of the first few places I started dining in when the restaurants were allowed to open. I have to say I was very impressed with the steps they're taking to help people feel and be safe. First off, they have you wait outside their porch and the waiter will come out and greet you. Temperatures are taken along with filling up a form for contract tracing. We are then taken to the BEAUTIFUL spacious outdoor patio to be sat. Tables are more than 6 ft apart, maybe 8-10 ft and the waiters always have a mask on. I ordered pasta with shrimp and it was great. I normally prefers white sauce over red but the red sauce has some spiciness to it that it didn't feel to tangy, sourish like most red sauce. The shrimp, they are juicy and and a good size. I love the overall ambience, service and food at this place. Definitely one of the nice and casual place for a date.

name: Caffé Molise
content: This was amazing food! The atmosphere was beautiful! My new favorite restaurant! They also had a great system for the Covid-19 screening!

name: Caffé Molise
content: The patio provides a great atmosphere and suited our party of eight comfortably. The food is great, a little on the bland side for me but nothing to complain of. Service was on point and environment felt clean. I give four stars as the mixed drinks were a bit pricey in my opinion.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Caffé Molise is one of my favorite places. Their gnocchi is the best. We always choose Molise for special occasions with the family!

name: Caffé Molise
content: Hand sanitizer and temperature check upon arrival. This was my first time at Cafe Molise and it was incredible. The butternut squash ravioli might be the best dish I've ever had. Our waitress Darby was sweet and everything was timed well

name: Caffé Molise
content: Service and live music was great! And what a beautiful building! My review is 3 stars because my lasagna wasn't the best and the tiramisu was not good at all. The tiramisu tasted old and like it had been frozen for a month and then put into the fridge a week prior, not fresh and not what I was expecting compared to the previous pictures I had seen. Maybe we got a bad batch. But my boyfriend got the parpardelle and his was amazing. All in all good experience and I would come back but not for the lasagne nor tiramisu

name: Caffé Molise
content: During covid times, I understand the need to be cautious. I missed the door sign to stand outside, when I entered, I was greeted very harshly that I need to stand outside by the hostess.  No need for aggressiveness.  The server on the other hand, was outstanding! He was very nice and helped us through the menu as this was our first time.  I looked around and the decor wasnt what I expected, very bland.  I wish I was able to sit outside as they had live music.  Request for outside if you can during your reservation.  I had butter squash ravioli for appetizer, very delicious and would recommend.  For the entree, I had the Artisa the pork dish that was supposed to be sweet and savory.  Eating the pork by itself, it was very salty but coupled with fig/mash potato and stir fried veggies, it was good.  My boyfriend order the lasagna and that was spectacular.  I would come back to try another dish, if I were to come back into town.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I tried Caffé Molise for first time and it was the BOMB. They had outdoor seating in their beautiful outdoor courtyard area that was airy even on the hottest summer day. We had the bruschetta with polenta (fabulous) and I had the gnocchi with sausage with an Italian soda and my husband had pappardelle bolognese. Both were out of this world.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Was visiting the area and decided on Caffé Molise for dinner! Was not at all disappointed!! I got the eggplant meatballs and was in aww! They were so good, I have been vegetarian for +10 years and have never had such a good vegetarian Italian dish! The salad and bread served with the entree were also great! Plan ahead and call for a reservation and maybe save time to swing below for a glass of wine first! Great service and I was very impressed how they handled their restaurant in the midst of Covid!

name: Caffé Molise
content: We dined before at the old location a few times and we have been to the wine bar downstairs, but this is our first visit to the main floor at this location. Excited to try it out for the hubby's birthday!They have signs on the doors and markings on the ground, please read the signs before you try to enter. They give you all the info you need for what to expect.  Masks are required when entering and leaving and any time you are not at the table. The host will come out to greet you. When they are ready for you, you will stop in foyer and have temp taken (touchless thermometer) and fill out a contact sheet (this is important in the event of an exposure). They provide masks if you don't have one with you. The menu is digital now so you just scan a QR code and view it on your phone. This is GENIUS so they don't have to have physical menus to wipe down constantly or throw away each time.Hubby ordered the flat iron prime special with fingerling potatoes, asparagus and squash. The steak was perfectly seared and it was tender and incredibly juicy. The reduction sauce on top was not overpowering and had excellent flavor and the avocado tasted fresh.  Potatoes were roasted nicely and the veggies were still crisp with great flavor. I ordered the gnocchi di patate. Gnocchi is usually my go-to dish when testing out Italian food, and they certainly did not disappoint! I can't stand when gnocchi is swimming in sauce and that was not the case here. The tomato cream sauce was nice and rich without drowning the dish. It was the perfect amount to compliment the gnocchi and the flavor was robust without being overpowering. The basil and pine nuts just capped off the dish giving it that extra something special as the flavors of everything come together in my mouth. And the gnocchi...perfectly cooked pillows that just seem to melt in your mouth as you eat. I absolutely loved this and would definitely order again!!Hubby ordered an Old Fashioned to drink and he thoroughly enjoyed being able to have a drink made by a bartender for the first time in months! I started with just water but could not resist ordering an Italian soda. I branched out from the normal Vanilla and tried the orange at our server Trent's recommendation, and it was so yummy tasted just like a Creamsicle!!Trent was a fantastic server and I appreciate all of the work the entire staff is doing to keep us safe while we enjoy a night out to celebrate the hubby's birthday. I haven't wanted to eat at a restaurant the last several months, and this experience definitely put my mind at ease. The dining area was nice and open and there was plenty of space between the tables. The bussing staff wore gloves and thoroughly wiped down each table after the guests were finished. Everyone was wearing masks and they were all mindful of distancing among themselves. If you have been waiting to come enjoy a nice night out, I highly recommend giving this a try (plus they have a patio for outdoor seating)!

name: Caffé Molise
content: Brought my roommate here for her birthday, left disappointed! Our expectations were really high from the sound of the dishes online and the utter aesthetic of the interior (insert heart eyes here). First piece of advice, don't be fooled by their fresh green salad, that our very young-inexperienced-unenthusiastic server so graciously offered for us, word for word "to upgrade" like we were at Dave and Busters or something, the salad was nothing but Costco green lettuce and some olive oil and cheese. My roommate asked the server several questions about the menu and he said I don't know without any followup.From the photos I'm attaching, you can see the dishes look beautiful, five stars on presentation. I didn't even take a picture of the creme brûlée that we went out on a limb to get because once I had a bite, I wanted to leave. In my opinion the lack of flavor, smaller portions, low quality, and feeble service no where near matches the price point they are charging...

name: Caffé Molise
content: I went to an event here for my professional organization, and it was really fun! It was held in the outdoor area during the summer, and there was a buffet of appetizers and an open bar. The employees were friendly and very helpful to everyone at the event. The food was excellent, lots of delicious cheeses, meats, and other charcuterie fare. Would be a nice place for a small wedding reception or party.

name: Caffé Molise
content: You have got to Try this place . I would give it 6 stars if I could . The food was just like when I was in Italy. Fresh and so tasty. Been a long time I had such a great meal like that . And the staff was so helpful never waited and anything. Drink full, Bread brought right out . Bill was there when I was ready to go as well.

name: Caffé Molise
content: This place was absolutely amazing. The staff was so wonderful and they were so safe and sanitary amongst COVID-19. The food was WONDERFUL. we will definitely be coming back here.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Was looking at the photos of this place and it looked great. We went to the downstairs wine bar, our server was not very nice at all. However Mr Barker made up for his short tone and un pleasant demeanor. The charcuterie board was nothing to write home about and the smoked Gouda was terrible ( not sure why you would have that on your board ) . Don't order the Pollo Marsala it was rubbery and the mash potatoes tasted like they were made from a box really dry and sandy and had been sitting for hours. The highlight of the meal was the penne with mushrooms. Overall would prob not come back, service needs work and the dishes need to be re thought.

name: Caffé Molise
content: We took friends to dinner, and the food and service were exceptional. Since our friend is hard of hearing, we were put in a side room, which was quiet enough for us to converse. That was so thoughtful and accommodating. Last fall, a friend and I went to lunch and reserved a spot on the patio. Service was lackluster. Salads need a major overhaul to be aesthetically pleasing and flavorful. Waiters need much more training. Our pasta dishes were delicious, but we never saw our waiter again for cracked pepper and/or grated cheese. Oh, well. The worst part? We had begun to notice a horrible stench off and on. After paying our bill, we decided to alert the receptionist to the stench issue. Shockingly, she said they already knew about it, and the city was working to fix the pipes. Hmm...If they knew, why weren't we offered a seat inside? There was a flippant apology and no offer to comp anything. I haven't been back. Impeccable service is as important to me as the quality of the food. I've been reading other reviews that also indicate inconsistencies with food and service. Management, are you taking note?? Why haven't you respectfully responded to valid concerns? We'd like to try the restaurant again. Maybe.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Staying the night in Salt Lake City. Restaurant is next to our hotel, the Sheraton. Just finished an amazing dinner there. Great staff, great food, great selection of wine. Our waiter was Trent and he was so very nice!  Absolutely recommend.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Compliments to the landlord for a well appointed reno of an old SLC favorite building, highlighting balconies and patio.The restaurant, however, is lackluster.  Both front and back of house need a thorough "reno" in my estimation.  The staff is young and inexperienced; presentation no better than an average diner.  While the menu titillates, the arrival is no better than Olive Garden, and at twice the price.  Geez, I'd take the Garden's hot, buttered breadsticks, wrapped and in a basket, than the cold rolls, flat on a plate, butter patties flung aside that were presented.  Sauces were watery, flavors unremarkable and plates expedited that looked like they came from the cafeteria.Sorry to be a downer, but this just did not rise to the occasion the mgmt, or owners think their trying to accomplish.  It doesn't have to be pretentious Valter "Osteria" cuisine, but this needs to step it up starting with correct training of floor staff (long ticket times, bus staff walking around ignoring finished plates needing pick up, water refilled, etc., servers offering minimal presentation and engagement).  My Father's Day dining choice was a huge disappointment.

name: Caffé Molise
content: The food was delicious, the waiters were nice, but we were so disappointed to be seated inside because it's really not the same as outside. The patio looks amazing and almost feels like Italy, but the inside is too wide, has no personality. They should decorate more. We'll go back for sure, but making sure at the reservation that we are seated outside!

name: Caffé Molise
content: This is an adorable Italian restaurant in Salt Lake great location easy parking and homemade noodles and sauce. Didn't love the bread options but the pasta more than made up for that. Sit outside if there is space.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Came here with two of my friends celebrating a birthday and were pleasantly surprised by our first time visit! Firstly, the building is just gorgeous. Looks like it is straight out of old Italy. You almost expect to see the Venice canal when you look out the window. Lots of art, beautiful interior, and comfortable seating. When we walked inside (up a grand staircase, no less) the hosts greeted us immediately and not to mention complimented us on how all three of us looked so pretty! We were sat right away and were left smiling by the kindness of the hostess. The menu is very limited but the food is awesome. They offer complimentary bread that is seriously AMAZING. I ordered ravioli and the portion was so big I could only eat half! Definitely got my money's worth. The food also came out pretty quick considering it was definitely a busy night. Caffé Molise also offers delicious italian sodas amongst other unique non alcoholic drinks for those of us who are under 21 but enjoy a fancy beverage. In terms of service... It isn't the fastest or the most consistent. As a server, I greet my tables in no more than 3-5 minutes of them sitting. We waited about 10, which isn't ridiculous, but we could tell it would be hard to get a hold of her all night. And it was. However, I think it was partly the scheduling managers fault because I got the sense there were not enough servers on deck for the amount of customers. Nonetheless, she was very nice and brought my friend free cheesecake for her birthday (and yeah, it was amazing... I'm talking better than cheesecake factory) which we really appreciated. I recommend going on a slower night if you want a more intimate, quiet experience because it was very loud. The ambience is totally romantic. From candle lit dining to long white tablecloths, there was real attention detail. Definitely make a reservation!

name: Caffé Molise
content: I have been to Caffe Molise on a few occasions, one being a large company holiday lunch party, and one being a more intimate family dinner out to celebrate my mom's birthday. Both trips to this restaurant were amazing. The restaurant itself is absolutely gorgeous, and I do love a pretty place to eat dinner. Beyond that, the food and the service are fantastic. I have never been disappointed in either, and always leave happy and with a belly full of delicious Italian food. I love this place, and will continue to be back, over and over again.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Great food, nice service and beautiful places. Our first time in Salt lake city and happy to find this place.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Save room for dessert!!!!!!!We wanted to come here last time we were in SLC, but it was super busy. Luckily this time they were able to squeeze us in. Everything on the menu seemed delicious, but our server tempted us with the specials. I had scallops, angel hair pasta and a bacon cream sauce. The scallops were perfectly cooked and the noodles were al dente and tasty.But then, the piece de resistance - HAZELNUT. CHOCOLATE. MOUSSE. CAKE. Omg, probably the best dessert I've had at a restaurant. Apparently the secret is lots of Nutella. I don't want to say much more so people can experience it themselves, but the person responsible for this national treasure deserves an award. I would come back here and skip my main course just to have two servings of this dessert.

name: Caffé Molise
content: The hostess got us a table for two without a wait or reservation but it was a bit weird to be told they need the table in an hour for a reservation.. our waiter did a good job of explaining the menu but never brought the bread he offered.. the arista was awesome, heavily seasoned and I enjoyed the fig compote. I probably would pass on the bruschetta next time. It was good, but the rolls with some olive oil and balsamic would do it.

name: Caffé Molise
content: To start off what a shame ... I came in feeling hopeful and excited to try out their new location because I heard it was beautiful and worth a visit, we parked in the parking lot to the couch and walked up the stairs inside . They had a little sign on the host stand saying that the parking to the south was not cafe Molise parking we asked the blonde hostess about it and she explained it ... so we went back out to pay the parking fee for the time we assumed we would be there .... we came back inside and were greeted by a sweet blonde lady again we told her two of us were looking to have lunch , a hostess in a red dress named Sierra (forgive me if I got her name spelled wrong she wasn't wearing a name tag so it's to the best of my ability) she walked towards a table without saying anything to us it seemed weird for an establishment that looked upscale so we just followed behind her wondering why she hadn't asked us to follow or why she just walked towards a table without speaking to us or letting us know to follow her. She sat our menus and said enjoy and walked away... we began to wait and made a joke with the people who we were sat next to ( because we had more exchange of words with them than the hostess since we hand accidentally sat on their jacket . I began going through the wine list and researching the wines to see if they had any organic ones since I'm allergic to Sulfites. While waiting we looked over the menu and decided on what we wanted to eat. We continued waiting and no one approached us . So finally we decided to leave after having been waiting ten mins when a blonde server came up to the table and said I'll be right with you ..... about 10 seconds later another server came up named Shawn and said he would be taking care of us .... so I asked who is our server since we were just approached by the blonde gentleman and him ... to which he replied that he would be taking care of us now.... I became frustrated because that meant that the other server hadn't seen us and someone new was coming to take over because the other guy had not been paying attention...he asked if we wanted drinks while he got waters for us ... I replied to him and said give us a moment we've been here waiting for a while and we aren't sure if we wanted to stay now .... so we stood up and decided to leave since I knew I didn't want to be upset while I was eating and trying their food because it makes for a bad experience ... we stood up as Shawn was coming out I handed him five dollars and said thank you for trying to save us from leaving today but we were frustrated and unhappy so we had decided to leave ... perhaps another time I'd be willing to try it but as of today this place was disappointing and unwelcoming.

name: Caffé Molise
content: It had been a while since my last visit to Caffe Molise. This was my first visit to their new location. The change in venue has enhanced the experience. The food was still great. My family enjoyed it greatly. For them it is more in line with their time in Italy. I love that there is dishes that are already gluten free without having to do substitutes. I am looking forward to my return visit

name: Caffé Molise
content: Every time I try to go here I have to leave or wait outside while waiting for food because the smell of stale vomit is so prevalent. I understand that it's just a specific Italian cheese but no other Italian places smell like this. I don't understand.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Disappointing! We really wanted to like this restaurants but it left a few things to be desired. Our waiter was not very good. Not sure if it was his first night on the job or if he was seriously distracted. We were trying to give him our drink order and he wandered off without getting my friend's drink order. He was gone for what seemed like a LONG time. Then when he returned and tried to tell us the specials for that evening, he was having a very difficult time reading them. He couldn't pronounce the word "spinach" (He called it spin-notch!) We kept having to remind him that we were still waiting for bread. My husband ordered their Pomodori e mozzarella appetizer and the proportions were WAY off. Like 25 tomato slice with 2 slices of cheese!! WTH? Guess they couldn't afford more cheese?ALSO the creme brulee dessert wasn't worth the money. The dish was about the size of a silver dollar. The price of these dishes and receiving so little is upsetting. Now we know to eat elsewhere.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Caffé Molise has been a favorite of ours for years. Prior to moving into their new location, we enjoyed many meals on their patio and alway had a great experience. It had been a long time since our last visit. Too long, to be honest. Last night, we decided to celebrate our Valentines Day dinner (a day late); as they were booked on the 14th. This was the first time we have visited them, since moving into the historic Eagle Building. First impressions... this is such an incredible building. It's historic design is absolutely amazing. From the moment, you begin your climb up the wide concrete steps, to entering through the front door, it's impressive. How they have chosen to decorate the restaurant reminded me off the many fine establishments I have had the opportunity to visit in downtown Chicago and New York City. As you are seated, you feel like you are dining in one of the finest establishments in Salt Lake. The vibe is romantic and elegant. The craftsmanship of the woodwork is beautiful. On to the menu. For those that enjoy a robust and fine wine selection... you will love what Caffé Molise has to offer. There are many choices, when it comes to appetizers and their main courses are thoughtfully created and prepared using the finest of fresh ingredients. There is something for everyone's liking. My wife usually orders her tried and true favorite, Pappardelle al Sugo; which is House-made fresh pappardelle tossed with a savory, slow-cooked sauce of pork and beef with tomatoes, topped with Asiago. I have tried many dishes in past, but found my favorite to be the Ravioli con Melanzana; which is Roasted eggplant and mozzarella in egg pasta with red bell pepper and tomato coulis, topped with crumbled chevre.Much to my disappointment, they discontinued this item. (Please update your menu, both on your webpage and physical menu.) I had been thinking about this dish with great anticipation. Our server told us this item had been discontinued months ago and been replaced with a mushroom ravioli of sorts, covered in an alfredo type. sauce. (I decided to give this dish a try.)So here's the scoring of our experience. Service: OUCH!!!!! Our server was about as impersonal as they come. I was a few minutes late to the table, when the salads arrived. When he stopped by, he asked if we needed anything else. As I began to tell him  I would like to order a drink, he had already walked away, to assist with placing the neighboring tables desserts. Literally,walked away in the middle of my sentence. As if the table runner that was holding the desserts was unable to handle this task on her own. When he returned, he nonchalantly addressed me by saying, "sorry, what did you want?"  Once I placed my drink order, there was no confirmation... just him vanishing again. This is how the entire evening went with him, until it was time to drop off the check. All of a sudden, we mattered and he cared about how we enjoyed our evening. Out of respect, I will not share his name. However, he truly diminished the experience and if he were to be assigned to our table again in the future, I would requests a change or just leave. 1 Star for our server friend. (Disclaimer: I waited tables for 4 years and seldom criticize) Food:The ravioli plate that I ordered, in place of the discontinued eggplant dish, was definitely not accompanied with an alfredo sauce . It was a pesto and strong cheese mix. (Possibly goat cheese or gorgonzola type cheese -  No idea.) Luckily , I like strong cheeses, so I enjoyed it and found it to be flavorful. Just wish I knew what it was and what is was called. Obviously, our server didn't help much on the name and description. My wife's favorite dish, came out overcooked and dry on parts ofthe noodles. Consistent with sitting under a warmer for an extended length of time. Management:AWESOME!!!!! One of the managers stopped by our table, near the end of our dinner and asked how our meal was. My wife was hesitant to share her disappointment, but after sensing something was wrong, she convinced my wife to share. This manager couldn't have been more engaged and apologetic. After offering to bring out a replacement dish, a different dish or a dessert... we respectfully declined with appreciation; as we needed to leave to attend another engagement. The offer itself was enough. Upon receiving our bill, our server stated his manager felt that we deserved better and had comped my wife's meal. TOTALLY UNEXPECTED and very kind and thoughtful. Truthfully... she made our night, because she showed us just how important we wereas a customer. She is an absolute sweetheart!!!! We will definitely be back and Caffé Molise will always maintain a high place on our list of favorites. Everyone can have a bad night and last night was very unusual for such an amazing restaurant. I believe in being candid and honest with my reviews. Trust me, when I tell you this restaurant is usually excellent and worth a visit.

name: Caffé Molise
content: We were so excited to try the new location. We booked reservations for Valentine's Day for a party of 3. Myself, my husband and our 3yr old. Our first issue cam with the parking. There wasnyany, the adjacent parking lot is very small and hard to get around in, otherwise you will need to park across a major street and walk, which wasn exactly fun on a cold February evening. The hostess who greeted us was very friendly and was super sweet to our 3yr old daughter. We were immediately upon check in taken to our table. We were on the top floor which has several level of stairs, good thing I was in flats. They do have an elevator for use as well. Our waiter was also very personable. Our issue really comes with the timing and very slow service, given the holiday it was not busy at the time we were there, it did get busier as we left. The server took a very long time at everything, we had enough time to decide on everything and ordered our entire meal including appetizers at one time, giving the impression that we did not want to dally as we have a child with us. Our appetizers came out in good time but it just seemed that the waiter forgot about us throughout the rest of the night. We waited for about 15 minutes after we finished our appetizers to ask for the bread he had offered earlier, he then remembered we had salads and had those sent out, our meal arrived after about 40 minutes after our appetizers and had clearly been sitting out for some time as my mashed potatoes and chicken had kinda hardened over and were cold. By the time our meal arrived we had been there for just under an hour and our 3yr old was starting to get antsy, we asked to have the rest of our meals boxed to take home and instead of taking it back he brought out boxes and gave some odd excuse for not taking it back himself. Needless to say while in the past we have really enjoyed our dinners ar Cafe Molise we will probably think twice about returning. Good service is very important to us and we felt like we were not considered valued patrons.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I cannot believe how disappointing this was. I know my first mistake was thinking I could find a decent wine bar in Utah and my second mistake was thinking I could find decent Italian food here. I honestly wasn't expecting much but I also wasn't expecting it to be this poor and to have such bad service from my server. She really seemed to care less about anything especially her customers. When I told her that the greens in the salad were bad and wilted she said oh OK I'll take it away for you.  The proper answer would have been I'm sorry and let me do something to make that up to you. I did not even bother telling her that every glass of wine tasted like it's been open for days and was completely turned. I had the Pappardelle, which was honestly OK. That means the texture of the pasta was OK. But the sauce had absolutely no flavor. The tiramisu was also OK. I would say it's equivalent of what I could buy at a supermarket. None of this food was real Italian and why I'm most disappointed about that is that some of the reviews actually raved about it being real Italian food. I decided to come here over another location because of the reviews and now I'm regretting that decision. This is probably the most disappointing restaurant experience I've had in a very long time. I would give them zero stars if I could.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Looked for a restaurant serving early dinner after flying all day to get to SLC. Found the listing for Caffe Molise with a 4 star rating. The server (Shelby) recommended Pappardelle al Sugo for me. Never had it before and it was one of the best Italian dishes I've ever had. It was delicious. I will look for it in my home town. My wife had a salad that she said was very good.  It was not busy and the server was nice enough to talk to us about places to visit in the city.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Went there for lunch, everything is pretty good. We ordered gnocchi and lasagna, portion size is large. The grill chicken is a little less satisfied

name: Caffé Molise
content: I'm here waiting to give my order. I understand it's busy. I understand my waiter had large parties to attend. However when I ask what vodka my server recommends and he barks back "WHAT DO YOU WANT" then walks off, not taking my order at all... I find great offense. When he refused to take the order of a friend's of mine who is not the same as us in skin tone, I take great offense.  Is this normal practice for the establishment?If you ever get Chris. Ask for another server. Seriously this guy has major issues.

name: Caffé Molise
content: This restaurant was  recommended to me by a local. They had lovely Italian dishes served in a warm, friendly atmosphere. I ate at the bar and enjoyed the special halibut with asparagus. I will definitely come back the next time I'm in SLC!

name: Caffé Molise
content: My friend and I came here for an early dinner for my birthday! I was so impressed with the beauty of the building and the overall decor!  The food was delicious! The staff was so nice and accommodating! I will be back ! This is  a must while you are in SLC!

name: Caffé Molise
content: We came here for a business dinner on the advice of a fellow colleague and I have to say that I was impressed. The location is a bit eclectic as it used to be a night club, but for this restaurant it works. We were seated out on the patio and it was the perfect night for a dinner under the stars... in this small courtyard in the heart of downtown salt lake, they have created a small space that makes you feel secluded from the hustle and traffic and provides a really great dining experience, especially on a warm summer night. Being that it was a business dinner, we tried just about all of the apps and I had the bistecca as a main. All were very good and cooked perfectly. Service was amazing and the staff were very knowledgeable on menu items and specials. Overall, we all had a fantastic experience and will be back.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Wonderful food and great service.  We highly enjoyed our last night in SLC with a dinner at Caffe Molise. We had the lasagna, pappardelle, and butternut squash raviolis. The Mediterranean salad was delicious and the rolls are tasty.  Our water glasses never got low and we can't  speak enough about the excellent service.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I went to this restaurant twice at the previous location. I ordered the spaghetti marinara both times, and loved it! I ordered the same dish last night and could not have been more disappointed. I got a bowl of angel hair past (over cooked, and NOT spaghetti ) with chopped tomatoes, basil and cheese. It had about an inch of water it was all floating in. The "sauce" would not even adhere to the pasta. I've had better spaghetti marinara from a jar.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I put off trying this restaurant for a long time because their menu seemed to lack my favorite Italian dishes that I like to order when I go to Italian restaurants, but I visited for dinner this week and my entire experience was fantastic. We had reservations and were seated downstairs right away. We ordered the caesar and mediterranean salads and both were very good. For the entree we both ordered the Penne di Caprino w/ chicken and really liked it. For dessert we had the Tiramisu and it was really good. Our server was very fast and provided great service. Our drinks were kept full and the environment inside was really nice, especially at Christmas time.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Just finished our dinner/end of the year work party tonight, and we couldn't be happier with the food and service. Paul was our waiter, very patient for our large group asking too many questions and he was extremely helpful to those in our group who felt a little overwhelmed by the menu and experience. Not only was the waiter great but the people cleaning up the table and delivering the dishes were fast and timely. I'm a sucker for trying specials and personally I hate salmon, but it was soo good. We had the bruschetta for a starter and it was good not amazing, but what my wife and I both agreed on was the dessert. We go out and have great meals and such below average desserts, it was a nice surprise to have a great dessert. She had the choc mousse and I had the tiramisu...both were large portions, we should've split hers. Plus I like coffee to end the meal and very rarely can you get a good cup of coffee or espresso at the end of a meal in Utah. I'm rambling here but couldn't be happier with the evening! Thank you for making our (small) company party a success.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Cute Italian place set in a historic building. Service is excellent. The goat cheese pasta was refreshing and delicious. But the tiramisu was fantastic and the wine selection was pretty extensive. Relaxed but upscale ambience. More spacious than it looks from the outside and the decor is cute and woodsy.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Booked this restaurant for our Anniversary dinner and loved every second of it. It was the perfect choice for a moderate noise level, perfect lighting, great staff, and food was excellent. Cannot wait to come back! The appetizer Ravioli con Zucca was my absolute favorite!!!

name: Caffé Molise
content: Went here on a Saturday night for an early dinner before the ballet. I have not been to Caffe Molise in a few years so I had yet to experience it in the new(ish) location. The building was one I had always admired from the outside and wished they would make into something. Now I finally had a reason to go inside! The inside is very impressive, the wood beams and elegant decor add to a great atmosphere. We started our meal off with some drinks-- I had a type of whiskey sour, it was recommended by our server, Gordon. My fiance had a glass of Malbec. Off to a good start with the drinks! We were then given some bread to munch on, which was so delicious, especially with olive oil and balsamic. I had a hard time making a decision on what to order, but Gordon gave his honest and enthusiastic opinion and I chose the Penne di Caprino. It was very very good, however, as one might expect from the description (goat cheese based sauce), very rich. I did enjoy it, but was unable to eat very much. I took the rest home, and the woman that brought by the box packed it up for me and gave me some tips on how to best reheat it. We ended our meal with espresso and a shared tiramisu. The tiramisu is different from typical tiramisu in a way that I really enjoyed. You should give it a try. Our experience was flawless, I think the service is really what sets it apart from other restaurants. There was always someone nearby to fill water glasses, remove plates, and ask how everything is tasting. We will definitely be back!

name: Caffé Molise
content: This is my wife and I's favorite place to eat. The sugo is always a good option your first time. The quality is top notch and the price is fair.My favorite dessert is the bread pudding. The chocolate is rich and the fruit is sweet. Definitely a restaurant worth trying!

name: Caffé Molise
content: Wow, what a unprofessional restaurant.We had reservations for two weeks for 14 people (seven couples) on a Sat at 6:30.Some of the group got there early, went into the bar to wait for rest of our group. When we had all arrived we were taken upstairs to our table. Those that had an alcoholic drink at the bar were not allowed to carry their own drink to our table. A server came and took the drinks (mostly red wine) on a tray to carry to the table. There was no way for any one to identify their own glass of wine once at the table.The next thing; as we were looking thru the menu there is a note at the bottom stating the restaurant would not do separate bills to a larger group. I talked three times to Cafe Molise representative regarding this reservation of 14 guest, not once was I told of their large group no separate checks policy. That is a BIG part of being aware of how we would be handling the bill at the end of dinner.Time to order: the menu had lasagna, one person ordered that and our server told us there had never been lasagna since he had been employed at Cafe Molise. Why would an upscale restaurant not update their menu?Food is delivered: three different servers/helpers brought out our main dish and basically was asking our group "who ordered the ......"? Really? Dessert: I ordered the a Tiramisu the bottom was a soggy wet crust. The check please: the server did try to give us individual checks but the checks came out one at a time, and were not correct. So, needless to say, we figured that each couple spent $100 plus. There was a gratuity of 20% that was automatically charged on the bill.Finally: Our money will not be thrown away at a restaurant that is so unorganized and unprofessional.Oh on another note to our server; when someone ask you about gluten don't say maybe just a little. What kind of an answer is that? Go Ask the Chef!

name: Caffé Molise
content: I went to Caffé Molise to celebrate a friends birthday this evening. This is a restaurant I have been to a handful of times before, and they have all been mediocre experiences. I had high hopes that this time would be better, as they moved locations in the past year or so, to a beautifully remodeled building. However, it was probably one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had. Our party made reservations many days in advance (there were 7 of us). Myself and another friend arrived earlier than the other guests so we were seated right away. When the other guests arrived they somehow "lost" the reservation or forgot that they seated only half the party, leaving the rest of the group to wait for a table to become available, for 30 min. Meanwhile, the other half of the group waited upstairs for everyone to arrive. In total we waited for an hour before the whole situation was worked out. We were not comped in any way for this mishap. Our server was horrible. Not only did our food take forever to arrive, but she was incredibly rude, anytime a plate or water glass was refilled it was slammed down on the table. 3 of the 7 people at the table ordered the vegetarian entree, the eggplant "meatballs". Which we had in the past, and they were pretty good. However, this time they were completely inedible. It was like trying to saw a rock with a butter knife. Which I didn't even know it was possible to over cook eggplant to the point that it turns that dry and hard. Not to mention EVERYTHING, was coated in that nasty, cheap Parmesan cheese fluff...not even real Parmesan flakes. The sauce was horrible and sparse. Luckily the dessert was pretty decent. That was the only redemptive part of the evening. All in all, we left 3 and half hours later, and paid $50 a person for horrible food and awful service. I can think of a ton of restaurants in the same vicinity that I would go to in a heart beat over Caffé Molise. To name a few- Copper Onion, HSL, Current, Vaulters...you'll spend the same amount of money for an incredible meal and amazing service.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Absolutely excellent. This chef is outstanding. The restaurant is eclectic and attractive and this along with the  price point will bring me back again and again.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Dinner was very good and the desserts were exceptional. Best tiramisu and chocolate cake I've had in awhile.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Made a reservation and we had a party of 4, was 15 minutes late because of traffic. They called me 5 minutes after the reservation to check on me. That part was cool.After being seated our waitress came to our table every couple of minutes asking what we wanted to drink and if we were ready to order? She was trying to rush us to the point of it being annoying and then exasperating. The good:-Hot Chocolate-Polenta Con Funghi-Polenta Con Salsiccia-Capresse-Penne Di Caprino-Gnocchi Di Patate-Polpette di Melanzane (eggplant meatballs A++++)-Spinaci salad (spelled funny)-complimentary rolls, olive oil and balsamic vinegar-Tiramisu & creme bruleeThe bad:-Spaghettini Pomodori (bland)-Complementary salads (very little dressing flavor)-Rushed service-Ignored at the end-Said they had all desserts, when in fact they were out of 2 of themThe food was exceptional in taste preparation, the service was abhorrent and yes such a strong word.Will be back and hope to not have that same server again.

name: Caffé Molise
content: I was in SLC visiting and I came here for dinner two nights in a row with my sister. We absolutely fell in love. The ambience is incredible, the service is superb and SO on top of things. But the FOOOOD! Wow best pasta and bruschetta I've ever had. I don't know who is back in the kitchen, but I swear this food came straight from Italy. Their Pappardelle, gnocchi, and penne dishes were our favorite. Their rolls are super soft and warm too. If you're in town, this place is a must. I highly recommend giving it a try.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Loved everything about this place. Noticed it while driving by to a different restaurant and decided to try it the next day. When we arrived we were very graciously welcomed and was seated very promptly even though we didn't have a reservation. The waiter was amazing and extremely nice and knowledgeable about the menu. The food was also delicious. Every person ordered something different and we ended up having nothing to take home. For dessert I ordered the bread pudding and again loved it. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Salt Lake.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Would have liked to try this restaurant - but when we called for a reservation they said call back in an hour they were too busy to help - so we did and this time they but us on hold and didn't come back forever - so we made reservations elsewhere

name: Caffé Molise
content: Time after time Caffe Molise delivers. It is a family favorite of ours, to the point that my sister had her rehearsal dinner here! The service, while not always incredibly fast, is always attentive and pleasant. Good wine selection at multiple price points, and their food is to die for. The entrees, apps, and pastas are amazing and consistently made, but they also always have great specials off the menu. Their new location is beautifully decorated, and is a space that matches the menu (the old space didn't do it justice). Between Molise and BTG (their wine bar next door), this local spot is truly a gem!

name: Caffé Molise
content: Seriously disappointing. Seems the only decent thing here is the pastas.  Bread even was subpar. Chicken not recommended.  Decent vibe

name: Caffé Molise
content: I've been wanting to try this place for a while now due to the historic building they moved in to. It's beautiful inside and is full of charm. We are in the bar downstairs from the main restaurant because reservations were full, but you can still order from the full menu. I had the butternut squash ravioli and it was delicious! I had a bite of my friends Mac n cheese and it was also amazing. We were also all very impressed with our drinks. The only reason I'm giving it four stars instead of five was that our service was awful. The server was nice but we wouldn't see her for 20 minutes at a time. Our food came out before our drinks. We were there for over two hours because the service was so slow.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Good food, good location. Staff was attentive. Bread/rolls unimpressive, and for me at a nice Italian restaurant that is a must.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Caffe Molise never disappoints! Try the pappardelle al sugo. Such a relaxing atmosphere and great serviceAs well.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Made reservations here for some bites and wine before the Elton John concert.  The hostess offered the choice of either the wine bar or the restaurant upstairs.  I chose the wine bar, since I had visions of flexibility, and wanted to taste a variety of food.  We were not disappointed!!  And, as expected in a wine bar, the cost of our adventure was over 1/2 wine....They offer flights of wine, wines by the glass, and a whole host of 'bar bites'.  We ordered (for the 2 of us) the charcuterie board ($19), garlic shrimp ($12), asparagus ($11), prosciutto dates ($7), and a mediterranea salad ($9).  I would do it all again except the dates.  WONDERFUL food!!  The salad was especially great.  If they had done the dates without the 'wine reduction' they would have been awesome.  But as it was, the dates were completely drowned in the wine, and there was no flavor profile of other than wine. In total for all the food, 3 pours of wine (5 oz each), and one of the most expensive flights of wine ($24.5), the bill came to $135.I deducted one star for the lackadaisical service by our waiter.  He rarely came to check on us, never checked our water, had an attitude of 'what are you doing here', and the manager had to come over and clear our plates off the table. Hostess was great, manager was great, and other staff very friendly.All in all, I'd go back again. After I've tried the huge offerings for restaurants that SLC has to offer.

name: Caffé Molise
content: Super awesome part of Salt Lake, looooved the interior of the restaurant. Very 1930's feel, really pretty decor. The food was pretty average Italian food, can't complain. We were happy with it and would go back.

name: Caffé Molise
content: We love Caffé Molise. The food is amazing and the renovation of the building is even more amazing! My only issue is with how highly lit the bar right off of the front entrance is. The antique bar is beautiful the furniture is too, the lights are just too bright. Not cozy at all. It does not make you want to sit down and relax there.

name: London Belle
content: This place was really nice.  We went for brunch...super open space ,nice decorations.  There was live entertainment while we were there, and while I usually ding for live entertainment, I had to up the stars.  This lady was absolutely incredible.  She was so good that she factored heavily into our experience.  Wow.  The food was good, tasty, creative.  One thing that was a little odd is that their coffee was really off.  Not sure how this happened as, in my mind, coffee is a cornerstone of brunches.  The service was good, and, you could tell the staff was really happy to be there.  Why 4 stars? The parking was horrid . As in, we almost have up after circling the blocks 5 times.  However, I'd def go back! Shop local eat local! Especially now- support our local restaurants.

name: London Belle
content: Ordering online was very easy and quick. The food arrived 20 minutes earlier than its expected arrival. The deliver guy was very friendly. However, I wish I had the option to tip the delivery guy (by card) after the food was delivered while signing for it. However, this is not an option. Customers are only allowed to add tip money to the total before the food is delivered. Why would I leave tip money for a service I have yet to receive? I feel bad because the delivery guy was really nice & I on had a couple of dollars on hand.

name: London Belle
content: Their Duck Frites! Oh my, I could eat them everyday. Will definitely be going back, enjoyed everything we ordered.

name: London Belle
content: This is an update to my previous review. Miso chicken is great, brunch is delicious and seating options are comfy and great for date night. Ive become a big fan of London Belle... despite the awful music selection and our rough start, I've had many great experiences here! I'm glad they've gotten rid of the titty bar vibe!

name: London Belle
content: This is a business with heart. Amazing people, great food with a fun atmosphere! The owners and staff are amazing. Do yourself a favor and visit London Belle!!!-Mike Flavin

name: London Belle
content: Great food and cocktails. Highly recommend for a relaxed dinner and drinks. Bar staff is highly knowledgeable and creative and food prepared perfectly with a diverse menu.

name: London Belle
content: My good friend and I just arrived from the airport , checked into our hotel downtown and we're looking for Some drinks/ some great food downtown. We walked a few blocks from our hotel at the Hilton and were told whiskey street Is a popular spot. After opening the door the host  was extremely rude and said "The restaurant was at capacity and it would be a 30 minute wait". I looked around and the place was basically empty !!! We then walked out and stumbled upon London Belle (next door). Wow...  we were both blown away!! Not only was the customer service amazing (thank you so much Sawyer and Nicquey ).. But the food is to die for ... oh and the Decour is unique and the atmosphere hip , yet casual.I highly recommend any locals or tourists visiting to enjoy a nice meal here as it seems like a diamond in the rough... Ready to be polished and enjoyed!!Thanks again Ryan from San Diego.

name: London Belle
content: One of the best steaks I have ever had!!! Seriously amazing and it wasn't even what I ordered, hahaha. I had the short ribs that just fell off the bone and were so flavorful. This is a must and has a vibe all its own.

name: London Belle
content: I've been wanting to try this restaurant for quite some time, I just prefer to avoid downtown whenever possible, lol. Finally made it in for brunch today! I ended up ordering the large mimosa, crab benedict, and some bacon. I thought all the food was delicious! The crab eggs benedict was delicious. These guys know how to do hollandaise right. (You'd be surprised). It was light and buttery, but had a good amount of flavor. I've tried so many that were just too tart from the lemon or didn't have enough salt/cayenne. Anyways, it gave the dish a nice balance. I also ordered the bacon plate. It was more like pork belly, it had such a nice fatty texture, and the marinade was delicious! I gladly recommend both of these items. I regret not having gone in sooner. I will definitely have to make it back in to try the dinner options.

name: London Belle
content: Came here on a Sunday to check out the brunch menu. Everything is clean, tables are socially distanced and the staff are wearing masks to ensure we're safe. Hand sanitizer is readily available when you check in. They check for ID at the door so be prepared to present this.Service was ok. My bestie and I shared a large mimosa which came with a bottle of champagne and some OJ. The server only brought out the champagne and maybe 10 mins later brought out the juice. I was hoping they would've popped the bottle at the table so we wouldn't have to struggle trying to open it.  Food was just ok. When we ordered a side of bacon, and I was expecting strips of bacon. I mean, it's brunch. Instead, I was presented 3 huge slices of maple glazed pork belly. It was so soft you can cut it using your fork. It was a little too sweet for my taste. I also ordered the miso fried chicken hash and it wasn't anything special. My fried egg was over cooked which was sad. It would've been great with my potatoes.

name: London Belle
content: London Belle is a cool bar on Main Street in Salt Lake City. I've been here many times for many occasions, as well as just wanting a good place to get a drink. The staff is outgoing and friendly every time!!

name: London Belle
content: Amazing cocktails. Did not eat here but the drinks are great and service is awesome. Super under-rated bar!

name: London Belle
content: Went to this spot after dinner. It was a nice place. Good spot to just vibe and get some drinks. Enjoyed my time here.

name: London Belle
content: Had really great service and the food was absolutely amazing! It was our first time going and I was very happy with everything. Thank you!

name: London Belle
content: Where do I start?!?!  We got sat and it took over 15 minutes for our waitress to come serve us. Keep in mind that the restaurant was not even at 25% capacity. Waitress finally came and took our drink order and by that time we knew what appetizers we wanted. Order our appetizers and our waitress was not seen for a good 30 minutes... this could be because someone was at the bar that knew the waitresses there who brought their Nintendo Switch in so the waitresses decided to play video games instead of serves their guests. Even had time to take pictures which more important then coming and taking our entree order. Waitress finally arrives with our appetizers first the olives and pickles which came first then the bone marrow which me and my guest where exited about, she dropped off the appetizer and no care to ask if we needed any plates to eat which I had to ask for. Dug in one bone was so overcooked and dried out that you couldn't scrap anything out of it. The other two over 45% of the bone was the same way. We discussed this with our waitress and she stated that she would go ahead and take it off the ticket since most of it was over cooked. We both received our entree which were both great. Time came to pay our check... I guessI should have looked it over because although our waitress said she would take the bone marrow appetizer off since most of it was overcooked,Looking at my receipt she ended up charging me$9.50 of the $12 which was how much it cost for the appetizer. If any of the owners or managers read this.. make sure your waitresses aren't to distracted with playing video games to where they aren't tending to their guests. All in all I'll give my experience a 3 out f 5 stars. Hopefully the next time I decide to dine in my waitress along with the others aren't to busyPlaying games. I still tipped 20% which I felt was too much for our experience but only did because servers work off tips

name: London Belle
content: Solid food, would come back again! Got the Miso chicken, butternut squash soup, and arugula salad and all were very tasty. Dipping sauce for chicken was bomb :) To go service was great and super quick.

name: London Belle
content: Visiting from Chicago and stop by London Belle. Ambiance is beautiful and classy! Had the Brothel Burger and it was AMAZING. Best burger I've ever had! Had the calamari and bone marrow; absolutely delicious! For cocktail, I had the mojito and cruel intention. Both great and not too sweet like some other places.  I will definitely be visiting again when I'm in town.

name: London Belle
content: Amazing food! Came here for dinner before our flight and had the best burger! Great vibe, great music.

name: London Belle
content: Great spot for dinner, drinks, and snacks! It's a lot bigger on the inside than you'd think, and they have a great outdoor area too. We sat outside by the fire. Our drinks were great! I had the salmon BLT which was awesome (candied Serrano pepper bacon-- yes!), and my partner had the butternut squash soup (yummy, but sweet) and the falafel sandwich. He loved both! The side salad that came with mine was way better than your usual side salad. Cocktails were tasty too! The only comment to management would be that it took several asks for us to receive glasses of water, and it would be better if they came out when we were seated.

name: London Belle
content: The food and service were fine, I'd have given a three star review.I had the Desperado cocktail which was refreshing. I was recommended the Miso Fried Chicken entree. It was plated beautifully and the taste was pretty good but the chicken wasn't fried as crispy as it could have been.The reason I'm giving only 1 star is for their COVID guidelines. I sat at the bar and during the majority of my meal they seated people both at tables and at the bar with social distancing in mind. After I had finished my food, I was relaxing for a few more minutes as I finished my cocktail. The host seated someone literally in the seat to my right. There was less than 1 ft of distance between us. As soon as the guest sat down he took off his mask. I immediately downed the rest of my drink and put on my mask and asked for my check as fast as possible. The guest to my right then proceeded to chat with two other people who came over. Hugs and high fives were exchanged.This is no way to reopen during COVID. While I want to support local businesses as much as possible, I will only do so if it's safe. Please have a serious discussion with your staff to take COVID seriously and seat guests with social distancing in mind.

name: London Belle
content: Had a delicious date night full of tasty cocktails and perfect grub. We were on the early side for dinner, but it definitely was getting busy as we finished up. Try to sit in the open air patio, it was wonderful. Our server was Olive, who was attentive and kind.

name: London Belle
content: Amazing place with great food and cocktail menu! They have a cute little open roof nook in the back with dim lights, perfect for a date night...until 10pm! Went on friday and that might explain why the music and crowd went LOUD after 10pm.

name: London Belle
content: F@*k me! This place is so good it is f'in ridiculous! I ate here twice in one day (no joke - I had dinner, left to pick my girl up from the airport, and came back with her and had dinner again); AND it was even better the second time around?!!! The food - bananas good (like insanely good); the team was amazing (from their head of security Nicky to the best bartender in SLC, Flavin). Frank, Dave, stop putting drugs in your food because it feels like your entire menu should be classified as a "Schedule C" controlled substance. You're killing it, and I'm so proud that you guys are staying strong during COVID. Damn, now I have to dream of miso chicken tonight. Looking forward to coming back every week until I die or Christ comes back, whichever comes first.

name: London Belle
content: I am still thinking about the delicious Ribeye/The London We had last night!! Omg it was fantastic! Our server Anyi, was excellent! We wanted prime rib and he recommended the London. Compliments to the chef, it was perfectly cooked at me!!! We had an amazing time on our date night. Thank you!!

name: London Belle
content: Four of us enjoyed a well-thought out and well-prepared brunch, made even better by excellent service. In the chicken hash, the miso chicken was moist and flavorful. The moist, tender ham in the Eggs Benedict was superior to any Canadian bacon. The English breakfast had quality bacon and sausage with well-seasoned potatoes. The thing that struck us most was the expertise in egg cooking. Sunny side up eggs in the English breakfast had creamy yolks and well-set whites (no snot). The poached eggs also had creamy yolks and perfectly cooked whites (no chalkiness). We'll be back for dinner to see what the chef has in store for us.

name: London Belle
content: We enjoyed another Sunday brunch with friends today. Two of us had the eggs Benedict which we both loved and the others had the English breakfast and the miso chicken  - we all  really enjoyed the meal. Try the Mimosa great price and generous pour. Others had bloody mary's - the bartender Nate, a great mixologist and fun companyGoing back next week

name: London Belle
content: I LOVE THIS PLACE! The food, the atmosphere, the hosts, the people!  I'm obsessed!!! They just barely started doing Latin Nights on Thursday, and any local will know that Latin nights are slim pickin here in slc. They are so fun! Hope this place stays open FOREVER-EVER!

name: London Belle
content: Awesome service, incredible drinks and the best food in Utah! Love the atmosphere and vibe of the environment and the live music on Sundays during their brunch is perfect! Highly recommend!

name: London Belle
content: Best food! Best staff! Best drinks!!!! LB fo life!  I wish I could eat Matt's food every day!

name: London Belle
content: The best food and bar in Salt Lake City! They treat you like family as soon as you walk in the building, they have the best service, and the craziest crowd. We always have a fun time when we come here, and choose London Belle over any other club in SLC. Also, THE FOOD! OMG. Your search is OVER! COME HERE! And shout out to Niquey, the general manager, for being the best host in the valley, absolutely the best place in SLC!!!

name: London Belle
content: I was really excited to have found this place, make a reservation, tell my friend that we're having dinner at a very great place!Unfortunately, they didn't let my friend in with a 12-year-old. Nowhere does it say/was mentioned when I was making a reservation that it's a bar and that minors under 21 aren't allowed, so I didn't make any backup plans.As it was an 8 pm reservation on Friday, I couldn't find another good place to go to and my dinner was ruined. I guess this is what happens to your life if you have children in Salt Lake City. :(

name: London Belle
content: What a great evening. Came here after visiting "The Rest" restaurant many times. London Belle is always packed. Came here over memorial weekend and with social distance we were hoping to get in. The food was amazing. The Fried chicken ham and cheese is delicious. Like a chicken cordon blue. The miso fried chicken was amazing. When it first came I thought it was rather small. It's all thigh meat. It was perfect and the flavors were amazing. (Fresh jalapeños would be better than bottled) but the service was Spot-On!!  We were never waiting for anything. The ambience was way cool. Chill.   This is a way cool place to chill. I love the SERVICE!! Great smiles.

name: London Belle
content: Delicious food, friendly service and huge bar! We had a great dining and drinking while keeping socially distanced and sanitized. Please give this place a try.

name: London Belle
content: Decent food and fun drinks, like a packed club on the weekends. Getting dinner, depends on which server you get wether you get good service or not. Last time we were in our waitress basically came to us twice without us physically walking to her or attempting to get her attention (remind you there was maybe 3 other table in there at the time). Bartenders are very friendly and serve fun drinks!

name: London Belle
content: Thanks to Yelp I found this place the second week it was opened while I was in town on business.  I keep coming back whenever I visit SLC.  I really like the vibe.  The bartenders always have the right balance of conversation and also giving you space if you have a friend with you.  They seem to always poor a very balanced drink.   I've had a number of different drinks over the course of my visits.  I opted for the Moscow Mule this time. They have a number of different versions with different alcohols, I stuck with original but used raspberry vodka for a twist.  Fantastic, second one I opted for the extra $2 upgrade to use ginger beer with alcohol.  So while it was more potent, I preferred the mule with the non-alcohol ginger beer as the ginger flavor had more snap/zip to it.  Split the duck confit fries, scallops, boneless wings with my buddy.  All were fantastic.
