Note the wings are boneless, I missed that and I prefer bone-in wings, but these were still really good and it was great tender meat that wasn't over battered like most boneless wings.  Also note music usually starts at 10pm and the vibe switches from a chill dinner/bar joint to a night scene with waitresses switching into bustier tops etc. Keep in mind this place is named after a legal brothel that used to be here.  But to be honest, since I'm hitting this place while traveling for work, I'm usually beat by 10:30 so I can't comment too much on the night scene other than it starts to get full at 10:00 and there seems to be a fun crowd that gathers.  Enjoy!

name: London Belle
content: Ahhh. Ambiance. This place nails it: gorgeous, elegant. Perfect for a celebratory event - and that was what drove us in.  The front door itself is a masterpiece - heavy, decorative - and offers a welcome no regular door can offer: get ready for exceptional when you cross my threshold. We selected a spot on the entry wall - but unfortunately had to move due to a chilly night and a non-discrimatory door that also ushered in blasts of sub 30 air.  We chose a front window bench table that consumed the four of us with its size.  Olive, our waitress, was kind and efficient.Food was presented beautifully on oddly shaped platters and plates. Interesting mixes of food were consumed - all enjoyable. Why then, four stars? Simply due to the lack of vegan options. There was...one.  And vegetarian? Hmm. I think this was it as well.I would absolutely hold an event in this space. In fact, it reminds me of the decor brought in to high-end Sundance parties. I would just insist on one more choice...I'd like to message management,  but cannot. Please DM me.

name: London Belle
content: We have been coming to London Belle for quite a while now. The food is always fantastic and the drinks are top notch. Flav is by far the most entertaining bartender and makes the best drinks. The man is a mixmaster genius and we look forward to visiting with him every time we come. Please don't ever get rid of the Q Burger! It's the best vegetarian burger around. The food and drinks are in our opinion the best in SLC.

name: London Belle
content: If I can give them negative stars I would I showed up for an private event and I got denied I dj for MTV and they told me no I did not I said really and walked away Djluckyiam.com I understand security is doing their job but they should do their investigation or ask for credentials a little better if could have shows him my credential or even I showed him that I'm on the VIP list !!

name: London Belle
content: I have been to London Belle for a date night, and for a night out with drinks. I would recommend only going for the latter. Their drinks are good, and have a large variety of all types of alcohol, with a range of prices that are fit for any budget. When we went for dinner, our server was amazing, however the dinner itself had little to be desired. The fish and chips had a good, high-quality cod, but were ruined by the fact that they were fried in oil that was obviously not hot enough, rendering it soggy. The burger somehow had no flavor. As I said, great for drinks and a night out, but don't stay for the menu.

name: London Belle
content: Horrible service. Tips are NOT optional. 20% is automatically charged to your card and the service did not deserve a 20% tip. Don't go here but if you do use cash so you can actually control the tip.

name: London Belle
content: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night and were a party of 4. Was surprisingly not busy. The atmosphere is amazing and it's a beautiful place. We ordered multiple items including the loaded fries, bison tikka masala, and the miso fried chicken. The food was amazing. Prices are reasonable for both food and drinks. We enjoyed both cocktails and a bottle of sparkling wine with our meal. The only complaint I have is with the service. Our cocktail glasses were empty and were left on the table, the plates we used for appetizers were empty and left on the table, our glasses of water were empty and never refilled. Multiple waitstaff walked by and looked at our table and didn't acknowledge any of this. And our server was rarely able to be found. It was a huge disappointment to enjoy such amazing food and not have staff to showcase it.I'm easy to please...it doesn't take a lot to make me write a review. But having a table of empty plates, glasses, and no refills of water for an entire meal is disappointing...especially on a night that wasn't busy with multiple staff standing around and walking by.

name: London Belle
content: I've been to this bar-club numerous times and my experiences have always been fun filled with sociable conversations as well as tasteful food. Can't go wrong with getting some cocktails to go along with a meal. My wife celebrated her birthday party here along with a fairly large group of friends (30+) at least lol. Our waitress Mechelle did an awesome job keeping everyone happy by constantly checking up on us. So if you're looking for a chill laid back atmosphere with a group of people, LB has this vibe. Frank (owner) was a cool guy to deal with. Straight forward and gave me a deal on the reservation for the night. Food, I still have lots to try on their menu. So far my favorite is the calamari with their side saucesThe bone marrow was a bit on the salty side but I can see marrow being a bit difficult to try and season. Overall I'll continue to be a customer here, great vibes, prime location, cool staff, good music, cocktails, fooooood. Updated: added more food. So damn bomb

name: London Belle
content: Great dj! However, The drinks are pricey and it SMELLS LIKE VOMIT! Lots of broke glasses, if I didn't have closed shoes I would've been cut for sure. So gross. Will not be back.

name: London Belle
content: This place is a gem in the heart of Salt Lake. We came here after a party downtown and I ordered the  loaded frites, ceviche and bone marrow and all of them were very good. The atmosphere is that of an English pub and it's made to look like a brothel as a play on the history of the building. I loved the ambiance and the food and will definitely be back for more.

name: London Belle
content: I was so sad at how unimpressed I was. I had went in excited and with high expectations because the menu looked fire. Unfortunately, the food was unmemorable and mediocre at best. I was especially excited to try the duck confit nachos, because hello, doesn't that sound amazing? It wasn't. Honestly, we got a bunch of different small plates to share and I don't even remember most of it because it was that unmemorable.

name: London Belle
content: Excellent staff and ambiance are the foundation of this establishment. The craft cocktail and food menu are its implements. Whether you order a Sazerac or a gin fizz you will not be disappointed. These pair perfectly with the roasted bone marrow or chevice. If one is not as adventurous they craft excellent burgers and steak as well. Quite a find for SLC.

name: London Belle
content: Out on the town in the middle of the week and we were looking for a nice date spot where we could enjoy dinner and drinks. Most of the bars on Main Street's kitchen were closed, except for London Belle's! As soon as we walked in, we felt welcome and excited to be there! The energy of everyone working there was amazing.You could tell they really enjoy working there, they know and understand the menu, and they want to have fun and for you to have a good time! The manager Niquee (probably spelling it wrong, sorry girl), and our server Kristen were so much fun and had amazing vibes! The food was seriously incredible for a bar, the drinks were refreshing and the overall vibe was a nice mix of classy and hipster. I highly recommend this place for a chill week night date spot!

name: London Belle
content: If you're looking for an elegant spot that is mixed with hipster vibes, THIS IS THE PLACE!!  Drinks are on point!  Service is superb! (Shout out to Kristen, our amazing server and  Niqy, the most accommodating manager I have met). We went in as the kitchen was closing, and  was still able to get in a full order, with no rush from the staff, and received top notch service with smiles and rad vibes!!  This is definitely on our list as a monthly must!  Cheers to these two ladies for going above and beyond to allow a special time in this place!!!  Keepin it real!!!  London Belle is a  MUST!!!

name: London Belle
content: Did the bison tikka masala. I really love bison meat, this was ok. It was either overcooked or a lesser cut. It was my first time here and the service was very very good. The price-fixe dine o round meal was going on. My friend got the schnitzel and it was very good. Great location, great drinks, but bison needs to be better

name: London Belle
content: Absolutely amazing. The charcruterie board, the calamari, the huckleberry grilled cheese, the bison tikkka masala, the miso fried chicken and the London, we're all incredible. Next time id choose the bone marrow or London frites over the charcruterie board. The steak was on par or superior to any of the local steak houses, and for half the price, and the miso chicken, although small, was very good. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone.

name: London Belle
content: That is a massive upcharge for the miso fried chicken.I'd still come for it but far in between because of this.

name: London Belle
content: Food was not that memorable and overpriced. Better calamari is right next door at whiskey street. Waiter didn't tell us that gratuity was included in our check until after one person in our party asked. They did not give us an itemized receipt and The receipt did imply that we should leave a tip. That's pretty misleading in my opinion and put a really bad taste in my mouth as we finished the night. I'll stick with restaurants that communicate effectively. Server was Jacky Huynh on the receipt. Really disappointed - I wanted to like this place.As stated in an email to you, and my google review, we had 5 people in our group, so how would that group gratuity apply to us?

name: London Belle
content: This place mimics a lot of already established bars in Utah, seeing as how it's a newer place. The drinks are over priced, along with the food. The staff isn't particularly nice or diligent. I would say skip it.

name: London Belle
content: The only reason this joint might survive is Main Street overflow. The decor is an odd, uninspiring mishmash. The beer was just a few degrees below room temp, the staff seemed confused, my cocktail was like something you'd order at a state fair, and the menu font was so tiny I had to take a photo with my phone and magnify. This is the kind of place created by the dude who named his tattoo shop Dream Masters Tattoo. Also, who plays Disney covers in a bar?

name: London Belle
content: Admittedly, I don't quite understand Utah, Salt Lake City, and many parts of this mountain, skiing, LDS driven culture.  London Belle's 1980s ambiance and milieu are both beyond my comprehension, but the London Belle's popularity can't be denied.  At 10:00 PM, on a Saturday, a line formed to get into the bar/restaurant.  Food was fine, typical small plates bar food.  Drinks were Utah poured, I kept mistaking my water for my cocktail.  Service was pleasant enough, attractive young women in skimpy outfits.  Huh?  Was I in Rick's?  Is this 2019?  Did the "Me Too" movement evaporate? I guess it's the dichotomy of Utah, an enigma wrapped in a puzzle. I assume London Belle attracts the young and beautiful of Salt Lake City, and this is what masquerades as hip and trendy in the Bee Hive state.  However, if anyone experiences what is truly hip in NYC, Paris, or even Portland, London Belle would be "quizzical" at best; An enigma wrapped in a puzzle.

name: London Belle
content: Wow! I can't remember the last time I went to a restaurant and cleaned my plate! London Belle is a hip, trendy venue with gothic/boudoir inspired furniture and fixtures. The inside lighting is dim to create a classy atmosphere while you socialize and dine. With multiple spaces to entertain, including an upstairs area with red velvet couches, London Belle feeds the stomach and soul.I enjoyed the calamari appetizer and miso fried chicken - apparently, it's their most popular entree! I definitely believe it because after one bite I was hooked. The breading on the chicken is just right, and the chicken itself cuts easily and is full of flavor. The plate was garnished with ponzu glaze and aioli sauce which paired perfectly with the meat. Decent mashed potatoes, and tasty green beans!The reason I'm giving this place four stars instead of five is because of the service. Great food with a "meh" attitude, felt like the waitress wasn't really interested in us or her job. Hostess was very sweet though! All in all, I enjoyed this place and definitely want to come back. They have a space for DJs to perform - so maybe on a night when things are hashtag lit!

name: London Belle
content: Came here for a quick lunch with a friend today and all we were craving was a charcuterie board and aperol spritz. Neither item were on the brunch menu,  but the chef and bartender made both for us! Wonderful service and very inexpensive for the quality of food and drink. 10/10 would recommend and I will definitely be back again.

name: London Belle
content: Meh...  I really really wanted this place to be better.  It's SO cute and it has a great vibe but the food was terrible on the night I went.  We ordered the ceviche because I was SO EXCITED to find some in Utah. I did not like it at all, but the chips were good.  I ordered the fish and chips and they were very dark and soggy.  Old grease and not hot enough is usually the problem.  It's SO cute but the food is lacking execution and our liquor laws in Utah make the drinks not worth the money.

name: London Belle
content: Come here once a month on business. Always get the steak. Never disappointed.Great friendly staff and cool street views when the front window is up.

name: London Belle
content: This is the place. From the friendly manners of our server (Kass), to the phenomenal food and drink. In coming to the London Belle, I had to pass other establishments, which all seemed busier, and I was wondering if I was missing out on something passing them by. However, I can say now that those that I passed were missing out on what the London Belle had to offer. I ordered the salmon benedict and bangers and mash. All I can say is, Wow! Perfectly done. Perfect presentation. Solid flavor throughout each bite. This place is a must try. I will be back

name: London Belle
content: We were actually headed to Whisky Street when London Belle caught our eye with their 2 for 1 boneless wing special. Great atmosphere & ambiance when entering. Industrial meets chic boutique but in a dark way. Ordered the Rye'N Gosling drink which I highly recommend if you're a fan of Moscow mules. Also ordered the Black Window drink that tasted super delicious especially the hints of jalapeno. Ate the boneless chicken thighs which were super moist & full of great flavor. We tried both flavors; Mango Ginger & Honey Harissa glaze. The Mango Ginger took the win! Couldn't have asked for a better waiter that provided us with excellent service. He made ot very personal by referring to is by always saying, "anything else I can do for us." We went on a Monday night which was packed so we had his full attention. Learned about the history of the building & overall had an excellent experience where we'll be returning once again. You cannot beat their prices for the good quality of food & cocktails that they provide. Happy we stopped into this gem.

name: London Belle
content: Really nice venue and good drinks but the 5th star is for the service! I came in on Tuesday night with a group and after drinking my glass of water, i set it on the bar mid-conversation, intending to ask for another soon, but by the time I turned around, the bartender had already refilled it! Bravo :)

name: London Belle
content: Had a funky experience with a patron who was too drunk, but the server (I feel terrible about forgetting his name because he was great) was gracious towards her as well as myself and my date. We shared the loaded frites and I had a rye'n'goseling. I was impressed and would love to come back.

name: London Belle
content: Great Sunday brunch with Awesome mimosa bar and such a fun and attentive staff! We even enjoyed the bar tender's bad dad jokes.

name: London Belle
content: OMG!!!! So good!!! Where do I even start? When you first walk in it looks beautiful! The place was so beautifully decorated. We arrived and were seated at a small cozy table with huge private ornate chairs that you can get intimate conversations in. The menu, oh the menu is so darling! It gives you a brief history of a pioneer brothel house and the history of the mistress who ran it. Way cool, I love history! We were impressed with the menu options! So many distinct options to choose from! Since it was date night, we splurged on to apps, our entree and a few cocktails! (After seeing the menu, we moved to a larger table. Still cozy and quaint.)We ordered the Roasted Bone Marrow and Crispy Turmeric Calamari. And OMG!  I've had calamari from almost everywhere that serves it and this is hands down THE BEST!! I could've eaten that and not share and be fine with it.  The roasted bone marrow is on a whole new level!! The combination of the crostini, the chimichurri and marrow was excellent! For dinner we ordered the Pepitas Crusted  Sea Scallops and the London Prime Ribeye. Again, I can't say enough on how down right delicious this all was!!! Those sea scallops were done just right! Tender and deliciously crusted! The ribeye was perfection!! Ugh, I already want to go back! For cocktails we ordered the Raspberry Moscow Mule, the Rye'n Gosling, the El Sobera (I think) and the Cucumber Moscow Mule. . Great drink options! A wide variety of all kinds of cocktails, wines, and beers! Overall, I can't say enough. I was impressed by all of it. Beautifully done. The establishment, the food, the wait staff. Amazing! (I tried to post pics, but all I have are videos )

name: London Belle
content: Heard about this place from a friend that lives in Salt Lake. We were in town for a wedding and decided to give this place a shot (even though we landed at midnight) and we're very glad we did! It is probably the most "poppin" spot in the downtown area. The decor was very modern and had a large bar with a sick "Game of Thrones" art piece hanging above. The drinks were good and the server girls weren't so bad either. Looking forward to visit this place next time the hubby and I are back in town.

name: London Belle
content: We came here for Mother's Day, there's was no wait and barely anyone inside which was surprising the stress Kass was sweet and the service was great but most of the food was bland. I had the crab Benedict, it was flavorless. My father and brother had the hangover burger but it was nothing special. We did enjoy the fries and we're stoked that we ordered two sides of bacon because that was delicious but other than that it wasn't the best food. I feel like this place needs to change something. There's no reason a bar with amazing staff, perfect location and beautiful decor would be dead during  holiday perfect for brunch.

name: London Belle
content: Contemporary decor and decent food. Our salmon plate was good. The scallops were a little bland. The service was awkward. It was a very slow night. I walked in around 10:30 and was told by the hostess that the kitchen closes at 11pm. We ordered as soon as we sat down. Our server told us the kitchen was closed at 10:30. We was about to leave since we were starving but decided to stay for 1 drink. The server came back in 5 mins and told us that we still can place an order so we did. He then came back every 10 mins to check on us. At first it felt very attentive until he kept cutting us of multiple times from our conversation just to know how did we want our check. 2 or 3 more times if whether we were ready to pay. We only stayed 1 hour sharp there for both drink and dinner. I personally felt like he wanted to kick us out as soon as possible. I had to order another beer to be able to stay and finish the conversation with my friend. 2 entrees, 2 liquor drinks and 1 beer cost $98 before tip.No I won't come back.

name: London Belle
content: Went to London Belle for the first time. Cool vibe, dark atmosphere. Waited 25 minutes before someone even approached our table. I ended up going to the bar and ordering drinks on my own. Won't be back.

name: London Belle
content: We had dinner and drinks here last night. I had the scallops and my husband had the short ribs. Scallops can be tricky to cook and will often taste rubbery if not done right. Mine were perfection. We started with loaded pomme frittes, which I will need to go back for. Gorgeous interior, delicious food, and friendly servers.

name: London Belle
content: Absolutely loved this place! Went there for a brunch. Food was delicious, mimosas were great with different flavors. Prices are very affordable. Definitely coming back :)

name: London Belle
content: London belle is a bar that serves food as well. We came in and they seated us in the back at a big beautiful table. The chairs were one step above folding chairs. Terribly uncomfortable. The majority of the bar is themed for the prostitution ring that the block was famous for. The tables and chairs In the front match the theme wonderfully. The ones in the back not so much. We came as a group of eight. They were slow to bring us our drinks. I ordered the ribeye steak (London belle). It was a good price and it was cooked to perfection. However the carrots stole the show... they were the best thing on my plate. The steak comes with a curry sauce that doesn't fit the dish well at all. It's good but confusing. I would say you need to try it but just once.

name: London Belle
content: Excellent service fun and friendly staff and the food is excellent. Scallops, short ribs, and fish and chips were all ordered with drinks and everything was very nice with a cozy atmosphere. I would recommend coming in and stopping in for some drinks and food while making your way out of the city or to just have a fun little get together. There are alot of new lounges popping up on main Street and London Belle is one that you will want to stop in and check out.

name: London Belle
content: This place is going to need a lot of work to survive. Unacceptable service compared to their prices .. food is pretty good. Charged for items and upgrades that I did not order. 30+ minutes between attention from any staff. Cold inside and blowing air conditioning in the bathrooms when it was 30 degrees outside. Thankful my company was paying for this meal and not me.

name: London Belle
content: This place is a half block from my home, so I've given it a few tries. The food is reasonably good, assuming it arrives at its intended temperature. The first cocktail has always been great, the second is not the same thing (even if I ordered the exact same thing). The real issue is the service: it's unbearably slow, inattentive and inconsistent. Aside from that, its identity seems like a vague interpretation of a half dozen bars I like better.

name: London Belle
content: the decor is beautiful but the vibe is weird, and the food is boring. the nachos were good but the rest of the meal - including the cocktails - was 'meh.' with so many other tasty places nearby, i won't be spending the time or money here again.

name: London Belle
content: Very cool modern decor.Food was decent but the place took on a totally different vibe at the strike at 10:00PM. Went from a nice contemporary bar to a thumpin night bar scene with a DJ spinning killer tunes. Awesome scene and great service.  A little crowded but some people like crowds just not me.

name: London Belle
content: Went to London Belle for dinner and in my opinion this restaurant is not one to write home about. Although the food was not bad it was not extraordinary. We ordered the short ribs and salmon added to the vegetarian curry cauliflower main. The beef was quite dry and needed some extra seasoning. The accompaniments to the beef were done well. The curry sauce on the fish was very spicy due to the whole pieces of hot peppers throughout. The highlight of the meal was the starter salad that was bejewelled with dry fruits, goats cheese and nuts; the portion was very generous. I have yet to experience the after dinner late night scene at London Belle but rumour on the street is that it is super lively and fun.

name: London Belle
content: Appetizers, drinks and atmosphere.  Love this place.  Live right around the corner and this is one of my favorite places.

name: London Belle
content: This place is was like amateur hour! I felt like I was at a soft opening.We went early on Friday evening. There were more people behind the bar than were sitting at it. Counted as many as 8 employees at once and 4 customers. Still couldn't get service. Our bartender disappeared. When I asked for a second drink, I said can I order a drink from you? He said no but I will find someone you can order from. Minutes went by, he went to the other end of the bar and asked the other bartender, I saw him just shaking his head no. Then he came back and said your bartender is in the kitchen, he'll be back soon. 10 minutes went by. Trust me if they were busy I wouldn't care but there were packs of employees congregating and fooling around the whole time.We were going to leave but had my heart set on the bone marrow so we stuck it out.When bartender returned there was no apology.Ordered the calamari and bone marrow. Calamari was excellent I must say. The bone marrow, while a large portion wasn't good. It was served with rock hard bread and an oily chimmichurri. The marrow is fatty enough. Don't need oily sauce.Got the check and left!

name: London Belle
content: This is probably one of the cutest bars I been to here in Utah. With the coolest largest entrance door I've ever seen. The atmosphere was automatically chill as you walk in. Our waitress was the nicest and most attentive server. The seating booths and chairs are very unique. Giving space for a more private and intimate party with dimmed lights. I enjoyed it very much. Our dinner was amazing! We ordered the Roasted Bone Marrow, Tomato Curry Cauliflower, and Miso Fried Chicken. The Dedperado cocktail was also very delicious! Highly recommend this place to everyone, worth the fun experience!

name: London Belle
content: Mikey (at the bar) took care of us.  The calamari appetizer was better than most (presentation was exceptional) and the Bison Short Ribs are worth returning for.  Totally admirable selection of spirits but the wine list suffers from a lack of big bold Washington reds and Oregon Pinots.  Otherwise, a must visit locale in SLC.

name: London Belle
content: I have been wanting to try this place forever and when I was at an event within walking distance I just couldnt resist. The staff was very inviting and accommodating. We sat at a table up front that wasnt quite big enough and they got a better table for us in the back. I started off with bone marrow which was delicious. There were three large bones and 4 crustinis. I ended up taking the remaining marrow and pouring it over my french fries. The sloppy joe however was a very interesting idea, but just had so many strong flavors that clashed the only real taste that came out was the spicy mustard. My brother got the smothered fries for the table and they smothered them in horseradish which was very overwhelming. They were ok, but with our large group all trying them they still went relatively untouched.

name: London Belle
content: Delicious and beautiful! We went for dinner. The staff is friendly and accommodating. They have several vegetarian options. Every dish we ordered was yummy and inventive. New favorite date night spot!

name: London Belle
content: Six months since my last review on this place. Been there a few times since then including last night. Incredible range of liquor and the service continues to be top notch with an attentive staff that is both welcoming and professional. Had their calamari last night and was spot on perfect! Didn't go full meal this time around as it was pretty late in the evening, but overall the food, drinks and staff continue to exceed expectations!Also, a big fan of their miso chicken from my visit there a few months ago. Highly recommended!

name: London Belle
content: I was a little upset with the energy of this place. I was hoping for an upscale restaurant/bar to add to my list but London Belle has decided to cater to the college and slightly older crowd.  Cheesy DJ playing top 40 hip hop starts around 10:30 and it goes downhill from there.  Save your money for White Horse or the Bodega.

name: London Belle
content: This is a trendy venue with awesome decor.   This was my first time coming and was impressed with the menu offerings. I wish there was a drink menu. If there is one, it was not offered to us. But that's ok as I got a loaded Bloody Mary. A piece of bacon is what differentiates that from a regular Bloody. Oh, and $5 for the .I ordered the Egg Benedict and the basil they put on the tomatoes is an awesome touch. It really sets it apart from other eggs Benedicts I have had from other places. The menu online describes using high quality ingredients and it shows. The breakfast potatoes were also awesome.My partner ordered the Bangers and Mash. The sweet onion gravy was delicious but we couldn't figure where the buttery mashed potatoes were, which was rather odd and disappointing. He said that while he is glad we finally tried London Belle, he probably wouldn't come back for brunch.

name: London Belle
content: Dinner here did not disappoint, taking my figurative hat off to the chef, everything we had was wonderful. The boneless chicken wings were so juicy and tender, the brothel burger was wonderfully seasoned and so delicately flavored (the grilled peppers and onions we're magical), fries perfectly cooked, and the star of my meal was the soul of the day: chicken lime tortilla, wow. I was blown away, pretty sure that soup is the cure to the common cold. It was hearty, had just enough of a kick that wasn't overwhelming, and just warmed up my tummy as much as my soul. Thank you for creating this experience for my friends and I. The service was only okay, but the food made up for it.

name: London Belle
content: For being somewhat new, the service, ambience, and overall experience there was a disappointment. The waitress was literally sitting at a table flirting with a bunch of guys while on the clock, rather than tending to the patrons. The restaurant itself has a nice setting, but the crowd wasn't there. The food was meh. I wouldn't go back or recommend it.

name: London Belle
content: This place is amazing! We came for our anniversary and were not disappointed.  We sat at the bar because the tables and chairs were really low and not made with this place being a restaurant in mind.  It is a bar so the  tables and chairs are perfect for that setting.  The bartender was super fun and attentive.  He was great at giving recommendations on food choices.  We both couldnt decide on exactly what we wanted because it all sounded awesome! I got the bison short ribs.  These short ribs were fantastic! Super moist and flavorful.  The huckleberry and serrano glaze was absolutely amazing.  The combination was so great with the short rib.  I was hesitant before ordering, not took a chance and was so happy I did. There was some kind of pepper pickled on the plate, I'm assuming serrano, and I wish there had been more! It was so good.  Then there was the cute carrots.  The cute carrots were carmelized and tasted so good by themselves or with a bit of carmelized onion and the mashed potatoes.  Literally everything on my plate was fantastic.  My husband got some kind of pork dish.  While I didnt try everything on his plate, because he ate most of it before sharing, the pork was moist and nicely seasoned.  It was a little spicy with a smoky flavor.  It was amazing! We had such a great time.  We both cannot wait to head back and try this awesome place out.  I recommend this place to anyone!

name: London Belle
content: This place is somewhere between a 3.5-4.0 - partially because later in the evening the place gets ratchet fast. The service is great (pre-ratchet hours). The decor and ambiance are also quite nice - very speakeasy - though I hate that they have random TVs playing sports and the back area is weird. The food wasn't bad, nor were the cocktails. Definitely an earlier in the evening stop - unless the SLC dance scene is your thing.

name: London Belle
content: Did you know ''Belle London'' was one of Utah's most famous madams and head of organized prostitution,  regardless of her controversial profession she tried her best to do good ~ you can find that and more secrets in this club style bar :) I really like their selection for drinks and great  music for dancing. I highly recommed making a reservation because this club is quite popular. There is no entrance fee**

name: London Belle
content: I'm not one to typically leave reviews, even when something is so impactful and life changing that it compels a response. However, my first time at London Belle SLC was a level beyond anything I've ever experienced so here I am... writing about how lovely the experience, atmosphere, and staff were. There's no place I'd rather spend my wedding anniversary; this year and every year hereafter.

name: London Belle
content: This is best spot for brunch and dinner. Amazing food & cocktails. Very helpful and friendly staff, just met the owner David and he made us feel so welcome! Highly recommend!

name: London Belle
content: When this venue opened, I only heard positive reviews so my friends and I were excited to visit. Now I've been here numerous times. Depending on when you decide to go, you'll get a great, brunch, dinner or nightlife experience. The food is amazing and I'll definitely recommend this place to my friends and family!

name: London Belle
content: This bar serves great drinks and had excellent music with a good dance floor. If you want a quieter experience they have seats in the back.

name: London Belle
content: This place is seriously the best! The music is bomb! I'm come here very weekend with my friends and I even brought my parents here and they had a good time! There is something for everyone here. You can't not have a good time!

name: London Belle
content: I'm in college at the U and this place is dope I'm tellin you guys it's got baller music, baller DJ's and baller drinks. It's the place to be!!

name: London Belle
content: Everything was good, not great. Decent whiskey selection. The cocktails were good. Bar did a nice job. We ordered all of the appetizers. The calamari fell short for sure. The rest were pretty good. I ordered the bison short rib. It was tender, a little dry, flavor was nice in the meat, but the dish was just kinda over the top -- too much going on. There's a berry coulee (or reduction) and pesto, and sliced peppers, and roasted carrots, and polenta (which is good, not great), and pickled onions. See the theme? Also, important to note, we came in with a large group (12), on pretty short notice, and they accommodated us well. Service was solid. All in all, I'd give it a 3.5 for the food and a 4 for the rest of the experience. But a 4 it is.

name: London Belle
content: Great food and the atmosphere is aesthetically pleasing. My waitress (Lindsay) was a gem. I highly recommend London Belle when in Salt Lake City.

name: Habitat Coffee Shop & Event Center
content: THE coffee shop destination downtown!Habitat Coffee just opened a couple of weeks ago and I am already in LOVE. For starters, the space is huge, with the cutest Bohemian-style decor. There are so many different fun areas to hang out with friends, get work done, or just relax and read! The vibe is awesome, and they even have a cute little area in a far corner that gets decorated differently every couple of weeks.Now let's talk about the coffee. Their coffee is very high quality and strong. They have a cloud coffee (off menu) with cotton candy which is very unique. I love their mocha, but my favorite drink is definitely the chai tea. I tried both iced and hot, and the iced chai is a big winner.Besides tea and coffee, they have also have small plates. Their salmon brushetta is sooooo delicious, I could eat several plates of those! Their avocado toast and spring salad are also wonderful. So much detail goes into presentation and they use fresh, high quality ingredients for everything.In case you are wondering, Habitat is closed on the weekends because they host events in their gorgeous space.Highly recommend checking out Habitat, this place is a must go!!

name: Habitat Coffee Shop & Event Center
content: This place is an experience. It's beautiful, dotted with plants and the food and coffee was delicious. The staff is pleasant, and the space itself is divine.

name: Habitat Coffee Shop & Event Center
content: Love this place! It's such a cozy environment and such yummy food and coffee!! This is the perfect spot to study, work, or even hang out with friends and have a private conversation! I love it!! DELICIOUS! Recommend  to everyone!!Best hidden secret in salt lake! Brand new, and they are already so amazing!

name: Habitat Coffee Shop & Event Center
content: Finally a coffee shop you can relax in post-COVID! This space is HUGE with tons of comfy socially distanced seating areas with a relaxed boho-chic vibe. And probably my favorite vanilla latte in SLC - it is the perfect in-between of the weak coffee shops and the ones with the really strong punchy coffee - smooth and balanced. They just opened and are still refining the menu but I got the avocado toast which was anything but basic. It came with feta, Brie, cherry tomatoes, dried fruit and nuts which I was skeptical it'd all go together but it worked! Fresh avo too, not the weird pasty stuff. It would be an awesome place to go and do some work if you are feeling a lil stir crazy working from home. Note: they are located upstairs of Himalayan Kitchen (separate entrance).

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Another goodie here in Utah. I was going to be basic and order my all American breakfast but at the last minute decided to get the hash. I am so glad I did. I was doing a happy foodie dance the entire time, every single bite was perfection I didn't want it to end. This is definitely the breakfast of champions. One thing to note if you're an out of towner, they do not serve alcohol until after 1130a on weekdays so I was bummed I didn't get to try their Bloody Mary because it looked delicious, but maybe I shouldn't have been drinking before 11a anyways haha.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Fun little spot. Great food. Depending on what you're looking for service wise, check which location you're going too. Also, if you're looking for a mimosa - check your serving time.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I had been so excited to try this place but it did not live up to my expectations.. Now I do have high standards fo food.. I got the Hoss, it isnt as big as it looks. The biscuit is good but the gravy not That great, no idea why they say its Tooele county gravy .. More like prison gravy, I have definitely had better , that could be because there was very little gravy on my plate but who knows. The Hash browns were gross I couldn't even eat them. My husband got the breakfast burrito, he was ao disappointed he didnt even finish and he is a guy who eats anything.. Seriously never leaves food on either of our plates. The seating looks nice in the front but they took us back past the kitchen that lookwd kind of trashy, I felt like I was the kid at school that wouldn't stop talking so I got put in the back of the classI wont be back.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Ham hash was delicious. Chicken and waffles was just ok. Disappointed to see a random unexplained $4 service charge added to my bill.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Amazing food always. When I go with my brother we end up ordering me shrimp 3 plates between us so we can share. Neither of us can decide on just one thing because it all tastes so good.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Loved this spot! Had a sparkling wine cocktail and pulled pork salad. Both were delicious and super friendly service- I'll be back!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Came here for brunch on Saturday with my daughter and bf, we had a good time and it was a relaxing atmosphere with a good music selection. I'm giving it a 3 star because the potatoes were really salty for my tasting and we did not like the fact that we had to order at the counter so a server does not come to your table and we had to order drinks one by one after our meal. The waffles were really good they were fluffy and had flavor, our favorite plate was the chicken and biscuits; it was well seasoned and the biscuits were really soft. Mimosas were also a plus and they're cheap!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Cute, quaint, and busy! That's what you like to see in a restaurant like this. The food was amazing, and I'd recommend it wholeheartedly for anyone looking for a non-chain restaurant for breakfast!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: So stinkin good??? First time in SLC and this was our first stop. Such an awesome little place and the food was delicious!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Delicious. Food came out fast. Clean place. Loved it. Decently priced. Coffee is good.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I consider me and my boyfriend to be regulars here. We come 3x a month and love the food every time! You can't go wrong coming here for brunch. We are big fans of the Ham Hash! A potato and kale skillet with eggs and hollandaise sauce. I get the half order because it is super filling! I recently tried the "Green eggs and ham" eggs Benedict and really enjoyed it! The only reason why they don't get 5 stars from me is because of how small and compact the building is. There's usually always a 45 minute wait because of how few tables they have. Tables that, mind you, are NOT covid regulated spaced apart. I'm young and have already had covid so I personally don't mind at all, but i know this is a factor that would affect people's decision to dine here.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: So I've been here twice now, once for breakfast and now for lunch. I got the pork sandwich which was seriously a great sandwich. The pulled pork was very lean, tender and  had a lot of flavor with a little kick to it as well. Combine that with the soft artisan style bun and this is one great sandwich. This is  not your Texas BBQ style sandwich so if that's what your looking for go to a BBQ place.  My buddies got the burger and the chicken sandwich which looked great as well. The chicken sandwich is one big honking piece of chicken so come hungry. I had a taste of it and it was very "moist" ( sorry guys best way to describe it)  and some spice to it definitely something I would go back and get myself. Paired with the tasty fries and a lemonade this was a great lunch.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Definitely top favorite for breakfast and brunch. The beignets are fricken so bomb and so delicious in the jelly it comes with.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: $5 Chicken & Waffles Thursdays! Pro tip: ask for Franck's hot sauce with it. I actually don't know if I've ever even tried their jelly...

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: This place was so great for breakfast. Highly recommend and must try for any foodie coming to Salt Lake City! The hash, was DELICIOUS. I also got myself some delicious beignets. They don't compare the NOLA's signature beignets, but still so damn good accompanied by the blueberry jelly. Must try!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Great breakfast spot before hitting the slopes. The neighborhood/surrounding area could use some fixing up.Pros:+ Service was friendly+ Food was promptCons:- Space is small- Tables not actually distancedWhat We Ordered:- Ham Hash, 3/5 (I'm not big on ham and yet I ordered this...dunno what's wrong with me)+ Kitchen Sink, 5/5 (LOVED this!)+ Chicken and Waffles, 5/5We were considering dining in, but once we saw how close the tables were and how occupied the place was, we decided not to chance it. Small space so I understand the difficulties with distancing. Take-out it is!My partner ordered the Kitchen Sink, which turned out way tastier than my Ham Hash. Not a fan of ham but ordered it since the pictures looked good and the kale won me over. Will try and substitute the ham and double up on the kale next time. Chicken and waffles, my go-to safe order. Glad it turned out nicely.Will be back! But also wanna try other SLC brunch spots.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: We ate breakfast there this morning, the food was really bad!!! My omelette was so mushy I couldn't even eat it!!! We won't be going there again!!! On our bill they charged us a service charge of 4.50 on a 22.00 bill I guess that was to make sure they got tipped.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Amazing food!! Great chill environment..We had the kitchen sink and the chicken and waffles..tasty and the perfect portion..we had to get the beignets-which were amazing!! Highly recommended

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Very cute spot! Service was super friendly. Lines are a bit long for brunch times and since it's not super big and there's more limited capacity due to covid I would try to go earlier! Got the Egg Scramble and it was yummmyyyyyyyyy. The eggs on top were perfectly cooked and the yolks were nice and runny. Only thing is towards the end of my dish I felt that all the juices and everything were a little too salty! Also tried the Chicken & Waffles and they were super good! Waffle was nice and fluffy and the chicken was fried to be nice and crispy. Would definitely come back!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: This was place was hopping. Waited a long time for a table - unavoidable, and then had to sit at a bar top which was fine, but had to order at counter, and really did not have a server so never received refills or was able to ask for anything additional. Appreciate the effort to get us a table, but it was expensive and was expecting a bit more. Food was ok.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: This is one of those places that everyone seems to rave about but I just don't understand the hype. The service is good and for being a brunch place close to downtown, the wait is never long but the food is very mediocre to me. I've gotten the kitchen sink both times I've been here and while it's good, it is nothing to write home about. Maybe I'm ordering the wrong thing but there are better places to try if you ask me.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: On the Website and when I called they mentioned they offered curbside pick up. I even asked him if I could pay over the phone right after I placed my order with him and he told me to pay when I got there. When I got there I called and he told me to walk inside the restaurant to pay......What is the point of offering curbside and a parking spot for curbside during the pandemic if you are still going to ask clients to walk inside the restaurant to pay when the place is completely packed??? It doesn't make sense at all....first time trying food, no utensils, food was ok, not the greatest.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: First place we went to eat after a day of flying in from Texas! The food was very delicious and the batter that the chicken was fried in was so good!! It had kind of a sweet hint to it. The only downfall to this place was the space for seating. It was very small. It was a cool little place in Salt Lake though.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I definitely want to try this place again, due to the ratings. But I do not recommend the Nashville hot chicken. It was not spicy, and had no flavor. Probably the worst fried chicken sandwich I've had. The fries were also pretty uneventful. My friend had the chicken and waffles, he didn't give me much detail, but he wasn't impressed.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Food is great, place is quiet and clean and comfy, location is awesome, people are super nice. I'm a huge fan.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Ugh. This is a frustrating review to write, but sadly I don't think I would even go back to the Holladay location anymore. We went a few weeks ago and it was really a bummer of an experience. They completely changed the service structure and now you have to pay for your food before you get seated... Which would have been fine, had they changed their prices slightly to reflect the lack of service(which from what we could tell did not happen). I asked the guy at the front if it was just temporary due to COVID-19 and he said it likely was permanent. It was super chaotic and not enjoyable at all. We couldn't get our "servers" to pay any attention to us when all we were asking for was water and they quite frankly seemed irritated we even bothered them. Super sad because the first time I went to this place I thought it would be a solid favorite. On a side note my chicken and waffles were unbelievably soggy and gross which made me sad too. What a bummer!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I didn't have high expectations when we decided to come here for breakfast because we had such bad experiences at other breakfast spots in the city, but this one is well worth the trip. We ordered the ham hash, the kitchen sink (with egg whites), and the cinnamon biscuits. Firstly, the portions are huge. I could only finish half of my meal. The two entrees were so flavorful and tasted really fresh. The cinnamon biscuits weren't what I expected. I thought it was just a sweet biscuit, but it's served with a syrup and strawberries. It was tasty, but I would pass if I had to choose again. I would definitely recommend this spot for breakfast and would return!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Not that great. Customer service is very serious not very friendly. Food was ok?? I won't go back!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Decent atmosphere.  Bland "Nashville" chicken sandwich - no spice or cayenne in the breading, no flavor in the sauce.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Great place for breakfast in SLC! Hash browns were tasty and had lots of flavor! The beignets though were a bit thick not as airy as normal beignets but still really good and it did have a hint of cinnamon which was really interesting. Their jelly is really tasty.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: This spot is as good as licking a plate full of spices and then eating a set of dog's balls. Seriously. If you are a foodie do not come here--Yelp seldom fails me on popular spots but this spot is honestly powered by a chef who thinks that if you throw a couple tablespoons of salt in potatoes, eggs etc anything will taste good!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Fun place and great atmosphere. Went for a great dinner with spouse. Food was excellent.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: This is the spot for a great different brunch spot. We got the ham hash, breakfast sandwich with side of gravy & chicken & waffles! I never get biscuits & gravy because my boys love mine. This did not disappoint. One of best we've every had. All's I can say is Yummmmmmm

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: They're food is good but they don't social distance you from others you're literally sitting close to others

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Amazing food and drinks. Prices are very affordable and the service is exceptional. I recommend the chicken and waffles and the Nashville hot chicken sandwich. The pig punch is amazing!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I was pleasantly surprised with the food. Sometimes when you look at the menu it doesn't look as good as it actually is in real life. The breakfast was satisfying. The workers were all great, however, Orlando was rude to the couple next to us and racist to the couple before us. The couple next to us had stood up for the couple before us, and petty Orlando wouldn't give them their beignets (which they had already paid for)!! rude!!! perhaps some male pms or poor customer service skills :)

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Food is amazing, service was great with the waitresses, food came quickly. But the manger Orlando was racist and rude and overall shouldn't have a job in costumer service. Was very mean to the couple before us and next to us. Both were lovely people. Everything there was amazing except for the manager.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Great breakfast. Limited seating, but that was expected. A definite repeat, when the opportunity presents itself. Thank you.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: This was a cute little spot. Very small, you will wait for a table, but the food was fantastic! Must try!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: First off, I just moved to the west after living in the South for awhile, so my expectations at biscuit focused restaurants is probably higher than most.From the start, we got in line that was coming out of the door, waited about 20 minutes, just to get to the counter to be told that we were only putting our name in to get a table. So we had to go wait until a table was given to us, then after seated, you had to get back into the same line to put in your order. This process of being seated and ordering is shameful. Theres no signage explaining such, and the fact that you have to get in the same line two separate times, makes absolutely no sense. I wouldn't go back just for this single reason.Then, I ordered a biscuits and gravy meal...sadly, it fell very flat. Almost no flavor in the gravy, the biscuits were mediocre, and all around, nothing interesting or unique about it. I would recommend that anyone who knows what amazing biscuits and gravy taste like, steer away from here...otherwise, you may be fine.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Great place! Great menu and good quality food. Can't wait to go back!!Only wish they opened the patio during the winter when the weather allows!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Love it! Food great, service too. Only wish they opened the patio on hot winter days like today.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: If u haven't been here you need to go for bfast or lunch if u like fun people and great food. It's loud but in a happening way. Highly recommend. Wait staff here are the kind u want to party with

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Green eggs and ham was DELICIOUS!! Love the vibes this cute dinner produces and their amazing food is just a plus! Employees are quick and efficient when it comes to taking your order at the cash register the second you walk in. FYI no alcohol before 11:30!! Overall perfect spot for breakfast and will be returning next time I find myself on Utah!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: The was the absolute worst service I have ever had at a restaurant. We came in and there were no other customers. They took 20 minutes to come take our order. Then another almost hour for the meals to come out. The person serving us tried to bring over catfish multiple times over the course of 20 minutes even though nobody ordered it. The drinks were flat. It was like the people working were all completely stoned the entire time!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Best part about this place was the bathroom art. Food was bland at best. Hair in our food. The biscuits and gravy was luke warm at best. People were nice but the food needed some flavor and some seasoning. Cool mural on the wall and some cool gifty things. Way over priced for the quality.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Cute corner space. I had chicken and waffles and it was delicious! My whole family enjoyed them.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: A nice cafe not far from downtown SLC. The place was kinda packed so that's normally a good sign for the food. I was torn between two items but ultimately went with the friend chicken and biscuits. The biscuits were big and fluffy. The chicken was similar to the biscuit and fried just right. I would have liked to have had another option for a sauce to place on the biscuit besides sausage gravy. However I made the mistake of not adding the gravy when I should have included it. The potatoes were alright. Nothing special about them. On a side note, the cinnamon biscuits were truly a treat and tasted fantastic!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Pig and a Jelly Jar for brunch?... Heck yes! The waffle with cinnamon spread is amazing, it's my all time favorite. All of my friends love this place, we have great memories eating here and will continue to make this spot our go to brunch place. The service is efficient, the food is great and the drinks are yummy, yummy.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Rude service. We weren't greeted when we entered, sat our selves after not being helped for +5 minutes and then employee made a comment due to us seating ourselves. Service could and should be better.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: It's hype was more than I thought it was alright. They don't know the difference between over easy and over hard

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: The places that Yelp takes me for brunch :-) This one was nonetheless a great selection. They have unique dishes abs presentation.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Got some good southern style chicken and biscuits in SLC and the gravy was awesome. Would highly recommend.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I was visiting SLC from Los Angeles. A friend of mine who lives out here recommended this place. I had the chicken and waffles - it was great! I'm very picky with this certain dish because some places drench both the chicken and waffles in syrup. This might be the correct way to eat this plate but I like to separate the chicken and waffles haha. Any who, the chicken was nice and juicy, not greasy like some places. The waffles were yummy as well. The service was good and the place is pretty artsy and hip. I definitely recommend this spot for breakfast or lunch!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: We strolled upon this place before taking an 8 hour road trip and boy did we luck out.This was a nice and warm little spot on a corner with awesome decorations all around. We were happy to see they had hand sanitizer as soon as you walk in and I'm sure they have social distancing in place, but we got there right before close, so we had the place to ourselves.I got the ham hash and wow it was so good and had an egg on top to make things better. They serve big portions, so I was able to share with my whole table and still get filled up. I had the house coffee to drink which was good. For desert, we saw some beignets that we were curious to try, so we took them to go to have with or coffee. Although they weren't my favorite, they were still a pretty good option since I usually don't see these on the menu.Thwy have multiple locations, so will definitely be back when in Utah.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Amazingly delicious breakfast and good service. We are from the south and the chicken and waffles were spot on. The beignets were more like dense donuts, tasty but not at all what you would expect If you've had the real thing. They had Limited indoor and outdoor seating but we felt safe and comfortable the whole time.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Just went back after being here at least a dozen times before.  Worst experience ever.  I ordered curbside because of Covid.  I parked curbside and tried calling but nobody in the restaurant answers the phone.  I tried calling 5 times.  I had to then go inside.  The place was way to overly packed all with nobody wearing masks.  The lady in line in front of me was calling people on the phone to ask what they wanted.  She stood with the only cashier for 10min.  I asked if I can just get my to go order.  I was told to wait in line by the rude cashier.  Then somebody else just walked right up to the counter told her their name an she gave them their pick up order.  What the hell? The lady holding up the line kept saying she could move to the side and the cashier kept saying "no worries, no hurry".  All while my curbside is ready that you wouldn't bring out to me curbside.  I finally get to the front I get my order and ask for hot sauce.  I am told you don't have hot sauce.  I have ordered dozens of times and am always given hot sauce.  The mix with the syrup on the chicken & waffles is amazing.  I finally get home, open up the food and it is wrong! You messed up my wifes order.  Just horrible.  Cashier was super rude as well.  All of this and you charge an automatic 18% gratuity on pick up orders.  A tip none of the employees deserved.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Best breakfast! Just had a Ham Hash & sausage gravy with biscuits and oh my!!! Espectacular!!! Hands down best breakfast in town. Complemented with a dark coffee. And I'm ready to get the day started. Till next time, thanks for the friendly service. You guys are amazing!!!! OH!!! And the cherry on top has to be the Tunes, the music playing here feeds the soul!!!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I've never understood the appeal of waffles and chicken being eaten together and have tried it various places and have never loved it. When I heard that this was the best dish here I was highly skeptical. They easily convinced me after I had my first bite into their dish. Without a doubt, it is the best chicken and waffles that I have ever eaten and it was done right. In a way that I personally had never eaten before. The chicken was incredibly crispy on the outside and very tender and moist on the inside. The waffle almost matched the crispiness of the chicken on the outside but was quite fluffy and airy on the inside. The dish had a very robust and incredible flavor and texture that I had never had before. Despite the mediocre service, the food came out quite quickly which was appreciated. Although flavorful, I would love to see the restaurant give this entree life and give it a better and more unique presentation.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: My fiancé and I just flew into town a couple hours ago. Did a search on yelp for some food and found this little gold mine. Menu look interesting, which got us in the door. We didn't want the normal, since we are not here a short time. We ordered chicken and waffles along with green eggs and ham. No Dr Suess here sadly :). The chicken and waffle can be described the same. Both were crispy, not oily, flaky, and light. They both were excellent. I substituted sausage patty for the ham. Not a big fan of ham. It's basically eggs Benedict but has green chili's in the sauce. Homemade biscuit instead of English muffin. It was awesome! It came with potatoes and they could have been a little more crispy, but overall still good. If we ever come back to Salt Lake, I will for sure be here again! Oh.....good Mimosa's too!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Spicy chicken sandwich - just enough heat to make it great. Would recommend having them put the coleslaw on the side, but that's a personal preference. Lots of fries, just the right surface area to blend crispy and soft. The beignets were just OK - satisfied my sweet craving, but did not finish them.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Maybe cz im from California and love my stuff ready to go quickly but man 35 mins turned into an hour of wait time to be seated. Then another 12 minutes for my drink and 30 waiting for food. My breakfast time turned into lunch and i was quickly annoyed. As to the food: Delicious and amazing food. Everything tasted awesome and i really have no  complaints thereThe service: It was good. No complaints. they will tell you ahead of time it will be a long wait if needed but again. 35 mins turned into 1.5 hours lol. If you care about COVID, they don't really have social distance enforced. They're using all the tables. They sanitize the tables, I don't think they sanitize chairs.Sorry for the rant maybe is my 1.5 hrs of wait from getting my food to eating but would i come back again? Although the food was great it would not be my absolute first choice. You guys should try it out though i mean I reiterate: the food was great. Follow our travel vlogs on instagram @thehungrynomadz

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Let me start by saying I was here last year and this time it was the ultimate let down. Went here with my girlfriend and got a table for 2 and was told to wait 30 minutes for a table which isn't a huge deal. When we were told our table was ready we had to order our food at the hostess desk, which was not mentioned to me 30 minutes ago when I asked for a table. In a panic we ordered since the line was then insanely long, and speaking of long our food took another 45 minutes as guests after us in line got their food before us. They also added an auto tip into the bill which is silly, I always tip high and it seems they were okay with missing out on that. But then again they took an auto tip before I even got my service, so essentially they could just be bad employees and still make 18%. We gave them the benefit of the doubt since we figured Covid shut them down and it must have been one of the first days back since everybody seemed insanely lost. Nope apparently they were only closed for a week in March and 7 months later they still are amazingly lost. Management either needs to give up on this place or rethink how they are running it because they are losing customers by the second.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Came here for dinner and realized right away it's more of a breakfast joint. I ordered the Nashville Chicken and it was on the dry side but the spice was perfect. The fries were kind of stale. They currently have dine in and a nice patio.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: We had chicken and biscuits and the cat fish. Both were good. Coleslaw wasn't fresh which was a bummer. Order at the counter, service was ok-not great. Drink refills never came. I had put the tip on when we ordered and maybe that makes them less apt to service the table. That's the only negative.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: One of my girlfriends and I went out for a girl's brunch out and she chose Pig & A Jelly Jar. She had never been, but I had and wouldn't turn down the opportunity to go again! I love the Chicken & Waffles! It's a perfect mix of sweet and savory! She had never had the dish either, and she loved it too! I also always love fresh OJ. It's the perfect addition for chicken and waffles!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: As a previous SLC local I was thrilled to be visiting salt lake and take my family back to our yummy brunch spot. We ordered/paid up front (due to COVID) at the stand  2 servings of The Pig Breakfast with the $2 upgrade to each meal for a "house made veggie patty" as listed on the menu. When our food was brought out, very quickly (impressed by the fast service!) the server said he had 2 pig breakfasts with portobello mushrooms. We said "oops sorry those must not be ours as we got the veggie patty" and he apologized and promptly went back to the kitchen to check on the order. When he came back we were informed by the server that they were out of the veggie patty and we had been given the portobello mushroom as a substitute and placed the meals in front of us. We wish that we had been given the option to confirm we would like that substitution or been given the option to decline and have the $2/meal refunded back to us. I walked up and explained this situation to the manager on staff who told me "if you read the menu it says it's a mushroom served". Nowhere on the menu did it state this but said "house made veggie patty" as a replacement for meat. After showing him the menu online I stated I simply would just like the $4 back that we had paid for this. He seemed upset but told me to get my card and then told me he was refunding $16 (2 pig breakfasts) and handed me a receipt. When I got back to my table I noticed this was someone else's receipt with a different name and charge so I went back up to let him know I had the wrong receipt. He again seemed upset with me and abruptly said "I'll find you a receipt and I've already refunded you more than was necessary". I apologized and agreed. I didn't want to bother him again so we left without ever receiving a receipt and at this time I've still received no refund to my card. It truly was not about the money but I was super disappointed in the service we received and the way I was treated. We have been here multiple times when we lived there and previously been pleased but this was a real bummer

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Enjoyable breakfast! Love that they open at 7:30 -- this is prefect for early morning coffee / breakfast before it gets too busy. The seating was clean and comfortable. They don't really have a designated waiting area because the restaurant is pretty small, so it was a bit awkward having the people waiting to be seated watching you eat while they're waiting for you to leave.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I liked very much this place. Very friendly people, great recommendation  with the menu, and delicious breakfast. Everything is very clean.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Driving through town and was looking forward to try this place out. We knew it was gonna be packed because it was a Sunday but the fact that there was no signs or directions or a staff letting us know to order first then we have to wait to get seated, which takes about like an hour and yet we see all these empty tables   Outside. The girl at the cashier was new, and need to know how to greet a customer and the lady that was training her was just point blank rude and not friendly at all. Idk if customer service is important at this place but yeah, check your staffs! I ended up getting my food to go, waited 1 hour for it even though I was told 30 mins, my fiancé had to go in to the place and asked where our food is and turns out it's been sitting there on the counter and yep u guessed it, the food was cold. I say if u want a peaceful breakfast and brunch place with good customer service go to anywhere else but here. You'll get a much better service, food probably taste so much better and you get more for your bucks.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Just when I thought the service couldn't get any worse.... Very limited seating with COVID-19 which is expected and understandable. But wouldn't that allow the possibility to have better customer service? Absolutely not here. There was about One waiter/server for every 4 to 6 people. I love the food here and have for a long time but probably will not be going back to any location. After experiencing poor service over and over I'm just over it. Poor management? Poor training? Who know. It's very unfortunate.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Unbelievably expensive, Biscuits and Gravy, Coffee, Water and OJ $43.00. I guess I should ask why it was so overwhelmingly expensive. Food was good, very creative but somehow they clipped me so hard I can't see any value. Run away, away, Pig, Pig, Pig from this place, it's not worth half what I paid.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Went here for brunch at 10:30 am before our flight back home. I thought I was gonna be able to end my vacation with some cocktails, too. Too bad they don't serve alcohol until 11:30 am. I was looking forward to try the BJ. Food was good tho!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Wow, this place really surprised me. We came here for the first time to have breakfast with my sister on her birthday. The place was clean. I loved the fact that they made accommodations to our group of 5 to allow us to sit and eat inside. The man that helped us check in was nice. The food was perfect! I have been craving this ever since we went there last time. My only hang ups with the service was the fact that they slip in the service fee without telling you before they charge you. They also didn't give us the receipt. I don't think that a service fee can be charged to someone without letting them know. That should be illegal. They have a sign typed up to the left side of the cash register when you enter by the window that says this. Also their orange juice is $5.50 and it's literally a small cup of orange juice. You have to also pay for refills. A gallon of orange juice at the grocery store doesn't even cost that much. Make it make sense.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: We found this place on yelp. There a lot of parking all over. You can eat inside or outside. They sell other little items like tea and socks. We sat outside and the tables were very spaced out. I really liked the fence they made it with recycled materials like bike parts it was very cool. We got our food the portions were very generous and the  food was delicious. The price was very reasonable. I would definitely return.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Tried this place for the first time the other week and was unfortunately extremely disappointed. I tried the veggie sink and my eggs were partially undercooked. My fiancé ordered the chicken and waffles with pork sausage. The sausage was raw in the middle which is extremely dangerous, and there was no seasoning on the fried chicken. Our friends we went with really enjoyed their meal which we were happy to hear, but it was a bummer to not be able to share the enthusiasm. We would probably try this place again in hopes that it was a fluke, but serving raw pork was a major hazard and turn off.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: My in-laws were in town from Chicago this week and we thought we would support local. The food looked great online and we were excited to try it. Our food was under-seasoned, twice-fried and underwhelming, however, we politely ate our food. While eating, my father-in-law noticed a roach on the wall. With the understanding that we are in a pandemic and every local restaurant is doing their best, he quietly reached and grabbed it with a napkin. Trying to be discreet and not cause a scene amongst the patrons, my husband handed the napkin to a busboy and informed him of the situation. The busboy took the napkin and tossed it in the trash. We sat there for another fifteen minutes and there wasn't any action taken by upper management. No explanation or apology for what SHOULD have been an alarming situation. My husband then told the hostess about the situation and asked her what action would be taken. She said she would talk to her manager and then went right back to her post at the front desk. It is alarming that this was the response to a roach crawling around in a place where they sell food. I'm absolutely appalled that I took my in-laws here and we were treated with such disdain and disregard. The most unnerving part of this situation was the health and concern of their patrons was not a top priority.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I was really disappointed at how this place is run. The food was really good, but absolutely not worth the wait when you're hungry. The staff is completely disorganized, they interrupted our order to talk to each other and try to figure out what was going on, the system makes no sense. First we had to wait 20 minutes to get a table on a monday morning, then once we were sat we didn't have our order taken and had to wait in line again to order. Then food took another 20 minutes- no cutlery was given. Tables are tiny and we were jammed in next to other diners, which is less than desirable with the corona thing happening. Sadly I won't go back.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: The service was good and the food was great. It's a very simple casual brunch place, but the food is hearty. This isn't a place for big groups since it's in a very small space. The feel of the restaurant was really casual and I wasn't expecting it to be, but I do recommend trying this place at least once if you're okay with really heavy food for brunch.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Our new favorite Sunday Morning Breakfast take-out place. They are really organized in pick/up. The food is fantastic. Blueberry LavenderThe Pig Breakfast are must tried.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Such a cute breakfast spot! I took one star off due to asking for my eggs over medium and they were very over easy, but the bacon was delicious, the Belgian waffles were tasty and the fresh fruit that came on it was great! Overall I would eat here again next time I came through town.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: So good. I want to try everything on the menu. I tried the chicken and waffles, which was my first time trying it ever anywhere. The chicken was perfect, the waffle, the syrup, the bacon and the egg. I'll def go back again.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I am a breakfast snob and I cannot emphasize enough how much I love this place. Their service is always phenomenal and the food is even better. The ham hash, chicken and waffles, and chicken and Biscuits are to die for!!!! 12/10 would recommend

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Let me start by saying the food at this location deserves a 5 star. I am compelled to give an overall 4 star due to the service. Let's start there, and then I will get to the phenomenal cuisine. The hostess was of no help. She directed us to our table without informing us that we were suppose to order at the counter. There was no obvious sign telling us to order at the counter. It was not until sitting at our table for 5 minutes that we noticed a wall menu in the background that stated to order at the counter. At this point we had to get back in a 15 minute line to order our food and even get a glass of water. With that said, I ordered the Fried Chicken and Biscuits. As a southerner I pride myself in knowing good fried chicken. This meal was unreal. It was as though Jesus was personally shaking hands with each one of my taste buds. I got the meal without mustard and added the sausage gravy. I would highly recommend this meal to anyone and it will go down as one of my all time breakfast favorites. I enjoyed a side cup of coffee which hit the spot. I will be back and recommend this place to anyone. Tip: Be aware that you need to order at the counter.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Regrettably I have to say that after the other locations I've been to, the location on 900 S is a major disappointment. We were told it would be a 30 minute wait for a table of four, but 15-20 minutes for a takeout order so we opted for takeout. Our food took 35-40 minutes and tasted fine but didn't look appealing, not worth the cost. We asked if we could be added to the seating list as there were a number of open tables throughout our entire wait for food but were denied. Having worked as a hostess and manager at a handful of restaurants I know that though you may not be able to just sit at any open table at any given time, it causes no problem whatsoever to be added to the waiting list. Myself and three of my colleagues will not be returning. P.S. Do not order the hot chocolate, it tastes like 3 parts water 1 part chocolate and they didn't put whipped cream (which is explicitly written on the menu) so my inner child was bummed. In fact, the whole beverage menu here is extremely underwhelming.Want amazing service and food? Try Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade just a couple blocks away. The service has been great, the biscuits are phenomenal and each time I've dined there the food and drinks are spectacular.
