name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: When they first opened the food was great.   And then we ordered through Doordash or Grub hub, can't remember.   I guess the cooks did not like making food for delivery.   The chicken was dumped with salt.   It was the saltiest thing I've ever tried.  Thought it was just a mistake and ordered a couple of weeks later.  Same thing and the portions were half what we normally got.   I'm sad.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: The food is good, but the service is terrible.  My wife and I tried to have breakfast at Pig & A Jelly Jar and were told it would be 20-30 minutes.  I'm okay with this and understand that less seating due to Covid- 19 makes eating out a bit of a chore sometimes.  What I'm not okay with is watching 4 tables get cleared and then receive our message to be seated only to have a party of 8 walk right in and get their order taken before ours.  Another couple that had been waiting longer experienced the same treatment and was also frustrated.  When I asked the host why we weren't taken care of first I was told that larger party guests are always taken care of before 2 party guests.  Now don't get me wrong, I understand that during a pandemic it is difficult to run a restaurant, but treat your guests equally.  The host had no idea how much we were going to spend, as it's possible we were ordering for others and getting take out. When the host explained the way they handle 2 party tables I said "I'm done, I do not want to eat here!"   During these crazy times, I have been trying very hard to spend my money locally and there are plenty of places to spend.  It will be very difficult to convince myself to return to Pig & A Jelly Jar.  Two stars because I enjoy the food.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: So delicious!! My husband and I had been here a couple times and loved it so we brought my sister who's from another state and she couldn't get enough. One of the best chicken sandwiches we've ever had and the fries were perfect. My husbands dish had hollandaise on it and wow it was amazing.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I love their chicken and waffles! The savory sugary combo cannot be beat. The wait is never too long and the customer service is on point.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: The area of this place is pretty bad . The food was good and the service was good . Definitely like to support the smaller guys .

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Pig & a Jelly Jar was sooo good. Amazing brunch menu with the best jams. The blueberry lavender jam was off the charts. The bun on the pig burger was a special treat that made the burger pop!!! Definitely recommend a brunch date here. #CozyVibes

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: In town visiting from California.We decided to go on Yelp We were searching for a breakfast spot. We arrived around 1:00 went in and was told the wait would be around 30 mins. We decided to wait we only waited about 20 minutes so that was a plus. For a Breakfast place the menu is on the small side.Daughter was hoping for pancakes which she usually orders. So she ordered the Belgian fruit waffle she said it was scrumptious and she enjoyed the cinnamon cream. Family was very  satisfied with their dishes. Ordering was easy and staff was nice. When we're back in town we will return again.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Awesome place for breakfast with outside seating. Came here for breakfast on our last day in SLC. Ordered chicken and biscuits and the dish was really tasty with a generous portion. Place was busy too with lots of people placing to go orders or waiting for a table. Can't say I blame them. Was thoroughly impressed.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: I was really expecting more from this place. First, they only have maybe two items that are gluten free. This is annoying since they promote they are a gluten free restaurant on Yelp. I ordered the burger medium, and it was well done. My partner ordered some bbq pork sandwich. It was such a weird flavor and not appealing. Also their fries definitely come from the freezer. We left unsatisfied and feeling bloated and gross.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Rude and horrible experience right from the door. Guy wearing navy shirt with light blue eyes was horrible. Talking over guest he was helping to tell us that we have to wait a long time. We asked him how long we would have to wait only to get a response of "well I can't kick people out for you guys, come on!" Horrible. Don't even want to try coming back. Ain't the time to act like that.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Fantastic find in SLC for brunch/lunch.  Loved the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich - best I've ever had...heat kicks in at end.  Fried chicken and biscuits outstanding too.  Staff was great and sanitizing often.  Will be back!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Absolutely delicious. We ordered the Ham Hash and the Fried Chicken and biscuits. (Be sure to add the sausage gravy.) we also grabbed the beignets which weren't great (very over cooked, a dark brown and very tough to bite) but it didn't take away from how great the food was. We'll definitely be back!

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Dissatisfied summed up my take about this place. It really was. So many 5 star reviews? For what? Average tasting food! I came here with really high expectations, but it was quickly shot down after the slow service. My family of four arrived here before the crowd. A Tuesday afternoon. We placed our orders and were seated at the corner near the kitchen and restroom. About 10 or 15 minutes went by, I noticed that a couple that had been sitting at the window table was just now getting their food. They (couple) have been there before we had entered the restaurant. I immediately though, whelp, it's going to take a while for us to get our food. And yes, I was correct! I sat and waited as a Lady and her two little boys got their food. They were the party who had ordered before us. After some time, the couple that had placed their order, after we had sat, was now getting theirs! Wait a minute now! It's been over a half an hour where's our food!? Well it wasn't soon after because the next group that came after said couple was now getting their food! Unbelievable!My wife had let out a "finally!" frustration when our food was finally brought out. Our waiter didn't provide us with as explanation for the delay nor did I get a refill on my water. All of our plate looked good, but tasted so meh. The chicken on both of our plates were tasteless. I took one taste of potatoes that came with my chicken and biscuits and never ate them again. The fries and gravy was underwhelming. I took the fired egg and threw them on chicken and biscuit sandwich for some flavor. The cinnamon biscuit was meh too! Beignets were also ordered, but no photos were taken of them. They taste nothing like Beignets, but they were better than the cinnamon biscuits. We ended up wasting a lot our food because they just weren't good. A disappointment and no way can I recommend this place to anyone. We had Brunch at Sweet Lake Biscuits & Limeade a week before and would much recommend them over this place here. 2 stars because price.

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: Great terrace allowing dogs .Went several times and food is not the best Potatoes were not fully cooked for instance

name: Pig & a Jelly Jar
content: We were really looking forward to trying Pig and a Jelly Jar for breakfast before returning home to Nashville after our trip to the National Parks and Salt Lake City but we were unfortunately disappointed. I understand COVID has things a little turned upside down but basic service should not be one of them.When we arrived, the girl at the counter told us to download the menu, which we did, and let us know our table was outside on the patio. She didn't tell us exactly which table was ours, so we guessed, and also didn't tell us we needed to order with her before sitting down. We had gone to our table and were waiting for someone to take our order for about 15 minutes before she finally waved to us to place our order inside.While we were waiting on our food, the trash came to be collected. Not a problem, other than we were seated right next to a long row of cans. When the cans were returned the lids did not close. The smell was terrible! My husband went inside to let one of the wait staff know about the cans and smell. After they had not come to close the lids for about 10 minutes, our son went to close the lids, fortunately right as our food was coming out. Eventually, someone from the restaurant came to move the cans around back and away from the patio area. At no time did he apologize for the inconvenience or acknowledge that my son had closed the lids. He essentially ignored us altogether. Although there was nothing the restaurant could do about it, food had fallen onto the hot street and was beginning to attract flies. Not making for a pleasant dining experience, as you can imagine.As for the food, it was just ok. I ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken had no flavor and I didn't finish it. The waffle was good. I ordered coffee which had grounds in the bottom of the cup. My husband had the hash with "country ham." The ham was not the country ham we are used to in the south. It was just regular ham. He thought it was pretty good though. My son had the waffles with fruit. He thought it was good also...however the wait staff failed to bring his milk to him after being asked several times.Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to friends or family traveling to SLC. It was nothing to write home about, although the locals seemed to like it as there were several parties waiting as we were leaving. Pig and A Jelly Jar did not live up to our expectations and we were disappointed with our last SLC dining experience.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: YUM!  this place was a gem to find and dine.  the wait staff was hysterical and fun.  We will be back!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: They have wonderful food and the very best service. Got the lunch special. Chicken and veg with pot stickers.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Do yourself a favor and try the chicken wings the garlic butter wings are amazing. Can't wait to try the Saigon wings later.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Excellent fresh food nice staff. Our hostess recommended a dish and it was awesome. Be adventurous and try something new.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: The food was delicious! The location is prime and the service was exceptional! I was in the mood for delicious pho and that's exactly what I got! Thank you!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This place has awesome food and equally great customer service! Will come back again when I am in SLC.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Finally found a place with amazing pho! Everything they serve is absolutely flavorful, authentic and delicious! You must give this place a try!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Oh my, the food was amazing! My sister and I were looking for a great local place to eat and we definitely found it. I ordered General Tso and she got Orange chicken, both equally good, so much flavor. The chicken was sliced skinny, which I loved, texture was perfect  Staff were so attentive and safely followed covid guidelines.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: We love red lotus! This is one of our favorite Chinese restaurants in town. Definitely eating here again.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Friendly staff, super fast. We ordered takeout and they were watching for our car and brought it right to us curbside. The food was delicious. Vegetables fresh and not  overcooked. Pon pon chicken had just the right balance of sweet and heat. (My husband and I have differing tolerances for spicy and we both loved it.) We will be back, and we look forward to dining in soon as the restaurant looked cozy.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This place is amazing and we definitely recommend it to anyone. We got the yakisoba noodles, they were delicious, filling, and no weird flavors or textures. We also got the potstickers, which were delicious, the sauce perfectly balanced out the savory in the potstickers. The fried rice was delicious, and it was amazing even when reheated.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: The food was great! Customer service was also friendly and fast. My favorite item was the pho. Definitely recommend you visit

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: So freaking amazing. I've been looking for great Chinese food in Utah for years and finally found this restaurant! Every single thing We ordered for takeout was perfect and delicious, like over the top astonishing. Egg rolls, won tons, walnut shrimp, pon pon chicken and szechuan tofu, as well as steamed rice were all prepared masterfully. I drove from Layton to SLC downtown to pick up and will do so again and again for this food.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Simply amazing food! Best potstickers in SLC. We came in because they have vegan options for my fiancé and it was recommended from one of her groups. We will definitely be back for more.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Just tried them for take out and was not disappointed! We had a huge order--9 dishes in total! And it was completely correct and on time. The veggie pho was delicious, and they package it in a way that keeps everything fresh. No soggy noodles, sprouts, or tofu! The general tso's chicken was delicious, as was the szechuan beef. It all tasted completely fresh and of the highest quality.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Great take out  - brought it to my car and it was delicious. We will repeat! Menu is simple and straightforward- I would term the food American-Chinese - but it is fresh and delicious- packed well which is super important for take-out

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: My SO and I both got the general tso's chicken(made with vegan chicken) and it was INCREDIBLE. We were blown away with how tasty the food was and our server was also super friendly and made the experience that much more enjoyable. We highly recommend eating here if you want delicious Chinese food and awesome service

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Amazing food that came out fast. We loved everything that we ate. The service was just as good. Can't wait to go back!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This restaurant was not only very clean and well-oriented around covid still being prevalent, but the food was AMAZINGGG!!! Everything on the menu is the perfect amount of food for some leftovers later. Not to mention, the customer service was a 10/10 the whole time I was there from moment in to moment out. If I could leave more stars on this place, I would without a doubt.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This restaurant is very one of a kind. I walked in and the person that greeted me was extremely kind and professional. I ordered a lunch combo with sweet and sour chicken, rice and potstickers. I also got a coke for the drink. I was pleasantly surprised with how fast everything came out and was ready for me to eat. The server checked in on me several times while I was enjoying my meal and was always super nice. The food tasted great, I loved all the decorations in the restaurant, they are doing well at covid precautions, the prices were awesome. I couldn't say enough great things about this restaurant!You definitely want to pay a visit here if you haven't already.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This has turned into on of our favorite places. Family owned and incredibly nice. Amazing food. Great flavor. Always fresh.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This place is delicious! We've done take out from here a couple of times and the food was hot and delightful! We dined in recently and the service matched the taste. Absolutely spectacular staff and tasty food! The atmosphere is relaxed, modern, and clean. Loved the music they were playing too! Cant go wrong with The Roots.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Amazing food! The General Tsao's was the best I've ever had. Also loved the Walnut shrimp! Great service as well.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Great food great hospitality! Family run business. Walnut shrimp was delicious!! Also enjoyed the pho and sake. Really great service

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Our meal had some real highlights and we'll be back. Here's a breakdown of our order- Tai chien crispy chicken: 10/10 definitely get this!- Shrimp yakisoba noodles: this was good, I'd get it again- Kung pao: the sauce was mostly flavorless and different from how kung pao typically tastesI'll also mention the service was very friendly and welcoming! This place is worth checking out.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: We tried this place out for our date night and we were so pleased! The atmosphere is great. It's quaint and well decorated with a great ambiance. The staff was attentive and very friendly. The food was really good and the portions were generous. We'll definitely come here again!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Love the authentic food from this family owned restaurant. I typically do not order tofu dishes when I go out, but I find myself ordering tofu from Red Lotus every time. In addition to their tofu dishes I really enjoy their hot and sour soup and tai chien chicken. They are full of flavor with just the right amount spice. Make sure to check out their refreshing and unique drink menu as you will not be disappointed. Definitely try this place out for dine-in or takeout. I've ordered takeout numerous times and the food is just as good and fresh as if I were dining in.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Had the sesame chicken and wings. They were ok. Had a wired flavor. Nothing bad but nothing great. For the price I should have gone somewhere else and had a steak dinner! Was disappointed and expected good things from all the 5 star reviews.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: We stopped here for an early dinner. The server was very attentive. We had the wings, which were absolutely fabulous! Pot stickers, sweet and sour chicken and white rice. Super simple and very good! This restaurant was clean and welcoming. We will be back!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: I love this place! I can't tell you how many times I've come and always been greeted with the nicest people! The foods so good too! I always get there Bun noodle salad. Wonderful place and wonderful service!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Free parking just north of the building, great friendly service, and the food was delicious  we got Yakisoba noodles (mixed protein), Pho, Vermicelli noodles (with pork and egg rolls), and cashew shrimp. For dessert, we had fried bananas over ice cream topped w whip cream. So good. We will be back for sure!!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: I ordered delivery via GrubHub and it was so good! After a long day I wanted to try something new and heard they have vegan options. Their vegan chicken is on point and overall their food is great quality. Tofu was fried perfect IMO. We will be ordering again. Good job guys and thanks for having a variety of plant based options!!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Wow!  This place is MAGNIFICENT!  We came for a late lunch/early dinner around 4pm.  It was so delicious.  I ordered a sesame chicken and my husband had kung pao chicken.  We also ordered chicken fried rice.  Beautiful dishes and they were so flavorful and fresh.  The vegetables were cooked so perfectly and they seemed so fresh.  The sauce it was in was the perfect amount and so well paired with all the ingredients! It was really decent portions and I felt like the value we paid for was well deserved in their end.  We had little to no wait time and the service was fantastic.  We were always well attended to and our drinks were refilled as needed.  I loved the atmosphere and the industrial feel of the restaurant.  We were seated indoors, but the outdoor seating seemed really clean and well kept. There is a little parking lot to the side that you can park in for free although I imagine during a lunch rush there wouldn't be a ton of room available. I'm excited to go back again and take my friends from out of town.  I'd recommend anyone to stop by and have a nice fresh meal.  Also as a side note, it felt like they were being very cautious with Covid.  Very clean, hand sanitizer around, one time use paper menus or you can scan the QR code on the table for a digital menu.  Everyone should visit!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: The pho rocked my socks off. Delicious! The service is terrific. Very friendly staff. Pretty good prices and a very fun location.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Amazing Pho and nice atmosphere! We ate outside and had a great experience. Friendly staff, reasonably priced.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Craved pho after a hike in snowbird! Looked at all the pho places in the greater salt lake area, and settled on this one. As picky pho enthusiasts from Chicago and Los Angeles, we're always skeptical on pho spots! It's all about the broth. This place will be our go to in salt lake! The chicken pho is great, and the staff is super friendly, and accommodating. We really enjoyed everything thoroughly. Pot stickers are good as well! You know when you don't have to dress the pho up, it's good!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: There were 3 of us and we all wanted to try different things.Loved the bun with tofu, Thai tea, kumquat ginger drink, spring rolls, pot stickers and cream cheese wontons. What wasn't good was the Pho it was on the greasy side without much essence. Service was excellent and we sat outside in the shade which had a nice breeze.For sure will be back!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Found this restaurant on a whim when it was late on a Thursday night, and we were hoping to get some food after a long day. The food was fresh and delicious! It was so good that we got takeout from them again the next day. I love that Red Lotus Bistro is a local, family-run restaurant, and I'm looking forward to ordering from them again! They are now one of my new favorite restaurants in SLC!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Wooooowwwwwwwwwwwww!!! This is the best general t'so I have ever had! I've had general tso in California! Up and down the coast! In New York City! Shanghai 21 was my spot in the city! This place supersedes anything I've come across! If you haven't been here you must! It's so delicious! The outside is so crispy and the inside so tender! It's the perfect combination! Customer service was 100! They're literally so friendly. Remember y'all Locally owned businesses need us more than ever!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Had the secret squid appetizer, which was delicious! Staff was excellent, and outdoor seating was very nice. Highly recommend the Tai Chien Chicken.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Always friendly and helpful.  The food is great.  Not super greasy (which is a normalcy for Chinese and Thai).  It's nice to see restaurants powering through Covid and making great food.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This food was much needed! The vermicelli noodle salad was a refreshing and filling entree and the cream cheese wontons were an absolute treat!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Absolutely top tier restaurant, great customer service got to meet the chef and he went out of his way to make our meal more spicy for our tables delight. Couldn't say enough great things about this place and can't wait to eat here again.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Super good food.  Food taste is a 5; price, quantity, and location drop it a star.  Is that such a bad thing, that I want more of it? :) .  Sauces are sweet, and chicken is great.  I will be back for more.Orange chicken was very sweet, which I love (I know not everybody does, so just good to know).General Tso as well as Sesame chicken were out of this world.  Sesame chicken had onion and really did something great to it.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: My favorite Chinese food in the city! COVID has forced me to only order to go from here, but every time the food is hot and fresh. Fried food stays crunchy, the flavors are great, and the service is top notch. No better Chinese food in the valley.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: We stopped through Salt Lake City on our way back from going to Yellowstone and The Grand Tetons. We had nine of us and we were looking for a restaurant that would accommodate all of us. We also wanted to taste some of the local fare instead of going to a chain. We decided on Chinese and this place did not disappoint!! The owner was so gracious and welcoming. He had great recommendations, our favorite was Pon Pon chicken. A must have! We were surprised to hear they had just recently opened because their service and food seemed like they're seasoned veterans.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: I'm going 5 stars. Service was friendly and prompt without being overbearing and the food was really delicious.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This is quickly becoming my favorite SLC Chinese food spot. Their 30+ years of experience really shows. The food is and tastes clean and the flavors bright. The staff is friendly and eager to help and answer questions. The lunch specials are very satisfying with all the extras. Affordable and very quick for those who are on a tight schedule downtown. Right now, they are operating off a limited menu for both curbside and dine-in. I can't wait for the larger menu which I hope will have more traditional items. My favorite has been the Tai Chen chicken. Saucy yet crispy.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This place hits the spot! If you're looking for a good Chinese fusion restaurant, I highly recommend this place.  Give the Tai Chien Chicken a shot, my personal favorite. My second fav would be the Pon Pon Chicken :)

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: You have got to try this place.  Pon pon chicken was the best i've ever had.  eggrolls great! employees awesome!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Anthony was our waiter and he did an amazing job! He was so polite and took care of us with whatever we needed. And the food was awesome! Try the cream cheese wantons!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Always a great go to!  You can tell the staff takes great pride and care of their restaurant. They have always been curtious and nice every time I have visited. The food is delicious and there's something for everyone! They also have vegetarian and vegan options. I've had almost everything on the menu except for the pho, and I've never been disappointed. I highly suggest yakisoba, General Tso chicken, and Thai Tea. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This place is too cute, the owners are very friendly and such nice people. The food is amazing!!!!!! Although this place has only been here for two months the service here is nothing short of professional. This place has great vibes, great food, and great service. Would totally recommend if you are looking for great Asian food at very reasonable prices. Especially cute for a quiet date night and even to bring your whole family!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: We just had the most amazing meal at red lotus!! The staff were extremely friendly and provided us great service every step of the way. From the demeanor over the phone to the bill. Food is great too. I liked the Vietnamese egg rolls the most! Check it out!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Great food! Authentic is the best way to describe it and it has a unique taste that's hard to come by. Experience it for yourself and thank me later.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: One of the most enjoyable dining experiences I've had in a long time. Excellent food and amazing service.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Hands down the best Chinese and Vietnamese food in Utah. The Walnut shrimp are so fantastic! My husband has been a loyal Mi La Cia vermicelli noodle lover 20 years and he proclaimed Red Lotus vermicelli salad even better. In fact I think he used the word perfect! The pon pon chicken is heavenly and the veggie stir fry is so yummy. LOVE this place!!!!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Super Good! The veggie pho and potstickers are awesome.The ingredients are super fresh too. I reccomend:Veggie PhoPot StickersGinger Kumquat drink.I will definitely be back !!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Such an amazing restaurant that is also family-run! The customer service is so awesome and the food is just as great! My family is visiting Salt Lake City and was craving Chinese food, thank God we saw Red Lotus Bistro while walking around the city earlier today. I got the Pork and Egg Roll Vermicelli Noodle Salad and it was absolutely delicious!!!! We were even greeted by the owner himself while he let us try his wonderfully flavorful and spicy chili and when we were packing up our leftovers, they threw in some extra yummy food! Portions were great and i'm excited to come back before we leave Salt Lake City!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: While in Salt Lake City, I was looking for something I haven't had in a while and found this hem of Chinese food.  Red Lotus Bistro, you rocked my night.  Haven't had Chinese food in 2 years since I left Seattle, and you didn't disappoint!  Thank you for allowing me the privilege of good Chinese food once more.  where I live in Arizona there is no Chinese food worth indulging in.  The kumquat ginger basil seed refresher as so good.  If you wanna know, the Orange chicken and general tso's chicken was very good considering the Pablo crust it's done in.  Also the house special combination fried rice, OMG was the bomb!! Got another order to go.  I feel so glutinous.. but it was worth it after 2 years.  Thanks again Red Lotus!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Amazing food, amazing service. The pon pon chicken was amazing, rice amazing and the Vietnamese egg rolls are AMAZING. Definitely will be back.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: The food was great. We ordered the orange chicken which tasted completely different from the typical orange chicken. It had an orange taste to it and the chicken tasted fresh. We also ordered the pon pon chicken and it is now going to be the main one that I'll come to get when I come back. It was crunchy on the outside and the sauce tasted freaking good and the chicken was nice. The sesame chicken was very good too. Staff was great and kind.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: This place was AWESOME best service I've had in a long time and great food! They had the best attitude and I will definately be coming back

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: #thankyouthursday Thank you to this wonderful family run business who have been blessing us with their delicious food since even before this new restaurant opened, and thank you for serving our community even through this pandemic. I've gotten to know Anthony (owner) and his family over the years and can confidently say that they are some of the hardest working people I know and are passionate about what they do. Their food is always delicious and meets our expectations. We really love their hot and sour soup and Pon pon chicken!

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Awesome food and service, highly recommend.  Amazing ponpon chicken, my wife devours their cream cheese wontons.

name: Red Lotus Bistro
content: Okay, due to COVID-19, many of my favorite Chinese/Vietnamese spots have closed down entirely for the time being  and I have been having majority cravings for it. I ordered from Red Lotus Bistro yesterday and it was beyond delicious! We ordered Tai Chien Chicken and Sweet and Sour Chicken with Cream Cheese Wontons, Hot & Sour Soup, and Egg Flower Soup. First off, service was beyond great. They took extra precautions with curbside pick up and taking payment. Food was not greasy, nice and crispy but still juicy!

name: All Chay
content: Over the past six years, All Chay has been consistently amazing. I visit once a week and I'm always happy with my lunch! You can always count on the food being fresh and delicious. The service is always fast, polite, and friendly.  All Chay is my favorite restaurant in Salt Lake City!

name: All Chay
content: Tons of great options on the menu, it was super hard to decide. Ended up trying a bit of the Lemongrass Tofu Banh Mi, Drumsticks, Pho, and Teriyaki Chicken Fried Rice. The Banh Mi was a little heavy on the bread compared to the ingredients. The Drumsticks could've used a little more breadcrumbs, but was super tasty with the sauce. The Pho was awesome, probably the best vegetarian pho I've had (although I'm not a huge fan) -- it has lots of tofu and pieces of fake beef which really helped! The Teriyaki Chicken dish was probably my favorite, I love the sauce and the texture of the chicken.Overall, I support most vegetarian places pretty strongly -- I love that this is place is purely Vietnamese food. I think it's unique and really worth trying, would love to see it get more business!

name: All Chay
content: I love this place! Their Vietnamese Ban Mi sandwiches are the best! Perfect meal when you want fresh ingredients and nothing too heavy.

name: All Chay
content: Delicious, affordable, and super sweet & considerate service. We ordered the BBQ noodle salad, which had very generous portions. The soy protein is delicious and convincing. The egg rolls were also super generous for about $4, and yummy as heck. Highly recommend! Support this local business!

name: All Chay
content: We were visiting SLC for 2 weeks and came here twice!! I love Vietnamese food, and miss it since becoming vegetarian. My husband and I agreed everything on the menu was so flavorful, and the meat substitutes were some of the best I've had. The pho was a massive bowl and we had every drop. The rolls were creative and fresh, as was the banh mi. The noodle bowl was my favorite and I was thrilled to have so many options. We got take out once and ate there once. It's a very big space so we felt comfortable despite COVID, and the food was prepared SO quickly. Everyone was so nice. If I lived here I'd order every week!!

name: All Chay
content: I might be the only less than fully satisfied customer here. Food was okay, appreciated a fully vegetarian menu, but thought the taste of our sandwich and noodles were mediocre at best. The place has a buffet-like decor. Our experience was more 3.5 stars rather than 4, but rounded up. Would probably not come back.

name: All Chay
content: I love chicken nuggets. I've eaten them all my life. The perfect chicken nugget is where breading and crispiness meet to make a magical thing. The crispy nuggets here have that. I could eat them all day long. The winter rolls were amazing too and so was the lemon grass tofu. If I wasn't really trying to eat vegan I would still really enjoy this place.

name: All Chay
content: This place is sooooo good. Even my non vegan people loved it!! Best Noodle bowl I've ever had. (That says a lot)

name: All Chay
content: We really enjoyed our food, great for vegetarians!  It's nice to support a restaurant in our community and would certainly return:)

name: All Chay
content: All Chay has my heart. I've tried most of their noodles dishes as well as all the appetizers and drinks. Carrot juice is delicious and not sweet. Thai iced tea is refreshing and light. Vietnamese coffee is a bit too sweet for me but it's creamy and tasty. They've got delicious pho, best broth in town imo. I find myself craving it all the time. All Chay egg rolls are so good and made in house! You ought to give them a try. I usually get pho with extra veggies, thai iced tea, all Chay egg rolls and flan (lol yes, flan, so so good! The sauce is to die for). If I'm not feeling pho, I get the bbq noodle salad, side of pho broth, flan and thai iced tea.

name: All Chay
content: I ordered pho along with bahn mi, spring rolls, and Thai iced tea. Their vegetable-based broth tasted better than many meat-based broths from other Vietnamese restaurants.

name: All Chay
content: So as you can tell by looking at my profile, I do not go out of my way to rate ANYTHING that is not 5 stars. This place absolutely deserves all 5 of them! I am originally from the Bay Area where there is an abundance of good vegan options. I am particularly fond of Asian food, Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese, Thai... all of it! All Chay is hands down the best vegan Asian food I have ever had. I would even dare to say best Asian food period, come for me meat eaters! I have tried most of the menu at this point and have not found a single thing I dislike about any of their dishes. Not only is the food delicious, customer service at this place is A1. Sooo damn happy I found this place! Do yourself a favor and bask yourself in the joy that is All Chay!

name: All Chay
content: This place is absolutely fabulous. I was in town from Denver, where we don't have any options for all vegan Asian oddly enough. The flavors are right. My recommendation is to get the "beef" pho and the four seasons rolls. A delicious filling vegan meal that is uniquely flavorful. We wish we could go all the time.

name: All Chay
content: We had to order takeout because of COVID.  We were in the area for a volleyball tournament and Pho sounded good.  We are from Los Angeles and are used to good vegan Pho in our area and this place was just as good!!!!  We had the 2nd pho on the menu and the broth and noodles were so yummy!  I even had a gluten free version.  The soup came with all sorts of tofu and tofu fake meets like shrimp.  Totally filled us up and can't wait to go back again when we are in town.  The only thing we had any issues was that they packed all of our 3 soups in one plastic bag and it was too full.  I had my husband hold the bag in the car and one of the soups toppled over onto him and scalded him.  Next time we will ask for 2 bags if the bags are towering over with soup.

name: All Chay
content: As a SLC veggie resident, this is one of my favorite spots!!! I always go here as my go to Vietnamese place and it never disappoints. Take out only during COVID times which is just perfect . They now have drumsticks too, which are just incredible!!!

name: All Chay
content: Always delicious have been going for lunch for the past couple years. Mongolian Noodle Salad and Teriyaki Chicken Bahn Mi are my favs. Not even vegan but still love it!

name: All Chay
content: Owner is super friendly, very environmentally conscious and the food is absolutely delicious!Hands down the best Vegan Vietnamese food I've ever had, if not the best vegan food I've ever had in general.Don't take my word for it, check it out yourself!

name: All Chay
content: Do you love delicious food and sweet owners? Look no further than All Chay. Amazing mock meats, flavors, and everything in between.

name: All Chay
content: Holy sacred cow !!!! I think I just found vegan nirvana Amazing, delicious food. Wonderful quick service, and fabulous hospitality.The tranquil music playing really enhanced the love and gratitude I felt while savoring my meal .MY NEW FAVORITE . THANK YOU ALL CHAY !

name: All Chay
content: One of my favorite spots in SLC. Their food is to die for! Most people who go there don't even know it's vegan/veterinarian. I highly recommend this to anyone, whether or not you eat meat.

name: All Chay
content: This place is great! I was skeptical since I'm not vegan, but I couldn't even tell it was not meat. The noodle salad was great! I'll be back soon.

name: All Chay
content: Got to the counter and ordered a BBQ Noodle Salad, and was about ready to order a Bahn Mi sandwich too, only to be told that there was no real meat because this was a vegetarian restaurant, which totally took me by surprise. The BBQ faux meat was actually not too bad. It's quite possible I may not have even known it wasn't meat, though I probably would have thought it was a little "different". The portion size was rather decent too. Overall, it was okay.

name: All Chay
content: I'd consider this place a local vegan hidden gem! Their food is so comforting, and my kids felt right at home with their vegan chicken nuggets. I forgot the name of the soup I ordered but I love the way the flavors blended together (especially with fresh, raw toppings) and we were pleasantly surprised to find it came with all the fake meat products you can think of including a faux shrimp that was pretty realistic. Absolutely amazing and the owners are super sweet.

name: All Chay
content: Oh man! I might be converted to a vegetarian by all chay, we happen to have a friend with us who's pescatarian so she searched for some place that she can eat. This one is a lovely surprise.

name: All Chay
content: Really good vegetarian food- lemongrass dishes. Lemongrass rice could be a little wetter. The egg rolls were excellent

name: All Chay
content: Nothing fancy about the atmosphere. Walked it to the place being Smokey from the kitchen, left with my closes smelling. The broth for the Pho was good. The tofu in the pho was ok and the beef was also just ok. The dish didn't come with very much meet in it and they gave you a limited amount of sprouts and basil to add

name: All Chay
content: Best vegan restaurant in town!!!! The shrimp was great & the bowl was super flavorful & healthy. Would come back to try the rest of the menu. I usually don't like fried spring rolls, but they do it so well here; super in love.

name: All Chay
content: This place is more of a 3 in my opinion, but given that SLC doesn't have much competition for Asian vegan food (that I saw), I'm bumping it up a star. We tried the four seasons spring rolls. We could barely tell the difference between each one.. The peanut sauce was really weird too and didn't taste like your usual peanut sauce.Then for entrees , we had a vermicelli bowl and banh mi. The banh mi and shrimps in the bowl were probably the better part of the meal. Although the sandwich did miss the usual zing and crunch, it was decent. The vermicelli bun was fresh, but again missing in flavor.All in all, it was a decent meal. But definitely not that impressive in terms of vegan food or Vietnamese food.

name: All Chay
content: Fantastic food. I'm no vegan but everything here was really good. I was really blown away by the pho. The broth tastes very much if not exactly alike as my favorite overnight beef bone simmered broth.I got the lemongrass.... Something. The texture resembled chicken. Whatever that was, oh I slaughtered that. Nice little gem here, will return.

name: All Chay
content: Yes! Was almost turned away by the interior, but they have amazing food. I would like to go back and try more dishes.

name: All Chay
content: We saw flies in the dining area all the time, and eventually eat out a piece of hair that does not belong to me......

name: All Chay
content: So let me start by saying how awesome the staff is let alone how amazing the food is. the staff always treats us like family especially Miss Chow that works often. She's a beautiful soul inside and out and always cheers us up when we come in. The food is very amazing and you're sure to leave with a full stomach and be satisfied. Vegan or not this place is perfect for anyone who loves a Vietnamese food experience.

name: All Chay
content: OMG there are sooooo many vegetarian options it's so exciting!! Vegetarian Vietnamese food is often limited to just a few dishes at most restaurants so I was excited to explore more vietnamese cuisine at this spot. I had the ginger tofu which was really delicious - the brown sauce was flavorful and tasty. Bahn Mi was decent - I've had better ones but not bad. The Four Seasons roll was nice and it came with nice peanut sauce. I enjoyed my meal here despite the minimalistic/slightly rustic ambiance.

name: All Chay
content: Awesome place.  Food was superb. My family is vegetarian and loved the food.  We stopped here on our way to Yellowstone.  So, on the return all the family members said they want to eat only at All Chay. Its a bit of a hole in the wall but food is really nice.  So, I agreed and when we reached at 5pm, we realized that being July 4th, the family closed the restaurant early and were leaving.  When we told them we really enjoyed their food and came back for it, they were so nice that they reopened it just for us.  We felt bad to have them go back in as they were leaving but they were extremely nice and gracious.  The gentleman who owns the place shared his stories of how he came out of Vietnam in the boat and moved to America. His niece and daughter got the food together and we said we will take it to go.  Absolutely wonderful restaurant and family that operates it.  Please do make it a stop over when you go there if you enjoy vegan food.

name: All Chay
content: Really wonderful vegan food, my non vegan friends love it too! Reasonably priced and very fast service. Run by very kind people.

name: All Chay
content: We really loved the food here- when we were driving to the location I thought maybe I put in the wrong address, sees that it was in a residential area in a low income area. Which I didn't know how this experience would start or end at the beginning. But the food was absolutely delicious the decor and seating felt like you were in a soup kitchen, no joke.  But the vegan food! Delicious for sure, so look past the environmental area and come and dine here!

name: All Chay
content: Amazing pho. All vegan options with great spring rolls and soup! Owner is extremely nice and staff is very friendly/helpful. Will be back soon!

name: All Chay
content: so freaking good. the lady working was super nice. food came quickly and was delightful. I wish i could go here every day

name: All Chay
content: I'm so happy a vegan restaurant exists in Rose Park! The service here is always outstanding and friendly and the food is delicious! The pho is unbeatable, and the bahn mi is awesome. I recommend asking for a little extra aioli in the bahn me, though, but that's just a personal preference.

name: All Chay
content: Delicious! One of our local favorites. We eat here about once a week. We love the noodle salads and the bahn mi sandwiches. All the appetizers are great too along with the Tai Iced Tea. The staff is so friendly. I just love this place

name: All Chay
content: Whatever you have read and heard about this place is absolutely true!! I had the ocean love and the vegan shrimp was absolutely crispy on the outside and soft on the inside while my friend had the lemongrass tofu. We like it a little spicy so had to add extra spice but the taste was fantastic. Looks like a little quantity but boy it filled us for a long time!

name: All Chay
content: Their bean curd  Banh Mi is excellent. Super fresh and tasty. I haven't tried their pho yet but I'm looking forward to it!

name: All Chay
content: Love this place. Everything on the Menu is fantastic. The All Chay Bahn Mi is one of my favorites as is the Lemongrass Fried Rice and the Crispy Egg Rolls. You also have to try the Crispy Shrimp they are so amazing. The staff is super nice and the place is always clean. Go try this place - you won't regret it.

name: All Chay
content: Visiting Salt Lake City and have been craving rice for 3 days now. Saw its Vegan, gave it a try. We had the summer spring rolls, Mongolian beef noodles and the fried rice curry.  Everything was delicious and felt healthy... fresh! Loved the curry fried rice the most. Must try of your near the airport!

name: All Chay
content: All Chay means all vegetarian.  My wife recommended this place to me as a Vietnamese vegan place she found on Yelp while I was on a business trip.  I told my coworkers that I would be a trail blazer and eat on my own, and they asked me where.  My coworkers were talking about eating steak and a lot of meat on the trip, but I was surprised they joined me.  One of them was a really tough critic of the food, and he gave this spot a 7.5 out of 10, which is great because the best place he gave was a 8 out of 10.We shared the vegan chicken nuggets and assortment of spring rolls as an appetizer, where they were both delicious.  Each of ordered some version of a vermecelli noodle salad bowl with different types of Vegan meats.  To enjoy our food, we each tried the Vegan Thai tea with Mango boba.  The only minor complaint that I have is that too much ice was in the Thai Tea that it was difficult to get a hold of all the mango boba.Overall, superb experience!

name: All Chay
content: I love All Chay! I'm not vegan or vegetarian, but I've loved everything I've tried. The staff is super friendly and the food is always ready very quickly.

name: All Chay
content: Love this place. The food is so good, portions are generous, and service is quick and friendly. There's hardly ever a line and it's a great quiet spot to grab a bite to eat.

name: All Chay
content: I am just thrilled to have this gem in my neighborhood! My favorites are the lemongrass tofu noodle salad and the bahn mi sandwiches. I didn't think a vegan bahn mi could possibly be good, but I was wrong! I tried to get my husband to try this place for years, and when he finally did we started getting it about once per week. He had always disliked meat substitutes but loves this. The employees/owners are friendly and package to go orders nicely.

name: All Chay
content: Got the ginger tofu rice dish with brown rice. Asked for more sauce, and it definitely needed it. Next time I think I will try a soup, because I didn't really love the raw vegetables. Also, it said it would be served with fresh ginger, and pickled carrot and daikon.  The carrot seemed raw to me and there was no ginger or daikon.  I would have preferred more veggies and less tofu  in my meal.

name: All Chay
content: First time trying vegan Vietnamese and it wasn't too bad. I can definitely say that if you're used to meat and go to this you will be able to tell a big difference. The portions weren't big for what you pay or maybe I'm used to other pho places but customer service was great.

name: All Chay
content: The food was way good. This place has the best vegan food in town in my opinion. I'm not a vegetarian but I lovee what I just had here for lunch.

name: All Chay
content: This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Salt Lake City and even better, it's vegan! I've tried several of the noodle dishes and they have all been  beautiful, colorful and fresh tasting. The egg rolls are delicious and perfectly crispy..I'm getting hungry just thinking about them.

name: All Chay
content: Best vegan Vietnamese food! We had the pho, teriyaki chicken Bahn mi, and egg rolls. Everything was very affordable and delicious. I can't wait to go back!

name: All Chay
content: I have never had vegetarian Vietnamese food so flavorful as at All Chay - if you hadn't told me it wasn't grilled pork in my Bun Thit Nuong, I wouldn't have noticed! Even my dad, who's a notorious carnivore, had only nice things to say about the place. They were so welcoming to accommodate us an hour before they closed early (4th of July) and we never felt rushed; my mom got into a long conversation with the owner about authentic Vietnamese food in SLC and this place is definitely it! Asian mom approved! They also sell all their house-made meat substitutes to-go if you want to cook with them in your own meals! Highly recommend!

name: All Chay
content: Absolutely love!! It's always clean and the people are always nice. Food is delish. I prefer the noodle dishes.

name: All Chay
content: If craving pho and bahnmi this is the place. You will pay more here than most non veggie places, but the food and variety is good

name: All Chay
content: This is the best vegan pho I have ever had in Utah. I will only be eating my vegan pho here from now on. They know how to create a spectacular pho broth that tastes nearly identical to a beef broth. On top of that, there's no bullshit. No weird veggies, just the authentic pho garnishes and spices. As a Vietnamese individual who has grown up eating pho from scratch made by my grandmother, this place is absolutely delicious.

name: All Chay
content: Wow! I'm going to admit that as a non-vegan who eats pho in LA all the time, I was super skeptical coming to an all vegan Vietnamese restaurant in SLC. However we were traveling with a vegan friend so we decided to give All Chay a chance and I'm happy to admit that my skepticism was completely misplaced! My husband and I shared a bowl of pho and the curry fried rice. The curry fried rice was quite good, but the pho completely blew my mind and how hearty and tasty the broth was, but also so clean! My biggest complaint about pho at other restaurants is that it's frequently too oily or too much MSG, but there was none of that here. I have no idea how they made such an amazing pho broth out of a vegetable/fruit base but I would happily have it every day if I could!

name: All Chay
content: This is my favorite vegan restaurant in Utah! I absolutely love their Pho, the broth is delightful. I always make sure to get their Four Seasons Rolls as well, because I can never choose between the Spring, Summer, Fall or Winter Rolls. They are all just too good! The restaurant is tucked away and divey. Usually they just have one song on repeat when I go in. You order at the counter and everything you need is on an island in the middle including their sauces, chopsticks and water. Don't let their "look" or location in Rose Park turn you away, their food is phenomenal and they are always very kind!

name: All Chay
content: Not much in the way of atmosphere but the food was delicious.  Counter people were very nice.  Reasonably priced.

name: All Chay
content: I'm not a vegan and neither is my husband who was not happy of my choice for lunch. After he devoured the spring egg rolls and the BBQ bahmi sandwich, he was converted to "I highly recommend this place"

name: All Chay
content: Last time I was in town and around this establishment here, I enjoyed a bowl of Phò Noodles and the vegan meat that they offered here.  I remember it was fantastic, and being a meat lover, I found it to be very tasty and enjoyable, even though the owner said it was a soy-based meat. Today, however, I was in around the area again and this time, I wanted to try something else. While standing in line, I've noticed that the restaurant is quite busy at 2:30pm in the afternoon on a Saturday in the winter time. I ordered the Bành Mì (sandwich) -- I choose the "All Chay" option. After, say 5 minutes or so, the order came out. I asked for it to go so the chef wrapped it in foil paper and placed inside a brown bag! The sand which was relatively warm and the bread is just right--not too brittle nor too soft. I have got to say, this is by far the best Bành Mì sandwich I've ever had--that is saying allot because if you grew up on eating these sandwiches in Southern California with the various and multi-location of the Lee's Sandwich Shops throughout all of California, you'll know that this here shop, All Chay, makes the best Sandwich I've had in a loooooonnnggg time!! I'm highly recommending this establishment to anyone wanting to try Bành Mì or even the Phò here!! Sorry, no photos this time--Sandwich was too good to take a photo of! Cheers!

name: All Chay
content: By far one of the BEST vegan vietnamese places in the valley. The curry fried rice to die for! Could have it morning, noon and night. Amazing customer service too! Highly recommend this place.

name: All Chay
content: I went to All Chay for my first time last week and I have been trying to summon every friend who hasn't tried it just so I can have an excuse to come back. It is really hard to find vegan Vietnamese food ANYWHERE, especially where I can eat more than just pho.

name: All Chay
content: I'm not vegan or vegetarian but this place makes me want to be 100%. Their Pho is AMAZING! and their fried vegan shrimp is absolutely incredible. I've never had anything here that wasn't delicious. Oh and their Thai Tea with coconut milk is the BEST I've ever had. Their customer service is outstanding as well. Everyone is kind and helpful. And they always bring out your food so fast! I've been here at least 15 times and I have never ever had a bad experience. I LOVE YOU ALL CHAY!

name: All Chay
content: I seriously love this place. The best vegan restaurant food I have eaten. The setting is casual, at best, but the food is wonderful (healthy and SUPER yummy). Prices are low. If you are considering it, you should definitely try it.

name: All Chay
content: Honestly, I was skeptical. How can Vietnamese food be vegan?! Will it actually taste good? Does it actually taste like it's intended dish??? YES!!! All Chay blew my expectations out of the water while providing a delicious and satisfying meal. My roommates and I heard about the place and decided to check it out! The restaurant itself was simple and humble. Utensils, sauces, and water is self-serve. You order at the counter and the food is brought to you. All the employees were really nice and willing to explain the dishes. We ordered the following:- Curry Fried Rice: SO GOOD! It was flavorful and contained veggies and a "meat" (kind of like nam nung pork patty but vegan obviously). I loved this and would so get this again!- Mongolian BBQ Bun (dry vermicelli noodle bowl): I was curious what the "fish sauce" dressing for this noodle bowl would taste like and it was delicious! Slightly sweet and acidic, while it didn't taste like fish sauce it perfectly complemented the noodle bowl. The BBQ "meat" had a similar texture as tempeh and had a slightly sweet BBQ pork flavor. - Pho: Definitely most skeptical about the pho but it was amazing! I've had vegetarian pho before and enjoy the cleaner, lighter taste of veggie broths. The pho contained lots of vegetables and tofu as toppings and with all the sauces, tasted just as good as beef pho. - Bean Curd Bahn Mi: I just had a bite of this and while probably my least favorite out of all we tried, I love banh mi and all the flavors like the pickled veggies, the crispy French bread, and the fried bean curd tastes just as satisfying as a meat banh mi. As a total meat lover, I can stand behind All Chay's vegan dishes!

name: All Chay
content: Ordered the Mongolian Noodle Bowl which is a salad with lettuce, rice noodles, Mongolian chicken, fresh cucumber, carrot, mint leaves, bean spouts and an egg roll. I loved it, and I will definitely be back soon. It's great to have this fresh flavorful food option in Rose Park.

name: All Chay
content: As a Viet dude who occasionally has to eat his ma's tasty Buddhist cooking (vegetarian), I think All Chay falls between a three and a four, for me.My take: *****I. VIET LEGITIMACY: Most arrows pointed in a positive direction upon entering. They include the following:- Karaoke setup near the front door- Traditional sad AF Viet music -- about war, love, or a combo of both -- playing in the background- Blue LED lights lining the ceiling of the restaurant, which, I would bet, was provided by a cousin or uncle at generous discountAll Chay just needed the little kid playing Pokemon in the corner and a few elderly Viets playing cards in the corner.II. FOOD: Regarding their eats, I tasted the following:===Not recommend===*Summer Rolls ($2.95): Fried tofu with vermicelli, bean sprouts, jicama, carrot, lettuce, mints, and cucumber. I didn't find it flavorful or rightful wrapped. I liked their peanut sauce, though.  *Spicy Lemongrass Tofu Banh Mi ($5.95): Super chewy bread instead of a crunchy exterior and soft interior. I would not recommend it, either. But it does it the spot if you're in need. ===Recommend===Pho Chay: Surprisingly, the dish I thought would be the best wasn't. It had a good depth to it, and it didn't taste overly salty. III. SERVICE: No problems here. I liked the person who took the order, and the food came out blazingly quick.IV. PRICES: Hard to complain when a stomach-filling meal costs less than $20.V. OVERALL: Even though I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there, All Chay seemed like legit restaurant to try vegetarian Vietnamese food. And vegetarian Vietnamese food isn't plentiful at all, anywhere, really. Also, you'll receive fantastic value (generous portions for the price) there. P.S. They should print a t-shirt that says, "All Chay, All Day."

name: All Chay
content: Was it not Jesus who said, "Tis a moral shortcoming if you still haven't checked out All Chay"? Who are we to defy all that is holy and good i.e. the Ocean Noodles with the vegan shrimp and the spring roll??? We are no one. Nothing in the face of the overwhelming loving-kindness that is All Chay's comfort food. I mean, I can't speak for any higher power when I say they'll judge you for not coming here for a meal but I know I will hardcore judge you. If you've been told of this good news and you still don't believe then woe is you.

name: All Chay
content: Very tasty and flavorful food,  the fact that everything on the menu is vegetarian does not take away from the taste so if you are not vegetarian or eat meat regularly I totally recommend this place.  You will not be disappointed,  I got the teriyaki noodle salad and everything tastes so fresh and crunchy, it was almost thirst quenching in a way.  It is topped by fried vegan spring rolls and chicken substitute that tastes just like the real thing.  Everything was piled up nicely and complimented each other.

name: All Chay
content: Talk about incredible service. As we arrived I told the guy behind the counter we had never been in. He went ABOVE and BEYOND to help us understand the entire process and menu. He did not rush us, took time to understand our own personal likes and dislikes, and when we were finishing up stopped back by to ensure we loved our experience. So that was service...the food? Go check it out. You will not be disappointed and we will absolutely return!!!

name: All Chay
content: We love this place. We're not vegan or vegetarian but it's hard to tell it's not meat. The staff is kind, friendly and food is served fast, fresh and tasty.

name: All Chay
content: All chay is a wonderful restaurant that serves lighter vegan fare. Very simple order at the register type of place. I usually get one of the noodle bowls. There imitation meat is very well seasoned and leaves you feeling adequately full and refreshed.  I usually get a spring roll as well. Make sure to bus your table if you can.

name: All Chay
content: What can I say except this place has excellent food. We very much enjoyed our crispy egg rolls and the pho. My daughter is vegan and this was an excellent choice for all of us to find something that we enjoyed. The flavors were impeccable and the quality was exemplary. We enjoyed it so much that we returned the next day for lunch. We were only staying one night and leaving the next day but we definitely didn't want to miss out on the opportunity of eating here again. The young lady that was working both times when we were here was very sweet and helpful. If I lived within driving distance of this restaurant I would come here very often.

name: All Chay
content: Loved this place so much!  The service was great and the food was amazing.  Only issue was there were too many choices and we didn't know what to get!So many amazing vegan options we loved this place.  We took home left overs and we would have ordered more if we weren't on the road.  I highly recommend seeking this place out.  Love supporting such friendly service and great vegan food!

name: All Chay
content: It doesn't look like much from the outside, and to be honest it's not promising once you get in the door, either. The food, however, is absolutely wonderful and is reasonably priced to boot. The owner is warm and friendly, and the place has a vibe I just love. This is my new favorite vegan restaurant in SLC.

name: All Chay
content: This place was incredible. I'm not vegan and judge all vegan food by the standard of someone who eats everything. That being said, I'll be back. The food is just very very good. It's family run and deserves your money.

name: All Chay
content: Oh my goodness, this place kept me vegan for an extra month. Don't we all try to go vegan at some point? Maybe it's just me, but my undying love of health documentaries has sent me down the vegan path multiple times. After several weeks of eating fries and rice (too lazy to cook delicious vegan meals) I was beginning to feel the tingling in my fingers for some chicken and steak. Right as I was about to throw in the towel, a friend suggested I try All Chay. I must admit, I have tried vegan asian dishes before and they are... less than satisfactory (they are very gross). I had very low expectations, but boy did the food blow me away. I ordered the "beef" pho and ocean seafood dish. I hadn't had decent food in a long time (again, too lazy to cook, vegans actually have great food). The pho broth was delicious, it did not taste artificial. IN FACT I would say it was one of the best pho broths i've had in Salt Lake. The fake shrimp was also absolutely delicious. The pairing of the rice with the shrimp really sealed the deal for me. I wanted to cry, the food was so good and I was living out my dreams of being the successful vegan I have always wanted to be. But alas, it was not to be. The location is too far from where I am to do pick up every day and my cravings eventually gave in. However, this does not take away the fact this place gave me the push to be vegan for an extra month. There should be an award for this accomplishment. I do have to say, out of all the vegan restaurants I have sampled in Salt Lake, this is the only one I have returned to after giving up my vegan lifestyle. It is a true gem for vegans/vegetarians in Salt Lake City!

name: All Chay
content: If you want to eat clean but still experience the textures and flavors of meat then this is your place. The portions are generous, recently had a slight price increase, which is still fair for what your getting. Rice is perfect, fresh carrots and cucumbers. The spring rolls are amazing and the sweet and sour dipping sauce could make cardboard taste fantastic.I'm a vegetarian every time I come here, try this place and clean all the rotting meat out of your barbaric gut!!

name: All Chay
content: Amazing. The only vegetarian that matters--Everywhere else is hot crap. I had the noodle salad. I asked if they had drunken noodles and the server looked at me and said, "No. You're stupid. Try the noodle salad". I did. It was great.

name: All Chay
content: Warning: If you don't like my frank reviews or honest commentary here, then please keep eating from your dog bowl.  My over 200 reviews prove my frank and honest credibility. Pointing out a place is in a dangerous area is not racist.  Pointing out a place needs a non Asian decorator is just frank and honest.  I have been in thousands of Chinese, Japanese and Vietnamese restaurants.  I dare anyone to suggest with a straight face that most(not all ) are tacky as all get out.  A saloon decor from Bozeman likely not attractive to most in Shanghai. Is what it is.  Pretending otherwise is dishonest. The food  here is excellent. Thus the 4 stars. I mean that sincerely. The facility is lacking in most every respect but it is reasonably clean. Owner operators seemed quite nice.  The place needs a non- Asian consultant to spiff it up. But again, the food is top notch.  The area is also pretty sketchy.

name: All Chay
content: Vegan or not, this is the best Vietnamese place to eat in Utah. I've moved here from Southern California where the Vietnamese community (Little Saigon) is alive and well. I can honestly say that I love this place as much as anywhere I've eaten in Little Saigon. Really good food, super nice staff, very fast, very affordable.

name: All Chay
content: I just moved to Salt Lake City and was pleasantly surprised to see so many healthy food options along with vegan options! All Chay was a gem of a restaurant, the restaurant was clean and we had come in 30 minutes before close looking for food and the workers were so nice and even told us not to rush to finish our food even though they were closing! The food was phenomenal! I grew up in a Vietnamese household, so I've had my fair share of delicious Viet meals and the lemongrass tofu noodles I ordered tasted just like homemade noodles I've had before. The vegan jerky at the counter was also a nice surprise since it was delicious. Would come back for sure. Also I am not vegan and I think anyone regardless of food preferences would enjoy this place.

name: All Chay
content: I love this little family owned home-in-the-wall. Their food is made with love and always superb.  I get the pho (all vegan).  Broth is incredible, and veggies abundant.  The fried egg roll is always a nice treat as well.  Not fancy, no alcohol, but great little neighborhood throw back spot.

name: All Chay
content: Who knew vegan could be so good??  Came here in a whim, and I'm so glad I did. I had the All Chay egg rolls, and house phô. Both were amaze-balls!Great balance of flavor and texture, you won't miss the meat!

name: All Chay
content: My friend showed me this place. At first I seemed a little sketched out but the food was amazing. The staff is really friendly and are knowledgeable of the menu. I would come back again. My favorite is the vermicelli bowl.

name: All Chay
content: Vietnamese food for he soul! Hearty noodle soups and amazing bahn mi sandwiches...what more do you want? If I'm ever on the right side of town I'm sure to pick up at least a sandwich! I am constantly craving food from here and wish I lived closer. The environment is relaxed and everyone here is so nice!

name: All Chay
content: I'm new to being vegan and haven't found places I'd go back to eat again till today :)It's was definitely worth going back. I recommend the vegan shrimp, pho, and vegan egg rolls

name: All Chay
content: Healthy and tasty.  Don't expect a lot of big flavors, that typically come with the heavier places. I love all the sustainable plates and silverware. The only suggestion would be to put the sauces in reusable containers. The single use ones were so out of place!

name: All Chay
content: This is truly my favorite place to eat in Salt Lake. I love the 4 seasons rolls and the veggie soup. The food comes out fast and the people working there are always nice. The drink selections is not great, but I'm a big water dinker anyway so I don't mind. It's definitely a no frills restaurant but the food is really fantastic!

name: All Chay
content: So grateful a co-worker recommended this little gem. A vegan/vegetarian restaurant where I can get a flavorful delicious meal for under 10 bucks...yes please!! There is not much parking in the lot in front but there is plenty of street parking. You go up to the counter to order and take a number and the food gets delivered to you. We waited all of 5 mins between ordering our food and having it brought to our table. The dining area is open and spacious with plenty of tables (And even a few large rounds with the lazy Susan in the middle for larger groups). Nothing fancy. Not much decor. Just plain simple and open. My husband ordered the Pho  (and he was shocked to learn it was vegan ad he has never had a vegan pho...most restaurants only offer beef base), and I ordered the Teriyaki Chikun noodle bowl. The meals came out in oversized bowls and packed with food. His Pho had vegan ham, vegan beef, and tofu with noodles and a fragrant broth. He added some sriracha and oyster sauce to finish it off and he devoured every bite. For someone who loves his meat and loves pho, he sure enjoyed this vegan version down to the last drop.My meal came with spring rolls, lettuce, cucumber, mint, noodles and teriyaki vegan chicken.  The spring rolls were perfect crisp outside and one of the best I've had in Utah. The noodles were cooked perfect and the chikun was really packed with flavor.  I could barely tell it was vegan. The meal came with a dressing of sorts to cover all the ingredients and it added a little punch of flavor. I loved the mint in the dish as it was a nice surprise with all the other flavors. I also ate every bite.  The person behind the counter was extremely friendly and explained things well when we asked questions.  When finished with your meal, drop off your dishes in the tubs in the middle of the room  (or leave on the table if you wish). Thoroughly impressed with my meal here and will definitely be sending other vegan (and non vegan friends) here and make a trip out during lunch during the week as well.

name: All Chay
content: An unique, family owned vegan restaurant that draws the attention of all foodies around SLC! I was with my vegan friends when they wanted to stop by. I ordered the Mongolian noodle bowl while my friends ordered teriyaki chicken rice bowls. The portions seemed big and I had ordered the biggest plate out of all my friends. But after chowing down the whole bowl, I still felt hungry. I guess I can't justify spending $10 on some noodles and still feeling hungry after. Don't get me wrong, the food is delicious. However, for vegan vermicelli, I'd much prefer SOMI that offers quality dining space along with delicious and filling food for about the same price. Will I be back? Probably. As of right now, I will adventure through other great Vietnamese restaurants around town.

name: All Chay
content: Delicious and fresh vegan food. The bbq noodles and ocean love rice dish are both great! Highly recommend

name: All Chay
content: I don't generally get vegan food and was tricked by a couple of friends to try this place. Was I glad that I did try it. It is amazing! The food is so flavorful. The spring rolls are yum. The noodle bowls perfectly made. And the faux meat actually tastes good. It does not taste like meat but tastes great nonetheless.

name: All Chay
content: OMG! I could eat here once a week! In fact, I'm only in town for a few days and ate here twice in a row!As one reviewer stated, the interior is unassuming but has plenty of space for large or small groups. Pick up a menu (or look at their online menu) and order at the counter. Free cold water is available self serve style along with a refrigerator filled with other types of soda, a table set up to bus your own dirty dishes and another table with silverware and sauces to spice up your dish if so inclined.I admit, I had the ginger tofu with rice and side vegetables with a nice dipping sauce on the side along with the Four Season Rolls which were 4 spring rolls filled with fresh ingredients and side sauces. My husband shared the spring rolls and enjoyed the rice dish with Teriyaki Chicken. We both were quite satisfied upon leaving without feeling overstuffed and feeling quite virtuous for enjoying such a healthy meal! :)This evening we were surprised with a free eggless flan! We were a bit dubious about the dish when we were presented with it but tried it to be polite and WOW! Really? Eggless flan with decaf coffee splashed on top? It was soooo yummy! I would purchase it next time we are in but unfortunately we fly out tomorrow. One extra note: The older gentleman that works there.....I believe he is part of the family that owns All Chay.......what a sweet man. The first night we walked in he immediately made us feel special by taking our order when the cashier was busy and showing us his home in Vietnam in a book by the door. He immediately recognized us the next day as we were enjoying another meal in the same booth and came over to speak with us. He is a "keeper" :)  I can't wait to come back to SLC and visit All Chay 1st for the food and 2nd for the delight of speaking with this gentleman!

name: All Chay
content: I'm just preaching to the choir at this point but GOOD GOD DAMN. Was in SLC for a conference and didn't know where to grab dinner. All Chay was not too far from my hotel, and rarely do I deny an opportunity for Asian noodle dishes. I ordered the Lemongrass Tofu noodle bowl for carry out. It was ready in 5 min. The interior was unassuming but had plenty of seating. I pay $9 something, slightly more than the menu pics I saw but oh well.Back at the hotel, I reset my eyes on a large portion of lightly fried, golden tofu, lettuce, rice noodles, spring rolls, mint, cucumber, and sprouts. A sweet and sour sauce compliments the dish, with a large dipping container. It tasted so fresh, the textures were perfectly contrasted, and the tofu was spicy and cooked to absolute perfection. I FaceTimed with my partner after eating and told her I legit would eat this everyday for the rest of my life and be completely content.If you want a fresh, delicious, healthy dinner that's also quick and to the point--you won't go wrong here.

name: All Chay
content: FANTASTIC! Great food and friendly service at a nice price! I will be back! The veggies are so fresh , and the flavor combinations are amazing! Can't believe this is a vegan restaurant with so much to choose from.

name: All Chay
content: Good vegetarian food. Place is different where you pick up your own silverware, plates, drinks.

name: All Chay
content: Yo. I gotta tell you, I love Vietnamese food. And I love meat. And I could barely tell that this Vietnamese food had no meat. I mean man. Probably the best vegan food I've ever had.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: So so sweet. This little cafe is a perfect spot to meet up with an old friend you haven't seen in a bit. The food is fresh, the coffee delicious and no one runs you off if you want to stay in linger over old times.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Their portions and the quality of ingredients make this place very memorable to me. I was sold on the biscuits, jam, and butter alone. I could picture myself eating the combo over and over again with a hot cup of coffee and be satisfied. Their stellar customer service, especially with this pandemic, solidified the 5 star rating. You've won this NorCal foodie's heart

name: CYTYBYRD
content: We eaten breakfast and lunch here a few times. Great downtown spot. Never disappointed. Coffee, egg dishes and salmon toast are all very good. Tip: Lunch can take awhile since it's inside city hall.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: So cute interior.. tuck away in the corner but I enjoy soy latte with cozy, and so warm inside when the weather in Utah is cold & have snow in the mountain. Its next to Washing Square. If you are in down town Salt Lake city and don't  forget check in.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: 55 minute wait for our food and they say, "Sorry, we had a last minute catering for the Mayors office. And we didn't know about it."  Seriously??!! There were only 3 tables of people in the restaurant. Terrible planning. Not going back.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Totally disappointing. At the time I'm writing this review this place has 4.5 stars with over 50 reviews. I stopped by at lunch time and ordered their grapefruit and beet salad with chicken and my friend got a breakfast sandwich with fried eggs, sausage and cheese on toast. It took them around half an hour to get us our order, by the time we got our food we had finished way ago our glasses of prosecco. There were only four pieces of chicken in my salad and the bread that came with it was cold as they just got it out of the fridge. The salad did taste good though. My friend's sandwich was rock solid, but also tasted good. Definitely not a 4+ stars place.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I loved this spot! So glad we weren't shy about it being in the City Hall building. The menu offerings here are exceptional for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. I ordered the tofu scramble and our server was happy to add an egg at my request. The cost was pretty reasonable for downtown brunch.
