Coffee was hot and strong and they offer a collection of alternative milk creamers upon request. I loved the artwork - interesting paintings, strands of paper cranes, lots of mirrors. Our server was very sweet and helpful.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Delicious surprise inside SLC's downtown City and County Building. Great creative and artistic atmosphere, delicious coffee, and the best biscuits and gravy in the city. I loved the salmon toast with goat cheese and carrot coulie. You could have a quick coffee and comfort food breakfast or a fancy latte and sophisticated brunch. Can't wait to go back to try the other menu items. Worth mentioning breakfast is served until 4pm! Yes!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: What a gem. Coffee 10/10. Food 10/10. Service 10/10. Can't go  wrong with anything on this menu

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Went here for lunch on a whim since it's right across the street from my work. I went with a group of coworkers and ordered sandwiches to go. Little did we know how long it would take. We ordered at around 12:20 and our 3 sandwiches weren't ready until 12:50. The sandwiches were tasty. I got the Goat Cheese and Arugula BLT with Cajun fries. The sandwich tasted really good but was missing a real taste of goat cheese. I could taste the semi sweet spread and arugula, but not as much goat cheese. I would expect it's from the lack of filling since the sandwich didn't have much girth to it. The cajun fries were OK. Not a whole lot of flavor. Definitely needs sauce which they forgot to give us. I know I should check before leaving but we were in such a hurry to get back for a 1:00 meeting that we didn't.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Great surprise.  In town on biz at SLC Building department and found this great cafe in basement of stunning building.  Ashley was a terrific help with menu pics and where to eat dinner tonight.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: My sister arrived not knowing what to expect other than this place had good reviews. Located inside the city hall building, this quaint gem definitely deserves its reputation. I had the Greek salad with chicken and peppercinis. The dressing pairs so well with the delicious peppers. My sister and I had a mimosa with the fresh squeezed orange juice. It was delicious! Everything is made fresh to order and the decorations makes the restaurant feel cozy.I highly recommend.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Cytybyrd catered a reception for us 12/11/19 and it worked out very well. Very nice presentation, high quality food, very good variety. The staff members were very attentive.  Set-up was nice.  Highly recommend!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Absolutely love this place.  Whenever I'm in SLC, I work nights and crave a midday breakfast.  I ate at CYTYBYRD everyday for a week.  I worked my way through the entire breakfast menu.  Everything is delicious...hard to pick a favorite.  The atmosphere is hip and quirky.  The menu shows that they really love quality food and it's full of deliciously creative goodness.  The staff is friend and attentive.  I'll eat there everyday on my next trip to SLC, too.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Quiet dark place in the basement of the second most noticeable building in the city. I'm not exactly sure what is the east component in the east meets wet dish  but it was delicious and filling- sausage, bacon, zucchini, fried potatoes and a little avocado. Good place to wait for the library to open up. Bad place to hide from the police.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Delicious homemade breakfast in the basement of the City Hall building with two adorable outside tables as well. We had the huevos rancheros & the breakfast burrito with green sauce. Both were fantastic!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: The server we had was very polite young man. The coffee was lovely. I did enjoy the meal, they messed up on how I wanted my egg cooked. This wasn't an issue though due to the server being on top of the mixup and getting if fixed right away. Great, quiet  place to talk with a friend or loved one and eat breakfast !

name: CYTYBYRD
content: For breakfast we had the huevos rancheros and east meets west. Both were great; however, there was only one person working the front who was responsible for taking orders, serving, making coffee and other drinks, bussing tables and running the register. This led to lengthy wait times, especially when it was time to leave. I had to wait in line for at least ten minutes to pay my check. He busted his tail and did the best he could so I don't fault him at all but that's a two-person job at minimum.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Fantastic breakfast! I had the Huevos rancheros while my husband had the East meets west. BOTH were DELICIOUS. Fresh ingredients, perfect portions and wonderful service!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Went for lunch on a weekday and asked for a refund after waiting for food for more than 30 minutes. No apology offered. Place was 1/3 full.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Great little shop.  Well decorated, friendly service and great food.  Breakfast all day was what I was looking for and the Farm Burrito hit the spot.  Highly recommend for breakfast and lunch.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: 30min for a coffeeFood came late, reheated microwave food, over-salted eggsHorrible service4/29 8:30am monday

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Nice enough restaurant. Great location in the historic county courthouse lower level. If you have any kind of dietary needs forget about it, they wanted to upcharge me for any kind of substitution, and gave me a hard time about it.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I think this restaurant has promise, but it needs to tweak the execution a bit.  Fresh flowers on table, good; primordial ooze where water ought to be, bad.  Charming salt and pepper shakers, good; empty pepper shaker, bad.  Real maple syrup good; dispenser encrusted with other diners' drips, bad.  Fresh food, good; waiting on the hen to lay the egg, bad.  Eclectic tables scattered about, good; 2/2 tables tried being tippy, bad.And then there was the food.  The menu sounds great and I love that there are so many vegetarian and vegan options available.  Execution was okay.  Pancakes were meh (despite the maple syrup).  Huevos rancheros were fine, but why the unspiced pile of cheese covered white rice on the side? I can do better at home, and I always find that annoying when I dine out.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Amazing caprese salad!!!! Definitely would recommend this place. Cute dinning area. Good place to go anytime of the week.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Comfortable, tastefully decorated, delicious coffee drinks and dishes. Came back next day for another Vegan Burrito Breakfast (I'm not a vegan).Highly recommend.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Absolutely fantastic hidden gem! Rustic Chic vibe! It was hard to narrow down all the things I wanted to try. I settled on the Goat Cheese BLT with sweet potato fries. OMG!! It's hard to make a good sweet potato fry, usually over cooked or soggy. These were absolutely perfection! For me, you could put Goat Cheese on a shoe and I would eat it....but this sandwich was spectacular! I had a Tiger Woods (lemonade, black berry tea and ginger) very yummy! When in SLC, find this restaurant and enjoy!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I always thought this place was just a cafe, but when I found it on yelp, I finally decided to go when my brother visited salt lake! Good atmosphere with good brunchy items. Got to self tour the city hall afterwards, and I think that made my whole experience a 5 Star one. The restroom are also really nice, and it will go back again soon to try something else!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Awesome spot with delicious vege food. A bit difficult to find the first time. Keep walking around the building and you'll find it. Awesome art as well

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Can I just say I am so disappointed that Cytybyrd isn't doing delivery with Grubhub anymore? It had become my latest obsession and when I went on their website I found that I could get it delivered through bike cab (or something) but couldn't get ahold of anyone via phone or figure out where to order. I can't ever really leave work and so delivery is a must. Their cranberry turkey sandwich with caramelized onions is what dreams are made of! Paired with a hot chai coffee, oh yeah, that's the will to live midday on Monday in the office. Add some Cajun fries and your soul will thank you.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Tried out this place from the star reviews I found on yelp. Sadly it was not a good experience. Server was super friendly but food was not good. I ordered their Chimichurri tofu breakfast and added egg whites and my egg white scramble was super salty I couldn't eat it. The sweet potatoes and black beans were not all cooked thoroughly. My husband had the farmers burrito and somehow his burrito was salty as well. The server did take off the egg white from our bill which was great. Maybe the chef can ease off on the salt next time

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Food is okay  service is good and the location is nice. I would come back here whenever i would like to have a relaxing chat with a friend or a small meeting; it is quiet.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Love Love Love this place.  Ate here 2 meals a day while I was at the utah arts festival. Everything is great. Food,atmospheres and especially the service.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I love this cafe! The music and decor gives off a small town and 70's vibe. The smoothies are nothing less than magical, and the veggie omelet is practically to die for. The rustic furniture could make anyone want to stay for "just five more minutes!" The lighting is impeccable, along with the food and seating arrangements. You could sit at the counter table, or at one of the many lovely tables. This restaurant it amazing and I would highly recommend it to anyone in the area. Molly K. Age 12

name: CYTYBYRD
content: The most excellent salsa & short ribs I've ever had. Their oj is amazing too. Never had a bad meal. Wonderful.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: We were at the Utah Arts Festival and saw the signs for frozen coffee. It's blistering hot so we stopped in for a cold drink and some cool air. The ambiance is really nice, casual but quiet. Their ice is wonderful. I got an iced latte and my girlfriend got a vanilla frozen coffee. Both were great. Due to its somewhat hidden location I never knew this place existed. I'll definitely be back.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Located in the SLC City Hall. Hard to find but well worth it. Great breakfasts and lunches.  It was not crowded when we were there.They have free short term parking in the circle at the rear of the building.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Food was ok, not exceptional. Server seemed pretty clueless, no silverware placed on table, no spoon for coffee, no quality check on food after a minute or two. Then I sat about 20 minutes or more waiting on bill. No, they weren't busy. Other tables around me sermed to be looking around for something also. The atmosphere is nice but somewhat strange dining experience.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: This little cafe is located inside SLC's city hall. It was such a great breakfast and I highly recommend ordering the breakfast burrito. It was so good. This place has such a cool atmosphere and vibe along with great service.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Watered down coffee and juice. Food is simply not good. The two stars is for the service. But the food makes a restaurant.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: One of the best meals we've had in SLC was at a hidden little gem tucked away in City Hall. If I was an employee at the building I'd eat there everyday! Lucky we found this place on Yelp. The yogurt parfait and stuffed French toast hit the spot.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I was staying at a hotel nearby and used Yelp to find a place where I could get a vegan breakfast. This was really a find! I had probably the best vegan breakfast of my life, a lentil burger inside a burrito with some kind of yummy gravy, I forget the exact details. My friend is not a vegan but she loved her meal, too. Service was friendly. The place was adorable, too, loved the art on the walls and its location tucked away inside the City and County Building. We even explored the building after we ate. I will eat here again for sure when I return to Salt Lake.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I have to admit that when the hubby asked to meet at cytybyrd I wasn't sure what to expect. When you think of a cafe in a work place you typically think of meh food. However cytybryd is anything but meh. They have a traditional lunch menu that is expertly executed. My veggie sandwich was hearty and well seasoned with loads of avocado and a smear of hummus. I ended the meal with a very chocolatey chocolate chip cookie.  The inside is very cute with a shabby chic decor.  They service is fast, so you don't have to worry about going over your lunch hour.  I would gladly return for another weekday lunch.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Love this place! Great service always and quality ingredients. I really like the caprese melt.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Cytybyrd is a yummy lunch spot really close to my work in downtown SLC. I had a salad and everything tasted fresh and delicious. The desserts are heavenly! They also serve breakfast, which I want to come back to try.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I've stopped by Cytybyrd 3 times now, and have tried something different each visit. I am first excited by their options when I see them; a ton of vegetarian/vegan items! However, I usually leave fairly underwhelmed. I think the inside is very fun, with a lot of aspects to look at. It's also in a good location for anyone working in the City County building. I was first drawn here by noting all of their options for non meat eaters. They have a house made lentil patty that is used in burgers and such, and I think this is the start of my underwhelming feelings. The patty tends to be on the tasteless side. The very first thing I ever ordered here was their "The Bird". This is a combo of small salad, veggies, small dab of hummus and a veggie burger (without a bun or the fixin's). I didn't realize the latter half was so, and this lack of "burger" type left me wondering about the price. I left feeling like I paid a lot more than it was worth.The second visit, I got the actual veggie burger. It's honestly on the pricier side of what you get. A simple patty on bun with some toppings. No fries, no side. I ordered fries separately so it wasn't so simple. I make my own veggie burgers at home, so I'm really kind of disappointed with theirs. Price wise, taste wise, etc. Which makes me upset, because I really appreciate an establishment that makes their own in house! My third visit I only made because my cousin wanted to stop in. This time around, I decided to try something from their breakfast part of the menu: vegan smothered burrito. It was a smaller sized burrito but smothered in a delicious sauce with a generous side of potatoes! This meal made up for my two previous lackluster ones. Overall, I'm glad there are a ton of veggie options at Cytybyrd, but if I have the choice to go elsewhere, I will. I don't think this place is bad whatsoever, it's just very underwhelming to me. I'm hoping in the future these feelings can improve.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Cytybyrd is so convenient and I love their affordable and comforting vegetarian chili with a roll. Also, really cool atmosphere!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: It's really impressive that the menu caters to a variety of tastes and diets, yet manages to be cohesive. Given that Cytybyrd's sensibilities are grounded in cafe/diner fare, its menu is thoughtful, and the kitchen executes it well. The quality of ingredients and preparation is obvious. The ambiance is pleasant and relaxed, but the service doesn't suffer one bit for the ease that infuses the place. The staff is amiable, responsive, and authentic. I'm not much a fan of the sensational spelling--but hey, that certainly won't keep me from altogether recommending Cytybyrd.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: The food is excellent every time I come here. It's all done right, even down to the coffee. As a vegetarian, I'm a particular fan of the vegan smothered breakfast burrito, which has some of the most flavorful lentil patty I've had. I would come here much more often if it were open on the weekend!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I came at lunch time, which was a little busy, but it was worth the wait. The special was egg salad sandwich and I got that and a side salad as a side with a delicious in-house made dressing.  The staff were great, the environment nice, and I the city building is beautiful. I will come back.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: CYTYBYRD! Salt Lake City's best kept secret. Breakfast served all day. Amazing fresh ingredients. Lunch time can get busy from 12-1:30 but they're open till 4 so I enjoy an early breakfast or late lunch! Sit outside on the patio and enjoy the sounds and sights of the city. 5/5

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Working in SLC for a couple days and it was an easy call to come back two days in a row for all day breakfast. Great service, really good smothered burrito, nice atmosphere- indoor and outdoor seating.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Food is fresh and there are lots of healthy options. They serve breakfast and lunch all day. There is a full coffee bar with espresso and baked treats. I prefer iced tea and there's is a lovely fresh brewed black. It has its own entrance on the east side of our historic Salt Lake county building. They keep a few tables open outside when it's warm so you can bring a furry companion and enjoy the beauty of the grounds.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: The food is okay. I would say it's comparable to bar food. I had the Philly cheesesteak and I'm so sorry to say it is the worst one I have ever had. The French fries tasted great and the service was not well either. Take your order drop your food and peace. No drink refills, how's your food or can I get your check. There is also the dead plant collection that frames the interior of the restaurant. I think it's a part time plant cemetery that doubles as a restaurant. Honestly nothing special here other than a lackluster diner I say go elsewhere.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Good lunch in a beautiful space. Kid friendly!! Yummy tomato soup. Was a hit for the entire family.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Their spicy creamed grilled cheese with tomato soup definitely hit the spot when we stopped by on a rainy day. The Ambience and staff were great and I would definitely recommend!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Located at the beautiful City Hall! Came in due to signs posted outside for their spicy grilled cheese and soup and it did not disappoint! Hits the spot on a rainy day.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Was only in Salt Lake for a few days and randomly happened upon this cafe on the last one. I've never reviewed anything via Yelp before, but this cafe seemed overwhelmingly deserving of a good review.The food was fantastic, prepared quickly, and there was a variety of options. The atmosphere was relaxing and comfortable, somewhere you could rest and have a nice conversation with friends/family, or even meet new people! The staff was also quite kind and helpful (and seemed to enjoy their job, which only adds to its desire ability!)Definitely suggested it in Salt Lake!!!

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I never would have anticipated that the city and county building would posses a cafe like Cytybyrd. It is easily deserving of a 5 star score. The space itself is very eclectic and interestingly decorated. There are a variety of unique art pieces that look as though they could have easily been acquired at a flea market. There is a good amount of seating space, and the area is well lit. Essentially, it has its own distinct character that nicely contrasts the architecture of the building itself. It is relatively small, but still is spacious enough to accommodate the usual lunch rush. I would recommend trying to avoid the lunch rush at all costs, because it can get quite busy.Despite this, the servers are always friendly and work hard to keep things moving along. They give great recommendations as well based on your personal preferences. You are always greeted with a smile.My personal favorites are the Monte Cristo (ham, swiss, mayonnaise) served on french toast, and the Reuben. Breakfast is also worth trying. The mixed fries (sweet potato and regular) are definitely a step above what you find in most run of the mill restaurants.  I suppose this is because Cytybyrd actually makes all of their meals from scratch. The food tastes as fresh as it looks, and definitely sits at a higher pedigree. Pastries are house made as well, and constantly changing. Incidentally I was skeptical to see how a "hummus cake" would turn out. A pleasant surprise, Cytybyrd is best when creating abstract combinations.Luckily, none of the food is outrageously expensive. You definitely receive what you pay for, and the fact that the meals are made from scratch reflects in the prices. It's worth the few extra dollars. Next time you're in the area, do yourself a favor and come experience Cytybyrd.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: This review is specifically on their catering. They have catered 3 or 4 of my business meetings in the past year. Just in the past few months they have really stepped up their catering menu options. This past dinner we had pear stuffed chicken breast with mushroom pilaf and a side salad. The chicken was juicy and the pear paired surprisingly well. Their salads always have a generous potion of spinach and other non-iceberg greens.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: I love the space, the people and the food. But then, I always get the vegan smothered burrito, and it is always good, hehe. Open for breakfast and lunch. I've been lucky and usually get princess parking in the few public spaces in the circle, but a few times I've had to park on the street at a meter. Hint: free parking on the south side of 500 South between 2nd East and State. But don't tell anyone. I may need a space to park next time.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: We go here frequently and mostly enjoy the setting. It's a really beautiful space. The food is okay - not great, but they're usually fast. Sometimes you'll order a soup and when it comes out it looks nothing like a lentil stew or whatever they're calling it. Once I got a bean thing that had exactly three beans in it. Think we'd enjoy this restaurant more if they'd stop letting their plants die. I nearly popped the one on our table into my bag because it was in such need of TLC. They were all pretty sickly and it was a rather depressing sight.

name: CYTYBYRD
content: Quirky, bright and airy cafe tucked under city building at Washington Square. Vegetarian and vegan options. Tried home made lentil/quinoa veggie burger with hummus and added avocado. The taste was falafel-like and pretty good but unfortunately the patty was undercooked and fell apart as I ate it. Service was five stars; food three stars but heading in the right direction.

name: Ginger Street
content: Love love loved this spot! Perfect for our first night in Salt Lake City. We noticed right away that it was a very trendy atmosphere-- great music, colors and decorations all around. They were out of Thai tea which was a huge bummer but the Thai limeade was authentic and refreshing. We ordered the mushroom rolls as an app and they were to die for!! The mint leaves in between the fried roll and rice paper were everything. We both got green curry and we scooped up every last bite! The staff was friendly and the bill wasn't too bad. Would definitely recommend this place for a fun night out, especially for plant-based peeps! Sooo many delicious options in a chill environment.

name: Ginger Street
content: I went in the other day with my wife and kids, the food was amazing and so was the atmosphere. But the real thing that assured us coming back was our waitress Jess. She was sweet, attentive and helpful. Thanks Jess!

name: Ginger Street
content: Welcoming hostess as we entered through the door. The decor is pretty with a fusion of Asian themes. We got the Thai basil chicken stir fry, fried salt & pepper tofu, and cha manao drink. The stir fry chicken was pretty salty so I could have used a little more rice and/or salad garnish. The tofu was fluffy and the sauce it came with compliments it well. We did not like the cha manao: way too sweet. We watered it down and it was a bit more sip-able. Overall, the service is friendly and quick.

name: Ginger Street
content: I work nearby and every time I walk past the restaurant the smells are inticing. However, the overall price paid didn't match the amount of food received. I paid $6 for (4) very small pork dumplings. $10 for a small serving of the Thai Basil Stir Fry which was just ground chicken with red peppers and green beans. No real flavor. Loved the vibe of the restaurant but probably won't be back. Also, when I asked the cashier what was in the Stir Fry she failed to mention that it was topped with an egg.

name: Ginger Street
content: The service was super fast and friendly. When I ordered the wrong dish they got me a new one free of charge.

name: Ginger Street
content: Everything I expected after seeing their reviews and pictures on Yelp. The menu is amazing, I recommend ordering lots of different things to share with the table. It's adds up and definitely gets you full. The staff was so friendly and helpful, awesome ambience. I'd go back in a heart beat.

name: Ginger Street
content: I went in last Saturday and I enjoyed the food. Everything I tasted around the table (orange chicken, Dan Dan noodles, pad Thai, green curry, steamed pork belly sliders and duck rolls) were very good! I wish my sister orange chicken had come with a little bit more rice. Their cocktail menu is limited but they had some fun beers and wines available as well. The building was cool and the decor was gorgeous. I'd like to come back sometime and try something new on the menu.

name: Ginger Street
content: Ordered some Pad Thai and Orange Chicken for takeout today. The Orange Chicken was bomb, the Pad Thai was meh - not enough flavor.

name: Ginger Street
content: LOVE the inside of this place AND the food was amazing!! What an awesome experience. We were at first sad, visiting on a Sunday to drive all the way up to Salt Lake and have everything closed, but we wouldn't have stumbled accross this hot corner spot had it not been so. We enjoyed our food and service, thank you so much!!

name: Ginger Street
content: This place was amazing. Everything we got was delicious and the prices were great. Staff was awesome. The green beans were so good, and the yellow curry was some of the best I have ever had.  Would love to come back and try their other menu options!

name: Ginger Street
content: Visiting SLC and stumbled upon this gem. Nice location, interesting menu options,  great vibe!Thanks for the ice cream, Lacey!

name: Ginger Street
content: This was a great, little find in Salt Lake City...an Asian fusion restaurant specializing in street-style foods - both tapa and entree-sized plates.Though the place was surprisingly small, I especially loved its gorgeous, bohemian ambiance with various seating arrangements. Great seatings too!I had their specialty Orange Chicken, with a side order of Pork Buns to share. My husband ordered Yellow Curry, and my son ordered their Spicy Chicken Sandwich. Thoroughly Delicious! In some ways, this place reminds me of Hawkers, but with a much condensed menu. Gotta say that I was a tad disappointed with their small lunch menu. Even though we were there during brunch hours, their brunch menu wasn't accessible. They said it was only for weekend. One other thing we didn't like was its inconvenient parking. We had to go around the block to find one, and couldn't see where we could park, so had to resort to the $3 parking in the garage (not validated). So yeah, that's definitely not a plus in my book. Still, we were NOT disappointed with their yummy foods...or the friendly, masked service. Definitely a great, little fusion restaurant!

name: Ginger Street
content: The food was awesome! Every dish we received was so yummy. The dumplings were great and had a great price. We were out of there under $40  with an app, a "kids" meal, and two entrees.

name: Ginger Street
content: Loved going to eat here but recently I have had TWO ORDERS of the Thai basil chicken stir fry end up with LARGE STRANDS OF HAIR IN THE DISH. I have had it!!  The place is absolutely disgusting. Would highly advise to stay far away

name: Ginger Street
content: Ginger Street is comfort thai food that is guaranteed to blow your tastebuds out of the water! Their food is packed full of flavor and steps out of the realm of traditional Thai food.I placed a to-go order and was blown away by their dining room's cute interior decor. There was a live DJ, dim pink lighting and a beautiful v-day balloon display. It seems like a great vibe on a weekend night! The customer service was amazing and my order was neatly and creatively packaged up! The branding is so unique! I had the yellow curry and every bite blew my mind! It was so rich, hearty and thick. Everything that you would want in a curry, this curry had it! And the veggie dumplings were a wonderful accompaniment. This was the first time I've ever heard of veggie of dumpling so it was exciting to finally eat some (without breaking my diet and feeling guilty). The dipping sauce was tasty and the green onions added an extra crunch. I am hoping to try the pad thai pad whenever I return back to SLC!

name: Ginger Street
content: The four dumplings for 6 dollars was disappointing, the dumpling was mainly cabbage.

name: Ginger Street
content: I used to think that I didn't like spicy food. It turns out that I was just always eating the wrong spicy food. It took me almost 40 years, but I finally found the good stuff. (Spoiler alert-it's here. At Ginger Street.)My wife and I wanted to celebrate Valentine's Day a little early to avoid the crowds, and we wanted to try something new. I found this restaurant on Yelp and selected it based on a few things: 1) reviews were fantastic (duh)2) location was near where we would be that night 3) they offered reservations through Yelp Those were all important factors and I was excited to give it a try. We arrived a little early-our stomachs were growling and we wanted to eat sooner than we thought we would. Not a problem! We were immediately welcomed and seated. We had scanned the menu ahead of time since this was a new place for us, but still downloaded the menu to our phones using the QR code on the table. This helped us remember what we had pre-decided. I ordered the Thai Basil Chicken Stir Fry and my wife had the Pad Thai with chicken. We also ordered the Steamed Pork Dumplings to share. (Who are we kidding? We shared everything. We wanted to try it all!) The first bite was good. Sure, this is going to be fine. Then I had another bite and another and another. Each one got progressively better. I'm not sure how that happens-maybe the ingredients needed time to warm up to each other in my mouth or perhaps, like a good bottle of wine, it gets better over time...but whatever it was-I was falling in love minute by minute. I had to be careful not to make my wife jealous. I tried hers and it was also delicious. She  wanted me to try a bite paired with a piece of cilantro. Nah, that stuff is just garnish. But she insisted and I relented. That combination is like Barack and Michelle-they just GO together. They compliment each other perfectly. In addition to spectacular food, there was a DJ spinning records, adding to the overall funky vibe of the place. I appreciated that we didn't hear boring music piped in AND that it was as a reasonable volume. I love the tunes, but I also love conversation. This was the best of both worlds. As we were leaving, we were greeted by who we later learned to be the owner. He asked how our meal was, how we heard about them and told us about a few other restaurants that he owns that we ought to try. He also introduced us to the lady who decorated the entire place for Valentine's Day (it looked remarkable, by the way!) It was really cool to chat with him briefly and feel welcome. We are excited to return soon!My only complaint-or really note to myself for next time-was the stools. My wife has a bad back and needs a regular chair with back support. The table we were seating at had tall stools. I did see other tables nearby with proper chairs, so we'll just request to sit at one of those. No worries!

name: Ginger Street
content: I love Ginger Street! I've only experienced the weekend brunch menu but WOW. The yellow curry is top 3 best curry I've ever had. The fried chicken sandwich is *chef's kiss*. Yuzu mimosa, ON POINT. In fact, all the drinks are great and REASONABLY priced! I recommend everyone I know to come here, and everyone always comes back with beaming reviews. Thanks for existing, Ginger Street!

name: Ginger Street
content: For my sister's birthday we decided to try out ginger street. Have heard good things about it. We absolutely fell in love with the flavors! It was NOT the cliche American Chinese fusion with sweet glaze and oily fried foods. The orange chicken actually tasted authentic and delicious. Pad Thai, dumplings, duck spring roll and Dan Dan noodles were yummy as well! We ordered half the menu to try everything. Oh and don't forget to order their soft served ice cream for dessert! It was amazing as well! The only thing I'd complain about is the portion size. I wish it was a little larger so we could do family style.

name: Ginger Street
content: Delicious! Ordered a bunch of dishes of the menu to share with my table and we enjoyed every one. The service was great and the food came quickly. I will definitely be coming back here.

name: Ginger Street
content: Great vibe to the place. Parking was a bit difficult due to prime location.Great covid friendly service from the staff. The dumplings had good zing with soy sauce. Spicy chicken sandwich had good layers with great Asian ingredients and flavor. The stir fry portion was small but packed with great items for a filling meal. Definitely recommend to check this place out.

name: Ginger Street
content: Yum! Yum! Stumbled here after a work event where there was not enough food to eat. Nice to have some foods that aren't afraid of spice out here!

name: Ginger Street
content: Really loved our experience at Ginger Street. The restaurant has an awesome Vibe and is decorated in a modern way. Reminds me of some of the establishments found in LA, Phx, NYC and  Chicago. Really cool and absolutely needed in Salt Lake. The service we received was great. Our server was friendly, helpful and attentive to our needs. As we went through the menu options, there were a lot of appealing items and made the choices tough. (Everything sounds and looks so dang good!)We selected the Dan Dan Noodles, Orange Chicken and the Steamed Vegetable Dumplings. All three selections were fantastic! The dumpling black vinegar and chili oil dressing was flavorful and the dumplings were cooked to perfection. The Dan Dan noodle bowl was plated in such a careful manner; allowing you to see each particular ingredient - before you mix  and mess it all up. LOL. Really tasty and a large portion. The highlight for us was the Orange Chicken. This dish is a must, if you stop in. It's one of the best orange chicken recipes I have ever had. The chicken was on point and the sauce was an amazing compliment. The Orange Chicken will be a repeat for us, during our future visits. All in, this is a great place to visit. It's an casual, upbeat and venue filled with energy, people having fun and food that will make you very happy! Can't wait to visit again in the near future.

name: Ginger Street
content: It was a bit loud and cold inside. Didn't get a waitress for about 15 min, (understandable since it was a Friday night and they're busy). The host was kind enough to give us water and chopsticks and stuff, 5 later waitress still was not there. Then there she comes, the blonde skinny girl took our orders and after were done eating one dish, she didn't even bother to get the dirty plates, she just told us i'll get that for you in a second but never did. She just stacked dirty plates with new plates with hot food, we got 2 appetizers and 2 entrees so just imagine how the high the plates are. Didn't even bother to check, then the check came she was holding the card reader thingy so it will make you feel like you have to tip at least 20% for a REALLY SHITTY SERVICE! THANK YOU MA'AM!

name: Ginger Street
content: Amazing delicious great prices and services. I was very impressed. The only thing that was underwhelming was the duck roll. Papaya salad pork dumplings, orange chicken, and basil stir fry dish were all AMAZING!!!!!

name: Ginger Street
content: Asian fusion is a fun idea and I do think this place is good-alright, but not a fav spot per se. I've been here twice and the dishes are hit or mediocre I think, but I seem to be in the minority with all the 5 star reviews. My Asian background might make me a little more picky. Steamed buns are a favorite of mine. The (chashu/char siu) pork, eggs, and spicy Mayo are a great combination. The pork is very tender. I order this almost every time. I'm not a huge fan of their dumplings bc the sauce is too sweet for me personally. My favorite dish here that I've tried so far is probably the GS Fried Rice. Topped with the eggs, it's delicious. I also highly recommend getting a side of Sweet Chili Jam to go with it  I always take a couple sides of that jam home bc it's very good with a lot of things (like to dip your fries in). My only complaint about the rice every time I get it is that it's too oily so it doesn't make for good leftovers, but it's very good when it's hot and fresh!Definitely worth a try! It's a fun spot.

name: Ginger Street
content: Everything on the menu is delicious and bursting with flavor. I will definitely come back again before leaving Salt Lake City

name: Ginger Street
content: Dan Dan Noodles were okay, but I had said "no roasted soy beans" but they put them anyways. They were small and broken up, I tried to pick them out the best I could but yuck.The Ginger Beer was good, really flat. Like you could tell "it used to be carbonated", but tasty!

name: Ginger Street
content: Had a delicious mixed drink- Naam Manao- which is like a Thai style limeade. I ordered the steamed pork buns, which are just so good as well. They include the perfect amount of hoisin and the pork is supple and full of flavor. The service was very fast at 9pm on a Saturday. Our waitress was super nice. Great place for a bite to eat downtown!

name: Ginger Street
content: This place is SO GOOD and a fun vibe. We got the Dan Dan noodles (my favorite) and the drunken noodles, and our young children LOVED the orange chicken.

name: Ginger Street
content: Have been wanting to try this place for awhile! The pad Thai is good, the flavor and sauce was PERFECT (which might sound odd but a lot of places do too much sauce or do too much of a 'teriyaki' flavor and this place did it right), the noodles were a bit aldente but it works because if they are too soft, it's kind of weird... haha. The chicken Sammy is great! I looooove the idea of papaya salad on top and it tastes sooo fresh mixing the veggies, cilantro and fried chicken. I will say, I feel like of the fried chicken ended up being a lot of fried pieces and not a whole lot of chicken, which creates a bit of an odd balance. The speciality cocktails were great - I've always thought a Thai iced tea would be a great one and they did not hold back. You can easily drink about 10 of their speciality Thai iced eyes cocktails. Service was lovely, we got our food in about 5 minutes and the ambience was fun and hip. Would recommend to anyone looking for a fun experience. Last thing, a lot of the items are actual entree items in Thailand, so it is a fun place for trying new, fun flavors too!

name: Ginger Street
content: The only item I liked was the orange chicken. I thought my rice was okay but my friends said their rice was dry. I am a huge fan of noodles so I was looking forward to the drunken noodles but it was salty and the noodles were tough. The staff said that the pastrami is salty so they asked if I wanted to switch it out for something else. They re-made the noodles with chicken. The noodles were still tough and salty for my liking. I also ordered the duck rolls tying to be adventurous. I've heard duck tastes just like chicken but I was not a fan and it did not taste like chicken to me. Luckily, my boyfriend ate all the left overs I brought home. Other than that, the staff were friendly and atmosphere was calm.

name: Ginger Street
content: The staff was attentive, amazing and very grateful for their customers it definitely shows with appreciation. The atmosphere is beautiful with charm and design it sets a lively fun mood. The food was unique and the flavors really came through. What I loved was there dessert tart described as a cross of oatmeal and Baklava. I have never tasted soft serve ice cream better than this before too. It's 1/10/21 and I feel very safe with procedures in place. It's a slow Sunday but I am so glad I came for so many reasons like showing support for restaurants in my City.

name: Ginger Street
content: First time trying this place and I'll be back! The food was great! I got the orange chicken and rice for delivery! The personal touch/message to the bag was a very sweet surprise!

name: Ginger Street
content: The customer service we received from Garrett when we had a small issue with our meal was the absolute best I've ever seen. The food (we had pad Thai, pot stickers, and orange chicken) was delicious and the atmosphere has such a great vibe. Will definitely be returning when we are in SLC again. Thank you!!! - Whitney Kane

name: Ginger Street
content: Came here for brunch with my dog. Garrett the manager accommodated us very well and took great care of us. Got the patio warm for us with the outdoor heaters and get my dog little water bowl. The food was good and their fried rice was great. Also the egg sandwich is delicious. Overall it was a get experience and the staff was great and friendly. Would recommend it.

name: Ginger Street
content: Food was delicious. And I guess that's what matters. But the service was beyond terrible. I ordered for take out. When I went to pick it up, I was told to sit by the hostess stand because it wasn't ready. 35 minutes later, they asked me what I was waiting for- the food had been ready almost the whole time and now was cold. I told the server that it was cold- she felt the bag and said "it's not really that cold" and she walked away. I had to argue to speak with someone above her and finally got it resolved with a manager/ employee in charge. A shame the service was so poor because the food was good.

name: Ginger Street
content: LOVED this place. now i will be showing it to everyone!!! the atmosphere was so cute and groovy and hip and earthy and the food hit so right. we got the chicken sandwich (i prefer mine mild) and the pad thai. i can already tell i will be craving this place lots

name: Ginger Street
content: WOW!! seriously best dinner i've had in utah and i've been all over. Not only is the food amazing the wait staff was just as good our server briton (sorry if i misspell) could not have been more sweet and the general manager garrett was seriously the best person ever. We all enjoyed our meal as our plates were all cleared by the end of the night. I PROMISE that you won't regret coming here. We got a free dessert and it was amazing. i got the orange chicken and it was huge! so much food for such great prices. Amazing location right in the middle of downtown. best dinner ever

name: Ginger Street
content: Still sitting at table while writing this but flavors were so varied and great couldn't wait. Dan Dan noodles - just the right amount of heat. Orange chicken, basil rice chicken all exceptional. That it was served by pleasant attentive staff and engaged GM topped it all off. Just visiting SLC. Won't come back without stopping in again.

name: Ginger Street
content: This is an overdue review . We came to Salt lake in October for our honeymoon and I can't believe I did not post a review. Everything we ordered was delicious. They stay true to flavors and food is fresh. I knowMost of the pictures do not have names but I forgot what we ordered lol . The good thing is that you are not going to go wrong with anything you get.

name: Ginger Street
content: University of Utah hospital employees were so thankful for the delicious lunch entrees that were delivered to us this past week! We appreciate the support our community during the holidays!

name: Ginger Street
content: My girlfriend and I went to Ginger Street yesterday for the second time ever, and it was really fantastic!! Last time we came, they gave us a free G Bar. This time, they gave us a free cocktail!!!! It was like my mf birthday. COVID precautions are bueno. We liked the customer service! We really like the servers Chloe and Briton, they are both very nice and should get a holiday bonus or something.

name: Ginger Street
content: First I'd like to say that the ambience is amazing. Such a chic,fun place to grab a bite to eat! Vegetarian friendly which was a huge plus for us. We had a little issue with our meal and the manger Garret was so accommodating and kind. We are excited to come back and try different curries! Oh and, there are many special craft cocktails that look very fun! Highly recommend for your new go to spot!

name: Ginger Street
content: Very impressed! Best dumplings ever! Fabulous non-alcoholic beverages, yummy pad Thai and fried rice. And perfect, helpful, non-intrusive service. Will return soon!

name: Ginger Street
content: Apparently they don't like customers - even during covid, my wife and I just walked over to give this place a try. Hours on the door said open til 9, place had several folks sitting down, it was 8:20pm. Guy at the door watches us walk up to the exit door (which is where the open sign is) locks the front door then while we were walking over to the correct door - dude walks over to the exit door and turns the open sign off then turns his back. He could've at least said sorry folks, we aren't seating any other tables tonight. Screw this place. Don't go here. Sincerely,Salt Lake City explorers

name: Ginger Street
content: UPDATE: My review is simply my experience and I removed a photo of an employee not masking because I don't want to target them. I showed proof, got management to oversee their actions, and be more mindful going forth. My goal was to not be aggressive but to inform others about my personal experience.I'm not here to start an argument, but I have noticed that the person who responds happens to be very passive aggressive towards low ratings, which is understandable...  but remember to take it as constructive criticism. I would have been more open to trying this place out again if the response I got was more focused on accountability. What I saw vs. what was said does not match up exactly, and it shouldn't matter if you're not on the clock to mask up, as the current pandemic doesn't end because your shift does. Again, please take this constructively. --Oof. Heard lots of good and bad things about this place. One of the things I heard was that their ice cream was on the good side. So I went to try it out and wow, I was in for an emotional rollercoaster. You can quickly order ice cream from a "to-go" window where you ring a doorbell. Service was prompt and the girl was really nice! Some items on their menu was outdated (they don't serve cold pressed juice anymore) and I just ordered my soft serve. The soft serve machine is like right in front of the to-go window and oh boy, let me tell you what I saw. The girl grabbed a guy, who I assume was either the manager or a supervisor? They both went to the soft serve machine and looked like they couldn't get it to work. The guy did NOT have a mask on, nor anywhere in sight on his body. He didn't have a mask tucked in his pocket somewhere cause he was meaning to put it on or anything. He was mask-free, AND then he used his gloveless fingers to touch parts of the machine that would be unsanitary! It was quite gross to watch him trouble shoot it so I'm quite glad I left without my ice cream. Not sure if I want to dine in after this experience...

name: Ginger Street
content: I had high expectations for Ginger Street (based on foodie friends' recommendations and the owner's reputation). Our expectations were exceeded in every way. When you walk in you could not feel more comfortable, and at the same time energized, in the down-to-earth and eclectic space that is so stylishly brought together (we wanted to walk out with the white washed, hand-carved, footed bench that sat across from our booth). We ordered more than we needed just because we wanted to try so much. The waffle topped with real-fruit berry sauce and whipped cream was crispy on the outside, yet light and moist on the inside. The hand rolled beignets were reflected the crispy, yet soft nature of the waffle and were generously rolled in a cinnamon sugar which was complemented by the fresh coconut milk. The kimchi fried rice was both satisfying and rich with this fusion of the Korean classic topped with a freshly fried egg and the crunchy rice bits that are a favorite of asian rice connoisseurs (and we know Korea). Our son could not stop at one, nor two orders of pork dumplings, but this 17 year-old teen could not stop until he had consumed the freshly sauced third plate. And once he got a taste of my drunken noodles, with their depth and complexity of flavor accompanied by the lean pastrami, I knew I was destined to share my plate. After I finished my Thai lime Naam Manau, which holds a seriously delicious punch, I promptly turned to my family and asked, "can we come back tomorrow?!" Bravo, Ginger Street!

name: Ginger Street
content: I LOVE Ginger Street! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is so fun. I have gone twice with a few friends and we always share multiple dishes and each one is SO good. The staff is also super friendly.

name: Ginger Street
content: This place was absolutely incredible. It was one of the first places I stopped in at after covid happened. They were wearing masks, keeping things extra clean and distanced, and doing all of the appropriate precautions. My sister and I ordered a couple different dishes...the Thai basil stir fry, an eggplant dish, and the ribs. Everything was delicious! But what really set them apart was the service. I had my 11 month old son with us and they brought me out some extra rice for him in case he didn't like any of the dishes. They also cooked everything mild. My kiddo loved the different flavors just like his mama. Then the waitress asked if it was okay if my son had some ice cream. She went to the soft serve place next door and brought him a little cup! Are you kidding me!? How sweet of her! Damn you Covid from keeping me away from the office. This place would be such a frequent stop for me.

name: Ginger Street
content: Really amazing pork buns and great service. They accidentally served us the wrong dish and immediately corrected it and took it off the bill. We had ordered their shrimp rolls which ended up being quite good, the sauce they came with was tangy. They also gave us some ice cream on the house which was really nice of them. The main dish was a pad thai dish that could have done with a bit more flavor, but was still enjoyable.

name: Ginger Street
content: Came here for brunch to try some of their best dishes. We ordered pork dumplings, sausage and egg steamed buns, coconut waffle, kimchi fried rice, mapo tofu and breakfast sandwich along with kimchi bloody mary and yuzu mimosa. They were decent, but not like OMG so good! I really liked the coconut waffle, mainly because it came with cream and blueberries. Very soft and sweet. The rest wasn't so bad and I guess as an Asian, I came in with a high expectation of what Asian food should taste like. Please come in like you have no idea what Asian food tastes like then you might enjoy it better than I did.

name: Ginger Street
content: One of my favorite places in Salt Lake!!! I have a lot of allergies and it's always hard to find new restaurants that can accommodate. The first time I went I was so impressed with the whole vibe, because ginger street IS A VIBE! Since that first time my husband and I have been hooked! We are advocates for good ingredients, and quality food and ginger street does not disappoint! When I am in town we are there multiple time a month, we have ordered takeout and everything they do has a special touch to make them unique. We have also had them cater one of our events and EVERYONE was in love!!! There was something for everyone! I can't thank Ginger street enough for always giving 100%, with their food and their service.

name: Ginger Street
content: My family was passing through Salt Lake City on our way back home to Los Angeles and I decided upon this restaurant based on their menu and good reviews. I'm happy we did. The restaurants decor and ambiance were both chic and inviting. Our server was great, attentive and friendly. There was a minor mixup with one of my husbands dishes but it was corrected at lightning speed. The food was spot on, we all had different dishes and all 4 of us loved our meals including a hard to please picky mother daughter duo.  I recommend the Wok BBQ Ribs, sooooo good!Special thanks to Garrett the GM who was so welcoming, came in to check on us and chatted with us for a bit, something that is unheard of back home unless you're throwing a tantrum. BTW... They were following proper Covid safety for those wondering. I hope this place survives and thrives so that we can come back for another visit the next time we're in SLC.

name: Ginger Street
content: Love that there was no wait on Sunday afternoon and plenty of dine in seating. I had a Vietnamese coffee, but it was not as sweet as I'd prefer. For my entree I ordered the pad Thai with tofu and it was delicious! Lots of bang for my buck. Will come again to try the soft serve.

name: Ginger Street
content: We have been to Ginger Street a couple of times since we moved here in August. Our first visit was met with excellent service and food - our whole party of 6 thoroughly enjoyed the meal. One of our favorite dishes that night was the orange chicken - it had the most delightful fresh orange flavored glaze. However, our past 2 visits have been met with inconsistency. Most notable tonight was the orange chicken. The chicken was very dry and the sauce was nothing like the first time I had it. The sauce tonight was thick and dark, both bitter and burnt tasting. This was a complete 180 from the sauce I had a few months back. For a while now I have bragged on the orange chicken to friends, but I will no longer recommend it. The inconsistency really turns us away and will likely sway us from visiting again anytime soon. If you do decide to give Ginger Street a chance we have enjoyed the dry fried green beans (although a little inconsistent with the amount of sauce) and the Thai basil chicken stir fry.

name: Ginger Street
content: I enjoyed our dinner on the patio at ginger street. The space itself is really well decorated and has a fun vibe. The waitstaff was kind and accommodating. The food wasn't my favorite but I need to go back and try another dish.

name: Ginger Street
content: Very cozy and alternative style interior with food that fills you up and makes you feel warm inside (I got the drunken noodles). The brews also pair very well with the meal-- I chose the Tsingtao Lager and Astronaut juice. All made for a great night with kind and caring service. I wasn't able to leave a tip on the machine they used (or at least I didn't see the option) so I hope this makes up for it :)

name: Ginger Street
content: Everything we tasted was incredible! Definitely get the fried green beans and yellow curry. Such a fun atmosphere...but what was even better were the people. Garrett the general manager was outstandingly kind and brought us heaps of dessert on the house when the kitchen had moved slow on one of our dishes. Preston the assistant manager was so knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the food and customer service, and our waitress Hayley was so fun and attentive. A lot of downtown restaurants on a Saturday night might turn up their noses at a couple bringing their kids in to a trendy night spot - but not Ginger Street - everyone was so fun and sweet to our 3 girls (even when they spilled a drink all over the table and floor)! Ginger Street gets it and they make you feel very welcomed...don't forget to try the super creamy malted chocolate ice cream & addicting G bars (If you know you know).

name: Ginger Street
content: We have tried to go to this restaurant multiple times and the staff is not the best. We have been turned away twice because "the kitchen is shut down so I can't seat you" even though it was before they closed, and people were still ordering and eating in the dining area. We decided to order delivery this time since we really wanted to try this place because we love street food from around the world. We were very disappointed. Portions are way too small for the prices you pay. It also appeals to the western pallet instead of being authentic street food. I'm really disappointed. We ordered the pork dumplings ($7.50) and we got 4 that looked and tasted like they came from Costco. The Pork Ribs ($9.00) came with 4 of them, and they were actually the best part of the order, but didn't come with anything but the ribs, no rice or anything. Pad Thai ($12.00) this is the worst Pad Thai I've had in my entire life. I have no idea how they managed it, but there was absolutely no flavor, texture was horrible, I couldn't finish it. I've had really bad Pad Thai before but this hits 1st place on that list. Definitely won't be back. If you want better food go to literally any other place.

name: Ginger Street
content: This place was absolutely delicious. We had the dumplings, the pad Thai and the orange chicken and the taste of everything was out of this world! Will definitely be going back. Truly enjoyed it. Very nice ambiance as well.

name: Ginger Street
content: Good food. The interior is super cute great for Instagram pictures! The food was good, and service was great.

name: Ginger Street
content: Oh man! You can taste the green beans were frozen.  If want authentic Asian food please don't come here and it's over priced for what you actually get.

name: Ginger Street
content: We went in right before closeI know we are a**hatsBut the service here was amazingStaff and managementThe food was equally amazingI literally haven't wrote a review in ages but had tooThis place is truly amazingAnd if you are in the salt lake area I could not recommend it moreBest restaurant for sure

name: Ginger Street
content: Ugh! Ordered one Pad That, one Chicken Stir-fry.  I don't know whether their quality is always this low ???? The rice is dry AF, Pad Thai is nothing like what they show in pictures.

name: Ginger Street
content: We live down the street and this place has been inviting us for months! It looks so cute from the outside. I didn't get to try the soft serve but that is still on my list. The orange chicken was delicious! The chicken was so crispy and good. Honestly doesn't even compare to any other Asian restaurants we have tried in Salt Lake. The potstickers weren't the best I've had, but I'll be going back for the orange chicken. We just did carry out and it was super easy to grab and go!

name: Ginger Street
content: Had really high hopes for this place as the pictures looked amazing, but its sad to say I had an awful experience with this place. Maybe dining in would have been better, but I advise not ordering take out or delivery here. Menu items are unavailable at some times apparently, which resulted in them replacing a $10 item with some plain unseasoned tofu. No notice of this upon pickup whatsoever. We went back obviously to remedy this and get our moneys worth and their resolution to this was a $10 gift card and no replacement to our dish we were hoping for. Grubhub ended up giving us a full refund because we open up the rest of our food to be met with plain, unseasoned noodles as our "pad thai" and dry ass flavorless chicken with some plain rice as our "orange chicken." Like are you serious? I was expecting a little white-washing from an asian fusion restaurant but not This bad. I could have made food far better for far cheaper than almost $40 myself, or even gone to Panda Express for better quality and flavor. Hoping for a FAR better experience when I go in to use my gift card. You guys need to really improve your delivery and takeout service though.

name: Ginger Street
content: Ginger Street is the hippest and coolest restaurant in slc.Environment: 9/10We are obsessed with the vibe Ginger Street created. It was casual and cool, and had the cutest neon lights everywhere. This restaurant is truly one of the cutest place and very welcoming. They do play music and it can be pretty loud-which we enjoyed, but that isn't for everyone!Menu: 8/10The menu provided was all online making it COVID friendly! The menu is divided by lunch and dinner and provides a variety of options, including curry, noodles, and orange chicken.Customer Service: 7.5/10We read some reviews that were critical of the customer service, but we didn't have a bad experience! We watched the servers be very diligent in filling waters and checking on tables. Price: 8/10We think the portions are pretty big and the dishes we got cost between, $10-$15 which for a sit down restaurant and large portions is a fair deal. Taste:8/10We heard from other people that Ginger Street has a delicious orange chicken, so we obviously had to try that out. The chicken was friend in a tempura batter with very tender chicken. The orange sauce wasn't too overbearing and we added some chili powder on top because we love spicy food. The balance of the spice and orange was perfect and an item we would definitely recommend! You also can't leave without getting some coconut ice cream. We aren't in love with coconut, but were dying over this ice cream.Overall: 8.1/10This is a place we would definitely recommend to friends!

name: Ginger Street
content: Went here for brunch with my friends this morning and it was amazing!!! The food was incredible, you can tell they really put a lot of thought into their menu and the atmosphere of the restaurant is unlike anywhere else in Salt Lake! The owner and staff are very attentive and kind, overall a great experience and I would highly recommend!

name: Ginger Street
content: Right before the pandemic started, I was super excited to try this place out. Tonight, I finally decided it was time to order some delivery from Ginger Street. I can eat Asian food any night of the week but for the hubbie, he needs to have a break now and again. I decided to go with Ginger Street because they had a chicken sandwich on the menu that I thought he would like and I could order all the Asian dishes I wanted!Ginger Street did not disappoint tonight. I ordered 3 appetizers and they were all delicious - a great way to try a bunch of dishes. This place might be self-described as "asian fusion" but they are not shy on the flavors! Some people might think that asian fusion means that it's less authentic but that's not necessarily the case. The dishes at Ginger Street from a certain perspective are more authentic than the dishes you might find at your favorite Chinese buffet for example. Ginger Street doesn't hold back on the bold flavors that many Asian cuisines are known for. I actually found the rice that came with the bbq ribs to be some of the best Chinese style rice I've seen in Salt Lake. The rice was perfect - soft and fluffy with individual grains and they had that distinctive light floral aroma that Jasmine rice is known for. You can tell that all the dishes are cooked to order and with care.Speaking of bold flavor, my husband's sandwich was definitely really spicy - easily the spiciest thing we've had in Salt Lake. So if you're sensitive, be aware of the spice level. He ended up picking a few of the jalapenos off and it ended up being a great spice level for him. We were really impressed that a place in Salt Lake was bold enough to make food this spicy because we've really struggled to find decently spicy food around these parts. It was kind of like a cross between a Nashville hot and a bahn mi. Really great to try if you're hesitant about Asian food!We also appreciated that they stapled the bag shut so we could tell if our food had been tampered with. Not enough places do this! It's definitely appreciated!The only criticism I have is about the wonton wrappers for their dumplings being a little off game. I'm not expecting a place like this to make their own or anything but the flavors from the wrappers are veering to much in the ravioli territory and needs to be brought back east a bit. Not sure what it is, if they're gluten free or not eggy enough, just seemed a bit off on the style.We'll definitely be ordering again! And after the pandemic, we'll be back to dine in. I can't wait to enjoy this food with some of their house made cocktails! Everything we ordered was delicious!

name: Ginger Street
content: Yummy, yum, yum! Visited from California and found Ginger Street bear Marriott. Really amazing pad thai and dumplings. So glad we tried this local spot. Great service, food and prices. We will definitely be back for more! If you get the chance to visit ginger street, do it!

name: Ginger Street
content: I really wanted to like this place. Maybe they were short on help . Our server was trying to work the entire patio by herself. It took one hour for her to take our order. 30 minutes before we were offered water.  Had I not been with five other people I would have left. Our meal came out one dish at a time after another hour. We would finish one dish before they brought another. The ambiance and food was fine that's why I give it two stars. But it was a painful dining experience. I wont be back. I would have tried the ice cream but I didn't have another hour to wait.  Waited 30 minutes for the check too and had to all for it to get it.

name: Ginger Street
content: Had high hopes as it looked appealing, but I unfortunately can't say the same for the food. TLDR; if you want amazing Asian food, take your hungry selves elsewhere.Shrimp dumplings: Only came with 3 pieces. I'm assuming its their take on spicy wontons. Drenched in sauce that was waaaay too salty. It was so overpowering that you could hardly taste the shrimp. For those who do have peanut allergy, BEWARE!!! Despite noting our peanut allergy, it was definitely still in the dish.Pork dumplings: The potstickers were steamed, and the bed of sauce it laid on top of was amazing. However, I feel as though they put too much emphasis on the sauce that the potsticker/dumpling itself lacked flavor. Also for something (possibly) steamed, our pork was very dry and dense. Pad Thai: Perhaps the best dish! The noodles were not cooked to what I am used to-- al dente-- nevertheless, good. Their take has the egg sunny side up topped on the noodles, rather than scrambled in. What made the dish was the shrimp, well seasoned & perfectly cooked!Service: POOR with so much attitude. I had to bump down another star. Since it was our first time here, we did not immediately know what to get so we took time to go through the menu before ordering--as one normally would. Upon asking the host what the most popular dishes were, we were met with discouraging attitude rather than one that was passionate about the food they offered. We also did mention our peanut allergy, and the host did ask again to confirm and notated it on our ticket (much appreciated). Unfortunately, the sauce that the shrimp dumplings were drenched in DID indeed contain peanuts. I personally went up to another worker who also confirmed with chef himself that the shrimp dumplings apparently did not have peanuts. I find it very disappointing and ironic that the chef does not know the ingredients that are in the food they are serving. Allergies alone are a very serious health matter. Luckily we caught it within the first bite so the reaction was mild. This is a warning to anyone else who possibly has a more severe reaction to peanuts to BEWARE as they do not pay much attention to that. I'm assuming that it was the supervisor that we had spoken with, he initially did not take our concern seriously, in fact approached us with attitude saying "What's the problem?" Suggesting a "what do you want me to do about it" vibe, extremely disappointing. Safe to say, will not be returning.

name: Ginger Street
content: We gave their new weekend brunch a try and man it was fantastic. We tried the son in law eggs, coconut waffle, beignets, and kimchi fried rice. Let me tell you that it was all delicious but THE RICE WAS INCREDIBLE. Highly recommend all of that but especially their fried rice.

name: Ginger Street
content: They had warm ambiance and colorful interior. We ordered dumplings, noodles as well as mushroom crisply rolls and it was very delicious. They even sanitized the tables and creditcard machines

name: Ginger Street
content: I have wanted to try Ginger Street for a long time!  I ordered the Orange Chicken and a G-Bar.  They included a cute little note that is just an extra touch.  To be honest, when I opened the container I was unsure what to think.  It was not saucy, but dry.  I am used to orange chicken being coated in sauce.  Then I took a bite... Cooked to perfection!  Light and crispy with moist and juicy chicken inside!  The addition of chili powder on top really gave it an extra special zing!  My new favorite orange chicken!  And the G-Bar! Yummmmmm.....  A G-bar is a house made ginger snap crust melted with a dense coconut caramel.  You have to try it!  I look forward to ordering from Ginger Street again!

name: Ginger Street
content: Nice place and environment , very friendly staffs but food is NOT GOOD. Don't go here if you're hungry looking for a good meal.

name: Ginger Street
content: Ginger Street has to be one of my favorite restaurants in downtown SLC. Their Asian fusion food and their drinks are phenomenal. I usually get the veggie dumplings and the red curry and always leave having had the best time.Lacie and her team do a phenomenal job to make you feel welcome be it with the ambiance or the quality of service.Yesterday, during the high winds, I had lost power to my apartment and a lot of the establishments near my house were closed due to the weather too. Ginger Street came in clutch and I had a great, hot and spicy Asian meal that perfectly turned around the dull day brought on by the weather.Once again, I love this spot, it never disappoints and I can not recommend it enough!

name: Ginger Street
content: Ginger street was delicious. Flavor packed and a funky, unique decor, this restaurant located in the heart of downtown SLC is going to be one of my favs. Customer service was excellent and everything was so fresh and packed with seasoning. When ordering the Pad Thai, careful not to sprinkle on too many of the dried Chilis, made that mistake and had to juzzle water! Otherwise, loved this spot and will definitely be back!

name: Ginger Street
content: So sad to write this review but we had an unfortunate experience at Ginger Street. We were so excited based on the ambiance but we were seated for about 10 minutes before our waitress ever acknowledged us. The hostess was great and we could see she was trying to help by asking us for water continuously. When the first dish came the food runner spilled some of the curry on my friends leg. Then when the drunken noodles arrived they were so salty my friend had to ask for a different meal. they did accommodate but the experience had already been not very positive so this just added on to it :(. the food was average, but you would find better at your average thai restaurant. to top it off...went to the bathroom after and there was no toilet paper.

name: Ginger Street
content: We tried this place for the first time a couple weeks ago. We had a few small qualms with the meal. Things like portion-to-cost ratio on some appetizers, textures and balance of an entree, but nothing that would deter us from coming back to try again. We are hopeful and adventurous foodies, so one average experience won't usually stop us.As you will see below, one of the owners, Nicholas, reached out to me about our experience. I spoke with him over the phone and he invited us back to give Ginger Street another try, at his own expense. We were amazed at his hospitality, generosity, and willingness to extend himself to ensure we were not only "reimbursed" for our previous experience, but catered to and completely satisfied. I assume his excellent qualities as a servant-leader are contagious because we encountered attentive and cordial service during both visits from our waitresses.We indulged in the: Crispy Duck Fresh Rolls (flavorful, unique)Dry Fried Green Beans (flavorful, an excellent twist on a classic veggie)Drunken Noodles (good portion size)and the Spicy-Crispy Chicken Sandwich (crunchy, complex flavors, but I'm a Nashville native, so I'll be asking for more heat next time!)all of which paired well with the Iced Thai Milk Tea (sweet and refreshing)Nicholas was not only polite, helpful, and accommodating, but deliberately ensured our experience was pleasant and memorable.Your drive to be a hub for good food and community is exponentially accelerated by your willingness to listen to your staff, your customers, and especially your critics. I look forward to returning.

name: Ginger Street
content: I ordered delivery and just wanted to report a mixed bag, so you may need to find your favorites here. The duck fresh rolls were actually awesome and flavorful. That was the highlight. The Dan dan noodles were soupy with generic noodles, but the flavor was ok. The pork dumplings were just plain meat flavor on the inside, and no one ate more than one. I am thinking I probably won't have anything to do with this place again, except those duck rolls could lull me back.

name: Ginger Street
content: Never had orange chicken like this in my life!!! Wow!!! The pad Thai was delicious! The veggie dumpling was spicy and worth it!!! Again, so yummy. The duck roll appetizer, was gone in seconds!! Everything was so good!!!

name: Ginger Street
content: We loved eating here. We tried so many menu items and visited twice in the same week. I loved the ambience and decor, which kind of makes you feel like you're transported to India, but still modern city Salt Lake feel. If you enjoy curry and other Indian dishes, this place is a must.

name: Ginger Street
content: Everything we ordered was delicious. The staff members were all very nice and accommodated special requests.

name: Ginger Street
content: Entrees were a bit small but delicious. We got the green curry with shrimp (perfect spice level and great vegetable pairings), orange chicken, and ice cream.

name: Ginger Street
content: Amazing food!! Plain and simple... you should come here! Had the pork buns, the ribs, and the pad Thai and all were awesome.

name: Ginger Street
content: This place is fantastic, the service for dine in or take out is always on point. If spice sensitivity is an issue for you please tell your server to recommend a dish that is in your wheelhouse. The orange chicken is my classic go to. I also recommend the drunken noodle, which features pastrami....and trust me, please do yourself a favor and try it. The steamed pork buns and the ribs are also a classic appetizer for our group whenever we eat here. The service, the flavors, the added touches and flair inside all make this restaurant one of my local favorites.

name: Ginger Street
content: Atmosphere is nice, staff was friendly.   Everyone else's food looked good.  Unfortunately mine was very subpar.  Exterior of my chicken was crispy but the inside was not tasty and very slimy.  Just couldn't eat it. But.  Host/ manager was great and asked about the meal and what she could do to make things better.  I explained and they made another order of the chicken to go. Hopefully it is better.

name: Ginger Street
content: The Thai limeades with a shot of vodka were amazing. Best drink I've ever had. I ordered the Drunken Noodles and my husband had the Orange Chicken. The Drunken Noodles were way too salty; I couldn't eat them. The orange chicken was different than any I'd had but VERY good. So crispy. I know I said my drunken noodles weren't good, but I'm still giving 5 stars - the drinks were awesome and the service were great. Bathrooms were very clean as well.

name: Ginger Street
content: One of the most amazing places I've been to in a while, especially during COVID! I wanted to take my boyfriend out to a newer, nicer place for his birthday and this exceeded our expectations! The food was super rich and filling for such an excellent tasting meal. The environment is so adorable and the staff was super friendly! We will definitely be coming here again.

name: Ginger Street
content: The prices were really good. 10$ for one of those crafted mix drinks or like 4$ for a beer. The only problem was we had to order something to eat otherwise we couldn't sit there. Which I thought was ridiculous but the waitress said soft served ice cream is cheap and small so we could stay and drink. The drinks were good and the ginger sour was made great. The ice cream wasn't bad either according to my friend.

name: Ginger Street
content: The food was good and fast. Seemed a bit bland. Pad Thai was missing bean sprouts and the sauce wasn't very present in the dish. The orange chicken slappppps. Best orange chicken I've had in a hot ass minute.

name: Ginger Street
content: Omg I loved this place so much! The ambiance, waitstaff and food were amazing! It was a perfect instagramable place that had outdoor and indoor seating. Would totally go here for a date or girls night! Also the bathrooms are cute af

name: Ginger Street
content: My friend had been before and took me there for lunch. We got in with our mask on and used the requested hand sanitizer upon entrance. We were welcomed and informed that we could order at the counter and then be served at our table. The Menu was available on our phone by scanning a QR code. We took our time to look at the menu and got also recommendation from the waitress (the Red Curry if you want to know!). Once we ordered, we went to sit on the patio. The tables had been disinfected already and we enjoyed a nice table separated from the other clients. We got our food and drinks really fast! It was great! Their drink menu also looks great. Thinking about maybe coming back at night at some point, we asked about that and the waiter told us they are open at night but it is a more traditional table service.It was a great place to go for lunch, I really enjoyed it more than I though I would and will go back!

name: Ginger Street
content: So we stumbled into this place by accident, and oh what a find!! We took the corner too quickly and thought we read the word "Burger" instead of "Ginger".
