So we parked and walked over and to our chagrin it wasn't he burger joint. I have a lot of food sensitivities and we had our kiddo with us who had never had Thai food before. Well the staff were wonderfully professional and sweet, going through the menu to help me figure out what I could eat and they had the most amazing orange chicken. You will never taste an Orange chicken as good as this one. It's not what you think of like American Orange chicken but it is BOMB! The ribs were amazing and hubby loved the Pad Thai. A treat that we were not expecting. Also make sure you get the pineapple ice cream !

name: Ginger Street
content: I was here last night and have debated what my review will be for over 24 hours. This place has so much potential... it is in a perfect location, I LOVE the inside, the food was flavorful...however, my biggest irritation is that I feel as if it is pretty overpriced. I have been wanting to see what the hype was about with Ginger Street. I walked from my condo downtown to their location. Upon arriving, I heard music and they had patio seating. I walked in and was super impressed! They had a projector, a live DJ, plants everywhere, and it was just so neat! I ordered from a really nice girl and then picked a spot to sit down. As soon as I sat down, my drink (which was just a water) was brought to me. I really liked the fast response time to get me my drink!My pork dumplings came out next and they were SCRUMPTIOUS!! I loved the sauce that the dumplings were in! Then I got my orange chicken. Definitely orange chicken in a way I have never had it before...I loved the texture!The experience was cool but also sort of odd...There was servers just running around to any table doing anything. Which was alright but it would've been nice to have a designated person! The atmosphere is probably one of the best in Salt Lake City that I have seen thus far...but I really don't think it's worth the price. Especially when it comes to price vs. portion. It was $25 for me to eat and I didn't even get a drink or dessert...as bad as I wanted to try their drinks or ice cream!I definitely want to return, I hope they do some kind of lunch special or something in the future...that would be awesome. Overall, I think this is a great place in Utah!!

name: Ginger Street
content: From the outside I thought it was a club because of the neon street lights, but inside was hipster ambiance: so many cool textures and neat lights, toms of bright juxtaposed colors, and fun 90s music and decor and an odd film reel of 90s music videos with Bruce Lee... though the incense or essential oils was a little much for my sensitive nose. Service was excellent, and food was delicious: I got the Thai chicken basil and the flavor was excellent, though the portion was kinda small. The spice I got was 3, hubs got 4, but both our dishes were not spicy at all, so it must not be an authentic Asian spice rating. Hubs got the chicken sandwich and the pickled daikon was so good, tasted like a Vietnamese Banh mi yum yum.

name: Ginger Street
content: A popping place that's super indie and fun. They have a dj boothShrimp dumplings - my favorite app. Must order. Pork buns- worth it. So tender and delicious. Thai lettuce wrap- taste like cat food Fish- tender, delicious, crispy, fresh. Orange chicken- my favorite entree.

name: Ginger Street
content: This place never fails. I love their food! The pad Thai, chicken stir fry, and pork buns are always a home run. Tonight we tried to "make your own cocktail" where we added a liquor or our choice (vodka and tequila tonight) to the juice options on the menu. And it didn't disappoint. Refreshing and delicious!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Quaint little shop that I saw online a few blocks from my hotel. So, decided to check it out, and was not disappointed. One person was ahead of me, but took his lunch special to go, and ate it in his van just outside. I ordered the beef pad Thai while another couple guests came and ordered lunch specials. Food was quickly made and provided, and was very tasty. The food wasn't spicy (didn't order any heat) but I'm sure I could have asked for some spice, but the food was great without the 'heat'I would definitely come back to this quaint place and enjoy the food in the park or on the sidewalk (as long as there was space available.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: The best Thai food in all of salt lake. It's amazing. The pad siew is what I always get but apparently other things are just as good- I'm just hooked on that. Really feel like salt lake is lucky to have this place!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Combo meal is delicious!! You get two choices with rice and it's very dense as a meal. It does not come spicy so you can ask for a level of 1-Thai spicy. Always order with Thai spicy or you won't be able to taste the authenticity of the Thai food. The cook and owner were good people and definitely made it Thai spicy. I really enjoyed the complex tastes here and definitely coming back again.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This place was convenient to come to since I stay nearby and the receptionist here at my hotel recommended it. A cute lil hidden spot that was worth the walk; with some reasonably priced good food.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: After trying several Thai restaurants in SLC and coming away disappointed every time, we gave Laan Na Thai a try. It is the cutest little hole-in-the-wall restaurant and there was a line out the door waiting to pick up food, so i was hopeful that we would like what we ordered. And we were not disappointed. Our food was SO GOOD! I've found my Thai restaurant now in SLC. I can't wait to go back and try more items on the menu.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Pretty authentic Thai food with delicious flavors. Portions weren't large, but the price is good.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Everything I had was the best of in Utah. Their pad kee mao was amazing! The chicken soy curry was also amazing! There's. I seating inside, just sidewalk tables which is great too! I wish I lived closer so I could go all the time.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is my favorite Thai place in Salt Lake City! The food is so good and comes in good portions. It looks like a place you could easily miss, but it's worth a stop by!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Definitely a favorite Thai place in SLC. It's a hidden gem right off of Broadway, and has such good food for great prices. The owners are very nice as well. I recommend the curry dumplings for an appetizer!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Every time I come this place is amazing. The yellow curry is delicious and so are the drunken noodles! They are very quick and the portions are generous. Would highly recommend

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: A little hole-in-wall restaurant that serves up really good Thai food.  I'd give it five stars but it was missing something.  Something.. Something... Oh - Fish Sauce!  That was the authentic touch that would have put this place on the do not miss list.Lunches are SUPER affordable, which elevated this to a 4 star from my original 3 star.  And fast.  Super fast.  Brown rice option for no extra was a huge plus, too. During Covid times, they seem to have it covered.  Literally.  barricades in front of the food and register, gloves, masks, etc. No inside eating: Just order, pay grab and go.Seats outside are available to sit and eat.  It was perfectly sunny and 39 degrees but I was plenty warm with the higher elevation sun beating down on me.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: We went there 5 times in 7 days, always called in for order, always fast, professional, clean, and most importantly, incredibly delicious.The curry dumpling is simply heavenly. Everything else was great too. Highly recommend

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I was super early to return my rental car at SLC airport and still had an hour to kill so I googled nearest Thai restaurant and this hidden gem popped up! I'm so glad I got take out here before I left to go back home because it was delicious and definitely filled me up! Not only did I get mango coconut rice, but I got the one of the daily specials witch was the pumpkin curry, rice and they throw in a veggie egg roll (not too sure the name but it was so good). The pumpkin curry was so flavorful! The mango sticky rice also hit the spot too!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: We went in and ordered takeout pad Thai, drunken noodles, pineapple fried rice, and pad siew. It was all absolutely delicious and came out very fast even though it was all cooked fresh after we ordered it. This is definitely the best Thai food I've had!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is definitely the best Thai food I've found in Salt Lake City so far. It's a very unsuspecting place, basically the size of a kitchen, and nothing fancy about it. But the food quality was perfect. I ordered the Panama curry and a Thai coffee. My only recommendation is that if you like spicy food make sure to specify you want it extra spicy. Also for covid purposes: the employees use new gloves each time they handle a transaction and even give the customer a plastic covering for when they sign and tip. Excellent safety precautions

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I love Curry/Thai food but I'm always concerned about shellfish cross-contamination whenever I go out for it as my wife has a severe shrimp allergy.  We've been there a few times now and, despite their smaller kitchen size and larger number of shrimp dishes, Laan Na Thai has a better record than even Zupa's as far as not making her swell up like a blowfish.  The food itself is fantastic and fantastically priced on it's own, but the extra savings on Benedryl and Epi-Pens make this spot a no-brainer.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I LOVE this place!  The food is sooo good.  The sauce on the Yellow and Masaman curries, are amazing.  I could drink them.  The Mango 'Sticky Rice' is also fantastic.  The potstickers are delicious, but all because of the sauce.  The sauce!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Delicious, fast, affordable. Best thai I had in SLC.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Laan na Thai is endearing, delicious, fresh, and stylin. Support local business :-) places like this is what makes slc, slc.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Wow! We made a last minute decision to come here and it was the best decision! I am still thinking about it!!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Great Pad Thai late at night when nothing else was open.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This Thai place is a small hole in the wall across the street from the park and always seemed to be a little crowded. When I visited SLC with my boyfriend, we stayed downtown and found this gem.This place is run by a woman and her husband and it is authentic, wonderful Thai. The inside is very small with only a few people able to go in at a time. They're quick with their orders and the food always came piping hot. The best things were the curry dumplings and the yellow curry with sticky rice. Both curries were super flavorful and delicious! There was a good amount of meat and the veggies were really tender. The portions are huge for the price as well. If you're ever in SLC, this place should be near the top of your list of places to eat. It's simple but delicious. You can't go wrong with hot food made with love.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Much like the frog splash maneuver most associated with Rob Van Dam's career, this restaurant is 5 stars You will not find a more authentic thai restaurant in the city. Don't even bother looking.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Truly amazing Thai food. The restaurant set up is very unique and appealing. A very small footprint, which keeps the cost down. We got four dishes to go, and all four were excellent. I would definitely recommend Laan Na Thai restaurant.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I ordered two dishes for dinner. One was Pad Thai and it turned out ok as I've never liked Pad Thai and they did a good job to balance out that sourness. Then there was this second dish, Thai Fried Rice, it was an insult to fried rice. The rice was overcooked, it is probably from earlier in the day and I can see some rice forming blocks that didn't get seasoned at all. From my years' experience of eating and cooking rice, this has to be the lowest on the list. The meat I ordered with fried rice was absolutely no taste what so ever, it is like cutting a very cheap piece of frozen meat and soak it in water for hours to defrost. I understand the shop is trying to survive this pandemic but sacrificing the quality of their food to cut cost is more of counter-intuitive that no one will appreciate. I will not return for a second time and hope they good luck out there.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is a cute hole in the wall place. There is outside dinning upstairs and outside in front of the restaurant. I got vegetarian drunken noodles and vegetarian massaman tofu with brown rice. This place was quick and flavorful. Cured my spice fix- ask for spicier! Delicious!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Great spot, Pad thai is delicious, bean puffs are flaky, coffee is strong and delicious, I would die for these people

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I eat Thai food quite frequently and Laan Na Thai is some of the most authentic and delicious I have ever had the pleasure of eating. The Cashew Chicken was light, full of vegetables and extremely flavorful. The sauce on the Pad Thai with tofu was outstanding and did not have the "heavy" feel that one often finds on Pad Thai. This is an extremely casual restaurant where you walk up to the counter and order. The  food is handed to you packed in to go containers. There are multiple tables with umbrellas outside where you eat if you choose. I highly recommend Laan Na Thai.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I got the tofu pad Thai, basic dish unfortunately it wasn't very flavorful. The tofu wasn't fried at all and was mushy flavorless.  I'll most likely be back and try a different item just to give it another try.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: My best friend and i LOVE this place, we seriously crave it all the time. There's so many choices and everything is so fresh and authentic!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is absolutely freakin delicious!i could probably end there, except it leaves out the how and why.After being in Utah a year, and have eaten at some really bad thai places, some very average thai places, that i gave the benefit of the doubt to, and  some better than average thai places, that i gave 5 stars to out of desperation, i can clearly say this is the BEST in the state! And, in all fairness easily competes with some of the best Thai i have ever eaten.I have put off the review, because when i did, i would have to go back and drop everyone else at least a star in comparison to be fair how good this is.Its a tiny little shop, with mostly outdoor seating, (or take it to the park across the street like we did).The place is high speed low drag, orders go fast, portions are very generous, and am still trying to find something they are not good at.  they provide hot dry chili and lime with every dish, and that is a sign that they really get me without knowing me at all. Dishes ratings are going to look boring, but here goes:Drunken noodles 5 stars: it was a picture of this dish that got my wife and I to drive 45 minutes to SLC in the middle of a riot, to try. Its the best version I have had, and now my current favorite thai noodle dish. It passes Pad See Ew and Pad THai at my other favorite Thai in the AZ, which is saying something. rich, flavorful, and the noodles are done just right.Pineapple Fried Rice 5 stars: flavorful with ingredients different than the norm, but still amazing. sprinkle some of the dry chili on top and stick a fork in anyone who reaches for a taste.Panang Curry, 10 stars on a 5 scale: OMFH! the best i have ever had, no hyperbole. Thick rich coconut sauce, nice heat (level 3-4), and crisp tender vegetables that defy logic. How do they do that? I want to sneak in and watch some time. I have gotten beef and pork different times, and they were both good.Thai fried rice: 5 stars (see the trend?) tasty although i prefer the pineapple, and i don't really like thai basil, but they make it dominate here without overwhelming. The flavor balance is perfect, and i cant stop eating it.Pad Thai 4 stars: the pretty charming girl until you see her drunken noodle sister, and then she fades into the wall paper. Tasty, but not on the future menu choice for us, sorry sis! my fav place in AZ can sigh in relief, since they still do it better, but on nothing else!Massaman Curry 5 stars: Wifes fav, and i admit its pretty good, and i normally don't care as much for massaman. Veg and meat and potatoes done perfect again, and we have eaten here enough to know its not an accident.Overall, you get the drift, its not high end, its a couple of very hardworking people who produce great thai, and you can take out and sit in the nice weather and eat. It's currently on my top 5 favorite places to eat, and i'm not sure what it would take to get them off.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Wow!!! I love everything at this place! Thanks so much for all the delights! It's great how the weekday specials rotate so you can try a variety of things. That being said, be sure to check the specials for the day before going for lunch. I would highly recommend any of the noodle dishes but honestly the curry here is to die for. The curry dumplings are something else and certainly worth a try!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Such good food! Huge portions, and the kind of flavor and heat that I love in my Thai food. They put the chili powder off to the side so if you don't like spicy, you can eat it without any spice. Called ahead and picked up during the pandemic and it was very easy (and yummy of course)!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Hands down my favorite Thai place I have ever been to. Every time I am in town I am sure to stop by for dinner. Food is delicious, quick service, and always very kind. Great food for a great value!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Always delicious every time!!! Perfect for takeout. There is limited outdoor seating here. I loooove the pad Thai, so great to grab on the way home when you're too tired to cook dinner :) this place never disappoints. Definitely one of the best Thai restaurants in SLC.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: The curry is very good, amazing depth of flavor.  I'm always a sucker for curry that has a thicker consistency though, more of a stew than a soup, and there curry is a little runny.  But that does not take away from the flavor; very fragrant and a full flavor that brings out all the notes of the spices and vegetables.  Fresh vegetables that are not overcooked nor raw.  Very large quantities as well, which is a plus!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: The food was fantastic! I decided to order takeout because I was tired of cooking during this quarantine. Little did I know that this was a gem and the food is superb. The best part is that the food is cooked by a woman who was very understanding and pleasant to call letting her know I was running late for my pick up.Everything was fresh and delicious and best part is it's right in my neighborhood and you support Minority owned businesses. Seriously goodness Thai food in SLC!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Wow. Most amazing Thai food. We had the Drunken Noodles and the Kao Soi Chicken. Great flavor and the chicken just fell off the bone. Not to mention the fresh veggies in both dishes. Super sticky delicious sticky rice. Totally worth our stop in Salt Lake City.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This gem of a place might not look much but the food is amazing. It is not a place you sit down and eat but perfect for take out. Prices are amazing and they give you so so much food that you can probably face a single dish for the meal times. My favorite is their drunken noodles. I would definitely recommend.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: The Kha Soi chicken is incredible!! When I worked downtown, I ate there at least once a week. Everything is great! But the Kha Soi is amazing.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Decided to get Thai to go for dinner. With Covid-19 they close at 8 pm now ( and I think they open at noon but not fully sure) and they don't take orders in person (I called). They are really careful with using single use gloves, giving you gloves to sign for your card etc..I don't know anything about Thai food, but I got the Thai Fried Rice with tofu and it was great! I always had leftovers (like every time I get food there), so I ate it for lunch again, twice the pleasure! My husband got the pork with potatoes and carrots... A bit spicy for him, but didn't prevent him from eating the entire plate! And he gave my dog the bones... My dog make the connection and is trying to pull me in the restaurant when we walk by now!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: COVID friendly: they close at 8pm now and call in orders only. Masks + gloves so I feel safe picking up foodThe food: best Thai in salt lake at an amazing priceFavorite dishes below: Kai soi chicken: personal favorite. If you like yellow curry get this. Green curry pasta: not a typical thing to order but it's also packed with so much flavor. I went full seafood and it was worthwhileDrunken noodle: favorite traditional noodle dish Pineapple curryIn short, the curries pack a ton of flavor and aren't overly sweet/watered down like some other places.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I always feel like I should preface a 3-star review by emphasizing that this is based on personal preference. In fact, wish I could tag my friend in this to leave a review because she RAVES about this place and this is her go-to when she's feelin' some Thai.This place doesn't feel consistent to me. I've been there on 3 separate occasions, ordered pad thai each time and have been please 1/3 times. I had a great first experience and really enjoyed my entree but when I went back the second and third time, hoping to have the same experience, I was disappointed both times. My dish seemed to lack a lot of flavor and had a burnt taste the third time. It's important to note that they don't have seating here besides the few seats against the wall, so it's more of a take-out place in my opinion. I will say that you get more than what you pay for portion wise. I shared my dish and between two people, still didn't finish it. Overall, this place is "okay" in my book.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Stopped in for a quick lunch and ordered the Pad Thai based on other reviews. It was delicious and definitely something I would order again.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: We got take out.  It was very quick.  We ordered drunken noodle, pad Thai, curry dumplings, and mango sticky rice.  This food was the best Thai food I have had since being in Thailand.  This is definitely the place to go for authentic Thai food.  It is delicious!  There are a couple of high top tables and bar stools - so not a ton of seating.  If you have a group, get it to go.  If it's just a couple people you can sit at the bar.  The couple is soo nice and they work really hard.  Support this local business!  You won't regret it!!!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Great hole in the wall Thai joint in downtown SLC, quick yummy food, nice lady working the place.  Will come back and recommend you come too.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I was traveling through for business and noticed Laan Na Thai wasn't too far from my hotel.  Parking may be a challenge during the day but I came in after 5:00 and found a place no problem.  As many have mentioned, this restaurant is very small with limited seating.  I don't like to eat in my hotel rooms so I stayed in and sat by the front windows facing the street. It was cold so they  had the outdoor seats locked up.  I ordered the drunken noodles with tofu and sticky rice with mango for dessert.  It came out very quick in a styrofoam container with plastic utensils and chopsticks. It was very good, plentiful, and hot.  If you're traveling through, this is a neat place to eat but you may want to take it to go. I didn't see a restroom so that could be an issue.  The lady is a good cook but short on personality.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Literally a hole in the wall. I love that this place exists in Salt Lake City. Ordered a 2 item combo for takeout. I tried the massamun curry with pork riblet and kao soi curry wIth chicken thigh. Both are delicious dishes. What's even better is that the items change daily. Next time I'd like to try their noodles! Downside: I think the fan was broken that night so the smoke from the fried items were trapped inside. Hope they can fix that soon.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Ordered takeout here for dinner, so good! The online menu was a bit confusing, posted only on Facebook.  I thought the combos were lunch specific, my mistake. Will definitely be going back for combos but the drunken noodles were great!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Shrimp pad Thai. Definitely had better. Pretty bland. Probably won't go there again but I wouldn't say it was bad. Friends rave over it so might align with your tastes.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I love the pad Thai here, it is as authentic as it gets. It's run by a Thai mom and pop and the food is delicious. It's my go-to place for Thai food and I love supporting the family. Seating is limited since it is a small shop but there are outdoor seating. Most of the stir fry dishes are made to order and the curry dishes are usually ready-to-serve.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Classic hole in the wall, grungy looking and right across from pioneer Park.. what was I thinking. I was thinking I want to finally eat good Thai food. I was not disappointed. I felt like I was back in LA getting some good grub.. not typical Utah fare. Noodles, egg rolls, pot stickers..all so good. There are some cute markets behind this place too.. don't miss out on checking those out. Tip- if you love Thai and someone else in your party doesn't, there is a place right next door that has chicken, burgers, waffles.. you can sit outside on the tables together and eat the food you like... No compromise needed:)Check out the Italian deli tucked behind this place.. amazing.. get your dessert there:)

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Utah. It is the best. I have been here at least 20 times and every time it is good. Chicken drunken noodles, chicken/tofu/shrimp pad Thai, and curry dumplings are my favorites.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Seriously some of the best Thai food I've ever had. It was a little greasy and there isn't much seating but the vibe is great for a small hole in the way Thai place.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Incredible food and service! There are only two people working and they got my dish out within 5-10 minutes with 6 people ahead of me. Food is amazing and authentic! Would recommend 10/10

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Great, fresh, hot food. Cooked right in front you, so you know its fresh. We had the Drunken Noodles and Massaman pork rib curry. I'd definitely come here again.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Little hole in the wall takeout place. Curry dumplings are the reason to come here. They are amazing!  Pad Thai was just ok.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I ordered the chicken pad Thai. After having a disappointing experience with one of their commercialized competitors. I still needed my pad Thai fix and these guys delivered gangbusters. I will definitely be back.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: First time here. Tried the chicken pad Thai, chicken pineapple fried rice and curry dumplings. We get the first two items at other establishments quite a bit and this was one of the best we have had. The curry dumplings were amazing and highly recommend. No complaints, friendly service and very quick!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Wow, this place was a total hole in the wall and right next to Pioneer Park but it was absolutely incredible. The pork dumplings were the best I have ever had.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: amazing.. people are so hospitable there.. don't forget to try egg rolls and curry puffs.... I might like those even more than entrees...

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Their egg rolls and sauce are amazing. Delicious Thai cuisine. Would definitely go there again for a quick lunch or dinner. Very small joint with limited indoor seating, and the menu is on your right when you walk in instead in front of you where you order (which I didn't notice so I had to ask).

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I had the drunken noodles which was recommended by the girl who took my order. It was made to order and was fantastic! They put the pepper spicing on the side with a lime to make to your liking; so don't worry if you're not a fan of spice. Not much seating, maybe 6-8 seats inside, so bring a jacket if it's cold or take your food to go.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: When you think Thai food, there are a LOT of restaurants that come to mind, but this humble location right by Pioneer Park has dished up some of the best Thai I've had in a very long time. First of, it's unassuming size is easily overlooked when you drive downtown, so much so that you'll probably notice Bruges Waffles before you notice this place. But, when you're walking towards Laan Na, the delicious aroma of Thai spices lure you in like an invisible Pied Piper!I like my Asian Cuisine simple, so I order the Pad Thai and the seasoning was perfectly balanced, the noodles not mushy, and the ratio of sauce to noodle is just right. The flavors are authentic, they're light handed with the sugar which in my experience, makes it more authentic, if that's what you're looking for.Expand your Thai food repertoire and give this place a try! And hop on next door for dessert!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Figured I'd grab a quick bite and Thai sounded real good to me. This was the closest to me so I stopped in. It's very small, and doesn't really invite you to stay too long as it's really designed as more of a takeout than a dine in. Read reviews all a out the dumplings with the yellow curry and got myself chicken pad Thai. The owners were friendly too.The pad Thai was steaming when I opened the box. It was as good as you could imagine pad Thai to be. The dumplings were out of this world. The sauce was creamy and the notes of curry weren't too strong.I'll be dreaming of this place after I go back to Chicago for sure.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Tried the chicken satay and ginger tofu rice entree. The chicken satay portion was huge, I thought it would be two skewers, as shown in the picture on the wall but instead, I received three and they are ginormous! It came with a peanut sauce and a sweet chili sauce. Ok, the former is just divine. I wanted to douse the rice with it. The ginger tofu had mushrooms, firm tofu (not fried), thin ginger chunks, white and green onion all in a sweet brown sauce. Everything tasted delicious. The only downside is the limited indoor seating, more of a takeout place.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Favorite Thai restaurant in downtown SLC. We always order the Chicken Pad Thai with a side of spring rolls. I also just discovered their Thai Tea and it's ammmazing. Highly recommended!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: One of my favorite fast Thai go-to's in Salt Lake City.If you drive by, you might not even notice the little restaurant. But waking by, you smell the aroma of the sweet and sour dishes that are cooked up.After trying various dishes, my favorite one is definitely the curry dumpling appetizer. It's pork dumplings marinated in a green curry sauce that melts in your mouth. In addition to that, I really dig the drunken noodles. It has a deep appetizing color and it tastes just as savory. I prefer the appetizers and entrees that are freshly made instead of the pre-made curries. Those tend to be served lukewarm, but are good nonetheless. For the price, it's well worth it. I just hope they can cut down on the styrofoam boxings because some dishes can simply come in tin foil, such as the appetizers. Overall, great little restaurant that I frequently visit.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: The ratings for this restaurant are inflated. It's solid, affordable, street Thai food but not especially quality food. Staff is polite but pointing will be the language translator!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: My favorite Thai food in Utah. The flavor and love in the food is on point. Always fast and kind service. This spot is locally owned and by immigrants whom were sponsored through The Spice Kitchen; such a heartening story as to how they became business owners.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Just ok. Place is pretty dirty inside and kind of speedy for what you get. Lacking flavor...just kind of blah. I got the drunken noodles with tofu and it was just very bland. For price paid needed more vegetables and some kick. Would not return.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: this place was a super surprise that I found by accident, and the food was soooo fresh and soooo good. I have been to Thailand and this is 100% authentic! everything was so delicious and fresh and not caked down with extra seasonings and salt. i'm sad that I am only passing through otherwise I would come back here over and over again!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is the definition of hole in the wall ma and pa shop which I am all for supporting! You walk into a room about the size of a bedroom with the two owners ready to take your order. There is limited bar style seating inside and a few tables outside on the sidewalk. I'm from Seattle where we have a huge melting pot of culture and there are more than a fair share of Thai restaurants I have been to.First off, the curry along with some other soups and dishes are already precooked and on cooking heaters at the cash register. Don't let that put you off though because the yellow curry was probably the 2nd or 3rd best curry I have had thus far and I've tried at least 20+ different yellow curries. The Pad Seiw is also very flavorful and amazing! I would definitely recommend this place and would continue eating here. There is a dish called Drunken Noodles which is an escalation of the Pad Seiw with more vegetables! 5/5

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is the exact definition of an awesome mom and pop shop. Not only was it really delicious, but we got a ton of food! I love this place. Definitely going to go back.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: The food is 5 stars, for sure! Absolutely delicious flavors. And, the story of the owners -- inspiring. So, why 4 stars? Well, if you choose to eat there (limited indoor and outdoor space), they don't use reusable plates and cutlery -- just styrofoam and plastic. If they move away from the styrofoam and plastic, five stars for this cute and tasty place!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: came in for some lunch and was treated to some very delicious curry and thai tea. the yellow curry is amazing but you can't go wrong with anything. will be back again

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Came into town to visit a friend and she took me here! Amazing food with lists of flavor and spices, and all for a really good price.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Great authentic Thai food! Many options for meat eaters and vegetarians! I got the drunken noodles with chicken and it was cooked to perfection. The best I've had here in Utah!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: i really enjoyed the pad thai yesterday. i would come back here again to try other dishes

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Cutest family owned Thai food. Love the curry dumplings and drunken noodles. Walkable from our apartment.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Food is amazing!!! So flavorful! I crave this place at least once a week! I think it's a hidden gem! More people need to know about the amazing food they have here

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I'm from Seattle where we have a lot of places with pretty solid Thai food, but this place blew all the others out of the water. Their Phad Thai was the best I've ever eaten, I wanted to continue eating but I was so full I couldn't and was so happy for the leftovers!! We had the Phad Thai and Phad See Ew (based on other yelp recommendations) and both were incredible. I honestly can't wait for next Salt Lake City trip to eat their food again!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: We stopped by this place on the way to the airport from Park City. Lots of variety on the menu and the food tastes authentic. The atmosphere outside is amazing.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Amazing curry, drunken noodles, and pad Thai. Seasoned fantastically. I've been here so many times and have never been disappointed! Sooo good.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Green chicken curry is bomb. Tiny little kitchen, amazing food. Friendly and very fast service.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I love this place. Been going here for quite a long time. The Kao Soi is the show stopper here. Just amazing flavor. Also the brown rice, get it.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Love this place! Everything I have ever gotten has been delicious. My go to is pineapple fried rice with shrimp and the curry dumplings are so tasty. I love the sauce they put on the dumplings. They cook everything right in front of you and is always fresh. I love supporting small business like this. Excellent fast service with a smile.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: The best Thai place I have ever been to. I even went with my friend who lived in Thailand and he loved it! We first shared three plates among four people, but it was just too good... so we ordered two more!! Our #1 recommendation is to get the Kao soi chicken curry! It has flavors that will literally make you say "OH MY" to your friends. It's a creamy coconut milk based supported by beautiful curry spices that isn't to hot and a little sweet. We also got the mussamun curry and the drunken noodles! Both were excellent but overshadowed by how good the kao soi chicken! We also ordered them with the black rice or forbidden rice. Which has numerous health benefits without it tasting to dry or healthy. It's a little hole in the wall owned by a cute hardworking Thai family! Seats about 8 max

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: I heard that the The owners are from Thailand. Th sitting space is limited in door and the kitchen is not separated from the dinning area. If you don't like the smell of cooking smoke, probably not a good idea to sit and eat in the restaurant. You can order to go or in the summer there are tables outside. Pad Thai 3/5 It has a flavor/smell that I don't know how to describe. But they did give me lots of meats. I had pad Thai at other restaurants where the pad Thai has more peanut sauce flavor and a little sweeter. Drunken noodles 4/5 first time having this dish. Taste much better than their pad Thai.   The noodles are wide and flat.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: If you're looking for quick delicious authentic Thai food, visit this hole-in-the-wall mom and pop shop.  Reminds me a lot of the street food in Thailand. I've gone several times and ordered the chicken drunken noodles which has always been my favorite go to--this is my favorite spot to get it. It's always made fresh and service is quick. I'm usually in and out within 5-7 minutes. They offer combos with rotating daily dishes which include a variety of curries, stir fry, etc. I have not tried them but it seems like a popular choice for most visitors. Portions are generous and you cannot beat the price. Seating is very limited inside, they do offer outside seating. In my opinion, just order it to go and enjoy it in the comfort of your car or home.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Really yummy! Fresh and hot! The pad Thai was excellent. Food was five star. The only reason I can't give them 5 is it's more of a stand/quick grab to go than a restaurant. Seating was limited to like 8 counter spots.Staff was super friendly and got our food within 5 minutes! Try them out :)

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This little restaurant is near the center of down town Salt Lake City, next to a park.  Super fresh made food and full of flavors!  You have to come and try, it's delicious!

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Had the pineapple fried rice and the Panang beef curry and was quite surprised at how good it was! It's a small spot but delivers great food! Will definitely be back for more

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Tried this place for the first time for lunch. The food is awesome and fresh. Family owned which I love. There is not a lot of seating but nice if the weather is good and can sit outside. Bar seating so not great if want to sit for a long time. Great for take-out.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is the best tasting and cheapest Thai food I have tried in all Utah valley. The food is authentic, service is sooo quick, and you cannot beat the pricing here. The environment is like street food and the owners are patient and kind. Definitely will be returning.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: Wow... I think I might have walked into Thai heaven. The food was simply amazing and cheap. Seating is limited but not hard to find since for some reason I can't understand there weren't many people there.I'm looking forward to coming here in the summer when the patio is out. This might just be my new favorite place.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: We came from out of town, read the good reviews, and it did not disappoint one bit. Pad Thai was up there with the best. The food came out hot and quick, sides of crushed pepper and peanuts to choose your own portioning, and the people were very nice. Would recommend to all Thai foodies.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: This is hands down my fav Thai food in town. Been coming here for years. The Green Curry with Shrimp is my current meal of choice, but everything I've ordered has been good. It's  small without lots of tables, and it's a real big city Thai food experience.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: A no frills mom and pop shop. The old place was Ekamai Thai and I never went there so can't comment on the differences.The menu is pretty straightforward, they have the daily specials, as well as other items to choose from. The curries were quite good and not so runny like other places.Their egg rolls, Thai iced tea, and mango sticky rice all delicious as well. Seating is very limited if you choose to eat inside or you can sit outside as well.For sure will be back.

name: Laan Na Thai Restaurant
content: The spring rolls are perfect and the curry is delicious. Not to mention the food is ready so fast. Laan Na Thai has become my go to take out restaurant. This is also a great place to try new dishes because every thing I've tried has been great. I highly recommend it.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: GOOD LORD!This place lives up to the hype!!The best frites I've ever had were in San Luis Obispo, CA and the best waffle I've ever had was in Vancouver, Canada. AND THIS PLACE TRUMPS THEM BOTH!!!The fries are cooked and seasoned to perfection. The aioli is light and complimentary. They had other sauces but this came at the recommendation of the gentleman working there. The "Favorite" waffle is light and delightful. It's warm, lightly sweet and crunchy on the outside. The creme fraiche is light, airy and subtly sweet. The strawberries compliment it so nicely and are super fresh!!If you're just visiting for a night or two, make sure you put this on your list!!!!!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I generally avoid waffles and pancakes for the frozen food and syrups! But this place was so gooood with fresh fruits and a good vanilla bean ice cream clubbed with a nice crisp waffle! Their fries or frites are awesome too ... very home made with yummy sauces!!! Totally loved the place!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: If you've read any of my other reviews, you would know that I've been looking for my favorite fries in the city. I'm sorry I waited so long to try Bruges!Incredible fries and sauces (probably why they've been awarded best fries in the city since 2011). I highly recommend the fry sauce and ranch as classics and the Samurai and Zango for something a little different.The downtown location is next to Caputo's Market and a few other great quick bites. This would be a great stop for a snack, meal, or dessert. There're a few seats inside (blocked for COVID) but some nice tables and benches out front or on the rooftop courtyard.On a Saturday night, street parking is sparse, so be prepared to walk a little or make an event of eating and shopping near here.Bruges will always be my go-to for a late evening snack!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Amazing waffles! Honestly I don't know if I can call what I make at home waffles any more after these amazing ones. The menu is simple which unlike and you can't go wrong!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: We went here for a quick bite and got the favorite waffle and fries. The waffles here were one of the best waffles I've ever had. The crime that they top their waffles with go very well with the strawberries! I will definitely come back next time we're in Salt Lake City.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Came across this place while exploring SLC. We got the chicken and waffle and the sausage and egg waffle.I'd say the food is pretty decent. The chicken was crispy and hot, the waffles were glazed I think, and the Belgian sausage was hot and yummy. Prices were pretty decent as well. We got our order fast. Employees were decent as well, no crazy good customer service but decent.I'm giving four stars only because the place looked a little bit suspicious to me. There was dust and dirt spots inside the place, but the cooking area looked pretty decent, so I guess it didn't matter too much.I'd go back for more.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Such a great vibe overall! The food was amazing, waffles were so moist! A little slow but not bad.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I recall that it was decadent and significantly more than I wanted to spend on a super trashy date. At first I thought the blue hair was kind of kinky, but quickly determined that there was a certain underlying depravity and addiction that was not satisfied by crispy, Belgian treats.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Bruges has so many good options on their menu to choose from. Whether its something sweet or something savory, they've got it and the food is so good. The staff and owner are so friendly, too. Great place to eat!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Place was cranking but super ice was really good and everybody was getting their orders punctually despite how busy they were.  I didn't try the food, as my 4 waffles went to a catered event I hosted... Wish I had tasted them though....

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Yum yum!!! Very serious food fries are on spot even though we did wait quiet a bit for our fries it was worth it .

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Delicious! I have not been there in COVID, so I cannot speak to that, but they made some delicious food when I was there December 2019. Fresh berries, delicious cream...loved it.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I am a huge fan of Bruges and have been for many years. However, the prices have gotten so high, and the portions have gotten so small. I went tonight and had a 6.5/10  tasting waffle, but In no world was the waffle I got, not to mention its skimpiest portions of toppings, worth the $10 that I paid.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Man we loved this place. So many sauces to try with the delicious fries. We came here twice in one day so we could try more stuff. The hot cocoa with coffee and Creme was awesome. The owner was there during the day and he is super cool and friendly. Waffles were tasty. Just wish I was local so I could try more of the menu.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: keep your expectations low for customer service. they are definitely lacking in that department. the chicken, fries & fry sauce were awesome. not impressed with the waffles. it tasted doughy and undercooked. my friend and i were excited to try the waffle monster and chicken & waffle because the pictures we saw had a very cute presentation of the dish. we had to do a take out order and the lady who took our order didn't bother telling us everything in our order would be in separate containers, not looking like the picture on the menu or the ones we saw online. big disappointment there.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Consistently delicious! Best breakfast in town, and great for dinner or late night also! The chicken and waffles and the machine gun are my two favorites!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Out of towner and a friend who is a local said this is a must go to place! (I enjoy supporting businesses that bring their authentic nationality and heritage into the cuisine.) Needless to say the waffles taste amazing! Quite different (and way better!) than a traditional Belgian waffle you get at any American eatery. The Belgian chocolate drizzle is also sweet and tasty with the combination of whip cream and raspberries. The entire waffle was not overly sweet as a mid day snack. This cuisine experience has definitely made me crave more, now that I'm back home. Even their Frits tasted unique and higher quality than again a traditional American eatery. Not sure what it is but I'll definitely be returning when I'm visiting SLC again.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: May be I am in a minority here, but I hated the goopy hodge podge of fried chicken and dessert. I can see kids liking it, I don't understand how adults can eat this stuff.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: This is the best waffle in town with a friendly staff (and owner) and well worth the price. Definitely put this in your short list and don't worry about the line, it moves quickly.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Tasty waffles. The waffles are the best part, topping ok, whipped cream is very good.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I wish I found this place earlier as I'm leaving today. The Belgium waffles are out of this world lovely little place for breakfast or a snack.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: My wife and I love coming to this place. I've had many things on the menu and have yet had a bad experience. The owner is super chill and nice!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Came all the way from California and I wasn't disappointed! They're food is deliciously savoring in every bite! I had the chicken and waffles, I did not expect for it to actually look like a chicken! Too cute! Loved it! Will come again!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Great dessert spot with nice outdoor seating. The presentation was super cute and it tasted just as good! We will definitely be coming back to try their other waffles.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Pretty good treats. I personally would not go here for real food. But if you need a place to get fat...merry Christmas

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: We got takeout and both ordered the cinnamonster plus a medium side of frites. Honestly the frites were the highlight of our meal. Both waffles were basically rock hard on the outside and strangely doughy on the inside. I struggled to cut through my waffle with the plastic silverware provided. I don't think a waffle should be THAT difficult to cut. It's the main reason why I'm giving 3 stars. If you have a sweet tooth/are a Nutella lover this is a hit w/ the toppings, the ice cream was good as well. Now on a positive note- the frites are a good cut and their variety of sauces are great. As a Utah resident their fry sauce is soo good and I tried the refreshing sauce was interesting but also good. These really pulled through for the meal.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Best waffles in the whole world! If you're anywhere near SLC you MUST go. Everything on the menu is divine, but the torpedo and the apple pie have a special place in my heart. These waffles would be the appetizer, main course, and dessert of my last meal on death row. I will be back!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: It was a day out going to support our local restaurants. We found Bruges Waffle & Frites and chose to try this small little Hoke In The Wall place. When we arrived they were just about to "Open" according to the Hours of Service sign in the window. We sat there waiting for them to turn on their OPEN sign on. We waited and waited and finally I tried the door and it opened. There were two younger ladies inside working. We weren't greeted, but we were asked, "What do you want?" We asked what was the best item or for a recommendation for what us newbies should order. The response was, It's all pretty good." Well my thought was if it's only going to be pretty good, then I'd better go somewhere else to eat. We ordered to meals, the Chicken and Waffle and a Sausage and Egg meal, under the "HEARTY" section of the menu.The Chicken, Waffle and Butter was hard to swallow let alone put in my mouth. The Chicken was over cooked and the waffle was very doughy and covered by about a cup of butter. The Chicken Strips were very small and the Waffle was no bigger than 4" in diameter. It all fit on a to-go plate that was 5" wide and 8" in length. The waffle was more like eating gritty, uncooked bread dough with butter, and I mean butter, and a very little syrup.The Sausage and Egg meal was served in the same type of serving container and came with 1 sausage link, 1egg and the small gritty uncooked waffle. We also ordered two Carmel Coffees and what we got were two cups of coffee. We mentioned the problem and the lady told me she was sorry and continued to do whatever it was she was doing. After two minutes I figured she was done dealing with me? Neither employee ever welcomed us or asked us how we were doing. They seemed very ungrateful that we were there. It was like we put them out by being there and they were upset that they had to work.Well I do not only "not" recommend that you go here, but I Highly Recommend you stay far away from here, unless you are going to visit of the other businesses or the Farmers Market on Tuesday's and Saturday's!At BEST I would rate them a 1/2 Star out of 5 Stars just for the fact that they showed up for work. But when you pay $37.00 for two inedible meals and two small coffees, I felt more like I was better off going to a Bernie Madoff investors party with my life savings than going to this place to have a good meal!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Went with our kids for a late breakfast. Food freshness was great and the staff very friendly. My only dislike was how sweet the waffles are. The waffle itself is extremely sweet, like overpowering. This may be what real Belgian waffles are like, I don't know. I'm just used to a much less sweet waffle with the delicious toppings being the sugary sweet part. My husband ordered the bacon and egg waffle and that waffle was sugary sweet as well. He couldn't eat it. It's a great place and their sandwiches sound amazing but the waffle is way too sweet. I felt like I was eating birthday cake.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I traveled across the country just to eat here again. This time we tried the chicken and waffles which were AMAZING. The salty chicken is a delicious contrast to the heaping scoop of sweet whipped cream . We also had the s'mores waffle which we waited a bit to long to each and the marshmallow had hardened and was a bit difficult to eat, but tasty! We had to have some of their delicious fries as well and really enjoyed the green sauce. Can't wait to come back!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I loved their waffle. It was sweet with Vanilla which went great with the he eggs and bacon. It was a perfect size so I didn't feel overly sick like you do with huge waffles.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: This place is absolutely amazing!!! So savory and sweet, the waffle was perfectly cooked and fluffy and the chicken was moist and crispy. The perfect combination! I will definitely be back to try out more of their menu items!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: This review is for my experience several months back when my friend and I were in SLC for a short trip. We were really excited to try Belgian waffles made by Belgians; unfortunately, we weren't all that impressed.We thought the size of the waffle was really, really small for the price. It could literally fit on the palm of my hand (and my hands are petite!). The waffles were made with brown sugar and should've had some sort of a crunch, but even the portions that didn't have strawberries or syrup on it had no crunch whatsoever. In addition, the batter must've not been well mixed because some portions of the waffle had more brown sugar than others, making it such a shock of sugariness when you eat the wrong part!We also tried the Croque Madame with the egg on top with fries. The sandwich was definitely better than the waffle, but overall I thought that it was just ok, nothing super spectacular. The fries were ok and they had different dipping sauces. Overall I would not recommend a stop by this place - definitely not for the waffle, but maybe just for a quick bite of the sandwich.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Customer service is HORRIBLE. I made an order online and came to pick it up. I got the wrong time for pick-up. The manager(?) literally came out of the truck just to give me a lecture for coming late. Showed me his phone and pointed out where I made an error. Sheesh! The poor teenage boys working for him looked sheepish and embarrassed. I can only imagine what working for/with someone that abrasive is like. Never again. No thank you.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Amazing Belgian waffles. I really like the machine gun sandwich but it's pretty huge. The frites are really good and crispy. Nice balance between potato and crisp. The sauces are also really good

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Used to love this place, then one time while enjoying my waffle I bit into a piece that was connected to the rest of the waffle by a long strand of blonde hair. Told the guy working there, he told me it was the sugar that had an appearance of blonde hair. It wasn't sugar, you could hold up the chunk with hair in it and the rest of the waffle could dangle because it also had the strand cooked into it. Disgusting. Haven't gone back. The fries are tight though and might be a safe option. In conclusion I didn't appreciate that the kid working wouldn't just make me a new waffle, sans hair, instead he told me what I was experiencing was wrong. Also as we were leaving, a worker with long blonde hair was returning from taking the trash out. It was their hair in my waffle.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Came in to get the chicken and waffles expecting to see what I saw on the picture and this is what I got terrible customer service also tipped the guy. Never will come here again

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Terrible customer service. Guy was a jerk and then on n top of that forgot part of our order and never made it. Waffle was cold and hard. I bet they're good when someone who is a decent human being and cares about their job makes them.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: So I absolutely love this place and have for YEARS. But. I went in to get a waffle this morning with my husband and I cannot even believe how absolutely slow and mindless the girls working behind the counter were. I don't think it would be humanly possible for people to move any slower getting orders taken care of while the entire place was packed full of people. They were nonchalantly walking around, talking to each other and moving slower than I have ever seen in my life. The food is always amazing but I honestly can't ever go again if the service is going to be so mindless and slow. Especially when it's so busy. We waited 30 minutes for two waffles. Not because it was busy-because the employees just moved So slowly. I also have to say that I think the food is overpriced. $10 for a tiny waffle (that was very overcooked) and a strawberry or two on top is a stretch. I brought my husband because I was so excited for him to try it but I feel like quality and service has definitely gone down hill.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: WOWSA!!! We happened upon this tiny hole in the wall place thanks to Yelp and we were blown away!! Pierre, the creator and owner, was working and made us the most delicious breakfast !! We had chicken and waffles , the famous Machine Gun Sandwich, Flemish Stew & frites , the amazing hot chocolate and coffees , and last but not least both the dark chocolate and vanilla frozen waffle desserts. We are now falling into Waffle comas and it was TOTALLY worth it!!  Do not miss treating yourself to this fabulous foodie experience!!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Tiny hole-in-the-wall with class and taste. Great for a date. Sit outside. Not much seating inside anyways. Delicious options. My hot date got something sweet while I got the savory Machine Gun thing. Good portions. One of our SLC faves.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Bruges has become my favorite stop in SLC. The original location here at 3rd west / 3rd south is takeout only with outdoor seating next to Pioneer park. For better parking and sit down space, visit their sugarhouse location. They also brew Belgian beer there. The machine gun sandwich was featured on man vs food. But If your not a fan of lamb, the Ricky Burger was tasty, and I always recommend Chicken Waffle. If you are a simpleTon, just order la carte for a basic Vanilla Waffle with Crème Fraiche.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: If I could have given this place more than 5 stars, I would have!  This location is a bit small, but it makes up for it with the food!  I ordered an apple waffle (absolutely delicious) and cappuccino.  As the few tables that were inside were taken, I sat outside to eat.  There was also a nice view of a park across the street.  I also had the pleasure of meeting a young lady that was in the area for a business trip as well as a mother/daughter who were long-time residents.  I enjoyed my breakfast and the company of great people!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: What a cute tiny little place. And the food is very yummy! I had the Shot Gun. Yummy!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Every time I'm in SLC I have to stop here! It's perfect for breakfast, and afternoon snack, or dinner. There is little to no seating, so be prepared to sit outside or take it to go. Either way it's super delicious!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: The frites live up to the hype. Handcut, a little limp - the only thing I like a little limp - with browned edges and a deep potato-y flavor topped with a dee-lishus fry sauce! The fries were part of the Man v. Food Machine Gun signature sandwich which is a baguette topped with a couple of lamb links topped with the frites and drizzled with fry sauce. The baguette tasted pretty authentically French without being from France. The sausages were tiny and - at first I was disappointed - but when I bit into this weird sandwich I understood! It was perfectly balanced and the right amount. So, 1) it ain't always about size and 2) get this sandwich and finish your meal with a Belgian waffle.p.s. a little on the pricey side. Or think European portions for the price. But lots of satisfying flavor-quality over quantity. So a good experience with a good end instead of just a long, um, eating experience. Sorry, went off the rails a little here.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Just a small place - almost a hole in the wall. I had the bacon and eggs and it was so delicious and filling. Probably the best waffle I've ever had.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Excellent food! Loved the waffles my favorite is the rhapsody! Crunchy sweet & delicious

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I was surprised how disappointed I was.I got the machine gun sandwich, which was $10.88 with tax, and it only contains one very thin sausage, which looks to be a little less than 1/2 an inch in diameter. The food itself is good, the fries and sauce are nice and the bun and sausage were fine, but it was just such an insultingly thin single sausage and such a small amount of meat for so much money. You end up just eating fries on a bun with a little sauce, and although I suppose it's novel it's a really stupid sandwich combo and isn't worth the 10.88 it costsI suspect other items are better but the machine gun sandwich isn't worth your money or time.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Real belgian waffles, amazing taste, nice and cosy... you won't ear better waffles in the us!!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: You haven't had a Belgian Waffle until you've tried Bruges Waffles & Fites. Worth a visit!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: We were recently in town for a youth sports tournament and were looking for a place for dinner close to our hotel. We ended up here and were impressed. So impressed that we had breakfast there the next day and told our team about it. They all eneded up there the next day. Food was great; fresh, quick, tasty and reasonably priced.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I was enticed by the idea of fries and gravy (andouille sauce) and they've got that in spades. Add some meat to a baguette, topped with their fries and you've got their magnum opus. Good spot to snack or eat if you're near Pioneer Park!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: This was our first stop after arriving and was a great place to grab a quick bite. The menu is unique and flavorful. I recommend reading the menu before you go because it's overwhelming when you arrive! The mini gun and frites was spicy and delicious. It was the perfect portion size for myself. My kids loved the sugar house. The fruit topping was delicious and the waffle was perfect! We would frequent this restaurant frequently if we lived here year round.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I stumbled across this restaurant about six years ago and fell in love with it.   I've moved all over the country and any chance I get to stop by and get a waffle I take.  The staff at this visit wasn't super friendly however, the waffles are still amazing.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I love their product, however, I have never been more sick in my life than after eating a sandwich from Bruges.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Amazing fries!! The best I've ever had hands down. Then they throw in some amazing Belgian waffles and beer just to overload your taste buds with everything good in this world. You think these three items dont belong in the same sentence? I dare you to go and find out for yourself. Plus they have other options to choose from. I cant come here as often as I'd like only because I dont want to have to buy new pants when I cant fit in my own anymore. This place is a one stop shop! You get some great food, delicious beer and an amazing dessert. I highly recommend this place.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: tried from food truckordered chicken waffle and lamb sausage egg waffle and fry.waffle is amazing, lamb sausage is flavorful, egg and cheese are not bad.fried chicken is so so....same quality of mcdonald's chicken tender, even smaller and lack of flavor.  same feeling on the fries--mcdonald's does betternext time would probably order waffle only, hot, crispy and pairs perfectly with whip cream & other toppings.   only 3 stars since I am not a huge fan of wafflesif you are, this store deserves a try

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Definitely an experience! The monster was great for our kids. A little small for the price but we all enjoyed it. Can't say I would make it a regular visit but glad we tried it

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Tasty treats. That Cinnamon jawn is hot.Not a lot of room to eat inside (and got attacked by flies).

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Great spot! Many sweet and savory waffles to choose from, sandwiches, meat & frites, and "the best fries in Utah"... is what they advertise and I can't really say they are wrong. Everything was really fresh and delicious, but my waffles were sooooo sweet (i have the biggest sweet tooth) and we could not finish them. It's a tiny lil space next to Caputo's Market and Deli. They have a couple outdoor tables. Try at least once

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I was really excited to see this place listed as a recommendation for places to eat fry sauce. I got a burger and fries, and my fiance got the machine gun sandwich. The sauce on the machine gun sandwich was actually really good, and I wished I was dipping fries into that instead of the fry sauce. The fries were a little inconsistent- a lot of them were soggy.They have little tables to eat at outdoors across from a park, and it was really nice hanging out and enjoying our food out there. The staff was also super nice.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Honestly one of the best waffles I've ever had! They're super yummy and are very reasonable priced. The French Fries were also amazing and were best when dipped in the garlic aioli. I would definitely recommend this to anybody in town and definitely plan on coming back!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Usually love this place but I had the Pig on a Cloud and they changed the bacon! It tastes like precooked or something now and not very good. Everything else was good but won't be ordering anything with bacon anymore. Fries were great as usual.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: We went to this food truck at s block party in downtown SLC.  It had a sign boasting they were voted the best fries since 2011.  So if course we had to try them. My son got the fries and an astroburger.  He LOVED it!  He said it was an amazing Burger with a great taste. And the fries loved up to the hype. :) They were really really good.  Just enough seasoning but not too much, great size, and not to soft and not too hard. They came with fry sauce but I didn't need it (we all shared them). They were really good. I would definitely but from them again.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: First time here and loved it! I got the cinnamon waffle with bananas, nutella, and vanilla bean ice cream, with a side of fries. Would definitely recommend this place!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I ate here on a Sunday and it wasn't too busy. Small dining area but got a table. I got the "favorite" and an omelette for protein. Both were hood. The best part of the waffles was the whipped cream. It was thick and tasted like it was freshly made. The omelette came w a waffle and fries I didn't need, but the waffle was good. Street parking available. Clean bathroom.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Delicious. Such great combinations of flavors. We had a savory one and a breakfast one, and we'll have them again in a heartbeat.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I've been here twice and have thoroughly enjoyed my experience both times! I don't live in SLC but if I did, I would come here often! It's the perfect spot for a slow Sunday morning. The waffles are AMAZING, thick and fluffy, with caramelized, crispy sugar on top. They aren't served with syrup and they don't need it. Everything they serve is fresh. The creme fraiche, the fruit served atop waffles, the coffee! Their frites (fries) are also amazing with housemade sauces. Service is stellar. The owner is from Belgium and passionate about his work. He is quick with a smile and a joke and a good time. Highly recommend. No seating indoors but there is seating right outside and on the rooftop. In addition, it's across the road from a park with shade trees and green grass for lounging.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: The Mini Gun sandwich was AMAZING. I had never eaten here before today but I happened to visit their food truck and was immediately in love. The sauce was so creamy and the fries and bread had the perfect crisp to add texture into this dish. The lamb sausage was very moist and tender. I cant wait to go back!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I needed something good near the Clarks planetarium and found this place on Yelp. Of course it had been on man vs food also which made me want to check out more. The atmosphere is very intimate and small. A few seats inside but plenty outside. Service: Best service ever. They were so friendly and made recommendations off the menu also. Food: plenty of types of waffles plus sandwiches and coffee. I ordered the Machine gun sandwich which was delicious. The fries and sauce they used made it messy but very enjoyable. If I return I would love to try some of their waffles.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Everything was delicious. Definitely recommend the Monster Waffle and the house special coffee. Free parking across the street or on the. Multiple eating areas around and an excellent park across the street.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Only in Salt Lake City for a few hours and glad I got to check this place out! Employee was suuuper friendly and went into detail about their products and why they are special, you can tell they really cared about what they did.Decided to order Bruges Favorite, Pig on a Cloud and the Machine Gun sandwich and all were very tasty. I favored the Pig on a Cloud as the sweet and savory paired so well together. The waffle was delicious and the crème fraîche alone was so overwhelmingly good I could have just ordered that on a spoon and been happy. Bruges Favorite is the top choice for a reason, it's classic and good for the picky/plain eaters you may know. Beware that the location is very tiny with limited outdoor seating, so maybe not good for groups/rainy days, but this place is worth checking out!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: my issur with this place is cost and service so asked the young lady in the food truck how big are ur fries she shows me a large papet boat and said it fill this said ok 5.50 for an order of large fries is not to bad still a lil pricey but with cheese not bad so i wait 6 ppl order a head of me burger waffles chicken all of it and they all got there sandwiches there waffles and fries before i did then they finaly call my name i go up and they gave me what u see in the photo i said to her the girl i order from said it filled the tray yhis is 1/2 of a tray for 5.50 she said yes 300 grams of frues is an order ok what ever just no better jext time think all the signs say best in utah so i start eating them they are squishy gresse mees there us a thing of chees so again what ever then the chees pulls up the hole thing and it looks like they took the last kf the bag or a couple bags and gave me the tiny lil piece i just dont understand if u want me to pay top dollar then give me top dollar food please

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: It was good, but it didn't live up to the hype I heard about it.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I just happened to stay down the street from this little gem.  If you are in Salt Lake City, this is a must stay.  Great menu and delicious food.  Don't let the small store front and limited seating change your mind.  Every bite was worth just sitting on the curb outside.  If I could give this place 6 stars, I would.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: i've never heard of this place before we found it online and i wish i had found it sooner! had the machine gun sandwich and was blown away by the different flavor pairings and genius behind a sandwich. Bruges will be a must visit everytime we hit the Salt Lake area.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: The owner working the front was such a great guy (from Belgium). The food was incredible. Had the machine gun sandwich. The bread and andalouse sauce mixed with the sausage and fries was flavor city. The waffles are tasty with fresh fruit as well.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Interesting place w/ outdoor seating. Very limited space inside. Waffle was great, with toppings including two scoops of icecream , blueberries, strawberries. I couldn't tell what the brown spread is, but it's sweet. Frites are a bit salty to my taste. Overall very cute family style brunch place. I like the fact that they hang a Belgian flag by the entrance.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: This place is delicious! They have amazing staff and the service was wonderful. I had the chicken and waffles which was delicious and decently priced.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: The frikandel was good and the fries tasted like true Belgian frites.  I wish they would have given me more mayonnaise for the fries, and had the curry and onions as well.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: LOVE the sweet waffles. I ordered the favorite (vanilla waffle with strawberries and cream) and I wish I had gotten two. I also had the chicken and fries and they were mediocre and overpriced. If it was only dessert this would be a 5 star review. Still, will be back next time I am in town and need some dessert!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Yummy waffles and so sweet and tasty - it can't be all that healthy or good for me, can it?  Does it matter, if you're tempted to eat from here then just enjoy.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: My meal at Bruges was so good that after I was done my first thought was how I would squeeze in another visit before I left SLC. I tried their machine gun sandwich, which is a merguez sausage topped with frites and spicy sauce. So delicious. Get it, and don't share. My husband and I ordered a waffle topped with fresh fruit and cream and it was so decadent. Naturally we immediately ordered another waffle, this time with chocolate. We asked them to cook the waffle a little longer, and they were happy to do so. This place is tiny and only has few seats along the bar, so you may not get a seat.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: The waffles here are tasty! My favorite is the one with chocolate sticks inside, then add some extra strawberries on top!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Chicken and waffles are great. Don't plan on eating inside though, very little seating. Great spot for Spring to sit outside with your food.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Amazing quality waffles and fries and good portion sizes. The fry dipping sauces are unique and delicious and they have a ton of delicious sweet AND savory waffle options

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: The waffles here are exactly what you will finds in Bruges; chewy, sweet, and so so delectable. We had the chicken and waffle with Frites and it was a wholesome, satisfying meal. Would definitely visit again! The owner was extremely cheerful and kind. We enjoyed our visit!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
