content: A great spot for some real Belgian Frites after a concert at the Utah Symphony.  There's something great about the Andalouse sauce and authentic twice-fried Belgian Frites.On a cold night there's not very much room to eat inside, but other than that, this is a terrific slice of life in Vlaanderen (Flanders) right in downtown SLC.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I should clarify my star rating: my husband is a huge fan of this place.  I think, if left to his own devices, he would eat here daily.  I don't approve of that dietary choice, but I do like Bruges. We've sampled from both their savory and sweet sides of the menu.  Generally, everything we've had has been very good.  I wouldn't recommend any of their croque sandwiches, however.  They never seem fresh, even though they very well may be.  The cheese always feels like it was melted yesterday somehow.  Like the texture of day old pizza. Unfortunately, I can't explain it any better. I prefer their Waffle Monster on the sweet side and their Belgian dog with curry on the savory side.  I've had the Machine Gun and I really like the sausage, but I wouldn't order it for myself.  Just sneak bites from my husband when he orders it.  The frites are OK but they really serve as just a vehicle for their wonderful aiolis for me.  Finally, they have take-away packaged waffles dipped in chocolate.  I think my dear husband has a stash of these squirreled away somewhere at home...for his cravings.It's definitely worth checking out next time you're in the neighborhood.  And, if you're lucky enough to come when the owner is there, chatting with him is really interesting.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: THE FRIES AND SAUCES ARE AWESOME! Such a great comfort food place. Love going here after fitness testing.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: The crispness of the waffle , the sweetness of the toppings and sauce, the selection of choices; it all has to add up to make a great quick eatery.I've been to Boom and I've had a Belgian waffle. This place is definitely my favorite waffle spot. I will say I love the way this place approached everything. Great customer service too. This place just comes together. Now added to my favorite Utah staples. I really want some chicken and waffles now.Thank you guys and gals for a great breakfast! It would go well with a Belgian beer at home.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Ordered the torpedo waffle and a medium fries. The waffle came out first and was amazing. The outside was nice and crispy and the inside was oozing with thick, melting chocolate. It was super sweet. There was a huge scoop of cream on top.The fries came out next and a medium order is a whole lot of fries. I got the aioli and andalouse sauces and those were great.It was a little weird mix with the sweet waffle, so next time I would get one or the other. The place itself was pretty small. There was a little station where you could get water, one long table on the side and a few small tables outside.I paid $14.75 including tax and tip.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: The food here is delicious. Everything is really good and the sauces really stand out. Great find.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Unique eatery, untraditional menu with good food and service.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: This place is amazing! The food is so good, the workers are so sweet, and the food speaks for itself. Highly recommend coming here!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: A must breakfast stop if you're craving delicious food.  A European twist on waffles, made with dough, rather than batter.  Absolutely fantastic!  Had the pig on a cloud. Best waffle ever!  Friendly staff, and very good coffee.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Serendipitously found this place while I was walking around and saw the huge Belgian flag hanging out front. It's not often you find a Belgian style friterie outside of Belgium.  I had the mini-machine gun sandwich and it was delicious. It's a toasted baguette-like roll, with a spicy merguez sausage, authentically Belgian frites, and andalous sauce. This was the real deal although bread was a little different than I remember but still good. With the open air market across the street I felt like I was back in Belgium for a second.

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: Great customer service. The guy taking our order was super nice and helpful. I picked this restaurant because it was featured on Man V Food. I recommend grabbing your food buddy and getting one waffle and one frite entree to share!!

name: Bruges Belgian Bistro
content: I thought I had a favorite liege waffle spot, but Bruges just moved up my list to my favorite. The waffles here are very good.We arrived shortly after opening on a Sunday morning and they were busy, but we didn't have to wait in line. Inside there is a bar with about half a dozen seats, but most of the seating is in front of the restaurant. The friendly employees greeted us right away and were pretty quick with preparing orders.The menu offers waffles with sweet toppings, breakfast waffle sandwiches, lunch waffle sandwiches, and various frites. Liege waffles are hearty so most people will find that one waffle is plenty of food. I wanted to try two types and it was far too much food. All of our waffles were delicious. The liege waffle was doughy and had the perfect hint of sugar flavor. The Favorite was simple, but delicious with strawberries and whipped cream. I also ordered a cinnamon waffle with caramel sauce and that was a nice sweet treat. My husband loved his Waffle Monster. The Waffle Monster is a fun combination of fruit, ice cream, and cookie butter.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I had such a great experience at Veneto. My friend and I came here for dinner and the chef was so accommodating to our dietary restrictions-- I have some allergies, and we both eat plant-based. The flavor pallet was divine, and the ambience was intimate yet upscale. If you are in Salt Lake City and in need of a romantic, date night spot, Veneto is the perfect restaurant for you. There is such great energy here, and the servers were very friendly. I'm already wishing that I could go back.Although I couldn't get enough of their fresh vegetables and pasta, The highlight was their wines and desserts. I have a major sweet tooth and their tiramisu was delicious. Chefs kiss!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Another AMAZING visit to Veneto for our anniversary dinner.  Called and made reservations for the three of us  (we took our 10 year old with us) and decided this year we would enjoy dinner inside the restaurant.I was so happy when we entered and it reminded me of all the cozy little spots in Italy where we enjoyed amazing food.   The staff was outstanding and truly live by the motto that waiting is a profession, not a job.  Every aspect of the service was perfect and great.The 10 year old stuck with the spaghetti and the sirloin steak, which he loved both.  The wife and I each ordered the Gnocchi (she refuses to share an order).  I ordered the sirloin and she had the salmon.   Throw some desserts on top and you have some amazingly full and happy patrons.Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING, was prepared perfectly and beautifully.  The plates were as beautiful as the food tasted.  There wasn't a single thing out of place or anything we would have changed.One thing to note is this place is truly Italian traditional.  You do not tip.  If you do tip the money is given to charity.  Veneto believes in paying their staff a living wage and ensuring they are not relying on tips to give great service or experience.  I like that.Please try this spot if you have not.  Please tell your friends about it (just until I cannot get a reservation any longer then we will have to back off 3-10 people.)

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: We recently attended a wedding. brunch here. WOW!  I felt as though I had been transported to Tuscany.  The food and wine pairings were wonderful in every way, and the service was impeccable.  We began with an antipasti of salami and cheese plus a vegetable frittata, all beautifully presented.  At that point, I knew that I was in for a treat!  Next was an exquisite ricotta salad generously adorned with polenta, honey, walnuts, and my favorite, fried sage - YUM!  We had three choices for the  second course, and despite feeling quite full, I wanted to sample all of them.  The fresh tagliatelle pasta with a beef ragú was perfect.  I can't wait to return to try their regular menu.  Molto bene!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: We visited Italy for the first time in early 2019. We loved it so much, we didn't stop talking about going back, then the pandemic happened and we haven't been able to travel all year. When my birthday approached this year, my wonderful husband decided to take me to Veneto and do the pre-fixed menu. It was an absolutely wonderful experience! Yes, it is expensive and risky to dine in but it's both cheaper and more responsible than traveling to Italy right now! Veneto does do take out but the take out options are different than their dine in menu. Besides the other customers speaking English, the food and the experience feels like you've suddenly found yourself in Italy! You can definitely see the northern influence on the food. Our pre-fixed menu included a variety of fresh vegetables, stuffed pastas, corn products, perfectly cooked steak, fish, a light cocktail, and dessert. We were absolutely stuffed by the end of the meal. I don't know how Italians are so skinny! If you want the true Italian experience, I recommend the pre-fixed menu. A traditional Italian dinner is large, long, with multiple courses, and goes late into the night.They have a super long and somewhat complex wine menu. We wanted to explore their wine menu but we didn't want to spring for the wine tasting that's paired with the pre-fixed menu so we decided to just order a bottle to share. Unfortunately they do not publish their wine menu online, so you'll have to decide if it's worth it before you go to buy a bottle ahead of time or just go with their menu. Their wines have a huge range of prices, going all the way up to $1000 or more. The cheapest bottle we saw was $40. We ended up springing for a Sangiovese that was $75. That same bottle sells at the liquor store for about $25 so if we would have bought it in advance and paid the corkage fee ($35), we could have saved about $10 but then we wouldn't have had the opportunity to choose from their well curated wine menu. Because I don't know much when it comes to wine, I think $10 is a good price to pay to be able choose from a well curated list. From what we saw, they do not sell much wine by the glass. If you're a wine aficionado, maybe the wine sample pairing would have been more up your alley. I thought the wine we ordered was amazing and typical for the style but, again, I'm no wine connoisseur.When we were deciding between ordering the pre-fixed menu and ordering a la carte off the menu, we thought the pre-fixed menu was a no-brainer. Their portions are not huge so by the time you order several items off the menu, you might as well pay for the pre-fixed dinner. Of course, even if one person at the table wants the pre-fixed dinner, everyone must order it so depending on the size of your group and what everyone wants, it might be better to just order a la carte.Because of COVID, a reservation is highly recommended but be sure to stick to your plan! It's okay, most of us don't have much else going on right now anyway! They take a credit card number to make the reservation and will charge you if you're a no-show. Makes sense, they've had to significantly reduce their seating so they want to make sure you show up! Because of the reduced capacity, we were only able to get a later dinner spot, but if that happens to you, don't be sad! Real Italians don't eat dinner earlier than 9pm! So you'll just be getting a more authentic experience if that happens to you too! Just have a few light snacks at home to tide you over until it's time to show up for your reservation. Italians call that "aperitivo"!Bonus! Veneto is super Italian, like so Italian, they don't expect a tip. In fact, if you do tip, the tip is donated to local charities. Yes, it's still expensive but you don't need to budget an extra 20% for tip if you don't want to. Similar to restaurants in Italy, there is a small table fee. Basically in Italy, every restaurant charges a table fee so if you wanted to stand at the bar and quickly drink an espresso or order take-out, you don't have to pay the table fee. Veneto doesn't have a bar for sipping espresso but it's so common in Italy to charge a table fee that even restaurants that don't have a bar still charge it. Even so, the table fee is far less than what most people would tip. I think our table fee was about $8 for example.We absolutely loved our experience! I've decided to disclose that our bill ended up totaling around $450 (2 pre-fixed dinners + 1 bottle of wine + espresso). We actually budgeted over $500 for our meal but were pleasantly surprised at the end when we didn't have to tip. Maybe we would have done the wine sampling if we had known! Yes, it's expensive but like I said, much cheaper than hopping on a trans-atlantic flight, you don't have to learn Italian, and I can honestly say the food is just as good! Can't wait to try out their take-out menu!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Absolutely fabulous! The food was some of the most authentic, delicious Italian food I've had in the US! And the service was top notch. This will become a new go to place for us.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: The pear ravioli and the tiramisu were highlights of the night. The wine list was also impressive. The service to my table was excellent, but not the young male waitor to my neighboring table. Although it's the guests' issue that they were not familiar with Italian food, the explanations provided by the waiter were not helpful, as overheard by me. Also to guests who don't make their way often into fine dining, not being able to point out the price of the steak is per ounce and how many ounces there is usually for one steak was a major failure of the waiter. This led to chaos that should have been avoided...

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Fantastic service and great food. Everything we tried was great. The highlights were the pear filled Ravioli, Caprese pasta and the Tiramisu (probably the best I've ever had). Similar to dining in the old country... No tipping, small portions, multiple courses and a 2.5 hour dinner experience.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My girlfriend and I went for her birthday with a few Á La Carte options mind. After meeting our lovely server we were convinced to try the winter tasting menu. It was such an incredible experience. It was a tasing adventure through Italia's historical dishes with a nice winter feel to each dish. All seven courses were delightful.   The wine menu is stacked, to say the least. I decided to settle with several beers that were authentic to the country and very delightful to pair with the winter tasing. I'm glad we went with the tasting menu. It is a LOT of food, we left very full and satisfied.  We are both looking forward to future tasting adventure here.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: First time trying Veneto. Food was good, but portions were small. We got takeout and at first I thought it was some kind of mistake because of how small the portions were. Over 20 dollars for 6 pieces of Ravioli seems a little extreme in my opinion. The Tiramisu portion was huge though. As mentioned there was nothing wrong with the food, but I am still left a little disappointed. There are other great Italian places where you get more value for your money and the food is just as good. I will give Veneto a strong 3 star.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I've never had better food in my life. I remember our family coming back another day just to eat here. The owner and waiters are the sweetest people ever. I recommend this restaurant to everyone. The atmosphere is also amazing. The food is traditional and fulfilling. This will be a great place for a nice family dinner or a cozy get together.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: This place is amazing and the people are the best. I got some things I couldn't pronounce and they were delicious.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Delicious apps and main courses!! Such great customer service and atmosphere. Can't wait to go back soon!!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Bravo my compliments to the chef . I feel like I went to Italy and saved the airfare . The chefs simplistic way of cooking truly brings out the real flavors of the food . The dry aged beef was excellent. Perfectly aged flavorful and cooked to perfection. The salad made of radicchio walnuts fried sage ricotta and polenta was wonderful. Sautéed spinach Italian wine and tiramisu for dessert!This restaurant is so authentic it doesn't take tips just like in Italy! Chow for now I will be back !! Perfect for a romantic evening

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: What a great discovery! This restaurant is exactly what Salt Lake City was missing, a delicious, authentic, classy, high-end Italian restaurant. The ambiance reminds me of high end restaurants in Italy. The atmosphere is perfect for a date night, or for work meetings/family reunions, since they can accommodate larger groups, still offering privacy thanks to their curtains that break down the larger dining room into smaller, reserved areas. Food was outstanding, the wine list is incredible, so much effort to build a wine list for every palate and every budget!I definitely recommend the bigoli with duck ragù, as well as the Fiorentina di Piemontese. Marco - the owner, and the staff go beyond every expectation to accommodate your requests.  I will definitely be back! Grazie mille Amy e Marco!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: This was a completely different experience than the last time we were here.Once seated, had to ask for them to take our beverage order, then had to ask for menus. Shouldn't that be a given? We saw a couple come in about 10 minutes after we did, not only did they get bread, drinks and their order was taken before ours. Not sure if that was the new King of England or what but found that so odd.The burrata cheese and prosciutto appetizer were both amazing! Gnocchi and Tiramisu were also delicious. The bread seemed like it was a bit stale and surprised that wasn't baked fresh or ordered fresh. Not a good sign at an Italian restaurant. Service was slow and I realize there is no tipping permitted here but that shouldn't take in to account the horrible service.With the high prices and small portions not sure it was worth my while to sit 2+ hours let alone always waiting for our server.UPDATE:  Amy S. (owner) just sent a private message stating that frequent customer's get this special treatment:_____________________"I did attempt to address your comment re: the table you dubbed as "The King of England" by sharing with you that it is our ultimate goal each night to excel for every guest. It seems as though you would like more specifics, so as I research further into Friday night's reservations, I see that this table seated 10 minutes after you, is a frequent guest. Our team naturally builds relationships with frequent guests over time, and we take great pride in doing so. Getting to know our guests is a privilege; learning their names and anticipating their preferences for their favorite table, chairs, drinks, bread, etc. Genuine relationships are built when we see someone multiple times a year vs. once, or once a year. We would love the opportunity to build this type of guest-restaurant relationship with you as well; and if we are not able to (since you say you doubt you will be back), we hope you have your special place to go, where you are made to feel like "The King of England". "______________________I guess the rest of us peasants will get the leftover scraps from others. Would hate to see first time guests go to this restaurant and get the same lousy service as us. Maybe when they become a frequent diner they will be treated as royalty. Maybe I am overreacting or way off base but one would think if everyone were treated as equal it would be a great dining experience for all.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: There are not enough words to describe how AMAZING our experience at VENETO Ristorante was. The dining room was spacious due to Covid but still had an energetic vibe. Our server, Matteo, was as authentic as you can get... here from northern Italy with life of knowledge and love of his Italian upbringing. Matteo recommended a superb wine from the very extensive wine list to compliment our menu choices. Every course was better than the next... steak tartare, the mushrooms over crisp polenta, THE GNOCCHI beyond any you have ever enjoyed. Sent us home w complimentary Italian cookies. Top of our "can't wait to return" list and make sure you go there hungry, you want to leave lots of room for all VENETO offers.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: We had a date night recently at Veneto and sat on the patio. It was a wonderful experience. With Covid we weren't able to do our planned trip to Italy this year but Veneto made us feel like we were there for a couple hours. Very authentic experience and the food and wine were amazing. It made us miss Italy and look forward to going there again all at the same time. Marco has done an amazing job building the wine selection and the food was excellent. We will be back!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Wow, Went to Veneto for the first time and had a great time. Big thanks to Aaron the Sommelier for the education and recommendations. Great wine and great food. I would recommend this place to everyone I know. Thanks Aaron

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Amazing way to treat yourself to a nice evening out. Our server (who was a tall male with glasses, I regret not keeping note of his name) was so kind and helpful with our decisions. He had something interesting to say about every food item we ordered. Everything we had was delicious. I also really loved that they pay their employees a livable wage and don't ask for tips. If you insist on tipping it will be donated. A truly wonderful experience and we can not wait to go back!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I decided to reserve a nice dinner for my best friend's birthday. And the service I received was poor quality. I wasn't expecting sub par food for the price I was paying. My order didn't even come out, but at that point we wanted to leave so I didn't even want to ask for it. My bestie ordered a steak and they didn't even it cook it the way she specified twice. We also were made fun of out loud by other costumers. And to make us feel even more welcome, the look our server gave us every time we asked a question about the menu was so rude and sassy. So I would not give any stars if that was a possibility. But the bread was awesome so good on them for that.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I've not gone out to eat since quarantine started so I was very skeptical when my husband told me he had a safe dining experience planned for my birthday. Veneto exceeded any expectation i had and eased all fears. I felt extremely safe and taken care of. The food was delicious, they were incredibly thoughtful with a birthday gift and it was a beautiful atmosphere. Our waiter was wonderful, kind, and informative. Highly recommend Veneto!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: This is one of the best restaurants in the Salt Lake region, by far! Not only is the food authentic but the owners, Amy and Marco, make you feel like family when you are there! The back patio is like being in heaven with the beautiful greenery and lights.  The Black to White wine and the caccio & pear ravioli is not to be missed! If you want an unforgettable and safe culinary experience I highly recommend VENETO!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Best Genuine Italian pizza in the west.The only time I've had pizza this good was in northern Italy grateful that I finally found pizza that is truly Italian.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Though I've never had the pleasure of the Veneto in-house dining experience, I have had the satisfaction of trying the food. Due to Covid-19, we were able to get takeout for our anniversary and coursed it out on our own. We started with the insalata mediterranea, which was the perfect, simple blend of arugula, olives, and cherry tomatoes.Next, we enjoyed the melanzane alla parmigiana, which was my favorite dish of the night. The flavors were incredible, and the texture even better. Lastly, we shared two pastas: the pasticcio and the gnocchi. We also splurged on the pesce, which was a baked black cod. The cod was cooked perfectly, and the spinach/red onion mix side was the perfect addition to our amazing meal. We're gluten free due to sensitivity, but they convinced us to try their housemade noodles because they use Italian 00 flour, and it didn't bother us much. I am very glad we went for it because the noodles were excellent and well worth the very minor side effects. They're also a European style restaurant in the fact that they do not expect tips. And if you do choose to tip, they will donate it to a charity of the staff's choosing. To top it all off, they gave us free polenta cookies, which I absolutely loved!! Thanks VENETO! We'll be in soon.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: What can I say... start by making a reservation and being transported back to northern Italy for fresh authentic food.  Antipasta, primo, secondi, sides , & desserts!  You are family as soon as you step into this quaint restaurant. Tables are private and acceptable for a romantic dinner or a group dinner to laugh and eat with friends.  The wine list is Uber amazing, with so many amazing wines and price points...you can buy a bottle for $16k if you are feeling like it!  The food is fresh, creative, vibrant and beautifully and tastefully creative.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: One of SLC's finest dinning experiences. The food is superb, wine cellar vast, and service impeccable.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: The Italians are coming!  Finally, SLC is getting its fair share of authentic, quality Italian food.  This crew always treats us like guests in their home.   From greeting us at the door to taking our coats to the impeccable service/timing, Veneto just does everything right.  It's super classy, yet casual.  On our last visit there was a particularly loud table (not the restaurant's fault).  For the love of god, people...it is not necessary to scream like you're in a bar.  Kudos to the restaurant staff for expertly engaging that group to bring the volume down.  Back to the food, it's always been perfect.  No complaints.  I usually skip dessert, but here it's worth spending a little extra time with your friends for a special treat.  If you're burned out on the "How many?", "And what will WE be having?" greeting and service, then this place is 100% recommended.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Lovely ambience and authentic NE Italian food. Great Italian wines by the glass. Interesting 'no tipping' policy in keeping with European norms!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: As an Italian, I must say that it is so great to have a true Italian restaurant in Salt Lake City! I would go to this restaurant even in Italy. The service is good, the atmosphere very friendly and the food is just amazing! Btw, Marco is famous for his wine selection and if you ask for his advice you will understand why. Thanks Marco and Amy for bringing a piece of Italy in the heart of the United States!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Went back for our 3rd anniversary. Turns out there was a private event which is fine. After we left two ladies called us back from half way across the parking lot to tell us to move our car? I mean did they expect us to just hang out in the parking lot all night or until the next day to get a table? It's sad that we will have to change our tradition of  dining at VENETO. It would have also been nice if there was a notice regarding a private event. Very disappointed in the need to tell us to move the car while we were walking to our car. I would give Zero stars if I could.********************************************************************************************Response to owner:Hi Amy. After having to move our reservations from Saturday we called at 1/30/2020 at 7:15 and were told that we could walk in. As for parking in the other establishment the Veneto FAQ states that "Our neighbor to the East (Sequel) has kindly offered guests parking privileges after 6pm." We arrived after 6. Thank you for reaching out.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My husband and I came here for a birthday dinner, and it was one of the best meals either of us in had ever had. Our waiter was helpful and gave great suggestions, as well as being super attentive! We shared the buratta e prosciutto crudo and the risotto all' amorane,  and I had the tagliata Di Manzo while my husband had the Australian Wagyu Taglio New York. Our first course were beautifully presented and absolutely delicious, and I loved the slow pace of the meal (they do warn you at the start of your meal), and both of our steaks  were cooked perfectly. We had gelato and tiramisu for desert and I only wish I'd had more room to enjoy them.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: The hubs and i really enjoyed ourselves at this restaurant. You can tell that it was more authentic and housemade, especially the pasta. I loved my pasta and the hubs said that the meat was on par with any other steakhouse we've been to, and that's a hard thing to please my husband with.  I like my steak to be pretty well done and it came out nearly raw. I completely forgot to tell them how I wanted my meat cooked. But they kindly took it back and cooked it more for me with no problems.  Service was great and the desserts were pretty good too. We'd definitely come back.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Cozy, intimate setting with great service. We enjoyed glasses of prosecco while perusing the menu. It was so delicious that we ended up getting a bottle. For a starter we shared the ricotta salad. The salad was fresh and the polenta made it. We tried to eat every bite with a little piece of polenta. Then we had the mountain gnocchi and ravioli for our first courses. Both were amazing. Hands down the highlight of our meal. We couldn't decide which was better. Both lighter dishes with superb flavor. For a main course we shared the tagliata di manzo. The steak was cooked to perfection but we wished for a better side than cabbage with it. This was plenty of food for us to leave pleasantly full. We skipped dessert (trying to be good). Having spent a lot of time in Italy, we enjoyed the nice touches of being welcomed with traditional Italian greetings. Overall a great experience. We will be back.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Wonderful! The gnocchi and ravioli were amazing. We tried two types of fish, but next time I would just get pasta. There is an ice cream with Italian cookies that by the description I was going to pass on, but thankfully my friend ordered it because it was fantastic.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Wonderful staff gave us a night to remember. Hostess was so kind and considerate. Food was perfect. Not your breadsticks-4-dayz kind of place. My steak came just as I asked (still moo-ing) with a foot-long bone sticking out of it to boot. Crazy good and difficult to find this kind of quality in Utah. Bravo to everyone involved in this place.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Authentic Italian restaurant that is family owned. The food is top notch! Fresh ingredients, pasta cooked to absolute perfection, and a friendly staff.  It has a romantic, charming, cozy feel to it.  There is parking in the back of the restaurant, they have a coat check, and a lovely wine list as well.  They don't do substitutions since they want you to really experience the true culinary experience straight from Veneto.  They do want to make sure you're happy though and they do ask if you have any dietary restrictions.  Recommend making a reservation. No need to tip since they are following their Italian culture. So please respect that.  I haven't had gnocchi this good since I ate at the Ritz Carlton in half moon bay.   If you like authentic Italian food, this is the place to go.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Amazing atmosphere and fantastic food. This place is very cozy and intimate. We enjoyed the wild mushroom over polenta, tartar of piemontese beef with toasted bread, ravioli filled with pecorino and bartlett pears, gnocchi, wild mushroom and sweet country-style sausage risotto with friends. Everything was amazing, especially the gnocchi and the risotto! We really want to return soon and try the tasting menu with the wine pairing. Highly recommend this place!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: We went as a very large group and rented the whole place.  There was so much food and all of it wonderful.,I enjoyed the gnocchi.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Great food! Amazing service! I little expensive but definitely well worth it! 2 entrées 1 appetizer and a bottle of wine was about $130 ish and I would do it again! They have a lot of meatless options as well! If your looking for a recommendation go with the spinach filled Ravioli n house made Alfredo sauce  ohhh myyy gershhh my mouth is watering just thinking about it...

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Over priced for the flavor of the food and the atmosphere.   Waiter pushed their sparkling water and Prosecco before we decided what to order.  Not  a great menu.  Waiter not friendly and condescending.  This is Salt Lake City not New York.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Beautiful decor, with an incredible wine list, but they forgot the add an Italian chef to this Italian restaurant. The food was, to say the least, disappointing! Having lived in Italy, I was extremely excited for this highly ranked Italian restaurant, but I will never go back.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: There are five locations in my life that the service, food, atmosphere, and hospitality will never be forgotten.  This small gem is among them.  The host, Oz, was the most genuine and gracious woman, making sure I was pleased with each and every course.  The waiters were delightful in making sure a glass was never empty and that I could ask them any questions I had.  The Italian wine selection was over 400 labels for every connoisseur one could imagine.   This was European style food, NOT cheap Americanized Italian.   The menu selections are so unique and seasonally crafted with the finest of ingredients!  Every bite was melt in your mouth delicious!  I was too full to indulge in dessert, but managed to power through the tiramisu.  OMG!   Never pass that up there!   The lady fingers were so light and the creamed filling was the fluffiest I've ever experienced.  Do not pass this restaurant up!   You will never regret it. This is genuine Italy!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: What wonderful foods! Our family is on a road trip from Washington to Texas. We passed by here, never expecting such delicate food. All the food here are as tasty as it looks! We are ready for our second meal here!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Utterly charming. Impeccable service with delicious, farm-fresh Italian. Looking forward to patio dining and more menu-exploration. Thank you  and YUM!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Best meal I have had on my periodic visits to Salt Lake. The setting is intimate which is not surprising given the size of the room but at the same time you do not feel crowded. The room also has a very warm feel. Once settled in, the next impressive quality was the wine list. Any lover of Italian reds should come here for the wine selection alone. A very deep list including bottles with a fair amount of age. Well recognized names in all the major categories and, in my opinion, fairly priced. The food and service were also excellent. I started with a ricotta salad that was extremely fresh and tasty. The next dish I had was a risotto with asparagus that was perfectly cooked. The texture and taste were really excellent. My main dish was a sliced steak that was not only flavorful but perfectly cooked. Unfortunately, did not have room for dessert so can't comment. They have a 4 course menu and a seasonal menu and allow you to freely mix and match. Something for every palette. I enjoyed my meal so much that if I was coming into Salt Lake to ski, I would plan it so I could come here for dinner either upon arrival or departure. It was that good. Absolutely coming back next time in Salt Lake.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: EXCEPTIONAL dining experience!  The Chef took us through an amazing evening of wine paired foods: gnocchi, duck ragu pasta, steak tartare, steak 3 ways (with Vatican Salt), eggplant parmesan and finished the night with spoons of desert.  World Class Wine List!  Service was excellent in an intimate setting.  Loved that every chair was different and imported from Italy...too many details to list, just go and enjoy this SLC Gem!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Best dining experience in Utah. The service is great and the food is excellent. True European style dining. You are not rushed through the meal and the owners make sure you feel like you've arrived in Northern Italy. Truly our favorite here in Salt Lake.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Very disappointed in this restaurant.  Started with Ricotta salad--not much flavor.  I ordered Bigoli pasta with duck ragu--noodles weren't fully cooked and the duck ragu was awful--tasted raw.  Husband ordered  Gnocchi and it was good but the portion size was soooo small.  We ordered one Tiramisu and they could leave the chocholate bits out.  We both ordered a soft drink and had a refill--we were surprised that we were charged for refills--$3.25 twice???    I would have loved to leave this place with a full stomach but was still hungry after leaving.  Everything we ordered we felt the portion size too small.  This place tries to nickel and dime you for everything.  Won't be coming back.  P.S.  Don't come here if you're in a hurry--food takes forever to get to the table.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I've never been to Italy. But after driving through a rain storm mess of Utah's traffic, turning into the wrong parking lot, making a questionable u-turn to get to the right place, trekking across the pavement - all the while trying to avoid drowning in the pool of water that accumulated on the ground, my friend and I were welcomed by Amy's warm smile and no kidding, transported to the region of Veneto.Once seated, Amy and the staff gave us an informative introduction to the structure of the menu along with the unique style of pacing. While we would have loved to have fully experience this, we were on a time crunch. So kudos to the staff for accommodating our schedule!I ordered the beef carpaccio, gnocchi, and the wagyu . The beef carpaccio and gnocchi was out of this world crazy good - definitely the shining highlights of this dining experience for me!! What was majorly disappointing was the wagyu especially when it was $6/ounce and I got 10 ounces! Perhaps it was an oversight on my end but I didn't request medium rare and the wagyu came out well done (however I don't recall our server asking me how I wanted it cooked). The first indicator that the steak was a sad piece of meat was when I tried cutting it, I was struggling for sure. The second, was just the toughness of the bite(s). The third was the lack of flavor. I was extremely bummed because I was really craving a good steak. My friend ordered the ravioli and the salmon and she thoroughly enjoyed everything. She also appreciated the flexibility in choosing items from both the special and standard menu!Despite the wagyu being a let down, I would still highly recommend Veneto to everyone! I am looking forward to returning to Amy and Marco's establishment - only for a special occasion though because the pricing is on the higher end.-Sailor out

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: So it was late in the evening and we were scrambling or were to eat. One of our favorite restaurants was closed and the other was already closed. We Yelped and this restaurant came up. We called them hoping they would sit us since they were close to closing time. Boy were we GLAD! We definitely didn't dress for the place but they were cool about it and the service was exemplary. Now to the food. Oh dang! The food!  It was amazing, fresh, healthy, and delicious.  I will be adding this place to the rotation and the fabulous service. Thank you for having us so late.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My husband and I enjoyed an outstanding meal at Veneto last night for our anniversary.  We were warmly welcomed by staff and also co-owner Amy.  All of our dishes were delicious and I have to say, the Beef Filet was better than any I have had at Ruth's Chris or any other high end steakhouses.  My husband's gnocchi were perfection.  Service was attentive and never intrusive - A perfect evening out.  Veneto is at the top of our list for a special evening out.  Wonderful!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Veneto was truly one of my top experiences in all of the Salt Lake areas...including Park City. Veneto is all around authentic Italian. From the building to the decor to the menus and ordering style. Even the tip is included in the bill, just like Italy! We were warmly greeted by the hostess as if she was expecting us like friends who she was dining with. We were also greeted by one of the owners named Amy. Both welcomed us like we were family coming to dine at their home.  It had about 10 tables set up the night we were there. There were a few large parties that occupied most of the space. Which made it feel more like my Italian family's holidays. Our waiter Patrick, was truly an artisan in his craft. That is not the usual description one would give a waiter. But from the beginning he was helpful and clear. He took his time explaining dishes and which wines he would pair which each. We ended up getting an Antipasti, a first and second course.  After the first glass came out and our antipasti arrived, we knew our waiter knew what he was talking about.  We also knew the chef was a master. Our waiter's recommended wines were perfect! We knew to just trust him from then on. With the first course we were wowed again with his suggestions of wine and the food was so delectable.  We had ravioli stuffed with Ricotta and pears, and topped with grated pecorino I believe. We also had the Gnocchi.  It was amazing in texture and taste. The gnocchi comes in a large portion that two could easily share. However we got to take some home, which I am excited for tomorrow's left overs. The second course was truly the apex for me. I had the Filet Mignon it was garnished delicately and cooked delicately.  It was the best I have ever had. When I took a sip of the red wine he brought out with a bite of the filet, it was like two old friends shaking hands as tastes exploded in my mouth. I almost pulled a meg Ryan from "When Hairy met Sally", but it was my wife's birthday and she deserved as few comedic out bursts as possible. Plus we were obviously in a gastronomically sacred place.  My wife had the Striped Bass that once again was perfectly paired with a wine that was so golden and beautiful. It was a white version of Amarone, with basically pressed grapes fermented with pressed white wine "raisins" that explode with flavor as they dehydrate. I had a taste, it was a big beautiful wine. We had double cream gelato and a Nutella tart type pastry that went together like they were meant to be ordered that way. Again, thanks to Patrick our waiter. Our 3 hour dinning experience ended with coffee for me and my wife had a macchiato.  We relaxed, laughed and I couldn't have felt more like I did in Italy, where your meal is an event, rather than just what you devour as you talk or don't talk to the other person across the table. As we left, we were met by Amy the owner and the hostess who was holding a bag of our left overs as well as a box of amaretto cookies, for my wife's birthday. It was a very sweet gesture. Amy hugged  my wife like an old friend, and I shook her hand finishing our finest dining experience in Utah. If it wasn't obvious, I recommend this place highly. If you are interested in authentic Italian dinning Veneto is an absolute must!  We will definitely be back again very soon I am quite certain.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Had dinner here last night. The restaurant was cozy and slow paced.  The food was Fantastico !!!  Eggplant parm was perfect. Stuffed tomato was delicious.Friendly and perfectly relaxing.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I loved this place. Take your time enjoy each course. Its not a rush and go place. You'll be there a while. Worth it in special occasions

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: For anyone that wants to experience TRULY Italian food don't go any further: this is place is the real deal!You have one of the best Italian restaurant in the whole US, SLC!! Amy&Marco are the best hosts ever.I felt back home in Italy.The wine list is super-curates and exciting.The service top notch.The food simply amazing.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: A cozy restaurant with authentic Italian fare prepared by chef from Italy.  The food were spot on, along with an extensive Italian wine lists but for the experience be prepare to pay the price.  It's not cheap.It's a busy restaurant so we waited a few minutes for the table to be ready, we were offered if we would like to order wines start while we wait and so we did opted in for the Prosecco.  Since it was our friend's favorite restaurant and he suggested his favorite dishes and wines for us. Let just say I can see why he wants to bring us here, it was a lovely evening with amazing food and vino.We had a family style dinner so we can all shared and tried all of the food.  Every dish was just spot on with flavor and texture.We started with the Frito misto with champagne batter, wow how fluffy and airy it was so amazing.The fried cheese with fried polenta was another dish that wow, I can't really eat cheese but that was so good.Chef started out with a spoon of polenta and bolognese sauce that was a spoon full of uh ah wow from all of us.The spaghetti was aldente and the gnocchi was a must have.We also had a 90 days aged steak and the flavor was also great.  You can't go wrong with anything here since everything we had was just wonderful.Including the most expensive bottle of wine ever ordered at a restaurant, yes it was phenomenal and complex but I am not sure if I would ever order it if I knew how much it cost.  Our friend suggested it and we said yes but would rather bring our own bottle and pay corkage since mark up was hefty.  $75 corkage fee is pricey but far more reasonable than paying for the restaurant pricing.We had an enjoyable time with great friends and great food couldn't have a better dining experience just wish that it didn't cost my super generous friends an arm and a leg as, he was tricky and pick up the bill before we get to see it. So for 3 bottles of wines and a few dishes of food for 5 of us the bill came to $2400 was a lot for SLC pricing. Food cost maximum $350.That would be Michelin star, New York, SF or Vegas price but a small restaurant in SLC it is stiff.I would have not agreed to ordered the wine if I knew what it cost and I knowing how much it worth retail making it harder to say it's worth it.  But I guessed restaurant have to make money somewhere and booze is where the big bucks revenue come from :) so if you have the Uncle Sam to spare then go for it but for me one time trying would be plentiful, we will be back for food though the next time around.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: This cute restaurant located off of 900 S. is both charming and quaint. You will be greeted by the owner who is Italian. It is best to make a reservation as your dining experience will take longer than average. For two people it took Almost 3 hours to eat. The restaurant is strict about ordering everything at the beginning. This is a four course menu with one side of the menu being seasonal options and the other side being year-long entrées. The staff will recommend you to order four courses per one person. The portion sizes are large. I recommend ordering 3 dishes for a party of 2. The wine list is extensive and also expensive. The tip is included in your final bill. This service is excellent but will also encourage you to over order. We recommend the prosciutto and the gnocchi. Please note, the salmon on the menu is for her not wild. In addition the food is not for health-conscious individuals. Most of the dishes are based it in butter or oil.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: So, i went here last night and it was a gorgeous little experience. The ravioli is what i got for the appetizer. It was delicious! My only wish is just a little more tomato sauce. Other than that it was sooo good! For my first course i had the beef tartar with capers. I could only eat about half of it because it didn't have much flavor, my complaint with that would be to add more salt "/ . Or perhaps more capers. And after that we had decided we where starving and didn't wanna wait another hour for our main course so we skipped to dessert which was absolutely delicious! We had the gelato. And omg, it was sooooo good!!! Ok so, I do understand this type of dining is expected to take awhile and isn't meant to be rushed at all. Except this...was a bit excessive lol. We got their at 6:45. We didn't leave that place until 10:00. AND the wait in between courses was insane. I was expecting to be their maybe two hours. Had to flag our waiter down a few times, (it was busy though) Other than that he was great. But yeah my biggest complaint is the wait time. We where starving. but because it took so long we just had to cut it short. I may be back to give it another shot to see if it was just slow because it was busy. Or if that's just the way they're doing things. The chef obviously knows what he's doing. Also the manager (i believe) came by to check in n make sure things where great. I always appreciate that because it shows they are trying their best to please everyone and make the experience and pleasant as possible!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Wine list is epic. The food is fantastic and authentic and the fun server is the best! He gave us stories and made the food a level better with imagery. It is expensive, but for a work dinner (or even a romantic date) it was ideal. The European model for eating was great, as we weren't rushed and encouraged to take our time.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I've heard a lot of good things about this place so I went in with very high expectations....and they exceeded every single one of them! I can't begin to describe our experience except that the staff was truly amazing, wonderful service and food to die for. We felt like the chef Marco was cooking personally for us with impeccable detail on every course. This is our new favorite in Salt Lake City, and the country for that matter.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My favorite Italian in the city, hands down. Not sure if they still do the Monday Prix Fixe, but if they do, I highly recommend coming in for it. Always changing, always delicious.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Amazing dining experience in SLC.  The attention and guidance to help you pick the perfect meal is amazing.  Food and wine are delicious.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Charming spot to dine in SLC. Chef is from northern Italy and you can tell in the delicious good prepared! Highly recommend this gem

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Me and my friend went to Veneto to celebrate. We ordered scallops and duck ragu.The 1 scallop was not tender and the duck ragu was too dry.We ordered 2 glasses of wine that the waiter recommended (we paid $78 for them!). So, if a glass of wine is going to be more than usual (~$15) the waiter HAS to let the customer know.Other than the very expensive wine and the dry duck ragu, the ambience was pretty good and our waiter (Patrick) was very helpful and welcoming.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: We have been to Veneto a number of times and ordered several things off the menu. Everything on the menu has been cooked to perfection and served beautifully. The wine list is outstanding and the servers are all wonderful about making appropriate recommendations. Marco and Amy have created an establishment that truly makes you feel like you are eating dinner in their home. They are gracious hosts that care for each customer and treat them as friends. I always look forward to an evening at Veneto.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I love this place. We came on a Sunday so a bit quiet. Incredible owner and experience. He suggested an incredible wine. Delicious food. Great wine.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Do yourself a favor and go to VENETO. Had an amazing dinner with EXCEPTIONAL service. The ravioli with pecorino and pears is incredible. Start to finish a great dining experience. I will be dining here again very soon!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Overall it was a great experience and I would recommend this place as long as you're prepared for a pricy meal. The waiter was great, and he explained everything thoroughly if there was any questions. My girlfriend loved the wine and dessert that he recommended. The wait was long ( we got 3 courses and dessert) and we were there just under 3 hours. However, it's explained that they pace the meal, so nothing wrong there. The ambiance of the place was also great, small but classy.Most importantly the food was good. My only slight complaint is that my pasta was not warm, but it was still good. My girlfriend got an amazing filet and I got a great veal dish. I would probably rate this a 4.5 if I could, but because we liked the waiter and the style of the place, it's a 5 for me!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: When Phil G. loves it, I listen. Came here with the wife, son, and DIL. I like them using en European model of eating. I don't love that it's so far out there, that they spend the first few minutes explaining what that it, and what it means. Sadly, I know they do it because they have to. SLC has always had a dearth of what I would consider Italian food. We have lots of NY red sauce places. That what Italian is to nearly everyone. We have a number of places that claim Italian, but they tend to be more standard fine dining with more pasta. I like that Veneto is straight up being legit Italian.For our dinner the pacing was good. We were not in a rush and wanted to spend time visiting with each other. The prawn dish brought out the largest prawn I've ever seen. The polenta with ragu, perfect. Veal sweetbreads and veal liver. Please. I either didn't see that the bistecca was actually Piemontese beef, or other things looked too good. When you see Bistecca Alla Fiorentina everywhere, realize the magic of this dish is that it is made with a specific breed of cattle with a gene mutation that changes the muscle. It is not as marbled, but it's more tender. If it's angus, waygu, or similar, it's not the real thing and not worth your effort to get it. They have the real thing here.In the end, we had an excellent meal, in a wonderful facility.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I ordered the dry aged t-bone and it was delicious, the presentation is spectacular. I also ordered a pasta and it was ok, not as good as the main plate.My only issue is with the waiter attention, very lacking but not rude.For sure I'll give a second chance.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Just an amazing dining experience! Wonderful place to celebrate our 37th anniversary at! We enjoyed all four courses: appetizer, first course pasta, second course meat, as well as dessert. If you like salted caramel, do not leave without trying the panne cotta with salted caramel! The branzino was cooked perfectly! All of the staff combined with an exceptional meal made this an ideal dining experience!After coming home, I discovered one thing to really complain about. My husband and I are not wine drinkers, but we both decided to have a Diet Coke with our meal. We Paid $3 each for about 8 oz of drink. We were asked later if we would like a refill. Well, sure we would since we were paying $3 for a small soda. I just learned that those were $3 refills! You have to be kidding me! We spent over $12 on an amount of soda I would have paid $1.50 for at a convenience store. Granted, 7-11 does not provide the lovely atmosphere nor serve  my drink in a wine glass, but that was unacceptable!We did very much appreciate the anniversary gift box of cookies we were given on the way out, though!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: What an awesome little place in slc, excellent, wonderful experience, from the food, to the ambience, and service, highly recommend.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Best restaurant experience I've ever had in SLC, would love to go back soon!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: One of the best evening meals I've ever experienced.This small venue is set to take care of you from the time you enter, to the time you leave. Marco, the owner presents each course, with an accompanying wine offering to take the experience to the next level.We started off with shaved meat wrapped melon...awesomeThe we had extraordinary appetizer plates, assorted meats, and cheeses offered on a flat plate were unbelievably good.We then were given a medley of crab, prawns, and lobster from Hawaii, paired with a homemade pasta that would make ever the greatest chef envious of the flavors and wine pairing...so delicious.We then had the most incredible triple offering of 120 day aged ribeye steak, delmonico offering, and T-bone...the were all wonderful, with fantastic wines, but my favorite was the delmonico...We were given several wines after the main course, but ended the evening with a triple dessert offering, sweets x 3...all delicious, with a final balsamic vinegarette to cleanse the palate...Overall a wonderful dining experience, if you have the time, enjoy an evening with Marco...you'll love it...

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My husband and I have visited twice in the last eight days... Outstanding service, food and a wine list beyond any establishment in the Utah area. Who would have known a little neighborhood establishment would have so much to offer.  Love the staff (Seth & Marco),  their knowledge and passion for food.  Thank you for sharing the evening with us.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I so badly want to give this place a more favorable review. Unfortunately, this place does not meet the hype in which it proclaims. Dining is slow, which is understandable given the atmosphere. It's not that it's meant to be enjoyed, as the Italians do, but it's painfully slow. Too slow. It's not timed properly. The Italians eat at a pace for digestion, conversation and to enjoy wine. This place mocks that. It's a pale imitation. The wine list is extensive, and pleasurable, but the food comes cold and in offensively small portions. The wine list is exquisite, but the waiters only know that it is vast, not what is actually good. The food is obscure and not worth it. I would have liked if the food had pairing suggestions, or if the wait staff knew what each meal should be paired with. That is what the price suggests. I would suggest anyone who is looking for this kind of dining experience look elsewhere.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: It's so far the only place I've had authentic, high-quality Italian food in Utah. It's northern Italian food and it's done really well. Highly recommend this place for anyone seeking real Italian food. The ambiance is a bit stuffier than what you'd find in other Italian restaurants that serve a lower quality food but play up on the "warm, friendly, Italian stereotype," which impresses some people. This place is more of a fine dining experience so while you won't get the waiter screaming "Mamma Mia," inexplicably at you in the doorway, you will get high quality food that is what you'd actually find in Italy, great service, and a friendly staff.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: We were supposed to come here for Valentine's day and couldn't make it so we decided to come check it out to celebrate our 1yr wedding anniversary. Cute house on 900e converted into restaurant.  We had a reservation for 6pm but got there early and Heather the hostess seated us right away and explained the story behind the restaurant and the owners.  There were 12 tables instead, a few out front and great patio in back with more seating. It is small and cozy with understated decor and simple sconces on the wall with curtains in middle of the room to close off and make an area private if needed.AJ was our server and he greeted us promptly and explained the menu and how it would be traditional Italian style service. Slow paced. Multiple coursed. And no tipping allowed (they charge a comperto per person and a service fee).For the antipasti I picked the vegetable tempura and the hubby picked the board with the selection of cured meats. Tempura had peppers onion olives basil and lemon! Hubby loved the olives (i shared with him since I'm not an olive fan) and everything was light and crisp and I loved the light fragrant olive oil that was used to cook the tempura. The meat plate had super thin sliced meats (4 varieties). His favorite was the salami and he enjoyed the pickled onions and peppers served with the platter. It was a great compliment of flavors between the meats and pickled peppers. For the 1st course the hubby got ravioli with cheese and pear and I got the gnocchi. We were expecting it to be small portions like 1 or 2 ravioli but the plate was actually full (8 total).Ravioli was full of flavor and it was an interesting combo with the salty  cheese and the sweet pear inside. Light sauce on the ravioli was not overwhelming nor was it swimming in it. It was the perfect amount of sauce.The gnocchi was soft, thick and creamy cheese combo. Totally different from the potato gnocchi I have had before. Sage butter sauce was thin and just enough to compliment the gnocchi without overpowering the dish. Smoked cheese was a bit heavy and took over the flavor but I still enjoyed the dish.For the 2nd course,  hubby chose the Sliced Beef Filet and I got the veneta salad. I couldn't eat any of the options on the segundi menu so server just brought out the salad with my husband's dish so I didnt have to wait for him to finish his course before I ate mine. The sliced beef had sea salt sprinkled on top. Meat was blackened on the end pieces but the center slices were seared perfectly on edge with warm medium center and the salt just brought out the flavor of the meat. The Veneta Salad was really bitter and a bit too salty for my taste. I couldn't eat it but it's just not my preference (not that there was anything wrong with it).We brought our own cake to celebrate our anniversary and I loved that they let us bring it in and have it even though they sell dessert. However, I checked in with Yelp and got a free sampling of the sbrisolona cookies. So we took a few bites and took the rest home.The part we had the hardest time with was the fact that we couldn't tip and the coperto they charged was only $8 total. The bill for our amazing meal was much cheaper than expected (176) but $8 is not even close to 10% so I feel like we were robbing the server of a well deserved tip. I know they get paid more than typical server but still feel really uncomfortable not tipping more. If we do offer a tip it gets donated.  That is awesome, but I still feel like we shorted AJ on thanking him and the rest of the staff for his incredible service.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I've been to Veneto a number of times, including tonight, and after reading a couple comical one and two star reviews, I wanted to make sure I chip in with my two cents.  First off, I never write reviews, this is my first and likely only review I will ever do.  My experience with Veneto has been that good.  I've been to Italy five times for atleast 10 days each time and have spent lots of money dining there.  Veneto is the only restaurant that I've eaten at that makes me feel like I'm back in bel paese.  The service is like Italy, so plan on spending at least two hours there.  The emphasis is on the quality of the food and a relaxed experience to enjoy it in.  Don't come here if the dinner isn't the main event for the night.  If you don't want a true Italian experience (like one reviewer said) please free up a table at Veneto by going to the Olive Garden instead.I highly recommend trying things off of the seasonal menu as I have only been impressed by them.  The appetizers are delicious and they have a excellent options from simple charcuterie boards to tartar (the seasonal mussels currently being served are fantastic).The pasta dishes I've had have been cooked perfectly and the sauces are rich and flavorful.  The meat courses are interesting and authentic.  I've particularly enjoyed their wild game main courses.  The Monday chef's choice meals have also been fantastic.  I had a pea soup that I would have never ordered that turned out to be phenomenal.However, the crown of Veneto is definitely the aged Piedmontese steak.  With no hyperbole, the steak has been the best single thing I've ever had in my life.  Simply amazing.  The richness of the aged flavors sets it apart.  Better than any steak I had in Italy or anywhere else.  The care and quality that goes into is apparent.  I had this steak over a year ago and I still vividly remember the experience from Marco bringing it out before it was cooked to its exquisite taste.The effort that Marco and Amy put into the experience at Veneto and their presence in the kitchen and the dining room is the cherry on top.  They are pleasant to talk to and are gracious hosts.  Thanks for adding such a quality restaurant to the SLC scene.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: The dining room is lovely and the food was good- not great, not even particularly memorable, which it should be for the pretense they put on. Upon arrival, one is given a speech by the hostess about the experience. Next, the waiter gives another speech as they want you to experience Italian dining and they apparently really need to control your dining experience. We were told there is a $35 corkage fee per bottle! because they only want you to drink Italian wines of their choosing. After the main plates were served, I had to get up and ask a server to bring cracked pepper (oh the horror for Marco, the chef/owner, I'm sure) because our waiter did not check back to ask how we liked our dishes. We were told we COULD NOT have our espresso with dessert- it's not the Italian way and is their one hard rule. That was just too much! It's condescending and pretentious. I've travelled to Italy, this is SLC, if you wish to provide the authentic Italian experience, do it on a special night where people sign up for that. I just wanted to enjoy dining with friends from out of town, not be treated like a child. I just bought a house blocks away from VENETO, I'm going to be surprised to see it there next summer if they continue to treat customers like this.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: This is our favorite restaurant of all time!! You will truly feel like you are eating food right from Italy and the service and hospitality are incredible. You will never find a better restaurant in Salt Lake City! Thank you Marco and Amy for bringing a piece of Italy to Utah!!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: As I lived in Italy for 6 years it is hard to find a Italian authentic restaurant state side. If you are in St Lake Utah ever please spend the time to try Veneto Restaurant as the staff is friendly (family style) and food really does make you feel you are in Europe!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My wife and I enjoyed the intimate, relaxed, fine dining experience this restaurant offers. It's rare to find places that let you have a nice 2.5 hour dinner with no rush. It is quite expensive, but my feeling is I can go to any number of other places downtown that are nearly as expensive, where the service is much less personal and you're feeling like you're taking up space after an hour when they've rushed all of the food out.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Has to be one of the very best... if not the best dining experiences ever.  Primarily due to the people involved..a special recognition to our server Seth.  I love it when you can simply trust the server to pick the food and wine.  FOVE COURSE meal. All the wine and food were impeccable.  I was very surprised at how well he nailed it.  I've eaten at Per Se in NYC and Quince and Michael Mina, A-16, Chez Panisse in SF. I know what I am talking about. Go here if you want an incredible experience.  A little pricey but well worth it!!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Service seems to be purposefully slow - designed to make you linger - food was fantastic - ravioli that I'll be thinking about for quite some time - great for a long special night out

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! I had been traveling and was waiting for the meal. Everything about this was prefect. Just a nice slow relaxing meal.  We started with a nice glass of prosecco and a palate cleanser. We then placed our order with a few appetizers, the prosciutto, buratto, and tomatoes were amazing!! The crostini to go with this was perfectly toasted and butter to make the perfect style bruschetta. We then had this fried polenta cake which was slightly different than what I'm used to but amazing! We then had the sage butter gnocchi that was like eating fluffy clouds! We then had the steak perfectly cooked and slightly salted. I want this meal again and maybe the only reason why I would go back to Salt Lake City. Hehe

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Our second time....Amazing food and a fantastic experience!Veneto is truly a gem for the dining scene in SLC....

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: I had a fantastic food experience at Veneto in SLC. Let me point out that even though I'm American I lived in Friuli for 28 years and this is one of the most authentic restaurants focused on Veneto and Friuli in the whole US. Bigoli in salsa and tagliata  were just like my grandma would make them!!!Beat restaurant in Salt Lake City!!!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My girlfriend and I just dined here. It took about an hour and a half to get our food which sadly we didn't get to enjoy since my plate was overly salty, and hers was burnt. When we expressed our concerns with the owner he told us " they weren't a McDonald's, if we wanted fast food to go there" it disturbed the ambiance of his own restaurant and the lovely couple next to us were in complete shock of what was  said. Unfortunately it was an unpleasant experience, not only with the customer service but the quality of the food. May I add I'm from Italy and it hurts writing this review.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: The menu is unique to the Veneto region of Italy and not your traditional Italian fare or I should say, what Americans tend to think of as Italian (bread, olive oil, Lasagna, etc). But if you ask why you'll find there's thought and reason in every detail. The quality of the food was INCREDIBLE and served piping hot right out of the kitchen as the Chef completed each dish. My biggest piece of advice is to be adventurous with your selections and ask your server what they do really well. We had some of the seasonal anti pasti that were delicious with great flavor. If you like mushrooms do not miss the risotto! I personally found the game stew to be magical. Slow cooked Venison served on a piping hot bed of creamy polenta. The service was attentive and the ambiance was warm and comfortable as the tables filled and guests progressed their way through each of the courses chosen. We'll definitely be back to enjoy the seasonal menu as it changes and more of the dishes we weren't able to try like the gnocchi.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My favorite restaurant in SLC, mostly because of the food, but it's the whole vibe which is so incredibly warn and authentic. Given the excellence of the food and wine this could easily be a snooty place but isn't -- that's just not the way the owners are. Always great meals here but also attentive and warm servers, not overbearing. Great taste in the decor, too, which is simple and lovely. Highly recommend.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Was looking forward to our dinner here...I hate writing bad reviews but we came here based on reviews. I ordered the steak dish. The portions were extremely small, maybe 4oz filet. It came out raw and the server was happy to fix it. Problem was it went from raw to med well. I prefer my filet at medium rare. The steak also had no flavor, the salad that came with it was bland. Long story short the prices and portions were similar to long haven without the ambience and flavor of log haven. My wife's meal was equally disappointing. Had some good bites of pasta and some bites that were hard and chewy.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: We enjoy a slow dinner, but wished they would notice we needed a glass of wine. Risotto for $42 for two people, are you serious? Wait staff needed to run to the back before recommending a wine. Good effort ,but struggling to be a 5 star restaurant.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: First time at Veneto, we loved the restaurant that used to occupy that space for special occasions so we thought we would try this relatively new restaurant. Love the idea of the set course menu on Monday and the food was great. My fiancé really loved the wines suggested with the dishes and other than a rather bland polenta the meal was delicious. The tiramisu and crostata desserts with a cup of espresso was my favorite part of an overall satisfying meal. Atmosphere is very pleasant and the owner's wife was very courteous. They sat us for a 9:00pm reservation which was great for us since it can be harder to find dining options for later evenings/nights. It has great potential to be a very romantic dining option.Some things we didn't care for....our server was unprofessional. He was nice enough and looked like he was in training but he had a difficult time even reading off the menu options from his notepad. There was no physical menu so the server tried to hurriedly read off the two options per 4 courses all at one. We would have like for him to have paused between the dishes and/or courses so we knew when he had stopped describing one dish/course and started describing another since he described 8 separate dishes one right after another. A menu would be nice to follow along with. I'm not sure if it was his first serving job, he looked and acted pretty uncomfortable...for ~$100 per person ($60+ per person for the Monday set menu + drinks), we expected quality service. The server said they do not have a liquor license so they didn't have any port, grappa, or any digestif options besides coffee and espresso. I did not know they do a European "no tipping" system until just now reading another Yelp review after the fact. I wish they would have mentioned something when I made the reservation, in the reservation reminder voicemail, or when the check was paid about this quirk or about the "coperto" charge that takes the place of a traditional tip. I unknowingly left a significant cash tip in addition to this charge, it would have been nice to know the purpose of the "coperto" on the check. I'm not sure if we would return, it feels like it would be an expensive gamble.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: My parents, my boyfriend and I came to Veneto for dinner this evening for the first time and everything was wonderful. The atmosphere, the service, and the food, oh the food was just beyond. We had an issue with one of our dishes but it was resolved with no issues. If you you are looking for a authentic Italiano dining experience this is the place. You will not be disappointed.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Lived up to the hype! Started the night with prosecco as recommended by our delightful server Vince. A perfect appetizer really. Then a insalate tricolore, Pumpkin risotto, barlett pear and pecorino ravioli, bigoli duck ragu, Tagliata di Manzo, Pork chop with sautéed greens, roasted potatoes, and caramelized shallots. Honestly those caramelized shallots were one of my favorite things. The homemade pasta (all of them) were really the stars. Extensive wine list with some that are affordable some that are way out of my price range. Service was really just impeccable. Definitely hope to be back soon!

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: This was our second time at Veneto and it was my birthday dinner. The first time was amazing and delicious, so naturally we were excited to come back for a special occasion. Our visit started out great and the staff was very nice. Then, we got our first course (after the appetizers) which was the risotto (which we had the first time we were here-creamy and perfect). This time, it was crunchy. So we told the server who apologized and offered us something different. We ordered something else and next thing we know the server came back and said he and the cook both tried it and said it was cooked correctly. He said it was al dente and how they always cook their risotto. There is a big difference between under cooked and al dente in my opinion. Anyway, they wouldn't comp the risotto, even though we ate less than half of it. At this point we were done and just asked for the check. Weirdly enough, the owner came over to wish me a happy birthday, which was very nice but kind of awkward since we were just told we were wrong in our dislike of crunchy risotto. We've had risotto several times both in the US and Italy, so being told we were wrong was embarrassing and made us very uncomfortable. Just as a point of reference, we've been married over 11 years and in that time have sent something back to the kitchen 2 times maybe. Their reaction to us made it seem like we were those type of people who dont have to pay for anything because they send everything back after eating most of it just to get it comped.I couldn't get out of the restaurant fast enough. Kind of ruined my special birthday dinner. We won't be back.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
