content: My new favorite restaurant! We went there to celebrate my husband's birthday and needless to say we will be back. Service was exceptional. Friendly, warm, inviting and so knowledgeable of the menu. The food was beautifully authentic and absolutely delicious. Best risotto in Utah hands down. Over all it was a wonderful experience. If you are looking for italian VENETOS is the best you will get here in Utah.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: Awful... I went and received average service with gross food. My pasta was homemade but the sauce was insipid.  I started with  steak tartare that was under seasoned and had no flavor. My partner ordered a steak roulade and his only comment was that it was oily.

name: VENETO Ristorante Italiano
content: We are there a couple of weeks ago.  The service was great but after a few hours my wife became very sick.  The reason was that she had pork at this resturant and it was under cooked.  The sickness ruined the next day.  To make things worse, the owner called us today after seeing our original review.  The only thing he said was that he was sorry and asked us to give him another try.  What the the possibility of that happening?  No refunds was offered or any other remedy.  So the conclusion is don't go to this resturant because the customer service needs a lot of help.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: One of the best taco spots in salt lake! It's addicting, I've gone several times and I've only lived here 2 months. The Birria is delicious, not overly salted, and melts in your mouth. They give you the option of getting crispy tacos or regular soft tacos. I've loved the tacos and mulitas! I'd recommend anyone wanting authentic Mexican food to give this place a shot. Also there's a Rancho grocery store adjacent to it with tons of good grocery items as well.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Love that they follow COVID Guidelines and also use social distance sitting, they pick up and clean each table as each customer or party leaves they do wear gloves for prepping I didn't see in between sanitizing after customer contact. the tacos de Birria dorados with cheese if you ask for these make sure order the consome as well they are fast at sitting and trying to take your order the rice is bland but condiments and drinks were on point I truly recommend

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This place was amazing! The food was fantastic, the service was quick, and the vibe was perfect for a small hole in the wall taco place. It was also very clean and had lots of customers present. The food was flavorful and filling. I enjoyed both the soft and hard tacos while my fiancée enjoyed the mulita. The tacos with cheese had the perfect amount for me but for those that enjoy a lot of cheese, the mulita is the way to go. The consome was also a delicious addition to the meal and I think the food would've been incomplete with it. Highly recommend!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: The Birria tacos here are AMAZING! We've tried a few different places for this same dish and no one compares!!! My only complaint is the taco truck always sells out before I get there, great food great service!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Crispy Tacos were a bit too toasty. Flavor was okay. Can taste a lot of caramelo on the sauce.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Yooooooo. Best choice I've made all week LOL! I may or may not have been here several times in the past couple weeks (judge me LOL) and not one time did I stop before eating to take a picture LOL! The tacos dorado con queso with consome is where it's at! I know I can eat a million but to save myself from that embarrassment, I'll eat 3 or 4. Honestly, that's enough to get me full and ready for dessert! I normally order these along with strawberry horchata which has a stronger horchata flavor than strawberry. The strawberry is very mild in this drink so if you're looking for that, you won't find that here. My tacos are crispy and full of meat and cheese ready to dip in the consome for added flavor. They come with lime, red onions, cilantro, salsa on the side and in the plate with tacos, grilled onions and jalapeños. I've also had their birria ramen which is pretty good. The noodles sat in the broth too long for me for my liking but the flavor was there and bae ate that up quick. I love the consistency here. Whether it was from the store front or the food truck, everything tasted the same! So good and worth my money. Service in the food truck was more pleasant than when I've went to pick up from the store. A couple of the girls in the front seem annoyed when placing an order..almost like it's an inconvenience. Not exactly sure why but maybe because they're busier than normal due to the birria taco hype? RBF is real LOL! (Don't worry, I got that problem to y'all LOL) I haven't dined in yet but we're always on the go and need something good to eat when we're in that area. I'm big on customer service and the impression it gives to your patrons whether it's your first time there or not. I work hard for my money and I'm coming to your establishment to hand it over so they can pay all employees, vendors and keep their business going. The store looked clean every time I've been there and seemed to clean tables pretty quickly after diners are done (only noticed because I was standing in line to order).

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: I got tacos from their food truck in Herriman. While I thought the meat was good, it was kind of dry for birria and there was hardly any meat in the taco. Not pleased with the amount of food for the price.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Went here for lunch with 2 coworkers during the week after an ok take out experience. They could not seat us at an open table because that table was for 5, even though it was not reserved. Was told by hostess and kitchen manager that we could not sit at that table just in case a party of 5 came and that we would have to wait 15-20 minutes until a 3 top opened up.  Are you fuggin kidding me!?We took our business to Santos Tacos and glad we did, quality of food and service is far beyond the over hype of this place.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Saw them on tik tok and wanted to try the birria tacos out. I was disappointed because everything lacked flavor. Also the ramen smelled and tasted like cinnamon

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Ordered 2 tacos dorados (crispy shell) con queso (with cheese). Comes with lime, cilantro, onion, and spicy salsa. Optional side of dip, rice, and house cooked beans. The tacos don't even really need any additions because the meat, cheese, and tortilla alone is so great. Fantastic flavors

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Awesome tacos de birria! I got the dorados with cheese and they were delicious. Got an horchata as well, which was very tasty.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Best mexican food in utah! Authentic and delicious! Filling and pure bliss! Must eat in Utah don't leave without stopping here.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: I came to the food truck in west valley, everybody was hyping up their birria tacos . My first time to this place I was two bites in to it and very disappointed. Tacos are not what I expected they are very plain there's no (seasoning)flavor and the juice that you dip it in also no flavor at all. Got burritos also and hubby and kids did not like them . I would give a 1.5 star just because the salsa was spicy (good) and the crunchy of the tortilla

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: I was craving Birria after returning from LA and unfortunately the flavors here do not compare to what I get back home. The ramen lacks depth of flavor and I wasn't served lime, cilantro, onions, nothing. I didn't know I need to ask for that specifically. The tacos were anything but crispy. Perhaps dine in would have been better and I would recommend that the order and pick up option tells you the approximate wait time before placing an order.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Hidden gem in Salt Lake City. They don't have too much variety on the menu, but that wasn't a problem for me. I ordered the Tacos Dorados with consume and it was excellent! The shells are perfectly fried and filled with cheese and meat. So good. Make sure you get the consume to dip them in! Online ordering was so easy and they give you limes and cilantro/onions on the side so you can control exactly how much you want.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: The birria tacos are supper good also the tapatío ramen with birria is spot on! This place is so good the owners are super friendly the one and only drawback is the location but aside from that the food is great!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: I don't recommend when people will be honest about their reviews, I felt all good reviews from friends of the place I drove all the way there because someone on TikTok recommended it, the ramen was bowel of salt went straight to garbage no varieties no taste

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Just outstanding!  This little taqueria, which specializes exclusively in birria ( barbecue) tacos, nails it with authenticity and deliciousness.  Located in a little strip mall adjacent to Rancho Market, it's easy to miss, but don't!  You'll find birria-filled tacos, crispy or soft (the fried ones were perfectly crunchy and teeming with greasy goodness), with cheese or not.  You can order some delicious simmered pinto beans and/or rice.  A small selection of drinks (hibiscus/horchata/Mexican sodas) round out the menu.  The service was super friendly and helpful.  The taqueria is practicing excellent hygiene with only carryout for now.  An absolute gem in the Rose Park neighborhood!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Disappointed because there was a lot of hype on Tik tock but it was only alright. The food was cold even though we ordered there and waited for it, consomé cold. There was like no Birria in my tacos, more tortilla than anything. I'm super disappointed  don't think I'll be returning.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: I can't tell you how many times we have ordered to go from here throughout quarantine and still frequently as of today. Their Birria tacos with the consumé broth taste just as delicious as they look. The crunch of the tacos and the warm broth to wash everything down all just pairs together so well. Each taco is pretty big and stuffed with a ton of meat so three or four tacos fill me up pretty good. The service here is outstanding. Ordering over the phone is easy, and my orders always come out right. We dined in once and the whole crew was very attentive, welcoming, and professional. I loved the family-like vibe they gave off. Will continue to keep coming here especially with this cold weather.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This place is tied for best taco spot in Utah bruh! I from the Bay Area and lived in SD for a few years and this place competes with their best spots!! It's that good frfr.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: The tacos de birria are to die for! I got 4 tacos de birria with a side of consommé to dip the tacos in! Best in Utah by far. Super friendly staff as well!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Just got home from picking up my order. 2- 32 oz consomé con carne and honestly I'm extremely disappointed and feel scammed. Barely enough meat for 3 tacos out of the both containers. Two freaking 32 oz containers full of consomé for $18. Feels like I bought an appetizer.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This place is to die for! Seriously, go try it. It's the best birria tacos con consome that I've had (so, basically only the 3rd place I've ever tried birria tacos con consome lol but it's still the best I've had so far and what I've found in either Seattle area or SLC). The broth is absolutely amazing. I'd recommend placing an order online in advance because even the online wait can be a while (unless they've fixed that in the past couple of months). I don't live in SLC, however, this will definitely be a place I go to every year when I'm in town visiting. I already can't wait until my next visit during the holidays! So juicy.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: The food is incredible - crispy, cheesey tortillas, filled with flavorful meat - what more do you want?! I love that they keep it simple. Small menu, fast service - they know what they're good at it and they do it SO well!! I have been twice in two weeks and I plan to visit every week from here on out. I order 2 of the tacos dorado con queso and a cup of consume for dipping - so good! The service is great, the food is unreal - do yourself a favor and go to los tapatios!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This place is really incredible. The tacos are perfectly crisp, meat incredibly well seasoned, salsa the perfect amount of spice, grilled onions great, and consume so yummy. And they're open on Sunday. This lived up to the hype!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Order online cause sometimes it's so packed it can be a very long wait, but it's worth it! It's a special type of tacos but the Best tacos ever!!! I could die after eating this. It's the softest, juiciest, most flavored meat in the world! It's messy. It's juicy. It's delicious. We drive all the way from pleasant grove just for this.  They have one meat only. Get the consume. You'll just drink it down!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: First time having tacos Birria, and they were FIRE. The crispy tacos with the dipping broth and salsa were delicious. Next time I'm going to order the biggie size of birria broth, it tastes soooo good. Staff was super nice even though they we're getting worked hard, place was full, line out the door. I will definitely be back again, and again.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This spot is the best hidden gem ever. I love birria and I never thought I would ever get it here in Salt Lake City. When I went to try it out I didn't have any expectations either. I don't really trust any birria. Just those that I can get from a home cook meal I thought would be delicious. Well los tapatios proved me wrong. The tacos was delicious. The broth was super good. I recommend getting the fried birria. The one with the soft tortilla was delicious, but the fried tortilla was way better. I hesitated when it said fried, but it just meant the tortilla was lightly pan fried, and not a hard shell. Make sure to pay the extra $2 for the broth. You can literally dip anything in it, but the tacos is just way better dipped. I recommend ordering online. They currently don't allow dine in since covid, and there's always a line to get your meal and order it. Ordering online is so easy. No line, just walk up, pick up, and go.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Really delicious tacos and horchata and the staff was so nice and helpful. My only tip would be to order ahead of time for pick up since they don't have any dine in space available right now. We came on a Saturday afternoon and ordered there, but they were so busy it took about forty minutes to get our food. I will definitely be going back soon!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Came here off a recommendation from Tik Tok lol. I've never been to a taco place that specializes in birria tacos, so I thought I'd give it a shot. The first thing I'll say is that it's pretty busy. I came on a Saturday afternoon and the wait was about 40 mins. Definitely order ahead. When I did get my food, it was pretty good. I'm not a huge fan of shredded meats, and I thought the tacos lacked flavor. I ended up using lots of sauce and was satisfied. The strawberry horchata though... life changing. So good. So sweet. I'll definitely be back if not just for that sweet nectar.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This is my first time trying tacos birria and this place do not disappoint. I ordered the tacos dorados i.e crispy taco birria (beef) and they were delish! It goes very well with the sauce included along with the cilantro, onion combination  The online ordering was a breeze and I love how you can check your status easily  and how many people were in line ahead of you and once they're ready, you get a text letting you know.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Wow. Just wow. These tacos are incredible. Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, just the right amount of cheese. The salsa they serve with the tacos is perfectly matched. Worth the wait. We'll be back.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: We ordered a tacos dorados con queso with a 32 oz consume with meat. Holy cow these were so good!! The tacos were so crispy and warm, and with a ton of meat too! I wish they added just a little more sweet grilled onions and jalapeños. I ordered a 16 oz (aqua chica) strawberry horchata which was good but unfortunately it was more of an 8-12 ounce, hopefully they update their menu to reflect the true amount. I'll definitely get the 32 oz (aqua grande) next time because it's a true 32 ounce. The online ordering system was easy to navigate and tells you where you are in line and when your order is ready. When you get to the restaurant they have a ton of people waiting outside, they don't have a pickup vs order system so it takes a bit to let them know what you're there for. Hopefully they have a better organization in the future so people can get in and out of there quickly. Will definitely be back for the food and aqua fresca

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Customer Service: 8/10We loved our experience at Los Tapatios grill. Even though they unfortunately had their AC go out they made sure we constantly had water and a large drink of aqua fresca (which you should definitely order) they were also fast with our food!Environment: 8/10They are currently only doing takeout, so call ahead! However when they do open up for dine in they have the cutest and coziest spot for tacos!Menu: 9/10Their menu offered so much variety while maintaining simplicity. You could order Al la carte tacos with rice beans or with consome or both! We got tacos as well as the quesadillas and truly enjoyed both.Price: 9/10What makes this taco shop coming back is the killer price and killer flavor. A taco was $2.50 and the quesadilla was $5. Both don't skimp on the cheese or meat!Taste: 8/10We loved our tacos and quesadilla. We couldn't quite pin the flavor of the meat but there was definitely some cinnamon, making it an unforgettable taco! This taco was so juicy we ordered the consome on the side to dip, but even without it the meat juices were dripping-a sign of a truly good meal.Overall: 8.4/10If you're in the area (or not) you would be missing out if you didn't get some tacos!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Delicious, juicy and very well seasoned tacos with perfect side fixings of chopped up onions, cilantro, lime, and  extra spicy salsa. So glad to have found this spot. So sad that we only got 4 to share and now I have to wait till next weekend to get some more. Oh and the rice was super tasty too.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Amazing birria tacos in SLC - comparable to taco trucks in LA. They have a great system- order online and keep track of where you are "in line." I would recommend ordering online because of the long lines and heavy demand. Consomé can definitely be shared between two people! Friendly owners, great customer service.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Super delicious.  The owner was super nice and went the extra mile for us when he didn't have to.  Loved it!!!!! Ps my mother loved it too

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: I am so happy this place exists.   I got the tacos dorados and the tacos dorado con queso an a cup of the consomé.  Everything was so delicious,  the flavors are a celebration in my mouth and it tastes authentic Mexico too.  I would recommend this place to any who wants to be blown away by the deliciousness.  I will be coming here again and again and you should too.  Thank you Los Tapatios!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Food was BOMB, service was A1. Line was LOOONG but moved really fast. Grilled onions in the plate were so good tacos are crunchy and perfect.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This place was awesome. I've never had Tacos de Birria before and they blew my mind. The flavor was immaculate and for a very good price. We had the soft and hard tacos, both were great to go along with the salsa and consume to dip in. The aguas frescas were great as well, very authentic. Especially in this time of social distancing they made sure to provide everyone with easy, fast access of their store even if it was full; which it often is.Will be back soon  to have lots more!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This was my first time ordering food from Los Tapatios and I was highly satisfied. The only thing is that the birria tacos did not come with broth which is what I'm used to when dining out for birria. Other than that, the tacos were crunchy and the birria was moist. Definitely delicious and I'd also recommend the watermelon Agua Fresca! So refreshing!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Best tacos I've had in a long time! Make sure to get them with cheese and get the broth, it's a game changer!! I'll definitely be going back!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: First off, I don't like birria from anywhere or anyone that's not my tia! This place knows what they're doing and how to do it properly! You can't go wrong when picking this spot! These guys are seriously the best when it comes to birria! The customer service is great! They're going through a lot with Covid and it's been super hectic when I've picked up my orders and the guys are always trying their best and have great attitudes!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Went back again the following Sunday and the Tacos Dorados Con Queso were still so good! Eight of them were enough for a family of 4.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Damn you guys...... this place was ! A friend posted a picture the other day and I knew I had to try it. They are not currently serving inside, so you best bet would be to call 10 minutes before arriving to get your food. We ate our food in the car in the parking lot. They are taking all of the necessary precautions right now to make sure the food is safe and their area in clean. They all were wearing masks and they had a pretty good system down to get your food. Well let's talk about the food....... the tacos were on point and they were HUGE! I am 6'1" and 200lbs and I was stuffed after 2 tacos. They filled them with a ton of meat and cheese and the shells were nice and crispy. The meat was nice and tender with no fatty pieces. I was very impressed and you bet I will be making a trip back soon!! These made my food heart happy! The girl taking my order was also so nice and answered my questions and gave great customer service!!!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Literally best tacos in Utah! I've tried just about everywhere and nothing beats these tacos.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Best tacos de birria in Utah! They are full and flavorful. The staff is friendly and go above and beyond.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: If you are lucky enough to get your Birria before it's sold out you are one lucky person! The Consomé at this place is delicious!! It was full of flavor and perfect! Most places In Utah are short on flavor but not this place!! I've had Birria from Baja California and they can make mean Birria you see Birria shops all over and I gotta say this place has better flavor than those places in Baja! Loved every sip and bite of my food! We ordered fried tacos a mulita (must try) and a quesadilla. Everything was perfect! I can't believe I waited so long to try their new spot! With COVID going on, they only have pick up but that's just perfect I rather bring it home and enjoy it. I suggest you either order online or call ahead to make sure you don't just show up to the sad news they are Sold Out sign.Their mulita size was great for the price! It was full of meat and cheese. It was Mulita heaven!! So what is a mulita? It's two fried tortillas they put cheese on both tortillas so they put one tortilla with cheese on bottom meat goes on top of the cheese and top it with the other tortilla with cheese, AAAMAZING a Must try item! Their menu is not very big and it's simple!I will try everything on their menu. Gotta try all their Agua Fresca flavors too!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: This one of those run don't walk situations. These tacos are AMAZING. Beat birria tacos I've had. I tried some delicious tacos in California and was  looking for something that could compare even a little bit to those. Instead, I found something that tasted even better  than the ones I had in California. I ordered via phone, and was surprised how long the line was outside but they still maintained social distancing making everyone stand ft apart. Once we got to the front we quickly picked up our order and left. Great COVID response/service.The tacos remained perfectly crispy despite my 30 min trip back home. The meat was tender and juicy and the birria  consomé was amazing. Unlike others I've had it was full of meat. I did buy the large consomé so I cant speak for the smaller one. Located right by the Rancho market. I cant wait to come back once they have dine in available. From what I understand they're only open weekends (Fri-Sund). Come try these tacos, you wont regret it.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Great online ordering process. Let's you know exactly when your order is ready.  Tacos are generous in size and oh so good. Salsa has a good kick but not overly spicy. The tacos dorados was our to go order and they remained crispy upon eating at home. I will be back seriously so good!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: A friend bought me some birria tacos from here today...OMG! I ate the two that she bought me and it left me wanting more!!! They are good size tacos, the soup that you dip them in was amazing! I also tried the melon aguas and damn! The food at this place was amazing... I should have probably put 4 stars because I didn't get to experience the actual service which is very important to me but the food is 5 stars. I will change the rating if I experience poor service when i actually go there but this is what they get!! I'll be there sometime this week, I'm sure!!!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Best tacos we've ever had!!! Been following them on Instagram since they opened and finally made it in to grab some before they sold out. The crispy beef tacos with cheese dipped in the beef consume are to die for. 10 out of 10 definitely give them a try!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Omg I heard their praises and they more than lived up to the hype. The birria is amazing. They only have birria as a meat option but it's because it's done so well. I had a birria and cheese taco durado and a mulita and they were both an amazing experience. My vegetarian partner had a quesidilla, rice, and beans and was also singing praises.

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: You have to try their birria burrito. Great vibe and even better food. Price is fair for the quality of food you are getting. Definitely unfortunate that all this COVID-19 business is going on during their opening and first month in business. Everyone should absolutely go check it out when we can dine in again

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Los Tapatios has the heartiest, richest, most filling birria and consome around, the portion sizes are large for the price, the service is speedy and friendly, and of course, the food is to die for!!

name: Los Tapatios Taco Grill
content: Incredibly delicious tacos and with the best consomé I've been able to find! Solid pricing for what you need and just enough toppings (cilantro, lime, etc). Plenty of seating for a sit down, and I'm expecting the walls to be decorated soon! It's also great for quick take-out if you want to avoid person to person contact right now!

name: Lucky 13
content: If I could give 0 stars I would.  The worst customer service I have ever received. Very rude and racist.  I was shocked they would treat paying customers this way. Will never go back and will spread the news.

name: Lucky 13
content: I was in SLC on business, and decided to stop by this restaurant for dinner. Here goes....This restaurant is near the downtown SLC area and sort of looks like a small building, but is actually bigger than what it looks like from the outside. Went in on a Thursday night, so it wasn't too difficult to get in either, as I hear this place gets really busy. I also hear this place is known for their burgers. Anywho, I ordered the Celestial Burger, which was ridiculously amazing! Comes with smoked bacon, grilled onions, cheddar cheese and bbq sauce, so nothing too fancy, but the palate thoroughly enjoyed it. There are a slew of other burgers that are much more creative and sound equally amazing as well. The service was great and this restaurant is easy on the wallet too! All of the staff were masked up and followed social distancing guidelines, which I appreciated. If you're in the downtown SLC area, make it a point to stop by here to fill your belly. I'm pretty sure you all will appreciate it like I did. Two thumbs and two big toes WAY up for this place! Happy eating, my foodies!!!

name: Lucky 13
content: Lucky 13 is very reasonably priced for what I believe is the best burger in Salt Lake. It's consistently amazing! It's in a great spot for the summer, being right next to the Bees baseball stadium. If you're ever going to a Bee's you have to stop at lucky 13 before!

name: Lucky 13
content: Never disappoints! Had a chili cheese burger there  Definitely will be putting chili on more of my burgers!

name: Lucky 13
content: Had the bacon cheeseburger and fries. Fries were pretty good. Cheeseburger was ok. Was on the salty side and I didn't care for the flavor of the bacon.  Took it off and it improved the burger for me.

name: Lucky 13
content: Great location next toThe ballpark when public games start again. Still worth the drive from Tooele county for good food and great friends

name: Lucky 13
content: I have yet to recommend lucky 13 to someone and not have them love it. I've been going for years and am so happy they are thriving even through the pandemic. I always default to the celestial burger with Cajun fries but almost anything on the menu is delicious.

name: Lucky 13
content: I came in for Sunday lunch and was blown away by the tasty food I had. The fries were perfectly done, not too soft but not totally crunched up. The drinks were good as well. I wish there was more than one cider option, but their beer selection is extensive. The black bean burger was good despite having to sacrifice my preference to eat vegan. The veggie patties contain egg whites as a binder, so they are not vegan. I do wish they would explore the option of vegan patties since a vegetarian wouldn't even miss the egg in the patty. The patio is a nice shaded area to sit and see the mountains. Keep in mind it can be a little loud due to the busy street, but it is not horribly distracting. As with most places, the COVID protocols are enforced: masks on until you have drinks or food at your table, masks when leaving your table, wait staff wearing masks, and plenty of space between tables. Overall, I would come back for a happy hour or Sunday lunch.

name: Lucky 13
content: Probably the top three best burger joints hands down we got in Utah. What more could you ask for, great food, great ambience, and of course alcohol lol

name: Lucky 13
content: For a bar environment, I loved the burgers and fries. The staff were all friendly with the exception of the guy at the door. But I'm sure they don't pay him for his charming personality

name: Lucky 13
content: The BEST burgers in the state and great cocktails. Some people are animalistic about their love of In-N-Out animal-style burgers and fries, and that's how I feel about this place, except it's different in a better way. The menu is similarly simple, so everything is done to perfection, but it's clear from the moment you hold that dripping, delicious burger in your hands that the bite you're about to take will be far and above any other burger experience you've had.Those fries. I eat them first. I think this is the unspoken rule understood by everyone who's ever driven home after picking up takeout and nearly rolled the car into the median while digging through that crotch-held bag for fried potato perfection. I like the Cajun seasoned fries with ranch, but that fry sauce, which is Utah's version of ketchup and mayo (it's so cute that Utah thinks they're the first to ever mix these two condiments, et. al.) is really great, too. I don't think there's actually any ketchup in Lucky's sauce, but it sure is good.I'm a believer, so in true animalistic-style, if you don't love these burgers you're wrong and I will bite you.

name: Lucky 13
content: We were told that Lucky 13 has the best burgers in Utah, so we had to come try for ourselves. I seriously dig the vibes of this kinda divey, punk rock, feelin' bar. It reminds me of my home bars, yet it doesn't smell like pee or have bad vibes. It actually smells damn delish bc of those burgers!We came here on a Sunday late afternoon and were carded by the bouncer upon entry. I'm not sure if any youngsters would be able to partake in food if they came here? To-go is always an option, I guess...The bar is pretty big and tables are spread out (outdoor seating is also out back). We were seated in the back of the bar right away. We first got some mixed drinks: The Rabbit Hole and the Cucumber Cabron. I ordered a second Cabron because it was so good -- it had that perfect amount of jalapeno kick with the freshness of cucumber. Tasty-DANGEROUS.  The Odell Sippin Pretty Fruity Sour is also one of my fave beers I have tried in months, so we had to get more than one... We didn't think we could finish two burgers, so we ordered the Ol' Man Burger and the Buffalo Chicken Wrap. OMG that burger!! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. It was ooey, gooey and savory perfection. Nothing to fear spice-wise. Rosemary-garlic Fries (highly recommend -- you can smell that garlic from a mile away!) and fry sauce are great. The Buffalo Chicken Wrap was also really, really good! It was actually crispy (as promised) and there was a balanced amount of blue cheese in it (not too much, not too dry). I was surprised because usually burger-forward places don't do chicken well. The side salad was BIG and the dressings were a good mix to try. I was pleasantly surprised at the good quality greens (endive) that they use for the salad. The food came out pretty fast, too!We finished off our time with my first ever Unicorn Fart shots! Not only were they adorable with those rainbow sprinkles atop, but they were just as scrumptious and went down smooth. They were large shots -- so much so -- I'd call them shooters. No complaints about that! The prices for everything were very, very fair. I will definitely return to this gem of a find. Love this place! Wish I was closer.

name: Lucky 13
content: This place was strongly recommended by many in the Salt Lake City area . The experience did not live up  to the expectations. The drinks were watered down and the burgers were flavorless. The service lacked professionalism. Overall the rating reflects an experience which left too much to be desired.  There are too many excellent places to eat in the area to take a chance at this establishment. Let's hope the management gets the restaurant back to it's  better days.

name: Lucky 13
content: Richy the bartender is the worst! He was very unprofessional and worst customer service I have ever experienced to be honest with you! We ordered the burgers and they were ok! Honestly the rosemary garlic fries were the best! Richy raved of how he is a mixologist and makes the best old fashioneds but to be honest as soon as I tried it I noticed it was super watered down with no flavor! After I explained I didn't like drink and wanted something else he said with an attitude I'm still going to charge you for it even if you don't drink it because it's Utah law??? What?? Are you serious? Also the rest of my party ordered beer and never got any of their beers but were all still charged! Update! We spoke with manager before we left and although he was hesitant about what to do at the end he did do the right thing and not charge me for my watered down drink that I didn't touch as well as refund everyone in our party for their beers they NEVER received! Manager was dissapointed that we didn't have a good experience and was shocked our table didn't get their beers as ordered and did apologize for the service we received! I'm giving 3 stars because the burgers were not as great as I remember them unfortunately they lacked a lot of flavor; I felt like I was eating just some hamburger meat with no flavor to them! The best all time favorite of the table were the rosemary garlic fries, they definitely made them taste amazing and with the sauce it was perfection. Maybe it was an off day for the restaurant and the waiter def was not having a good day,  but I'm not sure I'll be back for the burgers.

name: Lucky 13
content: if i could go lower than one star i definitely would. burger tasted like shitty meatloaf. super greasy too. my total came out to be $14.69 and i handed my waitress, Meredith, $15 (i was going to leave her another 3 dollars as a tip once we left) and said i told her i didn't want change, because i don't like carrying change. she came back and handed me my change and said "gratuity isn't included in that. learn how to tip" needless to say she didnt get a very good tip.i have nothing but bad things to say about this place and it bothers me because i had high hopes and i was so excited! save yourself a trip and don't go here.

name: Lucky 13
content: The burgers here are the bomb, I've been a couple times now and eventually want to try every one on their menu but I haven't even started on it yet because each time the special burgers sound so good I have to get them. They have an outdoor patio as well.

name: Lucky 13
content: I had brunch here, and loved it. I did however need to adjust my reservation and they were amazing in making the change for me. I found it cool how the tables have hooks underneath for like your bag, came in handy. When we ordered it was smooth and felt like our server really engaged with everyone's at my table. My food was absolutely delicious, I had "THE KNUCKLEHEAD" I loved the little potatoes and my bread for my sandwich was nice and crunchy when I took my first bite.  The mimosas were delicious I tried most of them but my favorite was raspberry

name: Lucky 13
content: Really good burgers and the best fries I've had in Utah.  They just need to get over the fry sauce fetish and not 'expect' everyone to like it.  I'd bump this up to 5 if they started offering malt vinegar for the fries.  They've got the perfect fries for it.

name: Lucky 13
content: You'll be glad to know they'll con you out their gift cards! My bill was 23 dollars. I paid 30 in Lucky 13s gift cards. They didn't give me my change and they refused to do so. The waiter pocketed my change as his tip. I didn't want to give him a tip because he didn't bring my any extra sauce after I asked him 3 separate times. The only reason they get more than 1 star is the food. I don't think I'll come here again though.

name: Lucky 13
content: BEST BURGERS- hands down. Incredible onion rings and the very best fry sauce. Everyone on staff is kind and friendly and we have never been disappointed with a meal. They are so good, every single time.

name: Lucky 13
content: Great burgers! My server reeked like weed. Not a bad thing though  Place looks kinda dirty with lettuce, bacon, and lots of breadcrumbs on the floor. I asked for habanero sauce like three times and my server kept getting confused for ketchup. I don't like ketchup, just that pink sauce y'all call fry sauce or somethin. Asked for my check and my server was talking on his Apple Watch while I waited. Y'all need better trained servers.

name: Lucky 13
content: I have always enjoyed the food here. The service is spotty. It's pretty hit or miss on having a great server. I have to especially complain about their need to card everyone. I have tried dining here with a family member who is a pretty old guy. Does not drive anymore due to having dementia and doesn't always carry an id. This was a hassle and makes me sad to have been refused service being he actually liked/remembered the burgers from here. Get the garlic fries.

name: Lucky 13
content: Biker bar with an amazing burger. I would recommend the celestial burger but they do have a peanut butter burger and a Mac and cheese burger if you're wanting to try something new. Parking is a mess but you can usually see some pretty sick Harley motorcycles out front!

name: Lucky 13
content: I loved everything about my recent experience at Lucky 13 in SLC! They seated us pretty quickly outside. I was worried it would be cold, but they seal off the outside area so that wind doesn't come through and they have heaters going. The temperature was actually super comfortable! I got their Caramel Cider which was DELICIOUS and the perfect drink for the cold weather. Their burger with peanut butter is one of my favorites! I hadn't ever tried a burger with peanut butter before Lucky 13, and was skeptical, but WOW! It is probably my favorite burger now. They also have HUGE portion sizes, so I had enough for another meal, too.

name: Lucky 13
content: So we called to make a reservation and the guy told us they weren't busy and to come on down. Sounded very nice so we drove 15 minutes to the restaurant. When we got there the place was packed and people all over out front. I had to get a woman off her phone to help me get on the list. She was snappy and did nothing to accommodate us after confirming our story with the guy. She sharply told us "You will have to wait till these other 5 groups get seated". So we left.

name: Lucky 13
content: BEST BURGERS IN UTAH!!! we love going here. It's such a good environment and supper yummy food! Cant go wrong with this one!

name: Lucky 13
content: All about the burger. If you are really craving a burger, this is one of the best in all of Salt Lake. It's a bar, so you gotta be 21, but when you can go, it's worth it. Get the bacon, get the cheese and get the grilled onions.

name: Lucky 13
content: The food is amazing! The black bean burgers are some of the yummiest I've ever had. Make sure to ask for Cody - he's the bestest!

name: Lucky 13
content: Very large and very good burgers! Plus, the fact that the entree prices include fries make these meals one of the best deals in the valley.

name: Lucky 13
content: Always a go to when in Salt Lake! Their Breath Enhancer is by far my favorite! The service is always great and we love taking friends here.

name: Lucky 13
content: My favorite burger is the Stinky Blue Cheese Bacon Burger! Its just a great combo of flavors that all work. In my opinion the garlic fries are way too much garlic, but the regular fries are great. My husband loves the Pigpen burger... it's almost the only one he orders! We have both survived the Ring of Fire Burger... but buyer be warned.... they sauté literally tons of habanero peppers. Its hot!!!  Like burns twice hot!

name: Lucky 13
content: Food is amazing every single time. Their burgers and fries are second to none. Service could be improved as well as a face lift on tables/ decor

name: Lucky 13
content: Classic burger spot with delicious fried pickles as an appetizer. I enjoyed the peanut butter burger and added jalapeños per the server's recommendation. Also tasted the celestial burgers. Cajun fries were good, not too spicy. The garlic fries were strong and overpowering.

name: Lucky 13
content: My God they are freaked out about covid. I'm surprised they don't spray you off as you enter. The staff is alright. It is a bar so I guess its expected to hear and see them act that way. Our server didn't communicate very well and was definitely in a hurry to leave. Now as far as the food. Best burger in salt lake is a stretch.  They put it together nicely but it lacked seasoning. Was cooked good though.  The Cajun fries were fire. Rosemary and garlic fries were great as well. The food is good I guess the atmosphere is a bar and looks it. If its your thing give them a shot. I personally probably will not return but don't let my opinion sway you.

name: Lucky 13
content: Best Burgers in town. But I always get them to-go since I feel like I'm going to get beat up when I walk in the door.

name: Lucky 13
content: They are not just a bar- it's an amazing burger joint as well. A perfect post game spot if you are in SLC. I know there are less activities due to Covid but I still recommend stopping by if you are in the area. They are pretty good at social distancing and they have outdoor patio seating. There can be a long line so please either make a reservation or get there with plenty of time. They don't really have parking so you may need to scope out parking ahead of time. The menu is robust and they have the coolest burger combinations- I love avocado on anything. They also have a good assortment of beers and booze if that is your vibe.

name: Lucky 13
content: We were enjoying a couple of brews at Kiitos brewing when we got hungry.  We asked the bartender where we should we get some lunch from.  She suggested that if we were looking for the best burger in town then we should go to Lucky 13.  We called and found out that they were offering curbside to go orders.  We placed our order over the phone easily.  My fiance ran around the corner to pick up our food.  He barely pulled up outside and a Lucky 13 employee was bringing our food out to him.  Even when he arrived back to the brewery the food was still warm.  I ordered the House Smoked BLT and it was full of flavor.  The sandwich was much thicker than I would have expected, the lettuce was fresh and the bacon was crisp and thick.  I loved the sandwich.  It was so filling.  My fiance got the Nut Butter Burger.  He thought that the meat itself was high quality.  He would have liked the addition of some jelly with the peanut butter.  We have a hamburger like that in Columbus and he is a big fan.  Overall our burger and sandwich were delicious.  The freshness and quality came through.  The order process was easy and the curb side delivery was perfect during these difficult times.  We highly suggest Lucky 13!

name: Lucky 13
content: This place has the best burgers!  They are creative and delicious, and won't leave you walking away hungry by any means.  Add a beer and order the fries with the burger for the perfect deliciousness you've been craving.  The atmosphere alone is something to experience, I love this place!

name: Lucky 13
content: Second time we have been here. Seems Covid safe. The burgers here are memorable. I enjoyed the bacon and blue cheese cooked perfectly on a homemade bun. My side was onion rings that were deliciously crunchy and soft inside. Hubby had the salad which was huge. We will be back

name: Lucky 13
content: Pretty good, the service was nice but not great. Salads there are not awesome but their sandwiches are okay.

name: Lucky 13
content: Easily  the best food we had on our trip was our dinner at lucky 13. Absolutely fantastic tasty Burgers to die for and love to visit here again next time we land up at Salt Lake City. Not sure if Buns are home made, it sure was different than the regular ones we get. My recommendation Try their spicy one to feel real heat in your mouth

name: Lucky 13
content: Best burgers I've had in Utah. The meat is quality, seasoned to perfection, and properly cooked to for amazing juiciness and flavor. Beer batter onion rings and fries are great as well. I wouldn't the Breath Enhancer unless you are absolutely nuts about fresh garlic. Otherwise get whatever burger you think sounds good and it will be. The beef quality is what makes it

name: Lucky 13
content: Best burgers in the valley. You may think peanut butter doesn't belong on a burger, but you'd be wrong. Give it a try!

name: Lucky 13
content: Don't ever get a salad here.  I ordered one snd it consisted of lettuce with cheap luncheon meat on top.  Like a high school cafeteria would serve.  I have had better salads I gas stations.  I threw it away. Yuck

name: Lucky 13
content: I've been going to Lucky 13 and I believe it to be a place every person needs to visit. I currently order takeout probably three days a week from here, and I wish I could eat inside each time. The atmosphere is amazing, the food and drinks are extremely cheap, and the bathrooms are surprisingly nice. It's a great place to grab a beer and a burger. They don't have the best burgers in SLC, but they're all extremely unique and most are $10 with fries. You really can't beat it!

name: Lucky 13
content: Seems like Bekah C loves to run her old fat mouth about how her and her brothers are apparently the goddamn burger experts of Salt Lake City, Utah. Well I'm here to tell you that this place is a JOKE for letting her and her tasteless brothers into their business, putting everyone nearby in serious jeopardy. Just listen to the attitude on these opinions:"My brothers LOVE burgers. They're the type of guys who will order a burger at a Mexican restaurant. They're not picky, they're just devoted."Its as if they're the only people on planet Earth to enjoy hamburgers. Really rude and so trashy I can't even believe it. Pathetic and lame, and I dearly hope I'll never have to come across these people

name: Lucky 13
content: I really am obsessed with the burgers and environment here. They have great outdoor seating when the weather is great and the burgers are absolutely magnificent. Expect to smell and feel like garlic for a while after you leave from eating here. Parking can be pretty tight here, so sometimes you have to be creative. Make sure you check the hours before you go, and make sure that you have your whole group together before you enter.

name: Lucky 13
content: When the waitress says the lucky 13 is "melt your face hot"! Listen to her! I came in with my father in law and wanted to try their signature dish. Was told by numerous people to make sure you try them out if you like burgers and they were right. The meal is so massive we were able to share it and was quite filling.If you are not up for really hot, just ask them to take out the extra heat. An option I debated even the day after ;)

name: Lucky 13
content: Brunch is to die for! Great burgers, great staff. 10/10 would recommend and will go again. Locally owned and I want to make sure they're still around after this plague over so order to go and buy gift cards!!!

name: Lucky 13
content: Super bad service. They forgot what we ordered. Then the whole restaurant turned and everyone got their food before us. Was told it would all be covered but was still charged 4 dollars for a Dr Pepper. My water was empty 80% of my time there. The waitresses didn't even check on us. The worst experience in my life. Burgers not as good as hyped to be. I will never return.

name: Lucky 13
content: Visiting Utah this is always my favorite burger place. Can't go wrong with ordering any type of burger here. The fries are good, the atmosphere is fun, and the workers are nice. I was craving a burger and you must try as you will not be disappointed. You have to be 21 to enter as I believe it's a bar!

name: Lucky 13
content: Burgers were great! Beer was cold! Service was excellent! Would definitely eat at Lucky 13 again!!

name: Lucky 13
content: Best burgers, fries, and fry sauce in Utah hands down. Love this place. Excellent atmosphere, lots of good food and drink selections, and the outdoor area is awesome.

name: Lucky 13
content: Lucky 13 is so great. A new employee told me that the owners of Lucky 13 read these reviews. I usually get take-out, just due to the pandemic. This process and experience is pretty terrible, but I put up with it because I love the food. I work for a company called Podium that would help with the take-out process and experience at no charge. It's called Podium Starter and if you want info about it, let me know.

name: Lucky 13
content: Holy. Delicious. It has been a very long time since I have had food that just hit all my tastebuds perfectly like this. We were in Salt Lake looking for some later night food and stumbled upon this place through yelp. We ran into a local and asked them about the place and if they were familiar, and they said we HAD to go eat here. So we did! It was close to closing and it was pretty busy, so we ended up just getting takeout. The podium for ID check just outside the door had a host who took our order. We got a grilled cheese, a celestial burger, and even got our fries tossed in some garlicky seasoned goodness. We took the food to our hotel room and just opening the boxes, I knew this was gonna be amazing! The flavors were heavenly, guilty pleasure, pub food greasy deliciousness. Fries were perfect consistency. We were both so fat and happy  after our meal and I cannot wait to eat here again someday.

name: Lucky 13
content: I'm visiting from out of town and my coworkers brought me to Lucky 13 for lunch. First of all I appreciate the precautions they are taking to keep both employees and patrons safe, well done! The burger was amazing, I had a ring of fire and that hands down was the best beef patty in a burger I've ever had. And the Cajun fries were outstanding. Looking forward to my next trip down so I can try another burger. Thanks again and keep up the great work!

name: Lucky 13
content: We were lucky enough to not have to wait because we didn't have a reservation, going early is the key. Our service was just ok, but our drinks were great and so were the burgers and Cajun fries!

name: Lucky 13
content: Simple: this was voted the best Burger in Utah and it deserves it.Everything they do is right on point from the burgers to the fries. You will not leave hungry or without a smile.Of note, you have to be 21 or older to come in. Just FYI to all the families visiting they have a pure restaurant down south that you can go to instead.

name: Lucky 13
content: Terrible service and disrespectful, calling a customer a "brat". Good place to go for food if you don't mind the unprofessional staff

name: Lucky 13
content: When I read that Lucky 13 was voted the Best Burger in Utah, I knew I had to try it! Now that I have tried their food, they definitely deserve the title. I ordered the Celestial Burger. It was juicy and savory with each bite. The barbecue sauce on it made the burger extremely flavorful. I ordered the Rosemary Garlic Fries as a side. These fries were just as good as the burger. They had real garlic infused in each bite and the fry sauce was delicious. I will definitely order the Rosemary Garlic Fries again when I return.We ordered take out and ate at Liberty Park. The whole process was seamless. We called in our order and our food was ready when they said it would be. They came out and delivered it to our car as soon as we arrived. I was impressed with their efficiency and how they have adapted to Covid 19. Overall, I had a great experience from start to finish. Lucky 13 is definitely a place I will return to and recommend to anyone in the Salt Lake area.

name: Lucky 13
content: I am taking my company's opinion into account here, as I don't eat burgers. They said their burgers were somewhat dry and lacking in the flavor department. I ordered a loaded grilled cheese and while it wasn't bad, I felt as though I could have easily recreated it better. As far as drinks go, I saw all the usual suspects on their menu and had such a difficult time selecting a beer I had never tried, I opted for the cocktail route. Wasn't disappointed, but wasn't especially impressed either. Apparently, this place attracts the masses, so under normal circumstances, expect a line. From the non-beef consumption perspective, I probably would not return.

name: Lucky 13
content: Great burgers at this place. I usually get the fungus amongus from them and it's really good. Tasty burger with fresh vegetables on top. You have a choice of fries or salad on the side, which I usually get their fries and the fries is pretty good as well. They don't make their hamburger buns themselves and order it from someplace else but it's pretty fresh every time I had it. It doesn't come with sesame on top, but I'm gonna see if they have sesame buns next time I go there.They have variety of drink as well which I haven't tried yet.Last time I dined in at this place the service was pretty good and they have nice staff. Since COVID they started doing pick up parking spots which is my thing these days since I only do pick ups.

name: Lucky 13
content: So glad I finally decided to get some food here.  So sad I waited so long. We called ahead and ordered takeout, so I can't comment on anything about the indoor dining situation or service, etc.  I can comment on the prompt service when we got there though.  We called and told them we were in one of the To Go stalls and they were out within a minute with our food and bill.  Great service.  The only downside to this experience is the very tiny parking lot they have that was completely full when we were there.  Had we wanted to eat inside I'm not sure how long we would have had to wait for a stall to open.We called ahead and the food was ready right on time.  We ordered several different things with some changes to the regular menu.  They nailed everything perfectly.  I had to try the Nut Butter Burger.  How can you not go out on a limb and try a peanut butter burger.  Doesn't sound like a super great combo but if it's kept it's place on the menu it must be at least worth the try.  Well I loved it!!!  Despite it being huge, I finished the whole thing.  The others ordered the Celestial Burger and the Fungus Amongus Burger.  Both received rave reviews and both were equally large.We also got a side of onion rings and rosemary garlic fries to share.  I had not eaten here before and didn't know the burger came with a mountain of fries already.  While their fries were very good, in the future I would upgrade the fries that come with the burger with either the onion rings or rosemary garlic fries.  I'm usually not a huge fan of onion rings but these were really good.  And their rosemary garlic fries were great.We for sure will be back.  I'd like to experience inside next time when the world has returned a little more to normal.

name: Lucky 13
content: Great burger always! Even during covid time the line to get in gets real long real fast. Can't complain too much when the burger is that good.

name: Lucky 13
content: In my opinion, the hype of this facility is over the top. I didnt have any complaints about their service or the environment; the food wasn't all its cracked up to be.

name: Lucky 13
content: I was referred here by a friend and it was delicious! The celestial burger was sooo juicy and flavorful. The fries and the house fry sauce were also wonderful. The staff were very friendly and helpful. If you're looking for a great burger, you should try this place out.

name: Lucky 13
content: This place continues to be my all time favorite burger place! I love the juiciness of the burgers, the flavor of the habanero sauce on my fries, and the great relaxed atmosphere.

name: Lucky 13
content: Grabbed a to-go order from Lucky 13 one late afternoon. Their order over the phone and pick up outside was pretty seamless and the food was ready quicker than anticipated. We thought their burgers were tasty (pastrami and stinky burgers) with the fry/burger sauce that came with it. We did upgrade one order of fries to the garlic rosemary, and they were okay.Docked a star since the patties were a little dry. Would try other items on their menu when we're back in SLC.

name: Lucky 13
content: They have the worst customer service.  Do not eat there ever.  When people came from out of town on corperate jobs. I used to refer to go there.  But don't.   They will be ass hats.

name: Lucky 13
content: Really good burgers and fries. I had the Celestial burger and my husband had the Nutter burger. Also had the fried pickles. Service, food and beer were great. We will definitely be back.

name: Lucky 13
content: Best fries and burgers in town.  I crave this food.  You'll find me sneaking in and out without the kids.Must be 21 years or older to get in but not to eat the food.  I'll make a big order to and for the whole fam.You think there is a standard for this type of food and somehow Lucky 13 just makes it better.  Also, the food doesn't get weird in transportation.Fun bar and outdoor setting.  The atmosphere is cozy and rustic.

name: Lucky 13
content: This burger was loaded with flavor! The meat was juicy and spiced to perfection. It came with grilled onions, jalapeño, lettuce, tomato and mayo. I added bacon and wasn't disappointed! Hands down the best bacon I've ever eaten!

name: Lucky 13
content: I went here with my buddies before this COVID stuff. We went pretty often. The service was great and their cocktails were very good. I got takeout recently so my daughter could try their food. She got the Mac and cheese burger and I did too it was very good. Very good bar very good food highly recommend

name: Lucky 13
content: Ashlee did a great job checking in on the table! I didn't know what to drink but she had great recommendations. 10/10 would recommend!

name: Lucky 13
content: This is a divey burger joint and if that's what you're looking for, this place won't disappoint. We got onion rings for an appetizer and I hate it when you bite into an onion ring and you can't bite through. You end up with entire onion sliding out of the ring and four inches of onion hanging out your mouth. My burger was good but this is an extremely greasy burger. I'm not talking juicy, I'm talking white pool of grease at the bottom of the basket. Fries were excellent. Service was fine but they disappeared around the corner at inopportune times. If you want a decent, greasy burger, this place as good as any. Flat face

name: Lucky 13
content: Okay... so I'm glad that Lucky13 is still operational during Covid, but for a place that I've heard about for years (supposed legendary status burgers), this place fell really flat for me for the most basic reason - meh food.  The burger wasn't good, the fry sauce was god awful, and the only lighter colored beer they had was bud light???  For a burger and beer joint (and a highly recommended one at that), seriously WTF!!

name: Lucky 13
content: Lucky 13 was recommended to us by a friend while passing through Salt Lake City. My boyfriend and I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap and a cheeseburger. Everything was excellent! April our waitress was amazing as well as the other friendly staff. Thankful they were still open due to COVID-19. Thanks Lucky 13 we'll be back!!

name: Lucky 13
content: I am predominantly a vegetarian, until I go to this place.  Without a doubt the most amazing burger I've had anywhere.  The staff is always awesome and the food comes out fresh and hot.  Great selection of beer as well.  Kudos to them!

name: Lucky 13
content: Burgers were just as expected, delicious! The upgrade to rosemary/garlic fries are a necessity and live up to the hype as well! Make sure you bring your ID because I saw a few people have to leave without having it.

name: Lucky 13
content: One of my favorite restaurants. A recommended spot to visit for anyone visiting or new to the area. I have yet to try a burger I did not enjoy (don't knock peanut butter on it until you try it!). One of the few restaurants that actually carries Franziskaner (really amazing hefeweizen) as well. Staff is always amazing and friendly from the door guys to the wait and bar staff. Always friendly even when it is crazy packed.

name: Lucky 13
content: My brothers LOVE burgers. They're the type of guys who will order a burger at a Mexican restaurant. They're not picky, they're just devoted. So when my younger brother came to town, I knew I had to take him to get a quality burger. Lucky 13 was obviously at the top of my list! Our group ordered the Pig Pen, Celestial, Cheeseburger (black bean substitute) and the Chicken Fingers. The food came out steaming hot and ready to be devoured. My brother took one bite and said, "Now THAT is a good burger!!" Needless to say, our plates were all cleared by the end of the meal. I confess, I'm not a big red meat eater, so I can't speak to the flavors or textures of the burgers, but they're chicken fingers were pretty damn good. Great breading-to-chicken ratio. Zero grease from the fryer. And plenty of dipping sauce options! They're cocktails always taste delicious (great alcohol to mixers combinations) and they have an extensive beer selection for the beer connoisseurs. Lucky 13 has something for everyone! COVID INFO: Reservations are encouraged (no groups larger than 6 allowed), masks are required, and you have the option to sit inside or outside.

name: Lucky 13
content: Great atmosphere and food. They are taking all the precautions for Covid-19 to include closing the restaurant for 30 minutes to sanitize. Service was quick and attentive.

name: Lucky 13
content: I dream of the burgers from Lucky 13. Each time that we find ourselves craving an amazing burger, we end up at this fine establishment. The parking is questionable, but totally worth it. The patio is decent and it is close to the Bees stadium.

name: Lucky 13
content: First time here great food and the service was excellent our server Jaymes and one of the other serverJanice were awesome great sense of humor. I highly recommend this place.

name: Lucky 13
content: My husbands favorite! We go there when we come into SLC. They have great vegan burger option. We loved them before we became herbivores too. Fun atmosphere, good food, friendly staff!

name: Lucky 13
content: The food is good and I and my wife love that place but after what I saw tonight at this place I don't believe I'll back, it's unprofessional how the manager talk to her workers at front of the customers , or maybe it was an indirect to me because I'm brown ???  I and my wife love to go to try so many different restaurants and never ever I have feel like this in my all life !! And one more thing, they delete the bad reviews, that is why they have more than 4 stars

name: Lucky 13
content: Best burger ever. Ever?  Well definitely in Salt Lake City and top ranking across the country. My fav is the Bacon Stinky burger. It never disappoints.

name: Lucky 13
content: A friend and I came in from out of town, and were recommended to try this place. Upon entry, we were greeted by the host (blonde gentleman) very rudely and asked to leave because we didn't have masks on. He asked us, "did you not read all the signs coming up to the door?" In a rude tone, so we apologized and went to grab our masks. When we returned he was rude in explaining to us that we wouldn't be able to sit outside, and as he was doing that, he got into another argument with another patron because he thought that he had shared a mask with someone to get in. As the argument started to heat up, my friend and I decided to leave because we didn't feel comfortable with the amount of conflict and hostility this host/server was exerting toward customers. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone just based on service. Their food may be great.

name: Lucky 13
content: If you love burgers, giant Bloody Mary's n Craft beer, then this is the place for you! If you can find a parking spot.  Cheers

name: Lucky 13
content: Went last night (Saturday) and the line seemed crazy, but due to COVID/social distancing rules it makes sense. Although we were maybe 20 people back, we only maybe waited for 30 minutes. I had the pastrami burger and it was really good. The bread/bun was great, and omg the fries were delish. Suuuupppeeerrrrr garlicky. Not a place I'd recommend to eat something healthy, but if you want to indulge and have a good burger and beer, this is definitely the spot.

name: Lucky 13
content: We ordered takeout because of the Covid-19 situation but then we got delayed in traffic. Needless to say we were almost 45 minutes late to pick up or food. We called and let them know what was happening and when we got there super late, the General manager came out to our car and told us that he was sorry that we got stuck and rather than give us cold food, he decided to scrap our food and put in a new order for us so that it would still be hot when we arrived. Needless to say we were beyond impressed.  We will definitely be back. The food was amazing and the burgers were perfectly cooked and juicy. They went way above and beyond what we expected and earned customers for life. Thank you!!!

name: Lucky 13
content: I've never had a bad experience coming here. Every burger is great! There is ample parking just to the East which I think gets missed. Anytime I have a visitor from out of state this is a must to show SLC's  top restaurants.

name: Lucky 13
content: I had the best chicken wrap and onion rings at this bar. The server was super friendly and helpful! I was also very impressed by the cleanliness of the restaurant as well as their bathrooms. I can't wait to go back again.

name: Lucky 13
content: We tried lucky 13 again after having a bad experience a few weeks ago.A group of 5 Friday night,June 5th,730 pm.Food was as bad as it was three weeks earlier. Fries were soggy,hamburgers were average.I have watched the quality of this bar tank over the last 3 years.I have also found they don't like bad reviews.My last one was removed.I use yelp alot,eat out alot,cook alot of food myself.I use yelp because going out is expensive and its nice to have the reviews. Good and bad ,deal with it.It a burger and fries,not the hard to master.I normally give a place a few tries after a bad experience but lucy 13 has let it slide.

name: Lucky 13
content: Lucky 13 gets my vote for best burgers in SLC.  Service is hit or miss and you often have to wait for a table because they are so busy, but it's worth it.  Takeout is also always an option if you don't want to wait for a table.  My go-to is the bacon stinky cheese burger (bacon and blue cheese) with rosemary garlic fries.  I just can't talk to anyone for a few hours after, but man are the fries garlicky and delicious!  The bacon is always thick and delicious and is smoked in-house daily.

name: Lucky 13
content: Their burgers have gotten chewy and gone downhill over the years, but my newly legal kid wanted to try one. Walked up and he was told he needed a mask which he had on him. Noticed the sign saying "all patrons must wear a mask" but noticed few were. Pointed that out and the posted policy only to get no clarification and an invitation to leave if we didn't like it. Asked the manager to come out and clarify, but then she decided to go low and tell us we could leave too. Okay... Nothing like voting with your wallet. Kid didn't want to stay by then and I was relieved I didn't have to eat another overpriced grisly burger there. So many other places nearby getting food and service right. Skip this place.

name: Lucky 13
content: Hands down, best burger in town! Their garlic fries are the best! Yes, you should try the Peanut Butter Burger. Also, if you aren't in the mood for a burger, their grilled cheese is delicious! It can get busy and you may have to wait, but totally worth the wait. Also, thank you Lucky 13 for keeping your patrons safe during these crazy times.

name: Lucky 13
content: We ordered the vegetarian ole man and the fungus among us burgers. Both were so delicious. As if the meal couldn't get better, we also ordered a side of Rosemary fries. So. Good. I don't think I'll ever be ordering regular fries again!

name: Lucky 13
content: It wasn't bad, ordered a burger with no bacon but ended up having bacon. I don't eat pork so that sucked. Have the sandwich to someone else. The fried pickles super yummy and the fries on point as well. So that's the only reason giving three. I will of course give them another go.  See if it was just an off night.

name: Lucky 13
content: Love Lucky 13. Some of the best burgers around. They are crowded and a little on the slow side but worth it. I love their garlic rosemary fries. Blue cheese on a burger is always welcome. We feel blessed they have opened another location to give us more opportunities to go.

name: Tradition
content: My family & I ate upHere visiting from St George & this place was phenomenal! We tried everything on the plate menu & the Brussels sprouts & fried green tomatoes are some of the beet we've had anywhere! Service was great & cocktails were on point! Bravo! Thank you for an amazing brunch!

name: Tradition
content: They were perfect for the birthday party we were looking for they know exactly what to do everybody had a wonderful time the cooks were perfect the bartender was perfect the service was excellent I recommend it for anyone for any occasion

name: Tradition
content: My scoring system: Service, Quality, Price, Ambience, Je ne sais quoi Nice environment with an open and very active kitchen. A lot of energy both indoors and on the patio. Our server was kind, knowledgeable and attentive all night. Our kid was a little bit of a handful and she was very patient. Our pigs n blanket came out a little late and they comped us a s'mores pie dessert. I think she was one of two servers on a Saturday night so I've fully reserved judgement and say they deserve a full star. The food was decent but wouldn't bring me back to Tradition. We ordered fairly basic appetizers. Worth a half star. Brussels sprouts were over cooked and funeral potatoes were overthought (keep em simple). The pigs n blanket were actually the best dish we had. They held together well, the sausage was juicy and doughy croissant bun was a bit dry but buttered exceptionally well. The pie was comped and I hate to judge, but it was too tough and solid to eat after the first 4 bites.Price was decent. I imagine they could charge more given the location, design and brunch-ability. Exceptionally well priced and varied wine menu. Full star.

name: Tradition
content: Amazing food and drinks. We tried the funeral potatoes, fried green tomatoes and Mac and cheese. All were delicious but the funeral potatoes were legendary. Entrees were perfect, service amazing, it's easily a new favorite spot for us!

name: Tradition
content: I'm so happy we decided to try somewhere new, Tradition was easily one the best places I've eaten at in SLC for a while. I got the pigs in a blanket and the dumplings. Both were amazing and next time I'll get my own pigs in a blanket so I don't have to share! Will definitely be going back soon.

name: Tradition
content: So glad we stumbled upon this place. Food and drinks were great and it was a nice clean open atmosphere. Looking forward to Covid restrictions being over and seen this place full of life, it looks like a fun place to hang out.

name: Tradition
content: Always amazing service with the food to DIE for. I have gone here so many times!The drinks are also excellent.Highly recommend!

name: Tradition
content: Funeral potatoes are bomb. Also, liked the fried green tomatoes. The breakfast sandwich didn't really seem like breakfast but it was delicious! Love this place.

name: Tradition
content: We had no wait time as we chose this place as a last minute option. We were sat in the bar area which is only 21+. It was quiet and private which I really enjoyed. You also get a view of the streets and as it was snowing this day I really enjoyed the white view! After reviewing the menu I was scared that the portions would be small and I would have to order more than I'd like but I gave it a shot and only ordered one plate which was the Traditional Breakfast. It was so good and filling. Only the potatoes were a bit too crispy and salty. My partner ordered the gravy and biscuits and it was AMAZING. My pancakes were so fluffy and good. I'd come back again.

name: Tradition
content: THE BRUSSELS SPROUTS  I get brussels sprouts at a lot of restaurants and these are by far the best I have ever had. And the best part was, the rest of the food was amazing too! We got the short rib with mashed potatoes and the chicken dumplings. Everything was great. Also got two great, unique cocktails. Inside was nice enough to feel slightly upscale but still cozy and comfortable. We came by after a long day out in duck boots and winter clothes and didn't feel out of place. :)

name: Tradition
content: Never did I know it was possible to love meatloaf SO MUCH. Holy good god 3x weekly minimum. French fries, red beans and rice, grits are regulars. The tofu sandwich makes me wish I were vegan. fried green tomatoes are way better than those in the south. never had anything on the menu that I did not love. Bravo! (Also plenty of covid friendly options)

name: Tradition
content: First time we have been here in the evening.  A very cozy place with a great atmosphere.  It did feel a little odd because we were the only ones in the establishment (Thank you 2020)  The staff was great as it seems like they are wearing many hats these days.  With all that said the food is also great ,  we ordered the funeral potatoes, if you don't live in Utah this may  not make any sense but they put their own twist with putting a savory jam on top as well which was very delightful.  I also got the burger which was very good as well.  They have a decent selection of local beers as well.FYI in the summertime they have a top 3 patio!!!

name: Tradition
content: This place is soooo delicious!! I've never had anything that I didn't like here. The menu is limited BUT the quality of every dish is amazing and the drinks are great. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is laid back. I will continue to eat here again, again and again.

name: Tradition
content: How to describe Tradition: Nee Wave Southern. What does that mean though? They take good classic southern favorites and add new flavors and ingredients to them. Take the chicken sandwich I ordered, it wasn't just a plain fried chicken sandwich it was infused with Thai seasoning and spices. Tradition is trying and succeeding with marrying classic southern dishes with flavors around the world. Overall: take your date here, take your family from out of town. Orders some cocktails and get the Brussel sprouts and finish off the night with pie. You'll be happy.

name: Tradition
content: One of my favorites! Sad to see the breakfast bowl go... but am hopeful after the pandemic will be back. I don't want to cause too much of a fuss over the cauliflower grits... but they're literally the most delicious feel good willing to gain ten pounds ordering multiple orders of. I couldn't say a bad thing about this place if I tried. The owner is an absolute doll and works his bum off to satisfy customers and Taylor also is probably one of the best servers we have ever had. If I could have the breakfast bowl, the grits, the fried tomatoes and a pineapple mimosa everyday I would.

name: Tradition
content: Ordered for takeout. Was delicious. I got the short rib which fell off the bone and had the sides grits and Brussels sprouts. Wish I tried the Mac and cheese but got the collard Ed greens which had the perfect amount of spice.
