The get together got the arugula salad (yes!) and all the appetizers including pig in a blanket and fried tomatoes. I would highly recommend all of the appetizers. Would order again. I also have been here in person where the service and cocktails are on point. Thank you for being such a great restaurant.Located right by liberty park.

name: Tradition
content: This small and cozy play has become our favorite go-to place for good food and a setting that invites good conversation.

name: Tradition
content: Great (but small) outdoor patio and ambience is nice and relaxed. Ordered a mimosa and it wasn't the best. Food was decent.

name: Tradition
content: I've been coming here since I moved to the neighborhood.  Good service. Nice outdoor seating. Great food.  Everything I've had here's been great.  The Bloody Mary's are pretty tiny, but at least they're cheap. I haven't had a remotely mediocre meal there yet. Everything's been great.

name: Tradition
content: Great location for great food. I have gone here multiple times and have enjoyed everyone of them. Food is comforting and homey. Good drink selection as well

name: Tradition
content: Atmosphere- nice inside, open kitchen so you can see them cook. Pretty Spartan with wood top tables. Nice outdoor patio with a cool cat- meatloaf that hangs around. Worth going just to see the cat!Food- we tried a lot of appetizers and 2 entrees. Everything was yummyFuneral potatoes ($9) never had before, was told had to fry them while we were in UT, so we ordered and we were so happy we did. Baked in a pot and so cheesy and yummy. We loved themFried green tomatoes ($12) thick slices of green tomato breaded and fried, served with a spicy chipotle aioli and a cilantro pesto. Was out of this world good. Pigs in a blanket ($9) you get large pieces, a nice sausage wrapped in a light flaky pastry and served with a nice mustard. Trout ($17) was a nice large filet of trout, not sure what kind it was, had a pink hue and was really tasty. Meatloaf ($18) was yummy. I love meatloaf and wasn't disappointed. It had a nice brown gravy with it. Drinks Hot girl summer ($11) vodka drink, seasonal and very tastyBirds & bees ($11) tequila and aperol and it was also very goodService was good. Answered all our questions and offered suggestions. Was not very busy so we never waited for anything. Great all around experience

name: Tradition
content: This wad my third time to Tradition and it continues to impress me. I've only had brunch here, Fri - Sun, but I'm sure it's good other times as well. Food- To begin we got the Brussels Sprouts and they were so lovely. Very unique and really well done. Some of my favorite in the city. The seasonal hash here is my favorite. They add wonderful touches to the hash that make it a must try. Next time I'm trying the funeral potatoes, everyone said they were amazing. Service - The Service is always on point and the waitress that I've gotten every time is super fun to chat with. Vibe - The indoor vibe is well done and inviting as well as relaxing. The outdoor seating is fun as well. Give this place a shot. You won't regret it.

name: Tradition
content: Amazing, I'm almost afraid to say how good it was and then never be able to get a table again.  My brother went here and loved it so much he took me back within the week and now we are taking our other brother and family there within a week of my brother first trying it.  Everything we had was delicious.  I felt bad when we ordered dessert and I told them I had low expectations, only because how could they be good at everything, they were.  From apps to drinks to main to dessert, it was all good.  Arugula salad, bomb, pigs in a blanket, great, meatloaf, better than your grandma, short ribs, I'll be back, sides as good or better than mains, and the pie....oh the sweet potato pie was better than any other sweet potato or pumpkin pie I've had.  Just go and try and love!!

name: Tradition
content: We ate on the patio and felt very safe, the food was amazing, we walked around Liberty Park after, was lovely. Upscale comfort food.

name: Tradition
content: The fried chicken, cheesy grits and Brussels sprouts were amazing! I had a taste of my husbands mac n cheese and red beans and rice, really liked the mac n cheese. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. Ended the meal with a slice of sweet potato pie and a slice of peach pie. Both were very good though I would highly recommended the peach pie. The only reason I do not give them 5 stars is I would prefer that the leg and thigh of the fried chicken be separate pieces instead of all one piece.

name: Tradition
content: Highlights: Great outdoor seating with views of Liberty ParkFood: Excellent menu loaded with healthy and comfort food options.Ambiance: They've done a great job designing an experience that feels casual but upscale.Experience: Excellent service, brunch on Sunday was tasty, and pineapple mimosa was a winner.

name: Tradition
content: I had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes, and collard greens. The meal tasted good and the portions felt just right. I was hoping for gravy with the potatoes based on other Yelpers photos, but they recently changed the menu. IMO the gravy would help keep the plate from being too dry. Seating and atmosphere is very nice. The staff was masked and the seating was properly spaced during COVID. Overall, I would return to try other dishes. I was happy with the experience, but had slightly higher expectations.

name: Tradition
content: The food was really amazing! I got the seasonal vegetable hash and loved every bite 10/10 recommend. Get it, it's amazing! The person I was with got the corned beef hash and also raves about it. I have a pretty serious love for bloody Mary's with brunch and this one was lack luster. Not sure if the amount of horseradish was intentional but WOW it was excessive and overpowered every other flavor you could possibly try to pick out. With that being said they had an extensive cocktail and beer selection that looked amazing and I would recommend giving one of those a try. Super cute ambiance and great location.

name: Tradition
content: If you live or visit SLC, this is a "must eat at" place!  The food, service, and cocktails were all the best. We were there for Saturday brunch, but I hear dinner is AMAZING!  You won't be disappointed!

name: Tradition
content: Loved the grits, loved the funeral potatoes.  Fried green tomatoes were pretty good.  I got short ribs and the whole entire piece of meat was fat unfortunately. Not a huge fan.  Brussel sprouts were really good. Macaroni was cold and quite bad.  I feel a bit sick this morning.  Mashed potatoes - Loved.  My husband was happy with his food. He got chicken, beans and rice, and grits.  Friend said chicken and dumplings were good.  Overall it was a decent meal, but I wouldn't order the short ribs or macaroni again.

name: Tradition
content: I stopped by with my coworkers and had quite the brunch. The staff was amazing even after we scrabbled around outside in the sun and settled for a table inside. Sorry guys! However, all that seem to go away when we ordered and ate the delicious foods. I had the funeral potatoes and it's worth all it's hype. A must have dish to share or eat by yourself because, why not? The texture was   creamy with chunky soft bits  and the sweet and savory bacon jam just the icing on top. A must have when I go visit SLC again.

name: Tradition
content: Delicious spicy cocktails, Brussels sprouts were on point, best dang crust I've had on a pie with a delicious spicy cherry filling. All around a very delicious brunch. I highly recommend this place for your Sunday brunch.

name: Tradition
content: So I went into this restaurant knowing nothing about it. Holy S**t it was bomb! Everything was phenomenal. Drinks, entrees, sides. Everything had so much flavor. Eat here, you'll definitely be satisfied. Oh yeah I was here for dinner.

name: Tradition
content: Really enjoyed eating here with a small group. Wonderful outdoor seating area and cool ambiance/neighborhood in slc. Food was amazing, waiter was attentive. Pigs in a blanket app was great. I got the trout with Brussels sprouts and fries - would highly recommend!! Draft beer was also . Would come back.

name: Tradition
content: My first time at traditions, I had heard very good things about it. I was disappointed. I didn't understand why the water had no ice in it on a 90 degree weather day and then the Mimosas that were ordered had no ice either and were served in a short round glass - it was disappointing to say the least, it was not refreshing at all - I didn't order a second drink, there was no point. We ordered the Corned Beef with potatoes and funeral potatoes, both dishes had great flavor. The small cup of Funeral Potatoes were served in a small dish/cup and certainly not enough for two people to share. The Corned Beef and potato's were good, but again not enough for two people to share and there were more potato's in the dish than Corned Beef. No deserts were offered. So aside from small portions and no ice- it was ok.

name: Tradition
content: One of my favorite new places to eat after taking a few laps around Liberty Park.  Love sitting on the patio.  Fast, friendly service and excellent food.  The pigs in a blanket, roasted brussel sprouts, and the mac and cheese are must tries.  So are the short ribs.  Can't wait to may my way through the entire menu.    The homemade pastry dough is so good!  Try the apple pie which is quite surprising as it packs a little heat.

name: Tradition
content: This is my wife and I's go-to date night place. Simple menu with sophisticated entrees and sides.

name: Tradition
content: We ordered curbside takeout recently and the whole process could not have been more seamless. Plus the quality of our food was just as good as takeout. We ordered the burger, corned beef sandwich, Brussels sprouts and fried green tomatoes  If you're stuck at home and craving some stick to your ribs comfort food, Tradition's got you covered!

name: Tradition
content: Unfortunately we were visiting from out of town when all the "virus shutdown/restrictions" happened. Luckily we were here on the last night before they all started and they let us eat in the dining room, and there was a large group of us. The food was wonderful! The staff really friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us. We appreciated them so much and truly loved the food. The brussel sprouts! everything everyone had was great short ribs, fried chicken, mashed potatoes, fries (which are more like wedges!),...I really hope this gem makes it through this rough time even stronger! If you live nearby or are passing through definitely give them a try the food speaks for itself. And if we are ever back that way we will definitely be back!

name: Tradition
content: We had an amazing experience at Tradition.  The hostess was very helpful to accommodate our group.  The ambience is somewhat communal, but cozy with charming details. We loved the food and shared most dishes. My favorite appetizer was the fried green tomatoes, which was a surprise to me. Dessert is a must, so amazing, but you might need to order it with dinner so they don't run out of your favorite choice.  I will be back soon!

name: Tradition
content: Waited years to try this gem. Everything from the drink selection, apps, entrees, service, and ambiance was perfect. I recommend the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer. The short rib melts in your mouth-one of the best I've had. Fried chicken sandwich is deliciously crispy, and has quite the kick to it (if you hate spicy ask for sauce on side, it made my nose run and eyes water). Must come back to try the pie.Perhaps make a reservation- was quite busy on a Thursday night.

name: Tradition
content: Been here a couple time only for drinks and appetizers. The funeral potatoes are absolutely amazing! Along with the pig in a blanket. Tried the gnocchi and it was a little dry and tasted a lot like thanksgiving stuffing.

name: Tradition
content: We came here for breakfast and loved it.  Came back and tried dinner and it was even more amazing. The Parking for this place is the only thing I dont like. We had the same waiter both visits and he was great. Very attentive and kind. We will be back for sure

name: Tradition
content: I absolutely want to give this place another try for dinner. Brunch was meh.   I went on a Sunday for brunch with a party of 6 so take this review with a grain of salt. I guess I was expecting more of the food since we waited for an hour to be seated. I tried the chicken and pancakes. Pancakes were delicious but very small in size. Chicken was again, ok. I also tried their funeral potatoes and cauliflower korma. The funeral potatoes are something I've heard a lot about since moving to Utah. The funeral potatoes  are a major reason this place didn't get five stars. It's casserole. CASSEROLE. Nope. Not for me. I don't want it. $10 for a tiny ramekin of CASSEROLE. GTFOH. I also had an old fashioned style drink which was delicious. Still mad about the casserole though LOL. At least I can say I immersed myself into Utah food culture. Not for me.

name: Tradition
content: One of my very favorite restaurants in SLC. Everything I've eaten here from appetizers to drinks to dinner have been good. The fried chicken is especially exceptional, it's huge and has a bit of sweetness too it. If you're looking for a bit healthier of the meal, the trout is also very good. Service has always been great and usually there's not a huge line to get in. Overall, it gets 5 stars from me

name: Tradition
content: I've been to Tradition two times now. Over the course of 2-3 months. Each time it has been a great experience. Delicious cocktails and some of the best food I've ever eaten. I recommend the Fried Brussel Sprouts, Meatloaf (absolutely divine), and the Short Rib. The biggest positive at Tradition is the speed in which the food is a served. Appetizers were served within 5-7 minutes of ordering, and entrees within another 10-15 minutes. The staff is very pleasant and knowledgeable. Tradition is my new favorite restaurant!

name: Tradition
content: I went to this neighborhood spot with my boyfriend and his parents. The ambiance was a little noisy for their taste but I happened to enjoy it very much since it had the busy feel of a big-city eatery. Our server was incredibly sweet and gave us a couple of solid food recommendations. We wound up starting with an order of the Fried Green Tomatoes which were delicious, but a little too spicy for everyone else's taste. Followed by the Funeral Potatoes which were legit perfection. Lastly, we tried the Pigs In A Blanket which was--and I can't believe I'm saying this--our favorite thing on the menu. I know...that sounds crazy, right? After devouring our appetizers, we ordered a few items to share: the Chicken & Dumplings, the Short Rib, and the Gnocchi. All of the dishes were really flavorful but, at the end of the day, left us wishing we put in another order of the Pigs In A Blanket. Overall, this place is a must-try and we'll definitely be back to try some of the items we missed.

name: Tradition
content: Came here for their brunch menu and I was very pleased! Get the orange roll, comes with two big rolls and they are absolutely sweet and delicious and the fresh zest is such a great addition. I also got the chicken and pancakes which were very tasty. The pancake was not too sweet and the chicken was cooked well! We also go the funeral potatoes which are very tasty and a great spin on the classic hash brown because this one comes with cheese, corn flakes and a bacon jam. Service was a little show considering there weren't many ppl in the place at the time. But overall I was very happy and will definitely be back!

name: Tradition
content: The appetizers were AMAZING. It was a cute atmosphere and the hostess was really sweet. The burger was okay, good meat but the bun was really dry. Our waitress was good at first and then didn't put any effort into our table after we got drinks. I'm assuming she figured since we were younger we weren't going to tip well, which is really unfortunate. I would go back but order a different entree for sure!

name: Tradition
content: We had a cozy dinner Saturday night at the so very beautiful Tradition in Salt Lake. I can't say enough good things about the kind and attentive service we received from everyone we came in contact with. The food was incredible!  I had the Guajillo Chicken, which is a roasted chicken breast with guajillo glaze, elotes (YUM!!!) and black bean hummus. My husband had the Risotto, which they made with beet purée, carrots, lemon, garlic, and whipped goat cheese. Can you believe how beautiful it is?? We also got some small plates. Their take on Funeral Potatoes (that is bacon jam on top, and bacon jam is so my jam!!!) and Acorn Squash, which was topped with farro, kale, fennel, honey and a cashew tahini dressing. I loved all the attention to detail in each dish, every one was so delicious and visually appealing. I can't wait to go back and try more things!

name: Tradition
content: we had the fried green tomatoes, the brussel sprouts and the short rib. The service was nice, decor was nice, but the food was just ok. Probably would not go back.

name: Tradition
content: Tradition stands out and I'm not entirely sure I can describe why. There's something different and it's good. I've always loved places where I have to park and walk. Maybe I'm just not paying attention and there's actually closer parking but I've always parked on the street about a block away. It's located next to a nice park and beautiful neighborhoods. So the walk is definitely rewarding. It's Salt Lake City but it's in the suburbs. Maybe that's why they chose this location, because it feels somewhat like you're maybe going home as you walk the neighborhood area to the restaurant. The food is great. It's different in that I can't recall much similarity in the region. Interesting enough dishes that I have difficulty choosing what I had last time and I haven't regretted this method yet.Only been here in the evenings. Nice, trendy but relaxed. Brought a few out-of-towners here, old friends and they've enjoyed it. I quite like the place.

name: Tradition
content: I've been to Tradition at least 4 times now, but after last nights dinner I had to come on and give them a 5 star review. This was one of the best meals I have had in a Salt Lake City sit down restaurant all year! Amazing food, quality ingredients, and fair prices. The hostess, Taylor, was very friendly and got us a table so quickly. Our server was great too. We started with the broccolini which is our absolute favorite and we order every time. The house-made hummus that it is served with is to die for. Then we shared the short rib, which was served with mashed potatoes and a killer mushroom gravy, and the trout served on a bed of basmati rice and red beans! Both were so good that my mouth is watering just thinking about it now. The short rib was cooked to literal perfection and was so soft that it did not even require the use of a knife and melted in your mouth! The crispy skin on the trout put it over the edge. To finish off, we had a slice of Cherry pie and ice cream. The ice cream was just vanilla but it was SO amazing we had to ask where it was from and turns out that that is house-made too!!I can't give Tradition high enough ratings. And all of that food was just about $65. Sidenote- their breakfast is pretty great too! Thank you Tradition for your quality and unique dishes, and the PERFECT date night. We will be back and then back again.

name: Tradition
content: On a very busy Sunday, they were able to squeeze me into their lovely bar area, and prepared my meal quickly.  Great food, great place

name: Tradition
content: Great restaurant with a cozy, classic atmosphere. Stopped here before going to the football game. I had the short rib with mashed potatoes and vegetables along with the red wine blend available. Service was friendly, food came out quickly and everything was delicious. Everything is served in appropriate serving sizes, unlike most American restaurants. Also placed across the street from the park where you can take a walk after. Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting salt lake.

name: Tradition
content: They had a great variety of food to pick from, i ordered the beet salad and it was very delicious. The time it took to get my food was fairly long, but it was a Friday night. I'd definitely come back to try more.

name: Tradition
content: The cold weather came and suddenly I needed warm, comfortable food. I needed a place with meatloaf and spare ribs and fried chicken on the menu and boom, right here on 900 South, is a place that fit that exact bill.We parked along the road and found our way in. There's a small bar off the main entry that holds all kinds of promise, but we didn't make our way in there. Instead we were seated in the main dining room which was light and bright and full of early evening sunset rays. There's a really lovely patio on the sunset side that faces west, and in warmer months you can surely sit and enjoy the food out there and take in the bustle of this growingly trendy neighborhood.We were seated and quickly settled on an order of funeral potatoes. My guest was visiting from out of town and I remember having told her about this Utah spectacle before, so when we saw it we had to have it. For entrees, I honestly could have ordered every dang thing on the menu. It all sounded so perfect for the mood I was in. What I ended on was meatloaf. Meatloaf with beans and sweet potatoes. We also ordered chicken and dumplings. The chicken and dumplings were the winner, with a salty kind of gravy over soft dumplings and tender shreds of chicken. But that meatloaf was hearty, too, and I gobbled it up. We also asked for some bread to sop up the chicken and dumplings gravy (before noticing that the dumplings were a bit more bready than imagined) and they made incredible, buttery, pan-toasted bread. Above and beyond, guys. And not to take away from the well-crafted entrees, but that bread was a super memorable part of the whole experience.This is the kind of place where you go with friends, you talk about the good ol' days. You talk about the big picture life questions, or the new line of trucks, or you just sit and enjoy being in the same room with good friends and good food.

name: Tradition
content: Went here for breakfast and we couldn't have picked a better place! The food what absolutely amazing! If you are looking for a new place to eat, we highly recommend eating here! Want to go back for dinner soon!

name: Tradition
content: Had a really yummy pre-football game dinner here. We got the fried green tomatoes, funeral potatoes, and pigs in a blanket small plates. We loved all of these! They were all super good, all of the flavors were unique and yummy. We then had the short rib which was good and tender but not quite as ~special~ as the small plates. Overall a great meal, look forward to coming in to try brunch soon!

name: Tradition
content: So sad I've waited this long to check out this spot. Get the chicken and dumplings. Honestly, WHAT goes into the sauce? It's like heaven. Also had an amazing gin cocktail. A+ all around.

name: Tradition
content: I've had brunch/lunch here a few times and really liked it, but I had no idea how bad I was missing out not coming to Tradition for dinner. Absolutely fantastic food, on the level of Pallet and Provisions for me but at significantly less cost. Value is absolutely massive. We had the melon salad, brussel sprouts, and pigs in a blanket for starters and they were all great, the sprouts were just incredible. I had a pork shank special that was delicious, and the wife had a steak salad. Dessert was a pie made in-house that was also great. Service was excellent as well, no complaints whatsoever about the entire experience. Can't wait to go back.

name: Tradition
content: Great food. A little pricey but usually leaves me satisfied. I like the fried chicken for the grits. Very tasty. I will probably be back!

name: Tradition
content: I got the chicken and pancakes, I really enjoyed the pancakes but the chicken could've been cooked longer. I really liked the oats the chicken was bathed in though. Overall this was a nice spot for brunch in SLC

name: Tradition
content: I like Tradition, and I've eaten here quite a few times.  The fried green tomatoes, as well as the chedder grits are really good.  I've never had a bad meal here and the prices are reaosonable.  It can get a litle loud, but other than that not much to complain about.  Pretty great food!

name: Tradition
content: While traveling through Salt Lake City, my husband and I stopped in for a bite to eat. The location is perfect, easy to find and plenty of parking options around. The hostess, McCally, greeted us as soon as we walked in. She was so sweet and even offered a few local places to check out while we were in town. Our server, Brit, wasn't as friendly as the other staff. Maybe it was an off day or we caught her at the end of her shift, I'm not sure. Service wasn't terrible but rather mediocre. Love the atmosphere. Very relaxed and inviting decor. We ordered a chicken sandwich and Ruben sandwich. Both were very good. I liked the chicken sandwich wasn't your typical chicken sandwich. It had a little kick to it and tons of flavor. Everything about the Ruben was delicious. You can taste quality ingredients are being used. Overall, I'd say this place is pretty good and they have a unique menu selection.

name: Tradition
content: This was not a very good meal. We had the brocollini and Brussels sprouts to start. The brocollini was actually very good, but the Brussels sprouts were charred to a crisp. They only tasted like char. I had the trout as an entree, it was ok. The chèvre wasn't very good. The drink I had (Hot and Cold I want to say) was very perfumey. I'm sure some may like the food here, and it was probably just my personal taste, but I was not satisfied.

name: Tradition
content: Pleasantly surprised!  Good drinks, good service at the bar.  Shared several appetizers, all were delicious.  Will definitely return to try more.  Heard their brunch is awesome

name: Tradition
content: Went here for a friends birthday dinner. We had reservations and were seating right away. I will say the food and drinks were amazing but the service was HORRIBLE. The hostess offered to sit us in the bar area because it was quieter. We had to ask the bartender for drinks as our waiter was "busy" with his outside tables. We watched him visit that table no less than 5 times before checking on us. Our appetizers were delivered but they didn't take our main course order so we sat with empty plates in front of us before finally making a remark to the bartender and our waiter coming to take our order. Like I stated earlier the food was amazing but the service was just HORRIBLE.

name: Tradition
content: Best sourdough pancakes ever. A bit of a limited selection for brunch but there's enough to please mostly anyone

name: Tradition
content: The food was butt naked!! The fried chicken with the grits is slap ya mama good! And the chicken and dumplings had crazy flavor. Can't wait to come back for sure!

name: Tradition
content: I revisited this place a little over two years after my first experience because we live close by and decided to try it again. It was very newly opened the first time we first went and it seems they have worked out the kinks. The cocktails we had were both very good. Cinder and Smoke was brilliant to me but I'm sure it won't appeal to everyone. It tasted like a refreshing fruity BBQ, haha. Brussels Sprouts were great, grits were good again, garlic fries for an app were OK (mostly got them for our two year old) they are super thick potato wedges and I don't really like fries like that. The Trout was AWESOME. I give them huge props for serving it skin side up just daring you to eat the skin, which you absolutely should!!! Fish skin is probably a turn off to most people but give it a try because it is good. The rice and beans with it was   great too. MY OLD REVIEW from June 2017- I got the "braised pork shoulder" which it turns out wasn't a shoulder at all but some ribs......but the kicker is that is was bone DRY! I've eaten jerky with more tenderness than whatever I got served. I'm not sure how long you have to "braise" a fatty piece of meat like that to turn it into jerky but the one thing it does show is that they must have put  A LOT of time into it. Which brings me to the point of the  incredibly slow service. I had high hopes for this place but it under-delivered big time. $6 for a draft beer seems a bit absurd. We got the cauliflower and grits app and it was definitely the best part of the meal. My wife had the pigs on n a blanket which is impossible to screw up because they do use good sausage from next door at Beltex meats. Watercress salad was pretty solid too but nothing you can't get at any decent restaurant.

name: Tradition
content: I had seen the pictures of the fried chicken leg and mini pancakes when I was researching places to eat in SLC. I narrowed it down to Tradition and another brunch place known for its fried chicken. I chose Tradition because of the interesting idea of oatmeal breading and sourdough pancakes.Sad to say, the meal was not worth the Lyft ride over. The chicken was much smaller than the ones I had seen in Yelp while the pancakes were way bigger. One thing that appealed to me about this dish was seeing mini pancakes on the plates pictured on Yelp. Maybe I should not have relied on the dish being presented a certain way. If I had known what I was going to be served, I would not have ordered it. There is no way I can eat four full sized pancakes! Plus, they didn't taste any different from regular pancakes. The chicken was a bit dry and the breading was thick. Overall, it was not worth $14.The whole time I was eating inside, I had to swat flies around my food. Although, that is no fault of the restaurant, it made for a less than enjoyable dining experience. Iam sad to have wasted one of my meals here.

name: Tradition
content: The fried green tomatoes are absolutely out of this world along with the grits, funeral potatoes, cauliflower, and brussels sprouts for appetizers!! The chicken and dumplings, meatloaf (!!!), burger, and fried chicken sandwich are all so so so delicious! Will definitely be coming back. The cocktails (Fire and ice) are delicious and the atmosphere is great for date night or dinner with friends

name: Tradition
content: Pleasant surprise! This was our first time and we enjoyed it. After some coffee mishaps, I was finally able to get a drinkable cup. But then the food came and it was worth it! The pork bowl was so good! The saltiness of the pork went nicely with the eggs and grits. My husband had the chicken and pancakes. He loved the maple-oat crusted chicken. The chicken was moist and the pancakes were the perfect about of fluff.

name: Tradition
content: Wow! An absolutely amazing eatery. I came here with 2 friends for brunch on a Sunday. I ordered a mimosa, the cauliflower appetizer, and the orange roll. The cauliflower was absolutely amazing. I spent 5 days in SLC and this was the best thing I ate the whole trip. Such a unique combination of flavors and textures made the appetizer a win for me. The orange roll was super tasty and the candied oranges on top gave it an extra kick. My friends ordered the chicken and pancakes, and some kind of potato hash. Both raved about their meals as well!If I ever find myself back in SLC I will absolutely check back in for the lunch or dinner menu.

name: Tradition
content: Everything we tried was delicious (even if a bit on the salty side): pork breakfast bowl, hash, pigs in a blanket. Just super tasty with a relaxed atmosphere.

name: Tradition
content: My wife and I came here for our 1 year anniversary on vacation from Chicago. This place is amazing. STARTERFried green tomatoes... easily some of the best I have ever had.ENTREEI had the spare ribs... wowz highly recommend. I eat out almost daily and this has to be one of my favorite entrees of 2019 thus far.DRINKCinder & Smoke highly recommend if you are a mezcal / ginger loverOur server was also excellent and very attentive her name was Ceza

name: Tradition
content: One word: Bomb! I visited this yummy place with about 10 of my coworkers during a business trip. The hosting staff was very accommodating! The drinks are legit handcrafted and delicious! My food was even better! If you live in/are visiting SLC, please check out Tradition for an amazing experience!!

name: Tradition
content: I've been to Tradition many times and I'm never disappointed. Everything on their dinner menu is delicious. I especially like the fried chicken; it's so flavorful and spicy! The potatoes and grits are also really great starters. I recently tried brunch there on a Sunday morning and ordered the pork bowl. My one complaint is that they ran out of the fried chicken and pancakes :/. My meal was delicious and  had a ton of food. One of my favorite spots in SLC and will be back for brunch (:

name: Tradition
content: We went there for Saturday lunch though we got the brunch menu. That starts at 5pm.First course, pig in a blanket, a fancy way of saying sausage roll, with Beltex sausages. I love Beltex produce, I don't see how a flavorless savory wrapper is going to enhance the freshness of the pork, nor do I think the two side dipping sauces, while tasty in their own right, do anything either to really embellish the overall flavor. Just a Beltex sausage here is fine.My main course was the fried chicken sandwich, there was a bunch of interesting flavors going on. The experience was sloppy, which is not to my personal liking, but the peanut sauce and the slaw did absolutely make the dish something quite different to what I normally expect in a chicken sandwich. I would happily eat this again and furthermore the thick cut steak fries were well-cooked, well-seasoned and delectable. My dining partner ordered the cauliflower and that worked quite nicely with different sweet and savory flavors going on. There was no cheese on the menu for the salad, but it came with cheese, and there was the issue of a dairy allergy, and while our waitress responded very quickly to taking the dish back and bring a cheeseless version we did wonder how such a slip occurred in the first place.Some staff seemingly more friendly than others, the cocktail was fine, the service was a slightly strange mix of friendliness and pretentiousness.We left there with mostly good feelings and have heard rave reviews about the evening menu.

name: Tradition
content: I've been driving by this place since forever and wanting to stop in for a brunch. Today I went in and was so pleased. It's right by liberty park and has a great patio. I always thought it would be expensive from the looks of the place but it was fairly priced. The biscuits and gravy were wonderful and I got to try my friends chicken and pancakes- loved it. The sausage gravy was perfect and The chicken was moist and tender. Mimosas were also only $4 so... drink up ! There was no wait on a Sunday morning (the other place on the south side of the park would probably have at least a 40 minute wait that time of day). Well worth a visit!

name: Tradition
content: OMG! Best breakfast in SLC! A lot of flavors going on here. I highly suggest the grits (from the south and these are the real deal).

name: Tradition
content: Tradition is a beautiful restaurant that can be found right next to the park! So whether you are hanging out or riding your lime scooters, you can stop by and have an amazing brunch on the weekend! I would recommend getting the fried chicken and pancakes if you are looking for something more filling, but their brunch menu is awesome and worth checking out.

name: Tradition
content: Had a brunch experience here on a very busy Sunday recently. The inside space is so noisy it is impossible to carry on a conversation when the restaurant is full. We were kindly moved into the bar area. We started out with orange rolls which were ok,  not outstanding. We were, however, super glad we ordered those as it took forever for our entrées to appear and we were hungry. I ordered a hamburger medium rare that arrived on the rare side. The bun was completely soaked through with the red juices from the meat patty which made it impossible to pick up and devour. Personally I just find eating a hamburger with a knife and a fork not right. The accompanying fries are cut large and baked, I believe.  Mine were served warm not hot. My friends ordered a breakfast egg and bacon dish which reportedly was very good, as were biscuits and gravy consumed by my gentleman friend. The serving size was on the small side. Would probably come here again but would not order the burger. I think 3 stars is fair for a very noisy restaurant, pretty slow service, ok food that is not very cheap.

name: Tradition
content: What a great place! Looking for a last minute dinner on Monday night, and we found this gem on Yelp. The interior of it is uber-cool, with an open kitchen and really cool seating arrangements, open ceiling and a great atmosphere.We ordered the Funeral Potatoes (the bacon jam makes this a can't-miss dish) and Pigs in a Blanket for starters. Main dishes were the fried chicken sandwich and the chicken and dumplings which was to DIE FOR. The dumplings were the perfect size and flavor, the chicken was deliciously seasoned and tender, and the sauce that the dish was served in was amaaaaaazing. Had I had any additional room in my belly, I would have asked for some bread to sop up the remainder, but man, I was stuffed. Didn't even have room for some of the desserts on tap--next time! Service was great, atmosphere is comfortable and food is amazing. Go to there!

name: Tradition
content: First time coming in for dinner and it was delicious. The meatloaf was phenomenal. The drinks are always tasty. We are here almost every week for brunch because I crave the food. Service is always attentive and friendly. Just can't quit this place!

name: Tradition
content: I've been here for brunch and dinner, with both small and large groups and it's always been a really solid five stars. The food is excellent and the servers are helpful and considerate without hovering. It's a popular place so I usually have to wait a little bit but it's well worth it! Everyone who I take there has always been blown away by how yummy everything is

name: Tradition
content: Great new restaurant for us.  We had the small plates of roasted cauliflower and a bowl of collard greens.  The collard greens had a great sweet taste.  The meatloaf is special- flash seared in a pepper sauce.  Definitely coming back!

name: Tradition
content: Love this place! The atmosphere and service are great and welcoming. I've come a few times for special occasions and just got some snacks to munch on. The brussel sprouts are amazing! My friend ordered a Rueben sandwich which also looked great, and I've had the pigs in a blanket, collard greens, and French fries, all do which are very tasty! They are famous for their cocktails and have a good wine selection! Also don't skip dessert here: sometimes I come just for the pie and homemade icecream.

name: Tradition
content: Everything is on point here. Im a huge beer snob and this place has a super curated list of beers on tap and bottled that make me happy. It's a wonderful space that makes it feel like an upscale neighborhood establishment. We come in here all the time and the experience is always amazing.

name: Tradition
content: Tradition always exceeds my expectations! The staff always makes me feel at home, I never want to leave. I've tried A LOT of the meals here and you CANT go wrong. You can tell they truly care about everything that goes into each and every item. Not to mention the drinks are amazing!! If you're looking for a cozy place to cuddle up in the winter or a chill outdoor summer date on the patio, this is the perfect spot! I rave about tradition to all my friends and family and they always agree. Anyone that gives this restaurant less than five stars is a complete fool and don't listen to them!

name: Tradition
content: So good! We both got drinks, and I got the meatloaf, he got the steak salad. Both very very fresh and full of flavor. Total price was $70 with tip so pretty average for dinner downtown. I love how close this is to Liberty Park, because for a date night you can walk around after eating. Great service. We sat at the bar which was great because it was much quieter compared to the main dining area. We would definitively go again!

name: Tradition
content: We walked into this restaurant on a whim.  The ambiance looked nice, and the menu looked interesting albeit a little pricey.  The service here was prompt and amicable.  But the food?  Disappointing.  The chef seems to have a black pepper fixation.  It overpowered everything and made the food barely edible.  Really, there should be warnings on the menu.  Advice for the chef: lay off the black pepper.  Let your customers add their own (if they want any).

name: Tradition
content: My husband and I along with many friends have been to this place a bunch of times, and I'm finally writing a review after the dinner we had tonight. Hands down, this place is my favorite for brunch on the weekend. I usually get their traditional breakfast with no meat and ask for their veggies and their pancakes. Their pancakes are amazing!!! But tonight...we were invited to dinner with four other friends. I got their special which was lamb. It was AMAZING! Lamb can be tricky, but it was cooked perfectly. My husband got their chicken sandwich which I probably ate half of because it was delicious.A few people in other reviews have mentioned their prices and moody service, we have never experienced moody service and their prices are average. We have traveled many places throughout the country and the prices and mood are just right for the area.

name: Tradition
content: Love this place! Nice ambience and cannot wait until the patio is open for dining outdoors.  Very friendly waitstaff and speedy service.  We shared several small plates and some standouts for us were the roasted cauliflower and cheesy grits.  We shared an entree of gnocchi and were very full. Some nice cocktails on the menu too!  We will definitely be back the next time we're in SLC!

name: Tradition
content: Every time I try to to order something different on the brunch menu I fail miserably because the chicken and sourdough pancakes are excellent. Thickly coated in a maple oatmeal breading with maple syrup riding side-saddle--it's a brunch classic that can easily feed 2 people. This is only after opening with those scrumptious, hot orange sticky buns  topped with candied orange peel. They also serve mimosas and creative craft cocktails. Just in case you can't tell, I am highly recommending this place!

name: Tradition
content: I ate here with my family. We each ordered different dishes and shared. It was possibly my favorite meal in the entire city. My trout was tender and delicious. The chicken and dumplings had a bit of a spicy kick that pushed it past tasty into delectable. The fried chicken also had some spice. It wasn't overpowering and enhanced the experience. This is the type of place where I feel I need to go back again and again until I try everything on the menu.

name: Tradition
content: Food was delivered by a moody waitress and both my date and I looked at each other and cringed. We ordered the broccoli, it looked sad. The funeral potatoes were cold and also sad. And the chicken sandwich was nothing to write home about. It all looked and tasted very blah. Super disappointed and money down the drain. And it's not cheap! Look, I make money and I'm a foodie. I'm all about paying more $ for food and ambiance but this place has neither. Weirdly I heard good things about this place and unfortunately I won't return and won't recommend to anyone.

name: Tradition
content: Tradition might just be part of my traditional brunch rotation. It's a very nice place to go for brunch with all your friends and family. Literally, with everyone! When I first went there I discover that it would be faster to get seated if I would have called in to make a reservation. Someone was having a birthday party while a lot of people just walk in and said they have a reservation. Their menu does seem steady with the occasional special rotation. The place is a bit noisy, so speak up or drink up. Best part about this place is that right after brunch, you can go for a walk at liberty park if it is warm enough. Now onto the food. One of my favorite dish is their appetizer. Their cauliflower grits was amazing. The grits was super creamy and cheesy. Very rich and flavorful. The cauliflower has the perfect char to flavor ratio. It goes well with each other. Every bite complimenting each other. The fried chicken and pancakes! Omg! Who would have thought that rolling oats onto fried chicken would give it such a wonderful texture. The mini pancakes has a bit of a sour taste to it, perfect combo with the sweet syrup. This plate was sour, sweet and savory! My tastebuds was off the charts.The corn beef hash! Oh the corn beef hash. So much of everything. Potatoes was nice and soft. The meat was tender. The eggs cooked to perfection. With the oozy yolk pouring onto my dish, I'm just salivating thinking about it. Our server kind of ignored our seat. It's like this table never exited. Hence the one star away from a five star experience.

name: Tradition
content: I was alone so I took a seat at the bar. The bartender was very nice and attentive. He suggested items on the menu which were all great. I had the pork chops and a side of brussel sprouts. The pork chops were quite nice, but not the best I've had. The brussel sprouts, however, were the BOMB! And I'm not even a huge fan of brussels. The bartender also made fantastic drinks. I'm taking my boyfriend here next.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Nacho Daddy had the most AMAZING nachos!! My husband and I are obsessed!! Nayra is the best waitress and is soo kind! She had served us every time we've been here and she has always been so wonderful! Highly recommend this place!!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Buyer beware. We ordered take out last weekend and had never been or eaten there. Parking is nonexistent especially if you are trying to pick up your take out. The price all I can say is wow! We ordered 3 pork chimi's which came with nothing on them, not even sour cream or sauce. A shrimp and corn kids meal, 2 street tacos and plate of pork nachos for $105.00 with a small tip. For that price the food should have been a lot better but it's not. They put way too much meat on the nachos and it was really wet. If you want bland food this is the place for you. I had so much hope for this place but way over priced and will not be back.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Great margaritas and nachos! Had the Daddy's marg and the strawberry marg and they were amazing! Also had the buffalo hot nachos and they were delicious. Nayra was our waitress and she was very friendly, helpful and kept drinks on the table!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Nayra was great and made the whole experience amazing

name: Nacho Daddy
content: This meal was absolutely delicious and my bartender, Tristin, was insanely attentive and fun to be around. She also made a pineapple jalapeño margarita that would make a grown man cry of happiness. My new favorite drink I've ever had. I'll be back just to see Tristin!!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Tristan was the only bartender and was our server in the bar area. She did great at making all drinks for the restaurant yet still made us feel like a priority. The Golden Night nachos were delicious but could have used more mushrooms :)

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Honestly, the best customer service!! Thank you to Sasha for being such an amazing waitress! She catered to my entire party and everything we had requested. Definitely came through with the vegan options as welllll. We came here to enjoy drinks and food and received that exact same energy back, will definitely come back here again!!  not sure if my first post posted but posting again because its that amazing, thank you so much to Sasha and the Nacho Daddy staff!!!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Oh man alive I love nachos and then kick it up a notch with these over the top ones!! Delicious we tried 3 different kinds and then basic cheese enchiladas that were so good! We will for sure go back just to try more. I felt like it was kind of expensive for nachos but they were good. So willing to pay the price.  The nachos were awesome

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Nacho daddy is the place to be, especially during a pandemic. Lots of food for your money. The spicy shrimp nachos were the perfect blend of spicy and savory with the piping hot house salsa and creamy white queso. Unfortunately we devoured our food and forgot to take pictures (the aroma was too enticing). Service was quick and super friendly with great recommendations. Shout out to Sasha and the scorpion team!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Every employee was very nice. The food was delicious (I got the hamburger nachos and the strawberry marg) and so are there margaritas

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Great atmosphere. Our waitress Tristin was super friendly and made my husband a fantastic take on a mule, and used tequila, ginger beer, lemon, lime, mint and a hint of jalapeño. Food is flavorful and I recommend the Mexican corn appetizer and churro sundae.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Lived in Salt Lake City for a year now. I finally found the Mexican restaurant I will always think of when I think Mexican food. Christopher is also the best bartender I've ever had, such a great start to the weekend.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Nayra was our server and she made my birthday celebration a lot better than I even expected!! Give her a raise. Employees like her are an asset.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Tuesday night 9:30 I've called three times and no answer. I drive down and the doors are locked. There are patrons inside the restaurant dining but all the doors are locked. I call again from my car and it rings until a voicemail picks up.. A fourth time. I guess they don't want my business. Business hours are listed open until 10:30. They lost themselves roughly a $60 sale for a group of three. I will never waste my time again.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: First time here in SLC and had to try this place from the reviews. Food & drinks were fresh & delicious! Service was great!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: We brought our new friend Nacho for his first outting to Nacho Daddy! The shrimp nachos and spicy cucumber margs were absolutely delicious and the service was spectacular.We'll be back next time we're in town!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I come here often and recently visited tonight and our server was Nayra and she was horrible. She was sitting at the bar drinking a frappe from starbucks, charged us 3 times for our chips and salsa that are supposed to be bottomless, our food took 45 minutes to come out, and she never refilled our waters. I never leave without tipping but unfortunately had to do that this time. Makes me wonder if I'll ever come back here.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Great Nachos! Tristin's attentiveness and willingness to help us navigate the menu truly sets the standard for what a good waitress should be! Not to mention her positive attitude and amazing personality! Can't wait to come back and see Tristin again!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Pretty solid nachos! Overall the pork carnitas were good, and a large serving size. The chips were crispy and warm and there were a decent amount of carnitas and other toppings on the chips. My only slight issue was the cost. The portion size was solid, and we were glad to try this destination however based on the bill I'm not sure we will go again.We also got the spicy cucumber and Mexican candy margaritas. Both pretty tasty, I enjoyed the Mexican candy margarita more, but again just kind of expensive.It's a fun novelty place and would say to try it once though to see what you think!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I love the food here. They have great vegan/vegetarian options and their micheladas are amazing!! Our server victor was super friendly and took really great care of us. Definitely coming back on my next business trip!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Our server Christopher is so freaking awesome we love him and we only come to Nacho daddy to see him because he's so freaking awesome!!!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: We love us some nacho daddy's! They know how to make a stiff margarita and they go big here on the food!  The prices are a little high but they give you plenty of food so it's definitely a good value! My go to drink is the Daddy's Marg and love their nachos. Usually stick with the enchilada nachos but they have more adventurous options like Thai shrimp that sound very interesting! Service is A+++  Even if you don't have daddy issues, you need to get yourself some Nacho Daddy because everyone loves a Daddy!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Disappointed. Had grubhub deliver lunch for an order of cali burrito, surf and turf tacos and queso dip and a couple sodas.  Unfortunately, we did not receive the surf and turf tacos since they were out of lobster. We were not informed that half our meal was missing and had to call the restaurant. We received a refund for the missing dish but it would have been nice to be told so we could reorder. Also would have appreciated some napkins and utensils. As for the Cali burrito it was average, salsa good and the queso dip was ok. Chips were stale.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: The BESTEST place for margaritas! Oh and nachos :-) I've had the spicy cucumber Margarita, Mexican candy margarita, and white peach. ALL delicious and would highly recommend any of their drinks. The nachos are all amazing. Cheese enchiladas are also good. If you're looking for a great meal with amazing drinks, this is the spot! Shout out to our server/bartender Chris. Had some great recommendations and excellent service.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Some of the best nachos I've ever had  great blend of traditional Mexican with an American take. Solid local drafts.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Overall the experience was average. It started off with a 20 min wait around 9pm on a Thursday. After being seated, waters were promptly brought over, but waited a while to put our order in after that. QR code's are used for the menu and they have complimentary WI-Fi. After signing in and giving your email, they will send you an email with a button to click in front of your server that offers $5-$25 off your meal! Didn't figure this out till after we left unfortunately. Food was not that great for the price though. Tortilla soup was very bland and basic. Got the pork enchiladas with green sauce per the waitresses recommendation. Unfortunately it was pretty flavorless/dry and there was hardly any sauce. Rice and beans were surprisingly terrible. What I WOULD recommend is, the Queso and Chips as well the Fish Tacos. Those were really delicious. And if you get thirsty, The Skinny Margarita was really tasty. Might give this place another try in the future since the service was very polite and we were greeted by the Assistant Manager later in the evening to check in on us. The music played in the restaurant was a tad loud, which created loud chatter amongst everyone, so if you have children, that's just something to note. Overall, drinks and apps here are worth it and they are open later than most reaturaunts!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Massive deliciousness. We got the fajita nachos and they blew every nacho experience I've had out of the water! Victor was awesome and attentive. My drink never ran dry. We will be back for many occasions.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: This spot was the first restaurant we ate in SLC. They were out of wings, so we didn't get to try those. The carnitas was not as great as the lobster and crab, but both were delicious! Their queso was also great! We went during lunch and the staff was absolutely amazing. They took pictures when asked and were very knowledgable about the menu and about things to do around SLC. Would definitely come back again!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: First time but not my last! Obsessed with the Mexican Candy Margarita and had amazing lobster and crab enchiladas.  Victor was a wonderful guide on my journey to being full of delicious food and beong tipsy on a Sunday afternoon

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I have had the beer-battered fish tacos a few times now and they are SO GOOD. I have ordered for delivery only, so I haven't been in the restaurant, but the food was so good and I'll definitely keep ordering.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Excellent drinks, service, and food! The nachos are creative and taste fresh every time. One of our salt lake favorites!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Average. We sat at the bar and had to wait for the hostess to come back and remind the bartender to serve us. Once served it was pretty slow. The margaritas were good, but nothing special. They are big, so that's a plus. We shared an order of the fiesta nachos. They say that there is 'no dry chip' which was true. However they were actually just soggy with juice from the shredded chicken and tomatoes.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Great food. Great drinks. I recommend the strawberry margaritas.  Great and friendly service.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: My fiancée and I have been twice now and we're hooked! Definitely pricey but worth it for how much you're getting and the quality both times has been awesome!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: We have eaten at the Las Vegas locations and were super excited to try out the new SLC restaurant. The food didn't disappoint. My husband and I shared the Thai Chicken Nachos. There is a great balance of sweet and spicy  that leaves you coming back for more. I'm excited to try more of their exotic menu

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I have been to Nacho Daddy three times now. Each meal that I have gotten from there has been so delicious and packed full of flavor. The portions are also HUGE, so you can share one nachos order among two people. Their margaritas are also huge. I had the white peach one and loved it but couldn't drink more than half because of the size.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Got in before 10pm. Sat down before 10pm. Had waters before 10pm. General manager comes up and asks if we have an issue with the liquid menu at 10:03. We didn't, until we realized that the bar closed at 10pm. We were here before and the only reason we can't enjoy a margarita is their poor customer service. But wait, there is more....it's 10:08 now and still no server. But you bet your a$$ every employee in here is cleaning up to close shop at 10:30.I have been to the Nacho Daddy's in Vegas, this makes a bad name for Nacho Daddy. This place needs a serious lesson in customer service (drinks aside)

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Came here with a couple of friends. Have to pay for parking unfortunately. The waitress was nice but it did take a while to get our food, and it didn't all come out at around the same time. The burriton I ordered was great. But the nachos were very average and parts of the steak were too chewy and fatty. Both entrees were $20 since it was steak. The burrito was way more worth it. Prices are a little steep here though.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Overpriced, over salted, and rude service. I have been to Nacho Daddy in Vegas and it was great. I was psyched when I heard there was one here. We made a reservation and we were asked to leave after our ticket was paid because there was a group waiting for a table. We hadn't been there longer than anyone else and were being very appropriate. It was really strange and left a bad impression of the place.  I don't even want to go back.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Loved the lemon pepper wings. Definitely would get again. Only tasted the Thai nachos and they were pretty good. Another friend got the vegan avocado tacos and really enjoyed them. Waitress was on point. Very attentive and helpful. I'd come back.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I saw some people's posts about Nacho Daddy and I took the wife there on a Saturday afternoon.  It did not disappoint.  The Filet Mignon nachos were loaded and delicious and I can't wait to go back to try the other exotic nachos.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Nacho Daddy never disappoints! These vegan tacos rocked my afternoon. The service is great despite the wait. Love love love that they are open on Sunday's  xoxo

name: Nacho Daddy
content: The nachos were legit and the skinny margaritas were great. Our server, Nayra, was awesome!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I ordered the hamburger nachos. It could have had  more cheese. I wasn't blown away by the taste it wasn't something I would order again. This place has a variety of margaritas to choose from also but I didn't try any.  The are following the CDC guidelines and have digital menus. Wear your mask when in the restaurant.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Not impressed. We came in for lunch with two people for $80 with tip.Filet Mignon Fajitas - $25 for one person. A massive mound of pepper, onion, tomatoes. A meager portion of filet mignon was placed on the bottom of the hot cast iron. This causes the meat to become very well done and chewy. At this point, there is no sense in cooking filet mignon, could use chuck, and it would be just as bad. Also, the portion was way off (see picture). For $25, there should be a lot more meat. It was all pepper and onions. Tortilla was super dry and crusty. Fish tacos - these were good-- great crust on the fish, good flavor. The tortillas were super dry. Corn - delicious. I was expecting it to be on the cobb. It was well mixed in with fajita peppers. Chips and sala- the salsa was good. Chips were average. It would be better if served warm. Service - our guy was super distracted. He made a few mistakes, but he was friendly enough. It just felt like we were a second thought the whole time. I would not return. Prices are too high, and food was not executed well. There is a Mexican food place right down the street whose food and prices are excellent. It puts this place to shame. They are closed Sundays and Monday's though. Glad we tried it, though, now we know!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: This is THE WORST experience I've ever had at Nacho Daddy. There was about 15 chips on the entire ate. They didn't put any lettuce or bacon on it as advertised. Maybe a spoonful of queso. Will never come to this location again. McDonald's has better food.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I came to this spot after a late night flight into SLC! Man was I excited, Nachos and Margaritas! We arrived at about 9:50pm, and the close time was 10:30pm. We were seated right away. However, during this time, no servers came to our table. As soon, as the server came, I was ready to order, and was immediately disappointed because it was 10:01pm, and they said their bar closes at 10:00pm. This was super frustrating given that no one helped us for 10 mins! What was worse, was that during this time, the staff were cleaning up, getting ready to close. While frustrated, we decided to stay. We ordered 1 plate of filet mignon nachos. It's was over priced (approx $25), and frankly not that good. Overall, I was disappointed with the customer service more than anything.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: As the reviews already mentioned, service can be a lot better. It was our first time and one gal was hustling to serve most of the tables. We ordered a variety of nachos to try amongst our group of 5. I think they're over-priced for what they are, nachos. Taste good but I wouldn't say they're fantastic.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Nayra was put surver and was amazing. and the nachos and the service are amazing. They are super good people with a good atmosphere. I'd recommend the fire ffighieatas..

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Really delicious nachos! The golden night nachos are definitely the best. The barbecue chicken nachos aren't that good. Way too sweet. The only problem is their price. 20 dollars for a plate of nachos. Seems a little steep.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: They serve a lot of other Mexican food options, BUT you have to try the nachos! It's a big serving honesty could feed two people and the flavor is amazing! We had the Cajun nacho of the month and it was sooo good. The margaritas are tasty as well and a very good size.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: This place is definitely a weekend night vibe. Do not expect low-key because this isn't it lol. They were playing 2000s rap and hip hop music videos which is definitely not something you see often here in Utah. There was a bar area for people 21+ but I forgot my ID that night. The food was alright. The filet mignon nachos were okay. I don't know why I was expecting them to be as good as a taqueria since this clearly isn't a taqueria. The lemon pepper wing appetizer was the best. Definitely top 10 wings I've ever had. My friend got the Cali burrito and he liked it. I felt like this place was made more for social media pics but they should more so focus on the quality of the food. We won't be back, no offense. Unless I'm in the area and I've already had a few drinks lol.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Ate here Tuesday and I had the worst food poisoning for all of wednsday!  I had to cancel my whole calendar because I couldn't stop puking. Chills and shivers all due to a taco salad that nobody else ate but me.  Service was good. Nachos great but I will never eat here again.  Buyer beware!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: What a great experience! Took a while to get in, like 1.5hrs. Good part is you could see where we were on the list through Yelp. Server was all over it as soon as we sat down. Drinks were great, and the food was hot and exactly as ordered. Environment was loud but totally expected. Good job everyone!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: People that gave this place a bad review need to go back. It was SO good! We had chips guac/salsa, fish tacos and the churros. Our friends got filet nachos, one of the salads...I dont k ow what else but they all were pleased. Everything was amazing. We got regular Moscow mules (sorry tequila) and they hit the spot. Our waitress did an outstanding job considering there were 8 of us in a booth in a loud setting. I feel bad I didn't get her name (frowny face wrist tattoo sweetheart, thank you!) Great experience!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I was really hopeful about trying this restaurant. Unfortunately I won't be going back.Food was mediocre and the price was steep. The tomato sauce tasted like Walmart brand of Ragu and the meat had no flavor.Next time I want nachos- I just do drive-through at TacoBell.Social distancing was sketchy.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Food was great and filling. We ordered 2 plates of nacho's to share between 3 people and it was more than enough. We even tried the famous scorpion shot and it wasn't too bad. Our server Hope was very nice and attentive.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I got there 20 minutes before the said closing time on Yelp and google and the doors were all locked and there were people in there. So we decided we would  try to call them to place a to go order. No one answered even though we could see them cleaning!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: This has got to be the most overrated restaurant I have ever eaten at.The wait time and service was average.The food is another story,4 of us eating so we all ordered separate plates.The quality of the food was below average,tiny plate 12 or 13 chips,like they weigh them.If you where hungry plan on eating 3 plates of nachos, about 60 dollars.We ordered drinks,typical utah 12 dollar drinks with one shot.We paid our bill and were all still hungry so we went and ate somewhere else. Will not be back

name: Nacho Daddy
content: My wife and I tried this place after a recommendation from a friend. It was amazing! All my in laws loved it. I got the enchilada nacho and my wife got the golden knights nacho. I liked hers a bit better but both were great. There was not a dry chip and we will definitely go back.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: The food is really good. But, this is a bar. It's really loud and they have music on the tvs instead of sports. If that's your mood, it's great. Queso is the best. It's pricey too. Parking is a problem too.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Cute place and good food! Managers are rude and unaccommodating. Spoke with a manager that was working a different night, then went in today and they said they can't honor what he offered because he wasn't there? Also giving one star because it's a little pricey for what you get, pictured is an $18 plate This place could be good just need better customer service and better food for what it costs

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Food was average, waitress was great. I ordered to go dessert and it took 40 minutes. I got an insincere apology from the manager, no offer to buy it for me or any suggestion on how to make up for it. One star for my waitress, the other for the ambiance.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Tristin was great! This was our first time and she gave excellent recommendations. The fish tacos are killer. White peach marg is delicious. We also had the filet nachos with yellow queso instead of ranchero.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Stopped by for lunch the other day for the first time.  Was seated quickly by a very friendly staff member that then proceeded to get our drinks and give us a rundown of the menu.  The restaurant was clean and had music videos playing on the TV's. We ordered a margarita and Filet Mignon Nachos too split.  The drink was tasty and the Nachos came out quickly.  I have to say that the steak on the Nachos was perfect.  The ratio of cheese and chips was good.  Overall an excellent nacho platter that was plenty for two of us.  We were able to park out front and this restaurant serves Coke products.  I'm looking forward to thing back and trying some other menu items.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Food was great but service was an ABSOLUTE DISAPPOINTMENT IM A SERVER MYSELF AND NEVER IN MY LIFE HAVE I EVER EXPERIENCED THIS TYPE OF SERVICE our server didn't come and check up on us our drinks were empty and server kept walking by and didn't bother to bring us refills until I asked her to!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Really fun atmosphere and fun concepts for nachos and margaritas. I will say the margaritas are good and the option of tajin, sugar and salt is great. The reason for three stars is the nachos are subpar. I had the enchiladas nachos with red sauce (more like a mole, so heads up...) and they barely had cheese, the shredded chicken on them was delicious though. The jerk chicken nachos were probably the best between the two but all the cheese was at the bottom of the plate and the chicken was oddly rubbery. The lemon pepper wings are definitely the highlight and are delicious!!! I've just had better nachos at other places that don't specialize in nachos and are cheaper in price  but I will return to try again!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Expensive and honestly not that good... Ordered with no sour cream or pico and when my order arrived all my chips were soggy with pico and sour cream...

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Very food nacho place, the place is new and very clean. All the types of nachos sounded so good it was hard to pick. We went with the filet mignon and Buffalo hot ones, and they were stellar. Great beers to try as well. Lucky to have this place in salt lake now

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Not enough liquor in the Margarita. Might as well just put it as a regular juice on the menu. Not worth 12 dollars. More like 4. Other than that. I can't blame the place for the restrictions that they are on. Want to know if you should come? The answer is no.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Tried the avocado tacos and the vegan cheese . I wish they had the protein alternative they have in Vegas . I didn't see them on the menus. We had a odd service experience . And when I went the sanitation was  questionable . I will go again in warmer weather due to the open window option .

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Tried this spot out because it was open later than others and had vegan nachos! Our server McKayla was amazing and so were our margaritas. 10/10 will be back.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: We are regular visitors to Nacho Daddy in Las Vegas so we were beyond excited when we saw the coming soon sign here in Salt Lake City. After reading the initial reviews, we decided to wait a little bit to give them a chance to work out the kinks before we visited. When we had occasion to celebrate one of life's little victories toward the end of August, Nacho Daddy seemed like the perfect place to do just that. Taking into consideration the horrendous wait times noted by other Yelpers, we elected to call ahead right when they opened to get on the list for a 6:30PM reservation. As it turns out, that move was definitely the way to go on a crowded Saturday night. We overheard as one visitor was told the wait was approximately two hours. Obviously, the limited capacity due to the pandemic is a huge factor here when it comes to wait times for a table. Thankfully, we arrived a little early and were shown immediately to our table which was a high-top right next to the bar. We were greeted after a short wait by our server, Miranda, who was noticeably busy, but still very nice and welcoming. We promptly ordered our adult beverages consisting of a Dos Equis Amber (in the bottle) and a specialty pineapple mint margarita.  Waters came out quickly, but the bar was very slow. In fact, we had ordered and received our food before the drinks arrived. Staying true to our favorite menu item from Las Vegas, we selected the Fiesta Nachos with pulled pork. We love the multi-color chips in this one. We also both ordered chimichangas for an entree. I chose a chicken chimi and my date went with pork (which was regretted almost immediately as "pork overload"). Sadly, our nachos were lukewarm upon arrival and were way to soggy to eat after only a couple minutes. We flipped them on the plate and soldiered on a bit, but were still disappointed in our most anticipated dish. The drinks arrived just before we flipped the nacho plate. My beer went quickly and I decided against ordering a second round considering the extended wait times with the bar. Instead, I ordered a soda for my follow up beverage and it appeared almost immediately. My date nursed the margarita partially out of respect for the $15 price tag and the flavor was probably not the best selection, though it sounded the most interesting at the time. With the masked mob of onlookers outside growing in number and impatience, we decided to cut our celebration night a little short and give up our table. When the check arrived, the gracious and attentive Miranda had not charged for my soda understanding what happened with the slow bar situation. Fiesta Nachos, two entrees, and two adult beverages ran us a bill just under a Benjamin including tip. The price tag seems much more reasonable in Vegas, but here it was a little North of the norm. We'll be back to share a plate of nachos and maybe some domestic beers next time. Still, it is so refreshing to see something new and different coming to our beloved city. Viva la Nacho Daddy!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Amazing! We got the golden knight and pork carnitas! Drooling even thinking about them

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I'm definitely not a nacho fan and these are definitely not normal nachos. They're stacked and loaded with everything besides chips. Lol. I believe chips are needed? No? I don't know, not a nacho fan. I did try their wings and I'm just a breaded wings kind of girl. That's all I can say. Not my cup of tea. I didn't come here for the food though. I came with one goal in mind. To take a scorpion shot, and that I did. Granted I didn't chew it like the rest of my people. The tequila they use is yummy. I am a fan of beer flights and they also had a flight of their nacho daddy beers and they're literally all good beers. You can't go wrong with any of their in house beer. Also, the scorpion shot is $20 but you get to keep the glass.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I was SO excited when I found out Salt Lake was getting a Nacho Daddy! Nacho Daddy is a must whenever we are in Vegas so this was a big deal. To start, I am convinced that Nacho Daddy margaritas are the best margaritas money can buy. I LOVE a good Nacho Daddy margarita. As for the food, as a vegan, I REALLY appreciate Nacho Daddy having a large vegan menu. I was obsessed with Nacho Daddy as a non-vegan so I am extra happy that I still get to enjoy it as a vegan! Bonus points!! The vegan nachos are so tasty! I love them. My only complaint is that, several tables around me ordered regular, non vegan nachos and their plates were PILED with nachos and fixings. Whereas, our plate of nachos was seriously lacking. It was a pretty small portion considering the size of everyone else's and the cost. So my advice to Nacho Daddy would be, please make the vegan nachos just as big and full of all the good stuff as the non vegan nachos! Vegans like to get their money's worth too! Other than that, my experience at the SLC joint was great! So happy to have one close to home!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Plan ahead of you want a table, especially with Covid. Food and drinks are awesome. We love the trio appetizer then street tacos.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I really wanted to like this place but our waitress was just awful. She had some friends seated behind us and waited on them and barely acknowledged us. Also she forgot to take my husbands order but took everyone else's. We even waved to her to get her to come over and she wouldn't. Then she had the balls to say she was casually at the podium next to us so she could get us whatever when really she was ringing up her friends. She also would only take one item at a time when clearing the table. She was inattentive and spacey. Honestly she seemed stoned lol Food was ok. You can tell they used canned Tostitos salsa on their food. It was just not the business. Their drinks were great though. Two stars to the bartenderAlso they claim NO NAKED CHIPS and that's a lie. A heaping pile of chips and only the top was covered. The rest was dry.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Cool ambiance but even after eating at nacho daddy four times now, I still stand with this recommendation: if you want great nachos, just go a block away to Lake Effect. They serve far better nachos for an even better ambiance and the same price.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I am so happy my friend took me here. It was a definite pick-me-up that I so required. The drinks are amazing, I got a fantastic mango margarita. The food menu is quite extensive. I had to have nachos and I got the spicy buffalo nachos with popcorn chicken. So spicy and amazing! They have other Mexican food options as well. My friend's vegan flaming fajitas were a spectacle. They also have a range of their own sauces that are amazing, their smoky extra hot one in particular.Definitely recommend!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Finally tried it! We got the Daddy's Margarita, the Filet Mignon Nachos and the Caramelized Apple Nachos.
