The Margarita was really good, and it was a big glass, the Apple Nachos were really good and filling. The Nachos were good but I think the interest of the place is more in trying different kind of Nachos than the classical one. I would like to go back to try the Crab and Lobster Nachos though!Everyone was wearing a mask and they took our temperature at the entrance. We got there on a SUnday at 1 pm, there were not too many people but it was during a snow storm, and it was getting busier when we left.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: This place was soooooo fun, couple things!!! 1. One plate is definitely enough for two especially with a yummy margarita and I'm talking nacho plates!! But also if you're still hungry which I was then the next plate comes out "fresh"2. I did not fully read it but the scorpion shot literally has a  in it so beware and be ready for the celebracion when you take it!! 3. Utah is a one drink only state so if you get that shot be ready to gulp it cause the margaritas don't get MADE until it's gone bb's 4. The main reason for the 4-star instead of 5 is that they didn't do blended drinks personal preference for the most part but seemed very limiting for what their menu offered and the space they were creatingThank you Nayraaa for an awesome time and attentive servicePS sorry for bad food/drink photos

name: Nacho Daddy
content: The cheese was like 1980s pool snack nacho cheese. Some pieces were soggy, others were dry.  Overall a disappointment.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Great food and service!  Flew in from Chicago and was hungry! Place was clean and well kept!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: It was my first time here, tacos were good, although my margarita was on the sweeter side, the chips quaso were bomb! Don't forget to try their homemade hot sauce!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Well that sucks. I paid $18 for soggy chips. I got the vegan nachos and it didn't have any: guacamole, lime, sour cream or anything. Just some super spicy red sauce. I will not be going back

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Wow! I've been the the Vegas location so when I was searching for a place to get dinner I had NO IDEA there was a SLC location. Everything was so good and our server Ciara was wonderful. They have a really fun atmosphere and the place was full! We will be coming back.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: To many issues to count. Horrible customer service, long wait times (30 min to get a shot and beer) our waitress said my card declined I told her there was no way possible and she told me she would try again but it was going to be the same error. It wasn't, she was entering the cards manually and she must've made a mistake and now there's 4 charges pending on my account so she must've tried multiple times.... never again ‍

name: Nacho Daddy
content: During these times, it is very easy to want to stay at home to avoid being around people and social distance from everyone. Was visiting SLC with my husband and staying around the corner from Nacho Daddy, and, being a vegan, we heard lots of great things about this restaurant. On 10/15/20, we walked into a welcoming restaurant where we were temperature checked by the staff who all wore PPE. Not only were there lots of vegan options, but my husband, who isn't a vegan, was satisfied with all the choices on the menu. Our server Hope provided suggestions and they were great. Not only was Hope very informative with the food menu and drink selection, but she was very attentive and personable. Hope provided the best customer service that my husband and I ever experienced dining anywhere.This is a definite must try restaurant for vegans and visitors looking for great service, great food, and a safe environment during these strange times. If you can, ask for Hope to be your server. You won't be disappointed!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Staff is super friendly and service is great. Shout out to our great servers Mickayla and Eduardo?(sorry man don't remember your name ) we ordered the house corn and lime wings to start. One of the best elote I've ever had. Be sure to sprits the lime on top! We also ordered the filet nachos which lived up to the hype. This is place you'd come to after work for a quick bite but If you're looking for something quiet and relaxed this isn't the place for you.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Hope was amazing.  See my check in review!!! Food and drinks are so good.  Welcome to Salt Lake and so happy hour here!!!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Tried out this location after passing by the one in Vegas and because all my coworkers talked about it and I always went to other places to eat, I'll admit I kinda regret doing that now. Place has really good food along with decent prices depending on what you order, friendly staff and a nice interior. I ordered the Supreme tostada nachos and enjoyed every moment of it, while not the largest order of nachos I've had at a restaurant it was among the best I've had, easily in the top 3.I'll being trying them out again in the future, though I will be focused on the nacho items due to them being named after it, hope you guys keep up the good work!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Not the best! Way. Way, way overpriced for cheap nachos! The service was ok. I got a margarita and it was filled with low budget sweet and sour.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: 2 stars is generous for the food, but not enough for service. We were excited to try this place and their vegan menu. It turned out to be a bummer. The overpriced vegan nachos were soggy, with just canned beans, a little scoop of guac, salsa and a little cheese. It wasn't good. The vegan quesadilla was equally disappointing. One of our dishes came out wrong, and wasn't good enough to eat more than a few bites before tossing. Our desserts tasted stale. Drinks  were okay, better than the food at least. Had to ask for silverware and napkins a few times but, our server (Ryan) was busy so, no big deal. For 4 people, our bill was around 100 dollars before tip. The food was not worth this much, it was fast food quality. Definitely won't be back but habe to acknowledge the good service . Our waiter was friendly and attentive.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Fun new place.  Love the food and the atmosphere.  Prices were a little steep but that okay you get what you pay for.  Great service and vibe too.  100 inch big screen tv was great for football.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: An hour long wait because they were under-staffed (not a Covid issue). Over priced Pre-mixed drink (bull) for a premium price & low quality premix. Food was good but over priced. Price are equivalent to Vagas or California but not adjusted for Utah Lower earnings.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: We were so excited to welcome Nacho Daddy to our neighborhood. This said, we will not be returning after multiple times we've observed poor sanitary standards. While the front of the house takes temperature of each guest and offers a sanitation station at entrance, we continue to see non-compliance with public health standards in the back of house (kitchen & bar)...primarily employees not wearing masks in food prep area. As good as I believe the food is, there disregard for hygiene now eliminates Macho Daddy from my brunch list.

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Good nachos and drinks !  I got the fiesta nachos . They are really good . Good place to watch the UFC fights and grab a drink

name: Nacho Daddy
content: I'm a certified nacho expert. I live, breathe and love nachos. I first went to Nacho Daddy in Vegas,  my mind was blown. Got the lobster nachos, on a rectangular tray. This was great because the chips stayed crunchy. You also got a very good amount ot chips. I certainly thought it was worth the price. My most recent experience at the SLC location was super disappointing. Great location, cute atmosphere but the portions are WAY SMALLER. Not sure if these are franchises or if that was some sort of corporate decision. It certainly was not the right decision. Chips are cheap, and although the flavors and lobster meat provided tastes great - I couldn't get past the fact I paid $24 and hardly any chips. Sad to say I won't be coming back. At least give more chips  with the sauce and spread out the "expensive" toppings. People won't hate you for it!

name: Nacho Daddy
content: Incredible nachos, wings and margaritas! William (our waiter) was attentive, informative, and fun. Can't wait to come back for brunch!!

name: Bambara
content: Bambara was amazing. My first time going to celebrate my birthday and everything from the ambiance, to the server, to the food and the presentation was immaculate! The cheese and meat board was delicious. And the steak and frites.  It's a bit pricey but that's what you go there for is to treat yourself. *chefs kiss* Thank you

name: Bambara
content: Update time during corona virus which they are following all protocols including wearing gloves.  Our server was amazing.  I've had him before but all the amazing cocktails has erased his name from my memory.  You should try a cocktail here, they are delicious and we'll worth the price.  My favorite was made with tequila named standing on the beach and boy did I.  Another thing you have to get here is the blue cheese chips.  Aaaaammazing!  Cheese platter was big and delicious.  I had the ceaser salad and I was so full from all the appetizers I barely finished it.  What shines is the filet and elk.  Not really vegetarian friendly fyi.  I prefer the vault the bar attached that you can order same menu from but it can get tight in there.  Lose a star because bread used to come with this yummy hummus for free but now they charge.  Menu is also quite small.  Parking is valet.  Great place to come with group or date night.

name: Bambara
content: A very beautiful restaurant inside of The Kimpton Monaco hotel. Our waiter was delightful! I ordered the steak and fries and was delicious! My boyfriend got the elk and had a squash base, which was absolutely delicious!! First time trying elk and was very impressed. I would even say get the elk over the steak!

name: Bambara
content: I was torn leaving only two stars (edited, see below) as it seems a bit harsh. But considering the prices I think it's about right.  But, first thing first, nothing was bad or wrong. Oh wait... the soup was really really good. I'm upgrading to three stars based on that.I ordered three starters and a salad for our table of two. Bone marrow. Red pepper hummus. mushroom bisque. Fuji apple salad.The marrow, served with toast, was just kind of bland. The hummus was mediocre. The soup was really good. The salad was boring and bland with flavorless apples. Maybe some seasoning would've helped or maybe tastier dressing or better apples.All together actually "bland and boring" is probably the best summary of the whole meal. But the soup was definitely yummy.The vibe and aesthetic was unimpressive. I had flown into salt lake for the first time and was out with a new date, so the goal was to impress to some extent. In a fairly empty restaurant we, a mid age couple, were sat next to a family of 4-5 with young children in an area on the side, in a sort of pass through walk area, near a server stand with no intimate lighting or ambiance whatsoever.Total bill was $79 with tip. It doesn't seem too pricey but consider we didn't have any drinks or entrees. It's normal to excuse the prices because it is a hotel. But you want good food or vibe.Ironically, I am sitting at a hotel right now eating one of the best meals of my life and it is only $12 (brunch), which unfortunately solidifies my thought that the value is way off at Bambara for what the experience was. I read a lot of reviews on a lot of restaurants in dt slc before choosing Bambara. Maybe this was just a bad night for them.

name: Bambara
content: I had breakfast here. The staff was so nice and accommodating. They went beyond their responsibilities to help out with a custom drink request. In addition to my Americano, the raspberry and cheese danish was exquisite. I highly recommend this Klimpton hotel restaurant in Salt Lake City.

name: Bambara
content: Just had one of the worst meals I've had in a long time at Bambara last night... I ordered a Caesar salad which was a teeny handful of spring  mix greens (not romaine) and unfortunately the mixed greens were probably out of one of those massive packages of mixed greens because they were starting to get on the slimy side.. The salad cost $15 and it was smaller than your average side salad.ThenI ordered the filet  and it was a really weird fatty stringy piece of meat that was just bad... The person working acted absolutely put out to be serving people...  safe to say I will never go back to this restaurant. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else!

name: Bambara
content: This atmosphere is amazing. The food was okay, not as I had hoped. I went expecting to try the beet salad and they didn't have it, even though it was very popular the girl told us they took it off the menu to limit the ingredients due to COVID, stupid Covid!! The elk stake my husband got was too pink for us. My scallops were delicious. The bleu cheese nacho appetizers are one you could skip. I wish we had gone with the charcuterie board.

name: Bambara
content: Very limited menu. Need at least one vegetarian option, and more than one dessert. Beer menu is terrible too. You will need to offer much much more to stay afloat. Many other eatery's offer way more in these trying times.

name: Bambara
content: Dinner for 1. Thought I'd try one of SLC's 10 best restaurants. It does not disappoint. It's amazing and may be one of the best restaurants I've been to in years. And there is only one other party here, about 30 feet away.

name: Bambara
content: Ok, so I rarely leave reviews unless we had a great experience. We arrived for our reservation and were seated immediately. After being seated, we didn't get greeted by a server for nearly 10 minutes, no water or drink orders (almost walked out). After ordering, both our meals arrived undercooked (filet and scallops) and I asked for veggies instead of potatoes which I was told was no problem. My meal arrived with potatoes, no veggies and undercooked. Interior is very dated, not the ambiance we'd expect for a high level eatery. We are from a community of under 200k people and this was a huge disappointment for what looked like a 5 star restaurant. We will never return to this run down establishment and if you are looking for great service and food, go to the copper onion.

name: Bambara
content: I have eaten at many of the fine dining establishments in Utah (Christopher's Prime, Ruth's Chris, Carvers, Pallet, London Belle, etc). Not all of those are on the same level, but I want people who read this review to know, that this is not my first night out at a nice restaurant. Our server Tony was great, as can be expected, the service was wonderful. We started with a cheeseboard, and it too, was excellent. Our main courses came quickly after. I had the house steak, the 13 oz sirloin with the bernaise and frites. It was cooked a perfect medium rare. It had some wonderful grilled cippolini onions, and there bernaise was incredible. The steak was tender, and a slight crisp on the outside. My wife had the elk Loin with the squash risotto, and it was just as good. We got a side of the mac and cheese, and many times this can be a gamble, but it was amazing and worth it. It had a slight tang to it because of the bleu cheese. We ended it with a VERY lemony lemon sorbet (it was very tart, but that's how I like my lemon sorbets), and the best sorbet I've had in my.life, their yellow watermelon sorbet. It tasted EXACTLY like you were eating a cold slice of perfectly ripe watermelon. You MUST get it. I cannot recommend this place enough, absolutely consider this place when looking for a place to enjoy an incredible meal in downtown SLC.

name: Bambara
content: Normally, hotel restaurants would get a solid 1-2 stars. At the bottom of Hotel Monaco you'll find Bambara and if your staying there and looking for a date night and don't wanna brave the cold, you're in luck. Bambara is beautifully designed and has some of the fanciest dishes downtown.All that good being said, there are some reasons why the 3 stars. If this was a restaurant at a lower price point serving the same dishes it'd easily be a 4/5, but being at the price point it is I'm expecting a little mind blowing-ness which is a little underwhelming when it doesn't happen.

name: Bambara
content: Probably one of the fanciest places I've been for dinner in SLC area. We were here with some clients and wanted to treat them to some fine dining. Service, setup, ambiance, etc. is all absolutely fantastic. Look no further if you want to treat your customers to some fancy dining and hope you get their business! Excellent food too!

name: Bambara
content: All meat lovers like me know the benefits of eating Bone Marrow. I have always appreciated this dish as an appetizer or just a side dish. I came in and ordered one order with a drink and to go juice and water. I tipped 1$10 on a $40 Oder that took ten minutes. I got yo my hotel room and there was barely any marrow on the bones. I called the manager and he offered to prepare another order or give me a refund. I asked for another order because really I was looking forward to eating my marrow. I should have looked in the box before I left but it was worse than before! I am never coming back!

name: Bambara
content: Bambara is like a good friend for us. We have spent some nice dates and special occasions in this stylishly adorned and customer service savvy restaurant. They will always take very good care of you and your party when dining at Bambara, but if you have a special occasion, let them know and they will be sure that you know that even they care about you with special touches, including a custom printed menu for the occasion. They have staples that stick around, like their perfect signature fillet, but they also have a menu that adjusts to the seasons and local farm availability. I have had the fillet a number of times and have never been disappointed. The dessert menu is always something to enjoy as well. Our last dessert was heavenly, but it was the berries tossed in almond sugar that took it to the next level. We have tried many of the appetizers from the cheese and meat plate to the blue cheese, hand-made, potato chips. Yes, it was as good as it sounds. Our son paused when their hamburger was Elk, but he took a chance and ended up loving it. Thank you, Bambara for being there for special occasions and an elegant evening out.

name: Bambara
content: Came in for a date night dinner. Started off with the butter leaf lettuce salad. My wife always orders the blue cheese potatoes chips. I eat the cheese off the bottom of the plate. So good. I got the pork chop tonight. It had a delicious Chinese black bean themed sauce on it. It was incredible. Like out of this world good.

name: Bambara
content: Can't say enough about our experience at Bambara! Exemplary!First, we discovered after having booked a room at the Hotel Monaco that the fabulous restaurant we chose for dinner (Bambara) was located within the hotel (SCORE)!The food & the service was 5 stars (ambience & location deserve 5-stars as well).  The fancy pants cocktail was so delicious and my neat Mezcal tequila was perfection.Cannot get over how phenomenal the squash soup with candied nuts and crème fraîche tasted! I almost ordered another bowl for dinner it was THAT good! (Still thinking about it ...).  The blue cheese potato chips were delicious and paired beautifully with the 2008 Dom we brought to celebrate our vacation.  We also shared some tasty tempura green beans with a nice spicy sauce and some soy dip.The dinner entrées were spectacular. My husband had the filet mignon which was perfectly cooked (med-rare) with a Madeira gastric and duck fat potato fingerlings - absolute perfection! After all the initial snacking, I went light and had the Fuji apple salad which was the most perfect salad I've eaten in a long time. They turned the apple into Fuji matchsticks and it was spectacular with the fresh lettuce, nuts and blue cheese. We ended the meal with some lemon sorbet and a decaf espresso and called it a night. Thanks to Jake, et al, for the outstanding service!Go - you will love this place!

name: Bambara
content: I had the loin of elk and blue cheese chips. Elk dish was very very very salty, if I wasn't starving it would've been inedible. I'm disappointed since it cost so much. two stars because the risotto and tempura mushroom were perfectly cooked had it not been for all that salt.

name: Bambara
content: The food is always spot on. We went out on Friday and had a great experience other than the host. She was very abrasive. Our server overheard her talking to us and immediately apologized for her. Then he brought us a free Appetizer and then Desert.  We will definitely be back!

name: Bambara
content: Absolutely amazing, one of the best meals start to finish my wife and I have had in a while. Service was very attentive, the head chef stepped in when needed to ensure an excilent experience.

name: Bambara
content: Places like this I feel are hidden gems when they are tucked in a old hotel.  Bambara is located in the beautiful Monaco hotel in downtown.  The venue is in a old turn of the century bank and is decorated about as perfect as possible.  Our server was fantastic and knew everything about the menu and could describe everything perfect.  Now I feel guilty because of the high quality of food served here that I ordered the waygu burger but I am always curious when they have a burger on the menu at a place like this because you know it is going to be good and I am a burger junkie.  It did not disappoint.  Was cooked perfect and just packed with flavor.  Perfect night out with my honey and would make a great place for a romantic night with your honey!!

name: Bambara
content: Love to eat here when I stay in SLC at the Kimpton. The menu is always changing and seasonal

name: Bambara
content: The food is well made, but didn't have strong flavors or anything that really popped. I get that they use good ingredients, but the craftsmanship and use of it all does not justify the prices.  I don't feel like it is a fancy place, but they price their menu like is. Overall it was an okay experience but the high prices and lack of ambience was a killjoy for me. The menu is generally very fish forward, which is okay but doesn't really give you much to choose from outside fish. Once again it's all well cooked...just kinda blah though. Not bad but just muted.

name: Bambara
content: Absolutely phenomenal food and great service...currently operating with a staff of 6 people...but you would never know...had a wonderful steak that was seasoned perfectly. A tremendous dessert and ...wow...just a wonderful evening!!

name: Bambara
content: There is no excuse for poor customer service.  Not Covid, not anything.   We had been looking forward to a great meal.  What we got was poor management (no signage advising us to wait in the bar to be seated), ignored by the bartender-no more than 10 people in the bar, rudely spoken to by a server when we walked into the restaurant to see if our reserved table was ready,  then left on our own for over 5 minutes waiting for a sign of life from staff, no acknowledgment that we were even alive and waiting....we left.  Never in the history of ever will we go back.  Wish I could write a good review.  Too bad this formerly good restaurant has sunk to such lows.  If Yelp had the option of minus stars, this place provided a negative 10.  Stay away.

name: Bambara
content: Absolutely LOVED this place. My husband took me here for my 30th birthday dinner and I was so incredibly excited to try their menu! I was not let down. In fact, I was worried I would be - restaurants and food are going downhill so much these days - but Bambara was the furthest thing from a let down. We shared an appetizer which was delicious! The pork belly was tender and amazing. I also tried two of their Christmas cocktails - both were the best cocktails I've had! And then I ordered the sea scallops, and he ordered the filet. Both were melt-in-your-mouth soft and tender, and tasted so delicious! We both decided we should also order a dessert and we couldn't stop eating them, and were sad when we finished them. I highly highly recommend Bambara. Our server was also absolutely wonderful! Will definitely be going back.

name: Bambara
content: While in SLC and staying at the Kimpton Monaco, we were pleasantly surprised to find Bambara located within the hotel. I'm not a breakfast person in the least, yet My Person definitely is. The menu had everything from oat meal with numerous toppings to eggs benedict. The meal came timely and was pretty good. After reading reviews about dinner, we are thinking about visiting for dinner as well.

name: Bambara
content: First and foremost the menu is amazing!  It is fun, inspiring and eclectic, there is definitely something for every palate on this menu.  That is one of the reasons I chose it for my party of 5 on February 15th when my partner and I were in town for a conference.We arrived first and were seated at the round table in the back of the restaurant, we sat down and ordered a cocktail while the rest of our guests arrived.  I sat down and noticed that some the seats didn't have full utensil settings and since no one was on the floor, I got up and pillaged from another table.Our guests arrived and they joined us with a cocktail and we perused the menu.  We ordered several appetizers to start, a few entrees, and a couple of side orders which all looked fun.  We are a bunch of fun people from San Francisco, we were laughing and trying to engage our waitress on the menu, what was her favorites, what was popular, any specials...to no avail...zero personality.  She came back with our starters, put them down in the middle of the table and left.  We all looked at each other and laughed as there weren't any plates.  Once again, there was no one on the floor so I got up and started to look for plates in the hutch and sideboard (there weren't any).  I flagged down a bus boy and he must have told our waitress and she came back with a stack of plates, said nothing and put them down in front of me.  Ok.  I handed them out to my guests and we started to nosh.We were looking at the wine book and were wondering about this certain winery (we're from CA...we love our wine).  We asked our waitress and she didn't know so she asked the sommelier to come by and chat with us.  We decided on a couple of bottles of Red. Our entrees were being served just as the wine was being poured.  My partner was serving the plates (we were sharing family style) and she was pouring the wine over his arm as he was plating. I found this slightly rude, but I didn't say anything.The wine was poured; but in front of us were our cocktail, and water glasses and now big Burgundy wine glasses.  Once again, no one on the floor so I got up and picked up all of the used glasses and brought them to the sideboard (thank god for this side board, it helped me tremendously throughout the evening).  I could not believe the lack of attentiveness.  Maybe it's because my partner is a chef and I am used to seeing how things run in a kitchen and the front of the house.  Dinner is finished, we ordered dessert and a few after dinner drinks.  We are finished with dinner and couldn't wait to get out of there and go to Bar X. I started to feel not well and we went back to our hotel.I have food allergies.  I don't go anywhere near shellfish as it's a life changer for me.  I didn't eat shellfish at the restaurant.  I also don't leave home without my Epi Pen.  By the time I got back to the Hotel I could feel my face and body swelling up; I took my pen and a Benadryl and called my doctor.The next day, I left a very nice message asking to speak to someone due to my incident.  My doctor called me again and asked if I spoke to someone, I said no, they haven't called me back and I would call again.  I called back on Wednesday and spoke to the hostess who told me that Tommy just left the floor and that he would call me back.  Tommy never called me back. I am back in SF with an appointment at UCSF Allergy Clinic.  Clearly, there was cross contamination, but I will never know because no one called me back.When you go out for fine dining, money aside, I think you expect a couple of things.  Good service, nice atmosphere, pleasant and attentive wait staff and to eat without your life being in jeopardy.  This is not that restaurant.  This is a PSA:  If you have any type of Food Allergies, DO NOT COME HERE, your life depends on it.I have pictures, let me know if you want them.EDIT:  Tommy has NOT tried to contact me until this review went up this afternoon.  I have a phone log and it has zero messages from the restaurant or Tommy.

name: Bambara
content: This night was planned for my wife and I for our 3 year anniversary. I called a little late to get reservations on Monday this week, and today is (Saturday). I called and talked to someone, didn't write down the name or recall what her name was (horrible with names). The conversation went with explaining that I needed a reservation but it was booked. I then asked how long walk-in typically wait, and was told it just varies. So I explained we would just show up right before opening and wait for a table. Well we travel up, show up 15 minutes early to opening and ask that we get on the wait list. Well they then tell me that the tables are completely booked. I asked why I was told on the phone that we could walk-in and there was no explanation. We are now sitting in the bar, and as I sit here writing this, I'm very angry. This ruined our night and I should have just left and took my business elsewhere, but I have a large gift card for us to use. So I guess I will leave a 1 star review and sit in the bar that smells like alcohol and cigarettes while we try and have a nice evening.... Thanks Bambara. It would have been nice to at least give me correct and accurate information so I can plan accordingly. Specially since this was suppose to be a nice evening.

name: Bambara
content: If you are looking for a great meal this is the place. We had Betsy as our server and she was delightful. She had wonderful recommendations and they were spot on. She was attentive but not too much. The food was delicious and the presentation perfect.  The Vault, where you can go for a drink ahead of time is not worth it. Just go to Bambara and you will have a wonderful evening.  Ask for Betsy!

name: Bambara
content: Booked for a fun brunch with friends before theater.  Food took forever to arrive and was served cold.  Waiter was very nonchalant.  Left food and never returned.  We had to ask for service from another waiter.  The manager apologized, but very disappointing experience.

name: Bambara
content: Flew in on a last minute ski trip and stayed at the Kimpton Monaco SLC, so it was very convenient.  Ended up eating lunch, dinner, and breakfast there on different days.First Day Lunch -- Stopped in after having flown from the East Coast and not really eating that morning or during transit.  Checked into the hotel and went to grab lunch as I was starving.  The burger of the day was an aged beef with onions, truffles, cheese, etc.  Sounded great.  Sadly when it arrived, it was just their plain house burger.  The waiter noticed after a couple minutes that it was not the special burger and apologized.  I was starving, so the burger and fries were going to be destroyed regardless.  Was a good burger and quality bun.  It was not a standout plain-jane burger, but still good.  Shoestring fries with herbs were a good pairing.Second Day Dinner -- Stopped back in for dinner after a long day of skiing powder at Solitude. Legs were dead, so again super convenient to grab a shower at the hotel and quickly down to get dinner.  They were fairly busy, but had high top tables open and was able to walk in and get a seat immediately.  Ordered the Elk loin with corn risotto and tempura asparagus.  Perfectly seared medium rare, good quality meat, and the corn risotto was a perfect pairing.  Also the perfect amount of food, though plating of the arugula could have been a bit cleaner.  I had also been eyeing their corn and crab bisque as an app, but opted not to get it....until I realized that sounded like a perfect dessert.  Again, super fresh soup and very good.  Could use some additional crab in it similar to most places that serve she-crab soup.  Still, very delicious.Last Day Breakfast -- Had an omelette with ham and bacon with cheese and chives served with toast and fried potatoes.  Well cooked omelette and the potatoes were perfectly seasoned.  Was exactly what I was look for, but def no-frills breakfast.

name: Bambara
content: Had high hopes and the restaurant impressed until the service and food left us disappointed. The establishment is very nice and ambiance was great. The service was lazy and acted like they had better things to do beside their job. The host didn't bother to show us to our table, just pointed and said your table is In the corner. The waiter seemed annoyed that we had questions and asked to see dessert menu again. We had a large table and everyone didnt get a chance to order the first time. Ice creams flavors weren't listed and after asking a few times to repeat the choices, the waiter coped an attitude. Same waiter was rude and condescending when we asked for parking validation. My wife is foreign born and didn't understand to his satisfaction. Overall we felt the service was lacking and rude especially when you drop $500 for dinner and tip 30%..Food was hit or miss.  Salads were good, wine menu adequate, choices were ample. My elk loin was delicIous as were the sides of corn risotto and asparagus. My wife had the tuna and said it wasn't fresh.We will give it a try another time but was a disappointed experience.

name: Bambara
content: Brunch was what I would expect from a hotel restaurant.  The poached eggs were done correctly; however, my friends pancakes tasted of griddle grease to the point of not being edible.  When we tried to send them back the server, not ours, he was chatting at the bar....was quite short with us and actually quite rude.  I will say that the waiter did take the pancakes off the bill, as they should have and comped us an order of toast.  Presentation was nice as you can see by the pictures, but I would do some more research on breakfast/brunch spots before settling on this spot.

name: Bambara
content: I proposed to my wife at Bambara many years ago so we have a special fondness for this place. We've been going back for years to celebrate our anniversary and had always enjoyed it tremendously. It was always a bit on the pricey side but the customer service and ambiance made the event very special.This year like most, they printed an anniversary message at the top of two menus for us, always a nice touch that helps us remember the dinner. The artful design of the space, with funky lighting, cool furnishings, and open kitchen added to the experience, making us feel like we were truly In a metropolitan city. But the lighting and furnishings had gone through a makeover making the space a little bland and much less interesting in our view.And then the changed menu was a disappointment. Some of our old favorites were gone, and several items were cooked in duck fat. Yuck!  My best summary of the offerings is shishi comfort food from a hunting lodge. Our calamari and shrimp appetizer, was overpriced and perhaps re-fried. It tasted old and even my wife who loves calamari could not get through half the plate. There were exactly two shrimp in the mix of bad tasting calamari. We did mention it to the waiter and they took it off the bill and we re-ordered something else.My wife's overpriced scallop plate had duck fat fried potatoes with four small scallops, all lined up on the one side of the plate, with a "fancy squiggle" of green sauce taking up the other 2/3 of the plate. This gave new meaning to the term "less is more" as in less food and more money. To their credit, as always the food presentation was beautiful. My chicken breast was very good. One of the cheaper à la cart main plates but definitely the best food we were served.I had a draft craft beer which was reasonably priced, but my wife ordered two glasses of their house white wine which turned out to be $18 a glass. Admittedly our bad for not paying more attention to the price, we won't make that mistake again. The white wine was an average California wine certainly less than $18 a bottle at the liquor store. I understand the restaurant business is hard and overhead is high, but the price seemed excessive. Speaking of overhead, at one point I counted 10 staff crowded in the kitchen, that's a lot of overhead for the relatively small number of tables in the restaurant.I'm giving them three stars mostly because the customer service is exceptional, but we agreed as we payed the $200 dinner bill (yes $100/person!) that that might be our last dinner there. I've tried to be fair in this review, but I am left disappointed and mostly sad that we won't be returning to our favorite place to celebrate our wedding anniversary.

name: Bambara
content: One of the worst services I've ever had. Came in around noon for brunch/lunch, left 45 minutes later. Initially, I was seated fairly quickly ~2 mins. Waiter got my order within 5 mins and the food was delivered about 5 mins after that. But after I got my food, I was never once approached for more water or to see how my food was or to even offer a check. Some waiters would pass by but would not even make eye contact as I attempted to get their attention. Each time I asked for water or my check, it was a different waiter passing by. Even after I got my check, it took another 10 mins for someone to walk by so that I could hand it to them. Overall, it took about 15 minutes to get my food and another 20 minutes after finishing just to be able to leave. As a visiting traveler, I was fairly annoyed.However, the food was great.

name: Bambara
content: Nestled within a little hotel, Monaco lies an amazing restaurant, along with a little bar to go along with it. I first came here for a Valentine's dinner about a year before I married my husband. We had the bleu cheese nachos, sounds weird I know, but they are amazing and I don't like bleu cheese! When we got married in October 2011 we stayed at the hotel and while we were in our limo on our way to the hotel, we knew the restaurant would be closed so we order not one but TWO bleu cheese nachos to be sent to our room to await our arrival. We have been back several times after getting married 8 years ago. They know how to prepare a steak like no one else I have ever had. We always get the bleu cheese nachos and the steak with fingerling potatoes, you cannot go wrong with this order!They also have a little bar, and on our last visit for our anniversary we decided to eat at the bar instead of the restaurant and seriously the bar tender took amazing care of us. She bought our bleu cheese nachos and the restaurant made us a special just for us dessert. It was our best experience by far. We will probably always celebrate our anniversaries here from now on because of the great service, past experiences, ambiance, and amazing food!

name: Bambara
content: Love the food here!  Such a creative menu.  The service is great.  I love the bar here and at Christmas they do a Christmas pop up bar called Miracle on 2nd street.  Try the creative cocktails at the pop up bar.

name: Bambara
content: Love the decor, but the holiday drinks were just too spicy. Bartender was super nice, but lady cleaning tables in the red dress, was not in the Christmas spirit. Great ambiance, poor service, drinks not worth $60. Happy holidays.

name: Bambara
content: We've come to Bambara multiple times and have never been disappointed. From drinks to appetizers to mains or desserts they get it right while maintaining creativity. We've sat in the bar on most occasions and service is fast and friendly. Tonight we dined before the theater and they accommodated our short time frame without compromising quality or flavor. I had the scallops which were cooked to perfection and hubby had the elk. Frankly, the elk stole the show. Hubby is a red meat eater while I prefer white meats but we both agreed this elk was simply the best meat we have ever had bar none! I would return and order it again...simply thst good. We ordered the holiday drinks and while pricy they were creative and tasty. No time for dessert this visit but we will return again. This is a go to spot for us.

name: Bambara
content: Incredible service from Francesca! You must try the blue cheese chips! The beet salad is so satisfying! Also the chicken with a side of Mac and cheese is a favorite of my husbands. The pop up Christmas bar was a plus - try the snowball Manhattan!

name: Bambara
content: Not sure what their target market is, but I gather it's clueless out of town people (on expense accounts) who won't mind paying $16 for a Red Rock Elephino beer that you can normally buy for $10 at other restaurants, and $4 at the liquor store.  4X markup?  That's robbery.The rest of the meal followed that same profit margin.  While acceptable, definitely not worth the crazy, inflated prices they are charging.  My gnocchi plate had 10 garlic cloves... they claimed it was poached and seared.  Bahahahah.  It was RAW!

name: Bambara
content: Great atmosphere and ambiance at Bambara.  Started with a variety of starters that were out of this world - fried green beans, calamari & deviled eggs.  Had a wonderful baby green salad with just the right amount of dressing.  Had the elk as my main dish which was good.  The risotto that came with it stole the show.  Only thing missing was bread.  I like some kind of bread with every meal.  For dessert I tried their homemade ice cream sandwiches which were delectable.  Overall a very memorable evening.

name: Bambara
content: I was left with a very good first impression of Bambara.The dining area is inviting and the working environment seemed serene.I ordered the Short Rib Beef Hash and I everything about this dish was great. The eggs were cooked the way I asked. Thew potatoes were neither too hard or soft. It was a hearty dish for a snowy Sunday.The service was also excellent and prompt.Overall I would recommend it even based on a single experience.

name: Bambara
content: We went to Bambara for my birthday brunch. Best Eggs Benedict I have ever had. The hollandaise sauce is perfect and the shoulder bacon is super rich and perfect.  Boyfriend got the brunch burger again super rich and super tasty. My brother had the French Toast. Again super good. My mother enjoyed her dish as well. It's hard to find something EVERYONE LOVES and my family definitely loved everything we ordered. Can't wait to go back for another family brunch.

name: Bambara
content: Extremely disappointing experience. I am a loyal Kimpton customer and heard many good things about this restaurant. I waited for an hour for my entrée to no avail. I informed the hostess upon arrival as well as my waiter that I had a show to catch at 7:30. I waited over a half hour for my salad, and finally left at 7:00 pm without being served my entrée and with no acknowledgement from my server. If the kitchen can't handle the pre-show volume, they shouldn't accept reservations. Ruined my evening. I overheard a gentlemen at the next table over telling the server that he had never waited so long for his meal. (I presume he is a regular at this restaurant.) Go elsewhere or give yourself two hours if you have a curtain to catch.

name: Bambara
content: We now have a new goal when traveling... To seek out the nearest Kimpton Hotel and check out their local restaurant!  This property has Bambara, which offers not only a unique menu and decent wine list, but the same amazing customer service, fresh ingredients and awesome dining experience we've come to love when visiting Brabo in Old Town Alexandria, VA (which we visit often).The server we had was outstanding!  Very knowledgeable, helpful, accommodating and also a Somm!  The kitchen was also very accommodating, as we made a special request with nearly everything we ordered and each was met with an empathic, "Yes!"Some highlights of the meal were:  Their incredibly fresh green beans and asparagus done tempura style - WOW!  Lightly battered and definitely appropriately fried with a savory sauce for dipping.  The Elk Loin was fresh and perfectly prepared, as was the Steelhead Trout!  Each course and each dish was perfectly and independently prepared and done so as not to rush us, rather allow us time to enjoy, sit, sip and nosh.We can't say enough about this place and highly suggest foodies (like us) give it a try!

name: Bambara
content: I had a terrible experience here. Every dish we had was greasy or spoiled or simply flavorless. Service took forever. Maybe it was an off night, but as of this moment I wouldn't recommend this place to any of my friends. I'd much rather send them Manoli's, Pallet, or Valter's. Additionally, I had someone on the staff reach out to me due to by bad review on google. Unfortunately, the staff just said they would pass on my complaints to the chef and they hoped to see me back in soon. The outreach definitely was as disappointing as the initial experience.

name: Bambara
content: I decided to bring in some executives from out of town, and decided on Bambara. We had the pleasure of being sat in Collins section. He was incredibly knowledgeable, and made our dining experience fun! The food was delicious, we had a great time, and I highly recommend this place to anyone.

name: Bambara
content: The cast iron roasted mussels and clams was to die for. So rich and flavorful and cooked perfectly. The restaurant has a laid back romantic vibe and our server was very friendly and knowledgeable of both the food and drink menu.

name: Bambara
content: Every time we come stay at hotel Monaco we also come try out Bambara for brunch and every single time we get let down. Our server disappeared after he took our orders and  forgot about our drinks. Once the food finally came out two of our four dishes were cold (not like sorta cold, they were very cold) we flagged down the host and he was amazing. He took the food back and heated it up, when it came back it was good and toasty warm. It seemed like the host was paying more attention to us than our server, he didn't even know we sent our food back. It also seemed like our server made our hot chocolate and didn't really know how to, the milk wasnt foamed properly and there was barely any chocolate in it. Maybe our server was just having a bad day you never know?

name: Bambara
content: The food here was, hands down, amazing. Every dish we tried made our taste buds dance, and every bite was succulent. The flavors and combinations are unique and the head chef knows what he is doing!

name: Bambara
content: We took my mom here for bunch. Really great food and very accommodating with substitution requests. Great coffee as well! Will return soon.

name: Bambara
content: This place is so good !! We couldn't decide between two dishes so they literally brought us the two to try ! The food and dishes are unique is a really wonderful way , service is amazing and I would highly recommend this place

name: Bambara
content: I had the best server at Bambara! The food was great and the drinks were unique. If you are fine paying $15-$20 for a cocktail this is a great restaurant to go to!

name: Bambara
content: I enjoyed a great meal recently at Bambara.  We were in town for a business meal and our hostess was very accommodating in putting us in a booth where we could talk quietly.Everyone ended up ordering the steaks which were cooked to perfection.  I also ordered the beet salad which was really tasty.  They have a good selection of wines and beers and our server was very attentive.  Note, this restaurant is actually part of a hotel so you have to enter through going into the building first.  They also looked to have a large bar area with nice wood decor so this looks like a great place for drinks too.

name: Bambara
content: The food here is extremely mediocre and is an example of the gastro scene problems across the USA. Glorified hotel food with no love. The potatoes at breakfast were dark brown and very greasy and cold. My omelette had non-melted fontina, raw spinach, and the mushrooms were dry and super funky. I also ordered deviled eggs sent to my room and the potato "chips" were soggy, the carrot ribbons were water logged, and they charged me $20 when the price on the menu was $12. Be careful hotel guests, the dude that delivered me the deviled eggs and a cocktail (which, for both items the bill came to $58.!!!!)- did *not* tell me that the gratuity was included and waited for me to fill out the receipt and tip him. When he left, I saw that gratuity of $7.80 was already included - again, on just deviled eggs and a "old fashioned" cocktail. Not stoked. Not stoked at all. **update** the front desk modified the price and took off the extra charges

name: Bambara
content: I decided to dine at Bambara tonight on a whim and had the most amazing experience. Our server, Collin was a delight and came with plenty of recommendations, including an excellent glass of wine. Erin, the manager, took the time to give her suggestions and make me feel very welcome. I will definitely be back and bring many more food connoisseurs with me.

name: Bambara
content: We ate at Bambara tonight and it was perfection. We had a beautiful table it was quiet private but still open. We had amazing service in many different areas from host to server. I have been here before and have always had a great experience but the Manager Erin was so lovely and attentive. Greeting us making us feel welcome and that we mattered. This is the feeling I get when I come to bambara. I had an amazing glass of pino and blue chips to start. So crisp and savory. My main course was the steak and I must say that the crab and basil mashed potatoes were truly divine. The steak was cooked perfectly. Couldnt be more pleased. It's no wonder I come back over and over again. I bring clients here for buisness and best friends for birthdays. If your looking for a gem in downtown Salt lake you will not find a better place.

name: Bambara
content: I love Bambara. And it is an under appreciated spot downtown. I have yet to have an dinner that wasn't great, or an experience that left me wanting. Staff is tremendous. Food is amazing. And add that to the fact you are located in the best hotel in Salt Lake, located close to so many great walking locations, makes this a go to every time.

name: Bambara
content: Enjoyed a truly delectable grilled flatiron steak Cobb salad at Bambara for lunch.  Every component of this meal was perfectly prepared.  When ordering I was a little suspicious of the $25 price tag, but having now enjoyed this salad I would say that it is completely worth it.

name: Bambara
content: Ok, so this may be the shortest review I've ever written but just happened to pop in for a little night cap before turning in at the Kimpton Hotel Monaco.Decor and ambiance definitely hit the mark.  Our server was exceptional and the wine superb.Peace out.

name: Bambara
content: Really loved this restaurant. My avocado chorizo eggs benedict were perfectly poached and the beets me juice was wonderful. Would definitely order this again!

name: Bambara
content: From an atmospheric standpoint, I really fuck with Bambara. The hotel Monaco, in general, is the perfect marriage of boutique and casual. I like spaces that are well kept, but allow for breathing room. Take for instance the waitstaff at Bambara. Everyone looks uniform, but tattoos and gauges peak through. It operates on a fluid spectrum. You feel me?The dining room consists of an open kitchen (big fan of this), high ceilings, tables, booths and large windows, creating a naturally bright space.Thus far, I've only been here for Brunch, but I've consulted all the menus just to get a feel for the overall offerings. As a vegetarian, lunch and dinner are really limited. Brunch not so much. New American generally seems to focus on taking traditional dishes, with room to color outside of the lines. Lots of great flavor profiles at your disposal. My requirements for service are quite minimal. Were the drinks consistently attended to? yes. Was our waitress available but non intrusive? Yes. Good? Good.As far as I'm concerned, when I see French Toast on the menu, the other choices may as well evaporate into thin air. When I saw "deep fried" in front of it, I nearly gasped. And yes, it was very very good, but to keep it gangster with you, not $14 exceptional. However, I was a fan of the dish presentation itself. These were more or less french toast "sticks". Which allows for a much more gracious way to devour the goodness. The serving size was perfect. Filling--but appropriate. Coffee was also good, although one small complaint I had. The coffee we picked up in the hotel lobby was much warmer than in the restaurant itself...whoops.Based on reviews, dinner seems to be the must have meal here. Although, with so much emphasis on meat dishes, probably not going to be something I try for awhile. All that said, if you're a fan of the New American cuisine, Bambara is a safe bet.

name: Bambara
content: Great place to have lovely food and drink. Erika is an amazing bartender mixing amazing elixirs while engaging in humorous conversation.

name: Bambara
content: One of my favorite restaurants in salt lake! If you're celebrating a special occasion, this place is a treat! The service is excellent here, and the food is amazing. It's got a very classy ambiance. For dinner entrees the steak, and lamp chops are both amazing. I personally have had the steak at least 4 times. The s'more dessert is also excellent!

name: Bambara
content: Was a great dinner two months ago. Loved the blue cheese potato chips, elk and steelhead. Last night was a little disappointing with a salty lamb shank and the steelhead was a little dry. Sake and ginger risotto was delicious as usual. Friend ordered a vodka martini, vermouth was too strong. I would go back again, but would stick to what I know is good.

name: Bambara
content: Beautiful hotel that really needs to up its game at their restaurant. We went for brunch, it wasn't crowded at all but we waited almost 30 minutes for our food. The whole grain pancakes were decent, but this upscale establishment brings syrup in a bottle of store bought (not real) syrup that has dried crusty syrup spilling down the side. My husband got the Bistro omelette and the egg was cooked to almost give that burnt egg taste. My son had the portobello hash. Other than his over-medium egg being cooked to over-hard it was a decent entree (listed on their menu as a "bigger plate"-it wasn't. Service- After our food arrived, we weren't checked on to see how everything was or if we needed anything else (when he came to take our plates at the very end AFTER we were finished he asked how it was then). Sorry we won't be back.

name: Bambara
content: Just okay. Server was very nice and attentive. Wedge salad was solid. Martinis were good but disappointed at no blue cheese stuffed olives. Glass of Cabernet was $22 and was terrible (can't remember the name). NY Strip Steak was fatty and tough. Giant metal basket of fries was an annoying hindrance on the plate. This place could be great with a few minor adjustments.

name: Bambara
content: We ate dinner her with friends and our waiter was fantastic! He was helpful in recommending specific dishes for our desires of the evening and made some custom drinks for us to enjoy. The environment was quiet, even though it was a packed house and it seemed like we were never left wondering when our waiter would be back. We had appetizers, small sides and full dinners and everything was perfect. We ended up ordering more appetizers at the end of our meal because we loved them so much. We will definitely be back for more. I had the risotto, which was fantastic by the way.

name: Bambara
content: The food is absolutely incredible! I had the most delicious brunch and they accommodated my food allergies with ease. The server, Gabee, was so thoughtful and kind. The wine list was perfect and the service was top notch. I'd highly recommend this place!!!

name: Bambara
content: As out-of-towners, the food and especially the staff at Bambara makes this a must-way place. Our server, Gabee, is a personification of Salt Lake's hospitality. She was extremely polite, sincerely attentive, and just made us feel special. The food was fresh, and flavorful! The wine list was top class. Even a menu item that would be "basic" fare had an extra level of attention. For the experience and flavor, the price is more than adequate. Highly recommended!

name: Bambara
content: I've eaten here a few times for breakfast and once for dinner. Overall the experience has been quite good hence my inclination to return.The place looks upscale, nice sophisticated decor, yet not a big restaurant in size. I have to comment, however, that although the booths look nice they are terribly uncomfortable, tight and restricting. Plus the seating is not that comfortable. Get a table!I found the breakfast menu to be broad and comprehensive. I've had the oatmeal, quite good and a nice size filling portion.  Another time I had the bagel and salmon (lox).  It had all the expected accompaniments, including a sliced hard boiled egg. It also came with a good size portion of cream cheese for smearing. I have a fondness for bagel and lox, and it was generally good although the quality of the salmon was a bit off. Another time I had eggs over easy with bacon, potatoes.  What you'd expect.  The coffee is good but weak.  I like strong coffee and SLC seems to lean to weak coffee, unlike the Pacific Northwest or New Orleans.Dinner was very good. Starting with the creamy corn bisque, yummy.  I tried the elk as that is so unusual for me to try. It was cooked perfectly and tender, not too gamey.  It is expensive yet I found it worth the price. The accompaniments were good and appropriate to the dish, creative, including a delicate hash.The wine menu is good and the waiter suggested the red Obsidian with my elk and that was spot on. Rich and full bodied, yet smooth.  Very enjoyable.Service is very professional and friendly.I recommend this restaurant for its atmosphere, good food and nice relaxed feel.

name: Bambara
content: This was a culinary and educational experience.Service and food was fantastic. Will return

name: Bambara
content: Brunch on Saturday: cocktails tiny, avocado toast was a send back.  Looked like peanut butter spread.  Brown and thin.  The short rib hash sounded amazing, was just ok.  Bloody Mary was only worthwhile order.

name: Bambara
content: Had filet of beef, which was well seasoned but on the greasy side to my taste. Service was good. It was a group of four and we waited about an hour and a half for our food. Not sure if that's a typical wait time at an upscale restaurant like this.Starter salad was very good, spring mix with walnuts and honey. Chocolate mousse cake was great as well, not overly sweet.Overall good service. The waitress was attentive. One star off because food was on the greasier side and we weren't prompted on how we would like the steak done.Fantastic wine/drink options too. I didn't have any sip but my company enjoyed it very much and had multiple rounds of the same drink.

name: Bambara
content: Really disappointed the last 3 times we've had dinner.  In the past, Banbara was one of our favorite places to eat. Not anymore. The service was slow and inattentive. The menu selection was very limited and nothing really sounded all that great. It will be a while...if ever before we return.

name: Bambara
content: Came here for a business lunch because of the centralized location and couldn't have been happier with our choice!  I ordered the Grilled steak Cobb salad and having eaten many throughout the Salt Lake Valley this is hands-down my favorite!!  Great service!  Great location and the food was outstanding!

name: Bambara
content: First time here was great, a little pricey, but good food which I'm willing to pay for.  The second time, the bone marrow appetizer did not have the same amount of marrow, and the meal went from there.  None of the food was horrible, and we enjoyed our meal...but for the price I expected more.  Don't skip it, but I hope you get my first experience vs my second!

name: Bambara
content: Only went to have a charcuterie board, and this place definitely is worth it. So convenient that this is restaurant is in the Kimpton hotel!

name: Bambara
content: The food is OK, over-rated, and not great.  The wine by the glass menu is exorbitant, and the pours are short. Overall, the place is a complete overcharge.  The bar is small, busy, and very noisy.  There are many better restaurants in downtown SLC, and there are certainly better values.  Skip it.

name: Bambara
content: Went for a "treat yo self" date night.What we orderedCream corned crab bisque- amazingCalamari- amazingFilet mignon- double amazingLamb- pretty good, wouldnt order againService was amazing as expected

name: Bambara
content: It's been a while since I was here last.  After this visit I am sad it has been so long.  I loved this place on my first visit and I am regretting not coming back sooner.  This place is beautiful and the menu is awesome!  I also really enjoy that the kitchen is open for you to see into.  I love watching the chefs cook.  I came here with my mom and Aunt on a Sunday night.  We were seated immediately.  We chose the dijon deviled eggs and the calamari and shrimp as appetizers.  The eggs were amazing.  I loves the dijon instead of your typical mustard.  The pickled mustard seeds were a nice contrasting almost crunchy texture to the smooth and creamy texture of the eggyolk mixture.  My aunt thought the pickled carrot was ginger, once I told her it was carrot she liked it more because she thought it was a  weird ginger flavor.  The calamari was cooked to perfection and the crunch was awesome!  I loved the tempura shishito peppers, they were so yummy!  The dipping sauce was a great pairing with both the calamari and the shishito peppers. I chose the filet of beef.  I got it medium rare and it came out as I requested.  It was seasoned beautifully.  The black truffle aioli and crispy onions on the beef were superb together.  The leak puree was so good and I loved it with the crispy fingerling potatoes.  It was also super tasty with the steak and aioli.  The whole dish was awesome and I ate the entire thing.  The portion was perfect because most of the time I cannot eat an entire dish.  My mom and Aunt both got the steelhead.  My aunt loves salmon and wasnt sure about the trout.  The waiter helped convince her to get it and she did not regret it.  She even got it medium well as recommended instead of well done.  It had a great flavor and cooked perfect and it was juicy.  Neither my mom or aunt like medium well but they both loved the medium well because of how moist it was.  My mom did wish that the gnocchi brussel sprouts came in a larger portion.  They both loved what they got.  I got a brownie chocolate bowl and it was awesome.  The ice cream and brownies were awesome.  It had a weird but yummy marshmallow that reminded me of what an astronaut might eat.  It was almost powdery but it was a fun texture to add to the bowl.  I am definitely gonna try and come here more often.  I loved everything I had.

name: Bambara
content: If you are in SLC you absolutely MUST go to The Bambara. Brunch, lunch and dinner are exquisite. We had brunch this morning and our server MYKE was literally the best server I have ever had! Cheers and 5 stars!!

name: Bambara
content: Had brunch here with my girlfriend, the food was great!  Gabby recommended the shrimp and grits with bacon, we both liked that a lot.  The atmosphere is cool, we will be back for sure

name: Bambara
content: I want to preface this review by saying that we had  only heard good things about Bambara prior to dining there ourselves. Unfortunately, the restaurant failed to live up to our most reasonable expectations. For starters, Bambara's fried calamari was the most pitiful attempt at fried calamari I have ever encountered. Not only were we served tiny morsels of squid, but almost all of the breading had fallen off by the time the appetizer arrived to our table. The entrees did not fair any better. Both the filet and the elk were completely over cooked and were as tough as an old leather boot. The service, or lack thereof, only made matters worse. This was our first Valentines Day as an engaged couple, and we both wish we would have made other arrangements. Please do not make the same mistake we did. #thankyounext

name: Bambara
content: We were going to the ballet and all other restaurants were completely full. Bamabara serves the whole menu in the bar/lounge area which is walk in only and it worked perfectly!! It was just two of us and we split the blue cheese chips, beet salad and chicken entree. It was the perfect amount of food. They split it in the kitchen without being asked - so helpful! The entrees were huge and I would definitely get the chicken again. Highly recommend (just make sure you have plenty of time before the ballet because the entree took a very long time to come out.

name: Bambara
content: Please check your CC charge. They overcharged me by adding to the already 20% tip that was left. When I spoke with the GM, he was unapologetic... Buyer beware.

name: Bambara
content: Great atmosphere and vibe. Went on a Friday night and were seated quickly. Pork belly, wedge salad and elk were all money. Highly recommend.

name: Bambara
content: Fantastic dining experience. Dinner was on point. The service was exceptional. Catered to our needs and wants without hesitation. The cheese board was awesome, featuring several local cheeses. I love when chefs try and incorporate local foods into the menu. Worth every cent!

name: Bambara
content: good food. wine pours are outrageously lean...especially when the lowest glass price is $14...like this is maybe a 4 oz pour.

name: Bambara
content: I travel to SLC for business and have eaten here twice.  They have a bar area where they can accommodate solo diners.  The first time I had the short rib ravioli.  It was good. Tonight I had the Elk. It was excellent!!  It is pricey, but well worth it.  The waiter paired it with a Merlot that went perfectly with the dish.  I'm not sure what the bad reviews are about.  Both the service and food are excellent.

name: Bambara
content: Reserved the private room off Main Street here for a family party for 21 people.  The room was nice, but chilly. We had to ask more than once to have the heat turned up. I was also very disappointed to find we had one server for all of us.  I give him credit, he did a great job for one person but he definitely needed help. Dishes weren't cleared like they should have been and we weren't even asked if we wanted more wine or other beverages.  The food was okay but not fantastic.  We had many different appetizers and entrees among us.  I had to sign a contract for the room which was fine.  I just wish  the restaurant provided the service we expected of a fine dining establishment.

name: Bambara
content: One of our favorite restaurants in SLC. Tonight our server, Amy, is rocking it as usual. Try the mushroom appetizer. Tell them Mike sent you for a free high five (maybe).

name: Bambara
content: We came here on NYE and thought the food was ok. The service was a bit lackluster. Food was a bit over salted. The best thing was the Cobb salad which wasn't very traditional but I liked it, very fresh. The steak was also cooked to the perfect temp (medium rare). Just seemed like a pretty tired menu and overpriced.  I didn't leave feeling like the value was worth it?

name: Bambara
content: Made reservations for a group of five on a Monday and were seated promptly upon arrival in the back secluded area for bigger groups. Our server was super friendly and helpful. Made suggestions that we tried out and were pleasantly surprised! Everyone in the party enjoyed their meals. I got the seared steelhead and gnocchi dish. The fish was perfectly cooked and had the perfect amount of gnocchi to balance out the meal. Definitely a place to go when you feel like treating yourself to some fancy dining and splurging on a meal.

name: Bambara
content: Great experience at Bambara! I had heard this restaurant is one of the best in Salt Lake but I prefer to eat plant-based. Jacob, our server, said that one of the chefs, Anthony, is vegan and could something together for me. It was perfect! A mix of pumpkin, quinoa with pomegranate, spinach and cooked pear slices with a nice sauce.  My friend had the chicken and couldn't stop talking about how good it was. I asked for a Vesper martini even though it wasn't on the bar menu. No problem, they knew exactly how to make it. Friendly, professional service with a nice atmosphere!

name: Bambara
content: Great atmosphere ! Nice hotel eatery we had breakfast there they were able to get our food out quickly , I had an omelet it was yummy

name: Bambara
content: I have mixed feelings about Bambara. On the positive side: the food was excellent! It is the only reason I am giving a decent rating. We were in a large group who had multiple appetizers, cocktails, entrees, and desserts. Everything was cooked perfectly and plated beautifully. On the not-so-good side: some of the staff was not very friendly. They did not have our reservation, which was made a week in advance. Actually, we called twice regarding our reservation because we couldn't make it online and nobody answered the first time. We also had a very dismissive and unfriendly server. As a group of young professionals in a high end restaurant, we felt judged and unwelcome. Our second server was much more professional and attentive. Another strange thing to note is that we ordered a seasonal cocktail (And a Partridge in a Pear Tree) that was different colors depending on when we ordered it. It tasted the same, but something noteworthy nonetheless. I don't recommend this place for families or for a younger crowd as they clearly do not cater to, nor wish to cater to, developing professionals. I hope Bambara continues to make excellent food and strives to better their versatility for future generations.

name: Bambara
content: Bambara's take on the classic dish, bagel and lox, was delicious. Located in the Hotel Monaco, the restaurant is comfortable and cozy.  Bagel was toastwd perfectly, and all accompaniments were fresh.  Generous and delicious smoked salmon.

name: Nohm
content: Excellent flavorful food. The fried cauliflower was in a yummy sweet-spicy chile and garlic sauce. The savory chive pancake and spicy sauce was great. A stylish place with hip atmosphere.

name: Nohm
content: Very different! My friend and I enjoyed dinner here last weekend and can I tell you, if I was more adventurous then this would be my jam. The service was amazing, atmosphere was welcoming and comfortable, and the whole kitchen staff thanked us when we went out! Highly recommended for all of you adventurous folks!

name: Nohm
content: The food was so yummy at lunch and I heard at dinnertime they grill food over charcoal and is my favorite just thinking about grill. I think is the best Asian food in Salt Lake City. I can't wait to go there next week at dinner time with my fiancé!

name: Nohm
content: We got curbside takeout, and the food was still nice and hot when we got home. Everything was delicious, the portions were perfect and the price was unbeatable. The chicken katsu was extremely juicy and had a beautiful crunch to it. The udon was perfectly al dente, and the veggies were smoky and fresh. Will definitely return, this was one of the best meals I've had in SLC.

name: Nohm
content: This is my new favorite restaurant in salt lake. You're reading this, you've read the other reviews too just do yourself a favor and get down there already. Cain gave us fantastic service and was so helpful working us through the menu. Wish I could give it 6 stars. And water witch is next door how could you go wrong!!!

name: Nohm
content: I am a trained sushi chef and I can say without a doubt this place is hands down the highest quality Japanese food in Utah!  Great price points!  If you don't like this place there is something seriously wrong with you. Chef David is legit!  Thank you for going the extra mile!

name: Nohm
content: do not go here if you're younger and from out of town. we tried to go here for some pre dinner drinks and we're refused service because our ids "looked faked". even after they scanned, we were told they couldn't serve us! there are plenty of places in the downtown area, dont waste your time here.

name: Nohm
content: This could be the best restaurant in the city. It's insanely tasty, it's creative, and it's not the same food you could make at home or order at five other places.Every dish we ordered was interesting and incredibly good. Want something hot, fried (but not over the top), and spicy? They've got that. Feel like a combination of flavors you haven't had before that somehow just work? No problem. Want subtle, fresh, perfectly sliced sashimi? They do that too.Server was super friendly and knowledgable (and very careful about hygiene), owner came out and gave us his favorite dish, and we just couldn't have asked for more. While it's not cheap, we also felt like it was a great value.We'll be back. Cannot recommend it strongly enough!!

name: Nohm
content: Hard to explain how amazing this restaurant was. We ordered 4-5 of the shared plates, 4-5 of the skewers and Ice cream for dessert. And each plate surpassed whatever expectations we had. The flavors were unreal, everything felt fresh yet hearty. Can't explain how much we enjoyed this restaurant. We will definitely be back!

name: Nohm
content: I loved my dining experience at Nohm. The staff wore their masks the entire time and encouraged guests to wear theirs when entering and while using the restrooms. The menu looks like it has changed a little as I didn't see the prefix set anju meal everyone was talking about but the food was so good. We recommend the pork belly skewer! Chicken wing and chicken thigh skewers were juicy too. We also shared the Miro as a small app and the sushi was fresh! I think this is a great date night spot or a place to do a quick girls night dinner.

name: Nohm
content: This was the best dining experience I've had in a while. Food and service were outstanding! This place is a MUST for any real foodies.

name: Nohm
content: The experience was amazing!  Nohm is a gem. If you like to go to a Japanese restaurant and let the chef select (omakase) and/or small plates then this is the place. David crafts the meal. Start to finish. You get a set menu of 5+ courses. Beautiful presentation but also wonderful flavors and textures. Amazing!

name: Nohm
content: Utah is so lucky to have Nohm! Went with a girlfriend last night and the meal exceeded my expectations. Each dish was so beautifully plated and the tastes were phenomenal and so fresh. Not to mention the value of the Anju set menu. We felt like the dishes kept coming out and well we welcomed every single one but we were also running out of space in our stomach.The service was exceptional, David was so kind and accommodating. I can't wait to go back and share such great food with more friends!

name: Nohm
content: Amazing experience all around- they are currently doing a tasting menu that was thoughtfully curated. More than enough food and such a good deal for $45. Everything was delicious and the presentation of the food, including the indoor ambiance, made me feel like we were stealing from Nohm as they should have charged us double for the experience they gave us. Highly recommend- please go and support local biz! Google says not taking dine in but that is not true.

name: Nohm
content: Incredible tasting menu tonight. One of the best meals in SLC. I really enjoyed the sake pairings. All were new to me but incredible. Don't sleep on Nohm.

name: Nohm
content: Salt Lake is lucky to have this place at this price point. I've lived in San Francisco and New York the past decade and Nohm is every bit as wonderful as my favorite restaurants there. The food is outrageously tasty. Lots of wonderful textures, temperatures and flavors in the dinner Anju set. For how much food comes with Anju set, $45 is a total steal. This would cost double anywhere else. The service is impeccable. David is incredibly kind and down to earth. We will definitely be back! These guys are new and opened just before the pandemic - go support them so we can keep them in SLC forever!

name: Nohm
content: Wow! I was pretty blown away by Nohm. This is probably one of SLC's best new spots. And they are open for dine in! We had the prie fix Set menu and it was incredible for the price. A salad came out with homemade crispy tofu and 4 or 5 types of pickles. Then an omakase small raw plate of big eye tuna, shrimp and mackerel. A set of charcoal skewered rib eye, chicken and asparagus. Plus a set of Katsu vegetable skewers and a small plate of spicy eggplant and tofu. All of the food was some of.the best I've had in SLC and beautifully prepared and plated. If you like Japanese food, they really know what they are doing here. We asked them to pair it up with Sake and the glasses we had were perfect.

name: Nohm
content: This foodie says, no matter who you are,No matter where coronavirus takes you in lifeAt some point you're going to needSome place like Nohm to help appease the hunger in you..Oh yeah! Oh my darlin' Nomn, please keep grilling delicious skewers for me!No matter who you are, no matter where coronavirus takes you in lifeYou gon' need some place like Nohm to help appease the hunger in you.No matter how much water bottles you got, or the toilet paper you got,You gon' need some place like Nohm to help appease the hunger in you.When the night has come, and the store aisles are empty,And that Costco line is the only sight you see.No I won't be afraid, no I-I-I won't be afraidJust as long as the chefs at Nohm welcome me.Darlin' darlin' grill the whole menu for me, ooh grill the whole menu for me Oh grillGrill grill all of it for me C'mon grill for me, grill for meIf the grocery markets that we buy stuff fromWell should tumble and fallAnd the online stores should mark up their prices to the TI won't cry, I won't cry, no I won't she'd a tearJust as long as some place like Nohm help appease the hunger in me.Darlin' darlin' grill the whole menu for me, ooh grill the whole menu for me Oh grillGrill grill all of it for me C'mon grill for me, grill for me-Sailor out

name: Nohm
content: Excellent food excellent service. The Izakaya style of eating is really a fun way to dine out. Grab a couple skewers, some raw stuff, maybe a beer or some sake, and order more if yuh feel like it! I also find it especially Cool you can see the station where they grill the skewers over binchotan coals.  I especially recommend then "chicken neck skewers as well as anything raw!
