Did I mention they're open late night? It's impossible to find food of this quality late night in SLC. you're totally missing out if you haven't experienced NOHM yet!

name: Nohm
content: Soooo good! Such a great addition to the neighborhood, the perfect date night or late night spot (they serve food til midnight - good food is hard to find in slc past 9pm.) The menu changes daily I think but as of right now I would highly recommend the chive pancake, spicy fish salad & the chicken neck skewers! We also had an amazing shareable plate with bean sprouts, mushrooms & asparagus. This is the place to be - you would be hard pressed to find better quality food elsewhere!

name: Nohm
content: Expensive for mediocre americanized asian food. Ordered all the shareable items on the menu for 3 people and were still hungry. The portions are small for the price you pay. Mixed drink tasted like liquor mixed with water. Overall 4/10

name: Nohm
content: This place is somewhere you would visit for a drink with friends and eating small dishes. The food was really bland and boring. I didn't really enjoy it, but I could understand people that would. For how much you pay what you get is the atmosphere and environment. I was here for good food not environment. I wish I could rate this higher, but the food is just so bland. The best thing was the stuff that taste like poke!

name: Nohm
content: My husband and I thought it would be fun to try and we are glad we did. I'm a fan of the foods magnificent flavors. The drinks were great kinda pricey. We started with oysters. They were Kusshi oysters we didn't like them. I thought I wouldn't because I didn't like them in the past. So no third chance for I am a Kumamoto oyster devotee for life. We ordered a Sapporo and a Chu-High. I thought the Chu-High was okay but not my jam. The chicken thigh skewers were juicy the chicken tender was more dry and the pork was good but I thought the flavor of the sauce overwhelmed it. The special charcoal adds the perfect flavor without out being to strong. I ordered Itamemono - Shishito yummy it had bean sprouts and pork belly I recommend this dish. I think my husband thought it should have more pork belly. Anytime pork belly is involved I want more so I agree with him. I ordered 2 sakes the Rihaku (dreamy cloud) Nigori always good and Kikusui Junmai Ginjo also delicious. The set up for the sake isn't a carafe you get a 3.5 pour in a xlg shot glass filled to the brim. Bochum Asian Chive Pancake the best green onion pancake I've ever had. The Bokum Spicy Rice Cake has Gochugang sauce with dumpling and fish cake. This dish was impressive not to spicy I could handle it and I'm not to brave. I didn't like the fish cake but it was easy to get around and my husband liked it. The atmosphere is nice they offer bar seating.    They have gender neutral bathrooms.

name: Nohm
content: The interior is clean and modern yet somewhat dark. There were only a few other tables there around 8:30pm on a Wednesday evening. Our Server, Soph, was awesome and was exceptionally helpful in explaining various menu items.We started with a few drinks and a couple oysters. I got a Sapporo and my wife tried the Chu-High mixed drink. The Kusshi Oysters were not our favorite. They had a fairly strong tinny flavor. My wife also didn't really enjoy here Chu-High, I think mostly because of the Barley ShoChu. It was prepared well and looked nice, it just wasn't for her.Then we ordered one each of the Chicken Thigh, Chicken Tenderloin and Marinated Pork Skewers. Next time we'll be sure to order in pairs if we intend to share. They are a pretty small portion. The flavors on each were distinct, deliberate and very interesting. The Marinated Pork had a sauce that had a strong Cumin flavor, which was too much for my wife, but it was definitely one of my favorites. The Chicken Tenderloin was a bit dry and overall my least favorite. The Chicken Thigh was very juicy and delicious, the special charcoal they use is noticeable while not being overpowering at all.Then we had the Itememono (Shisito Peppers, Pork Belly and Bean Sprouts). Again, the flavor was very distinct. Throughout we were impressed by how different each item tasted and how intentional all the flavors seemed. My only complaint with this dish is that I would have liked a little more Pork Belly.At this point we were ready for another round of drinks and I got the Kikusui Sake. My wife got the Dreamy Clouds Sake. The Kikusui is crystal clear, and has a very clean and light flavor. One of the better Sakes I have had although I prefer Hakutsuru (not on the menu) but they are very similar in flavor. Dreamy Clouds is one of my wifes favorites, it is very nice and has a cloudy appearance and a bit of a creamy flavor. They do not provide carafes for the sake but instead bring the empty 3.5oz glass to the table and pour the sake there right up to the brim.We finished with 2 skewers of the Enoki, Buchim (Green Onion Pancake),  and the Bokum (Spicy Rice Cake). I really enjoyed the Enoki, small Mushrooms wrapped in Bacon. Umm. My wife really likes Green Onion Pancakes and said this one was the best she has had. The Spicy Rice Cake was awesome. Spicy but not too much. My wife, who is pretty sensitive to spicy food was able to eat it no problem.This place is not cheap. We had a great time and we will most likely come back, but the cost will be a consideration for sure. I provided some pictures of the current menu but it changes frequently.

name: Nohm
content: We had a fun here! The food and service were great. They just opened and are busy. Reservations are recommended.

name: Nohm
content: Great lunch - curated small menu, awesome portion sizes! Everything sounded good, ended up picking the Chicken Katsu.Open 12-2 for lunch

name: Nohm
content: Nohm is a pretty cool new place for bar food in SLC. Located in the hip area of central 9th and neighboring Laziz Kitchen, it certainly matches its neighbor when it comes to taste. We came in on a late Friday night, ordered Nimono and Sundae in the shareables, both I do recommend. Sundae (squid) is probably the better one with very good grilling and mayonnaise-based sauce underneath. Nimono is a soup that fills the heart on the cold day. For the single grill sticks we had chicken hearts, neck and enoki. The neck and enoki come out amazing and would be something I would reorder. The other one is not as impressive. Certainly the drinks are special with Japanese sake and beer selection. This is the place that you should eat something else before coming here because it's definitely gonna break the banks if you come hungry because the portion size are tiny and usually they are to accompany the drinks.

name: Nohm
content: Seems like they stopped their lunch serving on saturday. Too bad. Its the only day I can have a lunch date with my daughter. We had katsu and oyako don. Portions are smaller than other SLC places but to us just fine and tasty. Nice mountain view.

name: Nohm
content: Absolutely pricey, 3 pieces of mushroom BBQ is 3$ .chicken heart 3.5$ which is per pound in supermarket.and spicy noodle is deathly spicy,they don't ask how spicy you want . It makes you sick ,had to stay in bathroom all night. I don't recommended.

name: Nohm
content: We were looking for a new restaurant and to try something different on Valentine's Day. Nohm served the Valentine's Day menu. We had the grilled skewers, the blue fin tuna, rice cakes, and the pork shanks. The skewers are a must try as well as any raw dish. Flavors are complex and different with an innovative menu. The restaurant is modern, service is fast. We had a great experience. Plenty of parking space in the area. Be ready for something different!

name: Nohm
content: Loved this spot!  If you can't resist tasty grilled bites (and goddamn it, I sure can't!), Nohm is the spot for you!  Specializing in izakaya-style bar bites grilled over charcoal, Nohm has taken over the stylish industrial space formally occupied by Meditrina.  On the menu are roughly a dozen selection of skewers---mostly chicken parts, including the wings, oyster, heart, gizzard and neck.  Each is beautifully cooked---with a crispy char on the exterior, yet succulent inside---and demonstrate a range of textures and flavors.  An excellent selection of seafood (oysters, bluefin tuna, yellowfin tuna and mackerel) is on offer.  Bigger plates influenced by Korean cuisine are also available.  We chose the delicious spicy rice cakes---a Korean version of gnocchi.Nohm has a pleasant selection of wines by the glass and by the bottle at reasonable prices as well as an extensive list of sakes and beer.  I wish they had a few cocktail selections, too.Be forewarned that snacking your way through the menu can carry a significant price tag.  We paid roughly $120 for a glass of wine, roughly a dozen small dishes and one main.  Service was friendly and helpful.  The restaurant can get quite crowded, so be prepared to be patient as the kitchen prepares your meal to order.Nohm is a wonderful bar snacking companion to Water Witch, located just next door.  You can take your food over to the bar to enjoy there, but unfortunately, one cannot carry cocktails over to Nohm.

name: Nohm
content: We were looking for something different before an evening event and saw the good reviews for this new place on 900 south. We had the Spanish mackerel, rice cake, and squid "shareables" and a mix of the skewers. Everything was delicious. The service was attentive. We enjoyed the experience and we will be back.

name: Nohm
content: A+ all around. We ordered the bluefin, mackerel, squid, pork shank, and assortment of chicken skewers. High quality food prepared with care, service was great, and ambiance gives a classy big city feel. Rare to find a place like this in SLC. We'll be back and will be spreading the good word~p.s. I was also informed that a private event room will be available soon for business events. They are also planning dessert options as well.

name: Nohm
content: Really one of the best new restaurants in SLC, hands down. They have all the best Korean and Japanese dishes, cooked perfectly and just the right variety of options. Don't let the menu confuse you, the servers are very helpful and professional. Good drink choices too. We had a bit of a wait, and you can expect to pay for the quality. I loved the grilled mackerel, bossam, and both moris. I will be going back as soon as I save up some $$

name: Nohm
content: Do yourself a favor..... and go try this Japanese restaurant. It was absolutely delicious! Everything is house-made, fresh, and authentic. My favorite was the mori (chefs choice) sashimi, Asian chive pancake, and the miso mackerel. The fish quality/variety was great. Price point was also very reasonable. Last thing... service was excellent. We will definitely be back soon.

name: Nohm
content: Nohm is incredible and they are just getting started. I can't wait to see what else they are going to be rolling out. Truly unique, delicious, authentic small plates, great alcohol pairings and an incredible lunch value, I'd gladly pay more for their ramen, tonkatsu, curry udon lunch specials. Do yourself a favor and put it on your list to visit soon. Salt Lake is lucky to have Nohm on the 900 South corridor and being next to Water Witch this place is a guaranteed good night out

name: Nohm
content: i forget to take picture with the others food but is really really good and  very clean restaurant you must try in here .

name: Nohm
content: So excited to see a modern izakaya in Salt Lake! The ambience is cozy and modern. The food was absolutely delicious and the service was stellar! Definitely will come back!

name: Nohm
content: Just what SLC needed: izakaya-style seasonal small plates, yakitori, and asian comfort foods to snack on with a delicious beer or sake. We sat by the charcoal-inspired wood panel walls which was great to people watch from but next time we go we'll sit at the bar to watch the magic happen by the kitchen. The aroma of a smoky charcoal while the kushiyaki cook to perfection is incredible. All the skewers were delicious but my favorites were the chicken oysters, pork shoulder, and mushrooms. Definitely getting the chive pancake and the chicken rillette as starters when we go again. Yum! Great location, service was fantastic, perfect place to hangout for a late night drink and amazing food til midnight!

name: Nohm
content: We tried 6 dishes and everything was unique and flavorful. The atmosphere is very modern. The menu can be hard to understand at first but our server was great and walked us through. Most dishes are small plates of one thing, like three pieces of sashimi, or a skewer of four pieces of meat or vegetables. There are a number of larger dishes that could serve as a small meal for one person or good to share. The fried squid was super yummy, as was the picked vegetable starter.   As with most Japanese food, most dishes were quite salty, so it would have been nice to have a dessert to finish it off.  The menu isn't large, but they said they change it often.

name: Graffiti Bao
content: The Hallpass concept is really unique and a nice addition to the SLC area. Graffiti Bao is mildly flavored so if you are afraid to try this because of spice, fear not! Prices are a little high but worth the unique experience every once and a while.

name: Graffiti Bao
content: The food was OK but I was disappointed with the Bao Bun, which really was more of a somewhat fluffy taco. My main reason for the rating is that albeit promoted here as offering curbside, we called and were told it's takeout only. So we had to walk in (usually not a huge deal), but it's a Covid party in there. Mask wearing is not even closely enforced and all the cool kids were not wearing their mask. During a pandemic pretty much the worst experience possible. It wasn't clear where to pick up the food at all, so we had to spend more time in there than we ever wanted. We will take our money elsewhere.

name: Graffiti Bao
content: Was visiting SLC and decided to try this place when we found Hall Pass. Ambiance is really cool for this shop and Hall Pass in general. We got a total of 4 dishes and the only one two that stood out where the fries and the samosas. The noodle bowel looked amazing but somehow lacked flavor. Same for the dumplings. Overall food was a little cold when our number was called. Really wanted to like this place but it just didn't do it unfortunately.

name: Graffiti Bao
content: Broke out of my rut to order delivery from somewhere new. I had the Thai beef samosas and rice bowl with tofu. The samosas are crispy but not at all greasy and served with a light but tasty dipping sauce and veggies, including hot peppers on the side. The bowl was white rice with pickled ginger, bok choy and some broccolini, roasted corn and what I think is enoki- a little mushroom. What I love about Vietnamese cuisine is that you can really taste the vegetables and the flavors and textures complement and that was the case here as well. The tofu was so good - it probably had been fried because it had the delectably chewy texture folks who like tofu like and those who don't like tofu also like.  I gave 4 not 5 stars because $14 for the tofu bowl seems a little expensive to me with only three chunks of tofu, but the restaurant business is tough and I still have some leftover for lunch tomorrow. Recommend giving it a try!

name: Graffiti Bao
content: This place is the best! I literally dream about their crispy spring rolls. They opened recently and I have tried a few things. Everything has been tasty.

name: Graffiti Bao
content: I'm a big fan of HallPass. I love having a lot of choices under one roof, and right now, I like that the roof is pretty spacious and you can eat out and still keep plenty of space between you and others. I was stoked to see a new addition to HallPass, with the introduction of Graffito Bao a few months ago. They have an Asian-inspired menu and of course offer a few varieties of bao buns to stay true to their name. The menu is pretty simple, and pretty slick.We opted for the namesake and ordered pork belly bao buns. It's an order of two, with cucumbers, jalapeños, and some slaw. They're sweet, but pork had just a touch of crisp and the spice cuts through the sweet a little. I wish the slaw had a bit more crunch, as the buns and pork both are pretty soft, but the cucumbers to lend a bit of that so it rounds out the experience. An order of two is $8.We also ordered the Vietnamese rolls, which were served with lettuce, Thai basil, mint, carrots, and pickled onions. Such a fun combo and even though the delivery was a bit clumsy (despite following the kind instructions of the staff) it's a really great balance of flavors when it all comes together. I think it was around $10, and together with the bao it was enough for dinner--but we did still have room fore dessert.They have a few bowls, a teriyaki dish, and a soup that all looked very promising. Service was pretty quick, as it was a slow Thursday night. We got our food, found a table away from the cold of the doors, and really enjoyed eating in somewhere while the Jazz beat the Hawks on the TV and Post Malone (the artist, not the building post in the space that is named Malone) played on the sound system. Servers from Beer Zombies were attentive, even though we weren't drinking.Having been a fan of HallPass since pre-day one, I'm excited to see a new concept come in. Once we can go out more often, I'm hopeful that this will become the norm so there are new places to eat all of the time. Graffiti Bao is a perfect example and a great fit.

name: Graffiti Bao
content: We were the only people at HallPass on a Sunday and it took about 20-30min. Took a while for only 3 items.

name: Graffiti Bao
content: Another Asian fusion spot that just opened @Hallpass in Gateway, I've had them in Las Vegas and I was surprised they have the same as good service and food.  They have DELICIOUS vermicelli bowls, Pho and my favorite is the Bao Bun ! I'm coming back for the Spicy Basil Eggplant and more. Happy that we have it here now in SLC.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I've had a lot of ramen all over the country, and this was an unexpected gem. Great food, service, and the drinks weren't too expensive either. Highly recommend the Umami Bomb!

name: Ramen Bar
content: This is my favorite restaurant in Utah and I've lived here my whole life. AMAZING FOOD. Super, super quick service, and a really nice atmosphere. They also have great customer service here. Best ramen in Utah hands down.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I came here because Takashi has an hour wait and I was starving! It was cold and snowy so I was also in the mood for something warm. They did not disappoint!! I've only had ramen a handful of times in my life, but this place was excellent. The vegetarian broth wasn't too salty. The noodles were a little too mushy for my taste but I loved all the mix ins, like corn... gave it a nice variety of flavor. Definitely would come back. I would've taken  a pic but it's dark af in there! I guess it's the vibe

name: Ramen Bar
content: You can order appetizers by piece here- which makes it easy to taste and try. We ordered:Spicy pork - good stuff!Spicy wing - liked itFried gyoza - loved itFor the vegetarians :)Veggie ramen + extra broth (to share between 2, the yam noodles were delicious! Really tasty, one of the best in town for vegetarians! (I've tried Jinya, La Cai , ramen 930 and Tosh's) the only place I've enjoyed equally more is Mr. Shabu's spicy veg hot pot)Edamame - good, the usual

name: Ramen Bar
content: I ordered Umami Bomb Ramen, and boy was it delicious!!!I was seated quickly and the order arrived in just a few minutes. Great ramen!

name: Ramen Bar
content: Noodles and calamari were good. Waited a bit for water refills and our ticket. Would come back though.

name: Ramen Bar
content: This is some of the best Ramen I've eaten. The staff is super nice and the service is quick. I would definitely recommend that you visit this establishment

name: Ramen Bar
content: Awful service. Ok ramen. My order was wrong, then in my corrected order the egg was cold and we were charged incorrectly.

name: Ramen Bar
content: After a bad experience at a previous restaurant, we walked around to find this wonderful Ramen Bar. The food was absolutely amazing, and this is for sure the best Ramen we all have had. The flavors are divine and they accommodate to taking things out of your order if you don't want a particular food in it. I ordered the Umami Ramen, and I asked for non-spicy pork belly (which I received and it was delicious). They have hand sanitizer at each table and the staff wears masks at all times. Wonderful atmosphere and service! I wish I could rate this place more stars.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Got the spicy pork and the gyoza. They both blew my mind. I feel like i don't need to say anything else, except that my boyfriend has tried to go back to get the same thing three times this week. He's in love with ramen bar and you will be too. Kind staff, fairly clean restaurant, decent pricing. Amazing ramen.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Found this place while visiting Salt Lake City and the food and service here are EXCELLENT!! Cozy atmosphere, very reasonable prices, what else can you ask for? I will definitely come back when I have a chance.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Ramen Bar is the best ramen in Salt Lake City! I usually get their Pork Tonkotsu or the Spicy Porn Tonkotsu. The staff is awesome and kudos to the chef! I would recommend Ramen Bar over any other place in town.

name: Ramen Bar
content: My husband and I really enjoyed this place. It was a short wait to be seated and then again to place our order but the waitresses were hustling to accommodate everyone and get people seated quickly. Once our order was placed we received our ramen quickly and it was delicious. Both orders were packed with flavor, hot, and fresh.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Friend visited from out of town and wanted to get something warm while having a few drinks... and so I stumbled upon Ramen Bar. Walking in, it's nothing impressive. A few tables and 2 counter top seating areas that proved to be covid safe, even while dining indoors. The staff were friendly and got us seated immediately. Food was good, was it amazing - no. It'd be unfair to judge their ramen because I had never gone to any other ramen spots in slc, but their noodles were up to expectations - chewy and perfectly cooked. Their broth was great and definitely their well deserved star of their menu. As for their appetizers, I thoroughly enjoyed their dumplings and blistered shisito peppers, but their chicken wings were dry and more like jerky. Overall a good experience, but I'd have to change up their rating in the future after visiting more ramen spots in SLC! Btw, save room for their Honey Toast. Extremely simple but is overwhelmingly generous and a perfect sweet ending to a full umami meal

name: Ramen Bar
content: The ambiance: We went on a Saturday night at 8:00pm, and while busy, we were seated immediately at a cozy table. It was quite dark inside, but not in a dim and damp way. It was more so like a club or bar feeling. The accent lighting made the place feel calm and inviting amidst tables buzzing with conversation,. I especially appreciated the lighting against the warm brick and high, exposed rafters. The service and food: In addition to being seated immediately, we were immediately brought waters and able to put in an order. We got a hot sake for the table, which was so smooth and comforting after our cold walk to the restaurant. I did not like my Lemon Drop Sake cocktail, as it was a bit too sweet and the sake flavor was overpowering. This was my first time eating ramen, so I don't have the ability to compare it to other restaurants or ramen experiences (besides the 99 cent grocery store packets, which definitely is not the same). I only say that for context, but for my first experience, I was blown away by the pure flavor and volume of food. I am a sauce girl. I put sriracha and ketchup on most everything. But this was one of the first times that I did not desire additional sauce with my meal. All three of us ordered and devoured the veggie ramen. The clear noodles were super slurpable, and the corn added some crunch to bites that otherwise just contained broth and shallots. I personally did not like the way the tofu was fried, as the inside of the tofu lacked flavor and a moisture/texture I would have expected of tofu in soup. I would have loved some more hearty vegetables in the ramen, as I ate the whole thing and was pretty hungry three hours later (which is unusual for me). Overall, this was a great experience, and I would go back here. Especially for their $1 chicken wing or $1 gyoza! That is a great trick if you want to get drinks at a restaurant in Utah, which requires you order food if you order alcoholic drinks.

name: Ramen Bar
content: The Umami Bomb was amazing and flavorful! We were seated outside and had a wonderful meal, would 10/10 go again.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I love this place. The atmosphere is dark and cozy, kinda giving that date-night feel while not being overtly romantic, and food is absolutely delicious. I totally recommend the honey toast dessert and the calamari appetizer. As far as ramen goes... I have a hard time choosing because they're all really good. I especially enjoy the curry udon - it has a thick, hearty broth... almost stew-like in consistency, making it a favorite for those colder days where you're craving something to warm you up. Love it!Their other ramen offerings are just as good - more of what you'd expect from typical ramen with thinner noodles and broth. The ramen eggs are just perfectly done. At first, both my boys were like "Eww! Brown eggs?" And I had to describe how ramen eggs are made and how they're full of umami flavor. Once they worked up the courage to eat the "not white" eggs, the boys LOVED it too. They're always asking when we can go back to the Ramen Bar.

name: Ramen Bar
content: The food was delicious, the staff was amazing, & the whole vibe of the place was peaceful & fun! I would recommend it to everyone I meet. It's definitely the new spot.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Not only did the cook not wear his mask correctly, he took it off and walked by the patrons without it while the patrons were eating. I won't be going back.

name: Ramen Bar
content: The food was great loved the customer service but the place it self needs working, when me and my friends went in, it smelled really bad like moldy or something, I really couldn't enjoy my food since the smell was all over there place. But overall it's a great ramen place .

name: Ramen Bar
content: Excellent little ramen spot and nice staff. Gave me vibes of being back in Japan. The flavored sake was awesome! Cool Decor as well. Downside was they weren't answer their phones which was a bit annoying since we wanted to make sure we could get a table (covid Friday night) or maybe even order take out. When asked on arriving they said they don't answer the phone when they are busy.. Unacceptable to me not to mention they were NOT busy and was no wait to sit down.

name: Ramen Bar
content: So I stopped off here for lunch on my way to Ogden and the food was ok. It all came across as ready made ramen and I didn't get a feel for any authenticity. The curry udon was a store bought mix you can find at any Walmart and while it was filling I never got that great feeling you get with a good ramen shop. The gyoza were ok but they didn't have any dipping sauce or even soy sauce. It's basically a hipster spot more then a ramen shop

name: Ramen Bar
content: Delicious ramen and great outdoor seating!! Would definitely recommend. Service was great too and accommodated half our group being 45 minutes late.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Such a cute place! Good vibes. Definitely Americanized and not super authentic, but tbh that's what most people want anyway!! If you like food that most people like, this is a safe bet for you. Oh and GREAT cocktails. I don't even love sake, but yummmmm.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Fun location , great food and kaden was our waiter and he was awesome. Will be going again very soon

name: Ramen Bar
content: Hands down best ramen in the area! I am vegetarian so I have only tried their veggie ramen, but it is so freaking good. The broth is super savory and delicious, and each ingredient has a unique flavor like they are all cooked separately before being added to the broth. If that sounds obvious I can tell you I've had ramen where you could tell that the ingredients were just added to the broth without any prior preparation, unseasoned and completely tasteless. Also it should be noted that I have never actually tried the purple yam noodles, I always sub the classic noodles, so I can't speak to how those taste. In addition to their delicious food, I have had FANTASTIC customer service every single time I have dined in, ordered takeout, and even when ordering through third parties like Grubhub. They are so friendly and sweet and knowledgeable and accommodating and professional. Love love love this place!!!

name: Ramen Bar
content: Wife and I found this place on Yelp as we were in downtown SLC tonight.  We were seated immediately in their sidewalk patio area with socially distanced tables.  Service was super friendly.  Our ramens were delicious from the rich creamy broths to the tasty and tender pork slices that wasn't too fatty and just the right amount of skin.  I also enjoyed their plum wine fizz cocktail that was light and refreshing and complemented the rich ramen broth perfectly.  Go try it!!

name: Ramen Bar
content: We went here as it was rated one of the best Ramen places in SLC. And it was really good, but the noodles didn't absorb as much broth as other ramen places I've been too. They tasted bland in comparison, which brought the dish down for me. Otherwise, we really enjoyed it. The Umami bowl was perfect if you like a bit spicy, and they have really good sake cocktails to pair with the ramen.

name: Ramen Bar
content: My friend has recommended this place and I can honestly say this is the best ramen I've had in a long time. I ordered the Umami Bomb which was delicious and filling. The servers were also very nice and the location is nice if you want to walk around downtown. My only complaint is that they didn't have ice and the water wasn't that good so I ordered a Squirt which comes in a glass bottle. Overall though, I would try this place out if you're looking for some savory ramen.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Food was less than ok, the noodles were flavourless, the egg was super salty, there was no AC or fans  in this hot  summer day (they just had the door opened) service was bad, they never refilled the water cups, I had to stand up to get a container to go and to pay the bill. I understand they were switching shifts but at least there should be some courtesy especially when we were 1 of the 2  tables and we were a table of 6 not 2 like the other table. Still gave them a tip for working during this time, but I will definitely not go back, did I mentioned there was a public restroom smell in the whole place... :/

name: Ramen Bar
content: I had this place bookmarked for well over a year and finally got around to giving this place a visit. The restaurant itself is rather small and only has a few tables but every single one of these tables were filled and I can understand why. The servers were all really kind and attentive.The menu is pretty small and only has a few items which I actually prefer because there are less options to choose from. I tend to play it safe and stick with the Tonkotsu but there were a few other items that sounded really good as well that I'd love to go back and try. Many of their Ramen dishes have corn in them which was something I hadn't had in my Ramen before and it was so good! While I can't say it was the best Ramen I've ever had, it is definitely up there if you're looking for some good Ramen in Salt Lake City.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Really fantastic food, and the service is always top notch as well. If I had one comment it would be to chill the water being given first rather than just the chilled bottle but that doesn't take from the experience in any way.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I have had ramen from many places in town and I think Ramen Bar is just not really worth it for the price and the quality of the food. Their price is pretty standard for slc but the food is overly salty and seasoned. We ordered spicy ramen, umami ramen, Gyoza, and chicken wings. The pork in the ramen and eggs are overly salty. The wings have some fishy taste and overly saucy. The only thing that are acceptable are the broth and the Gyoza, though the Gyoza is very Americanized and came with some sort of fried sauce instead of the traditional dipping, which could be good after eating couple of them and getting use to that texture. Overall, we regret spending that much money there and we do not recommend this place.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Very solid ramen place! Some very good quality ramen, I personally felt that some of flavors were overpowering one another but other than that it was very enjoyable! I love the look and feel of the place! One of my favorite food places!!

name: Ramen Bar
content: Did not disappoint. Had this delivered to our house. They gave us a call to let us know some of the items we orders were no longer on the menu; That was a nice courtesy. My husband loves there pot stickers. Always crave this place on a Monday, of course, the day they are not open.

name: Ramen Bar
content: The food at the Ramen Bar is really good.  My go-to is the tonkatsu or spicy tonkatsu, depending on how I'm feeling.  What really makes this place is its incredible atmosphere.  For a small space, it never feels overcrowded, and is surprisingly quiet and comfortable.  The dark lighting makes it that much more enjoyable.  Although there's typically a wait on weekends, it's definitely worth it.  The only downside is parking, but that's what you get with downtown restaurants.  The staff are not only incredibly kind and friendly, but they are more than accommodating to their guests.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Ordered takeout like 30 min before they closed, but they were super nice (and fast) and it was sooo delicious. Some of the best soup I've had in my life!!! I ordered the veggie ramen and it was SO good especially for being veggie. Yum.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Probably one or the best ramen I've had in a long time. Must try the Gyozas and chicken wings! Delicious

name: Ramen Bar
content: I tend to judge a ramen place by the quality of the tonkotsu, because it's sort of the standard ramen. Everyone can make it, but not everyone makes it well. Ramen bar's tonkotsu definitely passes the test. The broth is creamy with just the right amount of salty, the wavy noodles are chewy and plentiful, but the real highlight is the pork belly. Super tender and delicious.I really like the location and the vibe of this place as well, right in a convenient downtown spot, where you can sit facing the street. I'll definitely be back here.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I thought this place was fantastic. Went on a Friday night so it was pretty busy but the service was quick & friendly. I got the Veggie ramen with regular noodles because I don't need GF. It was one of the best veggie ramens I've ever had. Most places don't put enough veggies or flavor in their vegetation options but this place did great. The broth tasted wonderful & all the veggies that were in it worked very well. I only wish I lived closer to this place because I would go all the time. Definitely will be back though.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I stopped in for dinner while in town for work and since it's February and freezing I thought ramen would be perfect. It's a rather small and quaint place but being a solo diner I found a spot at the bar and didn't have to wait. I tend to lean towards shoyu ramen so although I was torn between that and the tonkatsu, I opted for the shoyu. It had a delicious, rich broth along with tender pork and the perfect textured noodles. My only complaint was my egg was overcooked in my opinion but otherwise it was a great meal and very filling.

name: Ramen Bar
content: This place is Amazing compare to the other Ramen shop in the mountain west area. I personally from NYC moved to Utah around a year ago. Have to say compare to NYC is pretty dam hard to find a good Ramen shop in Utah. This place is one of the more legit one I found. Is hard to say how good it is on a nation wide scal I feel like is unfair for them to compare with place like ichran or Ippudo, just my personal feeling of this place is definitely one of the best Ramen shop in this area, the noodle is legit, the pork belly  tastes awsome.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I was visiting salt lake for a few days and had been dying to try some ramen and this was the closest to us downtown. The restaurant itself is kind of small but cozy! We went around  6pm on a Sunday and it wasn't busy at all. Our server was a little bit too serious, didn't really smile and was a bit monotone but she was still "nice". Our food was good but for the price we're paying & compared to the competitors I felt like the portion size should have been more. Regardless it was still good and should try it if your in the neighborhood.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Oishi!!!! Unparalleled flavor in broth alone!   Highly recommend!  Low lighting, great service, chill trap music, amazing food.  Haven't tried a dish I didn't love.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I loved this ramen place! I came here for lunch during the week since it was close to where I was working. The place is modern and chic with a mix of bar seats and tables. I tried the kimchi and Umami bomb ramen. The kimchi was good and not too overpowering. The ramen was definitely the star of the meal though. The broth was very rich and flavorful with good spices and tons of topping. This was probably the best ramen I've tried. The soup had a lot of thinly sliced pork, ground park, scallions and seasoned mushrooms that are marinated in a sweet sauce (sounds odd, but really good with the other flavors). The whole dish was very good and I would be happy to return heere on another cool day for more ramen.

name: Ramen Bar
content: 10/10I'm from California and was craving ramen. This place exceeded my expectations! I got gyoza and wings ($1 each) both very good! I got Pork Tonkotsu but made it spicyMeat was tender and soup was delicious Food was quick and service was great!!

name: Ramen Bar
content: fantastic ramen! can't beat the $1 gyoza. LOVED the umami. we like the brothless option. perfect for the little!

name: Ramen Bar
content: It was so yummy we love our Ramen and this was one of the best!! The staff was very nice and good customer service. We will definitely go again.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Found this gem of a place and I'm so glad I did.  It's nestled comfortably right in the mix of a slew of hip small restaurants and bars walking distance from several of the hotels in the area.  Our server was upbeat and very knowledgeable.  I'm pretty much a tonkatsu ramen gal and their version was exactly what I look for.. rich flavorful broth, succulent pieces of pork and springy lively noodles that cradle the broth.  I could eat here once per week.  It's small and cozy and super laid back.  The perfect atmosphere for enjoying a warm bowl of delicious ramen.  I'll be back whenever I'm in town for sure.  Side note.  I posted a happy birthday Facebook message as I was waiting for our ramen and literally seconds later one of the server's asked aloud "Who's got a birthday today?"  Later they brought out a bowl of ice cream and a  slice of cake .  Nice touch guys!

name: Ramen Bar
content: Stopped by this place twice during my five day conference at Salt Lake City, so I clearly thought it was worth revisiting. The main seating area has a bar at the window for individual seating, a decent number of tables for group seating, and a bar for spirits in the back.The first time I got the Umami Bomb Ramen, which had a decent rich and spicy flavor. I liked that the broth packed enough heat for me to notice but not enough to overwhelm the other flavors. It had slices of pork belly and lots of ground pork, so I felt like I got my money's worth of protein. The second time I got the Tonkotsu Ramen, which was really hearty without being overly butterly. Both meals, the noodles were soft but springy and the egg yolks were wonderfully balanced between being too runny and too hard.Overall, the prices weren't too cheap (around $10-15) but they seemed typical for downtown SLC and I thought the Ramen was easily worth the price both times I went.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I stopped in here for a very late lunch after a long flight into town.  I ordered the Umami Bomb.  I absolutely loved the rich flavor of the pork broth and combination of ingredients in the bowl.  The candied mushroom is different but I found this unique and enjoyed it.  I see some other reviewers complaining about how fatty the pork slices were but I think that's how it should be.  I say the fattier the better people!  One last thing is I sat up at the bar and enjoyed some friendly chatter with Peter.  All in all a great experience and I hope to circle back the next time I'm in town.

name: Ramen Bar
content: This may be the best Tonkatsu ramen I've had in Utah. My friend coming in from Portland said it may be the best she's tried too. Don't let the hipster appearance of the outside or the servers deter you from coming in and trying it out. They're actually really friendly. At least the server we had was very fun. We had very little wait and the food came out quickly and as ordered. The serving sizes are generous and the dishes are full of flavor. We left happy and satisfied with our orders and the price point. I highly recommend giving this place a go.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Wrongly charging my bill. After I've pointed it out, they pretended that they've corrected it but never did so on my credit card bill.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Visited this place twice in our week trip to Salt Lake.  The restaurant is very accommodating to vegans and kids.  Simple, fast, and delicious.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Great ramen and extras. Good service too. Love that you can order appetizers by the piece and get exactly what u want. Live too far. Away to come back but do recommend this place 100%.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Stopped here while visiting the area on vacation. From california and pretty much have unlimited access to ramen. For me it was 3.5 stars. My bf loved it and said it was the best ramen he has ever had. So I gave this place 4 stars to even it out. Will eat here again when vacationing. The service was fast. The server/waiter was very friendly and helped us with our choice of ramen :)

name: Ramen Bar
content: What an amazing little spot. We were visiting SLC and walked by the Ramen Bar, we decided to stop and take a look at the menu. Lucky us! Amazing food, unbelievably tasty. I recommend the sake sample and the soy sauce ramen. This is a MUST GO in Salt Lake City

name: Ramen Bar
content: So delicious! I love that you can pick how many wings and gyozo you can order. The ramen was warm and aromatic. The plum fizz was sweet which compliments the salty ramen perfectly! Can't wait to go back

name: Ramen Bar
content: Tonkatsu was really flavorful but I'm used to the egg being soaked in a delicious soy brine. The shoyu broth was severely lacking in flavor. It honestly tasted like they just boiled some soy beans in the water and dumped in generic chicken broth. The wings were pretty good and came out fast but one of my flats had a broken bone attached that was not so yummy. Overall, was a good dinner and I recommend it to anyone looking for some good ramen.

name: Ramen Bar
content: The inside is cute and the menu is super simple which I appreciate from a ramen place. However, the ramen itself is lacking in flavor and thier gyoza was just as bad. Not to mention our waiter didnt check on us until we asked for our check.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Pretty good and not too salty like most ramen places. The ramen bowls are deLicious and filling. Gyozas and peppers as appetizer were okay but I wouldn't order either of them again if I come back. One complaint: service was strange--took them a while to come to our table and bring the menu + water over; however, when it comes to billing and taking away the dish, they were extremely fast. We were 5 minutes into eating and the lady had already dropped the check on our table and I was like bro.. no one likes to be rushed, especially while eating. Downgraded the whole experience and food quality to a 3 star.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Best ramen in town. Been there many times - consistently the most flavorful broth and properly cooked noodles. Nice gyoza.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Nice ambience.  Ramen was solid, but nothing to write to grandma about.  Gyoza was deep fried.  I prefer the pan-fried version.  Stay away from the flavored cold sake.

name: Ramen Bar
content: First time visiting this restaurant and I was very pleased. Service was excellent! I loved that they have a gluten free option and it was delicious. Very rich flavor in the broth, egg cooked perfectly. I will most definitely be back. Great experience

name: Ramen Bar
content: Super amazing & staff was outstanding, patient and explained bowls throughly.We ordered the soy bowl and the bomb bowl (super spicy) but excellent.Egg was different tasting but I enjoyed!

name: Ramen Bar
content: Umami filled ramen! I have been here several times in the past year. Great lunch spot, they are always friendly! I recommend the Umami Bomb ramen, and Ika salad. The wings are also tender with the right amount of spice!Especially on a cold day. I'm looking forward to more winter lunches here, now that it's cold again.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Went with coworkers for dinner here. Young hip atmosphere for bar crawlers. We all ordered the same Umami bomb.Umami Bomb- it was ok but not enticing for me to come back again. Shiitake mushroom in it was candied I believe (never had sweet mushroom in ramen) , the pork slices were cooked so tender it felt like I just ate fat.  broth was ok, and spicy ground pork was lackluster.Appetizers:Blister shishito pepper- great Kim chee- can't really mess that upFried calamari- too salty and looked sad  Fried gyoza- ok but pretty greasy(Dunno what with that tartar sauce came with all appetizers except Kim chee)

name: Ramen Bar
content: First time here, was not disappointed. Got the salt bowl & it was amazing. The nice blonde server gave us a great experience! Will be back

name: Ramen Bar
content: Absolutely AMAZING ramen  some of the best I've had, such a great combination of flavors. I can never finish a bowl to myself, but I did here because it was that damn good. Friendly staff, nice ambience, pretty reasonable prices. No real complaints!! Go get you some ramen!

name: Ramen Bar
content: One of the best ramen places you'll ever go to, the staff was so pleasant and the music as well as the vibe made it an overall spectacular experience. The potstickers were out of this world. So good. I could nose dive head first in a giant bowl of those. We ate the Umami Bomb ramen. It was delicious! Perfection on a cool fall day. The hot wings are the right kind of spicy. When we got to dessert....Oh. My. God!  The honey toast will blow you away. The way to my heart...yes Ramen Bar. You have it now.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Just waited 40 minutes to be served ramen. There are maybe 22 other people in the restaurant. 40 minutes??? Seriously? I can make ramen at home in 3 minutes. You guys suck.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Really, really not good when compared to Ramen I'm used to in SoCal.  I was served a warm, not hot bowl.  There was corn in their specialty ramen... The pork was not tender at all.  Plastic, poor grip chopsticks.  Asked for it spicy and it came a 5/10 on the heat spectrum at best.And to top it off, the plum fizz cocktail was easily one of the worst drinks I've ever been served,

name: Ramen Bar
content: Finally tried this place out for the first time. Recently moved from LA where ramen was my life and I was reluctant to try another spot out here after my first failure at another spot. I was pleasantly surprised. I had the pork tonkotsu and the broth was fantastic. Could definitely have used some chile oil, but I'll give that a try next time because I will definitely be back. The best part is that it is right in the middle of downtown by a lot of my favorite bars. From the time I sat down to the time my ramen bowl was empty was about 15 minutes. Great and fast service. Highly recommended, especially on a cool Utah night.

name: Ramen Bar
content: It was okay. Nothing too out of the ordinary. Not many choices of meat. All they have is pork. So if you're a pork person, this is the place for you.

name: Ramen Bar
content: The first time I came here, the food was great. I grabbed the Tonkotsu ramen and it was pretty good. The broth had good flavor, and the chasu was great. The service was okay though, and not quite matching up to the food. I ordered dessert and that was obviously forgotten as my check was set in front of me, sans dessert. The person did end up apologizing, so I was like okay, mistakes happen. That's forgivable.Fast forward to today. I stopped by with a friend. It was cold so some good, hot ramen sounded appealing. We arrived early, and there were only 2 tables taken. Sweet! We can get seated right away.We were directed toward the seating in the front with the cold window, so we asked if we could have a table. As I mentioned, we were looking forward to sitting at a table more inside that was warm, plus my friend is tall and those higher seats are not comfortable.Well, we were told that those seats need to be saved for other 'potential' bigger groups so we couldn't sit at the tables. Really? So getting there early in order to beat the rush apparently didn't matter; we apparently need more people to get a table. We just looked at each other in disbelief, then headed out to another place. I doubt we'll be going back after that.Edit:Wow, so apparently I'm a keyboard warrior now. Instead of taking the higher ground and giving their explanation, this is the "rebuttal" I get. I have actually eaten at this place before (as pointed out the beginning of my review). We were also there at 11:30am, not dinner. I'll leave this at that, as the owner is right, Yelp isn't a place to rant.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Honestly the soup was average had their special umami bomb and it was ok wings were soggy if that's how you like them !!! Good fried gyoza wouldn't go back though

name: Ramen Bar
content: Was craving a hot bowl of ramen on this cold fall day and Ramen Bar did not disappoint. I also have been meaning to try this place since it opened. The goyoza was a little bland but whatever! The ramen was sooo good I didn't even care.

name: Ramen Bar
content: We enjoyed Ramen Bar!Cons: Started a little rough - you sign in at the front and there's a very small waiting area and it was raining so it was cramped. It didn't seem there was a ton of urgency to seat people once tables opened up. The gyoza was not traditional, it was deep fried and served with orange mayo that had no taste - wasn't super impressed but would be good while drunk. My sauvignon blanc was served warm.Pros: The food was good and the service was great. We we served very fast. Quality wise, it's certainly an acceptable alternative to Tosh's Ramen. We both had the Curry Udon, it was delicious and a good portion. We also enjoyed the wings, the sauce was good and they were meaty. Wine was served at a good portion for Utah. The cucumber Saki cocktail was yum.

name: Ramen Bar
content: What a wonderful place. The ramen broth was fantastic and shitake perfectly cooked. The chicken wings where also great, spicy and sweet. Topped off with a sake gimlet. Perfect! Great service, pleasant staff. Thanks for a great meal.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Amazing ramen. One of the best that I've tried. The broth is rich and creamy. I went twice and it was good both time. Their potstickers were homemade!! Everything tasted authentic. I would recommend them any day. The place is small but there is outside seating. The service was excellent.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Thank you Raymona for the excellent customer service. We enjoyed the food and the place is really cute inside. You can enjoy dinning inside or outside.We're in Salt lake visting from San Diego, California.

name: Ramen Bar
content: I usually don't post food pics but I found the best ramen bar! Pork belly ramen, Takuan & Fukujinzuke pickles, wings with a Orion Japanese brew. Great service, good vibe, amazing food. (Side note: no real liquor, just sake and beer)

name: Ramen Bar
content: Friendly service and delicious ramen! Spicy pork for the win! The only thing I would do differently next time is ask the chef to heat up my side order of kimchi so I could add it to my soup without cooling it down.

name: Ramen Bar
content: After a brief rain shower that lowered the temperature in Salt Lake City, I decided today was the day to get ramen. This is my second time here and I was very happy to see the umami ramen on the menu. It is by far my favorite with a delicious broth with just enough spice and toppings. I also love their noodles, which are cooked perfectly. It was a nice surprise to see the summer appetizers. I ordered the shishito peppers that were perfectly blistered.  The $5 cocktails were a nice edition to the restaurant. The staff was wonderful. They were attentive, without being annoying. I enjoyed sitting at the front bar and watching the world go by. When I travel to Salt Lake City it can be difficult to find restaurants open on Sunday. I think this is my new go to place!

name: Ramen Bar
content: My first couple of tries going here was a dud cause of how long the wait can be. My friend finally was able to get a seat there and they weren't busy, so I just joined. Originally I didn't plan on eating, just drinking but their menu enticed me to order. They do a really perfect table to take a photo at, if you are lucky you might get that table for the optimal insta foodie photo. I wasn't that lucky and sat at the bar.The drinks here are very good. I didn't know how I feel about them diluting the sake in front of me. I was concerned about how much water I got in drink versus sake. Even the employees joked about a cup of clear liquid if it's sake or water. The food here is decent. Cheap appetizers (dumplings and wings) and their noodles are decent. I got their curry noodles. The curry was good. The noodles was cooked to perfect texture. The meat was seasoned very well as well. And the egg was cooked to perfection. The service here is a very hit or missed. Even though everyone was just standing in front of me behind the bar. They were busy talking and "training" than helping me. I had to wave at them and raised my voice a little to get attention. This is just to order. When it came to the check and clearing out things...we were practically escorted out the door. Great food, fun atmosphere....but that's all.Update to my review:As we can see, the owner didn't appreciate my review and now I'm here clarifying my sarcasm. I do understand if that they would need to explain my diluting comment. The way they were pouring the sake into another bottle and then following a joke about it being water got me concern. I didn't came up with that conclusion without listening to that comment. Maybe don't joke around about diluting in front of customers. My second comment about the word "Training" in quotes...they weren't training. They were just standing around joking, I said "training" so I wasn't too blunt with my review. I wouldn't mind if they were actually training new employees. Have a magical day!

name: Ramen Bar
content: This is the BEST Ramen I HAVE EVER HAD! We went last night for our anniversary! Originally we had planned to go to Takashi for sushi but it was as expected packed so we came here. WE WERE SO HAPPY WE HAD! No wait!Fun chill ambiance!The food freaking ROCKED!We ordered two appetizers: the shishito peppers (these were flavorful but they are so thin that it was like eating a fried piece of nori ) not my favorite! We also ordered the gyazo but they forgot to bring them out, but we were happy about that because...We both ordered a bowl of ramen: Umami Bomb & Udon Curry! They were both SO FREAKING AMAZING!!!! The beef is insane just melts in your mouth! The flavor is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! It was spicy but I couldn't stop eating it!!! We'll probably go back this week yum !!!

name: Ramen Bar
content: Nice ramen bar in the middle of downtown Utah. I had the pork tonkutsu and my gf had the vegan ramen. Had some of the wings as well and it was delicious. The broth was rich in flavor and had a good amount of noodles and meat. The decor was nice and the atmosphere was relaxing. Our waiter Raymond was super nice and attentive. Def recommend this place if your in Utah and feel like ramen.

name: Ramen Bar
content: This place is amazing. The best Ramen in Utah. The fun wording on the menu just makes it that much more enjoyable. It's a small little place that feel cozy and comfortable

name: Ramen Bar
content: So great, been here 3 separate occasions different times of the day and always got good service. Limited bar choice drinks but other then that super good food and social environment

name: Ramen Bar
content: Exactly what I was looking for! $10 ramen with perfect ingredients, thick broth, solid and not clingy or clumped noodles, perfect texture egg, perfect flavor tonkatsu, my own chilled craft of water without ice, open on Sundays.

name: Ramen Bar
content: A flight attendant I flew with told me he had a great bowl of ramen here so I had to be the judge of that. When I think of Salt Lake City, really good ramen is not the first thing that comes to mind. Ramen Bar definitely changes that.This quaint, friendly ramen spot is right on Main Street. I stopped in a few minutes before they opened and they accommodated me right away. For $11, you get this generous bowl with all the toppings. The broth was on point and very comparable to more expensive bowls I've had. The noodles could've been better. I'm not sure if they use alkaline noodles or if the noodles are not homemade, but they were not as good as some others I've had.You can never go wrong with spicy ground pork, and the extra chili oil is always appreciated. The only thing missing was some black garlic oil. I did not see it as an option on the menu. Otherwise, for $11 I can't complain about the quality and service at this ramen location. I can only imagine how amazing the bowl tastes on a cold, winter day in Utah.

name: Ramen Bar
content: Food was ok service was better. In the world of Ramen Bars and I have been to the best. This bar is average on food but on par with service.

name: Ramen Bar
content: My first time here today. The food was delicious and came fast. Love the small atmosphere. Friendly folks. Will definitely be back

name: Ramen Bar
content: I had THEE SINGLE MOST exemplary night here. Quality ass food, quality ass environment (seriously, the brick walls and bar are adorable), and the kindest and most involved, kind waitstaff. Tiffanee wasn't even our server yet she heard us talking and chimed in to our table's conversation yo relate and bridge and hang out with us. She even taught us a fun, Korean drinking game and talked to us about her travels. Seriously the nicest person on Main Street. PLEASE stop by here.

name: Ramen Bar
content: tiffany approaches our table because we were talking about visiting Seoul, and came and chatted with us for a few minutes about the experiences we've had there. she was incredibly sweet and really accommodating. she made us feel super welcome and was really kind. tiffany is the best!!!

name: Ramen Bar
content: Wasn't very impressed. When we walked in to check it out the waitress had a sit down or get out attitude. The pork bowl was good but the pork was quite fatty. The broth was really amazing though and very flavorfully. Biggest turn off was that it was so warm in the restaurant. To the point you would feel like you were over heating. Not the atmosphere you want to then sit and eat hot ramen

name: Ramen Bar
content: This place gets 5 stars and 2 thumbs up for the food and service. Came in here with my family the other night we all had different broth base ramens and we all loved the ones we chose. I had the pork broth ramen, it was so delicious. Then we all shared the Honey toast dessert between the four of us and it was plenty. It was also a must try. On top of that we had great service. Our waitress Tiffany was so helpful and attentive and had a great attitude. Will definitely be back.

name: Ramen Bar
content: The food and service was great(: it was a little hot in there though. Also it would be great if the had high chairs.  The drinks were so yummy!!

name: Ramen Bar
content: Easy 4 stars, bordering on 5.Umani Bomb Raman Bowl: I was floored by the intensity of savory goodness.The broth base foundation is what it is all about, and they deliver, combined with Pickled mushroom, salted egg, pork belly, spicy ground pork, etc.Having traveled to Japan and sampled specialty Raman there, I would say Raman Bar is up there! Good service, sake selection, a hidden gem.

name: Ramen Bar
content: So delicious!!! I will be a returning customer for sure! It is definitely the place to go for a date night

name: Street Tacos
content: You can tell right away the manager is very involved in your order, I received my food, and it exceeded my expectations. The taco meat has lots of flavor, they go the extra mile. This was well worth my money.

name: Street Tacos
content: This is the best restaurant in all of Salt Lake, this one. Right here. Everything is always phenomenal, the guy working the window is the friendliest man alive, and the price for the food is insane. The pile up the meat so high you have to eat half of it before you can really get to the tortilla of your tacos. Amazing salsas, very spicy. The shrimp tacos are the best.

name: Street Tacos
content: First time here and can't wait to come back! Ordered food thru the drive thru and it was a longer wait than I would've liked but the food was worth the wait! I ordered the fish tacos and shrimp tacos and they were both so yummy! Both the fish and shrimp are deep fried to perfection!

name: Street Tacos
content: Best midnight munchie tacos ever! Delivered by Door Dash and the ice cream was still frozen!

name: Street Tacos
content: This place is ridiculously good. Was going to make food at home then I saw this place while driving and decided to stop. This is my new favorite Mexican food in Utah

name: Street Tacos
content: Absolutely incredible; the food is delicious, the service friendlier than they are fast, and they're pretty damned fast. I'll be back

name: Street Tacos
content: The tacos and tortas are delicious. I've tried various taco stands and eat it in locations around Utah and this place is one of the best. It's a bit on the pricier side but the taste you get from each taco is worth it. I'd compare it to some of the tacos you can get from MX.

name: Street Tacos
content: Given the glowing reviews from my fellow Yelpers, I decided to give it another shot. I have faith in the Yelps, and so I set out to give the benefit of the doubt and try again because I certainly want it to be good.I also was on a quest to eat a lot of tacos without leaving the car, and in the times of COVID, it is absolutely a big deal that they have a drive-thru.So, we set out and fired up the app and navigated our way in. I'm happy to report that it was much better this time around. Lots of flavor in the two taco varieties (carne asada and chicken) and they handled the drive-thru part super quickly and it comes with all the fixins you need--three salsas, the cilantro, limes, and you're all set. The avocado-y sauce is pure fire. I mean, like, so crazy hot that it burns right away. Not the slow burn, and luckily not the long lasting burn, but good grief it was smoking hot spicy to start.Of the two, I liked the carne asada a bit more, though texturally it may give some people grief. However, I will say that of all the tacos I had on my drive-thru taco night, this was by far the most generous with the meat. They pack it on there and give you a great value for sub-three bucks.I'm glad I came back, and glad they have that drive-thru open right now. Do not underestimate how nice it is to get tacos without getting up.

name: Street Tacos
content: Great taco spot. Great price and selection. Flavorful and fresh. Best cactus taco I've ever had.

name: Street Tacos
content: Staying at a local hotel and found this place on Yelp. Atr her twice. Tacos one evening and a burrito two nights later. Both exceptionally tasty. Both were take out orders.

name: Street Tacos
content: Stopped in SLC because we were staying at the hotel next to it. Based on the reviews we gave it a try. Excellent service and tacos. We had asada, cesina and suadero. Delicious and the tacos were loaded with meat.

name: Street Tacos
content: The best tacos in Utah!! Love this place! The food is amazing, the service goes above & beyond & not to mention the great music  20/20 would HIGHLY recommend

name: Street Tacos
content: I eat out 300 days a year, often at a different place usually in a different city- due to the nature of my job. I am based in San Diego, very close to Mexico and I go into Mexico very often (Tijuana) for my taco fix. I have to say; the suadero tacos HERE are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! 100/100 for the suadero tacos! Huge shout out to Miguel, who was working the register, cooking the food, and attending to the guests all at the same time- he checked up on me 4 different times to see how I liked the food. I've never seen this level of service at a taco spot. Truly wonderful experience, I will 100% be coming back and this place has my full endorsement! The suadero has the perfect amount of fat and the beef is nice and tender. The cesina beef is very similar to philly cheese steak kind of beef, like skirt steak, highly recommend! Tastes waaay better with their Oaxaca cheese.They are a chilango place (Mexico City cuisine) and boy I feel like I'm right there in the heart of CDMX!Huge shout out to Miguel again, you're the sole reason I'll be coming back! Give this guy a promotion!!

name: Street Tacos
content: Great tacos. Reasonable price! Loved the sauces. And, the service was friendly. I especially liked the bean dip appetizer.

name: Street Tacos
content: Very generous , large portions, made fresh upon order. Expect about 10 minutes for your order to be ready.  The sauces and condiments were killer. The owners seem like really nice people who try hard to make things right. Only reasons for not getting 5 stars were:(1) the to go order is not packed by the person (so make sure you tell them how you want it when you order, or ask for plates)(2) the meats were not seasoned as much as I would have hoped. (3) the meats are not as tender as I would have liked (perhaps a sign of low volume covid conditions)Hard to take photos in a rental car of the to go order, but take my word for it that you will get a lot of food. The best taco was the camarron (shrimp). And the elote (corn) side is definitely worth trying. 3 of us spent $26 and are fat and happy.

name: Street Tacos
content: These tacos are amazingly flavorful served up in decent portions. The decor is cute inside and right now tables are properly spaced for COVID-19 precautions. The horchata is not to be skipped at all. One of the best taco joints to pop up in SLC!

name: Street Tacos
content: Didn't have high expectations for this drive through taco place but damn was I surprised! I couldn't find parking for the sushi place I wanted to go and out of frustration I drove into this place. I order two shrimp tacos and one fish and they were all BOMB. They were cooked really well with fresh coleslaw and sauce to top it. Even their tortillas tasted fresh. The gentleman who took my order speaks mostly spanish so it took us to a little to order until he realized I can also speak spanish and it was smooth sailing from there. Great service. Will be back during my next SLC trip.

name: Street Tacos
content: So good! We were just passing through Utah and stopped here. The owner was so sweet and helpful. He recommended the Saudero taco and thats what we recommended too! The tacos were really good and came with toppings on the side (limes, plenty of cilantro, and onions.) There's a variety of salsas. As well as plenty of drink and dessert options!

name: Street Tacos
content: This place is an oasis in the middle of this COVID desert. Extremely kind employees, loved the vibe, and the food is PHENOMENAL! Will definitely be visiting very soon!

name: Street Tacos
content: Wow, what an incredible place. My fiancé and I recently moved to Salt Lake City and this was one of the first places we tried. The staff was kind and welcoming, the restaurant was clean and well lit, and the light music was pleasant and added a homeyness to the restaurant. We had carne asada, pollo, and chorizo tacos and they were all fantastic. They come on one tortilla so it was prone to tearing, but the food tasted amazing regardless. The red salsa was a little spicy but really flavorful. If you're in town and want to have some authentic Mexican tacos like my abuela makes, try these!

name: Street Tacos
content: We were starving when we decided on Street Tacos, a short walk from our hotel. We ordered tacos, burritos, quesadillas, and bean dip. Everything was delicious and the portions were huge!! The service was quick and extremely friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant and recommend coming hungry or share!

name: Street Tacos
content: LOADED tacos! Expect to get a big portion and I would say these tacos are pretty good. They are not the best but these are very comforting. There's not many places where you can enjoy a genuine taco while sitting down. Service is timely and very polite.

name: Street Tacos
content: Y'all, these tacos are legit! If you're wanting to get the good authentic greasy Mexican tacos, this is your place. I'm a Texas girl, Austin at that (Capitol of tacos) and I was very pleased! We ordered the asada, buche, al pastor, and tripa. All very tasty. The service was great to boot. The two guys working were super friendly and made sure we were enjoying our meal. Thanks for that! Again, if you want good tacos, this is your place!

name: Street Tacos
content: I was craving some tacos when I was out there in Salt Lake City Utah. Came across this spot & man this spot is legit. It's the real deal. Plus they only give you one tortilla instead of two tortillas for yo tacos which is a plus in my books. Also they hook you up with a bunch of meat & the meat is full of flavor. This is a must if you are craving tacos.

name: Street Tacos
content: This is the old Wendy's on 400 S. Probably the best and healthiest tacos in the Salt Lake area. They have a great variety of tacos at this location.

name: Street Tacos
content: This place is so good food is athletic Mexican I had a quesadilla, tacos de carne asada, tacos alpastor, and a chocoflan everything was amazing definitely coming back

name: Street Tacos
content: They were taking a little longer with our order and the man gave us a corn on the cob for free while we waited. Great portion size for the price and absolutely delicious food.

name: Street Tacos
content: The food is good but they have only 2 people and it's not run effectively. Didn't get the cilantro and onions and the guy was running around serving food, taking orders from the drive thru and working the counter. Just need 1 more guy or gal to make the experience seamless! Just a thought!

name: Street Tacos
content: Was having a big craving for a really good tacos and right now there is not many options.  We saw that this place had a really good rating.  I ordered the Carnitas, Pollo and Chorizo.  While the meat was perfect and really good the tacos them self were a little underwhelming.  Taco's could have used more garnishes of some sort.  On the upside the gentleman on the window was fantastic and made suggestions and was super helpful.  I would go back again for sure once they are open.

name: Street Tacos
content: THE absolute best tacos I've ever had in my life. And I'm from Vegas so I've had a lot of tacos in my day!! The tacos here are so delicious. I love how they have veggie options here- roasted poblano pepper and cactus leaf. My personal favorites are: al pastor, suadero and the cactus. If it's a lot of meat for you I would recommend getting an extra tortilla. I got the flan here once too and it was delicious!! I am always recommending this place to everyone I know because it's always quiet inside. They have a drive thru also. The tacos here are so good I don't even want to eat tacos anywhere else!

name: Street Tacos
content: FINALLY!  Great street tacos in Salt Lake.  We fell in love with great street tacos in Tucson, AZ  and haven't found anywhere like it since.  This place has amazing food!  We bought 6 different meats, rice, beans and guacamole!  It was ALL amazing!  The owner (assumes) has a great attitude!  He really seems to take pride in his work and wants his customers happy!  I was very appreciative of that!  We enjoyed everything and with the whole Corona deal going on, this is a great place to get take out or DoorDash!  Definitely put this one on your list!!!

name: Street Tacos
content: I was skeptical, being a Mexican from California, but I was pleasantly surprised with the authenticity, great customer service, & delicious food. The torta de suadero was so flavorful, satisfying, & reminded me of home! You should definitely come if you want an amazing authentic taste of Mexico in the middle of Utah.

name: Street Tacos
content: Are here for the first time today, absolutely delicious, huge portions, clean facilities and very friendly staff.  I'll be back!

name: Street Tacos
content: Like others have said the tortillas are very oily and don't taste very fresh. I worry they are frying up the tortillas to cover up that fact that it is not fresh. The carnitas was too wasn't very good. Also did not taste fresh. I think it was refried to "freshen" them up. The pastor was ok. I had the Suadero which I liked. Honestly if the tortillas were better I feel like I could overlook a lThe portions are huge and this place is open late. The service was fast and friendly.

name: Street Tacos
content: I went at 9pm and it was empty so I got my tacos in less than 2 minutes which is great!!Good tacos but they need a little bit more of fat, from my perspective you don't eat "light tacos" ah! the carnitas were kind of dry but with good flavor.Tortillas are ok. Nopales are good too.

name: Street Tacos
content: I didn't know it was actual restaurant I was thinking it would be street stand lol.  I ordered asada, chorizo, and cecina tacos.  The cecina was my favorite.  I was wondering why the tacos are 2.79 when most places charge $2.00 but it is appropriate price for downtown and they give you a lot of meat!  I should have just ordered one taco, I couldn't eat all.  They bring the food to you.  I would recommend and go back.  I did take down one star because the restaurant wasn't too clean, need to spray and wipe down tables better and sweep floor and then it would be 5 stars. Keep it up homies.

name: Street Tacos
content: I'm 83 years old and have had tacos almost all my life and this is by far the worst excuse for tacos I've ever had. Three tacos were just soft corn tortillas on a plate with the meat on top. Nothing else except onions and cilantro. The meat was so greasy the corn tortillas fell apart. Maybe the homeless folks like it but for someone who eats every day this is a place to stay away from.

name: Street Tacos
content: I've only done delivery so this is for that. Fast! Portions are huge. Nicely steamed tortillas, great fillings, food for days. Seriously, it's a lot of food. Nicely seasoned. Never sure what salsa will come w/ but they're always complexly seasoned, even when super hot.

name: Street Tacos
content: EASILY THE BEST TACOS IN TOWN!! So so so good. My fave is the carne asada and the chicken  chile verde! And the guacamole is so yummmy. Also, the avocado sauce that's on the salsa cart is TO DIE FOR. Great staff and atmosphere. Music and food will make you wanna dance.

name: Street Tacos
content: Food is good. Rough area. I was the only customer and there were 3 homeless guys skulking around and harassing the cashier to break change. I was there at 2:30pm on a Saturday. Uncomfortable experience.

name: Street Tacos
content: Good price, big portions and tasty meats. Highly recommend the chorizo! Perfect spot for a late night snack. Service was quick, would definitely swing on through again.

name: Street Tacos
content: Drove past it for the last year. Said to myself today, let's give it a try!  Feel like I wasted a year of my life just thinking about trying it! For 2.79 I asked if they were good, she laughed. I was like, what dose that mean?  I ordered 4 tacos, the toppings came on the side... the guacamole was even free! I took a bite, I put the taco down, and I started to laugh! This was a damn good taco!!! I'm excited to come back here again!

name: Street Tacos
content: Great for groups ! Price is reasonable and they give you so much food ! Very fresh ! Easy to find . Great environment .

name: Street Tacos
content: Latin music and a token only bathroom give Street Tacos charm Rancheritos & Alberto's dream of.  Good late night option although the lighting is too bright for late night faces.

name: Street Tacos
content: They stepped in and revived an empty fast food location that would have eventually been filled with another soulless franchise. This food is legit and generous. Great service and prices, too.

name: Street Tacos
content: the food here was pretty good. my favorite part were the tortillas, they tasted handmade, and they loaded up the tacos with meat. although this was good i think that maybe there was a little too much meat. i also got a tamale and the filling was good but in my opinion they were made with too much masa. the workers were very nice though and next time i'm in the mood for good tacos i plan on going there. i'd at least give it a try if i were you.

name: Street Tacos
content: Totally Unexpected Foodie Experience.  So many meats to choose from.  Huge portions.  I ordered shrimp, carnitas, carne asada, and the incredible chili relleno.  Ate some there & took the rest to go.  Second day was even better!  Served with 3 sauces that were  mind blowing.  Generous sides of cilantro, lime & onions hit the spot.  Great location- close to downtown & plenty of parking. I'll be sure to be back on my next trip to SLC.

name: Street Tacos
content: I'm not sure why this place has almost five starts. I tried the tacos and the Alambres. The Alambres was very middling. Not horrible but not something I wanted to eat very much of.
