The tacos were very bland and the pollo in particular was so bad I threw it out. It tastes gray. Like they boiled it and slapped it on an undercooked tortilla. The guacamole was fake. And not fun fake, where it's tasty but a little watery like a salsa so it will stretch. I mean it's like a green paste that slides out of the container and doesn't taste like anything readily identifiable. It doesn't seem like much love is going into their food. I love me some street tacos so this kinda crushed me and my wife. Maybe we went on an off day but I won't be coming back.

name: Street Tacos
content: We've been looking for a "San Diego" quality taco shop and are happy to say we've found it!  Delicious flavor, good heat and friendly service.

name: Street Tacos
content: Walked over from the Sheraton before my flight back to DC for a quick lunch.  GREAT fast choice.  Very authentic.  Only thing missing is a Fish Taco choice... or shrimp.   That would put this spot over the top!  Chicken tacos were great.

name: Street Tacos
content: I would say that the other reviews are correct the portions are large, but I have no complaints. The tacos that I got were delicious and the Carnitas were crisp and tender. The Al Pastor tacos were delicious, My only qualm is that the meat for the Al Pastore is not cooked on a split. But other than that the food is delicious and my tacos were not too greasy. The staff was friendly and kind and patient while I looked at the menu. I would recommend getting two tacos and a Coke. I ordered 4 and it was too much for me but mama didn't raise a quitter so I finished them.

name: Street Tacos
content: We flew from the dakotas  on tuesday and found this place on Yelp and decide to try it and found a  great place to eat real  authentic  food

name: Street Tacos
content: This place is delicious!!  Great food and great prices!  I got three tacos and am about to bust!  Taco nopal (cactus), Rajas (peppers) and Taco Pollo (grilled chicken) and a side of Cebollitas (grilled onions).  It was arrived with delicious sauces each with a different kick and level of spicy.

name: Street Tacos
content: This was our first time eating at Street Tacos. We are coming back!  My taste buds are screaming "more Fénix Burrito".  Portions were large and presented well. The tacos asadas come with all the condiments on the side so you can make them to your own "gusto". Tons of meat on the tacos and in the burrito.  The food was prepared quickly and the dining "in" experience was exceptional.

name: Street Tacos
content: Amazing customer service and crazy amounts of meaton these tacos!  I can't believe the prices and the hours I just love it!

name: Street Tacos
content: Update: I came back today and they gave me one on the house the correct way! Very nice people, thank youOn 9/10/9 I asked for a Fenix burrito with no bacon and I got a fenix burrito with no cheese, no pico, and guacamole was added to my order that I didn't ask for. All I asked for was simply no bacon. My coworker who I was with asked for guacamole but not me. The worker that night came out confidently and handed us the bag telling us which was which so I didn't feel the need to check it but I will be checking my orders from now on. I'm allergic to guacamole so 9.00 down the drain. Thanks

name: Street Tacos
content: Delicious!! Buche, carne asada, lengua, and the shrimp!! So goooooooood!!! Highly recommended!!!

name: Street Tacos
content: The place was empty when we arrived and there was no one at the register. The ambiance felt odd and I wasn't even sure how or where to order. We got our food and the meats they offer in the tacos are generous. But...how are you going to fold that and put it in your mouth? Some may like the giant meat mountain that piles so high and wide that it covers the expanse of the tortilla underneath. I would have been fine with less meat and a foldable taco. The food was generally good but I just wasn't feeling the rest.

name: Street Tacos
content: I was worried that it wouldn't taste like traditional street tacos but, NO FRET these are even better!They give you so much meat for one taco, two tacos ended up being very filling and their horchata is so perfectly crafted with the right amount of spice. The staff was also so friendly and nice.

name: Street Tacos
content: I travel all over for work and this place is in my top 2 taco joints. It's #1 For portion size!!! They PACK IT ON! The lingua and beef cheek are my favorites here. They are super nice also. Don't let the fast food style of the building fool you or you will miss out. Dine in and enjoy a cold beer.

name: Street Tacos
content: It's really cheap and open late. So that's a  huge plus. Their tacos are completely loaded with meat which is a great value, but for my tastes it was a little overload on meat and grease. It's def finitely good- don't want to be too critical of a good thing- just, y'know, you're getting what you're paying for. And like... it's good, just feel like it will clog my arteries immediately. I really wish i could give 3.5 cause it's right between a 3 and 4 for me. But... I guess i fell this way for a reasonThe staff is really nice and when i was there a homeless person walked in to ask me for money and before i said anything the cashier had kindly escorted the man out of the building. Thought they handled the situation very well.

name: Street Tacos
content: The 1st time I ordered food it was fantastic all my items were in. Today I ordered and it was missing an item and the food looks like total crap compared to what I got the 1st time I don't think I'll be ordering again.

name: Street Tacos
content: Well, the pictures looked good, and the reviews seemed decent.....that's where it ends.  This meal was so bad, I'm actually pissed off that I paid for it. The one person eating here should have been my first clue. The place is fairly clean, employees were not overly kind or polite, but not bad. I noticed the lady dunk the tortillas in grease and then throw them on the flattop. As you can see from the picture, it looked pretty good when the food came out.  I figured I'd play it safe and start with two asada tacos. The portion was large; I was getting ready to congratulate myself on this great find. I added some condiments and was ready to be blown away!  I picked up the first taco..... and the grease just poured out. I could almost overlook the grease, but then the chunks of fat and gristle started appearing.  I ended up spitting inedible chunks from almost every bite. I finally got so frustrated, I just left the rest. The two employees were in the back and never came out to check on the order (I'm assuming they already knew the answer). This food was literally not fit to serve to a dog. I would be embarrassed to serve this to anyone. Luckily, there is a McDonald's on the next corner!

name: Street Tacos
content: I had the Al Pastor tacos and they were delicious! Great fresh flavor with handmade tortillas. Good for a quick bite to eat. Reasonably priced as well.

name: Street Tacos
content: Huge tacos. Really affordable and very tasty. I'll definitely be back. You can't even see the tortilla because it's covered with meat.

name: Street Tacos
content: I have been so excited about a street taco style place that I was worried I'd be let down. No way. This place serves generous portions of quality meat with their tacos. I had tacos al pastor, asada, and suadero. I have never seen any place in Utah that serves fresh, roasted nopales and chapulines. I tried both. It has such an impressive menu full of real Mexican food that I'll have to be back - many, many times.

name: Street Tacos
content: Situated at a perfect location, enough parking or you can walk from downtown to their location. Place is clean, super nice inside. Food is great, portions are huge! It's taken me a while to find some al pastor and this place so far is my #1. Ordered 5 tacos and seriously had enough meat to make about 7.

name: Street Tacos
content: From Los Angeles working in Salt lake for a few days. I travel 75% of the time for work. It's not very often I post on yelp but this place is worth it. If your looking for authentic tacos in Utah this is the place. They have all the traditional meats along with a few exotic ones that only the authentic places carry. Plus hand made tortillas to wrap your warm delicious meat. Before you go anywhere else check this place out!!!

name: Street Tacos
content: Let me start by saying that the PEOPLE and the SERVICE here is PHENOMENAL. They owner himself has a few restaurants in the valley but he recently opened this location in SLC and he greeted us and accommodated us. The tacos here all all flavorful and are stacked with your protein choice. You're given a fork to eat some off to be able food your taco the proper way with three salsas, limes and cilantro/onion sides to add to your tacos "a tu gusto" (adding your sides on your own). The food is great, the ambience is good, the people are exceptional and way nice and already ready to get what you need. Recommended to get your tacos here. Trust me. Go get some. Their signature tacos in my opinion is their suadero tacos. Please come here!

name: Street Tacos
content: Hidden gem. I've been here a few times, and I keep coming back. The tamales (rohos or verdes) are excellent, and the tacos are generous and delicious -- don't miss the Carnitas. It's a bargain too. What speaks louder than my review, though, is that after straying to fancier lunch spots, I keep coming back here. Love it.

name: Street Tacos
content: Yup very authentic.  This will be my go to when I'm in town.  So far the carnitas are my favorite!

name: Street Tacos
content: Awesome, this place is great, the meats I chose all had wonderful flavor, cooked perfect. The homemade corn tortillas were delicious. Can't wait to bring the wife here and try the tamales.

name: Street Tacos
content: Everything you want from a street taco cart, but with air conditioning. The staff is friendly and eager to help you make a decision on which items to get, along with their favorite recommendations. I ordered the al pastor, and I would highly recommend getting that every time!

name: Street Tacos
content: These tacos are fantastic, everything I want out of a taco, great flavor, huge portions and not breaking the bank. There's something for everyone, I can take my wife and she can eat carnitas and asada while I chow down on the mountain of lengua and al pastor that comes in a taco. The al pastor was delicious and comes with chunks of pineapple, on top of a homemade tortilla. Their salsa were top notch and had a great balance of flavor to compliment any taco craving. I will definitely be coming back.

name: Street Tacos
content: The alambre was ok but not impressed. Seems that they used the cheapest bacon since all I could see was the fatty portions. Every single tortilla was broken in the borders which tell me that it's either low quality or the let it dry while storage. Flancocho taste like a cheap pre made cake mix. Service was ok but place was completely empty at around 7pm

name: Street Tacos
content: Brought the family (3 kids, ages 14-8) for a quick lunch...excellent menu for those new to Mexican as well as for the adventurous...tamales, carne asada, carnitas, as well as slow roasted pork stomach. Quick and easy...excellent service...tacos come with fresh cilantro, onion, lime, and salsas on the side to add as much (or as little) as you want.Strongly recommend.

name: Street Tacos
content: I tried this place out for the first time last night 06/21/19. I work late on Fridays and was looking for something to eat and you can never go wrong with Tacos. I looked up places open late near me for Tacos and found this place from Google Search. I decide to try it since it is on my way home to Bountiful. This place is so good!!! Definitely treat yourself and don't cheat yourself! The tortillas and everything is fresh. I tried one of each on the menu. I was really hungry don't judge me. The tacos are about medium sized not the little ones your used to from the street carts. They put so much meat on them that really I was full pretty quick and had to take the rest home. I went back today and had the pleasure of meeting Juan Dominguez who runs the place as well as his store in Kearns Azteca De Oro Market. Really nice guy! This is my new favorite place! Out of all the meat choices my favorites are Carnitas, Lengua and the Shredded Chicken. All of the meats were really good. Please go see them for good food. They are open late on Friday's and Saturday's.

name: Street Tacos
content: This tastes like actual homemade Mexican food. You get lots of food for the money. The platanos were wonderful and the corn tortillas are so delicious they could stand alone!Avoid the flan. It's more like a slice of cake. No caramel sauce. Not made in-house. AND it cost like 5 bucks. Avoid this but get definitely get the plantains.

name: Street Tacos
content: My husband and I visited sweet tacos after a hike SLC before heading to Park City and they were some of the best street tacos we've ever had. When we travel we always are in search of tacos. The alambre,  chorizo tacos, and corn tamale were fantastic and cooked to perfection. Service was excellent and we are hoping to visit one more time on our way back to the airport.

name: Street Tacos
content: These are the perfect street food.  Good portion sizes and they are really authentic. I had both the asada and the al pastor. The al pastor was my favorite, and had a a lot of flavor. The tortillas had a bit of grease and were a little fried, which I'm a big fan of.

name: Street Tacos
content: Excellent tacos and they don't mix their cilantro and onions, which is awesome. The churros are also excellent.

name: Street Tacos
content: Had the chicken and brisket tacos. While pretty tasty they were so greasy I couldn't pick up to eat. And the guacamole was not good at all.

name: Street Tacos
content: Finally tried this place today and I was very very satisfied. Love how big the tacos are!! I had Asada, carnitas and cecina. Loved them all but my favorite was Carnitas! Will definitely go back and try the rest of the menu. One thing though will be better if they put two tortillas instead of one. I hope they keep the big portions and don't get stingy as time go by. Also will love more salsa varieties and not so thick. Saw a review complaining about how greasy the tacos are. They just do the tacos the real way it takes me back to Mexico City style tacos! I love the atmosphere and awesome customer service! Found my new taco place!!

name: Street Tacos
content: We just randomly picked this place one night, never have been here before we decided it was nice to try something new. Upon arrival, we loved the interior design, it's a bit extra but still cute. We came around 10pm, so the place was pretty dead. The cheif/cashier was awesome. He was extremely friendly, checked on us 3 or so times to ask if we needed anything. Now onto the food, we had the Al Pastor tacos, and overall verdict, killer tacos. The tortillas are amazing, not sure if they are made from scratch or what, but the rock. All the fixings came on the side with the order, rather than having to go to a salad bar kind of thing to get onions, limes, cilantro, etc.. these Al Pastor tacos came with pineapple, which I've noticed not a lot of taco places around here do with their Al Pastor. But the best part about this place... BEER! They have a fairly decent selection of beer for being a little taco place, but hey, most taco places in Utah wont serve you alcohol. My suggestion, come here, you wont regret it.

name: Street Tacos
content: 3.5 stars would be more accurate here.  The staff was friendly. The food was ... ok, not great. Just ok. Very unlikely would come back here. Not that it was bad, There are just better places in town.

name: Street Tacos
content: Exactly what I was looking for. Cheap. Fast. Authentic. Large portions. And open late. Two to three tacos is more than enough for anyone. From a white guy from the Midwest they seem authentic. Variety of meats. Perfect spice level. Tasty salsas. I'll definitely be back and probably order less than 4 next time because it took two meals to eat it all!

name: Street Tacos
content: Amazing service! I went with my friends looking for a new and fun late night spot to go to after a concert, and we found it! The staff is also very lovely. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and cared for even after you have ordered, and expected nothing in return. They even gave me a free Horchata!!The food is all very fresh and affordable as well. The authenticity made it all the better. More than anything, the experience is a very important part of going out to eat and their effort to create a comforting environment makes you want to come back. I am eager to eat there again, and I can't wait to return!

name: Street Tacos
content: Oh my this place is great!!! I have been a few time and will not disappoint!!! It's a great place sober or drunk.. Oscar love you!!  We will see you again!

name: Street Tacos
content: Very tasty!!! Cool vibe and Great food! It's all about the buche baby!!! Three thumbs up!!

name: Street Tacos
content: Street Tacos has the best street tacos in town! We tried the buche, tripa, lengua and carnitas and each were as delicious as the next. The meats are cooked perfectly: well seasoned, tender and not overcooked. Don't let the prices scare you because each taco is loaded with enough meat for 3-4 tacos you'll find in any other place in town. We also had the plantains with condense milk and oh my was it delicious! The place is clean and service was good as well. The owner/chef came by our table to say hi and made sure we were satisfied. If you are in the hunt for delicious, authentic street tacos, you gotta give this place a try!

name: Street Tacos
content: This is a great find. Really good flavors and generous portions of protein on the tacos! Best tamales I've had in a really long time. I felt like the prices were extremely reasonable. Good bang for the buck!

name: Street Tacos
content: My wife and I went for the first time today.  We ordered a variety of tacos and tamales.  We definitely will be back.  Tacos were plentiful with meat (good thing they were served with a fork) and the tamales you didn't have to search through the breading for the filling.  We tried an elote tamale which we hadn't heard of before but thoroughly enjoyed.

name: Street Tacos
content: These tacos are huge. At least twice as much meat as you'd get in a street cart taco. And the marinades are really good.

name: Street Tacos
content: Just enjoyed probably the best tacos I've ever had. Definitely going back to this place for lunch again soon. If you need a quick delicious lunch in downtown Salt Lake this is the place to go very convenient parking "for now"I tried the Asada and the fish taco.  I'm going back to try the shrimp and pork tomorrow.  Love this place!  The tacos are huge!

name: Street Tacos
content: I hate to do this the tacos are fine but when you come in and order and pay for something and you are not delivered it there's a problem. I came in and ordered three tacos and apparently a tamale and a flan I was giving two tacos and a tamale no flan. So now I'm expected to go back in middle of the night because you can't get my order right. Not worth your time. Go up blockaway to Alberto's they will get your order right. My hard earned money gone.

name: Street Tacos
content: Really good food! Everything is homemade and they have great customer service. They have tacos, tamales, and dessert! The salsas are on point.

name: Street Tacos
content: I stopped here while in SLC based on reviews and craving for tacos. I wanted tacos but did not want to go far from my hotel. Right when I walked in I was greeted and asked what I was looking for. I decided to go with the carnitas and the al pastor tacos. I also ordered the plantains. I loved the corn tortillas because they were homemade and didn't fall apart on me. The carnitas was a bit greasy but it was delicious. But for me the al pastor was the star. It was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The meat was not dry and the pineapple was mixed with the meat so you didn't get one bite of pineapple alone. The plantains were a delightful end to the meal.  Overall it was a great meal and when I am back in town I will be back!

name: Street Tacos
content: I was really looking forward to trying this place out. Some friends had recommended it and there are lots of great reviews.  The reviews are right about the generous portion of meat on these tacos, however, the tacos were underwhelming! The carnitas were just giants chunks of dry bland meat.  The carne asada was ok! I pretty much had meat with onions and cilantro.  The tortillas were so greasy from either the grill or the meat, that I couldn't eat it.  Their red sauce has a yummy smoke flavor.  The green sauce was my favorite but wish it had a little more kick! Overall - I prefer the street tacos from the sears parking lot!

name: Street Tacos
content: Visited on a Friday evening and loved our tacos. Very casual, but inviting environment with Spanish music playing in the background. Lots of filling in the tacos and they even have some less typical fillings like grilled nopals (cactus) which were super yummy. Enjoy being able to support a local business that is affordable and tasty. Total for two people (8 tacos) was around $20.00

name: Street Tacos
content: Solid street tacos. The salsas are delicious too. Overall, a great bite! Good authentic cuisine.

name: Eva
content: Eva is my favorite restaurant in salt lake. Our server Erika was fantastic. She was an expert ambassador of the menu, and explained items with intricate grace. She was so kind and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience!

name: Eva
content: One of my favorite tapas restaurants in Salt Lake City. The gnocchi is to die for (albeit pretty rich just FYI). Decent sized wine selection, and cute ambiance especially in the back seating area.

name: Eva
content: Been coming here for the last decade. One of my favorite places to take out of town guests as well. A fun casual vibe with a seasonal changing menu. It's a tapas joint with plenty of options. Their Brussels sprouts is one of my all time favorites. Portions do seem to get smaller and smaller though.... service is always spot on. I haven't been here without making a reservation in many years. So I'm always seated promptly and food comes out at a decent speed. The sangria is one of my favorites in the valley!

name: Eva
content: We stopped in for dinner at 8:30, 1/2 hr before closing, looking forward to a nice meal at Eva's. We'd had a good late night dinner there a year ago. My order was delivered to another table, and  after 45 mins waiting for risotto, I was finally told that they would make another order. The result was one glass of wine, a small pizza and nothing else. Ridiculous, unprofessional service,  And, I'm still hungry.

name: Eva
content: Eva has always been a favorite of ours but we hadn't been in years and we forgot how truly amazing it is!! We came on a Sunday night around 5:30 and we were able to get in no problem our server Catherine was great and the food was to die for! We started with the Brussel sprouts and asparagus and then moved onto the gnocchi and the French pie! We used to come to eva just for the French pie 5 years ago and then they took it off the menu and we were so sad so when I saw it on the specials list I was ecstatic!! For dessert we ordered the sticky date pudding and it was so good we had to order another and I probably could have had another it is so damn good! Service and food was 5 stars! Can't wait to come back!

name: Eva
content: We have been to Eva several times...tonight was A*Mazing! We had the French Pie, pizza with brie, pear, lemon & walnuts. The dessert was amazing Fig Bread Pudding, truly a delight for our taste buds.

name: Eva
content: We love Eva! We go here pretty often when we just want to hang out for a couple hours. Because everything is tapas style, we like to just order one dish at a time and a few drinks along the way. The food is always amazing, just know they will be small portions. I have loved the spinach gnocchi, shaved brussel sprouts,  and the fig pudding dessert lately. Also, if you can sit in the back, do that. It's a cozy vibe

name: Eva
content: Hard to keep this review succinct. The dining experience here is what I've been dearly missing during Covid. Fun, different yet familiar plates; awesome service; beautiful ambiance. 5/5 and would strongly recommend it to any Yelp readers out there.Food here is exceptional. The plates don't look particularly fresh or unique, but the flavor and texture combination is "WOW"-worthy. We ordered the Oink, Oink, Oink, Togarashi Fried Chicken, Spinach Gnocchi, and the Asparagus. Each was more delicious than the rest. The outdoor dining area is super cute too. If we could come back I'd request  a seat in the back.

name: Eva
content: It's been one of my favorite restaurants downtown SLC for a few years. The gnocchi is a must have every time we go.

name: Eva
content: The food at Eva is a remarkable experience. You'll want to order at least 2 small plates per person to not leave hungry. We got the sautéed brussels sprouts, cheese board & crostini, fried cauliflower, lobster ravioli, and Eva's steak. Then, we ordered the sticky date pudding and chocolate pot de créme for dessert. In all honesty, everything was fabulous except the brussels sprouts because they were shredded and bland in flavor. The cheese board could've used prosciutto or meat to accompany the cheese. Lastly, we were seated by the door and a member of the kitchen crew kept going back and forth outside to the dumpster giving us a cold draft that was unpleasant in January.However, despite the minor obstacles, I liked the concept of different small plates to share and had a good experience.

name: Eva
content: Eva has always been a stellar date night choice and I gotta say, their standard holds up even as a take out option! I had really missed some of my favorite dishes and I'm kicking myself for not getting take out from them sooner. I don't normally think of Eva for take out, and if you're like me definitely add them to your list.We got a few of our favorites - tri-tip bruschetta, grilled lamb chops, grilled asparagus with the dreamiest lemony cream sauce, and togarashi fried chicken served with rice. Get all of these! I know I will be again, like probably tomorrow.

name: Eva
content: Love the atmosphere, the staff was great!  We ordered 5 plates.  Three were really good and two we wouldn't order again.  Big thumbs up to the mushroom pizza, Brussels sprouts, and spinach gnocchi.  Then the calamari, which was ok, but I was not a fan of the breading.   The worst though, were the shrimp and grits.  Usually when one orders shrimp and grits, you expect, well...grits!  This basically was a few pieces of shrimp swimming in a bowl of salt water with a disgusting piece of polenta under it.  Yes, I know polenta is also corn meal, but it's just not what I consider to be shrimp and grits!  I spent many years living down south near the ocean, so my expectations of seafood are probably too much for Utah!  We will probably come back here again, I just won't be ordering any seafood type dishes!  I've also found that many Utah restaurants, this one included, love their salt!  I wish they would realize you don't need a weeks worth of sodium in a dish for the food to taste good!

name: Eva
content: I love this place. Every time I have ever eaten here the food has always been exceptional. This time something was off.  We ordered a few things that I have had before including the steak, the gnocchi, the cauliflower, and the meatballs. The steak was overcooked and all of these selections didn't seem to have much flavor.  The pork chop was one of the small plates I wasn't too interested in ordering, but it ended up being the best thing we had that night. Cooked perfectly and seasoned really well. Of course the fries are always good.  Although this experience wasn't the best, it probably won't keep me from giving it another try. I think the restaurant is probably doing its best under the given circumstances.

name: Eva
content: Great restaurant with amazing service! It's a small plates eatery, so expect to order quite a few plates if you're in a larger group. Recently, went with two friends and we ended up ordering meatballs, spanish salad, fries, brussels sprouts, fig pizza and chocolate cake. The biggest plate will be a pizza. However, my favorite dish would have to be the fries and the spanish salad. Also, dessert did not disappoint. If you can, ask for a seat in the back patio. We were in a booth back there and it gave enough privacy to chat freely in idyllic atmosphere.

name: Eva
content: We just had the best experience at Eva's! There were 3 of us and we ordered 6 dishes at the suggestion of our wonderful server Catherine. Each dish was better than the next!  We truly enjoyed the Spanish salad, Sautéed Brussels Sprouts, Fried Cauliflower, Grilled Asparagus, Shrimp and Grits and Gnocci.  The flavors were amazing, the attention to detail on these dishes was phenomenal!  I highly recommend Eva's and can't wait to go back!

name: Eva
content: We ate here with our friends who had eaten here several times before and I'm glad we did. Our food was all delicious, service was extremely attentive and typical covid precautions were required. We ordered plenty of food and got to try everything we wanted. I did notice a really cute outdoor seating area in the back that looked like a quaint area you'd find in Italy, perfect for a date night. Edit: I'm having a tough time trying to recall the names of some of the food and I'm not seeing the descriptions of anything that matches on the menu given here.

name: Eva
content: Very eclectic, cozy and well ran establishment- even during COVID. Great staff and food. A must try.

name: Eva
content: The atmosphere was perfect, the food and drinks were delicious..... but Carmen was the best part. Thanks Lady xoxo Wild Souls Ranch

name: Eva
content: The food was AMAZING! We had the Brussels sprouts, the beets, the calamari, the meatballs, the summer salad, and a couple of other items, and every single item was incredible! Highly recommend.

name: Eva
content: Eva is EXTRAORDINARY. The very best restaurant in Salt Lake/Utah/one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. Their knowledge of flavor & texture is unmatched, their menu is FILLED with the most delicious & perfectly crafted dishes, and the atmosphere is nice, quiet, and bohemian. Since it's small plates, we got 7 to share: the asparagus (fantastic), the charred beets (my husband loved these so much), the tri tip bruschetta (one of the best things I have ever eaten), the spinach & potato gnocchi (perfection), the togorashi chicken (so yummy & well balanced & goooooooood), and the pork 3 ways (give me pork belly, or give me death!). Our dessert was the warm chocolate cake with malt ice cream, which was easily one of the best desserts I've had EVER. The service was nice, the location was fairly easy to find parking - I WISH THEY HAD THIS PLACE IN EVERY MAJOR CITY. seriously amazing. GO.

name: Eva
content: One of my favorite brunch spots is still operating during all of this...yay! Went there with friends all wearing masks and they have a window you now order into. Quiche Lorraine is the best, but they have a veggie quiche that my friend had which is also good. With the quiche comes a salad and potatoes, highly recommend. Grab a sweet treat for the road or as a side  from croissants to sticky buns to danishes they're all good.And if you want to eat outside there's bistro tables which are very pleasant to enjoy your meal. If not get it to go they package it up nicely and it's that same great food regardless if you're eating it there or at home. So happy they are open during covid-I now come once a week.  I want to support local and it's nice they are open for me to do so!

name: Eva
content: This place! Such a fun find, we were just walking around looking for somewhere delicious to eat and we popped into here. A nice hostess told us they were  booked but we could try waiting, we told them to text us if there were  any spots open, we walked around down  town salt lake and we got a  text about 20 minutes later. As we walked in the restaurant, it smelled so delicious my husband and I felt like Hansel and gretel, and wanted to bite into the house:) we got the pork belly and apple appetizer, and the beets with cream. Both sooooo delicious. My husband said it was his favorite porhe has ever had.

name: Eva
content: I absolutely love the food at Eva! It's fun to go with a small group and order a bunch of small plates. My only complaint is that the service is usually not great.

name: Eva
content: Wow! What an amazing experience! We've been to Eva a year or so ago with our son & daughter-in-law for Mother's Day, a great celebration. This visit was equally wonderful for just the 2 of us. We delighted in the roasted cauliflower with ricotta and capers/golden raisin vinaigrette. The charred beets were delicious with goat cheese and pistachios. The lamb chops and "Oink, oink, oink" pork dish were melt-in-our-mouths tasty. We were a bit pissed off that our dessert order had a little mixup and we had to suffer through BOTH the chocolate creme do pot AND the date pudding, but somehow we managed (with the help of a spot on Irish Coffee and a Black Magick cocktail - whiskey, coffee liqueur, and bitters). Our server, Carmen, gave us the PERFECT amount of attention, never interrupting but attentive to our needs. We loved everything about this experience. Thank you so much!

name: Eva
content: Love love the atmosphere at Eva's it is one the reasons I keep going back and the food. Their small bites are amazing and oh the chocolate cake with ice now that is my go to desert. Also had the banana split and that did not disappoint. Most times when you have a banana split it can be messy it just has too much going on. This was none of that and the right portion would definitely recommend that.

name: Eva
content: Came in late on a weeknight and was sat immediately when other restaurants nearby had hour long waits for 2. We ordered a mix of plates, my favorite was the cauliflower... that caper raisin sauce is in my dreams now. Had an amazing server and stayed until they put chairs on the tables to clean but never felt rushed or out of place. For sure coming back for my next date night.

name: Eva
content: The most amazing food I've had in a very long time. We went out with my family and had David as our server. We asked David to keep the food coming and pick which appetizers to come out, and let me tell you all of it was AMAZING. From dinner food to dessert we were so pleased with everything. Seriously delicious!!!! You will not be disappointed. Thank you David

name: Eva
content: Usually love small plates. Food was okay just not worth the value. Server got order wrong and when he realized it he didn't come back for over 20 minutes. Never came back to see if my girlfriend wanted another glass of wine. It's definitely a beautiful spot but if you are looking for the same thing I would recommend Manoli's

name: Eva
content: Eva is a charming little spot for creative tapas style small dishes.  My sister took us here over the holidays for dinner at which we over ordered for the two of us with 6 items. I'll list what we ordered by the best to least favorite items.- Lamb chops- Spanish meatballs- Gnocchi -(sister's fav)- Togarashi fried chicken- Chopped salad- Eva's steak  So my sister typically doesn't even like lamb because of the gamey flavor, but even she agreed that the lamb chops were the best item of the night.  The chops were cooked to medium rare-ish and served with yogurt cucumbers.    Next best were the spanish meatballs, I'm not sure what about them is spanish as they taste like italian meatballs in marinara sauce, but they're good.  The next menu item was one of contention, the homemade spinach and potato gnocchi.  While this is my sister's favorite gnocchi of all time, i found that the gnocchi was too firm or over worked. Maybe that night was just an off night for the gnocchi, but she still enjoyed it.   Other thoughts, the fried chicken sounds very interesting on paper but the asian flavors are not as pronounced as you'd imagine. The steak should be passed up for the lamb for sure. I also tried one of their signature cocktails, the foret, which was a bit sweet but good if you like whiskey.  Their pizza actually looked quite good, but no way would we have had room for it.

name: Eva
content: We booked this restaurant for our New Years Eve dinner based on decent reviews and we ran into a lot of problems, mostly due to bad service. Our reservation was for 9:15 PM for 5 people and we were excited to do family style and order a bunch of dishes. First problem...We put in a bunch of food, and it started coming out and we quickly realized the portions were super small, something our server didn't tell us at all! All she had to say was "Hey, just an FYI, if you are all planning on splitting everything, order two or three portions of each. Literally the Brussel sprouts dish was equivalent to a side dish for one person. We started panicking a little, and decided to double the order for everything else. Second problem...when we realized we weren't going to have enough food, we asked to order more and our server goes. SORRY, THE KITCHEN IS CLOSED. WTF! Where was the warning?! Like a "Hey guys, kitchen is closing, want to put in any more food?"Third problem...They have quite a few pizzas on the menu and they were out of all of them. How hard is it to freeze crust to make sure you have enough for a holiday?We immediately paid our check, walked outside, and ordered from the food truck across the street. Worst service we've ever experienced. When you eat tapas, or make a late reservation, you are at the mercy of the server to tell you portion sizes and give you a last call warning. The food was alright, but overall I would not recommend this place.

name: Eva
content: Wow. I was absolutely astonished. The food was great. Small portions. Good service. However, there is a huge sanitary flaw at this restaurant. As we sat having our dinner we saw a mouse run across the floor. To confirm our suspicions, the table next to us also freaked out. The waitress assured us that "he (the mouse) doesn't like people. He only comes out when no one is around." This clarified that the staff was aware of the mouse problem and seemed to be ok with it. As we continued with our dinner, two mice races across the floor multiple times, even running right in from of a waitor's foot. They seemingly didn't care and just kept carrying on with business as if it wasn't a big deal. We felt insulted as though we were supposed to go along with their front that this wasn't a health hazard. I will not be returning to this restaurant and would DEFINITELY NOT RECOMMEND it to anyone else. Until the health department comes, DO NOT COME HERE!!!

name: Eva
content: The ambiance here and service were great!   We were sat in the hidden dining room that used to be an alleyway between buildings.  It was very cool!  However, we left largely dissatisfied.  It's a tapas place and each dish cost at least $10.  We didn't think much of it until the plates came out bearing ridiculously small servings.  Yes, I know how tapas work.  But $10 for a single overcooked pork skewer with a few slivers of apple is a ripoff.  Or the Spanish meatballs plate that had three small balls and a tiny sliver of bread.  Same for the "steak" that was basically four small bites for $12.  The disappointment was compounded by the fact that three of the four dishes we got were bland and forgettable.  My wife and I are not big eaters, but the end, we paid over $100 for four small plates and a bottle of wine and we left still hungry.  If it weren't for the exceptional service and ambiance, I'd be giving just one star.

name: Eva
content: This is such a fun place to go with a small group of friends or a date and share a few dishes. We personally loved the Brussels sprouts, fries, and bruschetta. They had a fun drink menu with some unique cocktails that were delicious. You don't feel like you are in Utah when you are here.

name: Eva
content: This was a great restaurant to visit my first time in Utah. Very good food and friendly staff. Was able to park in garage 1 block behind restaurant.

name: Eva
content: I adore the location of this place, and the tapas style. It's busy and makes you feel like you're in a busy city restaurant. The food is extremely varied. Almost to the point of confusion. Is it a pizza spot? Is it a tapas place? What do they specialize in?! A couple of things that are detractors for me:1. We ordered a seafood fish that came out so late we had finished everything else and just assumed that the waiter didn't hear us. It was just a skewer. Nothing too complicated. 2. The food was lacking flavor. Could have used a LOT of salt. 3. Our waiter was impatient and rude 4. The menu was confusing. Would I go back? Yes, but because it's really the only tapas place in SLC.

name: Eva
content: As a foodie, Eva's is one of my absolute favorites in SLC. Amazing food, fantastic drinks, fabulous ambiance, superb and always adorable service.

name: Eva
content: Great downtown location! Cool vibe. We didn't have a reservation on a Saturday evening but we got there pretty early and they got us in. We sat in the back room which was like a long hallway, rustic but definitely inviting. Loved the place. The food was delicious. Small plates shared. We ordered a pretty big selection of small plates, all of which were really good. I ordered the drink, Foret and it was seriously one of the best cocktails I've ever had. This place has a great vibe with excellent food and great staff. Will definitely return.

name: Eva
content: Delicious! Everything was enjoyable. Best meal was the Spinach gnocchis--the sauce was unbelievably good!

name: Eva
content: One of SLC's finest! Just love this place. It's always on my list of recommendations to locals and to those who are visiting.The fried chicken and congee is one of the best dishes on the menu, and that's saying something considering how amazing all the dishes are (I think I have had most of them.)Fantastic service, nice drink and wine list and cool vibe are the cherry on top.Highly recommend!

name: Eva
content: This was A nice find! Didn't make reservations but was able to get a table outside in the back patio. Wonderful atmosphere, not too loud for a Wednesday evening, music is just the right level. Ordered several dishes: Oink oink oink, grilled asparagus, calamari, lamb chop, all wonderful!

name: Eva
content: Gave it another chance - still super loud. But the food has gotten significantly better in the last 4 years. Definitely recommend if you don't mind the noise.

name: Eva
content: Amazing food but have been coming here for years and every time the portions get smaller and smaller. This last time plates were SO small it was insane.

name: Eva
content: Food was incredibly void of flavor.  Every single dish was bland and boring.  Nothing creative or innovative about the menu.  I learned this on my second visit.  That's because on my first visit, I was seated and then walked out after waiting more than 15 minutes for a waiter to come take our order.  The restaurant is very small, so there is NO excuse for a table to be completely overlooked by the wait staff.  To be fair, service was quite attentive in my second visit.  Unfortunately for Eva, this is the visit where I actually got to taste the food.

name: Eva
content: Small tapas and wine restaurant in the middle of the downtown strip. Nice and intimate little joint ideal for dinner.

name: Eva
content: Food:  5. Ambiance. :5.  Drinks:  5 Service. 3. Forgetting to put our entire food order in and making excuses instead of solutions: . We went to the movies and started all over again in celebrating our anniversary.

name: Eva
content: The outdoor ir this place unfortunately is not very attractive and for that reason we almost past it. But once you enter it is a really cute place with nice staff and delicious food. We shared a few tapas and everything was amazing but my two favorites was he brushes sprout and the pork belly. Really recommended it.

name: Eva
content: I recently went to Eva with a friend, and we were both super happy with our experience! Surprisingly, the restaurant was busy for a Monday night; however, we were promptly seated in the back patio. The ambiance of the patio is super cute. Between the two of us, we ordered five plates, which proved to be the perfect amount. We started with the white pizza. The flavors were dynamic, and the kale was the perfect addition. The veggies we ordered were phenomenal! The harissa carrots are a personal favorite, and the Szechuan snap peas were flavorful and fresh. I was let down by the spinach potato gnocchi. The texture of the gnocchi was off, and the sauce was lacking flavor. To finish our meal, we ordered the togarashi fried chicken. The miso congee was a great compliment to the chicken. Throughout our meal, we had multiple different servers, but it didn't detract from the overall experience. I would highly recommend Eva for a slightly more-than-casual dinner.

name: Eva
content: Dined at an exclusive SLC restaurant last night, randomly chose Eva for tonight's dinner.  Eva was everything I hoped from the exclusive restaurant, imagination, great seasoning, good vibe....great food, delicious food.  Eva is the winner!

name: Eva
content: Yes!! Why have I not tried Eva before? My friend and I stopped by for dinner Saturday night. We got seated right away (what?!) in the back patio. The patio was so peaceful, quiet and well decorated. We had a wonderful time. Staff was friendly and service fast! It is tapas style so order and share! We had the fries, the beets and the pig&fig flatbread. It all tasted great and all for a decent price!

name: Eva
content: A cozy, lovely spot. Friendly vibes and one of the best meals I have had thus far in Salt Lake. I would definitely recommend this spot and the date cake. Make sure to get the date cake :)

name: Eva
content: We were visiting Salt Lake City and decided to visit Eva. I was here with my nephew for his University of Utah orientation.  He is under 21--so one immediate advantage of Eva was that it was not classified as a bar so that my nephew could get in--but I could still drink.Eva is a tapas place with small plates.  We started with the cheese and meat plate and the Brussels sprouts.  The cheese and meat plate was good, but a little imbalanced between the meat/cheese/bread (we both would have preferred more cheese and bread, less meat--although everything was good).  We both really liked the Brussels sprouts--which was a good complement to the cheese and meat plate.Next we had the steak bruschetta and the braised meatballs.  The steak bruschetta was good, but in this case kind of lacked the meat (they could have used some from the meat plate).  Our favorite item overall were the meatballs--they were really flavorful and the sauce was excellent.

name: Eva
content: We had dinner here and it was great!  My husband and I prefer small plates to share, so this tapas bar was perfect for us.  We had the mushroom pizza, gnocchi, asparagus (awesome) and cauliflower.  All we're very good and unique.  I highly recommend you check it out!

name: Eva
content: Great place for a date or friend catch up. Food was fantastic and fresh, portions were perfect & a great wine selection. The place is small so it gets packed fast. Service was outstanding.We waited about 15 min to be seated during a Saturday night- which is fast compared to many other places.

name: Eva
content: Eva is perhaps my favorite small plates restaurant. There are always many interesting, varied and delicious plates to choose from. The atmoshphere is nice too!

name: Eva
content: Accommodating staff. Chic atmosphere. Creative dishes for the foodies. I think I like the shrimp and hominy the best and that was unexpected (shhh...don't tell my husband). This restaurant is based on small places that you share and the cost starts to add up. I had the Rodeo Ghost cocktail that was fun and tasty.

name: Eva
content: I came here for Galantine's Day with my gfs! Wow talk about smallest portions of my foodie life. I remember my friend and I ordered a dish called "scallop shrimp ravioli" for $20 with of course many other things to share. I kid you not this dish has been our inside joke ever since. The dish (if it even deserves that name) came with 1 single tiny ravioli and 1 small scallop. My friend and I were in shock. We asked what happened to the shrimp, the waiter didn't know so I said "maybe its shredded inside?" he's like "ohhh yaaa." All dishes were just okay and we all left underwhelmed. You will only get full if you order their more carby dishes like the mac'n'cheese and pizza etc. I have been to many tapas restaurants including those recommended by acclaimed chefs in Spain. I was genuinely disappointed by the quantity and quality of the food given two factors: 1. you're in utah 2. you're charging descent prices for lack luster food.

name: Eva
content: Had dinner here and absolutely loved the experience. From the ambiance to the food and service. Great overall experience. We went a little crazy and tried six different dishes. All were amazing except the calamari dish. See pic for reference.

name: Eva
content: One of my favorite places downtown. I request to come here for all my special occasions, and the steak bruschetta is just...mmmmm.

name: Eva
content: I have been to Eva twice. The first time, about a year ago, was a wonderful experience! The food, wine, and service was wonderful. However last weekend it was lacking. The food was unremarkable, the wine tasted as though it had gotten hot and gone bad, and even with an early reservation I was sat so close to the door I froze the entire night. At this point I don't think I will be going back.

name: Eva
content: This place is a gem in SLC where there is so little to choose from. Very good selection of tapas choices, especially the veggies! I have eaten here twice and enjoyed it both times. Not sure what else to add, but in a city with very few choices for good food, this one is a winner. Small but good wine selection and love the shaved broccoli, asparagus, olives, flat bread and more!The only downside is that my sensitive digestive system struggles for a few days after eating here because the generous amount of sauces and dairy used in the dishes. If I could recommend, they really should go easy on the sauces....and dairy.

name: Eva
content: What a fantastic tapas place!  We didn't realize how much space there was in his restaurant.  The ambiance is great the back seating was in almost like an alleyway and had a wood stove in the back.  We ordered 4 plates plus a dessert!We ordered the following:Calamari a la plancha with toasted orzo, piquillo ailoi, and olive vinaigrette- we weren't quite expecting what we got, but it was very delicious!  Every bite had each ingredient making each mouthful tasty.Grilled asparagus with jalapeno aioli, pancetta, romano and a poached egg-  the asparagus was good, nothing too special about it by itself but the poached egg on top was a great dressing to add to the dish.Spinach potato gnocchi- with white wine cream sauce, peas, mushroom, and truffle oil.  This was our favorite!  the gnocchi was PERFECT.  It wasn't too gummy like some gnocchi's are.  The sauce on it was delciously creamy.Fig & Pig pizza with arugula pesto, mozzerella, pancetta, and fig jam- the pizza was the perfect size for us and the arugula pesto was something I never thought of.  the pancetta and fig jam are a perfect pair, the only thing I didn't like was that the jam wasn't really spread out, so each bite was a little different.  The jam was more like a blob so each bite was different and some bites were too much jam.Caramel banana sundae- perfect for two and delicious with the bananas, caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream.I'd really like to try everything on this menu!

name: Eva
content: Great downtown tapas restaurant. Small place, cool vibe, great seasonal menu. My favorite dish is the asparagus! Great place for a nice night out.

name: Eva
content: Delicious food and good service. Will definitely be back. The only disappointment was the small cocktail menu. Otherwise, almost every dish we tried was amazing! Will definitely go back!

name: Eva
content: Wow wow wow! I've just had the best brussel sprouts that I've ever had in my life. I'm not from here and I would come back just for them.Another thing to try is the chocolate pot de creme! Best chocolate mousse I've ever had in my life!! These 2 things were enough to give them 5 stars because gnocchi was just okay.

name: Eva
content: One of the best places in salt lake. By far. Thoughtfully curated plates, fantastic wine selections, constant updates and regular off menu specials.  Literally can't ask for more from an unwind and dine experience. Perfect place to have a conversation and eat. This isn't an in and out kind of place. Enjoy how each dish is pieced together. The ambiance asks you to get cozy and relax.

name: Eva
content: Tapas are my favorite style of food. Not only does it mean I get to try more items (especially when you have several people), but the chefs also seem to put so much care into each dish. My theory is that because it is just a portion of a full meal, each item is handled with more care... For example, the vegetable gets a sauce of its own and extra garnishes that it wouldn't get as a mere side on a normal plate of food. As someone who doesn't eat meat, I love going to places like this and just reveling in the beauty of veggies. I love well-cooked veggies, and this place did a great job glorifying some of our common vegetables.I tried the charred beets, grilled asparagus and fried cauliflower. Wow, double wow and triple wow. All were excellent, but my favorite was probably the cauliflower. The caper raisin vinaigrette on it was amazing, as was the whipped ricotta. I was raving about all the sauces on the dishes so much that the waiter brought me bread to eat the leftover sauces with (the bread was delicious of course)!The asparagus was heavenly. It was perfectly charred and cooked to the point of tenderness, but not chewy like can happen with asparagus. The jalapeno aioli in it made me stop and sigh after trying it. It's THAT good. The poached egg on top was a perfect compliment. I got the dish without the pancetta. The beets were excellent as well. It was a mixture of different beets, which I appreciate since I love golden beets. The yogurt sauce with it, once again was SO GOOD.I look forward to returning and trying even more! This may be my favorite place I've tried in SLC to date. Enjoy!

name: Eva
content: I love tapas bars because I am very indecisive when it comes to ordering food at restaurants and I usually end up ordering both me and my husband's dish so I can try both. This is a "small plates" restaurant, so order 4-5 if there are 2 of you. We ordered the harissa carrots that were served warm with a tahini sauce and mint. I loved the refreshing taste the mint added to it, so I would recommend it for that. We also ordered the macaroni and cheese that had butternut squash in it and it was delicious. It was so creamy and flavorful and it literally melted in your mouth. We ordered the Eva's steak that was served over fingerling potatoes. It was really good, basically the quality of steak you'd get at a nice steakhouse, just smaller. My only complaint was one piece in the middle was too rare for me (I usually order medium or medium rare so I do like it red, but it was a little too rare for my preference). Lastly, we got the French pizza which had a Neapolitan style charred and crispy crust and brie, pears, walnuts, and arugula with some type of vinaigrette or vinegar drizzled on top of it. I really liked how the bitterness of the arugula contrasted with the sweetness of the pear. I gave it a 5 because it was unique and it was on par with the high hopes I had for this place.

name: Eva
content: Really delicious food. Only gave a four star because of the atmosphere (could use a couple of updates). Waiter was fantastic. Menu interesting. Really great place to go for a date. My daughters and I had a pleasurable evening. We had the special chicken liver toast, French pizza, Eva steak, spinach and potato gnocchi, chocolate pot de creme, and spiced cheesecake. Along with several cocktails and wine. Thanks for a great evening.

name: Eva
content: I took a group here for work and was glad I did; it's got a hipster vibe which reminded me of home (Seattle) and the service was great. I wouldn't recommend it for a large party since the place is on the smaller side, but our group of 6 fit perfectly. I wasn't a huge fan of one of the cocktails on their menu, but I think it's just a personal preference. For the most part the food was pretty good, the friend chicken and flat bread plate are definitely something to brag about. They recommended about 2 items per person which ended up being way to much for us but at least we got a taste of about half their menu !

name: Eva
content: The food is very good and I like the small, cozy environment inside the restaurant. Not a great value because portion sizes are small. Seems like quality of food and service have gone down a little over the past few years but still a good spot.

name: Eva
content: Sad day. Used to be our very favorite spot, but after moving out of state, our recent dinner revealed that things have taken a turn for the worse. The portions have been reduced to comical levels. What's smaller than small plates? Micro-plates? Is that the new hipster thing? There were literally 7 green beans in our green bean dish (Flavor was good). The $15 meat and cheese plate came with a few quarter sized slices of meat and a couple penny-sized bits of cheese. For the portion, that dish is absurdly over-priced. Lastly, the steak dish ordered medium-rare was served well-done without a hint of pink.   The Fig and Pig pizza is still (thankfully) delicious. At over $90, a dinner at Eva will no longer be on the shortlist of must-visits when we are in town. Pro tip - go to Manoli's instead. PS - service still sucks #hipstersaretoocooltobehelpful

name: Eva
content: I made a reservation for 12 (at Christmas time) and the food and service was fantastic! This was the first time for most of us. So delicious! Roasted cauliflower! Grilled asparagus! Pizza! Yumm

name: Eva
content: Visited this place last night, very quick seating (I was solo so I asked for a bar seat). My server, David was a very nice guy and explained the menu to me and gave me some time to think about what I want. I ended up with the Mac N Cheese, the special for the night which was braised beef and for dessert had this chocolate/marshmallow treat. The Mac n cheese was amazing. 10/10 I would truly recommend it to all. The cheese was the right amount and I'm not a fan of squash but it was mixed in perfect with it. The braised beef was another dish I would recommend. It's very similar to an Afghan dish that my mother makes, lot of spices which will leave your taste buds in awe. Last the marshmallow/chocolate dessert, wasn't the biggest fan since I don't really eat marshmallows but wanted something different. If you like marshmallows this is for you, otherwise next time I'll be trying out the warm chocolate cake.

name: Eva
content: Okay, I think im late to the party. I've been hearing about Eva's for years now. But, and i know how judge-y this sounds, I HATE their sign. It's just this ugly yellow bleh sign. And if you know anything about color theory, yellow is a big no no. Alas, i did finally make it past the ugly and the interior is beautiful. Its fairly small and has a subtle European vibe. The food is tapas or small plates. So for 2 people we ordered 5 plates. When i think tapas i think Spain. These are quite different from what you find there but incredibly delicious. Really rich flavors. Daily specials. Everything tasted fresh and well prepared. Anxious to try more on the menu and relive some of the favorites.

name: Eva
content: I've gone to Eva a number of times over the past 6 years. Last night I went for the first time in roughly 3 years and it seems to have gone down in genuine quality of food. Don't get me wrong, it's presented nicely and it's still decent and ok, but not worth the high prices. They have shrunken their portion sizes, already smaller than they were, because it's a tapas style restaurant, which was quite disappointing. They changed their menu, keeping only a couple staples available. Among those staples, the potato gnocchi was and is my favorite. My boyfriend was turned off by the amount of truffle oil that they douse the entree with, however, and they served 6 gnocchi total in the dish which is much smaller than it used to be - when the dish came out, it looked bare. As for new menu options, the cabbage wrapped dish was alright - something you could make at home. Calamari was pretty good and is more for the adventurous eater, I do recommend. The ribs were among our tables favorite and worked out with our 3 party table because there were only 3 ribs. The dessert cheesecake came in a mason jar with a lemon jello-like topping. The topping was overpowering and not something any one of us cared for. The cheesecake itself was good once you got hallway down past the goo on top.Out of 5 or 6 cocktails available, my party of three tried 3 of them and all of them seemed lackluster in some way. I'm all for a good mezcal, but the "rodeo ghost" was hard to finish. The execution on mixology just wasn't there. Service was great. I really enjoyed our waiter. I'm forgetting his name but he was quite personable and gave suggestions when asked. The busser was a little more reserved, almost in a snobbish way, but I figure he might've just been having an off day. Service is decent and they make do with the close quarters they have to work with. Kudos.Overall I'd normally say it's a 3 star but because of the ratio of high price compared to portion size is so off, that takes a major hit. It seems that this is a restaurant where you pay for ambiance and an interesting twist on concepts instead of it getting a reliable GOOD FOOD tapas restaurant. For larger gatherings(4+), I would not recommend this restaurant. There is simply not enough space and it's not worth the money.

name: Eva
content: Eva was a delicious spot for dinner. We came on a Sunday night and the restaurant was gloriously empty so we had incredible service as well. The plates are tapas, so you get a lot of things and share with the table. We tried fries, green beans, fig pizza, Eva pizza, steak bruschetta, and the short rib. Everything we tried was delicious, with the exception of the steak bruschetta. It was too hard to share and didn't have enough meat. The Eva pizza has a delicious gruyere and arugula tossed with a dressing on top. The short rib had an amazing sauce, and the meat was tender. The fries were light and airy with an incredible dipping sauce. Everything is reasonably priced as well. Can't wait to be back!

name: Eva
content: I wanted to love this place so much but it really disappointed me. We ordered five different tapas and besides the spinach and mushroom gnocchi everything was at best just ok, one was not eaten. Most dishes were not properly seasoned and another star knocked off because we got first two plates within ten minutes of ordering and then waited almost 40 minutes for the rest without any explanation. Like I said, loved the concept but for the same money and better tapas I'll go to Manolis.

name: Eva
content: I love the food at Eva. Tonight we shared 6 plates between two people and had lots left over. The beets were excellent, shrimp and hominy was divine - our server didn't seem to be overly enthusiastic and we found the tables so close together that we were talking our tables either side of us.

name: Eva
content: Eva was a good tapas restaurant, but didn't WOW me. We have been traveling a bit to various cities and seemed to be having tapas every other night, so when we came to Eva we had a good reference of other tapas places throughout the region. I realize the interior may be a stylish atmosphere, but quite frankly it feels that you are dining with the people at the tables to each side of you. They are literally right next to you, which to me, takes away from the meal when I have to pause my conversation when the tables next to you are talking. Anyway, that may be a charm to you, so I won't go on.The service was fair. At some points it felt very intimate, and at other times it felt as if we were overlooked. Did they wonder how each of our dishes was? Not sure to be honest. The service was good. The knowledge of the server(s) was good. No real complaints.The dishes were interesting and appealing on the menu. The tastes of the dishes were fine, but none of which I would say had me salivating to return quickly. Again, none of them were bad, they were all quite good.So, in short, it's a solid tapas restaurant in a good location. I just feel that some other tapas restaurants throughout the US really shine, and this one wasn't shining as bright for me. A solid A-OK on the Yelp scale.

name: Eva
content: Love the concept of tapas but it sucks if you love one of the dishes and you have to split it with at least 1 other person. Came here for dinner before a show at Eccles. We got the grilled asparagus, braised pork ribs, brussels sprouts, and steak bruschetta. Loved the poached egg on the asparagus. The meat in the braised pork ribs and steak bruschetta small plates was amazing, didn't care too much for the other parts of those dishes. Brussels sprouts were alright, to be honest I prefer the way I make my brussels sprouts.Even though I wasn't wowed by the food, I would still come back and try other dishes.

name: Eva
content: Ah-mazeing! This place was such a breath of fresh air after a negative experience elsewhere. The crispy pork belly was perfection! The pricing might give some pause but don't hesitate everything is more than worth the price! We also had the fig n pig pizza, I'm not usually a fig fan but this was so wonderfully savory and just the right amount of sweet. The calamari was lovely and had this really nice sauce? it was so yummy we were dipping the pieces of pizza in it too! We were just in town for the evening and Eva totally saved our night. We came in late and the super cool waiter guy was very nice and offered great suggestions for wine pairings! Eva is an absolute MUST try for locals and visitors alike!

name: Eva
content: I was lucky to find Eva on Yelp as I was driving cross country. It is a delightfully compact restaurant with wonderful people and delicious food.I arrived late at night and I'd been eating on the road on my drive from Massachusetts to California. Eva was just what I was hoping to find. I had an amazing, original cocktail,  a shrimp and hominy soup and a stuffed cabbage. Everything was wonderful; the flavors really popped.My server was great and the entire staff seemed to love their work.Yelp is amazing. You can use the filters to find real food in a city you've never seen before and at any hour you need.

name: Eva
content: This place was great!! Our waiter was very attentive and helped us through the menu. Our tapa style dinner was amazing! Beets and goat cheese? Yum!!!!! Mushroom pizza with crust to write home about! The drinks were great and carried an extremely reasonable price tag. We are glad we tried this restaurant and if we lived in SLC we'd be back!

name: Eva
content: First impression walking in was Dimly lit narrow restaurant reminded me of East Coast downtown restaurants. The tapas however were all really good and had such a large selection it was tricky picking. The dishes were served course style according to your selections, which I liked rather than just bringing out whatever was done first. The meats were all cooked perfectly and seasoned right. Apparently there is seating out back as well so it is likely slightly larger than it appears. Reservations are recommended on weekends as seating is still rather limited.

name: Eva
content: Honestly a bit disappointed. I hate leaving negative reviews but I'll start with the bad and end with the good. The Calamari was a tad cold and tasteless around the edges and some bit and pieces in the middle also had no flavor. The service was meh. Hardly got checked on, we had to keep asking random people for drinks. Now the good, the Pork Belly was absolutely delicious. It literally melted in your mouth and the temperature was perfect. The dressing and vegetables served with it was the right amount and not over done also had a delicious citrus flavor with the smoky bbq pork. It accented it very well, and would def recommend. All and all 4 out of 5 because of tasteless Calamari and the service is what lacked the last star.

name: Eva
content: We just finished dinner here and wish we didn't live a few states away.The seared beets and harissa carrots were lovely nuanced plates. The beets were paired with a whipped goat cheese, mint and pistachio and the flavors paired perfectly. The harissa carrots were smoky and subtle.I highly recommend the flatbread dish both for the dips on the plate but also to soak up the bits and pieces of the small plates. The calamari was tasty but the orzo with a bland creamy sauce underneath was a little dull.The steak was perfectly done and the gravy was delicious.We will be back somehow someday.

name: Eva
content: Very good food. As it is a tapas place you'll have to order quickly a few plates to get full. Kind if pricy in that matter. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Cool place to go with a group.

name: Eva
content: Food was a 5 service 4.  The food tasted great,  hit of the night the Brussel Sprouts.  Looked labor intensive and this flavor profile was amazing.  The trout was also amazing.  Servers seemed inexperienced and lacked training.   If you eat here ask for the patio, much quieter and a bit more privacy.

name: Eva
content: To begin with we had a very fast service to sit us down and also David was friendly and and informative.   Our first dish was the beef and lamb.   I can say that I was pleased with the texture and how juicy it was to the touch of my mouth.  Gave me a bit of a street feel but still very enjoyable.    Mine and taushas rating for this fish is 7 and 7.8.  She didn't enjoy how Street it felt because it needs more of a fine dining taste .... whatever that means     The second dish was shrimp and hominy.   It wasn't what I was expecting at all (probably because I didn't think it would be soup). Overall it tasted delicious and the chorizo combined with the soup was a great idea! It dampens the chorizo taste and brings out the broth so clap clap to that one.   Overall great and it has a very nice uptown atmosphere.    Thanks for the service guys

name: Eva
content: While not Spanish Tapas this place is fantastic. There were many great dishes that were unique including fried chicken, lamb/beef and corn cake dessert.... The gnocchi was light and tasty....

name: Eva
content: Holy Moses! This place was FABULOUS!!! My husband and I had the cheese and meat plate, the roasted veggies and the fig pizza. Everyone of them played was amazing!!! My fave was the roast veggies. The chickpeas that went with were delicious!The cocktails were pretty divine too. I had a grapefruit cocktail that added a boost to the tapas plates we had. Would definitely hit this place again when I am in town!!!

name: Eva
content: Eva's has a chic yet casual atmosphere . It's in the heart of SLC downtown , yet the ambience and decor make you feel relaxed and at ease as if you're on vacation. The only reason Eva's gets four stars from me is due to a few tiny overseeing details.    For one we ordered the grilled asparagus overall it was a great dish however I feel like for me it could've used a little bit more salt just to bring out the flavors of the poached egg and the sauce.our next dish was a steak bruschetta. It was supposed to come out medium rare to medium however ours was a little bit more medium well. We should have been more specific about our needs; I prefer rare to medium rare. The presentation and flavor of this dish was very good. We followed the bruschetta with the trout. The trout dish knocked it out of the park. Great flavors, and texture. Delicious . We ended with a upside down caramel cake. The Whipped cream on top was fresh and cold,  delicious. The cake itself taste more like corn bread. All the flavors were amazing but we could've used a little bit more Moisture in the cake. Eva's is a great place for a date night.

name: Eva
content: Good solid place to eat. They are all tapas so we just got 6 to share so we could sample them all. I really liked everything we got. There wasn't one stand out dish, unfortunately, but I was pleased with each dish we tried.  My favorite was the flatbread with four different types of hummus. So delicious. I wasn't a fan of the upside down corn cake,  but that's just me. I loved eating on the tiny patio in the back of the restaurant. It was really cool!I'd for sure go back here again.

name: Eva
content: First time at a Tapas restaurant and I am in love! Eva's had great service, warm ambiance, easy and casual atmosphere. The food was amazing! We had the arugula Margherita pizza, beef and lamb meatballs, braised short ribs, shaved brussel sprouts, and fried trout. Every dish was bursting with flavor. Wish we could have tried every one!

name: Eva
content: What a treasure! I wanted to spend a romantic evening with my wife before heading back home and spent much time researching dinner options before making this reservation. We were beyond satisfied! The staff was amazing, the ambiance was cozy and elegant, and we both think the food was some of the best we've ever had! We have the brussels sprouts, beets, steak, pork ribs, steak bruschetta, and Gnocchi. Everything was so delicious and different and if we lived here we would be regulars.

name: Eva
content: I've been here twice and both times our food came out quickly, the service was great, and everything I've had is delicious! Very refreshing takes on simple dishes.

name: Eva
content: Delicious food! We tried a lot of dishes but the highlights were the Brussel sprouts, the flat bread and spreads, and the pork cabbage roll (we had to order more we liked it so much!) The corn cake was the highlight of the desserts we had, but my daughter loved the marshmallow topped chocolate pot de creme. The only bummer was they only had one bottle of rosé in the restaurant the night we were there and the kitchen was a bit slow with some dishes.

name: Eva
content: Definitely a good place! Food tastes good! The only thing is the plate is small maybe double order the dish you'd like :)

name: Eva
content: Just enjoyed Eva again after a few weeks and just gotta share the love for this great eatery!  This time we had the braised pork - absolutely delish!  Lamb Tagine is a seasonal fave that I highly recommend as well.  The plates are always so perfectly balanced and the tastes stand alone while blending perfectly at the same time.  Thanks for another wonderfully-crafted meal!

name: Eva
content: Love this place. The mushroom pizza is my favorite. This time around, I also got the kale Caesar salad which was good too. Good drink selection and great vibe. You could easily do a business dinner, girls night out or date night here! The meat and cheese plate is also delicious

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: So the arepas, arempas (?) are a little much for me, they come SUPER stuffed, but flavor-wise they're great. The tequeños though, wow, my son could not get enough of them and I'm not sure what they put in their sauces but they're equally amazing! Also, the pabellon empanada is a meal in and of itself, SO good! Then we also got some treats on our way out, I'm not Venezuelan, but I can imagine how nostalgic it'd be for someone to stop by and see the candy they sold upfront just like in Latin America.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Dude, first time eating Venezuelan and it was a great choice. Service was good, food was great, and the location is awesome.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Large portions, great flavor and seasoning! The cachapa (cornmeal pancake) has corn pieces throughout, which gave it a great balance of sweet/salt + texture. The shredded beef was very flavorful, just the right amount of salt. The empanada was filling on its own - i ended up having it later on in the day. The oil was minimal! They provided extra sauces, napkins, and utensils. Enough to share out the portions with someone else or just have on hand. I ordered delivery and the wait time wasn't long. It also arrived hot.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The food here is incredible! I appreciate they have vegetarian or vegan options - the vegan arepa was so flavorful. The potato and cheese empanada was not only massive but also unique compred to other styles I've had - very tender and flaky. The cachapa was amazing as well. We ordered take out and the food was all ready in time, and the staff was very friendly.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Amazing. I ended up ordering a second round to take home with me. Great atmosphere, super friendly, good music, and PERFECT cuisine.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The empañadas are BIG!! I thought maybe I should've got one more with my order of 3 but it turned out to be a feast. The arepas are great too, I tried the Pabellon Arepa and it didn't disappoint. Also, the green sauce is dank!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This is a great place to go if you're trying to enjoy one happy lunch or dinner! They have great costumer service and they love making people happy. We will definitely come back!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Excellent little hole in the wall place l. Food was authentic and had a lot of flavor. Fast casual, no table service. People are friendly too. They have vegan and gluten free options.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Very covid clean & good service. Pay street parking.  We got the cheesy fried plantain sandwiches. My husband loved it, I thought it was good, but not use to it. We also tried the cheese & chocolate sticks, it was average good. They were busy, so the locals love em. I'd come back to try something different.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Heard so many great things about this place and unfortunately didn't live up to the hype.Ordering was painful, and standing up at the front counter waiting to order was a bit brutal. Compared this place to a Venezuelan restaurant in West Jordan and not really an apples to apples comparison. Glad we all got to try it, and don't mean to be harsh. It was 50-50 in my opinion on what was good and what was subpar.Don't think I will be back.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This was hands down the best beef empanada I've ever had. I downloaded and created a Yelp account just to leave this review. I had three dipping sauces.
