Can't remember what they were for sure. Maybe cilantro lime, chile garlic, and one other green sauce. Just ask for them all and thank me later.Thank you, Arempa's. I will return soon... like, tomorrow.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: In my book, this is one of Salt Lake's holiest food sites.Perfect dishes, perfect sauces, friendly staff.As unique a restaurant as you will find around here.Personal favorites are the carne asada & pabellon arepas as well as the cachapas with any of the porks...or the patacones...in short, it's a lengthy and delicious menu with a lot of love to give. Who knew an arepa could be so full?? Sometimes they are so deliciously stuffed they almost look like cartoon food.If you haven't tried plantains before, or are not used to meats being sweet, you will get a lot of exposure to that as you can get plantains in almost any dish here whether it's the pabellon arepa or the actual pabellon or the empanadas...or the fried plantains obviously. Most people trying them for the first time definitely find them unique and I think that 50% of people who have never tried plantains love them and the other 50% wouldn't get them twice (their loss). So if you're very vanilla, skip the plantains.A minor critique, given with the utmost respect::I found the Reina Pepiada to be somewhat undersalted in the couple if times I've had it. And the filling is kind of homogenous...just a lot of it with one texture and nothing to break it up.The tequenos and fried plantains seem to come out a little soggy if you order them plain as a side dish. They're still good, you just don't want to let them sit around for too long, but I think that this is just the nature of fried plantains.The fried meats are sometimes dryer and chewier than they have to be.None of this puts a damper on any of the other dishes. They have so many options that are literal perfection!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: With almost an entirely GF menu I knew I had to try. It did not disappoint! I loved everything we tried and making this a new favorite place.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The first time I came here, I ordered the peluda arepa and pabellon empanada for take away. I was very surprised at how large the empanada was for it being only $6! It was a deep fried empanada filled with shredded beef, black beans, cheese & plantains. The arepa was shredded beef and cheese. The shredded beef in both items were very tender. The combination of all the fillings was delicious. It was perfectly salted. I loved the food here so much that I was thinking about it many times once I returned home. I came back here earlier this week (a few months after the first time) and ordered the pabellon empanada again! I was finally able to fill my craving.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The items on this menu are for you no matter what your taste. Get something from every section and see for yourself. Most people that eat here seem ta speak multiple languages... That's a good sign when eating "non-american" and for the record, anything made in America is American... But this food tastes better than what I would expect from America!The service is splendid, the beverages and food are authentic, and the orders were made faster than I could ever do myself.  Everyone who was waiting on food looked desperate for their order.Most places like this, one near is the one ta choose and at this gem it's any of the selections you're in the mood for

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This is my favorite restaurant in all of salt lake. I make it a point to stop here close to weekly. You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu but if you're looking for suggestions the shredded chicken empanada and potato & cheese empanada are my favorite, and don't forget the cheese tequenos, they're bomb. I will say the one downside is they don't have cups of water, only bottled, and trust me, you're gonna need one. Do yourself a favor and check this place out if you haven't.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This place is amazing! The food is beyond delicious and the sauces are so flavorful. They have great vegetarian options and it's all filling and hearty.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This place is or should be considered one of salt lake's  best. Tucktaway in a little corner on State Street between 400s and 300s you could pass by and think it's a little hole in the wall. Don't let that discourage you. The flavors are on point and arepas are authentic and different. My favorite one was the one with pork cheese and black beans, so good! We also tried the Carne Asada and the chicken salad arepa and they were OK not my favorite. Doesn't mean you won't like it. Might need to try them all like we did. BUT the pancake with a side of pork was so different, so delicious and I will be going back for more. Empanadas were too big for my liking- but that is just me. I won't hold them too that because of the other items that are for sure 5 stars! Definitely putting this on my regular circulation.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: My Venezuelan husband and I are just obsessed with Arempa's. A lot of the bad reviews seem to be from people that aren't accustomed to eating Venezuelan food because my husband has said time and time again how authentic it is. I get the fried pork cachapa almost every time. A MUST-TRY while in SLC. One of our go-to spots!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Holy empanada!!!! Do you ever eat something then think about how good it was all week long?! That was the case for me and the pabellon empanada - fried masa filled with that ooey-gooey cheese, black beans and tender shredded beef - oh and don't forget to top it all off with their garlicky white sauce, herby green sauce and tangy hot sauce and right there is your dream come true. Super friendly staff - you order at the counter and they bring it out to you but still stopped by to make sure everything was good and we didn't need anything. It is definitely a smaller place so call ahead if you want take out.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: My fiancé and I drove to Salt Lake City for a little ski trip together. I had never been, and a friend recommended places we should get food. Arempas was #1 in his list. We went there for lunch and wow- it was absolutely delicious. The most authentic Venezuelan food I've had in the states. Their salsas are just as tasty as the meals. And the empanadas are as big as your hand- HUGE! A huge selection of gluten free foods- very celiac friendly as they have separate fryers. The owner was outgoing and gave us his recommendations. I couldn't recommend this place more highly. I great way to start 2021!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Food is delicious, abundant and fairly price.  My wife, from Venezuela, was in heaven. The only thing I'd suggest changeling is the very cheap plastic cutlery and providing real plates for dine inners!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The arepa wraps were very good. I don't feel like the flavors came together tho. We purchased the peluda and the carne asada arepas. The meat to vegetable ratio was heavy on the meat side and very mono flavored. The sauces all tasted like there was a strong mayonnaise base. So if you're looking for that fresh arepa that just pops, this place isn't quite there. COVID: there were a lot of people waiting inside.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The food is mediocre. Nothing really tasty or good. We try 2 arepas that were ok, the plate with rice, beans and meat is awful. The plantain with pork was bad too, the meat was cold and very grease. The guys on the counter were nice, and the place is so so as well, nothing that I will come back to!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The food was good, holy crap the amount of oil in the empanada was nasty!! Just look at the picture, the empanada's box was full of oil  why!!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: My husband and I got the carne asada and pulled pork arepas and it was delicious. Ubaldo was really helpful and explained everything to us, being our first time here. Casual, lively, and inviting atmosphere. We'll definitely be coming back when we visit SLC!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Tasty arepas! I had the pabellón and it was delicious. Small restaurant with great customer service. Will come back here again!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: OMG, try this place! It's a casual eatery and smells amazing. The guy at the counter was friendly, easy going, and welcoming. We got seated with some laminated menus. I got the cachapa (some sort of corn flour venezuelan pancake stuffed with melted mozzarella cheese (I think), and dusted with what tasted like cotija cheese) with shredded chicken and cheese placed on the side. Boyfriend got a shredded beef empanada and a carne asada arepa (like a venezuelan sandwich). We got a couple cheese tequeños as well. We both loved the cachapa, it was hands down amazing and there was plenty of it. I've only had it once and already can't wait to have it again. He liked the arepa just fine and would order again, but the empanada was just Meh in comparison, being slightly more sweet than savory. The tequeño was a cheese stick wrapped in their dough and tasted baked even though it said fried. It was good. I'll be going back soon to try the pabellon. We were there until they closed at midnight. We got to chat with Sandy, the owner, as they closed up shop. She is a super nice woman, and I think the guy running the front must have been her son. Both are originally from Venezuela. Sandy told us they opened up about a year ago, and is managing to stay afloat during the pandemic because of support from customers, but has had a 50%-70% drop in business as the primary sales were from late night diners leaving bars after last call. If you want to get out and do your small part in supporting local businesses right now, give this place a try, it is well worth it.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This is a great casual dining spot that offers some good Venezuelan eats at a good price.  Some of their ingredients don't seem to be top quality (example being a pretty generic shredded cheese sprinkled on some of the offerings), however it's still very good and nice to have another diversified gastronomic option in Salt Lake City.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Reasonably priced, generous portions, fresh hand-made food. What more could you ask for? The spicy sauce really takes the arepas to the next level.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I'm pretty sure I'll be dreaming about the vegan empanada tonight. I think I said "this is so good" after each bite I took. The chimichurri sauce really completes the flavors. I love the combination of the spicy fresh herbs, sweet plantains, savory beans, and creamy avocado. And the pastry was perfectly crispy. The staff were so friendly and cheerful, it made the whole experience even better!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Let me start off by saying the food at this place was amazing. I order a carne asada arempa and a ground beef empanada and they tasted freshly delicious. I had never tasted venezuelan cuisine before and this made me want to be more adventurous in exploring more of this culture's food.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Arempa's is AWESOME!! Customer Service: 10/10Everyone that we met at Arempa's is AMAZING. They were so helpful in explaining the menu, giving us suggestions on what to try, and making sure we were okay throughout the duration of our visit. You will feel right at home when you walk into Arempa's, they are all so friendly!Environment: 8/10The environment is fairly open and bright, with plenty of seating! Every table is spaced out pretty well to ensure social distancing. Parking can always be difficult in Salt Lake City, especially if you are going on a weekend or at dinner time, so that is the only thing about the location that could prove to make your visit difficult. Other than that, their environment at Arempa's is great!Menu: 9/10 Arempa's has an amazing menu with tons of different entree options! There are many meat choices to choose from, or you can get vegan as well. Most of their menu items are completely gluten-free, there are only a handful of options that not. How awesome is that!?Price: 7/10Most of their empanadas are $3.50 which is a great price for how large they are! We got their Vegan empanada and it was so big! Their other menu items range from $7.50-$12 (ish), which could seem a bit pricey depending on what you get. All their entrees are pretty big portions and everything is so filling. Prices vary depending on how much meat/filling/toppings you get, but it is all great quality and homemade with love. You definitely won't regret anything that you try at Arempa's.Taste: 8.5/10We were pleasantly surprised with how much we loved their vegan empanada! All Venezuelan empanadas are made with corn flour and they are fried. The empanada we tried had black beans, potato and avocado in it and it was SO yummy. We REALLY liked their fried pork, and we got that with their Cachapa. We also tried their Patacon (fried plantain sandwich) with shredded chicken. It was pretty hard to eat but the chicken on it was delicious. Their Arepas are HUGE and delicious as well. All of their sauces are SOOO yummy, you definitely have to try their avocado one. If you check out Arempa's you HAVE to try their fried cheese sticks with guava. They are something else OVERALL: 8.5/10

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Such amazing food I'm not even sure how to describe it. We ordered the Peluda arepa and the shredded beef and cheese cachapa, and it was like the taste buds in our mouths just exploded. The cachapa, especially, was so delicious. A corn pancake with a thick layer of cheese in the middle, some sauce on top, and juicy beef on the side... this dish was destined to succeed. Eat here, and you won't be disappointed.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Open for dine in during Covid. Masks required. Limited capacity. The food here was delicious. I ordered potato and cheese empanadas, ground beef empanadas, and pabellón. First of all, when I saw the price for the empanadas I was expecting them to be similar to the Mexican ones. THESE ONES ARE HUGE. So worth the try. The green sauce is a win. Love that stuff. I want it on everything. The pabellón plate is why this place received 4 stars. The meat was a little too salty. Now that might be personal preference. Everything else was amazing. Cute and quaint vibe. Lots of Celia Cruz playing in the speakers. I was living.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Delicioso! A little bit of a wait, but so good! And everyone who worked here was super nice.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: It's great to have a good Venezuelan arepa empanada and patacon option. Overall, food was decent but nothing to write home about. Fried yucca was decent but the dipping sauce wasn't the best, just tastes like mayo. Potato empanada was just a boiled and mashed potato (there was half of a potato unmashed in mine). The crust was great so I'd imagine the other empanadas are better. Shredded chicken arepa wasn't bad, but the way they filled it tore a hole in the bottom so it wasn't easy to eat

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The food is just amazing and staff is super friendly. I ate arepas with guanabana juice and omg, so good. Coming back for sure!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Tonight was my first time and I will definitely be back. The food is great as is the customer service.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: We love this place! So flavorful and affordable. Their empanadas are super good and very large.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Aaron greets you and you know this place is legit. The best empanadas are some of the best I've had. The sauces and quality; fantastic. Skip the pizza next door. If your looking for fantastic cuisine, here's your spot.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The food is always great. Empanada pabellon is my most favorite thing on this planet and it's HUGE.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Very good food but bad attitude, I'm visiting Salt Lake City today and I was looking to eat Venezuelan food so I can show to my family our traditional food, I order online tequeños, la arepa pelua (I didn't expect salad inside because usually is just meat and cheese), empanadas and arepa reina pepiada, everything was delicious and the price is very good.But when we went to pick it up, it was a long line to order  and my food was right over there on the desk waiting, what's the point to order online when I have to make the big line just to pick up my food? My food was getting cold while the guy have to takes everybody orders. He had a very bad attitude and told to my boyfriend pointing his face that next time he should knows that there is an order confirmation, not just the name on the order and also that he have to make the line.Anyway good food but I thought for the pictures on Instagram that they were nicer or with better attitude.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: One of the best Venezuelan restaurants I have tried (and I'm Venezuelan). The mix Patacones are my favorite!!!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Went for some late night grub!!! Delicious, great, kind service!!! The food definitely hit the spot!! Will go again!!!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Omg the food here is awesome.  The customer is also very good.  I look forward to eating there again in the future.  The patacon is my favorite

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Update: 5/7/2020 I called to order for pickup (pandemic times). I unfortunately found out that they are now using the same fryer for their food as they do for their gluten containing food. This place was a gluten free haven for me and on my last visit, back in maybe January, I felt sick after eating, but the first visit I was fine. So it makes sense now after talking to them on the phone and finding out there is cross contamination for their "gluten free" options I can no longer dine there. Really good food, no longer safe for celiacs.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Absolutely delicious!! We ordered a little of everything because we have never had Venezuelan food before! It didn't disappoint! Every thing we ordered was fresh and full of flavor. My favorite is pictured fried plantains cheese and nata. Excellent service we will definitely be back to enjoy during our visit to Salt Lake City

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: If you like the taste of homemade you've come to the right place. Litterally the best home style Venezuelan food I've ever had at restaurant. Everything on their menu is amazing. I personally enjoy the plantain sandwiches, arepa's, and my favorite their cachapa's. You can tell when something is homemade and this restaurant has all of those tastes. You can taste the corn they use in their fresh, made from scratch, corn dough for the cachapa's, the fresh cheese they use, and how their pork is perfectly seasoned and soft and tender on the inside yet crispy on the outside. It is delicious and inexpensive. Honestly one of the best restaurants you will go to in Salt Lake. Their service is great as well and every time I've been here they are always willing to give you suggestions and make you feel like you are at home.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Really debated between a 3 and 4 for this place... but to be honest I probably won't come back. The people are so incredibly kind though!! Their sauce is also very good. The food was just very disappointing... and expensive for what it was not to mention. I paid almost $6 for the tiny little dessert and the arepa was quite small for what it was worth. The empanadas were big but very oily and fried. The meat in the arepa was quite bland and underwhelming. We waited for a very long time for the food to come out, although it was served fresh. I'm really hoping they improve, especially with the flavor of their meats!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Great variety. Authentic. Very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere makes you feel like you are in Venezuela. Delicious, everything on the menu is perfect

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I was a little disappointed. The tequeno tasted just like a cheese stick wrapped in a tortilla. Pretty plain and no flavor. I also had the avocado chicken salad Arepa. This was okay. Nothing I ate was horrible, but none of it had my tastebuds saying wow.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: There are limited Venezuelan restaurants that I have found in Utah so that keeps me from giving a low rating, but I do think there are things they could do to improve the overall experience.My mother is from Venezuela and has requested we go there to eat twice and so we have had two experiences.One of the things I found difficult was ordering because the desk is located in the middle of the restaurant where waiters, guests, and everyone else needs to cross. This makes it very inconvenient to order as it is a high traffic area.I agree with other reviews that the meats are bland and flavorless. I had the empanada and an arepa and I was not blown away. I think it would help to have more specific menus that describe what comes in each item. No where in the menu did I see they would add lettuce and tomato to my arepa. And even worse.. I ordered the chicken arepa and found it had ketchup and mayo in it... Never have I seen this done with an arepa. Hopefully some of this feedback is taken into account.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The empanadas are amazing, I like everything here but the empanadas are the best. Great veg options, cheap, cute building, good atmosphere.  Love this place.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Arempa's is a great authentic Venezuelan restaurant!  My husband and I ordered, the Pabellón, an Arepa, Tequeños, fried Plantains.  All of it was amazing, and the staff was very friendly and welcoming!  Highly recommend this restaurant!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I was so excited to try this new restaurant as the food pictures looked promising and I thought I was in for authentic Venezuelan food.  I ordered a pelua (or carne mechada) arepa, and the carne mechada wasn't great.  I don't know why some people keep insisting in adding lettuce and tomatoes to the átelas when nowhere in Venezuela they do that.  I asked them to hold off on these vegetables but they ignored my request. The tequenos were good and the carne molida empanada was also good, mass was crispy, thing and a bit sweet.  On another note, I'm glad they had authentic frescolitas, which was a plus.  In addition, my friend ordered a pabellón and they used the same carne mechada that they used in the arepa.  Nothing memorable, and according to my friend the black beans were also bland.  In conclusion, great idea and great concept even when the food is overpriced specially when the flavors are not there.  Salsa tártara was yummy but the avocado (or wanna be guasacaca) was not memorable either.  Good luck and I hope you improve in the near future.I might give it a chance again in a few months

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Best empanadas I've ever had, you crave them for weeks after eating one. Made fresh and they're huge. Delectable sauces for dipping too! GO N BUY AN EMPANADA OR 4. JUST DO IT.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: IN SHORT: Food took forever; Food varied extremely in temperature; Service was inefficient, and workers seemed overwhelmed and clueless. This is our second time dining here... we thought maybe the first was a fluke. At 30 minutes of waiting, I approached the cashier who appeared extremely overwhelmed with orders and other customers also waiting for their food. One of the workers came out with a plate of food, and she seemed really clueless about where the food went to. She ended up asking all of the tables if the food belonged to them, and finally found out where it belonged. It took 45 minutes for us to receive JUST our appetizer. The lady who brought out our food, again, didn't know that it belonged at our table and when I asked her if it was ours, she said she didn't know... :/ like, what??? when she verified it was indeed ours it, the food was so hot that we couldn't even touch the little plantains for at least 5 minutes. My canned soda was finished by this point... :/ 15 minutes later we got our food and the food was  COLD... we got two pabellóns and an arepa with shredded beef. The beans in the pabellon were SO SALTY... and I had finished my soda by this point :(The beef was cold... the rice was okay?... for $45 I would have much rather spent HALF money getting TWICE the food in awesome pizza next door... I rarely write reviews, but I'm pretty passionate about this one because the cost was simply not worth the experience. Pretty bummed out because Utah needs a solid Venezuelan place. I hope they make changes soon... but we won't be going back.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I love this place, they take care of  people here! The arepas are amazing, if you never had one do your self a favor and eat one.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The staff was amazing and very accommodating to all the questions I had  The food was very tasty as well!   I had the vegan arepa and a life bowl   decided to order some to go for my bf because he would kill me if I didn't bring him home yummy food! Thank you guys for this amazing experience! Will definitely be back with more people.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I love that salt lake is finally becoming more diverse and as a Venezolana, I really wanted to like this place. The staff was great and very welcoming as we naturally are. Some of the things were okay, such as the patacon, but some things were lacking in flavor. For example, we had to use a ton of guasacaca on our tequeños because they didnt really have flavor. They're also a bit expensive, but my husband tells me that is usually do to their location downtown. Me encanta que SLC finalmente se esté volviendo más diverso y, como Venezolana, realmente quería que me gustara este lugar.  Los dueños fueron excelente como naturalmente lo somos.  Algunas de las cosas estaban bien, como el patacón, pero algunas carecían de sabor.  Por ejemplo, tuvimos que usar bastante guasacaca en nuestros tequeños porque realmente no tenían sabor.  También son un poco caros, pero mi esposo me dice que eso suele afectar a su ubicación en el centro de SLC.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: TRASH. Service was abysmal; food took over an hour to come out after we ordered. Quality of food was horrid; the cheese in the middle of our Cachupas was cold, not melted, and essentially from a bag from a Vons. The "fried pork" that came with it was small cubes of meat, deep fried for WAY too long, to the point that it was basically rubber. After I left, I couldn't believe that I actually waited 1 hour and 12 minutes for the food that I VERY clearly overpaid for. DO NOT COME TO THIS  RESTAURANT. Honestly, I wish I would've just waited in line for 'Pie Hole'' next door.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Took over an hour to get food. Food came out cold. Lack of flavor. If you want a cold cheese quesadilla with not fresh fried pork come here.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Shredded chicken arepa was great. Ive had arepas once before and didn't care for it but this was delicious. Tons of meat, great sauce, tasted fresh. Shredded beef empanada was pretty good too, wouldn't do the beef again though.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Whether it's 2am or lunchtime, Arempa's is a new classic that you can't go wrong with. A few friends and I decided to give this place a try less than a month ago and absolutely loved it. I've been back for lunch several times since, and they knock it out of the park every time. Friendly environment, vegetarian and vegan options, and fantastic food. Go, take your friends, and be prepared to get a little bit messy

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I was craving tequenos and was excited to try this spot! Unfortunately, the tequenos came out lukewarm so they didn't quite hit the spot for melty, cheesy goodness. The flavor was good and the garlic and avocado sauces were delicious. The shining stars were the shredded beef arepa and empanadas we tried. So scrumptious and filling! The potato and cheese empanada was a miss for me, it was served mashed inside instead of the diced potatoes im used to, so it lacked the normal cheesy appeal. I enjoyed most of what we ordered and  recommend giving it a try!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This was my first time trying Venezuelan food. My sisters and I are visiting from Texas, and happened to drive by this place, which was a great blessing. The food was mind-blowing! We ordered the Patacon, Rena Pepiada, and the Guava and cheese tequenos. We devoured everything, but I remembered to take the picture of the patacon. Excellent service too. Once we're back in SLC, we will definitely come back!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Obsessed Like woah. Vegan lovers read up. Was already in love with this place for the obvious reason of amazing food that you cannot get anywhere else!And then.... then... they created a vegan menu!Cue heavenly tones.I mean, most vegan food let's be honest is some deep fried something covered in a sauce you hope is being honest about not having real mayo and still tastes bleh.Not here, literally so amazed. Everything has flavor. Texture, substance.Tropical salad is a die hard yes, it's like candy.There Arempa's and empanadas ... and did I mention they cater?I really like eating healthy and trying to cut back on meat, sounds easier then it is unless we have amazing items like this

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This place is fantastic! Had the Pabellon, fried yuca, and a shredded chicken empanada. 10/10 would go here again! Staff is awesome too! Very gluten free friendly and lots of dishes to choose from :)

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Incredible. I'll be dreaming of these Arepas. Family owned, first time business. What's not to love?

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Popped in to this gem with my family. We he Arepas, Empanadas, and yucca. It was all amazing!  From the crust to the fillings of the empanadas, the over flowing beef in our arepa, and the avocado cream and garlic sauces to compliment everything we had. The staff was awesome. They even went so far as to locate a single 50 peso piece from Venezuela to give to our children. Hands down amazing. I will be back every time we are in Salt Lake City!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: So glad Yelp suggested this place! I'll definitely frequent this restaurant often and of course, let my peeps know it's so good! Came in on a Monday evening with a party of 6. Since the larger booths were taken, we moved a couple tables and chairs over without issue from the staff to accommodate our party. We were greeted upon entry and the customer service throughout the 1 1/2 hours we were there was great. I appreciated the smiles, conversation and item knowledge from the staff. It makes a visit to any establishment that much better!I love the menu is split into sections for easy and quick ordering. I love when menus aren't too cluttered with items that they do "alright" and filled with a few items they do amazingly. That is definitely a plus here. They also have veggie options for those that live that lifestyle or want a meatless day. I had the grilled steak arepa and guava & cheese tequenos. B O M B. My arepa was fried (fry all the things!) and the steak was nice and tender. I took out a couple things that I'm not fond of and it came out correctly. The avocado sauce and garlic sauce that's out on the tables were such a great addition to the flavors already in the food. I could literally drink the both of those! I'm a dipper so it was a nice touch on the tequenos as well. I also ordered the shredded beef, ground beef and potato & cheese empanadas to go and when they were consumed, it was SO good even without all my dipping sauce needs. Not burnt at all, golden and crispy as they should be. They have canned beverages in the cooler and a water jug by the register in case soda isn't your thing.The decor is beautiful! I loved the Venezuelan flag on wood..gorgeous and very proud! There are restrooms here but I didn't use them during this visit. Parking on the street or in the garage behind it.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Loved it. Excellent food. Fun atomsphere and the service was top notch. Tried the carne asada arepa will be back for the pollo asado.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Wow. The food here is so good. Very good, friendly service.Do yourself a favor and order the patacon with avocado and fried egg and grilled steak. Amazing sandwich (with plantains for bread).My son had the pabellon plate. Rice and beans were tasty. Pretty similar to ropa vieja (if you've had Cuban before). Daughter had chicken arepa. It was tasty, but I should've tried it before the patacon. Eating the patacon first set the bar too high...

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Absolutely amazing! I've been wanting to try Arempa's for a while and it definitely didn't disappoint. We got two of their main Arepas the Peluda (Beef) and Catira (shredded chicken). The flavor was excellent and filling. This is in a great spot downtown and the atmosphere is casual and friendly. I highly recommend and will be back for sure.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Having lived in Venezuela, I can tell you this is the real deal. For my first visit I ordered 2 pabellon empanadas. They are stuffed with shredded beef and plantains. So so good but a ton of food. Just one is filling enough to be a meal. Second visit, ordered the cachapa with with fried pork. An amazing combination of sweet and salty with the sweet corn pancake stuffed with gooey cheese with fried pork. Takes a bit of time to get food only because it is freshly made. Can't wait to come back and try other menu items.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I found this place through another Yelp review and proposed it for a work team lunch.  After eating here I'm sure I'm now the hero of the group.  The Pabellon was fantastic as well as the cheese and cheese/guava tequenos.  I would recommend this place over and over, now I just need to bring my family!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This place is THE PLACE TO GO!!! Perfect location, Down town! Convenient hours and open very, very late night - hits the spot after them cocktails. The food here is prepared with LOVE & PASSION  and it reflects it on anything you order here! I'm  addicted!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Amazing restaurant. I went three times  and the food was always delicious. I had the empanadas. The chicken and also the beef. Both empanadas are amazing. I like that they are opening till 3 am in weekends. The prices are affordable. They also have other dishes. Also they offer delivery.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Excellent work!! Empanadas are fullPabellón delicious flavor.Quick service & sauce comes in a bottle you can actually use. Everything Well thought out overall.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Staff is very friendly and owner is amazing at interacting with customers. they take feedback really well and improve everyday. Food is authentically Venezuelan and they grow everydayEl Staff es muy amistoso y el due,o es increible interactuando con clientes, toman comentarios muy bien y se hacen mejor todos los dias.La comida es autentica de Venezuela y crecen todos los dias

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Really yummy Venezuelan food. I got the beef arepa and it came with cheese, tomato, lettuce, and was drenched in this amazing garlic sauce inside a masa arepa. Extra sauce is available on the side. The workers were really nice. One mentioned they plan on rolling out a more keto/vegan friendly menu next year.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I just tried Arempas for the first time tonight, and the flavors at this place blew my mind. The things I love most in life are now as follows: 1: My wife, 2: My daughter, 3: My religion, 4: Crazy-good Venezuelan food at Arempas. Everyone should patronize this place. You won't regret it.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Probably the best Venezuelan food in town!!!Saturday was a little slow but we as a family were too anxious. Very clean friendly and very very good food!Keep up the good work

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This restaurant will be the end of all other late night SLC restaurants. Open till 3 am on Friday and Saturday, this is the perfect place to stop by after your night out.The empanadas are amazing. $3-5 each and they are massive. One of them is enough for most people, two would be crazy. You can get them stuffed with all sorts of different meats, cheese, potatoes, and they also have a vegan option. The pabellon is my favorite and comes packed with black beans, shredded beef, plantains, and cheese.I found the perfect meal was an empanada with a tequeño on the side ($1.50).The rest of the menu looks enticing, and I plan on making it through one day, but for now the empanadas are too good to not get. I feel so bad for the other places around here, because this place is the new late night King.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Great food and experience. I really enjoyed visiting this restaurant, being that my husband is Venezuelan. Best part is that this place is open until 3am on the weekends. The ambiance is chill and the music has a mainstream Latin flare. Would recommend after a night out after the bars or even on a more casual basis!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: This is a Latin hidden gem in the middle of downtown. Food is so fresh it's unbelievable, you can taste the passion in each bite and THERE ARE VEGAN AND VEGETARIAN OPTIONS!!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Amazing food, open late, gluten free and vegan options for the empanadas go, you can't go wrong!So glad we decided to pop in here on Halloween. They also gave us free water bottle web the sauce they make is amazing. It was fast, fresh, super happy about everything and not enough Venezuelan food around the city.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Just read Scott Ps review below and boy that guy couldn't be more wrong. What a garbage review. Oh you couldn't figure out where to order at the counter with the woman standing behind it? Sounds like a You problem man. I decided to try Arempa's myself and review it because it was that good. And I rarely leave reviews. I'll be adding this place to my lunch rotation because everything about it was awesome.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: First empanadas in SLC that made me feel like New York again in all the right ways. Staff is sweet and they hustle, shredded chicken was my favorite, even the vegan option was great. Also, I know we all want to but don't be that guy who steals the sauce!! Let's keep this place around

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I really enjoyed eating at Arempa's. The arepas and fried green plantains felt/tasted very authentic. We absolutely loved the green plantain shredded beef sandwich. The grilled chicken wasn't as good, but the arepa and other toppings made up for it. We just didn't love the chicken itself--I'll probably go with the vegetarian next time. But we will be back!! My only suggestion: simplify your menu so that your cashier doesn't have to spend 5 minutes with each customer.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Great food!! Great people!! Great location!! This place just opened but if you ask anyone they will tell you it's amazing. It is a bit pricey for what you get. $9.50 for one item is a bit much, but it's a good splurge!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: First time having Venezuelan food and this team deserves to win! Not only was the food amazing, but Grubhub managed to not send a driver to pickup the food at closing. The manager personally drove the order to my hotel after the restaurant was closed. I have never seen this type of dedication to take care of customers. Thank you very much for going above and beyond!!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Delicious! The arepas were huge and very filling. I got the vegan one and my boyfriend got the grilled steak. It filled us up and was so good. The atmosphere was great too. The workers were very kind. I used to love in Venezuela as a young girl and it brought me back some good memories. The only thing I did not like was they put ketchup on the vegan one and once I got to the bottom it tasted like there was mustard. I'd prefer it without sauces so I could put the garlic and avocado sauce on it. Very delicious and will come back for sure!

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: I just discovered this place and it's great!  So far, I've tried the cachapa and one of the arepas.  I had the beef and cheese cachapa - it was huge and delicious.  On my second visit, I had the chicken arepa and it was equally tasty and large.The staff is very friendly and helpful for those of us unfamiliar with Venezuelan cuisine.  I'll definitely be back, after I burn off some of these great carbs.A very welcome addition to the downtown lunch scene.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Dang, the  shredded chicken arempa (I added black beans) was SO good. We stopped by the area for a service and decided to eat downtown. We we're going to go across the street but ended up here. So glad we did. The meal was perfect. A much lighter meal than we would have had and much less expensive. The salad was fairly basic (shredded iceberg lettuce), but the arempa really tasted amazing. The sauce they added adds great taste to the chicken. We wanted another one! We will be back here for sure. I was happy to see that several people were stopping by as we were leaving. The place was clean and the staff friendly.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: It was so good. The carne molida empanadas were soooo good. I am dying to go back. Prices are really good too

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: LOVE this place! Went twice in the first week it opened. Amazing, authentic food, made fresh! The staff are so friendly, the location is comfy and convenient.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: Great people and great food. It's awesome to have another late night option in downtown SLC. The shredded beef empanada was wonderful.

name: Arempa's Venezuelan Cuisine
content: The food here is really good. Place has a nice atmosphere that expresses the Venezuelan roots. The food is well priced for how much and quality.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: This is such a great find! My boyfriend and I have ordered takeout twice and loved it. The kung pao chicken, lettuce wraps, and house lo mein were our favorites. Be sure to order off their website, there's a code where if you buy two entrees you get the third free! Great deal. Excited to add this place to our take out rotation

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Delicious food and great service! Would eat here again! My poke bowl was fantastic and the mix of cuisine fit the needs of my group. Will eat here again next time I'm in Salt Lake

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Recently ordered takeout from Won Won Kitchen and it was great! Their online system is very easy to order from, including making any modifications (like gluten free). The estimated ready time was about 45 minutes, and the food was ready when my husband went to pick it up. When he got the food home, it was piping hot and delicious. We ordered the Honey Walnut Shrimp, the Orange Chicken, and the Moo Goo Gai Pan. They were all delicious, and huge portions as well. They also make most of their entrees available as gluten free! We'll definitely return to Won Won Kitchen!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Loved the food, the service, decor, and spacious seating booths! My favorite was the gyoza (dumplings) and noodles! My kids thought the walnut shrimp was the best they ever had. They also liked the Vegas roll. The crispy beef was alright (it was the only leftover we had). The only suggestion I'd make is to have tea cups for hot water. Other than that, I'd recommend this place.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: While my boys were off skiing, I spent a day strolling around SLC's Trolley Square...shopping, of course! While there, I had a super-early lunch at this stunning, new Chinese restaurant...so I was the first and only customer there for most of my meal (YaY!)!The overall decor and ambiance was magical...and as mentioned, the place seemed squeaky clean. But then again, this place is new. Of course, as is the case with all restaurants by now, they were practicing good Covid measures, like mask wearing and social distancing.The item that immediately caught my attention was this "Triple of Won Won", which included Chicken w/ Snow Peas and Carrots, Honey Walnut Shrimps and Black Pepper Steak...plus your choice of White, Brown and Fried Rice. All this for only 16 bucks! I also ordered their Mango flavored Iced Tea, and it was also beautifully presented, in a tropical glass.More than anything, I loved the Honey Walnut Shrimps...so much better than what I anticipated! Didn't care too much for the Chicken w/ Snow Peas and Carrots, but liked the Black Pepper Steak. I just love variety, and this sure delivered on that! I only wish we could have substituted some of the meats in the "Triple". Still, I love how I got to try these items that I normally don't order on Chinese menus. Topping all this was the amazing presentation in this fancy red tray...Loved it! All such a great idea!!As if all this wasn't enough, they even gave me a complimentary dessert, Mochi Ice Cream! I actually forgot to take a pic of it, but it was a perfect ending to a great meal.BTW, the service was amazing as well. Overall, this place double "Won" me over. Totally deserved all 5 stars!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: I found won won kitchen on google when my boyfriend and I were looking for new places to try. 1000000% would recommend won won kitchen! Their food is out of this world & they have stellar prices. If you want to sit down vs take out their restaurant is so cute! It's super comfortable and they have the sweetest staff.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Highly impressed!  That is the only route I can go with this.  This place is very nice, pleasing decor and not an overly noisy place.  Of course during these trying times it is hard for most places to be very noisy. Absolutely impressed when they brought our drinks.  Well, I can easily say that I will not be needing a refill.  The important part is when our food arrived.  The Tangerine Chicken was the best of the two items we ordered.  Though, I did like the Family Delight.  Considering the check when we got it I am shocked how little new spent on a very good meal.  A place to bookmark for a return.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: We were seated right away, the staff was friendly. The atmosphere is nice and clean. The food is wonderful. We got plates to share, the Family Delight is a mixture of beef, chicken, shrimp and scallops, plus a mixture of vegetables. It has a garlic sauce and is surprisingly good; everything was cooked perfectly. The second dish we got was Tangerine chicken. Honestly it was just mandarin oranges but I have to say it's absolutely delicious!!! I'll order this every time. I wanted to pour the sauce on everything and I did put it on my fried noodles that were by the way cooked perfectly too. We're leaving happy and will return!!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: This place is a hidden gem here in salt lake. Coming from the east coast, good asian food is hard to come by in Utah. I can say this place lives up to the standard that East Coast Chinese food has set. We got the crispy beef which was AWESOME! We also got the teriyaki beef bento which was pretty good, they give you slices of steak which was a nice surprise. I will say that service was a bit slow but the restaurant was adorable and the food made up for it. Definitely check it out if you're looking for good asian food, it's the best place I've tried.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: This is a wonderful restaurant, clean and tastefully decorated.  The food is fresh and well prepared.  Food is also served with pride as only top restaurants do.   We have tried several plates and they are tasteful and correctly prepared.  My wife and I have been in some of the best Chinese restaurants from California, Beijing, Taiwan, and other countries, so we are able to compare.  This restaurant serves plates that in the USA would compete with the best, even the ones in San Francisco.  This restaurant deserves your attention.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Finally got some of this in my own after having it catered at work. When I ate the orange chicken I could just tell the sauce and everything was made from scratch or at least they home make the sauce. Orange peels in the sauce and with the chicken, fried rice was great as well. Takeout/pickup was simple, just called them after being parked by the tower and they brought it right out.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: We're new to the city and were craving crab wontons, a favorite in our old hometown. Unfortunately, we would never order them again from Won Won. The crab smelled pretty funky - we could only eat two - and the "stuffing" was more like a light spread on the bottom of the wonton. We also got spicy tuna rolls, which were definitely not freshies. But I mean, you get what you get for 5 bucks per roll. The spicy sauce saved them; it was delicious. We also had the chicken fried rice but would not order that again. It was very bland, so we used what we had on hand to spice it up. To end on a high note, the crispy beef was amazing. The sauce was flavorful, the veggies were crispy, and the beef was tender. Everyone ended up sharing it. We would definitely use GrubHub again. Everything was on time and hot.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: best standard, staple chinese food in salt lake. great deals for decent portions as well

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: We stumbled upon Won Won Kitchen tonight and we couldn't be happier! First, our server was wonderful. Second, large menu with a lot of options. I had the chicken teriyaki and it was the best I've ever had. My husband said the same about the beef and broccoli. The sauce they used on all our meals was so fresh and delicious! This is now our favorite Asian restaurant in SLC! I can't wait to go back. Seriously,  that teriyaki sauce was delicious!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: I've been looking for a new Asian restaurant and I've finally found one. First can we start the chic ambiance. The decor is fabulous and fun. Customers service is EXCELLENT! The owner/manager is the sweetest. She gave me the cutest Christmas gift for being a customer. Now to get to the important part. The food is amazing. I haven't had one bad thing ever. Everything is cooked fresh to order. The sushi is delightful. The crispy beef is a favorite of mine. Full of flavor. Serving size can be shared for 2. Lots of great options to choose from. They also have a really delicious lunch menu.Do yourself a favor and check this place out.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Such a wonderful experience. Good food, great drinks, absolutely fabulous service! We ordered several items, and everything was great. The shrimp (in several dishes) was on point. And the cold pineapple Sake? Sooo great. Highly recommended. We will be back!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: We just had the best meal here. I got the  Triple of the Won Won.  Presentation was creative and appetizing. Generous portions.  Our first time eating here was takeout right before they were closed for some plumbing issues. Had such great food we were disappointed it was closed for so long. As soon as We heard they had reopened we came and again impressed with the quality, cleanliness, generous portions and service.  We will definitely be back!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: I'm so glad I find this spot!!! Wondering customer service and amazing food!!! Worth to come

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Definitely one of the more solid Chinese food spots in the Valley! Tried some of the usual and most popular dishes which were solidly good - not amazing but good. The sauce on the Pon Pon chicken was a bit sweet for my taste but I liked the crunch of it. My standout was the beef pan fried noodles - crispy noods but still with some tender ones (how it should be!), in a rich beefy gravy, loads of veggies and tender beef - get this!!! Very cute new modern decor inside. They have a HUGE menu so lots more to try! Staff was friendly but nothing to write home about. Bottom line: I'd recommend and go again.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Ordered the Honey Walnut Shrimp, Beef in Garlic Sauce, & Sweet and Sour Pork and was pleasantly surprised at how quickly the food was prepared and delivered via Grubhub. Everything came steaming hot just in time for dinner, and for the affordable price point, the entrees came with big portions and are definitely of great value! I really liked how the restaurant didn't skimp out on the shrimp portions for the honey walnut shrimp -- the dish tasted super yummy and authentic. I loved the perfectly crispy fried shrimp coated with a creamy sweet sauce, topped with candied walnuts. The well-seasoned broccoli also complements the dish super well! Would definitely reorder this dish when I have cravings. The beef in garlic sauce had a really great savory flavor, and I appreciated that it was well balanced with veggies. The sweet and sour pork, however, was a bit bland and the meat tasted a bit dry, hence I would not recommend.Overall definitely leverage the amazing deals Won Won Kitchen has, such as the buy 2 entrees get one free, which is incredible value :)

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: This is a gem of a restaurant!  From the Chinese tea served in a lovely glass tea set to pineapple water glasses our first impressions were beyond expectations. We ordered and the food came. It was absolutely delicious. We especially liked the Kung Pao Shrimp and Chicken in a light but flavorful sauce. The poke salad was packed with vegetables and incredibly yummy. The meal ended with the tastiest Mochi ice cream balls. We truly recommend this restaurant, and look forward to a return visit. Thank you!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Don't order the wonton soup.  It is a plain brown broth like watery soy sauce with a couple of undercooked raw dough wontons, each enclosing a tiny sliver of mystery meat. That's it.  Awful inedible.    The vegetarian Delight was marginally better: no flavor just veggies in a bland translucent sauce but the veggies were fresh and crisp.  Veggie fried rice was 90% rice with a smattering of peas and bits of other veggies.  Delivery service was treasonably fast at 30 minutes and the food was pretty warm.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Just recently moved here and have tried 4 other chinese food places and this is by far the best one. Got my order correct and was ready on time. The most flavorful beef and broccoli that i have found thus far here in SLC.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: First time trying this place and it was amazing! We were greeted right away and our server Jade was so nice. We started out with the Bao Bao Platter which was fun and we got to sample different things. Then we split the Sweet and Sour Triple Delight which was delicious. We also split the Mongolian Beef which I could just drink the sauce, the mixture of onions, sauce and beef was one of my favorites. Topped it off with the Mochi Ice Cream. Definitely will be back.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: This place is AWESOME! I went there for the first time on a date and it was so pretty! The customer service was amazing, they were so sweet. The food was delicious and came out very quickly and it wasnt ridiculously expensive. They had both chinese and japanese food too. I would love to go again.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: What a great experience!I decided on this place for lunch today!The place was pretty easy to find and the parking was convenient as this restaurant is right in trolley square. I walked inside and was shocked to see nobody else in the restaurant. As you can tell, I loved the vibe of the restaurant--hence the pictures. The decorations were intricate and is probably one of my favorite restaurants when it comes to the inside atmosphere! The server was super kind and overall so great! The food order was accurate and came super quick! I got the General Tso Bento Box that came with fruit, fried rice, a veggie roll with sauce and wonton soup! Everything tasted so amazing! I especially liked the rice as it was super flavorful! The server checked on me a few more times and was just so nice throughout! Overall, this place was absolutely amazing and I highly highly highly recommend visiting!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: The delivery was fast and very nice. Also the food was great except some of the appetizers was a little dry. Other then that they were very good. The meals were wonderful and there was enough to have for lunch the next day. I had the teriyaki chicken and rice. I highly recommend it.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: We ran across into this place while going to whole food shopping. We thought we would give it a try since there are few Asian restaurants are open for dine in In the area. They have a big menu with both Chinese and Japanese. We ordered dishes from both menus and they were surprisingly good and portions are generous. They have sake, beer and wine. The wine and sake list is quite complete which is kind rare to find in Asian restaurants Utah. The restaurant is very clean and decor is comfy and beautiful. The only thing is the fountain is kind loud.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: The only thing good about my meal was the sauce and egg roll.. even the fortune cookie was stale, and the chicken was not cooked through.  Very disappointed all around

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: With Sampan closing in Sugarhouse, my family was looking for a restaurant to replace it. The first time we ordered, we played it safe and stayed away from the "spicy" options. Meal arrived and it was quite bland. Okay, try again. Ordered the spicy options. Still very bland. In addition, the order was wrong. Okay, mistakes happen. Try a third time. The order was, again, sans two items we paid for. This time we called and they could not have cared less. On the plus side, the portions are big (quantity over quality), and the food is okay, if you like things on the bland side.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: I'm very confused by the other high reviews. We ordered delivery and they forgot the won ton soup (ok that can happen), the chow mein is soupy- I've never had it served like that before, and the fried rice tastes like they haven't cleaned their grill in a very long time- not edible. The food is also loaded with salt- I've had a quarter of a plate and I'm already thirsty. We spent a lot of money to be majorly disappointed.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: A great local Asian Restaurant! The food is amazing and very authentic. All the staff and very friendly. That also have some pretty amazing hot teas that are served in a super cool teapot and glass cup!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Ordered this through DoorDash and was so pleasantly surprised! The food came piping hot, and with everything we needed! The crispy beef was so good, with lots of veggies. The sesame chicken had a great flavor, but a little dry. Mongolian beef had an amazing garlic flavor. All in all it was so yummy and I'm so happy to have a Chinese delivery place available in town!! Will for sure be ordering again, and visiting the restaurant once they're open!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Gahhhh danmmm..... this is my go to Chinese place from here on out. 5/5 will return to slurp tasty noodles and inhale delicious entrees

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: We found this place pretty accidentally, I'm really happy that Trolley Square is coming back to life! I usually judge Chinese food by their Hot and Sour soup and theirs was great! Not slimy, the veg still had some bite and it had the perfect amount of spice! The veg lo mein was great and their orange chicken was not at all like we expected! It was not that brute orange, super sticky, crappy cuts of meat like in most places. Their homemade sauce was sweet, tart, spicy and fresh.We'll definitely be back!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Ok kiddos. Its Sunday and everyone wants Chinese food!I stumbled upon this WIN WIN (see what I did there guys?) due to my go tos being closed on Sundays.Well, I think this is going to be my family's (and my neighbors) go to now.Service was super friendly (thanks Brian!) and so fast. The meals were delicious, clean, and fresh. The hunan beef was garlicky and spicy, and the mushu pork had this really nice balance of shitake mushrooms and napa cabbage. Everything was delicious. With everyone being stressed out it felt nice to be treated to such a delicious meal. Thank you!

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Love that this place is in walking distance and finally something to take out in Trolley Square. The decor is beautiful and they have cool group seating. The people working were really nice  I love that I can grab comfort food fried rice or sushi on more nutritious days. Such a relief to not rely on Whole Foods sushi anymore

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Got off work and thought, "where would I like to eat on the last day before they close all restaurants?"  So I yelped for great Chinese food and this restaurant came up.  I saw the reviews and thought, "I'm in."From the moment we stepped in, the first thing that hit me was the ambience.  It was intimate, Art Deco and held a soothing warmth when you walked in.  I was greeted by server named Jade, who was friendly, engaged and accommodating.  We ordered appetizers that included the tako yaki and vegetable tempura.  Both dishes came out fresh to order:  The tempura was light, crunchy and not greasy at all.  The tako yaki was crisp and burst with flavor.  The "tako cooked to perfection.  I ordered a small bowl of won ton soup; definitely not watery.  The broth was bold and rich in flavor, the won ton a very nice balance of meat to wrapper.  Our entrees came out next...  I had the triple won won which was black pepper steak with onions and mushrooms, honey walnut shrimp and "rainbow" chicken (chicken slices with snow peas, water chestnuts, carrots in a white garlic sauce).  First, the black pepper steak.  Although the menu said it was spicy, delightfully it was not.  It was a nice balance of garlic, pepper, and rich brown sauce.  It had cubes of steak, sliced onion, mushrooms and minced garlic.  It looks tough but it was so tender and again the flavor was on point.  Next was the honey walnut shrimp.  The shrimp was plump and cooked to perfection, the sauce was creamy and so very tasty.  Not too sweet and it paired well with the taste of the shrimp.  Finally the rainbow chicken.  So delicate in flavor but you could taste each individual ingredient and together it complemented one another and made for such a light yet delicious entree.  For dessert I had oolong tea and it reminded me of my younger days, when my grandmother took us weekly to our hometown Chinese restaurant.  She always made sure we had tea to end our meal.  Overall wonderful experience and I highly recommend it.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Won Won Kitchen is a new and most welcome addition to Trolley Square's various offerings.  Like another reviewer, my wife and I have been eagerly awaiting the restaurant's opening and were delighted to see it had happened!  We dined in on 3/10/2020 and had a marvelous experience.  A few details:First off, the ambiance is comfortable/cozy.  The staff were exquisitely attentive and pleasant.  We were seated immediately.  But what of the dining experience?We started out with Hot and Sour soup - the large bowl was the greatest of plenty for the two of us.  When I lived in Georgia I frequented a Thai restaurant that I thought had the best Hot and Sour soup in the land.  I'd say Won Won's Hot and Sour displaced that one.  It really is excellent.I ordered the Triple of Won Won which, as the name suggests, delivers three dishes: Honey Almond Shrimp, Black Pepper Steak and Rainbow Chicken.  As an Accompaniment I ordered Fried Rice (which is really just rice, but tasty).  I was surprised by the sauce coating the Honey Almond Shrimp and think it could be made less heavy, but it was mighty tasty (side note - I heated my leftovers at home in my microwave and the sauce's heaviness melted away).  I'd thought the Black Pepper Steak would be spicier, but was tender and very flavorful.  The Rainbow Chicken was a super standout.  Snow and carrots peas crisp, abundant water chestnuts, and chicken that was beyond tender and toothsome!My wife had the chicken lettuce wrap, which is minced chicken stir fried with other ingredients and presented with ample lettuce for the wrap.  The filling was delicious!  It reminded me of another long-time favorite: chicken larb.  Other places where I've had larb in SLC seem stingy with the wrap (I like cabbage, but lettuce works well too).  Not so Wan Wan Kitchen.  There's plenty and then some.  Looking forward to trying their sushi and sashimi!Be forewarned - portions are generous indeed (a good thing in my opinion).So very happy to have such a high quality, friendly Chinese/Japanese restaurant added to the down town area.  We expect to become well known there.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: We've been waiting patiently for Won Won kitchen to open for over a year, so we were thrilled to see that they were open and we decided to order right away. We chose takeout over dining in. I would've given three stars but I think they'll perfect their game soon enough and I feel like 3 stars over 4 can negatively affect a business (which has employees and families to feed). The reason for "three" stars is that the fried rice we ordered had no ham, egg, or peas in it. Just fried rice. Eh. The walnut shrimp was overloaded with a cream sauce that made it a little too gooey. And the seasame chicken was decent chicken, but there was barely any sauce on it. I hope they take a tip from their Thai neighbors at Skewered and spend a little more time perfecting the ingredients in their dishes. Downtown SL needs an awesome Chinese spot and I'm confident that trolley square will hold them up. For now, I will keep this post here and remove it once they've mastered their dishes. Until then, go enjoy yourself at their awesome looking restaurant and let me know if I'm just too picky. Thanks!Update: The super sweet team at Won Won replies letting us know that they're perfecting their dishes. My husband picked up the food and said their staff is absolutely wonderful. They're on their way to absolute perfection and we're 100% supporters. Changing this review shortly. Thanks to their team for reaching out.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: This place is great!! It's tucked a little behind Whole Foods. We got the lettuce wraps and they were excellent! Would recommend to anyone.

name: Won Won Kitchen
content: Huge Asian menu. Presentation is amazing. Great date spot. Nice interior, lots of food options, clean, and some of the rolls are set on fire.
